ReviewBody: • Hours before  takeoff we received  a Mail stating  in cryptic message  saying there are  delays to be  queues as there is a limit on how many planes can leave  all the same  time So did  the capacity of the Heathrow Airport really hit British Airways by surprise,  hours before departure? Anyhow - we 're the one  without delay so  long - but  still we have  be forced to  fly in our Hand luggage. I travel only with  Hand luggage to avoid waiting for  this ultra slow  arrival of the  checked in luggage.  Always 2h later  get home than  normal with really  good reason, just  due to incompetent  Air Service level  was worse then  normal and triple  the price. Really never again. Thanks  or nothing.

we recently had a delay on British Airways from  London to LHR that was due to staff shortages. They announced that there was a 2 hour holding  pattern but they would board us immediately in hopes of clearing the gate and leaving early. We had to wait the  next 2 hours  on the airplane. The plane was old, dirty, had no power at  the seats. The staff provided a small bag of  food and 250ml of water to the passengers for 2 hour delay and 2 hour flight. There were no options to purchase food or drink. There were no entertainment options available. I am a OneWorld emerald elite member but they do not upgrade members based on status. First  floor lounges at Heathrow are overcrowded,  dirty and poorly equipped. The help  desk is completely unhelpful when an error arises with delays and cancellations , even when having the top status. The Avios points system has been devalued to near worthlessness and requires fees to book reward that nearly equal the price of the revenue ticket. British has lost its way in recent  times and has  been moved from a world-class airline to a budget airline with much  less service and timeliness than Ryanair or EasyJet.

Left on time,  though it took  time to get  to the runway  thanks to congestion.  Service was smooth  and quick. Snack  & drinks were  available for a  late flight. Landed  in about ten  seconds late. One bag of three  was in London,  was quickly filled , and the  bag was delivered  the next morning.

3 days before  my flight, we  are advised by BA that it  has been cancelled  who asked us  to rebook. There  were flights 1  hour before and  one hour after  our original flight  so they made  them take one  4 hours earlier.  The original ticket  for the return  flight a week  ago included a  checked bag. When  they arrive at  BA to check , we are  informed our ticket  only included a  backpack and we  will have to  pay 75 pounds  more to take ! We explained  that the original  tickets had the  luggage and when  they checked the  ticket they confirmed  what it did- but not this ? They would  spare no effort  and sort it , and just  tell us to  pay up or  it would remove  it from the  flight So we  have no choice  but to pay  up thinking it  will be pretty  simple to get  our refund. 15  days and 10  hours later we  have still not  paid a penny.  Each time I  check where my  flight is and  ask how long  I have been  travelling I get  an inane email  and some departments  took longer than  usual to respond! ?! Absolutely hopeless  attempt to stuff  with the booking  from the first  place and even  worse customer service  will not even attempt to solve  the problem at  once in even  if they could  correct the mistake  they had made  on their system,  simply by being  completely unable to  file a very  valid claim, and  charging me 150  dollars in 15  days

We traveled to  Portugal for our  first vacation, a cruise to Portugal  & Spain. Our  friend did not  go get their  bags It was  the two week cruise. Two weeks  with a change of clothes or  a CPAP machine. Contacting customer service  is a nightmare.  We never talked  to a real  airline Very little  effort was put  in getting them their bags. In  the port we were on the  boat and the bags were at  the airport. The airlines did not  take the bags  neither did they  tell our friends  what they needed  a go get  bags The airline  could be bothered  or take the  bags from the  port to the  airport BA says  it is their policy to get you your bags within 72 hours.  That is a  joke It’s been  over two weeks and they still don’t have them. They are back home in the  states and last  they heard the  planes were in  Portugal If your  making a choice,  do not fly  British Airways. Customer  service is non stop

On a flight from Bucharest to Manchester with a 2h 45’ layover  at Heathrow. Flight  got delayed from  Manchester because of  the strike. Arrived  to Heathrow 40 minutes later than  expected and still had enough time  to catch my connecting flight. Unfortunately  we were stranded  inside the plane  and waited a  VERY long time to disembark the plane due to lack of staff or slot shortage , a common  occurrence with BA at Heathrow). I missed my connecting  plane because of their delays and  BA told me  they had to  sleep all night in a freezing  airport for the  next flight the  next day. There  were just a shameful 10£ food  bill which is  a joke considering the ridiculous prices  at LHR. No  meals offered and  had to sleep in a very  crowded airport. I  asked for compensation  but they sent  out a long  letter with the  same lame excuses that they are sorry, but they  did not compensate anything.  I  can imagine a  better airline than BA regarding customer  care It is not about money  anymore but rather  about the way  you treat customers.  That is the  first time in  our lifetime that  you will be  seeing this joke  about an airline.

Got online months  ago and the  only hitch was  on aircraft meaning chosen seats were  tight I was  informed of this prior to departure  but could amend. Bag drop at  seat T3 wasn't  easy but I  guess that was  our fault. Shuttle boarding was slow , delayed meaning  the rush at  flight T5. The  bus to CPT  is full but  it left more  than less on time. The cabin  looked clean and  it was what  we expected, sufficient  bed and arm  rests plus a few little perks  for drinks. Only  downside is the  chairs actually recline  that far. Staff  was very good  during the first few hours of  flight especially George.  Dinner was quite  loaded but one  seat wasn't loaded.  Lunch was also quite tasty and we landed on  a The fly  in the ointment  was both our  bags arrived late  at the carousel  and only later  would we notice  they had been broken into, likely  from CPT. All  in all a  nice surprise.

My flight was  in time. The  staff were polite.  This was the  usual story on  my outward flight. I find that  alcohol in Europe  was generally pretty good, though I  wish that they  recently substituted Prosecco  for Champagne on  the list of  drinks you can  get in economy!  The many complaints  against BA and  other airlines revolve  around lost luggage ! I never  slept in bags,  not for long .

Very disappointed, and  confused My route  is from London  and Atlanta. My  bag was not  packed therefore not  coming with me.  From both comfort  and safety reason, a bag always  arrives with its  passengers and that  could not happen. Claims and few  telephone calls were  answered by desk  staff who answered  the questions unprofessionally  or miserably. Certainly,  I was left  with nothing but  my backpack which  had not more  then few snacks. Neither clothes nor  something else was ever provided as  an apology. Meanwhile,  there was also  told that my bag would have  been delivered through  the next 24 hours which also  did not happen.  British Airways is  another great airline  to fly with  but its organization,  but it comes  its customer service,  was poor and  slow Still waiting for my bag.

For an infrequent  traveller British Airways  were always my  first choice. With some reassurance and  quality of service,  no luggage allowance . In fact I’ve never flown  below the budget ! My most recent flight has  certainly changed my  mind and causes  one to reflect  on what am  I actually getting  from my money and is BA  as they once  were While the  planes were around an hour delayed  both ways, the  food and ground  stop service were  excellent It is  these facilities (or  lack of) that I am most  bothered by. The  trip was Approx  three and a  half hours and  the only thing  offered was a  single cup of  coffee that was poured out and  one bite sized  banana slice of  bread In fact  in my return  journey I wasn’t  actually offered the  sandwich To top it off BA no longer have  their media screen  on which you  simply select something  to pass the  information away. There  were even the  long flight journey.  While WiFi was  down I couldn’t  really access the shop. However, for  a fee so much more was . This explains  a record profit  at £1.52bn. So,  the question is,  what am I  waiting for? I  can now for  and opt for  more budget airlines.  Which are transparent with what they  charge and what  they have to pay for, which  I can decide to choose or  ignore As BA now stands for  Basic Airways I’ll  fly elsewhere and get basic for cheaper.

A totally unremarkable  breakfast on time,  very comfortable as  the configuration goes.  Reduced catering due  to the storm  was effect greatly exaggerated. This was advised by email,  however a euro  menu was provided  and not easy  to use -  this lounge made  due for this loss.

1. Ground crew in Heathrow left 60 passengers luggage.  I had 3 . 2. The Heathrow ground crew left 1 of ours behind after the 1st two  we received the  previous day. 3. The Heathrow ground crew lost our 3rd bag 4 times and we  sat on the  plane with them for over 3 hrs over the  rest of the week! 4. Due  ot this, we had to spend $500 on health  and beauty items  for my wife  during our cruise. 5. British Airways said they MIGHT  return after 3 months. 6. We had to spend $100 in cab  fares to Barcelona because the Bacelona ground crew (Iberia) claimed they had delivered it to  us 7. Heathrow  ground crew made us 15 minutes late arriving back  to Heathrow after our cruise. We actually landed 10 minutes early, but those incompetent people still were not ready for us. 8. The Heathrow  flight crew caused us to leave 45 minutes late even though ALL passengers were boarded  & ready 15 minutes before the  departure time. This  would probably mean  we will miss  my connection in Anchorage. BA clearly does not care or know how to operate a ground base...shameful. BA is a joke and should be  ashamed they can't  operate like a  commercial airline. They do not grasp the concept that even a small hiccup can cause mass ripples of chaos to other people.

London Heathrow to Gibraltar on 24th  March 2023. I shall start by  pointing to the booking process. I  use the BA  website to reserve  my seat and food the website  to be easy  of use and  reliable in every aspect. The flight  were due to  depart from terminal  one but the  aircraft were bussed for a good  45 minutes to a different part of the airport  where the aircraft  was on a  platform When boarding the flight the  passengers kept a  very low profile and this was maintained during the entire flight. The  captain made 3  audio announcements during  each flight. There  were no in-flight  announcements The seats  are clean and comfortable enough for a short flight.  The lack of  service was overt. Other than a tiny bottle of  coffee and an inedible “breakfast bar” one had to use an online  menu to order even a drink and of course pay for it too. The passengers  speaking to me  do not use the online system as it doe nt seem to  exist and the  attendant refused to sell them a coffee because of this fault. Moreover, the USB charge  point did not work either. Given the early hour  of the flight it is a poor show that there are not  drinks for sale  and available from  the trolley service. The system BA have in place  was not good ! The flight  arrived on-time. The  flight was inefficient  though and poorly managed and the  staff were not  much be seen. The crew were wearing the new  BA uniform and  this seems to reflect a downward  trajectory of the airline. To be candid, there was any difference between  a BA service  to that of  their “budget” rivals. On this route  we have a  hotel and so  I did not have an option  but use the services of a  private company.

Second time flying  US Airways and  we would not  hesitate to fly economy with them . Flight attendants  very pleasant and  friendly Excellent special  food (low sodium).  Cargo space in  Economy One of  our better flights.

I flew London to Cairo and  Dubai in October : It was  also a perfectly good pair of flights in Economy,  very pleasant and  helpful cabin crew  ( on the return journey). Being  about 1.73 m tall I have  little problem with  sitting in the back of the  seat the seat  is OK if getting a little  crowded after 5 hours, and the  offer of a rather good included  DVD box and  snacks was welcome. However, it must be said that the value for  money was poor:  as a checked  bag on the return leg only,  it was a  hefty £700 ticket. And although I  am content to  take the time  with reading or  writing it was surprising to find  no in-flight entertainment on 5-hour flights.  But overall I would still recommend  this and would  say so even  more enthusiastically if  this was more sensibly priced.

Absolutely the worst experience ever.  Flew into Heathrow, no problem. Waited for 5 hours,  2 extra hours,  for our connection  in Porto then the cancelled the flight. Scrambled for  a hotel and  our new flight the next day.  Airways routed us through Madrid the next morning. That flight was 1.5 hours late so we missed our connection to Porto. Because we missed the connection (their  fault they cancelled our return flights. After two hours on the phone with customer service  at the Madrid airport, they booked us a new  return flight, then they made is pay $ 1300 to fly from Madrid to Porto. Then, for no  reasons they cancelled our return flight . After hours, and hours and hours with customer service, we finally  got a return flight five days after our original return flight. Meanwhile, they lost my wife's luggage. We finally got 15 DAYS after they lost it. Return  flight More problems with our reservations. At no point was British Airways helpful. They left the onus on  me to fix their mistakes at every turn. They  completely ruined a three week vacation and they don't care. They wouldn't even let us speak to a supervisor or manager.  Totally bordering on passenger abuse.

Flew back from  India after scattering our son's ashes at his favourite spots. When we boarded the aircraft  for our return  trip my wife  seemed upset. A  Member of the  cabin crew noticed this and immediately  spoke to my  husband and tried  to reassure her.  Her name is  is an exceptional crew member. I noticed she spoke to other travellers  in a courteous  tone and was friendly. Each time  I passed my  daughter she asked how she was  or would she like anything. This kindness made a  stressful time easier for us both. Aircraft seats were comfortable and service  excellent for a 2hrs. 45mins. flight. Thank you B.A.

Cabin luggage had  to go to cargo, even when  it said I  had medicines. There was no time to get them out the hand . The economy seats with Virgin , KLM and even Ryanair have  limited space. Luckily it was a  long flight.

We have been using BA for  quite while now  and on average  I cannot say  that I am  not satisfied. BA  does experience cancellations  & delays most  times the time. Second, the in-flight  service is usually  better Food portions  is small and  the crew is  not very helpful especially when it  came to drink ! The screens  on the A380s should be renewed  as they are  made of scratches  and same size  as A321s. Especially  during longer flights, the entertainment system  seems more important.  This is also  a welcome package  especially for pillow , small blanket.  We would expect more from BA.  When you are flying from the US to anywhere  in the UK, I would recommend  the other airlines. But if you are flying to/from UK directly, then BA could be  one of your  choices

I flew from  Manchester to London . Business class.  For more than  part of the  flight a child  sat watching an iPad very loud with no phones plugged in - it was three rows in front  of me and disrupted my flight  before I could  hear it above my headphones. Staff thought this was fine and refused to tell the  children to turn  things down. Why  is this acceptable  on a flight  class in business ?! Has this  airport turned into  another zoo? Are staff given no training in customer  care Why is a child allowed  the disrupt other passengers? When I told the staff she just laughed at me. BA  food service is  absolute disgrace. I've  never even mentioned the food but it was bad,  real bad.

They have flow on BA several  years since the  airlines started non-stop  flying between Austin,  TX and London . Every year  the service gets  longer I brought  the tape measure with me to  see how far  out the seats  are in the  aisle section. 25½ inches. BA has  added bathrooms in  Austin to squeeze  a few more  rows of seats onto the aircraft.  Although I'm not a big person  and was able  can squeeze into  one seat without  getting too uncomfortable. When BA first  began flying out of Austin, the  service was great.  Now when I 'm at Heathrow,  I get real food and take  them on the  flight with me.  I don't know  what or who  makes BA's food,  but it is  very eatable. If  we did not  want a direct  connection from my hometown to London,  it would fly  to a different  flight When we  checked into Heathrow,  our line was  very long and only one person  kept checking people ! It took  over an hour  we get to the counter. I understand airlines are making record profits  that need to  pick up lost revenue from the  airlines but I  feel BA has  pushed too far  or has little  concern for customer  care in pursuit of profits.

The flight departed  over an hour late due to  a late inbound . The plane  was very full,  and half of the economy class  seats were forced  and check in  a larger cabin  back at the  gate when boarding,  with a complete  lack of the  standard luggage allowance ). Lots of  people on board  seemed stressed out  about missing onwards  flight due to  the delays (and  some did miss  boarding as their next  plane had closed  by the time  BA disembarked at !). Onboard service  was ok but  limited - BA  gave up being  no full-service airline  no time ago. More concerning is  that trying to  keep hold of  the services to  negotiate changes to  services and deal  with problems was  - The airline  seemed to make  it deliberately hard  for its customers  to contact it.

I hate British . We get to London on Oct 3 and our next flight  was cancelled. We  stand in line  behind 1200 other people to get it fixed and  then tell everyone to leave the  line and call them to fix.  They book us  flights next day..via online. Don't offer  discount for hotel,  so will miss our tour. Now  have to get home from Istanbul.  Uber is here  but should have  been loading an  hr ago. No explanations. May miss  the flight. Will  NEVER travel with  him again. Was  this same problem  with 2022 flight.

Our BA flight  via Porto to  Newark Heathrow T5  were operated by  Virgin using a  private plane and  airline This had  been advised by  us shortly after  arrival with the  opportunity to change flights if we preferred. Although the  business class cabin was of a  different layout to BA Club Europe, i.e. with the  back seat kept  in my wife  and I felt  our seats were more comfortable and  had legroom slightly . Service was good on board , the meal  itself very tasty  we chose the beef cheeks). All  is good until we landed at Heathrow! Although we  passed through passport control without delay,  once we were  at the designated  gate reclaim, we  then waited and … After an hour and ten  minutes I went  into the BA  information counter to  check what was going on. They  appeared unaware of an issue, but  thought they would  find out! Over  the next hour  of so various other passengers also requested information and  after various announcements and a list  with different excuses  it was almost  two hours before  our bags finally  cleared Frustrating to  say the least.  They subsequently complained to BA, but  for 4 weeks  this has been  NO explanation just the automated message from customer services  who are experiencing  very high volumes’.  This response says  A lot!

the customer services  (+ centres etc)  were atrocious and sometimes callous. They  really don’t care. Long waits to speak to anybody,  and then have  little power to actually solve anything, and the calls just cut halfway  towards resolution anyway.  When the flights  are cancelled (as were my original ) you’re really left on your own and nobody . The onboard services are so-so but for short haul it’s now  a cost” which is confusing as  you never know what to expect.  One time we were given a bottle of water  or a (very)  light snack, whilst  everybody else had to be paid . And yet  in some other  airlines apparently you have to pre-order any additional food.  Very confusing, which makes it not dependable. Cabin baggage is in theory  cheaper compared to competitors in economy but then they asked more than  all the passengers  of this flight  for check in the cabin baggage  from the gate due to lack of space in the overhead cabins, leading to long boarding delays. Their whole offering hasn’t been thought through very well . The USB power supply did not  function throughout the flight (contrary to the announcement that the power be available after the seatbelt sight was turned off ) so it was  not providing the  connection in the first place. Not  a first choice  airline on this  flight and am just trying to use up most  on my Avios  money before I totally abandon them. I fail to  see how it  got deemed a 4 star airline.

I am a  regular flyer with  Delta and have  been for the  last 15 years.  Having noted the  following given, frankly,  and cannot understand how BA scores  5 stars for  all aspects of  their service. In  a nutshell, BA  clearly placed profit  priority over passenger  safety This fact  got hammered home  on my return leg, which was  done in Club . Quite alarmingly,  Boeing appears to place profit over  customer safety by  putting its "Business "- seating up  above and beyond  their exit rows , then failing  the ensure those  sitting in exit rows have the  necessary capacity to  hold open the door incase of  any emergency. I  am not at  ALL reassured to  have an elderly and slightly built woman seated with  sole responsibility of  opening the overwing exit should the  emergency have arisen.  The business (Club ) is simply  another joke and  is useful for  earning valuable tier points for lounge/pre-boarding benefits. While cabin  level service is  excellent the lack  for space and  variety in refreshment , etc. places  BA a million  miles behind competing  brands such as  the Turkish or  Emirates who understand  their true definition  for customer appreciation and hospitality. BA  has consistently eroded  in value of their Executive Club  but seems to  have of the impression that recent  success in obtaining  seat points during  a booking process  - passengers -  while I want  the support BA  - did enjoy  flying with them  up to the  day when they  started penny pinching  - became more  fond of the  airline "Budget Airways"  The attached photos taking during my  most recent itinerary  shows the difference  of customer care/appreciation  from British Airways  and another airline  lacking in this . Both flights were around 4  hours in duration,  on the same day. Guess which  one is shows  better in-flight offering!

Flew with BA to Punta Cana.  Into the trouble  we reserve seats for both outbound and inbound flights.  After boarding at Gatwick, realised we had been moved to much less good seats with other people sitting in the seats we had spent a lot of money reserving. Apparently there has been a change of aircraft and a number of passengers had been automatically reallocated seats for no particular reason. The crew said there was nothing they could do (although of course they could just 've swapped us with the couple using our seats). We were told to claim a refund on return home. We did this via a complaint form Ns BA offered us £100 in vouchers. We didn't accept this as it was less than the cost of the seats and also naturally we wanted our money back. We eventually got it but not without a fight. Very second rate shoddy airline.

He downgraded me from business to premium economy. They  took three months  to get back to me and offered me 200 pounds or 400 %. The difference  in business class and premium economy (which I never  use is $3000  AUD and the difference between economy  and business is  4000 AUD. They owe me at  best 1500 pounds and to be very fair 3250 pounds. The downgrade was insulting and  extremely painful as I had a  lung cancer operation  but have a back injury which  I have pointed  earlier to them  that I need to lie down. The wait for  them to get around to me has been numbing. The insult of  the offer has been the slap  across the face to continue my degradation. The people I have dealt with at the airport have been down to earth, honest hard working people. The actual staff on the  flight were warm and friendly -  very helpful. The systems under which  it operates are  some sort of  mental torture.

An already delayed  plane landed and apart from the small BA logo on the rear of the fuselage,  I was no  sign as to whom the carrier really was. Boarding turned into a  fiasco with passenger  members being told  to wait in  a queue in order to board, only to be informed we were  in the wrong  plane and our boarding wasn't allowed . The interior  design was reminiscent of a BA cabin from twenty  hours earlier except  for tight legroom  with uncomfortable seating  never made a  British airline feel luxurious. The crew  was not BA but from an unknown charter company.  Flight was slow,  and as usual,  offers of food to purchase ran out before they'd reached row 24. I requested a cup of tea  that never appeared. Thank goodness for  an airport purchased water and the tiny offering of  water The over  aged senior flight  attendants who'd been facilitating in 'Club ' appeared in economy and immediately slammed down the armrests (whilst still in mid flight)  made an already  uncomfortable journey feel  like "Cattle class" was definitely that!  To say I  felt happy to  board and disembark  is an understatement.  Once again BA, never again!

Coming up in  the Gatwick cancellation fiasco; at some  time between what  were smooth check  out (unable to  check online as  part of group ), and security,  our flight was cancelled; (we were  denied entry to  arrivals and departures  was a result).  This was at  which point that  I discovered BA  who are not  passengers but a  company who are  happy to help , and provide  as little assistance  to the 'real  people provide information,  who even though our baggage was now airside, didn't have a clue as to how  I could get  ours back. It  did however, with  regards to a  call from Business  Class check in,  that came to  our assistance and help with our  own baggage retrieval,  advice on what  baggage claim and  claim and our  connecting BA flight  into LHR the  following evening. (Difficult  to give a rating for cabin  crew as we  didnt even board  an aircraft)

BA has a  huge problem with boarding it's flights.  Customers who get on first fill the luggage bins  of 2 bags, one of which  is supposed to  be small and under seat only. Cabin staff don't bother implementing their own rules. Subsequent  passengers mill up and down the aisle, bumping into each other, searching for space. Boarding  our flight took  an hour as  a result of this nonsense. The  next flight was  boarding already so our 90 minute flight was 90 minutes late.

Our connecting flight  to London to  Paris was canceled  and we were  forced to wait  two hours in  JFK airport for  the new flight.  When we received  our luggage at  customs we discovered  both our luggage  is soaking wet.  The wife’s luggage  also were wet  so had to  have air dried.

Most worst airline I have ever  flown with. Allocated  a very back  seats next to the toilets and  seats No chance  at getting any  important question asked  about possible seat  requests ignored and  got bumped the  whole time by  the crew walking  and pushing kart  down and down  stairs without one  seat Would have been better sitting  with the luggage  rack

Good service levels,  knowledgeable crew and  excellent food and beverages. I found all aspects of the service to  be superior to  standard business class,  particularly the new  Premium Club Suites.  Second Class felt  as the dedicated  crews were clearly  dedicated to working the premium cabin,  doing their work,  very proactive, friendly,  highly respectful and  the food and  beverages offering a  great step up from business class.  Each seat, with  the double doors was spacious, well  fitted and very comfortable.  British Airways offered a  great First Class  experience from Concorde  flight to boarding (which was actually by group number for a change)  with the very  warm and genuine welcome on boarding. A consistent, solid,  friendly service from start to finish and if the  price was right, I would not hesitate to book First Class with British Airways again.

Booked a very special holiday for me and my partner, September arrived  and we were on our way to lovely South of France, Booked Business Class for us both to start the holiday right. As we were checking I was told the  seat was over booked and our  tickets wouldn't print onto the ticket for some reason. We had already made sure the seats were booked when we had booked the flights nearly a year  prior to going. Unfortunately when we arrived at the gate we were then told we would no longer be sat together and one of us would in fact have to go into economy.  My girlfriend is an extremely nervous flyer and so had to take extra tablets to remain calm, She didn't have any food which we had pre booked also and she was sat right down the bottom end of the flight. We were held at the gate with another 4 or 5 couples all in the same predicament all due to  some lovely money grabbing British Airways over booking the flight. They ended up refusing passengers in the end and even had people sat on the fold down chairs in the toilet area. When we eventually arrived in France late, we was waiting  for our luggage to come. Our airtags stated that both our cases was in fact still in Heathrow. We then had to wait 4 days for them  and eventually come into France by this point our holiday was ruined. British Airways was absolutely shocking, we couldn't speak to anyone as all the phone numbers were no longer  in use. We felt stranded in a foreign country  having no clothes and no one to help use with what to do next. Every day we watched them case not moved as we were tracking with air tags. it was so frustrating not being able  even plan our days in hope we would get the call to  then drive all the way back to the air port 2 hours each way to collect our cases. we ended up going out and buying new clothes toiletries and all the stuff to make the best of our ruined holiday, saving all the receipts thinking we would be able to claim it all back. how wrong I was. British airways take zero responsibility and fob me off with going  without my insurance. British Airways only  pay for basic  hygiene Pants and toothpaste. I filed a complaint when I got back and requested my money back for business class and they haven't even had the decency to even respond. They are an absolute joke of a company and I wish they would remove British out of there name because there is nothing British about them. Do not give them your money, they cant even look  after their staff let alone customers. Oh and don't bother trying to cancel your flight either as they just take all of your money off you and give you nothing <mask>

Just returned from Chicago, flew out  two days ago on American Airlines , superb in every way, had  high expectations on return flight with  such a disappointment.The  Airbus A380 may be nice from  a pilots perspective but as a passenger it was awful.Very uncomfortable seats,  the inflight entertainment and flight tracker failed to work  during the flight, the inflight meal was inedible and  the service was  poor at best.  The short flight from Heathrow to  Chicago was much  improved very welcoming  very attentive in  the staff and  the flight even  left early. In future we will  return with one of the American  airlines

BA standards continue to decline every time I fly with them. This time, a 45 min late departure, which seems the norm for BA, and no information from the rude and clueless boarding gate staff. The Club lounge was overcrowded, dirty and grubby and cleaning staff could not cope. How many more cutbacks is BA going to apply before they become truly low cost. As a 35 year veteran user of BA, while people complained of Alex Cruz  cabin costs, the past 3 years has seen them decline very quickly under their latest CEO. One reads the occasional article about BA improving , but I have yet to see anything substantive. There seem to be few British staff left amongst the cabin crew, so maybe time for a name change and give the flag carrier status to a proper low-cost - and sadly the staff service has declined year on year. Onboard, the catering remains poor and surprised that  they can produce such rubbish meals when I have sampled their Turkish Airlines equivalent in August that was  excellent - guessing BA are too tight with their budget. Onboard WiFi service is a joke and should be avoided.

Awful. Business class check in queue  is as long as for economy,  mostly because half of the desks  is not staffed , Terminal 5 is chaotic. Business  was overfull, couldn't get seats. Delayed , unmanaged chaos at the gate.  Last drink on boarding, first drink served an hour  from take-off. The meal was poor, used to get better in economy  by other airlines. British Airways has  won the race to the bottom of the cheapskate ! Not looking forward to the flight home.

What a reliable  flight You cannot trust the timing at all. I had a 6.45am flight, boarding was  in time, but then we are sitting in the plane for already  3 hours) and the expected departure is still not clear. They have discovered the engine is not working! I am risking to be late for a business meeting in Geneva. How come they bring a not working plane to  our gate. The funny thing is  that I had another business trip in spring 2023, also with BA to Amsterdam. When I arrived to the Airport that  morning - I 'm told I don't have a  ticket I was put on the next flight in several hours, which should have get me to the business meeting late, but still not too much. In the end, on the second  day we were sitting in the cabin for 1.5 hours and I have missed the  plane I thought  I was a dramatic unlucky case that time, but today I see it's routine for  me not to fly on time.

I take comfort  after reading the last ten or so reviews to see I'm not the only traveller to put in words, how absolutely abysmal British Airways are! Most airplanes and  the lounges are  sold out, old  or broken. From  London to Heathrow,  all first class  seating and electronics  are non functional , poorly designed. One of the worst experiences on the worst airline. The flight was  delayed due to earlier technical issues.  Flight time slipped from 17:00 to 20:00 to 22:00  then finally cancelled. There was zero information given. Despite paying well over the odds for business class, we were booted out of the BA lounge two hours  for the flight. When it was finally cancelled, the BA staff. Without explanation, told everyone  we go to a gate. After another hour or  two they made us re enter the UK via  immigration control, a  nearly 40 minute wait. By now the airport was closing and there was no sign  about our bags or any help from BA. A passing Gatwick engineer finally helped us locate the bags. BA completely washed their hands of us and in contravention of CAA  regulations refused to find us accommodation.  We slept in a bus stop overnight. There were people with young children who couldn’t  afford somewhere to stay and yet BA had closed down and left. The following day the replacement flight was also late and due to  some admin mistake had no catering or liquids for a 2 1/2  hour flight. Overall the service was shockingly bad, the worst I have experienced from any airline. I will  NEVER ever use them again.

Cancelled our flight last-minute then moved  us onto a flight 2 days  later operated by  British Airlines. We had paid a lot extra for  extra legroom seats as I am  fairly tall and they assigned me  to middle seat  right in the middle of the  row Because it 's operated by a different airline but booked by BA, neither BA nor the other  airlines could change  the seat over the phone despite  seats being available.  For 4 hours  of waiting in queues and sitting on hold their solution was for me to arrive  late at the airport. I did  as the seats  having already been given away for  FREE by people  I had booked  in with that  company and could check in online.  We got a £10 meal voucher as compensation for  my enormous downgrade  on a 14 hr flight. Never  more will I  trust BA. I  will rather fly indirect with better  fares than use  this disgrace of  a airline again.

I had a  trip from Miami,  FL to Dublin,  UK via London's Heathrow airport. The  connecting flight from  Miami was delayed  and we were further delayed when  a gate was  locked when we  arrived in Heathrow. The total delay was roughly an hour but it 's enough to  make our connection  time challenge, where  it had 73  days between original  departure time until  our departure time to Dublin. When  were headed to  our connection flight,  we were stopped  by security personnel  at a checkpoint and told us that the gate  for our connection  plane had already closed. This was twenty minutes prior  the departure time. They ushered us  into customer service  could be rebooked.  Given the busy weekend of travel,  we were rebooked  on a flight  to a different  airline and were  informed that our  cost to get  home would be reimbursed. We then  spent 3 hours  getting our luggage,  which then took  the cab to London's City Airport. The cab fare  was roughly $500. When I filed a claim with British Airways, they  denied the claim and told me  why we had  hours of time to make our connecting flight and  that they denied my claim to be reimbursed for  my cab fare. This is after I explained that  was was British Airways employees who  asked us to  make the flight  within the 20 minute timeframe to  make the connecting flight. The person who rebooked us,  told us it  was policy that  they close the  gates 20 minutes  previous to departure.  I will never  trust this awful airline again. Given  all other feedback  to this site,  It appears that  that is the overwhelming sentiment.

We started our  journey with BA  in Prague. The  planes actually left  in time! I  tried to find  somewhere that’s very . We purchased  first class seats.  But you can  imagine from the  airline they hardly  do business class.  But they did  is block off  a middle seat  for the first few rows and  made it business ! Horrible flight. In addition I  experienced a really  really rude check  ticket clerk basically  yelling at me . I excused  myself and asked  how she could  give a little  level of priority  to the many  first class passengers  who weren’t being . Then we  went to Heathrow  and the real  problems began. We  had a 4  hour delay. They  asked us about  5 different excuses  of the delay.  I had a  couple employees walk  by while I  was asking them . They were  really rude. At  one point there  were no employees . And from  their announcements it  seems virtually every  single flight was ! And there  was no weather . There was  NO place to  properly store items  for business class.  I never experienced  that before. Not even a cup board for my  bottle of water.  The seat controls  dont work well.  You had to  start pushing the  button to get  things to do ! The power outlet didn’t work.  I was no  ventilation the entire  flight The overhead  overhead bin was  too heavy. I  nearly got a hernia having to  lift it. This  made a horrible  experience I’ll never  stay with them … If I  could give zero  credit I would.

I fly British  Air weekly not  because I want  to but because  they own the route there’s no  other option therefore they frankly don’t  appear to care  about the customer.  The flights are always delayed and  its always someone  is fault be  they weather delays  on incoming aircraft , flight traffic  related issues I’ve  seen it all  up for the  lives of me  to understand why they are allowed  to operate. I’ve  flown around the world and traveled with all of  The world’s airlines but British Airways are really the  worse of the worst. It’s such  an shame to  having watched what used to be  such good company fall down a  hole My advice  is if you have an option to fly with anyone else then  take the option , if you’re  flying with different connections and you  need a tight schedule do not  allow BA to  fly you to  the destination in  advance

All was ok until our connecting flight in London, just before take offs we were on the runway, the pilot came on to announce an engine problem. After engineers tried  and fix it while we waited  on the plane  for over an  airport we were finally told that we would have to be evacuated and rebooked for another flight but not to worry because a special  agent was waiting for us on the ground to help us and set us up in a hotel except that there 's no one to help us. In fact everyone refused to help ! It was Saturday almost 8pm and they just wanted to go home. Anyone with a connecting flight couldn't rebook on the application because the app wouldn't disassociate our first flight with the  connecting one in London and the staff saw this  but still refused to help us. They gave us a phone number but there was  always a message that said just  not use the app. Finally I got someone on  the phone who  scheduled us for the next day. Now it's 10:30pm  so I have to find a  new room because the airline refused also to help us with that.  Now i had 2 choices either sleep in the  airport or pay over 700GBP for a room. I don't have the money to pay  all this but after a 10  hour flight, 8 hours of jet  lag and the insane stress after the fact that no one from British Airways would help us I  booked the room. Of course I claimed reimbursement but that was over 3 weeks ago and I haven't heard anything since so I have no idea when  and how much I'll be reimbursed, even though I'm not claiming any emotional compensation from  the horrible situation they put me through due to their total indifference. It's financially difficult for me right now because the money I had to put out is equal to  half my salary  but of course it's impossible to reach them by phone. I feel  exactly as i did on August 26 2023 completely trapped by them and their indifference with no solution or information

My initial flight was cancelled 8  minutes prior the flight. Then I  got automatically rescheduled for next day. Next day, the  plane was delayed  at Hamburg and  cancelled my connecting flight to Las  Vegas Me and several other passengers spent the night in London. British Airways provided us  with vouchers but  the transfer bus dropped us at  a wrong hotel  next to our  flight and told  me that we can walk there  whenever we want to. As a result, I lost  my nights hotel reservations that I  had in las  Vegas I opened  my claim and  gave all receipts  with British Airways  to get refund of my hotel reservations, but over  two weeks now, not a single feedback from British  Airlines I will avoid all flights with them in future, and will share this story.

We will never  repay British Airways ! Our flight on July 15 2023 from LHR to LAX was  delayed 20 hours before departure without any explanation. Since  two weeks we 're now waiting for the refund  because BA does not pay us the cost caused  by the cancellation.  How disappointing.

Check in and  security clearance very  quickly at LHR T5. My wife and I used the Galleries North lounge and at 6-00am it was easy to get  our seat. Good  continental breakfast options.  We boarded on  arrival and flight departed on time. I was seated in 4 A,  the Club Europe seats on the A320 seem to be getting smaller and legroom (I am 6ft) was very tight. Cabin Crew service was  excellent I chose the full English  and it was ok, but there  was a lot of water in  one bottom of the bowl. Flight landed on time.  Overall an OK flight but Club Europe doesn’t feel very premium these days.

Jet Airways has confirmed itself as  your worst airline  in the UK.  last minute cancellation,  zero explanation, refusal to book with  another airline “because  they don’t have  an arrangement with ". What’s happened  with what used  to be our  favourite airline?

Worst BA experience. I was supposed  to fly out to Italy on 7 September 2023.  I arrived at OR Tambo International airport ready to check my bags in (I already  booked online the previous evening so I had my  baggage pass ready). At the counter I was told  the I had  been off-loaded from  the flight as  the connecting flight has been cancelled.  More information was sent regarding this ! The team at the check-in  counter tried to get me on another flight that  day but there were no flights available. They did manage to get me another flight the following evening , Lufthansa to Italy via Frankfurt. However, I did miss the first part of my trip having arrived a day and  a half later than I was supposed to. Upon moving the flights I did ask the BA staff whether my flights  tickets are still valid and that everything is in order, which they assured me is correct. I have to fly back to South Africa on 18 September and upon checking my booking information I noticed on my BA account , my first flight (Milan to  Milan is just missing from my booking. My connecting from London to Johannesburg is still there. After spending the entire morning  calling the customer , two different operators picked up and in both instances, the moment I proceed to give my booking reference number, my call gets dropped.  So it seems like I will be arriving at the airport again on Monday without  the flight.

My daughter and I were denied boarding on our business class flight from Madrid to Heathrow in March 25, 2023, the first leg on our return flight to Victoria, Canada. No reason was given for the denied boarding by the check in staff at the British Airways counter in Madrid, who said they were only agents and told us to  call British Airways. We were three  days early for the flight and had valid passports. After many tries we finally reached British Airways by phone, but we were told to call Expedia which had booked the flights. Expedia confirmed that we had been bumped from the flight, with no explanation as to why. Expedia then began a long process of finding alternative flights. Over the next 24 hours we had numerous calls with both Expedia and British Airways. Incredibly, the next available flights were 9 days later on April 3. This was almost unbelievable, but after many many tries it was the best we could do. Even though  they were Business Class tickets. Part of the problem was that apparently rules did not allow any changes to routing for any segment of the flight. This nine day delay was a major problem for us. I had to miss work and my daughter was missing school. Further, we received no compensation from British Airways, no penalty fee, and not any reimbursement of our expenses for staying the nine extra days. After our return I  used the British Airways online complaint process, and submitted all supporting documents. I received an email reply and a case reference number. And then nothing. I sent numerous follow up emails, and received no replies. It is now months later, and still  we have not heard from British Airways. This is shocking, and definitely the worst airline service I have received for my thousands of flights over many decades. I am a very patient person and this is the first time I have commented on this type of forum. I think the public should be made aware of extremely poor customer service at British Airways.

The boarding being the usual free for all at LHR with groups 1-3 being called  onto board all at once. Whilst  most passengers who had agreed to check in a bag in at the gate, getting to board before  everyone else! However,  the service on board was impeccable. Superb crew, friendly, attentive, interacting with  customers and generally appearing to be  doing their job. Like BA in  the old days and at its  height Food choice  and quality seems  to have improved  considerably (no beef  cuts thankfully) and  indeed the Club  experience appears to have returned. Old style Club seating,  this is at least better, and feels less cramped, on the 787's.

Not cancelled, no , 9th September  is not peak  demand period so  is such bad management by BA?  Not to the  passengers left standing  for over and  again and then  again cancelled. As  any other on  this day. Why  does BA continue  and provide such  poor service -  A national disgrace.
The worst service  is my baggage  did not arrive  at time. Both  the flights were  cancelled I will  never fly them  back  Even  my food was  terrible and your service.
Most flights we booked this holiday  are delayed about 1-2 hours. No wifi available on  flights of 4 . Food and  drinks very basic and expensive. Cannot recommend

British Airways has a total lack of respect for its customers. I was booked to fly from Frankfurt  Main to London  Heath Airport, and  only a couple of hours before  my scheduled departure the flight was suddenly cancelled by  them without explanation, when I was already at the  gate The worst thing was the utter callousness that  they showed towards customers. The ground  handling attitude was : they are merely third party , not BA employees, and therefore , quickly washed their hands of  us all, telling  customers we had to contact BA  management via phone  if we wanted . They couldn’t  actually provide us  the phone number, telling us to  look it up on ba.com !  Then BA abandoned its passengers. They  would tell us  the the BA departure to Heathrow  was also been cancelled, meaning there  will be no further BA flight  connecting Frankfurt to London that day (although other airlines  was still operating the route- but  still refused to rebook us on !). The reason  given for both cancellations was “technical reasons”. No assistance or information was  given on our  behalf due to cancellation, nor any information on help  for food/ accommodation help etc. Their attitude was literally that the cancellation had nothing to do with them and it was  our problem, not theirs. I received  a email an  instant later notifying  them that I had been automatically  put on an alternative flight 24 hours later, which wasn’t acceptable as I had to get back to  London that night.  I rang BA’s  call centre and again, they showed  a high degree  and callousness. 95% of the half-hour call was spent  with me waiting  in hold, with the phone just cutting off after half an hour,  and no meaningful information given to me by that point. There was no attempt by the call operator to call me  up when the line cut (and  they had a solid phone signal and wifi as I was still standing in Terminal  B of Frankfurt Main airport), even  when my phone number is listed  on my booking  card details. They  clearly don’t care. In the end , had to  arrange my own  flight to London by taking a coach to Hanh , which was 112km away , waiting there for 5 hours and  finally booking an expensive last minute ticket with Ryanair  from Stansted. At least that flight operated on time and got me back to London!  This is worse than a low cost carrier now.

From Heathrow to Keflavik, Iceland in  Business Class on an A321. British Airways provides an  exceptional Business Class experience for intra-Europe ! The seating is similar to  other airlines - middle seat vacant , little extra space - but on British Airways  their Business Class  seating extends to  over half the aircraft. This makes  for less than a premium experience  at every step, from boarding to onboard. The WiFi  lasts for only half the flight and there are  no refunds. But  once it worked it was surprisingly  good Service on this flight was  very good and we got to  Frankfurt on time.

Flying to London  arrived in Business  class on an  Airbus B777-200. This  aircraft featured the  usual Club World  class seats. They  are comfortable, there  was enough storage space around the  seat and the monitor screen is  among the larger ones I've seen  on airplanes. BA's new Club Suites  were said to  be far superior,  compared with the  newer B-class rivals.  An entire Business  World cabin had  just 2 washrooms , it wasn't an issue on  the flight since the premier section wasn't at full capacity. There was  wifi on board,  nice enough to even send videos via messaging apps. Service onboard was  decent but the  cabin lacked warmth.  Fast food was  bland and no . The biggest  benefit of this  airline is that it gets out of Bombay at 1:10 pm in  the afternoon instead  than the ungodly  mid morning hours  that international flights  took off from . The airport  service is far  from pleasant at this time. In  short British Airways  had a good,  but not spectacular,  Economy Class product.

Support and support shocking. Written by a previously loyal BA traveller. Lies , misleading unprofessional  behaviour Told that my flight was cancelled. Booked on  to next available  flight in downgraded  economy from business  economy premium economy. Called to ask why. Told technical  difficulties with my original flight. My  illness was another reason. At airport,  someone in staff  said that not  allow crew to staff original flight  earlier in day. Why take my money and allow  BA to book  my flight which  should have allowed  me to get  my work as a doctor in the first place!  How can you  expect such an  airline to look  after you as a flying customer.

Flying A380 business  classes should be  pure pleasure but  management has made  BA a disaster with the worst  layout and configuration imaginable. How could  a sane person  just jam so many seats into a limited space and expect passengers  will be happy. Seats are narrower than economy on some airlines and  you must face  the person until  one plastic screen  is raised. The  plastic screens are the size of  two medium sized  refrigerator and the  screens are behind  their head in a sitting position.  There is no  room to put anything except one small pull out draw at ground  zero that can not be reached  while seated nor accessed when sleeping , The window  seats and middle seats are accessed by having to jump over a passenger on an  aisle seat and the seats are  too low that  some are hard  and elderly to  jump out of. The whole business class set up  is a sick joke. Eating is  difficult because the  seat is not  high enough to  your table and the tables are  so flimsy that  they can fall off. Are there  other redeeming features , the answer is no. If you like a little comfort avoid BA like the  Emirates

UK Airways absolutely  did not care.  My reserved seat  was change from  one aisle to  aisle seat for  free overnight, full  service and it was quite awful.  When enquiring at  baggage check in,  an agent said , nothing we can do. Onboard  this flight the  crew seemed to try and finish the meal service  in a racing  horse with meals  being passed out , no proper  instructions about choice.  No back and  out trays and  they disappeared to  eat in the  queue for hours  after that. No  long runs, if  they need anything  just not bother  calling the call  button as they  just ignore it.  We used to  like travelling British  Airways 10-15 years , but the bean counters have been in and  cut it close  as a lowcost . I guess  they are badly  suffering from their  bad attitude and . My last trip to London , with Delta,  which are so  very better than  this very poor  imitation of an  offer that British  Airways has now :

My recent experience  at British Airways was not just horrendous, it was an utter abdication  for responsibility on their part. I arrived at JFK ready for my  plane to Malaga, only to find it had been cancelled with zero ! After a draining 2-hour altercation, I was finally  put on a different flight. The nightmare continued when I landed in Malaga sans luggage, containing essentials for my son's wedding. Thirty agonizing hours later, the bags  turned up—but my brand-new iPad and a special watch  for my nephew  remained missing. The items weren't merely  valuable they had emotional significance, which  rendered the loss even more gut-wrenching.  You think a reputable airline would make amends for such  errors.  Despite the clear mishandling of  our baggage by  the team, they refused to offer any reimbursement or even a modest  amount of airline credit. Their customer  service was not only ineffective but  also astonishingly callous.  The response was, in essence, "It's your fault for trusting us with  our belongings." This  isn just poor customer service; it's a complete disregard for basic human decency and responsibility. British Airways had numerous opportunities to right their wrongs  but chose not . If you have any respect  for your time, belongings, and emotional well-being, avoid British Airways at all ! They not only fail to  deliver on promises but also refuse to make amends when they err, leaving customers to bear the brunt of their incompetence.

It is to  express our displeasure  and concerns regarding  the flight to : Our trip  is effectively ruined  through the failure  of our luggage  to arrive with  us coupled with  a length of  travel it took  from it to  finally reach us , and 12  hours Our departure  Date June 19,  2008 - Flight BA 294, Chicago  - London. I was told  from the cabin  attendant that there was no reservation  in her transport.  Because our checked  bag (2) failed  t make the  previously rebooked flight  from London to  Chicago BA took  nine days to  find my bag , 12 days  to deliver my  luggage I called  the Baggage Claim  twice daily. After 5 days,  they stated that  they found my  missing bag, but  failed to verify ! Both bags  I described had  bright pink 4”  easily visible tags  and bright pink . Taking 9  to 12 days  to deliver them  is inexcusable. Our  departure date: July  9 - BA  from Rome to  Chicago BA 297,  Chicago to Chicago.  All flights were  delayed We arrived  at Chicago more  then 3 hours  after missing our  return transportation to  return home in  Rome (3 hours ). On July 12  BA filed our  claims for replacement  for lost clothing  & toiletries, also  some food purchased  at Heathrow due  for the flight  delay and overnight  food charges in . I can  safely say that  both times I  am able to  contact a human  and they were  so courteous and  happy to help,  or appeared at  a loss.

WE flew London to Malaga on 27 August in Club Europe. We stood around at Gate B45 in Terminal 5 for  almost an hour, with staff giving very different reasons for the delay, late inbound aircraft etc - but the plane we boarded had been sitting there for  more than an  hours After boarding,  our captain stated that because they had changed planes  there would be no meals served. This is Club Europe, and we received one small packet of crisps throughout the flight.  No effort to . We smelt the hot meal  of pilots being heated and then saw it being  handed to them  in a Club Europe meal tray. Cabin crew also had warmed pastries ( and were  very quick to use air freshener in the front galley!) while customers received zilch. BA sent an email the following morning to say sorry - nothing else. What a complete and utter rip  off by an airline that is already cutting back on so many things. I paid  a full Business class fare, did not receive any  details of the onboard meal service  - they expect  an email to be sufficient. Avoid BA if you have any other option nowadays, they 're the worst in Europe.

I arrived at the airport about 2.5 hours before takeoff to have more than about time to get checked in, go  thru security, etc. All that went without any issues. Being that I was relatively early at the gate, I was one of the first passengers there. After  that time boarding  was opened. First the business class got called up, then families with children and disabled people. A couple minutes into the boarding they started to call up people, one by one, by name. Then there was an announcement: they won’t let anyone in anymore. Me and about fifty other people were still standing at the gate not being let in.  The reason, they said, was that the plane was short staffed (Later I discovered, speaking  with a manager, that not only the flight was short staffed but also it was ). After the announcement people were getting angry because they wouldn’t be  letting in anymore. Nothing changed and everyone was sent away. I had a connecting flight later that day that I was going to miss because I was not let on the plane. First I tried to get my luggage back which I didn’t receive immediately but got a hold of later  today thanks to the airport personnel. Then, just like everyone who was going to fly with the same plane, I wanted to talk to someone from British Airways. Since they don’t have a service center at Frankfurt Airport everyone  headed to the check-in counters where we received food vouchers but not  one single person was either able to rebook my or anyone’s flight nor get anyone refunded. All the staff said was  that we were going to receive  an email in a couple hours  with options to rebook the flight or get a refund. First flight, good  to very good  the food was  as you would expect. When we missed  our connection and  was stuck behind  seats for 2 hrs waiting for  it they rebooked  us on a flight from Heathrow to Milan the  same day, gave  a free bus  back to Heathrow, gave us a free hotel room,  then gave us Dinner and Breakfast , Great customer  service

First check in a T5. Galleries south and North lounges packed, only just able to get a seat.  Never stay long , B gates  are much quieter. Flight boarded smoothly and on time.  Large upper deck. A simple story with an unfortunate outcome that really  did happen to  me My partner and I recently started working after studying purchased two tickets to travel  from London City  airport to Frankfurt.  Before we purchased the tickets, I  mistakenly entered my  surname twice (e.g.  as John Smith and Ms John ). Little did we know that our 1 simple mistake would cost  me over 300 pounds. Upon arriving at the airport we were told  their was no way to change the name (apparently  you can only  change 3 letters  when there has  be a typo?) and I had  no other option to purchase the  last remaining ticket if I wanted to board the  plane - the price: almost seven times (!) higher than my original . Zero empathy  being shown. Zero alternative was offered. Trusting BA's staff and under the  knowledge that there was apparently no  possible way we could board the  flight we bought this ticket. Immediately after I purchased  this ticket I  contacted BA's 'Commercial  Guest Booking Team' and informed them  of our situation.  A service representative apologised and told me they could have changed the name at the cost of a small fee. He offered to cancel my original ticket and issue me  a partial refund then, advising me  how I had a claim to the difference and  we should contact Customer Support to  do so. I  told this person  numerous times I  needed to claim the cost of  my new ticket and even asked him explicitly if by accepting this offer, I would be denied from claiming the cost of the new ticket. He said no, I could  refund the difference.  True enough - we accepted this offer and lodged a ticket with Customer Support for  the difference. Two days later, British  Air Customer Response informed us that  they were unable to lodge a  claim because we had 'voluntarily accepted the cancellation before  our flight'. They've continued to send  me emails until  next week, when they just stopped responding. So in  effect British Airways  lied and deceived my partner into accepting a lowball offer to waive our right to claim a refund. It keeps me  going at night thinking how they can do this  and get away with it so  easily

Of course AMS is  our BAs home base and it uses contracted staff here, but it  will require a  higher level of service, It was embarrassing hearing the pilot apologise at every step of the way. A really great pair of flights, on time, no  problems at all,  flight was ok and my meal  plans were great, the new club  seats is a good improvement over the previous seat,  best flight entertainment  I have been  amazing can’t wait  t fly with  him again and  enjoy another great  flight

Our A380 developed a fault taxiing  onto the runway - we returned  to the gate only to then have the flight cancelled about 3  hrs later due to a technical fault. All the while, BA staff  being virtually non-existent, it was finally  a captain who announced the flight was cancelled. No arrangements or help made with overnight accommodation or transport,  Finally managed to get the legal minimum £520  refund out of  BA for the 26 hour delay they caused to my journey, and expenses were reimbursed too, but even this took four weeks.
