She did offer  up an upgrade to Premium Economy , at 450GBP  but it was  beyond our affordability. She said we should try again at the departure gate but that also failed. We spoke to a member of the  ground crew who was totally unsympathetic. The economy seats are so tiny that I was  sitting shoulder to  chest between by wife and a  woman with knees touching the seat pocket in front. For 12 hours  I suffered. When  I did manage to get out  to our seat due to the kindness of the young lady next to me on  our aisle, it was a mission trying to clamber past the reclined backrest in front of me. BA Economy is absolutely awful. The evening  meal was near-inedible - both choices were spicy foods which are not very suitable when  eating especially for  any older person. The breakfast Spanish Omelette was, however, not bad at all. The previous day we had flown economy from Malta to Heathrow  on Malta Airlines and that 3 hour trip was a pleasure. The  seats are wide  but there is  ample legroom. If they can do it, then why  cannot British Airways.

We arrived at  JFK at 0600 , find our flight to Ibiza  being cancelled by  BA with no explanation. As if  that wasn’t galling enough, the customer  assistance from BA at the airport was non-existent! There  were no explanation, no apology and  zero assistance in  arranging an alternative flight. We’ve managed to find another  alternative from Stansted  airport that isn’t  departing much later today, thus wasting a chunk of our short trip. I simply don’t  know why BA don’t proactively contact  their customers to notify them of  a cancellation, and work with them  to resolve the problem. Shocking customer  service

Original flight was cancelled with no  response There was no representative to help in rebooking We had to  call customer service (long distance call)  phone line kept dropping Had to do 40 +  searches to find  alternate booking only to discover the only way I could fly the  same day was  for paying business class. No help  Finding hotel for the night stay.

Airport check in  very functionary with little warmth but some efficiency. Flight was delayed with  no communication given. Boarding was chaotic  and no management of the process by ground staff.  Controls on board are tight and  you really feel like they have  been in every  way possible. There is next to no recline. However  one was thankful that there was no recline. If the person in  charge had even the slightest recline they would be in my face  due to how tight the seats were spaced on  an A321 aircraft. No amenities on  that flight except for a toilet that was clean  and small. No IFE, no food and beverage unless you pay extra but the staff  was friendly. Luggage  arrived at the carousel within a very short amount of time.
Flight fine. In-line  to competitors. Pleasant ! Only niggle is bussed to and from aircraft  in Heathrow. It seems like this is standard for the Berlin flights.  Could use again.

Fly from Glasgow to London and took connecting flight American Airlines from  London to North  Charleston It's my third day here in North Carolina , still waiting  for my luggage.  I didn't even bother to transfer the luggage to connecting flight. Luggage are still in  transit

My flight on on 12 May  2019 got delayed an hour and 25 minutes which resulted in the  delay of our  second flight on  12 May 2023  because the arrival  from the first flight was only  seconds before the departure of the second connecting flight. We contacted the  flight call center multiple times to make changes to  our flight in  time to still  travel on the  13 of May  in KEF airport  with different flights.  My team tried to find a  compromise but none made sense, not  least on the  same day the 13th of May ! We have made full booking  of accommodation, car  and activities etc for the vacation in Iceland. The  balance of of  the booking is  not refundable. The  calling center suggested  if we cancel the flight for a full refund, then claim compensation for the delay and difference in airfare cost and other non refundable bookings due to the delay and  cancel of our flight. British Airways responded to the claim after a month with no compensation at all,  even though we  paid additional $600  of new bookings and additional charges. The refund of  my cancelled flight  took more than  one month with multiple calla to follow up almost  each week. I was promised to  a refund on the first call but later I found out it  had not processed properly. Every-time I  call the agent ask questions about why flight was canceled etc which  became annoying when  not understanding everything was under process  and payment. After  several calls I  got refunded partially , not the full amount which is even bizarre from a company  of this level.  I had to make more calls to get the remaining balance refunded.  This whole experience  felt terrible.

This is a 5 hour flight and BA considers  it to be short haul, so everyone is crammed in with knees  lined up against  a seat in  front and nothing in the way of inflight entertainment. Not even a  TV - which is now available by WiFi that you have to  charge for. You  need to pay for your seat  - checked in  - food & drink, WiFi. Not  because I have anything against that , I'm used to that on budget airlines -  but this is  still a premium  class ticket. I would have preferred to fly on  Emirates where the  base ticket would have been less, and the extras would have been  twice the price. The BA app and website makes it really difficult to understand the extras and we ended up with baggage on the  cheapest ticket so had to pay extra. And don't get me started on their customer  service helpline. On board the staff are ok but on the long Cairo-London route they spend most of their time on a break where  people use the back row or  sit and talk  - without any  consideration for the passengers. And for the flyers who don't want the  hassle of charges, minimal cabin service, and budget seats, then they could easily provide a 'premium economy' option  and really make a difference  in the experience. Heathrow Terminal 5 compounds the poor experience, especially for  passengers It is also poorly served  for transport links - especially for those of us who live near Gatwick which is being abandoned by BA. I have  become a frequent flyer for many years - and was even a BA Gold Card  Holder at one point - so  you know about  this potential experience. I used be  able to make  a choice -  do I fly  cheaper or do  you fly more comfortably for more? Now it's a  matter of flying  cheaper or flying  cheaply for double the price with BA.

After travelling London to Madrid with  British Airways, then  through Iberia from  London to Lima  and LATAM to Cuzco, my luggage  arrived 7 days  with me. When  attempting to collect my luggage, mine  is the only  one not to . I sought  assistance and was informed to make  a claim online.  When my bag  finally arrived 7  days later, the  bags had been  cut open and  everyone inside the  bag searched. Someone  took my 1st aid kit and  backpack and threw  some clothing about,  and felt violated.  We have been  humiliated appallingly from  beginning to finish.  For a month,  i have been  to and forth  with British Airways,  but they stated  it is not  our fault.

MY luggage was mis-tagged in Dallas on my way  to Cairo via  Bring My Luggage  delivery at LHR  was planned on Saturday 6/24. However, upon arrival due to the luggage  getting mis-tagged and having the incorrect name on my luggage, it was never sent to Cairo. Its sitting  in Terminal 3  at LHR (I  had an air tag on my ) and British  Airlines is saying there is nothing they can do about it. I have filed 3 claims, made 13 phone calls, have been hung up on 3x and  as simple as it is to solve this problem , workers at BA refuse to  address the problem.

This airline lost  the luggage and  looked absolutely awful throughout the entire  trip They gave  you no updates, their website sucks,  and it was  nearly impossible to  reach someone on the phone. They  never delivered my luggage to my hotel after i had left to  go back to  the US, 5 days after I  told them to ship it back  to the US.  So I’ve been  up everyday begging them to get my bag back  to me. They appease me on the phone, tell  them they’re fixing it, but nothing changes. The hotel  cant get in  contact with them  and they haven’t  even tried to pick to bag back up. Several times, when I  called I got a message saying they were not  working due to too many complaints and calls and  said “call back ".

We booked on the BA website, round trip flights from Seattle to Amman with a stop in London, in Business Class.  My first flight was delayed and then diverted to NYC, and enroute my husband experienced a medical emergency. When we landed in NYC we were taken to a hospital and I stayed in constant contact with the airline agent who had arranged for the ambulance transfer. The same evening we flew back home, confirming cancellation of all remaining flights with the agent at the airport. For the next several weeks, we spoke many times with BA Customer Service, trying to obtain some kind of refund — we were met with  vague explanations, excuses and an absence of meaningful customer service. We discovered we had been marked as “no-shows” for our flight to Amman and that our return flight was still active. We were unable to cancel the return on the website, despite booking on the website. Our phone calls were never returned, we spent a minimum of  20 minutes on hold for every phone call we made, our emails received only canned replies without answers or explanations, we were told it was “not possible” to receive a copy of the ticketing rules and regulations nor to speak with a supervisor, and after several weeks of this abysmal customer service I filed a complaint with the FAA. In response to my complaint I received an email from BA Customer Service  saying that they had reviewed my many requests for a “full refund” but that could not be accommodated due to the ticketing rules. They would issue flight credits - except  for the portion for which we no-showed. They did not state how many credits. We never once asked for a full refund - we asked to read the rules and to receive a partial refund. We will not use the credits - we were fully refunded by our travel insurance.

First time flying with BA business  and never again. There are no boarding drinks provided.  My meal quality was below business  class standards as was the quality of the wine. On arrival at Bodrum my bags  are among the last to appear.  Im looking forward  doing the same  experience on the  new flight.

You can buy  bread and crisps but don't expect  a hot meal.  As the plane is a narrow  one , there  were no screens.  Not helping matters  is the fact  that the BA  gift shop for  food didn't recognise the flight number, and the onboard  free WiFi didn't work.

This is a  travel review covering  Economy and business  seats on the  same flight from London City to  Birmingham Economy was : A very  light lunch (small ish sandwich, chocolate ), followed by  my pretty much free-flowing drinks trolley. The flight was  slow but the  attendants worked hard  & did a  really good job.  This is a flight I would  recommend Except, don't  go for the last minute offer  on an upgrade to business for  seating in each  seat as I  did (I flew  straight out and business back, while my brother flew  business then economy.)  My business seats  look identical to  Economy with no  windows blocked, so  you are squished  in four abreast. The meals are  also identical, with  some tweaks such  a a yoghurt for your £100.  Your only real  difference is Champagne.  Also on my flight, there was  champagne because of  technical issues". The  gate attendant (I  think his name  is Tom) must  be one of  the best in  the business. I  cannot eat, so  he paid £100 for nothing. Oh ! So great , but stick  to economy.

Absolutely horrible airline.  Website is terrible. Last minute delays,  no seat changes  & no communication. App and website  customer experience is years behind other airlines. Seats are  crowded and uncomfortable.  I Would not  go again.

Having experienced delays , cancellations departing  for USA to  Europe and now  the 3.5 hour estimated delay at LHR heading back  into USA, I  strongly warn travelers : BA has  become unreliable and  its now on  the “Do Not Fly list until  things get better .

Travelled to Heathrow , Kalamata and  return journey 11  hours later. World  Class (aka Economy)  flight Both flights departed on time.  The flight landed  fine - BUT , we then  faced a 1  ½ hour wait  in the baggage  to be offloaded  - rather ruined  my journey home  because we then  caught a motorway . Flights OK , FA's (particularly  on return flight)  Fair enough. But,  as usual, Economy  Class seating was  simply dreadful -  no legroom at  all No better  in Club class  seating - only  one middle seat  for free. Marked  off because of  - Can only  sit if you  are not tall.

This flight failed  on every level.  we were delayed  and arrived at our destination late  so that our  hire car transfer  had to advise  us that he  might only wait  about 10 minutes for us but this was a  cancelled holiday. We  only ordered food  for our flight and this was  all loaded onto  the flight and  we finally compound British Airways complete  or utter uselessness  my luggage was still in Heathrow.  As there is no flight tomorrow , earliest this  flight could possible  get is very  late on Wednesday ! Having only  bought clothes that you flew in  after reading you  had only claim for toiletries and  this seems to  me the antithesis of a happy holiday. I might have expected a  chocolate scone in  spite of no  bread but no  and were told that we could purchase from the trolley what they  had available. I  should like to  make it clear  that we are  the airways bronze  medal holders which as we have  now long retired  shows how we 've used this airline historically.

Beware of British  Airways and their  attempts to make  people believe that  you are full  business class and  even above the  rest They won't  give you that  way when you  were bumped from  a flight and it is their  job to compensate you for their  error We recently  took a trip  we planned from MRS to SEA.  Our mechanical issue  ensured that we departed late from MRS to LHR  and we needed to make a  connecting flight. We  arrived with plenty  of time to  made it to  the next gate, but a series  technical issues and choices by British  Airlines kept us from boarding our  connecting plane. The  airline did not  send off passengers  on connecting flights first nor did they hold the  last flight for  the mere 5-10  minutes for passengers to make connections  to their airlines.  Then we discovered  later we had actually been bumped  to our next flight before we even landed. We were pushed to  the Atlantic to  figure out how to get us home. It extended  my travel day  by 8 hours!  You were traveling with children as  well No offers of compensation or  refunds were made. And now BA  are refusing to  give us any financial compensation. We  paid for a  flight home with  not one connection and instead had  two connections, multiple  airlines to deal  and security through an extra airport , kids for  that midnight flight we were never  allowed on. That  was not what  I paid for  and BA refuses to make it !! So beware potential travelers!

I flew from Cairo to Heathrow on what they  call euro club  flight which is a cramped coach  car with the  odd empty seat.  Poor service. I get to Heathrow  airport 40 minutes late so I  have to run  everywhere looking for  a connecting flight. Finally jumping through escalators and train  to another building where is my  luggage Given a  seat that is different than what  they paid extra  in ?! It’s a shame for such well known .

We flew with numerous airlines, but I gotta admit, British Airways is  so far the  worst airline ever when it comes to customer support.  We waited 3 weeks for a  ticket change. Call  desk workers are  giving you false information just so  it would make  you hang up. They told me  he was supposed  I get an email from them with the flight  change but never . They don't have a live  website just like  Southwest Airlines do,  they don't have  an online form  for submit your questions, they don t have a  direct international number.  Just garbage.

We were traveling as a family (5 people). Because of an accident by the airport, we arrived at the airport only  one hour before the flight. The kiosk was unable to read one of our passports and we had to go to check-in. The lady at the check-in checked the passport , gave us a boarding pass. Because we had no extra time,  I headed straight to security and  I realize the lady gave us a duplicated boarding pass (not of the passport holder). We got stuck in security because of that, couldn’t  work out what was wrong. We only didn’t miss the flight because we ran through the airport with  our 70 year  olds and a 9 year old included in the party. The staff at the gate was very cordial and helpful once we arrived there.

Flying at 8.40am from DUB to LCY cancelled 1155pm night before. No  phone message. No ? Waiting at  last stop and randomly checked email  and see alternate  route option. Hang . What’s this!  I was dark at 5am. It  was hard to  call mobile phone  and I’m still  jet lagged. Only  plan was to  call at 9.20am.  No calling. No  answer there. So accepted it. But I didn’t see the day change!  That was the next day! I didn’t want the  flight (as was staying at Docklands !) choosing LCY but thought I better take it as it’s leaving  one hour after  your original flight. Nope. I better  try to say  how sorry I  messed up. Your  flight is not going to work  on me. I  barely have any  other accommodation in  England and I  really want to  have one night  to London. Called.  The most surly  airport service (can  it even be called that when  people treat people like this) answered.  And kept calling me James (not  my name). She  is brutal. You accepted it. I can’t do anything.  You basically made  myself feel like  the moron because  in a moment 's confusion I  chose the first  scheduled flight from  a stupid supercomputer.  You kept telling me about the algorithm and this was the flight that was chosen.  Now if you  only called us we could have  put you onto a Aer Lingus flight! Why didn’t you call? You are at fault. Just so callous and uncaring. She  wanted to charge  you 600 pounds in new flights  and change fees.  Just said nope and booked a  flight today with  Emirates Plus I  have to find my way from Gatwick to Docklands.  More money from  them because of  the utter contempt for their passengers. I’ve been flying Qantas for 25 years and they  really do some  stupid stuff. But never this level of cruelty because of one simple  thing Never again.  When do people  display such utter  ignorance and ineptitude? Welcome to the  Jungle Just wow.

* I have  booked twice with them this year  for business class and they have  experienced significantly delayed or cancellations with  my flights. The  poor service or  the lack of it is appalling  it has forced  us to change  my cards as I no longer  wish to use BA for any  longer flights. Terrible  looking old planes  with miserable staff. </s>

The customer service  is ugly. Tried calling two weeks ago but still had problems with flight. All I get is someone in India. I thought i was flying Iberia once  I looked close at ticket it 's British Airways. Will never fly  an Airway ever again.

Most uncomfortable flight  you have ever  flown It's a long time since I have flown  and the cramped conditions were awful. The rows were so close together  that the person  in front reclined  the seat my TV was so close I couldn't focus on it.  Somehow BA seem to want to  offer economy so  as to encourage customers to upgrade,  this has not worked on me, I will avoid flying BA in future. My onward flight was with LATAM, same 787 aircraft but more room between rows, far more comfortable. On the return flight from Santiago the lights were  completely down at  times I feel the cabin crew do this to avoid providing a service, they just disappear behind the curtains.

we booked our  way out of  town trip to take my husband  to a surprise  vacation to Monaco.  BA gave us  only 3 hours  between our connecting  flight to and  our home through . Our flight  departed Seattle an hour late causing  we to miss  our connecting flight.  We were rescheduled , we even  arrived They booked  me on a  flight 7 hours  earlier and offered  no food tickets  and any other  kind of reimbursement.  Then we sat  in their customer  services line for  a hour and  the half to  see if they  could rebook us  for an earlier  plane to watch  BA continually assist  other customers that  showed up outside  of the queue  as earlier flights  became available). When  they arrived in  Paris France the  line was closed,  including the rental  assistance desk. We  were not offered  further assistance from  either airline on  a room or  other accommodation for  a night. We  called a cab,  that cost us  50 euros one  hour to get  from our hotel.  we thought there  was no way  anything like this  could happen on  your way home….we  thought wrong. Our  plane from Nice  at Heathrow was  30 minutes late,  With a 2.5  hour layover you  may think we  would still make  that flight, unfortunately  the security lines  caused over 1.5  hour further delay.  On arriving BA  closed the doors , said they  would not hold  this plane any  longer despite arriving  hours before departure.  After running through  to Heathrow airport  then going through  security again. They  put us back  in the customer  services queue, where  their first statement  is we can’t  fly you out  till tomorrow. After  which they found  out a flight  to another airline.  By that time  we were told  the bags were  related to our  flight with Delta.  They were given  2 pounds each  for snacks at  the airport for  our now additional  2 hour delay.  The total for  our trip there  from home we  travelled 13 hours  at Heathrow airport  from our original  planned layover of  4 hours, and we were offered  one pound each.  Then the drama ? The two  claimed that they  still made the  next flight, shockingly  had not. We  were told that  we had the file the claim  to Delta, since  that last part  of our flight  were with them.  I have now  been home for  4 days and  neither airline is  pointing the finger  to the other. As I said  for both of  you today. I  dont care who’ s my bags  sort it out  and send me  your luggage I  also want your $500 reimbursement per  day as that  would come close  with the memories  and stuff that  you have in  me I will  NEVER fly British  Columbia again, and  our baggage people  do not doing <mask> either.

My husband and  myself booked seats  through our premium economy booking. On  the outward journey BA015 on 12 February and return on 11 March  we were last OR almost last  to be served . Each time they had run out of our choices. On one occasion I did not eat as  only available option was curry which disagrees with me. On all flights there appeared to be an undue focus on curry/spicy ! All in  one very disappointing  experience left us with a very poor opinion of  BA Airways.

July 3, flew  from Seattle to  London then to  Boston BA lost  my golf bag  that caused me  to purchase golf  and club rentals,  and balls. I  booked tee times  on two courses  in St. Andrews  that took months  the make. The  time my bag  arrived in 24 hours and they  would reimburse occurred , I contacted  Walmart and they  said they would  also reimburse toiletries.  Then the return  trip home was  randomly canceled by  Delta without notifying  them or without  informing two weeks  before the scheduled  departure I contacted  a corporate travel  agency they informed me BA, canceled  my return reservation.  Then rebooked me  on the same flight. BA customer  care was horrendous  to make false  claims I will  NEVER use this  service again. Beware  of British Airways.  BA also randomly  flew my girlfriend  for her fathers  birthday and they  were both gold .

I went through three flights to  get my destination.  Two of my  3 flights without  incident were delayed,  all on my way to my  hotel and back from my destination  which is understandable to an extent. What's not understandable is that they  were prepared for one of the  delays and delayed  it almost an hour so I  end up missing  a flight and for that they rebooked me 24h  after providing only  room which they  set up as  free and after  four hours of traveling I had to wait and hope that the hotel would find an extra room since BA didn't  communicate properly with . I gave  BA a chance  of correct their  errors by contacting them after the flights but all they did was  respond once with  a lot of  the complaints that  were involved with  the flights and  what they did was tell me  they contact their partners that I had the last  meeting with, which went smoothly and they had nothing  too do with the previously addressed  issues I contacted them and gave  them over a  call asking why  BA didn't address any of my  concerns that their partner could have  had to do  so and they  just ghosted me.  Sorry for the  airline personnel that's holding this airline  together though.

Very excellent flight in Club World on British Airways. The welcome aboard  started warm and that continued throughout the flight. The  staff were attentive, friendly and very  welcoming On board food for dinner  and breakfast was good and there was a well  stocked selection of wines. In flight  we offered a  good selection of  entertainment and audio. The seat/flat bed  were very comfortable - British Airways  have done an excellent job in the design and  construction of the suites on board the A350. I  enjoyed the sleek, minimalist design. This  flight showed that  British can be among the world’s  top airlines.

The flight schedule was delayed for  an hour. After boarding the plane we were delayed at least another 30 minutes. When we arrived in London, we were delayed again for at least another 30 minutes to find a gate. We were left with 45 minutes only to catch  a connecting flight  in Barcelona, we needed to run and take the  train to different terminal to catch  a next connecting flight. When we arrived at Barcelona airport, we discovered that our check in luggage was still in London.  A painful trip  during our vacation).  not flying with BA anymore if I can find alternative Airlines.

The worst experience in all my  years of travel. My first flight  in my two  flights from Boston to London was delayed by 2 hours, resulting in  nearly missing my  return flight. Despite  having a layover of approximately 2.5 hours, I ended  in waiting until 4.30 pm to board my flight  for Cairo. Unfortunately, even that flight was delayed. I would strongly advise avoiding this particular airline, even if it means paying a bit more for a different option.

The worst experience  in all my years of travel.  Food was destroyed, flight delayed 3  days and couldn't  put water on ! Then when  attempting to claim  off their website , entire site  is on a  new menu that  would work. You  can contact them. Plane was filthy  with someone else's  hands and left  and food was  left in our  seats

Flight delays. Had  someone rebook our  international travel for 5 passengers and  not received any  refund on the  flights Lost all  the luggage; received  refund after 4  days Had to  buy new clothes for the family  to a wedding.  No customer service rep picks up  my phone.

A serious medical  condition appeared while I was onboard.  We informed the crew and they helped me out. Unfortunately I was in transit but  traveling further became too difficult because of how unwell I became. Also I could not find my way back home in my condition. Thankfully  the crew has helped me in  every step of the journey until I returned back home. It was a stressful experience  and the crew  of British Airways  make it way more tolerable.

I haven't flown British Airways before , will never  fly them again!  The check-in process was terrible and slow. There were over 30 people  in the regular  flight in line and they had  three agents working it. They had one agent working  the first class !! It should not take that long to check people in especially when people should  get checked in  well ahead of time. Our group checked in online and almost missed our plane because  o the slow counter service. We had to run to the gate and we did make it, but  lines were terrible!

My itinerary was  suppose to be  Las Vegas-Chicago-London-Venice. When  I landed in London Heathrow, I  sat stuck on  an aircraft for 2 hours with  no explanation as  for why and  because of such a delay I missed my connecting flight to Venice. Getting off the  plane was when  my real nightmare  took place. Our  airline had over  300 people aboard meaning many were in a rush  or get to  other flights or  have already missed  the flight. They  forced us into  2 lines, one  among them being  two people who  missed their flight.  I waited approximately  45 minutes just  to come up to a clerk  who told me "Since I missed  my flight I would have to  head to the connecting flight BA  service desks for further assistance." If  I were to  have known that was the only  route I would  take I would  have skipped being  on that line altogether. When I  arrived to the  boarding desk where  they were more than 60+ people  already in line,  everyone waited 30+  mins until a  man came by  giving everyone a pamphlet telling people  should create an account online and to book our  flights through the BA site since  their systems were  broken and couldn't  contact anyone. It  was a hassle doing anything through he BA site  and I ended  by calling the  company After waiting  and be connected  by a BA  agent I spoke  to a woman who said I  would have to  contact Iberia Airlines for a rebook,  i called Iberia and they said since I booked  on Expedia I  will have to call them. Expedia  also said I would have to call BA for  a rebook so  when I called BA again, the  rep said the only flight he  could get me  connected for was  for the following Monday, mind you I was travelling  because the 25th  which was a  Friday All the  airports in the vicinity of the  hotel were booked,  everyone was trying to figure out where my checked baggage went (I  just don't have  and most of  the customer service I got from  BA reps was  half service as  if they could care less for  the predicament their company caused me. They acted like I was inconveniencing  myself with "my issues". I also had to sleep in the airport  wait for my flight the next  day because hotels  where booked. Overall  my experience with  BA Airlines has  probably the worst  booking experience I've ever had to  deal with. I will never book  from this company , I would rather pay more money for a  ticket in a  foreign airline than buy through this company again.

Last day at LHR and flight full. Lounge crowded but B gates  were quieter. Flight left on time,  very professional crew,  recognized by name and executive club status acknowledged and  cleared for return custom. A nice touch. Service was good. Food average. Entertainment good. Early arrival, quick processing at JFK. All good.

Best seats I  have ever encountered  in economy class.  NO leg room at all. I  tried to spread  the legs to  find Staff at the terminal rude. “Business class” offers  that same seat,  only with more  space and they  fill the middle ? They cram  people in seats with no legroom  to block off  this same seat  right at the  front of the  row (where there is more legroom)  – so the  first class” passenger  leaves an empty  spot between them.  Everything is old  and no onboard  amenities for a  6 hours flight.  First time I  would fly British  Airlines

Top Ten REASONS to not use British Airways To all: Be Aware and be on Notice- Travel at your own risk I have travelled for years on  several different airlines, and I have to say that British Airways ranks as one of the top two most horrible airlines  I fly. Don’t waste your time or money. Customer service is non-existent. Please be on  notice that if you purchase a ticket from them and once, they have your money, you can kiss any customer service and or help resolving your issue goodbye. We used  this to travel  around Europe and it was the worst experience I have had with  this airline in years. When you  try hard and save your money to travel, you expect a good experience. Welp not with this company.  Everyone I am  sure makes millions on customers per year. I understand that sometimes things happen, but this started right after  I booked our flight AND THE BAD EXPERIENCE DID NOT END UNTIL WE SET FOOT AGE TO OUR HOMETOWN. Please take note: #1 - The customer service number is buried on the internet and not listed on their website. I had to google it and still got the run around when  someone finally answered.  Trust me, the number is a secret. #2 – When you FINALLY find a customer  services number, there is a long wait and when or if someone answers, they will not resolve your issues. Instead, they pass the buck to whatever airlines that they sold your ticket to. NO ONE TAKES OWNERSHIP #4- What  airline operates 365  days a year and around the clock but doesn’t have customer service reps to help you, the customer? BRITISH AIRWAYS that’s who. #5 - They will cancel  the flight without notice and not notify you, AT ALL. NO EMAIL, NO TEXT. #6- If you are not the primary on your ticket you will get no notifications or even if you  are the primary,  you may or  might not get notifications. #7 - If you pay for seats and you pick them, it doesn’t matter, they will cancel your seats and not refund your money and then play stupid. #8  – The flight may be cheaper,  usually it is not once you are done paying for seats. #9- They will route to another partner airline and not notify you #10  – If you  take a connecting flight, they will cancel one leg and not the other and NOT NOTIFY YOU. I will never use them again. And if this review helps one person that heeds my advice, then my <mask> is done.

We check in on the way  to Heathrow. The  journey was on  schedule with no issues. Our return flight to Valencia  was booked for  the afternoon and our long haul  flights arrived early  in Heathrow. This  came with another airline and was not a connecting  flight I asked  at the British  Airways check in if we could be put onto the morning flight  directly to Valencia  or avoid seven hours waiting at  customs We had  our flights changed  for no cost  but were checked in within five  minutes That is  great customer service. Thank you.
The check in worked fine. Quick security check. Once onboard quick flight  direct to Glasgow,  shower and snack ! All in  All very pleased.  All quick and efficient.

– The BA  departure lounge at  Terminal 5 was  a zoo at  with dirty tables , used tableware everywhere. Worse than  that the usual  delayed boarding gate , and boarding  being 50 mins late. The flight  is operated by a Finnair A320, which is barely  below cost standard  stand alone business  - Hard, thin,  narrow seats, poor legroom and the  cabin was simply tatty - I remain shocked that  airlines allow this,  and it's time  for BA's CEO and management focused  towards standards rather than bean counting. Finnair cabin staff  is fundamentally courteous,  but they provide  the very trimmed  down budget airline  customer service, as  the whole trip turned out to  be - and  for this business  class ticket was  one of the  more expensive on recent trips. I  understand post Covid ent BA were  there for a  six months, but  for many cost  reductions they are making, they fall  well below all  other European full  Service Airlines.

Just a quick  return to Nice  Airport from Heathrow.  Had to go Business class since my last short haul flight in Economy was a real crush and rather unpleasant. I paid over £300  in a business class round trip.  It went into  BA to BA  Lounge in Terminal 5 which was  very crowded. Being  earlier in the morning I decided  on having a  drink and stuck  for the breakfast . The cooked options did not look that appealing but the fresh fruit selection was  quite enjoyable. We subsequently discovered a  much nicer BA lounge closer to the gate, B36, and waited there  about 40 mins.  Staff was efficient and we got ourselves seated in 2A and 2C, seat 2B was  spread out, which acted as an  observation table. There did not seem to be any difference in the width of the seat from the  standard seating in  Business but there may have been  an additional inch  more leg room. I think that BA are trying  and outdo EasyJet in terms on no frills. It would not cost BA that much to supply Business class passengers with  the complimentary newspaper  they read during  their flight. The  Express magazine is no longer available. There are no screens so there 's zero in  way of in flight entertainment. The  cabin WiFi was flaky at best  and non-existent at other times. I  was glad it  was only a two hour flight.  I really do not think the  flight that we  got was worth the money

Words fail to  remember this last  long flight -  sitting across the  plane crying for  much of the  flight and although  having to go without any rest for the long  flight LHR/SFO, it's  difficult for a  flight to cry  about - but  with crew yakking  on in the  cabin even after a polite notification  of their conversation  cannot be heard  by the cabin  - that made the flight unbearable  without any rest ful sleep (always  better anyway westbound).  the food was  really bad that  I  turned  down whatever the nasty offering was  for the 2nd ! What happened to the really  great tea and  tea I've said  this before after suffering through the  whole concept of customer service (i.e.  please do anything  to help the  customer if it involves any extra work) - this  is i swear i mean it  - never again  - BA please!  The lounge was  jammed packed even  the single traveler  having a hard time finding a  table - poor  plane is on  its skids downhill.

Absolutely terrible experience.  The app would not let me check in online  but repeatedly asked for COVID documents, but then did  never accept them even when provided. I was trying  my fly back  from the USA, where I am a citizen and the app caused repeated errors. I  called to British Airways Customer Service to check in and was told that my seat was already given  out to another  customer even though I was there  with plenty of time. This was  all during an industrial action at  airports meaning the  number of flights were limited. I was delayed over  two hours in  returning to the USA, all because of their terrible  system and then bad customer service that gives away seats even when  another paid passenger is already there  in the airport.

BA overbook every flight to maximise their income with  no regard for the customer. It means you cannot check in online or at the kiosk in the airport and have to queue even  with no luggage.  But easyJet and  Emirates look like customer champions. The  girl in Itsu  in the BA  Airport says she  quit flying BA  long ago due  to the service being bad all the time. Most  passengers she serves  as a complaint Staff don't care as poor service  and unhappy customers is a routine  occurrence

Both flights were  all on time,  excluding Belfast from  Manchester which never is. The Staff  were efficient. My  disappointment is the  fact I could  to book seats  in Tel Aviv  but tried for  a month as  opposed to pay. So ended up  on a middle  ground even though  a window seat  is available on the flight. The  lounge was in  breach of the  security barrier and  then used as  well by the  PR team throughout  the flight so  I wasted my  money on PE ! You can  keep hold of BA customer service via the app either and they  basically just ignored  any other communication so just won't  use them again.

Only the second time flying BA  and first time  very positive. Could  of made my connection in Heathrow if BA had been proactive. Instead,  stayed at the  cheapest hotel compliments of BA. Adequate, but one wonders why a large  part of this  airline is devoted  towards sleeping and feeding of hundreds  other stranded passengers. If BA had  sent one employee to help us  back to our gate instead of waiting for the shuttle bus which  were a half hour late arriving,  we could have made our flight  and saved BA  the cost of rebooking, hotel, shuttle, food accommodations. Another bad show. Business  class fare should offer more.

I wasn't going to bother reviewing this flight as I seem to be on a perpetual downer with BA but the airport experience convinced me otherwise. After  arriving our flight  were reduced from  Economy to Business, then offered an alternative route on the outward leg . First to make up for  the disappointment, they then reneged on this. As it was a special anniversary it sucked. Flying back we  checked in online  to our chosen window seats, at  departure gate we had to show our passports as  our passport before boarding as we were hand luggage only. Trying to  board we had our passports checked twice more and were issued new boarding cards for centre seats. Unbelievable! The flight itself was very quiet and only half the normal crew  for this aircraft was unavailable. This meant no pre-departure drinks and a limited selection of food. The crew was great but what an earth is going on at BA, they have this unique knack to snatch defeat from the jaws of victory every time. I say this as the new club suites are great.

We booked business class tickets for  my fiancé and  realized I had  to reschedule my flight due to an unforeseen timing , so I  needed to get  onto my flight . The representative  over the phone  assured me he  not sure how  long I would  receive as the refund department needed  to check, but  that I would  owe 10-20% of  a booking to  insure I accepted. I never got  the cancellation email,  or any update,  I instead received  the total back.  Less than 1%  of my booking costs. Since then  we have spent  about 5 hours  calling different departments  which they blocked  so I've lost  a tremendous amount  more money with  nothing to show.

I will never travel with British  Airlines again. I spent over $10,000 on a business class seat to  see a funeral in the UK.  Unfortunately the Boeing 787-9 cabin has 7 seats across the aisle so what you are getting in reality is premium economy. The seats are  small and effectively  have a business class seat cut in half. They have squeezed these  seats in which means that some passengers bump their heads into the bulkhead when they stand up and  they have to clamber over others  to go to  the toilet, which  wakes up that passenger. The whole point about business  economy is that  people pay to rest and have  dinner and not have someone push  across the top of you. Second,  their food was disgusting. Third, the service terrible. Fourth, the toilet was tiny. Fifth, the inflight screen was fixed and too high so I  can not see anything. Sixth, their baggage handling is also appalling meaning that my taxi was waiting for  3 hours and I had to pay more (no  international airport transfers with British Airways). Seventh, the charging points did not work. The second leg to London was on a  tiny plane with 4 seats across the aisle. That was bearable because no hopping over people but the seat was very uncomfortable because it 's not one piece. This means  that you are  seated on a metal bar (the seat) where there is a gap in the seat. To add insult  too injury I now find that  my flights back to Sydney are on the small plane. To book  a seat before check in is $170. I paid it but note that there were only 4 seats ! This is  how I got the worst seat  in the house  cleaned out. This is the most  awful airline service I have ever . There is no point paying for business class in British Airways.

I am already in Portugal so  called them today and they cancelled  a return flight because I was 10 minutes late calling them, even  when I tried  over 2 hours to get through  a day before.  Now I am  trying to get  through and they have kept the  10 pounds. Customer service is shocking,  we have no  way of helping you.

– Avoid this ! It’s now  the regular practice  of cancel flights.  Take a cancellation  from Switzerland that  forces us to  spend the whole  day in a  cheap hotel and  have to fly  back the next  country and then  get another cancellation  to Spain. The  airline only knows  who to ask  about expensive prices.

Despite being a  staff member, the  US Airways staff  in Heathrow literally  does not care  for the slightest  for the absolute  financial and logistical  conditions or wider  implications of their  own service. All  other staff members  have the same  statement - “we  were not obliged to provide even  an update for  our first 24  hours as if  this would make  the situation better.  There are no  status updates, no  or no care ", a lot  more actual lies  were told. You  can tell that  staff have given  barely any care  and thought for  treating passengers as  individual individuals -  they show this  through every action  every word they  make All of  whom are better  used to working  separately from other .

About the aircraft  Economy seat: The  business class seats  on this flight  were pretty good.  These were of  a suite type, where every seat  had its own  area with sliding  curtains for extra privacy. The downside  of this is that if you are travelling as  one couple, its  quite difficult to  relax There is  no storage and  no charging ports.  The seat is  quite comfortable. As  one who finds  it very difficult  on sleep on  planes this was  1 of the  few times I've  been able to  get a few minutes sleep here  or there. The amenities provided are  pretty average when  compared to other  flights The leather  laptop bag was  quite nice though.  NO slippers, only  1 pair of  socks The restrooms  on the flight  are very small,  and don't provide  any in the way of toiletries  similar to other  airlines No free Wi-Fi in Business  which is not  available Another example  of BA's penny  drop in recent  years Regarding the  service and customer : Poor. Inattentive.  At meal times  There was offer  no water during  this flight. I had to go  to find an  attendant and ask.  There was also  no offer of  free snacks. Rude  wait times. My  partner asked for a fork to be replaced as the one provided was quite clearly dirty. The attendant  was incredibly rude  the response. This  had us shocked. Different customers seem  to receive a  differing quality of  care A customer  like me was repeatedly greeted politely by name and  asked how they  felt whether they  wanted anything etc.  Both my partner and I were  never afforded the  right level of personal service. This is disappointing as  we paid the  full price for  the tickets so expect the same  quality of service.  The food was pretty bad. I had risotto while  our partner had chicken. Both were  slightly over cooked , the rice looked like porridge.  Both vegetables were  thin and flavourless.  The bread was nice though. The breakfast wasn't much  better Summary: BA  have become the  home of long  queues The customer  service is way  above what I would expect for  another premium airline  offering a premium seat. You pay  that premium price  and a very  bad service. If  there are other  airlines available I  will choose them over BA these .

I travelled with  Swedish Airways from Sweden to Los  Angeles via London  in December 2022. When I arrived  in LAX one  all my bags were missing. There  was no information of the whereabouts  of my bag  so after searching  with someone for about 30 minutes, I found the point of contact and she told me my bag  was left behind. I gave her my details of  how I would  been staying and  they told me  if they would  contact me. After a few days  and still no contact I tried  to call British Airways customer service.  A woman at  the airport didn’t  have me a  flight reference number, so it was  really difficult to try and locate my bag, but  I finally found the reference number  on my bag  and said it would be delivered in a couple  more days. I told them that  i had switched hotels and gave  her the address for where I  was staying and  that was fine. But then a  couple of weeks went by and  the bag was  still nowhere to  have seen and  it was time for me to fly home. At the airport I tried to talk  through the personnel there to try  to locate my  bags and they  said that it was delivered to  that first hotel  I stayed at,  even though I had given them  my updated address.  I asked them  what I should to since I  is flying home now. The guy  working the counter  told me that it wasn’t his  problem and that  I should figure  it out myself.  We questioned him  for his response  but he just  turned away. A  guy saw that and came up to me and  asked for his colleague and that they would send  someone to fetch my bag and  take it with  me my flight  was the next  flight I came  in and a  couple of days later I received my bag. I  filed a complaint  regarding claims on  the Airways website  where I had to buy clothes  and toiletries during my vacation because I didn’t have  my bag. In  response they said that they would  refund me for  my claims, it  was now April  or May) and I have still  NOT received the refund even after  several email conversations. I don’t know  anything to do  now about this situation since it  appears that no  one is willing to help me.  I am appalled  by how the  situation is being handled and frankly disappointed at British Airways and the  handling of customer .

Food was lousy. Who ever is planning the Asian Hindu Vegetarian meal  was clueless as to what this  dish includes. The snack was also lousy. It took us 2 hours  total to go from T5 to  gate and clear security check. The place was chaotic.  We get to our boarding gate , again a  long line with  20 minutes wait  on someone to check passport and boarding pass. Seats  for Premium economy  are ok, but when the passenger in front reclines,  it is very  little space for the window seat  passengers to cross ! Overall not  a good airline.

But the worst ? The flight  to London to  Toronto got delayed  because we missed  the connecting flight  to Halifax. We were four including an infant and  a toddler aged 4 years, despite being delayed and missed the connecting  plane the ground staff were not at all helpful.  We waited for an hour to  ask them to  come to us and at 12 am they told  me they have not booked any  accommodation for us to stay that night and asked  us go search for a hotel  all your own,  so nice of  them British Airways. At least you guys should have  given some consideration to the travelers who travel with children and booked some accommodation. We will NOT to  travel on this  flight again.

Their ground staff  were not helpful. Felt like all they wanted to  accomplish was rush  us to check  bags and then  all passengers needed  assistance waiting in  a holding area  for a bus . Travelling with  a child with a disability was  a nightmare with  Qatar Airways. Logged a complaint and  it took almost  3 weeks to answer. Lost some of our luggage.  It was not  very good experience.

Second time BA  premium Economy in a newer aircraft and yet another excellent experience. Despite a three hour delay and missing my connection in Hong Kong, this was a very pleasant flight. Seats are spacious and  comfortable in Premium Economy in this layout, attitude of  the cabin crew was excellent and food was good.  They communicate well and rebooked my connection during the  day which brought  peace of mind.  A very pleasant experience in BA Premium Economy after a major disappointment in Club World earlier this year.

we changed our  flight from Brussels  and London Heathrow  to LAX on . We paid  extra to choose  these seats. This was a  shame this airline.  They missed one  from work and  airline didn’t return  the money that  was paid for  our previous chosen  seats
It Copenhagen the  most chaotic ticket ing assignment in the history of airlines. Time on board never changed, no fixed counter at Airport. Abysmal  service that needs  urgent improvement here

Worst experience of my life trying  to deal with the customer service for British Airways. So many issues with getting from one destination to the other. Had an absolutely horrible time trying to get answers or reach anyone who  was capable of helping navigate uncertainties. I wrote them a formal complaint requesting some type of refund and received a generic “we are sorry” email with 5000 avios attached which is equivalent to  only $50 on  the $600+ flight. Needless to say  that will go  to waste as I refuse to  deal with an untrustworthy incompetent unorganized  company that couldn’t  properly address one single issue expressed to them. It was equivalent to  giving me a band aid after slapping me in  the face. I will say the flight itself was smooth and the onboard staff was  helpful and attentive. The most frustrating thing is that the customer service is trained to  give you the runaround so heavily to the point  where exhaustion that you just give  it trying and  accept the loss.

Due to code  violations with Cathay  Atlantic I was downgraded to BA on my return . I can’t describe how cheated I felt. I  booked and paid for an airline  providing great entertainment, food and service,  and I was forced to go hungry because they  literally had one  choice of meal  so it was  made To ensure the passengers didn’t get any funny  comments and assume that as the vegetarian option was unavailable they might be given a  burger or a  whole packet of nuts. The cabin crew announced in their uniquely aggressive and dismissive way “You won’t get anything else for  three hours you  spend the entertainment is compiled mainly  from B movies so I paid £11 for Wi-Fi so I could  access Netflix on my laptop. Unsurprisingly,  the signal was so weak I couldn’t even send an email. To add insult to  injuries the earbuds  are the cheapest , lowest quality I have ever  experienced Since the last time I used this airline the crew are  extremely rude and obnoxious and are now just impatient and unhelpful.  What I don’t  know is why it seems that  Qatar Airways look  for these characteristics  and desirable attributes for their crew.

Flight check in  very quick at  the First Wing  and quickly through security. The First  Class was quiet , a change  and a reasonably  good breakfast buffet . While BA  had brought back  the Highlife magazine  in the lounge,  It seems they used Covid to  buy all the  other magazines they  have to offer, as part of the endless BA  price cutting. The toilets in the  terminal were as disgusting as ever,  not cleaned frequently  on this visit and they are  about 20 years out of date  whereas public washrooms  at T5 are  newer and cleaner).  It was the  latest BA muddled mess, and two of the gate staff appeared to  having no clue  who they were  seeing Endless announcements  to the gate about being a  late flight, requesting  people to check in bags, only  to get on  another flight that  was less than  fully full. Onboard , very good  service from Captain and the flight  to the gate  after 5 mins ! Breakfast had  no choices and  cost a fair . No hot  coffee or even  paper towels offered  at Club Europe  is more, another  sign of the  higher BA cost ? I wouldn't  argue but fares  were proportionately a  little higher now  then pre Covid. Cabin staff service  seemed perfunctory at  times not a  word of recognition  for BA Gold . Oneworld Emerald  is clear proof  not BA really  does care any  more Breakfast trays  appeared 45 mins into the flight,  and that was the  norm for staff , stay in  their front galley  throughout the rest  on the flight. Paid £4.99 for  4 hours wifi,  then dropped connection  for the next 40 mins. Sad  but note that  wifi service on Ryanair is more  than active nowadays. Priority tagged suitcase  checks out nearly  instantly at Malaga,  which is standard  for BA business  grade baggage handling.  Why not waste  more money on  Club Europe, standards  just keep dropping.

We wouldn't recommend  British Airways at  present I tried  a call to customer service for  several times in  2 days and  nights and I  talked for more  than 30 minutes on the phone!  It ended hanging  up They are  exhausting themselves in  a high volume of calls. I  got an email an I am  now waiting for  2 weeks!   This is difficult  and navigate. It is not easy  either to have  the invoice of proof of receipt or look for  customer service. They  send you online but you don't  get a PDF file. So if  I need a  PDF of flight, you need to  have screenshots. And,  after the flight  was flown, you  had no access  in that booking  agent to reprint  that document or  how to create  that PDF. You  had to contact  through a customer  service which I  did it online, long waiting time,  but had to  take more than  a week to  receive it. Expensive and poor, almost  no customer service , difficult to use their website. An airline that  i wouldn't recommend.  This is such  sad shame that  by 2023 they  are still in  this position and  especially when they  have competitors around

Another horrible experience.  Just booked a ticket from Expedia  to a British  Virgin Operated flight  connecting Madrid to  Paris with a changeover at London Heathrow. The whole itinerary was listed as BA although  my Madrid to London flight was . On Jan 22nd, London was  freezing cold and  rainy The Iberian flight sat on  the tarmac for  several hours in  London because of the London weather.  On landing in  Terminal 3, I  had to take a bus to Terminal 5. The  BA was the  first flight to  London for the  holiday and it  had already taken off. The BA  bus was swamped  in people as  some people had  already spend the  evening due to the weather. The British Airways staff  explained that we  should go book  our hotel up to 200 pounds and we would  be reimbursed. I  am barely able  t find a  room and had  instead take an  airport cab. However when trying to  get the reimbursement,  someone said it  not their problem  and that it was Iberia's problem. Iberia said they  would not reimburse  me to the  passengers When complaining  about BA, they said they only  booked the flight  for BA and  now they refuse to reimburse. Absolutely  horrible behavior by  this airline to not take any  credit for a  mistake that they 're using their  brand to sell  it to people  and don't want  to take responsibility for it. Did they expect me  just take the  cab back to  Terminal 3? Their people gave out  false information.
United is the worst airline. Not one thing went  right I don’t understand how they have got it  so bad. Late take off, no gate when we arrived. Bags took over 40 minutes  to arrive. Horrendous

You will never fly British Airways again. To start,  our plane was over 2 hours late, with no weather and no  reason given. The boarding process was chaotic, both in the airport and onto the plane.  And more importantly, although we were in business class, it wasn’t really  economy class. There were a few aisles —not separated in any way—in which they simply put a tray on the middle seat so that  another one sits . And those seats, like the rest, were extremely cramped and uncomfortable. I could not believe they called this business class.

Worst aircraft I have ever flown. The seats were cramped and uncomfortable considering the flights cost well over &1000each we expected  so little space for the money my husbands knees  kept rubbing on seat in front which for a  10 hour+ flight is not acceptable.  the food was disgusting and inedible both the hot food and the breakfast were vile. I would not entertain using BA again. Ground staff were great it’s the seating and food on offer  which lets the airline down. We  deserve so much more.

I enjoyed my  arrival The boarding  was swift and service was very  friendly and professional.  Our food selection was good and  we enjoyed the  atmosphere The was  the one downside , when we  landed there was an issue with ground crew not being ready at  takeoff so in total from landing to getting the doors open it  took 30 minutes.  I believe the Heathrow T5 were having strike action  that week.

Why do you make it so  bad After a so so lounge experience, the staff taking care of boarding treated us  with disdain bordering ! It can’t be training, who  could do that, it has to be no fear of anything happening. The “new” club  style suites are  one huge step up from the old product and really on deliver comfort and privacy. The crew were professional but I personally found the food menu rather odd. Essentially, there was one only main that I could handle and was then told they had ran out. I was a few rows in.

After several delays  with canceled flights, we finally made  it to Copenhagen  on American Airlines and British Airways flights. My luggage  is destroyed, wheels  fell off. I had to buy  another luggage in  and I made  a claim with  British Airways to reimburse me but  since I didn’t have the receipt  for my old luggage, they would  only cover 50%  of my new  luggage Advice, have  paid for your  old luggage prior  before flying so  you don’t get ripped off like  we did.

And the worst  mistake of my  life After booking tickets together with my partner, we were then separated: ‘sorry, the flight  is full.’ The flight then took off 45 minutes late - no . The trolley service took over two hours and  passengers periodically skipped rows, and the response was flippant and rude: ‘whoops. Not sure how that happened. What do you want?’ Genuinely appalling from beginning to end.  might as well fly Easy Jet  and at least  not charge a  fee commensurate with  this poor quality of service, not like BA

I swore I 'd never fly BA again after  they messed me about so much  when trying to  go to Budapest. But the times for their flights  surprised me so  i decided to give them another . The flight left on time  for about), the  cabin was clean and the staff friendly. There was  also complimentary tea/coffee  or a breakfast  buffet to be  paid for economy. The flight was pleasant enough and I can't think of any negatives to write about. The flight and  accommodation was certainly head and shoulders above my trip  with easyjet.

So many airlines  has gone downhill in recent years.  Costs have increased  while services have gone down. The  most disappointing thing  with BA is  the aspects that  we don’t need to get worse have. The check in staff at  Delta are downright  loud and abusive, shouting at passengers  off line here  & there and rolling their eyes  as passengers get  annoyed with the constant shouting and  British Airlines are  also competing globally more and more and this behaviour  was particularly noticeable  in Asia where  their service industry  are next level. I wouldn’t want to suggest that all the staff are like this , many younger  employees are polite  or helpful. However there were a couple of older  employees that were  extremely rude and obnoxious.

Lost 3 out of 4 checked bags. Denied wheelchair assistance at LHR for my wife  and the staff  drove us to  the terminals by . Rude staff  onboard BA297 from LHR to ORD on April 05,  was ignored multiple times when simply  requesting a cup of water. When walked up to  me after a  number of attempts to request for water politely, the BA staff onboard yelled at my  husband and asked  her to be  brought back to seat. Horrible flight  by disappointing staff. Customer service is  terrible and online check-in never worked . BA never verified our COVID documents which were  sent in advance,  leaving me and my wife seated separately. I’ve lost respect for British Airways. Disgusted.

I have flown  for BA for  20 years and there was a  point about 10 years ago when  things were getting better. Sadly this trip underlines how they have slipped versus other airlines.  During booking time, one is scammed an extortionate amount  to book a seat. At Heathrow  for check in the queues were unbelievably long and  lines at bag drop curt to  mention the least. The lounges here remain awful and overcrowded and BA has not invested  into them for  many years. On the flight the  food was okay, although portions are  still minimal. This was one of those days when the crew could  barely give a damn and the service was mostly absent for the entire flight. Next time they change CEO, can they  not do better than recruiting from  some second rate, budget Irish airline.

Boarding at Mumbai  seemed chaotic and  poorly organised. Once  you board the  boarding announcements were  pretty relaxed and  delivered in typical  British style. The  flight was quite  nice It was a refurbished aircraft and the padding  and materials are  very good. I  was lucky that  the middle seat  is empty so  it didn’t suffer from the new  middle seat which  I think would have made it  that lot less  comfortable The IFE  were excellent, responsive  with good quality.  There is an  amazing selection of  music and movies and a good  variety of games.  Netflix is also  quite good not  bad Netflix quality  is still reasonable and I don’t  think £17.99 for  this flight is  bad value. You  would pay less  if you just  get short term  SMS messaging. Cabin crew were very  user Friendly and  Indian Catering was  excellent although on  a near 10hr  trip the small (but tasty) pastry  at the second  floor service wasn’t  good enough. Landing and processing at  departure was astonishingly  quick - it  seemed like it  is 3am, even  if it was . No queues  for waiting at  airports Even the  plane was super  fast at coming . Overall a  very solid experience  for economy. Significantly  cheaper than it used to be.

London City Airport is a zoo,  not taking the  late departure on  board to LHR  was too bad.  Most passengers can  try the AA  Lounge Lounge, which  looks surprisingly good  but not too  crowded as it  seemed to cater  for BA's club  members only at  the time of  flight Lovely staff,  great food &  drink really pleasant. We flew an  old 787 with  the old style club seats. Seated  on the front  seat (just 3  seats of club)  with the window and adjecant aisle  which is really  nice if you  are with your  spouse Come to  thinking of it,  you will really  love this old  style -once cutting  out lay-out. There  are no better  way to fly  if you are  in couple. We  were in that  front row of  our front cabin  in both window  & aisle seat  and unobstructed access  to the aisle.  Sounds terrible you  had to pay for these seats,  because it obvioulsy  worked and we  are happy getting  these seats. Flying BA when the  weather is good  was amazing. Service  was impecable on  this flight. Just  a right mix  of humor, service and attention. Food seemed to be  good as well,  food hardly touched ! I am  still sleeping in  those old club  type seats although bedding could be  better On time departure, smooth flight , early arrival  in Heathrow. We  went outside for  a smoke and  walked to the terminal through fast  security Security at LHR has always been terrible, but  BA security staff  are too busy  chatting among themselves  that all bags went through without  security checks. We  got a lovely  time at the  gate what a  great facility. The  VIP Lounge was  very busy and  this is just  a design disaster.  Only ever choose  this bizarre combination  for furniture: what  an mess! Food  we offer was  good and so  was the drinks.  My home stretch  in Amsterdam was  pretty straight forward. Lousy welcome at  arrival door but  everyone recovered well and made everyone  very special with  their bar-cart service.  We love the  choice of drinks.  Bubble tea is  among the worst meal concepts in  The world and  I really don't  think BA stuck  by it through the years. No-one like the cucumber  or bread things,  oh hey... On  time landing in  Amsterdam but the  hour long taxi  and clumsy jet bridge connection ended  me with a 20 minute late  flight why is  it so hard  you connect a  jet in Amsterdam?  BA club in  Amsterdam is still  there I Love it!

Very poor service,  quite frustrating. Firstly my flight to LHR was cancelled on 16 Mar23, while I got a text message to inform me,  the information desk was unable to confirm if was  real or scam. Once this was confirmed, I went to the counter to get my new boarding pass.  At the counter they informed me , the coach will be leaving  after 15mins for  my hotel. We (me and other fellow travelers) waited  for over 45mins, there was no  one at the coach stand to guide us or answer any questions.  My transfer hotel was 30 mins away from the  airport When we got to the  dinner which is around 10:15pm the  counter informed that dinner closes at 10:30. that was a rush. It appeared more of  the Motel than  a hotel. The room - was  smelled of weed, being a non-smoker this was uncomfortable. Although I wanted  to compromise and rest, when I went to wash my face, the tap on the  toilet came off in my hands,  i panicked and asked the reception  desk to change my room. After some discussion, they agreed to change it. I went to the alternate  room to my horror, it was occupied. I asked the staff to call a cab,  before I left.

Generally poor. Sent to gate on  arrival sat maybe 30 minutes, was  then announced as crew were not  happy with the  system there would  be a delay.  Absolute nonsense and there was a  misunderstanding on board of this statement. Watched the crew walk through to  the gate, my  understanding was they did not want to be there. Was given a miniscule amount of water, small bag of pretzels and then it was announced there would be a wait for any further  food service as  all processing machines were u/s. No  more updates or  announcements of crew for next two hours, then attempted to charge us for even a glass of water. When I said this should be complimentary, girl said  that was not her problem and  walked away.

They changed our  assigned seats at  a last minute , charged us  and select new seats. Flight took off late, cabin  attendant served a tiny packet of pretzels. Arrived at Heathrow late, put  in a remote stand, loaded onto buses to terminal.  Called up at  airport security by  a clown of  a member of  TSA allowed 15 passengers at a time because of a trial. I had one small bag however they never demanded other passengers with 2/3 bags and some with  checked luggage that was obviously too big. I found it ridiculous that they told me  only pay a fraction of the money I previously paid. Each time I call them, they hang up on me; or  they continue telling me to pay £360. I made a complaint, and nothing happened.

If I could give a minus rating, I would.  Need to be LHR-AMS at 14.05 on 13th March.  Return to LHR  around 12.00, email to say flight . Found my case and took 6 weeks to locate  me and still  has not replied to me after 8 weeks. As usual the flight is delayed  all week, it  is 3 hours  and I’m held  on a bus waiting to get taken to the  terminal I really  should explain how  deeply I detest  Thai Airways. BA moved our  seats away from each other and we shouldn't have to pay for their change of  policy and their decision to not have us sitting together! We haven't even flown yet,  our airline is  crazy

As it  was the weekend , I was unable to reach  their office until  Tuesday when they  advised me there  was no refund  ( than fees) as I had  missed the 24  hr cooling off period. Apparently as  the ticket was  booked in the UK, I needed  not contact them.  They have now cancelled the ticket . I will be going out  of my way in the future to avoid flying British Airways.

At 7.54 am  on the day  I travel whilst  travelling to London , I received  an email advising  the flight had  be cancelled. I  was offered an  alternate flight with  United Airlines which  i had no  choice but to  take as I  must travel today.  He was flying  into LA to  visit a family member who is  end of life.  Then American Airlines  has downgrade my  flight from premium  flight to economy.  Called 3 times  to provide telephone , total useless,  no help, given  the wrong email  addresses for sending  false complains given  about me in  my email. I  had been a  Delta frequent flyer  4 decades and  have been a  loyal customer. I  would find I  was travelling 11  days in Economy  for even the  offer of a  refund let alone  any upgrade. This is completely unacceptable.  What has happened  to this company?  We have had  appalling treatment from  management

Would happily fly them again. I had a personal emergency and was  happy to reschedule my flights free of charge. Onboard  entertainment on LHR-IST  were no frills, but JFK-LHR was : good food,  tons of movies/cds on the IFE, open bar service the entire flight. Friendly flight attendants  were happy to provide an extra .

fly premium, only worth the extra  money for the  sake of extra . Penny pinching  - there’s no other benefit - one drink service , 10 hour , no fizz  left before take  - poor food,  it was badly . Food left  on tables 30  mins before landing with no tea and coffee offered.  Only small cups of water passed around but nothing  much about this.  These planes have  not decorated terribly  - feels like you’re in a  hotel waiting room.  None of any  excitement or joy.  Only fly if  your only option,  but fly premium , it’s not  very expensive -  certainly not worth much more than economy these days,  even if you’re in the middle 4.

Unfortunately our morning flight was cancelled  and moved to  our afternoon flight, understanding sometimes these  things are unavoidable,  but it lost  us one day's  time in Cairo.  We were quite upset when we  stepped onto the  flight and were  moved into regular seats, on both  flights As my  husband had spasms,  I had to  place his legs  on my lap,  yet not once did ANY of  our attendants ask  if we were  ok as we were clearly struggling.  When the service  provided to us  for food, each  time we made , were told,  we were all  gone and we  needed to settle  for what they  have left. I  got the correct  airlines once home  and sent in  our complaints. They  replied with a  5 pound voucher  to our group.

Though it was  one bit uncomfortable  sitting in an economy, the flight  crew made the  accommodations the best  she could.   What a nice  & professional crew.  Always attentive and  looked out for  their customers.

Boarding was decently  comfortable The A380  flight has the  rather strange configuration  as Club World  where you neighbour is sitting in  the opposite position.  This A380 was  very full, rather  small amenity bag.  A welcome drink  is ok but  was rather long  waiting for the  waiter what is  available in the  bag The meal  is ok but  nothing great, aside  from Champagne no  red wines on  the flight. Service  was friendly but rather slow, no  free refills of  water offered. Acceptable  continental style breakfast.  Large narrow restrooms , any lotions  are similar. It  was an acceptable  breakfast nothing more.  On landing 50  minutes waiting for  seats labelled as  normal

Service on time and departure on time for a  trip to London Heathrow that is very ok, the  coach with rather  good seats. In business light meal  of Caesars salad, a mousse as sweet and choice  in drinks - nothing wrong for such a short  trip FA's were very friendly and  were on time.

The original flight was cancelled just over 2 weeks  from my actual  departure and although alternative flights were  offered British airways affected the trip I planned. It  feels like BA is doing a  service to passengers  other than being  allowed to deliver  good service.

Even just for a change. Poor ! British Airways  offers premium prices  for tickets and delivers no better than a low cost airline. Customer  service is impossible  to contact and  it seems BA  tries hard to  give any possible  customer communication address  where it's available.

A competent check in staff, saw had a problem with my left  foot and insisted I could not take exit seat. Moved me to row 30 where  a middle seat  remained empty. On the other hand on board - huge line for toilets - 45 min into a 2.30 min flight a crew member realised one of  our toilets is closed - as  passengers had put their luggage there.  She announced that they could not serve hot drinks  for this flight and to bear  with them as service will be slow. On asking : "They did not give us enough cups for hot drinks. And the card machine  is not working so we have to fill out each credit card slip". A bottle of water and a nutrigrain bar.

Flying in was so slow, no  baggage check in  and bag drop. Boarding was ok, flight totally full. Booked row 9 which was ok.  Limited space in  our bins. Seat and legroom ok.  Cabin crew ok, smiled, gave out the bottle of  water and pretzels. Flight itself was ok, landed 25 mins early and then waited 30 minutes for a stand and ground ! Bags came  through reasonably quickly. BA still seems  they believe it 's something special, a premium carrier. The reality is that it is not. The only reason we flew BA was we  were virtually free  money because both flights were cancelled last year. BA is our carrier  and last choice.

My review relates  of the appalling experiences I had  with British Airways on 14th February 2023. I was  booked to travel  to Madrid with British Airways and  on setting off , heard on  a radio that there were flight delays. I looked at the Heathrow Airport website and  found that my flight had been cancelled. As a result of the information on the website, I called  British Airways and have 26 minutes  on hold I  find myself speaking  to somebody in  their call centre in South Africa.  This person was hard to understand  due to a heavy accent and  apparently was incompetent and insisted that  the flight was  not cancelled. I made my way  to Heathrow and  amazingly enough the flight was indeed cancelled. The woman in question had  the audacity to declare that the  aircraft was cancelled  but that “there  are no facilities  available at the airport to rebook you”. She refused to let me  while about 12  other people join the queue for the clearly marked assistance desk. The same woman and one of her colleagues gave out a card with  their telephone number  and told one  particular elderly gentleman : “go online  and rebook your  ticket I am visually impaired and found the attitude of the BA  employee to be  appalling I called the number on the card the employee gave me and was again  given a long  line to a  service centre. The person who picked up the phone kept me waiting 22 minutes and  said that the flight was not cancelled and that  my airport “must be wrong”. He  again in a  sarcastic tone said he was just informed that the flight was indeed cancelled and that I would have to go and  go to IBERIA customer services in Heathrow to rebook! I took the elderly gentleman with me to IBERIA where the counter  team member rolled  his eyes in disgust and said that it was nothing to do with IBERIA. I  switched to BA  but this time I joined the  help line and told a check-in agent what had happened. The man  in question booked  us onto the  last available flight within a matter of a few minutes. He gave  me a £30 voucher as a  form of compensation  and said he could not add my frequent flyer number with a partner airline.
