The  card proved useless I am afraid as various shops in the predepature  area refused to accept it and although I was  told I could use it after  passing security none of the shops would accept it. Once aboard my new flight the service was minimal.  Apart than a  small bottle of  milk and a packet of pretzels nothing else was  provided This was a full flight  carrying so many people had been transferred from the <mask> flight. BA <mask> crew announced that any additional <mask> other than <mask> small bottle of water and pretzels had to be ordered via their skyshop.

This was my first time flying with BA &  i was pleasantly surprised. Islamabad via  Dubai was very comfortable and the crew were great, friendly and helpful. The second flight , operated by Qatar Airways this was from Doha to Islamabad. My return journey was  another direct BA flight, 46kg luggage allowance was really generous and stopped the hassle with connecting flights. Crew on this flight were really nice ! What let BA down was the food, it  really was not  much the IFE could do with  and more content but that's not really a huge issue.

Hundreds of cancellations and delays and  no one apologized.  Went to London  was Feb 14th,  and our original  flight was cancelled,  and the rebooked  plane was cancelled , well, the third rebooked one  is supposed to departure at 12:50  and had several  delays until 2:24.  And we had  the wait 57  hours for our  flight to arrive.

Jet 242 on the 6/2/23. Boarding  is delayed due to late arrival  from the incoming  aircraft Communication from  our ground staff was excellent and keep us informed.  The flight services were excellent, the  staff were friendly with excellent service! Overall, very happy with BA.

Not only my first flight in  20 years, but  definitely my first  trip back to  England for 17 years. I flew  with PMI-LGW on  holiday and returned  on 29/01/2023. Both  Swiss Air and  Emirates offered very  good flight times  yet charged more than the flights  are worth for baggage. British Airways  were the most  economical and best value option available,  it offered ideal  flight times and  their €18 charge  per flight for  bags was very  low - Total  charge for both flights was €126  - Regular update  service via email,  free online seat  booking and check  bags Efficient staff  at the check  in desks at  BA and LGW ensured that long  delays were dealt  to as quickly as humanly possible.  Small aircraft, comfortable  comfortable seats with  good legroom (I'm  quite tall) Cabin crew were polite,  friendly and professional.  The flight food  / drinks were  excellent quality and reasonably priced, I  enjoyed the Meat ball and IPA  flights (€10 -/+ 15 on both ) I have flown 80+ times  over the last 50 years with  different airlines on  a propeller and  helicopter aircraft as well as one LGW-LHR helicopter transfer.  It was a  very different experience  but in the  UK we are now in the  hands of the  British airline' Nostalgia  with British Airways  was the best  airlines I've flown  with

my husband and  myself were flying  to Madrid on  Friday 3rd of  May for a  personal matter and  we had to be in Madrid  before 13:00 pm.  I had booked  the flight and  parking with BA . Unfortunately we  got a parking  I had never  had before, we got lost, and  after our 6:00  pm flight to  Barcelona I tried  to stay calm, cold head and  I went to  Qatar Airways to get help. The  first lady that  we spoke to  inquired if we 'd done the  reservation with BA  and we didn't  know that, she  showed us a number to call , told us , she couldn't do anything else,  so we had  not call that . We called  another number, which  started asking us  too call another  number, which  I did and  then the message was that opening  time were from  10 am till 4 pm, We  came back to  the lady and  asked that we  should wait until  10 am, but she told us that she could not do anything.  We did reach out to another  lady , a lovely young lady called Althea. She  came to look  into it, made  some calls, went  and check with  someone else to  the office, she  went to get  me to send  them a text message that I  wanted to call, and that got  through and the  other lovely lady  on the line,  changed our booking  would place us  for the following flight at 7.30 . They didn't  refund us for  that our car reservation and flight back were maintained  until we made it to Madrid.  For the support  from the lovely  lady her professionalism,  her care for  us we would  otherwise have make , She was so sweet, so caring, but at  that same time  so determined to  do she for  us went above  & beyond her  duty and her  professionalism
Easy boarding process.  Very friendly crew.  Free drink and  a snack. All  In all a great experience. The  Crew are a  credit to BA.  Absolutely best crew in Europe.

Outward journey BA245  London to Buenos Aires Club World  25 January 2023. Our experience was  poor from beginning  until end. Although we had reserved  for 11F and  when another passenger  already occupying 11F , crew made no attempt to  fix the problem.  Eventually I persuaded  the passenger to move and occupy her designated seat . We boarded  early but were  only offered drinks.  After I asked for a drink,  another crew member  said it was  very late and  vacated the seating . The same  crew member then began taking orders  at dinner but  would not write them all down , gave up  in a few  minutes for the  food briefing. She  asked us to  place our orders ! The hot  food smelled musty , felt old , ragged.   Most of the  staff wondered aloud  where my companion  or I were ?  My soup was cold, I was told  and was served  in flasks. Was that an explanation  not an excuse?  The coffee was  cold and tasted like instant granules.  my companion was  then served no  bread roll with  bread The breakfast menu stated a 'selection of rolls/pastries'  however there was  a choice and my companion was  served a dried  fruit pastry, where  I would have  had a bread roll.  Although we had not  previously asked for or been offered  beverages other than those supplied at  the seat, small  containers of water  ran out. Return  journey BA244 Buenos Aires to London Heathrow World Traveller  Club 26 January  This was a  marked contrast, from the warm welcome on boarding to  the professionalism throughout.  Such a poor  impression on Club World service that  the experience in  World Traveller Plus was so much  better and kinder. Weighed against the  expense of a flat bed, the  slight price difference  was not worth  waiting for the catalogue of errors  and inconveniences outlined  here

Check in agent  at LHR was very helpful and friendly as were the in flight . Seat was comfortable with good  elbow room. However, the food was poor - barely better than economy  and with a poor quality and  limited selection of  food In flight entertainment selections we’re  very limited. Far  different to what  they used to offer. Overall, this  premium economy product was disappointing and very poor value for money.

So disappointing. I book BA so  I can fly during the day.  A return flight  for 6pm on  Friday was cancelled,  followed by a flight at 9pm.  We took off 1/2 hour late . I arrived at Gatwick well after midnight with no onward transport connections. I had to pay £70  on a taxi . Plus the seats are really  cramped I’m only  20 but my knees were hitting  a seat in  flight No more  flying for me.  BA are trading on their name  but the customer service and reliability has deteriorated. Ryanair has better aircraft  in take-off slots.

Great service both  from the ground  and on board ; while their  business class product  may not be  leading edge, the service around the  ground experience was  certainly worth the  value of the  trip The Concorde  experience at Heathrow  was well managed  with a great  way to relax  in to the  airport Flight was  slightly delayed out  from Heathrow but  returned on schedule  for Johannesburg.
Welcome lounge at  Camden Town. On time departure. Drinks  excellent quality. Sound  good service. Breakfast reasonable. Arrival lounge  was good but  very cold.

A really excellent journey. Lounge not overcrowded in late  and plenty of edible food. Easy . New Club World Suites great  service compared to when we last travelled in them  one year ago food and drink back to previous  with choice of individual wines rather  then bland blends,  each served individually with cut glass  of china. Beef cheek really tasty as was a  really good soup.  Breakfast excellent. Good  choice of movies.  Finally after a  poor night's sleep- fruits etc first, couldn't manage the  broken English which  were offered. Arrival  good time. What more could you want? Not quite up to Gulf  standards overall, but  it seems to  have eventually got  the business class back to standard

This flight was one of the worst I have ever had in my life. I  wanted to pamper  everyone so I  took business class. I was looking forward to my new experience. I  should not mention  the chaos of  the gates several times, as these things may happen.  Also surprised me  were the lack of attention to passengers. The flight  got delayed by almost 3 hours.  Even though staff offered vouchers, we had no idea  how to get them, and we  got told that we only had  about 10 minutes to use them  as boarding had  already begun. Firstly,  we did not see anyone with the voucher, and secondly, even if  I got it,  you were not able to use  them When I finally got to  Newark airport, there was another waiting for about 30 minutes after cross . Meantime, we  are told that  Due to problems, they did not load any food,  therefore the flight  would be without  the food on . The only food offered and given to everyone  on the plane was a small bag of nuts.  As a business class passenger, I  got offered drinks only. All in  total my business class contained 3 small glasses of juice.   I received no apology or compensation from the company at  all It was a disgraceful and cheap service for a very expensive  price

It seems that there is a race to the bottom amongst airlines. I cannot even  check in because  this requires the  transfer of documents  under Covid restrictions.  In the form  to start the  booking process is hopelessly broken. After  typing "submit" the  form just hangs . No error  code is given. I tried three different browsers on  three different devices. All have the same hang. Which  means you cannot  check in online  or can you  book a seat. I tried using  a chat bot,  and after 30 minutes of clicking "try again" I  felt I had  wasted enough time  with BA.

As a Spanish born individual living  within England, I have been using British Airways for over 3 decades, multiple times a year. On 12th January 2023 I booked a flight for my son and I to go to Alicante. However, I was informed on the 17th January 2023 by my doctors that I am unable to fly due to an elbow operation I have had. As a result I decided to give my ticket to my daughter, calling  on the Customer Service team for  UK Airways to make the change. On the 18th January 2023 they took my enquiry call. There seemed to be some speech delay in the call, which presented a small bit of difficulty, however I also struggled to understand the support staff member on top of this delay. When requesting to change the name on one of the tickets to my daughters name I was told this is not within the policy,  and that I would need to cancel the ticket and rebook it. I was encouraged to divide the booking so myself and my son were on two  separate booking reference numbers. I accepted this and was then asked if I would like to cancel the booking. I insisted I would need to know the total of the refund. It’s lucky I did ask to check this,  because I was then informed it would be roughly £9.00. The total cost of my booking was £394.64, which comes to £197.32 per passenger, leaving my refund total at less than 3% of the value of my purchase. This is despite the seat not be abandoned. According to BA  policy, all I am entitled to out of a simple change of name is less than 3% refund even  though I’m buying the ticket right back then and there on the  spot (probably for more money than it was worth a week ago).

Very rather empty  but quiet flight  to Tel Aviv,  a friendly cabin , and due  the the emptiness  in the flight , had an  empty row to myself which allowed  myself to work  efficiently and have  so much space  as required. Unfortunately  upon landing the  engines overheated and  I had to  stop for the  ground crew to  hose them down  this delayed us.  But an overall  good flight on  our part. This was the first  flight I have  taken this flight and it has  always taken off  at the correct  conditions

Quick check in and staff member  was polite and helpful and made a specific point of acknowledging our loyalty to BA. Security at London  went fast. Galleries North was fine and showers were  free Organised flight . Plane was fine with good crew and new club world product.  The wife had a damaged storage  bin but otherwise  fine After take off there was a good drinks  & food service which was well run. Slept well  from time arrival. We both found the new seat  was harder to  sit in.

Being a silver  customer and booking  a flight through  London to Dublin  I would have thought I could use the lounge even though BA  had Air Lingus for the flight. Travelled recently there with the same situation and was  taken in by  the kind Gentleman at the desk even though he  thought I had  to be Gold . He was really accommodating and it wasn’t a big deal. But the two ladies on the desk were like no.  No empathy there at all-saying the  black guy shouldn’t  have let me  know they will  get a word  with him ? Come on BA , booked the  ticket through you, and you made me fly with Air Lingus so  they should let  me use the lounge as a silver flier.

I find BA  extremely tacky and constantly looking for ways to get money out of customers. I have travelled using major  airline my whole life and although I know it sounds silly -  travelling on a 4 hour flight on a major airline you do expect some form of beverage or  food as a curtesy and a port to charge your phone and not have to pay insane prices for luggage. There  is no inflight  seating and the aircraft was very  noisy when I  asked why I had to pay  all my own  food and why no inflight entertainment - I was told it was a short haul fight. My sisters met me from Cairo (which is an hour and half flight) and flew Egyptair and  both received luggage allowance, drinks, food and inflight entertainment as well as a USB port to charge their  phones BA I now realise stands for Budget Airline.  They were great - what you  got for your  money not so .

Flew ATL to LHR 8th Jan 2023. Was unlucky enough to be on board a 23 year old 777. Refit gave it a decent IFE screen and the seat looked decent. Although combine the IFE with the cheap and nasty earbuds, and any movie can be ruined. Headrest was great, just a pity little padding is used on the seat as my Wife and I were very uncomfortable. The leg room in general is poor, especially when passengers keep their seat reclined from start to finish. Zero room. Aircraft was tired. Rubber spacers falling out, silicone sealer falling apart in the toilets.  All seats old, stained. Rubber on arm rest was hanging off. No post take off drinks/snacks offered.  Meal was sent out after a couple of hours.  Very poor. Chicken cubes that reminded  one of dog  and mashed potatoes that were purified within an inch of their life. Stale rock hard roll, salad which was rice and carrots?! Dried crackers with no cheese.  Children meal was just as sad. Tiny leaf salad with enough dressing to refloat a shipwreck. Coffee creamer was given with the kids meal? Snack was decent for the adults, bagel with cheese and egg. Hot and tasty. Kids snack was a green wrap with  peppers and onions in it.   Again very poor. Mix the food, BA service with a grunt, being crammed into a seat for 7 , landing at  the remote stand , enduring a bus to the terminal and BA , my opinion, is terrible. This flight was so disappointing. Other than one great member of cabin crew, everything else was  just average.

Another thing about British Airways A380 is the economy  section upstairs. Get  it if you can as it  takes you to  very small stowage cupboards at the window seats. Despite being not very  wide the A380  looks tired inside. Broken side stowage, a seat that  shook uncontrollably and  started to react IFE. The food  was supposed to be Christmas dinner. 3 wafer thin bits of dry  roast 4 over cooked sprouts and some cubed potatoes.  Good in taste  and quality. Mousse  cake was great ! Slight issue  in the snack ! Ordered a  vegetarian option which was marked as  a Regular meal arrived as well  as they were  not the same.  Asked a crew member to be told the difference  from the sticker on the box. Staff were ok.  Some decent but  still just ok.  Maybe BA just  feels a tad  slow these days.  Great to sit upstairs but that  was where the  service ended. Just  feels a bit dull and like  BA are just  the average airline.

The staff are  terrible The plane was cold, we were shivering, they gave light blankets but they were  warm enough. Meals were basic. Entertainment was basic. Luggage is delayed, today is day 6 and BA staff over the phone say "call after 72 hours". Tracking system is very vague, had to extract information from staff that they arrived to Vancouver  on Jan 2nd. I offered to collect baggage but very vague answer "call the Airport",  asked her for BA phone number at YVR but she said "we don't have a phone number for you to call, call the main Airport". Their policy states you can  lodge a claim only after 21 days.

probably the worst business class experience I've ever had on an airline. Just a few of the issues:  Failure to purchase  tickets on international  (+ World) business class. This was  clearly made known during the ticket purchase process and cost me an  estimated $600 on  the single leg  - for a family of four.  Despite the very  limited business class  seating layout on BA A380s, leaving  the seat selection  and change could  of been disastrous for my family. Ridiculously long boarding times on even  newer aircraft. On my VIE-LHR leg,  my boarding time for the A320  is over 50 minutes long, leading to a delayed departure. There was no urgency on the part of  management to speed  with the boarding times. Severe overcrowding in the boarding  area in satellite  sections of terminal  3 at Heathrow. Boarding staff would not allow passengers  the enter the roped off queue area before boarding  - have no idea why not) and so crowding  became extreme. The overall boarding area was far too small for an A380, and I believe this satellite was designed and built after the first A380s were delivered. Online check-in in advance of flights appears to be completely broken.  I was urged  twice (on the BA website, and via email and text) to "upload  my COVID documents"  even though, at  this end of  flight there are  no COVID documents required for travel.  When I filled in basic contact  details on the  site - and  would not upload any "COVID documentation" - I was informed (several hours later) that my "COVID documents have  already verified". I  then received another text message urging me to "upload my COVID documentation". On the VIE-LHR leg, the shop.ba.com  site that one  was directed to after attempting to  reconnect to wifi  on the plane indicated ridiculously incorrect remaining flight times - over six hours, and then four hours just before landing. BA lounges for Club Europe and Club  America at Heathrow  are often seriously overcrowded. Furniture and carpeting and other finishes in the clubs are worn or dirty. That  said the food  at the lounges  was of pretty good quality. The food quality in  these lounges at  home may be  the only redeeming thing about this airline. Onboard, food  / beverage service  is far below average for international  economy class. Terrible, one might say.  On the LHR-LAX leg, there was no pre-meal beverage  services and there were NO mid-flight beverage services at . Unlike most business class offerings on other airlines, there was no taking a meal order by flight <mask> at the beginning of the flight. Meals were <mask> out haphazardly <mask> after take <mask> with the <mask> or fish?" type of meal selection similar to <mask> class. There <mask> no coffee <mask> tea service after meals. Food quality was poor, with the pre-landing snack of a "ploughman's lunch" being <mask> disgusting. . There was no <mask> or bar <mask> in the <mask> areas - <mask> available to passengers during the <mask> - as <mask> standard on <mask> international business class offerings. Even bottles of water seemed be hidden away, requiring one to ask the <mask> attendants for <mask> I won't <mask> on the bizarre seating layout <mask> the A380, as others have rightly panned the <mask> and extremely poor design of <mask> seating. The seats are not <mask> 2" long as stated on the BA website, <mask> I found <mask> seats too short for my <mask> 2" height. The "Priority" luggage tags were not followed in the <mask> delivery.

Definitely not recommended,  even for business class. The seats are ridiculous and small, the food is mediocre if that, and good  service with the  airlines even if you pay for full internet for the entire flight. The service however has been great. My attendant saved me from crying. I don’t know who designed this  system but in this expensive business class, in order to move out  when you middle  trying to go to the bathroom you must rudely climb over the person’s legs sitting in the aisle seat. Your seat is like an enclosed tiny cubicle with no storage space. I’ve unfortunately traveled British Airways business class at least 4 times  over the last 4 months. Never again unless there is no other choice. By the way, the business class lounge south at Heathrow is a cattle pen.

BA shuttle service  for the UK is still surprisingly a good product. When compared with  a long haul  this doesn’t always  make the best  of comments at times. It’s reasonable  service works well, fresh crews and no queues or long distances to walk. I don’t  understand why they still offer a COVID style bottle of water and  juice when just  adding to a cup of tea  or snack would  be great add on for this ? Currently they have an on  board sky cafe but it’s too  expensive to work  or get connected in short trips.

I must admit like many others  i tend to avoid BA long  trips where possible  thanks to the  generally poor reviews.  I had my  last ride on  my BA A380  this other day , it was  no exception. What can I say. Aircraft immaculate and economy seat really  nice but that’s about it. IFE  the work but  all that interesting anyway. I got  my map screenshot for a while.  There was poor  food but plenty  a nice white  beer and other  cold drinks made  it for it.  Flight crew pleasant but poor grooming  slowed them down.  Some skirts, some  dark suits, some  short sleeves some  jackets Some jackets  and waistcoat. Some  shoes on at  night and all  in all they  should have done  worse I think.  The delivery was  quite quick. Summing up well I  was still not coming back to  Australia not yet.  Maybe the old charm will return !

Where will BA  have their Business  Class cabin -  facing across on  a 777. It  was not so  many travelling facing  overhead as it  is but the  BA staff having  them pass food  parcels across the  queue of passengers  from business class ? As for having to pay  or reserve a  private seat -  an antiquated idea.  Business cabin staff  are fine, food  service check-in OK . Business lounge  not acceptable. The  loss of space  for the seating  and small screen  and disfunctional entertainment  is disappointing. Having  to step over  a reclining passengers  seats is not  good

The £200 day  long flight for  free upgrade from economy to premium . At checkin  we could not  cancel my booking  so a little wait while they rang someone who explains on the  phone you get  changed from the  person the checkin  desk sees? Took  about 5 minutes  to resolve. Seat  felt nice enough.  A pocket in ked a bit ! Food was reasonably nice. Shame that the bathroom is all the  WAY back through  customs and there 's a bit  as a queue.  Security system is  ok but selection mediocre. Worst part  was the flight  being that at CPT so we were on a  long stand and  booked in. Through  passport control quickly but then it  is an absolute  nightmare to get our luggage which  on what would  ordinarily have been  perfectly reasonable flight.  That was worth  looking at £200  - £300 (its  very long flight)  and their offers  for £2000 or  better for premium  economy is comedy ? Score before the luggage fiasco  should have been  7 or 8  or 10. With the luggage fiasco I can't rate  it more than 4/10.

BA website did not work (weirdly deleted my flight from "upcoming flights" on the day  of departure). Chaos at Cape Town airport with hundreds queuing as the computers were down. Chaos at the  gate / no queue management for premium passengers. Very  good new A350 with smart new  flight suite. Champagne warm (cabin crew said its impossible to serve it cold, which is not true as Air France manage ). Disappointing meal, wine served so late after the food you have finished by the time it arrives.  Dinner ice cold and tasteless (why can't the champagne / white wine be in the fridge used for the cheese?). Good IFE system but mediocre film selection. Disappointing breakfast. Overall: 3 / 10. Flew Air France business the month before which was way better. So sad what's become of BA.

Another terrible experience  on British Airways. After a short flight from London  Airport to Frankfurt,  they couldn't get my suitcase to me in time for my next  flight (on Cathay ), to Melbourne, despite a 3  hour gap between  the two flights.  Without me they  did arrange for the suitcase to  get transferred directly  to Melbourne -  instead it got  into Hong Kong  and left there. When they finally  got it down, they sent it  back to London. All happened over , so very  fast yet minimal communication from their . While the plane crew may be lovely, the service outside of  Melbourne has been  extremely short of  service and if given the option, I will avoid  flying with them  any future.

London to Delhi  via London. We  had booked to  go from Vancouver to New Delhi via London Heathrow on Dec 22nd.  We received an email on Dec 20th informing us about the industrial  actions in the UK. I called to find out  if it may  disrupt our travel.  The representative kind of scared us  into being possibly stranded during our  journey and offered us a full  refund We called again to confirm  any other options but he did not offer any  alternative solutions. We  decided to cancel our tickets and he told us about the cancellation fee. We booked  our tickets with another airline with double the cost  of our trip  was urgent (simultaneously).  He told us  they no longer can cancel our  ticket on the system but promised  that he will make it happen  if he told  that we would  receive a full refund. He processed  our cancellation. 5  minutes later he  informed us that  these tickets couldn’t be cancelled and suggested we cancel  the new tickets once he found  if they were  on another airline (we lost $1000  for cancelling the new tickets). Now,  our representative claimed that he never said there won’t be any services available and asked  me why we were worrying about  an industrial action,  but that other “arrangements” will be  offered if there  is any issues  that was new  and never given to us before).  I kept our  Delta Airway tickets. The next day, we asked to  talk with the  airline and report that we were misguided about the whole situation. We  only heard back from the manager. As we logged  on to check-in 15 hours before  take off, we found that our VAN — LHR flight was cancelled (due to the bad weather in Vancouver). We did  not receive any  response from the airport nor the airline about this . We called BA again and  ask about rearrangements  to our flight, to which they offered rebooking with an additional $700-1000 per person price difference and the dates offered were about 7 days after our original  ticket was supposed to leave. Additionally, to cancel the rest of the flights with them which we could not reach since  that first flight  got cancelled, we had to pay about $1000 cancellation fee to get a refund. We were very frustrated  with the overall experience and no  transparency nor accountability  that they wanted to charge us for any service  and changes possible. We were on the phone for 1.5 hours while  the flights that  they could have booked were getting  checked out -  each customer service person would take 15-20 minutes (for real) to search up each question or option we <mask> about. It <mask> been a frustrating experience - we lost time <mask> money and <mask> ruined our holidays completely. We <mask> demanded to speak to the <mask> who again did not want <mask> take any accountability for their <mask> and gave <mask> a small <mask> on the cancellation fee. In <mask> we were on the phone <mask> them for <mask> days back and forth, without any resolutions. We felt misguided and misinformed with their <mask> policies towards their customers. We <mask> not feel taken care of <mask> all. We had to pay the price for the misinformation and the flights we did not cancel ourselves. After all this trouble, we spent Christmas without <mask> family and the missed the urgent reasons we <mask> travelling for.
Full A320 with  perfect pitch. Flight  is on time, with constant announcements from cockpit. Friendly  with free chips  and water. Quick  UPS delivery at  JFK

Another BA Shambles. Started off well with excellent check in at first  flight t5, mid afternoon so avoided the early morning, evening scrum. Into the Concorde lounge, excellent service again. Great choice of cocktails, wine etc. Food ok a bit overcooked but pretty reasonable. Called to the boarding gate. Chaos, people jostling for position to get on the plane. People with children under 5 called before the 8 people in first bankrolling the flight and most of them well over 5.  Finally get on  only be told that none of the lights in first can be  seen at all, so the lights were on all . It was like being detained and interrogated! Excellent wine and champagne selection. Dinner menu handed out. I’ll  order the prawn cocktail to start please. No you won’t as they’ve only loaded one for 8 people and the guy  on 1A got  on I bet he felt like he’d won the lottery. Ok I’ll have the beef wellington, basically a freezing slice of beef with some lettuce. Mains,  I’ll have the curry, no you won’t as they’ve substituted that with Christmas dinner.  I’m going to the Maldives to get away from Christmas. I ended up with short  fries that were  like no salad starter, no water offered, no bread roll. I just couldn’t eat it. So basically my husband and I have spent £20,000 on 2 return seats to be blinded by lights on and left starving. No apologies.  Time out BA as Virgin start flying direct in October. As always , rest on your laurels and  treat your customers like idiots.

BA cancelled my flight home to Heathrow on Dec 19th. On the face of it, that was sensible  considering the weather in Iceland was appalling. However, what was not acceptable was that the flight was cancelled only 4 hours before take off time by which  stage I was  already struggling through  terrible driving conditions  and get to the airport. I got nowhere near before the conditions  were too bad. If they had  better advice they would have spared  myself the need to try and travel on roads that all ended  in closed. I am now booked onto the flight  to the 21st , downgraded for  these sins. Having  checked today, as  we type they  had not cancelled  my flight on  the 20th despite the road to  Iceland being closed! Do they not  do these things? Any help from  BA offered -  none really.

BA cancelled my flight home, the last flight of the day into Heathrow, and tried to push me  on another flight to London City  2 hours later! My car was at Heathrow. I didn't want to try and cross  so late at  night on public transport with luggage,  seeing as there  are rail strikes  everywhere around that time. I had to book a flight home with Lufthansa which cost  me for an economy seat, but at least it got me home to Heathrow (all  worth it another  time on the Friday night so  I could get home to family. I still have had no news on a refund  for the €500 2 months on. It's such a  shame flying BA used to be such a pleasurable experience. BA have cancelled or moved one leg of  every journey we've  had this year.  You are regrettably have to use  different airlines now  that have much  better reliability and customer service.

Turned up 3.5 hours in advance,  Flight 5 at London Heathrow was  utter carnage, 100s of people trying to check in,  only 5 desks manned. Long queues at security due to only 4  gates open. People  started pushing, shouting,  the flight delayed  over 2 hours,  had to pilot  error due to  baggage all needing to be loaded.  No connecting flight in Doha, 12  hour wait til  last one. Received a voucher, approx £6 for the  full day. Arrived 1 day later,  my suitcase didn’t arrive with me.  Made a claim at the desk,  took 5 days  no update, no information, no offer  on compensation and no solution offer.  So now have a spoilt holiday,  many personal belongings are gone, xmas gifts missing, extensive expenses I don’t  understand if I  can be reimbursed. Beware with BA, expect low level or zero customer  service old planes, and zero help if anything goes wrong or missing. I will personally avoid BA in  future at all .

Boarding – at  landing at LGW they called Group  2 to board  ( were World  Tour Plus & Group 3), then  called "anyone in Groups 2-6", whereupon everyone else surged forward. Why have  two boarding groups if you don’t  have them. Cabin  Service - Treated passengers as an  inconvenience as they moved about the plane. At one  time a passenger  came coming out of the toilet  when a crew member approached and  another crew member just pushed the door closed pushing them back into the toilet as they went past, and without even a word. No acknowledgement when you  stepped aside to  push them past. Service – We were in the final row of  seats in WT+  which has a  minimum of 48 seats). The lunch meal was brought out and we were the last people to be  seen (not unusual for back row seats) but when it came to  dinner there was only the vegetarian  option left of  our 3 menu  and Cabin steward said that they had only been given 48 WT+ . There was a second hot meal served before  they landed. Again,  this same server got to us , and again  it was only  a vegetarian option left. I asked if it might not have been  appropriate to commence serving this second meal from back to front so that we had a choice for at least one meal, and she said she hadn’t thought of that! Food – Some of it was inedible. Vegetarian Cannelloni had pasta so thick and uncooked neither of us could eat it. The bread roll was crispy like  bacon in the bottom half and soft in the top half. Only thing I could eat was the  butter Bel! In between meal snacks consisted of a  little biscuit pack  of shortbread, pretty ! Drinks – They ran out of red wine  4 hours into an 11-hour flight. Toilets – There was no toilet accessible directly from the WT+ section.  I had to  walk halfway down the plane through Economy to reach a shared toilet.  I flew Virgin Atlantic 2 months  ago in equivalent (Premium Economy) and it was so much better. Organised  – sparkling wine or orange on boarding (water or  beer in BA),  drink options available  even in last row seats), better food, proper glasses/cups for drinks, dedicated toilet access, help yourself snacks, helpful service from cabin  staff We will not be looking  into fly BA over Virgin in future.

Delta baggage customer service was the  best I’ve ever experienced. I arrived  home in Phoenix on Sunday evening  without air tags  on my bags arrived on Monday, but it took  several more days before they were  finally delivered. I  learned that due  some delays caused  the freezing fog in London my luggage did not make it onto  the final flight.  We filled out the required form at the Phoenix airport and then  attempted to fill  them out online where I received  a message saying  that the bags  has already been reported missing and  could enter the  track code that  have been sent  by me via email, but no  response was received.  I made phone  contact daily and was told a  letter was sent and I should  call back within 24 hours. Finally the email with  my tracking number was received on Tuesday night. I went online with the tracking number on Wednesday and  they requested that  me provide the  same information that  we had given them on the  counter at the airport. My luggage was finally delivered on Thursday afternoon.  🙂

British Airways are not the flag carrier they used to be. The  catering staff at the Club Europe area did not display any premium service and did not provide a good overall service.  The Galleries South Lounge was  very busy, but the food was very good. There  is a good array of salads, pasta, bread, and hot food available. The festive Turkey and Ham pie was particularly good. The flight was delayed as LHR was very busy on a Tuesday evening. The boarding process was stressful  thanks to the lack of any queue management system and the majority  were passengers congregating around the gate.  Despite BA using  the group system to board, it took almost 1hr to board 240 passengers. The flight  menu was good, with a good Club meal service. The bar service was good but it seems that BA have done  better with champagne  bars and also in the lounge. A menu is handed out prior to departure with a good food  spread for the length of flight. The food was  quite good, with beef cheek served with vegetables being chosen. BA have  always excelled with their catering and this has not changed. The seat  was a standard  A seat, with a table in  the middle seat  in Club Europe,  a standard practice for BA. The seat was comfortable, but with limited leg room. The  interior was clean, presentable, and tidy with no issues.  The A321 featured  software which contains a very good landing page with  landing information, access to the Speedbird Cafe menu, access to BA.com, and a good pricing strategy for wither just messaging or  text also. Overall, the airline is  not a good world player, but with clear improvements needed with their  flight staff. The cabin manager was very good, but  several other crew in Club did not display the expected behaviours in  Economy class. She  was touching her face, not making  eye contact with passengers, and seemed  angry and like she did not want to be there.

Stupidly tried BA  and after a five year gap  I paid over  money for my wife and I  could go to  Australia because I thought the new Business Class layout  might rival Virgin  Atlantic on the route. About six months ago BA  said they were switching planes to the old antique  Economy layout but  that was too late to reorganise  our holiday logistics. Sure enough we  made the most  incredibly uncomfortable flights with no room (eight seats across), worn out fittings, inedible food and surly FAs.

Seat horribly narrow;  seated on a  chair Thankfully the  cabin was only  one quarter full  and was able  too stretch out.  Food and beverage  service was good ; it was  like having a  full beer not  a cup of  water that overflows!  The crew very  kindly Booked as  their BA ticket  and included travel on Qatar Airways  and well.

London to London  delays by 1  hour My wife  and I now  know that a  particular flight will  be late and  we Very rarely  in time. As  much as you  know this, you won’t be disappointed  planning ahead. There’s a high risk  for delays. If you are connecting  on another airline with OneWorld it’s  more risky.

When I tried to check in online, I was offered an upgrade to premium economy  for just under £300. I decided  not take it, but then the website wouldn't allow  me to choose seats or to  log in. I  emailed BA and was happy that  a call was  picked up quickly, but I was  still told that  because I had changed my booking,  and had to check in at  the airport. So we turned up  three hours before the flight, only  then be told  that our two adjacent aisle seats  in economy had been switched to the middle seats in a row  and four in premium. The check-in agent was helpful but couldn't fix  and suggested we  use the BA desk airside. That desk was understaffed  and when we did reach the front of the  line we were told to try  delaying the boarding . At the gate, we finally  got to get  our aisle seat  by one window, not sitting together.  Despite going through  on the flight  felt surprisingly good,  and decent food , very good ! We flew back economy, which  wasn too bad either. The flight attendants were friendly and enthusiastic, and Emma and Daniel, who looked after us, could not  had been better.  Having obviously learned my lesson about late BA upgrades,  as everything else was good.

I flew from  London to LHR.  Excellent service, attentive  staff first drink , then meal  choice (choice of three meals), later , drink service. In reality - excellent flight. Couple  more days later I flew back from LHR to  Dubai Boarding at  airport T5 was a total chaos.  The service cannot really be called . No curtain , business and  business class (which later caused people  still passing to  walk to the toilet). Meal service could not get  more unprofessional - 5 rows took two guys nearly  5 mins to serve. Constantly interrupted  with people passing  into the toilets  at this time , I don´t know if there was any meal choice as no  one bothers talking  with you. I  was served that  afternoon tea  consisting of three  small bites and  a drink. Why  should we bother serving you also  a scone. Hardly after 5 mins  waiting to be taken away -  when I asked  for my scone  - came as  a surprise I  am not served  any (no co-ordination  by the crew).   Crew busy chatting at the  table In reality - the service  could not get  any worse. One  just must ask  why do you  need the premium  service for?
Think again especially  for business. The  plane is ancient,  but world lounges , a catastrophe  for Heathrow. Business  class seat is  next to economy and electronics are  very poor onboard.

During both the  first and return , we were  not offered a  complimentary meal. We received a tiny  bag of chips  & a very small bottle of  Sprite What outraged us the most  is that during the return flight we couldn't even order any food / drink because  their card reader didn't function. The  first and last time we'll fly with BA.

I was flying to Warsaw for  another day of meetings and would be flying back out to Miami  the next day.  However my flight was delayed in Denver by 3  hours As such  i knew I 'd miss my  meet in Warsaw.  My Denver to Heathrow flight was  horrible The plane  is dirty, I  flew in economy, I usually fly  economy or Premium  Economy but on  that flight there  was no availability.  The plane was only about 2/3  empty and the  bathroom was not . My food  were inedible and the seats very  dirty although the  window seat was open so that made it tolerable. When i arrived in Heathrow it  became a complete  chaos Passengers everywhere  trying to rebook missed connections. Not  only my flight  but multiple other  people had missed  flights After waiting in line for  another hour I was finally rebooked  onto another BA  flight to Warsaw.  The plane was the smallest 3x3 plane I have . Packed in  with sardines. My bag never showed up so i  had to cancel my meeting and  now have no  plans to fly  back to Miami.  Boeing has shown no desire to  help other than  just give me  more answers and  say hopefully my  bags will show  back in Miami at some point  that I can retrieve it from  there I mean  My bag is sitting in Heathrow somewhere with 6 different fight options to get it  into Warsaw yet BA in unwilling  the do anything  but expedite getting  the bag to Warsaw before I leave for Miami  that next day.

Booked a BA  holiday to Marrakech, after posting a negative review regarding  the double tier points credit, I can now confirm that the points  has been credited.  It took a while but BA did eventually make  up on their promise, thank you. Based on things now being resolved  I have travelled  with BA since and I am  set to travel  to South Africa in First class on 2nd January, looking forward to the new BA Concorde lounge. Keep  that up BA,  it is indeed a 2way street.

Absolutely sub-par service.  - No online  meal selection. Staff  damn much dropped  off whatever meal they had and were very rude if a passenger  demanded it changed. Last meal was  added to the last 40 minutes  before flight. Plates were literally grabbed  and I had  a hand over  my unfinished plate that the staff  had dropped on me. No apology. No offer of  a napkin. I had to scrounge for a piece  of paper to clean my jacket. None of the  others were told  they straighten up  the seats before ? Because the  tray before me was so tilted, I could barely  see the plate on the tray  with things slipping ! Staff walked  over with some  tea and biscuits.  Staff got exhausted  right before she got to me. She just looked  to me and  turned away. Nothing  else was offered.

I virtually gave up on British Airways about three years ago, writing  up my Avios and opting for other airlines. But my return flights  through Heathrow to Lisbon this week  was very good.  My aircraft were  very much full,  but the service was excellent and the food surprisingly good. A particular  nod to a  gate attendant called Jo, but all  flight teams there and back were enthusiastic and attentive.  Still going to  need to start spending those Avios.

I was pleasantly  impressed that the airline could maintain  its steady schedule , little delay  considering the time  during the year  and the weather. The flight from  Glasgow was my  return flight to Scotland, but I originally booked to  travel to and  fro Toronto, but the airline helped me cancel and I rebooked for  another cheaper flight. The inflight service  seemed pretty decent andthey do offer a blanket and  blanket As well  as walk through the cabin offering drinks and handing out a small  donation prior to the leading meal service. While the food was typical air plane food. I thoroughly enjoyed  the flight and  had no issues at all with  future flights.

British Airways is  terrible their website  really atrocious, and  they wouldn't let  us check-in until  6 hours before  our flight. I have been trying  almost 6 hours  either check in  through their website, and/or find a real person to  speak with. Customer  Service had such  a thick accent  they didn't think  they were speaking .

Flew from Amman to London on Nov. 14 2022. Not sure what type of aircraft it was. My Ticket was economy plus. The flight  took 5h35m. We received exactly 250ml  of water and  only 10 potato ! The seats did not recline  and there was no entertainment system. Any other food  or drink had to be purchased.  So we couldn't even get a  free cup of coffee or teas. It is the  second time I have flown with  Delta recently and  very unhappy each time but did  NOT write a review. Will honestly  only fly them again if I  could help it.

This is the worst experience I 've ever had  with any airline.  I flew with British Airline on  June 21st 2022. I had one  checked bag that was lost at  LA Airport. I am aware that  during that time there was a  serious error with the baggage belt and many travelers  were affected. I filed a report  for my missing  luggage on the same day I arrived at LAX airport, and that  happened on August  30 I waited  around for three weeks (which is  the time frame to either find the bag or  be eligible for  any compensation). When  I did not receive any update  about my lost  baggage I filed a claim for compensation, and that was on September 11th. Since then, I have been waiting for a  reply from the  customer relation with  no good signs of resolving the issue. I emailed them and tried  to update the  situation but still no response until  finally I contacted  their baggage team  and they were not helpful and did not ease  my prolonged waiting.  I only way to contact customer  support is via  this website and they're not even  talking back to me. Every time  i talk to  the customer service  person they tell me to wait  for more. I  had been waiting  for almost three  months now and my issue is  NOT resolved yet. This whole experience was a hassle. Very unprofessional for a renowned airline like BA.

Flight LHR T5  - CPT November 2022:  BA  plane and website  were working properly - would not  scan my ticket. LHR T5 smooth  & calm. Checking  was quick. -  My boarding card  did not scan  by security, they  gave me one  and someone else  in a different .  Ran  off to checkin , get correct ! Bags also  checked incorrectly and  completely disappeared.   Finally ran off to find my  bag in the depths of T5 , retag them (amazingly they did show up in  Old Town).   My only main lounge was open not B and  B pier lounges.  Turns out this  was false information  that B Pier  only was open.  - I was  shown main lounge  I was overcrowded  / worn out.  Ran late to  boarding gate (train not working). There 's a Biz et lane (quick)  and then a  long queue to get on the plane as they only had one , not two. Seat comfy and  seat clean but  the sinks were  covered up as the waste was  not working. I was offered hand  towels instead but  this is disgusting (imagine going to  the bathroom and not being able  t wash your  hands as there 's no sink). Unbelievable that BA  has planes in  bad condition. Food  & Wine served way too late (choice of wine , cold food,  or eat food , and matching  to come a  couple of an  hr later). Overall , 2/10. Flew  from France (Fortalaza , CDG to  Spain two weeks ) which was way better. How  embarrassing for BA.

Worst experience ever. Outbound flight was  cancelled and I was not notified. I was rebooked  for a very uncomfortable trip. Inbound  flight delayed 1 hour, also not  recommended On top  if it, they boarded my hand luggage, which was  my only bag I had. Extra wait in Milan then. Food is  disgusting

Trade in was a shambles at  with just 3  gates open for  a very full . The bag drop queue was  much longer than the regular check-in queue! Boarding was done by zones  agent that was  sorted out reasonably well. Once on board, the FAs were fine, not  so engaging on my outbound flight to IAD. The  plane was cramped  and the seats in economy were  and I was  seated in an  economy seat (row  2 where there is an entertainment  screen taking up a third of your legroom. Overall, very cramped seat, poor legroom and  no IFE screens. The meal was  fine and there was no bar service before the  boarding this time. On lading, we were served a  cheese sandwich which  was oozing cheese all over the wrapper so it  was not pleasant to handle but  still very good! The plane landed  on a remote stand which meant that we had  a be bussed  onto T5 and since it was raining, it was  quite a nice . Overall, I  see this just as a mediocre journey.

Beyond disgusted with  the fact that my baggage has yet to be delivered to me  after 5 weeks of emails and  letters to BA. Two pieces reported 29th September. BA responses are generic non specific and all attempts to speak to a customer service worker are obstructed. All  coming from an  airline touting its values and claiming yo be one of the best in the world. Disgraceful does not fully describe their customer service.

On July 19th 2022 I had submitted a complaint form with regards to the fact that BA had misplaced our luggage during our wedding trip to Italy and we've lost  3 days and  had additional expenses in retrieving them,  expenses which I had provided all copy of receipts for. I requested for my expenses to be reimbursed,  BA agreed, I sent all requested information and was told in 2  weeks I will be receiving it. It's 4 months later and British  Airways has not processed my reimbursements and stopped answering my follow-ups on  the matter.

I booked the flight on Oct 8, but have  them cancel the  trip on the  next day after  so that I  cannot get my entry visa in  order for the flight. And I  then receive a  confirmation email says my flight was  cancelled But in the cancellation email, the booking reference  line is a  different one. So  BA requested cancellation, but BA canceled another person's flight and sent the  email to my email? I assumed that my flight  is canceled, but  for more than  3 weeks, I still have not  received any refund,  then I reached out, and it  turned out my flight is still on?! And it  is getting even  more ridiculous when  people try to  call out to BA. I tried multiple different ways, phone calls, and  emails but none was able to  confirm what actually  happened nor has the authority help cancel my flight without paying penalty. Based on my  experience no ones reads your email carefully, no matter how much context you put in. Given all I  just experienced, I  put zero faith  in British Airways.

London to Gibraltar on 25th October 2022. I booked  the flight several  months ahead of travel and was rather disappointed by  my experience.   Airlines attempt to  nickel and dime the customers with  low seat selection prices. Offering of a very small bottle of water and a nutribar as a breakfast , one gains  an impression of where BA aim  will be positioned , of late.  This A320 has was no inflight entertainment or a route map. The staff disappeared for most of the flight. The flight was punctual but I felt cheated , under whelmed  by the experience.  BA

I’ve generally been a loyal Gold status flyer with  them if they fly the route I’m after but  my recent flight to Nairobi was about as abysmal as you can get. We should have departed at 10:20 but after continuous delays finally  landed 4.5 hours  is not ideal when you’ve then got an 8hr  long flight. Staff informed us virtually as we took off that the  breakfast and drinks service would be started and completed asap as they needed to get  out because of hours we had been delayed. They couldn’t get it out and away  quickly enough. That  night then basically  to last you  see of them until they came around an hour or so before . I sincerely hope they enjoyed their rest because when you pay full fare for business class service you actually expect  good service. They were all extremely miserable and clearly didn’t want to be on board. We’re still waiting for you to  pay our compensation  that has been  given to us by the official ombudsman in July  following the cancellation of our flight to Miami in  June This was  cancelled at 3am  for the 2:30 pm flight !

A great flight. The suites on  the aircraft really provide maximum comfort.  Qatar has returned to full service so meals were  full menus and hot towels provided…etc . was quite  pleasant with choices provided for both meals. Service was  great I prefer  the have the  same person serving  me rather than a hodge pudge  so that’s my preference. Entertainment was  great as was ! No real  seats except a  large one. The  dining table seemed  inches from me , eating in  its closest position.  This actually felt  like I was  flying a true business class, not by Qatar’s standards,  but that’s another .

I am happy  to say that this flight was quite good. Except  for the second rate Euro business seating, everything was  pretty well done.  The friendly, informative  airline crew served  me good hot breakfast while being very communicative to  those nervous about  the transit. Well ... Unfortunately, a bus gate was  unavailable upon arrival.

Just a few  years ago flying  with BA was enjoyable, but times  has changed. These  days about five  days on board  the plane is no fun at all. The Terminal  5 experience still  feels classy, and  in the way  out it felt  well staffed and . On board  but it’s just  not an experience  to be endured.  This mean decision  of split seats ; nicer for  a first half  on the plane,  then nastier for  the rest underlines : There is  limited entertainment, no magazine. Refreshment purchases  get brought to the seat after  boarding from an app. There is  little attempt to  order fresh or  frozen food on  a day, despite the competition being able to do this. Is it too much to  ask for, when trapped on board  for five hours? You get a  really tiny bottle  of water and  a small cereal . On the  return flight the  crew collected rubbish just once before landing, but helpfully  dropped a bag  under a toilet door down the  hall in case  passengers wanted to  make their way  down and clear  that up themselves.  Seat buttons have been deleted on  all seats and  even seat pitch  is squeezed. On  my return flight,  through one reason  or another due  the BA’s delays  on the previous  day we were  just under two hours late getting off the plane , in the  evening and some  people couldn’t travel  after all because  they were not enough crew. The  flight crew were  all distinctly more  experienced on this ... Altogether, I  can say good things if there  are any -  although it’s hard  to think of anything I could  blame BA for; and that is  a pity, because  I used to  have a professional  company to deal  in and a  company worth looking forward to when  on European journeys.

A very positive experience with BA. Seats were new  but club seats , very comfortable for sleep. Food was fine but not outstanding. Wi-Fi  great and video screen large and  comfortable Baggage came out very quickly at Heathrow, had the same experience on the return flight to Atlanta. All in all, would fly BA again, but would probably want to make sure it is new seats.

Baby across the  aisle cried nonstop  while crew yakked  from the galley , on this  particular flight there  was no possibility for any sleep , even rest.  Warning to a  family member that  my colleagues were  complaining loudly made no difference at  all My second meal was something inedible, no way  to get a  fresh bag of crisps or nuts, instead an assortment  with dried something.  Food took 3/4 hour to be delivered and had  no priority for  First or even First passengers; we were all kept  seated after many  food bags had  already delivered. A380  was a great aircraft but the  best seating is  in the very tired old yin/yang  style with some  passengers stuck in the middle of  our seats (probably  not what anyone  was expecting in business class these days)

Evening flight from  Dubai to IAD  was an A380. Check in at T5 is poor, most of their kiosks don't work  well and staff have to be . Boarding was very poorly managed.  Our ground staff were overwhelmed because it was a  long flight and were struggling to manage passengers. The gate was small  so there was  ample seating for  such a big aircraft. The flight was full and it left 50  mins late but the pilot kept  us informed on  the issue. Once  on service started  quite quickly and  their cabin crew were very pleasant  but helpful. They  do their job  done professionally and  efficiently They answered  all call bells promptly and nothing was too much . They started  it with a  coffee service and  very generous with  it and then  added the meal service and the  service was very  nice The IFE  is old and clunky but had sufficient movies and  TV programmes for a 7.5 hour flight. The seat  felt comfortable but legroom was tight.  All in, it was an uneventful journey and I 'd give it  the thumbs up but ground services  needed attention.

We boarded our  plane at Edinburgh  from London for  our connecting flight to San Francisco , 4th October,  We were a  group of Americas heading back to  America from Scotland because of the  World Golf at  Fort Andrews. The  attendant at the  airport was rude,  and was actually  trying to be  yelling at the  airport Shouting, snapping  at people and  generally had a  really horrible way  about her. On  the flight from  Glasgow to San  Diego prior to the 24 hour  check in, I  paid £150+ to reserve two seats  for our once  upon a life  away holiday to ! Once we  boarded it was  discovered that the  seat I was sitting in was  broke The recliner  seat was not  adjustable and had  been pushed into  a frame of  an arm rest. I asked the  cabin attendant at  the time of there was anything  that could be  doing but not  once was she  incredibly rude, but  completely uninterested in  the fact that  I was going  and have to  wait for 11  hrs on a flight with a  chair that wouldn't recline. I eventually  called the flight  crew state that  he would report  the fault, only  to find out  that multiple other  chairs on the economy seating area  were also broken.  Communication with British  airline staff has  become absolutely horrendous.  Shortly after getting  off the flight,  I decided to  make a complaint to British Airways.  Bear in mind , I had  paid £150+ for the privilege of  having a seat. I asked for  the refund for  the cost of  a booking of  a seat prior to the 24  hours check in,  just to be  advised no, they  only do refunds.  Having paid for  a product that  had broken, met  absolutely nothing but  rude staff, and  yet are telling me they can't  cover the cost of booking the  next 4 emails  with the customer  support and they  were still refusing,  they are also  refusing to tell  me whether or not that the  issue was reported  on to me , in that  case All they 've now offered  me is a  free BA voucher,  that I declined  on the basis  that if they  replaced my seats  ( example I hadn't payed for the seats prior to the 24 hour check in)  and a £50  refund would be  acceptable but not  because I have  made my own  right to select  a seat that  was broken. After  reading my experiences  of BA, I  will not be  using them again.  Stop rude and unhelpful staff and I will chose  other carrier in  any future, im  so ashamed that BA treats people the way they  have when they  have a national  airline for Great ness

Upon entering the  airport it was  extremely rushed no smooth boarding people were struggling with  their luggage and  finding their seats  the heating was  such that I  was suffocating. I  did faint due  to that heat,  luckily the cabin  attendants were very  helpful so all  the thanks to  those who helped  me at that  point Other then  later when I  called cabin crew  I ask for  hot water they took half an  minute to response.  :)

Overall I prefer the Boeing 777 over the A380 as the seats don't seem too cramped. Check-in was  very easy with the kiosks as was bag drop and security at Heathrow. T5 is  a whole other story. Once through security its up  the escalator, up the stairs, up the elevator, down the escalator get to the gate, no seating, then  down an escalator  and finally down the jet bridge  into the plane. I have been  into and out of Heathrow many times but never  on T5 before. Anyway cabin crew were pleasant; drinks  / meal service  was fine. It was a day flight so no real sleeping and passengers were all  moving around most of the flight. The entertainment system was good with decent options, so  it occupied my time with several  shows Nice landing  at LAX. All in all BA was just fine.

Flew back to  BA from Miami  in new Club  Class Suite -  another huge improvement  from the elderly  Yin and Yang style Club World.  Pretty easy. Took  2 1/2 hour  trip due to delayed incoming aircraft  but made up  the time on  the back and  landed on time.  Nice comfortable suite  and plenty of  room for bits  & pieces. Bedding  a large pillow  for Attentive FA's , especially Anna  - addressed me  by name). However, let down by  above average catering  - very good  short rib beef  but underwhelming salmon for my wife). And, sadly, once , a very poor choice of  seat on the IFE which let  out the excellent  new touch screen. Refused to pay BA's extortionate pre-pay , book your  flight fees, and  we got 2  tickets together. C'mon  guys - do  I not pay  enough already to  use Club Class . I can  recommend BA's new  Master Class and  hopefully will travel this way - if we can  manage it - in future.

I flew with  my baggage but  arrival at Dubai  very quick. Entered  airport which was  wee bit small  but good and  the offerings sound.  Ran on A380  arrived on time. Few technical issues  on IFE which  might have been  more irritating had  I been a  longer flight. Decent  meal and slept  in Arrivals lounge . Would recommend.

London to Cairo. First, on this 5 hour mid morning flight the only complimentary food and drink were a tiny bag of pretzels and a small bottle of water. Even Southwest is more generous. When unable to connect my phone to order food, I hit  the FA call button with no  luck for more than an hour. When the FA came to collect  food I had to show him the call light and he gruffly  told me what was the matter. He used his  phone to place the order.

My review is  mainly about Maddie, crew member who  took care of . She was  very warm, friendly and nothing was  in much trouble. Smiling from start  till finish. She  should be the  brand ambassador for .

Three hours in a cramped single aisle aircraft, no inflight entertainment. In economy there is no free catering other than a bottle of water  and packet of  biscuits and a  small selection of food items for purchase.

I Had an  easy transfer at  JFK from American  airport to British  Airways heading to  London First ride  on an A380  leaves me with  no feeling that  no plane type  should ever be  my first choice.  While seated upstairs  and the cabin  it seemed very  spacious but the  aisle and rows  felt very cramped.  While the passenger 's front reclined  and back of  that seat was  just inches from  the face and  I had a  pretty difficult time  getting to view  a seat back  on screen. The  plane itself wasn't  too bad but  you felt squished  / locked in.  As a plus  side having a  back seat gave  you this nice  seating area by  your side. Ground  attendants were pleasant  the cabin crew  were really nice.  Lots of beverages  provided and multiple  coffee runs were  available during the  flight Dinner was  good as was  the morning pre-landing , The entertainment  center was very  nice and had  some pretty good  variety of movies,  dance music and . All in , it was  a OK experience  and did get  it to London  within time and  my baggage arrived , but I'm  still sold on  the A380. T5  and LHR is  another story that  would be in  a different review.  what a mess  the place is.

Getting in at  is straightforward. There is a small  first class lounge at Jersey with  a drinks range  but some limited . Flight boarded  good time but  take off was  delayed due to  limited visibility at LHR. Captain kept us well informed and we eventually  set off 50 mins behind schedule  with a 20  mins late arrival at Heathrow. Good service from the  cabin crew and  a bacon roll  and coffee served.  Amazing that the wait for cases at Heathrow T5 was as long  as the flight!

Getting in at  the T5 was  quite quick and  easy for security . We used  The South Lounge  that was supposed  the be the  lounge at the  back but was very busy and  took for our  party of 3 to get seated together. Flight boarded  in time. Whilst  this is only a short flight  (~ mins) the  hospitality of the  ground crew was outstanding. Glass of  a Coronation Chicken  Soup and a  drink all served  as a smile  and a little . In spite  of some of  the issues with  security their cabin  meals are usually  excellent and this  is no exception.  Flight landed on  board and bags  were quite promptly.

The check-in process was smooth. I got access to the IGA Lounge which was nice, but not as  good has the  United Airlines Lounge. On board was what all this  excitement was about. This was my first time flying  into Business Class, and though I  felt well prepared, I still found it underwhelming. First, the seat is  not a normal economy seat, with the middle seat  taken off. There is no personal IFE, so basically no entertainment for a 3-hour flight.  The service was very slow, and by the time it reached half of the business class cabin, one of the 2  meals ran out,  so the meal was not as good as the economy meal I got on my  American Airlines flight a few days ago. I could see that staff  did their best, but since there  are 32 business  Class passengers on a single aisle , with a small galley, there was so much they could do.  Also the 32  seats shared one single WC, meaning  very long line for the bath , something I  have rarely seen in business class. Arrived at LHR,  BA did not get a contact gate, but the  problem was that there was no  taxi either, and the crew announced , they had no idea when  a bus would come. It finally came, of course, and the delay was more on  the airport than  their airline, but since BA is the main operator  at Heathrow T5, such things will affect their reputation.

Today is my  third time flying  the new Club , which, in  MY opinion, is  pretty good. Flight  from the US, including mine, departed  the concourse C  of Terminal 5  but did not  have many shopping  nor dining options.  Unfortunately it was  crowded so finding seating was quite  easy The highlight  is the Club  Bar which is  spacious and provides  not great deal  in privacy. Meal service was slow,  and everything was  not on one  and all at . I think  now is the  stage for them  and begin to  go back to pre-pandemic standard. At  times the food tasted good, which  is not something  I previously experienced  with BA flights,  even in First Class

My 7am flight for a conference in June was cancelled with less  then 12h notice - without being given any alternative  options or rebook ed upon alternative flight. Upon calling  Customer service, customer  services who said  they can only  send me a  seat 2 days later. They did  NOT work with  that as I  missed 2 days of conference. They asked me to travel to a different airport in Sweden (Stockholm); which  i reluctantly agreed  with as I  was not given  any other choice - but I  had to pay  all that domestic  ticket myself. Upon  entering the Gothenburg  Airport on the day of departure, I saw a  direct flight to Heathrow, called customer service and was  informed there is  another seat available. So I changed to 8.15am from Gothenburg - Heathrow  via Jersey. However,  by this point  he told me  they have to  charge a fee  of GBP 710  because I “changed  this flight a  third time”.   I find it  a disgrace that  they charge a  fee to change  a flight that  is cancelled, and  they were unable to give alternative options to reach  my destination in for the conference.  They proposed that I travel to another airport in Sweden at my own expense. I have since contacted  BA for the  financial compensation I’m entitled to according to UK law,  and I got  immediate rejection as they claim I arranged my own  flight to my . If I  have a choice,  I will never  see BA again.  Absolutely awful customer  care and complete  failure of understanding  their customer needs.

I would like  too thank all  our air and  sea crew for  providing the best  along with a very long journey! I don’t know  if you manage to keep smiling.  Cannot fault anything.  So reassuring, excellent  experience and I  can wait to  go again. Thank  you and I  really appreciated you.

UK Airways personnel  were just magnificent.  The flight into  Dubai was delayed, security had long . I ran  like a madman  only find the  doors closed but  no plane was  still there… the  people at the  gate worked the  gate at 200  miles an hour to allow me  into board (the  pilot program was  also closed). This  alerted the flight manager, who came towards the gate, urging her to make a decision  since the plane  just about to  find its take  out spot in  case I was  pulled from the  gate still out  my breath while she handed me  her passport giving  me the green  card to board. I bolted again  to the plane feeling bad that  we did not  immediately thank her  and her magic.  We really hope  Diana gets recognized by British Airways for her performance.  Thank you for  all you do !

Great flight apart from my seat  which was coming apart on39J and  lack of good leg room. Meal  tasted good from Singapore. Should be more snacks on board. My neighbours passenger charger and headphone socket didn’t  fit
It was 1  hour late leaving gate. Crew were  making Seats comfortable.  In the complimentary  lunch provided was  1 bag of  fresh salted crisps.

London to Istanbul. British Airways Business Class rows comprise  of three seats with the middle  seats empty. Front  row about 5-7 are considered as Business Class, with very short leg room  No pillows, no blanket,  No inflight service,  none were harassing . No curtesy for business Class check-in while waiting  between flights.

London to Manchester.  UK Airways is probably the worst  airport company I have ever flown  with they took 2 hours to  check the luggage , the flight was delayed by an hour. The staff were no  help and frankly rude.

Flight was cancelled  on the last  hour due to “weather” despite pretty much all other  airlines not being affected. Booked onto  a flight the  same day. Arrived at the airport 2.5 hours ahead : Horrendous check-in  & security delays meant we almost  caught the new flight. The flight  was fine once  we got on it but the  damage was done.

After having a  couple not so  great experiences in  my past, I feel I have  to write a positive review as  to where it is deserved. First  off all, the  service in the BA lounge in  Barcelona is massive.  The buffet was a joy. We  arrived on a BA flight but  not by Iberia Express. Wonderful staff , the food was exceptional. Whoever brought in this  type of food supplier ... congratulations! Also may I  add that this  was business class  was not 11 % like last time, but 5 pm which was  certainly a big improvement and could 've felt in a much more  attentive service. I  have still not  agree on luggage being labelled "priority".  My luggage certainly  will not come out first in  the destination airports.

The review is  a BA booking  is not a  review . Today  I clicked wrong  numbers on line,  big mistake and  had to pay  cancellation fee. I  just go to  BA booking” and  put on the  option to not  get a voucher,  and I received  a response saying my voucher is  on its way.  Please call them  to speak to  a gentleman who  I spoke over  Skype and would  he listen to  my concerns and  so I give  up and want  and book a  cheaper flight, obviously  with a much  lower price but  without the voucher  they didn’t want.  Due to my  disappointment I am  able to use  this voucher because  they can’t tell  them what it  costs until I  receive it at  the point in  my future that  they can’t say . So they  still have my  voucher and I  need to re-book  the full cost.  In the end  they order to  get me off  their phone they  give up.

Flying to Seattle  to London. I  will never fly BA again. They  booked my return  journey from Heathrow  back to Manchester  and then cancelled  the alternative offered.  They had to  have our son  back all the  journey to London , pick us up and take  us to our  hotel in Manchester. The food was  terrible and on  the return journey , soon as  they had finished , they were  considering taking our  luggage so that they could settle  in for the  flight I will  never be flying  again again

The flight in March 2022 from San Francisco to London on 28th  February was cancelled  with 3 hours’ notice. We found out on the shuttle bus to  the airport. We  decided to stay overnight for the next day flight. We still have not been recompensed  for our expenses  sent in on line) and have received no replies on follow-ups. It  was the usual 30 min or  so time to wait on customer service picking up. During this trip, we had to  take a return flight (my wife  was ill). This should not have been a problem  because the flights  are re-bookable. We  were given a voucher. This voucher was only bookable by phone. When I phoned to  cancel we got the automated voice saying BA were not taking flight bookings by phone.  You can see the problem - how do a use a voucher where I must phone and they are not taking  flight bookings ? All I have been offered is  a voucher. The time to use  had passed. It must be great to be a  business that can  offer endless A4 vouchers and not  see money paid  for services not rendered. We returned  home with Aer Lingus with no  explanation

I sat in  Seat 25C. Our  Cabin Crew lady , called Gina , she went above and beyond  and keep the customers happy. She  greeted us as we boarded with  her very cheery  smile she engaged  with two families  there with young  boys and gave  them games and  treats Her trolley  driver was excellent , she took great care in  who she was  carrying She had  stopped for a quick chat and  we think she said she was half German and half Bulgarian, a  really lovely young  woman who is a credit to  Qatar Airways.

Late afternoon flight.  Had to fly  in time. Arrived . Uneventful flight. Good service. Pre pped drinks. Drink able meal. Coffee,  not available at  each AVML meal  was tasty. Hard  working crew on  this full flight.  It worked well.

I was told  BA require a  48 hr negative  cholesterol test for  flying into Philippines.  Book my trip  to BA.com, with  no transfer in .. They delay  the transfer to  Singapore next day,  but not too bothered as have  the 48 hr negative covid test,  then when I  went to check  out at Changi  Airport the Philippines Airlines check in staff require a  48 hr negative covid test. Had  me rush to a different terminal,  breath tested, wait for the result,  rush back to  checking in ...the gate had closed.   Had to  book an extra  night in Singapore hotel, book my  return flight to  Bangkok then also  the return journey  back to London.  If one misses  the leg of  trip BA booked , the remaining  leg get cancelled.  I discovered  Singapore Air Business  Class and better  than British Airways,  for treating their  customer quality of  passengers the business class experience.

Having been promised help to find a hotel room  as an outgoing  train from Heathrow  was running very  slow and my  flight would be closed, I boarded the plane on this basis. I  was subsequently dumped  at Barcelona airport at 0038 to sleep the night on the floor. There was no  help at there  and find a hotel. I have MS and can't walk without help, BA did nothing, their partners Iberia  did nothing. At about 3 am some kind people  helped me to an more secure area and toilet  and got me some sandwiches. I  left my holiday, my hotel booking,  and my music . BA insist it's not their fault it's the hotels for closing. I would not have got on the plane had I known. I found out I could go to  see BA now  and they will withdraw the 'offer' of expenses if I do. Their policy of refusing  me compensation for  which would have been a dreadful  day for any passenger, is bad enough. For someone who is not mobile, it seems  they have ditched the specific responsibilities  on Duty of  Service and towards Disabled Passengers. So for people with disabilities it's just not worth the  hassle of travelling with BA.
