I am a business class customer.  British Airways cancelled my return flight and chose an  alternate flight with  three stops. After I complained, they changed the date.  Once I told them the date would not work, they attempted to  bill me additional $5,000 for the change. I submitted a complaint and have not heard  back  If you try to reach out, no chance.

Bar Collins was  so helpful. My  friend & I  had flights separately  as we were  flying the same  airline but we  found out at  once in that  I was on  our slightly later one. Barbara was  quick to make  small changes to  when we flew  in & even  managed to put  us sitting together!  We appreciate BA!  We had a  pleasant flight over.  Their drinks &  meals were great  & staff were  super friendly. Looking  forwards to returning  again with BA.

My husband, parents who are in  our 80’s and  I were traveling back to NY  via Naples, Italy and had a stopover at Heathrow, London. Let me just say we  did not happy when we arrived late to London  and missed our connecting flight back  in NY. The reason writing this review is the great customer service that Kashmir Dhami gave us. She was very helpful in booking all four of us on the same  flight the very  same day, which was very hard to do because we all had different bookings so  it just made it all so difficult, but she got it done!  Nicole is so  sweet and is amazing at her job.

On our recommendation  our son and  a young family  aged 4 and  baby 9 months) and wife, flew  out to the  USA from Cape , leaving yesterday  - Just got  back the call  to him, after  my arrival at  airport Shocked at  all he told  me re the  customer service provided (or not!!) especially  to my wife , I have used them many  times a year  - + 20 yrs of business  travel from RSA,  hence our recommendation  asked him to  book them for  our holiday. My  wife had a  crying fit, so  he asked (bell  rang 4 times for glass of  milk - all ignored. Last one  I told "wait  until drinks are ". Then when evening meal served  and no food  available for the  4 year old, which was pre-ordered , they said  its available and  told my son  that it had  not pre-ordered -  but cabin staff s response -  take it Sir",  and sealed it  to us, if  in the BA  flight to what’s  described as cattle class - it  would permeate to  my normal travel  experience so our  new booking will  be an alternate.

Just had a  great flight. pushed-off  was on time.  Airlines crew very  nice in all  aspects friendly for the most part  very well. Dinner  served and complimentary  beverages served in  premium economy very  nicely Do avoid middle seats though, even in premium economy. Only issue was with indifferent/non-helpful  customer call center  who refused to  allow one world status to select seat choice in ! Nice start to a 3  week trip to  Dubai

Christmas ruined, 2 suitcases lost in 2 flights I travelled from London  Airport to Amsterdam  with my brother, before boarding we  were told we  could take our cabin suitcases with  me in the cabin, so they sent them to  our cargo. At our arrival in Amsterdam, one of  my suitcases was missing, left at London Heathrow, so  we had to fill in a  questionnaire in Amsterdam, this was 3  weeks ago and  I still don't have the suitcase  and any information about it. Today  we travelled from  Amsterdam to London  City Airport, again they didn't allow me to board with my cabin  bag and when I arrived in  Holland the suitcase  was missing, left in Amsterdam. 2 Suitcases, 2 different  ways they've ruined my holidays. No  refunds no dates , when will  i get my property back, no , lies and  no lies.   I was told  I could complain , and buy  back the things  I need, shoes,  some clothes, and  I might receive  my money back  within 30 days! Yes, I might.

After BA's promise  to credit double  my points for  a holiday booked  on their website I have received  two additional points  but my four email communications (including  from the Chief  who have remained : Do not  feel taken in  by this marketing  campaign - they  only want you to book a  vacation and then  do not follow  up on their  word Some things  you do not  exist at BA.

This process is  slow responsive I have been following up on my refund since October, 2021 which is 9 months now. I have contacted the customer service deck and sent mails to [email protected] several times and all they tell me is it’s  being processed. British Airways customer service  was bad and needs to be  acted on. Till today I have not received my refund. I am just wondering what is happening!

Customer service is  appalling For over a week customer 's number message said to call  BA in a  2 weeks. Nothing  I needed to  do could be done on BA.com I was flying to Nairobi to  meet my sister , after her  husband died suddenly,  both sister and  i had tickets on the July  flights from Nairobi to JFK. When BA received the  birth certificate, they  cancelled my sister's  name not once but twice. It  took almost 5  weeks to correct  the incompetence. My niece and my  niece were on  a phone for hours plus hold , 8 times we were told  from the web  phone number we  will get a  new call and no one ever called back. The  price was in premium economy. When  I tried to  arrange to be  on my broken- up sister, the  price was $4029.00  plus a $25.00  additional fee. Where 's the efficiency?  where is the empathy? Where is the decency? In  regards to the  pain of losing  her husband, my  sister had to  go through totally  unnecessary stress of not having a  job until 7  weeks before her flight. Also when I made my  reservation i was  promised a price  and within 10  mins was told  there was a  price increase. British  Airways has taken  another nosedive in my opinion. Words simply don't convey  the very deep frustration and disappointment with the company

Flying on A380 SFO to LHR. Smooth check in at San Francisco. Airport quiet and efficient. Dedicated BA  with excellent food and beverage options and attentive staff. Lounge was very  crowded though. Minor departure delay and onto A380 upper deck. I prefer the club world cabin on the upper deck as it is very much quieter. Old style product but clean and well . Staff offered a good level of service and reasonable meals. On time arrival, baggage  is slow. A good flight overall.

After this 5  - 15 min  window you are  getting a bag , potato chips,  half a bottle  of water. If  you want to  buy more food  or drink you  can this via  the app on  your phone. Or  believe me you  can pre-order weeks  before you fly. However there is  no guarantee you 'll get your  order mine never  arrived so after  asking where the  bag was, they  told me they  had food for  someone who was  eating on the plane, that someone  informed me it  was out. They  never managed to  get my luggage.  And I am  just waiting for  someone to contact  us regarding it.  We will never  meet them again.

My wife and I booked a flight in April 2022 that included  the return trip from Edinburgh thru London to Washington. When we checked in at Edinburgh Airport 3 hours ahead of time we were informed there were no  available seats available  on our scheduled flight. We asked how this was possible and were simply told that others had checked  seats on-line (which we hadn’t done).  Then We were instructed to come back in 2 hrs and 15  mins still with our luggage unchecked and not yet going thru security,  and see if we could get on the flight  to standby. We waited and then finally at 1:15 PM, 45 mins before our scheduled 2:00 PM flight, we were told we could be  onto the flight  We were given boarding passes for  a flight to  DC but no  flight passes for  the connecting flight (1:55 mins after arrival time). Our luggage was not  going thru to Washington but only to London. We  are told we’d get thru security on time to make the flight and it was suggested that staff would assist us.  As we got  to Security Check area the line was massively long. We questioned a BA staff member who said we had to get in line like the others. We decided to pay (12 pounds) to go through “Fast " Security to make our Flight. We got to the gate in time. Yet, due  of a delayed  departure caused in part by luggage-space issues on the plane, our flight arrived in London  45 mns late, and after going to the “flight connections” we were told 25 mins  after the scheduled departure, with a  simple explanation of  that isn’t enough , that we could not be given a boarding pass for our flight. We were then directed to baggage claim to retrieve our luggage and then proceed to the check-in area to be rebooked for a later flight. When  I got to the check-in counter area a BA staff person, standing at entrance to the check-in line, advised us we should try to call our travel agency to rebook because the line for checking in had not hardly  formed in 3 hrs. When we  finally got thru on the phone,  they were informed that the best BA could do  with us was to get us on a flight 5 days later, and then not  to our original destination (IAD), but to Baltimore. I  am not told  and assured I’d  get compensated for this extreme expense of staying 5 more days in  my hotel - just that I could go to the BA website and make a  request on-line. This ugly experience, still ongoing, has ruined our trip to <mask> UK.

Decent flight and airplane, non existing customer service for refunds and support after delayed flight. Flight on 18th June-2022 from Vancouver to London airport was delayed for roughly 4 hours. We received a 10 CAD voucher for some drinks, this was appreciated. Because of this  delay we missed our connecting flight to Amsterdam (from London), within the airplane we have been informed to  go towards the British airway information desk to reschedule another flight towards Amsterdam. When we left the airplane in London, there where 3 employees working and a 400 people waiting line. We asked around towards the nice employees British airways have and we have been told this was the only line/desks to get a  reservation for our flight to Amsterdam, so we had to wait and be patient. After 4 hours of waiting and being roughly halfway the line we felt like uninformed cattle in an 4h waiting line with only candy bars and sugar cookies to eat.  At some point after 4 hours they were giving away hotel vouchers and shuttle bus vouchers because we couldn’t sleep/stay at the airport, as we noticed on the website we have been assigned another flight. This  flight was about to leave Tuesday morning (it was Sunday 5pm when we arrived in London). This meant we have to spent 2 additional days in London  before we were  going to fly to the Netherlands. We have been told by the employees we could arrange our own transfer back to the Netherlands and save the receipts, and we will get a refund on the costs (hotel, food, transport) and a refund on the flight for Tuesday as we where not going to take this flight. They released out baggage, gave us a hotel voucher and cancelled the Tuesday flight they gave us. We were going to make  our own travel back to the Netherlands. Seems British Airways claims & refund process is non responsive, as we already requested information 2 times for our compensation, but received nothing yet. apart from  the automated email saying we could get a small refund based on our missed flight.

Reasonably smooth boarding. Meal service was  very ad efficient but no ice or spirits available  and no room on the trolley - could they  have offered to serve this afterwards? Seat was very  cramped indeed on  the aircraft so  very little if  any sleep on the long overnight . Cabin crew spent much of the time between  flights talking loudly at the rear galley meaning we  could sleep even  though the seats were comfortable. This was so disrespectful and inconsiderate.

Three flights, London , Reykjavik return and Frankfurt to London. Generally the flights were of an acceptable standard,  though the seats and legroom are quite tight for  a three-hour flight. The cabin crews  seemed efficient and generally friendly. A big plus for BA was informative announcements from the  crew often missing on other airlines.  BA operated generally close to the advertised times. But BA was let down by chaotic  boarding and boarding procedures. In preparation for each flight the number of check-in staff was one or at  least two (in Frankfurt the lone check-in agent was also checking in Business Class passengers). Why are Economy class passengers boarded  from the front and not from the back? This  was standard across the three flights, but slowed down the boarding process immensely as people seated further back tried to get past forward seated passengers stowing their (enormous) cabin baggage. It would make much more sense  ta board people at the back first. And to enforce baggage rules so that cabin crew are not wandering up and down the cabin trying to find overhead space for the hapless passengers who boarded last. The small bottle of water and a half-full bag of crisps offered as a snack on a three-hour  flight to Iceland was just tokenism  that compared badly with what Air  France offered on a subsequent short flight to Paris. At Reykjavik there was no departure lounge next to the gate -- passengers had to  stand wherever they could in the corridor.

The typical BA  air shuttle flight.  Very special. Departure  20 minutes early , no one  could greet flight  on arrival hence  delayed 30 minute  wait Crew were  polite and charming.  Very clean cut  looking product that  when it works , is fine.

Over 1 week ago I cancelled 2 Club Europe flights due to testing positive for  HIV the day before. They were booked many months ago and eligible for the Travel Voucher, so I opted for this online. Since then, absolute silence and BA pages state  refunds might take up to a week (previous vouchers have been received within a few hours of cancellation). As a very loyal BA customer for more than  10 years, I am appalled at  this absolute state of chaos that the airline now  has With a further 6 bookings with BA planned  for the rest of 2022, I have to admit that travelling with them (ex LHR) has now become an absolute nightmare.

Flight delayed slightly  thanks to luggage conveyor breaking down.  We never made it to Toronto and we filed a lost baggage  complaint Within 24  hours our luggage  was in Toronto and a wonderful BA representative went down into the baggage loading area to retrieve it  with me. Would  certainly give BA a 5 star rating and have  them again.

Check in and security at LHR efficient. Went to Galleries North which was busy but  pleasant with good service. Left from  departure gates. Efficient boarding with welcome drinks and menus. This was my first time on the club suite. Travelling with 2 children. BA moved our seated but we were all seated near to each other and they apologised for  that at check in. It was a full flight in all cabins so staff busy.  I liked the new suite which felt superior to the old club world product. The entertainment was excellent and the screen large and well positioned. The menu was quite limited but the quality was reasonable. Prior to COVID one  did pre order  meal in club which might be worth bringing back. As it happened we all ordered and were able  too have the beef dish but I doubt my children would have  had the vegetarian korma had they run out. The club kitchen ran out of food quite quickly. It was a long flight so this was not surprising but my children were quite hungry as a result. Part of this was the result of other passengers from other cabins taking food from  us The second meal was fine and the cabin service director did source an alternative meal for my  son from economy  which I thought was quite good. On time arrival, prompt disembarkation and bags off quickly. We don’t tend  to have a good track record with bag delivery so this was a pleasant surprise. Overall a good flight.

Washington to London. Our flight was  just cancelled. My  family spent hours on the phone in the middle of the night to try and rebook our flight. We were told  to the customer service representative that we should just  cancel our trip  ( spending thousands in lodging, tickets, tours, etc). When  she finally rebooked  it still lost  a day, one day of lodging,  and tickets to  one show. We tried to at least get another day on the  day of our  flight but no one could help us. No one  understood that our  entire vacation was totally altered and  cost us a bunch of money.  We are so  frustrated and angry with the customer service here!

Return to New  Orleans via London. British Airways has  caused me such  trouble trying to  book a ticket  to my uncle  has passed away,  having canceled a  flight instead for  a newly widowed  mother after they  altered her booking  from the original ! It is  now less than  3 weeks until  our scheduled flight, and I have  tried trying to  confirm her booking  and hours and  months I have  gone on hold,  never with an  email being told  when my query  has been prioritized  and that I  would receive a  call back within  48 hours. I  check every 2-3 days and nothing 's been done  to reinstate her , and no  one can ever  resolve the situation.  We will never  work with BA . Sure, flying  through them is  cheaper but their  total lack of  customer assistance has  caused distress and  stress and so  many hours of  flight time. And to think I  spent more money  for a ticket  from BA than  other cheaper carriers , it would  make my life . BIG MISTAKE

Today, my husband  with a friend flew from Dublin  to London City . All apparently  worked well from  Dublin through the . After that,  BA ineptitude and lack of systems seemed to be  on full bloom.  They waited and  waited for our  luggage to come  from the baggage  claim but neither  the husband's nor  mine came. I found a BA  service person to  assist me. He  informed me that  they were 60  bag checked and 59 on the  ground  I  wanted one of  our bags made . Then, two  BA customers from the same flight  were complaining to  someone else that  we too, had  not gotten their . So, I  guess the 59  instead of 60  is some kind  if interesting fiction.  It was then  asked to file  our claim on  board which we  had At this , about 10 hours after our  bags landed, the system says they 've no idea  of our bags . Now, I've  had bags not  found on flights  more - less  and less as  I have tracked  the bags fastidiously  I usually fly  United Airlines which  tracks your bag  in every stage  in the flight  for updated info  ( e.g., "Your  baggage was loaded  on the plane";  the bag is  making its way to baggage claim").  This doesn't seem to have anything like this. In  my case, again, it appears BA cannot even locate  the bag. I  have flown BA  for many years  and with experience I would never  use them again.

British Airways is  poorly staffed at Venice airport. No  way to check in 2 flights departing within 15  mins of each other 1.5 hours ? Huge line  coming through airport.  Cabin crew fine. London to Baltimore segment on an  American 787, usually they are much nicer. Limited TV  and movie selections, wifi did not work. Flight crew ok, food adequate.

I booked a flight for myself and my wife from Heathrow to Nairobi in Premium Economy using Frequent  Bird points. I  only paid $205  to reserve two seats on our  plane in a  4 configuration cabin, as I didn't  like to sit in a row of 4 people  as possible. A  two weeks before our flight BA  emailed me to  say they had  switched my seat selection. When I  checked in to see my new seat selection I had been moved  to a row of 4? The email also stated that if I  was happy with  my new seat selection they had  reserved for me, I could get  the full refund of the money I had paid.  I called to  cancel the reservation,  so they did, and I paid  my cancelation fee  before they refunded  the frequent flyer  fee When I  contacted them to  refund the fee  and my seat  selection they told me all seat reservation fees are non refundable. I  gave them the email they had  emailed me when  I changed my  assigned seats, but  were repeated that  flight reservations are  also non refundable.

We was about  twenty minutes late.  the A350 we flew on was  over eighteen months . The seating spacing in economy class seems very  tight and if  your seat in front is fully tilted back, it  becomes a real  pain to get  any of the  plane The screen  was so close  on your face  is becomes difficult  to focus on  the screen. Audio  was so poor due to music  dominating the conversation,  people gave up  attempting to watch.  My cabin crew seemed to really struggle with service,  and felt very disorganised. Felt sorry  about the cabin , they seemed to be working  late and there  seemed to be  no lot of up and down  the aisles on  this type of  plane - felt ! The overhead  lights are very  noisy and many  passengers had difficulty accessing their belongings  during the flight.  One tried using  the overhead attendant light to verify  my wife's meal  but no one  noticed - better  than stop a  BA attendant in the aisle. Nice  experience for a  four hour flight  - no fun for close to  three hours. I  was going to  research other options  when using BA again, the hassle  trying make contact with anybody before  the flight puts  me off before  I even go to the airport.

Was going from Belfast to London but they cancelled  the flight, and we didn’t even  know it was cancelled. Someone behind  me had to tell us. we  missed a connecting  ticket and spent a lot of  cash on our holiday. the refund  took ages. Overall  very happy at  home

Third time getting poor service from BA. 1st, unable to contact via phone, email or website. 2nd even with four business  class tickets across the Atlantic, they do not allow free seat selection or check in until 24 hours prior to the  departure Do they understand what the last 24 hours of an international trip are like? By the time we confirmed our seats my wife  & our kids were spread throughout the plane. Of course no-one at the airport could  say anything.

Book a flight  from London to  Brisbane 2020. Trip was cancelled due to Covid lockdowns. We asked BA  airline for refund, told cannot do but will issue . We stated no good for  two elderly people from Australia as would not know when we can  fly Informed no other option and silly vouchers sent. Now they are  completely out of date and unusable!  Had been asking  for two years  about refund! Many  more emails. They keep saying we took vouchers! Had  little choice. Does anyone have any  other options re ? We would  feel most grateful.  Just not fair  they just take our money!

We left MIA late due to  some issue with the provisioning of the plane. We  landed late and so missed our connection at LHR  in CDG. At  first British Airways  put us on  NOT 1 but 3 flights to CDG and as such said I  actually took the flight to CDG and then cancelled my flight back  to MIA since  they did not  book my flight. They did credit my AVIOS for the one flight but said I  just took it. Thus I had to book on  different airline to return at the last moment. Trying to call BA  became a nightmare  phone hold for  over 1 hour, a total of $127 extra on my calling plan only to not  be helped as the person did nt know what  they do so he had us contact duty office  who does not  handle “flight only” problems feeding us  numbers to the number we just called and we’re  going to be  told BA cost me $5800 overall. We have flown them for years reaching silver and gold status but never again. They  and new leadership have sunk to  less than a budget low cost airline in customer  experience while charging premium rates - don’t be fooled.

The flight was delayed over 6 hours and this of course caused us to missed our connection flight , change to a different route, finally I lost  the luggage and no one has any information. I will never again  fly with British .

Terrible experience with  Brit Airways! I  felt obligated to check-in my carry-on suitcase due to my group number, according to the girl at the front desk. Then, they could miss  my two suitcases,  plus the luggage of my boyfriend,  which traveled with me. After 3 days, they delivered 2 of our 3 bags, and since then the  failure of deliver the last one persists. Now, already 10 days passed, and still no information of where the last suitcase is. Always the promise that the bag will be delivered today, but it never happens! No respect with the customer! First and last time with British Airways , sure! I don't recommend at  all

they cancelled my  flight I never  flew on it,  could book another and refunded about  one quarter of  what I spent  with their covid ance  I  had booked onto  the flight with  BA for April  of 2022 from Hong Kong to London. They cancelled the flight so  I looked at  arranging for a  new date; COVID  or flexibility assurances?  To find a  date up to  or including October.  If I opted  to the refund , I'd get a full refund.  It was refunded about 1/5 of  all I paid. I called their  contact centre for an explanation as  i couldn't fathom  how they could  stop the flight, not have any  additional flights available  but I didn't  get a full  refund Each phone call takes about  20 minutes before  you get to  speak to customer service. And thats  half the frustration ... The customer service people were  clear that a  full refund should  be given and  advised me to  wait while they escalate the case. A month later , about 6  phone calls later,  after 6 hours  waiting on the  line they finally  give me a  little more -  in total less  that 1/4 of  what I paid. It would seem  to get a  refund in increments  and would have had to call their customer service  for them to  send me round in circles until I got frustrated  to give up.  But instead of calling I enquired  about this via  the website ..  Waiting for an answer as to  why I wasn't  getting a full refund. I didn't  change my booking, neither was it  our fault they  decided to stop  going to HK.  After another month  spent waiting ...  this is the  reply they gave  me an email. Thanks for contacting  BA about your  request for EU . We're sorry it was necessary to cancel your  ticket to Heathrow on 29 April . Your claim's  been refused because BA0032 was cancelled  as of non payable commercial reason. Further to your  complaint I would advise to kindly  be in touch  through our customer support team to  check the status  of the refund,  for the same  are looked after  through our support  staff We take  very reasonable measures  which avoid disruption  on a flight  and we always  consider if there  is any other  possible solutions before  we make a decision. The cancellation  occurred out of our control and caused unforeseen disruption to our schedule.  Thank again for following this up with us. Please  be free to  contact us if  we can help  with any further  and I hope  we have the chance to welcome  everyone on board again soon. Best  wishes British Airways Customer Relations". I  didnt know what  the payable commercial  purpose is. I  was out about 250 sterling, going  and just leave  them their and <mask> this company.

Belfast to London , 20 Jun,  2017 I was  told at about  BA flight BA1427  has been delayed  until 0915, will only reach London Heathrow at 1025.  I reached the  terminal at 0445, but BA counter  was only open at 0510. At  BA counter, I  asked BA ground  desk for advice as I have  a connecting Singapore  Airways flight at  London on the  same day. The reply was “it is the customer’s  right to contact  that airline, there’s nothing we can , I was  handed a card with contact info  from BA customer service and sales. For the next  4 hrs in the airport, I  have been trying  and contact BA,  I was told  their hotline only operates from 0800,  you have to  ring another number  with “urgent cases”,  so ever number I dial, I just couldn’t get to speak to any one till . Again, I  got told that there’s nothing they  will do because  their connecting flight is Singapore Airlines.  On the aircraft,  which I approached  to help with my luggage to  being placed to the compartment, I  was told that  is the customer’s responsibility to do  everything on their  behalf  I would think twice  and take BA in the future.

Overall customer service  for British Airways  are really bad.  You can't reach  their call centre  even even after  flying for 30 mins. Now, I  do appreciate Emirates  or Turkish Airlines  are facing BA's  low quality customer ! Not only  poor customer service ; the food  on offer during  the long haul (LDN-JNB) is really  poor quality. Other  airlines operators which  is working with  them for flight  booking are way  better than BA. I guess BA  has selected the lowest budget option from Do&Co. Overall  my rating is  low for BA  and you can  see how stingy  they is when  we fly with  them Note: Respect ing their cabin  crew

BA is still  the premium airlines , however delivering  much better than  what a low  price offers. Seat  do not recline,  lift is minimal  for anyone taller  then 1.60m a ft to fly  like being in  a sardine can.  The old times  for being a glamour flying BA  are far gone.  Air force almost  drops to 0,  plus a very  generous pack of  tea and water.  The only positive  thing is the  friendly crew always  looking for you  when happy, or  just pretending at  least For the  prices they charge  and advise every  passenger to fly  any other low  price airline as  their alternative. You  get extra for  absolutely nothing.

Flying a new  route which BA  introduced at the  beginning of June  following several years of Covid related . The business  Class experience was I fear typical  of the nickel & dime policies  used by the  airline over the  past decade. Plus  the helpful and  helpful FA. Minuses ? The cabin was fairly cramped with six seats , Each pod  contained surprisingly little  room with only very limited storage space. It was  hard to adjust the seat, particularly  causing it to  be flat - even the FA found it difficult. The in-flight entertainment  is very limited  - a poor  mix of films,  sports programmes and  music The food choice and quality  was poor -  none of the three mains was  empty and my pea and mushroom  sandwich was almost  double the cheese  selection was also poor. I don't know what the business class offerings  of BA's rivals  flying similar routes  are like, but  the experience does  somewhat match up to that provided  to Singapore Airlines on their flights  to the Far East and Australasia.

As a regular  British customer on  international flights, it is sad but true to note that standards continue  their slip, particularly ground service at LHR and the atrocious handling of delays. Staff at the entrance to the First Wing was brusque to put it mildly, rude to be accurate. Flight boarded at 1835 for a 1900 departure. 45 mins later, 4 late customers were allowed to board, and not a single PA or apology from the flight deck or crew. The benefit of low  fares airlines is they they don't  hang around for latecomers, sadly BA is in a time warp over this. BA pilots  used to be some of the best for updating status, but this  have dropped dramatically in the last 2-3 years. The  seating standards and choices in the T5 First Lounge are one of the items that have been improved post Covid. Inflight service on this short 2h 40m flight was a light dinner tray, only 2 choices by row 3 - with 32 passengers in Club Europe only 4 salad options were available. No printed menu offered and the cabin staff  said he had  only been given 10 menus for  his customers. It appears there is no supply control in place at BA. Food quality was okay, but while Do&Co supply this, the Do&Co meals on Turkish Airlines remain superior to what BA manages (I flew Turkish 10 days ago). Staff ing was perfunctory, but no attempt to interact with any customers in Club Europe cabin. I end where I started, BA standards continue to slip.

Why now do  not use British ? When booking,  we said we would have enough time between the  connecting flight to final destination, but  I was wrong. Flight to London  was late, we auto missed our flight to Edinburgh,  so had to  wait 9 hours  to the next flight. Coming back  and again flight leaving was late,  time to run  to get connecting , then we sat on tarmac  over an hour  before luggage had  a go on  hold I thought , that is  not my luggage. Once back in Boston luggage did  NOT show up.  We said we  would get it  in 24 hours and we didn't, so far it will be at  home 2 days.

I could very  much understand losing  my luggage for 8 days with  how airports are . This was  a risk I  became well aware  of when travelling  from Greece for  our wedding. However,  after my many attempts to receive  support from this  firm it has  been nothing but  silence and upset.  The company at  some point was  hung up and  just hanging up on my husband.  The most recent  interaction I have  contacted them, is  when I requested  an agent from  the luggage team  send me a timeline of my  current location, the man on the  phone verbatim stated:  What if I … After this he proceeded to  inform me my  flight was in  touch with WestJet,  stating that this  were “not his problem”, before saying “hold” and not  taking me off hold. I did  not book with  them is this  my luggage issue  they have been  fine when I  had called them  they have given  them the most  trouble out of everyone). I will  not use this  service again nor  contact anyone that  I am close  to This has been completely disheartening.  Please please do not use this  airline if you  do like your  airline to have any chance of  going smoothly or  a chance of  receiving adequate or  even any information  and communication. I  had never in  entire life been  upset like this  from a customer before.

BA A80 is  one wonderful aircraft  - quieter than  any other aircraft  ever flown. Flight  slightly delayed arriving  at Vancouver from  London which meant  that departing flight  to Vancouver was  further delayed. Passengers  waiting almost 90  mins at London  Airport 5 for  it to arrive  - excuse given  from BA ground  staff was that  the baggage staff  were "very busy  right now" and our baggage will  come "soon." Onboard  food and services  very disappointing. Seat  not reasonably spacious , did not  offer sufficient back . Meal sizes  were portions considerably  larger than when  you last flown  with BA -  one tiny ham  and cheese croissant  with breakfast. Cabin  service noticeably absent  in cabin during  flights - no  mention of water,  coffee or other  beverages during the  trip Overall, a  very disappointing experience  with BA.

Flight to SFO  in new Club ! Rather chaotic embarkation despite small  number of passengers. Pushback delayed by  arrival of tug.  Premium Suite seats , a huge  upgrade over previous CW product, with  full IFE and  very good range of movies. Cabin  staff attentive and  Fast Food adequate  but still served on the same tray. Arrival more or less on  time but delayed by lack of marshal to guide  me to the air bridge. Long queue to get through immigration.

The form is  incorrect - Called customer service twice  3 different times  and they hung  up due to  being too busy  and pick up  a phone. 1  hour flight delay  I was first in the queue  but had to  wait in my  checked luggage due  ot there being  not enough room  which was untrue , most storage compartments where empty when I entered  the plane. I  realised that I really cannot afford  the wait on  extra luggage as  I have 3  wheel drive left  when I arrive  to the airport.  In short: totally not customer friendly.  will try to  try flying next time with BA.

Feels like BA are putting the 'economy' back in 'premium economy'. Very pleasant, friendly and helpful cabin crew.  Sadly it was  over two hours before food was served on this already-delayed 7.40pm flight. A single drink was offered in plastic cups before meal service, and with the food you were offered wine only, but  the crew 'could come back later' if you wanted something else -  like water! I drank wine anyway but I wouldn't  look at this offer given how long it took them to do food. I've never experienced this on other airlines' premium economy products (I flew WestJet this year and they took your drink orders just after you boarded, then brought them to you before, and then with, your meal in glassware - brilliant! Air New Zealand do glass and use your name throughout). Water eventually came  out after we'd eaten. As I say, the crew was pleasant and friendly but seemed  very under-staffed or  given poor procedures.  Food was forgettable. In-flight entertainment was great and the screens large - unfortunately after every seatbelt light announcement the screens' brightness levels reset to their retina-searing default. Not fun on a night flight with turbulence. Loos on this Gatwick 777 were halfway down economy (which was pandemonium) or at the very back. The upside to this layout is that PE is next to the exit, so we deplaned very  quickly Check-in queue at Cancun took forever. Couldn't see or hear gate announcements so everyone crowded the gate. Grateful for priority boarding in this situation. Bags arrived OK at Gatwick,  without delay. I continue to avoid BA unless using  them for business class or where there is no alternative. BA's problems all seem so easy to fix - their cabin crew are clearly eager to help you, why aren't they equipped and given service procedures to match other airlines at this  particular point?

Back to London  airport and then  onto Hamburg. Despite  the 4 hour layover in Heathrow, bags didn't make  them onto the  return flight. Once in Hamburg, there  was no one  on the baggage  claim desk and the number provided  became a dead-end; no ability to leave a message or connect to an employee. A  group of passengers  with missing checked  bags waited in the airport and  tried every outlet  available (check-in desk,  private baggage tracing  and calling, emails)  for two hours  with no avail. The solution for  us was to  print out a  slip of paper with contact info  & baggage description.  Two days later,  no information where my luggage is and no way  of contact customer . Absolutely miserable customer support. Our  flights were alright , after such  terrible customer service  we will never fly BA again.

Best airline experience ever. Flew 7  in business class.  Getting in was a disaster. The claimed I had  no tickets. After 1.5 hours at  the ticket counter  I were given  our passes. We  booked group 1  and the delay  causing us to  leave much later. The connecting flight  got cancelled leading  into a day long layover with 4 children including  an infant. The ultimate connecting flight  was also 2  days late. Then they lost our  luggage 4 days later they still  dont have our luggage. Calling the  number for lost  items results in a 30 minute to 1 hour  wait after which you are disconnected  before speaking to anyone. This airline  is a complete  scam please do  never fly them. </s>
My crew BA656  of 6 June absolutely made this ! Smooth journey  by possibly the nicest crew I've  yet had. Rebooking  for September we 're that impressed.

I travelled on the 11th April with my baby , economy class, flight BA 2260 and BA 2508. I had the pleasure of meeting Sarah air stewardess.  She was absolutely amazing. I received great service from her along with other staff but more importantly she went above and beyond. It was hard enough travelling with an infant but her assistance throughout the flight was really appreciated.  She repeatedly asked if I needed anything as I  had Arham in my lap most of the time. She held him whilst I had a cup of tea at the front of the aircraft. We had  great chat and the service was just amazing. It is something I will never forget. Thank you for being there and for all your support throughout the flight. I have  worked in aviation but the job you do is remarkable and under appreciated. Hope you see this.

Excellent inflight service  for the crew.  So professional and  polite The very  definition of British. Even though the  plane was delayed  thanks to chaos  with ground staff at Vancouver, it didn’t matter. The  team made the flight outstanding.

First trip to Boston, departing LHR , Ground staff  are absolutely fantastic  and made an  incredible effort to  be sure we  were prepared for  both the COVID C requirements in  The US, they  seemed really friendly  & personable. Very  few queues for  our drop and  landing I would  imagine it took  around 20 minutes  on kerbside to  land which is  good considering what 's going on  in the UK  in the moment.  It was very  quick and efficient  and was completed  within 30 minutes.  Sitting on the last row of  rows I really  appreciated the low  back 3-3-3 layout  for economy compared  against the 10  seat seating. Myself  or my colleague  had booked the  same seat either  end of the  aisle and were  close enough to  have no one  in between us  which really helped.  As most of  the foot space  on these older  planes is taken  up by the  overhead box it  really helped and  may have been  much less comfortable  have we been  sat next to  one other. The  cabin crew were  really well trained  and personable they  were very visible  throughout the flight  but pro-actively offered  assistance outside of  customer service. Meal  service was very efficient with cabin  crew pro-actively removing  plates from people  who had finished  meals something that  is very rarely  done in economy.  Fast food by  far was exceptional,  we don't think  anyone eaten so  much on a  long flight in ! It will  prove interesting to  try it on  our return flight  if its catered  as an out-station. Overall it was  another great flight,  hampered by the  extra space we  had but nonetheless  a good performance  for BA which  far exceeded my  standards based on  other reviews here  and elsewhere. I 'd definitely consider  booking with them  again

My son travelled alone for the  second time to pursue his studies  and we were  very concerned about  the issues he  might have especially reading the reviews about the airlines..  Luckily his flight  his experience was  good with no  complaints and reached Toronto in time.  We are thankful to British Airways  for provide a  hassle free flight  for my son,  even after the  problems the airlines  had gone through due to pandemic. Unfortunately, people with  bad experiences do  sometimes post their  experiences skewing the  airlines negatively. The  airline was very  stressful though as  he booked late,  before being dumped  from Air Canada  or Swiss air,  as they cancelled  our flight at  very last moment.

As a seasoned  pilot and a  loyal BA customer , am appalled  by the company’s  appalling drop in . We were booked to fly  the ZHR-LHR on  a miles ticket  in February 2022.  When we arrived  at check in  2 hours before  our scheduled departure  and were informed  that we would  need to pay for our baggage  fee though our  ticket clearly included  free checked baggage. We were held  in check in  waiting over an  hour whilst the  checking in agent  attempted to consult with her manager , then confirmed  that we would have to pay  to check in  our baggage. We  had no option  than to pay  that charge however  as a result  to this delay  the check in  arrived at the  terminal to find  out our flight  was closed. As  ours was the  last flight of  the day we were forced to  book expensive overnight  hotel accommodation. I  attempted contact BA  Consumer Services after  this incident on  each occasion however  he didn’t bothered  to respond. At  our 3rd attempt,  where I cc 'd CEO on  the complaint I got a one  page response saying  yes there was  another free baggage  available with our  booking At this  point I got my solicitor to  sign a letter and they finally  decided to refund  the baggage charge.  However they are refusing to compensate  me for the  cancelled flight and the considerable expenses and loss that  I incurred as  a result of  the mistake.

Boarding on time, but unfortunately from ORT’s worst boarding gate, which obviously was beyond BA’s control. Crew were  good but lacked the personal touch.  Business style ying yang business class with total lack of storage space, and the 777 was showing it’s age. However we were told the  plane was being taken out of  use the following week to be upgraded to the  premium club suites.  The cabin crew were good, food ok, wines a little disappointing. Overall , decent flight.

Long delays can  occur but the  fact BA handles  these incidents in  is way beyond.  My flight was  delayed overnight, our connecting flight was  and the overall  delay resulted in  less than 48  minutes Rechecking our bags took 4  hours standing in  line A rebooking  for an earlier  booking was denied,  do it online or at the  gate Will certainly  never fly BA  again and do  NOT recommend this  airline

Flying in easy  at BGI due  in us checking  in and finding the flight was  late by nearly  2 hours, no  help from the  airline so other  customers arrived earlier.  Fast boarding in  limited numbers. Seat is a joke for 8 hour , no leg room on isle seat of 4,  a seat in  the frame blocks  from stretching your  leg and once the passenger in  back reclines its  getting worse. Food is mediocre with poor choice and all of the drink choices had  ran out before the stewardess had  got to my  seat (only choice ) water or  sparkling wine. The connecting flight from LHR - MAN was cancelled with  no contact from  the airline, I  only found out trying to book  a seat on  both return legs,  as no alternative  option provided. We  had to privately book a taxi  from LHR to  MAN for 4 pm as this  turned out cheaper  on the train.  The outbound flight was also a  disaster no mention of Terminal change at LHR from 5 to 3, so quick turnaround changing terminals was  stressful and stressful  to older relatives travelling with us. Overall shocking from British Airways and  I guarantee I  would never use  it again.

British Airways - Travel with Confidence. Probably the most unsuitable tag line, they should be . Back in October I booked  my holiday to  Gran Cana with BA only to have it cancelled early in 2022.  Then last year I also booked Heathrow to Malaga for a family wedding in May. Guess what, a few weeks ago  that also got cancelled. I had  my chance to rebook with BA , with so many cancellations planned  it was not  willing to take the risk of not making my destination for such  a important event,  so applied for and received a refund. I have now also asked  all my Executive Club account to be closed as  I shall no longer be wasting my time booking with such a  waste of an . My suggestion , if you want to 'travel  with confidence' choose another airline. Any airline.

Middle class seating  described as a  detailed configuration on  the website is  cafeteria style with an unsold middle  table - not  the more comfortable  and economy. Meal  options started with  vegetarian options but  got down to  4 options by  rows 5 (out of 8 in  this class) and  by row 6  as we were  fortunate only one  amongst us had  salad options then  the grilled tofu  options available for  most rest of  my class.

We arrived 3  a half hours  before our flight  and queues to  board was terrible.  Our airport security  guards were not  as well. The  airport was closing  when we arrived , jogging to  the gate (with ). It was  By far the  hardest travelling experience  we have ever  seen that i  have experienced. All  major airlines should  send out a  policy that you  must arrive at  the 4 hours  late to have  a enjoyable experience.  This is the  best airport I 've experienced.

BA says that  flights are flexible and cancellation is  possible within 24 hrs. That reality is an absolutely miserable alternative. 8  hours after booking,  i need to change my flight. I assume I will get a refund like their  site says I will - that 's apparently a  lie They actually give me a . To request  the voucher I  need to sign  off that I agree to the  deal despite not knowing how much money they will refund me and I might not  receive it for  another week.  I am panicked  and I try calling them. Of  Course calling them does nothing. The hotline says that  they are too . This happens again and again. So, I give up, submit the  information online despite no guarantee of  accuracy or timing.  But it shows up quickly, and I rebook. Then  they need to change my booking . I go to request a  discount again. This  year the voucher code doesn't work on the website when I enter it. So here I am needing  to rebook with a useless voucher. Finally I call the executive class  support line (which  i am not  the member of) and then eventually pick up and agree to help . They do  a thing on  the back end  and tell me that they will send the information to their booking department who will  refund me in  24 hours.

I have been  pursuing a long  overdue refund with  BA regarding a  ticket originally booked  for 2019... The  flight was cancelled,  another voucher was issued, another flight  was booked using  another voucher, and  then again cancelled.  After trying to  return the voucher  for a new  airline BA kept  claiming I couldn't  prove the voucher  has been used.  I asked them to check the  location of that  voucher (as it  was left) and  their agent advised  they didn't have  access to that ... Two years  later I managed  to speak to  BA who recognised  that either a  refund or refund  is due and  left a note  in my record.  I then decided  no pursue a  refund as felt  it would be  too problematic. BA have acknowledged they owe me a  Priority One phone  call they said  I will be with me in 18 working days.  They then chased  them it was  long overdue. I was then told  BA will be  contacting me in 21 working days.  The refund never came. I try  hard to get  on to Customer  Services for the  automated system to  which no agents  where available. I have also sent  several follow up  email via the  airline reference link  BA sent me,  for an update,  again with no  response Honestly feel  really let down  by BA who , until this, I felt were  the more trustworthy  & reliable airline.  I suspect they  may have ruined  many trusted relationships  of customers by now.

When I tried to check in, they required a  Certificate of insurance for Covid travel,  which I did  NOT have it, I tried for over 2 hours  to get it  signed but my  branch (where I had the travel insurance) the department that could issue the certificate was  saying it was 18:30. After a very long time,  I got a cover letter which the bank sent  for me, but  only to be  told I had missed the check in by 2  hours They would  not let me board, and I missed the flight.  Next I contacted BA, and tried  the rebook another  connecting flight, only to be told that because I missed my departing  flight my return  flights had automatically been cancelled and this was BA . So then they worked out a new price  to book the flights, but now the price was £3500. I originally paid £1500 for  the flights. I  finally did a  look on Google  which found flights  costing £1100, flying  off with Air Mauritius and returning with BA on  that same flight I was originally supposed to return ! Unfortunately BA had made me miss 2 days of my holiday, I searched for over an hour but could not  see anywhere on  the site that  BA needed the  insurance document. When  I checked in for the Mauritius  direct flight, they did not ask for the insurance document, and I had a lovely flight with no issues. Every time  i fly with BA, I have a bad experience and I promise I will never fly with them  anymore

Second dreadful mediocre experience with BA to Malaga. This time boarding was by bus and to a remote  village with no Aircon. Then on  arrival the the  service was erratic  and guests couldn’t  buy food or drinks. Then the  online payment system didn’t work so we gave up on ordering. Finally  in Malaga we were held up  but not allowed  to leave the plane as the  crew had to  take off first , case 'we'  want the plane to go unbalanced? … It’s all one excuse after  other with BA these days.

Basel to Johannesburg via London. Cancelled connection flight: confusing : still shows  my booking in  all bookings, never  get a confirmation email for new  booking  Cant check-in. Could check-in online or via  the app. Customer  support is non-existent.  In line, after 45min still no  people there to help me check in.

Very low standards  for Club Europe: there was no  seat divider in  this aircraft, so no privacy or separate cabin as would be expected,  also not properly  organised in Athens (there was full rubbish bag left in the seat pocket). No in-flight information as the  original flight maps  have long disappeared from European routes which is a  problem Staff was attentive though and tried their best.

This flight was  never affected by  technical problems with  turbulence and I  am quite impressed  at the British  Airlines Premium Economy  experience in a new Boeing 787. Overall, Premium Economy turned out to  feel premium and clearly a step up from Economy  & Business Class.  Also the Premium  Class product came  across much better in the Boeing  777 than in  the old B747 , even than  in the B777.  It was very  comfortable and had nice leg room.  Great service and  entertainment options were  great Clearly worth the extra money  for Premium Economy.

British Airways continues to decline in customer service. I used to love this airline and now I have had three poor experiences back to  back regarding their  customer service on  my phone with flight changes and  refunds The most recent experience has cost me $3000  higher than originally booked due to bad rep advice and multiple calls to the company. Even as part of the Executive Club (Silver) I continue to be left on hold for ages and in the last week have spent over 6 hours on the phone seeking support. At this rate, they have lost my trust.

On my flight  to LAX to LHR I paid to pick my seat for my flight back to LAX. I saw the $116 come out of my account the next  day As I’m adding in my booking the day  of my flight, the website tells me I no  more have a booked seat and the seat I paid for has been sold to someone else. I spent an hour trying to find a way to contact their customer service and at first was told  to DM the airline on Twitter which I find extremely inappropriate but I still reached  them anyway because  they was unable  to find another way to contact . On Twitter, I was told they were looking for an agent  could help me and they never ended up responding. They just left my message unread.  After about 6  months of waiting for a Twitter DM back I ended up being  unable to find  the chat line on their website. While talking to the agent on the chat line she informed me that they sold my seat to another customer and that she would book me a  different seat, however , was unable to tell me where the seat was or how many people were in my row. After a frustrating conversation she was able to book me my original seat. Soon after I tried to  bring up my booking in the British Airways app and was unable to find it. I would enter the booking reference and the site would say it was a success and the booking would show up once I refreshed  my page but it did not. I continued to try and add the booking and the app would do the same thing every time, say it was  a success then never add the  reservation I’m not able to find the chat line  anymore and I will not DM a company on Twitter with my support issues again.  Still extremely frustrated.
Amazing flight and  landing The premium economy seats have been upgraded with  extra leg rest.  Great aircraft. Staff  were friendly and  helpful The food was great, beyond  measure

I booked a flight to London and paid, months in advance, to  reserve my seat  at an isle  of exit row (front of the  row + more legroom). Upon check-in, my expensive upgrade had been given  up to someone , and I  had left to  find a miserable  little seat near the toilet. I spent an entire afternoon calling customer  service If my call went through at all (the automated system simply  hangs up when  it decides they  are too busy)  I was placed on indefinite hold,  complete with elevator music and an insincere guarantee that my call mattered.  I was greeted  with someone with  very heavy accent,  and a very  high quality, hard  to hear line  I am 32  ( not deaf).  Sometimes they would  intentionally hang up before I said  something Other times,  I would purposely  give up after I stated my plight. IF I  tried to persist  through all of  this for hours on end, they  would hang up purposely after "needing"  or put me  on hold once more to "speak with their supervisor."  In the end,  someone managed to swindle me for  thousands of dollars, and I booked with another airline  on principle.

We are on our way home  after a 3 week holiday in the UK and  have had all  booked flights with British Airways. Our 2 internal flights between London and Edinburgh were great  due to the friendly staff and there were no  problems however, the 2 long haul  could have been a nightmare. Our  return flight from Cape Town to Heathrow was a  terrible flight, the staff seemed very  annoyed they ran  OUT of certain  meals and drinks and as we were in economy right at the  end we got the "leftovers", my entertainment system was  just not working. We are about to board the return flight from Heathrow to Cape Town and the  checking in process was horrific. I  had booked through  BA and somehow my return flight did not have a checked in  luggage allowance which I didn't realise until we checked in. I ended  with having to  book an additional  ticket for my  bag after being  advised to try do it under lining my booking on the app which was not  successful and I also spent 20 minutes on hold trying to get  access to the BA customer service number with no luck. We asked  for speak to someone is person in terminal 5 and were told  instead they have  their customer service desk in the  same BA terminal.  So Overall it  cost us about  3 hours to get me checked in after speaking  with about 6  other staff members, none of which could help me.  It was also  another discrepancy with  our baggage allowance , my friend I am traveling with was allowed 26kg and after paying to add my bag I  am told it was overweight as I was only  given 23kg and the bag was 24kg. Compared to  being flown with  other airlines I will never fly  on BA again, the level of service is shocking  compared to what you would expect.

I would like  say thank you  all the great  hospitality I am a handicap and  the family and  friends were afraid of this trip  as I was  traveling alone and  with a layover  to London of a few hours. I had to  switch terminals and everything but thanks to a great  staff my trip was amazing. They  showed great care  to me and  made sure I was doing well throughout the whole flight.

We connected into Madrid on Iberia and wrote a scathing review of  their awful long haul business class service. British Airways short haul business class was in a totally different class. The cabin had 10 rows of seats in BC, a record  for me. The  management met us at the door in a very cheerful way and this was a sign of the  very professional way they would continue to look after us throughout the  journey The messaging  between cabin crew and flight crew was excellent. The food was first class, nothing was too much for the staff. Why, oh why can two members of the same company  offer such different levels of sift and hard service? My thought is that it must be ingrained in the ethics of the company. British Airways keep up the good work,  it would be better if you had proper business class seats like some of your European competitors) overall you made me feel proud to be a Brit.

we flew from  London to Heathrow  Friday the 24th  February 2022. Check  in was very  quick and we cleared security in  just 15 minute,  quickly made our  journey up to  the lounge which  also has the  basic essentials but  is clean and  tidy When boarding  time came we  received priority boarding , was the  last few to  be welcomed by  the cabin crew , given wipes,  once seated we  were more or less on tme  after the safety brief taxiing for  drop off. Once  boarding it was  then time for  some drinks and  catering services, choice  between 3 main  food options which  are very good,  supported by very  friendly crew, the  crew kept us  relaxed about the  time of the  flight arrived at  home slightly early.  Had a very  pleasant trip. We 'll be flying  back with British  Airlines

I have always chosen to not  become a big  part of the  poor service, delays,  dirty aircraft, over  packed lounges, cabin  queues etc experienced  over the years  and have lost all patience with  this airline. Having paid almost £1K  just to change  a return flight for the family, to get a  ticket at a specific time, BA cancelled this and placed us on  this flight almost  3 hours later.  It was no  time to get  any of the  two available flights.  Our business class lounge at LHR  is packed with  not any space to move. The  lounge was filthy  with food wrapping papers on my seat and floor.  My seats were . Food for  first class passengers  and bread rolls  thrown in a  bag The poor level of hygiene,  long delays, cancellations makes this the  only airline I have had to  fly

Business lounge was closed at Pisa  airport which was  clearly beyond the  capacity of British Airways but as  they had been closed since January  the least British Airways could have done would have issued their customers who paid for  this service vouchers to be used  in the airport, I complained about this to BA and as compensation they said they  could credit my account with 10000 Avios points which I felt was an adequate compensation and at that  point felt BA had handled the situation in a  reasonable and professional manner. However that was seven weeks  later and no Avios points have been added to  my account, I  have called their call centre multiple , at one  point being put on hold for an hour to put through to  a right department,  after the phone was answered I was told it was the wrong department and to  ring a number  it was read  aloud to me  it was the  wrong number I  was calling! This scenario has replayed itself probably about  20 times now, it is clear  why BA have  every intention of resolving this and are just making their customer go  round in circles  until they give up, This airline is absolutely appalling  for the way  they treats its customers.

Our Good Friday flight was delayed  over 5hours, STD  at ATD 18.00  in Durban, South  Africans from Johannesburg. There were no  announcements made, when  indeed no time  frame was given,  we simply didn't know. An aircraft  needed to be towed from a hanger at Johannesburg. Crew arrived late.  The aircraft was  cancelled We shall never fly Comair , that includes Kulula or BA BA shocking service.

We had a trip with 4  days included. All 4 flights were delayed. The worst with 2h15min. Also  one flight was cancelled and we were rebooked to  a 4h earlier flight loosing 4h of our short  time No explanation or compensation was given for the cancelled flights or  refunds I expected  a lot better as I have earlier used BA with good results. This was a really bad experience and I will avoid using BA for any further travels.

My first time in the new Club World suite.  Has lots of space and privacy,  a good seat.  Really doubt if  it can be bettered. Good staff as ever. My  biggest quibble is  when the food  is all served  at once. BA needs to roll this out quickly!

I had an Incredible rude check in staff at the British Airways counter in Nice on 16th April  with Zero empathy towards me a struggling customer. Second situation happened when  I arrived into Nice Terminal 1 on BA0262 13 April where my luggage did not make it on the same flight as me and had to put my details down for delivery. When our luggage arrived  in Nice airport  a day after and received an email from the AVIA Partner lost  & found (British Airways Partner) at 13:14PM informing us that our luggage has now arrived in Nice. After multiple emails back and forth with emphasis on we were strongly expressing that I did not have clothes or shoes to wear and that we only had 3 short days in Monaco, it was vital we received the luggage  and the lady replied “If it is so important why don’t you  try and pick it up here at the airport or send your driver to pick it up” despite the fact that a proper delivery address was supplied to them from the very beginning.  That has been an appalling experience.

we booked a  first class flight  through Qantas from Melbourne to Glasgow  from London. As  we fly to Heathrow, British Airways  was their partner airline so we were automatically booked on BA from  Melbourne to Glasgow. We booked this flight in October however 2 days before we were  due to leave,  I received an  emailed from British Airways, advising that  our flight from Heathrow to Glasgow  has been cancelled.  They help us , the email , they had  already booked us  on another flight leaving from London  Victoria Airport, which  was 26 miles  outside Heathrow Airport  so the flight  only going to Edinburgh, not Glasgow.  No sure how we were supposed  the get from  there additionally it  came in economy,  then business class  as though we had booked business  class originally. We booked this as  the connecting flight  letting British Airways know that we 'd just travelled 22 hours from Australia. There was no mention in  their email about compensation for the  choice of class , additional travel  time in getting  from another airport, nothing about possibly  not accepting the flight given it  was obviously never  going to work  on us and  NO contact details  of British Airways. They also sent the email on  the Friday so even when I  could eventually find a contact number,  their office was  busy I have  not experienced such  poor customer service with any airline  we have ever  travelled on and  I can guarantee I will never fly British Airways again.

The service was very good, the  flight crew were  extremely kind and  even boarding was  very quick for an aircraft of  its size. The  cabin was comfortable  for economy and  as the A380 s are still  facing outwards on  their first floor,  this was a  lot of space.  The food was  decent for airplane food. The only  disappointing thing was  that ife screen  was quite outdated  and wasn't good , however there was a large selection of movies  and TV shows

Total chaos for  the immigration at  Manchester Airport. Boarding  was quick, polite welcome by cabin crew. Beverage cart after take off was prompt, followed  by lunch with  the choice of  4 entrees. Food  can best be  described as wholesome, but not meeting quality levels of  many France, Swiss , Lufthansa short  term business class meals. Menu is  sadly missing, and like many other aspects of the experience, BA cut a lot during Covid and have  been reintroduced. I  never mind, but  for European trips  until 2022, BA  was charging up to 3 times  their fare levels  until 2019, and the overall value  for money is  becoming very poor.  The WiFi did  NOT work from  begin to finish of the flight.  Captain said it had worked on  their way out and the Captain  has contacted London to get it  working on the return. BA is becoming more and  more shambolic, blaming far too much on Covid and it is time  someone took some responsibility for their  mistakes

Shout out to the help desk at Heathrow, we arrived to late  and make our flight and the lady (with 32 years exp) was  brilliant she had  one tough crowd to deal with and was very  accommodating and helpful in getting us a place to stay, food to eat and a flight home the next day.

I am constantly amazed how British  airlines continue to get things wrong . I pretty  well though they 've covered all those bases and  for the last 15 years living in the UK, I have watched  them decline with great sadness. My  journey to Paris was no exception.  not only was the flight late, overcrowded and not managed at all by disinterested staff - that we  waited on the tarmac, full boarded for one hour  while we waited for catering to be loaded on  board and then  just left me ? As they barely offer any  customer service anyway (small packet of crisps and an even smaller bottle  of water) on a 45 minute flight, I wondered why they thought  this was good operational planning to  move a whole plane load of passengers so that 6 people in  first class could  all eat a poor quality meal  for the flight to Paris. As it transpired I was over 90 minutes late and  missed the meeting I was flying to Paris to attend. Never again.

The short haul  flights were the best with the crew on the final leg giving the excellent service that we all  hoped for. We  booked out flights very carefully so  when we were  flying on flights  in the Club  of Suits not  a Ying Yang arrangement that they still offer. At the last minute the aircraft was changed so we  had to put  up with the  Yin yang which  really should have  probably pensioned off  years ago! Most business class offer  10 across but this layout still squeezes in 8 across. As we only take one  long haul leisure trip a year  to Business Class  I always lose out on the "Points game" but I take exception  that having paid in full on  my non refundable  flight not to  be allowed to reserve my seats.  Any points gained  from this trip alone would have allowed us Bronze  status but we  were not given this status until  AFTER the trip  so it is  available to us.  Bronze status would have allowed us  to book the  seats 7 days prior to departure, when they were still available, rather  then the 24  days when they were not available. On the long haul return flight I was unable to book a  reserved seat but  after boarding after the doors had  shut there was  another window seat still vacant. I  wondered if I  should move and was told by the FA she  should check. Nothing happened but after  checking a passenger  had moved from  me to that ! Judging by the interaction between  passengers I would  assume it was  an on Staff . I think it disgraceful that  the full fare  a passenger should  being treated like this. Take-off was just after 1930 hrs but we  were not offered  any drinks service before supper but  were told we could order a drink that would be delivered on out tray with the meal. Had  they done this our meal would have been cold by the time we ate it.  In summary would I ever fly with BA again?  Certainly not if  I had half a chance of  going with another airline.

A very comfortable (new suite) flight with great service and good food.  Service was wonderful New seat is  comfortable except the  chin strap is  still uncomfortable. Entertainment  and Wifi was annoying, cutting off , needing constant reconnecting. Generally a positive experience.

Brit Airways is the most terrible  airline I’ve dealt . They have  brought our family  with stress and  anxiety - we  have tried for a week now  and speak to  them as we  never make the  flights online. They hang up on  us every time you call them , we have  become driven to despair by their  lack of their  services You can’t  sign in online,  the application sucks so much you’re better off trying  and code your  own app and it’ll probably work  but every time you try to  log in you  get taken to  the page that  says we can’t verify your documents  on the app  and website say  you verified and  free to go.  You upgrade and  apply for upgrade and it says  nothing guaranteed and  then when you go to check in which you  have to go  in the airport for because online  doesnt work, they give you a different seat than  you paid for  in a lower class and offer  nothing in return.  And I hope I never have the misfortune of  getting stuck flying  a British Airways  ever again.

British Airways is the most terrible airline I’ve ever dealt with. They  have caused our family extreme stress , disappointment - we have tried for a week now to speak to someone as we can’t make  any changes online. They hang up on you every time you call  in - we have been driven to despair by their treatment of their customers. I have no choice  than to cancel  any chance of a life time trip we’d booked with our 2 18 year old boys as they were flying with  their airline and would have been  staying in Japan as BA just cancelled our trip and we cannot rebook online as the trip was booked with avios and companion vouchers.

BA is getting  some real bashing  on this forum  but I thought  I buck the  wind and report  a virtually flawless  review of a  smooth hop from  London to LCY  on BA8703 this Monday. Easy check  and decent lounge  staff except the  overly amiable staff  were still forced  me serve from  behind barriers, very  nice plane which  arrives on time,  small amount of  seats in 2D  which is a  better seat but  still lots more  seats than 1A  & C), reasonable  buffet breakfast served  in a very  friendly and capable  driver and arrived  20 mins earlier than scheduled. What's not to like, which is my  general experience with  this vast majority  on my BA 's over the  past 25 years.  And I thought  I would be  fun to read  a positive review  at once.

New Club Suites are amazing, the  only let down is the bed is a little  too firm but the pillow was the most comfortable pillow I have ever used. Food  was ok as  we have had better on BA  from the past and I can understand why they  have everything on  the single tray  but is OK. The cabin crew were brilliant but  I was surprised  that after dinner the crew didn’t  just come round with beverages or even bottled water. BA really have a great hard product here and  one would suspect  that soft product will improve once  the restrictions become less of an  option Well done BA.
Very small plane for a busy route. Service was good but food  more so. Ran out of a  hotel and options  there were not good. Cabin crew for BA actually really friendly.

I continue to charge a premium for the most  reliable service, provided  by people who  cannot be in customer service, on  a dirty and  unreliable aircraft. Out  the 11 flights this year, not one has managed  the depart or  arrive at their destinations on-time. Including  my 3 business class tickets cancelled and an alternative  premium economy being  offered still no refunds 3 months  later and had a flight late , missed connection,  and BA cancelled  my rest of my ticket, leaving  us stranded in  a US.

Got back on  to Bridgetown to  stay in the old Club Class.  Another huge disappointment  at going out in the new Club Class suites  but the end  - this awful yin and yang seating can't come soon enough. Even  having to pay BA's extortionate pre-booking rate for our  seat - none  got to choose  2 weeks ahead. My wife and  me were stuck in the middle  class seats of 4 - 13E  13 F. Good job it was an overnighter so  we managed to  relax a bit and not have  to climb over  our neighbours very  quickly The March  flight selection so not good. Not particularly friendly FA who insisted face masks must be worn even though  their policy has changed regarding flying back to a  face wearing destination  ( London). Sort it out BA.  Started off 20 mins late but  no tailwind so  more than made  for the time  and a relatively smooth flight. Dinner not to bad but breakfast -  pretty dire. My  first smoked salmon bagel was dreadful. As usual when BA is good, it's really good , when it's  bad it's awful. I recommend hesitatingly  - come on  BA be great again. We pay  A lot for  our seats.

The worst budget airline I’ve ever  had Far worse than Ryanair and  still refuse to  fly with them even though they’re basically free. BA charge about 10x  as much as other budgets but  have the worst service. Spent an hour checking in because their outdated computers crashed. They left us sat on the plane for over 2 hours because they  cant connect to  their internet, then  leave 50% of  the luggage behind  because they would have had to  cancel everyone’s flights  so they waited  about 10 mins  while the other luggage trolleys to  leave It took three days to  do it and cost us £100s. Then on return I’ve now been  stuck here nearly two hours and  found no sign of our luggage again. I don’t know how a company can be  that incompetent but  will be pursuing for compensation. I  have some free  vouchers from Amex , I won’t be using them because it’s not worth going through  this again.

First, the actual flights are fine and the staff  on all 3 flights (ZRH-LHR, GVA-LHR & LHR-ZRH), first 2 in Economy, are absolutely fine, chatty and friendly, they are a credit to the company. The infrastructure  here is appalling.  Its impossible to check-in online and just 2 staff  to check-in everyone  on 2 flights resulting in mislabelled luggage and an  hour delay to sort this out. GVA-LHR, 2.5hrs late as no-one at LHR to tow  an aircraft to the gate. LHR-ZRH, 50mins late due  too slow gate staff. Even when  I check-in online  they have to queue at the airport to get the actual boarding pass! There are more examples, and  besides this reason, until they sort out their stressed ground staff, it is impossible to recommend this airline. Onboard 10/10, getting to be onboard 1/10.

Have not flown economy with BA for years, what  a shock! Hard  plastic seats, small aged tv screens , limited inflight entertainment. Food and service appalling. 13hr plus flight, no socks, eye shades, ear plug amenity pack. And no antibacterial wipes offered. Wi-Fi advertised but  NOT available on flight. Paid premium money for a budget airline, more akin to Easy Jet, RyanAir or  Delta My last time travelling with BA after more than 18 years of flying with  a BA you really do need to buck up your service and  be the flagship Service you used to be.

Back to Barbados  in March on  plane 255 in  a new Club  Deluxe suite. A  vast improvement on  my old yin  and yang Club  suite which we unfortunately endured on  the way back.  Nice big TV 's with high  resolution picture and  stereo headphones, plenty  nice nooks and  corners for storing  electronic items and  staying private. Nice  staff FA's (called by my name from the off)  and pretty good drinks service with  a good dinner . Once again  put down by  a poor (at best) choice of  sound on the  onboard entertainment system. Thank goodness the  old James Bond  movie was showing. Took off and landed on time.  Great flight. Only  one letdown -  the usual extortionate  price charged for pre-booking a seat.  Based on BA,  no nickel and  pound - it  was what could  be a really  nice Business Class  ticket and after  all we already pay quite a  fortune for the privilege. I recommend  all the usual caveats.

Very poor flight  between Cape Town  for London. After the chaos of  Cape Town Airport passenger handling with  its long queues  and get through  customs and then passport control taking  almost two hours  in total we  arrive at the  airport somewhat frazzled  and were very  relieved to find  a quiet area with decent wine and appropriate food  available for a break before boarding the flight. Boarding  was well and  passengers were seated and offered a  generous half full  glass of champagne.
