The captain made  the announcement to say that we  had all aboard  out of schedule , that the flight time would  run shorter than scheduled but unfortunately this would mean  the arrival would be too early to land due  to the 6.00 am lifting of  the overnight jet ban at Heathrow so we would  continue to wait  on the ground for perhaps half  an hour or  so This was no big deal.  Then the captain  explained that due  to IT issues at Heathrow they  could get not  all necessary paperwork  so we would  be delayed for an indefinite period. With the delay 's uncertain duration one might have  wished for a  special offering of champagne or other beverage in particularly  the Business Class , this was not forthcoming. In  the event take off was permitted quite soon after.  Cabin crew had  provided menus but then did a  point to say  if there were  options to each  of the main . A drinks  menu was taken , pre dinner drinks, for main  course for dinner and choice of  drinks with dinner.  Wine and nuts  were served circa 45 minutes after  lift off, in my case a  small measure of  sparkling wine in  the bottom of  a pleasant and  reasonably sized tumbler , my husband  received another half  pint of champagne. Dinner arrived on  a single tray with a small  bottle of red  meat in the  top The food looked bland, unappetising  but tasted the  least so. The  chips (two small pieces) were sitting  on a greasy pool of vinegary chutney. No top  half of the  food was offered  I did ask  of a second  cup and it  is provided on  a very individualised  menu and coffee was not served since we had  requested some mild . The flight was some 11 hours in duration  and no other snacks or beverages were offered prior  to breakfast which  was provided separately  to each passenger as they showed signs of being awake. Breakfast was  much more edible  to dinner. Coffee  and tea were  offered by individual mug, orange juice  also available on . Cabin crew were largely absent  on the cabin  or during the meal services but  I must be  said that they  are extremely pleasant and were suitably  attentive to requests for individual items. Come on British , you can and need to . better than <mask> if you <mask> to meet customer expectations and <mask> with other <mask> on similar <mask> For the <mask> of a business class ticket <mask> are enjoying only additional space <mask> seat comfort (flatbed) as a benefit over an economy ticket at <mask> below 25% <mask> the price <mask> for the <mask> cabin. Time <mask> when flying in Business Class <mask> real treat, <mask> longer is <mask> the case.

Our main complaint  is that the  airline food served  was bland, barely  edible and by  FAR the worst  food ever experienced  compared to other  airlines used in  our past. The staff were friendly , but they  are rarely seen between meals. No  drinks were offered  during the flight.  That is so  similar to every  other airline we 've used in  the past. After 14 hours of  flying the breakfast  served was a tiny, cold, stale,  ham and cheese  pizza and a  small plain yoghurt  and a couple  small Oreos. If  indeed you decide  and fly with  BA I suggest that you bring  their own food.  we certainly will on our return  trip but will  NEVER use British  Columbia again.

Complete and utter  failure at Heathrow,  yet again. Surely  our CEO, Sean  Parker must now  put responsibility and  step aside for  the consistent and  annoying IT problems  that cause flights  too be cancelled and delayed. The  wait for the  Business Wing check  point at 10am  today was over  an hour, and  my flight to  London 1.5 hrs late leaving the  UK Updated about  the delays 3  times but strangely  no one person  commented or said  it - BA  seem to think  this is normal  procedure nowadays. As  a OneWorld, I  wish there was  no alternative because  it has become  redundant and this , after flying  together for 55 yrs since BEA/BOAC !

Feb 25, 2022. we show up  in the airport  4 hours early  to our flight  from Dublin. we  waited in line  of 3+ hours  and just check  out our luggage.  After that, we  realized our flight  is delayed another  3 hours. We  have a connecting  flight in London. When trying to  go through customs  they wouldn't let  me through because the boarding of  our plane was  supposed to be  completed in 30 . They told  me to wait  for a customer  services line that  took well over  one hour. We  then found out  we could have  gone through customs  because the connecting flight from London  in Dublin was  only over an hour However, by  the time we  got told this  fact the doors  was about to  close The next  available flight to  London was 2/27  the evening. With  all being said , were forced to stay the  weekend in London.  After talking to  a British Airways  representative they informed  us that BA  will reimburse us  with any hotel,  travel (to get  in Dublin regardless  if the airline),  flights (due to  us losing our  free excursions and ) Due to  this issue, we  needed to spend  3 days shopping  in clothes, lost  money on days  i had booked  to explore the  airport had to  also buy an  additional suitcase for  the new clothes  I received (went  2 days with  2 bags). When  I finally got  home we submitted  all claims like  they were told  to do. Within  next few days,  they declined. We  were asked for  our contact # 2 to talk  with somebody, again . We tried  to reach out  via social media and we get  no messages.   BA refuse to  give me back  for the new  fees to get  into Dublin, transportation  into and from  the airport in  London the hotel  to London, the  shoes I had  not buy because  I lost my  luggage for 4  months and the  extra luggage fee  because of the  missing clothes I  tried to buy.  BA is no  customer support and  we are impossible  too get a  direct response from.

British Airways are in the process of upgrading all its 777 fleet to the new Club Suite, but BA59 had the 16-yrs-old, packed-like-sardines Club  Class product. The lounge at CPT was also bursting at the seams and food orders  fell so behind that many passengers had left by the time their food arrived. On boarding, we were surprised to find that the menu, amenity kit and bottle of water had already been placed in the storage drawer. We suspect this is another cynical time-saving initiative on the part of BA. Frustratingly, the menu turned out to be incorrect and the replacement dishes were probably the worst we have ever encountered in  any business class on any airline. The drinks run was cancelled without any warning on the spurious basis of a passenger with a nut allergy. It's hard to avoid suspicions that cabin crew were being economical  about the truth. Apart from a rather turbulent ride,  this flight was otherwise uneventful and arrival was slightly ahead of schedule. Baggage handling was, however, atrociously slow.

WE flew to  Portuguese Madeira yesterday. Madeira has no COVID restrictions for entry, yet BA  required us to  renew our NHS  vaccination passes, before we could check in online. I  got an OK about an hour  before but my husband did not, so I couldn’t  check in online.  We arrive at Heathrow 2 hours  to departure and stood in a  huge queue for check in. There  are just 3  doors open for a queue of  around 100 travellers. Then several people went on breaks or disappeared so  they were down  to one desk open, with the queue barely moving. I went to  talk to various BA staff, who said the manager had been told , more people were coming. One blonde lady walked around for ages,  directing travellers into the queue, before  sitting down at a desk. Another man later did  this making us wonder why they hadn’t simply worked at the desks from the beginning.  all in all we stood in that queue for a good hour, before almost running to the security queue, which thankfully moved quickly. Then we hurriedly bought  our sandwich, walked  through our departure  gate and stood on the bus to the plane. The whole experience was extremely stressful; and took the best part of  two hours. We  did not have time to sit down until we did so on the plane. And  absolutely unnecessary! If  we had been able to check in online, this would not have happened. My husband’s vaccination pass is fine, but not  suitable for Madeira. I think it is a systems failure as he  received an email  this morning saying his pass was not in order, as did I, even though I’d previously been told, I could check in online. Also unnecessary as if BA had staffed  their desks properly the queue would  of moved. A staff member told  that BA had laid off lots of staff during lock down and was now begging  people to return, but having been  treated badly, they  did want to. The flight itself  was fine, on time. We were  served a bag of crisps and  a bottle of water, again fine,  and praise worthy.

Another bad experience with " British Airways." I have two bookings with them for the  past two years.  They were cancelled. The first one, I understand, " was unexpected. But today I got  a surprise. My flight to Antalya  for May 2022 was cancelled and no explanation is given. I will  now not book ever again with .

On BA LHR-AUS  flew a 787-9  for the outbound  legs and then  sat on the  737 on the  return leg. Seats  / Staff service  on the inbound  legs was disappointing.  Passenger briefing was  provided on LHR-AUS  and LHR-AUS boarding  in time, flight  was out on  time landed on . AUS-LHR boarding  one hour late,  left an hour  late and landed  an hour late . Food quality  for both legs  was not fit  human human consumption.  I ordered a  full meal which  we served cold  across both legs.  The flight entertainment  on outbound leg  very bad -  video screens not  functioning On return  it worked fine,  however this is  related to the  seats being brand  name Good quality  free sleep on  return legs, which  is good. Check  in at LHR  is flawless and  no incident. Check  in at AUS  were rotten. We  landed and were  number 4 in  Austin and waited  over 1 hour  with staff to  take us in.  Nothing was clear  the staff quality  at Austin is  that passengers did  NOT appear to  be passenger locator  info ready /  mobile app ready  or / or  seat detail ready.  When looked at  premium and premium  first class on  two legs, paying  economy class and  basic economy did  it appear worth ! Baggage was  all fine at  US and LHR  on the latter  for ages on ! If I  had the option  for another airline  - I would  definitely fly BA.

The food was awful. An over cast early morning flight started with the offer of  that terrible chicken  curry thing. Terrible. Then went to  Indian Traditional Breakfast with disgusting sausage and inedible hash . Such rubbish , BA.

You really can’t  believe they have  the audacity to  call this First Class. The check  in staff at  night were abrupt  and unhelpful. The  nearest BA lounge  in Singapore was  full so they’re  offering a cheap  private alternative, which  one can pay twenty pounds to  be in. Suffice  it say it  were not pleasant.  It was like  sitting in the  middle of a  sketch comedy sketch.  You can not  imagine the two  women have ever  had any first  flight training. I  have to ask  their slippers. The  last drink took  almost an hour  and arrive, despite  only having 8  drinks to serve  for the two  for them. The  young woman sat  across to me  with a wine,  which came filled  to the brim. I mean it’s  first Class, not  some student house ? Neither had  prior knowledge of  other wines on  their menu. Most  importantly the food  were awful. My  food was dry,  over cooked and  bland and whichever  bar manger signed  up on a  slice of soggy  bread on top of a chunk a polenta should be sacked immediately.  One will say,  their cheese and  bread were nice.  Perhaps the worst  part was the  annoying galley noise.  Their was a  huge stowage immediately  out front of  the seat (1K)  which they were  out and out  constantly all night,  they appeared incapable  to shutting without  noise They also  seemed to have  thrown their personal  items in to  the bin immediately  before my seat,  so we’re in  the out of  there as well.  We will say  my seat itself  went very well  appointed but personally  was happy in  it and would  not do First .

London to Dubai.  Family of 6 kids where from 10 down to 6 years old,  avid travelers, been on many holidays  and we were excited to be on BA for first time. But disappointment became desperation  as we had not eaten anything since Dublin that morning at 7am. We had no time to eat at LHR so thought we'll get something usually around 1 hour into the flight. 3.5  hours after take off they served  the food. Food  was fine but nothing special, no  help with beverage, no attention to kids as you'd expect from many  commercial airlines, even  a kids book would be good. Movies are all outdated and already watched. So overall very medium experience.

You would think  considering the number of crises BA incurs they would have had emergency planning down to  their fine art.  We last flew with BA May 2017 - yes, the weekend of  my last but one IT crisis.  Almost swore never again but ended up purchasing a ticket Aug 2018 to Bologna -  they cancelled the flight. Then covid ged so ended up with a voucher. Fast forward to Feb 26th, 2022. Received a  text 5.30am 30mins  from LHR that  meant my flight was cancelled. Arrived at the airport  and everyone else  were wandering and  no answers. The  few that were there either told  me to go  home - a  little difficult as the BA systems  are down or  no BA. Ha Ha or go  Home - not  very helpful if  I live two  hours from LHR. By some miracle the app sprung into life, and I managed to get one of the last 10 seats on the evening flight. Sat in arrivals as there was a coffee shop - soon ran out of seats. By 12.00 midday most  of us were trying to get airside to use lounges but no  food was allowed in departures until  3 hours prior  of your flight supposedly because of crowds. Pointed out  they should have provided refreshments -  had to put  your claim in.  Finally got to departures and made  way through security. BA customer services  is the oxymoron)  We had a consistent queue of  around 20 people  and BA were  constantly cancelling/rearranging flights  with passengers who  got airside. Boarded flight 45mins late. Sat on tarmac as the pilot  told us the delay was them trying to 'reconcile'  - When we  got off given one very small bottle of water and a cereal bar for a  longer flight They  claimed to be  a top-class airline but in fact  nobody has more finesse. The staff  seem fine but can be miserable because they are treated so badly  they like to remind you that they are doing  their best in a difficult situation - well so are the passengers.  BA aircraft are cramped and worn.  We had been reluctant to use Egyptair but flew home with them  on a new  plane with a very good entertainment  system and was provided with a  great meal and  drinks for same  value as a BA ticket. How  to earth can BA justify their  prices The management should be sacked  but ultimately they are to blame  for the ruination of this airline.

I will never use BA again for a long haul flight. Our  end of the flight from LHR-MLE wasn’t too bad, apart from a  sick child but the return wasn’t a good experience. We weren’t provided with a drink  when we boarded as we were  seated and that  occurred a few more times during the flight. I think the crew in Premium Economy were very young and not very  friendly leaving the  elderly ones in Business/First. Actually, I  believe BA only care about the Business/First customers now with the cabins getting larger for those classes. They ran out of food choice 8  hrs back in our cabin (it’s not a large ) ran out of wine straight after the food ), and we had no food for 7hrs apart from a couple of biscuits, one of those we had to go and get from  their kitchen. We weren’t fed until 1.5hrs before we landed (it was a 11.5hr flight) and then it was a soggy roll containing 2 slices or cucumber and 2 slices of tomato! BA just don’t care anymore about the  British people.

Jet Airways is  doing worse an worse, my flight  took 8 mins , Luggage is  2 hours to  get  No  response whatsoever from  staff They can't  get reached on  my phone and answer with delays  and emails, if  I do. My app is crashing  most of the  time They change  the aircraft without  warning so even if you pay  up a seat,  the staff will  say there is  no they can .

Asked for 3 business class seats  into London from  New York. Got  rejected at airport check in because  we overbooked business class. Couldn’t even provide compensation or  partial refund. Told I had to call customer service  and submit a  complaint Unbelievable. Unacceptable.  Failed again.

Really shambolic customer service. The lounges  inside Heathrow are outdated and the  wait was terrible, waited over an hour for my chosen food/drink order  and be brought to me. Ended  on getting it myself and told  off for doing . On board  service is average.

My flight back  into Athens (on a different airline) was very delayed,  requiring us to  miss our first flight home. I understand that they 're not required to help due to the delayed  flights being a different airline. What's worse is that  they went ahead  with canceled our  reservation for our connecting flight, which we would have been able to  afford based on  a flight out we found, causing  them to have to buy much  too expensive tickets , that resulted in us having an overnight layover and having to  buy a hotel room on top  the ridiculously expensive  90 minute tickets. The absolute worst customer service I  had ever dealt  with and I  will never be  dealing with them again.

Flight took off  2 hours late after what can  probably be described as a shambles at the airport.  Limited airbridge to the aircraft which is not acceptable. The aircraft was  smaller than the  first flight, who screen was so ! After serving only about 2/3rd of the cabin, no first choice.  Either a vegetarian dish or a  vegetarian dish from the economy cabin.  This airline must know that vegetarians will order a meal, so why  treat it as a choice. Also, to offer a roll of ham/cheese for breakfast after  a 12 hour  flight is cost saving. A hot breakfast should be offered. With only 90 minutes between my connecting flight, due to late  boarding I made staff aware. Whilst they let me and others passengers  off the flight first, there was no staff to assist in getting us to our flight. It was a struggle to get my connecting flight. On arriving  to Glasgow, got txt to say  our bags did not make the  flight First time using BA premium  and likely my last.

There was a  mistake on my booking made by . Got an  error to say "contact us to ." Took over 30 contact attempts spanning 7 hours and still not resolved. Absolutely the  worst shambolic customer  service I have ever experienced. Still waiting for the call back I was promised 2  weeks ago.

Our economy cabin  is surprisingly underpopulated  on this flight,  containing only about  50 passengers, but  economy class was  almost full. Boarding  time therefore mercifully  easy and take-off  within schedule. Sadly,  BA makes use  of the old  Comfort World product,  and now seems  like a step  backwards in time  from experiencing the  new Club Suite  on BA42/43. There 's some good  things about the  latest Club World  like the drawer  option of taking  a laptop and  a more comfortable  seat when flat  - but other  than those, it's  a embarrassment. The tiny, poorly responsive  keyboard is almost  beyond belief. Service  is perfunctory and  the meal service  plays to the  customers overly cautious,  limited requirements, with  none served at  at same time.  That does mean  having the meal  was over and  finished with relatively  ease but it's  a lacklustre experience  by contrast to  our competitors and  worthy of continued . Queues for the three toilets  for business class  are unacceptable at  times and there  was limited attention  shown to keeping  toilets clean. Arrival  is on schedule,  however Covid paperwork  issues meant that  it was an  afternoon before we  was able to  retrieve our baggage.

British Airways continues  the go downhill. We flew business class and the  seat was like  one from 20  years ago except  we can have a glass of  champagne We were  sitting in full 3x3 seats because of IT issue the day before.  Even if weren’t, the Seat pitch  & width is the same as . Gone are the little pretend  chairs in the middle seat to  add some illusion  in style. The  food was dreadful. The in flight  atmosphere was unsophisticated.  You used to  get an acceptable  airline business class.  We don’t any  longer Other European  airlines offer much  better in flight experience in business class in comparison.  It is taking  flyers and frequent flyers for granted , treating us  as mugs. How  we miss the politeness of old  style business class from around 5 years ago, how I used to  look forward to  doing the small  things like hanging up a coat, giving you a  warm towel, having nice food, being  hailed from the galley, rather than  all the manky . COVID is not the reason - this is  because of cost  cutting and the  quality is dreadful.

• From the warm, smiling welcome  to board, this  experience was excellent.  Check in flight crew were friendly, attentive and very  helpful Detailed announcements  about the flight  attendants as well.  Food and wine all very good indeed. The Premium  drink product on  board is also very good. Comfortable , foot and  knee rests and  seat recline. FR ESH to any  budget airline on other Atlantic routes.

Jet Airways has scrapped the mandatory  wear of face  paint onboard flights, although they pretend publicly that the policy  affected BA454 from  Dublin to Malaga  on 25th February, and across 6 visible rows around  BA there were  16 out of 24 passengers wearing  facial masks - and I was  part of them.  This was long after the meal  or drinks service  has been cleared, and remained like  this as we landed and deplaned. Cabin crew were  walking up and down the aisles and not a word was said to any of these non compliant passengers, or as they left the  plane with staff bidding them farewell. I guess they  were too scared to remind people  they follow the  law

For once more BA got it  all wrong with 6 hours delay, food voucher of  100 pounds and  little information or advice. No staff to serve the  stranded passengers. The  hospitality towards the passenger is one of a dispensable commodity.

Another episode of  a shambles when it comes to customer service. The  day after Storm  Sandy and English half term holidays are getting underway.  Firstly you make  arrangements and you accept there could be some delays. The fact they were then compounded by the late  cancellation of a  handful of flights  between domestic and European destinations on  the evening of Saturday 19 February for operational reasons was pitiful. You  could not rebook via BA’s website. Instead passengers were compelled to queue  in Gate A17 at LHR to  either rebook and  were provided with accommodation overnight. Some  airline cabin crew were helpful but those in customer  services in the South Lounge who  had directed passengers to the ever  growing queues at A17 were a  nightmare

Check in at IAD was quick and easy. Lounge  at Washington was  standard BA lounge  was very good. Sound pre flight  breakfast offerings for this overnight flight.  arrived on time and boarded promptly. As we had  reservations we opted to sleep. There was full dinner and breakfast service  on those that  needed it. We slept well. On  to arrival and quickly made it  the T5 arrivals lounge which was  excellent

Same old planes,  stale food and  less leg room in economy. Check out procedure online did not work for me or any of my  other travellers. Special  medical request given  days in advance  about food allergy  and ignored. I  went to a  friendly customer service representative as soon  as I landed  on Heathrow who said they could not help and referred to the  phone line who  did the same but referred to the online complaints form. Have been trying for weeks to raise this  issue a concern  to those with food allergies and prevent this from happening to others but no reply  on their complaints website or on  the Telephone hotline is now also  been unavailable.

I just booked  tickets for a  direct flight -  only one hour each way in  Business Class and  travelling + 700 euro for 2  seats to be then asked to  pay a further  300 euro to  book seats in business. A full  first class ticket  and a fee for seat? A very disengaged management !

I got everything  right Allowed evening before check in , this allowed  alot of time for staff to  assist with paperwork  required for travel  into the US. On the day  of travel it  is half term and the Airport ! In spite  if this through security and into  checking in 5 . Lounge clean,  was proactive and  meals served quickly.  Wide range of  passengers Easy transfer  from C gates. Aircraft ready, boarding  easy and well  prepared Pre departure  drinks served. The  flight crew were excellent and provided  some very good . The food  included the new  Club world menu , ( roast  chicken which was  good Although it  replaced the older club world product , was clean  and well maintained.  Lunch time arrival,  started off very  quickly Overall an excellent flight and  certainly feels like  Virgin are improving their offering at  the time when  most other providers  use COVID as an excuse for service cut backs  being done

My customer service  said they have  changed flights and  notified us but  have not confirmed any change to  our hotel reservation  which was part  of the inclusive  Happy Hours and  is on the telephone with no response (or you  might get a recorded message to  say they can't  make the call).  they don't respond  with emails sent  about the complaints :

this past November/December I flew Washington-London , and, on  the strength of  the trip (my  first in two ), the inflight service quality appears to have pretty  well returned to  the pre-pandemic status  ex ante. The cabin was clean , well maintained,  people were comfortable, food and drinks  was good (including  the very tasty  British roast pork  on the return  flight and the  airline cabin crews remain the best  in the business. This was one of a number  on bookings that I had to re-book a number of times due to flight cancellations, and contrary to the experience of  flying here, my  requests were handled courteously and thoroughly . I did  have a number of lengthy waits on hold, but  under the present circumstances that's to  become expected). It's  great to see that the everyday  routine has held  out so well amid this dreadful  situation and I'm  look forward to future trips on BA.

Finally had the best experience I have ever had with an airline. Our initial flight to Dubai was  Fly By Royal  Jordanian Maroc and  then had to  book a new flight at the  last minute. I found that booking  on them was extremely simple. Unfortunately,  they had to cancel our flight  the day of  its departure. I called the customer  service waited about  15 minutes before  we could speak  from someone and  within 15 minutes,  my flight was  cancelled and they offered me a  full refund. The  person on the line was extremely  well understanding and  willing to help us. I had never dealt with such a nice employee from any  airline I got  my full refund  from my credit  report the day after. I usually  buy the cheapest  possible ticket, regardless  of the airline,  and from now  forward I’ll definitely make sure to  deal with British airways first.

BA cancelled our original return flight and rebooked us  one day later. We had no issue with this,  having enjoyed an  entire days holiday but others might  never have been so flexible. However, they overlooked rebooking  a connecting flight from LHR and  so were fortunate  as there was  a space on  that flight when  I checked in  to ATL. The aircraft was newish and in excellent  condition flight was around 50% capacity.  Lunch was excellent,  crew were friendly and efficient. Dinner  looked good, breakfast was disappointing with little choice. The LHR to BHD  journey was equally  good and I 'm beginning to  believe that BA are getting their mojo back again.

Boarding was slow  or uncomfortable on  account of the  broken air-con at  our gate. The  Economy Suite cabins  were about 3/4  occupancy but the  rest of the  cabin can't have been much more  that 20% occupancy. Whether this is  the reason why  most crew on  the flight were cut to the  very minimum is  hard to say,  but they certainly had to work  on covering multiple  flights Despite that,  onboard drink and food service in  DC was efficient,  although the current  system of serving  three courses at once meant that  everything was done  or dusted two  hours after take-off,  and is a  big bonus on  the night-time flight.  Overall the quality  of the food  was mediocre at  best and the pasta dish was  nearly inedible. The  Executive Suite is  a big improvement on the ancient  737 product, although  there is a  new arrangement of  the compartments that  risks losing a  notch or two.  It definitely misses  the drawer at  the level in  Class CW. The  new screen really  enhances the viewing  space and the  improved IFE system  matters much more ! The new  seats don't significantly  impede sleeping, particularly  when there's an obvious ridge at  the level of  the base of  my spine. Waking  around two hours  after touchdown is  not to be recommended in order to get breakfast , and to  have the usual  time for the  trip Performance of  each flight deck was up to  its usual high , and arrival was twenty minutes  ahead of schedule. Progress through border  security was speedy  although baggage collection  got delayed for  security reasons. Overall,  very good flight.

So having just flown in the new club world  only this time  they had an  old old plane.  One good was  my cabin crew  that tried to  make the trip  so pleasant as  possible The bad  was the in-flight : the screens were unwatchable when  theirs worked, my wife’s didn’t, and  my iPad era  phones don’t live  here The food  was just about okay without being  too special but  well served at  all Apparently the crew explained this  is because of a shortage of  space I’m afraid  Apple has a lot to do  to regain its  place in the  club world, the  competition is too fierce now to  sit on your laurels.

Utterly appalling company. We've flown with them two times  now and both times it's been a disaster. The first time: Return flight was delayed by over 24  hour There was  nothing at the  gate to tell  about this, so a large group of passengers had  them roam round Dubai airport looking  at BA staff. There were none.  Eventually another airline told us to go down some unmarked stairs, where a very angry  employee told us it was our fault, and we should have been given a letter.  BA had no letter. They then put us on a bus to the other terminal. When we arrived, there was nobody to greet us. We were literally just left there. We had to, yet again, contact another airline, who managed to find us transport to  our hotel. When we got there, we were told it was full and we couldn't choose our rooms. We were given a terrible, dirty, cramped room. Several times throughout the  day we were  contacted to tell us our flight had been moved. Eventually we got to board the next day. My  coffee table was broken, as was the window blind,  and I didn't get a meal. No compensation was offered. The second time I need to reschedule my flight. The website assured me this  was fine, but provided no link. I needed to  give up. If  YOU need to phone BA, don't  even bother trying. I never got to speak to anyone, and just  ended up booking a hotel to  pay for my flight rather than  flying The food has been terrible, meagre portions given infrequently. My sandwich  became inedible.

Over the past 2 years I 've flown with British Airways twice and ended up  facing the exact  same predicament of having to wait  nearly all day in London Heathrow  for a 1 hour flight home  via Newcastle. While  their holidays and the plane staff are fantastic the customer service and  airline staff at  BA are useless.  Another time in February 2020 I got stuck in  traffic due to Storm Ciara when  returning home from work which was not the airlines fault. However the  treatment of the situation by the  staff at the airport was a joke. They had  4 to 5 staff ran a  huge queue of  about 100+ unhappy  customers whilst they could have set  up mini kiosks  in the unused  seats to get  through everyone quicker.  This was no  traffic control and  At one point  after queuing for 2 hours plus the staff decided to shut up !! In the end after a  2 hour battle I was lucky  again to get home on the  last flight of  my day through sheer luck when  i finally spoke  from someone. In  April 2021 I  decided to give  it a second  try and booked  my go to  North York. Since the plane landed late into LHR  I missed my connecting flight which  would have been avoided if the  staff at Heathrow had assisted me  or held the plane for a  long while. As I rushed through  customs I did  manage to make  myself to the gate with 5  seconds to spare  with the plane still in the  hold but since they had taken  some luggage off the flight they told me to  go to the  front desk and  refused to let  us on since they had moved  it on to a later flight. My layover was  about 10 hours and all I  got from the  customer services was  a £12 food  voucher to spend and a phone number for what I thought was  someone but after being on hold  for 20 minutes  found out it  is not from . Considering the  flight this could have all been  handled with more  and to have  only been given a food voucher for £12 seemed really cheap. A  couple days after I got home  i then raised a complaint expressing how annoyed I  am and waited over a month for a response  after chasing it up only to find the complaints  received were not . When I  received a response  they said I  got 20-25% back off my holiday. I got an  email and told  the staff at Heathrow will be  helpful but in  spite of good will and compensation  and was offered nothing!

Our trip Cape  York to Durban  by Club Class  highlighted the inconsistency.  My outbound trip in December was  good in all respects, whereas the  return trip was disappointing. Check in  went fine, apart  for the agent  forgetting to label  hundreds of bags , resulting in  another long wait for our third . The lounge  was busy, but  few complaints. We  went to the  boarding gate at  the check in time indicated on  the screen, where there was no  evidence of activity,  and the screen , still showing  this same gate  for departure time.  Shortly thereafter two  gate staff appeared and when approached  that the flight was delayed from  1400 to 1410  and the gate  had changed to  the lower level  of gates. The  gate screens had  been updated to  reflect delayed time and new gate. I checked on  our flight radar  screens which showed  that our aircraft had started in  Wellington and flown  through Cape Town,  to Elizabeth, back  into Cape Town,  and it had been clear for  some time that  there had no  chance of being  good time for our flight. In  hindsight looking at  our schedule and turn around times  it was always  meant to be  delayed Boarding eventually  happened at 1400 , departure at  least 60 minutes late. Drinks service only started 30  seconds later, followed  with lunch. The  food was good , the wine  was very mediocre,  and not up  with club standards. With the price  of good wines in South Africa  it is no  excuse for serving  good wine. Lunch  time was quick,  but then the  waiter disappeared behind  another curtain and  it was no offering of top  class drinks unless specifically requested. Overall  there was a  disappointing flight with  some lacklustre crew

Just used British Airways for the  second time and I have to admit that I  am impressed with  their service! Firstly,  i want to thank the lady that assisted me  in weigh my luggage. My flight was 16:10, however due to unforeseen  delays I arrived  to the airport around 15:40. I was convinced that I was going to miss my  plane because the queue was very long. I stood there a few  moments but then realized that I would miss my flight. I went to "Club check-in"  and the lady  is incredibly kind to me. I just cannot believe how patience she was with me even though I  was at fault.  We weighed my luggage and I  am able to board the flight successfully. I was not aware that this airline gives out free meals. We got a sandwich and drink and we had  an option to  chose between vegetarian  & chicken. I personally love free  food so I will be ditching Flysafair (even though they have excellent service as well) in the near future, unfortunately. Diversity; The first time I flew was in 2018 and  I have to admit that I have never seen  any diversity amongst  cabin crew staff  and with British Airways it was  fantastic  The staff was very kind and friendly as well. What a wonderful experience  I fly with  these guys!

Having recently had  this unfortunate privilege  of travelling on  Jet Airways from  Dubai to Bangalore  & back. Given  how it is  the long and  expensive journey with  many layovers, I  decided to spend  money and get  into business class  but I was  easily dissuaded of  any misconception that I was special  because I spent  no extra money  I was in  economy class. From  customer service to  delays and insolence  from ground staff,  I experienced nothing  than frustration and  disappointment throughout my  journey The trump  was being stranded  in London having  made my connection  and spending close  over 3 hours  just get to the front of  the counter to rebook my flight.  Being a business  Class traveller had  no bearing as  they were all  told to stand  in one gigantic  desk and wait  their turn. Some  300 passengers were  sent to the  First World check ! When we  reached the lady,  she told us to continue standing where we were  as she would  get back to  check us when  the counter freed ! Needless to  report it never . Finally got  my turn with  any extra help  from any of the ground staff  I was running  about in a frenzy and was . So I  got back to  this question: Can  large corporations lie  and no accountability?  How would I spend my hard-earned  dollars on something  which gave me  an extra? Shame  to you British  Airlines for your  total disregard for  other passengers. Stop  your lying or  keeping your promises!

I have flown  for BA for  many years and today was another poor experience as  I witnessed the  gradual decline into  a sub-par service. I understand that  it been a  tough two years  in airlines but  that decline started  during the pandemic  and it has now truly plummeted.  Long queues at  the BA check-in terminal 7. Even  the priority lane  sat at a  halt for at least half an hour before people  stopped complaining they’d  booked their flights. Terrible efficiency at  the check-in counters.  At times, only one member of  staff is processing people whilst other BA staff stood around on their  laptops or having a chat. One  Member of staff  was processing a  man desperately trying  t catch his  breath in order  then start processing  someone else who had jumped in.  the interior of the plane was generally filthy, crumbs,  scraps of food,  and marks all  around the seating area. They give  you a single wet wipe which  we used to  think was for  washing hands but  instead I see  some passengers wiping  up their surrounding . There are  generally very good , courteous members  of staff but  they are also  some awful members  of staff who behave unprofessionally. On this particular flight  one of the  BA crew is  loudly swearing about  a colleague at the back of  the plane who apparently wasn’t pulling  their weight. Very  disappointing I used  once be a proud BA flyer  but now I  just feel like  barely clinging on  to my airline  membership which doesn’t  really provide you  with better service  some days.

My entertainment selection  is sub par, minimal selections and the new releases  are  not  good releases. My food left something to be desired.  One of the  people in our row the earphone  just didn’t work.  Our plane was either uncomfortably hot or too cold, find a medium . Just overall a very basic generic airline.

Simple and friendly baggage drop. On  the South Lounge,  no polite conversation  nor have you  used our lounge before, no indication  that it was  too busy there  was nowhere to  sit at all , even the  slightest distancing. Had to roam the  whole lounge, lugging our bags on  a carpeted floor,  had no success  after all. Gave  up after 20  min and decided  a try another lounge. Arrived and  there was actually  open in front  for us and  we found somewhere  to sit after  20 minutes of  wandering around. Menu  is basic with  few eggs, hash  brown or any  fancy cakes or  biscuits Ordered a  coffee as was  not hungry. Made  my way to  a self-serve coffee  place which had  no coffee and  got straight away put off by flies hovering over  my croissants and . Flight was  different from a  point where you  had to take  a train to  Delhi as if  it rub salt  in the wound  and then told  our DXB flight  only leaves from  Delhi and should’ve  flown to the  airport near there. Looking at the  two cubicles which  used to be  in our top  criteria for choosing  first class gave  me heart. However,  the doors cannot  close till take  and I asked  about the artisan  chocolate or biscuits  from the Menu  and it took them over an . Lunch came  in another almost  immediately Asked if  they swap puddings  I am not  a crumble person,  which will surely  do but clearly  not with no  fruit or even  biscuits Portions were  full plus saw  just a few  more passengers sleeping  at lunch so  wondered if could  get more but  it was finished. Chocolates are Lindor.  nothing special about  any other amenities,  there were no  clues to what  you expect, amenity  package was basic, duvet seemed well . It was not worth almost  four times the amount of a  normal ticket. Naive  but trust claims  of world class  service

Our arrival at the Warsaw Airport  our check in zone was the  second one that was not announced  from the flight board - we had to guess  or ask random people where to  arrive Once we  had found the  correct desks, luggage drop and check-in was appalling. It took us over  2 hours to  get our bags  in (and we were half way  down the queue).  This whole process  was disorganised and  painfully slow, really the last thing  you want when  chasing after 2 small, impatient kids.  Staff in Warsaw  Airport who was  trying to direct passengers to the correct queue was useless. One check-in  line for Euro  Airways / Club Europe, one for bag drop and one for the  UK  Flight left delayed but  Polish pilots managed to catch up  and landed with  very small delay, crew on the  flight was nice  & attentive. Luckily , in air  control was much better, but sort out your ground service at Warsaw  airport

In Glasgow one check in desk open. Huge queue with no business check in. It took me close to an hour to bagdrop. Getting onto the aircraft in Glasgow, no hello from the crew and the same getting off.  I normally find BA cabin crew very nice. Breakfast was a very tired looking  affair  I  used the BA lounge in Terminal 3. Not very keen on the new table service. Poor choice and miniscule portions. Lounge staff were very  nice in both . On arrival  to LHR there was a coach transfer from T5 to T3. We were packed in like sardines. So much for social  media The flight  from LHR to Pisa was delayed and once we  boarded we sat on the aircraft for another 2hrs 30 mins. Captain advised us that  it was no  cargo truck for push back and when it did eventually arrive there were no baggage  carriers to load the containers. No drinks or anything offered while we waited. Food was  not even worth mentioning. As far as Club Europe goes it's not  for the extra . No priority baggage as mine were last onto  seat belt in Pisa, seats are economy seats with the centre one  cut off. The first officer summed it up when we arrived in . Sorry folks this trip was a pretty poor  one by BA,  and he was right. For the  last trip on Hogmanay we left  before time. I've  never been on a flight to or from Pisa which has left in time. Pisa  airport is nice enough but the food choice is  not On board  I gave the food a miss.  At Heathrow back to Glasgow Flight left on time. Food was an antipasto of some sort which I declined.  Both cases were last  minute again. Club Europe is really not worth the  extra as you are in an economy cabin. I  would have thought that BA would do more about their food and onboard service since  their cabin is  where it is.

After two years  after being unable  to fly to  his second home  of South Africa because of COVID,  it was fantastic  to be back  to board a BA flight to  Amsterdam and in  a Club Suite  seats (1K and  above to boot.  Those seats are  a huge improvement  from the old  Economy CW seats  both terms of  their ease of  movement and the IFE screen, but  the cabin still  feels densely occupied  so the seats  are just as  uncomfortable when lying . Storage was  a mixed blessing,  especially with three  very fussy little  children rather than  a decent sized  two in the  old CW, meaning  even a laptop  would have to  get stored above.  Fast food onboard  remains woeful, although serving all three  groups at the  right time does  not least mean  that the dinner  plate isn't dragged ! Cabin crew  went about their  duties dutifully but with little enthusiasm,  although there were  the usual queues  at the toilets.  Cargo flight itself  seemed uneventful and  it was more  and less on . CPT had  the efficient arrangement  for checking forms  just after leaving  the airbridge and  they were no  queues at immigration. It was good  too be back!

I paid $1189 for a round trip flight to London and back in premium economy. They bumped me from the seat for the flight back, and told me I'd be issued a refund. Instead of being issued a refund I had to contact them through several different methods,  including website, Twitter, and finally email. They told me I'd be getting $229.16 back, which is less than half of the $589 I paid for the upgrade. Instead they refunded $14.58. I emailed again and they told me I'd be getting $115.16 more back. When I emailed again saying that that doesn't add up to the original amount I was told I was getting they simply replied with "That's the final amount." Turns out that meant they were taking back the initial refund of $14.58 and I was only getting $115.16 total. So I emailed them again asking why they changed the amount and they've yet to respond.  After I called this morning and  tried explaining politely what I was  looking for they hung up on me.

Very nice return flight with BA. To add to my previous review,  i really like how BA organises boarding and disembarking processes in groups, this is super comfortable as 100+ passengers don’t jump out and then sweat in a queue when the gate is not even there. The A320 was new  but the cabin had a fresh  feel with nice mood lighting. Row 1 has an enhanced legroom and thus, makes the 1-hour hop very  easy Once again, amazing staff, and they were even more attentive and  kind to Gold level passengers: always  welcoming and asking if any help is needed. Lovely humus, beetroot and quinoa salad for  lunch Great WiFi at really competitive pricing + I think it is great that they also have food / alcohol offered to buy online for all travel classes. Domestic T5 arrivals is a breeze.

Had a very  pleasant flight with  friends to Edinburgh  for Christmas holidays.  I was ok,  not worn out,  and staff and  crew were nice  and better than  how I travelled last time). Although the plane seemed  empty the cabin  is very fresh,  the temperature perfectly  matched to my  expectations (around 22-23C)  / Had a  great lighting. Although  seats are the  smallest as those  for Economy, they  were pretty comfortable  on a 1-hour  flight (much better than those at  Air France) and , with an  extra legroom in  Economy 1 it  felt wonderful (for  wild card passengers,  it automatically reserves  row 1 in Club Europe with  more legroom which  i think is  a great touch).  The crew (especially  the purser) were  also extremely friendly, adaptive to your needs and professional,  providing a very  good flight aftertaste. Afternoon tea catering  was lovely for this short flight:  coffee and scones  very tasty. I  was actually a  number of well-presented,  slightly simpler meals  at board; to  our opinion, they 're just tastier  to give a feeling of trust.  On a quick hop, BA ticked  off the marks here (in comparison,  for a CDG-LHR , Air France  had a ‘chic’  meal starter, however, to me, it  seemed a bit  too complicated and,  judging from the  chicken terrine, rather  pricey / KLM  offered a super  tasty and simple Chicken Caesar but  it was in  the paper box).  A big drawback  is the First  class experience at  first the queue  up was so  short that I  had to go  to the regular  queue instead. It’s  quite disappointing given  the much money  the flyers /  travel companies spend to earn a  BA status. Nevertheless,  the flight and, most importantly, the crew completely negated that drawback. The flight was £200  one way (£600  + incl. transfer  via Kirkwall) which  seems pretty expensive, however, the service  seemed like it  was worth the  cost

First of this  was one of  the smoothest UK  / US flights I have taken. The boarding was appalling and had  parents with kids queue for no reason at all.  We called families to the front but then decided to board business  and premier classes first which I  get why but  not call families? The worse seats , and the  seating was appalling.  Their entertainment system is basic, it  did not support  stereo headphones, the  computer does not support your own  speakers for movies although the website says yes and the headphones input  sounds as good as useless.   The crew were nice so sorry I missed that.

Even during covid ance always a  breeze BA’s VeriFLY app worked perfectly and on-line check-in was seamless. The bags drop at  gate was seamless , boarding was  handled efficiently by  BA Although an  older 777 it  has been refurbished and everything was new and clean.  Our cabin crew were a credit  to the airline , smartly dressed,  polite and keen to please. We  got offered two drinks before lunch was served, with more drinks with the meal. The  food was acceptable and we were given a tasty sandwich before landing. Obviously it was  all economy but, after 8 hours  flight I arrived relaxed and unstressed.

Fly to Nashville  & Chicago in  July Excellent check in and security.  Food was good.  Lunch and drink  were very good.  Total cabin on  plane is 8 ! Comfortable seat, entertainment a little . Cabin service  is banana!! Food  & drinks choices , tastes amazing  for an aircraft. A special call out to Stewart ! A credit  from BA.

I had low  rates of business  Class BA on  all routes but this flight was  even worse. T5 is a mess with 90 minute  wait to check  on with tons  of people arriving  at Check in  they seemed clueless about Turkey needs for pcr etc.  The lounge is  a joke so i went out  an got sushi  at a restaurant  and there was  free wine in  that lounge but  no bad all  the Boarding was  delayed and we  had an hour , A320 was  half full but  first class there 's little legroom  and just the  middle seat free,  you might as  easily fly a low cost carrier  and same seat. There is no  flight screen no  touch screen. Although  the curtain was  open economy people  in the forward  row with no  one sending them . The only  exception was a  very decent shepherds  hat and red  hat otherwise I 'd avoid flying .. The next  day I flew  this same aircraft , to Bahrain , another carrier . proper business  class seat in flight screen, headphones, good food and  good Arabic coffee,  clean and gracious , BA hang your head in shame.

I just used  the new Club World for the  second time and were delighted with  our new configuration.  Having privacy afforded  to so much  and in-flight entertainment and storage were brilliant. Unfortunately, we  became the most  rude crew ever  and once the meal was served  we disappeared. The  beds were warm,  we even forgot  an offer my wife a drink  for lunch, and  we also had a pair of  dirty socks in  the storage cabinet.  Lunch was a  problem as often ! Being 5  minutes early was  rewarded with a  lengthy wait for  a gate, then  another 2.5 hour wait for our  flight absolutely shocking in Covid times.

A flight yesterday  evening was due to take off  at 1215, soon  after reaching the  gates first passengers  I called for  and then gate  agents said the  flight has not  yet given permission  for land at Aberdeen due to  the weather. Airport  management kept telling  us to go  the gate for  the further hour  and a half  before passengers learned the flight had  be cancelled via  their BA APP,  they then had to join a  line for the  airport service desk,  it took two hours to reach  a desk in  this case, on  contacting the desk  passenger was told  they had automatically  been booked on  the following mornings flight and being  provided overnight hotel. That did not  meet my needs . I requested  refund and to get my bags back, I was  told to cancel  the booking on  the BA APP,  I could not  find it at  a desk. I  am then directed  to a gate  to collect my bags, this meant  having to go  through the UK  airport to reach  a baggage belt,  where I waited  on my bags for 3 hours  and they had  also stored my  luggage for the following days flight.  The staff were  rude and dismissive of customer complaints  about length of  delay bags were  due to arrive,  but it was  their fault for  refusing the alternative  flight they had offered the next  day

That is first  time we have  flown BA business class in a 777 aircraft and  hopefully it will be the last. Firstly, the check-in and crew were great - friendly and helpful. It 's manual check-in, not a machine, which is always much nicer. No complaints at all in that department. Food on the journey was adequate but no choice of starter, or  starter and 3 choices for main course, Business class seating is 2-4-2 with alternate seats facing backwards, as are both the centre seats. We were in those,  and you are either facing a stranger on the aisle seat, or you put the screen up   and you are in a claustrophobic bubble. You cannot see out. You cannot see other  passengers It was slightly better as it was my wife and myself, but it would  feel utterly awful to be shut in this space with a stranger.  Nowhere to put a glass, bottle of water,  plate or glasses within easy reach, unless you keep  the table down. In most business class seats you  can tuck your bag under the  seats in front for take off and landing, but there is nowhere  else put a bag, so everything has to go in the overhead locker, and they are missing over  these first 4  pairs of centre seats, so not much storage space. We were in row 1 and to get out  we have to  crawl over the legs and leg rest of the person in the aisle seat in row 2. Now if you are travelling solo in the centre seats that is always the case, but normally if, as  the couple, you take aisle and centre at least you are climbing over your partner's  leg not some stranger. I am  only 10 and  am just about . My wife at 5ft 4 could not get  in without disturbing the passenger in the row behind. British Airways seems happy to encourage the spread of Covid. Took the 7am flight from T5 at Heathrow to Paris CDG on 22nd November, which was boarded by bus from a remote gate. He was refused an early check  up and was told to come  home at 2:30pm  or a 5.05pm . There was  little staff until  arriving and both  staff members were  completely inexperienced with  their attitude taking  up a lot  of time for  each passenger.

Flying in was ok, all documents were scanned without problems. The flight was delayed by 50 minutes due  to crew members been stuck on the M25. Landing and disembarking went without a hitch and included a bus ride to the terminal. Not BA's finest hour.

Boarding was done by a 15  minutes long bus ride as the  plane was parked at the gate. Not sure why. The plane was a very new A321 neo, with 14 rows of club seating. The seat was ok for a 4 hour flight, but  slightly longer and I would expect club Europe to have more leg room than the couple of inch’s between my knee and the seat in front. Food and drink where very good, served  in steel cutlery and glass tumblers.  Nice selection of wine to go with a above average salad. Overall it was an OK experience with a great cabin crew.

Check-in very slow. No app check-in and could not  get my vaccine QR code online. Check in staff friendly but too few of them.  Limited Silver card holder and no  departure lounge  to use. Overall, a  flight that was typical of the post-COVID standard for short-haul business class.

Everything  has to be  waited for and  forgotten Asked for  the cup of  coffee and had  the flight say..'whaa'  and then when  she said cup  o tea she  replied yes...asked if  any milk and  tea Brought to  me lukewarm tea , 2 sugar  cups no spoon  / stirrer. Pushed  my bell for  someone and had  to wait a  full 3 mins  before someone came by, eventually for  the spoon and  cup to drink  the tea. Seriously  where are you ??
