Welcome to LCA.  Royal Lounge chock-a-block first thing on  a Wednesday morning , T5 seemed  almost bustling as . Boarding by  airlines efficient and flight almost full.  And the cabin  looked clean although  stray hairs on pillows gave the game away. Expanded  to Europe stretching  out 12 rows  is the new norm? Departure on . Good drinks , which sequed  us into lunch.  Yet lunch remains  disappointing - Do&Co must be horrified  at what they're  able to produce:  mediocre salads and  THE worst gnocchi . I've ever  seen Wi-Fi access  is free for  first class passengers:  but for an  hour of intermittent  wifi is excessive. Arrival ahead of  schedule and no  problem with passport  control at LCA.

Very pleasant flight to Lisbon! It  is a full  load and we  arrived about 10min  early as we  were taken to the aircraft by bus at Heathrow  as the gate staff allow too  many hand luggage  on the aircraft.  When in the air great service by the 3  member crew on a big Club  Deluxe cabin. Friendly and efficient crew  thanks to some demanding and obnoxious . Late breakfast/brunch served was tasty. What a contrast to the Iberia crew (Lisbon/Madrid/London) who were cold and unprofessional.
No check in  waiting for Economy. Never experienced this before. While Business  class strolled up,  Business passengers were  left standing for  10 mins plus.

A refund for flights cancelled 14 months ago but  where a ticket  is valid until 30 April 2022.  I bought on Edreams on June 16, 2020 for  a flight on July 7, 2020,  via Geneva to  San Paulo through London (British Airways),  one trip. The  cancelled flight was  cancelled without any explanation. I contacted both Edreams and  Virgin a number of times in  this last 14 months but they did not refund  the 461 Euros that I paid.

Stranded in the  plane because I wasn't allocated a seat. This for  my flight that I booked months ago. I didn't  expect to use them but was  told to because  it wasn't available.  I advise travelers  should shun them too and look for more customer friendly options.

I think British  Airlines needs to  become much clearer  in what their Covid-19 "travel flexibility"  program means, because it doesn't pass  my common-sense test: I purchased a round-trip business class  flight from New York to-and-from Mykonos  via London. I  arrived there with no problem. The day before my return to New  Jersey though, I  received my Covid-19  again and learned that I tested  because I tried to call the  airline on the many usless numbers  they provide on  the website. The  phone message drones on and on about how they have no one to answer the  phones because of  airline safety and  then says "therefore we can't answer your call; try again." No ability  to leave a  phone number or  leave voicemail, etc.  For whatever reason  The BA website  assumed that I  actually bought the  flight through a  sales agent (I  had not - I bought it on BA.com) and so wouldnt let me cancel or  change the flight on the web ! I called  and called over the coming days  but could not  be through to  call London, Athens or New York . Two days  ago after having  another negative PCR  scan (the most accurate test), I learned I was  tested positive and so had to  buy a new $5000 return flight to the U.S.  I now been  calling the BA  Airways customer service line for nearly a month at  almost every other  weekend never to get through. Finally , and have been told that the fact that I couldnt get  on the flight because of a  security scare counts for nothing. The fact they dont have enough people answering the phone counts for nothing.  Now that I  was unable to change the flight  again a few days later on  the web site  that the ticket  is mis-booked. They have offered that  if I send  them a Greek  phone note saying that I was sick, then they'll  send me a voucher for a  new flight from Mykonos to New York. I am  frustrated at the  absurdity of this  ridiculous situation.

My flight from  Athens to Heathrow arrived in time,  however I and  other passengers were  not allowed to  board the plane. We were kept  on the tarmac for one hour  & a half without being given  any information about what was causing  this delay. Because  to this delay, I and other  passengers lost the  direct flight to Tirana. I was offered another connecting flight which was  three hours later  at the time of arrival. When  they booked this  ticket one of  my main reasons that made me  decline it was  the fact that the layover was a little bit more than an . Turning it  was an 8 hour layover I  think is unacceptable  for very poor  passenger service. It shows lack of  regard for your  customers and lack  in commitment by this company to  delivering to their customers what they were promised and  what they paid for. I am very disappointed by  my experience.

Year after year  the British Airways ' service on the same route (Washington-London) is becoming  unreliable We just had one bad experience after another  on this route in July 2021.  British Airways (BA) notified us that our connection flight to Nice  were bumped from 2pm to 6pm so we had to spend an extra 4 hours  in the airport  for this COVID . Their website and emails prior to our day of flight kept  advising us to check UK.gov for the COVID rules and regulations for transit through London which said that no COVID test was necessary if we could show  evidence of vaccine, however upon our arrival at the airport they told  me we needed  ot go to the basement to  get a COVID test to show  positive results. They  cost us $250 per person for a rapid COVID , which was an outrage and  completely unnecessary. We  would have gotten the test done  for a cheaper rate had we  understood that this  was a requirement prior to our flight. Food service was horrible (they  offered food with  tons of cheese  for me while I had requested a vegan meal due to may dairy allergies). BA  cancelled our Samsonite  bags and they told us at  the airport that we needed to  order this online. We have been  trying to resolve  our issue since July and after asking us for  something like 10  days they are  finally giving us the run around.

BA used to  be my go To carrier and  still am a  loyal member. However , service seems to have gone hugely downhill. Flights  get cancelled, the  occasional alternative flights are offered and  whilst in theory  they can cancel  or amend bookings  manually or on  the app, invariably this is not  possible You cannot contact them by  phone and you  could find yourself  stuck on a phone for 40 plus minutes to speak to someone.  If they are  closed due to cancelled flights they  seem to employ  people to answer calls and emails promptly. I was stunned by the  recent cancellation to  my Catania flight  two weeks before  I was due to travel.

The entertainment system was working badly, the screen was freezing every time I wanted to open flight map. Though the aircraft was 8 years only, the window blinds worked with delays. The crew informed passengers that there would be no headphones provided as it was supposed to be  another short-haul flight.  When flying with Aeroflot and S7 Airlines, I expected to receive an excellent BA service, but I got only a pack of crisps and a tiny bottle  with water. I think it’s unacceptable for a non-low-cost carrier to offer service like this. I can get  that hot meals on board are now rare. I loved the most comfortable seats in my life! I tend to have problems with sleeping on board, but this time I didn’t even noticed my falling asleep right after takeoff.

I flew on  US Airways Cheapest  fare which was a Hand Baggage  Free fare in Economy Class. Despite  it being the  cheapest fare you  could actually carry two pieces of  hand luggage both  costing up to  10 each. The  bang for money  difference is incredible. The ground staff at London Heathrow  was very polite  but helpful. The plane was clean  but the cabin crew were very  friendly and polite. It was a  short haul flight but we were  allowed a free  pack of crisps and a bottle  of water. There 's Wifi onboard  but we paid  extra for the  full flight access  wifi and it was great. It was fast enough to stream a  movie on Netflix.  When you are  choosing between a  low cost carrier  or a premium  one like BA  pay the extra  to fly with the premium carrier.  Between the generous  carry luggage allowance  and the free snacks on board  you may end up being cheaper and nobody claps when the plane lands.

Very efficient evening bag drop. Security quick. Galleries North ampton was very  nice Food and drinks fine. Plane left on time  and ordered door was ok. Early arrival. Fortunately only  two bags were  being given priority tags and came out early!

I and my  2 year 11  month baby girl , business class  to Moscow Domodedovo  to London Heathrow , 11 august.  When we landed  in Heathrow, my  daughter was sleeping. I asked stewards  regarding my stroller, and they said  she is going  and wait for  us at the  front of the  corridor before entrance  into terminal building.  I grabbed my  little baby, who  weighed nearly 15 kg, and luggage  bags (another 15 kg) and walked  everywhere I went  and entered the building, and met no one with  a pram or  had my pram left somewhere in  a corridor. And  I was no one to ask.  Just a flow  for passengers behind , and in  front of me.  On top of  this we landed  at terminal 5,and  I had to travel on a  wheelchair to arrivals  desk for passport  check and other  passengers still on  me own, holding  my baby and  a bag on  my shoulder. I  found no one  and I can  ask for a . First British  Airways representative I  think was after  baggage control ,  and explained the  problem and he  explained that I have to go  home and my  luggage will be  with my suitcases. ! No further  questions or help. I had to  spend another hour  carrying luggage and pram. I am  really frustrated, upset  & disappointed! I  can see that  British Airways do  NOT care about  people with kids  at all.

For this flight  to Heathrow T5,  we were piled  off the bus  which left for  30 mins at  our terminal.   Several unhappy passengers  left and when  asked the BA  airport manager's response  was "sorry -  we are still ". On arrival  of the aircraft  one gentleman who came on a  wheelchair had no  problem with his  ticket (I helped).  Good - since  my service was  very good. For  a flight out from Munich BA had not (re) signed up to  their now open lounge in Munich. To me looks  like a systemic  failure rather than  some one off ...

BA encourage you  please download verifly  and speed up your check-in, this is absolutely rubbish  and the desk  staff don’t seem to want this,  they want to see the actual  flight tests etc! This wasted about  20 minutes and  is pointless. The return flight again had no access  to the club lounge, you pay for extras such  a this as  half of the business class ticket price and should by now be made available again (last 2 flight  was available at  all but this is more a part of the Covid experience). On board staff were  helpful although one did joke to another welcome to . On board food was very good for a  long haul flight.

They cancelled a flight I booked  six months ago for some operational  reason at a  price where the prices are off the roof. British Airways could not give me any alternatives other than  flights or a  hotel

Having been flying  with BA for  months and never  having any issues. I recently had  an arrange to  undergo surgery in  Budapest and naturally  had to fly BA. So I  booked my flights  to BHD to  Budapest via LHR online on their . Once booked  BA informed the  authorities and confirmed  my appointment. The  VERY next day  I received an  SMS from BA  informing me they  had cancelled my  flight to BUD  but not to  worry as they  have moved me  on an earlier  (& much earlier)  flight the same day. Only problem  was this earlier  flight departed around  2 hours before  my flight from  Budapest arrived. I  should have thought  that this would  be flashed up  in their system  as being an  issue but seemingly not… *interlude* To  travel into Hungary  by covid one  need a valid  exemption with medical treatment being one.  I had to  hand in a  rather confusing form  to the Hungarian  government website that  was a confusing  combination of Hungarian  and pidgin English.  This form filled  up with flight  information etc, emailed  with the authorities  visa and exemption ? So I  had the earlier  booking but this  way I had  already fly into London the previous  day and stay  longer in a . So operation  and hotel booked,  airport transfers booked  and papers amended  visas re sent , admiration granted  for flights re  booked what could  go wrong? Around  two weeks before  I was due  to travel, BA, rather unsportingly, decided  the cancel my  flight to BUD ! Needless to  say I was furious. I complained  about BA customer  services and was  offered a stock  email about covid  on air travel.  Simple excuse, only  having looked at  their arrivals info,  I had been  booked there once  before for at  most the preceding several months. So  the covid excuse  rang somewhat hollow.  As I got  back most of my money from  two flights I  booked with BA,  and they refused  to refund my  flights - LHR  - because who  knows I also  lost the money  they had spent  at a hotel  plus half of  the money I had spent on  London airport transfers.  Given the cavalier  behaviour BA seem to have to  be and their  attitude to ruining  months of preparation  for my part , the fact that I lost  some not inconsiderable  sum of money, I’ve decided to  avoid BA from now on.

Check in well organised. No lounge  like Cancun. Efficient  check process. Given water bottle before  taking off, no welcome drink. Now COVID rules are being relaxed this  needs to change.  Service good and food acceptable. Staff  very experienced and  highly organised and gave a very  good on board experience. Managed to sleep a few . For the first time my tagged luggage was  removed quickly. This may reflect the  reality that our  plane was the only one into Gatwick at that time.

Departure LGW north  of Aspire lounge. Bag from fine, lounge basic, on time departure. Cabin  is welcoming but  well given menu, water and amenity ! Looks like  some of White  Sox bedding options removed. Lunch was fine and good pre meal drinks , Not complete  return to old  hotel but getting  in Flight generally good. Early touch  to Club world  got off last which meant a  total of 75 minutes for luggage!

A flight six months before travel,  a month before  my flight BA  booked the flight giving the option to rebook for another day - bearing in mind that people have  children and school  parking wasn't ideal on top of  no parking for over three weeks.  We rebooked the flight- as suggested  to them and a week later BA cancelled the rebooked flight. We  was told that  passengers will receive  the refund within 10 working days.  Over two weeks passed and I  tried again. I was informed that  BA can't give  the time frame for processing refunds,  so no refund  processed yet. BA representative refuses to  give contact details  of the manager,  and cut the  connection

The airline cancelled my initial return flight with a 2 hours layover  from London, and my only option  was to book the next flight that has a 7-8 hours layover.  Right before I board the flight  to Toronto. While i understand schedule changes, and do my best to  remain positive and  accommodating i contacted  the airline, asking for upgrades to a best seat. I asked for access to the airport lounge during my prolonged stay in the airport. They denied my ask, no explanations and no empathy. Not only that,  however they ignored my subsequent ask to provide a path to escalation. Again, not the change in schedule, not the extra  two hours layover time. Just the way they chose  to treat a customer who didn't do anything wrong except trusting them with his commute.

I was traveling  as my wife in business class  to Seattle to  London via connecting flight in London and we reserved  two seats together while booking the  tickets But mysteriously  they changed it later and when we got our  plane pass, they assigned 11h and 5d. Called several  people but they couldn't do anything and gave us explanations like may  be some one else needed those seats and there are no other  seats together available.  As we boarded,  the whole plane was empty and still they didn't  want us to seat together.

I usually avoid BA because of  their appalling customer service and sneaky extra charges, but  this flight was my only option. Note that BA actually charges for seat pre-selection in biz class -- 100 UK pounds in this case! Does any other airline in the world dare do that? I saved the money and waited until checkin to choose my seat for free. The seats were BA's universally derided, cramped 6-across back-to-front configuration, where you stare into the face of your seat mate an arm's length away. No other airline ever came up with this awkward arrangement --- I wonder why? No preflight drink was offered. At meal time I selected one of the three main offerings, only to be told it wasn't available -- even though there were only 3 people in my 16 seat biz section. The seat area has practically no storage except a  small drawer at ankle level that  is inaccessible when the seat is in lie flat position. The "bed" is the narrowest I have experienced  during biz class, and is also very hard. The  floor was very cold and the blanket very thin; I had to raid blankets from two other seats  just to stay warm. The amenity kit is the smallest I've ever  used in biz class -- it fits in the palm of the hand. All in all, this uncomfortable,  cramped experience is hardly worth the £5,727 that BA charges for this route. I used miles to pay for my ticket -- but of course got whacked with BA's unique  and notorious "fuel surcharge" fee of $636 for using miles.

The airport has only recently opened its new facilities and check-in and  have certainly seemed very clean and efficient, although admittedly it’s only having to cope with a low passenger load at present.  I was good to see that check-in carefully scrutinised lateral flow certificates and passenger locator forms. Thanks to just 30 passengers on board, with more than half in Club Europe, the flight took off ahead of time. Service was a little perfunctory and the food was more reminiscent of economy than  business class, with too much pre-packaging - the COVID effect, presumably. Arrival into T5 was also comfortably ahead  the schedule, and although we were dreading many hours of queuing at border control, we were through the  queue and collecting our luggage just 20 minutes after landing.

We want to say a big  Thank you to  Daniel Ladjouze. After frustratingly missing my  train due to  multiple road closures,  they helped me  find and book  the next day  so without additional  stress I am  truly grateful.

Despite sixteen months of being grounded by COVID, it felt almost surreal to be back  on T5, heading for what to us was essential summer sun in Greece. T5 was blissfully quiet, with no queues at check-in or security,  and even the Galleries South lounge was less frenetic than usual, despite families with kids similarly desperate to escape Boris Johnson’s  bad boy attitude. Ordering food and  drink from one’s table seems something worth continuing, avoiding all the wastage  of endlessly replenished buffets. The flights was very quiet,  and just 30 pax on board, 9 of whom were in Club Europe. Boarding by row also seemed a welcome improvement  from the previous ‘groups’. Service on  the flight was good and the food was of the usual Do&Co quality. Landing was ahead of schedule and we were through passport control in just a few minutes after a quick check of vaccination certificates and the passenger locator form. Overall, a thoroughly reassuring, coming out of COVID, experience.

BA cancelled flight  to Dec 2020.  This was promised in voucher form  by call center. We are now 6 months down the line, 13 calls of which  there is 40 % waiting time, and 16 email reminders. Conclusion is that they are just going in circles to avoid issuing any voucher. Head of call center is keeping to her empty promises.
Last flight down  at Heathrow. Crew  do their best  to keep everyone  safe in challenging times. Nice to  know they have  provided a free snack and water.  Just a start.

Board and disembarking were greatly organised:  passengers were boarded at the gate by seperate rows, from the backside to the front (business), minimizing the  chance for jamming. Same at disembarking: passengers were asked to remain seated,  1 row per row was called.  Board members were supporting the process.  staff could be  used distribute hand-sanitizer  at boarding. When snack was distributed my row (#8 business) was overlooked for some reason; after a while my seat neighbour highlighted that we did not get food - staff was surprised and fixed it, This was my first flight since one year, and I  understood the COVID measures taken by BA - still it left some strange experience.

This was not my best experience with BA thus far as there were a couple of disappointments. I was happy with the fast baggage check-in. This was a bus gate which is not my favourite thing but not a blemish on the  airline The COVID protocols are not  as robust as  they should be, particularly attendants need  and be armed  for sanitizer at the cabin entrance. There was a big mix up which I find  frustrating - I and another passenger were allocated the  last seat on the same plane, causing a few anxious moments and the friendly attendant had to get  you another seat but I don't expect such at this level. Bottles of water were offered to every passenger which was welcome. The plane arrived 10 minutes late.

Ok flight apart from they cancelled  the majority of  flight outbound and crammed everybody on one flight. After having my return cancelled 3 times  they opted for a voucher so I could rebook a new route. I had not  be informed before requesting the “E-voucher”  and I would  get to call  them to rebook (I’m in a  poor country and the phone tariffs are extortion). So not only was  this flight cancelled  3 times I wasn’t offered an option to rebook  a new flight online I was  ignored every step of the way.

An appalling experience. British Airways, unfortunately,  has lowered it's standards and to my dismay, I've been recently having  a much better flying experience with  US airlines rather  that BA. Customer service representatives are  often clueless, unprofessional  or not bothered.  I recently  got my flight  home on 3 occasions and the  staff weren't interested  to helping me  fly home.

Had booked the above mentioned flight. But the travel  regulations changed a week before the travel dates. The airline didn’t notify me until I learned that I could not fly with the airlines only at the airport when I went for check-in. It was a single ticket with the company and they said they didn't realise I  was flying from  Vancouver to India via London. The  airline didn't allow any via flights but were ok with direct ones. When I booked  my single ticket  for Canada to  India how come they didn't realise I couldn't fly?  no refund at all. Gave me a credit for me to travel anytime in the next two years, but I don't  make any travel plans for the next two years. That means my money is gone? When talking to representatives, they ridiculously put everything on the website agents which was 'Onetravel'.  Absolutely worst experience ever with an airline. Am a frequent flyer, was trying BA for  a first time but now I  realise I am never going to fly with you. On my return journey, the other  carrier gave me a full refund  as the new travel restrictions didn't allow them to  contact me. A poor show with BA.

My return flight  form Antigua to London was cancelled 2 times. When I call to BA several times their computer system didn’t work and  I couldn’t issue  the ticket, as the result I had to pay airport price for  flight as I  could pay online without ticket. They  offered to give  the compensation of  hotel stay, food  or travel if  given online form.  When I done  it I was asked to submit  information but link provided was to lost baggage expenses, not what I  needed I replied that link is wrong and asked  to correct link.  They replied that they wouldn’t compensate anything.
4 cancellations for  1 month! Applying vouchers only to  finding out they  still work after  each cancellation! Terrible ! Do not recommend to anyone in Covid restrictions.

I had travelled to India for an eye surgery, on my flight back to London Heathrow I was assisted by a member of the cabin crew Madeline Thomas. She was an amazing person  as she made  sure I was feeling okay as I had come  home from my surgery and was  traveling by myself.  she was more then a nurse and took care of my needs  as a mom.  Kate also made sure I had  had my food and stood by next to me . I was feeling awful because  i was in  alot of pain

This was travelling  home from Mexico  City on a  work trip. The seat would  very easily convert to a bed.  Everything had scuff les around it  and generally looked a bit shabby.  Certainly not what  I expect from  a premium product. Charge £700 fee to make an amendment to a  planned holiday well  in advance. Absolutely disgraceful. I hope this is something they continue into  the future as  it made the  flights much more . Value for money marked down only because the Christmas flights were  so expensive! To  have expected though,  we know.

Dubai to London on 5th December. Flight was ok , seat comfortable enough, crew reasonably friendly but my  experience was gross.  Both flights  very full with little social distancing and plenty of mixed groups sat next to each . Lots of passengers with masks below nose or not on at . When coming back to Heathrow many seemed to have below their  noses Announcement made at the beginning about masks. Crew challenged a couple of people at beginning of flight for not having them on or  under nose but seemed to give up at the end. When leaving plane good number had already taken off yet nothing. On way back not a single maskless or incorrectly worn mask challenged.  One guy opposite me had his mask below nose the whole flight. He had a conversation with several attendants neither of whom said anything.  Not like  the crew were busy either, did 2 services the whole flight then  rest of the time didn’t see them. Of course flying in these  circumstances is a risk but those risks can be reduced by passengers wearing masks, enforced by the airlines.

Today is my  third flight since ! We have  seen three cancellations  that BA handled , But this  flight went ahead. I had a direct flight from London to Lahore and travelling with them was a nightmare. They did not have milk  on my son's bottle, didn't even  put warm water  with his formula milk. No kids meals, no snacks. Meal portion size was tiny, 1/4 glass of juice. You literally have  a beg them for drinks water  The Staff was  very rude and treated us like trash. If you compare them with  others I would  rate Emirates 10/10 and British airways 2/10. It's not at all child friendly. I will never travel with  them again.

Overall I have to say I am really pleased with the service BA provided, given the circumstances which must be particularly challenging for airlines. I had to call BA a few times regarding both my outbound and return flight and I would rate their customer service 10/10. Everyone I talked to was extremely friendly  & helpful, one  man even tried to help me figure out the recently updated arrival regulations from an  official website and listened to my  complaints about constantly  updated restrictions and quarantines. I was refunded promptly for part of my flight that had been cancelled and I was able to change my return flight to a completely different route and date with only a minimal charge. They have really shown flexibility here, which  was needed when  operating in 2020. The flight itself was fine and I appreciate that food and drink options are currently a bit limited, given that everyone  should wear their  jackets as much as possible rather  that sipping tea. The one thing - which I mean as constructive criticism though - I think BA could improve is a little more exchange with their destination airports. The arrival sheets for Italy we were  handed on the flight were outdated and the ground staff in Heathrow in charge of the boarding procedure did not even know that swab tests were now mandatory for arrivals  from Italy when I asked him whether he knew any details of what to expect in Venice. That's fine on the first day after  yet another) update, but this rule had been in place for 4 days on the day I travelled.  Ultimately my experience with BA was very positive though and I am  prepared to spend a little more on my flight than I would with some cheaper  airlines for the great customer service I received.

i am extremely  pleased with British Airways as they  booked my tickets Munich-London City-Munich within 2 working days in a friendly  and professional manner: the difference between British Airways and Lufthansa is night and day. Friendly, professional and prompt are 3 adjectives to describe BA,  whereas Lufthansa is best summed up : arrogant, impossible to contact and ignorant. Well Done and Best Wishes to all at British Airways.

Boarding and checkin formalities are very  easy Check in  security desk was very helpful and supportive. Everything was nice except food.  i am vegan and there was no food availability for vegetarian passengers if not pre-ordered. My flight was 10 hour journey  between London to  Dubai and I was hungry.

There have always  enjoyed great flights  with British Airways , this time  our experience was  truly amazing! As  it was my  last flight, I  wanted to celebrate  flying in Club  Europe which turned  it to be  my perfect decision.  The stewards working  in Club made  you feel special and delivered a  beautiful and personalised  experience and were  welcoming and chatty.  Whilst the cabin crew was the  best part of  the flight, other  staff didn’t let me down either.  In business class  checked in at  the cosy executive  lounge Preludium with  relaxed and helpful  but well organised  crew (although no  seats for Club Europe because of  ). The aircraft  looked very fresh and clean. Seats  were comfortable with  ample legroom, adjustable headrests and power . The on  board service is  slower than before Corona times but  was still very good. Tasty lunch  arrived from DO&CO  included fresh chicken  with oriental vegetable  soup and and  hot chocolate mousse.  The choice of drinks was wide,  including a very  fine quality Champagne from Nicolas Feuillatte. All in all , perfect flight  booked with British . Everything I  desired from this flight was fulfilled.  Only one thing  you can complain  about is baggage handling at Heathrow.  We waited around  45 mins for luggage and they were also delivered irrespecutful of Club  on priority.

We had a flight to Santorini from LHR at  midday As the flight was full, we had to  hand in all  my luggage. We arrived at the airport at 7:00am, and the queue for check-in was incredibly long because  no desks were  empty It took us over 40 mins to arrive to a desk, and when we arrived we were  advised that the  airport had closed (at 7:25am) and that we had missed the flight. British Airways staff did not offer us to jump the queue at anytime. The lady at the desk  put us on  a flight to Athens instead, telling us that the  costs to reach Santorini would be reimbursed. We had to book two tickets worth £200 for a flight  into Santorini on the same day.  We have just received a response  form the Customer  Service service telling  them that we 'll get nothing. .

A flight from  New Angeles to  France via London  got delayed due to late inbound  arrival due to  weather and so  had missed my connexion in London , arrived in  London 3'25" late  so missed my  original connexion on  to France and had to overnight on my own  land in Paris.  They applied for  redress lawfully due me through EC261  and their customer  service department refused , carelessly determining that my flight  had arrived in  London under the  flight delay window  for compensation even though my final was clearly Paris  as their CR agent acknowledged this.  After I pointed  out the error she ignored me  so I filed  the claim with  the Centre for  Air Dispute Resolution and BA sent  us a defences. They claim I traveled on AF65  which arrived in  Paris ahead of  me The truth  is that BA  at LAX rebooked  and reticketed me  on that flight . AF refused to accept me  with my baggage  until I paid  BA a surcharge.  And BA then rebooked me on  BA to have me arrive very late into Paris and misconnect and  had to overnight , I do  NOT know which is more shocking : BA would  resort to the  truth in order  further support their  own position or  that their agents  do not know  enough to read  your passenger name  and air history.

I booked flights to Rome from the US and  back home through London to LAX  in February of  last year for  Friday 1st of August. I booked  through American Airlines, and then I paid for seat selection for 3 people through the  American website, paying  over $951 in total. With the pandemic, it is now impossible for  myself and my group to travel  between Italy and England on this trip as (1)  they are not allowed to travel outside the US,  so as Americans we are not allowed to travel  in Italy or  England and (3) the US government has not processed one of the  passport renewal we  needed to fly which was mailed  back early February.  We had to cancel all of our hotels, AirB&Bs, car and train reservations over the last week in order to qualify to obtain refunds and/or vouchers. I’ve tried to reach British Airways customer  services a number  of times, finally got through today after an hour  on hold. I asked how to  obtain a refund or voucher for  the business class  seating selection that  I had paid for and was told that I  could lose the money I paid, that there are no refunds or  discounts allowed, because I booked the trip through American Airlines and not through British Airways. My understanding is that BA and  American have a partnership that should  make it relatively seamless to book  or travel on  both or both  flights though I was shocked at  having to pay nearly $1000 just to reserve our  seat in business , but this  has apparently not the case. I was told that if BA cancels the two flights that we are  traveling on that  they might be able to get  both a voucher or a refund. I was prepared  only to accept a voucher that I could use when I rebook this trip for  Europe as I understand that BA  ( all airlines) are suffering financially as much as I am, but  I was not prepared to be  financially ripped off  at BA. I  must wait until the first flight is supposed to fly, August 1st, to cancel this as I will lose the money  and miles I paid American Airlines  for this flight. I am at a loss as  though what I can do to handle a situation that is totally out of my  power and for  which an airline partner that I valued traveling on  and refusing to offer a voucher or a refund.  I will never again do anything that gives revenue to British Airways.

from Heathrow to Toronto. My wife and I used Avios and the BA Amex companion voucher to get a very good deal to fly  business class on our holiday. I was also excited to fly on an A350 for the first time and it definitely  lived up to  the expectations. The breakfast buffet in the BA lounge in Heathrow T5 was okay not amazing and there was a good  variety of drinks and comfortable settees.  This aircraft felt very clean and fresh and had good mood lighting, very comfortable spacious  cockpit and large  LED IFE screens.  I like the moving map but my wife opted  for the movies  but was impressed with the selection available. We both enjoyed the food , wines on  arrival and it  provided a professional  yet friendly service from the cabin crew. The A350  looks a lot  nicer than older aircraft like the  737 and 777.

My wife and I used Avios and my BA Amex companion voucher to get a very good deal for business class flights to our holiday before the coronavirus lockdown was on the horizon.  Passenger check-in and  reception were very efficient and the  cabin (not belonging to BA) was clean but had a more limited range of food than I would have expected. Boarding  went very quick  and cabin crew were friendly and professional. I am a big fan  with the iconic  747 but we  started out on  one of BA's new A350's and this brought home to me that the 747 business class is looking tired and old in comparison. The seats were comfortable and the food was good but small and very low quality IFE screen was behind  on times. However, it was a  short flight so I slept most of the journey  except when there was moderate turbulence  followed by strong tail-winds.

I flew with BA recently from Sydney to London, deciding to return  straight home from  Sydney due to the coronavirus situation. The first ticket  I booked with  BA was via Hong Kong. After  that HK closed  the borders so I could no longer get this flight. I rang  up BA who  said that the  first flight was  as yet cancelled on the system  so they couldn't  just book me  into a new  flight yet. The  customer service agent  told me he  could ring me back at 11am the next day as it would be cancelled on the system by  then and he  could tell me  which flight BA  will be putting me on as  the replacement. 11am came and went the next day and I had not received a phone call. I tried ringing to  find out what 's going on and was on  hold for 5  minutes and still  NO one answered!  Finally decided to  book myself onto another flight as there were hardly  flights left available and I didn't want to end  up stuck in Australia. I had not received the promised phone call  and even an  update to tell  myself what my  replacement flight would  entail so felt I had no  real choice. When I got back , I raised  this with BA. They told me  how I was  supposed to process an 'involuntary change'  to get a replacement flight -  that is not  something the customer agent advised me! I'd never even  heard that term before. He simply said BA would sort it out  to put me  onto a replacement  and he didn't  think I had  actually do anything.  And now because  I was given the incorrect advice, I am out ta pocket by  a considerable amount. I raised it  to the BA  customer team that I had been advised incorrectly and  If I had been told I needed to do  my involuntary change myself I would have done so.  The were extremely unhelpful and just said that they  already know why  BA was advised incorrectly and there 's nothing they  would do about it. When I  said that wasn't  good enough they basically just fobbed  it off and  told me to  speak to a  second party adjudicator if I wanted but they were not prepared to  do anything.  I will never use this airline again.

During the time of Covid-19 it 's normal, that  the airline has  sometimes cancel their  service I’m ok  for that, also  if it means that I had to reorganize a few things. What’s definitely is not okay is the compensation via voucher , you can’t  get their voucher , or for  the cheap flight - on the hotline they offer you no online  help and just way more expensive prices! So stay far away from  this voucher. For me as a  solo traveler I  always avoid BA  so much as possible in the  past I even  never use my  vouchers with BA...

London-Heathrow to Warsaw  on 14th March. British Airways stands out in many areas of the  flight experience, starting from check in  to ending on  my deplaning. Very  many smiling, chatty people throughout my journey, including the  airline captain, who gave all the information about delay,  departure slot and new departure time.  This is also  greatly appreciated in  the coronavirus times,  he entered the passenger cabin before takeoff without any  problems whatsoever and  reassured us, this aircraft is so  comfortable and has such good air filters that we  felt safe here.  My boarding procedure  is very well organised (no chaos)  as 5 groups  boarding sequentially. I  would try the  complimentary Marks&Spencer on board service but  also think it  will be a  lovely touch to  get some refreshments . The one  area I can pick on is  the cleanliness of  the rear toilet. Whilst the rest of the cabin  was impeccably clean, the toilet was filthy.

I set up conversations Facebook and Twitter, they went . I  can totally understand the turmoil caused by Covid-19, but never again BA.

So disappointed that BA are not  making it straightforward  I claim a refund on cancelled flights back due to covid-19, effectively holding onto my  ticket illegally. Do  things right and make it straightforward to do it . A voucher is not sufficient. Or get more phone operators. The virus is stressful , without you  having to check your site for  updates and a 2 hour wait  over the phone. Very disappointed - I expect much better from you!

I booked my  trip to the  USA in May  2019 and had  TO cancel our  flight to the UK on March 12, 2020 .. 4 days prior to leaving because  a travel ban  is going to  expire on March 16, 2020 and  because I am  diabetic and have pre-existing health conditions,  the doctor asked  me to postpone  our trip. The British Airways customer care associates I  dealt with were great and caring and they were  happy to issue  me travel credit for tickets that  were non-refundable. Now  my problem is,  you need to  cancel and use  the travel credit  by May 2020  and travel to  The UK by  January 2021 or  pay all the  money from our  flights How can I make travel  plans by May  2020 with the  economy out of  business throughout the  year and travel bans in place? I understand BA has policies in  effect but I cannot understand how  you can expect  me to make  flight arrangements while the world is  suffering with COVID-19. I feel this  policy is unfair  for any consumer who has trust  and their preferred  and my preferred  choice is still British Airways. British  Airlines needs to  evaluate their policies  as a world  emergency make adjustments  as needed to  stay fair to  those who trust  BA Whether a consumer has purchased  discounted or non-refundable  tickets should not  matter because forcing  the consumer to rebook while a world pandemic is  possible and not  updating your policies  to the situation can change your loyal customers, remember,  there are many  other airlines out  now to choose . The coronavirus  is something that no one has  full control of. I guess the  short line is I think British Airways needs to  apply some common sense to their policy. I want  to rebook and  fly but I  am hesitant to  look at this  time Hopefully, May 2020 this pandemic  blows over for  all of us. </s>

Mumbai to London Heathrow. I wish to highly commend the professionalism of  our stewards on this flight. Someone had erroneously accused me of being  aboard a flight from Goa to Mumbai and coughing  on the journey. Categorically I was not on that flight, but in  fact agitation the passenger could not hear me when I repeatedly said so. The stewards dealt with this situation with tact, absolute professionalism and great courtesy. All  airline staff must be working in difficult circumstances at  that moment. They are putting themselves  to more risk than most to ensure that holiday  makers and business  travellers can get home safely and I wish to thank our crew  and particular for what they did.

They have a  flight for March  from London Heathrow  to Valencia, and BA still show  the flight as  valid and are  not providing any  further option. The  BA website was updated on 17  April to state  that working closely  with the Foreign  And Commonwealth Office , to continue  travelling where travel  arrangements allow and where it is safe to do  so I then  checked the FCO  statement that was  last updated on  19 March and  this states: "The Foreign and Commonwealth  office (FCO) advises  on all but  necessary travel to  Valencia So it  seems clear that BA deem it  necessary to fly  to Spain despite  this FCO statement.  We know the airline is suffering,  and the rest  the UK industry  and business, but how can they  do away with  such deceitful practices.  it is clear  you are expecting  you to change  their booking to  a future and  save the funds,  they are not  happy with the  official FCO advisory.  Does this actually ?

Compare Gatwick to Funchal. British Airways  was still forcing  people to fly  to Madeira when  the Foreign Office  has advised against  something other than  family travel. My  sister and her  boyfriend were due  too fly to Madeira on 17  May for a  short holiday when  they found out  why the FO  had advised against  going there. The  British government had  advised that new  arrivals would spend  90 days in quarantine no matter  how long their  stays that's a  bit longer than  the proposed stay.  My friend contacted  them but was  advised they could nt have a refund as the  passport was still  open They offered  a voucher. If  there is an example of BAs  bad service I  was not surprised  they are in .

Lower Deck Club Class seat, with the current awful,  crappy business class  passenger seats. British  Airways premium passengers are treated with  contempt at best, and Club Class  seats simply terrible.  All food was  hardly fit for consumption. WIFI broken. Crew morale low. IFE quality a bad joke. To  add insult to injury, the   snack packs are . What makes BA management think that business people  want (or indeed would retain) a  pack of socks,  one plastic pen,  or disposable tooth . The ongoing decline of this once-great national airline  is palpable.

London to New York JFK. Another  long flight with British Airways in Club Class, on a tired and old B747-400. The Business Class at BA is by  far the worst  in the industry. The dreaded ying / yang configuration is going to be with us for some time, sadly. In flight entertainment with tiny screen, no HD, and poor movie , WIFI did not work, as usual. Food continues to be desperately poor, and crew were rather keen  to disappear quickly. This airline needs major overhaul, and investment in new aircraft and seats.

Given that British  Airlines are still  allowing people to fly to Madrid , other airlines  have cancelled their flights and the Foreign Office have advised against anything  more than essential ! What a  disgrace to treat their customers. If  it is how they are going  and treat people  it is hardly  like they are  having trouble.

Fly to Buenos  Aires via London  - October 2019.  The aircraft is  very old with  small screens and  limited entertainment, which  is an issue flying +10hrs. The  10 hour layover  is a complete  failure The staff  were unfriendly and  hostile to me. </s>

Welcome to Paris Air group booking , I know the current coronavirus is causing problems for any airline,  yet BA appears  per usual to  offer no contingency  planning to handle extra number of  customers and it  was proving impossible  to speak with . After the  many IT debacles  this airline has,  surely it is  safe for heads at the top to roll? Cancelled  group booking for  full refund online,  and they do  not return the  original booking fee  and you have  to do this afterwards. However, the  Group booking page wipes all preferences  for your booked  seat numbers and you cannot complete  a form without  this information. A  10 year old  website could improve  but the user  interface app and  service that BA  currently has, and  the patience of being loyal to  it (for over  20 years I  may add) has  ran out. The  majority of this  airline appear to  live in a  virtual bubble and  has no idea  what is going on at the  front line.

London City to  London on 8th  July Flight got canceled. The lady  working the counter  seemed extremely unfriendly and arrogant. Extremely rude staff and service. This is no way to  serve passengers!, especially  especially if the expensive flight is  cancelled

London to Beijing in January 2020. BA has really  improved their game . A few years back I  flew BA, the  flight was really  slow and avoid ant since However,  my recent flight  looks good. The  aircraft was delayed for 1 hour due to mechanical  issues but get  the majority of the delay in the air. Food  was tasty, and  staff are not hesitate to provide  food if you are still hungry. The drinks are offered in the promote manner, and crews are really willing to engage  with you (in the gallery when  many of the  crew fall asleep).  Security is a  tad tight but  thankfully I am  flying economy so this is bearable . return flight  has been cancelled, it takes like 10 calls /  mins and they finally sorted out  the flight. This  can be improved but I appreciate  BA is not  going to change  this to an airline which is  also BA's partner . BA has  greatly improved the  staff and the  service and professional  staff are the  finest in the world
King Kong to  China Great airline . Staff were friendly and helpful! The aircraft was  super clean. The  passengers are diverse. Will definitely fly  again

Flight to London.  The check in  process was quick, efficient and friendly.  As there was  almost two hour  delay on departure,  however BA kept  us informed and  they were given  some free food  and drink offering  alongside the food ! Information, explanation  & apology over  the delay was given by the  cabin officer which  all were happy ! The entertainment  staff were a  tad temperamental to  begin with but  they eventually worked. Good service and  great attitude from  our cabin crew  make the long  journey easier though.  Overall happy with  customer service.

Back to Delhi.  This booking was  part of a holiday group format so we had to check in as opposed to  simply drop. According to the check in screen, all zones were applicable for our destination,  and we were sent from one  zone to the next; (which, given  our size of the T5 check in hall wasn't helpful) Eventually, we managed to find assistance but it was very much a shrug of the shoulder attitude - especially when  I discovered we were seated separately; it was only when a family with two young children had been  picked up that we were able to switch seats.  But the cabin crew made up for this by providing a fabulous flight, with great service and positive, friendly attitude. I actually praised them and told them  why my faith in BA had been restored!

Paris to London. Flight cancelled due to “ATC Restrictions” after Storm Ciara  and rebooked to a later flight which was delayed on top by 2 hours. Arrived in London  2 hours later than planned initially and BA refused to recognise any additional expenses because it was a forceful operational reason.  First 3 flights to Italy for  February all cancelled.  On Thursday booked LGW/BGY/LGW and next day cancelled (for last week of March) a month ! Been a Gold Member of BA since 2016 and after seeing their constant downgrades,  i will go back with AirFrance/KLM for my travel  and AI found thr food and seats on Euro wings a shame.

We flew from Sydney to London  and visit my seriously ill mother.  my second leg, from Singapore to  Sydney was with British Airways. My  return flight from  Singapore to Sydney  is with British Airways, leaving 23 February. On 20  February it became  apparent that Mum  might not have long to live. I contacted BA,  who said I  should be able to change my  arrival date, and asked me to send medical documentation,  so I did,  and an explanatory  letter Sadly Mum  passes away very early on the morning of 22 February. I contacted  them again the  following day. They  explained because I  was booked through Webjet, I needed  not contact them. I phoned them, they said they 'd contact BA.  No follow up , either. When I phoned Webjet , they said , no word  of BA. When  they phoned BA again, they said  they couldn't help. At this point I gave up and booked with  them paying for another flight. BA's  total lack of  communication (apart from a couple of platitudes), and lack  apparent interest in helping me in any way, astounded ! Needless to  say I will never use British  Airways again.

Welcome to Malaga.  Very special, nowadays  but unfortunately not  much difference between  BA & Easyjet.  We left Gatwick  early & arrived in Malaga late.  All seats no  longer recline. Food , drinks are  still their Cream  but excludes tea.  Up your game BA, your product just continues to  look worse.

Vancouver to London.  We are time when British Airways  has to be ranked as one of the very  best carriers. This  certainly proves the point. From the warm welcome at  our door on  arrival until deplaning  at LHR, the  crew were outstanding.  Very attentive and professional. The dinner was excellent. Excellent choices on the menu, accompanied by some decent wines.  Still had a painful back from running. A flight  nurse provided some  assistance came back to my seat an hour or so later to check on me  then remembered to ask me if the pain had subsided when I  arrived Very thoughtful. Seat was comfortable  but complemented by  some proper cushion  and a very nice quilted blanket.  Really good. The B747-400 is showing its age but it’s still a wonderful, iconic aircraft  you fly on and I’ll continue to prefer it  to the B777.

I am flying London to Seattle in Business Class  until May 2020,  but British Airways  takes around £100 each way for me to choose ! All other  seats I have  chosen allow Business  class passengers to choose seats at no additional cost. They decided to  move my seat "for operational reasons"s.  What could that reason be? The  reason is the same. So, BA takes £100 off  flights for me so that I can choose my seat and then changes my seat - without asking me. What I get is an automated message (the next time I log on to  a BA website)  to tell me. There is a  reason I can  wait 40 minutes waiting for the  message to be answered and I  give up.

From Heathrow to Nairobi. BA First is so much  cheaper than that of Middle Eastern  and Asian airlines,  people despair. The brightest spot of this trip was being able to  use the CX lounge at Heathrow ! To cram  two first-class seats onto a 777 is quite an achievement. But it is the food that is the standout problem on . It is  terrible and it is shameful that our flag-carrier represents Britain so badly  in this regards.  All the flight  times were excellent in both directions. I only flew First because BA's business class is so poor. But never again.

Dubai to London. My husband and I traveled together.  We got business  and my ticket was a last minute add-on, so  I Premium Economy , After we boarded, my husband came to me to give me  my pillow, so  he got settled and started sleeping. I was woken up by a flight attendant who grabbed the pillow that my husband  given me and  yelled that, There is a lady in business class is missing a  seat did I take the pillow. I told her I didn’t, and the pillow was given to me.  She stood up  and told her  I wasn’t Ok for her to accuse me of stealing a pillow, and I’ll show her whom my husband is who gave me the pillow. I located my husband in  the business class, apparently, his seat had 1 extra pillow and so he gave me the extra one. He offered to give his pillow to the flight attendant who said there was no need and he  could keep it.

Back to Cape Town. Gone are  those days in which British Airways  was a great airline. Weird seat ling service that needs training, horrible food and no  chance in business , are  basic services offered  in most of  the airlines but  not by BA.

Rio de Janeiro to London .  - - packed out seating, awful food, very narrow  and uncomfortable, expensive add ons (seat  & luggage), try to match Norwegian pricing on the Rio route, IFE  pretty iffy. My  feet and legs have been terrible for 3 days (I paid £77  plus an exit seat), the breakfast served was unfit for me, I took my own drinks and some food items. Long haul is getting the same as short. Come prepared!

Go to Dublin  and London. I  travel to the  UK and require  my transit visa. Since when and  not if you  are in the  same terminal even.  There was no  clear guidance or  information from the  BA I also  have a non stop hotel booking  for Dublin! BA  fails to communicate  the changes.

from Vegas to Paris via London. The staff were great, but the  trip was the most uncomfortable flight  from business class I’ve experienced.  The aisle seat felt like I was sitting in the aisle, a business class configuration  of 2-4-2. That’s  a tight squeeze. And,there were backward facing seats. The  passengers were not only uncomfortable but just so many things wrong with the configuration. I was just glad I didn’t pay full price for this flight.

I cancelled my return flight on  Friday from Geneva to Gatwick due  the storm Ciara. They rebooked me onto a later flight, then cancelled  it as well. Since then, I heard nothing more and I was  left on my own to buy  the new return  ticket I've tried calling them several times every day,  and they are not answering their phones, claiming they  are too busy to talk to customers. They cancelled  another flight, so I want a refund, but so far there is  no way of  talking through to them.

Mexico City to  London via London. My plane from  Mexican City to London was smooth. Entertainment was quite nice and so was the food; although I chose  my window seat and was never  sure it wasn't  in the window, but a wall! The crew was amazingly kind and  friendly They're always  checking on you, and we even  shared a Magnum! Loved this airline for my first flight ever.

from Heathrow to  London A good  day onboard one  the BAs recently  launched A321 cabins, although unfortunately without  the in-seat power supply, contrary to what is stated on their website  about which aircraft s were due to get in-seat  power following refresh.  One thing to  add to the  problem of inconsistencies  from the BA ! However the  experience overall was  pretty good. As  expected an extremely  positive pre-flight experience at Heathrow's excellent T5. Fast track security was fast,  like expected. Galleries  and Lounge was pretty good, and  not too crowded.  Entry was smooth  with priority boarding  procedure as usual.  Flight crew were excellent and provided a very attentive  service with plently  timed drinks runs  within the slightly  longer distance of  the flight. The  seats pretty good  as a shorthaul business class offering.  Overall found the seats to be  reasonably comfortable and  quite reasonable for  my 5 ft  2 chap. So  far a good experience with no  major complaints.

I was to fly to Melbourne from Manchester via London and Singapore  1 July 2019. Arriving late to board my Heathrow  flight the Check-In-Staff discussed my dilemma  through her supervisor. Only option being to find my way to Heathrow. I somehow managed to get to Heathrow in time where only the Singapore to Melbourne Boarding Pass was issued. I was told that because Manchester to Heathrow  connection was missed, my Heathrow to  Melbourne was cancelled.

Madrid to London.  People keep giving BA the benefit  of the doubt, but things are getting worse not better. This A321  is cramped business  class seats, no middle table any more and frankly this is a  less premium cabin.  Despite every statement  they make about  cabin improvements, i simply refer to meal photos on this route in 2016 or 2017 to see they have severely cut back on meal portions and cost. Iberia staff in  Madrid were  not very nice, cabin staff okay, but overall Club Europe is not worth the money , don't waste your money on this.

Prague to London.  This is the  third time I  had flown with British Airways. The flight departed earlier  that intended and got to Heathrow about 5 minutes  later However at Heathrow, there was a plane in the way as we had arrived early. A negative  experience at the  time partly the website’s fault, as we had done the online check in. We selected the amount of bags we each  needed It said we would have to pay extra,  and we spent forever at the checkin because we had to pay £65 for each bag. Apart from  the negatives and the delay, I would definitely fly this airline again.

On to London.  BA designed the  new Galleries Lounge  and JNB has no understanding of  English as every  nuance of a  phone conversation was  just 20 feet away. Add in  multiple languages and  a degree of inebriation as you have a recipe  of an unrelaxing  experience Thankfully, the upper deck of the A380 was  more civilised, with  very efficient, if slightly distant, cabin  attendant who ensured  nearly everyone was fed and watered  about 2 hours  of takeoff, allowing plenty of time  for sleep. Food  was mediocre and I've given up  enjoying anything more  of BA's business class product. The White Company bedding  seems more of  a gimmick than  any genuine enhancement,  so breakfast has  been rather perfunctory, with no pastries or bread apart  for a solitary . Arrival at a chilly LHR was ahead of  plan and we  boarded curbside 30 minutes after landing. Reliability is currently BA's strongest card.

Las Vegas to  Dubai A very disappointing service for Club World, it felt like I was travelling in economy (with attitude). Especially considering the  extremely high cost of the flight  ( paid half as much less for business class returns to Australia). We got off to a bad start when offered one third of a glass of champagne (about 2 cm in the bottom of the glass). My initial  drink after take off was not what I ordered, when I queried it, I got a lecture on  this was how it should be. No wine arrived with dinner, until I asked for it a second time (out of  respect of the first choice), no second glass of  water offered. Yes, I could have used the call button, but 1/3 of a glass of champagne and one glass of wine being offered on a 10  hour business class ! Other than  the initial bottle of water, and a glass of water with dinner, no other water was offered until I got up and went to the galley to  order The good news is the food was good and well presented. Although the promised (on the menu) selection of pastries with breakfast were not served (I later walked past  this galley to see the crew eating them for their own breakfast). We had dutifully filled in the pre-order card for breakfast, only to find we were  being asked again at breakfast. Sleeping was impossible due to the temperature being so high, I actually thought I had a fever (I was so drenched in  water until I spoke to a colleague who was the same. I'm used to flying ultra long haul with Middle Eastern airlines, so I'm used to hot cabins, but this  is crazy. Only when the crew  adjusted the temperature  the few hours before landing (presumably  to wake us up), was it bearable enough to sleep. Combined with  having a very dry cabin air, it was very  uncomfortable No need  I say anything much about the eight across seating as I know the seats are being upgraded over the next few  years other than they are very cramped if sitting  up to a window. I do like the semi-reclined position for take off and landing though. I have fairly big shoulders and found the  shoulder width very  uncomfortable There is nowhere to put your spectacles or bottles of water if lying down. Being on the second aisle, we  got to join in with the economy passengers queuing to disembark, so  that wasn't quick.  at no point did any member of the cabin  crew introduce themselves other than via a general PA announcement. The seats I can forgive as they are <mask> addressed, but the service was budget airline level. Really BA, you <mask> to do much, much better. The ground staff in Las Vegas <mask> fast, friendly and efficient. The <mask> was something <mask> the dark ages, all 1970's wooden panels.

San Diego to  Chicago via London. Had I written  this review immediately on landing it would have been zero out of  10 But I  know this would  be unfair- BA is a game  with two halves. The inflight experience is immeasurably improved from a few  years ago. The food in Club is excellent, the cabin crew attentive and professional, the pilots are the best in the industry and IFE absolutely fine. The Club World product is competitive with the better European  airlines such as  BA and streets  experience of most US carriers. The problems start when anything goes wrong - which it frequently does given the mostly old  fleet especially on non-core routes. In my case, the flight was cancelled  due to the inbound aircraft (an ancient 747) going technical. Then a comedy of errors. First the hotel  app just said ‘Holiday Inn’. There are about 15 in San Diego- cue hordes of passengers looking for shuttle buses in the wrong place, arriving at hotels  with no booking etc etc. Next,  my replacement flights.  The clunky app kept just saying error for some reason. Eventually the  BA website on a PC showed my replacement flights.  But no booking refs or any statement if these were being offered to me, were confirmed or whatever.  When calling BA they wouldn’t talk to me because I ‘failed’ security- I didn’t know the billing address of the specific booking which was done by my company’s travel department  despite having a full executive club account that was  associated with the  airline and which  BA could have used. The next day I went to take the replacement flights- Alaska Airlines to Newark then SAS to Stockholm. Despite getting  a boarding card , making it  from my seat  on the plane, I was pulled off minutes before takeoff. BA had not paid for  this flight! A reservation had been created but no ticket issued. BA then booked me  onto a roundabout route back via Chicago plus a 12 hour layover from 4am to  midnight getting me home over 36  hrs after my original reservation. Later I spotted that the next BA  flight which would  get me home much sooner now had tickets available online, why was I not on . When I called they had  NO explanation and only agreed to  quickly change my flight again after I complained about all of the above. Finally, I  arrived home after a 24 hour delay and a roller coaster of incompetence. In summary, when all goes  right BA is  better than it was and staff  is doing a heroic inflight job.  Same old planes, rubbish back office IT infrastructure and plain incompetence mean this airline can <mask> hell if anything goes wrong. And bear in <mask> I was travelling in business class- who knows how they treat economy passengers.

New Town to  Southampton The SLOW  line at Cape  Elizabeth continues to  impress by the  level of service , the generous  amount of food  or drink, including  the wine-dispensing machines.  Landing was quick , take-off was  right on time.  There was some  turbulence but the  crew kept passengers  fully informed. The  last meal was  the usual offering  with the hot  chocolate displayed on  a tray. Arrival  was 20 minutes  out of schedule.

On 4th of  July before my flight's departure I  had my purse stolen in NYC  had all my  money and my  money in it.  Due to the  many strangers I managed to get  to the Danish  Embassy and get  a temporary passport.  When I arrived at the JFK Airport it was  very late and  I wasn't allowed  to drop off my luggage. With tears in my  eye I went to the desk  because they sell  tickets and the  clerk was so  nice and helpful , she booked me on to  their next flight  visa free, got  me through security  without having to wait in the  lobby and she  informed the flight  crew what happened.  When I finally sat down the  airline crew were  really kind and  brought me water  and food as  I haven't had  enough food for the whole day as I didn't have any money. I want to say thank you  to your service and kindness and for making sure that I got back to Denmark ! I was  happy with all the kindness from all the staff!  Once again thank you!

Phoenix to London.  Since moving to  The USA I've been flying BA  less than in  years past and overall, they provide a more than acceptable service. If you choose your seat in Club World carefully and the crew are in the right mood then they surpass expectations. The new menus and service offering are significantly better than in the past  and the wine list more interesting.  During this flight the crew were engaging and the food was good. Departed PHX early and arrived into LHR early where immigration and baggage took minutes. If you manage your expectations with BA, then you won't be disappointed with Club World.

from Heathrow to  JFK Done this  in a few  trips with British  Airways over the  years first time  and probably last in economy, old  cabin needs upgrade,  better entertainment system.  Great seats especially for 10+ hour  flight I know they’re starting to upgrade these planes  its still a long time away.  Probably only saving  grace was a  better cabin staff  in economy.

Mumbai to Boston  from London. My  experience with British  Airways was really  bad The catering  is excellent on  both flights and even the service  was good. However,  some of the seats have very limited legroom due  the the IFE A blocking space  on front of  me Also, BA  accidentally misplaced my  tennis racket which  they checked in.  They have a  rather weird policy  that you can't  claim your single  sport equipment as  a baggage and instead, you have to check it ! The ground staff was rude at Logan Airport  of Boston. Also,  BA took a  week to deliver  the racket to  our house even  when it arrived in Boston 24  hrs after I had come. Even  while contacting BA'S  Global Customer Service,  they were speaking  down to me.  They always tried  and cut my  time in like  20 minutes without  ever listening to  my concern. British  Airlines needs to improve their ground  handling

I purchased roundtrip  tickets for my  daughter and I  who travel from Orlando, Florida to Accra, Ghana and  also purchased advance seat assignments. Unfortunately,  Qatar Airways only  sent me the seats I paid  for for one of four international  trips our our  flight I have  continued fighting with  Qatar Airways to get my refund for these seat assignments. They have only provided me with refund of $234. Despite several  telephone calls and  making multiple on-line  complaints and providing  them with detailed, my fightcontinues. Their  customer service is really poor. I will never purchase advance seat assignments with them again.

Toronto to Geneva via London. I stopped flying BA  over three years ago after they dramatically downgraded their service. Apparently things have improved somewhat  now so I decided to give  them another try. Overall, I was happy with my experience, save for two major gripes.  To the plus side: I flew on new aircraft,  that were comfortable, albeit with the usual narrow seats for modern aircraft  ( with all airlines). Legroom on the 787-9 was generous and seemed to be more than the official 31". Pilots were very good and  polite as always , BA. Quality  and food on  planes has definitely  increased since the bad old days : soggy pasta and droopy sandwiches;  I rather enjoyed the meals served, which were on  very large trays. The IFE was just about adequate, though surprisingly dated for such new . Cathay Pacific's  is far superior.  But two major downsides: 1. The new Basic Economy ! It is really pesky and  available only to  select passengers. BA really need to get rid of it. Virtually everyone  flying long-haul has to check in a bag, so  they just include it in all airfare types. If  I wanted to be nickle-and-dimed, I'd fly to Gatwick on a charter airline. Also, not being able to choose a seat even at the  point of check-in is infuriating. I was automatically allocated a middle seat even though the  left rear half  on the plane  is empty! This  just goes to show that you will get a middle seat unless you pay. Thankfully, the lady at check-in changed it to a window  seating free of charge after I asked nicely. 2. No complimentary catering  on short-haul. Seeing  as virtually all  those flying to/from Heathrow are connecting  on long-haul flights with BA and  have spent at  lest $1,000 on  my airfare, I resented a drink  or snack not being included on the short-haul segment of my trip. BA should not  start treating connecting  travelers the same  than those on low-cost airlines who only paid a few dollars for a short trip.  Assuming BA would get rid of these two new features, I would not hesitate to fly with them again, as everything else about my trip was pleasant. As it is, I would still consider other airlines.

Hong Kong to  London Heathrow with  British Airways. One of the best  experiences I’ve had in a premium  airline The service,  great food and wine are among  the best I’ve  experienced The only gripe I had  was the cabin  itself which was  too warm and  sleep was quite impossible at first  especially with pyjamas  kindly provided by  BA The cabin  attendants did my  double bed and  it was a nice touch. I  did not hesitate  booking First class  on BA on  this next flight.

From Jose to Amsterdam via London.  Much of Boeing  the cabin is  fitted with rearmost , not having  cargo bins (row  numbers D, E,  or F,). In  Amsterdam the crew  fill the bins  in the outer  cabin (row 42-43 , J) with  their bags and  so I would  highly recommend BA  buy the 787.

Singapore to Paris  from London. The  flight was a ok, dated seating  and shakey arms , the most comfortable but a serviceable experience. However our luggage was  never loaded onto the flight, the  second time this happened now with BA and despite  the 13 hour flight, 2 hour stopover, and 1 hour flight to Paris BA did not make any effort to inform us at any time of the issue. Instead after  waiting for around 17 hours we had to wait for the baggage to all come and clear before we realised ours was missing. Being a Sunday and most shops close  by lunchtime that also left little time to buy emergency items and the despite knowing  they hadn’t loaded the baggage they  did not find  some way to  get it quicker than 24 hours  after arrival meaning  6 out of  4 days in Paris will be  spent without luggage.

On to London.  It went like clockwork and nothing could be disliked  about this flight. Professional crew with beams on their  brand new aircraft  (+ important to  have a seat no further than row 14 in A321neo, as those  rows are the  same type Pinnacle seats and have better legroom), very informative captain who told us about  the turbulence before we had taken off (very much appreciated), on time  flight and good atmosphere on board!  The food in Euro Traveller is unfortunately no longer free, however being  at BA's Executive Club you can  opt for the food & drinks with avios, which  are very convenient. The only drawback  you could find  was a long queue to the  passenger check-in at Warsaw Airport -  one opened check-in  area for approx. 200 people is rather not enough.
New York   Airport London Heathrow. Very good, staff  were nice, comfortable  and seat recline good enough, food a bit limited.  I would recommend  this to others , they are a very good  experience

London to Los  Gat Take off  is delayed by  4 hrs (which  was spent onboard) because of a dent to the door which needed  replacing - sure , outside of  our control. I  was flying with  the wife and  3 kids (2  & 4), sitting  on bulkhead with  car seats and  at the baby  shower facility. After  taking off we  noticed that the  family entertainment service  for the whole section - not  the cabin) was  NOT working. And  they were sitting  in an 11.5hr  long flight with  2 little ones, meaning sleeping was  NOT going to happen. We contacted  BA cabin crew  but made zero accommodation. Sorry they said. During the  flight the cabin  staff stood in  the galley behind the bulkhead talking , while the  cameras were dimmed,  they kept slamming  things as they  moved things around. To cap it  all we landed at 10pm ET and they had left behind our  kids car seat and stroller. We finally received them back 2 days . Conclusion, never fly BA again.

British Airways (Comair) Johannesburg to Cape Town route is never less than  a subscribed, and on this occasion the equivalent of Club Europe stretched back 9 rows. Service followed the usual pattern of a drink (champagne included) and Comair’s idiosyncratic ‘four-course meal’,  comprising a tiny salad, a hot course that one could see before choosing, a minute iced cake and a minuscule cheese & biscuits. The hot meal is  always scorched around the edges. Comair really need to move with the times to a more modern business class offering. Aside  than the meal, the flight was  extremely efficient, with  departures slightly ahead of schedule.

London to Bangkok.  Certainly not what  I used to , but most  of it does  NOT deliver what  is promises any .  Disappointing ly outdated and  uncomfortable seats, appalling  customer handling at  boarding and   terrible crew service ! The customer  service online is  equally as bad. My most recent  encounter was early  January 2020 when  they put me  next to a couple with a  young baby in  Club World on  their overnight flight  from LHR to  LA Baby screams,  will not sleep  and as the  cabin was full,  BA could not  help me. The  airline was very  quickly apologetic and  we just had  to bear the  12 hours long haul flight together.  Overall my dealings  in customer service  was appalling. When  was BA going  to offer a  duty free zone in Club World  for people who  want to work  to sleep?

Welcome to Johannesburg.  I was slightly  disrupted by 50 mph gusts, but  right away  , flight was  the usual comfortable  ride on the  top deck. Seats 53J/K are some  among the best  and long as  a galley is . The dinner  crew was efficient  but we were  late for sleep  after a film.  Flight crew were  friendly and attentive.  We were kept  updated throughout the  journey Arrival was  45 minutes behind time, but baggage  handling and customs  was mercifully quick,  and we were  at the SLOW  line just 40  mins after landing.  Overall a good  time

Had a very  pleasant flight with  British Airways. Both  of my flights  started off on  Friday and reached  in time. I  am really excited  about fly BA  since they changed  their aircraft from  the 777-200 to  new Boeing 747-400  and is known  to the queen  in the skies. . The flight  attendants are very nice and professional  towards passengers, they  tried their best  for speed up  our boarding process  and both of  our flights were  good and we  were off. Everything  was well on  my first flight  and also flight  time went short  on the atlantic  due to great  high winds. On  my second flight  to Mumbai, the  cabin attendants were  kind and respectful , gave the best service. However,  during the lunch , they ran  out of vegetarian  meal option and  used to fetch  more vegetarian food  from other cabins  and even give  free meals to  those who were  hungry Overall, my  two flights with  Boeing were good.  There are some  glitches on their  old fleet like  absence of USB , Power Outlet,  and IFE, the  small box in  front of you  that blocks your  lights  BA  may need to  upgrade their old  equipment on Boeing  737 and Boeing  737 they still  want to use  them on longer  flights

Los Angeles to London on 6th January, and my husbands seat was broken. The Customer  Service Manager was rude to me and made insinuations about our intentions.  This was a dreadful way to end our honeymoon  and left a  bitter taste. A truly horrendous experience.
