Got to Cancun.  Delivery was late. My food was  frozen and it 's not possible to change. I  asked for the  bus which did not work for  us most of  the time. Was  told to report  and no instructions  of where or  when

Fantastic flight. Travelled solo from London  Airport to Glasgow  using British Airway’s Club Europe cabin and could not fault one aspect of the service. I arrived at Gatwick around 2  hours prior to departure. All BA Club World passengers  is entitled to fast track security  at Gatwick. This  was quick and the staff were  friendly enough. The  cabin at Gatwick was clean and modern and made  for a nice relaxing start to  the journey. Boarding was quick and  my flight departed on-time and landed  20 minutes early, the crew were  incredibly attentive and  friendly The in-flight meal was delicious (I had smoked  trout served with curried rice). Overall a really lovely  flying experience. Had there been ever-so-slightly more leg room  for in-flight entertainment I’d have given this flight 10/10! A fantastic crew who were a credit to the airline.

Rio De Janeiro  to London Heathrow. Love this aircraft, only a 3  Class Business, World Traveller Plus and  First Class. 2 Cabins in Business  Class Front 3 rows and Rear 2 Rows. I  liked seat 3A,  in my opinion the seat, Window seat with a bit more space than the usual seat (at 6'4'' a little extra helps) very private , behind second galley area, toilet is over the other side J/K.  Finally settled in to sleep and did not have an evening meal.  Airlines very accommodating as they offered water bottles immediately. A good few  hours sleep as  usual and woke up about 10 minutes before breakfast. I really enjoyed  the fruit, yoghurt,  juice and the full English Breakfast.  All in all great service, Good flight and felt  very relaxed.

Gatwick to Tirana. I was incredibly disappointed by the service provided on this flight, because  there was virtually  nowhere for me to differentiate what made this flight different from being in economy. Business class passengers boarded at the same time as economy class passengers, there was no curtain dividing economy class from business class, and the people in economy class had taken the liberty of removing my cabin bag  in my space above my seat, to three seats behind me. . The seats were the same seats you have in economy, the difference being that the middle seat is empty, thus creating  a divide between window and aisle seats.  I encountered odd problems with the meal as well - the lovely cabin crew member notified me that I had no other choice but to eat pasta for dinner because other choices had finished. You are better off in economy as you pay less and get the same service. Flight left on time and landed early. British Airways have in my opinion the  best inflight W-Fi service. For 10 pounds you get unlimited, very high speed wi-fi where you can stream YouTube videos. They offer cheaper packages as well where  they can get unlimited texts.

Welcome to London . Cabin crew  were amazing. Weather  was terrifying as  I drove to  London airport so  I knew things  was going to  get tough. Expecting  some delay and  seeing other European  flights were cancelled , expected the  worst but then  pleasantly surprised to  find our flight  was Snow in  freezing conditions, we were surprised but  happily settled in  comfortable seats. Crew  very friendly and  the long story  long after 3  days on the  runway waiting for  our di-icing machine  it finally made  it way to  lift off. All  the staff were  so relaxed and  friendly with all  travellers including those  that had connecting  as they sat  with each one  and personally looked  over their options  and BA online  forums to help . Non-alcoholic drinks  or snacks were  provided during this  time The first  person kept us  awake all the  time that is  clearly not BA  and that the  fuel machine was  working so much  needed procedures done  and were ready  for take-off. How  our pilot and  staff managed this  in these conditions  you will never  guess but it was a smooth  get off an  hour through the  airport a smooth  journey all the  time back to  the Cabin crew  and excellent service.  After business we  are lucky to  receive champagne and  the meals were  excellent Veg shepherds  cheese and chicken  soup both lovely.  I just want  a thank you  all We know  I get a  ton of negative  feedback but this  is to say  you can't fault  you Particularly the  manager who made  a real effort  and talk to all of us.  Well done.
The economy and you’ll be paying  less for an  excellent service. The  bus to Vancouver  Airport uses old  of the oldest  of entertainment systems and my food  tastes inedible.

A partner and  I spent Christmas  at Tokyo. The  flight over was  amazing the staff  very polite and  helpful and it  actually ran smoothly.  The experience back  there was completely  opposite The staff  is incredibly rude  and lazy. The  plane was 12 pm and mid  route my partner  went for a  glass of water.  One lady very  politely said she  was going the  wrong way and  told my partner  her head to  the back and  get herself. My  partner headed to  further back where  the were two  older ladies sitting and when requested  they pointed to a shelf my  partners got the  water from. Both  their TV's stopped  in mid flight , for a  delay of 40  minutes We asked  the staff if  they could fix  our problem. The  lady said she  would try while  waiting As 25  yr olds deciding  over which airline  carrier to remain  committed to I  can tell you  US Airways will  probably be it.  Poor customer service.

Back to Hong Kong. At the  entrance to the BA business lounge  there was a  note saying Silver  and Gold members only. My membership  was just dropped  into bronze while  the wife's remained at silver. At  a reception desk  we asked why  she wasn't allowed and was only told I could  enter as a guest of my wife's. When I got to the entrance we showed  the boarding passes and I can  just assume the  lady must have overheard our previous conversation as my  wife was asked if she was bringing me in as her guest. No warm greeting, just a job's  usual high handed attitude. Neither of the BA reps bothered to check my boarding pass properly. Had they done so they would have seen that it was a business class ticket and I had the right  to enter under my own steam ! Fortunately the cabin staff were friendly and much nicer.

Los Angeles to  London Heathrow. If  you could give  this a zero stars I would. They have the worst customer service. I’ve flown many airlines around the world with my family, but surely we will never  go with British  airlines again. They gave our seats  priority on the return flight and would not address this after purchasing expensive business class  ticket 4.5 months in advance to  guarantee that our family flew 12  hr flight together. The flight to London didn’t have the best service,  the toilets were out of service. The beds in business class are the most uncomfortable  among all business  flights I’ve flown. The check-in process at Heathrow was disastrous. The most inefficient process with  no human assistances. The limited ones available were all slammed with line  up customers. I  highly highly suggest you refrain from using this carrier. I wish I would have done a bit of research prior to  flying with them.

London to London. We had to  wait for ages  to check into  the flight after being advised to turn up 3  hours before departure time to check ! We had to wait for  20 minutes before  our check in  crew turned up. Once they did,  BA staff were  cold and rude.  Entered the flight and there was  NO IFE, no  soft drink or  water or   a map to  find the flight. The onboard crew were a bit  rude Serving M&S  sandwiches for purchase.  Our flight was  not delayed by too much and relatively smooth. However  our BA product is now tired and slightly pathetic. </s>

London to Bucharest.  On my flight , hot food finished half way through - I  got seated on  row 22 and  at the time  my food cart  passed my row, there were no  tables left to  eat The fitting  in the cabin  is horrendous. Seat  change from one  row to the  other 24h before  take off cost me an additional 13 gbp.

London Heathrow to  Janeiro De Janeiro.  All the usual  flights for this route but it is one of my favourites, this  flight today has a First Class  which was flown empty as it  normally only offers Club World. Flight not full, Seated  in 7F aisle  and no one in the middle seat so very pleasant. It is away from the Toilet over at 7A/B but next  to galley area which was great as it is a day flight.  Food (pre-ordered) was very good as usual, plenty of drinks offered crew  was keen to assist, again nothing any trouble at all. I did  rent some films , I had already been on a previous BA Long Haul so was not really  looking for much.  I had some  drinks as it was a long day and I getting a cold!  Started late due to a technical problem at Heathrow, they managed to fix the problem on the taxiway to the runway but after an hour I must say I didn't really need to  get told they were trying to  solve the problem rather than return to the departure gate. All in all another very good flight.

Return to Athens.  These aircraft and  the flight quality were good, but they don't provide  sufficient food and drink. It was  clear they did  already have sufficient supply for goods  they were selling, so it ended .

Welcome to London.  Travel slow, had to wait for  buses which were  delayed Also packed  into buses to tight with people.  Parking too far  to arrival terminals. Service bad from  London Coming to  terminal 5 is  The worst terminal on Heathrow. The food and beverage on board was  bad for the  price For the  cost of the  same ticket the  entire experience was way below expected  cost and time  with staff.

Budapest to Billund , via London on 18 and  20 Dec. 2019. A320 aircrafts. Check-In in Budapest had a narrow timeslot  and 2 hours  before departure with  long queues. I  was not recognised  an Oneworld elite flyer (hold a Gold Card with Qatar Airways) at check-in and had  to struggle to  have 2 bags  marked as inscribed  as I was  denied lounge access as QR does  indeed honour 3rd party lounges any  longer unless flying on QR. There is no Oneworld  elite lounge in Budapest, so BA uses Menzies Lounge who would not accept me unless I was with  an entitled Oneworld , different from  British Airways. For  that I do  NOT have status.  Only London granted access to any  private lounge. Onboard,  food and drinks  at hefty price  and  water is not free.  Bars were full,  all on time. I found that the onboard charity  run by FAs  were inappropriate and intrusive. Luggage delivered perfectly. Return trips (2 legs) were both full flights but departed slightly early. Granted lounge  service in Billund  to the decent King Amlet and BA Galleries First in T3 in London. Loads of  good hot foods , good beers , wines. Onboard , is no IFE, no seat recline. Mediocre, not  ideal But the  lounge is among  the best in Oneworld and the gold status of  membership is very  nice

we recently flew  to Cape Town in South Africa  to London to . It was our anniversary and  we were treated  to a glass of bubbly after  lift off. The staff were so friendly and I  cannot even complain about the food  serving on board. Which I might add I seldom enjoy food served on flights.

Flying to Toulouse via Singapore / London. Boeing 777 and IFE ancient,  customer comfort and service superb. Highlight ing the TLS-LHR  was a (£5.50)  festive treat with  pumpkin pie, christmas  & brandy butter cream combined with  some G&T hit  sweet spot. You  could argue it  could be free , I’m not  complaining  I  will miss the  high quality of  food but compared  with the ME 200 you’re still  very good.

Welcome to London. A good overall experience. Departure experience let down by poor airport lounge in Sofia, and complete failure to  obtain priority boarding.  Flight experience generally good, and arrival  service at Heathrow very good and  comfortable

My husband and I had a  short flight to  London the cabin  staff were very  relaxed and nothing was too much . Josey and  the team were  throughout the the journey amazing, having flown with Virgin  over many years, I can say it’s night and  Day Tank you, your staff are amazing we will be British Airways in the future, many thanks.

London to Munich BA956 on 21 December, delayed by 25 mins. Dated not very clean A320. Boarding process was slow and  advised passengers to check their hand . Turns out  bag is half empty. No complementary drinks and snacks  will be served on this flight with buy onboard in economy. Never again.

Hong Kong to London. I booked  a return ticket for my sister though BA, provided travel document details they required. However when we got to the airport we found out  my sisters middle name was not  with her ticket and it therefore  cannot match her passport name. They refused to let  me fly, after  much hassle and my sister getting a temporary visa, they enable her  to fly. However,  on landing in  England I acknowledged that she may have the same problem flying back to Taiwan. Igot  lost contact with BAs' executive phone helpline service, yet spending a day  talking to them  may have only caused me to speak to numerous different people all telling me to do different things. We have still  NOT resolved the issue of her  ticket not having her middle name on. BA are refusing to alter  the ticket information to add my  sister middle name onto the ticket. They have not been helpful on the phone when i asked them to add her  middle name and  were not interested in try to  resolve the issue at hand. They were insistent on  speak to my sister who is from Taiwan and I told them  she is unable to speak english and that i can translate any question for her. They did not allow this so she was put on the phone  and they only spoke English to her.

My husband and I used British Airways to fly from London to Paris this past August. When we arrived at airport we needed to pay for bags, was charged 4 times for one bag after I was assured charges didn't go through. Have been trying  and get a refund from BA since. They give you a phone number to call for these claims  ONLY to never answer the phone! They have you do a claim online only to never respond to your emails. I sent them the  financial statements and  a card statement showing that I had been charged 4 times for one bag. Only  3 months later did they finally respond to the claim, claiming I had two bags and despite the fact that I sent documentation showing 4 charges and confirmed with bank  / credit card that the charges had gone through, they only saw two charges and since I had two bags they didn't owe me any money. They force you to communicate via email and then don't respond they owe me $258 USD and refuse to give me my money at this point.

New York to  London I was  also the last  flight out at  6 pm and  it is clearly  the cheaper version  by all respects.  The Boeing  777 certainly showed its age. IFE screen was tiny,  it was well . The flight  time was quick  2 hours) and  thats about it.  It is highly  unusual to the  level of being unfriendly to me.  The F& B was standard and not taken as  we had eaten  there earlier. I'm a One World  ticket and the  gate manager did  not greet me.  What a small  flight and in the grand scheme  that things means  nothing but is  no acknowledgement that you spend time  and money with  a carrier (usually  only by a  mile or two). </s>

Back to London.  As with an  agreed purchase price for each of  our roundtrip tickets  of my wife and daughter, BA  charged an additional  fee for seat  reservation to ensure they sat together.  When they went  to check in, those seat reservations (in both directions) had been given away and family had to sit  in different seats. Back home, I  asked for a refund of the $250 seat fee and was told there was no proof I paid  with them. I have credit card charges and email  receipts clearly stating  the charges were made, but there is no process  or upload those documents to BA.

Frankfurt to London . British Airways. Awful airline. Put me and my  friend at opposite  end of the plane even though we booked together. Gave me middle seat even though many others were free. A childish airline which charges a premium and then goes out to make the journey difficult for you if you  do book biz class. Avoid.

Flying to Glasgow with British Airways. Flight is again delayed it’s not  because it’s a  one off as  it delayed every week like a  big joke. Really  a poor yet  extremely expensive airline  which I wouldn’t recommend to any  one

London to San Francisco. This flight  was a delight. Friendly, relaxed crew, good food and  drink and a main deck Club World cabin that was nearly empty. If you manage your expectations with BA Club World and everything goes as it should then you shouldn't be disappointed. Yes the rollout of the new Club World Suite has been a long time coming however the food service  had improved considerably - BA are trying valiantly to  reclaim their long gone moniker of  " Favourite Airline". The 747 has seen better days however given they're being removed from most airline's passenger  schedules you should take the opportunity to fly one before they're gone. I'm gradually regaining  my confidence in BA.

Flying to Belfast.  Great service in  Dublin but absolutely  horrendous in T5 at Heathrow. Very rude check in  process when told we had to  fill out boarding  pass and also for our suitcases.  Quite disgusted. Cabin ets were lovely  on the 12.40 am to Belfast on 9th December.

London to Singapore. I was apprehensive about flying BA Club World after reading many negative  reviews I was however, surprised. Firstly, they are not on part with SQ or QR - but to be fair, I found them to be one of the most reasonably priced offerings. You get what you pay for. The  seat while old,  are perfectly comfortable with plenty of  padding The window seats are best for privacy. I am tall and  experienced no issues . In fact, I slept for almost 7 hours.  Customer service and food out of London was top notch, fresh and plentiful, which is a welcome contrast to the tiny meals you receive  in Qantas. Service was consistent, polite and very attentive.  Sugar and water continually topped up. I was truly impressed The return  trip service was  below average and quite sloppy but let’s focus on the positives!

Toulouse to London. I'm a able bodied, fit BA customer and Silver member and was seated at an Emergency Exit seat. I'd put away all items and had fastened my seatbelt in full compliance of regultions. A cabin crew member, came to  the row to point out the security exit and safety card and I was listening to him and responding, despite this he ordered me to take out my cabin pressure , which he called earplugs. I explained to him that I needed to keep them on to protect my ears as the doors were already closed and I can suffer from ear problems  when I fly. I told him  i could hear him perfectly, as demonstrated by our vocal exchange. Despite this, he kept talking over me and threatened to  eject me from my seat should I fail to follow his order. After I begrudgingly took them off, he once again ordered me to do it or be removed from my seat and I pointed out I already had! I then asked to speak to the purser, who came to see me after take off. I told him his cabin crew member was unnecessarily rude and needed Customer Care training or indeed to look for a new job. I wrote in to British Airways with my complaint,  however they have  never even bothered to respond. Awful, rude airline.

London Heathrow to Stockholm. Business class  flight is what it is. Seats  roughly the same  size in economy but with no one sitting in the middle seat.  Instead you get served drinks and  a Proper gin for the G&T and good food.

Johannesburg to London. We had limited recline seats on  the 11 hour  long flight. At checked in we asked and were  told we had good seats. Completed a complaint and asked why BA thought this was  true how come  their representatives are allowed to lie. Never flying BA again.

Johannesburg to London.  The recently refurbished First and Club World lounge at  BA has failed to resolve the  problems when passengers from the two evening flights to  Manchester descend on it. There's more table space for eating and the food has improved,  but poor acoustics mean intrusion on  flights Crying babies and facetime calls add to the restless maelstrom of human activity. Boarding was reasonably quick although there was the usual confusion  in group queues. The predominantly young,  young fleet crew  seemed competent but lacked finesse and  communication on getting drinks orders muddled. The meal service  takes ages because of some unidentified problem with heating  our main course.  the food itself wasn't at all  bad - when it was finally served. The cabin temperature wasn't too  bad and we both slept quite well. Arrival was  15 minutes ahead  of schedule and baggage collection was quick. Overall, a good flight despite the aged Club World product.

London Heathrow to Miami. Flying the Boeing 747-400. Unfortunately  BA hasn't done much work on  the first class  for these aircraft.  These are flat , but you  have that wedge  on the front that even for my 6'1" makes the beds small.  Also since it's so narrow your  feet get clamped  so you sleep  onto your side.  These seats are  business class on for example Qatar ! And I still think a  first class ticket  would include WiFi! But as always  customer service excel and the crew are so friendly , helpful. Meals  were impeccable.

Back to London ! As always  he works excellent with service. On the ground and  in the air. They still have  some good gin  range for a decent G&T and  so if the meals in Business  is like the  food from the  UK economy they  look great.

London to Sydney via Singapore. Flight left on time  and crew where fantastic. Meals were great. Leaving London  I had a chicken stir fry  before landing into  Australia at 18:00  and were served  traditional English breakfast  which I can eat any time  of day but wife thought it  spoiled a bit ! At Singapore, all passengers had  to disembark the aircraft while it  was refuelled and . When re-boarding  you had to  sit through a  bag check at  the gate. We were on the  ground in Singapore  in 1hour 30min. 2nd leg to  Singapore was great  the food and  room service was great again. 23 hr long haul flight was comfortable. We had exit row seating for  the flight which I recommend to anyone over 6ft !

London to New York JFK. We 'd booked on Brussels Airlines, two of us, which  cancelled the flight and rerouted us  to BA. The flight BRU to London was fine but the transatlantic leg and Heathrow 's Terminal 5 were utter nightmares.  NEVER again will I go to or through Heathrow. However, this review is about BA's 747-400 to JFK  an aircraft that 's in such  dire sorry state that it should have been junked  long ago. How does BA have  any gall to call its service "business class"? The  aircraft were tiny and wrapped in plastic chicken coop partitions that rattled , even fell  down on several ! Let me add that we faced backwards and looked at a filthy wall. Cabin service was friendly  and the food was actually quite decent. Aside from that, I now understand why BA  is such a horrendous and well-deserved  apology Never again.

The first thing  being the shortage of staff. The  Business cabin is  quite large and eight across and  needs to be serviced by one  or two people each side. It  seemed that the  menu after takeoff did not appear  until an hour after the order was taken. Unfortunately  when they were  arriving the staff were not up to the mark  and appeared very undertrained. I asked a young man  to turn on the reading light and he claimed  there weren't any.  They showed him the one by  one seat and  while fiddling with  it he said  there must be ? At the end of the  flight I discovered  a switch. Despite  being a newly  converted plane the dividing screen kept dropping. I had  also ask for a cup of tea 3 times. There was only  one choice of  three reds and  2 white wines and considering the number of people  on the business  class I cannot  imagine why they  would not offer a third. There was Port  of the menu  but was never offered with cheese. Every time the next course came  up the setting was not ready to accept it due to plates and glasses from previous course. Many  customers had clutter  wait for an hour after end of meal. Most  of the courses were quite small , and by the end of the meal I was ready for a mini snack. I am not  a big eater but I was  disappointed The layout of the business cabin is cramped. I am 6' and I could  hardly stretch out.  The seats and  rows are extremely narrow and people in the centre  seat rows and the window seats  tend to climb over other passengers. This means no  passenger has a  comfortable seat. You either have to climb or be climbed over. I wonder how they can expect such a bad design  and be accepted in the business . I travel  for many airlines  in business and  it is still the bottom of the pile and  probably the last one I would use. The centre  and window seats  get their food and drinks served  directly through the service hatch across other customers. Unfortunately,  on arrival at Bridgetown the BA  experience didn't get  any better. After one hour 25 minutes of waiting for my fast  food luggage I approached a guy wearing a BA  badge and he  just shrugged his  head I then found another guy  he worked for the ground staff and he went outside and found  about 25 cases  sitting by the  window doing nothing. .

Brussels to Bangkok  to London. Club  flight from London  to Bangkok on  16 Nov 2019,  seats 15C and  D It was  a Boeing 777,  with a 2-4-2  crew configuration in the business cabin,  that gives the  cabin a crowded  layout The seats  are comfortable, with  one flat bed  and good selection  and entertainment, although  still rather small  space The food  service offers different  kinds of starters,  second course and  soup The food  were disappointing, I  chose smoked salmon  as a starter,  with British Beef  as main course.  The soup was  mediocre mybeef was overcooked) and quantity  was economy class-like.  The service is  really friendly, but  very personal. I’m  supposed to be adressed by my  seat when I  fly business class.   While serving  their meals, they forget serving me . The amount  the cabin crew  are not enough  on a crowded  business class cabin.  During dinner I  tried to sleep. The seat is  made into a real bed, with  no extra mattress , a good . The space  is narrow, it  is difficult to make the bed.  If the bed  is made, there  is no place  you put   my stuff. I  have a real  full night of  sleep though. If  your seat is  not at the  bottom you have to step over  the legs to  go to the  bathroom The toilets  look small and  were not cleaned  often enough. When  we woke up, breakfast service was  slow  The  menu is good.  Fresh Yoghurt, pastries,  some fruit, and  spoke full English  service Overall, British  Airlines World Club  was a rather  crowded Business Class,  lacks personalized attention  but lacks the  same good experience. . If BA  want to compete, they have a long way to . I hope  BA can make  it up a bit on our  next flight.

San Francisco to  Frankfurt via London. The head support  got damaged, so I had to sit 10 hours  straight forward. The flight from San  Francisco was delayed,  so I missed  a connecting flight  from London to  which I came  in to the  departure counter, but  got a new  seat 3 hours  20 minutes later.  Flight staff gave  us a voucher  worth 15 GBP.

I had a connection flight from London to Berlin, traveling with hand luggage. I got  into a automatic  security gate and the man at  the gate said , I need  not check my  bag  He  had no right  to grab my passport and boarding pass. If the  plane is full they should check  the lockers if  they arent any  bins which should  get put under seats and where  there fits more  than luggage. The  plane arrived in  Berlin 7 minutes late.

On to Johannesburg  by British Airways. BA’s B gates  lounge is a  slightly more civilised  place to pass time than the  Grand Lounges in  its main terminal.  Its also a  bit closer on  ground transit -  and via the  more useful walkway  on level -4  - to the  C gates where  all A380s depart ). The new  flights by groups  meant snaking queues,  and at least  Gate 2 moved  on speedily. The  Small World were  about the same,  much maligned seats  and the small,  empty IFE screens  offering limited selection  on films. The  taxi service was  poor because of  the unwise introduction  of individual trays  attached to each . Trolleys may  have glamour, but  it does get  you to sleep  even on an  expensive flight. Breakfast  is adequate but  nothing more. Landing was exactly on ! Overall, a  good flight but  our inflight service  was distinctly average.

Flight to Bangalore. My flight from  Dubai to London , 10 November  2015 was delayed  for 4 hours  which resulted in  us missing the  connecting flight. My  flight from London  via Bangalore was  again delayed by  4 hrs. We  was assigned a  boarding gate and  after waiting at  our gate for  20 mins announcement  being made the  flight was delayed  for 27mins due to maintenance.

London to Sydney  from Singapore. I would like to express my thanks  and appreciation to the staff at  my bag drop  point at Heathrow  when I lost  the passport on  Wednesday evening -21st . They spent  over 2 hours trying to locate it and it  WAS eventually found  30 mins before my flight was  due to leave. A big thank you to you , I would  especially like to  mention the cabin  attendants on flight  7 to Sydney -22 November who were so kind . I was  so ill during  the flight, I  felt looked after  so well.

Lisbon to London. I pay extra  and check my  luggage to ensure  i am not  occupying more than my share of overhead space. To  see British Airways  charging me 50 Euros to check a bag to  my final destination, and then insist  that my briefcase  is put under the seat, in a cramped aircraft, to ensure there is room in the overhead bin for travelers too cheap to check their bags, is an insult. Will never fly BA again.

BA operate daily  services from London  via Glasgow, its  a busy route  so I'm sure  my money plus  time is no  issue However, BA  buses are rarely  on time and  BA fee paying  passengers are fed  stories about the  service was delayed  due from some  further flung exotic  destination Because I  take several buses  and trains to  London after I  left Glasgow punctuality  meant a lot  for me and  costs a lot  about BA hence I'm very disappointed  about the service  we provide.

London to London.  Very good flight,  smooth departure and  good arrival by  people very very attentive and friendly  people especially towards children. Food was  good since from  menu clearly announced  to passengers. Bag arrival was ok.  Great leg room and entertainment beyond  any expectation.

London to Buenos Aires. We paid  money on top of our holiday  package to fly with them as it was a direct flight. Firstly  we cancelled our flight a few months before departure, meaning we had to go a day earlier and pay an extra night in a . The plane was old and  slow making it difficult to get up and walk  about during the 14 hour flight. The entertainment system  seemed pathetic. Not  one film choice, a random selection  of tv programmes, and no games. The drinks service was lacking, my food was awful and there were no snacks offered in between. On other long haul flights we have had comfort packs with toothbrush/toothpaste etc, no such offerings.

San Francisco to London. A380 is a wonderful aeroplane.  Engine selection was below average. Staff  were polite. Fist time I used the call button  a response was fast, but on  another occasion I was repeatedly ignored  the button for  20 minutes. I don’t see how  it is acceptable.

Welcome to Singapore  with British Airways.  Locked in like  trash in a  tin can. What a disappointment of  this airline. They  check you in,  so even getting  to your seat  is a debacle  owing to the  cramped nature of  your flight configuration.  To awkwardly stare  at your fellow  flyers who sit  just opposite you  trying not to  even gaze. My  flight was so  low to the  window that at  points it felt  as people were  crawling over me  trying get past  a narrow passage ! Would not , could not  fly this airline.  Economy seats are  at best premium economy.

London to Mauritius. We are fortunate  however to have flown with many different airlines including low cost carriers and also upper class cabins on other premium airlines. Without a shadow of a doubt,  this whole British Airways experience is the poorest of  them all both with the aeroplanes and seats, the general service and experience but more importantly the poor customer service following the bad flight. I truly feel that this airline deserves to go bust because of  the truly disgraceful approach to service and the product they deliver. I begrudge flying with them and given the option I always choose a  cheaper airline.

Los Angeles to  London via London.  Due to delayed  lift off I  was missing my  connecting flight. Thanks to the excellent  airline host service,  Sarah and her colleague, I managed  not be on . Thank you  so much.

London to Vancouver. I used to fly this aircraft and route for many years until it was no longer priced competitively. I flew on the 14th and it was a remarkably bad experience. Food service was very poor in most aspects. I had the chicken tandoori which was far too spicy for most palettes. No drink was offered with the meal which was astonishing. Rather, tea and coffee an obviously far cheaper offering was supplied soon after the dinner tray was handed. I had to ask twice for a beer before it was delivered.This then put me out of sync with the service. The one time (yes one time!) offer of  tea and coffee was then obviously missed by me completely. Service itself was not good with no warmth or hospitality. On a 9hr flight engagement is pretty critical! Our hostess/host seemed to be only interested in those sitting in  their extra legroom seats and essentially ignored everyone else. The cold snack  is a cold tasteless sandwich just prior to landing. The entertainment system is a joke as it is so old. I had become so accustomed to a  large TV screen that I was blown away that this system was still in place. The screen size was the equivalent of your phone’s. No music selection  needed talking about so I just used my iPad. On this or similar routes I have flown Air Canada, WestJet, Virgin Atlantic, Air Transat. BA was by far the worst and some of those airlines are budget in nature and offer paid meals only. I cannot believe that the mighty BA offers such a terrible product in 2019. I will spend more to fly better and actively avoid BA on long haul.

My flight departure  is delayed due  of what the  pilot described in  an announcement as  another "mix up" with paperwork. Disembarkation was delayed due to what he also described as a "mix up" with landing bridge .. So the  passengers had to taxi around the  terminal until a gate was found.  They missed our  scheduled flight. The  man in purple  at the airport  which are supposed  To help passengers  on connecting flights didn’t know what  they do. We  end up being  transferred onto another  plane resulting in  another four hour  wait All of  that inconvenience is due to BA’s incompetent management. My  luggage would not  work and the  food was just carbohydrate filigree. The  poor attendants are  terrible It used  only be a  great airline.

From Heathrow to Lisbon. Mediocre. The flight was very smooth and arrived  in time. Cabin service left a great deal to  be desired and staff seemed to be just going  thru the motions. No bread roll  was offered during  customer service and  despite requesting a  bottle of wine  to accompany the meal this was  neither forthcoming and  it required a  drink before it was delivered. Not  another great Club Europe experience.

Flight to Boston. Comfortable flight in  business class. Food was fairly good both ways - dinner for the  departing flight west , the returning  leg flight east. Got some solid  meals in on the flight back.

Tirana to London Gatwick. I fly British Airways around  three times a month thanks to  our work, and  while I almost  never have a pleasant experience, this past flight definitely  surpassed all the  above We boarded and departed exactly on time, with a very friendly and welcoming crew.  Although the flight  being fully booked, my travel companion and I were  lucky that no one was sitting  across our row , that we  should have an  extra middle seat, and therefore more  comfortable The best  part of this flight by far  is the availability  for Wi-Fi which I have never  seen on any other British Airways  flight within Europe.  In fact, the  entire package I  received which included  unlimited texting, was  free and incredibly  fast - as  good as my  internet connection! This truly made this  trip more enjoyable  as it allowed me to continue my business even during the flight  and is extremely valuable to me. Something that British  Airways can improve on would be  seat space, which in this flight I noticed was  quite tight, although that is a  big problem for  me as I am 1.88 cm ! Also, for unknown reasons, no food or snacks  were served on this 2 hours  15 minute flight, only drinks. This was a slight struggle as I  almost skipped breakfast, but I managed . The flight  eventually arrived ahead  the schedule and we de-boarded quickly.  Would always recommend  it - and will continue to  do so.
Back to St Lucia. Great service  on this flight.  Thank you very  much for the  flight and the  excellent cabin crew. Excellent Service.

London to Singapore.  You have to  commend BA staff  on this occasion. They were friendly, welcoming and so  helpful to passengers throughout the flight. Even in the  first few moments they were laughing and joking with  us Highly professional  and sensitive to our needs despite their own tiredness. Thank you BA for making a  stressful journey a  great one.

London to San Francisco return in Economy. The seats are small. Outbound was bearable because there was an empty seat between the two of us but returning no empty seat  - it was horrible. I'm only 5'5 and female but couldn't lean down to the seat in front  behind me to collect my belongings.  If you want to get anything  in your bag below the seat in front of you, you will  want to do  a major maneuvering. Touching the person next to you throughout the flight is unavoidable. I 'm on a 747 both ways. They no longer have any air vents you can adjust so both flights got stuffy  or warm. I had to ask them to turn up the a/c both ways. I was literally sweating. Economy is small with the aircraft mostly made up of Business Class. Asian Vegetarian meal was good as usual although the  smell was terrible. Asian Vegetarian breakfast in Economy Plus is much better. I will find an alternative airline for my long  haul flights. It's not worth it.

Back to Venice. I have flown  this route and  returned on two  occasions and been  happy with all . On the  first trip we both had mobility  difficulties and the  drop in operator immediately suggested their assistance service. It  seemed welcome and  convenient particularly as the gate was  the very distant one. The flight  was to time.  Our cabin staff  were pleasant, the food was good.  the flight information  on the flight deck was good.  The landings were  very smooth. The return journey was  equally good. I  was very satisfied.

Bordeaux to Gatwick. British Airways cancelled my September 11  flight due to  their pilots strike, with advance notice.  We made alternative travel arrangements, confirmed that I wanted to to cancel from my end in order to  claim a refund,  I received confirmation  with BA on  1 August 2019.  They refunded my  money soon enough, but I am still awaiting a refund for the 70 Euro cost of baggage that I paid - six weeks later. I lodged a complaint on 9th October. No action. I lodged another  complain on 25th  December and still no action. They cancelled my flight, and won't refund  the money. And they call it Customer Service!

Seychelles to London. Day time flight  in to London.  Customers were very welcoming greeted on entry to aircraft and shown to  window 7 J/K, Best seats as a couple to book as they are away from the toilet in the front cabin and the window K seat has direct access to the aisle. On-time  service and swift meal services, nothing was any trouble  at all and the flight was full. Easy access  to the club kitchen after meal , and great entertainment, I have  booked this flight  twice and love the inbound day time flight to London the easiest to travel on.  WiFi and screens worked great and no problems. I  loved every minute of the flight.  Very big thank you to all the staff who were fantastic. Looking forward to my next flight to  London in December

London to Belfast.  UK Airways bullied  your parents and spoilt a special  day I booked  the parents on  BA to attend  an investiture at the Palace. My mother had a  cardiac attack 3 months ago and  this was her first flight post recovery and I had chosen BA  as the best  quality of service.  However they were  both appallingly and  repeatedly bullied by  BA airline staff. My mother suffers  with claustrophobia and  often requests an aisle seat and I booked my parents on 2 aisle seats side  by side. I  filled their boarding passes out myself  on seats 24c  & 24d. On  arrival at check-in, one of the  board passes was  not recognised by the scanner so  I printed out  another new one.  On going through  Customs the boarding pass was again  not recognised and  no new pass  was printed. Once my parents arrived  in the gate  they noticed that one of the  passes had been  changed My father explained the situation but the rep at check-in started  with the ‘Geneva  passengers that BA  was only contracted  with get them  to A to  B and could change seats if  we wanted. Waiting  at the gate  to try and resolve the situation , eventually with 5 minutes before  boarding they were  let into the aircraft and forced  ot sit apart  having no care for their welfare  nor circumstances. At no stage did  I receive any  encouraging words. For  parents recovering from  the heart attack,  this was an  incredibly stressful event and spoilt what had been a  lovely family occasion.  They have been  hanging on with  a hope that  their slide from grace will halt  yet seem to be constantly disappointed.  I will await  a response to  both parents; I know they will  NEVER fly the  airline again but  we will be  paying back my BA Amex and  loyalty points if  the appropriate apology  is not issued.  No update! In  general don’t trust  someone with your  young ones care.

London to Cape : We had booked business class  about a year  into advance for a trip to  where I usually fly Star Alliance, but picked BA  in a segment  with better connection  options through London  and Cape Town. This was a  major mistake. I had tried to reserve seats on  their website twice  but was not able to do so. Then I  decided to call  them twice and  hung up after being on hold for an hour  this time with  the call back option. When we  landed today in  London from Toronto at the connections desk, seven hours before our flight, we were told  the business class  was oversold and we would be  bumped to premium economy. BA’s representative told us that  because we did not have reserved seats, we were  on the bottom  in the list for business class,  and that loyalty  members would all have priority for  seats over us,  and we would  not be welcome  into the lounge,  as if this was a bonus). Then there was a problem for  getting to clear  clearance to get  into the lounge,  and they could  not print our  security passes (due to the down grade). It took  up to an hour to get  checked into the  room from the  time we first  arrived at the  connecting desk. We  tried to speak to a manager,  but at each  of our four  stops with BA  staff we were told that they  could get some to speak with  them giving the impression that they were trying to  scare off unhappy  customers as fast  if they could. At one point  they got visibly  agitated after the  gate staff issuing  our new boarding  pass indicated that  the down grade  were voluntary, which it definitely was ! After two and a half  hours BA customer  service managers came to speak with us. They were  our first ones  they were actually  friendly and tried to address the situation from a  customer oriented perspective. If British Airways , giving bulkhead  seats in premium  economy and basic lounge access to  our business class  which is adequate  enough service for  a downgrade from  a paid business  flight on our upcoming overnight flight, I will not  consider booking flights  with BA again.

from Jose to : The TV screen of 12F was broken, could not be locked into position that would allow to watch movies. Flight  attendants could not  fix it, and suggested to move to a different  one which we slipped on purpose  when checked in. The back of the seat in  particular was dirty.  The tray on  flight 12D where  breakfast was moved  also had a  crack on the right side, and  the TV screen  was not sensitive  enough to be be operated by touch. Although my  husband in 12E and me turned in the breakfast cards together, the  flight attendant insisted  I don’t have  time and was  not planning to wake him up and serve him !  Flight  crews were doing  our best, but  it seems that  we were understaffed.

From Heathrow to  Southampton Boarding efficient.  It was full so passengers asked to volunteer to check in hand , By doing  this they would  gain priority boarding. I took up the offer, too out my laptop and carried it on to the plane. The aircraft  is only two months old and I was sat at the back  of the plane - 36 F.  I am sure Ryanair have more room. British Airways  using this aircraft are offering an ultra low cost  experience under a cloak of legacy  airline legitimacy.

Flight from Gatwick to Barbados. Check in and business lounge were good. It looks like they had added champagne to the self service drinks  that is a positive. Breakfast was good. Flight left on time boarding well run. I have not flown in their economy cabin for a while and it seems ok. New  seats but that does come with  a IFE system which is way  better than the old Rockwell Collins systems. Food was fine and service friendly.

we were not supposed to be  flying this flight but had been bumped from our Icelandair flight and  booked onto BA direct from Toronto  via London Heathrow.  So tried to get it changed as we were  about to fly into Gatwick. The  flight was quite  pleasant Service was  excellent and the chicken tikka masala  very tasty. The  message onboard was  the flight was on time, and  flight was amazingly smooth.

I was travelling from Jeddah to London with a bag. I arrive 1 hour 30 minutes earlier but the check in counter was closed,  i tried my best but there  were no staff to help me so I have to leave my  luggage as I  was not allowed to take the bag on the plane. In London I made a complaint but they were saying that we can’t do any thing and to get through to customer service the phone call takes about 1 hour and 47 minutes of wait

Zurich to London return. Both legs travelled with hand  bags only, and I could not choose a seat  before paying. Fair enough but when there are 3  full rows either  direction of 3 strangers cramped into  one row and not allowed spread out as they had not paid , premium price seems mean to  argue the least. Hand Luggage fares are last to board, make them uncomfortable on board, no free food nor drink.

San Francisco to  Seattle Efficient check  out by friendly  staff who offered  the upgrade to  seat at $760  per person which  we declined. Refurbished  cabin was spacious , comfortable with  the selection of  amenities Boarding on  site but could  of been better controlled. Flight left  and landed ahead  as schedule. Flight  operations were excellent  but the food  was vastly improved compared to our  previous trip. Business  class is not  recommended but we  enjoyed an excellent flight with no  problems

Welcome to Belfast.  Checking in was  quick and efficient  by using the  BA Terminal-5 First  Class check in  the security area was really good and I was  checked into the  flight Great selection  for food and  drinks early morning.  Also really like  my BA boarding  experience i.e.by Group ! The onboard  entertainment and quality  buffet breakfast served  is excellent. Overall  very happy with  my short flight  by BA.

From Gatwick to  fly with British Airways. Worst customer  service I have ever had after  changing flights due  to strike action, no response and  when we did it was weeks between getting answers only to be told it's not  your fault and  would not pay towards cost of changing flights back home.

Frankfurt to London.  Flight attendants very kind when flying in. Return flight was canceled at London City Airport and it took almost three hours to get rebooking,  boarding voucher and transportation arranged. That  can be done far more efficiently.  Limited water, nothing, no necessities.

Back to San  Jose via London.  I had an awesome experience with  one of customer  service representatives at  British Airways. I  provided them with  me to a  bank and was  led across a  lady named Florencia.  She not only  helped gather all  info (bank, address ), required for  payment but also  make the payment !! That was  just over and  thats what I  wanted Great job!  Your service is  awesome

go to London.  had poor experience my flight with  is the 2-4-2  flight is not nice as much as crowded as economical class. One  window closed (nobody  bothered to repair ), on one point BA even better than asian  but its even more freezing. why  did we need to freeze in such a 9  hour trip ?  No staff to answer my question. no staff to make it better.  A good point,  my seat are surprisingly comfortable but  nothing to make  them better.

London to Malaga.  A terminally ill airline packed with  hostile staff full  blown attitude. At the checking at Gatwick airport, I  am told the  flights might well  have delayed of 2h as not  available yet from  my SMS confirmed the delay without  the new time of departure and  without a link  on flight status.  In Gatwick, there are no arrival/departure boards prior to  departure for me  or check if  the flight was  in time as  posted online. When  contacting the BA guy at the lounge kiosk, he said I could  follow the link provided or go  through security where monitors are. Surprisingly  no flight was on time and  a text was  sent for an update. At the  landing we were  informed the aircraft  is replaced. No apologies from anyone neither ground nor  on the flight. We boarded at 5 pm and took off at  Super Stiff and no recliner seats.  All crew are  absolutely sociopathic and  FULL of attitudes. 6 additional seats are replacing the  2 toilets located at the back  of the 320  and located at  one very far end of the  aircraft in the  same crew storage room and working space is. Horrible low cost service  for a flag carrier ticket price.

Flying to London. We were not  given a seat  immediately upon check  out and were  still waiting outside  our gate for  the boarding passes to be re printed without any .. Everyone else  having a boarding pass was boarding  and about 50% were just looking  to the operators thinking what is  going on. Extremely  poor communication from  either airline to  and from the airport operators.

My flight from London to Singapore in premium economy  was the worst  we have experienced.  Our seat was uncomfortable, the flight  toilet failed after  3 hours, the breakfast prior to arrival in Singapore  (& egg) was  burnt rubber. They  ran out of  water and so  my wife and  myself had no coffee, tea or  toast with our . I used  a call button  and get some  water and no one came to  take my call even after waiting  more than 30 . Eventually I  lost contact with  a passing cabin  staff member and  explained that we  had not had  a drink and was told that  we would come back. I never saw the crew  members again.

Air Lumpur to Glasgow via London. The service started, first some drinks.  At my aisle  came a female attendant and a young male attendant.  I asked for an ale,  the attendant pretended not to understand what I was asking for. I repeated many times the word ale with my Spanish accent, but she still did not  translate it. The male attendant said “like an IPA”,  I answered “yes”.  I changed  into a beer and she offered me Amstel or Heineken, I chose Amstel and had to ask for ice  to make it drinkable. When the service  had finished the  male attendant collected the empty bottles and cans and glasses but skipped me. For the meal I chose  roast beef and asked for a  beer The male attendant realized that the empty can  were still there, took it. With the food on my and no drinks I started to eat, after  10 minutes it  was obvious that  my beer was  still coming, so I stopped another attendant going to Business class and  he came back with an option of Tiger or Heineken lager. The female attendant offered me coffee but she did not mention it was normal coffee and in the menu it said that decaf was available  unless you specifically request that. ABreakfast I was offered  milk or coffee  ( decaf), I accepted, but there  was no milk or cream for  me

From Heathrow to Seychelles. Really great , boarding was very quick, the flight was full, seats great 07 A/B Good inflight entertainment, plenty of choices. Food was good as we already pre-ordered our meals, my beef  is well done just how I  like it. After a late 30 minute delay we landed on time into Seychelles, the  crew were very attentive, lots of very demanding passengers. All in all,  a good flight  and 7 hours  without sleep

Edinburgh to London Heathrow. I have  had problems with  much of the flight crew or service while flying, everything on the  plane was fine.  On the flight  landed I rushed to the baggage  area because my  girlfriend and I had another flight  north of London and only had an hour to make it. Even though we could see the plane , watch the  cabin crew drive the bags over,  still took 45 minutes before my bag came through.  The baggage claim service desk turned  down 30 other  airline customers until  their manager could  arrive by which time I was  going to catch my next flight , a different  flight which I  missed Turns out the next flight , on our  other airline wasn’t  in another 6 days. Hoping that  Brit Airways would  support us in  any way, we went to their  own customer service , where an agent, basically told us to pound . It ended  with costing my  wife and I  over $3000 for  two tickets to get home, spent the next 20 hours in the  airport and British  Airlines refused to offer us as  a meal voucher. We will never  see this airline again.

Return to London.  This is a  small aircraft, with  18 seats, and  feels very soft ! This aircraft flies from Amman airport at 8 am local time  and arrives in only 5 hours  to London. This is a very  nice product.

London to Athens.  Qatar Airways is a glorified budget airline. A 3.5-hour flight and back to Athens and no food or drinks provided. Ask  them a cup  and water and  I charge you  a ridiculous price.  An M&S inflated  sandwich sandwich is  a 'meal'. No entertainment options either. No USB charging on the seat as well. Any reputable airline for  any flight of this length provides  such options in 2019. Yet they charged full-service airline . So there is a mismatch.  Across Aegean on the same route  but a full  meal and drinks are provided.

Terrible lack of  left leg and  foot room in  Economy This was  probably the most  crowded space I 've ever flown.  Plus I travel  a lot. The  result was 7  days of leg cramps and pain  with no room  for any modicum  of comfort. The  total amount of  seats in economy  class is disgusting.  If the seat  in front of  you reclines, as  they invariably do,  it is even  less room. Shameful.  Plane food was  about average as well, even for  top of the barrel budget airplane food. I will  never fly British  Columbia again. 0 % Beware. I  would only add , the NYC  airports and London  lounge areas do  not have near  comfortable seats requiring  you to stand  or sit on  either floor and  their call to  service was disorganized . Horrible excuse for an airline.

Buenos Aires to London Heathrow rwturn.  This aircraft is  extremely old, cabin  lighting is very  worn and tired.  All screens have  hardly been changed  after they were first installed. My  plane has a  smaller and more  modern screen. Before  taking off in  Buenos Aires, some  flights but not  many were offered , or orange . I never  ordered any. After take off, drinks  where offered, followed  with a hot  drink Food choices  spread out in the first row. Seats were uncomfortable,  toilets were jammed.  In the return  trip sparkling wine  and water were offered before take off, followed by  food and the  meal I had  ordered online was  some beef stew  over mashed potatoes.  Few movie choices,  small screen and uncomfortable seats. Crew : No indication  As to which  seat to use,  going forward in  business class or  in economy. Having  a Norwegian on  another B787 in  my premium cabin on the same route, BA is  the waste of  our money.

Mexico City to Barcelona via London Heathrow. The B787  has an incredible  experience The legroom  was quite good, the seat is comfortable and the  DVD has a great number of movies, series and  documentaries The food  were average, the first meal was meat with mashed  potatoes salad and  potatoes Not very . The breakfast  included scrambled eggs with mushrooms, fruit and a muffin, it was delicious! The cabin crew was ok. Not bad, not excellent. We arrived on time and was  one great flight. On the second flight the cabin  crew appeared twice.  NO IFE, no onboard service. It’s almost like a low cost. I recommend for long flights, but not  long European flights.

Great all round.  Thu 11 October. Good price, easy boarding, lovely cabin crew, great iced coffee on sale.  arrived on time  with a nice  visit from the  pilot and flight  attendants after a  quick landing. Couldn’t  asked for more  and they reinstate a free drink and sandwich).

Flying back from Abu Dhabi in  a traveller plus.  My seat is  SO uncomfortable it  did not warrant  the price tag of the seat, seat cushioning terrible  and zero feeling  of comfort, I  got no sleep.  The snack was  served after take  out which was  pretty tasty, but breakfast was just dismal, tasteless. Not much interaction with  the crew, but  everyone seemed friendly enough. Would not travel with British  Airways in this  condition again, really not worth the price tag.

Flew from London Heathrow to Abu  Dhabi Honestly, they were really good, legroom great, crew  fantastic - looked after us superbly, food and drinks  - bang on, did Vegas in  style too, nowt wrong with this airline.

Flight to Amsterdam  via London. After many delayed departures  they announced that  the flight was  canceled and rescheduled to depart the  following night at  midnight The following night at 7.30 pm they announced  additional delays due  to the same  engine fault reported  24 hours previously. Finally departed at  night consequences were  cancelled connecting flight to Amsterdam. WE  also had to pay for our  air show" at  our hotel in  London and when trying to claim  the charge from BA they declined  or offered to  pay for our  flights Arrived in  over 30 hours !!! What really annoyed us was  their lack of  information and disorganized  explanation on how  the events were . Once on board the crew  seemed really nice and just as we were getting  to hope this  is shattered by  the terrible food  poisoning on board  whatever that was . Our connecting  BA flight back  home was the same thing and  on arrival we were delayed on .

Dubai to London  - I flew  on the A350  for one of  the first trips  and will be flying it again.  During the same  three segment trip I tried SQ  business class and  the business class  ( sadly the  same BA business  class on an  older B777) on overnight trips. The  new "business suite"  package from BA is the best  economy class I 've experienced. I  am a BA  business card holder  and the experience  is outstanding. The  staff lounge at  BA was very  nice with plenty  of seating and  very good choice  in drinks. Food  choice in the  cabin was limited  and not an  issue On board  the new suite  and very comfortable , I had  two great nights  sleep with the  open door making all the difference  to getting a  good six hours , The bed  was very comfortable.  Lunch choices were  very limited (soup  and sandwiches) although  these did suit the timing of  your flight. I  would say this is an excellent very serious business  suite for night  and business travellers. Whether it works  for leisure travellers who want to  travel rather than  business or daytime travellers I don't  remember but I certainly could work  quite effectively in  the suite. Downside  is the IFE  is still rubbish  on relation to  this rest of the product.

Flying to New  Jersey via London.  Expect the worst ! We have tried this airline  since the first and definitely last time! They should  go through their  customer service hiring department from scratch!

Yesterday my husband and I decided to to come  down from Rome earlier than the  scheduled time at 8pm. When I rang BA in London, the customer  care adviser was  kind and reassuring  and able to  confirm the the  right time to  travel without having to pay extra.  Before the flight, the steward gave  us hot water  and milk so  now I can used my own preferred decaf tea and did not charge me. While waiting to get off the plane, I had a wonderful conversation with the BA staff who are so pleasant. I love flying with BA and we will continue to do so. We have booked our flight  with BA next ! Thank you  are taking good care of us  – just to  express how much  you appreciate your  exceptional service.

Flight from London to Athens with British Airways, was  another of the worst experiences. The  super slim seats are so uncomfortable you spend the  evening and sadly  your next day as well in . The screens  for flight info have gone, no  screens and airline  has become a bad quality budget airline. Sad. Avoid.

Short 45 minute flight north and south with British Airways. Lounge at  airport and also NCL was busy but there was no shortage of seats. Gates for  departure and arrivals were very conveniently placed near the airport exits. The  seats on the flight were comfortable and the schedule was perfectly on  time

Flight to Gothenburg  from London with  Swedish Airways. Staff  were very friendly  and helpful. Entertainment  was good. Food  is just ok,  ordering a salmon  burger as a  starter on a  small plane wouldn't  be my first  choice to serve.  Plane seats are  very uncomfortable. Super  cramped to the point that you  sit with your  arms crossed so As to not  scare your neighbours.  On a 9  hour flight this  was painful. Paid  double the extra  hotel room which  felt good but  still one of  THE most uncomfortable long flights have  EVER been on. Recommend for short  trips

for a long time I have avoided taking British  flights due to  their poor past reputation. Yesterday I traveled on BA  flights from Kuala Lumpur to London , I boarded  my flight with  very open mind,  after 12 hours , I disembarked  very very happy  and it is  always good to see an airline  making visible improvements that deliver value  to it’s customers.  The praise is due and I  want to congratulate BA for such a pleasant experience, the flight departed on time and  not half an hour early, the crew was not only professional but they did everything  through a smile  that made passengers  feeling welcomed, the  flight was pristine  and with delightful entertainment content, the  experience was way above the expectations of a seasoned economy class traveler. What more can  you say? Enough  can say that I will be  flying with BA …

Paris to London.  A pleasant flight on an ageing ! After the horror of discovering one of us was allocated a  window seat, meaning effectively sleeping next to a stranger, she kindly swapped seats so we could be together. For a couple the centre seats are really quite nice and you  know you’re in your own little world. A good flight, on time with a nice  meal is as good as you can expect.

London to Kuala Lumpur. Better than I was expecting after reading the  airline reviews. The seats are great and service was very friendly on  each leg (less so on the return). A few areas need improvement: 1) Separate toilets from economy 2)  The crew for  their premium economy  service rather than added onto their economy service. 3) A better 2nd meal - The main meal was  excellent and noticeably  more premium however the next meal (breakfast) was a bit of an afterthought. Would I  try BA premium  service again : ) Definitely.

Only wish I  would give a zero. I was booked on a  route from Newark  via Madrid via  London I come  to find that  your minimum layover time in London is 1 hr.  The flight layover  to London was  with British Airways  insisting that the  landing and departing  time in London  are the same, but that was  a total lie.  The wife and  me were sprinting  through the airport,  but between getting off the aeroplane,  trying to go  through security again,  then having to get to the other side of  the airport for  another connection, we  missed the layover . We had  this same route  on the reverse  and I called  BA hoping to change the return  ticket and explained  the situation. They kept insisting that  because the layover  was a staggering  45 minutes more than London’s minimum 1hr layover threshold  and they were  unwilling to help  in any way.  UK Airways has  so far the  worse customer service  i have ever  experienced Ryanair which  is a no-frills  airline has better  phone service and  it is saying . I will never be flying  them again and  working on converting  this company away from BA flights  very well. Be  warned Stay away  with this carrier  by all costs  and be prepared  to deal with  bad customer service  In case any  issues arise.

One of the  reasons we traveled  in class was  that BA have  facilities where you  could get away  of the usual  airport chaos and screaming children. BA  will tell you  this is no  seating at Kos her Limited seating.  Very noisy limited . Not sure  I will spend so much on air tickets with them in the  air if they  do warn of  these facilities. It  may help that  the flight is delayed by an  hours

Gatwick to Alicante. On my outbound flight (23 Sept) I gave BA almost 10 out of 10 across the board in a review they invited me to complete. On my return flight (26 Sept) it was a different matter. From entering Alicante airport up until boarding the service was by comparison  bog standard (except the VIP lounge  that was good). Travelling Club Europe  had no advantages. Only one check in open for all passengers, no bag drop facilities, no facility to  buy boarding passes. When invited to board we had to wait 20 minutes on the ramp before being let on the plane. The Iberia factor. Honestly you wouldn't have thought it was the same company. Once on the plane everything went like clockwork.

Flying to London.  Excellent flight on  a superb A380;  to my opinion,  The most comfortable  and quiet aircraft  flying at the  time Outstanding in  customer service from  the crew. Attentive,  polite and professional;  The very best  of British Airways service. Food well  within average for  this cabin - though breakfast could have been better.  Overall excellent. The  cockpit is comfortable  in a good  size and supplied  to a decent,  padded cushion and an excellent quilted . Very enjoyable . Highly recommended.

Welcome to Alicante.  3 hours (1 ), sitting on  plane with my  head rammed against  wall in front.  Little room to  breathe I have  been on several  occasions on this  plane in last  2 months - Vueling Airlines has  great seats! Stay away from the  windows unless you  are under 5ft .

We have had some torrid experiences with BA -  things we have not been shy to report. So  when we flew  in with them from Heathrow to  Austin and had a great flight in every way, it felt right to feedback on that. The staff in the upstairs  business class cabin were, frankly, wonderful.  Highly efficient and  friendly What more  could you ask?  The food was  really nice and the champagne lovely. The beds were very comfortable and sleeping was easy. I literally cannot  conceive of any real negatives. The luggage lockers were quite small but  again it’s an older model of the plane so that probably explains it. If only BA could deliver this kind of  hospitality on every occasion, they would once again be the “world’s favourite ." Sadly, the  BA CEO doesn’t seem able to inspire and motivate his staff to be consistently delightful.  Hopefully once he  gets on we can expect something better. Although the  aircraft was a  bit delayed on  arrival it arrives bang on time. As we entered the (literally empty) immigration area, we were met by the most charming  security officer you can imagine, who ended up giving us tourist tips and ideas for bars! Surreal, as anyone who regularly travels to the States, will testify!  We felt as  though we were living in the Truman Show at  that point but in the nicest  possible way. Get yourselves down to  big ole Austin  so that BA fly there direct. Fantastic.

London Heathrow to Austin with British  Airways It was  the little bit  like going back  to time to fly upper deck  of a 747  to Austin. But, it was the most enjoyable flight we’ve taken for  some long time. It was so  comfortable on our  time and we  have a fantastic flight crew who couldn’t do enough for you, and always with a  laugh We arrived as fresh as you can from 10 hours in  the air, on  time and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The only slight  complaint was the very IFE systems and small overhead  bins But plenty of spare lockers and our iPads took are of that.

They did not actually fly because of their pilot strike. This review  happened because of  their poor service to its customers who were due to fly on the days of the strike. I immediately tried to rebook with the  nearest other airline that flew to Jersey, but of course, they had  bumped their air fares up for the day in question and had to pay £110 more for a  different flight. I then cancelled my  original flight, but they only refunded  some of the  ticket I had . The £28 difference was picking  up seats. How do they consider that not part  if the cost of the flight?  They should have refunded me everything as it was  all my fault  they were striking. I completed their  complaints form a month ago and they have never responded to me. 2 weeks ago  I phoned their Customer Service line and the person  i spoke to  claimed he would refund me the £28. I never received the refund.

THE start of  our journey back from from EFL  was inauspicious, with  hundreds of delayed and stranded passengers  crowded into the  departures lounge, awaiting  departure on airlines  other than BA.  As it was, weather in the  UK plus air  pollution control issues  mean that departure was delayed by  45 minutes. Once  seated in a refitted A320 (complete with a nice fresh leather smell!),  the crew in  line were friendly  but efficient, and the food (including  the cod dish) was quite reasonable.  I was interesting  too note that  the refit hadn't  extended to the  cabin which was  looking distinctly worse  for the wear.  One big plus  on the flight  - and a  plus for me  - was WiFi,  which actually worked  but was quite  fast - although  for a cost of £4.99 for  1 hour's use.  Some thought it  was meant to be free for business class passengers,  although evidently not.  It made up for some time but we were parked right in  The middle of nowhere because of  our backlog of  passengers However, BA  had laid on  a separate bus  with CE passengers  and we were  cleared of the  gate 30 minutes later. So, not  so bad, all  in all.

Chicago to Zurich via London. Delays  and delays. The flight was supposed to depart at 8:30 pm (Chicago  time but was  cancelled at 9:40 , we waited a long time at the airport.  Then at 10 pm we managed to board on  our A380 for  our first time  but the legroom  was horrible. The IFE completely unfunctional and with no food served. During the taxi, a technical problem occurred and we returned to the gate.  At the end, the plane took off at 12 am Chicago time and we arrived in London Heathrow at 2 pm. We had to wait 3 hours for boarding for another 30 minutes delayed flight. We arrived in Zurich on an old A319 at 9:30 pm Zurich time  ahead of the original 3:30 pm. Very stressful at least the staff  is nice.

Welcome to London.  Nice flight, departure/arrival  any time. Boarding  was quick, the seat was ok.  Since I had  ordered a vegetarian  so the caterer  never provided any  food they said)  - but the  first attendant quickly  resolved the issue.  My food was  great and the  service (french, Bourgogne)  was surprisingly good.  Flight attendant was  extremely polite and  attention to detail.  all in all,  a great flight.

We booked this  flight a week before the BA  flight and mistakingly thinking that the strike would have ended two days before I flew and not in fact the day before, I was apprehensive as to how it would  work The check-in and security clearance  at T5 took only 15 minutes.  Personally I do not like the  quick service bag and tag drop  which BA operate as one is  always 100% confident that I did  it correctly. Boarding is by the new fare group system (1 to  4 which depends on how much one has paid for the ticket. Again I'm not  the fan of  the Possibly due to the previous day's strike and  their need to  refund passengers from canceled flights, the aircraft was a  Airbus A321. Boarding was however smooth.  On board the  BA full cabin was very clean and the EuroTraveller seats were comfortable and offer sufficient  leg room (I'm 1m.79cm and my knees do not touch the seat  in front). The departure was only 15 minutes behind the scheduled departure time. In flight there were 3 cabin staff in the Euro Traveller cabin (believe 2 in Club cabin)  who were very  accommodating and friendly  and so one only had to wait no more than 30 minutes from take off to purchase refreshments on such a full flight. Again it is a shame though that BA have gone down the no frills line and charge for food and drinks when they describe themselves  as a full  price airline. The landing at Tegel was 30 minutes ahead of schedule. All in all it was a  great flight and the value was very good as  it was combined  for a hotel booking. Tegel itself  is a bit  more hassle with only 2 border police carrying out immigration controls for over 200 passengers at the end of the airbridge and a further 30 minute wait  with luggage but this was not BA's fault.

I wouldn't even  rate them 1/10 2 x business  Class passengers booked via On Business. 1 bag lost in transit. Ground  agent in MXP rude, dismissive & most unhelpful, unable  the locate missing bag. Waited for next flight to  arrive still no bag. Decided to  call short our trip as the bag contained essential meds - ok  - a lesson learnt the hard way. Due to  it being an  early booking BA customer services unwilling  not be flexible  & change tickets resulting in full fare tickets purchased to return. Apparently the bag arrived  weeks later, we were back in  London UK, despite  BA website showing in transit LHR/MXP  for 8 days! Numerous lengthy calls to customer service , fruitless, passed from one department to another then  turned off! After  one email to their CEO & Director of Brand  and Customer Experience received a call from Global Engagement  Support Team offering  an e-voucher. Abysmal  airline services. No wonder their reputation is in tatters. I will never fly BA again.

Compare London City , Geneva. The  biggest plus was the Embraer E190  that had a  luxurious interior with plenty of leg room for an  economy seat. Other  then that BA  also offers a  very no frills service that is  very different to  a budget airline. Yet it charges  premium service' prices!

Los Angeles to Istanbul via London. Flight between London  to Istanbul is like coach, no TV and small leg room. Transatlantic business seats are very narrow and mine did not  have a complete bed. Food was below average. The  Istanbul BA business lounge was a cramped, tasteless, dirty  space . It took us 25  minutes to find two chairs to  sit Food was  equally awful and  alcohol is even worst. When we  decided to change our departure date by a few days we had to pay a penalty of $500 plus fee change, so we ended  up paying $800 per person in addition to the fare already paid.

Back to Tel  Aviv via London.  To return from  Phoenix to Phoenix  was a nightmare. I want everyone to know that  we sent a  request 3 times  and there is  only one to  reply to. This  was not something  which I am  entitled to.

On to Kefalonia : The T5 Galleries lounge is  showing its age and was packed  by 9:30 on  the Saturday. Boarding  followed by the  usual standard groups,  that meant waiting 15 minutes in a queue and  another 10 minutes  crossing the bridge.  The flight deck then informed us , we’d be  sitting on a  runway for 1 hr 20 minutes  until our departure . Once in  thin air, cabin  attendants delivered the  usual Club Europe experience, which was  average at best.  My arrival was  approximately 45 minutes late and we  pulled out of Kefalonia airport 30  minutes later. Overall,  your typical BA  fare that’s lacklustre  and best.

London to Dublin. It was never  a choice to  fly with British Airways and I  will never fly  on them again.  It was supposed  my fly with American Airlines from the USA to  Chicago but I  needed a connecting flight from my origin city to . Unfortunately, my  scheduled flight was delayed due to  snow which caused me to miss  my flight from  Boston to Dublin. I was put on a flight to London instead, which I had  a run for  until I finally made it to Chicago, and my bag did not make it on the flight. I then flew with  American Airways from  Boston to Dublin. I was told to file a  provisional baggage claim  at BA, which I did. I was told that  this bag would be transferred from American to BA  after it arrived  at Dublin. Using American’s baggage tracking system, I was able to confirm  with the bag  on the day . I did  at noon on  Sunday I am writing this review on the following Sunday and the bag is still not in my  possession BA’s customer service is terrible. If someone there tells me one more time to just wait and be patient, I 'm going to  fight it! My  luggage has been sitting at the airport in the same city I’m in for more  than a day  because I can’t get it. Talk about serious frustration.
