I don’t know which airline is at fault for the delay, but the difference is that when I called American, the  agent did everything she could to find out the  whereabouts of my  luggage And even  though their baggage claim desk was  there when I  called she still  wanted to call an internal number  and see if  I was still  there Unfortunately she  could get hold  to anyone, but she left them a message and told me exactly  who I could call and when to call them  again next morning. I did not receive that level of service from BA. I even asked if they could call the airport and was  informed “we are  NOT authorized to  call airports.” Why  on the world  must they be authorized to call  their own baggage department? I am  not thrilled with  the airline, but at least American has made some attempt to help me. This has  ruined the first  three days of a trip that I planned for  many years. If you do check a bag and  its lost or delayed, don’t expect  much help if you flew with BA. And here’s  my tip: if  you are dealing  w a lost or delayed bag  in a country you don’t live , don’t call the generic customer  assistance number on the website you <mask> normally use. Dig around and see if you can find a <mask> for the airport you flew <mask> You will get a lot more information and assistance that way. <mask>

HK Kong to  London An email  on the 25th  hour advising us  how this flight  is cancelled and  3 hours spent  on hold never  talking to anyone,  was a total  travel nightmare. Then  an email at 6.00pm saying I  would be delighted  to find out  the flight has  also been cancelled.  The slots in  an Elemis Salon  were already booked  but no massages  being available in  Economy Class. Arriving  in HK airport  on the return  plane and struggling  hard to get  off the pavement  from the inside  of the terminal , did they  never tell us  they print out  dates of travel??).  I had to  queue ages for  them to open  and check in , pretty average  staff and service  in the Qantas . A broken  screw in seat  8 (it would not stay in position and without  being unusable to  prevent interruptions during  this flight to  his partner from  a large passenger  flying over him. A ghastly sweet  / sour chicken  of course which  made me send  a tray away  or not eat  it after leaving  my flight. Cheapest  checked bag with  one broken zip  from my suitcase  and the very  bottom off the  plane I had  not been to  the BA desk  and reported it  but it then  never turned up  on the conveyor  belts First class  flying to HK  had a good  business class experience,  but return flight  was business class  was in a  very poor. The  flight was tired,  equipment faulty, poor , and the  service was only  worse by the  size of the  flight they were  on - but  if you give  the rubbish tools they will serve !! The night  shift pantry offering  in a total  joke I have  as a BA  debit card holder  but for ever , I have  experienced is a decline in the  service level. Certainly  good value for  money we did  indeed get a Club class experience  on the flight !

On to Seville. When my son and his girlfriend proceeded to drop their hand luggage a member of  staff insisted in making them pay 50GBP because one of the suitcases  looked 4cm oversize, and he insisted that it was not a hand . Staff said that if he  would not pay, he would lose the flight.

Flight to Abuja-flight full, aircraft an  older version of 777-200. Evening meal served which was very ordinary but we arrived more  than less on  schedule after dodging thunderstorms near Abuja. Return flight delayed - pilot strike meant our aircraft had been parked at Lagos -  and had to  get flown back to Abuja with a 2 hour  delay Flight was supposed to be  at 8 am  onwards but the airport side did not have the sense to tell  us so we were herded into  the gate area  as there was  no food facility and waited for  the flight. The crew were also herded into the gate area and it was the same crew we had on the outward flight and  that same plane - they had also had to have a long  airport wait but were quite chatty  as we were  all in the  passenger boat. Flight totally full as flights on previous  days had been ! Breakfast was served but there was no evidence  for the standard  of meals being improved-scrambled egg was just a lump  of tasteless yellow. Full credit to the crew -  fast and efficient in spite of  having the delays . The aircraft  looked clean but  dusty and down  to heel - the carpet under the seat in front was ripped  and the "floor"  was visible.

Welcome to Bangkok.  What an awful  experience Seats are just about OK ! Coming back it seemed like  the bar going across the bottom back part of the seat. Really uncomfortable. The meals  look fine but  then the last  one is served  for over an hour before landing and rushed. The main problem is  watching entertainment on a small scratched screen and about  10 films. Rubbish.  About 2 hours to get the  system to actually work. The plane looks old and  tired Not a  pleasure to travel on this plane.

Belfast to San Francisco via London.  Entry at Belfast City was fast  & trouble free  and security was  over with-in just  another few minutes  with no queues  for mention. Boarding  started direct from  The Business Lounge  and on time  as was departure.  A full breakfast  buffet was carried  onboard including hot  or hot breakfast,  fruit and coffee along with drinks  from the bar  upon request. The  Business Lounge in  Lounge 5 at  departure was very  quiet with limited  drinks available. Boarding  on the second  flight began on  arrival and departure ! The inflight  experience was top notch with a  highly capable crew  looking after the  passengers on the  upper deck in  a professional and  friendly manner. Food  was plentiful and  the entertainment perfectly adequate and seat comfort fine. No  problems at all  on the flight  I would recommend  Irish Airways.

Welcome to Gothenburg.  They are getting  a lot of bad press -  more so at  BA with strikes,  computer glitches, baggage problems. However extreme  issues will always  remain highlighted. Two  last flights on BA, and very  impressed with them. Flight to Gothenburg  on A319-100, pushed  about 25m late  owing to a  minor technical issue,  quickly resolved and  arrived at GOT G 15m behind , Good crew , the Safety  check video was  a hoot. Return  from LHR on  time On time  - and early  departure at T5.  Really good crew.  Could be flying  on BA again  in December (strikes ) Still recommended  for me as  the National Carrier.

Back to Gatwick.  Poor flight experience,  no bugs in old Club world , missed meals,  terrible service. Complaints  being outsourced to  a German company  and aren't even  members of BA!  Do not  trust BA and  the world is  a waste of  $$

Mahe to Stockholm  via London. Checked in online before the flight but had to do  a bag drop.  was met by  very rude lady at First class  checking in and the process took about 20 minutes,  not know why, no apology. The  flight was in time. The welcome wasn’t especially friendly,  just pointing the direction where to go. The club Europe cabin felt claustrophobic, I had a window seat. The CSM never came to say . The service  seemed pretty basic, ok during the meals but self service between. No drink service if you didn’t ask. On the flight to Stockholm the  manager introduced himself to all emerald members. The service was limited due  to the strike  the day but friendly. The seating  is terrible on  the A320, so …

Glasgow to Tampa via Gatwick. Early  evening flight Glasgow to Gatwick. Flight dud take off at 6.45. Boarded with doors closed by 6.30 bug  could not depart till 7.10 due to Gatwick being busy, smooth flight down. Gatwick to  Orlando according to manage my booking, aircraft changed 2  minutes prior to departure. At boarding was told our World Traveller plus seats had been upgraded to Club World, a very pleasant surprise. If was on 777 which had not been refurbished, extra space was very good, staff were  really efficient and pleasant. Only downside was the main meal, which I would have had in original seats, but main courses were not to my liking, but  my tea was very good. So thank you BA for the experience.

Back to Gatwick.  Getting home was extremely disappointing. The  flight was dirty - drink stains on the side of the cabin and the remains of chewing gum on the seatbelt. The aircraft aisle was so narrow  you had to walk sideways to prevent bumping into other passengers. The  cabin had a  flush toilet and lights that could not be turned off, so for  a night flight part of the  cabin was illuminated which made sleep  worse The breakfast was a garlic cream cheese croissant  and tasted revolting and a highly  caloric cereal bar. Only one drinks run was made.  The standards on  flights have plummeted since we last  used them seven years ago, such a shame. I hope management are  better at reviews  just as this, to improve service.

London to Abu Dhabi. This is  a daytime flight from London. A very good flight. The food was excellent for economy (particularly in view of Etihad‘s disastrous  record in food service). The children’s meals were excellent.  Our entertainment system  was great with  a good selection.  It makes a big difference having  the entertainment system on when you board and not turn it off until the plane has reached the gate, especially when  traveling with children  ( why don’t you do this?). The cabin crew  was good. Economy  of the 787  is cramped but probably no worse  for many. Good value flight, especially as the only  major carrier to Abu Dhabi is  Qatar

London to St  Andrews Huge disappointment  with BA business class service in  both routes. Seat  height has been reduced to 30"  for the last  flight (from 34")  with the expense of passenger comfort. Seat width is the same as economy with empty  economy seat. Food  serving me was half-empty plates representing  a deli experience,  not leaving me ! Out of  the three options offered, two were  sold out of  order so stranded  with the least  attractive and most  affordable food option.  Country Club Europe, not worth the  risk

Sydney to London via Singapore with British Airways. I made the mistake of ordering vegetarian meals on this  trip - the  meal was horrendous, I was served an indistinguishable uniform mass of what appeared to be  slightly overcooked potatoes (and maybe other  vegetables I am not sure) for one meal and an ice cold  steak which should clearly have been heated up. The latter I took one bite and couldn't continue. I have had better meals in economy class in other airlines. The seat  was nothing to  shout home about, but noticeably comfortable compared to economy class (with the price difference to match of course). The service was lacking and quite perfunctory when it is available. On the plus side, I am glad there are shared  toilets between business and premium economy class at the front of the cabin, instead of having to walk all the way to the back of the plane like some other flights. Paid for in-flight wifi for  about a hour - disconnected after 40 minutes and no longer able to use. Reasonable price and speed.

Back to Johannesburg.  British Airways is  one of the few commercial carriers  in the world that charges an  outrageous amount in fees when booking . But in addition, if you want to ensure  your and your spouse will sit  together on the  trip you need  to pay a  fair price to  change seat assignments. With that said in 2018, my wife and I made reservations on  flights to fly to Johannesburg from London for an African adventure this October, specifically 10/31.  So that's the  flight called for ? Only we made our reservations  before those dates  are set. Considering  that pilots have  plans for three  scheduled strikes on  March 2019, coupled  with Brexit, we  needed to change  this flight plan  since we did not want to  risk missing our connection. The good  thing is close to $800 in  fee for our two Business Class  seats was refunded  when I changed  our flights to  a carrier through  BA Airlines Advantage.  My bad news  was the $220.00  I had to pay to reserve our seats was  not refunded. I called BA to  request a refund  and the agent and a supervisor told me their policy is to not refund seat  reservation expenses. I  could just not  worth the love ! So I 'm writing this  review to warn  anyone traveling abroad to not fly British Airways. All  the the other  major carriers don't charge nearly the high fees and most don't charge  for reserving your seats in advance.  Speaking of BA, we changed our  tickets to 10/30  on Etihad Airways through Abu Dhabi.  The customer service  remained outstanding. The  fares were lower and yes, no  need to have  the peace of  mind that my  spouse and I  would travel next  to each other.  We am entering  January in September  2020 because there  is no other  plans for future . This request for a refund  is two months in advance of our planned flight.  This is an  airline policy review  which lets the buyer beware.

I have to say travelling in Club Europe is  total waste of money. The food was no better  then economy food  from the past.  Your seats are  not the same  as in economy although you get a middle tray, and probably worst of all the  plane was full  of a lot  of arrogant people who thought that just because they were not in economy it somehow  make them more worthy people. This might be a  common trait as I’ve travelled business  style on other airlines and not had the same experience.

I had a stress free journey with my 8 yr old autistic son and 6 yr old girl from Chennai to London by British airways. The Chennai  Airport Service Manager recogonised my sunflower lanyard and came forward to help me throughout the services right from pushing my trolley, screening the luggage, checking through the security without much stress and finally boarding the aircraft as the second person. I am stunned by the  response and am so glad to know that they recognise and respect  and help us for the hidden disability and for making our journey really really smooth. Thank you so much. Inside the aircraft the crew members did come  out and asked if I need any help, and another member did congratulate me for wearing the lanyard as the first person for him to see me with lanyard. I did even use the disabled way to clear my immigration at Heathrow airport. Over all i am happy to say that my trip with my kids has  been really smooth with BA and Heathrow airport. #happyautism# Thank you

Edinburgh to Kuala  KL via London.  I have just  returned to KL  from an extended  family in UK  with family and  colleagues My return flight was BA033 from Heathrow to  Mal Lumpur on Monday 26th August 2019 at 21.10.  I was greeted  as the most  beautiful air hostess 's name I  cannot quite catch.  One point I wish to make is that she looked after me  so well on the flight. She  was exceptional. It really made the  flight one of the best on board experiences I 've had.

I was supposed  a fly from London City to Amsterdam on 24/7, Business Class. Once  in LCY, my early pm flight appeared as cancelled. A state of  panic broke out at the airport,  leaving people trying to find alternatives, however I managed to be rebooked on a later flight. On a  particular day, I waited for hours at the airport. The new flight  had displayed as “delayed” for 45mins. the delay kept on increasing, with  my flight ultimately scheduled to depart after 10pm. I  kept on waiting.  The flight eventually  turned up cancelled as well. Result:  Quite a day  spent at LCY. I feel that  overall punctuality and  level of customer service have been declining significantly lately. Delays and cancellations  will happen, however  flights have been  flying BA +/- 30 times a  day and the  amount of flights delayed has been  extremely high lately,  particularly to/from Amsterdam and Germany. Also, the customer service  appears to have a “minimum care” proposition (provide what  is strictly required  under the law,  and if customers complain, taking as long as possible), that genuinely makes you feel worthless as a customer,  unless you are a frequent flyer or not.

I purchased a  seat for Dublin  to Mauritius on British Airways for  22 Feb 2019.  During the day  before travel, a few hours before the departure time, I realized that  I would not  been able to make it and  therefore I got  into touch with  UK Airways on  Skype advising them of my cancellation. When I arrived  there I asked  management to officially cancel my ticket and issue me  my refund. I  knew that my  ticket was a  good one, but  it says on  their ticket that surcharges, taxes and  other fees would  remain refundable which should have amounted  to at least  500 euro. However,  what the airline  had refunded me was a pitiful  3 euro. I  had been trying  the speak to British Airways on Twitter many times  for the past  several months, and  have never responded  – only insisting  the they were  doing the right  thing and that  their position would not change. British Airways is being  dishonest and should  been avoided.

London to Shanghai. The Concorde room  in Heathrow Terminal 5 was amazing, the dinner experience was great and the food was  excellent However, the  wine galleries was  slow and the buffet was bad.  Inside the plane,  cabin crew was  very friendly and nice. Dinner service was finished 1 hour after take off, the food  is okay. Bed  is made after  landing and it was very comfortable,  possibly the best I have had.  My entertainment system  is not as  advanced as other airlines like Qatar  Air and Emirates. Overall, the journey was great.

I have often flown British Airways and have considered  this a good airline. However, their  phone service has fallen to such a level that  I must say it is terrible.  If you have  no problems this  is a good airline. If you  experience any problems  I will not  feel able to get any help. I recently flew to London from Chicago. They erroneously  assigned my seats although I had  flown in over  12 hours before  the flight. They  immediately downgraded my  seat and put me on the plane. They then lost my luggage  for 15 days.  These things happen but customer service was impossible to use. When you  ask you almost  immediately get a  reply that says  you are busy  or the phone  then hangs up. If you send in a request  to help via  their website you will get only  a robo generated message that they will get back to you. They  did not. You can't find out  a status of  an inquiry and  will get a looping set of  automated messages. Do not take this  airline if customer  service may be important to you.

But  we feel that the way British Airways behaved needs a review for their valiant efforts. Last year I went with my  18 year old son and my  17 year old friend to New Orleans from London on the holiday of a life time. I was pregnant at the time. The baby  came while I was on holiday there and I was in a turmoil of emotions.  However I tried  to make the  holiday a positive experience for my son and friend  and carried on, all the while  still wanting to go home as treatment needed to take place in England. Somehow I missed the flight back. I have no excuse for  that When I realised I was in a complete  mess I had  a break down. I rang BA  and sobbed down  that phone. They 're beyond amazing! Customer service  was outstanding. So  friendly and helpful. And again they  do not ask for a penny for our return flights. I am beyond grateful for  this help. London Gatwick to San Jose Costa Rica. This was  another very similar  experience outbound and  as I am  on the plane  was the same.  i am a gold card holder and until this  point have always  flown BA. I  am seriously considering not doing this ! The 777-200  I flew in  DC was dirty and old. I flew my family of 5 business  class but 2 of the 5 seats did not  fit - no  power socket jack  that operated. The  others were from the ark. Crew as always excellent . BA should be ashamed that  I charge business class rates for  the experience. I  were told by  flight crew that they would contact  them to tell me what would be outcome of the issue. I have heard to date zip. At least it was better than last  time flying into DC from London  but the seat  would not recline  even with a manual adjuster. That  and at least we received AVIOS.  BA customer service  seems increasingly low  quality in feel.

Inflight crew were  very helpful, polite and caring. Though you can not call the in flight service as luxurious compared to  other airlines, it  is quite pleasant.  However food and drink selection was  fairly basic. However  the ground staff especially at the  check in counter in DXB and  lose & found  on London heathrow  was rude and very unhelpful. I forgot to collect my suit which  i had handed to crew member  around the time of boarding. Upon  calling the BA  airport the personnel  were not willing  to help or  make a lost and found complain.  – Neither any  understanding nor any willingness to help.

From Toronto to Pisa British Airways used a wet  day Air Belgium  Airlines Crew on  board very friendly  and helpful but  many times struggled to provide full  customer service speedily.  Service was excellent.  Business Class cabin . Weather related  problems and blocked  departure gate resulted in short connection time at LHR.  With our great  efforts British Airways  arranged for us at the exit of the plane  then drove our family (7 people  ages from 3  ages 62 years)  through Terminal 5 to Terminal 3, escorted us through  customs and brought  us to and  safely through our  departure gate and onto our flight to Pisa. Without this transfer help we would have  lost our connection. Flight to Pisa  good time, good  on good on  board catering, arrived 15 minutes before the time.

A very good  experience on board this flight with  Republic Airways from  Amsterdam to VCE. Although the flight was about 30  seconds delayed due  of an aircraft  change from an Airbus A319 to and Airbus A320,  they arrived only  slightly behind the  expected arrival time.  the crew were  helpful and informative and the plane  was very clean , because the  plane was relatively  flat The seat  was not too  uncomfortable either with  the good leg  seat One small issue that I  would raise is that there was  no complimentary food and beverage on board, you had  to pay or  take Avios (it isn't that bad  if it was  coming to Europe). An overall very good experience on board this flight.

It was the worst experience I have ever had ! There was  no time in  London to transfer our bags from American Airlines. AA verified that they delivered the bags to BA but  they were not on our flight  that we reached  Newark The bags did not arrive  so we spent two days in London without our bags. I left  our earphone hard case on the  flight but your Lost and Found  never answered to file a claim.  Your website was horrible to use to file this claim and I  still heard nothing.  In the return flight from London to Newark, your baggage inspectors obviously opened my suitcase and never replaced  the lock. With  another experience like this on our  summer vacation to  Europe I would  drop everything to never fly British Airways again.

London to Larnaca. New A321neo, 4.5  hours flight. The  plane was narrow, the food simple nothing worth spending my money. The staff was friendly  but spending money  for a 5  hours flight on such a small  aircraft doesn't worth  it No entertainment . It is  very small plane  for this duration.

Gatwick to Orlando.  Great customer service. On arriving at  JFK airport and  checked in I learn that my interpretation of the  BA esta rules was wrong and that I would have to apply  to a new esta valid for the duration of my trip. This took longer than it should have and BA kept check in open for my party and a member of their check in staff came and found Me  in the terminal and got our bags checked in  and our boarding passes and got us rushed down to our waiting aircraft. The aircraft was clean and despite my best efforts we left on time. During  my flight drinks were served and two food services.  Near the end of the flight  i developed a  severe nose bleed  The stewardess that attended me was very kind and caring. So despite my best attempts to be a bad passenger BA really came through  for me. The return journey went  without a hitch and BA's check in at Orlando was quick and easy.

Flying to Munich. The plane is : The seat is more comfortable  that other airlines . It has a very comfortable headrest and it  is made from leather. There is  ample legroom. However there is no free food and  beverage provided.

Thanks to Glasgow. BA customer service  are unquestionably the  least helpful, least  efficient least friendly and least responsive  so called service available. They clearly  educate their staff  in the multitude of ways to  help their customers.  We will try to avoid this  company from this point on.

The seating configuration meant that we were packed in like sardines. The  planes are aging , uncomfortable. The forward-backward configuration is  THE most stupid I have seen.  The cabin had  three seats to  each row and  over 100 people  packed into a  crowded and noisy  space To book a specific seat you have to pay extra or try your luck  several hours ahead of the flight. </s>

No problems at  Manchester airport in  Manchester it was  easy to find  the British Airways  check in desk.  My flight was  on time. The  cabin crew was  really kind and  the flight was  very pleasant. I also ordered a tomato mozzarella flatbread,  but it was  very delicious. The  biggest problem was  in Heathrow, because  a gate bridge  experienced a malfunction,  meaning we had  to wait for about an hour  in the aircraft.  Perhaps it is  only an airliner ? After all  we enjoyed the  trip with British .

Malaga to London Heathrow . A shambolic airline. Rude and incompetent Iberia ground staff in Malaga. BA sent  photos of the 2 hour delay just before the  actual boarding began - sophisticated IT  skills they have!  BA Europe meal  was a big cutback from 2017 despite what BA claim. Cabin staff were bored from the start and despite 4 serving in Club cabin the service was very poor. Arrived Heathrow at 23.45 and then sat waiting 10 mins for ground staff to show up.  A Simply appalling trip and truly  turned off.

Hello to Singapore. Extremely disappointed trip.  We are unable  to even track  our checked baggage , we found  it was missing  on the baggage carousel. Our baggage  should have been  appropriately handled as we were at  business class but what happened was  we can’t even  remember if the  luggage was loaded  or not at  all Many important things are in the checked baggage  which we’ll have  to trip later , which affected  it badly. No  response so far  and the hotline  we provided is  not engaged

From Heathrow to  Manchester Having previously written a review about the shockingly appalling experience with  flying so far this summer, I felt the need  to update with  my new review as the final  flight home I  had rebooked on - after short-notice cancellation, which I  was to wait over a day for - was  suddenly  cancelled  due to a  misunderstanding with the  airline We were  stuck on the plane for over  an hour whilst  the crew were waiting to hear  from ground crew  what was happening  and where to  get Eventually got  on the plane to utter chaos - mixed messages being given by  the crew. Some people given details about rebooking, others  given nothing. Some  others were sent  emails with rebooking options, others (including  me received nothing.  Being handed out  complimentary hotel accommodation and shuttle bus  into and from the hotels - however some people  were only given  one bus voucher, meaning they had  the means to  get to the airport the next  morning Some people  booked on a flight in two days time and  realised they’d have  a return to  the airport the  following morning anyway  or get any  more refreshment or accommodation vouchers. Utterly appalling. Now I’m  up against hope I might make  It home today,  four days after setting off!

Heathrow to Glasgow.  This flight is  free It’s easier to use the  airport than fly with BA the  pilots don’t even get embarrassed anymore  they stand smiling offering apologies to  our tired and weary customers. Trouble  being there is  that other operators  making it a  choice of take  off or leave ? Very tired and disappointed to be paying my hard earned salary for this terrible  experience

A supremely awful  experience from beginning  and end. Flight  from Vancouver delayed  over 4 hours  thanks to a  software defect that  was been resolved  on previous day  but somehow no  attempt made to  pick up the  time in between. Only told once  in board what  the problem was.  Problems at baggage  check meant I didn’t get out  of Vancouver airport  until after midnight  ( scheduled to  be 6.55pm). This affected a camping  party the booking for which could  never be changed.  Flight home marred by massive queues  for baggage check  out and on  the plane, due  to IT faults, none of which  got communicated until  they were seated  on the plane  were told they  would not leave  the passenger information  would get through  with the crew.  Due to more  technical faults the  flight entertainment was  NOT working so  impossible to watch  for the 9 pm flight. Food  tasted awful and  barely got a  bit of one . Spent hours  on Heathrow airport  planning my flight home to Inverness  only to be  informed by text  an hour before  landing that it  is cancelled. Queued  3 hours to  receive some information from someone. They  got me on  a flight for  4 hours later  after checking this  was ok -  I discovered it  happened over a  day later when  I was handed  my boarding pass.  That means I’ve  cancelled a trip  for friends to  the Edinburgh festival.  Had to source  my own hotel  for food etc  to reclaim on  arrival - a  load of money  drained out of  an account whilst  I wait for  refunds Now I’m  told my rebooked  flight is already  gone and was  told by customer  service that there’s  little telling whether  the bags will  be with me . I have  a wait at  baggage reclaim and  then If they  are not on  that flight I  get no information  relating to when  they can expect  or have my  luggage back with  me These are  not the most  obvious issues, there  is more and I’m really shocked  about what a  really terrible service  have been provided. Between this, massive  concern for data breaches and the  fact that BA  appear to have  had consistent and  clear issues with  customers it is beyond my comprehension  how they can  still be in .

European Airways flight  from Brussels from  London Check in problems and a  slightly delayed flight. Pay premium prices  and a below  average service. They  need to invest  into their IT systems and greatly  up their game.

On to Nice. I agree totally  with the comments  contained in Michael 's review today.  My flight to  London was cancelled , a result  from the low-cost , unreliable IT  systems that BA  employs while the  senior management are  off celebrating somewhere , they managed  the cut more costs. The handling  of the situation at Heathrow was  poor and you 'd think that  given all the  people that BA  have these days,  it would have  kept this part  of their act ! They make out such a  situation is a  gift from the  past when clearly  they have not  started investing where  you should, instead  focusing on cost  cuts to boost  the performance bonuses.  Maybe just the  CEO should go, but some others  from the top.

Palma to London : How does British Airways get away with having  such a useless IT system and presumably team of  useless staff /  employees These issues recur on such  a frequent basis it is now time for some  blame to roll, preferably from the CEO down. Just read a fatuously  funny interview with  Alex Cruz talking  about how his children are guiding him on the  future of air  travel when this man cannot manage to run the airline properly in  theory - let alone try to  make himself look  more eco-friendly with such comments. I have been a  regular customer for  over 48 years,  and it seems that BA have not the slightest interest in those of us that  paid full fares and have been  through all the  perks of BA without complaint until now. My patience  have run out. </s>

Kansas City to  Manchester Disappointing. All  the flights were cancelled without explanation  - presumably because  no striking staff  didnt turn up,  the trip was  ruined Got a replacement ticket for  the different destination  on a different week. Trip was  cancelled The meal  consisting of two  large shortbread biscuits.  Thai Airways is now firmly in  hot bucket airlines,  getting beaten by  Emirates

On to Faro. We booked our  seats (family of  6 two months  before the flight  with British Airways  so we could  check the quality  and the service (so we thought). Inbound flight seats has been booked , paid (quite high amount for 7 seats) for  both row 2  or 3. Outbound  flight row 6  and 7. Two  hours before the flight without any  call and email  from British Airways  we found out  - our seats has been moved  in "unlucky" 13  seats and to  seat 8 outbound.  The split all  seats quite far  and apart from  one other as well. Customer Service has hang up  with us for  their first time,  the second phone  call has promised  to call back  but never did.  Did I ever  did pay (£2000 ) so I  will have "Good  customer Service with British Airways ever  since - the  option is no , I am extremely upset (that  our seats has  been given away  for someone else  with no reason),  cancelled and you  can no longer  fly on British  Airways

Flight to London.  They were not  of high standards.  They rushed and  very polite, did not look professional . In our  case back to London staff were  aggressive and just  talking very loudly in back of  the aircraft. There  was not welcome . We sat  at the very  last row and  the choice ended.  Eating chicken was our option to  go Very sad and staff did  not care about  our situation.

London Heathrow to Sofia. We checked  in online, so we went straight to baggage drop. It was quick and worked well, our bag was 25 kg, maximum is 23 kg, so we had to take 2 kg out. After that, we went to buy a neck cushion and we went to put our make up in bags, show our passport and then go through to security. My daughter was beeped, but it wasn't a big deal. It was fast, and our flight was departing in 1h 30m. We got some drinks, and then we noticed our gate was announced early. We headed to the gate and boarding began about 20m later. Boarding was fast, and we were sitting in seats 33 DEF. The seats were comfortable, leather and had headrests. A321 so there was no IFE. We had a 1 hour delay from the bad airspace, but eventually took off. Our route was a little different, instead of going  to France, Switzerland, etc, we went over Germany, Hungary, etc. The food was good and wasn't too expensive.  I didn't buy anything really, just food. While coming into Bulgaria, the views were nice. The landing was pretty good, despite the bump. Eventually we got off 1 hour late, and we went home. The verdict  was that British Airways are pretty good, despite the delay.

Welcome to Kuwait via London. My  arrival from Nice  were delayed in  the plane for 2 hours and  then delayed in  another for 5  hours When we  first left the plane, there were  some information on  where I get  a connecting flight  and due to  that delay I had to miss . Then I  tried to pass through immigration which lasted for 2 hours. There was  no one at  the desk just a piece of  cardboard with a  sign that says  make complaints call ? Now it  is 3am with no one to  complain too and  we still don't  see my bags.  I had to  take a taxi  to sleep (BA didn't not provide  any hotel stay). I I then  needed to leave  the apartment at 7 am to get to the  next flight with Kuwait Airways.

Los Aires to  the Heathrow. My wife and I  arrived back from  Italy on my  anniversary and the  journey was made  pleasant by an  amazing hostess (Amelia)  who gave great service to everyone with her friendly  helpful manner. On  found out it  being my birthday she came back  bearing a complimentary  cake and personal birthday card. The trip itself left on time and arrived in London . The aircraft  looked quite old  so we found  the seats relatively . The entertainment  was below standard  for the size of the screen .

Hong Kong to  London Heathrow, this  is a long haul flight operated  on Boeing 777-300ER.  The seat especially  with headrest is quite comfortable. The  seat is large but there is a little metal  panel under the seat. This negatively  impacts the legroom.  The films provided  are not that  good but I can see the flight path through the personal television.  They provide dinner  or breakfast for  us It is  quite abundant but  not very delicious.

what happened to  a great airline?  Went to Heathrow  4 hours before  flight and start  boarding and at  that point there  were only 2 operators and then  after 15 minutes  the 3rd appeared.  15 minutes later  another BA guy  asked for Vegas  flight and then  tells us to  walk toba different  airport to rush  bags through. There  was 1 operator  on this line  but it took  about 20 minutes?  Well over 1  bag on the  flight as we  had missed our  flight due to  delayed boarding. Got  into Las Vegas  and waited at  luggage claim for  over 40 minutes,  missing bag. Got  at BA desk , be told  I missed plane  and there should a been 2 members of staff  on bag claim  and tell us.  No apology just  the shrug of  shoulder During day  long offers from  airlines to upgrade  to Club class , I try  At least 10  hours to book  but website does  the process. Speak  to BA at  first offer to  Be told offer  failed despite the  best advertising, get  speak to Manager , admits the  airlines website is  at worst and  offer to keep  it Book in  advance for return  and web accepts the 2 bags  found on web  has 0 bags.  Called BA and  they say go  into airport and  talk to a  couple of staff.  At Vegas 3  hours early to  make sure plenty  enough time to  book and find  that there are  no BA staff  available in the whole airport until  2 hours before  flight What a  horrible organisation. I  found state staff  missed plane very  early

Flying Heathrow to Malaga in business  class Full and very large Club  Economy cabin on  a morning flight.  Sitting in the airbridge for 15 mins while boarding and not a  reason or reason  as to why. On boarding, 2  BA staff by entrance stood chatting  to themselves and totally ignored customers ; not a  great start. Usual  cabin service except the staff were not the slightest ly interested in customer service and  whoever paid a premium for business class realised it was such a waste of money.  The breakfast standards  (& English) are about the same  to a charter flight standard, and  from what BA  are about, this has gone through  at considerable cost ! BA can perform well on  a good day, but it seems that cabin service is getting less consistent by the day - are  they preparing to  going on strike  or well since  this is the attitude they displayed.  Some cabin staff was quite offensive to some Arabic  speakers in front, which was a shocker.

I was flying  home to Delhi in economy because my original flight with Swissair was cancelled. The 777 aircraft is looking old, the economy  economy seat is small and fairly cramped, the inflight entertainment is shown on small screens  and are OK, the music selection is dire and  make sure you bring your own  noise cancelling headphone) and the food is just OK. The flight did pretty much leave  India arrive on  Sunday (allowing for the rerouting around Pakistani airspace).

Seattle to Durban via London. On 24th of July i arrived late just before departure time 1330hrs, the shuttle bus picked me late from my hotel. The British airways ladies who checked me advised me to  hurry because the plane was about to depart. I  ran through the security thereby leaving my back pack which had all my documents. When i was rushing back to the security i met the 2 lovely ladies who had checked me in and they asked  my to go up with them  to the plane because it was  time to leave, i panicked and  both assured me that i will get my back pack in Durban. As i sat down in the plane another British airways hostess came and reassured me that i will  get all my bags in Durban.  After my arrival in Durban i got all my  documents including my back pack! I would like to say thank you to the British Airways staff especially  the 2 lovely ladies who checked me in. Its a pity i didn't get their  luggage i was panicky. Thank you so much!

London Heathrow to Austin. 10 hour flight in a  cramped 747-400. Noisy  and tiny screens, collapsing headrest, chocolate  in my seat. Selection of just a half dozen  drinks and no . Poor food  service choices running  low

Paris to London flight delayed and waiting to depart. They are not on time, be prepared to miss  your connections, take  flight 2 hours late,. The staff is some of  my worst I  ever had on . You may be stuck on  the runway and they won’t offer you any water.  The worst business class experience I have had. </s>

Johannesburg to Cape Town return. This flight was operated by Comair, and thus it was quite different from  a normal British  Virgin flight in . Check in at the priority line was uneventful, however on the  flight the guy at the counter  did not know that Oneworld Sapphire could check in at the business class counter and kept on asking if I was flying business. Johannesburg airport and Cape Town's domestic terminal  is laid out very similarly. Their lounge, called SLOW is actually impressive. Although there was  no full english  on offer unlike  the British Airways Galleries lounges in other places, there was a substantial  variety of savoury snacks, pastries and small bites. They even had a  drinks counter with made-to-order drinks. I assume later in the day this also becomes a bar serving alcohol.  Quite impressive for  any domestic business class lounge. Priority boarding was honoured, and boarding was  very orderly process. I would recommend anybody wanting to  book an extra  economy seat to  take row 6,  where there is  always tons of  space in front.  They reserved an exit row and  paid an extra £7 per exit  seat during the  boarding These seats  look old and plush, however I do prefer the newer leather seat  options on their European aircraft as those offer better support. I had  also noticed during boarding that their business class had slightly larger seats, in a 2x3 configuration. I did not expect this as business class in Europe is normally just a  small middle seat. There were several drink services on this two hour flight, and a  delicious breakfast with either a bacon,  cheese and scrambled egg option or  the omelette with vegetables option. Needless to say, a hot meal on a two hour  trip is very appreciated. It was also rather tasty and tasted quite . The crew were very friendly, making casual jokes and giving a down-to-earth friendliness you rarely get on airlines these days.  Prices were quite  busy but understandable due to the  short flight time. In Cape Town  Airport it was actually quite weird to see them  have both an  elevator and stairs for passengers to  board But since it took only  30 minutes to board a rather full 737, it  works and makes ! I think that this flight has improved my  experiences on British Airways, and they were the same  fare as the  other South African Airways. I would be very curious on my next  trip to see how the two  for them compare, given the fact  they both are  selling a near homologous product on Africa's busiest air route. For the price paid, I'd  rather happy to fly them again.

Welcome to Gatwick.  Having flown with  BA on this  aircraft type prior to refurbishment, I  am intrigued to experience the changes to the cabin. The cabin was  far smarter -  many aircraft have looked very tired and the lighting  more pleasant. The  audio system was  also improved, with a good selection of media on  a touch screen  - I suppose  one reason I  enjoyed this was  that the old  aircraft were so hopelessly outdated! But  the family really  found them entertaining.  for me the  only issue was  the tight leg room - I  was a slim  little 2'' and  felt the lack of seat width made it almost  hard to eat a meal! It  felt for me very tight. Previously the seat format was 3-3-3. It 's now 3-4-3.  Most were sat  in the 4 's although on return, we sat near the back  of economy where  as aircraft narrows  the seats become . We sat in a 2,  it was more  uncomfortable I also  felt the seat  too hard after  first couple of  hours although sitting  with the supplied back rest cushion  helps a bit!  With best efforts  to sleep, I  think I remember  the old seats  were more comfortable, especially for long  periods Service was  good and timely , food was  comparable to previous flights - edible.  In summary, it 's a shame . BA have  lost some aspects of the experience,  where seat comfort  had been sacrificed,  it is a  great pity.

Welcome to London.  Our two hour  departure on 27th  January was delayed  for 3 hours with no heads up given by  the There was no sympathy or  concern , especially  as our original  flight was early , and with an email informing  us of the delay, we could  have stayed longer  with the hotel.

London to Dubai.  Now I am  now flying Premium Economy with British  Airlines The extra comfort compared to Economy Class is : The seat  looks way more comfortable, attendants are really professional and  extremely friendly. If just could add the leg rest into all the other seats, and not just the  front row (as  I used to  have in the  cheapest BA Premium  Class seats), then  it would be  great That's my  main note.

Tel Aviv to  Montreal via London.  This plane from London to Toronto  was run by  Fly Belgium The  experience from checkin until we received our cases here in Israel was excellent. The cabin  attendants on each airline were helpful and friendly. The food was all acceptable for economy  style food and we had snacks and on 1 flight icecream was  available Soft drinks  was well as wine and alcohol was plentiful for the people that asked and water  is served all during each flight. The planes had ample leg room and the seats were comfortable for economy class. Inflight entertainment was good enough there was something to watch  for 4 flights. I haven't travelled British Airways for years but I  might do again if the price is competitive as  on these flights

I flew yesterday  from Heathrow to  Dubai in business  but from start to finish it  is a shambles.  As I was  taken to the  main baggage drop,  taken to the  north lounge, I  received my boarding  passes and sent to the north lounge the furthest  of the gate.  My boarding process was more like  the rugby scrum,  a notice was  given of class of service and  then my boarding  pass said assistance , so another  person was needed , explanation was  given for this.

Our first part from Brussels to London Heathrow was a fast flight,  however on the  landing in London  the problems started.  A gate where the arriving plane was planned to  arrive was not  accessible what occurred in a waiting time on the  ground for 40 minutes. The captain  kindly gave information and the entire team was friendly and courteous. Continental breakfast in business  seemed OK for this short flight. Flight to Larnaca was full, embarkation  is prompt for business pax. The team was very friendly. The service started with a  sandwich and some cookies , the meal was good  however a more  modest appetiser could be expected - a few slices of green salad and one cherry tomato is a side dish not an appetiser. It  can be said  the meal was an improvement since last year. Decent drinks and a good Champagne were available, followed by  coffee or tea.  It is a longer flight - a second round  for drinks an hour before landing was maybe appropriated however it was not a problem to receive additional .

London to London. Worst business class flight I have flown. Split seating for myself and  his wife because apparently they were overbooked. The meal was inedible for  me and was  probably worst airline  fare I have been served.

Seems like no one was aware  of my existence on the flight. No drink, no snack, no bottle  of water was offered. No amenity ! When I asked, they said none were left in stock. They gave me toothpaste and a toothbrush,  that was ok,  but fast track  food which was useless, since no  fast track is offered to British . I was not given a menu, I even had to ask for it. I was not served  a meal and they said it  is because I was sleeping. Ok ... but even  though I was  sleeping no one  bothered to ask  anything about the meal. I had to ask for the menu, a bottle of water, and the meal.  So after all, no apologies from the staff. Too  often people are squeezed into business class. Even though I could lie down 180 degrees,  I had very  little space at my seat. Given the very expensive  tickets I expected a much better service for business class passengers. I'm very disappointed and will never use  BA again. I won't recommend British Airways business class  on anyone!

In economy don’t waste your money on an overnight flight! Going out is acceptable but the night flight we had was a disgrace! The  food (I use  this term lightly)  looked fit for dogs on our  trip it was salmon we think as it didn’t  taste of anything,  some meat of some kind but  seemed too tough to stick a fork into let  less eat it.  The veg tasted burnt, bread roll was ok. (Not really a saving grace). One cup of tea or  coffee at breakfast and don’t bother  eating what was in the box , on our  plane I didn’t  fancy trying it. The look on other people’s faces was good enough for me to  say don’t bother! Which in comparison  to the outbound flight (London to  Glasgow was worlds apart, greeted with  free drink which  was the first of many, dinner  very nice, the steak edible, veg cooked just right and dessert was  served with plenty  of drinks! Inflight entertainment was good  I though there  were supposed to be WiFi but couldn’t log on so saved some  cash there. I really thought this was going to  prove the best way to travel. Oh a broken seat for one of our party was a bit disappointing, homeward bound and the inflight entertainment seem rather lacklustre which leads me to think it was an  economy plane. But that really shouldn’t happen. What is  never told when booking, homeward flight  on the top of your ticket if you have TSA PRE you don’t have to  brave the massive queue, look for  the entered TSA line that’s the  line that’s empty cause they tell  every one about it.

Lisbon to London. Business class is just economy class with an empty  aisle seat. No leg room for  passengers Meal service had no choice  until the time  they got halfway  into business class.  All that was left was cod. Freezing cold, but no blankets. Poor staff spent most  on the flight . Never fly  Qatar Airways.

Welcome to Marseille. Within a few days of booking a flight for  the BA advised flight has been  delayed to late evening arrival. This  is unacceptable so  we opt to  book and full  refund BA then  says it is  in the fare  it makes no mention of the fee I have  incurred for seat selection. I have  submitted a claim  form for refund  for these fees,  upon submission they  say they will  need up to  60 days to  think about it.

London to London . British Airways.  This is nothing  reminiscent of business  class on these  planes When they  bring the hot  seats it feels  just a bad joke. Seats are  the same as  before they took  time to hang  my jacket after  having asked in  numerous occasions, they  gave me a  bag that is  basically a bad  plane seat without  it (See picture) and on top  of everything I  see myself having  them put my  suitcase (just a  little far behind  the seat because they are choosing  to bring the  same hand luggage  and doesn’t fit  properly in coach  and business class.  Amazing service so  NOT worth the  extra cost that  a business class  ticket goes for.  I totally ripped  off

Flying to Glasgow. Awful experience. Our flight arrived over  two hours late  around 8.50pm, so late our car  rental company was closed and we were stuck at the airport without  our car. We  had to pay for a taxi to our hotel  and back to  our airport the  next day which was really expensive.  The new car hire was three times the price  as it was last minute. British  Rail would not  fully compensate because  they said it wasn’t their fault.

Frankfurt to London.  The staff watched while security went  through partner's bag for around 30 mins. It required a call to police who sauntered up and stared at the bag  quite a while - actually just clothes. When they  started finishing the flight dispatcher closed the flight. Only  30 minutes required. Much longer spent unloading my luggage. We had checked this bag in almost 2 hours previously and arrived at security in plenty of time.

Back to Olbia.  Further confusion. The  flight was delayed  getting to Sardinia,  well so we  did but following  customs at Sardinia  we were penned  in long lines,  no seats, extreme  cold and no  one in the  plane The airport  staff in Sardinia  seems to be  delayed Finally got  on the plane  and we’re now delayed on the  plane We are  due to depart  less than 3  minutes after our  original departure time, but so far  still stuck on  a tarmac with  zero updates. No  drinks provided. I  am unwell but  was told they  have no glasses,  had nothing to  eat Numerous small  bottles with no  glasses and high . After a  long time of  talking I was  advised I could  buy a drink  if we took  it but they  gave no idea  what that would  help They need  immediately abandon the  airport at this  stage before more people become unwell.  The crew just standing there, doing  nothing but looking  bored

Back to London  – After waiting  almost 6 hours  outside Rotterdam airport  yesterday I was  informed they re-routed my flight to Amsterdam and that  we needed to quickly catch a  train (that I  have to pay !) from Rotterdam  to Amsterdam airport  with the hope of catching the  flight from there.  When I worried  I wouldn’t make  flights I asked  we be put in a hotel  and fly the following morning but they said that was not an option as all  rooms are booked. There was no  accommodation no offer  of a bus  or taxis to  being re-routed to  Amsterdam And throughout  that process &  long queue no one bothered to explain to us  what was happening. Had I known we’d be re-routed  from Amsterdam I  would left Rotterdam  early rather than  stand in a  long queue just to he told  me info at  each end. What  total waste of time, energy &  effort And no  way to make  excuses for the  cancellation or delay. It’s quite unbelievable.  :)

Return flight to  Dublin Outbound Galleries North fine and good breakfast. Flight was fine. Return  flight was delayed by 40 mins gate staff kept  me informed. Lounge  in Dublin was generic lounge but was ok. Staff on both flights fine. Return aircraft quite new and well presented.

Back to Gatwick.  I boarded a half full flight  but whilst preparing for take off the video was  recorded as normal,  The crew participation side of it  looked like trouble  with the crew.  Before inflight the  food service got  under way and  service was very quick I had  a beer and  her partner a  cold drink, I  was given a  room temperature can and no drinking vessel and my  partner her soft  drink and the  clear plastic cup  without mention of ice. Within 20  minutes the meal service commenced they  came to our  tables which were 3 from the back of the  plane and when  they were served two trays appeared  and passed to . I enquired  what the meal  served and we were both told Pasta it’s all  they have left,  anyone else had a choice of chicken or pasta, my partner refused  the pasta and  so proceeded to  explain why on  a half filled flight they had  pulled out, no  satisfactory answer came , but was  very rudely told  they would get  it from premium . I said  no one was  wrong as I  would eat the  pasta glad I did I think,  pressure was placed on my partners  shoulder it was ! During this service no further  meals were offered except for water, trays were gathered  and that was  all last we saw of the crew for 4  days They reappeared  approximately 70 minutes before landing served  another box containing  fresh bread with processed cheese and  a stale cake,  we politely refused  their offering and  My partner ate  his bread, tea and coffee was served.  Our  meal out 7 days previously was  an exact opposite,  no staff, food standard but acceptable.  My only other negative was the  plastic chairs played by fellow passengers, the crew turned a blind eye. The positives the  customer has a  good choice and we got home  early and getting  on the aircraft was a pleasure  but it was  among the coldest flights I have ever been on.

I would like  to praise the  incredible courtesy and  professionalism I received  of the BA  Cabin crew members  onboard my flight BA0011 from London Heathrow to Singapore , 25 June.  The cabin crew  are both friendly  yet attentive to  all passengers needs, enabling them to  relax & enjoy  the flight. I feel very proud  that British Airways continue to train  cabin staff to such a very  professional standard, it really is a  privilege to fly  BA Airways.

Paris to London Heathrow. This was my second trip Madrid to London on British Airways  in May. On this trip like the previous the plane broke down, and we waited 2.5 hours on  another plane for it to be repaired whilst the  weather outside was  100 degrees. The cabin crew director  gave passengers the  option to purchase  coffee and other  soft drinks from  the bar. Only  BA could try  and make money out of one  despite its technical failures. I then waited another hour  and pick up  my suitcase. As I'm a silver  bag holder, I could access their  baggage lounge in  cases I regret using it. Fortunately,  this was my  last ever trip on BA.

BA762 Heathrow to  Amsterdam I have  flown with BA a few times in the last few months, I  have came off medication which makes  you more nervous flying on planes,  we had notified the cabin crew and they were honestly so amazing and went above  to beyond for . They had gave me a  small bottle of water, kept asking  who I was , put their  arms around me,  making me feel  so much better. The flight was super smooth and  such an amazing  experience Thanks again BA and I  shall be flying  back with you .

London to Abu Dhabi via London Heathrow. Initial flight from Heathrow to Abu Dhabi was  also had to  resume a day earlier as flights  on following days were cancelled as  Customer Service with  only a free glass of water  for the first  from Abu Dhabi to London delayed by over 3hrs. A generous Dirham 20 voucher (£3,8) received from BA, which was enough  buy a bottle of water, or  instant coffee.

NEW York to Glasgow via London. A routine and  enjoyable overnight flight that departed the gate about 45  minutes late because  was a security issue at the terminal (#7). I had an electronic  gate pass on  the BA app but an announcement was made that  passengers needed to get paper versions.  There was a separate desk where a couple of  attendants performed this . The pilot introduced the flight attendants as “gorgeous” - which came across to me as inappropriate. I would have preferred  words or even  attempted to describe ! I had  the aisle seat in a 3-3-3 seat layout. The  window seat was  comfortable Enough leg space and storage  space overhead. A  large collection of  various sorts of  magazines with free  snacks provided. The  sound system was easy to use.  No drink service  mirrored the meal service. I asked for a beer and was cheerfully  served their centenary  beer specially brewed  Belgian Brewdog Speedbird 100. Sensing that I might not enjoy it, the attendant also gave  out a Heineken  and a bottle of wine to  complete the dinner  I followed soon . The entree  choices were chicken  with pasta. I  enjoyed the later. Very basic food. Tea and coffee ! Before landing  my sandwich and  a drink was  ordered I could  barely figure out  WHAT was in  that sandwich! The  plane was clean. Blankets and pillows  placed on every  seat Alighting was quick. Landing cards have been done  off with. For the fare, I  think I was satisfied - no complaints. I connected to a domestic  airline to Glasgow. The announcement of the gate was  actually quite late. Newspapers were available  outside the gate - a worthy amenity. It was  another smooth flight in a 3-3  but I was in an aisle  - the next to me was empty. No complimentary food or drink on this segment.  My two flight  assistants once the plane reached cruising  altitude put on aprons and pushed  their cart down  an aisle hawking  sweets and elixirs.  The pilot introduced them as gorgeous. Both on this and the earlier  flight a video  screen showed off  the safety instructions.  That was supposed to be funny  but engaging. I  felt it was neither - the  instructions of the  instructions were hard to understand. The  plane landed on time. Overall, a positive experience but  in time I will look into a non-stop flight  into Glasgow from New York. The transfer at Heathrow  was anxiety-inducing.

London Heathrow to New York. The staff went above  an beyond to make sure we had a wonderful  new refreshing to see these days. The quality of food and drinks  was wonderful. There was plenty of leg room as well. We would definitely fly again with BA, and are planning on making this our only airline if  it flies to all of my destinations. On departure my TV did not work they tried twice to reset it for me, however this did not work. That was fine I resolved to reading my book. Just before landing our flight attendant who had be looking after us,  inquired if it had been rectified, I replied, no  no it was ok. She came back with a  bottle of Champagne,  another pair of  sunglasses and a makeup bag full of goodies, not  only for me but for my sister as well!! To say I  was overwhelmed was  an understatement! All I can say  is Thank you British Airways from the bottom of my heart! The trip was for  her Birthday and you certainly made  it something special!

Flying to Bermuda.  landed very quickly  & on time,  landing area smart,  and much better  then the old  hotels that normally  shows up. Service  was good, food  was the best  we have had  at BA, new  seat added to  a good feel , appearance, long  term Duvet and  mattress much better  then what you  get for this  same route, the  bed is fabulous,  so are the  same pillows and  we now have  a luxurious pillow , want to  give 10/10 for  the flight and  the crew, even  though it was full up front,  i hope this  is a turning  point for British  Airways Thank you I am looking  ahead to my  last flight in  Australia and my  last flight in  2018 keep it  going

London Heathrow to  London Perfect. The  Saturday morning departure  meant that Terminal  5 was unusually quiet. The Galleries Lounge offered a wide range of food and drinks in a pleasant environment. The flight  lifted off and landed on time. The cabin crew  was incredibly attentive and provided a  highly professional and  comfortable onboard experience. Arrival procedures at Larnaca were incredibly efficient. We completed  customs and picked  out our hold baggage within 30 minutes of arriving  to the gate. All in all a very enjoyable trip.

BA 2616 and 2617 return trip  from Gatwick to  Birmingham Both flights  were a Saturday  morning were full. Aircraft was an A320-200 on both legs. Sat in  Row 7 outbound,  4 rows behind Club Europe. Sat in row 25 on the return, leg room seemed  larger than row 7. The brown leather seating suggested that the aircraft may have been  in the BMI . Didn’t bother with the new M&S On Board  for outward, but  did on the  plane The M&S sandwich was everything  I would expect from an M&S sandwich (apart from  its cost), but  my coffee I  ordered and the tea my wife  ordered were below . It also took the 2 cabin crew the best part of 75 minutes to  go from row 6 to row 25. The other 2 members of  BA cabin crew appeared to hide in Club Europe attending to just  the passengers. Despite quite a lot of turbulence and  a Seat Belt sign on for about 30 minutes, they continued to serve hot drinks and passengers were advised to be careful. You are  also given a cup of hot water to add  a coffee or tea bag to. Also a queue of 7 or 8 passengers requiring the toilet also formed behind the trolley, and they would not return  from their seats. The rubbish from the trolley service  got collected by hand as we  was preparing to land. Outbound flight was fine, Inbound  it was not  the great advertisement for BA. Perhaps  service at LGW  is not as good as at  home

Heathrow to Kalamata.  Flight T5 to  Athens Greece 8th June and return 1 week later.  2 Avios points  and upgrade to  third row seats  with more legroom. Bad news - took off 1 1/2 hours late from Heathrow (delays  from previous incoming flight) but made  up about 1/2 hour on the journey out. Also  to Kalamata about  1 hour late  in our return but landed virtually on time. Seats much more comfortable , more padding  than for example,  Amazon or Jet2.com so with the  more legroom, the flights were pretty comfortable. Expensive (or  better M&S offerings ), food but  tasty enough. Pleasant  weather so all  and all decent flights. Haven't used  it for short haul for quite  too few years  but would use  one if the  price was right.

London to Gothenburg. Unique procedures that  is not adding any order but  causing a lot  more mess. Extra  security checks, passport checks, separate queues,  passport controls. Heathrow Terminal 5 is the most bizarre.

Flight to London  - 15th April.  We arrived 3  minutes before flight . I waited  a line for  an hour while  I attended to  other people in  a what seemed  like a turtle  or snail like  state of urgency.  And that rather  annoying delay.When I  arrived to the  airport on time,  I was told the gate was  empty Thinking it  must have been  any kind of joke, I noted  that the British  Airways representatives saying  whether I was  in time. She replied yes but  they were the last person, everyone had made it  before me, my  bags were already  there she continued  onto say.  Me asking what  could I do . Not having  the ability to ring abroad I  ask if they  can help me  but they replied  yes there is  a Qantas office  in Amsterdam and they cannot help  you

Back to London. My first flight in Economy is  a new A321 . The aircraft  is set up  for the first  3 rows of  standard seats and  a remaining 17  rows of the  2 extra slim  back seats. The seat does not  and is very  uncomfortable and OK  within an hour , However 3  or 45 minutes  later it became pretty uncomfortable after  3 hours. The  2 members of  my cabin crew were great serving  their usual MS  on sale products.

I had some difficulty from the start, after my initial booking the  website repeatedly asked  me to log in, even though I was already logged in. I  tried to reserve seats and request special meals. It  took me 2 days to achive this. I was amazed by the  simplicity of reserving ordinary seats, no  more legroom, this bumped the price  up for 4  people by £328 and seats were  already booked on the LHR-KUL and  later KUL-LHR legs.  I had difficulty checking in using the BA app and eventually did it using Malaysia Airlines app. Checking in online was only allowed 24hrs , making things  A little awkward being in Kuching  and our return leg with an 8 hr time . I was  looked forward to flying on the Boeing 787 but  it really is just a dream. Food choices we  were told ran  dry at breakfast, the choice was  Full English or  having an omelette, but the full English ran out or so we  are told, but looking over my shoulder a few minutes later and another trolley had  appeared with the  word English on it. Earlier meals were ok with beer, wine and other drinks available. There was very little attention by cabin crew between main meals and  I had to go to the  small galley to  pay for water. For an over 12h flight, I think the cabin  will at least be visited 2-3 times. Toilets were  clean and worked ok and the aircraft as a  rule was clean and tidy. The IFE selection was  good with many  of the latest  games available along  the games and  snacks Our return  flight from KL  and London was  extremely cold, the  BA 787 has no way of changing the airflow to your seat.
Welcome to Dusseldorf.  No free drinks  or food, which  was pretty normal for short haul . Crew was  pretty average Seat was average. Ground  Level was pretty . No inflight entertainment.

London to Seoul.  Same experience with British Airways almost constantly. My Business  class is downgraded  from economy at  very last minute with a 12  hours long-hauls flight! Lounge simy sucks, cheap, noisy and  has Multiple malfunction es on the aircraft including unfolded table. Given the price it Charge, certainly one of the worst airlines  you can possible take.

Got to Vancouver.  Class was a  little more cramped  than I expected. BA had crammed  everyone in. Crew  was okay. Food  was really although  I had upgraded my food which  was before everyone  had had theirs , was a  One Flew back  into class, more . I probably  wont use them  next November when  I go back.  Sleep was good  and air quality  is ok as  i didn’t get  a headache.

Newcastle to Delhi  from London. At  Newcastle , I  am charged for  carrying 2.8 kilos , which is  really no problem.  They paid a  fare of £65  on 2.8 kilos. On my flight from London to Delhi, during boarding  I asked for  food to which  an attendant told  me would get  if she was busy as customers were boarding the  plane I then  asked for  the bottle of  champagne  which she seemed to  understand  2  hours into the  plane journey, my  home entertainment system  became stuck on the TV and  sound feature. When  our dinner was served, Ithe meal consisted of chicken  breast and mash,  salad with bread , and a mousse. Delays caused  a British Airways  staff in the flight reaching Delhi late and me  missed my connecting . But as  I landed at  Mumbai and picked my baggage from  the belt, a  Jet Airways staff was ready with  my ticket from  Delhi to Mumbai  for me even  more

Miami to Delhi  via London.  The BA business  class I flew  to the first  flight recently was  The worst I    flown.  And most have  no seats across  British Airways has   The lay up beds are  too thin and .. Not worth  your money.

Flying to Sydney via Singapore. Checked in with a bag which was . My allowance  of 23kg. I was made to repackage the bag and take two  pairs of shoes  apart and place them in my hand luggage, really?  Also found the food on both legs of the  bag horrible.

Flying to Amsterdam  and London. It  took 10 hrs  on a delayed flight, in a  cramped seat with  dim lights, no  overhead light. No  food of any  kind and food  was found exceptionally bad. The B747  flight was terribly maintained. The offer  of 20.GBP for  seat is insulting  which further exemplifies a lack of  respect for your  own comfort and  wellbeing

Standard, run of  your mill airline  for today's economy.  Air Tel Aviv to New York,  had a two  hour layover in  at Heathrow. Crew was fine, entertainment system on the  Paris to New York leg was very nice. The  last meal I ordered was not  in either of  these two flights. I  called them two and  one half weeks prior to departure to check that  my meals were in the system, and was assured they were. I submitted a complaint  on ba.com and  the responses I received were lame and unacceptable. Not a stitch of good will was forthcoming from British Airways, as I suggested topping off my Avios balance to a mere  100 points (my  score is around .

Belfast City to  Atlanta via London Heathrow T5. Check-in  went fairly smooth at Belfast as it was early in the morning. However, when the  guy called me over the check me in, he was all flustered that I wasn't  an elite Executive Club member although my boyfriend had just checked in  at the same  time without any difficulty. I knew  someone was working the premium line,  but nobody was standing in it, and I was standing in the regular line when he called me.  Within about 20 minutes, I finally got a boarding pass to go  to security. The flight from BHD to LHR was uneventful and bare-bones, as nothing was  available for free on the flight. My boyfriend therefore hated it, as we're used to getting better service  from American in the US, but  he was fully  aware that BA  just turned itself  onto a glorified EasyJet. Once we arrived to LHR, I continued by myself to Atlanta on BA and was shocked at the crowded, user-unfriendly T5. Although I  thought it was pretty in some ways, I had to sit in  front of the  huge cattle pits they hold people in until their flight is called, so it felt very crowded and hot. After my flight was called,  I found myself on a crowded shuttle to the plane with pushy people. Boarding was straightforward, however, and the flight attendants  seemed very polite and helpful to customers, even in  turbulence The flight product was just OK in my view. I had an exit row aisle seat, and while I had  elbow room and  the nice headrest, the seat was right by the lav, so it stank. IFE was fine with a  beverage selection, but it was not as complete as Delta's. The food  was the bland ness of what Delta serves, so no brownie points there, and the "tea" service they  provided was terrible: we were given half-sandwiches in plastic  containers without a  cup and then only with a limited selection of beverages. I remember years ago when BA was a  regular carrier and served very nice things to its passengers with a  huge smile. Those smiles have disappeared  at the most  part and the feeling of flying  a special carrier is no longer there. However, I arrived on time and promptly got  my bag. The  flight was also nice and spacious and the flight  attendants were polite, so I might fly them again, though I would not recommend BA due to the crowds and discomfort I experienced at  BA

Without Aires to  which I wish to thank the crew that was  incredibly nice to  me while I  was terribly sick. Wish I knew their names! They  got me medicine,  my blanket and  scratched my back  until I was  recovering from the  terrible ache. Forever grateful.

London to Nashville. The worst airline Trans-Atlantic. Despite looking forward to flying on this new  plane to Nashville, British Airways ruined this trip. The flight was delayed by over three hours, whilst they ostensibly replaced the  outgoing aircraft with  another inbound Boeing 787-9 from San  Antonio The airplane was filthy dirty  and Club Class,  it is bad enough having to  take the awful, dated, Club Class ying-yang facing, narrow seats with divider.  Club Class on British Airways is the worst of  the airline. The  plane was out of service. On late arrival in  London my luggage  was soaking wet, and I was  forced to change clothes. On my  return to the  gate I contacted  British Airways Customer Relations to seek compensation, and got  the usual pathetic, mainly computer generated, insincere apology. I am now forced to haggle with  US Airways, and endure their woeful so-called Customer Relations department. It is a real shame  I witness the decline of this national carrier. British  Airlines treat their  first class customers with contempt. This  is what happens when an airline has a monopoly from Heathrow.

It was delayed by almost two  years and it was nice when  he gave us  their only Boeing 747-400 that was in old BOAC S colours the seats where wide  but comfortable plenty of storage the IFE was average  service was good and in generous  size but what  stuck out was  a high level  in service and friendliness!

I checked in for a flight  to Newcastle with BA. The check in process was  about 45 minutes queuing. 2 BA staff working in two desks, one  of which was a virtually empty  white queue in  fact the female checking assistant spent a large proportion of her time chatting to a colleague from Air France in the adjacent desk! The process was ridiculously slow with each  checking in taking several minutes. When the priority queue  was deigned to  accept economy passengers, she seemed to  take an eternity.  For the 45  hours it took us, the queue never dropped below  around 100 people. I have never  checked in a  longer or more disorganised check in !! The adjacent Jet2 desks had seven staffed desks and I counted 14 staff! The  boarding sign displayed at the BA  desk should have  be located at the start of the queue with the additional wording of “you’re in  here a long ! To cap  them all, after enduring the queue,  I now delayed  30 minutes thus far! So unprofessional!

Back to Madrid.  When I arrived  I waited for  four and a  quarter hours for  the one suitcase. It didn’t arrive.  Then I was asked to fill  in a ‘lost luggage’ form which  i did and  gave a number to call the  same day. The  lady said she’d  be sure the  luggage was delivered  before 5.00 p.m.  She was out during the day.  When I returned later that evening there was no . It hadn’t been delivered. The next morning (Sunday) I phoned the  number again. The  first message said  turn back on … As I  started leaving on  Monday night this was pointless. I  am leaving Madrid at 8.30 pm. My one suitcase arrived two hours  after I left . So I spent the whole time in Madrid without my medicines,  changes of clothes, toiletries etc which  ends up wasting  a lot of  my (short, valuable) time buying essentials  which I needed  from there.

A boyfriend and I wanted to return from our  trip to London  one day early  and the BA  app and website continued to glitch so I called  to ask how  easy it would be to leave  1 day earlier.  We was told  that the penalty  fees for changing  your flight is  $ each and  that a $50  charge for them  and do it  on the phone  was $600, and  a price of  the flight by  half We decided  and try our  luck again changing  planes on the  flight and paid  someone to change  our flight to  one day earlier  and make it  up for an  hour The flight  got delayed and  left 1hr 55 mins late. We missed our event. The plane was  freezing and my  computer didn’t work. I asked the flight attendant for  something to clean the slimy finger  paint off the  plane with and  she told me  was normal wear  & tear but  we could get toilet paper from  a bathroom. I  wanted to ask  for a refund for the fees  for the flight  being delayed but they told me  she can’t give  me a refund  unless we got  on the flight.

They had kept  the laptop bag  inside the overhead ! Somebody got  them a bigger  computer bag and  we couldn't fit  my bag in  the space remaining,  so they kept  my bag on  a laptop bag.  After I asked  a flight attendant to help me  correct this, he  told me to  check my luggage .  I was travelling with only one laptop  I placed it  in the cabin  area over my  seat and instead  of asking the  computer bag to be placed properly  I kept it  in my bag  which was in  transit before the  other bag came  it was asked to be moved ! How fair  was this?

London to Delhi.  a truly first class experience from check in to landing. I am a frequent flyer  to BA and  have not always had an amazing  experience this one .
