Check in  is easy and swift and the Concorde Room was excellent. The flight  crew was wonderful, while I accept it isn’t the best first class cabin in the  sky the service  were second to none. The cabin crew were friendly greeting us by  phone and showing  me personally to  our seats. Throughout they ensured we  were very well  cared after without  ever being overbearing. New soft product  is very good  and food definitely  much improved.

London Heathrow to  Dubai Last Sunday  We unfortunately missed  our BA flight to Dubai due to unforeseen circumstances,  therefore we booked  our next available flight for the morning which was  on Emirates. Today  We arrived at Dubai airport expecting  to board the  return home that  we had already  booked for months in advance. At check in the  airport staff told  me that our flight had been  cancelled as we  lost our outgoing flight. We have  not received a  replacement for the  delay and they  have refused to  give us the  ticket we had  requested

London to Seattle. My husband and I have used  the service for a number of years as our son lives in  Seattle We have always been very satisfied with the service. Unfortunately I  got taken ill  during this flight and the service went from good to superb! I’d like to thank the cabin crew and Captain for  the care I  received during the last two hours of the flight. Advice was sought via radio, I  am made comfortable  in the galley, at least one crew member with me at all times, given oxygen etc. paramedic boarded the plane and  helped me off when I was then given a  thorough medical check, a wheel chair  sat waiting and  then were fast tracked through customs  and I was  feeling well enough  to walk to the car park. We met the crew at the lift and the captain came to  see how I was. Many thanks  for all of  this and apologies to passengers that  they must have  missed

Johannesburg to London. I booked a seat without luggage. Firstly one cannot  have one booking for two passengers if only one has luggage. This  is an issue when trying to seat together. When the passenger without  luggage tried to move seats (normally a free option  in standard seats), you get advised that you have to pay. This was not disclosed when the booking was made. It was irritating because one of us was ill.

Flight to Milan.  This outbound flight  has some on  board space so  my seat was . Boarding by group number worked  well and I  was able to  store my laptop  from the overhead.  Local newspapers were available in the  aisle way. Passengers were warmly greeted. I was one  seat behind emergency  exit and despite  many requests from  a steward woman  up front was  quite challenging in  order to have  the bag stored  in the overhead  area the steward  acted very politely  and patiently. Usual  to board trolley  provided which I  now use. Flight  was 10 minutes  late due to  no taxi way  delays due to  a head wind  arriving in Linate  15 minutes late.  The flight could have been a  delayed due to  another strike but  a very full  and departed on  schedule and landed  30 minutes early.  Our cabin crew  of this flight  is excellent especially  a senior stewardess  that was warm ly friendly towards  every single customer , outstanding. We  were taken off  of aircraft and  went into T5  and I think  it saved time  because the entrance is directly below  traffic control. All  and all a  couple of very  successful flights.

My connecting flight  from Johannesburg was  on an older  aircraft with proper  business class seats  and lots of  space Pre-take off  food offered and  another decent meal  on a short  break Everything went  smoothly and service  very good. Boarding  in the main  flight was on  schedule and proceeded  as we were  sat on the  flight deck in  a forward cabin.  Little has been  said about the  current ying-yang seat configuration. The seats  were narrow, and  it is a  lot of privacy  along the aisle  - with probably the main complaint being lack of  space for personal  items around the  seats However the  seat is very  good in any  way and the  Air Company bedding  looks excellent. We  chose an aisle  between centre seats  towards the rear  facing the cabin,  which worked well  for a couple  had the privacy  were left down. The centre seat  does have a shelf for personal  belongings and access  to this seat  would not require  transferring over another  seat The service  on this flight  were superb, from  a welcome on  arrival and continuing  through the flight - very efficient,  fast to respond,  but super friendly.  Free champagne or fruit juice was  available as soon  when we were  onboard with a  good service as  soon as the seat belt light  was off. There  were a choice  from 4 starters,  4 mains, and  4 sweets or  snacks with a  small choice of  snacks Breakfast offered  another good choice,  but we were  provided with just  fresh fruit, yoghurt,  & bread. There  can be no  improvement in respect  for catering. The  747 is a super aircraft and  very quiet, but  I doubt the  standout feature of  this flight was the fantastic crew. Our connecting flight  to Leeds was  OK but compared  against our South  West flight it was noticeable that  this was economy  economy seats and  seats with just  the empty middle seat. It is  a short flight,  and there was  still a full  flight service. The  only poor aspect  of this trip was arrival in Leeds. The airport  looked quite run-down,  computers not working,  with few staff  could be seen.  There was only  the other arrival,  so we still  took over 30  minutes for luggage  and come through.

WA Heathrow to Los Angeles. Very  nice experience. I  heard other reviews  on BA but  it was not  my experience we  had From the  check in to  our lounge and on board the  flight our experience  were fantastic. Crew on the flight  were outstanding and  very attentive. Food  very good, not  amazing but very  good Seats worked  great and comfy  and on that  is the seat , Again, the  excellent crew and  made or break  the experience and  the crew hit  a home run. In flight entertainment  works well but was not streaming with I like  watching the monitors.  BA does a  pretty good job  for this One  Way route as  usual but I  will take BA  over AA if you can but  both airlines do  really good job  for these longer  flights

Delta is definitely  having its act together: BA's Galleries  restaurant is spacious  offering a good selection of food and staff actually  tried to make the group boarding work for once. The upper deck is still one  on the better  seats when flying  from Club World.  And despite the  cramped yin/yang seats  and the tiny IFE screen with appalling resolution. The  comfortable bedding certainly helps cushion the hard seats and  a large pillow  case feels luxurious. The dinner service was according to the new CW G design, which  caused delays while  menus were brought  out to passengers ! On the  whole I think  that works and having the 'triple  bar roll already on the tray  shows that the  meal is there  if you want  it rather than served with the dessert. Breakfast has  come streamlined, too, and staff actually paid attention to the request cards  sent in before . Apart from some inevitable turbulence,  this flight went  mostly to plan : we touched down 30 minutes ahead of schedule.  Very good flight,  anything but an  ordinary style business  class experience.

Flight to Belfast  from London. The legroom on the Sofia to Heathrow flight was terrible.  i am not  sure but my  feet were pushing  into the seat in front.   Service was non functional unless you want to pay  the prices. Where  is the service . There was  another bad delay  for the Belfast flight.  We were not allowed  a re-enter the  flight when the  engine developed a fault, as we had gone through !  Only after 40 minutes were we allowed  a re-enter the lounge. Service announcement was chaotic and contradicted what BA was sending us  in texts. The delay lasted 2  hour 55 minutes,  not short enough  and avoid compensation. The Belfast flight had a lot  more legroom than  our 3-hour flight  to Sofia.   I will never set foot on  any airline again.

Welcome to Gatwick.  Friendly and courteous  ground crew.   Each seat was  uncomfortable and the  onboard flight entertainment system derisory. The  seating was small  as in poor  quality Movies shown  by the in  the magazine were  poor and the  quality of movies  was poor. The  TV screen failed to respond correctly  or at times  and without warning,  with the sound  down to maximum  without touching the screen or handset.  A 12 hr  flight with a  poor entertainment system.

Flying to Auckland  from Singapore with British Airways. Service  is very good , comfort was  really bad, for  my 14 hour  flight had no more leg room than I did  for an hour  flight I was uncomfortable and as  the regular flyer I have used  several airlines that  provide much more space for long  leg flights.

I was seated right next to the galley and lavatory in the  cabin During the safety talk the cabin crew were only metres away talking loudly which was irritating, so my initial impression was disappointed for business class. However, into the flight I found one female crew very personable and was offered a seat two back. I was not provided with a complimentary travel wallet, so did not realise that socks and sleep mask were available, and I needed to ask for a pillow. The menu guide was on cheap paper and, with no convenient place to store it for reference later, was very ordinary. The evening meal was acceptable (soup, steak/veg, fruits )  but OK served  in freezing cold cutlery. Bed was ok but nowhere to store spectacles or personal needs such as spectacles, asthma puffer, or water bottle. The breakfast of juice and cereal/yoghurt was fine but the single poached egg  looked like a rubber ball and the included fish patties were unpalatable. The lavatory was spacious and allowed room to change clothes ready for the connecting flight. Overall I expected a better level of attention to detail and a more upmarket delivery. The only business class addition feature that I appreciated was being able to stretch out for some sleep. BA ground staff were unable to link my second flight on a QF 11 from Singapore to Brisbane, insisting I needed to collect my luggage, leave arrivals and recheck in for next flight.  I am 73 with some mobility problems, requiring assistance, so this was a worry for me. When I arrived in Singapore, the kind assistance girl arranged to take me to  the special transit desk where it was no problem arranging for my bags to be forwarded to next flight.

Flight was OK, minor delay didn't both me. What was astonishing is  when we had  them wait an  hours or so to drop off our luggage because at Lyon Airport they were training  their ground staff at the same time? They continued doing this even  after the cue became pretty huge and time started to run out  and make it to the flight.

Gatwick to Barbados  - I normally  fly on BA  with low expectations with the result that I am  sometimes too disappointed and sometimes pleasantly  surprised The outbound flight was about par for the  road with a  very comfortable seat  with an OK  airline crew that  were just about  happy to look  after us and  kept the flight uneventful. However, the flight did leave  almost on time , managed to land in Barbados  before the Virgin  flight that was  due to leave Gatwick five minutes  after us, with  another result that  it got through arrivals quickly. The return flight a  day later managed  and reinforce my  high expectations of  BA with one  or the poorer  experiences that we 've experienced over  these last few  months Once again when you travel west to east, the crew (specifically one lady who  is looking after  that part of  your cabin) somehow  feel they have  you rush through every part of  your drinks and  food service that  quickly becomes an  inconvenience The pre  flight drinks were missed on all  the seats on  my left hand  wall of the  middle cabin (not a big deal  although irritating non the less). No  butter was served with dinner, despite  their being butter  in the plate,  so I presume  this was missed.  my wife had ordered a veggie  salad and was  there about ten minutes before everyone else, which was  great However, as the crew were serving the remaining  food there was  a continual dialogue across the two aisles about what selections they each  had on their  respective trolleys. When  it reached our  seat they somehow  decided it would  make a good  time to try and pass a  whole tray of  chicken in gravy across the four middle seats with  the result that  some red hot  gravy spilled on  all my wife's remaining food and lap, although fortunately she did have  her napkin in place which absorbed  some of the  liquid It also  landed on my  plate which thankfully had the cover !! A very brief apology was  made but without any sincerity and  we suspect blissfully  oblivious of the obvious mistake they  have made. My  remaining wine was  served but not the rest of  the dinner. Once  home we landed  within time, which  was a good thing. Overall, the  whole flight was  pretty poor.

Marseille to London. I am generally annoyed with the  efficiency of the service. I believe that we should  only have to  ask for a  cup of water with slice of  cheese in a  domestic flight. I realised that I forgot a big duty free bag in the plane after the passport control. I went to the BA Helpdesk, the staff  directed me to terminal 5 at  the lost and found to pick  at my bag  but it was not even there. Luckily, I decided to stop on the way in  the lost and  found of terminal 3, where they  ( friendly lost and found staff , not the BA staff) nicely explained me that  this was no  need for me  to go there and called some other agents to help me.

The cabin crew on flight BA035 London to Chennai were very efficient and did their  utmost to take care of their  passengers I did tell them I would write a review and here  that is. Keep  on the good  work and, thanks!

Flight to Malaga.  Flying in was  fairly quick. The  check in area  at Gatwick is  really nice although  they are failing with general upkeep.  A whole area  required vacuuming and  there were stains  / signs of  chew gum on  some carpets. If  your not going  and look after it then you  should just having normal airport flooring. The lounge at  security is really  clean and whilst  I was very  small there were still available comfy and desk style  seats to suit.  Their food and drink offering was  very good. Tasty and varied. On  arrival I was  happy to be  able to book  an exit row,  which actually makes  your seats better  than club in  our opinion. Food  & drinks service  is fairly slow  although being near the front this wasn’t a problem  for me. The food offering is fairly poor really, a couple of  drinks or snacks..  the selection is  good What was  really nice was,  near the end  of the flight  one was given  1 free glass of champagne for  being a silver member. I wouldn’t  expect this, and  am sure it’s  just because they  left a bottle  to use up,  however it was  a nice gesture to show to  other flyers. Still  no WiFi or  internet based in  flight entertainment offered. Priority bag tags  as usual are  kind of irrelevant.  The bag took quite a long  way to come  out and was  surrounded by dozens  more non priority  bags Overall a  great flight, and  very good value  as I paid  my avios. Being  upgraded and getting  good access and  great seat selection was a massive  plus

Return to London Heathrow, was excited  to experience A380  as the first time. Paid a  hefty $91 for  the seat selection  on the upper . Was very comfortable with storage cabin beneath the  seats Seat itself  being the standard  but comfortable. The  flight was efficiently  handled for such  an large aircraft. There was never a massive crowd  in front of  the gate. The inflight service for  the outbound leg was less than  satisfactory The food was very mediocre  At best -  never worth losing sleep over it. There was serious bumps along the  flight midflight. The  bumps being so  very easily absorbed  - Return was  like a B777 - flight was  half full but almost full. The  passenger service and the food served  are both remarkably better than the  previous journey. The baggage drop area however was a  nightmare None of the machines worked  and there was  a kind hearted person assisting passengers.  Plane boarding was  never very orderly. Both outbound and inbound IFE was  OK but not  the good as some long haul . If both legs had similar  flight crew and food I would have scored them  equally

London to Cape lla in First , our first taste of the  new 'soft' product. Still, unfortunately, a  30 year-old 747  still hadn't had its refurbishment and  was showing its age. A wardrobe  door that's falling  from its hinges,  its non-touch touch screen and a  sliding door in  a washroom that won't stay shut don't pass muster  on First and  give the impression of the positive changes in the  food service. The  new mixed fleet  attendants did a  good job and  handled drinks and  snacks efficiently without  the wait other  customers have complained ! Care was  well taken in  preparing and plating up the food. For once, nothing  looked overcooked and  all the beef was decent. Bedding  was also improved, with a good quality duvet and large pillow. The IFE remains the same low-res screen  design and the  Bluetooth headphones are  better worn for  longer than the  length of a  short film. The goodies bag is  even better and  easier taking home. Overall, a pretty good flight, but  still remains to  be seen what BA will do  with its long-in-the-tooth  Economy Class when  their new Club  seats are launched.

This review is specifically aimed at  an excellent cabin  service on BA  Flight from JFK  to York to  London on Tue  27 May. I  am travelling back from New York  for a few days break with  two girlfriends. Check  in and boarding  are all on  but it was  reported that there  was a technical  issue and the  captain advised passengers  and some assistance  is required to rectify the issue;  this resulted in  nearly an hour's  delays leaving NY. Despite this annoying  situation the cabin  crew more than  makes up for this. They were friendly, polite and  would do enough to ensure our journey was comfortable , enjoyable, they  were all exceptional,  including those that  did not serving  within the section I was in. I do hope that this information  gets passed on.

Welcome to Aberdeen.  After boarding the  aircraft I was forced to check  out my bag  at the gate  because apparently the  plane was full  because I was  still in Group . I was  happy with the  baggage allowance and discussed with the  staff at the  Main Gate. I  observed people boarding with Tax free bags on top  of the other , Being almost  always last on  a plane, there  was free spaces  which accommodate bags.  I was not happy because I  had the permitted  bags

Back to Dubrovnik. Overcrowded lounges, business class seats same as economy with middle seat empty.  The lounge opens  1 hr before some EU flights  this morning only and met by a large queue. And now frequent  travellers don’t get  checked baggage anymore on long haul cheap tickets.

We paid an  estimated £500 for  two Premium economy seats on this  short haul flight  which was very  bad The seat  felt small and was shabby, the  LCD screen was small and very dark. I tried to adjust it but it was  completely unwatchable. The whole experience was very poor, not Premium in any . The return  trip was a  double share with  the Airines which  had Premium, a  totally different experience.  You would be happy to pay for their Premium  seats I would advise avoid British  Air Premium economy  as it is  different from Premium.  This felt a  huge waste of  cash

Faro to Heathrow. Flight was very good no issues  in all but yet again baggage  handling was a disaster. We fly club or first  half the time and without fail the baggage is always last off. Spoke to BA  again and they  are clueless and had no idea  when this happens or how to stop it and correct it. Same happened on flight out too. It is a shambles  & a disgrace. Waited 39 mins got cases at Heathrow and this  was unacceptable will kit be using them again. Avoid at all costs.

Vancouver to London. An excellent flight on BA. I travel this route several times a  week and generally BA are much better than AC,  but on this flight, BA were way ahead of  their competition. Seats comfortable, food pretty good for economy, decent wine and the in flight crew, simply outstanding.  Everyone smiling, friendly. They embodied BA  at their very best.

Gatwick to Tenerife.  Something so wrong. Lounge really overcrowded , food on  my plane pretty  much left most of it. Paid for and travelling  Economy Class and  sitting four rows  down from my  seat  this  was normal procedure.  But on top  off a £2000  one night holiday I should have  paid another hundred  dollars plus to  stay with my partner - total ! This is  the airline with a self destruct button, such a shame.Have just booked  flights for our next flights to Barcelona and Buenos  and did not even bother to  look at BA.

Washington to London.  I travelled out to Washington from Heathrow on 23/04/19 First Class I wasn't overly impressed. Although the Concorde Room was relaxing and comfortable, the bar staff were a mixture of attentive and somewhat  rude The cabin crew were polite but quite surgical in their manner which gave an overall impression of  the cold and clinical approach. My return journey couldn't have been more different. The BA lounge was very well presented with a fantastic choice  in both food  and drink but the hi-light of my return flight were the engaging nature of the cabin crew. Nothing short of amazing. I was offered the usual amenities upon boarding but what set this flight apart from the start was the very happy and friendly nature of the crew. Absolutely nothing was too much trouble and they took the time to chat with me and showed a real general interest in what we talked about. Demeanour was perfect with both a very professional yet relaxing  and engaging approach. A fantastic sense of humour and seemed genuinely delighted to assist. Having had mixed levels of service with BA and always flying Virgin I think BA need to track down this staff member and use her as the model  of all future cabin crew training.

Rome Fiumicino to London City. A  great Cityflyer service.  Great wait to  get in. Aircraft  is not full.  Finally pushed back , and arrived : This route  also has complimentary  service in economy, including wine – a great bonus and pleasant surprise.  Customer service was  friendly and professional.  A really excellent flight.

On to Shanghai. The most disappointing  first class I  have flown in  an long time.  My plane was  very worn and  dusty (there were  bits of food  on the seat  and the floor  of a previous ) It took  2 hours to  arrange drinks service  or reach my  gate after take  out - the  flight followed shortly,  which was over ). They seemed  not be short  of staff. However,  which made me  really angry was  that there were  passengers in the  plane who had  requested both drinks  AND food and  was having their  requests turned down . I’d even  being offered a  meal The service  is exceptionally poor. I am flying  again tomorrow and  really not looking  forward to the flight. As a Gold card holder,  you might have  expected BA would  think their frequent  customers are being looked after? I’ll return to using  cheaper airlines in  the one world  market for my  short haul trips,  such as Cathay,  Norwegian or Finnair. The only reason  why I’ve given  more than one  airline is that  they managed to  sleep quite well  where the bedding  and pillows were , Ultimately though : sorry BA,  no good enough.

Their customer service is horrible. Lost  our bags. Here we sit in London after 2.5  years of wearing  the same clothing.  We fly out  in 3 hours  from Barcelona for  our 14 day  tour and have  so much lost  all hope of  be reunited with  the bags before we go. I  spent so much  going on this  journey to celebrate  my husbands 60th birthday and our  second wedding anniversary.  That was supposed  ta be our  trip of a lifetime. We have  always been trying  and make light hearted things, but not getting our bags today, as  it now Friday and we left  last Tuesday AM  in Seattle, is heartbreaking. Not one  single person at  US Airways has  approached this with any kind of  kindness or empathy,  in that matter.  One customer service agent even asked  me if we  will be OK getting out to  Spain to "pick  them up." Truly  THE worst customer  service I've had.

London City to Zurich, I fly  this route a  little around 8 times per year, The flight was delayed initially by an hour, I was kept up to date via the app so I was not disappointed. Around 45 minutes into the  journey one of the crew member came over with a card in his hands wishing me a Happy Birthday followed by a bottle of Champagne, Brandy etc, this was totally unexpected, it made my day. Thanks  to the crew.

we booked a flight from Bucharest to London and  Paris and when  our were at the airport, they  told us that the flight will be delayed for 5 hours (from  midnight to 1pm),  then another 1 hour and a  minute (until 2:30 pm). We lost the money we  used for the bus tickets and  they would not  be Returning to Bucharest our flight  got delayed and they did not  immediately inform us about it. I  knew that unforeseen situation can happen,  as I have  never seen such  an poorly prepared company in my life.
Flying to Calgary.  Wanted you to  being a Club  Canada flight attendant . BA 0103 April 15, 2019.  Customer service was  extremely attentive and  professional I thoroughly  enjoy the flight. </s>

Vancouver to London,  We were upgraded  from business class  at the airport. The staff were  just delightful and had a fabulous  service Really they could not have  looked more helpful . I would recommend them.

Welcome to London  Airport with British  Airways Top deck  Boeing 747 with one experienced and  three new crew members. Perfect welcome , appreciated the method of selecting what and when to have for  breakfast Had a  drink and then settled down and  slept better than expected. On-time arrival and AA Arrivals  all was quiet  but good showers.

On to London. The plane left  one hour late while an engineer  helped with a  – I’ve no  issue with that,  I like travelling , I thought,  and I’m sure  I booked an  extra seat online , it appears it was a  pity I missed out on the  last meal and  then I realised  I buzzed the  waiter and requested  another sandwich and  began explaining the problem. He fetched  himself a sandwich  and various bits he’d scrabbled together from the kitchen.  So when the  complimentary refreshment cane  in both my  hand and I  with water and  I had to  come across him  for my drink  and he helped  it to his  food and left  us to it.

Back to Delhi.  The worst business  flight trip for us. Seats much smaller than business class on Singapore Air, Thai International,  Indian Air, Qantas;  all seated together  - same surname, Mr and Mrs - but moved . No privacy  in middle seats; one tiny drawer is only storage , shoes, iPad, makeup and sponge bag, book etc. Film/TV selection was very limited and  music choice wasn’t . The food  was very poor - main course congealed and so ot with a dessert that was  available no tea, coffee, or chocolates  available to us.  I had no  contact with the  staff Nobody came  out during the  night offering extra  water or other beverages. The crew didn’t put themselves . If one  asks more for  economy class one expects more and  they didn’t get it. I would  never choose to  take BA again.

London to London.  The flight with  UK Airways was 7 hours delayed (from a European destination to London). I applied for compensation for this . Initially I  am informed that under EU regulations I would receive  200 Euros compensation,  but be informed  two days later that this was  their error and  that I was  any longer getting  compensation British Airways  stated that sickness  on a crew  member is considered  exceptional circumstances (comparable  to weather issues) and that therefore,  you do not  need to compensate  me for this . However, there are court precedence  cases that clearly  states that crew  failure is not to be considered an extraordinary circumstance  and that it is in an  employee responsibility to  provide a contingency  policy for such  circumstances or compensate  until they do . I have talked to the manager of customer service and was  informed that there is nothing they  should do as  it is their  fault I believe  that if not  a legal basis, British Airways should have compensated out  the customer service  simply because a  7 hour delay  ( Europe) is . Many times  are picked to  fly with British  Airways based on the expectations of good customer service  and the case  for anything going wrong. But this  has proved to  me that it's  well worth investing that extra money into flying with British Airways.

London Heathrow to Bengaluru. I found  the crew very friendly and even humorous! Whenever the  crew passed through the aisle (I  was on a seat next to  an aisle) we  could exchange some friendly comments which  would always lead  to muffled laughs!  :-) One air  passenger admitted that she enjoyed such conversations which made the stress of her work lighter!

London to London.  I paid for  economy class and  BA paid for  the seats. The  first booking was  by Iberia (part of IAG which  operates BA, Iberia , Air lingus)  who clearly do  not integrate into  our systems since  not paying for  BA closing our  gate upon checking , we found  the seats had  been changed by BA (these flights  are operated by  Emirates and BA,  one being the return leg from  Paris to London ) BA explained that they would  have to check  if we were  getting a refund , total joke  since we paid  on the seats.  Apparently the BA  said the flight  was full and  could not change  our seats. No  explanation as to  why we paid  on specific seats  in business and  they were changed  by BA without  checking We'll accept  no refund on  this occasion since there is nothing  else we can  change and never use BA or  SAS again which  is a shame  because Iberia CS  have always reflected  BA and IAG . BA has  betrayed the customer  once again. Just  a poor BA  product and low  fares as always,  much more for  full fare business ! Rated 1/10  stars as we  felt let down , did not  receive an explanation  but were initially  disappointed that we  did not get  any refund on  being paid for  the seats!

Flight to London Heathrow. British Airways offered a very  nice overall service  with this flight. I booked online  and found that  was very easy.  The caveat was not being able to select the seat I wanted  ahead of travel without paying another fee. The check-in lady was very friendly and helpful and gave a  great account of herself. The flight departed on-time and the captain made frequent announcements. Within  these previous two weeks I had flown with BA twice within Europe  and this flight was by the best of the 3 thanks to the staff. The  airport was relatively  small but well managed with a  handy drop down map and staff visibly make a real effort. One curiosity was the staff handing out  the landing cards The flight was punctual and reliable.

London to Seattle.  My seat was  at the upper  deck a nice perk for Seattle  flying to Europe (BA is the only one flying 747s to Europe from Seattle). Overall the product is . Service was not at the level it used  once be. Staff  is polite and  attentive but they keep the service  below a minimum.  Upper deck  staff on this  flight was mainly uninterested except the  basic minimum.  No additional service,  No top ups, not offering water  on the flight. Of course if you ask for something you do  receive it. There  is also a lot of traffic  on the stairway connecting upper and  middle deck with the crew congregating at the lower deck.  I hope BA will improve their act.  They certainly won’t  change their services  for foreseeable future.

Flight to Gibraltar.  Check in at  JFK was fine, lounge was good , staff were more proactive than  was previously the  First Flight was good with decent  meal served including  all kids meals which were fine. Skilled landing in  Gibraltar a good flight

Back to Boston.  Boeing replaced A380  by a very old Boeing 747. Video system did not work for  longer than 1  hour then work for a few hours and stopped . No WIFI,  just old plane. Service OK. Not  recommended for business traveling.

London to Doha. Similar to our  first flight, the seats are comfortable but behind the competition, very small storage area , if you are  comfortable try sleeping sitting up or  on the cradle position as the  pillow is just not long enough. The food portions seems like you are forced to go on a diet, though the taste was ok. The entertainment system  was the worst selection of any airline I have flown lately - but their check in baggage policy  makes them a  very attractive option  when you see what their opposition charges for excess luggage.

London Heathrow to  Manchester Despite sitting at the back of the plane we were really  being looked after. Without exception all  the the staff in this cabin were exceptionally friendly  and professional. They really seemed to be enjoying their  flight Lunch and a pre landing  drink were provide together with an  Ice cream mid i Commendably, even  on these days of austerity, my pre lunch gin was served with  Lemon Tree tonic. Well done BA. Frequent drinks runs  were made. Despite its age the  cabin was well turned out internally. The only downside  was because of  the Traffic issues at Heathrow the flight arrived late.  Which meant that we almost missed our connecting domestic . This was  mainly down to  complicated Immigration procedures, the need to pick up our  bags and transfer  onto another terminal for our ongoing flight. All very stressful.

London to London.  The A320 is  completely unsuitable for  a flight of  that length. The seat pitch and  size are the  worst for economy  or club. Having  paid €1000 for  this flight it's  like on flight  if you are  stuck for more  that 5 hours  for an expensive  Central Europe seat  the personal space  becomes so tight.  If the person  up front reclined  their seat it's  another nightmare. The  door in the  cabin is blocked , getting out  when the seats  in front are  blocked is hazardous. . You pay  on a Club ticket for space  & comfort and  for nothing.

Having booked my BA flight from  Zurich to London  Airport using Avios,  my frequent flyer  and had to  be added 3  pounds during the  booking process. When  I tried to  find an aisle  ticket (for medical ) the BA  system showed that  none of the  flight had been  taken save for  a few seats  for which I  must have had  to pay about  50 pounds. The  waiting area for  flights at Zurich  Airport is in  this hard to  find spot of  the airport. The  ticket agent was  very professional, helpful , informative. The  point of departure  from Zurich was  via transfer train. The flight boarded  with an orderly  fashion and left  better or less  record time. I  became dismayed to  see cabin crew  serve alcohol to  a group of  very drunk German speaking sports fans. One of the  flight crew declared  when she had run out of  wine and then  suggested to an  overly loud and  drunk man that  he might like  some cider instead.  During the meantime  the same crew  repeatedly ignored me  as other passengers  in offering the  usual service. The  airline maps were  well used and  the captain made  many announcements during  this flight none  in which were  clearly German. The  flight arrived reasonably  late

My booking process  seemed easy enough  as they have  lowered the baggage  limits in terms  to the seats  passengers can book.  The cost of including a bag  reduced considerably to  our cheapest fare.  Everything was well  organised and it  was good to see passengers with  not much luggage  happy to check  their bags in.  Staff was well  organized and although  there was a  problem the captain  worked well. My  complaint is that  the seat was dirty and the  bathroom was also  dirty  Some  places the to asty M&S food  carts were not  good and the  one I used  was dirty. The  people were very  nice and pleasant  while the drop-down route map was nice especially for  the younger passengers  to enjoy. Hardworking .

London to Tokyo Narita. Had a  return flight in the new BA  business cabin on  a Boeing 787. On both journeys the crew were  friendly as was  their food and  drink service. The food was of high end restaurant standard, the seat comfortable.

Flying to London  – Paid for  the Business Class flight. The onboard service was abysmal.  Few refreshments offered  upon boarding. Dinner took three hours  to be served  in a night ! My Husband had to go  to the Galley  Bar for his dinner requests, he’d  completely forgotten. I requested ‘Express’ service,  that didn’t happen. Website advertises ‘Premium  Quality of Service’  and ‘Every Journey  Magical and Unforgettable.’  The service was  good but the  experience was definitely unforgettable for the  wrong reasons. Don’t  spend your money  on this airline,  you don’t get  what you pay for and they try to compensate by offering loyalty  programs and telling  customers that you  will pay for  the Service, that  the extra costs  account for taxes, the Lounge and  your loyalty points.  All BA could  live with was a goodwill gesture  of loyalty points. .

St Lucia to Gatwick on which my wife and I were both involuntarily downgraded from Premium Economy to Economy due overbooking  of the flight. It should be noted that at no time was there any announcement for volunteers for downgrading at Vieux Fort Airport. I now know from your cabin crew , it is normal practice for appeals for volunteers to be put over the tannoy system before any enforced downgrades. At the time of going through the baggage hall getting our boarding passes we queried them as none had seat numbers on  board to which we were told to just to go through security and our seats  to be allocated  as we went through the departure gate. Once in  a departure lounge all four of us were tannoyed to return to the baggage hall when we were then told that my wife and I were being downgraded to economy. The male telling us this more  or less indicated this was the only way we would be getting on the flight giving us £75 per each on a prepayment card as compensation under Article 7.3 of EC 261/2004 stating however that this did not affect our statutory rights. He then told us he would find us in the departure lounge and then all four of us  were to go through security once again. The male who we spoke to in the  luggage hall did not come and find us, we  decided to go  back find him when he also  advised me that he had put  my wife and I on a row with no other passengers which we assumed, rightly  nor wrongly, was  so we could not tell people  sat beside us  that the poor service we had received from BA. However two other passengers did come and sit beside us with the  woman sitting beside  the wife telling her this was  why the seat  they had been allocated was soaking  soaked and smelt of urine and the cabin crew  then asked them to sit on it with a cushion which they had refused and so they were given the seats  allocated to us which was no problem. What further  angered me even more was one of your cabin crew walking past another passenger with their seat in the reclined position on three separate occasions just prior to approaching Gatwick and after the Pilot had requested seat belts on and seats in upright positions, never telling the passenger to raise their seat. BA’s latest  ad celebrates 100 years of BA but for me their service is going backwards. The music that accompanies  this advert is called ‘Salvation’ and by the end  on the flight my wife and I were surely  feeling it. Article  1 of EC Regulation 261/2004 is worth reading if this happens to you.

Chicago to London. Cancelled flights just a few hours before I left home, then put me on a different flight which would have made it impossible to make my connecting ! Was finally put on a different flight. On  our way home, because my first  booking was through American Airlines, and the second through British Airways (all in the same booking), I was only able to check in and get a seat on the American  Express flight, as I was redirected  on time to their website. Couldn’t check in for the British Airways flight so had to have a middle seat which is very uncomfortable. I always check  in 24 hours before to guarantee a seat, but BA wouldn’t allow me to do this.

Flying to Bangalore.  That was the worst experience. I flew with my  only daughter ande cabin crew was  so rude. I was surprised that there was no way to heat  up for my daughter. I found the food portions  quite meagre. Not sufficient for a child also.   Indian Airways is sad in every  aspect of the term.

Europe to Abu Dhabi via Heathrow.  The 1.5h flight  via Hamburg to  Cairo was like  having a budget ! No free  tickets at all,  everything has to be purchased at  bargain prices. Heathrow  has the usual chaos. I can  remember the F Lounge due to  a One World ! Massive lounge,  filled with the charm and food  quality of a  hotel Toilets filthy.  None of the  best lounges I’ve  experienced Boarding orderly  and well organized. Boeing 788 IFE  is broken. Seats  are uncomfortable and narrow. Service and  product quality average.  From Abu Dhabi , Heathrow delayed by almost an hour due to  the arrival of the flight crew,  which is something  I have never experieinced before. Rest of the journey uneventful. Overall a  pretty disappointing experience.  I cannot compete  with the Middle  Eastern carriers.

Back to Seville.  following on from  my booking a  direct flight with  them despite having  no previous confirmed  flights with a  carrier I quickly  rang up BA  to resolve the  problem They understood  my problem and  sent me a  full refund. The  staff was exceptionally  friendly on the  phone and provided  us a quick  explanation and solution  of the problem.  I don’t believe  many airlines would  of accepted my  booking however it’s  great to see  BA treat their  customers with care.

On to Paris  and London. This  is the first  time using BA  from October 2002,  nothing has changed,  the same  old business class , with very  limited storage space  and comfortable but  BA business has  kept up with  them and left  it behind, with  very poor entertainment  experience and limited  product choice. It  can compare with  the business leaders , Cathay and  Qatar Airways but  on this route  and charges the  same price as  British Airways but delivers a much  cheaper product, though  their service was  probably not as  fast but alright.  What they are  lacking is with  the check in  baggage policy of  10 bags 32 kg each they  look superior and  although I will  always use them  and look forward  seeing them rolling  out the new  business class.

Scotland to London BA0457 on the  Emirates Couldn't have  been a better service. Long time  since I flew  to Europe but  this was an amazing experience. The  atmosphere aboard was excellent and so was the service and food. Stephen, one of the  flight attendants was  very attentive and happy to help  - he probably  considered it the  best short haul  flying experience I 'd had in a long time. Well done to  your crew on  that flight!

On the flight to Tokyo, I was separated from my wife even though it was our honeymoon. Thanks. The return felt like a 12  hr easyJet flight. One meal and one half meal.  No drinks. Very  comfortable seats. I’m 5 foot 9  so my knees touched the seat  out front. Very,  very mediocre.

Welcome to Vancouver. Check in agent very helpful in searching out seat . Very smooth process. The disappointment  is the receptionist  at the Galleries  counter at T3 who was rude  and unhelpful. All  were redeemed once  on board. The  accommodations were excellent  and the flight  in the best  Canadian Airways tradition , friendly, helpful and attentive. Food  not great but  on a par with economy in  other airlines. Wines  better than many . The aircraft  looked clean and  was well maintained  despite an older  flight IFE selection good.

The First Class zone at Heathrow T5 and the Concorde Lounge are  not good. Service on board was  good in both directions. The cabin  quality is unimpressive and the food  was nothing to  say home about. The screen is small, with poor resolution. I enjoyed the flights in  two directions, mainly  out of the service. This First  does not compare well with that of Middle Eastern  & Asian airlines, but BA business  service is so poor, I either  fly economy or  if I am very lucky) try to fly First.

I had a miserable experience in first class from London to Chicago. I had requested a special meal but that was not available. When I complained to  customer relations they  just said too bad and insulted me by offering  20 K miles. The bathroom lacked  amenities and i found the service was barebones. The angled suite is not private and when i stretched my feet hit a metal band in the middle of the foot ! Video screen  is small and  should be stowed away 20 min  before landing. Cabin crew never asked what I wanted and were only available when you press the call ! In flight entertainment is poor.

South Bradford to Las Vegas via Heathrow. Customer services handling of my question never answered it. Three times I asked them to explain why  I cost of my one checked bag caused the fare to increase  over £100 on the outbound flight. This was before any increase other than the increase announced for the short LBA LHR fare. I asked why the fare was so much when I could 've booked a seat for the  day for about . The response was we are doing what everyone else is doing. They never could explain why the fare increased by over £100 when I indicated one  checked bag. I  asked to speak with someone but that was never responded to. Book LHR LAS at that time and one bag included. Customer service apparently did not understand what I was asking because the answer provided was :

Welcome to London  arriving in First Class. This is the worst experience I have had on a flight. The crew was  rude and unresponsive, and treated you more like you were a nuisance to them. There was even less service from this so called first class crew than  we get in tourist class in most airlines. The attitude and service of the crew was abysmal. When you have average food and wine  in offer and a rather outdated cabin in first class, at least you should prioritize service as your competitive advantage to your full paying . This was nothing but a waste of money. I doubt very much I will  come back to British Airways again.

Flying to Heathrow.  Essentially a budget airline masquerading at  premium airline prices.  Had flown several budget airlines in  years past which  all offered far  more in terms of value for  face and service.  Controls are rigid  and I felt  As if I  were leaning forward  towards the the  middle of the  plane When I  went to put  a seat back  or recline, I estimate it moved around 5 degrees. Leg room is  also non existent.  Our food ran out halfway through  our 5 hour  flight and although  the crew were  responsible for food  would run out  during a lunchtime  this is inexcusable  but highlights how  poorly the airline  are being managed  by the upper echelons. Furthermore, several other budget airlines at the airport  have flights leaving  straight from the  terminal requiring no bussing of passengers.  Once again in  their move to  earn money opt s bussing passengers to the far reaches of the  city to avoid  any extra charges  and utilising direct  service from airport . Can't fault  the staff onboard  that are clearly dedicated to the  British brand. They  were professional, friendly  & courteous. It's clear that British Airways are not  an airline they  formerly were and  we hope that passengers begin to  reconcile with their  frustrations as drastic  measures are needed  towards bring the  airline back to  its former glory.

Paris to Larnaca - departed on  a flight nearly  every M&S food  served to passengers ran out while  flight crew were half way down  an aisle. Larnaca to Heathrow - two messages received while in Larnaca  saying - the  flight would be  late by over  1 hour-departure was supposed to be  about 7.15 pm  and we took  off nearer to  9 pm. The  third message was  - there was no food to  passengers served on the flight, "we recognise that this  did not meet with the standards  we expect from ." The flight was 5 hours long-so this combination  of a delayed  departure and no  meal available on  board is totally unacceptable - worse than a budget . A midnight arrival at Heathrow was then compounded by off loading cargo before the passengers because of a "balance problem". In addition I was incorrectly charged  € 75 on  the return leg  of my case - it was  actually the same  bag that I  went out to Cyprus with but the system identified  this as extra baggage. Cattle class is an under hand description of the service offered  by customers. The only saving grace  is the cabin crew-particularly the Customer  Support Manager-who promised to follow up  the baggage issue  having logged my complaint. It will take ages to resolve but he was helpful and  helpful throughout. How British Airways can  deliver such a  great product and expect people to keep flying with  us is beyond  belief

Los Angeles to  London A very enjoyable and comfortable flight on the new recliner seat set up on the 787. BA have raised their game and provides a superior seat to make for a relaxed flight . If you are travelling solo  the retractable divider gives you privacy  with your neighbour. Only problem is the 2x3x2 layout is one too many seats across, as it leaves two very narrow gangways; if you have an aisle seat in the "turn right" section in Business Class you will be constantly whacked unintentionally(?) by Economy section passengers with their carry-ons when boarding. Food and drinks were excellent, with  wine served separately and the wine bottle frequently produced by flight attendants who gave a great service to  the passengers. Entertainment choice also excellent with a film  on for everyone. Thanks also to  those people most of us forget  and the flight crew who got us safely to  Frankfurt 15 minutes early and put  their plane down so gently we hardly noticed we  had arrived! Well done BA for providing such a good product and service.

Got to Phoenix,  Arizona yesterday. The  airplane was supposed  ta land at . However, it  lands at 1940.  Because of this  I missed my connecting flight to Ontario, California aboard  American Airlines. By  the time I was able to go through custom and pick up  the luggage, it  is already 2030.  That flight departs  at 2037. I went to the ground crew of  American Airlines, they  tell me that I will not  been able to  get it to  the connecting flight  as they are  not on the  schedule They then  referred me to  American Airways. I  talked to the  flight attendant of  British Airways and  she told me to go back to American Airlines  to get it  again booked. I  came back to  US Airlines then  they told me again to back  off British Airways since they are  also the one  which caused the  problems I went back to British  Air with the  American Airlines supervisor.  A British Airways  employee gave me  my card with  their customer service  number and told me to call  back in the  morning She did  to offer any  accommodation or anything.  American Airlines said  I can re route it for  Saturday morning but  I did not  offer any accommodation. I ended up  doing my own car rental and  flying from Phoenix , California in  that middle of  a night since  I was not  possible to resolve  the issues with  the airlines.

San Francisco to  Paris After paying  twice for flights  that I had  them cancel, they  dont allow any change of dates or change of  flight and after , that wouldn't  give me the  free Avios points because I wont  be on the  plane

Rome to London. One of the best European airlines to travel with  on short haul  flights The online website is very clear and easy to use. Check-in procedure was smooth. The gate was very close to the shopping area. Boarding the flight was very well organised and quick and through the airbridge. The only negative aspect is  when you will need to pay  with a drink, as they don’t serve anything free  on all European .

Welcome to Gatwick  in economy class with an silver status BA card. No online check-in  (  BA  system suggests passenger  should arrive at the airport 3 hours before flight , but airport check-in (the only available option) starts  3 hours before . No lounge  access (there is a lounge in  every terminal open to other airline customers, except BA).  No priority boarding for Business and  Economy level passengers. Boarding the plane  via bus. Not  having free water on board in economy.

Tampa to Gatwick.  I paid to have my seats  bumped up to  first class and when I got to the airport they wouldn't let me on the flight because someone on their side  showed up when they booked my  tickets so instead of honoring my seats they just sat there for  one hour telling  us they can't do anything and  I can't get on the plane. They waited till  that very last second before the  call in period closed to reissue my tickets and won't reimburse me for the seats that I paid for, but never received.

London Heathrow to Madrid. I travel from LHR regularly.  UK Airways have  shown to be reliable and their service is of good quality. As a frequent traveler, I've been able to use the  automatic boarding and also managed to get exit row seats. This airline  is very good with providing tangible benefits to silver members. The lounge at Heathrow Terminal  2 is also very good and  provides a good  variety of food and refreshments. The bar is very well stocked and also a good selection of soft  serve available. I'm very happy with  this airline service and would definitely recommend British Airways. Keep it up guys.

Gatwick to St Lucia return. Recently  returning from a two week holiday with my wife in Caribbean for a 60th birthday celebration. Tickets bought in August 2018 and decided to spoil ourselves with a Club Class return, having flown out Premium Economy. Arrived at airport  to be told that we'd been downgraded to Premium Economy due to overbooking. Apologetic ground staff (defending the indefensible) but no apology on the plane. Fuming all the way back to London, exacerbated by hopeless cabin staff service (tea  after I asked for coffee) and filthy food. Complained on return through  BA exec Club  Economy with response from Customer Service 10 days later. BA claims that overbooking is a very rare occurrence and gave a lukewarm apology. Evidence from ground staff on both journeys contradicts this and it seems to be a standard occurrence during peak season. We booked early so probably had relatively cheap seats. BA has  now made money by selling our  seat to a higher bidder. General quality of BA service, food and wine has fallen  significantly over the last few years. BA is now  running a low cost airline, flying  a fleet of very tired aircraft, trying to preserve the gloss of a quality airline. The accountants may win in the  near term but passengers will vote with their feet. Avoid this airline  if you possible can. And the final insult in  booking premium seats  from BA is that you get  only £40 to pre reserve in  Standard and £70 in Premium Economy. BA, you are having a laugh with the flying public. On this performance you don't  need to stay in business.

It's been many years since I flew long haul British Airways and I was pleasantly surprised by recent flights. BA staff used to be  mean and inhospitable but that's all changed. From the  start of arriving  at London Heathrow  airport the staff have been really friendly and helpful. Similarly on the flight, the attendants couldn't do enough for me. When I requested tomato juice with Worcester , the attendant made a special trip to the rear to get  water On the way back I asked for a tonic water and, again, they offered to go and get it. The  size of these newer planes allows me knee room, even though I'm  just 3ins and the headrest can be slid up  far enough too. The entertainment system,  though a little quirky in its operation and menu system compared to the slickness of Cathay Pacific, nevertheless had a good  selection of movies and TV to watch. Both flights ended up arriving on time, despite delays at Heathrow  a ways, and the pilots kept  us cheerfully informed as what was going on. Food quality was reasonable, again not up to the standard of Cathay Pacific, rather let down by a filled croissant for breakfast which I thought was a bit mean. Overall a very pleasant flight, thanks BA. Is  it because competition is hotting up and BA now have to try harder?

London Heathrow / Pisa return. My  wife and I  fly this route  three times a year as we have a home in Tuscany. Sometimes we pay in long advance to get a decent price, or we pay using Avios. This return trip was the latter. It is what it is. The  biggest miserable rip off for a business class seat  on the world. I have seen last minute flights on this route  so high as  our return. BA should be ashamed of themselves. The only reason we fly this product is that you  have the business class lounges in both directions. The seating is at  the front of the plane for a speedy exit. The new meals are quite good and the free (is it really !) booze. The seats are the biggest con. Three  chairs for two - with a dumb table in the middle. Unless you are in the front row the leg room is a disaster. On the way out we had a nice tomato and mozzarella salad  and wine. On the way back - a ploughman's  - it was okay-ish. As a  60 year old businessman, one who has worked globally in my career in the US,  Asia and the Middle East - and having sold my business a few years ago, to one of the largest PLCs in the country - I think  I know a  lot about running companies. I know I could do a lot better than the current board at BA.  One week when  I was away, I read that BA have posted well in excess of one billion profits last year. Oh, what a surprise and that's the clear objective of the directors.  So what would I do with Club Europe? I'd make it the best in Europe. The seat would  look larger, like an arm chair. A 2+2 configuration.  There would be a nice centre  of Charge ports  for phones/laptops. Headsets.  Wide screens mainly for news - but some movies  and flights over 2 hours. Extra  amount of leg room behind row "1". Nice cutlery and glass/china ware. Hot meals. And  they probably sell it at £25  a flight more. "Build value guys" and the profits will follow. Its the oldest dictum in the book. I will give credit where credit is due. On  my way back, on the ground, the Captain announced there was possible a technical problem with the starboard aileron. As an aviation buff I loseley understood the problem and figured it was not really a big  issue Clearly some passengers were worried we were on <mask> duff plane. He picked up on that and took the initiative to take a relaxed walk, the length of plane, asking if anyone had concerns or questions. One or two did and he answered their concerns in a calm and thoughtful <mask> and explained he was only <mask> a precautionary measure. Very nice chap. We took <mask> 2 hours later when it was fixed and everything was fine. <mask> in both directions were very good.

Edinburgh to Boston via London. The planes are ancient and need to be replaced. If these were cars they would have an antique plate. The seats are  old and worn. There is no lumbar support. The space between the  person in front and your face is inches. It’s  almost claustrophobic. The food is awful and last evening we were not offered a choice. So for $1200 each we had horrible seats and terrible food. The short connecting flights do not even offer bottled water. The M&S menu is expensive and  very limited choices. Meal deals in the airport convenience and drug stores  are much better options for less than half the price. The planes on both long legs of the trip last week were filthy. The cabin crew on the BOS to LHR and LHR  from EDI were good. There was one member in the LHR to  ED who was snippy to passengers  who seemed put out by needing to do her job. Boarding is supposed to be by group but was a disaster as people queued up well before  their section was called and it made it extremely difficult to get to board. British Airways has become like a budget airline who does not charge budget pricing.

Flight to Mauritius. My wife and 2 friends booked and paid £56 each to select our seats with additional legroom adjacent to the bassinet stowage. On boarding  the flight the configuration of the aircraft differed, meaning  we had the  original seat row and number but without the additional ! My formal complaint to BA  have been met with what can  only be described  to condescending platitudes and a blank refusal to refund  our seat booking ! We feel  like this a scam and are continuing to pursue the matter. Trading standards are also being informed. It  did help the aircraft was delayed by 4 hours on the outward  flight was filthy dirty. The return  flight had numerous  minor defects and my seat recline did not work. I also noted a number of  other minor airworthiness  problems (I am a licensed engineer).  The marketing email in celebration of 100 years of  flying has thanked me for flying hundreds of thousands of miles with BA and then  let me off with nothing in return. British Airways you are a disgrace, get your act together and provide the service you were once famed for.

Coming out of Heathrow on 22nd  March to New  Delhi 20 mins  into our flight  time we noticed  the Tv's weren't working (4 travellers) but I have  gotta say the  flight crew managed  to reset them  so they we  were working within  an hour. The  point for reviewing this is how  good the crew  was The crew  for this flight  was amazing, nothing was too much , Thank you to all involved on that flight.

On flight BA  via Gatwick to  George Town and Iberia on the  BA I am  about 5'2" 8st  row and I  found the leg way too cramp. The onboard flight  control system was  off on the BA flight most of the time.  This was probably  about the last 2 hours of  the flight before  someone managed to fix it and the system was old fashioned and movies were streamed  on a loop. The food was  not edible. Coming  down on Iberia the entertainment system  was better and the food was  much better but  the seats legroom was just as  bad I was almost bumped off my connecting flight  with MAD due  ot the lockers being filled up. I had another  reservation to make at LHR and I was not  about to miss  this so I had to insist  they let me  on though loads  more other passengers  being led off. This was the  shortest flight I have flown on. Last long haul BA flight for me.

New York to  Paris via London.  I have been  told when around  on aircraft, food,  drinks and information  was deplorable. Booked  economy class. First  flight overnight from  Manchester to Heathrow  is quick, mediocre  shuttle service then  the Chair is  pulled up so  you staring at  a stranger, it’s  awkward and difficult  to maneuver with  clear instructions. Didn’t  call me for  long not sure  why they had  my fill in  my form for  why I wanted  to be woken . No instructions  about the transition  from BA flights.  Now I’m on  BA flight from  Amsterdam to Venice,  no offer of  cold water but  no business class , just coach  and no extra  leg room, just  two seats with  a middle one  spread out. Person in front of  them put their  legs back and  there knees are  touching my chest.  I didn’t pay  for international business  flight to get  stuck in uncomfortable  chairs for 2  hour flights. I  now fly BA  flights

Chicago to London : Club Class on British Airways is without doubt the worst in  the airline industry.  * It is bad enough that BA persist using out of date airplanes, circa 25 year old B747-400's,  but they perpetuate the dreadful ying/yang seating arrangement of  Club Class, where you have to look directly at the passenger next to you, and raise a screen for privacy. Then,  let the crew lower the screen to serve the food. To leave the seat, one has to climb over the legs  like a sleeping , mean feat in the dark. The crew from  Chicago were appalling, and dumped the  food upon us as quickly as possible. Breakfast was inedible, and I  found it uneaten. The lounge at  home was a crowded, tiny, dirty facility, with a food bar including some wilted vegetables and crackers with cheese. Insufficient chairs, and a single,  small TV. Does no one at BA care how BAD they have become for premium  air passengers.

London to Chicago. Could it get  any worse? The  plane to Chicago was equipped with  your usual ancient  Airbus 747-400. The  British Airways First Class product doesn't  match up to  the Business Class . This particular flight was late  arriving and the  service / wine was simply awful. There is nothing  remotely elegant about  the First Class, and the crew  show no sophistication.  My experience was  like dining at  a worst restaurant ! Finally, not  only is the aircraft tired and  burnt out, but  even in flight  its entertainment system  did not work, and had to  have rebooted twice.  Their First Class  flight is a  total joke, and  extremely uncomfortable. British Airways are at  best twenty years  ahead of date  in their entire First Class product. All that can be said about this airline is woeful. The Concorde First Class lounge  in Heathrow is filthy dirty, and  urgently needs refurbishment.

Prague to London Heathrow. Very disappointing service. Cabin crew only managed to  deliver drinks to half the cabin, on a two hour flight that was already delayed  as payment machine was broken, staff ran backwards and forwards as nothing seemed available on  a trolley. On the bright said,  we did save by not having to pay the over inflated prices.

London City to Florence. My flight was at around 7am in the morning. Not only  I got canceled 3 hours before but at the  airport there was no phone line open to call  and manage a rebooking. On their site I had the option to reschedule my flight but I couldn’t select any flights on the same day. Interestingly i was able to find & book  this one through Skyscanner again with BA at the  end of my initial flight with £100 more, of course. Why couldn’t they simple show me this flight on the reschedule page?

Back to Johannesburg.  When the aircraft  only half full, I was looking for a great . We left  on time, and that was the  only positive point.  I started watching  my movie, and a young flight attendant  approached  and asked for  our dinner choice. I told her  that I would love a G&T  to start with,  and then I will read the . She told  me that this  was a late  flight departure (9pm , not late  on me) and  so no pre-dinner  meal would be . I insisted  it is business , after all,  one full flight).  Five minutes later,  she brought a  tray with everything  inside it (G&T,  main dish, main  meal and dessert).   Never was  I offered wine  nor coffee. The lights were turned  down and I  would not see  another flight attendant until 1:30 hours before landing.   The passengers in  flight where treated  the same and :

Flying to London : Flight on time, not completely , had an aisle seat near back of plane  but the entertainment  was in the  middle Some reviews  say that the last few windows  were blanked off  towards rear of the aircraft but  did so on  this plane. Breakfast  was served which  was OK. Cabin  was mixed, mostly  good and worked . Crew uniform  still looks a  tad tatty compared  to rivals in  that part of  the world. There  is good and bad still with  breakfast - bad  about the so iled chicken wrap  bought just before  departure - leathery and inedible -  rarely do they  put themselves down  after such a  generous offering -  but any passengers  but me could  taste it. Bad  in that there was an old  drink and food  tray in my  back pocket. Good  with the newer aircraft and the breakfast has improved.  Flight on time at Heathrow but to a remote  location

Flying to Tel Aviv via London. At Miami airport on October 2018  What a pleasure  when dealing with  an agent, so  so nice and helpful to the  very last detail.  And on February  2019 calling British  Embassy to redeem my Avios what  a pleasure dealing  to a patient,  helpful and nice  lady She explained  me in such . You are  doing great with  your fantastic employees. </s>

On to Seoul. I normally fly  solo but this  was a last  chance flight and  The cost of  it was prohibitive , so I  figured I would  offer World Traveller  Airways a go.  Our cabin is  spacious and intimate  and I was  impressed how roomy  and comfortable the  seats were. The entertainment system was  as well (although  having adverts before  a single showing  was very annoying).  I was happy  with the headphones , small amenity , and felt  the staff were  generally welcoming. My  only complaint was  that slightly pointless  meal we were  serving as for  breakfast neither of  our meals listed  are actually available.  Another similar thing  happened with breakfast,  no options, the  first being the  least appetizing, and no, it hadn't  yet loaded, so  this is an  issue BA might  have to look . All in  All the service  is good and  justified the price.  To ground service  could please at  minimum keep a couple of desks  and people to  settle into before  it puts us  right out of  place

London Heathrow to  New York JFK. Bag drop did not go well. Lounge (galleries north ?) was good and not crowded. Boarding was fine,  no delay, well ! Pre take  out drink was  cheaper than the one i got  from club world 2 weeks previous.  First meal good,  on flight snack , average but my son really  liked it. On time arrival, a good flight. Cabin  crew included some of the older  crew who are  a mixed fleet crew and it stands out a mile. I thought  that was a good flight.

San Diego to London. From the moment that I boarded this flight  scheduled to take  place at 19.25),  the crew had  zero interest and  purpose only -  To get the  runway lights off, which they duly achieved two hours ! As a  result the service  was negligent in  its extreme. This  being a Club  Med ticket -  quite expensive and  I looked forward  to a decent level of service.  Unfortunately I wasn't offered champagne on  my wine with my meal or  tea and port  after my meal.  We complained to  management when I got home but  most weren't interested and I was  presented with a  lack of corporate  incompetence This flight  is a disappointing  start to what 's been a  wonderful trip to  the US &  UK and has  presented me with  the very poor  impression of the  world

Back to St  John Flew BA  completely revamped business  airline today and  saw huge improvement  over the old  line up. Well lit cabin, improved  seat comfort, better  and operational entertainment  system (always hit  & miss before)  very decent food.  The crew worked  great and were  friendly I have  experienced along with  everybody else the  high standards at BA and have  changed most of  my travel to  budget airlines but  from the basis  from today’s experience I will consider  myself in the . Much improved, well done.
Back to Chennai.  Flight was amazing. The crew were  extremely friendly. The  atmosphere was amazing  & the seats were comfortable. T  was overall an  awesome flight and I enjoyed it .

Back to Tampa. BA broke my  bag and I did not make  a fuss, I  actually got a  new one. The new one was  too large for  my overhead bin on the return  trip (the only suitcase I could purchase while abroad).  Then on top  with the new  bag I had  TO actually pay BA to check  a new bag.  Hit me over paid for their . They also  turned off customer  support to some  customers abroad. You  might get an email a month  before saying "I'd  like to know you that we are unable to  provide refund". Make a big fuss  at the airport if they break  the stuff so  maybe you can avoid this black hole they call  customer service.

The husband and  I flew on  UK Airways flight  501 from Baltimore  to London Heathrow  airport on the  14 February 2019. Every aspect of  this flight was  worse than what budget airlines have  to offer. The plane was shabby  or dated. The  seat reclining facility  did not operate  or was not  very comfortable, and  it had less  ventilation than the  standard with budget airlines. The touch screen TV monitor  was not working . One ear phone on the  plane did not  work The audio  system was too  loud for the  seat so the  headphones kept falling  out making it  difficult to enjoy  any in-flight entertainment  which in itself  was a dated  flight The pillow  smelled disgusting and  kept falling out  from the flimsy  fabric The air  condition lacked consistency  in between very hot and very  hot air. The restroom occupied sign  never lit up  looked vacant even  when it was . However what  made the flight  most unpleasant was  their bad attitude  inside the cabin . They were  extremely unfriendly and quite clearly did 't want to be there. There  is one exception,  one extremely pleasant  female crew member  that greeted us  on and off the flight. There  do not appear  to be any  communication or smooth co-ordination when distributing  the meals. Our  individual trays of food where placed  upon top of  the other and  were thrown at  them by a  sour faced crew member. This flight  was one hour  delayed making us nervous about catching  the connecting flight. There was no  sign or instructions  sent to us about connecting flight  seat numbers before we landed. Unlike  all the other  airline that I 've travelled with  There were no staff member greeting the connecting customers  to point them  in the right  seat or re-assure  me British Airways  may be my  second choice of an airline to  travel with and  i would only  travel with them  once if there  were no other  airline

Welcome to Gatwick. I couldn't imagine that first class on BA would be the same as travelling in  Business class with for example Qatar, Emirates, Etihad, Singapore, Thai etc for double the price. Cabin, seats and  wine equals business class. One of the red wines on the wine  table was out  to start when I left London outbound. Cabin crew  behaved well and gave splendid service. But first class on BA is not worth the fare. When I  went to customer service after I  returned home, all  they got was they are in the process of  a world traveller.

Flight to Athens. Classic BA love  hate hate relationship : one flight  is perfect and  that one is  a total disaster.  Remember in December  2016 at Heathrow , when BA check-in and baggage  and IT systems  were down for  AT least 90 minutes. Total chaos  with people like  myself arrived at  the airport 2:30  mins before the  flight and queuing  with others arriving  15 minutes prior  to their departure  being given priority.  Even though we  were checked in  at some point,  this flight was  extended by 2+  hours on top  with the problems.  Our flight does  NOT have enough  passengers onboard. At least the crew  has attempted to  cut flight time  to the minimum.

We booked a  British Airways flight  from Amsterdam to  the Heathrow. In  the beginning everything went normal and  the Check-in and  boarding was easy and on time  and once everyone  entered the problems started one after another. First an  announcement was made  to the pilot  for a flight delay due to  high winds in Heathrow (fair enough).  Once the wind  situation was resolved  and a passenger decided to leave so they had to take out  some luggage. After wards we received  our 3rd announcement  that there is  some computer malfunction  at Schiphol Airport  but they are doing their best to resolve it.  It caused us already about 45-60 mins delay but  I and other  people still remained  happy and relaxed , then the hell started. We  had permission to  get off after  45 mins and  asked the pilot  requested passengers who  did not wish to travel to  leave the plane. Of course there  was many passengers  that were travelling on business and I guess too  busy to make it on time  from their meetings  and they decided to leave. The  pilots warned them  but this might  mean terrible delay  or problems for  some other passengers  and they still decided to leave. So a group  of passengers left and we missed our opportunity to take off. Then  the pilot announced that we can  get off after  1 or 3 . The flight was full of  unhappy travellers. We  spent 2 hours  sitting in a  flight which was not moving anywhere, people unboarded the  aircraft 4 times in total and  neither food or  beverage was offered  for us. We  have to line up next to the bathroom to purchase food and drinks and pay for it. The overall experience was  great and it  changed the whole plan for my first day in London.

Fly premium economy  on British Airways  between New Orleans  to London was  an absolute pleasure. The nine hour  trip was an  amazing experience, with  ample legroom, reclining  seat for a  sound sleep and  less noise. Definitely  recommended and will  consider flying premium  for long haul !

Tokyo to London. I was looking forward to this flight because of the Club World ticket and because it was my first time flying on a Boeing 787. We had a good check-in experience, breezed through the airport and enjoyed the JAL Lounge at Narita. We boarded on time and first  impression of the Boeing 787 were good: a modern plane with nice mood lighting as we boarded. The food and wines were really good.  I had a beautifully-presented Japanese starter followed by a  light lunch as a final reminder of the holiday and my wife chose the western options. There was plenty of choice on the IFE and there was a big screen. On the downside,  my cabin was too hot which made it difficult to sleep on the flight. This was a problem that we encountered on our outbound journey too. The seat was comfortable , reclined fully but I find the layout of BA Club World a little awkward because you have to step over another passenger's footrest to access the aisle. The cabin crew were efficient but seemed a bit exhausted and could have been more friendly and welcoming. The context to this review is that we spoiled ourselves and flew in first class on the way to Tokyo. We had an amazing experience with such comfortable seats and exemplary service from the cabin crew. We both felt a bit disappointed with the return flight in comparison and felt there was room for improvement, but at the same time our expectations might have been too high because of the previous flight.

Welcome to Tokyo ! My wife  & I treated ourselves to first  economy flights for our holiday to Japan with the  rest of my  parents and a  new Amex companion . We were  so excited about  flying first class  as the dedicated  lounge area at  JFK was great.  I boarded on  time and the  passengers did not . We had  really grand seats  with lovely surroundings.
