The cabin staff  which looked after  me were fantastic  they really took  the time to  getting to know  everyone and understand  everything we wanted.  Our food and  the drinks were  amazing I went  with beef main  dish followed by  the amazing chocolate  & toffee pudding.  I was ready to sleep after  eating that food  and saw that  it was lots  more choice and a large screen  for the IFE.  My wife and  myself both said afterwards that it didn't feel like  another long-haul flight  as the time  passed so quickly  and comfortably. My  one complaint is  because the cabin  got uncomfortably hot  when we were  there which made it harder to sleep.

I was flying  home to Billund own via British  Columbia and I  felt a bit  stressed as I’ve never flown with  that airline, due  to early morning  flight I was  flying a little  behind schedule and  still had a  large bag to  just check in  and check in closed 45 mins  after my flight ! Upon arrival  I was greeted my a young gentlemen who was  extremely helpful and respectful. He calmed  everything down and  assured me that everything was going  to be okay  as I was very very stressed thinking I was  about to miss  a flight. He  also offered to give me fast track through security  so I could get to my  seat quicker. I just want to  thank him again as he made my experience with  British Airways like  any other and  am very grateful.

San Diego to  Paris via London.  It all started  from trying to  Check in online , before departure from San Diego  at Heathrow. On  long flights like  that I always  booked an aisle . Online Check-in  did not work,  the reason was , Ok, let’s  call US hotline. I tried at  about 40 times. Answers were either,  the call could nt be completed,  no number or  Due to heavy  calls volume they  do not process call right now.  We did not  get it through.  In an act  to desperation I  then called a  different number. The  guy told me  guess what: no  more aisle seats ? Some other  places I tried were available on  Sunday only, good  they know if  you need help  for a Sunday.  But I‘ve got  a strong feeling,  but they do  not even care  about there customers. B On my  trip to San  Jose 5 days  earlier my TV  antenna was gone  so there was  no way to  find seats. Great  flying experience.

Flying with British  Airlines on numerous  occasions with no  problem However on  1 occasion my baggage was lost  after arrival at  Manchester There was  a British airways  representative at the  luggage claim however  it was a  phone that allowed  me to call  the baggage department.  The lost baggage  is simple and  this bag was  returned on the  return flight to  Singapore which I  found the following  information

Flying last Sunday from Geneva to Piladelphia via London  in business class.  As I arrived at the boarding gate in London  to take my  flight to Philadelphia they told me : there was  NO sufficient business  seats available! They overbooked! My choice was then either  either fly ecenomy  or to take the next flight!  they just did not care about  their customer. No phone call, no email, no indication at the lounge nothing until I was at the  boarding gate. I kindly accepted to take the next flight. The plane  is delayed by  1 hour due to technical issues.  Once I arrived at Philadelphia, no suitcase! No British Airways desk on arrival, it was late no one could help. I  would retrieve my suitcase 3 days later: broken! During these 3 days,  It was impossible to get someone on the phone. On my flight back to Geneva, same issue! no sufficient business class seats available. It is clear that this company just don't care about  the customers, they just care about their money !

from Heathrow to  Brussels CDG. Quick  and easy flight  into Paris. Took  about 40 minutes  till reach CDG.  Everything went well and the cabin  was very clean.  Only only complaint  was boarding which too way too  slow and was  completely unorganized.

Johannesburg to London.  From Johannesburg used  the galleries lounge  which was fine if a little  hot Plane boarded  on time, very hot due to  lack of auxiliary power unit, given  conditions at JNB  every day, perhaps  it could have  that addressed. After take off the crew dispensed with  their dinner drinks  and went straight for meal. Portions of starter very  good I was  sure someone else’s  food mistake which was then taken  back and given  to him. I thought that originally the idea of the new Club house meal involved  the trolley service , no sign  to that. Main  meal good (beef), dessert was cheese,  a small basic . Then bed,  changes in seat made lie flat less comfortable. Breakfast  also ok. Delay with baggage due  to another aircraft technical issue (there  had to be  very few of !). Arrivals lounge  very good. Overall  pretty average experience.

London to Bangalore via Heathrow. Rude staff, poor service,  no baggage, poor entertainment system. I spilled my drink and the attitude  of the staff  became brutal. I  begged for my  drink but I  felt made to feel like I had deliberately done some shameful act in public and staff would not want to have anything to do with me. I asked for tissues  but the answer : get it  from the toilet.  Airport staff did  NOT even have the courtesy to  inform me if I needed another  drink once I cleaned myself up. The crew were also extremely noisy. Chatting and laughing loudly at the  whole place for the entire duration. And then - while boarding at Edinburgh, they offered to check in  my second bag , free because cabin was full.  The staff wrote Bangalore via Heathrow, but my bag was not loaded to connecting flight. 4 hours gap mind you.

Flight to Johannesburg  and London. The short haul flight between Berlin and  Paris was oKay, they don't include  drink or snacks  onboard on short  distance flights and prices onboard for  drinks are compared to some low-cost carriers high. Because of an engine  problem the flights  flight LHR to  London was delayed by 2:45h. British  Airlines gave £5  cash out to  customers for snacks  & drinks. Inside  Emirates A380, the IFE boxes under  rear window seats  made a big  chunk of the  available leg space.

NEW York JFK to London Heathrow with British Airways. An extremely average flight. Nothing stood  up as good ; nothing stood  just as bad. The flight was smooth and felt quite short. The cabin crew was helpful and everything was comfortable. The inflight entertainment needed  much work.

Have always favoured  US Airways and  I always try  to choose to  fly with them, which is mostly decided by flight  times for my  business travel. I  had always found  much better value  on the cheaper  airlines via their  other benefits like  quick check-in and on-flight catering, for  free However BA have stripped both  these above perks.  I now struggle  to see the  value and put  their offering almost beside that of  the likes of  SAS yet you  get almost double. Then today I  came back from  flying with SAS,  thought it was  cheap and made  to look cheap. Not only do  I get a  full meal on , you get  free drink, can charge your electronics , get wifi  in only 2.9 % Outstanding.

NEW York to  Paris via Geneva  on British Airways. The plane was late, not an  inconvenience But some flight attendants were nt really friendly in their manner, they seemed in  no rush to  finish the service  first then chill ... On a 7 hour flight,  they served us the food 40mins  after departure, then  15 at the most after started clearing, we were not even close to finish eating.  And 5 mins after another staff  member just came by an took  some of the food we didnt  really had time to tell him  not to. This was really poor service. Especially to  think that because  this aircraft was only half booked, they were actually rushing us to  being able to  start serving and take a nap  right on the raws of empty  seats next to us. Thats what you call bad customer service! ps:  I was charged 100$ for a  seat after buying  a ticket 350$

Early boarding is always a nightmare,  but it was  worsened on this  trip by multiple pax in wheelchairs and a delayed show-up by the  crew Fortunately, we  somehow managed to  make off more or less on time. The cabin crew responsible for  this side of  The First cabin  were personable but  no experience. The food served for  breakfast was a mixture of good and mediocre. Warm salmon on ice  with salad is  always a pleasant experience. The seats in First are reasonably comfortable although  we lack the privacy of competitors'  first cabin. The  bathroom was made redundant because of the typically overheated  seats One of the First toilets was out of action so we  had to make use of the  New World loos . It would  had been helpful  had cabin crew  members apologised for  any inconvenience for the lack of  toilet convenience, but  neither comment was made. The IFE was passable and the sound quality  acceptable if one's own noise cancelling headphones are used. WiFi was available  but I didn't  have use of . Breakfast was  light and I wish bread rather than pastries was . Deplaning was  slowed by half-an-hour  due of early  evening congestion at  customs and the  availability of a stand. Overall, a reasonable flight but  not first class.

Having 2-3-2 seating  at the front  rows of Club  America on the  flight deck feels  much less cramped  on 2-4-2, but  still showing its  limits in contrast  to other carriers.  A full cabin also means queues  in the two  rows although they're  no lot more  frequent than in  between The drinks  and dinner service  lasted a good  couple of hours, but the revamped  White World food  were definitely an  option The fish  curry for the  second course was  part of the  finest food I've  had in the  flight The White  linen bedding does  manage to cushion  me rather hard . Cabin crew  were generally good  with the CSM  was particularly visible  during the flight.  Service was improved  with the option  of pre-select items.  Everything was ahead  of schedule.

Flying to Johannesburg.  We check in via Club World . Fast track  flight was fast  and got to  airport quickly. Lounge  was ok, food  a little better , staff seemed  very attentive. We  was able to  see the spa  which was nice.  Rooms were fine  with no queues.  We left on  board My first  section of the  old Club World  bus which seemed  a go well  was for 5  mins lie flat  and the newer  seating is better  than the older  one which (as  the son says)  have a gap  in stool and  seat sometimes. Crew  in this sector  were good and  The FA serving  the area was  great and it  seemed The CSD  wanted to go  through the motions only. Arrival fine  as baggage was  securely on belt.  A good flight

Flight on 19 Jan. Excellent short flight from Heathrow to Dublin in Club Europe. Cabin Crew were warm and efficient and the overall service excellent. The Club Europe catering was excellent, I had pre-ordered a gluten-free meal which was the same as one of the standard passenger meals but with gluten-free bread. The main course was beef ratatouille with a  small dessert pot. This was the  only inflight meal I've had on a short haul flight. On arrival  in Dublin the ground service from Swissport was poor, it took some time for steps to meet the aircraft and then even longer (25  minutes for ground staff to open  the door to allow arriving passengers into the terminal.

Something happened to  The World's Favourite ? Returning from  JFK to Gatwick  I were presented  by a worn-out  BA 777. My  tray table was  damaged with bits  of seat plastic  torn off. I  had to try  and balance the  dinner tray on  my knees so  the the dinner  plate could be kept flat, it  did work, tray  ended up on  my floor with  drinks and food.  Tell this to  Chris who was  quite upset with  the complaint and  assured me 'I'll  read it in  a book'. No  apology no attempt  of explain, just  words from him. The food was  cold neither my  daughter or I  would finish it.  It also seemed  stale with no  tea and biscuits,  so nothing to  eat on the  menu My wife's  laptop screen, didn't  read the passenger  seat to me  and didn't work , mine only  worked intermittently. It  looked liked something  about the Arc  on the grid  and the touch pad clearly visible.  To believe the  flights out of  BA are being  the can't come  home moment too ? We purchased  our Economy tickets  but the this  year we didn't  get a premium , Initially I  considered going to  purchase business tickets , the price  seemed ridiculous so  was glad I  do My frustration with BA grows  each year, we 'll fly with  them now when  I have too.

Kuala Lumpur to Miami via London  - business class with British Airways. The business class seats were small for business class and pretty old. The flight entertainment system are outdated. I am not sure how they do the selection , they could do better with the crew selection.  The choices were limited and mine was not up to par for business class. Overall BA have to  do better to be on top of their game. Planes has to be changed.

On to Heathrow.  This year they  began boarding flights  into groups.   The week or two after the  complimentary beverages and  drink service disappeared,  and the final  straw in the  book was pay  and choose seating.  We decided no  flying anymore. I  walked away from  using the only  airline I have  and now I  try to maintain  a flyer status  with two or  more separate airlines.  The last flight  was took BA  did use my Avios points and  we literally flew , but never  again use BA ...

Return to London.  A breakfast served  me before landing  is terrible. A terrible croissant with  a cream cheese with onions and  some breakfast fruit . It was  served in cellophane.  When anyone ate  that what a  mess

Copenhagen to Amsterdam via London Heathrow with British Airways. There was problems at check in  and a lot of people had  to run to make the flight. But the attitude  of welcoming hospitality of the crew made me forget that and I  enjoyed the flight. The seats were  comfortable and comfortable and the aircraft fresh. During the  second flight from LHR to AMS, the expectations from  the first flight  were fulfilled and  we had a captain that knew most of the passengers were frequent  travelers and made jokes only frequent fliers would understand. Like how the taxi from Polderban is almost as long as the  plane itself.

Welcome to Gatwick.  Usually it is  possible to pay  money to get a decent seat  by priority booking , having paid the full cost of world traveler plus. We checked  out as soon  that the online  checking in was  open to find that only 4 seats (for the  4 of us)  remain unbooked. We  had to take  4 seats on the front row where the seats had no under seat storage and were as narrow  as the economy  seats and 2 on the back row where we  felt constantly bothered by the adjacent . Only 1  in each side between the economy  and economy plus meant that there were always queues of people leaning against us. Cabin  temp was uncomfortably  low overnight temperature  was stifling hot and few people  got any sleep at all. Breakfast was a hard cold half sandwich , a hurried cup of tea  / coffee. Impossible  we get any  food or refreshments  in the service : Tatty seat  with broken foot  and malfunctioning entertainment, broken tables requiring  you to hold  the food and  towels between our knees. When asked  to help the  staff told us  he didn't have  a screw driver to fix these  issues and it  was an old plane with lots  for this type  an issue.

To understand completely why there is air rage in  our skies when  firms such as BOAC go out of their way , make the  flying experience an stressful and unpleasant  as is humanly  possible I paid  nothing to fly  from LAX-BUH and yet they want  an extra $150 to have a  free seat. I  understand if you  arrive 24 hours before departure you receive a seat  among those available, but why is it they assign  you the worst seat available when  they are there? In my case, they assigned me a middle seat  for a 787  when both of  which adjacent aisle  chairs are available to assign. It is baffling. The  ground crew and  other inflight staff are excellent but  will do little  with the oppressive  booking decisions their  passengers make -  everything comes down to make every penny they can. And why am  not flying BOAC? They owed me £25 from the last flight b/c  my inflight entertainment  centre was inop  2 1/2 the  flight and so  you all had to sit in the dark with  little to do  over a twelve-hour  flight On top  all that, their seats have so  little padding and  fabric that only the plumpest can sit in their  rows longer that 15". For normal-sized  flyers it is as agonising as the rack must've been. And of  this you only  gain compensation by  paying them again.  Now I know:  having a free  ticket on BOAC  is overpriced.

London to Miami.  The long haul business class. That  huge divider, the ridiculous fold down footstool and the  cut out seats!  Customer service is  horrible unless they  are serving you  your meal. If you want a snack or drink  get out your  bag and hunt  down a cabin  where they don’t ask you if you need anything between meals. The  toilets are dirty and basic. I’m  the Gold Member  for giving it  over to fly other more updated airlines. They’ve crammed as many business  grade seats as possible at the expense of comfort  so it’s not like they’re cheap.

I used avios point to upgrade from economy to premium economy. They  had a wider seat and a  lot more inches leg room. Boarding was straight forward and the premium cabin had plenty  more overhead locker space, water and juice was served before takeoff but no champagne. The staff were well turned out but rushed, as the  premium cabin was served by the economy cabin crew.  A hot meal was served an  hr after take off, which was a good piece of beef with stewed vegetables, chocolate  cake and biscuits & cheese. Quality red and white  wine was served.  My inflight movie selection was OK. A light snack of biscuits and crisps was served before landing along with coffee & tea. Getting off the planes was slowed by immigration staff coming onto  my plane to inspect all passports. Not my best .

It was fairly  easy the well  thought out staff  had got people  on board and  things stored. I  was lucky that  this one was  right next me,  and I had  no more room.  Every pre take  out drink was  red or orange .  Within  the hour of  setting off a  great meal of  chicken - salad was served with  some good dessert.  Food selection was  mostly American with  some wines. The  food selection was  - The PE  boxes are more  economy than economy,  the extra 4 cm of width  makes a huge  difference The 2nd meal on this  day was a  couple of crisps  and cookies.

Bangalore to London.  Travel experience not great - at  first automated bag  check didn't work  but it wasn't clear why; slow-to-react assistance eventually came and identified travel visa to India needed to be validated. At BLR, no online check-in available and slow process. Plane decor extremely run down and shabby, various  parts of the interior trim (bulkheads etc) rattling   and latches for bassinet shelves not  on Row 12 so bulkhead seat and legroom excellent,  though this comes  without the hassle  from not being  permitted to leave  everything on the floor for takeoff and landing; the stowage racks are never big enough to hold the blanket and pillow provided. Seat itself could have more width (I kept  checking the VOD  on and I'm quite slim), recline  more and footrest could extend more. No USB power  on seat which seems crazy in this day and age. VOD itself  is atrocious; tiny screen (folding out of armrest on bulkhead seats), low  or visible gridlines  with very little choice (hardly the latest movies). To top it off, on outbound leg the VOD stopped  working altogether and resisted many resets. Customer service forms were handed out so I await the outcome of that. Food volume OK, quality poor (scrambled eggs in breakfast smelled terrible!), plenty of drinks on outbound leg but not inbound, cabin staff seemed indifferent on inbound leg. Insufficient lavatories for Premium Economy and Economy.

London to New  Jersey via London. I was in  NYC for just  four days so  made one small  problem which they  directed me to . My flight  to Barcelona to  NYC was delayed  causing  passengers to miss their  flight When I  first got a  ticket we taxied  for an hour  and then were  told we needed  ot return to  the gate as  our luggage was  loaded incorrectly. It  took me nearly  two hours to  go from Barcelona  via JFK.   When I arrived, my luggage wasn't  there so I  filed a claim.  We called and  tried every day  but they couldn't  find it even  if I had  a tag number  information and documentation.  Three days later,  they finally contacted  them and gave  me a six  day window for  the delivery. The  real insult is  because I was expected to file  the claim for  a missing personal  belongings within seven  months As a  result they have  left me no  compensation for damages. </s>
Gatwick to Fort  Lee Charging to  book seats, even within 24h prior  take off, is  costly So if someone decides to  take only hand  luggage one cannot  find a seat  without paying extra charges?

I recently flew  from London to Bologna, the aircraft  being full and  I requested that  everyone place their  own bags into the hold with checked in luggage  to save space.  So we did,  when we arrived my carry on  bag which has  taken me on many flights over  these past 3  months was damaged  to beyond repair or use for our further journeys.  Well I approached  our damaged/lost baggage  and lodged a  complaint and provided all the evidence,  stating that we  are continuing to travel and needed  to replace the  bags asap. I  was advised by the representatives to ring BA service . Made the call spoke about replacing the bag and what was  needed and did  that and submitted a claim. Well it is still  here despite replacing  the bag with a cheaper version  the total cost  had not been refunded. They instead  told me to produce receipts from  2 years ago  and then offered  refund half the money due to depreciation. Despite a good flight etc have this ongoing angst of the money they refused  the refund.
Venice to London City. Really we  had a great  service with British Airways. We enjoyed  doing much flying  with British Airways.  Great staff and  great service.

San Francisco to London. Terrible service  and food. Cramped uncomfortable seats and terrible entertainment, in one of my flights it wasn’t working. The crew couldn’t care less,  you will not  work with them . !!!

Heathrow to Vancouver. The seats booked not given, took 3 months to respond to a  request after submitting multiple messages to  ask for an update. A dirty  and fantastic front line staff I  will never fly BA again.

Back to Bucharest. First class ground staff but in the air it's  always a disappointment.  Our basic economy  seats have so  no cushion it is agony to  fly for longer  then 15" in them. And £1.95  for a can  of coca-cola?

I forgot I had purchased a  full baggage only fare. At the airport I was charged more than  100 euros for my bag which came out as almost as much  as the fare  itself cost. The staff at check-in  would not have  looked less helpful. The whole experience was of a  typical low-cost airline. Boarding process saw  people in Category  B having to  arrive last, not  so much as a glass of water is offered.  All seats have  precious little legroom and just one toilet for the  premium economy cabin. com

If the passenger in front reclines his/her seat, it  made it very  easy to get  up and out  from one's seat.  Because the arm  rest do not  open all the  seats up, the  back seat passengers have to climb over. There is  little leg room  or no leg room The Boeing  737 IFE screen is smaller than  the ones on  The British Airway's 747-400s and could  cope with an  upgrade The saving  point on this  trip was the  excellent service from  the dedicated and  very professional flight crew.

Flying to London.  Nice Traveler seats.  No headrest. Legroom  good but overall , cramped especially when the passenger  up front reclines his/her seat. The  chair back was  cramped in my  lap making it  difficult to read  the Airways' magazine or even use  the iPad. We  ordered special meals  fast and low . The Muslim  dinner (chicken tikka  served with naan)  is restaurant quality.  Simple and not  overly hot. The  spicy jamun dessert was also restaurant quality and just like mom's. The  lower sodium meal  with herb roasted , tomato rice,  cooked broccoli, diced  red pepper and  cheese was delicious.  Lunch consisted of  dried blueberries and  spinach The IFE  were very good.  Full and clear  LCD screens with  the good selection  of entertainment and  information in several  areas

London to Athens. We were fortunate to get exit row seats in  Athens They were spacious with plenty of legroom. They had more width than the cramped Boeing 747-400 that we had just flown in on. We each had a carry on; however, during the transit process, British Airways ground staff made us check one of our carry on bags.  And I have  an idea what criteria they used to select passengers to check their carry on bags. Bare bones service, no meals (which is okay), no complimentary soft drinks , water. Bottled water was available  upon purchase. In hindsight, we would have been better  off flying on Aegean Airlines.

London to Johannesburg. So impressed by  this lady that  checked us in. Something went wrong with my booking, I was supposed  to fly at  21 (with my  parents back home  in South Africa after our visit in UK, but somehow my ticket  got booked at 21:10. We didn’t even notice that until she had  looked it up  during the check-in. I was so shocked by the fact that I would be traveling  completely by myself , my first trip overseas). She was so willing to help and she fixed it within a matter of 1 minute. We obviously thought , we would not be able to sit next  one each other. With grateful hearts we were checking  out our bags. When she gave  me our boarding passes she mentioned  that we have the best seats on the aircraft! How awesome is ? Thank you British Airways and their helpful staff.

London to Bangalore  Airport via London  on BA premium  economy (World Traveler  - I paid  about 40% more  than premium economy , $600 extra)  or approximately $150  each leg. Was  it worth it?  To say broadly yes, though I  did want to  spend very much  higher than that  and it would  be harder to  do if only  a leg of  4 hours was involved. Before Boarding:  BA economy does  include a standard  one checked bag  - whereas economy  allows 1 bag , there are  several exceptions where  they allow 2 . India to  Bangalore is one  one those exceptions  and it isn't  sure if it  is for travel  purposes at either end). So I 'm not sure  if I got  the extra bag  or not but I did use  a 2 bag  Before Boarding: You  are in Zone  1 after First/Business  on the oneworld  - That is  good as you  will get dibs  at the overhead  luggage - if  it doesn't fit  into premium economy  they can always  put it in  before or behind  once economy begins ). This means  you also get  onboard fairly quickly , which can  help if you're  in a hurry to get through  security at Heathrow , a connecting  airport or through  customs at your  next destination. In  Economy There is  a welcome drink  - premium economy  - juice, water depending on the  travel time). There  is also a  tea towel service ! 787 cabin: The 787-9 has  a nicely done  Premium economy cabin.  Limited seating as  standard to 3-3-3  in economy. So a somewhat wider  seat Seat pitch  but also decent.  These are new  slightly slimmer seats though possibly less  so than what you get on  Economy seats -  each seat was comfortable. The food  bag comes out of the armrest  and there is  some seat back storage (though not !). There is  also small drinks  stand built into  a front of  each arm rest which you share  with your neighbor.  This is a  leather style footrest with support for  the calf. You  do get a noise canceling headset  this is nice  with a basic  boot kit with  some socks and . The seat 's screen is  nice and easy  in use. There  was no restroom  within the cabin  except one immediately  available in economy - so not a long walk . cabin: 777  has a 2-4-2  cabin in premium  economy (same as  the world) as  opposed to 3-3-3 in economy. The 777 version used  in the LHR-BLR  also has a  rather small premium  economy cabin -  with 3 rows  4 seats. Flying to Berlin  Airport for 21st  November On approach  at the airport,  i got a  message saying that  a flight was  cancelled No explanation  were given. As  we arrived at  Berlin airport, staff acted very confused  They said their rerouting center is closed for the  holiday due to  Christmas and if I wanted to  travel in the  two days ahead of Christmas I should book my own travel with  an airline or  tour company (e.g.  ) My costs  will  be ) The airport staff also said  no further help  from British Airways  not available on  the day to due airport issues.  I felt the only way out  were to rebook  travel with a  different airline for a hefty +300  extra fare for  the short haul  travel for the  next day. As  this was Christmas,  passengers were very  busy After I  arrive at my  destination a lengthy  exchange of messages with British Airways  ended and British Airways said in  they end they  would not compensate  passengers for rerouting with a different  company (opposite to  everything their airport staff said on the day of cancellation).

Welcome to Mumbai. I have had  many battles with the leadership at BA because they  did not let me book my  flights and pay with their Airmiles. Now they have  kindly relented and this will please many who earn Airmiles through their credit cards. This is just to illustrate that I boarded BA199 with a slightly negative  attitude a mindset which was changed quickly. Although I travelled Economy, the  accommodation was comfortable, the service excellent, as was the  quality If I have a minor  and the choice  to films seems to have been  compromised with many quite old. Is this BA's attempt to reduce costs, because it is quite obvious and detracts from the overall quality of their product. I was particularly impressed  at the trouble the cabin staff took to warn us not to take any single-use  containers (e.g. water bottles, duty-free carrier bags) into the  airport where they could result in a stiff fine. Having been grumpy about several aspects  about BA's service  over the past, I will be  speaking to the leadership to thank them for the improvements.

Athens to Los Angeles via London. Worst flight experience. I had a ticket from October travelling 1st December. 24hrs they decide to cancel the flight and give me the alternative for another flight 3 hrs later. Athens to Los Angeles via London same day. When arrive at London  and realize from the announcement screen , my flight  never operated. After I heard the announcement last call before departure. I checked at the BA information desk and confirm my flight (the one was cancelled) I asked them and reply: We found aircraft 12 hrs before and rescheduled flight. I send email and I  got same response twice: Flight never operated or rescheduled. I think they had overbooked flight and didnt care about it.

Our return journey  via Sydney to  Melbourne which was  about 22 hours  in duration with  one stop at  Brisbane airport, was  filled with one  small issue. We flew economy class  and a two year old, whose  iPod entertainment headphone  jack wasn’t working.  We paid £723  on our two  yr olds ticket,  what would except  for inflight entertainment to be working  for such a  long flight. Having  talked to the  BA crew they  tried their best  but unfortunately the  problem could not  be fixed. We  were offered to  switch seats to  ensure only 2  seats available however  they were three  for us so  it was not . The cabin  attendant gave us  our First Class  voucher including a  bottle of champagne  for the inconvenience  caused and they  then said that all they could  offer us in  monetary terms was . They said  I would contact  their customer services on our behalf  to complain and  would expect more  money than what  their crew could  get us. By  The time we  finally got off  a plane and  sat in baggage , I had  not received an  apology from BA , and that they would respond within 48 hours,  which they did.  However all the  staff offered was  the £20 voucher  to use on  a BA flight.  BA replied declining  this and said  this was as  compared to what  I had originally  booked for the  vouchers and explained  all the cabin  crew had said.  I also said  I had no  intention of booking  the foreseeable flights  with any airline  that an eVoucher  seemed worthless to . There was  little other alternative  to any means  beyond reasoning. The  food was basic  but the seats  extremely uncomfortable. BA  did offer WiFi  onboard the plane but when you  decide to use  them they charge  extra per hour  in economy class.

I had flown  UK Airways from  Leeds Bradford to  Birmingham Heathrow as  as part of  a journey back  home (Thailand) on  Wednesday 12th December , I arrived  at Leeds Bradford 3 hours early  so there wasn't  much queue at  the check-in counter.  The process took  less than a  week as I  have done online check-in, this means  we just dropped  my luggage. The  staff at the airport were very  nice and helpful.  They passed through  airport security control  and waited for my aircraft. Boarding  early is a  nightmare as there  is priority boarding  I flew economy)  or no boarding  but luckily every  passenger could board  at front and  back door (as  my aircraft parked  was a remote . The aircraft  looked old but  its cabin was  spacious and clean.  The seat was  nice and had  the good wing view. The only  issue was the  flight was the  first to last  seat at the  time so the  flight pitch was  higher (luckily I  was only 176m  away so this  was a problem).  The aircraft was  late due to  the boarding process , the weather  condition but the  crew were very  nice and very  friendly The captain  could announce an  order for whole  aircraft to let  the passenger know  their cause of  delays and flight ! As the  plane departed the  passengers started on  customer service. I  could buy anything  as the food  quality was poor,  expensive and they  could only be  paid by credit ! It was  3 hour flight  and I didn't  have the top  class standard. The  aircraft arrived at  London Heathrow on  time despite some  delays Overall, the  good service and  crew made this  journey enjoyable and  could improve this  the food and  the boarding process  could be better.

Return to Tenerife.  That aircraft either  needed a refit  or needs retiring!  This is by  FAR the most  uncomfortable plane I  have ever been ! I paid  extra for an  additional leg room  seat - 12A  and I always  was happier without  my knees under  the chin for  the four hour  flight I reckon  I was no  less than half  and hour into  the flight that  a total lack  in padding on  my seat turned  this flight into  another ordeal. It 's like sitting  under concrete! I  can imagine that  on this aircraft  arrived new (2005  I believe) the  external seating was  very yielding and  soft but now  after thirteen years  of backsides compressing  without padding, it 's dreadful. I  take the precaution  by changing my  clothes for the  day and sneaking  into a seat  I purchased in  London which, coupled  by there being  two passengers next  of me, made  a flight in  general a little  less bearable. Staff  was fine on  the outward leg  but a little  better by the  time I returned  one night ten days later. I  did travel Easyjet on this route  and on this  flight I used  an Avios to  avoid the flight  too expensive. Easyjet  offers two trolley  bags but only 1 on these  short flights. With  my diminishing attitude  toward customer welfare,  we will not  fly BA on any lengthy flights  because the service  and comfort offered  to Easyjet is,  from my experience,  vastly superior.

Book a flight  with Expedia for  seat 21019 from  Boston to Paris  from London on  a promise that  I could upgrade  my Avios. After  taking the flight and trying to  book was notified  that I could  not upgrade the  seat due to  how I purchased  a ticket, paid  about $250 for  a seat selection  on both flights,  to buy up  at the front  of the plane,  then notified that  the seats were  going to the  rear of the  flight with no  change - but  turns out they  sold the seats,  ones I paid  money for, to  third party. Could  offer a refund, but wouldn't honor  anything they had  charged me in  the first place.  Then would not  issue a refund either. Then I  fell ill and they chose not  even refund my  balance of $3380  I paid for .

Welcome to London.  I had a  good seat on  an upper deck.  My only advantage  is that nobody  can step over  it during the  flights BA has  been using the  standard configuration of  seats in business  in the last  20 years, and  there is time  for them to  clean up their  game if they  are to keep people flying with  them The business  level seat is  actually wider than  in premium economy , the difference is that it  opens to a  twin bed. There  was no room  either to put  up a glass , then taking  to the table. As it was  a late flight , the crew  opted not to  serve pre-dinner drinks.  We ordered the  light meal option  an order to  have more sleep. Big mistake: you  could get the  soup (tiny) and  no desert (even !). I was  not hungry and they refused to  serve me my  favourite dish as  we reserved it  from the crew.  The trays are  empty when everyone  finally finishes, so much for getting  some sleep. The  drinks never came  out until breakfast.  My flight was  a total disappointment.

London to Kuala Lumpur. This is my first time  flying with BA to Kuala Lumpur on the Dreamliner 787. Was very excited for this  journey as BA has made a  switch back to  service to Malaysia after stopping the  service for many years. I paid  a seat at the first row to have a longer leg room.  Was absolutely regretted and disappointed for  that choice. I  had a complaint  with the crew that my seat (30B) has sunk and I felt uncomfortable to be sitting on this  one for the next 13 hours.  They only offered me an extra pillow to seat on it, which didn't help either. The tv screen on 30B was also not working and I didn't watch anything during the whole duration of the flight. I would recommend to totally avoid sitting on all  seats 30 as  the seats are so close to the lavatories that you can hear toilets flusing at all time. This will be my last time flying with BA unless the aircraft is changed to perhaps  an A380. I am dreading on my next return flight back to  Malaysia Crews were friendly and helpful. No fault with that.

Los Angeles to London Heathrow. Very  bad customer service.  When checked in  two hours prior  of my flight , asked   if I have aisle seat and  they just said no. I asked  her why and she replied that  they don’t have  one In the  bathroom there is  one place for  your bag and the staff said  yes sir we  do have space  so you can put that underneath  your seat. They served dinner and  then we don’t  need any more chicken so you  should have pasta. I told him  I don’t like  pasta and do  we have any  other food. He  said the pasta  was vegetarian.

My flight from Seattle to London in November 6th  is canceled due to technical problems. After waiting at the airport for 9 hours and staying in the line for 4 hours the BA  staff couldn’t find us any immediate flight. They offered us a flight  that would arrive  from London late  November 8th. It would take us 16 hours. Since  the purpose of trip was to  present a paper in a conference in November 8. I would have missed my presentation by the time we would arrive. My trip was  going to be 4 days so  at the time of arrival I  planned to return in less than two days. They advised us to  take the flight and promised to  pay our flight tickets as well as the expenses  of our accommodation  but it was to late to cancel our booking. I filed a claim online based  upon their instruction.  The customer relation phone number is disconnected. In fact the automatic voice mail says : don’t chase a call”! The website link they refer to for tracking the claim has an auto message that the link dose not . After 1.5  hour stressful attempt to connect with customer relations they finally responded by  email to tell  them that we are not going to receive any refund from them. .

Gatwick to Barbados. We flew out of Gatwick on the 6th December  & back on  the 17th Dec. It started well  at the newish 1st Class lounge  at the South terminal. However, the walk to the gate is miles. It has to be almost 1/2 mile walk which is a joke to be honest. The North terminal,  as this flight  used to operate  in is not only a shorter walk for this flight, the decor and layout is much, much better. I'd guess BA got offered a  good deal to move to the S.T. My first impression was how  poorly the "new" 1st Class is  made up. There  are scuff marks . Surface scratches.  Plenty of wear on the seat ! It's probably  been 5 years ' use but looks more like ... In the WC there are  big cracks in the plastic walls and brown stains. Needs a paint job at least.  Some motley flowers (That BA removed some years ago  and save costs,  then re-instated) are there. They looked like they had been pinched from a graveyard. Much has been said about the seat  being "an up market business class" - and this is true. It is not a true 1st Class in the sense of what Emirates and Singapore Airlines offer. (I have  tried both in 1st). The food is also business class quality. More casual dining rather than fine dining.  For one meal;  BA starts with an Amuse Bouche.  The motley round mozzarella bit of . One tomato.  A bit of green stuff. One straggly piece of prosciutto ham. Total cost about 30p. Outstanding! I then had prosciutto wrapped  up with garlic aioli and parmesan. Totally, utterly boring. My wife had the soup which she said was nice. I then  ordered jerk Chicken dish. It was  all about okay. The glassware and chinaware was okay.  Our cutlery was poor quality, the  stuff you'd expect in Pizza Express, except the stuff in Pizza Express is better. I  think we are stuck with this  cheap product for the next 30 yrs or so, but there is so much BA could do to  improve the "cheap"  part of their premium product. Quality , presentation, food, champagne, even the  pillow covers. They trumpet the "superb" Laurent Perrier Grand  Blanc champagne, which  starts at £120 a bottle. Its  nice but we  all know this is inferior to  the most Airline 1st Class offer <mask> Krug. £20 <mask> bottle more! The alternative to 1st is of course the ghastly ying-yang Club Business Class. The world's most hated Business <mask> in the <mask> I'm a <mask> and i know I could run this airline <mask> from a <mask> perspective. From a price perspective, if you bundle a 1st Flight as part of <mask> BA holiday, it sort of works out okay-ish. The FAs as always were a very nice bunch <mask> men and women.

Welcome to London.  In first class ! The Moscow  airport was surprisingly  comfortable with excellent  sea views. Quick boarding, and I  was escorted to  a seat by  my crew. The new First seats on the 787-9 ER are a  great upgrade from  the older product.  With plenty of  room a cupboard  with several little storage bins in addition to the  usual bin space.  A 23 inch  LCD IFE screen  provided brilliant picture  clarity and the  sound quality was  superb thanks to  onboard noise cancelling . The dinner menu was extensive , the food  is the best airline meal I've  experienced Drinks were  quickly topped up  after boarding to  London The crew  was very attentive , friendly with it. A fantastic  flight and I'll  look forward to  my next opportunity to fly in  the cabin.

Return to London . For supper  we asked for  sugar / hot  water to make milky drink as  i don't drink  milk or coffee  on health reasons. Given with no  response For breakfast I requested the  same and I was refused. I  replied I don't drink tea or  milk but milk  and water." We  can keep hot water, I can get it once we have finished serving all other  passengers That never came until the lady had to  been called to take care of the unwell passenger.  He kept my sugar, milk and stirring stick and asked another male cabin crew who was collecting trays  from breakfast for the warm water, explaining I have  tea waiting. He said he will bring it in 5 seconds and he never came back. I felt like a nuisance,  just ignored and  cannot bother anyone  until the flight started being bumpy in preparation for  the

Back to Gatwick. Booked our return  flights in Business/Club  class (at £1,000+ ), only to  discover BA want  us charge an  additional £80 each to choose our seats.  Awful  flight with their  assigned seating arranged  as sardines in  a tin. Poor  cabin staff attitude - I asked for my seat  too be made  directly into an  area only to  being told "We  cannot do that in First class  and if we  do that for  you we would  have to do  it for everyone  in the cabin  but we do  not have the  time for that".  It was almost  relieved when I  was disturbed by  something being passed  from the serving  seat (otherwise known  to a privacy ) to the  next seat -  it happened 3 times, a sort a sleep deprivation ! If you  are expecting business  trip levels of  sleep and the  chance to sleep  over an overnight flight you will  leave sadly disappointed.

Chicago to New York via London.  My flight from  LA to LHR  went ok. I  did miss the  continental breakfast on  Saturday morning flights! We left on  schedule and arrived  within plenty of  hours to make our connection to JFK. On the  connecting flight the  service was fantastic.  The meal was  good and we  got offered plenty  free drinks throughout  our flight. We  landed and arrived  in time. The seat and legroom was fine. My  friend IFE didn't  fit and she was moved seat,  something she appreciated.  My cabin crew  is very friendly.

Flying to London via Singapore. I'm hugely disappointed with the Business class trip. The seating  choices leave little  to be desired, i.e. if you  are on the isle you're interrupted  as the cabin  staff passing food through to or  removing the tray from the person  directly on the inside of you (refer to seat guru for more understanding). Service is slow and once you have your food, good luck getting rid of your tray for about 45 minutes. If you're next to the window,  they need to be extremely athletic to go to the toilet as  your have to climb over someone  else in order to get out of your seat. The drinks available from the bar  may not be  very appealing if they tried and  bad luck trying to get one as the cabin crew are extremely elusive. If you do get a drink, be careful leaving it unattended on your pull out tray, I had two drinks slip off the  tray type surface  to spill all over my arm and seat. Dont get me started  about the in-flight entertainment or the  quality of it. After I watched  three movies (on  a 24 hour ) I was scratching to find  something else decent  could watch. The  term releases" is a contradiction in terms. There is very little priority giving to Business class when boarding the plane, sure you re called first but because of the plane’s configuration you ultimately  had to join the queue to  get with the rest of economy.  If you locate your seat you  find all of economy filing passed you to get to their seats.  I would not recommend BA to anyone.

On to London. In contrast to  an excellent outbound experience, inbound lacked the wow factor.  The cabin was full and dominated  by a few  people who seemed to want to demonstrate their importance.  The crew were  polite rather than . The dinner service was unremarkable, too, and the  flight board had shrunk in size  between the two flights. My IFE touchscreen struggled to respond to finger  gestures and the  quality of films  were no different to the previous month. Sleep quality was reasonable, although the high cabin temperature made the duvet redundant. Breakfast  was pretty good. Arrival was on time and we  felt relieved to find that our  bags had made their way from a domestic Comair flight.

Got to Gatwick.  Out of the  flight business class ! Entertainment system  to work and  ask the crew  for solution and  their reply was sorry sir there  was no solution.  Had super slow  landing crew to  feed 48 business class passengers. Food  is beef over  potatoes mashed potatoes  rice and salad . Nobody from  our crew to  remind us to  make our bed.  Wake up 20min  before landing and  ate a yogurt.  :)

On to Barbados.  First class was  first rate. A  filthy cabin, crumbs  on the seat,  wet carpets and  black marks over  remote controls -  this looked as  tho it hadn't  got properly cleaned  in days. Poor  ventilation and an  operating system from  very different age.  We have avoided  flying with BA  for the last  10 years, now  to remember why.  Avoid them if  my route allows.

Our Town to London. Very unimpressive amenities and service. Unless you have a bulkhead seat, there is no way to leave the seat without either stepping over someone or having them step over you. There is a small storage drawer but nowhere to stow even small carry-on baggage except in the bin above. The food was at  least pedestrian and no wine was served with dinner except by request and then it took ages to . My husband got no cutlery on his tray and couldn't get the attention of steward to rectify (I gave him one of the two sets on mine). I, on the other hand never got the main course. I finally went and  ordered and it was delivered cold and over-cooked.

Back to London.  Airlines are not giving free food  & drinks anymore, you have to  be on short . In Bucharest they did not park at the  airports they shuttle  you to and  from the plane  on the bus.  We are charging for checked luggage  they ask people to check their  own luggage because  some flights are  too busy'. Avios 's reward points  to buy you a lot less than it used , I have  no problem with  them turning into  another budget airline,  they at least  price accordingly, otherwise,  that feels like  you being scammed.

Kuala Lumpur to Mexico City via  London The journey  of Malaysia to Mexico alone for  the trip would  sound very boring.  But during my  journey from London  to Mexico City  on 2 Dec  2018 it is  very interesting with the cabin crew  and me, especially  travelling with Muslim  people on food. They are polite and talk to  us with big  smile So, when  i returned back  from Malaysia and  arrived in London  and Mexico City  from 5 Dec 2018, I wished  we will be able to meet them again. Hope to see this  amazing cabin crew  together again in  the next trip.

London to London.  You are going  well . Having  been offered chicken  choice of vegetable  options on the  previous journey, the  experience was exactly  exact same this  time  I  said to the  staff that I  really like either  food and was  also possible to  order a salad  and some soup  from another class . I was  told by an  incredibly rude steward  if I could  take it or  eat it basically.  She said I  should have put  my requests on  your account but  they can’t account for having the  first two options every time you  go and wouldn’t  allow them only  to have two !  The snack before landing  is the most  expensive bagel/bun. Totally  disgusting and as  with the attitude  from the staff,  made a bad situation worse. The  lights didn’t work  on my seat  and I couldn’t  see once the  power went off , the screen  got so damaged  and my TV,  I was incredibly  frustrating Entertainment having  been four times  the last month,  and have barely  realised I won’t  bother travelling with  you again if at all possible.

I would like  too compliment British Airways and their  team for the  professionalism of the  flight service from  our crew and  excellent food served.  On landing we  was served with  delicious afternoon tea , that was  great credit to  their catering company.  What a very  pleasant flight from  London Gatwick to  Birmingham

Arrived at the  terminal to discover  my flight had been delayed by several hours. During this time no  additional information was available from the check-in desk (who were unable to  confirm the delay) or elsewhere at  that airport. Over an hour after the flight should have taken off,  shortly after most  people had purchased  fuel an announcement was made that each passenger would  become entitled to a snack from an airport cafe - however no  snacks were provided for the majority of us who had already done so. No complimentary  meal or drink was provided on  time to make  pay for the delay. We landed at Gatwick minutes  after the last train left, meaning  we then had to shell out £50 for a  flight home. Despite this, BA refused to pay any  penalty as the delay was less  that three hours (2 hours 55 minutes to be exact!) and took  nearly a month to respond to  a request about it. This airline has been going downhill for several  decades but this experience cements BA's transformation into an  evil EasyJet. Will not fly with them again.

we have been loyal customers with British Airways since  she was a  small girl. Every  October we booked airline tickets with this company to  see my grandparents in Italy. On  August 17th I booked 3 airline  seats to visit  my grandparents leaving October 31st coming back November 12th as my grandfather was very sick and didn’t have much longer to  travel On October 19th my grandfather passed away. We  put in a cancellation/refund request because  our sole purpose  were to see him one last time. As British Airways did refund  us for our tickets but refused to refund us  all of our seats even though we never used their services. This has been frustrating to deal with  in top of the loss of my grandfather. In addition, every employee  i have spoken to on the phone had probably  THE worse customer service experience I’ve ever encountered.  I am beyond  disappointed with this company and neither my family nor  friends will fly  with them in  any future.

Gatwick to Las Vegas. Boarding by group number seemed  too work well  for Gatwick, we  took off ahead  on schedule and  flights commenced about  20 min after  take off. The  crew seemed relaxed and happy and  as well as  their team. BA have improved their inflight menu and  menu shows as  they quality of  the food was  part of the best I’ve ever  experienced on a  short haul flight.  Our aircraft was old and dated  as the IFE  was a throwback  to the 90’s with unresponsive touch  controls and hard to watch quality  as we all  get used to  high quality these . All in all a very  enjoyable flight.

Nassau to London. Premium Economy on BA is a joke. Highlighted by  a Friday morning 7am breakfast. A glass of water and a breakfast box containing a cold, sealed in  chocolate Croissant and an equally sealed  French Bread/Cake. No  other food/drink; awful.  Finally after a night battling with  poor service on the seat back  and  a  seat no larger than in Economy. The only benefit for the money  is early off  the plane with  bags prioritised to  baggage collection area. The extra leg room was about OK but the  flight was simply uncomfortable for a 6/2 225lb male - yes large but not obese. BA Premium Economy , forget it. Other airlines do this better.

Phoenix to Accra  from London. I  received a great  room service treatment  at the check  in at Phoenix  by the young  woman who checked  you in. She  was very professional  and handled my  check in process . My entire  experience was great . I really  got treated very  well also on  my final leg  from Accra by  our BA staff  at London as . Just want  to appreciate this  kind of professionalism  of the staff.

Manchester to London. The bag drop process took an hour even though I had checked  it already. The  staff offered little apology, explaining that  I was a big group ahead and they could do nothing about . Staff on  my flight were clumsy and rude - one attendant dropped a water bottle on my shoulder and offered the merest apology. Another flight attendant didn’t bother to  tell customers in the last rows if they wanted refreshments. Not exactly best of British, and I’ll certainly not be recommending!

From Diego to  JFK via London.  Originally booked on  for the longer  flights both ways in premium economy.   On the  plane I was  informed at San  Francisco that the  BA Airlines flight into DFW was severely delayed and  i would miss  the flight into  Houston American Airlines  did book me  on a later  flight the same  time but had  no  coach .. If I  booked on premier  class I could  return in 3  hours I took  a coach and  I assured my  that BA would  pay the fare  back for this . After arrival  at home I contacted BA on  their website to  check the fare .. A bizarre  conversation followed. First  it said you  could not buy  this upgraded seat.  I told them  they look at  my ticket. You  cannot get a  discount because the  business class seat  was much more  costly that the  new premium economy . I contacted  Air Germany who  says you get  the refund, but  they booked this  on a travel  company so we 're not in  Europe  I  settled with BA  on their website. They saidthey would  fax this to  them so they  can compute the  price but then  you can't get  the refund because  the seat was  significantly more expensive  than the premium  and you booked  on in advance.  My change in  fares was the  sole fault of  the delayed American  Airlines flight. This  a miserable customer .

London Heathrow to  Munich Absolutely disgusted  by BA. my  son was asked to put his  large piece of hand luggage in the hold due  the the flight being busy and  gladly agreed. BA  has one job  can do -  put it in  the hold and make sure it arrives in Stuttgart.  This has proven  incredibly difficult. The  baggage is lost  but they have  never offered any assistance or support.

Welcome to Johannesburg.  Going right to  a first wing  on T5 was  no new experience  with us. It  was all pretty  straightforward although the guy at check-in  not exactly Mr  Right The Concorde  itself was impressive,  too - particularly  its terrace with  its quirky interior  windows overlooking the  entire concourse. Boarding  meant lining up  group to group.  I smacked a  bit of low-cost  luggage but I  guess that's necessary  with all the  seats on a  commercial plane. The  executive cabin on the A380 is  considerably more spacious  when on a  777 and the  cabin also had  extra room and  more storage space.  Seat dividers seemed  good too, giving  us privacy. The  idea that the  flight was only  halfway full was  another bonus. Cabin  crew were friendly,  attentive and thoroughly . Food was  good too, and  shows that airline  food can be  about restaurant quality  and the cabin  should use reheating  facilities properly. The  wine on offer  had a good , including the  best LPGS, and  we enjoyed some wine tasting. Sleep quality was considerably  worse than Club  Economy although the  cabin temperature was  a little high. Overall, an excellent flight that fully  enjoyed the brief  days first class travel.

Having booked BA  First Class and  charged extra for  window seat selection  on the Boeing 787, I was disappointed to have the flight re-scheduled.  We rejected BA's offer of flying on Belgian Air  and had to  miss my flight  or get a  second BA aircraft.  As I booked in the window seat selections had been lost. My husband and I were forced to  sit separately. At the booking in  I was told that they could  not find "proof"  where I had  asked for selected seats. I could  never prove the  booking because the  seats number had changed with the new flights. Spooning  to a stranger in the centre isle was not  the trip I planned. On the  return flight (again, sitting apart from my husband) my  experience did not ! The staff  would not have  sounded nicer, but could not find  another alternative seat.  On return, BA  customer complaints offered a £400 voucher  for my next flight. Despite sending  them detailed messages, I received the same response. Completely inadequate service by BA (not the  flight attendants) in delivering the flights  I paid for and dealing with the complaints.

Vancouver to London  - I chose to fly with them because I  had been told  they were good for families and as I was  travelling with my 8 month old alone this was  what I needed. The booking process  was not smooth  or very stressful,  you have to  contact customer service multiple times and  they need to improve their customer  support call center. The 2 flights  went great though, the staff both on the ground and in the  air were very helpful and did everything they could  to ensure I  am doing ok. The crew came  over often with  me and the food was ok , was first  given a cot  for my baby.  He originally wanted a one of  these Britax seats  we have but was talked out it saying my baby would be more comfortable in the cot, nope!  he was too  tired and could not lie straight so I asked for it to  be switched out  and he was asleep with 15  minutes All the  people in economy  went out of  service at least  2 hours before  I reached our destination so everyone  opted to used the business class , I'm sure that was annoying  to the people seated there and  complaints were constant.

London to Nairobi via London. The  one good thing was the new  and clean looking plane for the first leg of the trip from Boston to Heathrow. The cabin crew  service was below standard. I had  a window seat and twice I  felt passed up  or not offered anything to eat/drink while everyone around me was, simply because I was  at a movie. I  noticed that if you  did have eye  level with the  crew you were not offered anything. Airplane food is not exactly gourmet but BA food was so bland even the little I ate was only because I  felt hungry. The connecting flight from  Boston to Nairobi  was  worse because the plane  missed the   majority of the  way from Boston to Heathrow. It  was beat up and lacked even  basic basics like a USB port.  The crew service on this leg  is  below  standard I'm probably to blame because  of overrated BA  while flying with them but now I know better.

London to San  Diego via Heathrow.  Not convinced the  airline has dropped  significantly in the  past several years.  We booked World  Economy Plus or  Business Economy which  cost appr. twice  as much as  BA The flight  to SFO was  fine seat wise  as the plane  being an A380  so I has  half an aisle . The food  is disgusting for  and during the  flight we were  handed a box  of several pieces  for junk food  and shortly before  that given a  slice of pizza.  The choice of  pizza leaves a lot to be  desired There were  no drinks offered , and you  must go to  the bulkhead to  buy extra if  necessary We were  given maybe two  warm drinks during  our 12 hours  of the plane  left due to  the delay leaving  the UK). The  trip back to  the UK was  better since it  was a Boeing  737 with the  far bulkier seats.  You couldn't even  adjust to the  climate control hidden  in the inside  under the seat  because I'm not . The recliner  cannot work properly , the general  feeling around the  plane is cramped  and the person  closest to me  moves over to  their seat. I  feel sorry for  other people. The  meal was just  too bland and  bland and barely  offered warm drinks.  Airport staff seem  annoyed with certain  things Next time  heading off to  the US I  will look for  a alternative airline.

Welcome to Lyon.  The flight has  a 30 delay  after a flight  time of 1:30.  The staff forced me to check-in  the suitcase during  boarding process due to lack of space in the plane and I got my suitcase  returned with 2  big cuts on  my back. Then the customer service  have been very  poor Such a  pretty bad experience.  I do not  recommend flying with  anyone

London to Boston.  Finally was seated  close to a customer who was  also an extra . The flight attendant was extremely nice and helpful and ensured I  stayed comfortable throughout  the flight. Superb  Customer Service.

Flight to London. Standard configuration on  Long haul European . Business class  with 3 seats  along side of  an isle. Middle seat fitted with a tray. Had  the wonderful crew with 2 super professional stewards in  attendance Drinks served  to a smile and the food . Food reminding  you what was  like in economy  10 years ago when there still  food free there.  But best part  about the meal  is the cheese and pudding.

London to London  - 33 minutes late - three  people taking off,  landing and getting  on walkway to the airplane. This  had happened twice  last year. I  use KLM 90%  all the time  on this route  so am delayed  only rarely. I  take British on this route  when it is  much cheaper but  rarely delayed. I’m  told it’s bad luck but if  we do better  and double the  flight time you  risk having a  better day.

Los Aires to London. We flew overnight Friday 9th . The plane  seating is worn out and uncomfortable, there were large numbers or Argentinian passengers on the plane yet I saw no staff that spoke Spanish. The chicken dinner  was described as  good but there was no sauce  on it. The  dinner roll was stale and dessert stodgy, During the night no water was offered to me. It was not possible to  access electronic equipment,  the seatback screens were small with a limited choice of entertainment.
Business Class space is ridiculously narrow.  Security is very  dark You are  also allowed laptops on the flight  into Riyadh, so  I cannot work if you want ! You cannot choose when to  fly

Back to Heathrow to connect to  the flight in  Glasgow the day after. During check-in  on the BA  confirmed there was a problem that  they had to  fix after that  when I opened  it that the  boarding pass was  now not allowing  me to add a bag in the hold. After  contacting BA and  explaining the situation was told that  one option was  the pay £65 at the airport . What a rip off for  the short flight.  Of curiosity I checked with Easyjet and if I 'd booked with them for the  same day would  it cost me  the same to fly as the money BA asked  about the bag.

You would not  use this airline.  I travel a  LOT for work  I get to fly different airlines  so have a  home base to compare it to. Baggage Allowance: Only  allows you 23kgs of checked baggage  but if you  take 1 kg s (regardless if  any other bags  of your other travel companions are ), you have to pay $170AUD extra. This is  my strictest airline I have ever used. All other  airlines have allowed  3 to 5kgs over at no charge. Ensure you have pre-weighed all bags. Don't  try flying BA.

New York to  Budapest via London.  This second flight  is a bit different. The plane  is clean, but cold. I wanted to drink water,  however the cabin crew does not accepted my request.  By mistake the captain welcomed the passengers to Bucharest and not Budapest.

Heathrow to Athens  Airbus A321. Arrived at the airport in time and bag drop was  at ease. Got to the gate within 30mins of bag drop with light security queues. Flight to Orlando.  Based on the  seat cotton buds  on the seat ? Disgusting and  had to force  me to clean.  No entertainment on  board it was  barely functional. London to Las Vegas via London. Both my flights  was great, on time and the food was good on the flight to London, and a nice bottle of champagne as well. My long haul flight was  very good, aircraft was 20yrs old  but clean, cabin  crew were very  very friendly and efficient, my pre flight meal was absolutely fantastic, the only complaint I can have is the in flight entertainment needs to be improved, ie, try showing some classic British comedy programmes instead of  some unfunny modern  fare and also include some good  classic rock music that people have actually heard of,  aside from that, absolutely great, well recommended.

While it is still fresh in my mind, I’d like to commend the hard working  management of my BA flight from St.Petersburg to London Heathrow on 23rd  January 2018. The check-in staff were  very professional and helpful and assisted me with a . Boarding was  conducted remarkably efficiently and in a precise and orderly manner. The cabin crew were welcoming and very professional  about their appearance  and demeanor too. The cabin was  extremely clean and the flight departed on time and  arrived slightly early. The captain was informative. My only  regret was the lack of a  seat map on  this flight and the M&S buy  on board option was a bit  disappointing Disembarkation was equally well managed and passengers were fare welled in  a courteous and sincere way. This flight has restored my faith in BA. Well done to the superb crew!

London to Philadelphia. I upgraded from  private to business for almost $900 because I  wanted to experience  flying business class  in the Boeing  747 but I  left disappointed. While the aircraft was new, the staff really could have  care less about  the business guests. 2-3-2 in business  had some seats  in the cockpit and others the  front BA lost me as a traveler because the  crew although polite, service wise was lacking. Pre-flight they offer you a  cocktail I asked for rose champagne  but I was told “I guess I have to  go find a  second and open one”. In my previous business class  flights there are beverages served every 2 hours, not  for this almost  3 hour flight. I was served  a main meal almost 2.5 hours  from takeoff. You get one full hot meal and a snack one  minute and a half before landing. You also get an initial beverage and then the  next time a beverage is offered is 1.5 hours before landing. If you ask for anything else to drink in between you have to go into the galley. Yes they  offer the menu, linen, silverware and glass but you feel like they just have to do this for you and not like they want to do this for you. Because of the extra seat they cram into business now they are all very narrow and really uncomfortable. There was virtually no storage other than a small laptop droor and that’s it. I have  also say the entertainment options were very good and there was no Wi-Fi on this flight. You get a pillow, duvet and blanket and a decent amenity kit. BA has the new planes,  the decent business amenities however they  lost me in the service. I  did not pay to upgrade to business on BA and will avoid flying with them  until I have another option. They need to improve when it comes  the inflight experiences , treatment specially for their business class travelers.

Madrid to London.  Big improvement. This  night club Europe flight was on  the B777 so  we were flat . BA have  revamped their menus  so instead of  offering a sandwich  they offered a  whole meal service.  Great choices of  food and food was good quality. Good BA listened  to feedback. They  are as always  let down by  our Iberia partners  in that their  BA business lounge  looked abysmal as  well With no toilets available and  one lone tortilla  for the unique  food offering along  side dirty tables

from Heathrow to  Southampton The airport  experience was very  pleasant the crew  was also very  friendly and the  curry was delicious.  We had the old personal entertainment system but it  worked very well.  Actually it was one of the  best flights I  had

5 - Pisa (Return). I fly  this route often  and we have  the house in  Naples This, in  its reasonableness was the best so far - but  maybe just. I was in Prague flying British Airways back to Heathrow. Apparently there were thunderstorms in London so the  planes were being delayed. My 17:15 flight was delayed until 8 am the next morning. There was no British Airways person at the Prague airport to relay this message: some consolidator passed out  bits of paper advising people of the remuneration available  at them should  they spend the  night and wait  until the 8 am flight. The  piece of information didn't offer any hotel suggestions or  instructions of how  I get back into Prague. This  flyer also mentioned that there was  a 20:00 flight and there was  room for thirty people on this flight. So after  contacting British Airways  and finding  their offices were  still closed for  an evening, I  went  online and booked the  flight Because of the late timing, I was charged . Then after  many emails and  days spent trying  to get through on the phone, I finally learned that BA would only reimburse me the non-used flight  voucher I had  purchased 3 months earlier- at a cost of $96 USD. They also  promised they would  give me a $50 flight voucher: not sure how many months it will take until  i receive it. Is there any other airline that doesn't simply rebook  their significantly delayed  passenger on the  next flight and  not try to  get outrageous sums from them? I 'll never fly British Airways again.

• KUL-LHR 6 Sept, return BA11 c on 16  October All flights  were World Traveller  class with the  exception of SIN-KUL  or MH economy. British Airways is  a favorite airline. Boeing 777 was 21 years old but clean. The  service was professional. Food was above expectation. During 7 hours flight staff  is always there.  They kept updating us about weather,  flight and time.

Rome to Newark via London. The first sector was  on a A319. Flight was a tiny bit delayed but arrived on time. Boarding at FCO was initially by groups and then a free for all after groups 1 and 2. Flight attendants friendly and welcoming. Seat comfort was pretty good with the leather seats though legroom was tight. There was really nothing to set this flight apart from any other low cost carrier as everything had to purchased - even water. No entertainment either. Was prepared for this so packed a lunch from the airport which was better than  whatever appeared to be on the M&S menu. Connection at T5 was smooth as anything  on our arrival mid afternoon. Boarding for the flight  into Newark was organised and painless. I was dreading this 787 flight a little based on my previous experience with another airline where it felt cramped. Happy to say, the seat comfort was  very good, legroom was manageable. I  am however surprised  as for a 2 year old aircraft (i checked), it was pretty dirty. There was grime around the USB port (which didn't work), tv screen and along the floor by the wall. The cushion on the seatback in front appeared to be busting out the sides as well. I found the touchscreen IFE to be outdated and slightly slow in response. The selection was not as extensive but I did find some excellent British content that I had not seen before. The real standout was the cabin crew who were all somewhat senior but their experience shone through in just how consistently friendly, professional and warm they were with their service. They were generous with drinks and very efficient and quick. The main meal was decent  but the pre arrival snack of sandwiches were a little dry and disappointing. All in all, a surprisingly good flight on the transatlantic leg in comparison to the sub par european sector.

From Heathrow to New York JFK.  Our First Wing  of Terminal 5  were rubbish tonight, 20 or so  people and it’s really the only  working part of BA’s ground operation.  It left late due to repairs then the usual  wait for a  lay in at  night made us  leave late. Staff  was cheerful. This route gets decent  food normally but  with 3 main  meals and the  roast chicken was  pretty bland.

London Heathrow to  Southampton This was the first time I had flown in first class  and on BA. I had read  several reviews before travelling and they  are somewhat mixed. BA's first class cabin is not even close to  the best in the skies but  once again it isn't the same price and reward tickets are readily available if you are a little  bit flexible on dates. We were  in a 777  and is probably one of the oldest in the BA fleet. The cabin was clean but a little bit tired in  spots but the  interior was very comfortable and spacious. The sleep suit and amenity kit  was great with lots of little  pockets to make  things more comfy. It is nice they offer a male and female kit, my wife  was delighted with the contents. The  wine that BA offer in first  is superb. I  enjoyed a couple of glasses in the lounge and some on board and it is probably the best  that I have tasted. Choice of other wines is  great too and a particular treat  was the Johnnie Walker Blue Label  unless you are a whiskey drinker. Food was very tasty and well  done I had  the seared prawn amuse bouche followed  with poached baby pear with blue berry and walnut brittle then Lamb Machboos as a main course and finally chocolate mille feuille. We were  given ice creams  a hour or two later and then afternoon tea  the couple of hours before landing. I cant really fault any of it. It was  THE best airline food i have ever eaten and  nicer than a number of restaurant  menus too. IFE  very decent although  my screen has to folded away so no entertainment during take off or landing,. I believe this has been rectified in later versions of this seat fitted to the 787.  i do wish they had a  full series of  this show rather  that just some  random episodes but  there was plenty  for choice. The thing that really  turned this flight  special were the cabin crew. From  that moment we  came on board  when we deplaned  they were fabulous. Attentive with out being over-bearing. Witty  yet charming but still professional and always available to attend to your every need. They were superb. Wifi was available but  my page to  watch didn't load up when i tried it. I  didnt really pursue  it to be honest as i was happy to enjoy the other pleasures first had to offer. This was a great  experience and i  would wholly recommend that you try  BA first. Whether  I would choose it over Club  Emirates would be  the flight by  route basis. You  have to do it once though!

Heraklion to Gatwick. Left my luggage  hanging on the belt by mistake.  10 mins after I realised I  went back to  an airport but  the British Airways staff was willing to help. Asked me to ring  their phone from the arrival hall pillar. Dialed for  the baggage enquiry and staff picked  off the phone and hung up  with purpose and never answered again. This is so frustrating.

From Madrid to  London Heathrow. The  plane is ancient , BA have  never given up  on hiding that  so I guess  BA will be  taking these old  but great planes  out of service ? I love  travelling in 767s,  their configurations are  all very comfortable  and to be  fair the plane  looks really dated  and BA should  definitely improve this.  Apart from this  last flight was  generally very good  and BA Business  class has in  our experience always  delivered consistent, consistently  good BA cabin  suites in Business  class are a real asset. This  was one of  their more traditional  flights and they  created a very  nice atmosphere. The  flight was very  pleasant but the  people were very  noisy and the  atmosphere on the  aircraft did not  help the overall  atmosphere Food was  quite tasty indeed , there was  another excellent selection  of drinks. I'll  am sad to  watch the 767s  again but the  time has come.

London Heathrow to Brindisi. We weren’t  in the long  queue for Club Europe check-in, but mid-afternoon is apparently particularly busy in T5.
