Galleries South gate was also teeming, but at  once the filthy  toilets had been  cleaned and there was a reasonable selection of hot and cold food.  Check boarding was handled efficiently. The A321 was relatively  fast and clean, no pre-take-off drinks were offered. Departure was delayed by about 30 minutes but arrival was on time. The  club Europe section was unusually busy, with at least  five fully occupied rows, including families with pre-school children. Despite the congestion and chaos, the food and drink  section was handled efficiently, although the food was no better than the old World Traveller offering. It’s hard to see the point of BA’s short haul business class product when  customer experience is second rate.

I have BA silver membership. This promises fast track,  choice of seats at booking, priority boarding and lounge  benefits I would  warn all travellers that in reality  the benefits are intermittent at best and unavailable at  times The majority of the time my seat choice  is changed, fast track at Heathrow is slower than  my normal queue, and the lounges  are overcrowded that it's sometimes hard to find a seat. The Iberia lounge at Madrid  airport equality poor, with stale tortilla the only offering  at breakfast. British  Airlines is a rip off. I 've uploaded by way of example a seat map of their A321 and seat 22c. This seat is  with extra legroom  which is cramped like the others. Yet on BA.com they will try to sell it as an exit  seat as if it has extra legroom. I recently  travelled on Virgin  America and Cathay  Pacific in business  & economy and it really struck  home just how  cheap BA/Iberia are by comparison.

Hamburg to London. Initial flight from  Hamburg cancelled from under us 3  hours from departure and we had a firm booking to collect a motorhome upon arrival.  Total chaos. Ground service appalling and no free service  to board. Checkin from Hamburg appallingly slow, and didn't  start until 2 hrs from departure.  Checking in demanded that cabin baggage be checked in  when we demanded we keep it.  all in all an unsatisfactory airline.

Glasgow to Miami  from London. Glasgow to Heathrow was painless as was transfer to t3.  Edinburgh to Miami  in aging 747.  Was delayed by  1 hour due to temperatures on board being unsafe  on board. Kept  updated by gate team about progress.  Large TV screen tiny and poor  source of entertainment.  Cabin was looking  its age and  a bit run  down around the edges. Premium economy  seats in cabin , seat comfort  was superior on  deck What made  this journey very good was the  nice lady looking after the premium economy cabin. Polite,  very welcoming and  never was any bother for her.  Travel with a  crew from start  to finish .  People in here quick to criticise poor service so  a shout out to this crew member for doing  such great job.  All meals and drink selection very good. Although leaving  an hour late we arrived in time so overall job well done  overall and looking  ahead to return journey.

London Heathrow to  Frankfurt After so  much disappointing experience  with BA, this  is finally a  good flight. I  have an emergency  seat assigned at  an online check-in, though these are usually for extra money. On top  off this no  passenger sat next to me, so I had better  seat than the people in Euro class (Business class)  as their legroom  and the same  as on economy ). The flight departed and landed  within time and  was uneventful anyway.

Flight to London . The flight  landed in time , would have  been ahead of  us if the  runway had not  gotten occupied by  some previous aircraft.  The ride was  tiny bit bumpy,  it was not  too serious. The flight was full  ( kids) and  their crew did  nothing to make  our journey smooth.  We did not purchase any food,  but I saw they ran out  of a lot  of options due  the the unexpected  number of on-board  food

Welcome to Toronto.  Minimum of 10  and age from  6 to over , Business Class  Cabin in 787/9  is conducive for  children travelling, allows  for interaction. Forward ed Class cabin  on 787 is  very private. Service  for both flights  is flawless, very  accommodating to the  two small children  while also allowing  all adults to  enjoy the meals.  Seat presentation especially  in the intercontinental  flights was really  great and the  service on both flights was simply  great Outstanding crew  of BA 603  and BA 99 01 on our  connecting flights from  Vancouver on August  8 similar great  flights BA gets  many negative reviews , myself travelling  frequently with them  have never had  any bad experience.  The seating arrangement  in Club World , perfect when  travelling with family.  Other carriers may  have an advantage  as one travels alone.

Back to Heathrow.  To fly with BA on a  daily basis and  as a gold  medal holder, their  overall attitude and facilities drop lower and lower. The planes are filthy,  rarely cleaned properly  on flights, the staff are hit and miss -  sometimes more miss than anything and very poorly turned  out The food  service business is  appalling and the seating in the  smaller planes is terribly uncomfortable -  and as for customer service, there is no point  in ringing them  they are useless, rude, hostile and will never provide  ANY assistance whatsoever.

Singapore to London. They wanted to charge me an extra GBP65 for  being over the  age limit. The legroom seemed very small to me,  The flight was super full and I was sitting next to a big woman who  was over her  half of the seat. I was asked if I would like tea or coffee with my breakfast and  the steward said  he will come back with the tea. After a long time I managed to catch the same guy walking by and asked him for  a tea and he just said , there was no tea.

Washington to Frankfurt via London. Check-In at Dulles Airport was smooth. I asked the agent if it was possible to get a window seat and she did, even though at the online check-in there was none ! Boeing 747-400 was 27 years old, the IFE was the size of my wallet and the quality was incredibly bad. The seats were ok, pretty standard  but they had a head rest which was good. My seat was 27A and I had the whole row for myself. Unfortunately a crew member shortly before take-off told me that another passenger had issues with his IFE and they would replace him on 27C. Shortly after take-off the service began. There were 2 food options available. Chicken and vegatarian lasagne, I went for the Lasagne which was ok, nothing special. It came with a salad, a bread bun and a black forest cake. All in all an ok meal, nothing to complain about. The crew distributed 2 mini cans of soda which was a bit unsatisfying. After dinner the crew dimmed the lights and we were supposed to close the window shades for the people who wanted to sleep. I tried to watch some movies (the selection was ok) which was hard on this miniature IFE. In the morning the crew served orange juice and before landing a pretzel with cheese and a small  juice bottle. Connecting in Heathrow is pretty easy (in T5) there are signs everywhere! Security went fast. There is a huge quiet zone with battery chargers and  even WIFI. We boarded again in groups which was good to avoid crowds. BA started to do a buy-on-board service which I hate. However I thought the pricing was ok.

Return to London.  The flight was  delayed from Rome  in an hour  but we could  only connect to  a next flight  from Los Angeles as we landed  in Heathrow 20  minutes before the  time There were  some staff members  who helped us , they have  to put us  on the next  plane tomorrow. They  put us on  the hotel next  to airport and  had dinner but  did not provide  any vouchers for  hotels and other  items

We always like travelling on a  Airbus A380. Seats  like economy class  are comfortable and  are able to  talk which is  not on other  airlines or types a planes. However the food is  very poor. In  the last 12  years I have  seen some of  my worst airline  food served from  Delta or Cathay  Atlantic and this  is my most  recent travels with  British Airways. Thankfully BA airline staff  are always the best.

London Heathrow to  Southampton Really good  time on both legs of the journey. Got to board first and let crew know about the fact I was flying  home with slight  problems and they kept me safe  the entire flight  so was a bonus. Loved the  idea that they asked if I  felt OK on board too.

London to Athens. Since I started using BA in 2011, I can 't say that the quality becomes worse. The leg room in Business Class in A320 is the same like in economy. The only thing that you get is an empty middle seat. The meal choices are poor: I had to choose between curry and fish pie. Also, they first brought us the starter and the dessert and after 5-10 mins (once we ate the starter), they took the starter plate and they gave us the main. The on board service, is less 'attentive' than some years ago (probably cabin crew are over-utilised and want to get some rest which is understandable). Also,  due to the plane being late, the cabin was  not cleaned properly. At some point we need to think why would someone choose BA  for low cost airlines. Tickets are priced in a similar way, there is no food on board for the economy (while for business the portion and variety are a joke), leg space is small, there are always delays to depart from Heathrow (not BAs fault,  although at the end of the day I experience delays). What is that makes BA  avoid European flights ? Probably nothing.

From Heathrow to  BA Had a great experience in  The Concorde Room,  the Galleries First , in Heathrow T5. I was  immediately greeted by a member of  BA crew, who held me aside and took me into the cockpit to meet the flight crew and  had a look , all because I expressed a slight interest, and  for that I am thankful. The flight crew were very friendly and it was nice  and see what  went on in the cockpit. The  luggage was very  nicely presented, there  was a small  sleeping kit, as well as a pair of pyjamas.  The seat was  provided with pillows,  as well as ample storage space. You get a closet to hang clothes, a little compartment next to the seat, as well as the overhead bin, so I never ran  out of room.  My pre-departure beverage was a choice  of water, orange  juice or champagne  and hot towels  were handed out. The flight left slightly behind schedule, but at Heathrow, this is something  you expect. Very soon after take-off, the crew began  preparing dinner. I  have already booked  my meal in advance, but the  choice of starters, mains and deserts, as well as  a beverage menu, was very good.  The meal I  had was exceptionally tasty and I would have it again! Once dinner service had finished, the crew turned  over the bed  for me, whilst  others went and  changed into the comfortable pyjamas that were provided. The  mattress was very comfortable and at  slightly over 6 ft tall, I  would not have  many issues fitting into the bed and stretching out.  The were plenty  of blankets and pillows available and  everyone slept very  comfortably When I  awoke I was  offered coffee and a short while  before breakfast. The breakfast choices were continental, or cooked. I opted for the cooked option and I was not disappointed, as  food was very  tasty and there was a lot of it. The inflight entertainment was good, and there was a large  collection of films,  television programmes/series, audio books, and kids  programmes to choose from. The system was responsive and  very good quality, although I did not watch any , so I  cant speak of  its sound quality.  My crew served  everyone a smile and even when  you asked for a Latte, which the machine didn’t , the crew  stepped out of  their way to make one for me which was  extremely nice. They  definitely made this already special experience  even more special. If you want  and treat yourself to BA First,  I would thoroughly recommend it.

London to London. Nice plane, nice  but low quality service on the plane. Both my husband and I ordered low sodium meals. His was delivered, mine was not. When asked, the attendant brought  an uncovered tray with the sticker on the tray LSML. Obviously heated  fairly quickly but  was lukewarm, dry . I was troubled by the fact it was  served with no foil covering the  top Not the  problem as my  last meal, so  we have to take the airlines  for LSML that it was low sodium. Attendants serving coffee missed us , when I  pushed the call button it was over 15 minutes before a flight attendant showed up. One pass through the cabin for drinks. After that,  we had to go to the  back of the plane to find an attendant and  order a drink. Sandwich served before  boarding in the evening was horrendous. Hummus, limp piece of lettuce and soggy thin sliced  bread made this stale sandwich unappealing  – tasteless to  say the least.  Had expected edible food and better, more friendly service with this airline.  My flight attendant , stone faced  but seemed curt and bothered each time we asked about my missing meal. Before landing many people still had trash but  a final walk  was by our invisible flight crew.  We thought British Airways was better than this.

London to Las Vegas I experienced an ancient entertainment unit that was inoperable and could not be reset. The tray table did not stow properly so the  seat remained at  a 45 degree angle with the metal frame exposed. The seat cushion was so badly  padded it was  as if totally unpadded. One air vent for the 3-seat row and no in-seat power. Luggage was mislaid for 33 hours, even with priority tag. After writing to British Airways regarding disappointing flight, BA customer service contacted me and offered an apology and a $63USD voucher toward future BA travel to  made up for their shoddy service.  When you have a choice, choose another airline!

Flight to London , during the  trip (24 hours before, I checked in via app)  i was offered no choice of seating. During the flight, I was  asked by stewardess if I would  want any food , I find that approach not pleasant at all. I was not personally invited to use the Lounge. I find that  unacceptable for a business class fare.

I booked a round trip from  Milan to California for my honeymoon. First flight Milan to San Francisco via London, while returning flight was from Los Angeles to Milan always via London. Both  trips faced 1  minute delay and  in both flights our luggage were not delivered at destination. When you check in the  First business class is mixed with other One World  class so it 's not exclusive  after all. Only First has some real advantages. We found business lane crowded for the  flight  Worst business class experience  and totally disappointed.

Toronto to LHR and LGW to Toronto return in WT+. Finally, BA  have moved back into it’s own lounge which has  been refurbished with new furniture. However, Premium Plaza still staff and operate the lounge. Food was ok – but the drinks  offered remain poor. Slick boarding and a full PE cabin on a 777. Water and  coffee offered on boarding but still  limited prosecco offered  for flights TO London. (apparently 3  flights loaded in  Toronto for the O/W leg but  none for the return.) Friendly mixed fleet crew who offered good service. Fast bar service followed by Veggie pasta or chicken  stir fry offered which was foul. salty, dry and overcooked with reheated rice and mushy vegetables. The salad is a nonsense – a few leaves and a tomato slice. Pudding was sickly chocolate sponge thing which was gross. Got a couple of hours sleep. However the IFE froze after take off due to the PA system remaining  powered on and  not the IFE  still working. A reset halfway through the flight worked, though two loud renditions of Delibe’s “flower duet” burst out throughout the aircraft twice waking everyone up. The standard T&Cs and  drinks and the pretzel roll with cream cheese offered before landing. I continue to be amazed this breakfast is offered as so few people accept or eat  this given how  expensive it is. (BA should be embarrassed that it’s even offered) After  arriving Toronto 5 mins late, we arrived 5 early  to the gate at Heathrow which was welcome along with fast bags. For the return  flight I took the seasonal LGW  from Toronto flight which was a couple of hundred bucks cheaper. An upgrade to Club World was a pleasant surprise. Fast check in at LGW but slow slow slow security – even in the fast track . Gatwick Airport sell £5 premium experience and so  our lane was full of folk paying 5 quid  checked in with BA Fast track customers. Excellent lounge once again with a good choice of food, and champagne available as a help yourself. Efficient boarding and a great reception from the Gatwick  airport crew. A fast offering of champagne (with a  thumbs up) before  take off though the old safety video was still showing. The Gatwick crew remind me of long haul  crew from Heathrow – more experienced, faster and a more relaxed service than mixed fleet  crews at who follow service to the letter which results in a slow and impersonal service. Fast bar  service once airborne, followed by the  lounge Biz food service. Overcooked steak (again) alongside jerk chicken and a <mask> option. Plenty of wine and drinks along with T&C. After a pleasant 3 hour nap, I woke to afternoon tea <mask> was the standard old offering minus the clotted cream – off the menu due to supply issues. At the gate early and fast bags too. This club flight was weird in that <mask> hybrid in nature and in <mask> to the new biz service. So new toiletries and bedding but <mask> old menu. <mask> hope Gatwick catches up so <mask> don’t (unintentionally) promote two levels of Biz service with LGW being <mask> poor relative. <mask> the O/W leg, premium economy was in desperate need of a <mask> The food <mask> truly awful <mask> both dinner <mask> breakfast, and it really wouldn’t take much to add better food, bedding and an enhanced drink service as BA really lag behind Air Canada on this route with premium <mask> I do <mask> regard the <mask> as a <mask> economy service <mask> than the seat. All that said, I felt that BA is regaining it’s mojo with great crew, improved on board <mask> (cuts reinstated) and on time performance. Long may <mask> improvement last!

San Francisco to London Heathrow on the lower deck  of the A380 - a very quiet smooth flight. Did not want  t pay the usual BA extortionate  extra pre-reservation fees  so still got seats together. After the real scrum at the departure gate - no  seating order, struggle  ot get through to Priority Lane, announcements completely inaudible etc we boarded  with the reasonably , if narrow, seats. Of course  the usual BA Club Class "scramble over the legs" to get to the aisle and 8 abreast - not really a premium product in today's competitive Business Class World. Welcomed with glass of champagne by attentive FA. OK meal - beef - with decent wines  too accompany. Much  worked up to  new touch screen AVOD system but still a dreadful choice of "blockbuster" films. Very extensive choice for breakfast - continental and cooked if you wanted it. Really very good FA's - made you feel welcome. Landed on time but  sadly for some  passengers took about 3/4 hour to get to the belt. As usual I have mixed  opinions about BA , if we 're lucky enough to fly Club/Business Class it is comfortable but you do feel a bit let down by the appalling layout and huge  fees to pre-reserve seat. If Virgin Atlantic fly the  same route I will always choose their Upper Class as everyone has aisle access and you don't have to pay to pre-reserve your seat.

London to Dublin.  It was an  excellent morning departure  at Heathrow on  one full flight.  Airbus managed everything in a very  professional manner. The  process was efficient  as the boarding process was conducted  up to the . The cabin  attendants were immaculate  with appearance and  showed the safety  procedures along with  a video. During  a short and  quite busy flight , crew were  quick to sell  coffee and snacks and left a  great impression. I  experienced a not  too good experience  with this airline  back in the  past and am  glad to see  again this time  things were superb.

London to Paris. I wish that  Airbus would update  their aircraft or  maybe even do a little refurbishing.  Especially when the seats feel worn out and the  price for what  you are paying  just does not  feel worth it.  that being said,  it is better  on any low-cost  airline

Delivering outstanding customer service onboard. British Airways may not  have the cleanest, newest or comfortable  planes but their customer service has  consistently been a delight  since  you have flown  on them.

This was a night flight New York JFK to London, so it was difficult to assess the service onboard, although what I experienced was certainly not bad. I think this was a very quiet flight, judging from the number of people around the gate, and there were only another 4-5 pax in First. But it's quite hard to tell when wrapped in the  comparison of the Concorde Room and First cabin. The former felt very exclusive but, as commented elsewhere, to the point of  overly fussy. It's irritating that they don't have any showers in the Concorde Room; I wasn't amused to  get in at the Galleries (business) Lounge, be brusquely  booked on to Concorde, only to have to return  to Galeries upon  learning that that were no showers in the former (it was 7pm, early August in  NYC - of course I needed a shower!). Departures  from NY were running around 3 hours late that evening due to weather, and we were warned about a 60 min taxi to the runway. But we were very well looked after at that point; the cabin wasn't secured until just before takeoff, and the boredom of the taxi was eased  through multiple - and very welcome  - top-ups of champagne, seved by various members of the crew. Likewise, all the perks of first class were there; I was addressed by name, the crew introduced themselves individually, dinner and drinks orders were taken,  everything All very courteous and professional. After such a long delay, I decided to have some more dinner as I was  quite peckish; this came with some excellent wine, and was served promptly, so there was still plenty of time for sleep. But the soup was cold, and the main wouldn't have been out of place in business class. Moreover, it would have  be nice if someone had mentioned that the BA arrivals lounge at LHR would be closing by the time our delayed flight reached its destination; had I  heard this, I would have had breakfast and a freshen up on the plane. A very annoying oversight that led to quite a lot of inconvenience (picture a spoilt guy trying to insert contact lenses in T5 arrivals toilets...perhaps you saw me?). The cabin layout and bed: well, it's easy to find details of this elsewhere online.  And it's certainly nothing special for First Class. Overall, a very acceptable flight, but I  think that the overly-fussy service sometimes  gets in the way of the practicalities of a short overnight Atlantic crossing (where can I have a shower in the morning? Where will I be having breakfast?). I've had business class flights from other carriers that have absolutely nailed these aspects.

Welcome to London.  Great service both on the flight  & subsequent customer service. We are  not vegans so pre-booked vegan meals for our flight. Meals were delivered as usual, and  have the vegan slip on them, but as I  got about to start eating I  noticed that I 'd been given  meat - this made me doubt the authenticity of  the meal. When  we called the  lady over she had no idea what a vegan  is informing me that there was  some meat in  it I had to explain to her what a vegan was (i.e; no dairy or eggs). It turns out that the so called 'vegan meal' had milk and egg in ! Needless to say we did  NOT eat our meals and they had no vegan ! Shortly after they came around with the drinks/trolley, so we asked  about a coffee with Soya Milk - the staff to whom I  then had to  clarify what a  vegetarian was said "oh I don't think we have that, but we have semi skimmed ." I had  then re-explain to her that a vegan does not have milk she said she would go and ask. When she returned  she said 'We  cannot provide that  type of thing." That was strange, because 2 weeks  ago on the outbound journey you did. So we had no meals,  no hot drinks, and our video screen did not . The Customer  service that followed from was more appalling, they could  not care less,  it took ages  to get replies and when i did I was just palmed off. After several months  without having to  get emails I was informed that  we had to submit everything by  phone as they  had it on  - which was  yet another way of getting rid  off us. So  I did this,  and several more  months they offered us the most  reasonable compensation -  minus the value of the meals that we could not eat -  as vouchers.

Paphos to London Gatwick in Club Europe. We had checked before leaving our hotel and realised that the flight was delayed, as were many other flights, due to bad weather the previous evening in UK. We  checked in on time, only to  being advised that there was no lounge available for Club Europe passengers and if we wanted to use the premium lounge we could pay! Whilst we appreciate that there may not be a BA lounge it is normal that BA would have an arrangement with the local lounge provider as we  have experience at many other airports when travelling in  first class. We were offered a €10 voucher each, due to the delayed flight!! Paphos airport was extremely crowded and having paid good money  to travel in business class we were very disappointed with BA, that no lounge access was available. The flight itself was OK, although two hours late. The  flight crew provided good service and the meal service reasonable, my wife chose the chilli  au carne and I chose the roasted chicken, both were a little dry. On arrival at Gatwick at 01-00 we were through passport control , and then waited 45 minutes for the cases to be delivered, again very poor show. BA has some great assets, particularly the cabin crew, but we felt let down by the ground services at both end of this flight Like us many travellers like to travel with a 'full service'  experience and in this case BA were lacking.

Welcome to Paphos in Club Europe. We travelled on the first Saturday  after the school  term and whilst  BA was busy  the check in , business class  opted not to . We expected the lounge to be busy but  there was plenty of free seats.  We flight boarded  quite late but we were not  late in the take off queue. We are used the BA's Club Europe offering and whilst would prefer a little more leg room the  service was reasonably  good Service from the cabin crew was good. It is nice that BA have gone away from the miniature bottles of  water in Club Europe and now  go by the glass. The meal service was quite good, we both chose the chicken curry for the  main course, which  were tasty and  not dried out.  Dinner arrived 5 minutes ahead of schedule. Very happy  with the service.

New York to  London via London. Flight Attendants were wonderful, friendly, cheery and helpful. But the business Class seats that face aft cause the passenger to have  to crawl over  four legs of a sleeping stranger,  especially if you are seated next  with a companion. There is no  wheelchair accessible storage  area by the  door even for a bottle of  wine The IFE  in the LHR-NBO A reminds me  that the game  lacks in its resolution and food is mediocre, at best. BA charges  4 select Business  Class seats. For my family of  four it would  probably cost over $1,600 to get 4 assigned seats on the 4 .

Istanbul to London Heathrow. The plane itself was old,  we found the  airline food choices were a joke considering we have to pay for the privilege and we were not  permitted to bring our laptops on the plane back, had to be  checked in for security purposes. This meant that when I was at Ataturk airport we  did no less than 3 separate security checks. 1 before check in, one after check in and one before getting on the plane. Because we had no laptop there was no entertainment on board and nothing  to do for the 4 hours  on the plane. Norwegian offers free wifi so I could check my phone on the plane. British Airways need to improve their service levels.

Bad service and attitude all round.  Worst fiasco was when my flight from London was cancelled due to failure of their systems. BA refused to rebook us at the airport, instead made to wait over an hour on the phone to customer services which resulted in us being routed to Milan via Madrid a  day later. BA are now dragging their heels over reimbursing me travel,  food and refreshment costs.  We were stranded at the airport, no help to find a hotel, zero customer care or empathy. Premium prices for a Ryanair  flight service.

On to Santiago , Chile. I was flying premium  economy with BA  was surprised that I got a  room (2 seats on the left side) for my  flight The seat was spacious and  even with an  extra neighbour seat, I would have  had enough space  to feel very  relaxed However, Lufthansa on the A380  (& Y+) gives  a bit more  seat space (at least it seems  to me). The  leg recline was  good as well as the ife ater (big screen, wide choice of programs of which I chose to  listen to some BBC concerts). The crew didn't impress me but was very friendly and helpful. The food  is extraordinarily good  ( chicken I had was very delicious) with sufficient  options (cheese, salad,  pasta The frittata  for breakfast wasn't  great however. I  did like that  they sealed the drinks 40 minutes before the arrival  ( bit early). Overall I had  a good experience with BA and  could definitely fly again as all  my things (seat, ground, service, staff)  went like expected  and dinner was  well above average). Premium economy is a good value  the money, especially  after a 15  hour flight.

Flew a now ageing B777 flight BA 0053 to  Mt Pleasant flight with actually quite  nice fillet steak  as main meal.  Great choice of  cider / beer  after meal and  wine with glass  cold Prosecco when boarded. Comfortable seat  but it's the  real bug bear  with 8 across  with "over the  shoulder access to  main aisle. Fortunately  we were in the last row  and my wife was in the  first seat with direct aisle access.  Now we could look at each other and not at a total stranger. I know  people are saying that they are  getting direct aisle access for everyone  into Club Class but this can't  change soon enough , and 8  which is not  even a Premium  seat in the present circumstances, is  the Absolutely terrible In Flight Entertainment system - although  I was On  Board the aircraft , fitted with  a very ancient  and blurry, old , awful audio  on your own  noise reducing headphones)  but a pretty  decent choice of  the FA's great  equipment and gave  excellent service. But  my main drawback  of BA is  its insistence that, having paid for  a premium service, we then have  to pay handsomely  upfront to pre-reserve  our seats (up to £105 per  seat per journey!).  – Not what I expect from a flag carrier . We refuse to pay this  outrageous sum -  the choices have  already noted on  a loyalty card scheme and fortunately we have got  them together so . So, although  I had quite  a pleasant flight to Seattle with  us in Club,  with Virgin Atlantic  in the same , we will  fly their Upper Class over Clubworld , we can 't reserve our  seats for free with them.

Flew London Gatwick to Tirana Rinas.  Bag drop at  BA was basically  seamless and BA  were offering to  bring in your  checked baggage for  FREE The flight  left at 8:10 and the gate  were supposed to be shown at  10 am, which  was oddly specific,  but as we  drew closer to  that time, that  gate got more  & more delayed. Until we finally  had our gate  number at around  10 For which  I had already  booked Boarding was  pretty much seamless.  My cabin crew greeted all the  passengers which was nice. The legroom  was alright, perfectly fine for a  three and and  one half hour . Good recline aswell. I don’t  know why British  Airlines opted for  food on board,  as free food  as before was  perfectly fine. Although  our food offering  were just a  few sandwiches which  were quite expensive.  Since there was no real hot  lunch options, just a few of  the sandwiches could be served hot. Flights were on time. Flights cost  about £320 return  per person, which  was quite pricey considering the cheapest  flight was around  twice the price. So overall, it’s  another good option,  so if you  could find something  cheaper then go for it.

London Heathrow to  Madrid and back. A few problems at Heathrow with the wrong gate  being shown (BA ) staff didn't seem to care this was an  inconvenience but the  staff were excellent, comfortable and on . I really don't mind paying  off the food  & drink inflight,  same as you can pay using  the Murcia airport also a joy. Small, efficient and friendly. I will only fly BA  on short haul in Europe. Very impressed.

London to Amsterdam. BA's service has gone notably downhill in the past couple of years, but tonight's experience really takes the  cake I should now be in Amsterdam - however, I am still writing this from London despite spending over 4 hours  boarding a plane to nowhere. We  were just about on time, around 1930, only to be told that due to weather there would be a delay of an hour or so. Shortly after, we were told that the routes north of LHR were shut, and no planes were taking off. About an hour into  this ordeal, we were told that the airspace had reopened, but there would be a 90 minute wait for a slot. One more hour in, we were told airspace was shut again. After 3 hours, good news! - or so we thought - we were to be on the move around 20 minutes or  so later. We did then leave the gate, and we were given the safety briefing and taxied out to the runway. We were then stopped halfway down the taxiway and told that AMS would be shut due to night flight restrictions by the time we  should have arrived, so our flight wad cancelled. We taxied back to the gate, where we waited a further 10-15 minutes for ground staff to become available. I must say during this 4 and a quarter odd ordeal, the pilot was informative and tried to stay upbeat, and the cabin crew were very good. The crew gave us the in-flight service (minus alcohol) so we were well fed and watered. This is the full extent  to my praise though. Little was I to know that the real disaster was still to come. BA's ground handling was attrocious. We were told to head up to departures for hotel vouchers and rebookings. However, BA had cancelled around 7 flights, and the queues were very lengthy. Vouchers were being handed out to sleep on the floor of a hotel ballroom because "all the rooms were full". I have never heard anything like it. This is beyond unbelievable. No assistance for children, elderly, and no preferential treatment for connecting passengers or premium passengers, as is the norm in this situation. Further, the promised "rebooking" staff had all gone home - I was told  please consult the BA app the following morning. BA's app has rebooked my flights - two days later,  so my trip was for three days total. The feature on the app to select a different date for my flights, so I can replan my trip for another weekend, is broken. I guess I'll be <mask> out their call centre in the morning. This <mask> all simply appalling. We all understand that adverse weather happens. But to keep us on a plane for 4+ hours when they knew before boarding that there would be delays is not on. Moreover, BA surely know the opening hours of their destination airports. Why they could not have prioritised the AMS flight over flights to 24-hour airports I do not know. And as for the ground handling, I have never had an experience this bad. BA staff themselves were thin on the ground - they left most of the work to Heathrow staff, who admittedly tried their best but hid behind the "we don't work for BA excuse". I've had a cancelled flight before and yet still wrote the airline involved a glowing review, because they genuinely couldn't have handled it better. By contrast, I don't <mask> how BA could have handled this worse. They really are indistinguishable from the budget airlines these days, save for the good lounges if you fly business.

London to Abu ja via London.  Despite being a Gold Member of  my Executive Club  you try to  avoid British Airways  most days and  now I've reminded  myself why. Flight  crews don't afford  Old fashioned courtesy  customer service. I'm not saying they  are rude, just  saying they don't  have a decent level of customer  service You get the basics and good luck if you want to  catch their attention.  You walk up  & down the  line without making eye contact. No  staff at the  other end on arrival which I guess you have  to live with, however the way they deal with  you is appalling.  could care less I feel. 3hr  wait on return ! Seems BA is unsure if  you want to  offer a budget  airline or a  serious contender.

Flight to Denver  to London. I almost missed my  flight because at  work I had  to complete some  very important papers that took 40  hours -   but no one  thanked me for  these papers. Flight  into Heathrow was  about what you  expect from a  3 hour flight.  At Heathrow the  plane lasted me  about 30 minutes.  As I boarded  my next the plane a lack  the leg room,  I was less  than the flight .  The flight then was  pretty much okay,  my food was  great had pasta  with tomato sauce  served several times drinks, the flight  attendant was kind and helpful. But  my plane had no paid Wi-Fi,  USB outlets or  docking ports, the  ratings were low .

Back to Gatwick. If it wasn't for Avios and  a fantastic deal  like this can make flying BA if you collect  it and use  the Club for  the tickets within , I would never fly BA  with the current product. The cabin was old, cramped , dirty. The  wait crew were  rude and surly.  But buy-on-board is still a massive  disappointment - we  are on award tickets but think  that is unacceptable  the food not to be complimentary.

Flight to Amsterdam.  Another delayed BA  flights by 55 % Old airplane,  old staff. Delays  become so regular  and staff have  very casual attitude  about delays. Another  sad show from  European Airways.

Gatwick to Barcelona  Airport Check in  quick and friendly and helpful staff. Staff very welcoming  on lounge and  on board flight.  Unfortunately the in flight product has  changed - salad  is out so  limited food option for business class  flight - had  better have sandwich. Seats dirty and no middle seat  available although business class. No priority boarding for business passengers. Really disorganized  at boarding -  sorting people by groups and lines  getting mixed up. On arrival no  update and trying  the get update  - no update. Trying to get  update on baggage after 12 hours  - no update. .

I thought it time BA deserved some compliments given so many negative comments that are common these days. I was fortunate to travel Hong Kong to London return in Premium Economy recently. Being able to check-in at the downtown Hong Kong Airport Express station is a real bonus as is using  the good Qantas Lounge at Hong Kong. I found the on-board service and operations a lot improved over the last time I flew long-haul with BA.. The new Group Boarding sequence system mostly seems to work, although a few of the signs are hidden or bent in the wrong direction so some people had no idea what was going on - but which helped me keep busy assisting people while waiting at  the gates. Food and wine on-board was quite good and overall service excellent, including recognising my One World Status. BA has the best in-flight magazine with articles actually worth reading and also has some very clever in-flight programs. I also particularly welcomed  an excellent service from 'Goswami' who found me a window seat for LHR-HKG when returning and when using the First Lounge at Heathrow. All-in -all made for an enjoyable experience, a rarity these .

Faro to Gatwick. Club check in was fairly quick and the priority security worked well at Faro. BA now do have use of a 3rd party lounge here, which sadly is absolutely awful! It feels like an average office , with no comfortable chairs and only just enough seats at all for everyone there. It’s really very  small and is the only lounge for all the airline as well as lounge schemes like priority pass etc. Considering this is the only lounge in a massive brand new airport, it’s a pathetic offering. Food was minimal and basic, drinks were pretty limited and  we barely ever had any glasses or plates available. Whilst BA do provide priority boarding, they do not offer any form of priority to  enter the gate and there is always a large queue for this. Once on board, I have similar comments to my outbound flight.. in my opinion they should provide a better welcome, a welcome drink and hand out menus prior to take off. Overall food and drink offering was pretty good on this flight, although cabin crew could have been a bit friendlier.. at one point I dropped one of my headphones and it bounced several rows forward under someone else’s seat. I was looking around for a while to find it and at no point did the crew  offer to help at all, instead  of looking mildly annoyed that I was temporarily blocking the aisle in  order to retrieve it. Priority disembarkation and baggage at Gatwick worked well and it meant we missed all queues at immigration and we landslide really quickly.

Gatwick to Faro.  The check in at Gatwick is very quick and  efficient and fastrack  it is also  extremely efficient and  you were quickly through to the  main lounge. The  room itself is  very nice, spacious  and to have  loads of seating  options and different  styles of seating,  but it also  felt very cosy  yet welcoming. The lounge was clean and tidy and  the were pretty  decent food options  offered including some  great scones with  whipped cream and  cheese As always  the drinks offering  from BA lounges  was great. The  new boarding by  rail seems to  have working quite  good and BA  flights are finally  becoming the priority .. long may  this continue! On  board was the  country club Europe  Club which while  nothing exactly luxury  or standard for  BA now and for a 3 hour flight is , BA don’t  really seem to  have a welcome  mat on short  distance flights which  seems a shame  because there is  lots of time  after the initial  flight rush is complete, there was  absolutely no personal  touch or greeting of any kind..  Just a quick  & simple gesture  and should be  expected on any  BA carrier. I 'd also like  a see menus handed out before  take off, which  could be done  at the same  manner as a  lounge The food  and drink offering  to board is  great although food  is typically over  priced and with  little presentation. Overall a decent enough  service and for  a reasonable price,  however a few small touches would  make it feel  much better.

Jeddah to Chicago , London. The flight from Jeddah to Heathrow wasn't as good as  i expected, ground staff at Jeddah some of them were rude. Also,  a new baggage restriction for the  flights to the  US made the trip uncomfortable, I had to check my carry-on bag at the gate because my laptop  case and the Power bank were there, they took my laptop when I dropped my bags and they  tell me there is no need to take the chargers. However, The crew were nice and friendly and the food was delicious too. The flight from LHR  into Chicago was full and the crew were helpful  and generous.  I won't fly  on BA again until they change their baggage restrictions for the Saudi flights.

London to Frankfurt. I need to fly BA for Business frequently, as I don't have other choices. Not only planes are delayed (as today), but the lounges in Heathrow are a joke. I  rarely use them anymore as they are overcrowded, and they don't serve proper food, just snacks. Their customer service is horrible  and never helps me with any requests. Their business class in Europe  is economy class  with a free seat next to  you

On to Malaga.  After booking the tickets, I realised  that by choosing  two flights in  Europe the fare  is cheaper than  before once I 've added suitcases and pay for  meals onboard, I  had flown BA  twice in Europe for a while and was looking  forward to it. I was nicely impressed. My outbound flight was a wet-lease by Titan  so this was  not full BA service. The crew were very good ; they were  helpful and polite without being sugary  and I was  quite impressed by  the quality and  comfort of the  service together with  their selection of  seats The only  complaint is that  in both legs  one suitcase did  not come out  top priority despite  getting tagged correctly.

Bermuda to Gatwick. Usual window and Aisle seat taken. Crew friendly enough  even when all meal options had cheese (including sandwiches)  but good when  you cannot eat cheese. Breakfast usual . OK but not really worth the money paid. Seats clean and comfortable just feel it is time for BA to  change seats so  I do not need to pole  up over other  peoples legs to  see out from the window seat in the night.

Flight to Boston  via London Heathrow. I found the  seats weren't wide  open and leg room was restricted. On the way  home to London  a person in  charge of me  took the seat  width as well  and this severely , and room ier had to  do Also the  narrow seats meant that I really  had to avoid  taking up both arm rests. Otherwise  these were good flights with, slightly  less choices, but  decent food. Extensive  drink options/variety as well.

Welcome to Hamburg. Baggage self-check-in was diabolical ... machines  being either slow or not working. Boarding commenced early, resulting in on time departure. Seat for this short flight was quite comfortable and better  that most European carriers. However the total lack of any kind of  service was poor. I don't expect a meal but  even a drink of water would  of been something.  People were friendly , the flight on time.

From London Heathrow  to Hong Kong  for British Airways.  The premium economy  but the experience  is anything but.  Check yourself in,  select and scan  your own baggage  bags and load  everything onto the  flight yourself. Unsurprisingly  tedious process, and  takes over an  age for the  three passengers ahead  let us in . Hardly a  helpful service attendant  in sight. Better service with Ryanair,  I hate to  admit it.

Flying to Istanbul with British Airways  on 5th June. At the passport/visa check desk, presented  the boarding pass  and the BA lady - my wife was holding  both passports. The lady looked at the boarding passes and barked 'Passports' as if she  could not see my wife holding them. Second bark: 'Do you have  your visa?'. Third : 'Show me'.  Fifth bark: 'Next'.  No smile, no  handshake or 'Good !' Hardly any  personal contact either. If anything, the situation was worse  than boarding. BA  has introduced a  buddy system. All  boarding systems need  to be policed,  so there are  ways of policing  these arrangements. Some  passengers attempted to  board before their group number was call. When caught  near the gate  staff they were told, 'Not Yet'. Some attempted to  board prematurely more  that once. On  a second attempt,  security staff told  passengers to wait.  Given that the  priority must be . BA gate  staff should be  properly trained how to deal with (potentially) anxious passengers  and reminded that not everyone speaks  or understands English.

Jet to London , with British  Columbia I booked  a flight online  just 3 months  ahead of my  scheduled travel date  and thought I 'd give this  airline another try  despite a bad  trip earlier in  this year. I give full marks  of BA on  each occasion in  both areas of  service I arrived  in the airport rather stressed as  the mobile phone  having been stolen  from a Salzburg  gift shop. The  BA agent was  very professional and  friendly towards me and entered into  conversation very willingly.  Everyone was professional  very pleasant and  quite efficient too.  Our flight was  on an A320  and boarding was  handled well and  cabin staff well  dressed too. The  flight crew were  professional and orderly.  Whenever there was  some delay it  is managed well  by the cabin  manager explained matters  on the flight , I bought  the overpriced tea  so felt very comfortable. Arrival was  through a remote stand and then  a bus. Overall , very good  experiences with BA.
Starting service on  a flight from Edinburgh-Florence on 7  May 18. Mainline  British Airways could  get lots from  a CityFlyer and  its franchise partner  ( S Africa  Capital Air).

from Heathrow to  Dubai It was outrageous of British  Airways to put  BA on a  single boarding pass  when I checked  out at LHR  in the 05/07. I bought, paid and the the  booking was confirmed  2 months before  the flight date.  How dare BA  do this to  ME when I 'm travelling for  3 hours and  they ran like  like clock work (different airlines) until  we encountered BA  in Heathrow. Check-in and help desk  were arrogant, rude  and are as  rude as hell.  Not even a  sincere apology for the amount stress  they caused me just here is  a £5 voucher  to wait till 40 minutes before  departure to see  that you have  a seat. we  have 12 passengers  that had the  worst treatment from BA. British Airways  are a disgrace of an airline,  if they have  the monopoly on  all Heathrow slots  and think they can get a way with such disgraceful service, well,  we are wrong,  among others I  have found an  alternative airline. I  write my review and say I will never ever  fly British Airways again. I would  rather walk to  London

Going to Madrid.  The seat allocation has led to  the husband and  myself not sitting  comfortably  I  think I can  fight to get  a seat I  need but other  than having a  chair next to  my husband I don’t want any  particular seat. We  were travelling as  one pair. There are three seats  either side of  an aisle. There  will likely be  some passengers travelling  and have chosen  one seat preventing  me from sitting  there as they  all know what groups are travelling and do t  care where they  are BA bothering to do the  seats allocations for  them the passengers  that don’t wish  and pay for specific seats would  do this.

Being broken into  and no explanation.  Now the good point. Cabin attendants  are very diligent  and friendly in  business class on  the London to  Shanghai on 22  July Not so . The bizarre  seat pattern that  has 8 business  economy seats across  the width of the plane feels  awkward and crowded  compared to a  seating arrangement. The  rule breaker. Upon  arriving in Shanghai  my was not  The only one  aboard BA169 reporting  lost luggage. Mine  was 3 days  later and the  luggage locking mechanism  having been forced  out and damaged  by repair or  previous use. Nothing  was missing, so  is it subject  to search as  standard luggage? People  expect an answer  if luggage arrives  to that state.  We have not  provided any explanation  or queries to  Customer Relations; this  was not acceptable.  A behaviour like  this not only  shuts down the  airlines but leaves  an impression that  exceeds and outweighs  the efforts made  of their own cabin staff.

Flight to Tehran  Airport in August  2011 The cabin  felt so old  & tired, I  struggle to understand why BA has not updated yet on a lot of their B777 . The inflight  entertainment screen was  small with a  soundtrack of something  from the 90s,  while the selection  on movies was . The meal  service commenced 2 and a half  minutes after taking  off and considering  I was a  long flight most  ot us were  already starving at  this point. The  drinks I wanted  were out by  which time they  spoke to me  and I wasn't even sitting in  my last rows  of the economy .  The  seats were very uncomfortable. A couple  drinks later there 's another drinks !

Flight to London : Having booked  or paid for  the leg room  for six months  into advance we  are unpleasantly surprised  we find out  that upon checking  a booking on  our BA website  A couple of  weeks before flying  there had been  no change of aircraft. Our new  flights were shown  as exit row  23 and we  had assumed that  this would be  extra leg room  when upon boarding  and realised that  row 22 of  the A321 aircraft  were standard seat . Why didn't  they notify us  of a seat  switch when they  heard of this  six weeks in  front of our  flight Once we'd  landed we found  that there was  no extra leg  space seat still available which was  nice because my  husband is tall  so needs that  added leg room.  Our BA cabin  manager did move  my husband but  explained "this happens  half the time  on row 22,  this might be  in exit row  and it's not extra leg room".

I recently took a first class flight from London Heathrow to Las Vegas and due to a plane change a number of people where upgraded. The plane  were not ready for passengers and we boarded 35  minutes late. When we boarded things  where still not ready and the staff were rushing around. The service on the outbound flight was fine but the plane was old and dated. The return flight was a disaster. The seats  got dirty, food was like rubber, plane was dated, seats smelt, Lauren Perrier was not served on takeoff  for some reason, some new policy apparently and again  they had upgraded people in first which is not great. When I complained I was  offered 8,000 Avios, are you serious BA? I think there are many  other airlines out  there with a first class product  it is much  nicer than that I experienced on British Airways. Unless a first class ticket on British Airways is on sale, I would suggest you fly  with another airline. British Airways planes  look dirty they have been told a number of  time they are dirty - it’s about time they  had a  thoroughly clean and re-model the first class it’s getting  really old, it’s  still club class  with a few tweaks.

Had four flights  in total with this airline, first  departure from Dublin  to London on 29th June 2018 was delayed by 2 hours. This delay would have meant we missed our connection in Heathrow to Miami except that plane was also delayed  by 2 hrs (no reason or  apology We arrived in Miami hours behind schedule which  took away our  last evening there as we were  planning a cruise the following morning. By the time we arrived we had missed our  luggage transfer causing further expense as we had to hail a cab. Our flights home to Dublin via  London were fine until we reached Dublin and realised  I had lost  our bag. Despite assurances it would be delivered to  my house later that day (it  is put on the wrong plane - again no apologies given for this inconvenience). We are still awaiting  this bags arrival and the phone  number we were given keep ringing out. Seems like no one cares.  This was our first and last experience of using  the

Back to Heathrow. British Airways are not doing us proud. I recently flew back from South Africa with some sports equipment. Their web site states that you  can take sports  equipment as part of your luggage , but I was charged £65  and bring my  equipment back. The  officers in staff were very forceful and abrupt. As  we had to bring the bike back, I had no choice but to pay. When  we got back  they contacted their customer service, they  are not willing to help.  Also, the seats  keep getting really  cramped The food is terrible.

A queue for  baggage drop was  huge and did nt move for  for good 20  minutes A more  knowledgeable person came and explained it  was due to  security issues that there was a  delay in the bag drop. Excuses . I saw  the staff came  back and the  queue was moving . They could 've just got more staff there  to begin with.  Air boarding was super slow. Inside  the econ cabin,  this plane seemed  really old, and  slow The entertainment  systems took a  little time to reboot and they  didnt inform the customers about it.  None of the  cabin attendants were  rude Meals were  ordered for me,  the dinner was  a sort of  fried chicken that  did not taste good. They gave  you bars for  my meal on  my 6h 50 m flight. The  bar doesn't exist in the cabin.

British Airways changed  rules and consequently , separating family  in business class.  No co-ordination at  Rome and apparently  just one BA  engineer at Rome  Airport who I could speak to.  Had to call  in customer service  at UK which  proved a waste of time. Given  the seats but upon boarding could  not take seat  as engineers trying  and secure cabin  seats in changed  seats Failed to  notice this and  boarded the plane  leaving it unsecured  the pilot did  indeed want to  do take off , Advised stewardess but they did  NOT care. Could nt recline seat  in fear of  a divider falling  and curtain was  out front of  us Waste of  money paying to  fly business class  at BA.   They did make  me wear a  safety belt upon  taking off so  when the bulk head fell we  did not get  out of the  aircraft

Welcome to Edinburgh  and London. I'm quite surprised to read the varied reviews as I  have always had  a great experience  at BA in terms of in-flight service and airport handling. After sales service can be a different experience! This flight I arrived a little late at the  door due to  technical issues, hot and sweaty and the check-in girl was such a  joy She calmed me down, reassured  everyone and helped me get through security swiftly. I  was able to  secure a very cheap last-minute upgrade to Premium Economy and I am  really glad I ! The service was wonderful, we were looked after very well, lots of water offered throughout the flight.  I thought the seat was tremendously  comfortable and comfortable, even for the  extra upgrade price,  2 rather than 3 seats to the side and 3 rather than  1 in the centre, gives you a lot more space. The food was ok, I've had worse, I've had better. But I was comfortable, a good temperature  & had a great choice of films. My connecting plane was late leaving Heathrow to Edinburgh due to  poor weather, but  I was handled  very nicely. All in all I'm glad I flew  BA for this .

Mumbai to London Heathrow. Disappointing experience. I wouldn't book business class again,  seems like bad value for money. I've flown economy and premium economy  and found economy  noisy and the seat uncomfortable but enjoyed premium economy for the quieter  environment and more . I expected a big step up in business class but really apart from choice of food, better seat and a larger entertainment screen I really didn't see an upgrade  for comparison to the huge extra cost. The staff weren't that attentive , I felt like I got one much better meal with alcohol , then was pretty much left alone until an hour before the  beginning of the flight. I had  another person ask if I needed anything who then brought me the tea I requested.  Security staff were helpful when I saw them but overall what a waste of money. I paid an  estimated £500+ for better food on  my tray with . Really not worth it!

Flying to London.  having read many  negative reviews about  UK Airways I  took my flight fully expecting to  be a bad  flight but ended  up feeling completely  happy with all  parts of the  airline It is  far too easy  to glamourise the  modern days but in its seeming  superiority British Airways  was no different  than other European  airlines As a  result of the  experience I hear Dutch people saying  that the same  of KLM, their  national airline, and  some friends say  the same about Air France. The  passenger service was  good and friendly,  if a little lacking in charm. The food was  more than adequate.  Their in-flight entertainment  is adequate too.  Am not sure  if the extra one pays for  Cost Plus is  really worth it  on terms of  quality food, but  the space and  relative quietness that  comes with a  small cabin matters,  and it is  worth it. When  it landed at  London a shortage  in ground staff  means that we  remained stuck in the plane for  30 minutes before  anyone could be  able to operate the bridge to  drop us off.  Some people with  other flights were  also beginning to  panic but the  staff handled the  issue admirably. They  less than rose  on the occasion  to provide the information and reassurance that passenger were  needed

When you travel British Airways its like you are lucky to be able to be  on British Airways staff. Right from the start the check in girl  in business told  me the flight was closed which was a load  o rubbish 1 hr and 10 minutes before the flight. She spent  20 minutes on  the phone to  me to see  that it was  so late. Because  I need special  equipment they didn't have anyone to push my wheelchair so my wife  had to do it. My wife now very stressed and I arrive  with the finger and when we could see that  flight was still  open I asked  another man on  his desk about  it closed and  he said nonsense.  My wife says thanks for the unnecessary stress. The guys on the desk were great and offered to push my chair  I was actually  taking a long  way The cabin layout has 7  seats across whereas  all the other 787's I have been on have  4 That means  people are squeezing  into another seat and it is  a very narrow  so cabin crew  grabbed my arm  any time they  pass by. Of course the 787 is a great aircraft. So for me the seat  was below my  knees I was also amazed that  we had to  charge £190 to reserve seats, I  would pay anything  for other airlines.  The food was  just OK nothing exciting and the  quality of films was not that  bad but then  that is all  about choice. In my opinion fly with a different airline if you  do there are seriously better airlines who don't have snobs working for them.

British Airways gets  loads of well  timed kickings but  my return flight  into Gibraltar was . On time  on arrival in  London smiling friendly  staff excellent hot  drinks and plentiful  wifi Gatwick lounge  is too small really but we found seats ok. Gibraltar lounge for  another dozen or  two club passengers  was relatively huge.

The First Class  are not even that any more.  Contrast with the lounge in T3;  this may be  a offshoot of  the fine Concorde  cabin in T5,  but it need  not feel like  another rural train ? Poor food,  mediocre drinks and  largely indifferent staff  did not compare  to LH facilities  on FRA or  Emirates There is  poor ground assistance,  so boarding was haphazard. Fine Cornish  tea was offered , happily quaffed. The seat was OK, but not  at the same  level as the  premium AC J class pods, and not close to  Air Emirate's suites. Small things like the menu presentation,  and sufficient food  ( are a  majority of seats in F), seat comfort (OK, but  not special) and the toilets (small and curiously offering  only paper). The  staff were very friendly; the service  was decent in  L but poor  for BA, your  sales drive to  rock bottom is  catching up with  passengers and your  first Class product is not worth  the name anymore.  We can only  imagine that BA  was trying to  stick it out  as they drive  off paying passengers  from other airlines  who place a serious effort to  deliver a superb  cabin product. And  poor wi-fi

On to London.  the morning of the departure I  had an email  or a text  messages from that  informing me that  the flight had  been canceled, with no specified reason.  Seeking an alternative  they rerouted me on a night flight to Madrid, then to Palma, to arrive the next day in Birmingham. Disappointed of  the disservice I called the customer service in England  and waited 40 mins at my expense before being able to speak  to an operator)  and I was offered a flight in the evening at 1900, which  would not help  us to arrive in time to  the appointment and  I declined. I had to find the only possible  flight that would  allow me to  get to London in time, unfortunately it was a last minute flight  to another company that cost me a fortune. On  account of it,  because the flight would arrive no  less at Heathrow but at Stansted, I had to pay the taxi £70 more than the agreed amount  once I arrived at Heathrow. British Airways did not  claim responsibility, I was not reimbursed  the new flight  I had to  take last minute nor the taxi . They did  NOT show concern for the inconvenience  and the stress . The worst  has been the  failure of their customer Care saying  I was not  my responsibility!

Flew British Airways from JK to  Newark Heathrow then  via London Galwick to Rome. Bag has been lost  over 48 hours.  Zero email, phone , text update. They didn’t even answer my email! My wife and  I have had  exact same clothes on our backs since we left JFK. Thank goodness , washing machines.  I have missed  up on events. We can’t get into certain places due to dress codes. We had to wait for  the store to open to buy  makeup and toothpaste.  Really horrible service.  And we were told our bag would arrive at our hotel at  1 pm yesterday.  Now almost 1 am the next day and the  bag still isn’t .

i have flown  US Airways numerous  times over many . Sadly the  service has deteriorated  very recently and  our flight was  very poor. The  staff were offhand  - one seemed  genuinely unhappy to  get there. The  woman next to  me and I  looked for the  food choice but  were told that  there was none  available - too  few had apparently  been loaded. There  was no apology  - we were  just told we  needed to make  our choice. We  paid for the  choice After some  time we were  given our meals  we found we  have both been  offered a vegetarian ! I had  to walk down  into the galley  and let them  in and was  informed in a  similar offhand manner  - they must  not recorded the  food choice -  without apology. Eventually  I received the  food which by  far was dry  but not enjoyable.  They were asked  about breakfast choices  but gave in  reply which stated  we wanted a  breakfast choice 40 minutes before landing.  We were not  given anything. The  service was really  poor - and  like usual the  best seats were  right behind the  seats and comfort  and in other  words BA will  now have to  improve their product  or continue to  serve premium passengers.

We can not  recommend the new  Club World' food and service, on  the 747 outbound  and 777 inbound , was great!  The food was  first class, the  decor very attractive,  the quality very  good - haven't  had such tender  meat on any  plane before (or  at a restaurant  For that matter ), and the  French style crockery/glass  was stylishly upmarket.  Truly worlds away  form what it  use to be,  flight crews were  so friendly and  knowledgeable Really liked  he way the  beds came out  in a trolley , you could  mix and choose  what you liked  or mix and  change if you  needed to. You  could get a  padded day blanket,  soft padded blanket  for night and  the mattress protector type thing to  keep on the  back of your  body much better  that the thin  and static blanket  you used to . The pillow  is larger and  much better than before. Can't believe  how fast the  plane flew and  how well we  did on landing  back in Seattle  - once home !! We do  wish Club Europe  a shame as  when this level  the service and  hospitality is maintained  our new Club  world will be  another great success.

Another disappointing experience - flew out on a 747 400 series (should be scrapped!) Departed late. Loaded aircraft  due for push back, no a/c Temperature was excessively hot all flight, no cool air. Personal Media system broken, split screen. Food quality diabolical. Moody flight attendants, ran out of  laundry soap. Return flight on A380 left on time, 100% better service, meal quality, and crew, definitely made up for outward flight. Been flying BA for over  10 years, probably  will be a last choice in future - sad to see.

Flight to London.  Half full. Overhead  was full of  people Seat excruciatingly  loud and headphone that worked intermittently.  Got off about  2030 local time.  Last meal appeared  on about 2030 local time. Menu  included seasonal salad  with one small piece of lettuce and cucumber), braised  prime rib of beef or mushroom ravioli pasta, with  fresh pecan cake. Only 3 beef meals available. Choice  was either pasta or to go , I chose  that latter and dined on a small bottle of  champagne and half a cup of  fruit juice. Breakfast  ( light refreshment including juice, tea and coffee) consisted  only a cream  cheese roll, and oat biscuit, and half a cup  with warm tea  about 30 minutes later. We paid extra for World  Class Plus but  we consider that  we were conned. Customer services have been useless and on the second  morning of writing  we received the  same response, "Thanks  for coming back  for us. I completely understand why  but disappointed we  could offer you  our full catering  package especially as on such a  long haul flight.  We hope our staff explained our  food supplier had  some unexpected problem  with the systems they use to  run their catering.  That meant they couldn’t provide a  complete meal service and I absolutely  guarantee this isn’t  how you would  expect when you  booked with us.  Very sorry we’ve  turned you down."  Which is it. Thank you BA.  This is the  first time we  will ever book long haul with  BA

London to Zurich. The airline isn’t bad. Their boarding procedure was very good, though the aircraft was very old. I know it is one of the oldest, and personally I enjoyed it. But  again I have  you be realistic,  it very old, loud and uncomfortable. The service isn’t good either, you don’t even get a cup of  coffee It’s great to hop to London, but don’t expect any kind  a special treatment or service.

Glasgow to New York JFK via  London Outgoing flight was on a refurbished 747. Still I could see its age. We had a duo seat at the back of the plane. The plane was hot and  there are no air con vents  above your head. The IFE was decent and had  very good selection.  The cabin crew , looking after  us was pleasant and friendly and  we chatted to  me Flight left  close to on time. Service was quick as we  are first served at the back.  Guests were given  snacks and drinks first then dinner was about an hour later, which was vegetarian pasta for me. Adequate amount of food  served and was tasty. Ice cream and juice/water was served halfway through the flight. We then received a  snack before landing  that was a sandwich and a toblerone. It was ok. Return flight  to Vegas was on a old  Boeing Horrible old  747 with no padding and very dirty. Service was a lot slower as they announced they had less staff. Less drinks served, again food was ok chicken curry this time. Small snack of  an egg tortilla yoghurt and muffin served for breakfast. IFE was horrendous on the old , tiny grainy screen with a very limited choice. I wouldnt fly BA again if  I had a  ticket because they charge such a large amount for  just the duo  and £210 return it cost us  plus it made  the air fare expensive. Also the planes they use are too old and tatty.

Flew on a  last minute emergency trip London Heathrow to Baltimore with BA. Most disappointing feature on this  journey was the aircraft the new  BA 787. I found the aircraft  very small and  cramped for transatlantic routes, in its 3-3-3 seating configuration, despite the crews in flight service and the inflight entertainment being of a generally average economy standard, the aircraft lacked the legroom and seating comfort of the  larger aircraft I 've flown on other transatlantic routes, 777, 767, A340 and 747. BA needs to remove many seats from this aircraft in economy class, also the cabin air temperature was awful and humid, with no individual regulation.  I felt to me more like  someone crammed in  to a Boeing 737 on a  short flight.

Just this year,  my wife and  myself travelled business  way with BA  connecting Dublin to  London returning from  Camden Town, thru  departures in each ). Having paid  economy class fares,  they were then  really taken aback  and have to  pay an additional  charge for seat  selections on the  longer haul sectors.  Having we not  booked seats, we  might have found , not just  two but possibly  only one of  them on the  upper deck and one on the  upper deck of  an A380 on  their way out  on the 747  for the return  flight We therefore  felt no choice.  What sort of  customer retention policy  does this? No  western airline with  whom we have  travelled business class  has then charged  on seat selection,  and BA just  cant seem to . It is  a rip-off. The  rear facing business  flight seat plan  for BA planes  is really unattractive,  compounded further by  trying to climb  over a sleeping  bag to reach  the aisle from  your window seat.  People should take  one look at the Emirates A380  when they want  a see a  customer friendly layout. This was our first business class  journey with BA. Having flown with  more eastern airlines  before we have  discovered how much  cheaper the play boys actually are.

Los Angeles to  Dallas I booked  the AA, LAX to LHR round trip very far in advance. BA is AA partner. Paid for the BA seat selection early to get  good seats. BA  canceled the flights (coming and going),  but did not inform AA or  BA that the  flights were canceled.  Half of my text and phone number was entered with BA with my passport number. They should have contacted me. I  found out a couple days before  my flight because  they happened to  want to do a meal request.  It turns out that BA shifted  the smaller planes and I actually spent six hours, over two days  trying to get flights on the days I needed to catch up with a tour. All they said , we can't  help you. I  kept calling and  texting and got seats on the days I needed but they were the worst seats on the plane and because they were smaller planed, Premium Economy was awful. Food was terrible. We had pre paid $276  and choose seats. There were no  empty seats left. We ended up  taking a night flight right next  to the toilets.  That meant the smell, people are bumping into you,  bathroom lights going off and toilets flushing for 9 hours. Same seats  back home. I  would have been  best off flying in coach. I have spent a month trying to get refund for the paid seat . I tried  to get this  when my return flight started because I was still  trying and calling to get seats away from the toilets on our  next flight and to get our refunds.They wouldn't refund. After returning, I made five phone calls and spent  45 mins filling out a detailed request online. Called  back today, was  denied twice and told there is nothing I could do. It is  possible I may get a response  in a month  to my email request. Don't ever  travel with them!  BA used to  have the finest  system in the skies but now  that system is broken and there is no such  thing as customer service. If you have a problem, you will be  down a famous creek without a paddle. They have  an endless loop , calling, waiting on line, their agent's can't or won't do anything but sell seats. I spoke to many many supervisors, no results. There  is no one to solve problems. They pass the buck, have you  filled out forms online and no  one responds.

My overall flight wasn't too bad.  Everyone and everything  looked comfy enough, although my girlfriends  laptop didn't work  for either the outbound or inbound  flights and little  attempt was made  towards a resolution.  Please understand that  it isn't the  cabin attendants fault,  etc but it would have been  nice if a  bit more effort than 'there's nothing we can do' was given to  that issue! On  my flight from  Miami to Tampa  we were stuck on the aircaft  by approximately 30-40 minutes as the  plane 'wasn't where it should be' which once again  presents the worst problem In the  beginning but after  the long flight isn't particularly what  I wanted! It wasn't the best  experience

BA’s Galleries lounge at CPT is adequate but let down by a  mediocre food selection (including packaged cheese and biscuits, with flimsy wooden knives) and limited wine choices. Champagne was  sorely lacking. Toilet  water wasn’t being  done in the toilets and here was no lock  in one of  three cubicle doors. There were no  TV screens, so one had to wait for the  phone call to  answer Boarding itself was efficient, with priority for groups 1 and 2. Seats 62J/K on the upper deck are the best  of a mediocre job, and at least there's plenty of storage space in the window bins. Take off was on schedule. FAs went through the motions, with little enthusiasm. The food was the  weakest we've ever experienced in Club World. The 'smoked chicken salad' was  appalling and the 'scrambled eggs with chives in a tortilla wrap' deserves to be in a museum of culinary horrors. The  Southern Company bedding was a let-down and far removed from the luxury portrayed in adverts.  Very little one can do to remedy a hard seat. Landing was ahead of schedule.  Quite a lacklustre flight in an ancient plane with a sub-par business class product. British Airways are falling ever behind their  competition

Back to San Jose. I’ve just  booked onto a BA flight from Gatwick to Costa Rica, an 11.5 hr flight, and can honestly I haven’t seen a screen with so few pixels since the 90s. I  fly other  air haul flights and none of BA’s competitors are  providing such low quality entertainment.  I used to  thought of British Airways as being  a premium airline  but now they’re  all rubbish.

I took the  cheap option of  a new Toronto to London Gatwick which debuted this summer as a seasonal route. Cheaper than the Heathrow  flight it was an interesting experiment in whether I could fall back in love with Gatwick. Excellent check in at Pearson as usual, but spoiled by the third party lounge. Goodness knows what  we were thinking, given the old lounge was well  maintained with excellent  seating and food . The Premium  Economy lounge is cheap and nasty. On time boarding on a near empty flight (too early in the season for the  BA traffic to have built up). The cabin was  three third full. Juice and water offered. No Prosecco in Premium Economy though the crew member couldn't explain why it's not  coming to London, but why Champagne in Biz is manageable. On time departure, and a fast drinks service. This is my first experience of Gatwick crew. Fast, sociable, less formal and streets ahead of mixed fleet  of serving Heathrow.  ( all over 25!) The meal was vile - overcooked, salty and dry. As the  lounge was empty,  I went back to economy and had three hours sleep across three seats. Awful breakfast of pretzel roll and cream cheese  sandwich served before . IFE on both legs was dated and still the same selection since my flights  over Christmas! An  easy arrival and fast bags finished off a ok flight. Returning, I liked the biz / first class check in area  in LGW -  friendly and friendly.  BA lounge at Gatwick was streets ahead of Heathrow. Self serve Champagne and loads of seats. Kept very  warm and plenty of food. An  addition to biz was nice on a full flight. Efficient boarding and a fast coat  of drink and  meal service. A really fast bar , only 20 mins in, with well cooked food made the service just like the old days of  short haul cabin crew from Heathrow. The only thing  that spoilt it was off duty BA staff in Biz, chatting (and distracting) the crew on duty while  sitting in the aisle and generally being loud and annoying. An early  arrival into Toronto finished a near perfect flight, The Gatwick 777s are old - very  slow with no power in Premium Economy.
