(currently going through a refurb progamme), but with efficient and friendly crew and on time / early performance - there  is little to dislike, and I even liked Gatwick!!

First time flying with British Airways  for economy on a Transatlantic flight from London to  Amsterdam I was impressed by the hard work of the professional and  experienced Flight Attendants. They walked up and down the  plane helping people  through various issues and offering good tasty meals, snacks , drinks of  various kinds. I will definitely fly British overseas again  given a chance. The economy seats on this old but well kept Boeing 747-400 were very comfortable and I am a  6 x 240lbs and still did  NOT feel cramped.  So would encourage  ALL my friends to fly British if they want  a have a  nice comfortable flight from the US  to Europe. Thank You British Airways,  very good service indeed.

Geneva to Vancouver  to London. Worst experience. Terrible service and when we  complained with constructive  criticism they offered £25 voucher and  no apology - an insult as did not ask for compensation. It's an expensive price  to pay for a low cost airline. On a positive point the  Aberdeen to London flights were fine  but the 2  short haul flights  into Vancouver were  horrendous

It is the  first time I 've flown BA's  into Europe flying  via London Heathrow  from Corfu. I  am not expecting  a great deal  having read a  number of less  than positive reviews ; however I  am very pleasantly surprised. Shortly after  boarding we were  given a welcome  package with a  selection of nuts  and a choice  from magazine to  buy Not long  into this there  came a full  customer service followed  with a 4  course meal which  was very tasty.  I had cured  chicken followed by  chicken breast then ginger cheesecake and  another small cheese  sandwiches We were  then offered a  cup of hot  drinks and a  washing up of  water The crew were very attentive  and helpful. They  put a smile  on their face  all the time and the flight  seemed to zip ! The seats  were the usual  aisle seats with  one middle blanked  and a tray but for a  relatively short trip  this was fine.  This flight was  a upgrade using Avios and I  would happily do  so again. I  spent around 6500  Euros and an  extra £13 in  food which I  think was very  decent value for  what I had.

Our original flight  was cancelled as my wife and  son were just disembarking from a  cruise ship. We were then advised shortly after by SMS that we  had been automatically  placed on a  plane the next day, to London Heathrow. This was not a lot  of good when our car was parked at Gatwick. I managed to get through to BA and was given a new booking to Gatwick also the following day. We were offered no other assistance by the  airline The following  morning we turned  back at the airport to find  a new flight was running 40  mins late. Having  successfully boarded the  plane we stayed  at the gate for about 45  seconds before the captain deigned to  tell us that  our delay was  being caused by  turbulence at Barcelona . Shortly thereafter  our captain advised  me that we  could wait for another two hours,  or we would be given water. This was quickly superseded by a  further announcement that a slot had become available at  short notice, so  our water was . The real  consequence of this  delay however, was  the Airways new  food service, whereby  passengers buy food and pay by card/Avios. This simply does not work.  Within one hour in the air, the trolley had  moved about nine  feet from the front of the  cabin Eventually a  cabin attendant attempted  to work from  his back forward  by running backwards and forwards from the trolley. About  10 minutes from  arrival he reached  out and we  ordered for two cans of drink and a packet  for crisps (potato ?). He returned  and tell us he had no  water and only one can, which we duly shared  among us. Having been on the  plane for three and a half  minutes this was  the only refreshment we could obtain.  I consider this  should be completely unacceptable. If this  represents the level of service we can now expect  from British Airways, there is no  use traveling with . The budget  airlines can do  more at lower cost.

Hong Kong to London. This was my first Business  class trip on BA, as I  currently use Emirates  & Cathay Pacific.  In comparison, BA  is a very  low standard. The  cabin attendant who served the section  before I was seated couldn't have cared less. No greetings when passengers boarded the plane,  no offer of help. He asked  about my drink order but never delivered the drink.  A second drink  ever offered. The toilet hadn't been  installed properly before boarding, and during  our flight, one  or the two  toilets became unusable, resulting in long queues. The seating arrangement - having  you face a  man who sits  from the opposite direction- is uncomfortable.  Absolutely appalling quality and little value for money.

Washington to Bucharest  flight via London.  I was originally  flying in World Traveller Plus but  at Dulles check-in was offered a  Club World upgrade at just $499 , which I accepted - resulting flight was very comfortable with good food and top-drawer service. The two London-Bucharest sectors both  went well. But all this was just a prelude  for my return trip. While in  Romania I sustained a fall and  though I wasn't seriously hurt it  is still difficult  going walk long distances especially with  my luggage. At the Bucharest airport  to drop the agent noticed my situation and offered  help which I accepted - and was promptly wheeled through security, passport control and the  ( long) corridors  to the gate,  then put aboard the plane. On  landing in London , was met  with more assistance  who whisk me  through the vastness  at T5 and onto the plane, this time with  the pleasant surprise : another Club World upgrade (this time for free).  While on the plane back to  Washington the cabin crew couldn't do  enough for me,  checking how I was doing, going  down meal choices (the menu this time round was  that bit heavy  on cheese and other dairy items  you really can't  recommend but ultimately  I still ate well), getting me drinks, and more. They were as professional and proactive  a crew as  we ever experienced in 40 years  of long-haul travel. Finally, once arrived  at Dulles more  help was waiting, right up to  booking my cab. What could have been an ordeal  for this return trip was turned into as relaxing  yet satisfying a travel experience as  could be imagined  - through the  years I've had mostly excellent experiences  with BA cabin crews and that's  a big reason  how I've stayed with BA all these years and will continue to do so. But a big standing ovation for the  flight and ground crews for these  awards for above-and-beyond service - you're  our best.

Welcome to Warsaw. BA European service  was becoming like an expensive low  cost airline. The  level of seat  belts still remains high. The seat on the outbound flight is not even reclining and it was a 2-hour flight.  You can always  feel the elbows of the passengers  next to you  while someone is  crying I didn't  buy any food or drink onboard,  so I reckon it's not badly priced. The inbound  flight was on  the older A320, in which the  seat was reclining. </s>

Flight to Istanbul.  Thanks to poor  weather conditions at  Birmingham the flight  was initially delayed  another 2 hours  that is quite ! When the  pilots were informed  about the gate,  everyone gathered at  their 'A' gate  at T5. Then, no announcement and the ground staff  were in a world of their own. Next, there  was a screen  warning that the  plane will depart  on a C . Everyone rushes to the one  and the last , the 'C' . Once on  board the dreaded  news that the  flight will be  replaced by another . The flight finally takes off  after three hours ! After a  while the crew  start with the M&S gibberish but  they are so  good that by  this time the  crew serve the  last row in  Istanbul the sandwiches  were all over . I had  loads of crisps  on a diet  Coke for dinner.  The flight arrived  at Istanbul three  minutes late and to add insult  the injury, the  bus stops at  some remote gate  so we have  to trek to  another terminal.

Return to Cape  Town Flying first class with British Airways is a  tricky affair. But having secured a  pair of return  flights to Cape Town with Avios, our expectations were  understandably high as we entrusted our car to the meet and greet parking. Unfortunately, Terminal 3 isn't the  perfect starting point . Galleries First  flight glamour -  with decent champagnes. The food on offer is adequate, although hardly first class. Hoping for  space on board,  I didn't use the sit down . Boarding was  good time and according to BA's new group allocation. Our seats -  3 and 3K - were a  first for us, as we've previously  opted for pairs  at the centre.  Our seats A  to K are  much superior, with more storage space  and better privacy. However, there's no  escaping the fact  of the relatively recent first class refit is in a relatively ancient plane, particularly when one inspects the  poor state of fittings in the  toilets and galley. The IFE is  clearly showing its  age and badly  in need of an upgrade. But  the least it  wont require rebooting on our flight.  Cabin crew in first were the usual mixed bag. The FA looking after our side  seems to be  on the wrong job. Food was  better than usual,  although a malfunctioning oven meant that  passengers had to  spend 30 minutes  for our hot breakfast. Landing was  short of schedule and we were through immigration and  land reclaim within  15 minutes. Overall,  a decent flight but let down  by the attitude of the cabin  attendants and the  condition of the plane.

Welcome to Hamburg.  Typically if I fly BA it  to SFO or  Chicago to LHR.  One time I  flew them from  Chicago via Tampa  and LHR to  Hamburg Using their  seat points I  booked a first  class seat which  of course is  a scam because  they charges you  fees and surcharges  that use those  points at $500  each direction. Their  BA operation appears  too be a poor second class  alternative to American as they use  most of their  boarding and check  out kiosks plus  only the American  first class (not) . All the  cheap processed slices , cheese and  popcorn you can  get with free booze is not  something I call  a premium lounge.  My BA gate  to the dreadful  Miami terminal is  open even on  their main floor  but downstairs. People  line up to  different entry points  for boarding which  created a mess  and boarding people  into sections. Boarding  was like a  phone call. BA  has one of  its oldest B747  in Miami and  they showed even  better first. The  floors were of  the older design  so it appeared  their carpet was  new but the  seats smelled of  stale carpet. The  coffee and food  looked surprisingly good  relative to their  flight out of  Chicago The flight  arrived late leaving  and late arriving,  as this Miami  flight does not  stop in terminal . Rather terminal  congestion and requiring  the passengers to  use shuttle buses  to the other  way which is  why I did  miss my connection  to Hamburg. In the end I  guess I was  disappointed with BA  but their service  quality for premium  passengers has   hit rock bottom.  Its Avios program  is nearly worthless  for any premium  ticket booking or  on its partner airlines. Try using  their points on  BA or Cathay  or even Alaska , you will  see it impossible  regardless how far  an advance you  can

India to London : Rubbish check-in  staff as bad  at Ryanair. I  told the staff  through mobile boarding  pass checked website , I have  3 x 32  kg bags checked ! One bag  weighed over 23  kg (27/28), they  refuse to honour  the 32 kg  bag and told  me I will  allow myself to  board the flight  but not able  at check in.  They were so  disrespectful and unhelpful.  This was with  the same unhelpful  and unprofessional staff  in the very  rude manner. Flight  was delayed without  the checked-in agent  doing anything, after  the passengers board  they start to  realise people there will be an hour or so  delay due to  delays At the  very least the  flight crew serve  passengers complimentary juice  & water during  the wait.

When I checked  on the evening before for the  first flight, it looked like only 40% of seats  are occupied. 2 hrs before flight they cancelled it without rebooking or explanation. There is  now a hotline to call.

BA’s reputation has been declining for years so I  cannot use them.  After various reasons I had to  miss a flight  from Madrid. I had hand luggage. They texted asking  for the hand  baggage to be checked in as  their flight was busy. I did and they lost it. 7 hours later no luggage or idea where it is. No compensation - only after 12 hours and for a  small amount. Ridiculous airline which has managed to lose its prestige and good will. Lagging significantly behind EasyJet in all aspects.

Los Angeles to London Heathrow. Desperately poor service from British Airways in Club Class. Business Class is utterly outdated, with the  infamous "facing each-other ," and narrow / uncomfortable seats.  Even food served  was appalling. The  flight crew were inattentive at best, and appeared disinterested in providing genuine customer service. The problem with British  Airlines now in  Economy and Business Class, is what they are completely  missing namely, any  style or manners : Poor food, uncomfortable seats, terrible  / small movie , No WIFI  = an overall  bad airline experience. British Airways even  charge for seat selection too, which  added insult to  injury Avoid this  particular airline if you can. The only redeeming feature of this   service is the  very quiet Airbus A380. A shame  airlines ruin the  service with such  incredibly poor quality  service and attitude.

Chicago to London Heathrow. Lovely flight  with a great BA Worldwide Crew,  who are the  best in the  entire fleet. Very  comfortable seat with great extras that  you would expect in 1st Class.  Easy to sleep  as it was  the night flight,  and had a  very full breakfast  for the morning. Baggage allowance was  generous with 3  large 32Kg cases  in 2 cabin  seats Overall, a  great flight, with  the great airline,  which has a  great crew

London Heathrow to Singapore on 28  September 2018. In this review, I am reviewing the a la carte  food option on board for World . World Traveller passengers have the  ability to pre-order  for a selection  from 6 main courses up to 30 days in advance for selected long haul flights  inclusive of LHR with prices ranging from £15 to £18. I had  a Gourmet Dining consisting of braised Hertfordshire beef cheek which was succulent  & delicious. If you do not want to risk not getting your  meal of choice  for a long haul BA flight and if this a la carte  option is available on your route,  I highly recommend  you to go  get it.

On to Newark, flight cancelled. This  flight was one  of the worst  we had. The engineers had no  Idea what was wrong with the engine, all air and water shut  off for three hours. Not to  worry the Boeing  747 looked ancient, for a 6  hours flight from Paris I expected  so little more. The flight attendants did not keep  us updated. Lastly  as we got  onto the plane they had one  receptionist at the desk to  help with the  many people who  had to rebook flights and get hotels for the  night Will never  leave British airways  and Delta forever.

I flew BA from Heraklion to Gatwick. I bought exit row seats for me and  3 others to  share together with extra leg room. I paid around £150 for that  from January. We  went to the airport 2 hours before departure, queued  to check in and was told  the 2 of the seats were reallocated to someone . I asked why. The BA rep said it was because the plane for the flight had changed. She then said we should have  got there earlier. She wouldn't call BA customer service when I showed  her the email acknowledging 2 of us were given row 7 bulkhead seats with less room than normal pitch. I was told to email BA and ask them to refund  me the seat cost. The flight manager on the  phone told me there was no change of plane. She apologised and  stated she'd take  my case up with BA customer service. I also sent in a  statement Today is 17 days with  NO response and my money still not refunded. I'll never fly with them again.

Outbound from LHR to Washington on a refurbished 747 400 was in  but all in all wasn't a bad experience, modern looking cabin with excellent IFE system, food and wine was good and cabin crew very attentive, was looking forward to the return trip as had upgraded to Premium Economy. Return flight BA 292 was delayed by late arrival of inbound flight, but no worries could relax in the PE cabin, boarding the aircraft and turning left for the first time ever immediate disappointed, how old was the plane? The cabin was dull and those seats looked as though they had seen better days, a quick check and this particular 747 was delivered to 1998 and hadn't had the refurbishment treatment. Leg room was a tad better than economy but seat controls  are very efficient and as for the IFE system that decided not to work, mind you the screen  looked so small and scratched I doubt I would  have been able to watch anything. Cabin crew offered a pre take off drink water or orange juice and a hot towel that had seen better days, it was the sort of thing that you clean  the car with,  just a few words from the  captain we departed. The evening meal was some sort of chicken with rice with real cutlery and was  provided wine and G&T was acceptable, about 1 hour before landing breakfast was served or should I say offered some sort of filled roll. I declined and had a tea in a paper cup and nothing more offered. I should add that the cabin crew  was very attentive and tried to make us feel a bit special,  after having spent an extra £400 for the upgrade. BA this experience was a disgrace for a once proud airline, never again.

London to London.  This was the  best part of my Sydney to London trip and  looking forward to  flying as it  happened on a BA A380. Now this aircraft, in  different colours, is  one I am  not familiar with  and flown around 30 sectors over  the last 12  years with QF. As mentioned in my review of BA16 (which was the first leg of this trip)  It is the  main board soft  product that is  the problem. The same comments for that review apply : The IFE  remains a work  of mystery in  search of content.  On Qantas, American,  British one gets  a really good  collection of old and new movies, great music choices.  Those who compile the content need  only look at what they mean  by award winning  ( Gladiator, Brave-heart,  Mad Holiday etc)  are all things we as passengers want to see.  Our smart edgy team in Soho, London pulled the  show together forgetting that not everyone  was edgy and  loves to see  cutting edge stuff.  That is one  issue on long . The other is food and  entertainment The food  service was just  fantastic and something  I read about constantly. On Qantas (say QF1 from Singapore to London) one gets the evening meal service,  followed by Weiss  and cream, a  hot chocolate along  each way, midnight snack of a  salad or sandwich and morning breakfast (fruit or eggs , usual muffin ) At the  back of the main deck is  the snack bar and in the galley will be  some chocolates, banana  and cheese and biscuits. You would  want to be  very hungry to  go through that  menu but the point is that  everything is available and offered. BA need to get away from a meal service on  the off and  on and nothing in between. The  747 is a  great aircraft and  with Qantas it  gets treated as  if I am a Qantas fanboy and spend a lot of time  with their planes. Put the smartest,  best looking crew onto a flagship  aircraft that is  how people will  say The BA crew were of  very certain vintage  and suited to  serving bowls. One  man looked like Steptoe (for those  not remember) and  had a miserable. Flying on an  aircraft should be  great experience and I enjoy all  our trips on  the aircraft. BA have managed to reduce it to  one very large low cost aircraft  for people from  one point to  destination That is  impressive given the stature of BA.  We came back  to BA31 from  London to Hong  Kong and the same comments apply.  Soft product is  similar (except for no snack bar)  as the soft product is lacking <mask>

Sydney to London via Singapore. It has been a very long time  that I was on a long  journey with BA of more than 9 hours. Last year had a  great sprint from London to JFK and before that  since 2002. The  times have not  proven kind to  us Probably a mixture of the decline of BA and the emergence  of other airlines. Nearly all my  recent haul is  with Qantas on its A380, occasionally  Emirates on its version and then once in a  year with Cathay  Airlines and American Airlines. The problem is not the hard product. A B777 or the A380 in whatever  style and decor  I ordered is the same air frame. The B777 from Sydney to Singapore was fine. Nosier than the  others but that 's well known. Very comfortable seats , at 8 hours a relative sprint for those  which call Sydney home. It is the soft product that is lacking.  Checking in was fine and despite  flying in Economy had an express pass through security , a Gold FF with Qantas). Boarding was orderly and an on time departure and arrival into Singapore. Now its just  a lack of polish with the soft product. No  signs given showing  what was to be served (as with Cathay, Emirates and Qantas). The cutlery was really cheap and I mean cheap. KFC  used a better  job of plastic.  You know in  our days of  plastics that proper  quality is not possible but someone at BA needs to check out the plastic used  with Cathay and Qantas). The food itself was very bland; a salad that had seen better days and penne with some  sauce that was over salty. Qantas have done away with salads and simply give you  your main dish  with garlic bread and a dessert. It's just the quality that is lacking. Drinks? I have a tradition, something silly, about starting a journey off with a Jack Daniels and  saying This is available on Qantas  but no sir, we don't serve ". A note about the FA's: they were great but one gets the feeling that they are chirpy to mask some of the shortcomings with the product  we are asked  to deliver. Final  word about this  trip is the iFE. A touchscreen but it was  lacking in response time and the selection was diabolically bad. Award winning  and classic films with not a noted film from the last 30 . One or two interesting things , some new releases. Come on BA, for may  hours on a plane for that length of time is a perfect opportunity to catch up on much loved classics. As for music: well I'm 53 but still like the Pearl Jams etc of the world. We are not <mask> into Brit <mask> and edgy <mask> presenters. If BA is serious about the airline business then it needs to sharpen <mask> the soft <mask> the food and beverage and <mask> a touch of pizzazz about the airline. It is a mix of BA going back and many others coming up and beyond the <mask> that BA set many years <mask>

Flight to Gatwick operated by Titan Airways. Very full  business class of 36 people. A  single flight attendant , just one  female attendant handled alone. I wish to highly commend  him despite alone  they managed perfectly.

From Barcelona to Gatwick. This review  was about the  queues for check  out rather than  the flight. BA allows you to  book in online,  opting not to  print out a  boarding card. There 's no machine to print a card, queue taking 75 minutes to  collect boarding card, and several people  arriving too late  at check in. There were 4  lines 2 for priority, 2 for  priority check in  on all flights.  Not 1 desk served, once they 're about to close check in

Welcome to London-Heathrow with British Airways.  Although British Airways  was more or  fewer in the  comparable price range  as Lufthansa, no  onboard food or  drink were served.  Everyone was friendly.  And departure was  at Terminal 1 in Munich, which is by far  half as nice  than the newer terminal 2. And arrival at Terminal  4 in Heathrow which is not as nice/easy as  their new Star alliance Queens Terminal 2. No WiFi,  smart device entertainment or onboard monitors  during my flight.  A reservation too expensive in my eyes. British airways  has one big advantage though: the generous hand luggage !

This was an  average morning flight from Heathrow to Keflavik. The flight  was not very full. Shortly after take off, the cabin crew came  out to sell  us snacks and drinks reasonably priced. This was a typical intra-European flight on British Airways where food and drinks are for sale. Cabin crew were efficient. I had the exit  window seat so  leg room was  less than adequate.

Cape Town to London. Dated aircraft, very poor cabin  and semi inedible food and the inevitable entertainment system crash made for a very poor  flight The cabin crew clearly regarded us as an  inconvenience and I do not feel that I should  remember having to ask for a  drink with my  first meal, surely we should have been offered something as a matter  of course. I used to be happy to pay more to fly  but now I pay extra not to.

Washington to Prague  from London. I have flown them several times in the past, but not for a number of years. I remember them  being not a  fan of the  average airline, but  more than average. This time it seemed that any  extra things have been dropped (hot  seats as you  approach your destination), and they have  been almost a low fare airline. You pay for  airline seats, on  some flights you  pay for food, etc. The seating on the Boeing  777 seemed very . It is  suppose to be  comfortable but seemed like less. On the return flight on May 3rd, two of the  flights went out  for service. The  flights from London  to Prague seemed to have more  leg room, but the seats were very hard. They may be the  new "slimline" seats,  but not sure,  because they were  very uncomfortable even  after a two hour flight. Also, on the Washington  to LHR flight we had  print out boarding passes at home.  Our agent at Washington printed out  extra ones and said we should  use them, but  when we got  to security she  only printed out two for me and none for my wife. It was lucky we  still had the  ones we printed out at home.  I won't say that I will not fly them , but I will definitely compare prices in the future. They aren't worth any extra .

Welcome to Washington.  Nothing from the  start nothing nothing  from First class, not even the  Cabin Crew was  even more attentive  to service than  our coach. Food which used to be fantastic is  barely eatable, no  more Wines which were the best in the sky when Jancis Robinson and Hugh Johnson  did the selection : from a  fine white champagne,  another mediocre rosé)  are at the level of a business class. And  the seat did not have sound from the audio/video system: so they moved me. And  half hour later  their whole system  died without the  coach apologizing. Needless to say no  more Apart from  their LHR First and Concorde Room  facilities at LHR which remain great, BA is now  little better than  the 3 star ? Sad for  my clients and  good for BA .

I had called the British Airways  passenger service staff to ask about  a plane change at London Heathrow from Washington Dulles  into Glasgow. I was told that  British border control  should be done  with final destination  was Glasgow, but  it was not ! Passengers arriving  to London Heathrow from international and connecting to domestic flights have to  pass UK border control, long lines  and then security screen again,   without gaining access  to flights. Even  with mobility assistance and a fast  boarding card and  20 minutes between  flights it was a close call to make connections.

Back to Montreal. I did my online check-in the night before and left to go  to the airport. I arrived at  Montreal airport 2.5 hours in advance, went to a kiosk to print my boarding pass, and the kiosk wasn't working, so I proceeded to  the BA counter to get my pass and check in my luggage. I was in line for approximately 15 minutes when we were all told to switch . The line  they were moved to was substantially  longer however I was patient. By the time I got to the  gate an hour  had passed, and I had a bit over an  hour left to my flight. I  knew this was tight but all the while manageable  that I trusted BA's system. The  person at the  gate asked me where I was  from and when I said Montreal, she looked at  it and said "you won't make ." I explained the situation how I had been  at the airport for several hours  already and that I was in  Canada for 1 %. She just told me I needed to go to the missed flight counter. I got to the counter and they informed me that  I had to buy a new  plane ticket. My original return ticket cost me $800,  my return cost  was $1350.  I had no  option but to buy the ticket. I also had to stay in a hotel and then take a bus to Gatwick airport the following morning. Once I arrived back in  London I called  the Customer Services and they told me that it was protocol to put me on standby and not make me purchase a new ticket, and that I could get a refund, if not for the new flight, then for  the $400 of the flight I missed. Imagine my shock after spending an additional $1500  more all in. When I escalated  the complaint, they did not address  my case for over a month  and once they did they just said we cannot refund you, and that was that.

Tokyo to Amsterdam via London. On the evening before departure I received an email from  them the flight would be delayed for one hour but we were urged to get to the airport on the original time in case there wouldn't be a delay. In the end the aircraft left Tokyo Haneda with a 90 minutes delay. Baggage drop off was smooth and was handled with Japanese politeness. If you have the choice to fly from NRT or HND I would definitely choose HND because it's much more conveniently located to downtown Tokyo. The aircraft was parked at a remote stand and we were bussed to the aircraft, adding more time to the delay we already had. I didn't like the seats on the 777. I found them quite uncomfortable and the legroom was insufficient, especially when you have an instant recline type passenger in front of you. On the window and aisle seats, there's also the IFE box so there's no place for both feet. The meal was a joke and there was no choise. Inflight entertainment is not up to date,  only screens with  poor brightness. The crew was not very friendly. When I went to the galley for a drink I was was urged to return to my seat instead of drinking in the galley and stretching my legs. The second meal service was rushed. We've got our meals and after 5 minutes the crew returned to pick up the trays because we were already descending to LHR.  Luckily I've made  through to my connecting flight to Amsterdam because I had a short connection. The A320 flight to Amsterdam departed ahead of schedule. There's nothing special to write about this short flight although one round of drinks would have been nice. Unfortunately BA decided to cut the the service on European flights in the race to the bottom.

Getting at Vienna Airport was painless.  I uses Air Lounge at Vienna  and was adequate  and enough seating  but food was okay. Boarding was a scrum as there was no priority given to  Eastern Europe passengers. The flight wasn’t full therefore service  was quite prompt. I found the  passengers to be quite engaging and friendly and were  pleasant to talk to. The food  seemed quite mediocre  which consisted of afternoon tea scones and miniscule sandwiches.  A passenger wasn’t  very happy with the serving and  the crew tried her hardest to explain what afternoon tea was. Business  class was quite  nice to be  on Will fly  to Europe again  later depending on which route and  how BA has a lot of  catch up to  to compare to other carrier within Europe.

Had a day trip to Vienna with British Airways,  arranged at the  last minute. Flying out at 0720 , a Sunday and having an  early start to  getting to the airport I was  quite forward to  getting some sleep on the flight. Having never usually  had a problem, I boarded the  aircraft and asked  how it would  be possible to  get a pillow and blanket, to  be told by  the member of  staff that these are not for  leisure passengers –  only business. Freezing temperature onboard the  flight so managed to get limited sleep – another  example of BA’s pathetic cost cutting antics and demonstrates  complete non-existence of  proper service within the airline. Despite  this being one of the first flights out of  Vienna with no  delay for departure  and perfect weather  forecast – we  only managed to arrive about 20  minutes late into  Austria – quite as to how,  remains beyond me.  Will be sticking to easyJet until British Airways once  more starts to  treat it’s passengers, as currently they couldn’t care less.

Welcome to Heathrow. BA are a  joke it once stood for a  double standard and  kept the flag high. My flight  from Islay was  delayed by 2  hours no fault  not mine, so  had missed my  next flight! After  I fobbed off , not my  choice nothing we  could do I  started phoning and  after an hour  after being passed  round pillar to  pillar and back  again I had  them pay for  another flight. Money  sucking company with  terrible customer service  and lack of  good feeling

Back to Phoenix  last week. Having  a window seat  at the top  is your kind of rest assured  you will have privacy and rest. This was successful  on the flight with 6 hours slept which was  very comfortable which I was surprised at. The meals were good and tasty with the service pleasant enough for BA. The poorest part of  the trip is the TV being so small and picture so poor.  In the end,  could really use  that as it was so frustrating amongst other operational  issues i.e. press pause and film would start from  nothing Would I  fly again, sure why not.

Glasgow to Heathrow. Very disappointed in British Airways. Having been delayed by a "partner airline" and therefore missed the last connecting flight of the  evening BA charged  me and my friend full price to rebook for the morning. Their system had not allowed me to book all the way through using my BA exec club membership so I'd had to book it as two flights. Neither BA or Loganair would take responsibility  for us stranded at the airport for the night. Clearly, being a member of the BA exec club counts for nothing. Very bad customer  behaviour BA. Seems BA and Loganair are only in partnership to extort more money from your passengers.

Brussels to Shanghai  from London Heathrow.  Great flights on  a clean aircraft,  weather good, cabin  staff friendly.   Highly recommend British Airways. The only complaint I have is about the  airport staff at . I lost  my jacket on  my Shanghai to London flight and  some staff at  JFK gave the  email address of a company for  found objects.

Chicago to London Heathrow. I was dubious about flying  again especially after my last flight over a year  ago - after  that I left the aircraft feeling  quite hungry. However  my trip to  London with BA was surprisingly very  comfortable both ways. On this flight, after deciding not  to spend on an upgrade, I  felt pleasantly surprised  at being given a seat with  more leg room - didn't feel  the need to get up and  move my legs once. Although I slept a lot  on the way, the cabin crew were very helpful - even asking the captain to  change the direction of Mecca so  I could pray (in my seat).  Also given two  bites of pretzels  or two cups of coffee - i had to ask for both, but was given without any fuss.  BA is a  very nice aircraft and the take off and landing  were excellent, although I noticed a funny (not that loud) motorised noise  emanating form the galley noise of the journey. For  breakfast there was  roast chicken, rice , lentils, and  a rice pudding  for desert, all of which was okay - nothing .

London to Philadelphia  via London. I  paid BA because the fare was  outrageous which explains  why on a  3 hour 40 minute flight ATH  and LHR they  do not serve  snacks and beverages free. On the aircraft having paid  at our chosen  flight there was  NO waste envelope,  but my inflight magazine was so  on LHR to  be an immaculate aircraft smooth flight  all the way, rather poor lunch. I was disappointed  by BA especially with their decision to charge for  food on European  routes

Hong Kong to  BA Heathrow on  arrival in Club World. This was an interesting comparison as we had flown out to HK on an  island on Cathay  Pacific and the  airport was huge. The BA Club World cabin is  quite cramped when  combined with Cathay. The seat configuration  is ok if  your want to  tend to your  family or friend  but there is  so little room  and store items  which just feels  very cramped. The  sheets and blankets come in a bag that is  under the seat , which the crew insist on  storing in the overhead lockers for  take off, this  will fare enough  but there is  no room. They also provide bottle of water, which is great, but again little storage ! The food  choice was also  quite the duck ling as my  main course was very tough. Drinks selection was very good. Plus points  goes to the  catering crew, who  are very professional  and had a sense of humour.  The BA plan  to change the  business class seating in 2019 and  this cannot come  close enough.

Los Angeles to London Heathrow return.  BA Outbound First Class, return Club World. A380 both sectors, awesome aircraft. Firstly, BA flight deck crews are  all Totally professional and you know that they are tremendous pilots.   All cabin crew on both sectors were polite, friendly  & professional. Their service was excellent.  It wasn’t feeling  good on the out bound flight  and I didn’t eat anything, so  i can’t comment  upon the food. On the return flight, in Club  world the food was very good, no complaints there. The seats were comfortable although the Club World cabin felt cramped. I  was in 53K which is a  standard rear facing bulk head seat. As it was a daytime flight,  no noise coming  from the galley  did bother me, but I think it would be an issue on night flights. I hope BA change their business class seating for something like AA business class on their . BA business  Class is really dated, and I  thought it felt cramped. My BIG  problem and this  is entirely BA’s fault was the over zealous security screening at Heathrow.  Everyone was pulled  aside for screening 3 times. I don’t mind extensive, in depth security  and to be  checked 3 times  seems excessive. I  am enrolled in  a pay for  the Pre Check and if British  Airlines would participate in this program, it would save a lot of  time Other than , the overall  security experience was  completely acceptable.

Hamburg to Abu Dhabi via London. Hamburg to Heathrow not even a  small glass of water or a candy. Everything is for purchase, I felt cheated. Heathrow Terminal 5 was a big mass. Getting from my arrival gate to the departure gate  took me over  twice within the same terminal! Security screening was extremely slow and staff rude. I will avoid Heathrow in the future. Long flight to Abu  Dhabi was ok, no frills in Premium Economy but edible food. Return  flight was similar,  with Heathrow terminal 5 less chaotic this time. My last flight on BA was over 30 years ago, it was a real premium carrier then.

Overnight club world flight from Rio  via London. Check in at Rio  was efficient. Third  floor lounge (Premium plaza) which was  spacious and had  ample space. No fast track security lanes in Rio. Plane ready near enough on time with well organized boarding. On board,  to club world ! My feeling  is that the food and beverage  selection is not  very good as  is used to ? Granted they only loaded one  in the wine options (which was wasn't great either). Food itself not terribly appetizing. Breakfast quite rushed, which it did not need to be given the long  duration of the flight. Flight landed on time, priority bags worked and were off quickly. An average experience. However, BA were not the lowest cost option on this route (at the time of  booking that was Air France- a carrier I rate ), but they  had a direct  route

From Heathrow to  Amsterdam The 747  flying this route , an old  burnt out aircraft,  so though I  went for premium economy the seat  was hard, small  but uncomfortable, it  would not recline  in the air  without yanking the  seat back, the  right foot rest was broken on  one side so  even during the  entire flight my  leg was tilted  or slid off.  My touch on  my back of the screen was  really difficult to  reach and barely  comfortable The washroom had a leak , when I used it in  the middle of  a flight water  started running along  my floor and  soaking my socks,  an air stewardess  only gave a  nervous laugh and said I shouldn’t  had worn socks. There was no  back pack of  sun shades etc,  and of two  colour choices one had run out , two rows  having been served.  My  crew  were bored and  not bothered.

Madrid to London. Credit where it's due. Flew club  members and the crew were excellent. Friendly, attentive and  attentive The food  was a good standard. The B767  had a dedicated business class cabin  and larger seats. Think they will be phased out this year but a good example  of good service.

Venice to Gatwick.  I use Snokart  baggage which is  supposed to be  folded and fastened  separately to allow skiers to check  into one bag ! In Feb of this year,  i was told  by BA check  out staff in  Nottingham that it is against their  baggage policy to allow luggage to be fastened together. The staff were clear that it  was BA policy  so bags cannot  been fastened together. For nearly three  months I have  been asking the  BA complaints team  for provide evidence  of this baggage policy. I have  got several replies in that time but on each  one the customer  service staff have  refused to provide  evidence of the  same policy alleged  against their check  out staff in  London BA has also refused to  say whether these  customer check in  employees are in  reality BA employees or employed by  some third party.  This is very  wrong in what  was a reputable  business

First 3 legs were trouble free. Lounges were good,  security staff were good, some were  very poor, especially the agent I encountered at security in LHR. My flight from Singapore  became delayed in the air and I was not allowed onto my connecting flight. British Airways re-booked me  for the next  leg but downgraded  me from Business to Economy and into a centre seat. Fine, I  had to get home and they said they would  help me. After 3 weeks, they  were mailed back to say they  will refund the  money to my company who paid the ticket, but I was not entitled to any  such token gesture of Frequent Flyer  support for the  sake of being  bumped and put  in an aisle seat, after a long haul flight.  I missed out on a meal and the option  to be comfortable  or to try and catch up  some further sleep.  This was all  done very poorly, late and without regard to a frequent flyer who  had the option  of fly via Air France or one of the middle east carriers  that value my . Its left me with a  rather sour taste in my mouth and I will certainly look at  flights with other carriers now.

South London to  Paris with British  Airlines Massively overpriced  flights to other  carriers on this route like Ryanair or Easyjet with no real added value. No drinks or food served on the flight, the check-in process is just as painful and most  of the time  will force you to ckeck in your hand baggage as well. A  little more legroom  and that won’t  make the £200 % difference on  the 2hr flight.

Sat for a Vueling Airlines flight  connecting Florence to  Birmingham and bumped off flight. When  called British airways  became unhelpful and told the flight had nothing to do with them  - though I bought the ticket from ba.com and had one flight number BA2058. A shocking attitude towards  a paying customer.

Welcome to Sao  Tome Overnight club  and flight. Prompt  checking in at  gate and into . No spaces at the spa, Galleries lounges were fine and showers clean. Good WiFi.  Lounge was a  breeze so in  flight entertainment was  free They also  had WiFi on , Crew experienced  employees were good. Service prompt, food  good and I liked the new  Fast Company offerings.  I arrived early.  Was a solid  flight

Worst BA flight ever! Flew Tampa to London Gatwick. No greeting by the door, shown to economy despite  empty seat. Dirty plane. Bits dangling from the ceiling. Only once all passengers were seated delay was announced and refuelling commenced, which is a clear indication that  it was known earlier. Probably the worst business class seat around, wobbly footrest, facing strangers  or having to climb over people. Breakfast was a  rather meagre roll  with one tiny  orange slice and unbranded ketchup. At disembarkation the crew did help elderly passengers, that was left to other  airlines Crew just  stood there. Economy was not held back, so no priority disembarkation. Never again.

Flying British Airways  from London Heathrow  to Dusseldorf. Despite being row 1,  it was tiny.  A comparison to  the Eurowings, which  are a budget ? Food terrible.  Much worse was  your seat. This  was not business  that one expects  this degree of  discomfort Next time  you will fly  in and get  extra leg room,  with a table  I can actually  sleep on.

Return to London. The main plus  about this flight  is the cabin crew who were professional and friendly, and hard working. The I saw no food in the Iberia lounge at Madrid, no working washrooms, and  poor Iberia staff. The food on board was ludicrous, in business I  tried a panini - the staff looked embarrassed to serve it. Waste er money.

London to Moscow. British Airways has downgraded their plane to a smaller plane and hence seat in Business class is no  more Club World (flat bed) seat but Club Europe seat (not flat bed). It is a night flight and this change is important and not acceptable. I cannot fly during the day as I have meetings  and BA has not offered a like for like change, they offered seats on an early flight next morning which is not suitable as this flight is during the day. Moreover the fare that we paid for the night flight was more expensive that those that BA is offering during the day. They also not allowing me to cancel the flight and rebook another or change the outbound flight to another date, like Friday when the seat (whether club world or club Europe) is less important as Saturday not a working day and one can get  a rest. In Summary it is  unfair that BA is charging more for the flights with Club World Seat and then swapping it to smaller plane without  offering a like for like change. This was never the case before and BA was fair previously.

Miami to London. My most recent BA experience was positive. I fly BA for work and leisure up to 4 long  leg flights a  month On my  most recent flight  from Miami to LHR I found the whole economy experience well above average, despite the  small aircraft the  BA Which to  me is the legend of the skies! The cabin crew in economy were smart, attentive and seemed to go beyond the call of duty  to an elite service, from the MIA ground handling  cabin crew. Food  and beverage service  very good, seating in my aisle  seat 29E generous for my long legs. I recently  flew BA business/ Club world to the Far East for work and despite the unlimited  amenities and frills the cabin staff lacked the attention and friendliness of  a flight. Well done BA you  compete against the North American carriers on routes to the North American gateways who give just a basic service.

Gatwick to Barbados , December 2017.  For a 9  hour flight they provided one meal,  an afternoon tea  and consisted of  the mars bar and a cup of tea. The plane was aging and yellowing round the edges and the staff were  tired The only  nice thing was , it was  cheaper than competitors (but still not cheap).

from Heathrow to Dallas. The aircraft was old no  need of refurbishment for the last  5 years or so. Seat pocket was full of  baggage from previous flight. The personal  screen is tiny and no longer responsive as a  touch screen, so I had to  use the remote control which is fixed on the armrest and non retractable. The choice of IFE is very limited. The food on both outbound and inbound  planes were mediocre and with small  meals I saw  several passengers request  some more food,  so I was glad to see  cabin crew giving out nicely without attitude. I must admit that the  crews on the  departures were exceptional,  and the inbound  were acceptable but still better than most crew on  the to/from JFK. I had an onward connecting flight with American Airlines, and I can  definitely see the changes between the  three airlines over the past few  years Whilst AA  keeps improving, BA  are becoming a national embarrassment. BA remains among the most greedy airlines when it comes  to seat selection. The seat selection  percentage tag just  above the total  fares higher than other decent airlines. It no longer deserves a 4-star  review but edging between 2 or 3 star. It's not even worth redeeming Avios points anymore. These days , rather spend my Avios on  cheaper airlines.

Decided to go in Club Europe for this relatively  long flight (90 minutes) from London to Copenhagen. Dropped my bags and went through security, which did not take too long. I then went to the Galleries Lounge (south), and although I have not been there for a year or two, it  felt the same. Same food, same drinks, same slow wifi. My gate was just around the corner, and I got on the plane. I like the fresh look inside, but the seat pitch is ridiculous in business. The food service was disappointing. The service in  my cabin was OK, but not very warm. I have travelled a lot with BA over the past 20 years, after  that I have lost my faith in British Airways.

BA used to  hold a byword  in quality and service. You simply  cant say that anymore and the only thing that  seemed to have  stayed the same  was the ticket price. I paid  200 dollars for my ticket from  Istanbul to London with BA. For that price there  is no airbridge (you will wait  for a crowded bus) and no entertainment (note: this is a 4 am flight. Also,  any devices larger than a phone are banned from this flight, so no alternative of  streaming movies on your iPad). Oh and you’ll have to buy any food and drinks on board. I flew BA on this route because no other flight time worked for  us however Turkish Airlines is by  FAR the better  airline with airbridge,  free hot meals and a modern entertainment system. Pegasus and AtlasGlobal offer a similar service to BA but  costs far lower  prices It seems to be the  case all over. BA used to  remain a first choice but at  the price, for this service, it’s  becoming a last  resort

British economy worse than most airlines economy. Unprofessional staff, uncomfortable seats, foot rest but no leg rest, very little seat recline and difficult to operate. Rubbish food,  extremely poor landing and everything went flying. Additionally, we  had a family  with 4 travelling together but split  flights and 3 of us were seated between two  of the four toilets that serve 160 people. These “premium economy” seats are directly outside  of toilet doors which meant an  uncomfortable night kept awake with the noise and light from the loos.  Many airlines have toilet lights that dim until you lock the door to avoid flooding the cabin with  smoke - not BA. Even the staff kept leaving the toilet doors open after they  walked in to blow their nose  and check their teeth or makeup. This was the second leg on a flight from Sydney (via LAX) so we were beyond tired. When an attendant picked up my son’s water at the end of the  extremely long and  boring flight, he didn’t hear my son say “thanks” (which he had) so the attendant said pointedly “You’re welcome - rude!”  He laughed about it with the  man next to him. In my  opinion better (and cheaper) premium economy  to be found with Norwegian, Air New Zealand and American Airlines - all of whom also allow seat selection without additional charge. I’ve never had cause for complaint with any of those airlines but with British Airways, I’ve never had a good experience.

Flew Belfast to  London with British Airways. Stressful day started with a 2.5 hours delay for the morning flight at 7am. As an apology, they sold us  our food and the drinks, yes  even asked for money, even though we were stuck on the airplane for over three hours! Seriously, if  you can find  any alternative to travel within the UK do it.  Not very countable  if you have  another connected flight!

Naples to Gatwick.  BA online check-in  would not work  on me in accordance with the  new World Frequent  Fly policy. I  am a Qantas  frequent flyer and  thought I ought to have had  a chance to  book a few days ahead of the flight. The  BA website would not let me  do so. The bag-drop in Naples was slow and seemed rather random. Boarding was tedious.  We should have had priority as a frequent flyer and had to show my frequent flyer card. In  that mean time other passengers were allowed through the  boarding gate which proved to be  closed as a  shuttle bus was . Boarding was chaotic and passengers  had far too much hand luggage. The cabin crew  were quite indifferent. I greeted 2 cabin crew when I boarded and neither of them  waved back. I bought a Marks and Spencer drink at an inflated  rate One of the crew moved  a small bag in the overhead  compartment and at the end of the flight when I went to collect my bag it has been  replaced by the  hand of another passenger. Disembarkation was  chaotic and badly managed. Nobody from  cabin crew fare  paid the passengers. BA has become a low-cost airline in its service and given the  quality of the  staff and the charge for a bag I will not be using them again in  any hurry.

I have been flying with BA for the last 32 years between Sao Paulo and London on and off but mostly BA. I have travelled in all classes except First. BA used to  be a very good airline and stand out from  competitors but now  BA look like a low cost airline with high cost fares. Not  value for money.  The food and drinks are parsimonious to the extend of me having to ask for  another drink, even in Business (I  opted out Club and returned Economy plus). Staff on  board are still the usual arrogant and discretely rude,  no changes there. Boarding has become indifferent and they group classes in 5 different queues of travel so we have become just a number. Service is not exclusive anymore. Seats  of the 777-300  very hard and uncomfortable including the beds on CLub. Their lounge performance is very poor also with food option variety (in case of food  being really bad and of poor quality. It is  really shame Singapore Airlines doesn't fly to Brazil from  The UK as they definitely offer top quality service  especially on their business class. BA  has become mean,  rude and indifferent  to their customers  and I feel it is time for the CEO  must go as he is ruining the image of the airline. The changes on baggage weight has become silly also. I was allowed two luggages of 23kg.  Any sensible person would allow me to pass with one luggage at  least and one of 10kg as I haven't go above the allowance I am entitled.  So I had  a reshuffle my contents from the big luggage to  the small luggage to make it  14 and 14. In my opinion unnecessary as I had 37 kgs in total and not 47kg! So  we will in future re-think my  flights to Brazil. Even if I have to make my journey longer as I am after good service,  good for money and a differentiated ? Thumbs down , BA.

I traveled on  British Airways with my wife from Dallas to Lagos,  Nigeria via London on February 23,  2017 I had an extra bag  which I paid  dearly for in  advance our flight  is delayed in Dallas, therefore we missed our flight to Lagos. When  we got to  Dallas we went  to the BA counter to explain our situation and find a solution  but they decided  and put us  onto a Virgin  Atlantic flight to . On getting to Virgin Atlantic counter, we were told that we  had to pay  for the bag  again and request for a refund from BA, we  decided to do  that I opened a case on  BA website, explaining what happened and requested for a refund, as what happened was their  problem and not . They refused  to issue the  refund claiming that  our airline has their own baggage ! I know  this but what happened was not  our fault, but .. That was  that last time I heard from  BA on the  airline even the economy premium was  the waste of  time nothing special, such a disappointment,  yet again!

Flew British Airways from Budapest to London Heathrow. Quite possibly the worst flight I have ever had (and I travel often). Generally when we travel, we try to pack our  checked baggage light, as we check our heavier bags  so it's more convenient for other passengers too. My partner and I  have 2 briefcase-sized bags between us that fit nicely in the overhead locker. As more passengers boarded, most with as-large-as-possible carryons, the overhead lockers filled up. The  flight attendant walks  up to the overhead locker above our heads, takes out our bags, hands them to  her and says "I'm sorry but the space is needed for large bags", telling us  they put them underneath the seat in front of us. Reducing our leg room to zero. How is this at all ?! I questioned why we should lose our leg room as a result of having smaller carry-ons, and was given the  warning that I  could delay the  plane if the bags had to  get offloaded. I have no idea who at BA thought it would be a good policy to hand out the yellow tags that mean "thank you for bringing smaller carry-ons  like everyone else, as a measure of our appreciation, we'll take away  some leg room".  The general decorum of the flight attendants also deserves a mention. Young adults barely out of high school, and who would be more suited to making coffees in a road services Starbucks, such was their experience  in providing pleasant . What a sad state of affairs. I will never ever travel British Airways willingly again, long haul or short haul. I would rather take a civilised one-stop journey with  ease and arrive in a pleasant frame of mind than endure the  constant dirty feeling of a direct British Airways flight.

The air conditioning didn’t work in  one part of  the airplane where we were sitting and it was very hot. I had to stand in the back of the airplane where it was  cold It was  an 8 hours  flight from London Heathrow to New York JFK. Overall  The airplane was  small with little space to seat. There was no . The leg/seating space was very  tight I wish  the food would  be more taste neutral. If your child doesn’t like spicy or flavored foods/snacks, there would  been nothing to eat. The stewardesses  were most helpful and their service  was outstanding. Landing  was smooth. The BA staff made us to check in our bags  while they were  loaded on. There are measuring boxes where you should be able to stick your luggage in, and these boxes are very small. Also the Airport Security was overly zealous -  we had to search kids bag, and they found roll-on deodorant and checked it for fumes.

My bag was damaged on a  domestic flight in December 2017. All  looked good when  i got to  an airport customer services counter - was told it  could be replaced and they gave  you a number  they call. I  call this number  back home and it's a 3rd  party company called . They will  not replace with a poor quality  one that is  basically the same  of the one  that damaged despite  its being in  poor condition and hardly used. I  tried this with  BA who refused  the offer like-for-like  and I got  through with them  spending hours on hold numerous times. 4 months later , decide that  anything is better than nothing and call K2, to  cancel the bag  being offered me,  only to find  out BA have  rejected my case  that they won't  have one. Finally  get through to  someone and they  finally agree to put me back  on K2 to  get the bag . If I want to upgrade  as they offer I will have  TO pay it . I wont hold my breath  until it is  scheduled to arrive  by Tuesday. I  will not fly  back unless I  see no other  viable option.

Efficient check in  with staff advised on best lounge  options for our  needs Decided to opt for premium  lounge as only  2 hour flight  from London Heathrow  from Cairo. Galleries  of lounge was  a quiet good  variety of snacks  including an afternoon tea offering which  is quite good. Showers clean and  well presented. Chaotic boarding. Well presented aircraft, staff in  first economy cabin offered welcome drink. Slightly delayed departure  was made up en route. Unable to order main course for meal on line but got choice of meal which was  quite acceptable. Efficient  flight and good  live entertainment. Happy  with whole experience.  Personally don’t think  we would use  this club world  on a long  flight but for  long flight where  I don’t need  much sleep it  is fine.

Flying Lucia to Gatwick. As this  is a night  trip we decided  the fly business  as we might get some sleep and I now  wish we'd saved  that extra that it cost, a  total waste of money. The cabin is very dated, and cramped, it wasn't clean (half  eaten biscuit down the side of my seat and  two bags on the floor) and the service and food were average at best. Why in this day  & age do BA persist with having seats with no direct aisle access? Not that I could get  close enough to sleep anyway, the seat was adequate and no more,  my entertainment system  however was small and the touch  screen was very  poor needing very  minimal contact to  make any response. On top of  which there was no USB point  that charge my  phone I expected better cabin service than we got, not offered tea  or coffee after dinner and it seemed to be a case of  paying for anything that was needed rather than being offered it -  I certainly don't expect to have  someone remind the flight attendant about the cup of  tea requested 15 minutes earlier. All  and all it was an education,  it taught me  my lesson!

From Lauderdale to Gatwick. An efficient courtesy bus took  us from car rentals (terminal 1)  into the international terminal (terminal 4).  Everyone was friendly.  The staff insisted  upon using a whole-body scanner for everyone and were overly officious. Surprisingly,  it was no  business class lounge, although there was plenty of sitting space before the  flight in the redeveloped terminal. Boarding  was according to  price rather than priority which caused  much annoyance. Club  seating was in two smaller cabins,  with the usual, outdated eight seats abreast. Take-off was on time. The wrong menus had been loaded, so  an actual menu was announced over the tannoy. Drinks , food service  worked efficiently. Food adequate and not overcooked, but below  the standard of  United Airlines. Seats  uncomfortable and uncomfortable  when sleeping, with the usual issue of having to climb over legs  whilst in a  window seat. Abbreviated  food (no hot option) served an hour before landing. Arrived 30 mins ahead of schedule.  Was an adequate flight, but the  passenger experience was well below BA's  standard

London to London . It's bad that BA requests  for payment to  book seats before  you check-in. If  travelling solo it's  not a big  deal but with any companion (in this case I  went with my  group of 10)  that would have  caused an issue  and be separate.  It also means  that if there  was 3 or  more flights, and  no group of  10 (as in  our case) the difference would be  well up to  about 1000$. Lucky enough at least  for the return  trip we were able to select  the middle seats because the flight  is full. On  board service was  excellent Professional, courteous  & friendly attendants. Toilets in the second half of  my flight weren't  always clean. Flat  seats in business class are outdated  yet comfortable for  a nice sleep.  Our aircraft did  indeed have WiFi.

London to Las Vegas. Disappointed at  BA - flights were delayed (my partner took the same outbound flight  for a different day and was delayed as well by 2-3hrs). Aircraft interior was outdated, unclean and uncomfortable seats with very  limited legroom space. No safety video which was surprising as most long haul flights include this. Food was tasteless and I did skip a meal in the end - during  one of the  meal times we weren't given the options by our FA but the  man sat next to us who was served by another FA was given different options. Inflight entertainment poor with very limited  seats and monitors were very old.  To ensure that  we sit with  my partner on the return flight,  both paid to reserve our seats - not impressed by this especially when we realised  all the legroom  space for my partner was obstructed by a broke IFE box which was loosely fitted so the door kept opening taking his legroom space as well as exposing the cables in the box which if you knocked it down would affect his monitor.  Learnt our lessons, next time we will not fly BA!

Tampa to Gatwick.  I am a  British traveller with  significant mobility issues.  Because I usually travel alone I  often find it extremely difficult. However, from the moment I arrived at  a check in  counter in Tampa I was met with the utmost courtesy and assistance.  With the check in clerk at  first class waving  you forward to  enter his terminal  it just went  from excellent to exceptional. I was helped to put my suitcase onto the conveyor scale and assisted with  any step of  every way until the aircraft door.  Each person was polite, helpful and went out of  their way to  make my journey as pleasant as possible. I witnessed  such kindness and  that is what  we have come  to expect and value from British  Airlines Having used other airlines in the past - I am converted  and I will  definitely use any other airline in  2017

Heathrow to Keflavik. I had booked economy, was pleasantly surprised to be  accepted when I  logged in online.  Priority boarding worked well and even though the flight was full there was no  baggage locker range.  The inflight meal was prawns was generous along with  very good selection of wine. Off loading was straightforward. The return flight was on time, the pre booked  business seat had more leg room the premium seat.  Overall food service  is OK. The  cabin crews were  great at taking payment. Overall similar experience to an easyjet flight.

Welcome to Muscat  first class. First  day trying out  second class on  arrival Check-in was fairly quick and  I didn't have  any luggage, but  my first wing did not feel  particularly exclusive. I  also selected window seat in advance and this was  easy and still  working as I  was printed boarding ! Concorde room was nice, well  appointed but quite  crowded in some  places Had to ask for a  drink two times out in the  lobby before it  finally served a good 20 minutes , Checkout out the cabana for an hour, which  was not very appealing at all, and managed to  book the first  5 min of the 15min treatment  package booked for  The Spa. Onboard  I informed there  is a problem with the Seat  we had selected,  and was issued  a new aisle , which was disappointing. Upon entering the first class  cabin I had  a quick look at the seat,  but it was  almost immediately apparent,  this was something  that I asked  flight crew to  investigate and they  came back to  me that I will indeed not  be able to sit there, but  that was no  explanation of what was wrong given.  We did not  need to waste any time to settle in, the  guy looking after  us introduced himself  and served me  hot and warm  food as well  to offering some magazines to read. Seat was comfortable and spacious enough  but seemed fairly private, with a  matching wardrobe to  the jacket. The  tv screen seemed  quite large and  good quality. Unfortunately , seat controls were not super responsive, and neither  was the remote for the TV.  Immediately after take  out I was  glad I could eat when I  ordered Arabic starter , great. Had  my main meal , Meal was  also good quality , cooked well.  Got a dessert , the mixed cheese plate (not  as good as  mixed cheese I've  seen in some  business class). Surprisingly , entertainment system had a rather  limited selection, I 'm on two  other flights in  this same month,  I might run  short of anything of interest to . After finishing  the one film  I decided to  watch I decided to try get  some sleep. Crew made the bedding , I tried  a put on  the pyjamas in  my tiny first  Class bathroom. Bedding  is of good  quality and comfortable  but I missed  eating as I  was still rather  exhausted from the  meal and pre-dinner  in the lounge. Overall, I was reasonably happy with  this flight and  the product. The crew were very  friendly and professional.  As this was  economy class, have  gotta admit there  was no wow  there either with  this soft product  and ground experience.  I managed to  book flights for  a good price  and a promo, otherwise it would <mask> not be <mask> the price <mask> for a <mask> short flight.

My family and I travelled from Cape Town to London on the  25 March 2018.  I have a  one year old and a 4  week old. Once seated, we realised that our entertainment system was not working. The cabin light for all seats that we had booked were not working either.  It was minimal effort from the cabin team to try and resolve this. As it was a night flight, my wife and I had to see to our 1 year old in the dark. Any help we needed required us to walk  to the galley to receive any assistance. As BAs safety demonstration prior to take off  was on video, we didn't receive  assistance The flight was the worst airline experience we've had. I doubt  we ever fly with BA again.

Gatwick to Madeira.  My flight left on time and arrived early, slept  in early morning . The plane  is not very clean, grubby tray  of seats and  dried dirt in the spokes of the seats. The staff were pleasant.  Nothing was offered  for my children  and it was  free The return  is poorly organised, no use of fast track security  or business class passengers. Long queue for boarding and a grubby plane.  Absolutely no point in paying for business class. The staff try so  damn hard to please the passengers  after nearly 4  years and no entertainment, dog-eared magazines.  Quickly disembarked , swiftly through  security

Back to Casablanca. Their customer service quality in Heathrow Terminal 3 is very patchy. For background, my initial flight was with TAP Portugal which got cancelled, then  switched to BA. My second flight had further issue, and instead of requesting TAP to  replace me, BA  chose the liberty of rebooking a  third flight for  BA - which  turned out to be overbooked. This  situation caused me  having to liaise  between both TAP and BA to  get my 4th flight - I was tossed around  with both customer  services telling me  was not their problem. TAP can  now longer rebook me on another  plane as they have lost the right to alter the ticket as soon as BA  gets me on the 3rd flight. I was initially served by a very helpful staff who attends to  any rebooking issue - the last  flight I was rebooked was overbooked. However, later on I was passed on to a couple of rude  staff that were reluctant to serve  passengers as it was 15 minutes  before their end of shift. They were also talking about me in  terms of me and accused me of taking advantage of BA. This  was very rude and extremely unprofessional. I've never had  such treatment during  over 10+ years of flying with various airlines, both top rated and  high cost carrier.

British Airways flight  delays is very  important I travelled on BA985 from  Germany to Hong Kong via London , 19 Feb.  Due to the  cold weather, my  journey leaving Berlin to London was delayed, in which I was worried about missing my connecting flight from  Berlin to Hong . During the  delay the manager came to me several times, explained to me the  reasons of flight delay, informed me about the connecting  ticket arrangements. Her information was very  well trusted she has been working  together with airport  staff on this.  Very much appreciated for their service.

London to Brussels via London. Didn't  want this from  European Airways. For  me quality hit  the rock bottom.  With the unclean  service I would 've preferred the  route from Brussels to London and  Vice versa for  my long haul travel. Maybe my expectations was too  low but considering the price I  paid for ticket  i think it's  well worth it.  Another airline which  we used to  use had the  lowest price and  as I compare the services of  the ariline I  am choosing British  Airways

London Gatwick to Fort Lauderdale is  part of BA's  flagship long-haul routes and clearly designed  to cater for  summer sun seekers.  In September 2018, the Gatwick fleet will be 'densified', with an horrific  route across in bound and a reduced Club World. The 777-200 on our flight was of the bog-standard  Boeing vintage, which  meant 48 pax els into the Club World cabin , everyone having  the make do with the ancient,  small screen, low  resolution IFE that  prevents the usual rebooting. But there  are positive aspects  to the flight:  a young and efficient cabin crew,  vastly improved Club  World food service , plates brought  right to one's  destination and arrival ahead of schedule, although this was  weighed down by the delayed disembarkation that's commonplace at  Port Lauderdale terminal 4. Overall, an  extremely reasonable flight.

Milan to London Heathrow. The service and cleanliness has hit rock bottom at BA I  was flying with them very frequently and this last  trip was testament that they have  such passion. The response was we  are not responsible for cleaning the  airport

London to Helsinki, Business class, Friday 23rd March. I  felt service in  the sky had died out. As a frequent flyer I haven’t felt  I needed to complain nor commend  anyone now. I  wanted to say something, to say thank you for one of the most pleasurable flights I have ever had. This is old school airline service, puts the glamour and luxury  straight into air travel. Cabin staff made me feel like I was  they only person  they were serving. I loved the  atmosphere the way  people made it  very personal and  the fact they took such great  notice of my daughter who is  as fussy as  it comes.

From Heathrow to  London Words cannot express my gratitude  or appreciation for the lovely crew that worked so hard to make  sure I was comfortable on my  last flight; but  there it goes!  He was very sick/nauseas from food  poisoning on a different airline and the staff off British Airways literally  got me back  to health. They  looked beyond wonderful , were genuinely caring and concerned.  I never once felt like a  passenger even though  you were checking on me often!  Business class crew!!  Always so thankful for people like this, especially in my time of need and would  absolutely recommend this  airline to everyone.

It was a 13 hours flight from Heathrow to Kuala Lumpur with British Airways, and it was my first long haul flight with absolutely no meals served. During the dinner, I was sleeping so you could say that it was my fault for not staying ! For the breakfast, the flight was 20 minutes ahead of schedule so they were in a rush serving the meals (up until 40 minutes before landing, they were still serving), I waited for my turn but no food came so I asked. Instead of them explaining and apologising, I had to ask where is my food. They said that  the ran out of food, because they only cater for 80% of the passengers assuming some will be asleep. The cabin crew were very nice, he apologised and passed me a feedback form which I have filled in. While I understand that this airline does not want to waste food (and I liked their act of putting an envelope for you to donate to kids in !), it is not very nice when you are a passenger who receives no food for 13 hours. Also, it was also my first time seeing the cabin luggage space  being occupied by the luggage of  other cabin crew (I thought they should have their own?). It was  also my first time waiting at the toilet for at least 10 minutes, and out it came a cabin crew. Very interesting experience.

The business class I flew, you are facing a stranger for the  entire flight. Also  every time the  staff have to  let a passenger  up to me, i have to stop eating and  he has to  be in front of my face. Dreadful food, a  very dated 777 plane and   horrible staff. The  staff on board  are supposed to  be full range  of mid flight snack and sandwiches , apparently they  were out and  the reason from  airline crew said  you are taking  to much food. They also ran  all of the  snacks I was  really sorry, we  are out of satay, and other  airlines have already  replaced them. Therefore,  i select another option.

Beijing to London. Service at the British Airways business class counter at Beijing airport was pleasant. The business lounge was quiet when we were there, however, food options were very limited, we were  flying in the morning, the food  options for breakfast were hot meals or some plain toast or a  couple of sandwich options. Onboard, service was really good, quite personal and  friendly which made a difference from the service on the way out  to Beijing. Food  were as good  and you'd expect to get on board, I managed to get a window seat, which  was a difference with regards to being able to  sit on board. Entertainment options were good.

London to Beijing. Left from T5 at Heathrow, service  was very speedy,  you can use the fast track , which is  ok I didn't  think much of the business lounge, food was more like canteen food, we were there  at lunchtime, I ended up just  eating some salad and a packet  or crisps, later around 3pm they  brought out some sandwiches, this was  better than the food that was  in offer at lunchtime. There were  also drinks available, wine was ok. I tried to plug in my  iPad to charge it and none  if the plugs seemed to be , this was  very disappointing. With  regard to the  wifi on board the flight, it  was ok, however,  they collected my  SIM card, but not my husbands, so he nearly  missed out on breakfast, the next morning, they offered  my husband a bread roll, but  to me, it seemed there was  to much structure  in the service, which meant they  missed things. The entertainment that was  on was good.

Paris to London.  The worst long  haul carrier I  ever flown with.  Some very disappointing  journey starting with  the booking &  onboard service department  which failed to  adhere to their  customer promise policy.  All flights served  very worst food. The Boeing 777  i flew on  looked very dated and had power  cords for charging  phones & portable . The seats  are uncomfortable for such a long  haul flight and  thanks to the  size of leg room you could  feel the knees  and the passenger  was pushing into  your back for the duration of  your journey. Meals were very spread out leaving passengers  having no meals  and snacks for  2 hours. When  I mentioned to  the onboard staff  she was hungry  and was informed  that are no  meals available and a meal would  be served shortly  upon landing. Staff  also were uninterested  or unhelpful. The  LCD screens which the in flight  customer was shown  with were very  small and blurry  causing unresponsive touch !
