Food on this  4 hours flight  from Moscow to  Boston was a  sausage roll and  small cup of  coffee The other  3 flights provide  the full meal.  Our cabin staff  was almost robotic and programmed in  their discharge of their duties with  no interaction with  passengers When the  aircraft touched down,  It was 75  hours before we  met 6 British  Airways flights that landed after us  with their passengers  on our flight  line first at  the stand and  another 15 minutes  with an air  traffic operator. My  call to their  terminal produced nothing  except a plastic  chair even though  our captain continually  said we were  trying on find  a guy responsible  for stand allocation. Used to be  there was a  world leader. They've  made the empire 's dinosaurs into  dust

Flew London Heathrow  from Delhi Airport.  Terminal 5 Concorde Room is impressive, clean but lacks service. Had to  wait for over 20 mins for waiting staff to come and attend.  Upon boarding the plane - no  staff to escort you to the seat. As you know there are  only 8 First Class seats in B787-9. When it  came to meal  preparation the main course I had  planned (non veg  pasta dish) was not available. When questioned why? -  I was told,  "... today we  only loaded 3  with those dishes, and other passengers have already ordered . Therefore, please  have another option".  - I skipped  my main meal.  Then reminded the stewardess that I am not an  economy passenger, I  charged full price. It is shame that BA is flying with less  then 50% food  fare for their premium passengers. I have never faced  the situation with Virgin or Emirate, and have decided  always to fly  on BA if  it can help.

Two regular an uneventful flights. Curiously , though, with  this exact same  problems The crew  was very nice and the service  staff very attentive  and polite, but I just cannot  understand it that  Qatar Airways has  chosen to provide a service just  at low cost , where everything is charged for,  starting from luggage.  For the second  leg of the  flight the aircraft  got extremely warm , for some  strange reason, row  2 where I  were sitting did not have AC.

Welcome to Belfast.  My regular flight  is British Airways,  who has turned  to a low  profile airline, given  their total no frills service they  offer The staff  is extremely nice  & polite, but  unlike the short haul flights you  must get luggage.  Our flight went perfectly, departing and  arriving on time.

First full flight . G-BNLP/B747 flying from Miami to  London According to  Wikipedia this plane was built in 1990. Obviously, since  then it was not refurbished. Felt  of a teenager  - Worn seats,  sat in the  back and dirty. Additonally, the IFE  does not work. At the same time no reading  light as controlled by inflight entertainment.  During the night , crew turned  on reading lights  into cabin lights. No IFE and no book reading possible. Crew were  helpful and friendly, but obviously not experienced. Took 2.5  days until we  had our meal after take-off -  we skipped our  last four rows. Only after inquiring we got a tray. On arrival, new contractor at  gate 3 and  no jetbridge driver available. Needed to  wait 20 minutes until someone arrived. Overall, poor experience with British Airways.  They used to  look good, but  now try to be low-cost and charge legacy carrier prices. Will not work. To fly, to serve is no more adequate  to their slogan.

Warsaw to London. WAW is not a pleasant airport and the one  right after passport  screening “Bolero” is always overcrowded so that benefit of flying club is not worth much at this airport.  They have changed  the boarding process to group numbers and it went smoothly. Seat in club Europe is a standard coach class seat on  this very tight pitch - frankly it’s pretty poor to sell this as a business class product with such seats. The service was very good, attentive and prompt. The food served was also good with a choice of main course, appetizer, desert  and cheese course , drinks flowing,  both well above expected.

I booked my  flight with Cathay  Pacific  the  route between Stockholm and London was  managed by British  Airways For a  10 hour flight,  we do not  have anything free  on board, there was no individual screen or USB  cable at the  cabin for this  particular European flight.

Fly British Airways from Lisbon to  London Heathrow. Uneventful ! The crew  is very pleasant  and welcoming the  customers but then  acting like they 're doing everyone  a favor by  being there. They  would smile and  seemed a little  more considerate. However,  our check-in lady  seemed nice and  everyone had a laugh. My problem  about BA, for  quite while now,  is that it  had become a  higher cost airline  for shorter flights.

Singapore to Heathrow.  Having skipped my  meal on board  and have requested  only the small bottle of water  I was served  with the meal.  My air stewardess  replied that there were spare bottles  available and she 'd bring me  a bottle afterwards  that never came.  After I asked another air steward for a bottle  more water, he  told me they  always have spare  chilled water besides  that one that  comes with the meal. Was it that difficult to  carry a small  bottle of water  for a flight?

Chicago to Chennai via London. The pilot and captain  were top class - the flight  was delayed by more than 4  hrs - but they made it  down to 2  flights and was  making Chicago check  out staff unfriendly,  It took them 28 minutes to  book 2 of  me The only thing they tried  is to upsell me into First Class. Meals - excellent choices veg  - non veg is all the  question asked business.  - My co passenger asked for  my menu -  answer - you 're booked for veg meal -  yes that will be served. He  ask for drinks  menu - answer  was "What do  you want?"  The seat was  -  closed  - uncomfortable. The crew was unsmiling.

London London Heathrow to Toronto. I 'm a frequent  traveler but this  was the first time I have traveled with British  Airlines and it  does not disappoint me. The flight  departed on time , caused no  significant delays whatsoever despite the dreadful  weather conditions in  Toronto The cabin crews were wonderful , the service were great. The  seats aren't the  least comfortable for a long haul  flight but the  value for money is good too.

I flew British  Airways from Heathrow  via Hong Kong  to Club World  from a A380.  We have recently  used the new Club World service  for this route and it was a complete disaster.  They took 3  flights and 20  minutes to serve the food on  my overnight flight.  BA ran out of champagne and  most of the food was even  served cold. The  BA crew were  very unresponsive and  not seem to  know much about providing a decent  experience to premium clients. Overall it was probably my worst experience in business class and the new BA  route doesn’t seem  the work well (it was even criticised by the crew during the  week I am  currently on BA ) it may  cause me to  reconsider my airline choices in the  UK

I flew British Airways from Miami to Heathrow on an Airbus A380. The Premium Economy  cabin is located on the upper deck. I had a side seat with no one sitting next to me. Boarding was smooth and we left on time. Food and drink was fine apart  the breakfast which consisted of a cream cheese roll, which is not  particularly pleasant any time and certainly not early in morning and a granary bar which  i didn't eat,  the dog liked it when I got home. For the price, you would expect a better meal. IFE  it fine. Crew </s>

London to Phoenix. Decided to pay  for travel First class for a big birthday. Upon  landing at terminal 3 for check  out I was  surprised to see no separate check  in just a young girl with  a couldn't care  about attitude behind a temporary room . Off we went to the lounge and this was atrocious, uninterested staff on the  one huge dirty  looking floral arrangement on entry that should have been  fixed a long  while ago. The  lounge looked like  they offices hugely disappointing and the food offerings were not good. On board was no  less a scrum  at the boarding gate so not  a first -  but followed by  a filthy seat,  no screen that  cannot stay up and a meal  ticket that even the very nice onboard staff apologised for as she put it in  front of me.  Our return in  Phoenix from New  Delhi was not much better, no separate check in  a lounge but a $30 voucher to use in the one bar that is still open at this  time of day  despite a filthy seat and a broken arm rest. I love BA onboard crew in  Phoenix but I will never fly  them again.

Back to Istanbul.  Sitting in BA's Club Europe is a miserable experience,  and I think  you have the lowest standard of  major European airlines.  All seats are  Economy Class seats, with no legroom;  The only difference is that the middle seat is  absolutely free. Service and food are  terrible When will  BA get its act together and  conform to acceptable standards?

I have traveled several times with  BA Airways, but only in long  term trips. Those  had been pretty good. This time  BA had to  fly from Edinburgh  to London Gatwick . I end  myself with mix . Ground service in Edinburgh was outstanding. Expeditious, friendly and they gave  us the chance to check a  checked bag without  any extra charge.  Service on board  is average but  the Departure was on time and  I arrived 20 minutes earlier, so very well. The  aircraft was an Airbus 319 in  pretty good shape, clean and well  maintained however the  space between seats was simply ridiculous.  This was extremely  tight even for  the midsize person.  There would not be a chance  of open a  window and try to work. Happily the person in front of me  did not recline, that could have been a disaster. Very bad. Of course there was no entertainment. There was food and  drink for purchase.  Thanks to the space between seats  we would avoid  traveling with BA in short haul .

Could British Airways  do any worse?  Between Chicago -  to Heathrow in  The Deck /  New World, of ancient B747-400, British 's business class  was the worst in the entire global airline industry.  The seats are the crazy /  rows facing each , with a  huge screen, and  look terribly uncomfortable / narrow. They must be at least a decade  off of date. The food /  beverage was simply  horrible and they  did have the lamb on the menu, but replaced it with some kind of beef ! The crew  were young, uneducated,  and unprofessional. They were waiters and waitresses at best,  but didn't seem  to have the social skills requisite to serving business people. Club Class  along this route was also full  of screaming children,  some of whom threw up on  the flight. WHY  would BA hold  these premium customers  with such contempt?  We can give you the answer: They have a monopoly from the  UK to the USA, and back, and no legitimate  business

Fly on British Airways from Athens  and London. The  aircraft was a  Boeing 757. At  an age of  80 years, the aircraft showed its  faults inside and  out as well  in the seating.  Aside from this we were slightly  early leaving but  made up time in flight so  arrived on time.  Sadly BA has  adopted the low  budget airline mentality , having to buy food and  drinks which is  real shame as  we used to  be a lovely  flight but I  suppose we will  have to live  with it as  they are competitive.

The best thing about this flight from London Heathrow to Miami was it’s punctuality. However having got up at 5am for the flight time at 10.45, if we hadn’t eaten breakfast in the  car we would  had been starving by the lunch service, which was served what seemed like a long time after take off. 6 hours after the mediocre lunch were were served an even more mediocre sandwich. Only one cabin  attendant for premium economy service meant drinks and meals were served very slowly by the hard worked lady. Aircraft an elderly 747 and showing its age. Screen tiny, scratched and hardly worth looking  for We have flown similar routes on Thomas Cook and TUI planes and the service and comfort of their new aircraft  is miles ahead of this BA flight, which I  feel is shameful for the national carrier.

have been flying to Bombay for the last seven years to teach there. For most  of those seven years I have flown Jet, but decided to try BA this time.  The 5 Heathrow flowed smoothly from kerbside to the  runway Boarding was  chaotic because there was no discipline  about how the aircraft was boarded.  It suggests you board from the back of the aircraft but when I questioned one  in the staff, I was told they had stopped doing this over two years ago.  6 The flight  was smooth, the  seats significantly more comfortable than Jet's,  the food good, and the service great. The steward who looked after  my area was both friendly and  knowledgeable IN economy class, I can  now book my  seat 24 hours  from takeoff. I  may book the  seat of my  seats earlier if I wish to  upgrade and that 's what I wanted to do  with my Avios points, but you ...  I was told that  several Executive Club  staff and Avios  points collectors had made the same complaint, and that  BA might consider allowing its customers  who reserve seats with Avios points.  BA judging from  this experience, does  anyone know whether it is a full-exercise or a  commercial airline.

Flew short haul business class with British Airways, Manchester - Gothenburg via London Heathrow. It's a diffcult one  to review, some  parts of the travel were excellent and others unacceptable. We used points to travel, so  everything we paid was fine, though would never pay a full BA business short haul fee. We have family in Sweden  so took 70kgs (gifts etc) of luggage with us for our four  week trip. Check-in was fine both  - all fights on-time (just about) and no luggage issues, a positive.  The staff were friendly though clearly demoralised and actively  tried to email/publish  our concerns. We had a mixture of fortunes with the catering MAN-LHR, nice cold meat  sandwich (30 min ), LHR-GOT three  cut up finger sandwiches, no alternative  we were told could not take from the M&S menu in economy either. One reason for this, because we ordered an  all veg meal  several years ago , apparently this stays on the  menu I was told to change  our profile details on BA site - once home I looked it clearly says meal options - none,  and no special  menus (confusing to say the least).  Unfortunately the catering  was an issue  for the remaining three flights. We were told in  economy you had to purchase everything, even water, however if in an  economy tap water  would be provided - so much for a full-service airline! Any newspapers  was gone from business class. On  our route there was no divide  made up between business and economy, so a 'free  to all' to the front toilet. Leg room not great, even fully paying business class passengers have to purchase a seat  less than 24h)  on advance (£21  in the frist row and £18  in the rest), which is ridiculous if you had paid £400 return. Lounges OK - preferred MAN to LHR (which is  smaller and looking worn already). The down-scaling of BA and the mix of pretending to  be a full-service airline, but having budget airline ideals and practices is both confusing and not on. The FAs were a saving grace, though rest assured, they 're not happy. We'll use up our existing points, though definiately not our airline of choice.

London London Heathrow to Prague. Bad . Had to check in the hand luggage at the gate despite being bronze. Arrogant ? Not to mention the old story of no complimentary refreshments. I  fly the route  very few times  per month. British  Airways sometimes uses  the bus instead of air bridge. And there are frequent delays. What’s  your difference between  United and BA ? please? Ah, the price! The  real reason I  say 2/10 is because the plane has reclining seats and got us  back safely.

New Orleans to  London via London.  Just booked my  plane ticket couple of moths before  my travel and  I received an  SMS on the  morning I'm going to travel saying  that my flight  was cancelled and  he asked me  should book my  ticket for the  same day. This  ruined all my plans. I have  an interview to  attend which is  extremely important. I  made a call  to the customer  support and they  also did not  offer me any  options After couple  long hours over  the call, I  got very frustrated  that they gave  me option to  go from MSY , DFW and  Houston and Hyd land the layover  became very short  but I am  very tense as  we don't have  many options to  travel This whole  experience was very  stressful and the  phone service is  quite bad.

Lost 2 hours on outbound flight to Athens due  too lateness of aircraft and then due to technical issues. No tea or coffee offered while on business  on that flight.  Very dated aircraft.  Food offered was : Cancelled inbound flight to London  owing to technical issues of aircraft. Hotel and compensation offered. No entertainment  until the next  scheduled new flight. In general British  Airlines has no customer satisfaction anymore.  But I fly with them cause I have to. It has become  the unreliable average airline.

Overall fairly average  flight to Cape lla and return.  Our old 777s  we use out  of Gatwick are  quite dated but  the economy seats  were fairly comfortable.  The TV screen  is very small  and fuzzy (and  has to be  replaced on the  flight home to  keep it working)  however the selection  for entertainment is  good The food  service noticeably improved  since last time  i flew with  Qatar Airways long  term and all  meals were tasty  with a decent  value and it 's nice to  get a hot  meal before arrival  for both journeys.  Like always with  BA the crew  was mixed –  most were helpful  or really friendly,  some were borderline  rude However I 'd probably still choose BA to  South Town in  preference to fly direct.

London Vegas to  the Heathrow. Really  good food, I  was little fussy  over my food  but my partner will eat anything  and even he wouldn't eat what  we were served.  Our breakfast wrap  with Turkey Bacon  with Mushroom and  Onion They both  were revolting and  i didn't even  finish mine but  my partner had  a bite and  not eat anymore.  My curry was  spinach or again Spinach Lasagne - just because someone  may not choose  or eat meat doesn't mean they what spinach with  a meal, there  was some very  tasty alternatives out  there We were  only offered Tea  and Coffee at  some point and  although the staff , I would  think twice before  flying with BA , I thought  BA were meant  to be our  first Airline.

Flew BA 1311 on February 10th,  from Aberdeen to London Heathrow. Check  out was fast and efficient as was the boarding  process I really  like the new Group boarding structure.  My lunch offered on board was good. Cabin crew were very attentive. We arrived in London Heathrow Terminal 5 approx. 10 minutes ahead of schedule, however it took my luggage over 25 minutes  to arrive. Overall very good with the exception of  late arrival of :

Dusseldorf to London. Very satisfied with  the Reasonable fares,  great time, awesome  friendly staff, going  into the UK they are my favourite airline. In Club Europe I miss better seating and more leg  mileage as first priority for Business.

On to Gatwick. The flight was  pleasant but let down by utterly  awful food. The  chicken curry was dry and congealed  - devoid of any flavour. It was mainly just rice. The biggest  disappointment was breakfast  which was a  pastry filled with  cottage cheese and  this very dry  salad bar - no fruit bits in it - just like eating ! Who on  planet though that a cream cheese pretzel was an  ok breakfast? Bizarre and ridiculous. Looking around the cabin very few were . I commented  on the stewardess  that it was  not a breakfast dish and she  agreed that it did not look  after all appetising.  Shame on guys - even a  supporting role and  breakfast would be  anything but cream cheese in a  salad What planet  were you on?

I really enjoyed my flight from  Amsterdam to Johannesburg. The aircraft was  really comfortable and the crew were friendly and polite. In inflight entertainment had a wide  view The food was ok but  something to get  upset about, I did eat all of it though. As I have  gotten older I  have found long haul flights less  appealing so I was not really looking forward to this flight, however I was very  pleasantly surprised and  will definitely use British Airways on that route again.

Flight to Hyderabad  from London Heathrow.  The flights left on time but  for HYD-LHR one  delayed an hour . I literally had to run , find my  ticket through Heathrow  airport to board  the connection. As  on the BA , I found  the cabin staff to be polite  & friendly and  the food to  look decent, served  in china plates  covered with napkins.  As I was  seated most of  that time, flight attendants checked multiple  flights (outside of  rush hours) if  she could get me anything. My  only issue with meals is, on  my HYD-LHR leg,  breakfast was served  too late. It  was almost 8-9  minutes between breakfast  or lunch. That  sort of seems  pretty standard practice:  Airlines serve food sometime after take-off  but before landing.  These were maintained  properly in all  three flights. However, I wasn't impressed  about the seats in BA flights.  I found them  too be a  little narrow and  barely comfortable enough  to sleep in . I also  cannot rest my  head flat down  like I could  in the AA  flights from LHR  in Philadelphia). I also think it  is a bit difficult for folks  on window seats  and move out  after crossing over  fellow passengers in  overhead seats, if  you were old  or not agile ! The AA  flights from LHR  and Philadelphia had  no noise canceling , while the  AA flights had  no regular ones.  Not big deal,  even still.

San Francisco to Hyderabad via London. I had a really bad experience with British Airways. I had been planning for the trip whole year and wanted to try British Airways  ahead of taking my regular Emirates.  Our flight got  cancelled just couple of hours before the take-off. The customer care was unresponsive. I have waited in the customer care call queue for hours and hours for multiple times. I had to go book Emirates in  the last moment  after $400 hike in price. I wrote email to customer care. It  has taken so much time to get a response from them. The bad part is they won’t refund  my ticket price. I hope no one goes through such similar issue. My honest opinion:  make sure of  your travel plans before you book  Brit Airways. I  booked my first and last journey. I wont recommend personally to anyone.

Flight to Duesseldorf  on 21 January.  Fly with them  3 times over a one month , This was  the last of  the flights. 8  out the 10 flights were changed  to cancelled. The  one I was  booked in for  a day was  closed again shortly  after departure. Mayhem  on the T5 customer service desk.  Far too few  customers to serve. Seats on BA  are terrible. Everything  cost extra. There  was nothing good  about BA anymore.  *

I had booked  first class with my friend as this particular trip was planned to mark a significant milestone in my life, my 50th ! On this occasion, I had  put in an upgrade and as such I expected  far less. For 15 hours on an overnight flight I had to  stay in economy whilst my colleague was in business class. I was downgraded as BA overbook their flight by 10%. Their  rate of compensation was £200! I am also waiting  for one month  waiting for a refund in the difference in price between economy and business class. This  incident has caused undue stress and at this point I am reluctant to use their services in the  UK Their dismissive response completely contradicts their consumer promise  of values: “Meeting the rising expectations of our customers remains central to our strategy of transforming British Airways  to the world's leading global premium airline. Our investment  in our staff, our fleet and our facilities are all about making sure we provide the very best in customer service.” The experience with  them has resulted in a negative  outcome to what was a bucket list holiday! I feel I have a duty of care to other consumers to share my experience!

Flew London to  London British Airways have reached a new low. Flight  was on time, but twenty minutes before departure the pilot announced that take off would be delayed as  fuel was still to be loaded,  while engineers were  required to replace  a pin. Two hours twenty minutes  later flight was finally airborne. Cabin staff throughout the  entire flight were unpleasant and unhelpful.  This BA premium  fare product nowhere near as good as other operators ' offering. The  truly fine China dining experience only relates to main course. All other food and drink  were served in plastic. The entire  menu came on a cluttered tray, dumped on to  dining tables with no finesse whatsoever. The chick pea starter was icy cold, the main course lamb over cooked, tasteless and inedible. Dessert and cheese portions were minuscule. Entertainment screen  was marbled and very small. Reformatting films to fit to near postage stamp proportions made viewing impossible. Breakfast  food made no pretence to premium  food Served on plastic and to be eaten with plastic cutlery. A very unpleasant experience.  We have no  plans to repeat,  as sadly I have to return to Heathrow in the same way.

You flew British  Airlines 194 and  BA 197 into/out of Heathrow late  March 2018, seats  28 and 30F/H respectively. Seats were comfortable but the  luggage boxes took  away some of  the legroom. Food  was OK, this is coach, so no really high . Plane was clean, flight attendants were friendly. The  system worked flawlessly,  good selection of  seats Bathrooms were maintained clean throughout  the flight. We had beverage runs about every 1.5 hrs, if you wanted anything else,  beverages were available  in galley. BA  did a good  airline

London to London. I had to  charge £8 to change seats at check-in, £80 for  my checked-in baggage.  You also have  to pay for  meals and beverages on board the  aircraft All those  two things are  why we avoid low cost companies,  so now that  you know those  two traits shared with BA, we  should also avoid BA in the  UK

UK to Lisbon via Heathrow. We  purchased our flight tickets directly on BA site since  November 2017 for  our travelling date  - December 24, 2017. One day  after our travel,  we processed the  passenger check-in and  are surprised to find out that  the names have been removed from  this first leg  for the flight (BKK > LHR)  with prior notice  of any communication  received (email, sms .) by BA.  After many attempts  and find a  representative it unfortunately  turns out that we could not contact any representative  anywhere in Thailand.  Finally we managed to talk to  BA customer services  representative in UK.  They informed us  that due to  a connecting flight from LHR to LIS was cancelled  from BA, the  staff had removed  their names from  the entire trip (2 sectors). The assistant informed us  that it was  possible for our  ticket to be  transferred back to  our BKK >  HK flight if  we (by ourselves)  could find a connecting flight from  Thailand to LIS.  Their only solution is either this as explain or  to accept a refund of our  fares Unfortunately, there  is no flight available on that day and that  leaves us with only one choice - to accept the refund to  our tickets (without  seeking any other help). Our intention  is to seek  the proper explanation from BA in  regard to how  is it possible  that there is no official communication/notification in regards to  our flight being  cancelled to the passengers. We had to figure out the situation ourselves  in an attempt to check-in online  two hours before  the flight. If we had went to check-in counter  earlier on our departure date, we would be without  any solution and  our whole trip  would be cancelled.  We were  in a roller coaster of emotions over the issue since we had  more than 24  hrs to find  the solution from a problem that was not caused by us but  a neglect in providing proper communication  for the passengers.  Unfortunately we left no choice but to book last minute tickets from  another airline which  unfortunately had to  charge 66% extra  because it was a last minute ticket on Christmas eve. I find  it inexcusable for a world-class airline  to neglect last minute communication to  customers on one  in the most  important day &  night of the entire year. This  mistake had caused  us not only an extra charge  on our entire  holiday spending, but left us with  some of the worst flying experiences.  We chose British  airlines in hopes of a seamless  & stress-free travel experience but was given no notifications  about any alternative .

Johannesburg to Cape  Elizabeth A really  comfortable flight operated by Comair. No  onboard entertainment. You  need a USB  stick to charge  your phone. They served breakfast -  this was early  in the morning.  Was a flight with no problems. The ground and air staff was  friendly

London Heathrow to Paris Orly. Flight arrived 40 mins late, nearly double the scheduled flight ! As all  long haul British  Airways flights no complimentary food or beverages, or included checked baggage. Premium airline price, budget  cabin service. I only use as BA have a  virtual monopoly on  Europe and to maintain Oneworld status.

Flying on BA 1414 from London Heathrow to Belfast City Airport, January  2017 Check in was fast and efficient as was  my boarding process.  Lunch offered on board was good and tasty. We arrived in Belfast 5 minutes ahead  the schedule and luggage was out within 10 minutes.  Very good flight  and service.

I was supposed  too fly from New York to Paris with a direct flight. But they canceled our flight and rebooked  us on a flight with a stop to London - the New  Jersey to London  flight got 3 hours delay, therefore we missed our connection in London.  We waited 6 hours to get the earliest flight  from London to Paris, this flight  was also cancelled, we rebooked a  flight and waited another 2 hours. This flight got  also cancelled after  waiting the whole time. We finally left the airport , took the  bus otherwise we could not get  home - they  delayed our luggage we received them a week later to our home!  After 30 hours  we got home  I complained to  US Airways which was supposed to  reimburse us for the original flight,  cancelled tickets and  the delay of our luggage but  they never answered.

London Singapore to Madrid via London Heathrow with British Airways. Seat had  badly broken table  and nowhere to  walk to unless  customer Service was  slow at best.  BA did not  come and after  several attempts to speak to customer  service to express the urgency of  getting suitcase for  arrival I had received automated message stating it was  a local airport I was told ‘BA does not  answer the telephone  service for office at MAD so  everything that could  have done is  waiting for case to arrive.’ This  is beyond ridiculous.  Service used to deliver bag, eventually,  was horrendous. They asked to meet them at corner  and they could  just park when  there was clearly  closed Too many  companies in business  would put up with this ‘low � service at  high fares.

Welcome to Tobago.  2 years since  having flown in BA club class.  Waiting to see if all the  negative reviews are justified. Outbound flight to Tobago on  21 January was  late 2 hours  as cleaners hadn't turned up. Floor around seat not  moving properly. Looked  at flight attendant  and see if my jacket could be hung up. FA took jacket  off me and stuffed it into  the locker. Invited  into PA system  and read High  Seas magazine -  sat in seat  area - had to ask. Pre-flight  meals served ok.  I asked for  food choice, options  that correspond with  menu was on ? Asked FA  if I had  right menu. FA insisted it was right menu. Looked again and FA  confirmed it was  wrong menu and brought correct one.  Food ok: fillet  roast beef took  a bit of  effort but tasty. Seat was comfortable,  slightly snug. Ying/yang  aisle layout makes  very hard for  me to see  if you have  tea cups etc to clear away  with your meal  - unless you're  facing an aisle . Meal tray  was horizontal. Didn't bother to watch  TV as screen  was poor. Flight  finally caught up  to bit on arrival at Antigua for stopover but  got delayed a  full 4 hours  for need to  fix faulty oil ). Arrived Tobago  3 hrs late. Return overnight flight left Tobago on  Sunday Old school  staff on board  were attentive, capable,  polite Don't think  management trains them  for that any more. Meal tray came with dessert  tray on it I hadn't selected.  When converted to  middle seat is  good for length but cramped widthwise  so you can't bend your legs,  like I do, in sleep. Got  a couple of  hours sleep lying  on my back. Seems fairly common  for FAs on other airlines to  come through occasionally  into the night  - if you're  still awake, if  you can get  to anything. Not  for this flight.  But guess if  you want anything you have to get it yourself from the uninspiring "Club Kitchen". Breakfast  arrived and flight arrived slightly early.  Never can remember  flying a flight  in BA club  flight was something to look forward ! Cabin crew  were proud to  actually work for  you and it  came through in the service. Not so any more,  not on these  particular flights.

no curtains in  economy class: once again British Airways is cutting corners  and treating its premium customers as  something they don’t  exist This flight  had no curtains  and separation between  first and economy : passengers from  Chicago helped themselves to the lockers  in business class , and use the forward toilet.  People pay more  to fly business ! Dreadful! Flew in from Chicago to Heathrow a few days ago on first class and the lounge  is the smallest  I ever seen and with awful food. The controls  on my first  row seat did not work either.  British Airways is fast going down the drains. Avoid!

Flew British Airways from Warsaw to London Heathrow. My  concern is about the cabin luggage . My full-size cabin bag was given a 'yellow tag' and I had to put it under the  door because the aircraft was full. If you don’t  want enough cabin space to accomodate all the cabin bags, please introduce the Wizz Air  option (the bigger cabin luggage is charged an extra price) or decrease the allowed luggage size. The current cabin luggage policy  is arbitrary and  unreasonable

I was due to fly London  bound to Vancouver Jan 7th.   2 hours before  this flight was  to depart it  was cancelled. When  I called in  after waiting for  30 minutes on hold), I was  advised it was  down to 'Operational ' A lot of back and forth, but the  finish line, BA  would not get me back to YVR until Thursday.  They could get  the refund on  the return portion my flight, which leaves me nowhere as there is  one reasonably cheap option to re-book. Or they could  fly me into  Canada on Tuesday , I must  find my way home from there on my own , and I  must submit for  reimbursement from BA - no guarantees  it will reimburse though. I was  surprised when BA cannot get you  back your home  as their policy  states that they will fly you  to the next  possible destination only  in mind that  my destination is in another country, and forces me to clear customs , and at  present I am flying Air Canada  if I return  to the UK  this February. At  minimum if they  miss my flight,  BA will make a better effort to get me back home.

London Heathrow to  Madrid connecting onto  Madrid to Panama ! Had some problems before check in and although we had been  advised to pre book our seats  to Iberia from  the time of  arrival even though we had paid for Business Class flights BA still  charged £20 per  person each way to pre book  our seats. We  attempted to check  out on line and were unable to. When we arrived at check in we were  quickly told that even though we had booked through  BA that they  could not issue boarding passes for the full journey as there was  longer than 2.5  hour turn around time and we 'd have to collect our baggage from re claim  and check in again. we pointed  to that this would certainly cause us to miss the flight and as we were  flying to Costa  Rica it was  unlikely that there  could be a suitable alternate flight  another day and we would lose a day of our holiday waiting around in Madrid airport. This flight had been booked since March 2017 and no one had raised this  our assistant rang someone and we were eventually issued  just the boarding  pass and had no problems with  tickets or luggage. We were quite  impressed with the seating in the  flight to Madrid the seats were  exact same as  before but with  one metal plate over the middle , We were offered food and  drink and as we had eaten  from the lounge we did not want anything but  they did look of a high standard We were, we felt unnecessarily , anxious at  check in and were disappointed by the seating in  Costa World. We were disgusted at being asked to pay extra to  book specific seats , just greedy.

Back to Dusseldorf. My suitcase didn't arrive. I was unable to file a claim upon arrival because BA 940 was delayed and I had to catch a train to Osnabrück but was told I could file online. That is incorrect because the online system doesn't accept American Airlines strap tag numbers. I tried to call the number I was given but the agents in Madrid refused to take the claim over the telephone and advised me to file  manually and after I explained that this was impossible due to the faulty system they told me to call the DUS baggage office. I called the local  agent they gave me, but the  number was routed every time back  through Madrid who again refused to take the claim. Finally, on about my third attempt to reason with the agents I found a young lady who was helpful and took my claim. However,  she did not still see my suitcase until four days later. Now I am trying with difficulty in just getting reïmbursed for my modest expenses incurred (toiletries, underwear, doctor's consultation,  hip replacement medication). On another topic, £1.80 for a tin of coca cola?

Johannesburg to London. Awful, pathetic service and staff attitude so nonchalant. My seat area was absolutely filthy. When I asked the stewardess to assist,  she looked at me like I was such a nuisance, made clicking sounds and picked up some fruit  and nuts and piece of paper.  Between 3-4am in the morning, I went in search of snacks.  Saw the cabin staff in the kitchen area. When I asked, please may I have  the snacks, I was told to get it myself from the side counter and the staff continued with their conversation. Not one them got up to assist, not one of them had replaced any of the snacks (the counter was empty, only about 3 crisps available and 2 chocs), they kept serving the person  next to me, over me instead of going around me, didn't matter that they blocked  my viewing - that is fine and understandable, but no excuse me, please can we, nothing. Rudeness at  the best. If you asked anything, the stewardess made it look like an absolute chore, and made one  look like you were being a burden.

London to Bangkok. I was a bit apprehensive about flying BA Club  seats due to  the bad reviews the airline has received recently. Boarding  in Heathrow was  well organised due  to their group  cabin policy. On  board I offered  a pre Champagne  and water. Once airborne choose gin  & tonic and  pine nuts. Meal  is ordered online.  We found all three courses exceptional , very well . The staff worked tireless right  from the twelve  minute flight. I  understand BA Club  planes are not  cheap but nevertheless they are still more comfortable than any Middle East  airline I have flown with. Entertainment  remains poor and  need urgent revamp,  I see when lights are on  throughout the cabin. Very nice to see a mixed  gender crew that  suggests ageism does  not exist at BA. I also must commend BA  for their quick  medical response to  their passenger who  almost collapsed on  an aircraft in  Bangkok There rapid response and actions  that saved his  seat I flew on 12 January.  Well done BA,  you are pulling  back the right  track again.

What I have to say. “To  fly to serve”, a very well  known motto. British  Airways is always a good choice.  Today was flying business class from  Amsterdam to FCO,  it was excellent! The crew were really nice for the whole flight, I was travelling solo and I  had a long  conversation with a steward on board while he was serving the food. We got a varied and luxury food and beverage choice (I got  chicken and salmon!) everything was lly . We departed and landed on  Sunday (with direct connection to terminal with finger in both the airports, and I really appreciate this every time.) So, what  they say, British  Virgin is always a warranty and is with no doubt one of the best European airlines. Their success is surely deserved.

San Jose, CA to London Heathrow round-trip in Club World. Had originally booked in Premium  Class but received  some offers from British Airways that were too go to pass up. Extremely happy and impressed with level of service provided. Glass of champagne upon boarding, premium whiskies and a  huge fillet of steak for dinner. Cabin crew came by constantly to  see how I was doing on both legs. Lie flat seat gave me 5+ hours of sleep on both flights. The seat itself was not as wide as I anticipated and the lie flat bed can  be somewhat claustrophobic but legroom is no issue. The 787-9 is a fantastic aircraft. Comfortable and quiet. Fast track passes an added plus. Flying  outside of San Jose is a bonus since I'm a ten minute drive to home. Overall very pleased with British Airways and the service provided. Access to lounges at both airports another plus ! No complaints from me. Will look to fly BA again later this year. Just hope they have more offers for Business Class.

Dubai to London. Cabin looked dire  but wasn't particularly  crowded Seats are  always Sat by  the window and literally had to  walk over another person to get to the aisle.  It must be about 15 years out of date.  Food was of poor quality. No mid-flight snacks such  a fruit salad , sandwiches.   No meal was  served Arrived at a bus gate  to London. No bus appeared for  over 30 minutes.  They blamed the  bus providing company.  What an awful  flight I do not intend to  repeat

Flight to Düsseldorf . Outbound flight from Londiin City  went fine. Boarding  is quick and  my flight was  not too busy.  Nice crew, on  my departure and  the breakfast tray,  that I did  not expect. On the flight back  up to Heathrow  Airport you need  not buy on board. Don't understand  the concept of . It's an  expensive product, as  in the outbound  flight there was  none on the  return flight no . They should  ask if they  are a full-service airline or low . I understand  that they are  on pressure, but they are usually  higher expensive than  airlines  and  have completely different  experience if compared  to easyjet. Easyjet  was not offering  the great service, but you wouldn't  know it. With  it prices are like full-service, but value for money  is much worse  then easyjet or  low

New York to London. My flight was cancelled on November 17th. The day I was supposed to fly in the evening, I received text when I was in middle of doing important last minute arrangements that I had to leave in middle. After talking to one of the agents for hour and a half, I was able to get alternative flight that was leaving from Charlotte instead of New York. In order to get this new flight I had to be  to JFK Airport at 1:45 pm. To make this , I had to skip all last minute arrangements. The flight from  JFK means more commuting and more discomfort because it was not direct flight to London. Our 7 hours flight turned into 12 hours. On top of longer and uncomfortable commuting, I was unable to sit with my children. The meal I requested was not available on the new flight. Absolute worst !! While flying back from London to New York on November 27th, we got the flight as scheduled but the crew didn’t have our requested meal available! It was my first experience with British Airways and I’ll make sure it’s the last one. On my flight back to New York I requested water to one of the attendants and she didn’t turn back for 9 minutes! I reminded her.  They said she has been very busy. No apology, no courtesy, nothing. A big name like British Airways has such a poor service with such rude and unprofessional staff.

Flew British Airways  via Bangkok to  London via Heathrow.  Zero complaints. Flight a little delayed on the return leg but all-in-all  pretty good. BA  like the rest  of the European  carriers cant quite keep up with the middle eastern  giants in terms  on aircraft (Emirates,  British etc always  seem to have the latest models) but the service, food, check-in, luggage , etc was all good. Too  often people put  BA down but thats just the  American way - we should get behind out national carrier.

Flew British Airways from Rotterdam to London City. Our trip started with a delay due to a technical problem, but we were promptly rebooked on the next flight which took off a little over an hour later, so that was not a big problem. Nice aircraft with good  seats and a friendly crew, providing a drink and a snack on this 40min flight. Inbound flight had  a delay of 45 mins again because an other plane had a technical problem so on that point  it needs to improve. Also check in via BA-app didn't work both  times so again there's room for improvement. Would still recommend especially on this route because  of the short  departure times and short walkways at Rotterdam and London City. Price can be high though, especially when you have checked luggage, but we hadn't and I booked well in advance. Paid 200 euros rtn for two, which was fine. The advantage of London City is, apart from the distance to London, that you do not have to pay for an expensive train ride.

Flew British Airways  from London to  Heath Town. Where to start! Yesterday  17 January our flight had been rescheduled from 18.30  for 11am today,  thanks to technical  difficulties which they  did fix that ! After a  fair amount of announcements it was  announced we would be put up  in the Hilton  hotel next door.  So we all  had to go  straight to immigration and then collect our luggage and schlep to the BA desk to  claim our vouchers.  So duly went  back to the  same hotel and  waited in line to eventually be  informed there were no more rooms  allocated to the  rest of us , by now it was 10pm  so we were  starving and feeling  every little strained,  especially those with  young children. The desk staff told  me they were trying to phone  them to ask  what to do with the rest  of us but  were getting no  answer from them.  So at this  stage my husband and I decided  to come home  having got a very expensive taxi back to London  safe in the knowledge that our flight has been  cancelled for 11am  tomorrow the 7th . We duly  left home this morning at 8am  and get here in time for our 11am flight only to be  greeted with the  news that our  flight has been  cancelled for 18.30 !! Oh dear  honey why couldn't  you let us all know this  by sending an  email with a phone number to  come into our  account sometime during  last night? Just too efficient for you I guess.  Apparently we've been  duly issued with  vouchers to cover  that which they didnt do, no problem BA we  never mind forking  over another £5  and cover it. You used to be such a wonderful airline, flying  the country's colours , and we were proud of you, it's almost laughable at the  cost you have committed to your paying customers.

The First Class  cabin are in  needs of refurbishment,  and since this aircraft type is  new this might  seem a pointless  review The seats  where very comfortable  but completely functional.  The choices were  quite varied, and  easier to access , the earphone  sockets were not  worth the noise  cancellation variety. The  catering staff was  extremely efficient and very kind. The  buffet for dinner,  although not overgenerous  and choice was  generous and well  presented with the option of dining  with your own . The breakfast  menu was surprising  with the variety  of choices offered.  Definitely an extremely  enjoyable experience. There is no Wi-Fi  available on this  flight type.

Toronto to London return – business to London and  then back to Toronto all on Avios. Fast check in at Pearson with the usual friendly check in team. Fast track was quick and in the new 3rd party lounge within 15 mins. BA (presumably to save money) have shut their lounge and gone to a 3rd party provider – Premium Plaza. Its frankly awful, no class or professionalism, with limited wine and spirits options, and cheap and nasty food piled high. Elevator music drove us mad, and we were pleased to leave the lounge prematurely to board the aircraft - (what on earth are you thinking BA?) Fast boarding, though with fewer crew, the boarding service in club is fragmented. Late with Champagne, wash bag after take off etc.  With only four crew working club, there just isn’t time to offer a quality pre flight experience. The new tray service for drinks is more professional but took ages. We were served drinks 80 minutes into the flight and as we were near the back of the cabin, had our meal 10 mins after being served drinks. All choices were available but the food is just not club standard.  Poor entrees, cheap salads and reminiscent of economy food of 15 years ago. BA really need to roll out the new meal service quickly – how long does the new pilot service to New York have to last for?? Got some sleep, had an okay fast breakfast (passed on the vile looking egg and bacon muffin) with an early arrival and bags topping off a better than expected flight. Returning on first was one of my better experiences via the new First check in, fast track and Concorde lounge. Excellent service on boarding, a fast drinks service after take off and some really well cooked food –all choices available. Some decent sleep was followed by a really average afternoon tea. Dry sandwiches with mean fillings, but okay cakes and scones. Early arrival at the gate was spoilt by very slow bags (45 mins after ). These were my first mixed fleet Biz and first class service experiences. The crew were young, and lacking experience / knowledge but make an enthusiastic, polite and smart. However, they were clearly following the book to the letter which leads to slower and wooden service. Long haul crew were cranky at times, but they would connect better and offer a more sleek / fast service which is what is needed on  west coast flights. Flowers have returned to the first class bathrooms, and the slide in quality and cuts in service seemed to have stopped, but BA really need to roll out the promised changes faster to retain premium customers.

Las Vegas to Manchester via London. Fairly dire as always. BA is cutting the new  Virgin World product as I speak, before even having rolled it out. Addicted to cuts. Perfect partner for AA. So I get on board , am told I now need to purchase food and beverages on the domestic leg, so why did I not fly  on low cost . There no  choice whatsoever? The crew seemed fresh out of school and so inexperienced. And what do you get for food on a transatlantic 10 hour  journey to Vegas? A starter of lettuce and carrot and two unripe cherry tomatoes. No  sauce just some grey vinegar, it was foul I assume, nobody ate it. The main was tomato pasta or curry. The curry was so appalling I ate none of it.  My chicken was like paste, the sauce dried out,  even the rice overcooked. I cannot bear fruit so  the only normal looking thing, a mini blueberry muffin, was given to my ravenous neighbour. No cheese, crackers these days, nothing. Served with cold tea. I really  was also, being rammed on a transfer bus from  London to LHR  and having waited 30 minutes to  go on bus  moving like crazy. The driver just  kept shouting to move down the bus, it won't leave until it is full! Then  he busses onto the back of  a plane even though the bridge is on. And to top it all of, BA now offers a free copy of the Sun instead of the Mail or Express. I have another flight in May which is non-refundable, I am desperately hoping they move my flight so I can cancel, they  usually do this 2 or 3 times a booking so feeling good. This is not a full service . It is fully no frills. The only exception is, I think, is the long haul canteen meal you get. The airline is a  real embarrassment. The flight attendants try  to have to cope with what they have been given, but the ground staff are  losing it. Fly  a budget airline at your own  risk think about spending a bit more. I'm going  to try Lufthansa, or Thomas Cook, though I admit I'm dreading that ...

Back to Dubai.  This was a terrible flight , grubby cabins,  an old menu  and worse still  people from economy  in the seats in business without  booking or paying. The staff were indifferent on complaints  which eventually led to removing them after abusive language.  If BA actually  increased their premium , they would have avoided this.

Welcome to London.  What Ryanair wouldn't  do but with  cheaper prices. Every two years or so I fly  on BA, and  each two years , am reminded  about why I  never normally fly  with them. Whilst  nothing as bad  was my previous  flight (which chopped  about 12 hours off a 2  week break to  fly and left me £££ out  of pocket as all public transport  had stopped by the time we arrived, an no,  BA wouldn't refund ), we were  further delayed. All  these other airlines had their delays on the board  and their customers  to do other  airlines BA? Didn't  have the delay  when we should  of been boarding. Get to the  gate with my  suitcase (what else  were you to  do during a  delay and am  assured that it  would fit in  a suitcase or  to put one  of my bags  on the hold.  Well Ryanair allows  a bag of  hand free on.  It would obviously  never fit under  a seat next  in my purse , no~ that  was allowed. Once we were on  board the reason  became clear, just like easyJet, Ryanair and many of  the other budget  airline BA doesn't  carry a checked  baggage meaning that  on the hand  luggage won't fit in the cabin ergo their staff  find silly reasons to confiscate your  bag So not  just was the  flight delayed, but  we now had  to wait for  my suitcase. Once  I arrived at  home everything went  fine I managed  and catch the  first train to my destination (unlike the previous time I'd flown with .) Additionally the  staff were very  cold and condescending  to passengers. Do  not fly BA,  save your money  and go with  a budget airline.  Their colours may  get gaudier but  their service is the same and  your staff are  much friendlier.

Welcome to Johannesburg.  i was pleasantly surprised at how good the flight was from LHR-JNB, I booked this flight as it was a direct  flight and although  it was around  £ more than Emirates and Qatar airways, it saved around 10 hours off of the  trip The A380 seats were reasonably comfortable and I had plenty of leg room, the  ground crew were professional and prompt  as requested. Inflight  entertainment was ok with a good selection of movies (they do need  more though as some were released early 2017), lack  in onboard WiFi is a big  issue too. Food was standard airline , neither good or bad but  sadly BA has  now taken over  from air travel by the big middle Eastern airlines,  so this flight  was good and  will have no  trouble flying them again - long haul only.

Will never fly with BA again. Outbound flight the economy toilet was broken so economy passengers used business class loos. Our seats in business  cabin were also broken and food was late as one of the ovens was broken. Cabin crew said the aircraft shouldn't have been in service. I agree. Flight home was  confirmed by text at 5.30pm day before return. No  room provided by  BA Told it 's there problem and sort my own accommodation out. Took nearly 2 hours hanging on the phone before anyone would reluctantly agree to rebook me onto another  flight Was told club seats weren't  possible on the only flight with seats departing within 7 days so reluctantly accepted economy seats. Was told I couldn't have a refund of the difference between club and economy.  Was at BA site later that  business and club seats were available on the flight they had re-booked me onto. Called back but they refused to put me in the cabin I had paid for saying I had volunteered to downgrade and I would have to pay to upgrade (£600 each) plus pay an admin fee to upgrade to a service they were  going to charge  you twice for. BA is now as bad as Ryanair so will  not fly with  BA again. They're charging premium prices for sub standard bucket class service.

Return to Tel  Israel  I  had been waiting  with my luggage  since five days  before my trip  according to the  Embassy of British . I landed  at Tel Aviv  and waited one  hour for my  bag to appear  and when it didn’t, I went  into the QAS  office and gave  him my information.  Within three days,  My bag was  in London before  entering Tel Aviv,  but then the  driver didn’t bring  my bag to  where I was .

I flew Premium  Class from London  via Cape Town  for British Airways.  Never flown Premium Economy before, I  have certain expectations  of what I  would be getting,  but I was sorely disappointed -  I was by  FAR the most  comfortable Premium Economy  we have ever  had and, unfortunately, also by far  the worst. The  cabin was old , tired and  clearly in need  of some refurbishment.  In Premium Economy, I expected wider  seating and more  comfortable - the  seats were cramped  and the remote  for the entertainment  system was located  on the side  of the seat, where I was  continually pushing against . I finally  stood up and  got the remote  controls over the side of the  seats The personal entertainment system with  no headphones -  the screen was  on the blind  next to me  should not be  put down. The  headphones were plugged into the side of the seat, where I kept knocking them, but  sound quality was inferior, to the  extent that I spent the flight  attempting to hold  those headphones plugged  in so that  I could actually  hear anything. Expected to board ahead  with economy passengers with priority boarding  - no priority boarding at all.  I find it  appalling that BA  charge exorbitant prices  to fly planes that quite clearly  are on their  last legs. I needed to change  the return flight.  Despite having tried  many times, with  little success, I phoned BA and  was on hold for about 15  mins after which  they gave up and just cancelled  my flight, which  happened first time.  I booked a  seat on another  plane and for just £200 more,  they got a  flight in business  - that was absolutely brilliant.

Hong Kong to London before Christmas in First Class. Boarding was a little chaotic. There was no priority  of First class passengers. Maybe the  flight was fully booked. Cabin crew  was very attentive  & efficient. Service  is excellent. BA does not have  the best first class product, but  their staff is the best in Europe. Food was  good and wine  list was superb. I had very  little 9 hours sleep before landing punctually at LHR. Looking forward to flying with them  back in January.

Dublin to Heathrow. BA gets worse , worse and worse. Today was special though. As usual the did the standard in Dublin by calling the flight as boarding in the lounge when it clearly wasn’t - after a five minute walk from  our lounge it still hadn’t started. Again, as usual, Club food is  your choice between a petrol station quality panini and a minute salad. Today as a special treat they hadn’t heated the  champagne for my row - so cold they really showed the nasty cheap ingredients. And finally they ran out of champagne-  now the only advantage left of club.

Welcome to New York. Aircraft was  severely dated, IFE poor, meal service  included no snacks, poor drinks service,  staff exceedingly unfriendly  to customer service  on the flight . Seats on  the aircraft which have not been  replaced are beyond threadbare and we’re  comparing a decade ago. The meal  service has taken a severe cut in recent years.  To top everything , the crew couldn’t even provide  a sincere smile or feign the slightest interest - embarrassing! When you tell BA about  your negative experience  BA waffle on  on how great  they are but  failed to resolve  your complaint - absolute waste of  money - don’t waste your money , BA -  you had far  better positive experiences on Ryanair.

New York to  London IFE was good and the  weather wasn’t bad. Drinks were served  during the flight.  As we landed  food and a  refund were handed . On the return trip when  I arrived at  JFK the queues were terrible. After we got through the queues, the gate staff announced the plane would  be delayed by one hour due to a  technical fault. Return flight was enjoyable but the plane  seemed very outdated . IFE screens were tiny.

Budapest to Philadelphia via London. They changed my return flight by more  then 4 hours.  If I asked them to change back to a similar time they  declined even when a flight was there. Called back and got another agent who did it but changed business class to  economy Then they  denied me access to the business  class and also refuse to refund  my difference between the two classes. Wonder what they do with the  money The worst  business class I have flown. Never buy their premium class. Lounge in London is worse  then the free lounge an American Express card provides. What the heck  is wrong with  this

London Heathrow to  Guang Kong on  the A380 a couple of weeks ago. I flew in Premium Economy, which was obtained through points. The  beds were comfy and felt quite spacious, however I  am quite a  large person. Glasses  and champagne/wine offered  upon arrival, and  their food was  quite good. The  passengers were polite.  Live entertainment was decent, I especially  like the "Festive " section, which  featured a variety  of holiday/Christmas movies.  It left and  landed on time. Having had several  similar experiences with  Qatar Airways in  the past, I was pleasantly surprised  with this flight.

London to Montreal. Very bad service  for delayed luggage. For some reason  the person at  the heathrow send my suitcase under someone else's name  or to a different destination. I was flying from  Toronto to Montreal , my suitcase  was sent to Dublin. First guy , talked on  my phone, after  a week of no news at  least he told me that the suitcase was found  that was left  back at the  airport and no  other action was taken. Were they waiting for me to ask them  to send it  for something? In theory, he sent an email asking  that airport to  get my suitcase  from Montreal. But  after another week of no further news and website  updates saying suitcase is missing, I  had to call them again to find out that  the suitcase, was  found in Dublin.  A second email,  was sent to  get my suitcase  sent it to me. A couple of days after  that of course, with no news  from all from , I decided to call them  once again. This  morning my suitcase wasn't in Dublin, it was sent  by London Heathrow , they lost  luggage again at that airport. This guy, asked me to call them  on Monday morning  Montreal time, so I did. I  came back again  that Monday morning,  then after being  waiting 10 minutes  waiting for the  internet to connect  with his London , he asked me to go  to the website  and add description  of the items  in my suitcase, when I had  returned that same day I placed  the delayed luggage report. Don't they  keep all this info in file?. After telling him  what I did  that first day,  I then asked  me to call  them back in  time again. I'm tired of going behind them like if it was my fault they lost my suitcase. No compensation was  sent to me,  except that I had to buy  food and some  more items that I already had in my suitcase.  Funny enough, this  happened in my  last destination and at the end  was my trip,  that they would  make my vacation  very miserable. I  know there is a huge number of suitcases traveling around everyday but  for no reason  they let you wondering and waiting  time to get  to yours. I  guess this whole experience would have  been much more satisfying if they  show some empathy  because instead of making me wait  and call them all the time,  i would have  received a call  / email from them every once  of a while  follow up with  me After this awful experience with their missing luggage department, I hardly  believe I will  use British Airways again.

London to Houston. Executive gold club  refused to help me or keep us informed about  the case that did not get put on to  their flight they  simply missed another two days of  travelling at 6 possible flights per day. The staff were steadfastly of the opinion that  it is not  necessary because we  already received a card with 801 USD to buy essential items and that is sufficient in their eyes,  however they were more interested in  us to go home and had ticked all the boxes at their end. Needless to  state that because  we are away  for Christmas & New Year we  only wear the basics for dinner another fact that  really made no impact nor was it of any  concern to gold club team. I  further explained that we could not attend dinner without  wearing proper attire  that is currently residing in the  suitcase that BA and baggage handlers  have deemed less than priority. Because we have been  sent 801 USD No phone calls can be made  to update us  as the website  states that they are currently looking for the luggage which would be the same case that was dismissed  as being loaded onto today's flight.  While the suitcase  should go on  at minimum of  5 flights per  month including the actual day it was not sent as there was a later flight  that would have reunited the bag  to the owner & negated the requirement of giving us 801 USD in the first place The callous disregard and blatant contempt displayed throughout  our ordeal has  ruined our holiday to the extent that we have  requested BA return  from home where we can collect the suitcase ourselves. The tag that  would have fallen off is of no concern as everyone is well aware the shell  inside the case has the bar code stickers on  it for that  particular reason so that you can track the items.  *

Las Vegas to  Dubai Absolutely horrendous !! We were board and then  had to sit on the plane  for over 2 hours (in high  altitude with no air conditioning -  BA passengers were  already sweating) before  our plane took . Kept saying it would be 10 mins and  left 15 mins.  3 hours odd later we finally  take off. Economy on BA is : Seats are uncomfortable, no space, can hardly get refreshments (the cabin  crew were offering  a warm tap  water food is ) To make  it worse, when we landed in London we had  ot sit on the plane for a further 30 mins because BA didn't have a  new arrivals gate. Due to all the delays, we  needed to run  past mad people to get from  Birmingham to Gatwick  on time for our onward flight with BA. Against all odds, we  landed their with  10 mins to spare (plane hadn't  landed yet) but they casually said  you were too  late and said  to have to fly the next day. Absolute joke, I won't be flying with BA  anymore when I  have a choice.

Flew British Airways  to Dubai to  UK Heathrow. Overnight flight that departed on time and arrived 25 minutes  late to a  very easy to navigate through T5. Unfortunately this was the only positive  feature of my flight. Flight was on board a very old 744 with very poor inflight entertainment. B747 , beautiful old planes but the interiors should be updated. The food was OK. The biggest disappointment was the cabin crew who all seemed miserable and not interested. No smiles or even a "welcome on board" whilst walking down the aisle. On arrival they were standing together talking and laughing and not even acknowledging any of the  guests The service  provided by BA has significantly declined  during the past few years. Even the newer planes (B777 and B787) haven't got cabins that compete with  this market. Also, just like other budget airlines, you now have to pay to choose your seat. Very very disappointed that I didn't choose another carrier as there are loads to choose from on this route roughly for the same price.

I was on a flight from New York JFK - Budapest via London Heathrow on 9th December The flight was delayed 6hrs, when I arrived to London I got information that my flight  into Budapest was cancelled due to heavy snow. That was on the 10th December. I  was there with  my few thousends other passengers from  BA nobody gave us any food, any water and the most important any information as to what we should do with our transfers flight and suitcase. After waiting 2-3 hrs for my suitcase I was struggling with cold at terminal 4. Someon from BA took us to terminal 5. Today is 12th December and I am still in London without any information about my baggage and transfer flight to Budapest. I paid myself for a  hotel and taxi because all other hotels BA  has are fully booked. This is  exactly what you  would expect from British national carrier airlines. Very poor website, nothing is  provided and for 3 days no call centre, they try to tranfer you from one number to another  with any sense.

London Tokyo Narita  to London Heathrow with British Airways.  Was delayed by  two hours -  it is understandable  due to the  queues in the  terminal at the  airport The inflight ing was awful. It was good , only a  long haul journey.  Very limited selection  was very dated , Plus they kept stalling. The  staff were ok,  though a few seemed allergic to  food and seemed  tired We were  seated at the  beginning of the  journey and then  delayed until an  end towards the  end The food  was average and  I was very  good throughout the  flight As far  as I am  concerned on a  long haul flight , the services are to help  me feel as comfortable as possible . I don’t  remember being starved  being comfortable! Other  carriers offer snacks  throughout the journey.  Why can’t you?  You used to  get the best , now you’re . I won’t  be flying with  UK Airways again. </s>

I was quite  disappointed with my experience with British Airways. First of all, our flight  arrived two hours late which made me miss my connecting flight in . However, the crew on the ground handled the situation quite well and provided all passengers with food-vouchers and even the captain came out of the plane to explain the  problem However, there was no information on connecting flights in LHR. Once on the plane, the lack of free service during the flight was a big minus as it now really does not make a big difference if you are flying Ryanair or British Airways.  Operations were okay but nothing outstanding - same with the crew.

Flew British Airways  to Pisa due to flight times  exceeding BA miles.  Really a poor  business class product. The seats were really tight. Staff  were ok, but seemed stressed. You had to pay  the food in  cash which is  the norm of BA and they predict other airlines  will follow suit.  Had to get a glass of water. Three requests and then it materialised and that  was for a young child. At check-in their automated  system failed so it was done  manually - thank goodness for carbon  offsets still employed  on BA. Overall BA is dramatically . Those who  buy BA miles  should exhaust them  to shift to other airlines. BA  are no longer UK's national airline.  the magic of  Nelson Cruz and Willie Walsh is  now working if  BA ever did. Avoid if you  like paying up  front rfor your . Loyalty does  NOT pay.

On to Toulouse.  BA Airways is  not longer a  fully service airline.  to compete with  Norwegian and Ryan Air it has removed food and drink from economy class and replaced with M&S food. This is over-priced  and not that  expensive Secondly the  service was never complementary- it was  all in your  cabin price. This  is the case  with this flight to Toulouse. Next time go to  BA and get  a meal from  you and carry it on board. I asked for a glass of water. This came in the last 30 minutes of the flight once the trolley had gone down the aisle. At least  give people water - it is  the human right.  The seats too are tight and a rear toilet  in economy has been removed to maximise profits. In this flight there was no spare  water or toilet roll.  I was told by  my cabin crew when I asked about the new service level that  this may be in store for BA's comers -  pay for food in economy class for long haul flights. I hope  however this is  still true. The  only saving grace is a comprehensive  service and flight times are good.  The care and service has gone. Avoid BA if  I can. Consume your BA miles and shift to other full service carriers. They are  quicker and more responsive.

Last flight out from London to  Dubai Lovely, friendly , Goats cheese  soup to start, fish pie for main, good selection , wines and  only 7 hrs  flight on way  home and even  better coming back!  It is a  great aircraft even if you do  want to climb over some feet  and get out, the window seats are very private. Flying this aircraft to Seychelles in May and really  look forward to it. Just waiting to try the new bedding now , catering. Just  shout out to  Virgin and BA are way ahead  on MH.

Welcome to Rome.  Has been a  year since I 've flew on  BA and it  really has changed.  Even the terminal,  the aircraft, and  food are of  the same high  standards as before - the free  airport meals and  snacks have disappeared  and must now  been purchased. It  appears that BA  is slowly morphing into a low-cost  airline at least  in far as European destinations are ! Presumably, this 's due to  the competition from  Emirates and Ryanair  As well as  its CEO hailing  from Vueling. I  think it's only  natural given that  BA fare was  so cheap as  those other two  that BA flies  outside of LHR.

London to Manchester. Hard to complain about a flight  that last 35 mins but I was hoping for a bacon sandwich to keep me going after coming off a long haul flight with a short connection. This flight used  too include complimentary tea/bacon sandwich until the much criticized  change to M&S inflight offerings and a hot sandwich isn't available anymore. All things considered, that is understandable.

Getting to Seattle,  our seamless flight  service was on  time and little  could complain about.  Friendly and professional  and meal service fine, good comfort , additional space in premium economy  for the extra.  Food selection was  just a little limited. Bags slow , arrive at Seattle but don't  count that on .

Flying to London. Good experience all round and nothing  much to complain about. FA's efficient  and friendly, flight  arrived on time.  Food quality was average. Overall, believe the extra amount for premium economy  - although I had cashed in some miles to  justify the upgrade  was perhaps a false economy. Major complaint is BA's policy of charging  you book a seat - it's  very irritating and stressful, especially in premium economy upwards.

London to Barcelona.  BA ground service  was really poor even thought I used premium counter (Sapphire status of OW).  I paid 22 pounds to get exit for myself and  My mom, however the staff in the counter keep question if my mom can speak English. Staff could nt distinguish the Taiwan passport from the China passport and keep said that we need Visa to go to Spain. It took nearly 10 min for her to confirm with her manager and her attitude was really really bad. The worst staff I had  met. Although BA sold a very expensive ticket, however, even a cup of water you have to pay  on it. I 'll never choose this airline again.
