London to Berlin Tegel return. It's becoming ever more difficult to notice any difference between  UK Airways and the budget airlines. The only saving  grace is that I've never experienced any issues flying out of or into T5. Noticeable  budget cutting measures include the removal of complimentary onboard food and drink but also, BA have removed a toilet in economy  in their A319 fleet to make  room for seats  in row 24 and 25 meaning there is only one economy toilet,  unfortunately My flight to Berlin was busy and the line for the sole toilet existed throughout the duration of the flight  so the flight attendants couldn't offer an efficient trolley service and involved a continual display of other passengers weaving in and out of aisle seats. I feel for the staff who often work  the

London London Heathrow  from Dubai. Arrived  at the new "Wing" at T5.  Very quick process  - into the  new lounge. I noticed (as before) the check in staff do not mention the Concorde lounge per se.  "... straight through there sir and into the 1st  class lounge." This option was rammed.  Quite pleased to  see that the Concorde lounge has  received a long  term make-over. It  helped a bit ... Had a  snack and a  half glasses of fizz - then made my way to terminal B. Friendly FA showed  me and wife  into our seats.  Was freshly cleaned.  Came back on  board 1st Class was full. Airborne I had dinner: Mezze to start  with was nice.  The chicken thingy  with mains - which was horrible.  Chicken and biscuits  at conclude. Wines were ok. The  suit (the new  one - is  still wearing well.  Was somewhat tired. Managed to get  some sleep on  a "bed" with  our usual duvet  and blankets. I  am a tall guy and need  some space. the Club World option  is horrendous. Very  pleased to confirm , Mr Alex Cruz (BAs CEO) has re-introduced flowers  to the 1st ! Readers will recall he cancelled  it last year  and save costs.  if Mr Cruz wants to save  money he should  getting rid of  the gas guzzlers 747-400s. So a full 1st cabin  should generate about  half of revenue. The flowers (for  the WCs) probably  run £8.00 -  but pleased to see the airline is still flying  and not gone bankrupt over the re-introduction of eight  dollars worth of  flowers per flight.  BA 1st product  was very mediocre  comparison with say Emirates. Some have said its "sort a an upmarket  first class". I'd agree with that. One would think, BA would want  a make a  positive impression on  their route -  or at least some high end  product "Logic" is  not something BA  needs to understand , given the high level of  poor reviews on  their site. Very disappointing.

Flew British Airways  from Dubai to London Heathrow. Arrived at Dubai airport, checked in - and endured horrendous security. Not BAs fault. Walked miles to the "new"  terminal It's a  nice set up. You walk through the Club option, with a considerable variation of food  and to a  private room with  the options of . Seating very  comfortable Made our way to the  gate Departed bang on time. Airbourne  - went for lunch straight away , after a  couple of G&Ts.  A lamb starter.  Light and tasteless. No other options.  Had the soup. Had a salad.  My beef mains was very good  but not exceptional  and no wow factor. Just nice. Red wine was OK - mid  price stuff at about £25 a  glass My wife was told the  beef was now "unavailable". My friend had beef and  as did I - when challenged  with this I 'm told -  only 3 beefs aboard! This flight  once again full  and had been for weeks. 14  and 3 beefs.  No joke. My wife had an Arab dish which  BA did not ! When it came to coffee, my friend, then  BA - had  no choice of  one My wife then had the  drink offered - only to have it more or  fewer demanded back by a pushy FA. Most BA  Airways staff are  great - this one was a PR disaster. Flight  stayed smooth all  the way home. Another sad experience from our national  airline Definitely not worth some of  those extreme prices posted for this route.

Flying British Airways  from Saint Lucia to London Gatwick.  Issues with other  passenger reviews: BA  service is severely  limited compared to  other Oneworld carrier’s  economy class. We  are not addressed  by name. Staff  felt rushed and  were proactive at  all had to  wait for anything  was required. Not all breakfast items  are available. Seat  comfort and comfort seriously under par.  We came to  my rubbish prior  to landing so  luggage remained on  a floor in  back of me.  Do not feel  BA valued customers.

Flew from London Heathrow to Belfast George Best Airport on BA1414. Boarding  very well controlled and the breakfast  being served onboard was very good. I was also impressed by the  prompt and efficient service. Arrived in Belfast ahead of  scheduled time. Overall very good flight and service.

London to Miami.  UK Airways have  been so disappointing  and need to improve fast. They  booked a flight  the morning of a flight and  so I had  me buy a new flight. The compensation they offered  was £22.  On my most recent trip was to Miami which I had an expired ESTA but  Instead of letting me know they could put me  a flight for a small fee , let me buy a £1000  return flight. Then offered me a £112 refund when I phoned to complain. I am a BA member and must say the customer service  was atrocious, as a company it’s  all spiralling down.

Flew London Heathrow to New York JFK. Have flown this route a  couple of times with British Airways, but this was my first experience with the new Club World offerings (White Company bedding,  updated catering, refurbished 747 club world ). The new  offerings are excellent, particularly the catering. Both the presentation and the taste of the new food is a  real step above the previous Club  world catering offering and the new  get your starter and desert’ options  on the display trolley is a real nice touch.  Also new bedding makes the Club World bed much more comfortable to sleep on.

Berlin to London City. I have never experienced such an unreliable, unprofessional airline, that is  very hard to contact. My flight kept being delayed for hours. After more than 4  weeks delay, there was no point for me to fly to London , as I had missed an  important meeting. I was told that I will get  my flight price refunded and also  given a compensation.  In a few  hours I call their customer support , ask about the refund. They  assure me that I will get  the refund within 7 days. After 4 weeks, I notice that they still haven't refunded  me It's very difficult to contact . The phone hotline is only  active until 5pm . They hide the contact form somewhere deep in their website. Once  I managed to send them a  message I only  got a reply a few days later telling me, that they can't reply to this case via email and that I should call. All  i want at  the point is  the get my deserved flight price  and I take  1 hour off  my work to  being able to call in their  flight opening times.  After being on  call for a while, it turns out, they made  some mistake and  did refund me the ticket within the next 48 . A very convenient mistake, to forget a 360€ refund and not be  allowed to look into this via an email inquiry. Only after I  ask what compensation I will get  after this, I  am offered 5000 Avios points. No thanks, with that level of unreliability and bad customer  service I will make sure to never fly British  Airways again. I make sure to tell all my  colleagues about this experience.

Flew Funchal to London Gatwick. Just wanted to thank the staff on the aircraft for retrieving my game console, was a pleasure to fly  for a great airline like British Airways. I left  this console on the flight, once  i realised that I have left it behind I headed over to the help desk  that is located  at the baggage control area. The  attendants were friendly and happy to assist me, the gentlemen made a call and while this was happening the air hostess appeared with my console in hand.  It has really  made me appreciate flying with a high quality airline. Future flights to Madeira are most  likely going to be with British Airways.

Flew Newcastle to San Francisco via London Heathrow with  UK Airways. One  mistake after another!  A flight from  Amsterdam boarded early but due to weather conditions in  Amsterdam we departed . We should have had a  four hour lay-over  before our connecting  plane but arrived only thirty minutes prior to departure  from San Francisco  and were told at disembarkation that  we had been re-routed via Washington!  The booked flight  to San Francisco also departed late  and we sat in the lounge  as it push . We finally got on the Washington bound aircraft  which were again  late in order to allow late arriving passengers from  London to catch  the flight. The delay meant that the late departure  had then caught  itself in a computer problem at  Newark thus delaying the flight further. We eventually arrived in Washington twenty  hours before the  original connecting flight  but there was  an announcement over  the tannoy system  telling us to hurry up but  without physical help ? Obviously we missed the flight  and spent the  last hour (around  around 23.00) trying  and find help  at the check-in desk in a practically empty airport. United (acting on behalf of BA)  got us onto  a flight the following morning and  a BA staff  quickly found us  a hotel room  twenty minutes drive away. Ironically, the  airline personnel had  kept busy ensuring  both the passengers from Amsterdam that  originally caused the  delayed departure made  a connecting flight  but were therefore  never available to help us! We were also downgraded  from economy on the flight between Washington and San Francisco as business  flight was full. We eventually got  to San Francisco about 22 hours  before our scheduled  and BA offered no compensation for  both the time  lost or the  change in class. They did pay  for the taxi , the hotel  plus the cost of the pre-booked  ( unused) hotel  in San Francisco.  The airline blamed everything on circumstances  yet would not accept any responsibility.  Never a good  story at all and nobody really cares!

Manchester to London.  You were flying  business class and  had a fast track boarding, but  actually the fast track boarding queue  is longer than  our boarding queue! Then on the  plane it was the case of  the ends of  the plane on  opposite side of  the curtain, those  at the front  being offered a quick sandwich and  a drink those  who had to ! The short  line was on time, the leg rest in front of the plane  were exactly same  and at the  back except the  middle seat was blocked off! Though  it felt like  business class in  this plane, on  a ground pre flight it certainly  did not! BA needs to improve  how fast?

London to Athens. On the date  for the flight I received a text message and  an email saying  my flight is  late so I could check in  and carry on  bag for free, later on another  email saying that  flight will have  15 minute delay.  I was at  the airport almost  two plus hours  and Checked in  all the machines  but It couldn't allocate my seat number. Then a  kind airways assistant came and successfully  assigned me my boarding pass with  my seat number.  While at a  hotel I was checking the tv  feed every 5-10 minutes and it said delay 12:46. My flight was  scheduled for 12:00. At 11:45 I tried to pass through security but  the machine would  tell me to  change my boarding  pass and asked  me to seek assistance. The security officer told me , I lost  the flight because  my flight was  at 12:00 and suggested me to go to counter . Now at the counter C1 A lady told  her that the  flight was at  4 and I lost it. While  she was explaining  why the flight  might be delayed  she made phone calls and tried  to explain the  whole situation. Then  he told me to go through security because the  time code on my boarding pass  would be valid  for 2 minutes!  Ran straight to  security exit and  terminal was packed  by people sitting. Waited at the  exit for another almost hour and  all total the delay on arrival to Athens was  around 20mins.

Very disappointing. I was scheduled on a British Airways flight to connect to a long haul flight at Heathrow and having  flew BA in the past it was very sad to see how  the service went  down this year.  Chips and drinks  to purchase, uninspired staff and delay on inbound flight. I would fly a low cost  airline instead, since  is exactly what BA now achieves. Many years ago  this was one of the european flagship carriers and  it was fun  too fly BA, now it's just another shrinking violet.

It was really a no frills  economy class. This flight was part  return trip with  British Airways. Unfortunately,  flight London to Doha was operated by British Airways. The seat is cramped and really outdated compared to  the other major airlines. The IFE was really poor  with old screen  technology and poor  choice of options. The meal was not good related to the price  we have to  pay The FAs were really dull,  nothing wrong but no effort to communicate with passengers like FAs from other airlines. BA really need to refresh or renovate  its business class cabin. It might  represent excellent innovation back in mid 2000s but the industry has moved on.

British Airways is seriously lacking in  some areas. Singapore to Sydney return in economy. Fly the route often, usually with Qantas  who are great. The flight out to Sydney is only 7.5 hours and over night - most people are looking to  extend their sleep. Especially those who have come from London. Cabin crew were surly, unhelpful and seemed rushed and disorganised. After departure they took almost three hours to get the dinner service over and done with  and turn off  all lights so people could get some rest. During the flight cabin crew chatted loudly and seemed unaware that people may actually want to rest and get  some sleep. The food is very average also. Two hours before landing, they serve a pre landing breakfast  made of a  newspaper wrapped in plastic. No tea or coffee. The competition is too strong for this route. I would never use them .

London Heathrow to Basel. Boarding: There are now so many 'priority boarding' passengers that all those who do not fall into this category are left to feel like second-class citizens. (The new numbering  structure is likely to cement this impression further.) Since I was traveling on a 'low-price' ticket, I found myself seated right at the back of the airplane. Yes, BA appears intent on replicating England's class system!  On board there was a delay of 40 minutes due to a French ATC strike. Obviously, this was not BA's fault, but no drinks, not even water was offered during the wait on the tarmac. After take off, the drinks trolley moved painfully slowly down the cabin.  Can BA offer heated sandwiches, further  slow down their BOB service even further, when only two ec cabin crew are serving in the first place, is beyond me. The no-cash  option further contributes to the snail-pace progress of the trolley. The trolley (and a cup of tea) was within grasping distance as the captain announced we would be landing in ten minutes. End of service. Someone at the back quipped, 'So you opted for the  back seats, too!' Yes, BA is a joke, its attitude towards passengers (its customers) shameless and embarrassing. It wasn't until I had left the airport that I was able to get that cup of tea. Needless  the say, Eurowings and EasyJet do  it much better.

Flight to London Heathrow. A bit  if a mixed bag. Boarding at Miami was conducted  successfully and the  aircraft departed on time, albeit that  some passengers were still getting into their seats as the aircraft was pushed back! So much for safety. Seat would not remain in the upright position resulting in an uncomfortable  landing and subsequent aching back on arrival at Heathrow. Also my wife’s  laptop failed mid flight. Impossible to  gather information from  a flight deck.  These ageing 747’s really are in  serious need of  help The congealed  chicken curry was disgusting and unpalatable,  and alternative pasta  dish was deemed  acceptable The minimal  food offering leaves  very lot to  become desired. The  one redeeming feature  were the excellent  hospitality provided by  a young enthusiastic cabin crew. They must feel very demoralised given the poor quality product  we have to support. Flight arrived early and luggage was delivered promptly.

Chicago to Washington via London. British Airways has turned out to be the worst airline I have flown. Unfortunately I am forced to fly them often from PRG, if I  want to connect on their One World partner AA,  who I have Exec Plat status with. BA charges for everything, including water. PRG-LHR is on a small business class seat (same as in economy), dried up breakfast that was tasteless, flight attendants that could not care less and when I asked  their coffee told me they were landing soon (40 mins before landing) and that I should have thought of it earlier. London to Washington  was on a broken down 747, seat sofa which you are supposed to lie on broke down and caved in on the floor. Had to be moved twice before they found functioning seat. Food was dried up beef with red that gave me a headache after two sips. Entertainment system has about 40  options compared to about 200 options on AA flights. Overall horrible experience. The extra added costs for flying over LHR and paying extra  tax is ridiculous. BA, what is it about your flights PRG-LHR, with your onboard luggage allowance only? They charge USD 100 for a checked in luggage even to Emerald partners?  Horrible food, aircraft, LHR and transfer experience. Good luck BA, will  cancel at all costs. Included a picture from the bathroom which was broken.

With Town to  say I can  make a positive  report on our flight. From the moment we boarded,  flight crew were polite and efficient,  who provided a high-class service throughout. Seats 4E/F suffer a bit from poor storage space and a lack of privacy, but they are the best for a couple. Glasses were kept topped-up even  after take-off. The menu provided four  choices of both  liquids and mains, and all the  meals were both  clean and well-cooked.  Back to cabin , it seems that staff are  increasingly being trained to prepare and  serve food with greater care, and  it really showed  during the flight.  The IFE screen was the usual low resolution with  the limited selection  of films. Still no WiFi, of course. Take-off and  landing was on schedule, and announcements  from the cockpit  maintained that typical air of friendly professionalism. An excellent flight, overall.

Bangkok to London Heathrow. Despite all the negative reviews I decided to fly with BA on my recent trip to Europe, on this route BA has a daylight flight (I can't stand midnight plus departure and night flight where you can't sleep anyway and arrive  at your destination ), more luggage allowance in premium economy and they advertised what seemed to be a  great cabin and stylish service. The fare was also pretty good. In the end, I have to admit my mates were right, this was a let down  get along. My issues were the following. I purchased a ticket in  standard economy. The advertised seats on the BA Thailand website were reflecting the newer version, when in fact not one of the 777-200 which operates the LHR-BKK-LHR  flights have been refitted. The seat date from the early 2000's - almost two decades ago, and I  had to pay 35 pounds each way to select my seat. Come on ! Yes  - got my amenities kit, a better pillow British papers and pre-departures , a full bar and plenty of drinks to keep me going for 12hr plus. But the seat is old, not that comfy, the IFE belongs to the late 90's and is a disgrace to the industry. Great sound, good headset but rubbish tiny screen with a poor picture quality. I spent 12hr looking at the ceiling as I could not see squat. The seat itself  looked way outdated and the cabin/seat were dirty. It  was however A bit better out of LHR but still not that great. The meal  service was not good out of BKK. Bar service did not have peanuts or savory  food - just a napkin. Main  meal was ok, but appetizer and dessert a cheap joke. No cheese nor crackers. Not enough at all, you are left starving, and in economy it is even worst. I have to say it was better on the return  flight and will give you more  satisfaction in a  second Cabin crew told me they just reverted to the old style as they have had way too many complaints and the J/C had a brand new a la carte service as well.  Cabin crew operating both legs  was great - professional, approachable and present in the cabin every 30mins with drinks. Out of LHR the main meal was this time pretty good, including cheese and crackers and a much better appetizer plus desert. The only false note was the meal pre-selection. You get served first  as they do with special meals - but do not offer you any drinks. You have to wait <mask> a very <mask> time. By then my meal was cold and i sent it back. They did <mask> it right away, but this <mask> clearly a waste of time. Pre-selecting your meal, means you are sure to get your choice of casserole and that you wish to be served at the same time then others so the bar is right behind and one can enjoy a glass of red with is steak. Pax with Special meals service can wait as the crew have way more to hand out and these veggies lovers often do not <mask> anyway. Other than that it was this time a decent meal. Having said that, there was no middle service, which meant 9 h between lunch and breakfast without even a snack. Not acceptable on such a long haul. Funny enough the <mask> feature three meals so why not on the LHR-BKK leg ?. <mask> could be so much better. They have a great force but way too many <mask> cutting left and right - and should have <mask> all their fleet at least 5 years ago. <mask> is clear to me the CEO is running BA to the ground and needs to get the sack by share holders sooner rather than later .

A 3 hour  delay at airport,  originally destined for  Amsterdam with arrival time of 21.35,  but rerouted to Venice, meaning bus transfer and arrival at 2.30am. We  passengers were informed , before boarding , of this change. I had planned to stay  that night with a friend who  were going to  meet me up  from the airport.  In such an unsociable hour of the morning, I  could no longer  with her. I  explained all this  to BA, who  told me that  a rep would  let me find  my hotel and  it would be : On arrival,  I was brusquely told by a  flight rep to  go online and  get my own ! After a  longer than 5  minute delay, my  phone had no  support life. I  am left to  call a fellow  on phone and  headed for the  closest motel near the airport -  minutes away from  anywhere I should  have been. It transpires BA knew  I had been  some problems in  early morning of  my flight - yet sent passengers  via email urging us to get to the airport even earlier. I  spent 5 hours  at Gatwick (when  I could have  gone on working). Also had I known, would have  had to get  onto an earlier flight or postpone  the journey. To  top it all, when all 150 passengers finally arrived  in the deserted  streets of Verona at 2.30 am - no taxis. BA had not  heard of contacting  any taxis informing  us of a  lack of tired  travellers Further wait. Not only had  I missed my  lovely reunion, to  my astonishment British  Travel has refused  to reimburse my hotel bill, stating  that they had  not all got  around to my . I hadn't  actually counted the extra taxi bills I incurred (£45)  – but I  did expect BA  would reimburse the  entire hotel as  another goodwill gesture.  Very impressed.

Flew British Airways  via Madrid to  Liverpool Heathrow. An  airline full of  passengers We were  either asked to  carry our hand bag or, in  some cases, to leave it by  our aircraft and pick it up upon arrival. I must say I find this irritating, as I had one piece of  paper within the rules. Other people ? Those should be asked to do this. I  often felt as  though I were  in a low  class airline, which is sad to  see Short-haul with  them never again!

Tel Aviv to London. We arrived  at the airport  after a lot  less time due  to the stories of how long  it can take.  Those stories were  true although it is actually a  fairly efficient and  highly organised airport,  we just have  a thorough border  and immigration services  as well as  most passengers face  the security scanning  and hand luggage . There were  two priority options  available for First  class passengers, although  I suspect that  is more down to the airport  than British Airways. The lounge provided  was a third  tier one and  is the same  as business and  pleasure and isn’t  always acceptable. If  there was just  us then it  might be ‘fine I guess’ but  it is not  as much seating, the food offerings  are almost non existent and drinks  are limited. Even  the main coffee  shop was broken  so there was  nothing very complicated,  one with all instructions only in Hebrew. At the  gate there was  your usual ‘priority � queue as well as the  general queue. But  that priority queue  included all first  class club passengers  and well as  our Oneworld emerald,  silver and ruby  customers - which is a lot  of people! Whilst  this is nice  they offer a  seat to all  of those members,  it really should be another queue  of first and  the emerald as  this queue was  quite long. The  service on board  didnt start off  particularly well for  passengers as due to some confusion  with the crew  I got missed , when crew  were offering drinks amenity kits etc,  and after seeing  which one was  working and the  others were all  empty at the  desk I had  a go to  the galley and  apologise They were  extremely apologetic and  gave excellent service  throughout the rest  of the flight , those kind a mistakes really  can happen in first. The seat  is comfortable and  offered a reasonable  amount of privacy and storage space. Annoyingly the ife  seems to be  reserved for take  out and landing,  that limits how  far you can  do It was  using Thales entertainment system so the  music was reasonable , with a  very good selection of things to  eat The food and drinks on board were all  excellent including a delicious veal cheek  main course and  two wonderful wines  which went together  very well. Aside  from the hiccup  in the beginning,  the whole experience  at board felt  really attentive and  enjoyable It would have been nice to have been  spoken to by  phone which I  have had before  with BA and with other airlines,  all in business . On arrival  the priority bags  came out incredibly  quick and were  on the belt  when we got  on which was  great as immigration  have also been  extremely quick. Overall  it was a  pretty nice flight <mask> a solid <mask> and excellent <mask> let down <mask> by the ground service in <mask> I used <mask> and a <mask> voucher for <mask> flight so it worked out <mask> value for <mask>

London to Tel Aviv. Arrived at  JFK at about 5pm expecting it  to be very  quiet but check  into security felt like it was 10pm, very easy , quick process (which included regular rather than fast track security as we didn’t follow  the signs properly). We used galleries  airport lounge and first impressions were actually pretty poor,  but they did later improve. The food offering on arrival was a  little sandwiches, soup and some dry . This wasn’t really acceptable at all although about an hour after we arrived the evening meals were laid out and there was a good selection of hot and cold dishes which were quite tasty. Drinks  served were good as always with British Airways although champagne is only served on request and the quality  for the one provided was really  quite appalling. In terms of seating, there was enough for all the  staff in there,  though it was  pretty busy, and due to it being broken up into different areas it felt like  a nice place, although better variety  of seating, including  a more comfortable  chairs would be appreciated as well as a bit of modernising. This  major failing was the staff in the lounge, which  were more similar to staff in  the factory canteen  then what you  get in competitors : Smiles are  important and go a long way, and whilst being unobtrusive can be a good quality,  staff walking around slightly like a  child seruptitiously clearing  your table without any interaction whatsoever  was just plain odd! The other  things which I find completely below  standard are the  toilets Whilst they are kept clean and there are some nice touches with flowers etc,  in general standard  in the toilet  room was more like a cheap gym locker room.  The regular Heathrow  airport toilets are far far nicer and to a  better quality. Whilst the individual toilet cubicles with self contained wash areas  were nice, there aren’t really enough and some regular wash room facilities and urinals as well would make it easier. On  board me and my friend had the centre two seats at the very back of  the cabin. This meant that we basically had our own private suite as well as direct aisle access. These seats are  perfect when travelling  with someone and as good as  the business offering  of any airline in terms of comfort, privacy and access. Unfortunately this  was an ancient  problem with the old ife, which is a completely  poor product in terms of resolution, selection and even  that fact that  some screens won’t even stay in place and fold themselves away! British Airways need to have an active  campaign to refurbish  & replace all of these aircraft, <mask> of story! <mask> the Thales system is showing <mask> age now, but this Rockwell <mask> one makes vhs tapes look state of the art! The cabin <mask> were slightly <mask> in terms of level of <mask> and experience. Some were clearly <mask> in sync with each other <mask> serving drinks <mask> meals etc, and some were rather abrupt and <mask> Others however <mask> absolutely wonderful and made the whole flight a <mask> experience. Food and drinks on <mask> were actually quite good, although the on board service was not <mask> new club world one on this route yet. Overall it was <mask> very enjoyable <mask> and as I booked using Avios and a <mask> voucher it <mask> exceptional value for money. Having <mask> that, I <mask> have still <mask> it good <mask> even if <mask> cash.

Kuala Lumpur to Madrid via London.  Our first time flying BA and I had very  low expectations. Fortunately, my experience was  pleasant as the  seats were generally  good and overall  it was good.  Customer service (KUL-LHR)  was brusque. Meal  is served not  long after take off and my  stomach was already  hungry as it was past midnight.  Someone had asked  how we could have it later , the reply  being a curt  reply and that they couldn't give  food to us later nor would they have any snacks to offer. So if we got hungry we 'll just have to wait more  than 8 hours  longer for the next meal. Luckily on the return route we had  the very courteous  airline crew who  asked politely. Both  planes appeared new  but the seats were wide enough for us. Some  customers complained about  the entertainment unit under the seats.  Something I didn't  notice though is  that the arm  rest couldn't be  moved up totally between the 2 seats so that  my child could lie across his seat and mine.  That armrest kind  of went up  at a max of 80 degree . The seat pockets were very small so there's  precious little that can kept inside. The toilets were  very clean but the toilet seat  just didn't work : They always  slid back down  as there was never seat liners. Food was below average.

Madrid to London Heathrow on a busy Monday evening  in November was  a entirely mixed affair. Boarding was from the satellite terminal which was efficient and well managed. Boarding was rather slow as too many people were allowed to bring aboard large amounts of luggage. This resulted in some bags being removed and placed into the hold. Some passengers were  poorly behaved and argued with the staff. Every single  toilet was occupied. This was quite  stressful on the staff. A trendy safety instruction took place with a video of certain UK based TV personalities. This was in English only. The inflight service was very poor. I ordered a sandwich and a drink and had  my receipt chucked at me. Disembarkation was slow again due to the  massive amount of luggage. I regard this as a health and safety matter. British Airways is not what it was and  along this route  they are alternatives  and better service.

From British Airways from Bologna to  Liverpool Heathrow. We  arrived at Bologna  expecting to be  told at the  departure check in  that the plane had been overbooked and that we 'd have to wait until boarding  cleared before we would know if there was a  seat for us.  They were both  shocked and surprised since we had  attempted this return  journey several weeks earlier and had  been at the airport in good . The member  on staff dealing  to us was  extremely brusque and  abusive and the  only information that we were given  included a typed  statement setting out  this fact that  since we did not travel we  should be able to claim compensation.  For us this was not acceptable  since we had  not be in  Salt Lake District  that following day. We were eventually  helped onto the  plane but would  hardly have made  this if it  were not been  to a fellow  passenger who seemed  to know how to get around  the queues in  this situation. I  think that these  queues were only  seen on the  better known cut  rate airlines!

The husband and  me booked our honeymoon to Italy  with American Airlines  and unknowingly routed  it to their  parent airlines, British Airways. We ran  ourselves into trouble  when we received  the email notice  that our flights have been changed  and we now had a 40  hour layover at London Heathrow and we would not  be in Rome  in the AM  we planned. We  agreed to give  it a shot ! We arrived  at BWI and discovered we were  flying on an  international flight and  we packed more  luggage than BA  will allow. (We  brought three checked bags instead of  one and British Airways only allows  1 checked bag  unless you pay close to $100  an additional). Luckily  2 gentlemen at  their counter checked  our bag at no charge. I  can say the  reverse for the  remainder of our trip. We found  that the flight  was full and  BA had not  reserved our seats  booked for a  3 hr flight , we had  two middle seats.  My neighbors on  this flight refused to swap seats, originally then after  some pity complaining  a lovely woman . We arrived  in London around  2 late of  afternoon and after  walking to the  airport terminal in  another attempt to make our connection, we missed our flight and were  forced to make  progress through security.  Our BA representative told us the  connecting flight was full and we 'd have to  stay until 5pm.  He again explained that we were on our honeymoon and had afternoon  seating reservations in  advance The BA representative was then able to find two seats on a 12pm flight  and so we  got our ticket  - but were  unable to get into Rome for  dinner Upon our  returning flights, we  attempted three times  and reserve seats online via British  Airlines app and  email (learning from ), and the  app kept giving  up an error screen even though  the charge was  not on my  bank account. We  then had to  book an international  airline and pay $174 to ensure  we were able  ta sit next o each other  during the 8 am flight home, though we could not select seats for our connecting  plane to London.  Once we arrived  at Rome to  London - we  are hit with  the $100 additional baggage fee (we  had tried to  get the representative  not to comp  the bag). Upon  landing at the  counter my ticket  got pinged for having an extra  charge that was  not paid for.  Fortunately we had  a receipt from paying 2 hrs . Otherwise I  doubt we would've  have to shell out $100 again.  we are crossing our fingers for  another safe trip  home as we  are again delayed  booking our flight from Rome to  Rome If you  fly British Airways prepare to be  nickel and dimed at every part of your journey.  :)

Flying British Airways , London Heathrow  to Johannesburg. Plane : T5 Satellite , so used B Galleries Lounge,  it was quiet  and pleasant. Efficient , seats 50J/K  on upper deck,  but provided good  ventilation despite proximity  from toilets. Mixed . FAs and  crew were young  yet enthusiastic. In-flight  is good, with  one notable improvement  to the quality  of food, i.e.,  being delivered individually  designed seats and  three courses not  inferior to a  standard IFE lagging  with that offered  by competitors, with  larger screens and  fewer movies. Breakfast  offered four hot options which were  better palatable than  breakfast Overall, a  good flight, although  passengers look forward to promised improvements  for 2018.

London Heathrow to Brussels. I had to travel for a surgery that had to be done in Belgium. Going there the staff at check-in in were amazing, as I had missed my plane she did everything possible for me to be on the next flight at a good  rate However coming back to London the staff were quite rude and not acknowledging. I got on the plane and asked if I could have help to place my hand luggage into the locker as I  could not carry anything nor lift my hand due to my operation. The first staff member at the  gate told me that I had to ask a member of staff  as to my  bag if no one could help then he will try to come. So that’s what I did, but the member of staff refused as she told me  why she wasn’t allowed to carry a bag unless I help her and even after explaining the situation, she just ignored it and just left me alone with my suitcase. Luckily another passenger heard me and carried my bag to the top and helped my get it down at the end. I work in  retail and I know about customer service but very disappointed with my expirience coming back especially on the plane. I am very angry by this situation and next time I will think twice before choosing the  airport again.

Flew London to San Francisco. British Airways provided a functional, disinterested service  during this ten  hours flight. We were given what  is necessary and certainly no more.  Waiting for five hours, not even a glass of water offered and  It was made clear that the staff were happy to do the  bare minimum and no more. If  you have to  work with British  you do, but  if you can  trust them then I would. In the interest of fairness I have  informed the customer service team at  British Airways of  our experience -  thus far I  had been ignored hence writing this .

London Heathrow to Seoul Incheon. I was flying my return leg back to Korea after a Christmas vacation. I had not had a pleasant experience on my initial leg and  I had no better experience on the return. To start with, i was unable to pre order my meal on line due to a technical fault. Having not had my selection available on the outbound leg (in business class!) i wanted to ensure i had something for my return. I couldn't pre book and of course when  offered the meal by the cabin crew they had AGAIN run out of 50% of the available selections. Quite disgraceful. I  am also unable to check in on line, so i was "directed" by staff to use the kiosk at the airport which also did not work. Eventually  I made it passed the staff and was allowed to queue for the business class  checking in. The rest of the airport process after that was smooth. This time i sat at the rear of the business class cabin  in the window seat. This meant that I did not have to  step over somebody else feet and legs if I wanted to get  some of my  seat in flight. Of course I had to pay extra $'s for the seat selection in business class - a point which i have made before about being very unhappy about in a  premium cabin. The flight was uneventful.  In this occasion  I had a very warm crew for which I appreciated. Overall I still feel that  Delta is just  being cheap on it's product and this is not  the acceptable practice especially in a premium class. Frankly, even though they  have the cheaper ticket price by the time I  have paid extra for the seat  having not had  the meal choices available i would have been better off flying another carrier.

From Incheon to  Birmingham Heathrow. This  is my first  time on BA  for many years.  As a Brit,  I was actually  look forward to  leaving them in  order to return  them for Christmas  on board the  shiny new B787. I was disappointed.  My fare I  paid on this  trip was relatively  fair value for  the J class  flight - in  my view. However,  it was extremely disappointing to see  that you have  to pay to  reserve your seat  in J class.  i do not  hear of and  would not ever  see another airline which charges you  for this and  most certainly do  not appreciate it. I was seated in row 1 by the window. My first experience  with this cabin  as a shock when I realised  it was looking straight into the  eyes of the  man sitting next to me. And  after that i had to step  over the legs  on the passenger  of row 2  could get into  or out from  his seat. The  tray table did  not sit straight  nor pulled out  of service. Even  in row 1,  from the time the cabin crew  came to take  my meal order  they were already  informing me that  some of the  food options had  now run out.  Which left me  with a Korean  person on a  flight on BA  when the majority  of the passengers  appeared to be non-Korean. Clearly something  off with the  crew ratios. They offer a serve  and snack bar  per flight. I  got to the  lounge at one  stop and there  was very little  action to take  menu wise -  it was mostly  cold drinks. It also seemed to  offer a fixed  flight time -  anything else i  did not appreciate  on business class  now days when  meal on demand  was a far  cheaper option for  booking The IFE  experience was nothing  better than average.  We found the overall selection somewhat  poor compared to  other carriers. The  price and product  choices left me  thinking that BA  is way behind  most carriers and  i concluded that  there would not  see a point  on flying with  it again on  any long haul  or in a  BA cabin.

Flew Cape Town to London with  Royal Airways. It’s  impossible to think  about a good  thing about this ! On the outward journey I  was in an  aisle seat. Next door me was  somebody who was too large to comfortably be able to occupy a middle seat. The crew could have  bailed the poor  passengers out by offering an aisle , they made  the attempt. So three people suffered  in conditions for  three hours. The food is awful,  low quality and  the poor selection  in wines -  only Spanish wine with no choice,  and cabin was  not heated. It was the most  unpleasant flight I  had ever taken. Until my return flight - entertainment system was not working - ancient plane same miserable ... This airline  use to be good, now it is awful.

Back to Bahrain 's world and  you certainly like  jet pack folk , a business class cabin in  this 2-4-2 configuration  that is out  to date and hardly worthy of business class cabin compared to the  airlines of Qatar,  especially Etihad which  is far more . The plane was old along with a tired  cabin and dirty  wooden bathroom basins that had permanent  damage which need  replacing On this  flight good choice  in foods with  knowledgeable staff. Cost uming was in  question in the  only bag you get, the presentation  of food trays  and the personnel service had gone.  Nothing more akin  an economy, also a real negative point is your  leaving Heathrows newest  airport & guess what you are  getting to your  destinations by buses!  a shining example  in what is  meant to be  the modern airport.  This flight is  definitely not 5 star and a 3 star rating  is where this airline should sit.  I was delayed  15 mins & arrived 25 mins  late so not  really a good timekeeping record either.  It was poor  on old films  as they call  DVD releases, no where near on a par with Qatar Airways.

London to Philadelphia.  I booked was an AMEX companion ticket so effectively family of 4 travelled for £2.5k in business class return so very good value. Positives  - B747 on both journeys was refurbished so very clean and great IFE. Cabin quiet and crew amazingly helpful. T5 Lounge fine, flight on time. Bags off very quickly. Negatives - food on  both both legs wasn't great. Salad  served and main beef meal very  disappointing Pudding which  are normally the show stopper - not great. In previous years food been excellent. Return journey just the same - except  for the crew  each time being outstandingly helpful. We were travelling with a baby and a toddler and the crew couldn't do enough to  assist The real test of the  product was on landing at LHR, we were walking  on the jetty and my 3 year old daughter  fell sick all over me. We were stood on  that jetty trying to sort the situation and all the crew after a long flight came to help us. They were amazing. They didn't  have to as they were done  for the day. BA are getting  too much stick at the moment - their hard product is fine if you are redeeming a companion ticket but not  if you are paying in excess of £15k. The crew lift this product to a much higher level.

British Airways short  of Business Class is nothing more  than an economy  class seat and  its 31 inch  window with lounge  chairs and a  bar thrown in.  Why is it  worthwhile paying three  of the cost  as an economy ticket? BA recently  introduced Business Class  to domestic routes , as I  made a decent  income for booking  flights in advance,  wanted to try  this out. Checking  flights was efficient,  with the Galleries  & Lounge adequate  by comparison whatsoever  with Asian or  Far Eastern Airline . Priority boarding  when announced, did not make any  difference as economy  & business class passengers were in  the same queue , confused. Having  climbed into the cramped seat, I  got offered a  hand towel as  soon as I  laid down. I  cant decide whether  to be amused  nor embarrassed by  this new celebrity  airline safety video.  I was more  in the stars,  than listen to  their safety instructions. But I guess  there was something  else BA was  trying out. The  service on board  was surprisingly efficient  and swift. Soon  after take off,  a tasty snack  and bar service  with premium brands  is offered on  the one hour . The service  is good, considering  its one hour ! Despite a  size 767, 2x2x2 , the cabin  felt claustrophobic. To  some this was no different than  premium seating, with  almost no leg ! How can  it be branded  as Business Class?  Is the extra  costs justified to  the Club Europe?  Perhaps not.

I requested Asian  style food both ways including my  connecting flight from Oakland to Gatwick on the 6th  June but I was very disappointed that my requirement  is not fulfilled.  I was  told that on my connection flight  they have to  lock up my  bag and then check it again  at Phoenix airport  before connection flight  which I never heard before as normally all the airlines do the checking luggage transfer themselves and passengers  then have to  clear security checks and board the flight. When I reached Phoenix first  security took long  lines to clear then luggage took time to come then I had to go on the different level to check in,  back down to go through security again to board my flight. On  my return flight  from Oakland to  Phoenix when I went to the check in luggage I was told  from the staff  behind the desk  of TSA will  check my lock to check through my luggage, so  please keep it unlocked.  I requested Asian vegetarian  breakfast but when I got my  last meal it  was cholesterol fat  free diet. When  I mentioned this to the staff who gave me this food she  said that’s what  they asked for but I said  but I didn’t  see on the  food label clearly  says 18A and my seat no . 18K so how is this my food. She still didn’t believe  so instead of apology she said  we have to  go back on  that matter to provide you food  or we might  still have spare  food to offer you. After 15 mins of wait once she serving  with the passengers she came to me and told me that if  I want I can offer you full English breakfast  I said but  this am vegetarian  she said I don’t have any other option.

Still continually disappointed by British Airways.  it seems they are now in  this race with Ryanair and easyJet  for become the  largest carrier in  Europe out of the UK. Flew Düsseldorf to London. Their lounge at DUS is closed  because their check-in staff doesn't know  me (she sent me up there).  We have a  reservation at JFK and I showed  her the boarding  number but she  cannot interline my bag to their partner AA and I had to  use it. Now,  not only do they not serve  the second meal on the 11-hour  journey LHR-LAX, but  what they want  is for a  packet of coca  coffee that they pay 15p for. Usually, you should always fly across  open ocean on a European carrier,  but with BOAC I recommend Finnair . American with their One World alliance. What is  their point?

London to Santiago.  Cabin crew generally  pleasant and friendly. Cabin a bit  more crumbs, nuts  and grime in : On the  journey home as  I took my seat I saw a bit of  plastic wrapper of the ear plugs  they give out  and seemed to  be been left  over from the  last flight - evidence that whoever  does the vacuum  cleaner before the passengers board needs to be a bit more thorough.  The alcoholic drinks  were all pleasant. The food was  very variable quality (as was the  drink none bad,  just a bit ), some good.  Many have commented  upon the somewhat  awkward seat arrangement  and I found  it a bit of a palaver to have to carefully step over  a sleeping, passenger's  and trying not to wake them up. The other problem with that configuration is the  computer screen has  only be stowed at take off  / landing which means you can't  touch it, as  one can in  flight when the  screen is on the back of  a seat in  front of you.  On both flights I found that my screen seemed  to be broken  and would not  be in position  so that I would have to  stare at it  on an angle.  We solved the  issue by stuffing  the rolled up  newspaper in the  bottom bit, but  still I had  to take it  off every time  I got out  of my seat.  Another problem with the configuration is  because the storage  area is minimal; apart from the overhead lockers there is only a small drawer. And that adds to  my litter problem.  Once you have taken off the polythene wrappers for your headphones and  speakers or the paper ring around  the napkin, what  would you do  to it? Er, drop it on  the floor? I  usually manage to  do quite well, though the pillow  they are provided  with is very  expensive On the  way back they  handed me another  pillow when I  returned Another small  annoyance is that there is no  separate air conditioning  system for your  clothes and if you take off  your jacket, sweater  and whatever, the lack of storage  space means it has to go  in the overhead  bins if you have already filled up the little drawer. And I  do want to  sound a bit picky, but although the in-flight entertainment has a good choice of films, the menu system for seeing what they are is  a bit irritating; they are all divided into categories  like as "comedy",  comedy etc but no A-Z. All  and all, it 's an unpleasant  flight but I would advise BA,  if they were  correct in my  case that they  need to clean the planes more  thoroughly and more  frequently and re-think the seat configuration.

Back to New York JFK in club world. After  my very mixed  flight here, I also saw that  BA were upgrading standards on flights  from NYC in  2015 and was looking forward to  the flight. Should n have been so optimistic, as  it is still  the business class  and belongs in  late 1980's. Aircraft  are tatty to be polite about : worn carpets, seat with various malfunctioning or broken  and washrooms grimy  as the word , Staff tried  best to offer  the modicum of good service, but  their so called food improvements were  really not much better than other  lower economy cabins I have flown  where I have  still pay for  my ticket. BA talk a lot about their premium standards, but even  when you pay  less for business  travel the standards are well below  even their US counterparts. Complete rip-off  sums it up.

My wife and  i booked two  short trip business  Class air tickets  connecting Johannesburg to Victoria Falls with  British Airways /  Via It turned out that our business class seats  were not any  differently from the seats in the economy class: they  were exactly the  same width and . So our pre-flight  meals were not  even better than  that of the  business class passengers because British Airways  had not even  offer a lodge  for business class  seats in Victoria ! Yes, during  our flight we  got served sparkling  wine and snacks, but does this difference substantiate my  request for two  round trip tickets  - rather than  one which would  have been the  price of the  economy class tickets?

Welcome to Mumbai.  All electrics at  my seat were  not working. This  should have been  fixed but the  voice control that  had completely broken  and loose   wires etc. -  My call button  that kept coming  on and off  by its own.  it was impossible for me to  control this and  at the time  when I did  NOT want to  leave the flight . This is not  specific to my  experience however the  power unit above  the seat/row kept  opening throughout the  trip The attendant  had shut it  and then it  would  open,  which happened during  check off and  on as well , throughout the  flight  For  my level of  economy and Club  seat seat, it 's not acceptable  that you should  need to rely  upon your personal  computer  This  particular flight was  the first time  where I have  flown business class.  I have spent  tens of thousands  of pounds on  an American Express  ticket to earn  our points required , to generate  the companion voucher,  enabling us to  being able to  book business class  during our honeymoon.  Whilst the outbound  trip was great,  it was very  disappointed with the return flight and  frustrated by the  poor quality of  our seat. The  attendant tried to  set my screen  which made no  sense and in  India the situation  got worse. Once  I had tried  the turn on  a screen and  reset it the  screen had attempted  a re-set; after  that the screen just kept flicking  off and off  on the remaining <mask> hrs of <mask> flight. As <mask> can imagine, <mask> is very <mask> to have <mask> screen flick <mask> and off <mask> no way <mask> controlling it. <mask> was impossible <mask> turn the <mask> off completely.

I travelled to Johannesburg from London Heathrow on Sunday 22nd October on flight BA55 and  my husband was meant to travel with my two daughters on the  next flight on 23rd October. They were refused boarding on the grounds that children cannot  go with a single parent to South Africa. There was no such  restriction on booking the tickets via BA's website and there was no notification of this  to the airline at any stage. The requirement is  not even on the front page of the embassy's website but well hidden under drop down menus. Usually when there are  requirements like for ESTA for entry into US, BA sends a prompt. However, there was nothing in this case. BA had on its system  and I (the other parent) had travelled BA already reach Johannesburg a  day before. The  ticket counter staff  of the airport refused to help my husband, who was travelling with a 4 and 7 year old with any alternative. Instead they directed to use the website to cancel tickets. After being  sent the wrong email address first, when finally managed to get in  communication with customer  support they refused to refund the ticket cost, only  refund taxes 25% of total. The overall service and the way it was dealt was extremely stressful at the airport and off-putting. They said they would use the complain to  change their processes but will not refund in excess  than GBP 2k in tickets as  they were cancelled prior to the flights upon refused boarding even the return flights and not within 24hrs  after booking. Other airlines offer alternatives but here the attitude was extremely  hostile even though both my husband and I are  international travellers and have Silver cards  through their Executive program. I will avoid travelling BA  again for work  after this event.  Having received better treatment from low cost airlines in the past.

Heathrow to Lyon.  Absolutely worst customer service I have ever experienced! I arrived at the airport a good 2 hours before the flight only  the be told that the flight is overbooked and that I could  NOT check in. After a long  wait to ascertain if anyone will not be turning  around I was told I can go on a  later flight - the problem being that the only available flight was the one going out the following morning. So I missed a whole day's business meeting  & was forced to do the round trip home and back to  the airport in  a matter of one day. When I queried the fact that I was unable to board I was told that overselling the flight was normal - "all airlines do it". The fact that all of them do it of course is not a justification nor explanation. I was casually advised to read the small print in the future. On the way back from  another destination, in order to avoid  that same thing happening, I decided  a check in online 24 hours before. However, I was again denied a check in and was put  at a stand by. Apparently, the return flight is  booked again! I do not understand how it is possible that the product/service that I have purchased, I can not use. How can it be legal that  this company has no responsibility to honour their contractual obligation to provide me the service  which I have duly purchased a  service 4 months in advance!!!! The disregard for its customers and the sheer arrogance of  the huge, inept company is beyond ! On top of that, the company's decision to  no longer serve coffee/tea and food on board is unacceptable. The BA has made a foolish decision to behave like a budget airline but  also keep charging premium prices. I  absolutely will never travel the BA  flights again!

Absolutely appalling service  by BA! I  requested seats with  more leg room  from a BA  flight to ensure  we was getting  those seats we  needed On arrival  to the aircraft  we did not  get those seats,  the return flight  did the same.  After I applied  with a refund,  After a lot of back and  talks with BA  I started paying  BA back, in  bits and drabs, not the full  price - so , I have  received half of  that amount owed! I traveled 6  weeks ago -  we have called a dozen times,  emailed and filled  in forms and  The last I  knew was that someone would contact  BA and would  sort this matter  up - no  one has called back in 2  days now. When  you call they  say “you can’t  travel anymore, You  need to await  for someone to  help you” BA  they are a  mess I have  stayed patient and  should have done . Worst airline  I have ever  had to deal .

Coming to London : It was  the first time  working with British  Airways and to  be very honest,  it is my  best time ever  travelling with them.  I had a  great experience going  to my destination  as well as  getting back from  that destination.

Heathrow to Barcelona. Reliable. No longer  feels like travelling with a premium . Very functional, but unfortunately at a cost. Flight  took off late,  checked luggage for  one passenger needed to be off , however arrived on time in Barcelona. Excellent information from the flight deck. Cabin crew  rushed and lacked personality. Enough has already been said about charges for  food and drink. Overall falling well  behind the standards of the competition.  A pity really.

Singapore to London.  Customer feedback seems to mirror many  BA users here - BA standards  is just getting worse and worse, and I am talking about business  class which I thought they would maintain? The cabin  carpet was worn and quite grubby,  the seats terrible  and now must  have one of the poorest for  short haul business ? The meal  service presentation is  clearly a joke,  but on my  recent long haul  European trip I got better food in Lufthansa premium economy. Cabin staff  seem quite friendly  - they do  complain in the  air a lot. Chatted to one  with them who  like so many  people are complaining and even deserting BA because of  this fall in  standard - I'm  not surprised and  I for one  to not use them again for long haul. Time for senior management changes, as the  new CEO clearly has no clue  how to run what was once a premium airline. Now, they do little more than  fly low-cost and easyjet for one is far superior and nicer for short hops in Europe.

British Airways appear to be taking positive steps to lift their game. The service on  our flight was flight was materially better than that previously experienced. The  level of the food served had lifted materially. The staff were helpful.  A big downside is that Club  seat sets remains stock standard economy  flight - with the middle seat  taken off. The pitch is tight , too tight in my view.  Another couple of centimetres would be  acceptable Overall, a better BA experience.

Back to Dubai. This is a  taste of what  to expect from  British Airways .  If they continue  their treat passengers  this way I can see the  company very quickly  running into difficulty. The reply I  got from the  airlines below just  throws all the  concerns I raised  under the carpet. Living in Egypt  almost 10 years  and became I  regular flyer with . If I  tried to change the date of  flight with them  BA only charged  about £60. BA want to charge  me over £500  and because I  decided to cancel  the flight and go with a  different airline they  are only prepared  for give me a £9.50 refund  even though I would have given  them over 2 months notice. This airline is on  their black list, makes me ashamed to think this  about my national  carrier but never  again will I book another flight  with BA. There was no priority seat booking unless I paid another  fee extra. There  were no priority  when I booked  for 23D but  it was mysteriously  switched at check  out to 24E.  BA emailed me  they confirm a change in the  booking but did  however say what  that change was.  We did not  make any changes.  My premium economy  seat was wedged in like a  log in a  plane that is only 1" wider than economy with  very few inches extra leg room. Is this some  sort of joke?  They had to  constantly check that  I wasn't in  line as there 's only one  leg difference in  each row. The  complimentary chicken meal  was diabolical. The  indicator light over  the bulkhead luggage  compartment was jammed  on and would  not go out  and no sleep whatsoever. I really  could not see  any necessity for  the light anyhow  as the non  screen lights and  a screen light give emit sufficient light anyway. I  end up paying  much extra for  it and am  extremely disappointed with  the flight. A  couple days previously  we flew premium Economy with Virgin  for return from  London and the  relationship between BA  & Virgin is  worlds apart.

Taking British Airways from Tokyo Haneda  to London Heathrow.  It is one  for the worst  journeys I have ever had. The  seats were so  heavy that I felt every movement  of the passangers  behind me, especially the guy in . Really old entertainment system and my friend next  with me was  using the audio outlet! Food was also horrible.

Back to Toronto.  Well now it  is nothing new  in that the CEOs very aggressive cost cutting, affected  all classes including  Commercial & Business  class called “Club " does not deserve it name, because it is  so appalling! Again it is on  average cost of  each customer and eventually on the  staff who have  too work harder,  because there are smaller teams.  It is not surprising that BA B ranking bounced  back to 40th  and 26th (in ). Fact is  why this airlines  which prefers rather to invest its  resources in flashy  new commercial rather than in its  business does clearly not deserve to  have recommended. New York to London Heathrow.   Economy class check in at T7 , JFK was  extremely polite staff  with better service  then those at Heathrow. The Concorde  lounge is just  every few metres  behind security.  It is nice  enough with a  wide range of  shopping and dining , but washroom / shower facilities  were downmarket. Selected  from couple of a la carte  breakfast choices and  they were nicely  prepared and tasty. Boarding was reasonably  priced  and  everyone onboard offered  free boarding drinks,  food etc. Delay  of about 30  mins on departure , made up during the flight. I opted to  sleep straight after  lift off,   as comfort is  nice if a  bit narrow.  90 minutes before  boarding I had  some fruits and  veggies for breakfast,   accompanied by  very good coffee.   I only  got minimal service ,  the  staff were courteous  & efficient,   and they are  one of very  few good things left after BA , their CEO  appears to have  managed to alienate  the customers of 40 years!   Checking into T5  from Heathrow,  B satellite at 0515 was absolute  mayhem and a  sign I would  take another airline  on this route. We wanted for 4 satellite trains  all pass by  in full before we could even  get to the  Central Terminal -  disappointing to find Immigration in total,  just disorganised chaos.  I buy and pay for my own tickets,   and do feel  the BA is now grossly overpriced  for standards they provide. Please get a CEO that  chooses quality over  price

Back to Marrakech,  BA cabin crew  was lazy and rude, refusing to sell a pack  or sweets which would have not  required more than  10 seconds .  During the duration  for half of  this flight they  are in the  back having a  break during which  their service stopped.  Half way through the flight we  requested some sweets  from the food menu. The lady  we passed said , they will  go back once  she had finished serving some other . After 30  minutes we pressed the bell for assistance and one  of the staff  returned to rudely  say that they  were finished serving other customers even  when none of  the 3 staff  member was seen  helping anyone. We waited 20 minutes , pressing the  call again which  were ignored. After  waiting 10 Minutes  my partner went to the back of the cabin  and order the  package of sweets  but the cabin  crew explained that  they are having  their break now  but that they  stop serving. We  tried for over 1 hour to  order some Jaffa  Chips which would  have taken less  that 30 seconds , it was  too much to ask for. Ryanair or EasyJet Service  is luxury compared to the service of this cabin  and I will  only use BA  and if I  can avoid it  but cannot recommend this airline .

Today was my  second time flying  for British Airways  to Los Angeles  and London Heathrow. I was able  and secure a window seat for myself (without paying  a fee) during online check-in 24  hour prior to . The baggage drop-off experience at  LA and LHR  is smooth. At LAX, the BA staff tags your  checked bags, at  JFK you have  to do it ). The on-board  entertainment was good.  This was my  third time sitting  in the upper-deck  Boeing A380 (which had a special  overhead bin by  a window armrest).  Food options were consistent with what you find on  many transatlantic flights (Chicken or Pasta). There was no WiFi, but BA  provided a good  variety of movies.  I enjoyed BA's  complimentary "movie snack"  as well. The "Flight Map / " wasn't working  during one segment,  this was a  little surprising. Overall,  we had a  good experience and  will consider flying  for BA again.

Flight to Cagliari  seemed to be  a rather pleasant  but well organised . The website  is easy to  navigate and very  soon I checked-in  quickly and simply  had to drop  off my bag.  It arrived very  late for the  departure and noted  that there was  not a queue . The boarding  procedure was quick , efficient and  my interior of  my aircraft was  spacious My seat  was comfortable for  a short flight.  The captain made  pleasant and informative  speeches and the  flight crew I  could see worked  very hard and  were pleasant. The  food made use  fluent Italian and  seemed cheerful and  helpful My gripe  was the awful  selection of Marks and Spencer food.  It has to  have purchased and  a good few  things were not ! There were  no route maps , no entertainment . The lavatory  appeared clean. Disembarkation  time managed well.

Disembark the ship and take our <mask> with Chinese immigration. Option 2 was outrageous, Option <mask> frightening. We felt we had no choice but to choose Option 1.
