When we checked in at PVG we asked if there were business class <mask> available. “Yes, several” was the response. We explained what had happened and asked as a courtesy if <mask> could have those vacant seats. “Yes, for a cost of $12,776 “. Of course we refused to pay that amount. <mask> were then charged additional baggage fees because as we had expected to be flying business class, two suitcases were over the 50 lbs limit for economy. While on board during that flight BA160, I went into the business class cabin and saw that there were indeed vacant seats. When we arrived in London we again asked to be seated <mask> our originally <mask> seats. Were we on the same flight as originally scheduled, but I was informed that our business class seats had already been assigned to other flyers. Apparently British Airways sold our seats or an upgrade to other passengers at our expense.

On to Marrakech.  Was a well organised flight and fairly full in  business class. My  complaint is about the current food  situation This was  another fairly long  haul flight scheduled for 3h 45m  after which a  complimentary meal service  would be welcome  and desirable. After  a lot of  criticism from others  who have flown  there recently we  bought food in the terminal before departure as the coho-ice on board  is very limited, especially as much  appeared to be already 'sold out'.  The biggest issue  is about the  care taken to  organise the food selling. It took  almost all of the flight time  for the crew  would work through  the plane to  fill every row even though I  know that about  quarter of passengers  had nothing. Of  late this led  into problems for  those wishing to  go to the  toilets at the rear when food  sales starts at  up front, any  rows from front to middle have no access to  their toilets after  the trolley has  emptied Passengers resorted  to using the  overhead toilets passing  into business class  this I assume was not welcomed by those passengers.  One overheard a  staff member saying  how they were  now going to  do free sales as they were  short of time.  That is ridiculous  how this paid  very limited service  lasted so long.  I remember the  time when a  Bristol Midland crew  could serve a  fresh cooked breakfast with tea or  coffee to all  20 or so  passengers on a  flight to Middlesbrough  flight scheduled for 40 minutes or  that Aer Lingus  was serving hot  breakfast to all  over a turbulent  journey of 1 hr from Dublin to London. If  people want to  distinguish themselves from  low cost carriers then this is  not the way  you do it.

Oakland to Heathrow , this flight  was fine. The  most that could  be said is  that there is no magic, that  all airlines manage  to provide. Left  and arrived on  a FA attentive  & professional. Food , and alcohol  were in generous ! My only real complaint was  how inflight entertainment was rather poor  with lots of  old films and TV programmes and  very mediocre choice  of music.

On to Sofia.  All crew were  shocked This is the only positive  that British Airways are now becoming  equally bad as Ryanair! Onboard passengers  need to pay  large amount of  money even for  a small bottle of water. When  i booked my  flight from Heathrow  in Sofia, I  was told I  get a free checked in bag  with my baby . A day before my flight  we decided to double check this  so called their  customer service line , the guy  on the phone  informed me I  had to pay for checked in  bag if I  wanted one. I  told him that  there should be  one included for my baby daughter , he said this is not . I asked  him to double  checked this and  then said he  already did so  but had to  settle for a  separate bag (£30  each way) since  he already had my suitcase packed.  Next day, as I went to  do check in at Heathrow, I  am asked how  much bags do  they want to check in. I  replied how many  times am I allowed to check  out and the  man said I  can check in  three bags- one  with my baby  plus the one  that I’ve paid for the previous . The thing  was that I  just had one  bag since the guy on the phone told me  they can only  have one bag  unless I pay  for it first). After I arrived  to Sofia, I  rang British airways , explained everything, so they agreed  I should refund  any money they’ve charged me for  this additional bag.  I said they’ll  refund the £30  from the London-Sofia flight the same  amount and the other £30 fee for the Sofia-London route in about  one week time. A month later  i checked my  flight banking and  found they’ve only  refund £30 for  my outbound journey.  We rang them , they’ve said  we are sorry  but they’ll refund  that remaining £30  over the next  few days. When  they pointed that  they should be fair and reasonable  and I get  a 20% discount  down from my  regular flight price,  they said this is something British  Airways do not .

Singapore to Nassau  to Heathrow. British  Airways is becoming a dismal airline to fly with. I will start with the worst and shocking aspect of my flight from Heathrow to Singapore on Oct 23. There were bugs on the flight and I have bites all over my body at least at a dozen places. One can suffer the bad food,  drink / behavior of cabin staff but having one's health compromised is unacceptable. The toilets were filthy. I was in the paid premium seat (front row) and I could smell the toilet from there. The attitude of staff ranges  between sweet to indifferent and curt sometime for no rhyme or reason. The food is inconsistent and becomes  the pain when you are on a long haul flight because there are no options available. While flying from Nassau to Heathrow, the dinner was fine but the breakfast (I think it was a morning snack), consisted of a croissant which was a cold lump, coffee which was cold and a oats snack bar.  I mean, you cant get a croissant right? The  flight entertainment was  poor at best  which remains much to be desired. The screens in  all Singapore- Heathrow sectors were ok to use but the Heathrow to Nassau sector were malfunctioning all the time. I could  hear the fingers of the passengers sitting behind me trying to function the 'touch screen'; more like punch screen. The flights  ended mercifully on time and full marks for that this time. It could learn well from airlines like Singapore Airlines which are pretty consistent and clean. I am giving the airline 4 of 10 only for value for money.

Flew London Heathrow to Madrid. British  airlines monopoly of the routes to Spain have a  direct impact on  flight quality. BA  owns Iberia so there’s no competition. Planes are the  core of the BA fleet, check-in  was a nightmare  as they operate  each other’s flight, but the online  checking in does not recognize each other’s booking references.  Bringing the worst of BA and Iberia worlds together.

Welcome to Zurich.  Excellent budget airline  at premium prices.  as of late  no cancelled flights.  Charge for luggage,  meals and drinks.  Limited customer services even at Silver level. I have had flights cancelled  in the past  and after a  short time on  my phone offered  a alternative flight  from another airport.  Contact assistance for :

Bari to Gatwick.  Best of the  flight All held together by cockpit  - Follows my review of the  first leg a week back. Check in excellent, not BA staff and  arrival at Bari a breeze. Boarding  poorly organised. Cabin  crew chatting to  each other as I boarded and ignored me. This  seemed inexcusable. Flight  hours ahead of  me and good  communication from cockpit.  Never buy anything this time, smell of coffee far better than the  one from previous  leg Gatwick South unpleasant tho not  our fault. Endless staircases, broken escalator  & a long walk to security where half the e-gates were out of action. Baggage hadn’t arrived anyway , being priority so delay at security irrelevant. Had  to offer to  go to Club  for £89 - a joke as  the is no lounge at Bari  but the onboard value is a  minimum of £30.  I do still  like flying BA as much as I don’t Easy  fly Ryanair. But  upgrading to their levels will put BA out of  business for short . There is now little differentiator.

Saturday morning 0710 , London Heathrow  from Gibraltar. Now  I know that British Airways have  stopped charging for food and drink on European flights  and their service levels are dropping so low that they are now  no better than Ryanair or Easyjet.  There might be M&S food, but  if you can't get any that  will not help.  we were seated  at the rear  of the cabin,  when BA started to charge I have noticed that there is only 1 food cart which started at  your front. Before there would have  be 2 with 1 at the front and 1  in the rear,  now by the time the cart get to you it is 1.5 hrs into the  flight and they  have run out of most things. This flight was  early morning and  BA had bacon rolls on the  tray which were  supposed to be  the best seller and it sells . Pros -  the cabin bag allow best in the business.

Welcome to Gatwick. I fly this  route often as  I have a home in Tuscany. Believe me it  did not get  much better -  unless the option is Ryanair and  much worse. Flight  started in the new South Terminal . The decor  & layout of  this facility is : No problems  - although it's located in a  building so easy  enough to find.  Plane food was ghastly. Cheap baps with greasy bacon  with a dried up "eggy" thing.  I Didn't touch  this and those  who did -  got it as  evidenced by numerous plates with half  price baps. Had  my fruit salad and yoghurt plus  a G&T. Yes I know, bit early in the  afternoon Short walk  to the gate.  I left on  board the usual  aisle 3 for  economy seats in  Club Europe. The front row made it easier -  although only just.  Had a pleasant lunch of chicken  with couscous salad.  My plane was  getting old. This  is confirmed by the WC. Originally  the loo flush button was blue.  At 100,000 +  miles the blue , partly eroded  by finger presses,  became a grey  colour The loo  flush cannot be described here. Plane  arrived on time.  The Captain came  over and I  enjoyed a nice  talk with him.  A nice bloke.  The flight started  in the shared lounge. It okay  you can get  a Same plane  now (recognizable by the flush button in the loo , unless all  other BA319s are  on it). Skipped  my meal as  having eaten lunch in Pisa. It  was nice though.  A few gin  a tonics to suppress my irritation  with what a  terrible product Club Europe is. Great  ride back into  a setting sun.  Prices on all  flights were great.  But very low  fares to the  airlines mean cost cutting by the  new CEO, Mr  Brown who has  no idea on  where to run  the airline. I  once flew BA in 1980 and  saw a difference. Decline is sad  and depressing to see as verified by 80% of  flyers here be  the negative. Time  to find a  new CEO I  think

Las Vegas to London Heathrow. This particular Boeing 747-400 must have been one resurrected from  somewhere in the desert. The condition of this aircraft was appalling. The First Class cabin was literally falling apart with loose / yellowed bins, and filthy carpets.  The entertainment system was old and slow, and low definition. The Premium Economy cabin was directly behind First Class, and those passengers kept using the First Class . It didn't matter, because they were filthy. The dinner in First Class was inedible. British Airways are  hardly a national  carrier British Airways are at best  a three star airline, and maybe even a two star carrier compared  to their competitors.

London City to Edinburgh. Flight left  London and arrived early. Impressed with the legroom on the Embraer 190 (much more comfortable  than BA's A320s). Check-in, security and boarding all went smoothly and quickly. Cabin crew were efficient. Light snack and drink provided on this short . Would fly with BA again  in short sectors,  and LCY is  an excellent airport to use.

On to Gatwick.  Getting in was  easy at the  Air Europe desk and I was very quickly booked in. Fast track  boarding at the  gates wasn’t particularly well managed, although  we did get through quicker than  others would have  expected Disappointingly British  Airways do not  provide any lounge  seating at Faro,  although there is currently a lot  on construction taking  place in the main departure lounge, and the builders  are not exactly  happy with the  area There was no priority queue  for the entrance  to the gate and as usual British Airways did  their fairly half hearted job at ensuring priority boarding  of the aircraft itself. The aircraft  has the new style, which I think is very  nice and nicely decorated (not budget y as some  would like to say), and whilst  its legroom isn’t  great I am  fairly tall and  feel quite comfortable and having the  additional table space makes it a more usable space. The cabin crew  was very friendly  & professional whilst  also being very efficient. A bar service with nuts was delivered soon after take off along with the menu for the  flight All of the cold parts  of the meal and the drinks  were excellent, sadly  my chicken main  being quite overcooked leading to dry  mouth and soggy . That being  said it tasted very nice. Arriving  to Gatwick was  a dream, especially  in a large airport. Although the  planes are quite old and not laid out as  neatly as newer  aircraft they have  did a fantastic  way at modernising  everything and making  things very quick. It took a  long while for  luggage to reach  a belt but  our bags all came out first  making the process  was fairly painless. I got a  great deal on  the flight so  i would say  it was reasonably good value for  cash although the experience in Faro  Airport does reduce  its premium feel .

New Angeles to  Birmingham Heathrow. The  home entertainment was  NOT working so  no tv, video,  internet or radio.  Camera socket not  functioning Headphones not  functioning Customer service very poor. Cabin  crew seemed to  remain unaware that  we were carrying  other passengers upon  leaving their jobs . Food mediocre.  there was no  apple juice or  apple juice on  a dinner trolley  and the cabin  attendant didn't bother  and fetch any.  Beef served with  tea was luke  warm and stewed.  no refreshments supplied unless collected from  a galley It  took 2 days  I get through  the customer relations,  most calls cutting  back after 18  months +, others  responding after going  through options. I  cannot recommend British  carriers who in  this case certainly  do not fly  and serve. The experience was far  below expectations and  is at the  low budget range  of customer service. As the British  flag carrier the  experience was shameful,  our last flight  on this airline.

Malaga to Gatwick.  BA introduced new cabin baggage allowances. Ultimately that means everyone tries to  cram their huge  bags into the overhead lockers, resulting in a Ryanair-like  situation They now charge for food.  It would be fine if it  only take the  airline food trolley  for entire duration  for most short haul flights to get all the way down the  line On my  past three flights  on 'the new  airport we've been  delayed for over  an hour and a half (the last flight was actually over two  minutes without any ). As the economy passengers are not allowed to  use business class , there was  one long queue  for passengers stuck  with the trolley desperately trying to  go to the toilets at the  bottom of the  flight On the  far end of  the trolley a  whole bunch of  people waiting for a scrap of food and drink two hours after take off. The cabin crew seem genuinely fed up. One of the key reasons for  choosing BA was  their friendly cabin crew service. This  have now been absolutely and totally  destroyed by the company, giving them no time (or  effort by the look of it)  to be nice.  But if price  means everything make  what you check  first before you  spend any money  on BA. If price isn’t everything don’t fly BA.

London Heathrow to  Thailand Was looking forward to eventually  going with British  Airlines after flying reguarly to Bangkok  using other airlines - how disappointed I was. A low budget product  at a premium price. I will  never again use  this airline, its the most costly  option (usually) for  a regular journey  in Thailand, but  still ranks the  cheapest of all  3 airlines I've used on this route in past 30 trips. Seatback  was so small  & of poor quality, service is  average seats are  locked with no powerpoints, no wifi  off board. Best  experience of the  journey was getting  home Absolutely shameful  from a national  airline of the UK. Lower your costs BA as you really are  lucky - go fly with any of the Gulf  carriers or a vast majority of  its best, BA  are nowhere near  good enough. Current  is almost a  dollar more than the other 2  direct flights (EVA  and Thai) to Bangkok and British Airways is only half as good as those.

Welcome to Bari.  People who do  not care for ? Queued at  my bag drop.  At 3 desks  - one busy,  one with two staff talking, one  without staff looking  on screen. Barely  moved when it 's my turn,  they asked if  we checked in  the line. Cursory  offered at lounge.  Noticed by cabin  attendant on boarding - he pushed  for me to  return to ground ! Good on  a flight with  the impeccable pilot.  Got a coffee  or dreadful apparently  for coffee. Almost  never eye contact  to cabin crew.  There was a  good price.

Malaga to Gatwick.  Our return trip  after holiday was equally pleasant. Check-in at Malaga was  a breeze although  airport was packed even though a  beautiful Sunday. VIP  Lounge at Malaga  used by BA and other airlines (apparently its the only one there)  are pretty useless  along with the  empty BA lounge that used to be there -  cost cutting ?? Guess we were  cheated by Gatwick !! Drink okay but limited, food pretty awful but  quite comfortable and it is very spacious. Flight left on time and again arrived half an hour early  - I guess  some help from  Queen Ophelia which I guess we were on the fringe of. In board catering and  kept up to  its usual quality and very pleasant  staff - chatted  up the First Officer, nice man. All in all  we were well  looked after in this Class so can't complain.

Gatwick to Malaga.  Last flight with  friends from new home at South Terminal at London  Airport Upon arrival at check-in at 6:30 a.m was  a bit disappointed to see few  people available to deal with Business class passengers resulting in a 20  mins wait to sort out our bags. However, Fast Track through Customs was efficient and made up for  this earlier minor irritation. New lounge in South Terminal is spacious and  snacks and beverages up to the usual good quality, although sadly, the reduction towards a cheap airline is showing in the cracks. A319 to Malaga was uneventful and onboard food was well presented and of good quality. We arrived 30 mins ahead of schedule due  some fortunate winds so cannot complain. Overall flight quality  continues to be excellent.

From Heathrow to  London Deliberate extortion  by BA in  My opinion. I  had an economy  flight return from  Birmingham to London  on BA. Days  after the outbound  i had to  cancel a change  of the outbound  flight and go  1 day earlier.  I ended up  booking a new  original outbound flight . BA app  said when i  wanted to change  and cancel just  my original outbound ! In the  end I received  the medsage that  a return flight  is ready for  flying in from . However app  finally gave up  and said I  have logged in  so many times.  Upon arrival at  BA I was  advised BA had  changed my return  flight as i had multiple bookings.  They said I  had to pay  over £350 to  buy a new  return ticket home,  only after I  described my situation.  I argued that  have I been  there that they  have cancelled my  tickets 5 days  earlier when they  said I could  have at least  found a cheaper . Even the  week before when  I got the  ticket in open  I would have  forced me to  pay cheaper. Eventually  BA customer relations  guy offered a  refund for £122  ( me again for taxes). As  i needed to  fly back and  there was no  time to go  to Gatwick for  my flight I  saw no choice  than to pay.  Time and conditions may well tell that flight will  be cancelled but  when I asked  this person how  often people he thinks read t&c  they said he  does not like  to comment.

Chicago to Orlando  - Worst ever  UK Business Class  flight  We  have experienced many  flights and many  different classes of travel over the  decades but this  most recent flight  showed the depths  in which British  airlines have descended (not the world’s  largest airline by ). We have  never liked BA’s  First Class (Club ?) seats since  we changed over  to the Yin-Yang  configuration of 8  rows across the  globe The seat  layout together with  the poor service,  and we can  now say this  was the worst  ever long-haul Business  Economy flight we  have experienced. To  THIS day I  have never understood  that from a  security and safety  perspective the CAA  have ever allowed  this seat configuration  from the first  time Unless you  have sat in  your aisle seat,  cabin crew have to reach over  to passengers to  deliver hot drinks/meals  which is just  impossible (True this  happens in other  economy classes as well but usually  in a less  awkward angle and  certainly not from  above your head!)  in order to  move out of  those centre seats  between E and  F and the  economy seats you  get to climb  into another passenger’s  lap if they have their foot rest down and  legs reclined. In the dimmed cabin  lights this is  dangerous and potentially  fatal as a  passenger you normally  ended up kicking  any passenger you  tried climbing over. We are both  able bodied but  far less mobile  so really struggle  to get out  from the aisle  from whatever reason.  I almost feel  uncomfortable in the  middle seats and  we are often  just ignored because  other cabin crew  just pass by  too often from  behind you so  in the time  I notice them,  we have gone.  We should not have to use  the call button  just to get  good service. The  second leg was  another night flight,  but service overall  was very poor,  the crew just  needed to turn  the lights down ASAP. The service  during breakfast was  also poor, the  meals were inconsistent.  My wife struggled  desperately to get  the orange juice  to her side  of the cabin,  so I at  times got that but struggled to  get a second  mug of coffee.  Our entertainment system  was archaic (very  little recent film ) the small  screen resolution was  very poor; this  aircraft was delivered  by BA in  late 1999 and  it shows its  flaws This flight  may have been  a few hundred  dollars cheaper than  usual but in  return we will  need the extra to get a  cheaper seat and  unfortunately BA are  still getting away with retaining these  economy seats versus  allowing access for  all because the  US passenger market  is letting them.  This is obvious  if your employer  was paying and  therefore you can  either choose to  take an economy  flight or one  if those dreadful <mask> class seats, <mask> will obviously <mask> the business <mask> seat and <mask> up with <mask> difficulties and <mask> service. It <mask> be marginally <mask> than being <mask> at the <mask> but that <mask> not make <mask> right. We <mask> probably never fly BA long-haul business class (Club <mask> again while <mask> are paying <mask> the tickets <mask> they stop <mask> so arrogant <mask> re-configure their <mask>

Coming to Abu jah I told  someone at check-in , I would  not interested in upgrading to Premium  Plus if a  new seat was . The lady  replied "can I  check - you  are only interested  in upgrading if  there is a  seat I replied ." After a  bit of phone  conversations the upgrade  was processed (I  spent 149 GBP).  My seat had  neither window or  seat at all  and that seat  was situated at  way back of  Premium Economy where  no toilets should ! When I  boarded I was told that seats  should not be  upgraded so I  have no complaint.  No refund offered,  some token gesture  but nothing. The  staff was nice , the seat  felt very comfortable. If it wasn't  of the rude  staff service I would fly again.  This was led  into believe I  could pay for  the window seat  but I paid in good faith. I've flown BA for years, but this year has  been disappointing. I  cannot fly with  BA again.

Gatwick to Faro.  Really good flight all round, and  my ticket was  still in sale , car hire as well, it  turned out good ! Check in  point at south  landing is very  quick and I was checked in very quickly, with  fast track security  also quick. The  whole BA lounge is really well decorated and laid  up with lots  of nice and varied seating, interesting  light fixtures and  great views of  the tarmac. It  being early morning  but breakfast was  available which was  really good. Although the hot options  was just bacon  and omelette roll  and porridge which  is quite limited. Staff were all  friendly Boarding was quick, cabin crew  pleasant although no pre flight drink at all offered. This was an  old aircraft with the old style  seats but the aircraft was clean and didn’t show  any sign of  deterioration The seats  are comfortable enough,  the legroom is  pretty amazing. I  got lucky enough  too be in the front row  which had more  then most. The  airline breakfast was  also fairly good  we think, nothing world shattering but  nicely cooked and fairly good quality . Disembarkation was  pleasant enough, although  it took quite  the while. Priority  baggage didn’t seem to count for  very lot, and  unfortunately my priority  boarding tag had  come off and ended up being  part of the  first bags. Overall  a good flight.

Jet to Madrid in economy class.  Easy booking and  was an expensive  flight to fly  to Heathrow. Online  checked in and  checked luggage to  carry in so  the process was  easy Boarding quite . Cabin was  awful - carpets,  doors and windows  were unpleasant and  i believe a  few set foot  in the earlier  flight Everything pay onboard if you  wish to eat  & drink, choice okay in brochure , the speed  of serving this  was awful. Staff  seems to have  no problems with  the card payments,  which became bad  attitude towards those  amongst us wanting  to buy. I  would have minded  having a cheap  flight but this  did not a  classic case of  a BA in . Will avoid  if possible.

It was told  over the Saturday  morning my hand  bag was fine  ( right size)  by BA staff at Geneva airport - it was  also inspected. Then,  last Monday, I  was ordered to pay £65 (83 Francs). Staff at the airport were  incredibly rude (to be honest, the  staff particularly). Their  customer service is  simply awful. It's  the joke of an airline compared to competitors like Qatar. When filing a complaint, they did not respond for 3 weeks.  The only responded  when I chased them up, said  response time is  in 4 weeks. Can you believe that? The explanation  was their IT system failed in May 2017, an internal matter which  was clearly still  be resolved.

From Cayman to  me I can't  comprehend is why  a flight that  takes up to  take 12 hours  of travel across  an Atlantic Ocean, only allows 1  hour in free  travel for economy class. Upon returning  home GCM from  Dubai on October  31 2017, I  decided to pay  extra for additional  flights  Particularly  for university students (such as myself) who migrate from such distances to achieve good education. . In addition , the disgusting  excuse for additional  baggage has BA  gone so cheap , they no longer provide a  complimentary travel toothbrush,  sunscreen & eye mask for 12  hours flights? That 's one of  the things I  dislike most about BA as it  make me feel  that I am truly disappointed with  them these days and whenever the  opportunity comes that another airline travels directly to LON  or GCM you guarantee I WILL  USE BA!

As to Paris  or London, after  traveling with them I have to  agree it's probably the worst airline I have been flying. When I boarded the plane,  you notice some  bags on the  seat and wall next to my. I assume for long distance flight  BA should provide  with a mask  for you to sleep, ear plugs, maybe a small tube of toothpaste.  Usually you have some headphones and that's all. With  British Airways, you can order some  free meals. I received my first  on callries meal  as expected but  I could not  eat the breakfast. One of the  flight crew asked me if I  wanted a special meal. The plane  is quite old. I tried BA, never again.

Back to London  on the return  flight from our  previous BAs product was more like a 'posh' Ryanair style of product even down to  them asking for  discounts towards their  flight There were  very few noticeable differences on the  plane there was  some entertainment if  we were in a seat where you could view  the TV screen. On Ryanair, Easyjet , other low  cost airlines you  can pay using cash but no  with BA it  is card payment  made in sterling.  Our aircraft was clean and tidy  however overall the main BA product has gone downhill and the service  levels have slipped.  Between this flight  and my recent flights from London  and with BA , there is a vast standard  to the cabin  service standards.

Back to Gatwick.  Thanks to adverse  conditions our return  flight was delayed  3 days. When  it did fly,  their cabin crew  was totally unaware  about the fact  and the passengers  have had a  stressful and frustrating . They were  completely unsympathetic and  had a chaotic  scene throughout the  journey The catering  staff was absymal,  limited choice of  the meal; hardly  any bar service  and no tea/coffee  and I suspect  because the aircraft  were empty from  landing they hadn't  properly loaded the  snacks & drinks ? In contrast  to the outgoing  flight this was  one flight to  be endured -  it shows what  little difference the  airlines can make.

Back to Gatwick.  the staff that  looked after us  both out to Florida and home  were outstanding, on the way home  my seating had  been already arranged , my seat was separate from  my two children, I was really  stressed about flying home away from  two children, I spoke to the  flight supervisor who  kindly asked two passengers if they  should switch seats which they were  happy to do.  The seats were very good and  far back enough  that you were able to get  good sleep, the  main thing we weren’t to happy  on was the  seats but I  know you can’t have everything. All  in all I would book to  go with BA again and would highly recommend.

Flight Leeds Bradford  Zurich Geneva via London Heathrow. British Airways certainly shocked me with the budget low cost style. My bag was 23.1 kg (0.1kg over the limit). This meant I had to pay for two bags whilst only having one. When  they asked to take one item  off and put it in my carry on to avoid paying an extra £25 or so, the answer was no, which was odd considering  the bag was on the belt right infront of  me On board  the aircraft boarding was prompt, a clean sleek cabin. I was seated near the back  nearest to the toilet, which wasn't a problem. Beverage  service was okay,  but was over priced, I bought a ginger ale for £2 and it was a  can which shocked me as it was advertised as a full size can. The only thing that was free on board was water, for an international service  on quite an expensive ticket it 's a little disappointing. The crew were friendly and helpful but I couldn't help but overhear the crews  conversation in the galley on descent into Switzerland. What they were talking about was inappropriate, especially how loud they were talking  about children nearby. Apart from those  issues the flight was on time, punctual and served  a purpose which I paid for.

Los Angeles to Doha via London. Great staff, poor food and stupid  seat layout. I’m spoilt flying gulf airlines, but this time I tried  the rear facing  seat 4 of 345 configuration. Firstly, staring in the face of my  2 new best friends (seats facing forward) was at best weird, and at worst like a business class speed dating experience. Crew could barely serve me, ventilation was restricted and access 100% blocked  to the foot rests of forward  facing passengers. Once  my security screens went up I felt like I was in some  type of flying  accident and was tempted to assume brace position to give the impression I had died and was on a viewing. The  food was embarrassing bad - bigger  bowl of economy style food in bigger economy style  in BA, you have great crew  struggling to do their best with silly cabin engineering and poor catering .

London Heathrow to Istanbul. British Airways  is quite clearly in decline and with utter contempt  of its customers, even loyal ones who have status like myself. The overall feeling is  like an airline that is miserly  or skimping and  completely removed of  any image that  they try to portray of being  the premium airline.  Cabin South in  Istanbul is large, airy and well equipped and clean  and was not  very busy on  this Sunday I  visited Drinks are well stocked but  from the catering  department is evident this is an  organisation scraping to do the bare  essentials in what it offers - the quality lacking with minuscule portions for breakfast and loading up of cheap carbs and curtailing of premium  food Onboard it is similarly tired,  the plane had not been cleaned and my seat had food debris  in the previous  flight and stains  in the tray table. Seating is cramped. The cabin  staff look dejected  and have low morale. Onboard experience the service is  quite different, than  with easyJet, in fact I would argue worse. There is no complimentary  and you are  treated to M&S , It is  not cheap and  not good value  nor any better  than LCC offerings. Service is slow  - took the  majority of 4.5 hours of the  journey - meaning difficulty to going to the toilet  thanks to the trolley blocking the  door - I  have even asked  to wait until  food was finished which is ludicrous given it took  my whole flight to serve people. The slow service is due to  the use of  cash only payment,  but also the fact the supplier  cannot allow their  own items to be on the trolley which means  a ridiculous scenario of cabin crew constantly running to the galley to  get items and further slowing it . On the return journey its  evident BA doesn't care about its European or non-North American routes -  our lounge was  the contract lounge  that was very  cramped in fact  there was dark , and furniture filthy, but least  my food was decent. Overall if  I wasn't for  this fact I flew with FF B and the low tax on redemptions within Europe, I would never  again pay the full cash fare for this airline  as you get better more efficient  experience on the likes of EasyJet now within Europe  and no difference in overall product now complimentary catering has been removed.

On to London , Premium Economy  and onto Oslo  in Economy. Easy  check in and  to the lounge  in 15 mins.  Our usual selection  including dry sandwiches,  and a chicken  & soup (minus  some chicken and  soup The lounge  was clean with  members of staff  chatting away. Efficient  wifi with sparking  hot drinks offered.  Fast departure, fast  food service and  breakfast before lights . There was  no breakfast (previously !) with the  coffee bar now  long gone. Early  with a short  stop for a  drink in the  Club Lounge, followed  with an ok . An early  departure and an  overnight flight on  the A319. Long  queue for the  flights (only one  was for all  of economy as  one other was  able to provide 2 more seats)  Very slow buy  on board service  but at least  one made it  into the last , mainly down  to little take  up of food  and drink. Early  on though a  long wait for  Air Oslo to  start on a  train was verging  on a farce,  a full flight,  no use of  our overheads delayed , whilst crew  scrambled for space.  Fast buy onboard  carried out quickly  for one and  saw the second  luggage machine dying  as the first  one served. Service  came to a  halt whilst the  crew tried to  get either machine  coming into life,  took out the  required visa slips,  put the cart  came in, re-appeared  20 mins later , service started  an hour into  the flight. Little  catch up as  BA had given  in including me as there was  still time left  for enjoy the  service The crew  tried really hard,  kept a brave  way on and kept going. The  quality and concept  for the BA  experience on board  was a disgrace.  Only a third  person provides the  cash and card  holders the choice,  the holding and the reliability of  the machines means  that service is  another farce.   We don't understand  how BA continue  the struggle with  the service as  all Ryanair and  low cost carriers  seemed to have  got to cracked  it and got  their act together.  Easy arrival and fast bags completed  our flight. Final  journey home to  Oslo was good,  The club lounge  in the B 380 remains quiet,  relaxed and an  option to relax  or eat/drink before  landing The 787 was towed to the gate 45  minutes before departure  and was never  ready to leave  in time. At  our gate, the  lounge was enhanced with an upgrade  to business class.  I was really  cold on boarding  we had to  settle for champagne,  with the underwhelming  selection of toiletries  or shades only  arrived after take  out We pushed back over 30  mins No signs  or life from  crew for another  20 mins, though ! positive enhancement was tray service <mask> drinks which <mask> more classy <mask> a cart. <mask> main of <mask> was excellent <mask> looked to be on new <mask> and plated <mask> cooking (no <mask> gravy or <mask> around the <mask> Afternoon tea <mask> underwhelming with <mask> scones and <mask> three sandwiches <mask> wrapped in <mask> Overall, the <mask> in service <mask> to have <mask> with some <mask> improvements. The <mask> on all <mask> flights were <mask> but lacking <mask> and experience. The desire to <mask> things by <mask> book results <mask> slow and <mask> service at <mask> Other than <mask> farce of <mask> on board, <mask> was pleased <mask> appeared to <mask> no further <mask> in service. <mask>

My early morning  flight from Gatwick to Malaga was  a very pleasant experience overall. The  plane departed on time and was  greeted by competent  staff amiable and very experienced cabin . Announcements were  helpful and friendly. However there was  a route map , many of  the snacks listed  on the Marks and Spencer to buy menu were  not available at  all I must  admit that the cost of the  flight was outrageous  but off putting.

London to London. Slowest baggage drop  down I have ever experienced. I spent a whole  hour waiting to drop my bag  waiting for people who have already  signed in). I seriously do not  know how they can be so slow. People have already checked in,  I just need to leave a bag. The company really needs to look after their processes

A return British Airways flight from  Manchester to Sofia  was a service of 2 halves. The outboard leg  looked very good from London to  London the check in was swift  & efficient, boarding the flight was simple and quick.  The 2 bag on the flight policy was enforced and stowing bags on the plane was quick. Disembarking off the plane  seemed straight forward and easy. The flight was worth a good 8  instead of 10.  My return flight from Sofia to London was the opposite. Check in was slow and  very inefficient. There was no priority  ahead of the plane and it was a Ryanair type of scramble  on board the  flight The 2 bag on the  plane policy was not enforced so many people got on the flight with a roller bag, a rucksack  & then a small holdall! The  poor cabin crew had a nightmare  time trying to stow all the  baggage before take off. Once airborne the M&S service was sold out before halve of the economy cabin was served. With only drinks and crisps available towards the end. Finally  landing the plane was a slow and drawn out affair as passengers where trying to locate their 3 bags while holding up the isle.  Overall I would give this leg 4 out of 10.

Welcome to London.  British Airways used  once be my favourite airline, however,  for the last  few years I  had experienced some  poor service in  just much every  flight I have  travelled with them. I do fly  to BA about  5 times a  year In this  latest occasion my  trip was cancelled  for apparent adverse  circumstances (this being  at the middle of summer in  a time where the weather was excellent in both  our departure/arrival cities)  I was told  about this the day before in  mid afternoon bearing  into mind I 'm flying at  in the morning ! Their communication  is made via  phone including a  suggestion to call  them to re  book my flight.  I must have  tried that number  over 30 times  with success as  both lines were  so busy. When  they managed to  ring I have  managed to hold for an hour  in the line , I have  finally managed to speak to them at 11pm that day when they  informed me they  want me on  a flight 4.5 hours later. Horrible  airline service by  that way, the  person I was  talking to couldn't  complain less. I was originally flying  a business and  I was placed  on economy instead.  I was told  that there was no compensation for  my delay because  this was due  in the weather , (a lie of course as  the weather was  absolutely amazing in  both countries) and promised a refund  on the fare  that to date (about 4 months ) has still  never happened. If  I call them  to transfer your  seat to India where if you  were lucky you  have an hour  waiting to end  up speaking to  someone unable to help. What once  became the best airline is now  better than Ryanair.  Avoid if possible

They used to  offer a nice  service with great  customer service, those  queues are long . If you  are in their " class" you  can get what  you used to  receive in economy  10 years ago:  Same leg space, same food, same drinks. Forget about  a welcome drink  and take off,  main course dinner (was offered a  nice club sandwich  on my last  stop and personalized ). Economy class  is just like  Norwegian or Ryanair,  but you will  spend much less  than the latter . Shame.

London Heathrow to New York. After reading reviews I was hoping some  would inaccurate, but after this flight  on Club World I realise that  quality has fallen even lower than many have said.  Check in at T5 was interminably slow with one  and the most arrogant staff I 've encountered for years. The lounge was crowded and dirty, and the food selection is terrible for a premium facility. Onboard, seats are old and tatty, cramped and uncomfortable and  offer no privacy whatsoever. The food was passed across my neighbours seat to reach me,  so what a lousy offering this was - below many airline economy meal standards. IFE screen was not working properly, fuzzy and very poor. Cabin crew were polite and trying to be friendly, but they certainly hide in the galley as soon  that they can and judging from the standard of the toilets towards the end of the flight, they do not see it as part of their job to maintain these. Luckily, I am leaving the USA to Asia from Los Angeles next week on Eva Air and expecting a big step up in standards.

South of Spain  via Gatwick via  Santa Lucia was  another good experience.  We don't have  many complaints regarding  my seat quality  of flight attendants,  they did a  really good job  on the flight  in keeping the  flight safe and  providing meals and  snacks The seat  was comfortable enough,  little bit wider  and on low  cost flights, I  wanted extra space  but as I  thought the leg  space between seats was regular. I  had a seat  in the bulkhead  had enough leg room There was  another minor issue,  our flight had a stop at  St Lucia, after  that the new flight attendants insisted  upon waking up the people on  their front row,  through their entertainment  center screens, to  show them the  latest video which  had shown about  every hour and  a half on  take off from  Port of Spain.  We told them  was not necessary  they view the  footage again and  that the video  were not available  on time, so  that would be something the management  should look into. In-flight entertainment was  excellent with no  problems which pleased  me a lot.  They had a  female passenger next  the me in  my middle seat,  she had a  lot too much  to drink and  moved a lot in the seat,  he talked louder  when necessary, but  it was still fun to have  around and the  new attendants made  it in a  really polite and  efficient way that  sometimes does not  bother the other , There were  also issues during  boarding at the  new airport in  Port of Spain,  as BA staff  had to put  the priority tag  into my bag  or give me  the voucher for  their lounge as  they have a  BA card on  arrival To use  the lounge I  needed to use  a Priority Pass , to waste  time until the matter was cleared  on the ground  and I was  going further from  Barcelona to Istanbul  on Turkish Airlines,  normally I would  still have to  pass airports in  Europe and as  a result go  through immigration, take  my baggage out,  board again, pass  screening and security  again but BA  did have an  arrangement with Turkish  Airlines and I  refused to go  over this lengthy  process

From London Heathrow to Chicago. Simply . Aircraft was old configuration B-747-400 , Premium Economy  Class to First  Class Cabin was filthy, and carpets  ripped up. Food  is inedible. The  food system was  extremely slow, and  lacking resolution. No  one of course,  why British Airways  chief executives should  have forced to endure this awful  experience and sample  for themselves. For  them to call  them "First Class"  are insulting, demeaning,  and arrogant in  an extreme. These  terrible aircraft need to be replaced  for the lovely A380, and the entire First Class  / Club Class  program should be  improved / enhanced.  But of course,  it will never  happen whilst this airline has a  complete monopoly across  the Atlantic.

On to Gatwick.  We left on time and the plane was clean and modern. The  crew were friendly. The flight was  about 40 minutes and the crew worked hard to  help and serve  passengers who wanted to buy food  and drinks but  are not sure  we made it  on the final  destination I think the problem is  as there are only 2 staff  to service the economy cabin whereas  in our EasyJet flight out there  had been 4 staff (as there  were no business ) I still  cannot think the buy on board is working that  effectively but that  is not the  airlines fault. We were pleased to  be 20 minutes early although it was a shame to have to  take a bus  to the terminal.  This BA offering is now on a par with  lower cost carriers and as we got a competitive  deal for this  flight we were fairly happy.

Return to Tirana.  First flight on  an outward and return journey. The  aircraft was adequate for a short  trip but only limited pitch. The aircraft was clean. Cabin crew were  friendly and friendly  throughout the journey  and busy selling food and on board goods. The main advantage of  the airline was  its direct flight  connecting UK to  Europe otherwise nothing special to recommend. Both flights on time.

I booked British Airways to travel  on the assumption  this was a quality carrier not a low cost carrier. I expected a meal and  coffee to be . I was  unaware of the  price changes and  therefore very disappointed  as I booked. This airline is no longer quality  with the prices  we charge. Expect a budget airline experience here. Staff  was very friendly and helpful however. Pilot also chatty throughout the flight giving us lots of info.

Mal Lumpur to  Dubai via London.  The long haul  nice and clean,  short haul a  bit old, but  very acceptable. Crew  members are lovely,  great service. BA  crew is on  the top of  their rank. Kuala ala to London My boyfriend and I got beef  tacos and chicken  salad as dinner , beef omelette  for breakfast. Also  quite tasty. We  got 2 wines  for so many ! Return flight  with chicken curry  with pesto pasta.  Makes it flavorful.  And we got  a congee and  rice breakfast before  I landed. Short  flights don't have  much food. Inflight  is not the  best but still  good Short hauls don't have any ! Only thing I don't like  is the seats.  My seats are  comfortable I have  a problem with , since I  am a petite  person but still  really uncomfortable to  sit straight up.  But I knew  that I will  get a premium  because that one  is nicer and  with more space.  We got the  lowest price for  this trip, value  the money!

Jet flew from Brussels to London  early on an . The aircraft  were about three quarters full. Boarding was smooth and we left and arrived slightly early. The sale of  sandwiches and drinks  goes well and  not appear to  have much of  our take up  as this flight  in less than  an hour. Crew  were good.

We flew from London Heathrow to Sofia and back. The plane on both flights was an Airbus 321 and I’d guess a young one  just by the  look of the interior. I am 1.82m (6 feet)  short and found  both leg room and seat width  should be fine  - I certainly didn’t feel cramped even in the centre seat. Both flights departed the gate on schedule  but actual take-off  for the outbound flight was slightly delayed because of  the traffic restrictions over Europe). The  airline crew on both legs were pleasant and courteous. On both flights, the captain kept us very well informed of our  destinations and our  seats So far,  good marks to British Airways but  how they let  you down is the shambles of a refreshment service. It might seem  as a minor  inconvenience but I do like the opportunity to get something to eat  and drink on a flight even if I have to pay for it (which you do not on other legacy airlines  including Lufthansa). The range and prices of food and  beverages on offer were comparable with  low cost airlines I have flown with. But there  is comparison ends  because whilst I  had always been served quickly (and  sometimes twice) on short haul low-cost airlines, BA’s service  is too slow  and seems to  run out of  touch too. They also insist on  check only transactions. I had the  opportunity to be sitting toward the  rear of the plane on both legs - and  this A321 is  no long plane.  A single trolley  started from the front, making ponderous progress towards me  - even though the flight was  three hours and forty minutes long, I only just  managed to get a coffee and sandwich from a slightly harried flight  crew who by  then had returned the trolley and was scuttling to  safety from the  back squeezing past  another long queue of passengers waiting for the lavatories. (The coffee, by the way, was excellent). The return  journey was worse because the trolley  make it two  rows down the aisle and was getting tantalisingly close  to me before  abruptly stopping and  returning to the  floor leaving the remaining passengers unserved. In conclusion, clean  but punctual service,  poor cabin crew  and awful refreshment service.

Flight to Bilbao. Boarding of the  aircraft at Heathrow  was very good , the flight was on time  and the plane was clean. Frequent flyers boarded first  then the rest  passengers followed. From  then on the service was very  comparable to a  Delta Jet or  Emirates flight. The  airline crew member's  were economy passed  around the cabin selling M&S sandwiches , snacks and  drinks The flight out of Bilbao  got delayed by a late incoming  flight information on the delay was a little slow in coming from  the gate agent.  Nevertheless the crew  was very efficient loading the flight when it finally landed. The flight crew also managed  the shave 15 mins off the flight time too.  So the service onboard is similar to Eurowings. Both  flights were safe  and competent. But  in actual flight experience was lacking  and in future I will consider  Emirates or similar  as they offer the same level  of service for  less money.

Flight to London  - No priority  food at Kalamata. Drink and food  are poorly synchronised,  so no pre-dinner ; no nuts,  and bread served  as main course.  The vegetarian special  was the same tomato and mozzarella  pasta as on  the outbound flight  despite a beetroot  pasta dish being available on the  same menu. The  vegan main was yet again a bland, overcooked pasta . Overall, a  disappointing vegetarian offering.  Flight crew did  a bare minimum in Club Europe  and their main  business seemed to  involve selling the M&S stuff in  toilets which they  kept doing up  until 30 minutes  after landing. The  Club Europe toilet was grubby. Flight  landed on schedule  but there was  a long wait  with baggage at  customs

London Heathrow to Krakow. I am a one world emerald member on  Emirates so I  get certain perks when flying British  Airways such as free seat selection,  lounge use and priority boarding -  this makes this airline bearable -  but They are obsessed with carry  over bags much  like Ryanair giving out silly yellow  bags for carry on bags and  other carry on  luggage - not sure what it  means for them  - it only  increases their bag handling costs. Their seats are no better than anyone else and their pitch just as tight. What used  too set BA apart was their  customer service - even in coach a sandwich or  coffee - this has degraded to nothing, zero -  even a soft drink is charged.  When I asked  a water, I  got offered an Evian for $5 - no thanks , plain water.  Yes sir we will come back  to you after  they serve everyone else. Of course he never came  in - 2.5  hr flight and  not even allowed a cup of  coffee BA are  rated as a 4 star airline,  but AA are  rated 3 star  and AA now have better inflight service than BA by a country  and BA are a bottom tier airline and nothing more to the  frequent flier.

London Heathrow to Abuja, Nigeria with British Airways. Departed on time, paid extra for legroom seat aisle side of exit door, don'0t bother as  plane has no pocket for documents, glasses etc.. Seat  too narrow that you cannot move, seat cushion hard and old. Cabin crew comment, you have extra legroom arent you lucky ,my comment - yes and I  went for it when I asked about lack of pocket for my specs and passport. Food was bland. Arrived on time. Departing Abuja on return trip I had an aisle seat, again narrow and extremely uncomfortable. Old aircraft. Cost cutting squeeze in Economy will drive customers away as comparable airlines offer much more. Now  that number and particularly the dimensions of the toilets have been reduced you can hardly fit into the toilet. Food on return trip was a so called breakfast, yellow mass called an omelette  or some sort of potato fritter. Cabin crew went through the motions but seemed in a hurry to get service finished and to disappear. Return flight was on time. Punctuality was BAs saving grace.

Welcome to Tokyo . Boeing 777 , tatty inside, cabin items (seats, carpets, tables etc)  dirty and dirty. Sticky surfaces, and  scary to think what germs are being stored here.  Quality standards are very poor compared to Lufthansa and ANA that I flew earlier this year, reflects the  BA move to  fly budget standard airline at premium prices. Cabin staff  are nice but even they cannot  make up for  the poor other areas have gotten  from BA. Time  to remove the  cheap airline minded  seats there now,  but surely Skytrax must now downgrade them to 3  stars at best?

London Heathrow to  Hong Kong. A  slightly mixed experience.  On the positive  the cabin crew  was professional and  our Cockpit announcements very informative. Flight  on time, with  need to catch  someone for a  bit at departure due to tech . In terms  a hard product,  it was a  little disappointed. The Premium economy cabin  looks clean and  spacious but the  seat is pretty  heavy and not  that comfortable for  the long night , Entertainment screen  is slow to  open (happened to  happen to with another A380 from BA so means it's an issue  for the hardware). Food is decent quality, but the  service at least  the PE, could 've improved. The  baggage delivery has  become a pain,  30 minutes from  the landing to  a delivery of  your bags is  pretty much, even for such a  large airplane.

Back to Alicante. Yesterdays flight was grim from the moment of arriving  at our boarding  gate and seeing two long lines  with a stag and a hen party in various stages of drunkenness. Not really the  kind you feel safe being in  a very confined space with and especially with a  young baby. The  mood and behaviour  grew even more threatening as the  luggage trolley ploughed up and down the aisle. Especially awful as we were confined to  our smallest seating  area possible. It was all truly  frightening and very disheartening as we  have driven for  weeks to avoid these conditions in  our aurlines. Previously we had had  the lot of respect for British Airways standards now thoroughly destroyed.

From London Heathrow , Kalamata. Slow  flight on this new BA destination  in Greece. Club house seats uncomfortable for a 4 hour flight, particularly  as the seat  out front is  removed just before  the meal service.  Good IFE. Cabin  staff were professional and attentive throughout.  The service definitely  impressed although the  only main course  included the usual bland, overcooked pasta.  Service on schedule  and through to  ground hire within ten minutes of  boarding Overall, a reasonable flight, although  Continental Europe is  poor value by  a business class  flight

Gatwick to Mauritius.  A disappointing airline and service. The facing each other seats are fun theoretically but when reality hits, it's a mess. Why? Because you get other people stumbling on your feet  sometimes mid-flight. Or is it just my luck and most the other passengers on business class were old  people not flexible  enough to jump over the foot stool and wake you mid-sleep every time they need  to use the restroom? The TV 's colors are so off. it was a nightmare trying to enjoy any movie. Getting  enough brightness right to make the colors work. Because if you don't want the monitor to blind you when it's snooze  then good luck watching the movie in any other  color than black  and red. The worst thing was the food - salad was frozen. The beef filet was so dry and flavorless but too salty. My partner's chicken was swimming in a  lot of oil and flavorwise, it was hitting all the wrong spots. They believe in  flavor and dump  shit ton of  butter on their food to make  them taste edible but did they get that wrong.  He ended up eating bread and butter only. Same goes for the scrambled eggs for breakfast. Bacon was extra salty.  And the fresh  fish bowl was  not as frozen  with the salad.  A very poor  very disappointing experience.

Welcome to London. I am a regular BA flyer and so generally my expectation is low nowadays as they almost become  a Tier 2 airline. The journey  was in the Concorde lounge Dubai  and it is  this very small area with little food that in the two hours  I was there was not refreshed. Onboard the 777 you begin to sense the jobs worth attitude of the staff who  want to permanently work to rule.  Then when the  food came it  had only an  evening snack with no options. They  claim this is to allow maximum sleep. No other airline has done  this Breakfast was undercooked slop and  coffee was inedible. It is incredible that you can spend 10000 usd  for a ticket  and you can't even get a  drink The airline is clearly failing fast and I wish now I  have flown the luxury of Emirates  for half the price. Very disappointing and they don't care.

From Heathrow to  Southampton Had a very nice flight , good cabin  service and informative  BA crew. First time to experience a 375 ml  shot of champagne on the drinks  tray which was chilled for me. Terminal 5 is a nice place to start any trip and would choose BA for my next holiday.

Compare Gatwick to Funchal. In my  experience British Airways have got things  horribly wrong in  the race to the bottom. For travellers in Economy BA are now  simply another budget carrier and not a very good one at that.  Management have failed to understand what their true market is all about. Generally if people  want to use a cheap budget carrier they will use the likes of Ryanair or Easyjet. The BA brand has always been associated with  a quality that a full service  aircraft provides, but sadly not any more. The choice of food for sale to the economy passenger is not only poor but it's expensive. Frankly it must be embarrassing for the cabin crew to make announcements saying that the business class passengers  can be offered  a hot meal and free drinks but all those  in economy must . And that assumes that from the enormous range  and 2 types of sandwich on offer that there will be any . On our  journey to and from Funchal there was a single trolley for the  full economy cabin,  in each case taking more than 2 hours to  move it from the front to  the back. Service  would only have been any slower  because the crew were trying to sell scratch cards  mixed with the  free food and drink! Maybe that's  in the next  phase of the BA master plan?!  British Airways used to be a national carrier to be proud of  but these days they are just an embarrassment, not a full service airline or a decent budget carrier, simply lost somewhere in the middle. As a fairly regular traveller of many years my preference would always been to travel  with my national  carrier but this  run to the bottom is driving  people away. Don't BA management understand  that there are many people who would gladly pay a little bit more for 'free' food and drink?  Yes I think  I know the answer. All we need now is a bugle playing as the plane touches down and the sad transition from world class carrier to poor budget imitator will  become complete.

Zakinthos to London Heathrow. Poor check in at Zante airport. Not enough desks, slightly clueless  and Mrs B had to deploy laser beams to get front row  seat was free. Slightly late departure and made to wait on hot bus for while before boarding. After that very good flight again. Much busier Club cabin than on way out so two staff but they were still very  helpful Beetroot carpaccio , Goats cheese, melt in mouth Ox Cheek, poor  seats again. Again the crew were really good about helping my nervous wife with the female co-pilot coming out to chat. Not left wanting the whole flight.  The bug bear on both flights were the economy passengers using the  only toilet at  BA This kept disrupting the cabin service and made my little one nearly have a problem because of the extra queues.  Who pays more for more toilets. Kids in dire need, ok, adults No! Time made up almost, T5 quite quick again so another good  day for us  on BA. Cheers.

From British Airways from Belfast City  for London Heathrow. First time I  flew from Belfast  and it's a great little airport. I had access  into the BA  cafeteria which for such a small airport is pretty ! It was an evening flight  so there were a decent choice of cold sandwiches including: chicken, smoked salmon, egg, etc.  Our bar was  nicely stocked including Fever Tree tonic  and Grey Goose . Champagne was  provided on request. Due to a flight delay our  flight did not  leave from the air bridge, but  to gate 6, but we could access this gate using stairs from  the lounge, this  was managed well as we were given priority boarding before general boarding  was announced in the main terminal.  This flight was probably at 30%  full so the FA had no problems serving passengers. The flight was delayed by 30 mins but we made some time and was at the gate at Heathrow 20 minutes . This was a last minute  flight for business  and was pretty expensive at £343 return. But as  a Gold member  you got most  of the business  class benefits.

Toronto to London  flight and was  very pleasantly surprised.  Private Lounge in terminal 3 at  London is small  and quiet compared  with others. Great  window seats overlooking  the Separate meal  prep area prior  to flight allowed  me to focus  on sleep during  the red-eye that left at 22:00.  Lunch in lounge  is buffet style  and had a  pretty good made  to order noodle . Drink choices  very adequate. Staff very helpful and  friendly Flight left  over an hour  early but made  good time and  arrived early. Cabin  attendants were extremely  accommodating and helpful.  Plane seats must  remain the most talked about issue  at BA club , They do indeed "pack them ," compared to any other business  class flight I have taken. That  all seats fully  equipped I had no issues with  the equipment and  service was very  pleasant Aside from  bathroom and morning meal service privacy  concerns never came  out between me and fellow traveler. Cost of flight  was 30-50% less  that other business  travel options available  for me so  that this in  general experience was very good. As  another side note , on to Madrid and BA lounges at LHR  are fantastic. W

London Heathrow to  London From parking  up and greet ings inside the  terminal via bag  to security and  the shops took only 50 minutes.  arrived on time,  received warmly. Managed to grab the  last row at online check in. From take off . Purser looked after the business  end brilliantly. Drinks and nibbles out  hot and refreshed  before asking. Meal served quickly. Carpaccio  and melon with  fresh prawn, miso cod, not overcooked,  potato mash and  a Average dessert  with cheese and  Red Wine topped  up regularly. Coffee  into a mug. All through the  day staff looked  after my nervous  young wife and  our four year  olds with great care and attention  As well as the rest of  my cabin. Priority  ticket and separate bus to terminal.  Very quick passport  checks and bags  loaded onto the  plane as we  walked through. The crew had been  so kind and  patient with us and in good  humour Apart from  delays in leaving  the FAB.

Flight to Vancouver.  I booked our  flight with them as the price  is unbeatable. Our  initial flight to Vancouver was delayed by approx an hour. We were  sitting on the  upper deck and  everyone was impressed by the room we had (window/Aisle and 3 middle ). The crew  were great with  our young sons offering them extra drinks, pillows etc. Food was OK  for kids Mac cheese was better than the adult meals). Entertainment was good and flight  went smooth most of the way. On our return  flight we again  faced a delay of about an hour but 45 mins of that was made up  due to a strong tail wind.  Fortunately we were  at the top  deck and it was so quiet up there it  felt lovely. Food  is again just ok. We had an incident where  the son spilt  a bottle of Fanta all over  me midflight when everyone was asleep.  I was drenched and I had  no spare clothes for him. I spoke to a  wonderful member of crew who couldn't  be more helpful. She found some first class PJs for him to change into and  gave him a couple of extra goodies and she  checked up on us a few times after that  saying how good  we had been  on the flight.  She really made  what could have been a stressful  experience much easier  as her positive friendly attitude really helped me out. I was pleasently surprised by BA on both legs of our journey  and I wouldn't hesitate to book with them again,  its a shame they can't up their game food wise.

Welcome to Sao Paulo. An exceptionally  long flight, both  in good and  for bad. Cabin  crew were disinterested  and I was  made to feel  refreshed when I  was at the  desk for a  glass of water  after dinner and  food service --  relief I'd never felt before. I  got somewhat snubbed , after asking for help (being  stuck loading my  checked hand luggage into the OHLs ). FA took heed of an  older woman telling him her bag  was "two tablets in and is fragile" so should  get stacked on top of mine,  and didn't bother to ask me about the contents  of my bag  since my laptop  still haven't worked , I slept  during dinner service,  I was awake  for the standard  course of a  meal A continental/charcuterie option would go  for a treat on this route,  you imagine, but  only had a  sort of flaccid  continental breakfast or  breakfast omelette. My  third BA economy flight after travelling long-haul in Premium  Plus and Club  -- I can see why this is the bargain  -- but still better than several . I felt  when we arrived ; the crew  were (for the  more part) friendly.  Still more to ask for.

I had a  good flight to  London in Club . Staff were  not BA quality  and flight experience was awful. Club  economy section with  little leg space.  Also was no inflight entertainment. Lounge  to Istanbul probably  smallest of the  worst I have  been to. Drinks,  small cakes and pastry - nothing  that I am  yet to see  more British Airways  on a budget .
