Flew Rome to London Gatwick. Big  mistake I paid £180 to fly with British Airways just for one  flight and the plane was delayed  two hours and 41 minutes because of late arrival of another aircraft. Instead of arriving at 21.30 we landed almost at midnight. No refreshments were offered, nothing. The customs queue  were massive, I got home at  2 in the morning. I decided to pay extra for BA instead of flying Ryanair and it was a huge mistake. Even the air conditioning in the plane whilst still on the ground did not work. BA is not worth the extra money. Staff did not speak a word of Italian.

Having flown First Class from London to Cape Town and Club back from Johannesburg I have really noticed a significant downgrade in BA service and standards compared  the premium flights I have taken in previous years. The seats in  London had crumbs on them on arrival, in Club  there was sticky stuff on the arm rest which  never been cleaned. On the return  leg flight in particular, the purser told us on the tannoy that staffing levels were low so service would be slower; on 3 occasions I had to ask for a G&T, eventually I only received it by going to the galley. It was made clear by the staff that they resented my interrupting their  service and conversation.  service in club  was average. First  person in T3 not great: sole  time spa person  decided to take an hour off from 1840-1940 (leaving a scribbled paper sign saying "back in an hour") which wasn't helpful given several long haul flights were leaving at 9pm.  When I tried to book an appointment on her return, she told me she was  tired and full (whilst checking Facebook on her iPhone). In terms of  the product, the Club seat just  doesnt compare with  Premium any more: it's way too  small and storage  space is dire. These flights were 'miles burn', I  should be accruing more avios with  this

London to Milan. Having read about BA's cut backs on service, I approached my flight with slight trepidation.  It was not too disappointed though. The flights were smooth and left on time, seating fairly comfortable, consider  it was a 80 minute flight. Pre-board and on board announcements were efficient and informative. The downside however, was the in flight food and drinks service which was in disarray. Although BA on European routes have also opted for charging for virtually everything that low cost carriers do, I still expected some efficiency. It was tediously slow,  and the attendants pacing up and down the isles to get an item not in the trolley. The glossy M&S menu looked good, but too laborious to get some food and pay for . With some  lines split up,  searching for items took longer, with  staff getting impatient and noisy. By  he time the trolley reached the back of the  aircraft the descent had already begun. It is a shame that our  national carrier while giving the illusion of a quality airline, is anything but. Come on BA, get your act together, or at least like  this quote I once read, "we are like British  we love, we may be late, but we're getting  better

London Heathrow to  Romania A full flight both ways  to Bucharest using  an A321. Boarding  into London was efficient and orderly. The boarding in  Barcelona was more akin to a rugby scrum! Any  lack of control  by BA went  most of the  blue The plane  was clean, but  the interior was  cramped and the  aircraft rough around  its edges. There  were no USB ports or entertainment  which makes for  another long 3 . The M&S  food service worked  fine flying out  of London, but  not so returning.  The Inventory must  of been limited  on departure as  the products quickly  ran out. Leaving a selection of  sweets and crisps!  As the BA  cabin crew are  quickly learning how  to take payments quickly and efficiently,  this slows the  flight down too.

London Heathrow to Bologna. I have given a decent score overall as both of our flights were on  budget and got us and our luggage safely from A to B for a competitive price. The planes were clean and modern. However like many I do feel sad that the service on BA has been downgraded so drastically. The buy on board scheme is a bit chaotic and on the flight out the trolley only reached us about 15mins before landing. It’s hard to say it is so slow, other airlines are much more efficient. The crew were very pleasant  and there is limited chance for interaction as the buy on board takes most of the flight. I  felt it was quite poor that  any announcements or communications were made on either journey in Italian. To be honest there was nothing to distinguish this flight from those I have taken with EasyJet, so now will make my  decision purely based on price rather than any loyalty to a particular airline.

The Heathrow to  London was a  good experience. Club Europe cabin was  only really a  Business class cabin,  but economy with  a centre seat  built into a  sofa Other than  a lack of  elbow room and  rear seat recline , cabin was  excellent The meals  served was very  tasty with a  vegetarian starter, decent hot main course  then tasty dessert.  It was endless  coffee and hot drinks available during  the flight. The  airline cabin crew  and after the  flights were very good and could  not do enough  for you. The  air was clean  in both directions.  On the plane both in London  to Keflavik was  pleasant

Larnaca to London Heathrow. Despite being an executive member and booking seats  6 months before on most flights,  these last 3  months I have had my seats changed. Last time my family split up despite booking  the 10 last  year Had this have been a  one off then I wouldn't mind  so much but this is the  third time in  6 months. I  repeatedly called BA and even emailed  its media team, even at the airport I tried  and rectify the situation but no one interested or even prepared to  explain me why.  Customer service and attitude of BA  employees is shocking.  This Alex Cruz  experience in the airline has gone  by so fast  is hard to believe.

San Jose to  the Gatwick return.  This outward flight  is delayed for  another hour at  Sao Jose due  a poor weather but the pilot  keeps passengers informed of the situation  in regular intervals.  For the flight  I was lucky  also to have  no empty seats  in my aisle  and as the  passenger in the  row directly in  advance of mine  put his seat  up as soon as we took  it making it  hard to hold  the book at  some distance and then jiggled and  bounced as he  passed the IFE ; it would have been a  miserable flight without  my seat to move along to.  Our cabin staff were friendly and  accommodating and did  occasionally disappear after  the meal service  and answered passengers , and made  its rounds with  tea and fruit ! The food  tasted of good  taste so it  was despite the  weather a good . On the  flight boarding was  easy and efficient, and the cabin  staff once again, friendly and helpful.  While not as  comfortable as on  my outward leg,  still perfectly acceptable.  People usually try to take a  shorter flight, involving  security but this  extra flight was  well worth the  extra expense.

London to Keflavik. British Airways lost  control of my  luggage on our way to Iceland for a week long vacation. This  seems understandable, bags get delayed all the time. However,  after I attempted  to contact British Airways concerning my delayed bag and to ask for help with getting a hotel room, I was disconnected  multiple times and given contact numbers that turned out to be fax numbers. The delayed bag contained our  travel bags and  tent for a one week camping trip. Not knowing if we could be reimbursed for a hotel and seeing that hotels  around Iceland cost upwards of $200  each night, we were forced to  stay in our rental car until  that next day  that we were able to rent  the tent. Since  filing my claim for reimbursement, British airways has done everything in their power to avoid reimbursement. I have been told my partner who purchased  our tickets must fax written permission for me to handle the claim even though the baggage was under  my name, paid  directly by me,  while all costs for tent rental , toiletry items  are paid with my credit card.  This is shameful  that a company can operate this way and treat people so poorly. I urge you  all avoid at  ALL costs!!

Tokyo Haneda to London Heathrow. This  is the return leg of a code share flight with JAL. I flew JAL on  my way out and the service was superb and meals delicious. On  our return I  was embarrassed that  it is our  favourite airline, mainly  due to the  absolute abysmal meal quality. White fish consisted of 3 tiny pieces of  meat surrounded by  a brown, fatty unidentifiable, flavourless mass. The tiny token broccoli was a  dark brown mush. Service was efficient, bordering on perfunctory.  Unfortunately we brought  every other food on board. Please BA, either do  something with long haul meals altogether as mooted and declare your budget airline status or serve more appetising, less embarrassing fare. You can't stay 'stuck in the middle' for long!

An appalling airline.  Could definetly not . Flew Rome  to London Heathrow.  Due to the  likes of Qatar,  Kuwait and Qantas  which do not  fly close. I will never travel  by British Airways . Flights delayed  between London to  Paris by over  in between 2  days they could nt take off  and land smoothly  with perfect conditions.  The food is shocking and over cooked The planes  are out dated.  The stewards and stewardesses are rude  & unprofessional compared  to the professionalism of other airline 's

Welcome to Gatwick.  Check in was  smooth thanks to  great help from  the check-in desk.  The staff at  our gate were  excellent and ensured  we did not  waste a huge  period of time. The welcome on  board was exceptional,  and the cabin  and service was quite regular for  the remainder of  our flight (ie,  nothing exceptional or .) The seats  are very appealing, but the seams  around the point  between the upright  or horizontal parts  of the seat back are out ta line and  makes it slightly  awkward to sit  on after a while. This is a great shame  for a good looking cabin. We  set off twenty  mins after the intended time, due  to a late  approach to boarding  and an extended  delay time. However,  the pilots did  the great job  of keeping us  updated to the reason for the  delays and the  slow progress in  speeding up the  remaining time. Overall , flight was  quite regular from , but the  friendly ground staff,  accurate information as  to the delay , friendly cabin  staff made it  very good service.

Flew Zurich to London Heathrow. I 've flown 14 times with British  Airways in the last 5 months. I've seen a  real degradation of service. Flights are frequently late or cancelled and the staff are worn down. They were  very smart and full of energy. Sadly they seem  they have lost  their pride. A huge shame.

New York to Cape Town via London Heathrow. A huge disappointment. Even worse when you  put it in context of what British Airways used to be. We decided to fly  solo  because I can't stand Club world (backward seats, forward facing seats almost on the aisle),  claustrophic, poor overhead  lighting on some  planes Seats were  too narrow, poor seat controls (unable  to independently control the different seat axes, foot rest  has to be set manually), American Airlines and Cathay Pacific new business class products are far better than BA first class.  Was great on  first leg with the new Pansonic system, dreadful on  our 2nd leg with the old  one  Food was mediocre at best. Breakfast JFK , LHR was passable, dinner LHR to CPT passible  My wife's fish was okay my hamburger was inedible.  Shuttle service slow. Cabin Crew from  NY was excellent, to Cape Town was passable. Changing planes in Heathrow  like a nightmar.. I am OneWorld Emerald, never Again

Had to get  a deck which  are rare flying  between London to  Paris Cabin was unclean with earbuds  and paper on  seat from previous  flights No hello ! Gold status.  Soon became clear  British Airways are  the sort of  ship to rule.  No stewardess for  the upstairs. Three  people to serve  dinner which was  boring and tasteless.  The Service Director  who appeared once  in my TV  screen refusing to  eat in open  cockpit Never ever  again will I  spend thousands of pounds for bland  customer service.

Florence to Bristol. A positive first experience and I will try to  try BA in  the future. When I booked the flight for myself  with my 11  to 13 year olds I was automatically allocated seats (no charge), 23kg  plus checked luggage included at no  further charge yet the flights still worked out the cheapest. A few  days before the flight, during online check-in, I noticed my daughter's name mispelt on the ticket. I telephoned BA's 24 hour helpline and the ticket was changed and reissued within  the hour and  we received a call back with an update part  halfway through the process (no charge and no hassle). All staff from  customer services to ground staff to  flight crew were  friendly Staff on  my return flight went out of their way to  try and help a young mum with an upset  stomach We were given a meal with water and a further drink on our 2h 20m flight. On this flight to Bristol everything is included in your ticket. We had  free drinks but  a couple in-front had G&Ts. Our  dinner was salmon with couscous, bread,  salad and a mint. On the way back there was a choice of falafel and couscous or chicken  soup with a chocolate brownie. The meals were actually really nice. Both  our flights did depart late for different and, what I believe were, unavoidable reasons but we were given adequate explanations and our flight out  of Italy still arrived early. Some explanation before boarding the return flight might have been helpful although nobody  appeared concerned and it was passengers  that hadn't got themselves to the  gate that further held the flight up. I wasn't bothered which airline I flew with.  The criteria were  that I could fly from a local airport as cheaply as possible and BA came in cheaper than any of the other airlines for this particular flight. My criteria will still exist but I will certainly be looking at BA first in the future.

Salzburg to Gatwick. Awful experience. Flight delayed due to operational reasons but this is forgiven as these things happen and BA handling in Salzburg did apologise for the delay. Once boarded with a  normal flight there were 4 crew  members 2 to serve Club with  only 8 passengers and 2 to serve about 120 or more economy passengers. Usual fight for bag space. I was desperate for some water and asked the crew can I buy some water  as they dragged the trolley to the front of the cabin. I am in seat 23C right at  my back. I am told no, I have to wait for the trolley. I wait , wait and  as we fasten our seat belts  for descent to Gatwick the trolley gets to seat row 20. The 2 members of crew are still struggling to take card payments, and tell row 20 that the service is now closed, and pass the trolley back to the behind galley. All this as the CSD stands chatting in the Club galley with the other crew member. 1/4 of cabin not given the chance to even buy a  glass of water in a 2 hour dinner time flight. No smiles from crew as busy doing math on what they are selling. Not  even a flight map to help  save time. Terrible airline. A national disgrace, worse than any budget carrier with high prices and terrible customer service.  I  am only rating  BA as 2/10 as they got me from A to B safely.

London to London : You must  reconsider your rating  of British Airways  unless you truly  appreciate how bad  they have become.  While delayed, that , I accept,  but the BA  cabin staff handling  is awful - to the point of zero in . Once boarded  after fighting for  a bin space,  I did give  us polite and nice apology, but  the cabin staff  service (that has  always been their  selling point) was . Aside from  the fact 2  passengers smelt as  if they had  applied a complete  load of aftershave  in their heads  - unpleasant in a confined space),  their service to  these lowly passengers  was condescending and . They seemed intent with making  funny faces and  insulting comments about  other passengers in  the hearing of  many of us,  something that is  absolutely not acceptable.  There they were  standing stationary in  an aisle trying  and sell food  and drinks and we had to  stand long periods  with such rudeness.  BA management should  have fired, or  very least the  CEO Mr Cruz,  who is destroying  the national airline.  He not a  bad old man, just a customer  of over 50  year experience of  flying British Airways  and BOAC and  BA and a  direct witness to  the demise of  what was a  good airline.

Athens to Newcastle via London. Another  unpleasant experience. Woken  from 7am by  email to say  my flight to  Athens cancelled for operational reasons - phone numbers listed to rearrange. One not open till  1200 GMT, the  next one no longer in use. Website also useless: 'We are experiencing technical difficulties - try again later.' 2 stressful hours later managed to get rebooked onto much later flights  - but downgraded on both sectors.  Still not happy . I was involuntarily downgraded on my last BA flight at Easter!] Athens used to  be a great  departure lounge. Now it's provided by someone else for varied airlines and was pretty grim. Partly because it  is filled with numerous disgruntled passengers also downgraded from  a cancelled flight. Flights adequate but no different really to service of any budget airline.  Was apologetic about  this but clearly  felt they have  a voice in BA's direction. Athens ground staff were  helpful in dealing  to unhappy people - albeit unable to say much other than to apologise and say make sure you  pay / claim.  BA are lucky  they have such brilliant front of house staff and cabin crew - without them I'd  have already deserted. Still waiting for any response from airline re EU compensation / downgrade . 2 weeks after submitting forms  and emails. This could surely be automatic [managed by most US airlines]  but contrasts with  my recent Air  France experience of  far more trivial  inconvenience where within  24 hours I'd received a voucher and a personal apology.

London Heathrow to  London Orly. Terminal 5 busy. Lounge was ok but kids area T5 North limited we  had to take our youngest downstairs. Aircraft was ok but could have been cleaner. Lunch was ok for  a short sector.  Total summary all was ok. However, we really do expect more in the premium cabins. It is with regret that I have to admit that I have booked our next  premium business class flight with another provider. BA will not retain their premium clients if they continue with their current model, I am sure that those who use point etc  would remain loyal. However, those of us who pay their hard earned cash for club world will begin to take their business elsewhere. It's  hardly this particular flight that's at fault, more a general trend downwards.

Toulouse to London Heathrow. This airline  may one day  receive its comeuppance for posing as  a quality flag  airline (it has  must be said,  no expense is spared on its branding) while operating  as a cheap and sleazy budget airline, thanks to  this rationale of its greedy and  arrogant new management. I have Bronze status with BA  Economy Club, have  flown a dozen  points over the  last year (both  for Business and  Premium Economy) and am increasingly irritated with myself that I chose to collect points with  that particular airline.  I was caught up in the  BA meltdown in  June (flying from Rhodes to London),  and I was  one of the  lucky ones (who  would remember those  horrible news reports of passengers stranded all over the  place for 4 days?). I had to purchase a  return ticket on a charter flight from Rhodes airport when my flight was cancelled (along with hundreds of  cancelled BA flights  in May); this (incidentally: ghastly TUI)  cancelled flight arrived  too much later  than the flight  originally booked that  it lost my pre-paid hotel booking at the airport,  which the airline refused to refund  until I lodged a claim. The  airline only refunded  both for my  previous flight and  my new flight,  complete with EU compensation, after I  filed a second  flight a month  into my first claim, as they  also neglected to  cash a cheque for me, according to the customer ! Their customer  experience is beyond  and I suspect they swear company oaths never to  even apologise for  any failings (all  you get is  angry with us,  no trying really !), lest actually saying sorry should incur legal liability. I am unfortunately due to fly  for them again at the end of the month  in Belfast, and after two calls to their contact  centre (based in India, with a poor connection and  no communication overall)  still do not know if my  traveling companion will  get allowed to travel on a domestic flight as  another Canadian citizen without a UK  ID document. The customer agents I  speak to gave  me contradictory answers, which, in turn,  ran contrary to the (almost non-existent)  explanations provided on their website. On the flights I have booked which have actually taken , I have by turns found  ourselves stuck along  my fellow passengers  in the tarmac  after an hour and a half in BDX when  our plane lost  the takeoff spot, having waited for delayed passengers (would  anyone admit this was their fault? Nope, it was all air traffic control's fault!), been held on the tarmac in TLS for an hour  while they sorted out luggage which  had mistakenly been put on our  plane retrieved a used bottle of rancid baby milk <mask> my Club seat (no apology from the flight <mask> who seemed annoyed at having to handle it), <mask> in a <mask> totally encrusted <mask> potato chips apparently used as confetti by a <mask> passenger and <mask> myself wedged <mask> totally drunken <mask> abusive passengers in Club and <mask> scolding flight attendant threatening to have them arrested on arrival. As <mask> mentioned, I <mask> been one of their luckier <mask>

London City to Dusseldorf return, flights operated on behalf of BA by Eastern Airways. The cabin was clean on both aircraft and the check in and wait at the both the airports were reasonable however then the good part  was the trip ceases. Cabin Crew must of been members of the Basil Fawlty school of Catering. The outward flight there were 3 passengers in the business class cabin and the onboard menu was handed out  for the three of us. The young stewardess took  my orders, then we heard a crash as the  old stewardess promptly dropped one of the meal and told us that  our aircraft only had two meals  then asked for a volunteer to give up their meal. The meal was of a reasonable quality and well presented. On  arrival at Dusseldorf the aircraft was parked at a remote stand and we were taken by bus to the wrong terminal. The arrivals boards in the airport say terminal B and we were dropped off at Terminal C. Our delivered to terminal C and we had to walk to Terminal B if you were been met. The return flight was another example of the sub standard ground handling agents  that BA is becoming famous for at overseas airports. Return to London Heathrow. Premium Economy very spacious with 38 inch seat pitch, very good IFE. The 2 crew serving this section were excellent:  highly engaging and  polite Amenity kits appreciated. Chicken curry was delicious- my brother and fellow traveller both advised their steaks were the best they  have eaten on  the airline. Impressed with warm bread rolls. Plenty of wine. Did not eat breakfast. Negatives being toilet and galley noise behind last row 38, elderly cabin, 8 abreast seating on Boeing 747 compared to 7 abreast on the A380. Outward from London to Johannesburg the upper-deck Premium Economy  section on A380 is very personal and much more spacious and quieter than on Boeing 747 aircraft. Nice wide selection on IFE. Once again excellent, young and polite crew. Beef steak asparagus dinner and orange chocolate dessert was delicious. Back to Chicago. I am a  Delta Gold member and reserved three BA business class tickets to Chicago returning from Denver.  We selected contiguous seats so that  our young daughters and myself would sit together. A week before departure,  I received a message from BA informing me that  our flight was cancelled and that we were moved to an earlier flight on the same day. On the departure date,  we checked smoothly at the business class counter at . The fast track boarding pass reader let us  enter without a . The lounge attendant, however, curtly dismissed us as having economy class boarding passes. I checked and it was true, but I had not  checked it at  least till that point, since I had paid for  economy class, believed that everything was in order and was not told otherwise at check-in.  A customer service agent at the lounge told me that there was nothing he could do since it wasn’t him who  bought the ticket! I spoke to the manager who  responded and tried to search for seats on subsequent flights, but they were all full. He could not confirm if BA had any intention of compensating us  for the downgrade,  but had no explanation for why BA did not give us any other option with business seats despite  boarding the flight  one week in  Denver nor did  he acknowledge that BA had made any mistake in this ordeal. However, he did contact the crew and  advised them of  the situation. We ended up traveling  in economy class. To add insult  too injury, the airline was unable to place us next to each other, so the  aircraft was split  several rows apart). However, the crew was nice and allowed us to leave the aircraft first. They almost  seem to work  at a different company when compared to the incompetent ground staff.

San Diego to London Heathrow. The worst business class I have flown : I flew  in the 777 so whilst it's not the newest plane in the fleet, I still expected some level of comfort. The seats are too narrow and do not lie flat. I'm a slim size 8 and could not turn around in my seat. There is a footrest that comes down to form the end of the bed, but does not line up with the rest of the seat. So your feet are raised. The armrests are narrow and hard and wobble around. Every time the person next to you moves, your chair moves too. The hydraulics must be connected. It was very  cramped The tray table was not well supported and when pulled out of the arm rest, it sloped  downwards and so drinks/meal tray did  NOT stay put. It was not secure and basically, was flimsy and unusable. I had to use my inflatable neck pillow to support it on my lap. I was in seat 14A which was a rear facing window seat. There is a plastic divider between you and the seat next to you (which is a forward facing aisle seat). The divider has to stay down until you are airbourne. So for the first 40 minutes or so whilst the plane is boarding, you are  looking a fellow passenger directly in the face. Very awkward! The tv pulls out of the side column and mine wouldn't stay put. It wanted to go back into the column and so I had to watch my movie at an angle. The food. Well. The fillet streak was tough and dry. I had a similar dish flying out to the states on a 777 with American Airlines and  he did a much better job. The selection of wines was good and the key lime pie was nice. Service: if you want good service, don't get a window seat. You are cut off from the aisle, and with the plastic divider up between you and the opposite passenger, the cabin crew forget you are even there. I had to ask for a drink when the trolley went round, both with dinner and breakfast. The layout of the seats also makes it tricky for the cabin crew to pass you  their drinks and  meals as they have go above the opposite passengers head! Not ideal with some turbulence. There was also  no wifi even though BA advertise as such. Apparently , Boeing 777 does not have the right equipment. In short, BA have obviously prioritised cramming as many small seats as possible into business class cabin. The layout is impractical, seats are narrow, there is an awkwardness with an intimate view of the fellow passenger, and the layout also means that your not clearly visible to the cabin crew and so get ignored. The 777 is an old plane and definitely needs modernising to ensure that the seats are working properly, the TV's stay out of their sockets so you can watch a movie and the tray tables can support your meal. I for one will not be flying BA business again.

Flew British Airways  to Pisa to  Newark Gatwick. The two of us  landed at the  gates exactly two hours before departure. We left the lounge  20 minutes before the scheduled departure as still had to go through passport control, the  line was long and slow and took 20 minutes  the get through.  Once through we  headed to the gates which was boarding for priority passengers. We received  our magic beep  and were upgraded  from Club Europe  ( of us are Gold members). We were seated  at row 7, it was the typical 3 seats but the middle  was blocked with  the tray installed.  The room not great but we 're both short.  Before take off we were offered  and I had  a glass of  water which was  poured from a  full size bottle.  There were then  given afternoon tea,  choice of three finger sandwiches: beef,  chicken and tuna and a slice  a Victoria sponge . All very  nice but I  did miss the scones in Club Europe. I also managed two top  bottles of champagne. The cabin crew  were efficient and friendly enough and happy to provide extra drinks when  required The flight  departed on time and we were on a train within 30 minutes  after landing. Overall  having paid £50  less for the  tickets and with  our upgrade was  the bargain.

The flight  home was okay, it pushed back slightly late and arrived at Bologna on time. I didn't bother with  a BoB as had eaten in the lounge and  were saving myself for dinner in Bologna. Cabin crew seemed friendly enough and spent quite  a long time selling the BoB . We sat in a pair of two seats  next to door 3L. Despite  A lot of moans about BA <mask> this forum I can't really complain about the overall experience. As a Gold member the lounge access was free. The new seat configuration is so narrow now I could not get into the allocated seat as I have a replacement knee which does not bend enough to get to the seat. Fortunately one of my party swapped with me  into an aisle seat. I put a small plastic bag with fragile items in the overhead locker, the steward, without telling me or consulting me, moved it. When I queried this I was told "Madam,  I know what I am doing I have done this before". I am 71 years old and I refuse to be so patronised so I was ready for a stand up row by  this time. Fortunately a lovely stewardess with this guy saw my face and jumped in with a jokey remark which save the situation. No food left at the back of the plane as usual. Why on earth are we paying premium prices for such appalling customer service? If I want a budget flight I will use EasyJet anytime.

Flight to Boston  and London. Mixed  surprise we had to rebook suddenly for next-day business  class because my wife broke a  rib in her  back and had to go home  - BA cut  her no slack for the injury ; the change cost a fortune.  the good: flight  attendants were wonderfully supportive and helpful;  I was surprisingly  helpful wheelchair attendants  on LHR were  helpful The bad:  our business class was an economy  seat with slightly  more pitch and the middle seat blocked; Boeing 777  first class seats were very comfortable, but a seat in the middle of the 4-seat central block allowed no access to  an aisle if the aisle passenger had the seat  back or was using the footrest; LHR connection of  2 hr was barely enough for  a 3 to  4 transfer (BA  later said 1  hr would be  sufficient - even  with a wheelchair  attendant allowed priority through security and transfer bus. Also a nasty surprise: no wifi on  a 7-hr transatlantic  flight

London to Madrid,  first weekend flight.  Flight check in , fairly chaotic  with early morning  checks in and  departure but once  again was okay. Full flight and  airport staff being  quite keen to check passenger hand  luggage but managed  the get through  to my 2 pieces. Flight deck  was informative about  luggage delay. Cabin  staff struggled to  get through the  long onboard service  but I managed  a get a  small coffee after  taking very long  flight It is  such a short  journey and the  noise was low  so cannot complain  to much, but  that is now  very different to  the flybe etc.

London Heathrow to Brussels return. Through work I have to fly frequently and am firmly  in the opinion that a BA flight is to be endured rather than enjoyed, even in the premium *. If your timing is right the prices reflect this, that is before the “add-on’s”. So be prepared  to get on ; be prepared  and be given the middle seat on the last or second to  last row, and eat and drink before you board – unless of course you are  going to pay more. That way if you get an aisle seat or are allocated  a third to  fifth row up, it’s a win. Any flights longer than a couple of hours I strenuously avoid BA if I can - a shame  as in some  ways I grew up with BA (back in the  day of BOAC  & BEA). Having said that the flights to and from Brussels were OK in a  BA aircraft either way.

London Heathrow to Accra. Flight left  London two hours  early - bit  without an explanation  that was really  that the ground staff boarded the  plane with only minimal time to  board This is always a busy  airport with passengers taking on loads  on cabin bags. Ground staff only started to collect  cabin baggage from  passengers with 20  mins to boarding and so there  was no room on board for  the luggage. Chaos in economy class.  On this flight it does not  stop when the  flight is boarded with anything less  then 1 hr  to departure. When will BA realise this flights needs  at least 60  minutes to board - it is  our most delayed flight out of  Europe because of this poor management. Fact. The ground  staff did nothing  to control the  passengers - simple and polite requests  could have helped. The grand staff  was downright rude and grumpy with  some passengers - on one of the money making  flights for the airlines they need to up their  game and just be polite (even if they do  really enjoy their jobs or dealing with passengers). Once on board the crew were friendly  & professional. Very friendly but this  will make up for old aircraft in need of a good clean  or refresh along with poor in flight entertainment, poor  service and very poor quality seats. The cold/salad options  were far better than the hot  drinks in BA's  business class. Still no wi-fi on BA? Even discount  carriers like Norwegian have this now,  all along the flag carriers like Emirates and Qatar ?

Welcome to London.  Meet us there ? My main  complaint is the  food service. I was sat in  row 21, probably  most of the way back. It  was an evening  class flight,so everyone  tired & hungry.  The new M&S  machine was a  nightmare The flight  lasted just over  3 hours. It  took 1 hour  getting the single food trolley to  make its way  to my row. By the time it arrived all  that was available  except a KitKat  & some other sweets! They had already run out  on sandwiches /  finger food. It  was a long  wait because each  person had to  pay using credit card - and  the machine seemed  ot keep on  encountering problems. Also the variety on  the new M&S  sandwiches - whilst  obviously a good thing - meant  the staff kept  constantly running back to the galley  to replenish (clearly ) not enough . Have to  say this services  is no better  on Easyjet &  I will think  again about travelling  via BA. If  I wasn't paid for by work  I would not 've travelled with  BA The service has gone downhill over the years which is a  real shame for a national carrier.

Gatwick to Bridgetown.  We managed to  secure some seats  which offered reasonable  knee room (I  was over 6ft), although after feeling the knees of  a passenger sitting  beside me, I  think he was not so lucky!  I had a  delay in take  out but apologies ! Food was  excellent and I was pleasantly surprised.  Staff members were  hard working, polite and professional. The  new 777-200was showing  signs of age (G-VIIW ) but compared to the  smaller aircraft we  were on last  week this plane  seemed more cared for. I am  unsure how BA  is going to  be 10 abreast  instead of the  Boeing 9. I  cannot conceive how  just eating a meal would be possible. Overall the  food was good  for this occasion. The IFE was  busy but worked, it did not  take time.

Welcome to London. Didn't have high  expectations but surprised  what bland and uninteresting this journey was. Started in  another uninspiring visit  in the BA  terminal with a poor food choice  very poky. Plane  looked just about clean but rather poor for business , The menu was poor and  probably the worst  you have seen.  The tea was  a afterthought and the forty minute  queue for a gate at LHR really summed up the state of BA today. Bland ing and lacking the passion to serve. Not a patch on Qatar Airways or Emirates  but makes you feel quite inadequate  as a Brit

London Heathrow to  Manchester Flight was on time and ground service was  excellent However our  seats were changed  owing to aircraft configuration change which  was normal to  passengers but no  additional choice or  discount was offered (for Silver member!).  No complimentary service  was provided. Crew  member had problem  with the payment ! Luckily I've got some water  & treats from the airport shops.  Large cabins and uncomfortable seats -  but BA is  now a budget  company charging premium  rates and has  less service than  many budget airlines!   Have abandoned my  BA status and  are using other  flights I'm still  with BA as  payment in cases when the fare  is competitive on  my route.

Return to Gatwick,  hello world. Efficient check in, third  class lounge at  Newark airport was a reasonable place  and spend time  on the flight , usual facilities.  Prime time departure,  served with warm  glasses of champagne!  Overall ok though , a little grubby in places.  Food selection mediocre  at dinner, the meze starter was average at best.  My main of course was bland , tasteless. Some  in the cabin  staff attending to  the wife were  just as helpful  but they could 've been. Toilets  kept clean throughout ! Reasonable breakfast. I note the  lack of the  departures lounge at . After a  few hours +  delay this would  have been quite  nice

New York JFK - London Heathrow. The British Airways  lounge at JFK is truly terrible. It seems to  be been refreshed  too late but this means rows of scruffy seats  with toilets that are too few  for the crowds. Not enough chairs for the evening  flights that tend to depart within  the few hours  from each other. I wasn’t allowed  into the First Class lounge despite being a BA  Priority List member.  How much for  that Was instructed  at check in  and this was  their “sleeper service”  and I should eat in the lounge. Not an  order but an instruction. The Club World food on  display in the lounge for the  passenger experience” was  mediocre and of very poor quality.  The Cub World  food on BA  planes involves clambering over people to  walk out to the aisle, poor food (they did  have food), poor  musical entertainment, putting the inflight divider  down but never putting it back  down (BA train ee staff if they put the  window down to have the good manners to put  back up again)  and serve food and drinks. The crew obviously know  BA are providing an inferior product  to act accordingly.  The product and offer from BA  are so mediocre  I even saw  Business Class passengers  put their own  food on for  which the other  airline must be  eating as they take over BA in terms of service and quality  for aircraft. Shameful.

Long packed flight  to Athens to  Newark Heathrow. Cabin  attendant spent quite  the bit of  money selling food  and drinks from  their trolley. Everything  had to be  - I had  a go to  way back for  another glass of  cold water -  - Small TV  screens hanging at  back displayed the  London route. Minimal  interaction with crew.  Everything was fine.  Cargo space overhead  was ample -  no charge for  seats Plane arrived  in time which  was a relief  because I had  not change terminals  and catch a connection. I had  three hours and made it. The  flight was followed  up by a  passenger survey by  the airline. I  felt glad when  that four hour  flight ended -  nothing special but  at least it  ended on time , safely at  home

Venice to Gatwick. I am done  with British Airways. It has the worst service and incredibly rude staff. We were supposed to fly back from Venice at 11.55 p.m on 10th July. The flight was delayed by an hour and a half. BA policy indicates that there will be no food vouchers or otherwise for flight delays of less than two hours. Fair enough. However, what this does not take into account is the timing of the flight or the airport. The only cafe at the VCE Airport available to customers after security was shutting at around 11.30pm. When I went to buy some water, the guy at the counter refused outright.  Another lady had been there since 11 am (her flight earlier that day was delayed) and she went around the same time to redeem her food voucher. The guy shouted at her and called a guard on duty who was of no help and was incredibly rude. My partner tweeted about this to BA and there was no response from them at all although they were complimenting on someone's pics at the same time. We finally found a vending machine and there was no water there too. There was not one person from British Airways this whole time till 1am in the morning.  As if this wasn't enough, when boarding started and we were showing our tickets, we were told that that was the priority boarding line and the one next to us was for regular joes like us. We were the tenth/twelfth people from the front in the queue and the other queue was moving parallel to us. There was no sign or announcement separating the two queues. Instead of politely mentioning that, this member of BA staff shouts at us for everyone to hear and asks us to go to the back of the line. By then the so-called priority boarding was  started so both  the queues were meant for everyone.  After I mentioned this, she told me that I was cutting the queue and wasting her time. We just moved aside and waited for everyone else to board before we did. I am definitely never going to choose BA .

New York JFK to Manchester via Heathrow. Budget airline trying to retain  their big name brand. Flight was cancelled then booked  then delayed. Aircraft  was diverted to Liverpool whereby the passengers were subsequently abandondoned. Poor quality, no aftercare and  their customer service extremely poor in responding to complaints, when they eventually did the shrugged it off as "Not their problem". Disappointing and won't be flying BA again.

After flying Boston  from London on  my A380-800, I  was on a  newly retrofitted Boeing ! The 747 s were newer , much more  spacious than those  in my previous  aircraft (they appeared  too be the  first ones in  the economy section  on the A380).  My seatback TV  for in-flight entertainment  have been significantly  improved The only  one of the  747 aesthetics and  design that was  lacking was the  cabin lights, which  had been replaced.  My cabin crew  was polite, professional,  and accommodating – no  surprises there. The  pilot even gave  passengers a personal,  welcome announcement before  takeoff which was  surprising given the  lack of preparation  done before a  long flight. The  flight itself was  completed at 6  minutes 59 minutes,  and without delay on either end.  Though I'm a  tad concerned that  Boeing is at  danger of turning  down a low-cost  airline under the  new leadership, my  impression was that  cabin crew are  still doing a  fantastic job.

Back to Gatwick. I used to admire and love BA. I now  not longer admire it but dislike it and am soon likely to hate it. I think that one is entitled to have pleasant expectations  without paying the  least inconsiderable supplement  for flying Club Europe. My wife , I have noticed a constant deterioration over the last two years, have complained (and received some Avios in compensation) but, this time, the cup overfloweth, unfortunately  not with blessings. We had, once again (!) been  given aisle seats in separate rows even though my wife’s preference states that she likes a window seat – and there were plenty of seats adjacent to each other available when we were permitted to make online changes so we did manage to get seats next to each  others – but , does BA have to keep  with this? The  journey as such started well enough in the new BA South Terminal Lounge, which was  lovely and had  another good selection  on drinks, food and magazines. When  boarding came for  departure and, amongst  which Club Europe passengers were invited  on board first,  this was no  change made at all, which resulted in an almighty scrum as just  everyone pushed forward immediately, exacerbated by then having to  be cooped up  in the stifling  atmosphere for over 10 minutes as the cleaning of the aircraft had not finished. Once boarded, we were – unlike the other Club Europe passengers – not offered a glass of water but, worst of all (and unforgivable) found food debris and other dirt in between our seats (so much for having to wait for the cleaning  too be finished).  Once I opened  our meal tray, it clearly had not been cleaned as there were  holes and stains  around it. We took photographs and also pointed our  predicament out to  the very pleasant stewardess, who seemed utterly appalled when she looked. The meal was pleasant but we were not offered coffee or tea afterwards. And whilst I do not object  at being served  water from a large bottle, it means one gets only a (smallish) glassful so has  ot ask for a refill, something not everybody likes  to do. This  method of pouring from a large  container is clearly  a cost-cutting exercise. On previous occasions we had been disappointed to find that no lounge  seats for Club Europe passengers are available in airports like Corfu, Rhodes, Heraklion, even Seville  ( to BA’s website at the time – we  are told at all these airports , BA no  doubt pays for its passengers to  have access’) so, this time, my <mask> enquired well in advance whether we would have lounge access in Naples. She was <mask> No; but at least, we knew beforehand – or so we <mask> but when <mask> got the <mask> area prior to the gate <mask> we were joined by some rather merry Club Europe passengers who <mask> us that <mask> was a lounge (though not exclusively for BA use) that they had been able to access and enjoy! Why could <mask> check-in staff not have told <mask> The waiting area did not have sufficient seats but we were lucky and found some. However, when a young lady arrived to deal <mask> checking boarding cards, passengers who were sitting beyond <mask> she stood, were forced to get up and move all the way back to <mask> other side. Club Europe passengers were amongst the <mask> to be <mask> so that did not look <mask> bad. Know what? We showed our boarding pass, then had to <mask> (no seats available) in a very cramped area for 14 minutes <mask> the gate <mask> opened. In other words, we had the doubtful privilege of having to stand for <mask> than other <mask>

London to London : I am a BA Exec  Board member and paid over £2,500  each for Business  breakfast as had  arrived straight after  on both journeys.  The Originally was a Boeing 787,  then they changed planes to an  upgraded Boeing 777  for both journeys.  The 'flat' business  seat on YYZ-LHR  had broken and  their Service Director  could fix it.  A bench part  only 5 inches  not level to  my seat. Extremely  heavy and didn't  move a wink.  NO extra pillows  available in either Business or First. Food inedible on  all journeys. Outbound  order of British Beef was as  bad as old !! They should be ashamed of  the Business breakfast  from the YYZ-LHR as I've had better in a  local Joe's cafe.  Even the wine  service on the  plane not available on both legs.  Another case of  arrogance and under-delivering , Simply miles  behind the competition. The CSD completed  a complaint for  them and I  also wrote to Alex Cruz. Their Customer Services Team offered me £50  in vouchers. What  planet is he on? Now they have a very angry and dissatisfied  Customer It is  about the money,  it is the  customer

London to Montreal. I have also flown their economy plus (Montreal to ) and business  class  (London-Tokyo, London-Rome return). BA  fare is on a par with Ryanair. Business is okay. Economy plus  are very disappointing with very poor food. Regardless of class of travel, the seats are less comfortable than most of the competition. The following is a relatively minor complaint but it was very annoying given that it concerned a thriller. I started watching a movie on the flight from Montreal to London but the last 15 min of the movie  were missing. It looked like the recording consisted of  about the first 105 min (out of 121 min total) of the movie. In the next few days I tried to see the last  half of the movie on other two BA flights (business and economy plus) and in all cases the final part of the movie was  lost In addition to this minor problem, all BA flights were plagued by a more serious flaw in the infotainment system: the recording of the safety information was almost inaudible  leading to a cracking noise (once again, the same problem applied to  all flights).

Two flights from  Birmingham to Geneva  at London Heathrow in Club Europe.  Check in at  very rapid without a queue. Fast track worked well. Lounge was ok,  with limited selection of food. Onboard  the flights, the domestic and European  Economy class is  Business Seats with  good legroom, choice  in food (chicken salad, charcuterie and ) and good  cold drinks. The  staff were lovely,  friendly and good humoured despite having  not lot of  work to deliver  in short sectors.  Experience from GVA-LHR  was good with  one biz passenger  that became unwell and needed medical attention on arrival.  Most of this  was the Mixed  Class strike dates. The South Lounge at LHR was like a sauna,  and access impossible  to south security (involves a long walk downstairs then  up again). North  is better on  arrival but bathrooms generally dirty and in need of an update. Tagged priority bags were  often the last  off the belt  to Geneva which  was a joke,  though likely not  their fault. First  flight back in . Overall, the  Long haul business  flight is perfectly adequate, if for nothing other than  the queues. BA's  facilities are pretty poor compared to  some of their competitors, but was  always happy to  hear their crew  for doing an  excellent job.

On to Keflavik. The British Airways experience has certainly  proved I'm happy to pay less and still be treated like the staff are happy to see me and that's not always the case when flying with  higher cost airlines. Terminal 5 is one of the best terminals at Heathrow and as we were connecting  with a long haul flight from Asia on another carrier we were a bit tired and travel weary when taking this morning flight. But the staff greeted us with a smile, the plane felt nice and seat was comfortable. It's bring your  own entertainment and you'll have to purchase both food  & drinks. Which we found to be comparatively good value for money and quite good. I like the  friendly service touch.  BA manages to  look both nice and efficient. We had a nice smooth flight home to Iceland at the end of our vacation and I can honestly say that I'm looking forward to  the next flight  on BA.

I was a  tad nervous when  we booked my  Qatar Airways return  trip from London  via Tokyo, but  overall had a  very pleasant experience. The flight attendants were lovely, attentive,  polite and sweet.  Normally a nervous  traveler so I tend to drink  A lot and  it never felt  uncomfortable or like  someone was bothering  anyone by ordering another. The food was good, plenty  of in-flight movie  entertainment and the  flight was very  good I'm not really sure what else I could need. Also, the price of the  tickets was affordable.

On to Mauritius.  Quite disappointed to see the decline  on quality from  airlines since I last flew with . For a flight of 11.5 hours to Mauritius,  everyone was shocked  at the quality of the economy class seats and  doubted BA seriously  considered them good enough for a long haul flight of this length. Possibly the least comfortable airline seat I've ever had, with every lump  and bump imaginable, and the infuriating headrest which doesn't stay up, slipping  off and banging  you in the neck every 15 minutes. The seat back offered no protection from the  passengers behind putting things in their seat pocket. Legroom also very poor  ( I am above average height)  so my knees were pressed against  the seat in front even before  they reclined into  seat The food was also poor. No snacks offered,  and the meals were slop. I have flown Air , Virgin, Emirates and BA in  the last two years and BA was the poorest in terms of  quality and comfort. Good points: the cabin crew were  pretty good, toilets were clean, and the in-flight entertainment  is fine with a good selection, but that wasn't  going to save  me from being a genuinely poor .

Boston to Barcelona via London. I  have a silver BA card holder  and reserved two flights (myself and  the wife) from Boston to London Heathrow (in premium economy) and Heathrow  to Barcelona in Economy class. I paid for seat reservations for my  spouse on both legs as she has a bronze  membership and cannot reserve without paying. On check in at Boston we were given different seats for the Heathrow to Barcelona sector than I had reserved (in the exit row), due to a  changing of aircraft configuration. Although the booking was made months before no  further notice was  given of the change. In early June I applied for a refund of the seat reservation cost and  it was given a case number.  To date there 's been no  acknowledgement or refund from BA in spite of my sending a second email asking for information. Overall the service onboard and attention to customers has declined significantly  over the past  year due to cost cutting measures. We will not be flying transatlantic with BA in the future after 7 years of several crossings each year. In an  editorial about British Airways in the Financial Times on 2nd June it said that their customers are less and less happy,  although due to increased earning from  price cutting the shareholders are very happy. Eventually they  may learn that  any loss of customers will be more important.

Gatwick to Mauritius in business class. The check in and lounge were of a reasonable standard and the new lounge at Gatwick is nice. Boarding was fine and pre-selected seats retained. The layout and features were standard of club world and service  at the level expected. The club kitchen was fairly limited in its offerings. Half the entertainment did not work properly if at all. In short acceptable service. Flight left and  landed on time.  Perhaps BA should take note that for this route, Emirates were less  expensive and would have offered an A380 offering on  both legs. The reason for choosing  Emirates was the fact it was a direct service.

From Heathrow to  London British Airways  were once the  national airline of  continental UK, you paid a little  bit more but the service was  always a cut above the rest. Now they have  decided to turn it into a budget airline where you have to pay extra for  everything including the  highest priced sandwiches  and they even  pay for water  and if you don't have a  card in your  luggage you have  to go without  because they don't  have cash. I  did not mind  paying that bit  less for BA  flights but now better off with .

London to Hong Kong in premium  Economy I have been flying BA on my many trips over the last six years, and I have seen such a shocking decline in their services that  I feel compelled to write this review. Of my six flights this year, three were seriously delayed. One was from Oslo to London on 9th June, when the captain decided to wait  for some Business  Class passengers who  never made their way out of the lounge in time for take-off. My worst experience,  then was going to Hong Kong on 30th May, when there was  another technical fault with the plane. The captain decided to board passengers  before the scheduled time, who then sat on the plane for almost three hours, without being offered any water or other refreshments, and with little information and  warning before an 11-hour flight. I was in Premium Economy, but the extra amount I paid did not offer any additional comfort. I switched my seat to help a disabled passenger and ended up in a seat next to the toilets, which meant that I got no rest during the night. How can Premium Economy seats be next to the toilet? The in-flight service was poor, as nobody came around to offer water or beverages during the night. I am still wondering why anybody  should pay for Premium Economy, as it is just a lousy offer: seats are only marginally more spacious than in Economy (but don't recline as they would in Economy), the food is the same, which means  something bad, and the flight attendants are clearly not interested in offering service beyond the first two hours of the flight. Predictably, the plane landed in Hong Kong just in time (below three hours' delay) for  my airline avoiding to have to pay compensation to passengers on this very uncomfortable flight. I had hoped to have a better experience on the return flight on 4th June, but then I found out that BA had scrapped the sparkling wine , a welcome drink for Premium Economy passengers. Although this time the flight was on time, this gave me such a bad feeling about BA, their cynical attitude towards their passengers and their meanness. I will look for alternative airlines from now on and would recommend to avoid flying with BA.

Belfast to Munich via Heathrow. Today (4th July) I  realised I needed  to change a travel date from  6 July to  8 July.  I attempted to  manage this on  the "Manage My " for about  3 hours and, although I selected 4 different flight  times each time I thought my booking change was  available (at an  added cost of  £ + seat costs), I was  told that my  other flights were fully booked, even  when my booking included purchase of  items shown as  tickets (quite a few). So. I contacted BA's Customer  Service by phone and waited for about 20 minutes for an agent  and after saying hello and providing  my name, promptly lost me. So, another 20 minutes later, I spoke  through another (very  helpful and helpful)  BA agent and she told me  my only available  booking changes would  cost me almost  holding onto my £218 ticket! I  would have booked a new return  trip for a  penny less! I am hugely unimpressed by the additional charge by BA  - all the work is by  hand and on-line and BA can re-sell my Friday  and the time I spent going around in circles,  only to end  up with nothing  and having to  call Customer Services; and  the  time it takes  you get though  BA Customer Services  very clearly, are  under staffed, over-worked , with limited capacity to really help. BA -  you are in serious need of a makeover and self-examination to have  customers such as  this consider using  them again and not tell everyone to avoid you and write reviews such as this.

London Heathrow to Tallinn return. Flight on time on way out. Had changed seats to  Row 12 (emergency)  Lots of legroom and row in  front can't recline, so it was very comfortable. Bought a nondescript coffee. Good flight. The flight home was a surprise using a Qatar Airways plane and crew due to BA strike. Row 12 not an emergency row but more legroom than is standard on BA,  a better seat  for a new plane, a decent free snack and a nice small  cup of wine also free! So a good experience.  Keep up BA!

From Heathrow to Barcelona. I thought  Emirates would be  cheaper than a  high cost airline,  and it is ! In fact  Spain is quite worse, so if you have a cheaper option, do not hesitate to  fly with them. The flight is  delayed and they say you can 't take on board a backpack  to put under  a seat but  in the bag ! Rude people  with ridiculous rules,  poor company living  for the past ?

Dubrovnik to Gatwick. Poor ground service, chaotic boarding via  airport bus. No  assistance or assistance on boarding from  airline staff. The  poor service which  had become the BA norm. Forced  into fly BA by tour operator,  or other wise  has chosen a alternative airline. Most  other choices for purchase were not . Tea was lukewarm and not pleasant. Cabin staff  hostile and unhelpful, a most unpleasant  feeling

Welcome to London : Shabby third  class lounge in  BA Very tired  BA aircraft. Buy on board service  takes ages. Crew were funny raising  their eyebrow at BA's new low  budget carrier concept  to Europe with  an expensive buy  a sandwich on-board. BA are one rung about Ryanair , on par with Easyjet when it comes to  passenger service and . Such a  disgrace what's happened  with them. Convenient  departure times and LHR departure is as good at  is gets I'm afraid.

London to Dubrovnik. Interesting that BA have dropped the "to fly to  Europe advert" Boarding was the usual  complete shambles. Selling  checked luggage only tickets only adds to the scrum in trying to place a modest size bag in the overheads. No less than three  bags came on with oversized bags. In one instance, it took 3 people to lift a bag into the overheads, coming dangerously close to dropping the bag onto to the heads of seated passangers. When complaints were made to cabin crew, the response was "they are entitled to bring hand luggage"  the trolley sales of refreshments took an inordinate time. Most of the choices were unavailable. Cabin crew frequently  took the wrong  food and had great difficulty with the automated card payment system.. Would strongly recommend taking own food on BA short haul flights.

Flew Accra to  London Heathrow. All  were going well  here in Accra  with an orderly  We got to  the end of  a runway when  the pilot announced  the we would  be returning to  the stand as  this was a  problem on the cargo load (I  think more loaded  than was on  our manifest). The  plane was terminated  shortly before the  crew started their  flight This then  takes an hour to sort out  more cargo being removed) - no  refunds offered (this  being business class  i reminded myself).  Right off the  runway was the  first British Airways  real world product.  Not special or  anything but at  times was not  shown so the  shouting over the  touch screen to  board did not  need to happen.  In business class  is old and  the plane (I  thought BA would  at least try  but not show  that interior is patched together with  electrical tape and  anything that looks  like grouter that  I would use  for a bathroom).  BA crew don't  really have much  on offer now  in terms of  professionalism although they  were professional if  very friendly. Must  be terrible working  at BA now  given that the product is so  different to other  major carriers. The  only entertainment is  average - for  business travellers only  with addition of  a or two  silent films, with the rest of  us chose the  following month after ). The memento  from this night  that has not  happened for years  so it is  probably due a ...

At Heathrow to  a Newish aircraft,  the leather seats  or very cramped  cream leather seats.  One emergency exit  area was fine  but others were very tight. BA  are now akin  of a low  budget carrier in Europe. Don't expect  much and you 'll be disappointed.  It is no different to flying  home these days.

Malta to Gatwick.  BA is for  British Airways Catering Service Managers. They 've invested a  bit of time  and money into  their meal scheme  in as to  generate extra income  and than give  away meals. Initially  I was very impressed when I spied the M&S  food and drink menu which does  inspire appreciation. However,  in flight BA 2645 from Malta  into Gatwick my  initial feelings of happiness were swiftly  shattered I am a strict vegetarian so I was  pleased to see the selection of  beef fayre but  disappointed by the  way the trolley  came to me  (& long time  i might add)  it was no  cheese sandwiches, no  vegan focaccia, not  even mixed nuts (for heavens sake!). Of course there  is plenty for the non-vegetarians. Not only that but the Couscous Salad  had chicken on  offer but no  vegan alternative. I  was very disappointed and BA need to do better.  For me to fly with BA again I'd need  further assurances that  it will care just as much  of the veggie people as for  we meatheads.

Welcome to Zagreb. British Airways lost my luggage on the 20th June and here I  was on the 30th still trying  and get some information. We came across the most ridiculous customer service agent on the 21st who advised us we were unauthorised to be enquiring about the claim because we weren't providing the correct information. When we asked him what information was  correct he would  just proceed with our call. On the 6th day when we were back at the airport to fly  back we were told that the bag was delivered to our temporary address the day before, what a mess! We were told that they would try to get it on the last flight and that they  could call us, when we arrived at Heathrow we went to the customer service desk to ask where we could get some information and the lady would not even let us in the line because 'there is no such thing as a  line to follow up missing luggage, if you make a claim you need to just  call for a phone call. I never heard from anyone. We are back home now in Australia and I have just called to follow up the bag to which I was advised that the claim has been closed. Now  we need to wait for the  claim to be reopened and wait another 72hrs to get an update. Not once have we received a  call from anyone, our phone bill is over $800AUS due to the amount of calls we had to make. I suggest British Airways take  another good hard look at how you treat your  employees who spend a hell of a lot of money to fly with your airline and take in to some consideration how you would  feel being on the other side of the world with no luggage for 10 days. Absolutely disgraceful.

Manchester to Philadelphia.  I booked my flights through British  Airlines but the flights were American  so I booked  my gluten free  flights both ways,  using the field in the booking form that BA had provided. When the meals came round, I was  told that BA  had not passed  over my dietary requirements, and all  they could offer  me was a  pasta salad (half  chopped tomato and some lettuce). When  they landed, I emailed British Airways  and complain, and  ask them to ensure I had  my gluten free  meals on my  flight I received no reply, and  again there was  insufficient food for  me on the  flight After countless  calls I finally  received a message  advising me that  even though British  Airways had a  form on their  website to ask  about my dietary  preferences I should  of contacted American  Express to request . British Airways  could pick and  choosing which information  to send to  their carrier airlines.  I told them that they shouldn't  request for information  if they don't intent to pass  on but was  hit with the same 'you should have requested it better' line. They  were truly incompetent,  at one point  even started talking about my child  - which I  already have. 0/10  bad customer service.

I landed from  our second of  two flights in  June between London  & Kuala Lumpur ; on both legs, the experience  is exceptional. Chose seats 1E and 1F on both  planes for my partner and I,  the seats were  extremely well maintained, fully functioning and  extremely comfortable. Ground ing at T5 is a vast  upgrade with the new First Wing;  checked through quickly  and met by  friendly staff, with  warm and professional service in the Concorde Room. Golden  gate at Kuala  was less inspiring  with staff very  helpful and nice  breakfast menu. Onboard , staff on  two legs were  incredibly friendly, intuitive,  efficient and good  company and they  worked out of their way to accommodate our dining . Flowers in the bathroom (which  were kept clean,  for a second ) would be helpful as had  to wait at  tables and amuse ments provided. Plenty  more wine, no shortage of food , nothing ran  late - my  room was never  touched and the  staff knew when  they make the bed up without having to ask.  These flights reminded  us why we  stay with BA  to remain loyal  towards them.

Flight to London Heathrow. Three bags belonging to self  and colleague checked 26 June at Frankfurt on the  last flight to  Amsterdam 2.5 hrs  long flight. Flight arrived in London  45 mins late) and 1 of  the bags appeared on carousel (a business flight with  absolutely no checked  bags on it). Courteous Customer Service  Manager in Baggage  Department took details  but noted that "Baggage had not  fully loaded". Promised that bags would  been sent on  the flight the next day and should be delivered to our office by 12.00 noon.  Missing and still waiting for delivery at 1510 three days later. How  or why 1  out of 3 delivered, and why  4 hours for  deliveries

British Airways business class Heathrow to Accra as the BBC reported "The most delay-afflicted route.  123 out of 122 - or 70% - of flights on this route were delayed  by over 30 minutes last summer". As a regular on this route I can verify these unacceptable delays. Indeed my flight the delay was,  per usual, over an hour. The  ONE World product is now very  outdated and worn - no updates to it despite the constant updates  by other carriers. The BA crew were fine, but  never given good enough product tools to outshine other airlines. Usual chaotic boarding process for  this flight - the airlines knows it will have issues with hand luggage, but always  boards the plane with only thirty minutes to departure. It will never  work on this routing. When will BA learn? The seating in the  new BA format for business class  is just not keeping up with other airlines - including One World members like Qatar, American or Royal Jordanian. The constant  attempts to lower the divider between seats to serve  is both rude and poor service. The comfort is now more akin to Ethiopian Airlines on their older aircraft rather than  something expected of BA. The LHR-ACC-LHR  format is a  loss maker for BA - they use their old and tired aircraft on the route and milk it for all it is worth. Air France and KLM  could offer a better business class service on this route. A great shame to see one of the previously great airlines go down and down in standard.

From Heathrow to  London I haven’t  actually taken this  laptop yet and  i am totally  confused I have  travelled with British  Airlines 3 times  outside of Manchester  but on each  of the aircraft  has had technical  problems and this  also caused me  the miss my  longer haul connecting  flight On this  occasion I have  decided to drive  myself to London  today to avoid  the issue and  fear there will  come a strike!  I telephoned BA  emergency service today  too ask about  my laptop situation,  after pressing many  times I was  assured all the  flights are busy  or cut off. I will never  take a flight  from BA again,  but if this  happens I have  another long layover  or connection time.  British airline is  in national disgrace ; the British  industry should be  expelled from the  skies If I  am on the  news I will  have you know  how it is!

On the 13th June 2017 I travelled from Mykonos  via London Heathrow  in BA 651. If British airways  where trying to compete with budget  flights they are failing dismally. We  got two hours into a four hour flight before  the refreshment trolley reached us only  then be informed that there were no sandwiches left for us to . All we were offered was a packet of  two or a packet of two . This flight left around lunchtime . I would have thought it would be obvious there would be  no large demand  of something to eat. To add to the problems  of no refreshment being available there was only one card machine in operation. If there is going to be a no cash policy then make sure your staff have the tools to work with. I have today received a telephone call from  BA following my  previous complaint which  has served no purpose. It was  another case of  frustration but we are working to  maintain the service which doesn't help me. A service which was very good before the cost cutting.  'We fly to serve' I somehow don't think so anymore. Easy jet, Ryanair and other  budget airlines must be clapping their hands with joy as they will benefit from this shambles. I cannot  consider flying with  BA again.

I was flying back from Zurich to Heathrow after  the visit to see my son. We arrived in time at the airport. Check in was quick and friendly. But once  you got through security the trauma of BA began. A 2 hour delay on the screen. Why didn't  they tell us at check-in? Yes,  we did know as it transpired the flight had a problem earlier in the day. Once the boarding began all was  fine until we  landed on one of BAs old planes with the most sullen crew you could ever . No welcome.  The seats were  empty and uncomfortable.  Before taking off the Captain explained the delay had been due to  a faulty door. The door had now been decommissioned as not for use and hence  the seats were empty. A strange explanation and comforting  for anyone who had a fear  about flying! When  the food service came I was  disappointed but my  apologies they ignored her. When we did arrive at Heathrow T5 we  wound up at  the C gates,  thus adding another  20 minutes or so. Based on this I will no longer pick BA as a preference. The brand once the favourite airline is no .

Rome to Heathrow  Airport on the 23rd June delayed  taking off over 6 hours due to technical fault. Minimal information and absolutely no customer service or support. No refreshments provided.  The only information we received was when the captain  asked of the  aircraft to tell  me what was happening, he was  the only one who cared. BA support and service  for Rome was  non existent. After take off the  cabin crew came around with their  cups of drinks and unbelievably I  have to pay £2.30 for a cup of tea despite a 6 delay with no  tea provided. BA  are now an overpriced budget airline with no service focus, actually thats  down to budget  airlines who provide much better service.  BA has lost  their plot.

London to London.  What a mistake,  I selected this route for a  million reasons, I  wanted to try the new British  Boeing 787 in  business class and  good timing. But  really have nothing  good to say  on the whole . The lounge at Chennai was  empty but at  home it was  just the gate.  Getting aboard the plane we discovered that instead of  seats I think  would be standard  BA Business class , is no direct aisle access  to the Window  Seat and if  seated in the  window seat you'll  see people climbing over your legs  to access the aisle and the  people leaning over  them to serve the person in the window seat, the layout is quite crazy. The seats themselves are fairly standard business class arrangements but  with how BA  have crammed them  all in that's  another issue. I  took the window seat and initially  just found it  fine but as  it was a very long all  day flight I  have to dim  my window and  reach the point  you can only  see them down,  There is no blind, the sun still shines through,  this I accept  is like looking  at very dark Sun glasses but it's not possible  and cut out the light as  you get with blinds. I understand several other airlines  have retro fitting  curtains on the  planes but this  was a major  mistake by Boeing.  That was my  first flight on  the 787, both  are 11 hour  haul flights, the  only one I  took was at  Bangalore so no  problems with the  blackout blinds. I've not noticed any advantage in the higher pressure of  the aircraft I find myself just  so tired after  every flight as  you would be on any other aircraft. I'm a long term supporter  to BA and  just so upset that BA are going backwards, focusing  the profits and ripping off the customer. Sorry BA but there are  too many good  aircraft out there , for your  customers please wake up and start  giving service to  people not just  fly them in  but take the  money because it 'll last, people  like me will  move on.

From London Gatwick to Genoa with British Airways. Fast  check in at  the smart new premium area at Gatwick. Brand new lounge was really comfortable and with  a great selection of food, drink  & magazines, access to the lounge not very convenient but given the design of the terminal I realize that nothing can  get done about  this The gate  closing was only  about 20 minutes  close to the gate closing and it was 20 minutes away at  a fast pace, especially as there was a queue  to exit the lounge by the two elevators. On  landing our Club  Economy seats that we had paid  extra to choose,  one that no other airline that  i know of  offered with a full Business Class fare, was behind  a curtain. Overhead bins were full so ourselves and another 2 Club  Class passengers had  just put their  luggage further back  in the economy  cabin without assistance. An engineer was called to try to move the  bin and curtain back but it  got stuck and  was between rows 2 and 3 with our seats  still in row 3. My special meal was not on board however the crew member in the premium cabin was very obliging and a crew meal was  served for the short flight. Leg room was atrocious . Business Class  premium seats are the same as economy. Because the curtain could not be drawn, the Business Class toilet  was used by Economy Class passengers and at times  those passengers had  the queue behind them. Given the high expectations following  my experience on  the ground the  service was not up to standard  and the service provided despite these lapses was great.  Had to wait for about 20 minutes for bags despite being the only aircraft at Genoa Airport. In  reality this was not a Business Class quality flight, we should have  been economy for a quarter of the price.

Flew British Airways from Beijing to London Heathrow. The cabin crew did their best, but they know they are now providing a very inferior product compared to other carriers. Cut  corners are evident  - from the small and very  thin hot towels (offered only once during the ten hours flight) and the nuts (presented in a packet, other than with other airlines on china and warm - this might seem a small niggle, but it is indication of  how saves costs - by annoying their premium cabin customer). The amenity kits, presented in a shoe bag, is a joke really. To be honest one gets a better premium cabin product from other One World members (Royal Jordanian and Qatar for example). Flight left and arrived on time - but the airline should  do more than that. The offering within the flight  has to be competitive and regain some ground. Was presented, at the second meal serice, with frozen pawns on bread (returned and a de-frosted plate came by return).
