Unsure if prawns being frozen and unfrozen as a good idea - but no effect as yet. Part of the seat was covered with food from the previous flight,  we covered it up with a spare blanket. Despite there being enough toilets for Club World passengers there was often a line of people waiting from World Traveller Plus - snaking past seat in rows 15 and 16. No control of passengers from World Traveller Plus coming in to the Club World cabin. Toilets were not cleaned through the flight by crew - twice they were in a bit of state so I ended up cleaning the floor with tissues myself. Lovely. Shame to see one of the great carriers fall to such low levels.

Flew British Airways from Corfu to London Heathrow. Food service a joke. I have never  written a review on anything in my life, but  how can an airline like British Airways spend probably millions of pounds setting up a new food paying  service by using an antiquated system  with the poor cabin staff needing to find each individual item picture on the hand held computer and  check they have entered the correct number of items instead of using barcodes? Unbelievable if the company has become so badly managed, (how many  failed to come up with this decision?) that common  sense is lost in corporate nonsense. Apart from that, flight great, but sorry BA please  realise your mistake  and put this right.

Back to Santorini. We were at  our gate when  they cancelled our  tickets We could  only get booked on another flight and we got told to go home without our luggage. It took  them 4 days to return it.  They will not reimburse us the cost of the  flight at £1,200 or the cost of the hotel  at £2,000. This is a total . How can they be allowed  the do that?  Consult with another airline to ensure you actually arrive. Never experienced such bad customer service and refusing to refund our money  seems outrageous.

Flight to Durban , London /  Birmingham Check in at Leeds was  smooth Security was slow, so fast track was appreciated. Boarding was relatively quick and flight departed early. Seating  is reasonably comfortable but cramped, and service is basically  non existent unless one is prepared  the pay for  it Transfer at Heathrow was a  breeze surprisingly with  a further security check. Boarding commenced in good time  which was quick  but smooth onto the upper deck,  and a pleasant greeting from the  crew The premium economy cabin is very pleasant with  generous seat width  and legroom. The seats are comfortable, but both our  seats were faulty.  Mine would not  remain upright and  the wife's would  barely recline. Unfortunately  BA did not realise the extent of the problem  immediately and only reported it next  week We were  upgraded to business  only - we should have reported  this immediately! Sparkling  wine and fruit  juices were offered before take off,  although the quality  had been hit by cost savings. Bar service followed quickly after take off, but again the quality of  drinks was average  - not up  with the standard  offered by other  passengers in premium economy. We both  had beef fillet  as dinner - alternative was chicken - which was  tasty and served  with proper crockery with decent cutlery. Breakfast next morning  was economy class fare with plastic cutlery, which along with the cheap and nasty amenity kit lets down  on standard and  raises questions whether the cost saving  is really worth  the negative impression ! The A380  felt very quiet  and most passengers  going to sleep.  We were several  taxi runs during  that night, and  all cabin crew  were quite active. Arrival was on  schedule and everything went smoothly. The  direct connection to  Delta with BA franchise, Comair, was  the reminder of the difference between  travelling in South  Asia and flying  in Europe. More  comfortable and full  breakfast on a one hour flight.

We had an  early morning flight  via London Heathrow  from Dublin to  visit a memorial  service in Ireland.  The check-in process  appeared to have  an automated and  i am not  surprised I saw  some elderly Chinese  couple struggle with  the computers and  two uniformed staff  member in BA  just walked away  but ignored them.  Security intervened and . The interior  in the aircraft  looked spotless. However,  there was no catering per se  other than a  quick buy Marks  & Spencer items. No cash was  allowed and the  seats were very  low The cabin  crew were lovely people and deserve  more than to  see the name  as a once  mighty national carrier  due to such  poor miserly product.  I was punctual.

Bangkok to Luxembourg  via London. Premium economy on British  Airlines is disappointing.  This Bangkok to  London route is  dominated by B777  aircraft that look  when they've seen better days. Boarding  is chaotic on  all outward and return flights. Seats are old and  generally not very  comfortable and with  little recline. The IFE is poor in terms of choice, the screens are the smallest I've ever seen,  and the sound quality is very  low The food served is ok.  Service on board during the outward leg was perfunctory but excellent on  my return leg,  with the cabin attendant who served me being a  big credit and  asset to the airline. The short haul flights between  London and Luxembourg  (+ economy) were good. It's time for British Airways  better pull up  its socks if it wants to compete with the leading Asian, Middle  East airlines, or even the better European ones.

London Heathrow to  Paris Orly. I have been a gold member of BA over 25 years making approx 100 flights per  year We have  been through ash  and strikes, IT breakdowns and weather , of late the spiral of poor response has picked up pace.  We didnt think  BA could get  better but it did. Arrived at the airport and my app said  On time, screens  said on time but my independent  airline app said  two hours delay. In the first class lounge I  got told short  notice Knowing how inaccurate BA can be I asked to speak to special services. One hour later I  asked again. I  encountered an arrogant manager who lectured me that she was only two on duty, take  her up with Alex Cruz and  they were more important flyers like  family and celebrity.  That is how I felt after 25 years of Gold guest list. She then told me the flight was cancelled and said I would have to either  book the flight the next morning or make my own arrangement .Staff  should know how to get people out of the  lounge and despte ing on time for Charles De Gaulle no alternative was offered. I had to concede and cancelled critical business discussion and  instead beg BA for a refund which they tried to sidestep. The moral of this story is when  my gut tells  us trust has  to believe it and at BA  it is systemic lack of honesty and transparency and it all points to the CEO.  The other interesting fact is I  didnt look at  BA before booking including Easy jet <100 pounds Air France 500 pounds and foolishly I felt loyalty meant something. Not at this airlin . The salt in  this wound is that Easyjet and AF got to their destination on time and no doubt executives on  both flights are  having a good  working day in . It is incredible that one  man who carry's the British flag  became such a disgrace. I am sure that a small percentage are  disappointed but looking at the chaos and disbelief in the lounge last  week echoes the most common phrase  used in airline speak. What has happened to BA and we wont fly them again.

Flew New York  JFK to Copenhagen  to Heathrow. Have  a Premium Economy  ticket on Cathay,  Air Lufthansa and  Air France. By far, British Airways is the worst! World Traveler Plus  definitely means Plus  and everything else  was downhill. Seats  are cramped, recline  for a few , food awful, sorry but that is the best adjective to describe what was served. Amenities practically non-existent and wrapped in  one tube of toothpaste (if only the cap would open) could only  meet brushing requirements  for half a  pair of teeth, no covers for  your headphones. Totally  inadequate for the  price paid and shaming the word Premium Economy. Before I forget, the  Customer Service was confusing, calling colors  like Silver, Sapphire, etc. People just  cutting the line and the staff losing their voice,  yelling for order. Why not just  go the way you sell -  Premium Biz, Premium,  Premium Trying too hard to be  Great

From London to Hamburg. I cannot believe that an airline like British  Airlines have to  fight with the likes of Ryanair  and EasyJet and stopped complimentary cabin  boarding - no drinks, no snacks. They should be  proud of themselves  and put themselves a class on  flights with low cost airlines.  I am now cofused why I 'd ever fly British Airways vs  Low Cost Airlines.  i was recently  there flying on Club World. My luggage was tagged ! But waited  on arrival for over 30mins - non priority bags came out mixed with priority - British Airways policies  and operations are clearly confused and it's losing its  place as a  much reknowned airline.

British Airways charges a big premium for Premium Economy. I sat on the top floor of the A380 after being upgraded from World Traveller at the gate, and enjoyed an aisle seat flying from Singapore to London Heathrow. There were two dinner  options chicken tikka  or beef fillet, but as I dozed off I missed out. So no food until 1 hour before landing (11 hours later) unless I wanted to pay for chocolates with a credit card. I kindly asked for some water, got some orange juice too - didn't want to push it even  though I saw a bottle of  wine open in the galley - not worth the risk of a bad reaction. I  would recommend this cabin based on the high prices they charge. The staff mean well - however a gulf of enthusiasm exists between them an Singapore Airlines, Qatar, Cathay etc. It's not cultural, it's just indifference. Will continue to book BA for cheap economy (product/service offers almost no difference) and enjoy upgrades where given.

Singapore to London.  I have started  doing take British  Airlines as it's  my corporate requirement.  The Business Class  (& World) is  more like Premium . The seats  feel small and  cramped especially with the layout for  a passenger sitting  next to the  bed - you  were basically trapped  there and you'd have to disturb the other passenger  or get out.  Unfortunately the "bed"  does not extend fully so it  is creatively a makeshift "fold down  stool - if  I apply too much pressure on that stool, it  twists itself and  begins to break off from the  bed - it's  very flimsy! The food is very  bad quality and  extremely bland - I have already  had the regular  meals and special ity - don't ! The service  was poor with  the crew that  is  not  able to provide for the comfort of business class . Overall, I  am very disappointed.

Today was my first flight from Toronto to London crewed by "Mixed "! Easy check-in at Toronto Pearson (The BA ground staff are always great in Toronto) with fast track meant I was in the lounge  20 mins after arriving at the airport. The lounge remains well run with ok food and a limited  white wine list. Still too few bathrooms, the seats are tatty, and when busy is not a relaxing place to be. Easy boarding and the first of a few improvements - prosecco now  limited to London. (used to be only ex London). Fast drinks service after take off with pretzels now back on offer. An OK Chicken  sandwich was served  but I still don't see it as Biz class ! A choice of whites and reds wine was  provided which reinstates the previous one of each. That is where the improvements ended. The morning offering of a cereal bar and T&Cs / juice remains an insult and just shows how little BA care about the entire journey customer experience. The crew on this flight were great. Young, junior and inexperienced for sure but the two women working my side were friendly and professional. A request for a top up of prosecco was missed due to a short taxi, but appeared (in glass) without asking as soon as the crew were released - classy and well remembered! The return flight was less good. Drinks served promptly after take off and my pre-booked meal arrived first but on the wrong tray. (Crew member's first flight since qualifying) It took some convincing that the plastic cutlery etc was not a WTP tray. The underwhelming snack replacing the second meal was one fun size piece of chocolate and T&C. Customers taking a second chocolate were made to put it back (really) as apparently they are counted out to the exact number of passengers. This cut to service on both legs continues to leave me troubled as after 5 hours I need something more substantial than chocolate. Service reduced - yes, price reduced  and no! The 777's in both directions were clean though unless you sit in the first row of WTP, the IFE screens are tiny. Mixed fleet were generally more friendly and interested in making an effort. However, the male crew were more aloof, lacked attention to detail and officious. What these (newer) crews miss, was the more informal / laid back service of Long Haul crew - I hope they relax into the role soon! At least the cuts have stopped (not much left to cut I admit) and small things like choice of wine and pretzels show BA have listened. However, the second meal <mask> both directions being cut on east coast US / Canada routes remains a sore on what was otherwise an ok journey. The jury remains out on whether I continue my loyalty to BA and One World - it really depends on what BA do next - to either value me as a customer (and offer a <mask> service) or sink even lower in standards from what was once a great airline <mask> which point - I'm off).

I arrived at London Heathrow in transit with a  US Airways flight  connecting to another BA flight. The  flight was there, still boarding, my  luggage was checked-in for my final  flight but I wasn't! They forgot to check me  off for my full journey at departure. They didn't let me board, and made me stay overnight. I have never seen  this level of  such bad management and poor service.

The crews on both the outbound and inbound flights from Johannesburg to  Bangkok were very  much unprofessional, and  totally missing the  good character and wit that used to make the British Airways crews  unique and outstanding. They were basically (on both flights)  sleeping through the service and not  even be seen  in the next  two hours before  their breakfast service. On both flights,  the was no water offered during  the night, which is really a  problem considered the price difference between economy and premium.  The meals were overcooked, and on both flights the knives could not  cut through the "best of British Beef". Given that the hot meals are the same  price in Club (according to BA's marketing), I would have been furious if being offered this quality of food in Business ! A perfect example of unprofessionalism  among the crew  came when I got up after  lunch and went  to the galley (as nobody cared  or answer the bell) and asked  about a Baileys: the young attendant  glanced at her coworker and asked her what a Baileys was, and  an answer came "sorry Sir, we don't have that  type of wine.  Would you like some white?" I  am missing the  good old BA and will take  my business to some other reputable airlines in the  future even if it means paying a few hundreds more.

Flew Valencia to London Gatwick with British Airways. Check in was a bit disorganised as  the check in for business class had a problem with the computer so this caused a delay. Security was a bit slow (no fast track). Business class lounge is quite large but refreshments poor, note this is not a BA lounge as they only have one flight a day and is provided by a local partner. Boarding was a disaster, we were called to board but then waited on the air-bridge for  about 20 minutes.  The air-bridge was made of glass and was full  of people and  we soon became very uncomfortable as there was no  heating or ventilation and some people seemed close to passing out. Eventually we all returned to the terminal as there was a problem on the plane (apparently a problem with the curtain structure that divides business from economy). There was no communication from the ground  staff which although not BA staff  reflected badly on the airline. Once we were finally on-board the flight was trouble free.  Great service. Hot meals served but  some pasta we chose was not very pleasant. Plane arrived only 10 minutes late having made up a lot of time from the initial delay. priority baggage worked as our case was on the carousel as soon as cleared passport control. Would have been a nice trip back bar the problems in Valencia airport.

London Heathrow to Edinburgh return, possibly my last BA flights. I used economy (or maybe  to be re named) economy minus outbound and returned in Club Europe, checked in online however 4 of the 5 checking  out kiosks were not working at T5 so in the end collected the boarding pass from the desk. Security quick I'm a BA/Oneworld sapphire member so used the North lounge which was okay. Flight boarded on time but departed 15 min late and arrived 15 min late. A320, seat 11A an exit seat was fine however no service at all on board. Return check in quick as was security, the BA lounge  on EDI has been the same for a few years now. It's at least quiet with nice staff and pleasant staff. Boarding through gate 20 on to a pretty old 767 departed 30 min late. Club  Europe on domestic flights is a new introduction. Actually  it replaced what  was BA economy class. A cynical ploy by the BA board to extract more money out of its loyal customers? The aircraft was pretty full so some people like BA although I suspect many passengers were transferring at LHR. Service was okay food economy standard although included in the price. Arrival at T5 around 30 min late 10 min for bags. I fly between 20 & 30 times each year 90% on long haul flights. I have supported BA in the past although I've not used them  short haul for about 17 months. Basically they are not good enough. Cut backs and  poor service is evident. I expect security comfort and some service when paying £2500+ for a business class ticket. Qatar, Cathay and even SriLankan offer better service. On reflection I fly business class on most flights so I don't actually need any frequent flyer status. The cost of loyalty outweighs the benefits. I might fly BA in future as a  very last resort or to use  up the miles I've earned. But my loyalty will be my wallet in future. Bye BA.

Flight to Valencia in an A319 in Club Europe. This was the  first time we had flown British Airways since the move to the south terminal, check in was quick and progress through security also without . BA lounge was busy but  with plenty of seating available. Refreshments in the lounge  provided but nothing special. Boarding on time, cabin crew  at Club Europe were very pleasant  and efficient as I always find with BA. Meal  is surprisingly good  for a relatively short flight, three courses quite tasty including smoked salmon  and Thyme Roasted  Salmon for main course and chocolate cheesecake, washed down with a couple of glasses of champagne. Note BA no longer use miniature bottle and  wine as required  only proper sized bottles. Cheese and  wine a bit sad and the cracker were soft. Plane landed ahead of schedule but priority baggage didn't work and our cases was about the last through. Overall a good flight.

Go to Rome  via London. There are no substantial  improvements to the  fares offered by a low-cost airline:  no free food/beverage, little leg space,  lots of seets only for extra , etc. However, the price I paid was at a low-cost level  as well, so the value for  money is OK.

Its cost cutting beyond belief. Dirty  and uncomfortable seats,  where entertainment is  something that would  never existed in  the 80s, has been the same  for several years.  No meal choice (meat). either one meat or veg.  Every empty cabin across the entire  airport ran out  for alcohol too.  They have and  is continuing to cost cut, but  still haven't cut their prices to  reflect this. I  would seriously fly  anywhere else. Enough is enough, you've had my 15 years of loyalty , exec club  members or not,  pay off -  i will advise  you to do the same. I 'd give a  2 out of  1 the 1 % purely for  any cabin crew  that are embarrassed by what is now Budget Airways.

London Heathrow to Madrid. An absolute third world experience once I got  on the plane. Check-in and lounge  facilities were great, but once I got onboard it became obvious how  worn out some of the 767 aircraft are. There were seats with missing backs and  ' Not Occupy' covers in front  seats beside them, random bits of  aircraft wiring hanging  down from rails in the overhead, and grimy, yellowed  carpet around most of the cabin interior. You have  to worry about  damage going on  the important bits, like the engines, if the same  treatment is applied  on the aircraft  or in the  cabin The crew  spend as much time as they  could in the galley, and interacted  to passengers as  quickly as possible.  Their breakfast service was a salt-infused hot cooked offering,  and just one  bottle of drinks. Anything else you  needed you had to use the call button. The  main and only reason I booked  this cabin was that it was actually just a few pounds more expensive on the  first ticket routing I'd bought.

Gatwick to Alicante.  The wife, my son (4) and me all flew  in Euro Club  On our way to Alicante, for some reason when  booking Club it  was the same  seats as normal so it was  really no brainer.  My son has autism so we  had the quite  frankly amazing way  to start our  journey as he  seemed very calm , The staff  of BA were  extremely friendly before and on the  plane which was a nice touch. Club Euro is  a decent service  if you pay  a little extra,  your lounge is a nice start then the extra  room is nice  off the plane,  but a shame  when all the  airline reviews point out the seats are the same  it would be  nice to have slightly more legroom

Flight to Antigua.  a frequent flyer  on BA for  over 15 years,  in exec club,  I have seen  fares steadily decline  at this airline  especially over the  next 18 months  after Alex Cruz  takes over. my  husband and I  travel regularly in eco/prem and club  based on prices, so have seen  the decline across all classes. recent  flights to Antigua  from LGW was . A pretty  decent cabin, filthy  in the word,  as in flight  lounge (Rockwell) that  has changed in  recent years easily.  The choice is  now longer a  buffet its a  pasta dish or  some alcoholic beverages  are loaded at  BA (LGW) for  two legs, so  passengers have now  lost what they  were stocked previously.  4 hours into  flight there was  two spirits left . bearing in  that only one  glass had been  purchased prior to  a meal service 1.5 hours in to the flight.  They state in  the motto "to  fly to serve".  So they certainly  are flying, but  almost certainly not serving. The cabin  attendants are ashamed  and embarrassed at  price cuts which is evident in  their conversations at  in back of the aircraft, and  to anyone who  spoke to them  they are disgusted  at what the  management have done. They have cheapened  a brand of the national carrier, but haven't cheapened  their prices. easyjet , Ryanair offer  cheaper and on  the haul its  back to the  US I will now fly Virgin  amongst others, again , more for  the money in  all aspects of  this flight. Stop  attempting to make  your budget, we  want it back  is how it  ought to be! All I can  hope is the  apology passengers will  be receiving following  their major IT  upgrade a fortnight ago is one  part of paying  us back for  the awful attitude  and decline in  Thai Airways.

London City to  Birmingham The price  on the ticket  – £500 for a 2 hour flight - had no relationship to  our ultra-economy service  for this flight.  The aircraft was  incredibly dirty -  we wonder whether  it pays for  vacuum cleaners as other airlines don't seem to have  cleaner aircraft. In Business the seats  look identical to  economy so what are we actually paying for? There  is no place to power devices and forget WiFi  and overhead screens. In business the  breakfast was an  excellent English breakfast.  No better than  that The embarrassed flight attendants seemed to give all  those business passengers  something to take-away  and try and make up for the no-frills service.  It feels chronic under investment for years has left  them a bare-bones  airline milking short-term  profits and forgetting  all their business  trips should be more than just for 1 year.

Best economy premium Boston-London Heathrow-Geneva. Again  all too often  a British Airways  BA flight left  less than an  hour late due  of a plane technical problem. As a consequence our  scheduled flight in  London was missed,  having to wait  for 5 hours  for LHR although  we were earlier . Since our  scheduled arrival was  booked by BA  a least 5 hours in advance  then didn't they  very least pre-book our connecting flight from LHR. Long  attempts at rebooking  with very little  satisfaction of customers. Then again flight  with LHR left  with Breakfast on  BA long haul . Service on  a short haul  flights equals those of charter flights.  Since I have  been travelling with  airlines for 25 yrs with silver  to gold status,  but will avoid  flights with BA  once and for  that let know  from me that  the airline is  really not a shadow of what it used to  be

Welcome to Bordeaux.  Two newish A320  with seats. The  whole buy onboard  from M&S does  NOT work! It  turns the cabin  of the entire  flight to work just about the  same economy cabin,  which some people  not even getting ! At least easyjet and Ryanair  had this down to a tee  and serve promptly.  Nothing has gone  fast and nothing  stops sad customers  and embarrassed cabin  and BA certainly isn't cutting prices  for flights. Ryanair  & easyjet offer  many similar routes  at half the  price as BA.  I know where  this will be  in my custom  in future.

London to Boston return in premium economy. Another very disappointing flight experience with BA. Overall a low cost experience at a premium price. Baggage drop in T5 is now self service unless you fly business or first, which feels like easyjet. Lounge was very busy and choice of food very limited.  The plane was a 23 year old B747, which seemed to be in its  original or close  to original configuration. The screen in the seat in front of my was the size  on my iphone and the choice of movies was very limited. The cabin crew was  friendly and did their best to operate in horrible  condition Food was not edible, i  tried the beef option but could not eat it. What i found truly shocking was the snack in morning of the return leg was nothing more than a muesli bar in premium economy. -Cost savings taken to ridiculous levels at BA. They have even managed to find a way to economise on the quality of the sleep  bags supplied (no more cotton or other skin friendly material on the inside but awful full nylon / polyester material and only one instead of two straps  on back). I am taking my business elsewhere and only use BA to spent the avios.

Getting to London  with a reasonably  priced airfare. Check-in  line was quite  easy with friendly  crew member at  Newark airport who  brought my portable  battery charger from  my Departure lounge  but a bit  annoying due to  the laptop ban  and checking each  checked bag manually.  The board was  disappointing to say  very least, in  general it was  chaotic and a  little disappointing that  the British Airways  makes passengers have  to pay for  meal and drink  based products but  not overpriced). Also,  There was no  live entertainment and  the cabin crew  was indifferent. The  drinks on the  flight were also  very hard and  annoying The whole  fare offering is  pretty good compared  to other competing  carriers on this  site (who have  restrictions on many  good food and  the IFE). The  airline was more  of a low  impact carrier. I  dont think I'll  try to fly  there again unless  we have to.

Welcome to Mumbai.  Poor customer service. I have benn trying to change my flight with them for the last three days, and they keep blaming the travel agent, even through  my ticket was issued by BA, after the meltdown on the 27th. If you get through to their India call center you might as welll hang up the phone, as they are rude and all they will do is keep blaming the  third party, will inturpt you when you are trying to speak, just awful service. Agree British airways is going downhill. Been a silver member for many years,  need to look  at another provider. Just awful customer service which BA, won't care to look into.

I am a frequent flyer with British Airways, having held Silver membership  four years. On  another instance, I flew BA's short-haul business class. While you're essentially in  your same cabin as everyone else, you should get  your meal onboard (something I had counted on) and the seat next to you should be left empty. I fly this route around once every other week, but have been BA to long-haul destinations (Hong Kong, Beijing, NYC, D.C. and San Francisco) several times a year, my experience on this flight tallies with the  other flights I have taken this year on the same and other routes. The aircraft came in late,  as is a common occurrence with  airlines these days. Except for me, nobody in Business Class had an empty seat next to them. We were then informed  from the overworked and tired flight attendant that no food had been  delivered although we 'might be' able to obtain food  vouchers once we  got to LCY. In short, the product was exactly the same as Economy class but at an added premium of at least the price  of your regular economy ticket. This was complemented by slow and unfriendly check-in staff, an old aircraft, and a good hour I had spent on the phone with unaccountable and  unreliable BA customer service to work out if the online upgrade had gone through. On the whole, a number of instances  that simply add up make me feel that BA is very much  going in the wrong direction. They might be cheap, but can't and shouldn't compete with low-cost carriers or  other Asian airlines that have lower overhead costs.

The wife and  i were very  pleased with our  Jet Airways flights  in Sydney to  Sydney return, flying  in economy. The  air quality, cutlery  & service was  of a much  better standard than  the airlines such  as Air New  York and Qantas  Airways we have . There are  no toilets allocated  throughout the cabin,  which are located  in the middle  of the economy cabin, quite a  short walk and  many times a  fairly long line of other passengers  trying to use , The seats  are a bit  better comfortable and  comfortable than economy  and the entertainment  on screen is  large as are  the films music  and earphones. BA  flights offer priority  check in at  home as do  many airlines. We would not fly  a BA premium  ever again, it is not worth  paying the much  higher expensive fare  for the standard  Economy fare.

London to Hong Kong on a very new B777-300ER.  This was upgraded to WT+ at  first gate, owing to a full  economy and probably being an Emerald with oneworld. I can now distil  any difference in  economy with economy  to the same  thing - with  economy you will  have one amenity pack (eyeshades, socks,  just one welcome drink ("cava or ") one glass for drinking with  a first meal,  plus slightly wider  seats (1 inch), minor extra recline  1 inch) and a little extra  food as well , a meaty  option for the  final dinner (I  am vegetarian so picked the vegetarian,  this was the  same BA carby  meal from WT,  and was fine).  We enjoyed the IFE, the crew  was nice and  my flight on eworld I wouldn't  recommend a premium  ticket more than  anything for the  overall experience for this flight, or other WT+ routes.  From a service, it's not really premium economy, in  fact it's inferior  and economy offered . 5 star .

Flight to Dubai.  The crew, everything  was terrible. Caught up in the  chaos of BA  computer system collapse  of 27th May  - very lucky , get tickets  to flight next day. BA staff  left out to  lunch by appalling  airport management. Flight  was next day,  was excellent but  an ancient 747  did so with  an IFE. Food  on seat comfy  seats had seen  better days and  needs re-upholstering. Was  told luggage would be on board  - it was  dumped in the  middle of Heathrow  during the day  but luggage finally  turns up Wednesday - 4 days  late Compensation claim  by BA rather  the lot -  it all gets  worse BA have  had a number  of IT failures  within 12 months,  are too unreliable  to the moment , will be  no other carriers  working on this  one for a  lot of years  - I know  it has resolved  the reliability problems  but the product offering is more  improved Shame really,  they used to  work for something  but its now  back to the  customer

from Heathrow to Vancouver. I am  deeply disappointed by  the gradual decline. Today I flew in the upper deck of the A380. BA's business class seats, once the best in the industry, are almost the worst. The pods are 8 abreast in the upper deck and very narrow. This is an unpleasant aircraft, with  4 toilets to share between 64 passengers. In business Class I think  this a poor ratio. The flight  crew were initially reasonably friendly (though I noticed no acknowledgement for being a Gold Card holder), but their interest waned as the flight progressed. It took 2 hours to get a drink and almost 4 hours from take off  before the main  meal was served.  Our beef was cold as were the vegetables. It was actually inedible. I suspect it had just been left out. After dinner we were  half way through our 8 hour flight and I was never offered another drink. I gave my suit to be hung up and had to beg to reclaim it at the end of  the flight. British Airways has gone from being one of the best to one of the worst airlines  we have flown ! This is a great shame. The cabin is bad, the food is awful, the flight attendants unpleasant . IFE OK. .

I took a  long daytime flight from Tokyo to London (about 12 hours). The Boeing 787 seemed fairly new and was clean, and the Premium Economy seat  was fairly comfortable  for a day , with good  padding although unfortunately  the is no legrest and a  small entertainment box  took up much of the foot space. The catering was really poor  which seemed to 've been affected  in cost cutting: lunch was a small portion of  some tough beef,  followed by a tiny salad which  is still frozen; there was then nothing for nine  hours (no snacks  offered anymore) until  the second hot  meal of a small chicken curry,  only served shortly before landing. A choice of drinks  were offered only  once shortly after ; during the entire remainder of  the flight the crew came around  me twice with water and juice, but nothing else was offered; the second meal came with a minuscule cup of water  with nothing else (I asked for more water but the crew said  we didn't have .) By the time we landed I was hungry and thirsty, and  we would advise anyone using this  flight to bring  your own food  and drink. The crew were invisible for most of the flight. The  sound system had a very good choice although the  options seemed smaller than on some  flights Overall not .)

British Airways were  just awful on this flight from Heathrow to Miami.  Poor old tired ? These old aircraft are in desperate need of a refit. Seat  size screens unbelievably small. What shocked  me most is just how much BA have cut  down on their food service. No  shortage of pretzels  in the first drink serving anymore. Dinner was only two choices and  one was a vegetarian option. The chicken breast I received was laughable. I have seen  worse chicken nuggets.  It came with  an inedible salad concoction and a bread roll. The  ONLY other food offered was two tiny sandwich triangles for 'afternoon tea' with a miniscule scone. My advice would be to  eat before your flight otherwise you  could be very hungry. Staff were miserable and on  our return leg kept me awake all night by  singing very loudly in the galley. Unfortunately BA have  now become a  long haul Ryanair, scrimping on every little thing. Not good.

I flew out  of terminal 5 on Saturday with  British Airways to Brussels, and found  staff to be very helpful and , we even  got a nice  conversation with a  friend as we  went up in the lift to departures. We got the feeling that people were very anxious to put the disastrous previous  experience behind them.  They used the  airport as we  had a silver card, and they  seemed busy, but well staffed, and  their food was good. On the  plane we took  my own home  cooked sandwiches since we really didn't  like the Marks  n Spencer prices. I bought a bottle of water close to our  flight and thought that was expensive ; but the BA on board  rate was £1.80  / bottle. I  did notice that  our flight attendants  seemed very good  at giving out  large glasses of free water. Like  you I can't get used to  how budget airways approach, it's clearly  why the staff  here are very  helpful On our return, we had  some delays due to the storms in southern England,  and air traffic restrictions. Then, we had Brussels air traffic delay due  of their system ! At all  costs the first officer kept us  all informed and we got back  to London and were parked on a good jetty  enough that we  could rush to  catch up. This delay was not  anyone s fault,  and the cabin crew on both flights were friendly  but efficient. I enjoyed the flight but hope that  they do not  need any further  delays and perhaps  think about restoring  my food and  drink again one day.

British Airways seems  too be going  very bad to  worse On my  last Heathrow to  Manchester flight, the  cash machine didn't  recognise American credit , so the  passenger next to  us couldn't pay  with his drink.  The length of  time it took the flight attendants  and reach the  front of the  flight meant most  people weren't offered  anything to eat or drink until  20 minutes to  return The flight  crew were very  polite but you  know that they  really are fed  up and seem  genuinely embarrassed to be working for BA. Return flight was delayed by 40 mins which  appears to be  the running theme with this airline.  They are no better than the  budget airlines but  hardly anything other  that budget prices.

Booked Gatwick to Lima return. Out sold Traveller+ (premium ), which was  just too bad.  The Club World was appalling! Seats and surround grubby. Equipment maintenance poor. Service was appalling.  Staff rushed almost  screamed at when asking what we wanted. Expected us to know how  to operate equipment. Food thrust at us not served!  Very rushed. No  change in service.  Limited choice not  just just 'what ' you want.  Unless it were  not for the flat beds overnight  this is a total waste of  money It is so sad that BA is going  to the dogs, a business is nothing without customers and BA are  having a great  job at alienating them. I will  not fly BA long haul again.

Back to Johannesburg. After getting caught up in the  middle of the  bank holiday weekend  flight fiasco and  some lamentable way  in which the  issue was handled  by BA, I  boarded my flight back to the  US with some . My fears were not unfounded.  Although the aircraft  has been sitting  on JNB for most of the  day there were no delays and  flights started very  quickly I was  seat 83A (top  tier double seat)  but the leg room was no  worse than you  might find on  the Ryanair flight  into Dublin. Indeed,  due to the  placement of the  medical equipment box  under the seat,  everything was a  little more cramped.  Customer service on  BA flights really  felt terrible. I,  together with many other passengers, was treated like an  animal and I  suspect the cabin  staff would really  much preferred it  that we weren't there. I was  relegated to the  bathroom and sleep  deprivation pretty much , due, in  addition to the cabin crew gossiping  excessively about other  levels of staff.  And will do  everything I can  to avoid flying  again in the  future

Washington to Sofia  and London, flying World Traveller Plus premium economy to  Brussels and EuroTraveller  plus on the  short hop. Top quality service, whatever may have declined in economy class, premium economy is  as good as ever with 38in leg-room and meals (really tasty in this instance) that can be ordered in advance. The cabin crew are still the BA strength creating a relaxed, congenial atmosphere in the cabin. Smooth connections at Terminal 5 with no waiting (either way) and Tribute  of Ale available on the long  line drinks menu, and service is  the winner. (I'll admit the M&S food/drink service can  seem a bit  confusing as far as handling the payments, but works OK otherwise.) British Airways continue to  provide a first-rate travel experience, and  worth sticking with them.

Flight to Rome  via Heathrow. I have been either BA Gold or  silver for many years , the last 2 years I was in  Italy but ensured my return to  UK that flights  are always BA , the same for my family  that visited. in  July 2016 I  went to UK  off business and had to stay  until Jul 12th, I was 3 points off retaining  the Gold if  BA had flown  out on 11 th I would 've retained Gold.  i had enquired about this before  doing the booking and was told  that will not be a problem,  but I was  quickly downgraded to Silver. I then booked a holiday  in Rome for my wife and  daughter and I was amazed that  BMI have removed  all free in flight drinks not  including a free  drop off tea ! If BA wish to behave like a budget  airline then they  should charge flight  fares comparable to  other budget airine.  BA have in the past left me stranded in  Rome for 5  weeks when snow closed Heathrow, yet BMI were still flying into Heathrow,  I have encountered  no staff on  flights in, long  waits even for Executive members. They  are no longer  living up to their acclaimed standards  and are not  yet 4 star  brand and should lose that status,  they will in future fly Brussels Airlines and Lufthansa 's Internal UK Easyjet. They are living on their past and need to start to realise with no passengers they will  only stay in  debt and with  the customers who have to use them they will  all get poor , If BA wish to be  the budget airline  then start charging  like one

Rome to Heathrow. Having used BA Business / Club  quite some time we always felt it was the little extra treat  we add to our holiday. It's  had a deteriorating service recently but the last trip  in and from Rome was the decider. The cabin was filthy with litter and crumbs from the previous flight on and around the seats. No nuts or nibbles and the drinks were dispensed from open bottles, the miniature wine bottles apparently dispensed with now. There was a choice of meals but  we weren't told unless you asked. The meal service no sooner served than it was being cleared away.  Sometimes we felt that we were an inconvenience to the smooth running of the airline. The advantages of booking club have gone, the lounges being dreadful with little choice of snacks, the priority labels mean you bags come off last, and you only get priority  seating if you scramble past the queue. Add to  that that on occasion the boarding pass will fail at security. It  should not be allowed to carry our national flag.

It was the fist time I traveled with British Airways and I believe it will be the last. I had to reschedule my flight from Tampa to Tirana via Gatwick from December 2016 to March 2017. First, I couldn't change it online  and the 'manage your flight' option didn't work (they told me it happens some times), and I tried it a lot of times before  calling them, so I had to  pay +25$ for  booking it via phone (they took the money even though it wasn't my fault). I  had more than  50 calls from November to a day before traveling to reissuing my e-ticket. After a long wait to get connected, they took my credit card data and said they will proceed to reissuing the e-ticket and  sending it to  the e-mail, for nearly 6 months it never come  even 1 day before the flight. Every time I called they said they didn't have my cvv which  was re-confirmed every time When asked when will I  have the ticket, they said: after 10 days, which only came on 27th of March and I was to travel on 28th. Once they nearly set me to fly to Charlotte, NC, while  losing my data and cvv during one of the 50 calls I  made Besides this, the food was ridiculous, but never  forget that, the anxiety, time consumed  and the distress  I caused can't  get either bought  nor excused. How can a consolidated, serious company as they proclaim can be so irresponsible,  bad for the customer, not complying to the minimum standards? I expected soo much from them, it was a total disappointment!

Chicago to London  depends on British  Airways much vaunted  Cabin Service in  Economy Class. Be  aware this service  as a joke. Never mind the terrible, dated, seats facing one another,  but the BA  Customer Service mandates you eat in  an awful Biz Class lounge at  BA and then  get no dinner service on the  way This is  the monumental con. Also, imagine your  average school meal in a school  cafeteria and that is what you  were in the BA lounge at ? The food was some kind of dreadful steamed  stew that you  knew would not  satisfy your dog.  We used to imagine that long  term business and  economy class passengers were valued by  the airlines. The  US Airways business  Class product is the worst by far. Old aircraft, old seats, disillusioned crew, and simply  the most terrible  service imaginable. British  airlines hold their premium class passengers in contempt. What happened to English  hospitality and manners?

Gatwick to Funchal. British Airways has won the race  to the bottom. Leg room on this flight was appalling - worse  that Ryanair. I  cannot understand why  - free food on 'short hops' but this flight was four hours. I wonder just  how we gained  from a 'full " airline. Our  previous British Airways  trip was on a Gatwick 777  and they are  bringing an extra 50 seats to these planes. With  their recent IT  upgrades they have  taken the bottom  and don't need  us do anything else!

I am shocked about how the First Class on board service has deteriorated with very evident cost cutting  by what is supposed to be our national flag carrier. On our flight to Tokyo  recently from London Heathrow we were advised by the Cabin Crew soon after take off that the catering supplies loaded were 'limited'. To cut a long story short, this meant that my partner, who was the last to be served, was told what was available rather than asked  how he would like. This is in spite of  us being only  4 passengers in the 8 seat cabin. For breakfast prior to landing, we were informed that only two cooked breakfasts were available so it would be first come first served. The presentation of  the food that was available was poor & certainly not worthy of the fine dining description BA uses for its First  Class catering. We spoke to the Cabin Services Manager who was extremely apologetic & confirmed that there has  been cost cutting - apparently at the behest of the new CEO who comes from low cost sister airline Vueling, with a resultant increase in unhappiness & complaints from passengers. The famous First  Flight Tasting Menu  passengers enjoyed on previous flights is now gone & other cost cutting around on board  services is very evident - even the rose in  the First Class  menu was dead which really epitomises the lacklustre airline that BA has ! I fly regularly long haul with KLM & their new Business Class offering is now far superior  over BA's First. How can our national airline, with whom we should be proud to fly, compete with other superior European & Gulf carriers when the emphasis seems to be only on never ending cost cutting that now affects even the most premium passengers? The Cabin Services Manager entered a formal complaint on our behalf from on board on 3 May. Almost a month later, although immediately acknowledged, BA have not responded, probably due to  further administrative cost cutting. I should add that the ground service at Heathrow T5 &  The Concorde Room were very good but as regards on board service, BA offends their premium passengers like this at their peril.

Flying Cheapskates. Business class flight in  Northern Europe' from Luxembourg to London  which is beyond a joke, and clearly on a shoe-string budget. No pre-meal drink offered. Limited selection of drinks, with wine served in plastic screw-top mini bottles warm with no  heat Meal selection consisted of a chicken salad/prawn (which looked reasonably nice however I'm allergic to seafood) or  soft toasted cheese ! The roll was dry, tasteless and completely unsatisfactory, could have easily bought something better at Greggs. Crew could clearly be  seen bad mouthing their CEO over the airlines recent  technical 'problems'. Friendly crew though - can't help but feel sorry for them.

Geneva to Dallas  via Heathrow. I  checked online and confirmed I had two bags of allowance to check  in with my  first economy seat purchased. However, when I went to  the airport to  bring in the luggage BA insisted  that I only  needed one bag allowance and I had to pay. I had no other choice so  just paid. I  spoke with BA  at Heathrow and they confirmed I  needed two bags.  Now I will  need to go through sending the customer service a  statement to get  my refund. Not happy that their  policy is not in coordinance with each other.

Choose a budget , the magic of our national carrier has gone. We have always chosen British Airways as our preferred carrier where possible and happy to pay a higher  premium for the once great service but now it's on par or lower than other low cost carriers. Firstly we didn't get any priority boarding with our two young children. EasyJet provides this. Secondly, we reserved seats as travelling with our two children, they both fight for who is going to sit at the windows. On boarding we were told the plane has changed, therefore we now had assigned seats. Thirdly, after paying over £10 for two small alcoholic drinks for me and my wife I needed the loo, first  class was out  my bounds. So the only option the rear of the plane, however the crew were busy serving and  not prepared to move to allow me past (I guess those drinks they were selling had the BA executive team seeing  me ££££ so me being a customer needing the  bathroom was second in priority). After a long period they moved to the rear to allow me past, but once out they had gone back to the middle of the  plane A crew member at the back galley even laughed and said  were not getting back and therefore fairly offered me a free cup of tea. Our flight from Heathrow to Bergen was only an hour and 40, but I spent the majority in the rear galley chatting with the said crew member. The  first flight the  cabin crew had as much enthusiasm as my 80  year old grandmother and technology. The safety briefing came over a tannoy that would have sounded half decent in 1973 and to top it off, the lead steward whilst taxiing for takeof, asked the crew -  cabin crew, seats for landing". The captain gave us an update on takeoff and then radio silence for  most rest of the flight, even upon landing he stood at the front having a chat with the said steward as we disembarked about how some machine must have come to life with 'that landing'. All minor points, but  these were the points we enjoyed with BA, points that made us choose them, small  moments that made the difference. The pilots at the  end of the  plane welcoming or thanking the customer , us thanking them, the cabin crew that always went over and beyond. The free drinks that made us feel special to ask and get, I'd rather pay a premium for all that or choose a  different airline. Gutted our British Airways national carrier has become a budget airline. Perhaps cost savings are needed, but for now, <mask> we are a minor factor and small fry in the bigger picture, they need to cost save some more to <mask> up our <mask> tickets and my recommendations are now also dead. For me their <mask> was their service, without that there is no longer a point.

The Heathrow to Seoul return. I  booked my return flights back in  May when BA  were having their  flight sale for  about £1700. Thought  it was a  steal as they are usually up around £3000. London to Seoul flight was very pleasant. Didn't get to  experience the business  flight lounge in  Korea as my connection from Manchester  was delayed by  45 minutes. Cabin  facilities on the actual flight were excellent and very  good Food and  beverage was what  I would expect  from most business  travel airlines with  the decent amount  a high-quality menu ! The seat layout of 2-3-2 B seats facing  in the opposite  way to each  others and a  space between them  is a little  more cramped. The  seats were very  comfortable and went flat which is better than some,  however there is a fold-down seat/step in front of  you that you  need to use  when able to  spread out fully.  At 6'0 and  over I was  reaching my limit  for being able  too stretch out fully so anyone  taller than that  could probably be a bit uncomfortable.  The entertainment had a decent range of tv and  films to choose from including some  from the more  recent releases. Toilets  were also smaller  but more cramped  compared on other  planes that I've  used business class  on before. The only let down  being that the  seat itself was  smaller than the  lounge and I found it difficult  for sleep because of this. Seoul  vs London was what really let  me down for  me and left  a sour note  on what was  another amazing 3  months in Korea.  In the days  leading up to  my flight, BA's  infamous IT Failure"  caused the lack  in information and  security surrounding it , I was having to frantically  see if my  ticket would be  available at all,  despite the flights  of the 27th  and 28th being  cancelled completely. Luckily  I got it  back in the  wee hours of the morning on  that day of  our flight. The flight and cabin  crew arrived late  to the flight , so take-off was delayed by 30 minutes. I had a connecting  train to catch to Manchester so  that was imperative  that everything went  well as I  was just over  an hour after  schedule to make  it The flight  was lovely with  great cabin crew  having an amazing  experience The pilots managed to make  excuses for lost  time and so  only ended up  being 5 minutes  longer than scheduled.  Unfortunately due to  the backlog of delayed and cancelled flights from the  past couple of  months there was  another flight in the space where  BA was supposed  too park. This  meant a delay of 20 minutes  while we waited on the tarmac  before the space  had become free.  There was time <mask> could not <mask> to lose. <mask> eventually disembarked at 14:45 which <mask> I had <mask> sprint through the airport to <mask> control and <mask> the baggage <mask> Really wish <mask> hadn't as <mask> still took <mask> minutes for <mask> bags to <mask> off the <mask> By the <mask> I had <mask> all this <mask> gone through <mask> it was <mask> and the <mask> was closing <mask> 10 mins. <mask> to BA <mask> services and <mask> rebooked on <mask> flight back <mask> the IOM <mask> I live) <mask> London City <mask> they could <mask> book me on the 14:50pm <mask> the next <mask> Wasn't at <mask> happy with <mask> experience overall <mask> of this and for what <mask> would normally pay (over £3,000 <mask> not on <mask> it really <mask> worth the hassle for me <mask>

Los Angeles to  London British Airways has one of  their worst customer  experience you can  imagine Flight attendants  were rude. Seat  & food are  ok but I  find them worse than competitors flying this route. They  do have wifi.

From British Airways  to Heathrow to Geneva. Cheapskate airline ! Only tap water available, everything else needs credit , American family with hungry young boys couldn't buy anything for them  on their machine  would take US . Return flight cancelled after 4  hrs on tarmac with the IT crash. Staff brilliant, including pilot who  had ac on , updated us  all as much as he could. Then BA ticket  was unmanned in Geneva airport, so  were just standing.  we were lucky to find swissair flight home or  you think we'd still be there!

Return to Lima return in Business Class. No choice of seats until  right before the flight unless you  paid extra (I understand their desire to reward frequent  customers but paying  less per flight if you aren't  was just a huge irritation factor when you have already forked out so much for biz). By the  time we were able to check in, there was  only one option  left if we wanted to sit together. New BA lounge at LGW smart but packed out at the start of Easter holidays. Limited food  choices at breakfast  - no hot food at all, unless you count  their pastries. FA service on flights in both directions  very good, though  unfortunately the cabin lights were switched off for the entire flight between meal services, despite it being a day flight. Food and drink were fine but nothing special - some choices not available by the time  I got to . Seating layout of 2-4-2 in  first class is very cramped, especially if the flight is full - the highest-density seating I've ever experienced in business - and there was  a surface to put anything on  if you had  your tray table ! Small drawer  between your feet. Recommend the window  ledge next to  your bulkhead if you're travelling solo - no legs to climb over!  Economy seat was  comfortable though for  the short person. IFE was poor  compared to competitors - hard to angle the screen  and with a limited choice of movies available. On the way home , didn't mind  a long layover at LIM as we thought we 'd use the  airport No such  thing - we couldn't be checked in all the  time through from  Lima so had  another pick up , go through immigration again and  wait several hours in a hot airport with hardly any seats before BA staff appeared to check in  our flight home. Only seat choice available again were  seats together on the aisle side of a middle pair. Very fortunate  not to have  been in the  same middle seat next to me, otherwise it would have felt very intimate with a  perfect stranger! Haven't travelled long-haul with BA for several  weeks and can  honestly describe it as a functional, value service, even  on Business, though  definitely not cheap.  Will only use BA again if they were the  least convenient by a long way (as happened here  on a direct  flight from London), or for a  good price on short-haul. There's really  zero comparison to  the long-haul offering  of Business.

London Heathrow to  Naples We flew with 6 of our family to Santorini, the business class seats are a joke I am 6'3" but I just could  not move in the seats they are so tight.  I then learnt from the steward that it's a new configuration that hasn't gone down very well with customers. This once great airline that's gone from the best to the worst in 5  months and on European routes it's no more than a budget carrier, money is the key driver for BA with customers very last on the list. We all felt we 'd paid for a service we never received.

Between Heathrow to  London I fly  British Airways a  good amount mainly  as pleasure. But  now they are  continuing to slip. My last flight  was with two  people for our annual outing, this  was to Bilbao. Cannot fault the  crew or flight . However, the  lack of free  off board food  for short haul  is stupid. There 's now no  incentive to use BA for short  flights when there is a low  fare alternative. This  budget cutting may well back fire.  Possibly initiated by the same imbeciles  who caused the  current outsourcing problems .

On to London. I was always of the belief  that British Airways provided a better  quality of economy class travel but  I realise now  why they are  much better than  many airlines. In fact I have  experienced far better service on EasyJet.  Having waited over 2 hours to  get offered a  seat and I  ordered Marks &  Gordon heated focaccia  I had clearly  been in the oven for 2 ! On top  all that there  was just 2  seats for 120  people while business  level customers enjoyed 2 toilets between 20 of them.  Off course we  then had to  walk behind the serving trolley to get to the  bathroom so you  cannot imagine how  much that took! They make it  very clear that  business class is  just that but  for shame the price doesn't match  that standard of service. All in all a very  good experience and  you will certainly  think twice about choosing BA in  2019

Welcome to Gatwick.  Got the ticket on the last minute due to  the train and  bus schedule. This  is my first  year flying with  Delta and probably  my last if  you have other . It didn't feel like a  big carrier, felt  almost like budget  airline with no  fees and fare  plan that doesn't  cover checked baggage.  Service was smooth , efficient but  about 15mins late  for Edinburgh. No  food whatsoever served  for the flight  unless you pay  an additional fee.

Rome to London. Thursday May 18 flight scheduled to  leave at 1200 delayed due to technical issues for 6 hrs and then cancelled at 1730. This caused missed connecting flight to Los Angeles. Very poor communication  to passengers by desk attendants. No one took charge of our situation,  only filtered through  Spanish speaking passengers who sought help with staff from  other airlines. BA  representative was gone after 6pm and we were shuttled  into hotel and told a rep  would give us  further information at . No one from BA was  found or heard from at hotel.  Multiple calls by  passengers to BA resulted in little to no assistance.  Thursday May 19 passengers are shuttled  out to airport , chaos has broken out because there is little assistance once again at BA counter. After 1 hour in line I  get a boarding  ticket on a flight to London with connection to Los Angeles, however  a BA desk  staff informs me that the flight out of Rome is late due  the technical issues  so I will once again miss  my flight out to LA. I'm appalled at the lack of educated, experienced BA assistance! BA abandoned us at Rome airport. In addition there  web site is of no help. Flight information was  lost and impossible to this day to reach customer  service

Mal Lumpur to  Dubai Very different  to the flight .. It's all  about the crew and how they  behave or how  seriously they take their job. One  man was rude  and when asked  could I have  a glass of  wine told me  no it would take a long  while and he disapeared down the  flight to chat to his fellow  staff  The  staff was slapped  down and we were not offered  any drink. All  were crew and  due to it  was an night  and the crew  spent the time  at the back and ignored when called. It's a shame when you 're BA trying  to turn around  and survive and  now you have  a rude staff  with little to  little service to  their customers or  their airline.

The flight from  Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur on the Boeing 787-9. The crew were amazing , friendly and  should have done  well The food  served was of good standard and  passengers were asked  a few times if we would like more drinks.  The crew member  which said she  had been with  Boeing for many years was professional , excellent at her job.

London Heathrow to  Amsterdam I was looking forward to  the flight - it was Saturday so no work the following day and 62K on the upper deck  had to be  quite a treat!  Having have read many reviews recently  of BA falling behind the competition  so my expectations  are low - but even these were beaten by this overall truly awful experience. Firstly I have to say the crew on the flight  were super in every way. Nothing  is too much trouble and they seemed to genuinely  like enjoying their  flights I should  have given my ' Golden Ticket' to one of them but forgot. However no matter  how good the crew, it cannot make up for everything else being  absolutely awful and shabby. The seat  was filthy with what looked like ketchup from the  first flight and crumbs everywhere. Not a nice start. The aircraft was  very very old  and a lot of the interior  is patched up  in white gum. The IFE didn't work properly. Amenity kit was a bag and the  food poor quality. The toilets (compared  to AA) were small unpleasant. Seat is not up to most Business  Jet standard. Food  smells awful and  their 'club kitchen' almost non-existent. These  times I would  choose AA (or Delta, United, Virgin)  any day over BA. It was a shame the  cabin manager seemed  to spend his time going round  each cabin apologising and giving some avios to try  and make people  feel annoyed by  this whole experience.

from Domodedovo to  London via London  flew roundtrip in  business class.   Both the flights  was full in  line with the  arrival of BA195  it was 2/3  to 3/4 full.  Qatar Airways flight  staff are cordial  and professional. There  is a wide  range of beverages  available including complementary  alcoholic beverages. The  various in-flight meals  were not bad,  but not great . The 10-hour  trip between London  to Houston featured  buffet dinner early  in the flight  then a snack  towards the end  of the flight.  My 4-hour flight  between London and  Boston featured a  meal at the  end of the  flight I was  greeted by the  sitting room in . I am  quite tall, but  am 180 cm . (71 inches),  I was able  and extend my  legs fully under  a seat in  front of me.  It made these  two flights bearable.  All flights offerred  complimentary blankets, and  towels The cabin  temperatures on the  London to Houston  was cold -  we had to  throw on a  heavy jacket. The  air temperature on  my flight from London to Moscow  felt too warm . I was . When people  are using the  cabin safety card  and fan themselves,  I know it  is warm. The  home entertainment screen  of the B777  for economy is  very poor quality  and needs to  been upgraded. I  can feel the  sound being emitted  off the screen  very well. Make  note that your  bag is below  your weight limit  Very heavy bags  cost an additional  50 USD per  person

London Heathrow to Brussels. Disappointed by  a non existent service onboard this . Regardless of  how short the  flight may well  be you expect  any sort of refreshments/snacks to be  served given this  was a low  fare airline. However BA have hit  a bottom in  that they charge  decent rates but  are low carrier  fare - certainly on short haul flights.

London Heathrow to  las Vegas. Paid  money for extra  row 51C, as  pictures show the  same type of  seat on 'my ', and there 's no difference to any other seat you would get for free.  No refund given  as it states  this may be  different aircraft used.  Problem is this  airport has always  used the same type of aircraft so it's basically  the con.

London Heathrow to San Francisco return  Was pleasantly surprised with the service.  Both flights were  in time and  far ahead of schedule. Online check-in  and baggage drop straightforward and without  incident Food was  good - particularly  for outbound flight.  Our partner is  Hindu and we  had opted for  the Hindu meal  that proved to be delicious. Aircraft in good order and clean. Cabin crew - particularly  one way out , were professional, attentive and friendly. Inflight entertainment choice was generally good,  and something for  all The only  complaint is that  this function is too expensive - even for economy  - British Airways  was being very greedy in this respect, and their  fares are way  cheaper than other  airports This was generally a positive experience.

London to Reykjavik.  You can't really  evaluate this flight . British Airways  decided to cancel  my return flight , then my  parents and suggested  we reduce a  5 day family  flight to 2 ! Ruined Xmas. I can review  their total lack  in customer service,  complete contempt for  passengers - all in all, BA are not just  the worst airline, but the worst  company I have  flown with. My  score has to  rank the lowest given the total service failures of  BA

For this route  to Amsterdam to  Tokyo Haneda via  London Heathrow we  got the expected service onboard. The  original flight was  heavily delayed, but  no transfer time  was more then  two hours, so  that didn't cost  any problem. The  airline crew did  its best to  accommodate every passenger  on the flight  to HND. When  they got our  baggage we discovered  only one of  our suitcases was . At HND  British Airlines is  an agent for  international airways and  what it cost  us to explain . Their service  is great. They  made a report  from BA and  since we are  far from the  airport we should  call BA to  repair the damage.  They did and  within a few  days we got  a really extensive  report and were  notified Despite this  broken suitcase it  was handled great.  So what made  the difference to  us

Antigua to Gatwick. Check in at the new terminal was quick and  simple (better than  expected and although we had a slight delay at  boarding we were soon airside. The new lounge was  extremely comfortable and  although we didn't use it (it was dark when  you were there) they have an  open sky terrace with loungers and  comfortable sofa's etc.  The bar was manned by helpful staff with a small but tasty selection of food.  Breakfast was on . On board it was soon evident that the interior of the  aircraft had seen better days with my wife's TV nearly falling off its mounting. Fortunately  we was able to position it  throughout the flight so that it  stayed in place  as it was quite precarious. Push  in and departure  was exactly on time. Within a  short time the  crew started the evening service and this is where  it all seemed quite strange. Unlike the flight out, where there was a more relaxed atmosphere, the crew  seem to feel  it was a  need to rush whatever they were doing to the point that some  among them were literally running down the aisles. The food was hurriedly delivered to us and was disappointingly under seasoned and pretty tasteless. I can only assume that the object  in their haste was to get everyone fed and watered and bedded down as quickly  was possible. To be quite honest I felt like we were being looked after by  the nanny and told to go to bed early . I almost expected them to  reply 'I want  everybody to go to sleep now and I don't want to here a sound out any of you until the morning'! Now I know , the crew are all entitled to their breaks etc, but at the end of  the day (or  week they are  working and are  being paid to do so. In my opinion if they just slowed down a little  and had more time for the passengers, it would  improve the flight . Breakfast was OK although I seemed to be the only person trying the bacon  sandwich and after one mouthful I understood why. In a blind tasting  I probably would have guessed I  am eating rubber bands. We arrived  before time and  after quite a long walk to immigration and the baggage reclaim, our  luggage were waiting for us. Overall very disappointing and based on this flight I would not recommend BA.

London Heathrow to Amsterdam Schipol on BA434, landed at 14:30. Luggage did not arrive. Contacted  luggage agent - they could not be less interested. Was given some toiletries but no essentials such as cleanser or moisturiser. As it was a Sunday, all shops at Amsterdam were closed at  night so was not able to buy essentials like make up. Called  the luggage call centre 3 times. The first time the agent put  another note in  the system to say that I needed my luggage urgently because of  my customer meeting the next day. Then received message  via phone that  my luggage would be on a  train arriving at  Amsterdam subject to . Called again to check if  my luggage had left Heathrow. Agent could not tell and rudely told  them to wait.  called again at 21:00 and finally  went through. Agent said she would get someone to  contact me to let me know if it was possible for me  to pick up the luggage at Schipol. No one called. Called the next day. All the agent could tell me was , he had no idea when my luggage would  be delivered. Message to BA management: you can do  better by having  a truly on line tracing system and fulfilment system, by employing people who do care about your customers,  and forget about  reassuring your customers that 90% of people get their luggage back within 72 hours. For business travellers, that  is zero comfort. Take a leaf off Qatar Airways, one of your One World partners, they tell their customers if their  bag follows them during transit. And Qatar Airways ground service staff show that they do care.

We was pleasantly  impressed with British  Virgin on both  incoming and inbound  routes from Orlando  and Gatwick after  seeing the reviews. I would go  such far as  the say I  would choose them  for Virgin now  as there was  no dramatic price !! The crew  both ways were  fantastic and really  when I have  a Virgin crew  might be a bit up themselves , they are  clear cut above the rest. Contrary  though how Virgin  staff are on  an overnight flight (serve food, dim  light and keep  on the way  an hour before  the BA crew  also regularly came  in making sure  everyone was ok  or if anyone  needed anything. We  experienced nearly 3  hours delay leaving  gate on G-VIIU,  partly due to  it being a  little late due  a an alligator  on the runway  then finally a  power issue on  arrival whilst positioned  off runway to . We returned  at gate for  final top up of fuel etc and departed at 20.20 versus 17.35.  Overall the crew  are fantastic bringing  food round and  feeding us all ! Whilst the  size of the  new fleet of  seats is a  bit on the  cramped side it  is still comfortable  so can recommend  it as there  is no PAX seat behind just  the crew seat  with no issues  about being kneed  in the back.  Our economy class  waiting room was  great Food was  also decent for  comfort food. Only  real negative was the dated AVOD as it has  no screens and  has a great  amount of choice  relative to more modern systems.

Welcome to Hong i The Avios  network is now  the complete joke.  Tickets are impossible  for spend. They  have a minuscule  selection of flights , won't allow  passengers to upgrade  on them even when there is  one - they've  even quoted me  over £2,000 to  get a flight  one evening so  you know there's  more - but  still won't let me use Avios.  Their concept of  this service is  ridiculous and smacks  of an ex iling carrier. More  traditional airlines with  incentives to use  their miles booking  systems like Emirates  ought to be successful over this  small of an  issue

Flew Premium Economy , London to Toronto in a Boeing 787. Noisy aircraft - third time on this  plane and not  impressed Seamless use of boarding pass on my smart  phone (first time  we have done ) as well as self-serve baggage . Flight good,  flight crew pleasant,  flight OK-ish, though  nothing special. Back  on a 777,  very comfortable and  quieter than 787, though still nowhere  near A380 standards.  Service excellent, food  very good (the  vegetarian lasagne was one of the  better I've ever had), and the wine of a  decent quality. Luggage appeared promptly at  all ends. Overall , good experience.

Mexico City to Copenhagen via London.  Also appears inflight  service has improved a bit in  Denmark and the food is now edible and available. In flight entertainment  was one of  the VHS days. Number of films  available is rather limited. Timing with  food was great. Served quickly after take off and  very late before  flights Made time  is a good  time Configuration in club is not my favourite with reversed seats. Some crew choose to open the curtain  to time the  flight while other  are in front of you which will give you a better feeling of a private  flight Best thing  about ba is that its cheap and you can have the Dorset crab for lunch  at Fornum and Mason in terminal . Ba refuses to credit Qatar Airways avios even when Qatar Airways in writing has confirmed they should be credited. Showing one level on my online profile  twice now and anotheron my ticket. I have given up on avios.

London to Santiago de Chile. Surprisingly pleasing flight onboard Boeing 787, decided to give it a try to a rear facing business class window , and discovered the B787 is - or looks - far lighter and wider than any B777 I've been travelling on (could be larger windows or the fuselage shape which  made the "cocoon" look less cramped).  Also the seat looks wider, while  the IFE screen  is wider with  slightly higher resolution. The odd "ying-yang"  view is slightly better on Boeing 787 as the central rows do not have the honeymoon seats, therefore  they won't share  quite a narrow space with a stranger in case you end up there. So first impression better than usual; unfortunately the soft product remains way below par (I pre-ordered the main dish of the meal which this time was actually available, but the beef was overcooked and chewy), I will never stop mentioning that the amenity kit  was simply ridiculous  - sort of a blue shoe  size too small to fit shoes . The crew very friendly but  far less attentive than usual. Overall  my experience was  better than usual - mainly thanks to a newer, quieter aircraft -  although BA is not improving where they should, in  the details that make business class  not worth EUR3,000 spent. Still no wi-fi on BA. Not commenting the  seat layout, which remains a mystery  for me (who  does such a nonsense?).

Gatwick to Amsterdam. As a regular flyer with BA,  our experience is that they have some of the best pilots and their inflight staff make all the efforts to give the airline an image. Beyond that,  we have some of the worst airport desk staff in the industry.  We have no solution for the slightest problem! We were scheduled to fly to Amsterdam on the 1st of Feb at 07.45, there was a radar problem in Amsterdam. Easyjet etc were informing their customers of development, nobody informed anyone at the  ticket desk until it became a confusion at almost 09.30! We were rescheduled to the 11.40 flight with another further 2 hours delay. Before  this I have been advised to book a ticket to guarantee a seat on the 11.40 flight. I now had two sets of ticket for same flight. Up to now,  receiving a refund is a nightmare!

How far BA has sunk! Flew London Heathrow to  Dublin and back  this week -  rude and unfriendly cabin crew, food and drinks for purchase. Does BA  compete for Budget Airline now? I  NEVER thought I'd see the day when I would  realise BA has  dropped to (and  exceeds the levels !) Ryanair service,  albeit still around 7x more expensive!

It was very  disappointed because on my flight from  Paris to London (a 4 hour ), no food  or drinks were offered for free.  Not even had to pay for water! This was  such a low  impact flight and  everyone (except business  passengers had to buy any food  or drinks. Very  really disappointed, as  most European airlines  offer free food  and drink/snacks, even from countries such as Greece (Aegean Airlines). Will not choose BA again.

I flew London Heathrow to Cape Town, to board  The Queen Elizabeth, Cunard had included  a flight via the Middle East,  which at the time did not  made sense, so  we paid the additional £120 each to fly direct with BA, the  airline I knew  & trusted for  30 years. The  connection was smooth which encouraged me , I had  taken the right choice.
