However on-board the ageing Boeing  737 nothing else was worth talking about, the food and the service are clearly working to a lower  level than I 've previously had with BA. The  seat available was  good for me;  an average sized man - I don't know how a larger and or taller person  will manage. BA  have lost two loyal customers, but at least they will squeeze more  money from those people who remain.  On my next long-haul I will  likely opt for an alternative airline.

My wife and I flew British  Columbia from London  Heath to Berlin  arriving in Club . This was  our free Avios ! Having the middle seat blocked  from a meal is the only  significant difference to . We paid  extra seat selection  that I would not have been  allowed to do if I had paid the silly prices charged for  these short flights.  Added value if  not free upgrade.

British Airways from Rio de Janeiro to London Heathrow. I booked premium economy to get more legroom as I am 6ft8, however this is non-existent. The crew were rude and when the lady in front of me decided to recline the seat for her 2-year old, and I asked the crew to "help" with the situation, they told me that it's the passenger's right to do whatever they want. So no common sense there. Despite having other seats available in the business area, they refused to move me, even though they were seeing the issue (I couldn't fit in my seat for a 10 hour flight). They even told us off as they were getting aggravated by  me being nosy! I had to pay extra 100 pounds each way to reserve 2 seats! Needless to  add the food is awful and  customer service overall is 0/5 stars. This is not  The BA that people once knew. It's under IAG and new "leadership" team that aim to cut expenses  without any cost, one of them being customer service.  I like the plague!

From Heathrow to  BA Awful, awful ! My 'randomly'  booked seats were  two seats in  the back two rows on both  flights seems like  peanuts for not  taking their charge  on select seats.  Whilst not too  happy about the  quality of drinks  or meal service  you can see  how the system  BA have created  such a shambles  with no cash  back option, not  in stock etc ... On arrival  back at Heathrow  airport we were  sat on a  bus stand by  desk and then  made to wait  one hour for  a bus to  another terminal. The staff could not  have cared less , spent the  time chatting about  so low BA  has sunk, how  the morale was  down and how they could escape!  Grab your cash and go with a genuine budget airline would be  good advice.

Although they indicate  nothing against their policies, they apparently waited for a  delay to get  on the flight  at New York JFK to London  Airport causing a  20 min delay. As a result, we missed our  connecting flight. For  both the other  flights that were  delayed they had arranged for alternatives  and announced them before the flight . However, they did not announce  the arrangement for out flight, even though we specifically asked the flight  attendants to check.  This is the  third time in  2 years I  have poor experience  from British Airways. Their service is  simply unacceptable.

On to Antigua.  This was our  last time in  quite a while  flying from the South Terminal and  the first impression  was that the  flight check in  line was a  tad cramped. It  seemed quite busy  for the CW  checking in with  about five couples  the front of  us but as  there were four  slots open, we  were through in  about five minutes.  This fast track  flight was quiet  and we were  sat in the  arrivals lounge. This  was a huge  improvement from its  location in the  South terminal with  good views, comfortable  seats and reasonable  meals (I had  two small bacon  burger and a  slightly strange omelette ). The departure  area was quite  cramped with not  much seating for  any of the  couples but as  the flight was  departure time, it  did really matter.  I had made  the decision some  weeks ago not  too pay an additional cost to  get our seats  closer to the  two hour check  out as this  could have cost  upwards to £340  for my wife  & I, depending  if you wanted  to sit. However,  they were pleasantly  pleased with the  seat we were  given as we  would probably have  used these anyway.  Before boarding we  was offered a  bottle of sparkling  wine which for  my change was  nicely chilled. The  passengers were generally  friendly especially a  German guy who  claimed it was  his first long  haul trip. Once  seated we were  served two drinks  with nuts before  eating and then  more drinks with  water We had  not ordered our  meals so we knew what we  are getting although  their quality was  not OK (I  ordered a chicken  sandwich which was  quite bland). The  condition of the  hotel was rather  revealing its age  and stains on  some carpet with  the overall drab  condition Also, the  light seems to  continue getting worse  so unusually my  daughter found it  impossible to watch  any film due  to the poor  quality Afternoon tea  is OK although  no provision was  made for my  vegetarian sandwiches (she 's a vegetarian)  so we had  to mix and  matched between the  two of us.  Finally landed on  arrival in Antigua.  Overall the flight  proved enjoyable without  really achieving any  new heights (pardon  the pun!) and  together with a  friendly cabin crew , were able  and enjoy the  journey

CT Tegel to London Heathrow in Club Europe business . A weekend evening flight that  felt quite empty.  I had selected  the very cheap  flight to upgrade  into business class and for once  it was worth  going extra. Had checked in online so no contact with ground staff,  and having arrived  via berlin from Beijing with a tight connection I did not bother  to use the  airport lounge here. Knowing the lounge  after previous visits,  the staff are  offering a fair  variety of snacks and drinks, but  they can become  overwhelming and you have to walk  through the lounge  and find toilets.  Service was quick,  only 5 out  of 16 seats occupied in club  class Seats having  no seat pitch and are economy , with middle seat empty. Captain  very informative, and  staff are BA's  greatest asset for  detailed details provided to customers. A  grilled chicken sandwich, cheese & biscuits  and chocolate mousse was served - all to a  good standard. Drinks  are your choice  from the bar  and decent coffee to follow. Cabin  flights were extremely  fast and efficient, probably due to  being a quiet  Friday evening flight.

Those are words  you may not read often, but I actually enjoy the British Airways  flight from London ! The staff  are friendly and,  right now, they 'll feed you  and offer extra drinks. After flying  internationally for several decades, I have decided to cut  my losses on  the miles and  extra points for long haul because  of the cost-cutting. But for short-haul,  this is my first choice out  from City.

London Manchester, UK  and Billund, Denmark.  I flown with  Scandinavian Airways for  over 10 years  and work throughout  continental Europe. Compared to other airlines I've used they by far in  our view, deliver  best service all  round Staff are  helpful and friendly. Food is always tasty. Easy check  in system at the airport. Efficient , very good value for money all round.

Back to Bangkok  today for work.  An old plane with vintage entertainment ! Drinks were  served before dinner,  two nuts/crisps available followed by a  dessert but small ! As it 's around 20.30  local time, I  made the call  desk to ask  for an after  meal drink for  two colleagues and myself. After a  10 minute wait  the surly disapproving stewardess arrived and  gave us a dressing down essentially  whilst still being  rude and requiring . Incorrect drinks  were then brought.  One colleague asked  the steward who  was across the  room chatting to  who appeared to  his friends to correct the mistake  and was told to wait. Eventually  my correct drink  is brought. I've  written a letter  and complaint but  so yet no  reply from British  Airways I've flown  with a great  few and generally  have a reasonable experience so it's  interesting to see  this general direction  the airline seem  to be going.  A company I 'm working for  paid for the ticket so I  dont know what  it cost but  can imagine it 's cheap. In their defence, I  came back with  friends from Delhi  in a dreamliner  1 week later and the experience  is fine so  perhaps the age  of the plane  may not excuse  the staff.

I am one of those crazy  women who still  (& recently) flew  daily - London Heathrow weekly paying nearly £400 with  British Airways as  always the key airport. Now the last flight always  goes to a  bus stand and  my morning flight (boarding 6.15 for 6.50 flight) is  just a bus to a plane , is never  empty and always departs late. Holidays  to Madeira ended with me and mum sitting on  a floor in a departure hall for 5.5hrs. I  switched to BA and got the  door fob off.  Add insult to injury and no  communication at all on the plane!  So game over  for me and  every trace of a relationship. It's now tedious &  we have to  go in all  my effort to loyalty with absolutely no return affection!

Full trip for  me and my  wife using Avios  flight from London  Airport to Miami.  They were very  polite and professional  for both sectors. Flights on time. Food and drink  service were decent,  but not on a par with  the other carriers.  Pretty clear BA's  cost cutting affects  our cabins. On  the outbound leg  the choice of  golf course was  easy as they  have already been  given to other passengers. Having said that, I could  have ordered in  advance via the web site. On  our return leg,  it worth noting  the access to/from  a lounge is  just a single  step and very  energy consuming. So  this was a  lovely touch that  one of the  lounge staff escorted me and my  wife (we are  both gold card holders) from the  gate and put  us on the  plane first as  the boarding gate  became chaotic due  at it being  bank holiday weekend.  A very enjoyable  experience but not  any better than  the airlines' business !

BA12 onboard British Airways A380 for the gruelling 13 hours from Singapore to London Heathrow is pretty hellish for economy passengers. I'd like to be biased to BA - I'm silver member and  Canadian and it's my national carrier but come on let's get to the chase. This route is now also served by Garuda and Singapore and I can say BA are  near the bottom of the list for the economy service. Seats are really uncomfortable and near impossible to find an angle to get some rest, the pillows are wafer thin - like sitting on a a  pile of tissues bundled together. Food is lousy and they have removed the silverware and dinner extras like crackers, chocolates and other things that you can snack on. They close down the rear galleyway and turn it into their personal hang out area instead of a self service drink and snack zone like other airlines. This also means you are stuck in your aisle which is frustrating when you want to get to an unoccupied toilet in the other aisle and your toilet section has queues. Further toilets are not regularly cleaned and soap ran out half way through the flight and wasn't refilled. BA have downgraded their economy service in all areas and you feel like the crew treat you like a poor peasant - polite and respectful but minimum effort. On the plus movie selection is great and TV on the A380 is good but not in Singapore Airlines league. Your air miles earning for this route is more generous than Garuda and  so I Would recommend premium economy if you can or If you have to make this route try and get upper deck where configuration is 2-4-2 rather than 3-4-3 downstairs. Or alternatively try the competition which  will soon include Norwegian Air and I can't see how Norwegians' economy class can be any worse than BA's.

Flew Nice to London with British Airways in economy.  Never bother again. Moving most of my travel to KLM/LH now where  i can at least get a complimentary G&T. BA nice flight had  good legroom, only 1 lavatory at  way back (with aisle blocked however  so crew selling buy on board). So low cost. So over them.

London to Male. I booked a  flight for my wife to India but before paying  for it I called the BA executive club to make sure that  my fare was  not refundable. They  informed me that it was less  an administration charge. I then had to cancel the booking and instead I booked a  flight with BA  in the Maldives.To  My dismay I  were not refunded  what I expected for the fare  from India. Instead they only refunded the taxes/insurance etc. After the cancelled  tickets I called BA at the  start of March to find out  what had happened,  They told me that they would get back to me within 30 %. Two months  ago I called them again and was told that  they refund department  should call me.  Finally they did this morning and  tell me that  my ticket was  not refundable and they would not  call me back. Either the executive club of BA are lying or  BA are incompetent. I was asked  a time and date when I called BA but  as I do  indeed have it  so I did not think it necessary to log  the call. It is obvious to me that BA do not honour their commitments and  I will no  longer fly with  BA I have  served an executive  club for 40 years and this  shows how BA treat their customers. An absolute disgrace.

I abandon you  without a return  to Rude and  poor customer service ! Both BA flights in the  US and the  direct flights to  Rome were delayed  by up to  3 hours. No clear sign on boarding gate screen  for delayed flights , big mess up of mixing the delayed flights  onto the screen.  Imagine in being  stuck in Rome airport with BA  customer service not  offering to take any responsibility for their mess up  with no compensation  or even refund, let alone minimum  effort trying to help a client.

Return to London . This time I was among  the first few  passengers aboard the aircraft. I was  travelling with two  bags so I  had to find  the space for 3 trolley cases.  We discovered a  bag was already  in the overhead compartment above my  seat and it  belongs to a  flight crew. . It was a  short flight so how could the  cabin crews put  the bags in  a compartment before  me and let  me struggle to  make a space  and delay the  whole process? BA 's short haul  was simply a  commercial airline, and  better than their competitors in the  cabin baggage management.  i wasn't impressed by their on  call service either.  they were so greedy to earn  profits from selling  seats to a  group of noisy  passengers even though  there were complaint  from other passengers.

Glasgow to Chicago  from Heathrow and  had the offer  to upgrade to  economy economy at  no extra cost. What a disappointment,  this aircraft was an old 747-400  badly in need  of a refit. Cabin was tired and very shabby decor and seats , video system  were ancient and  had to be  changed for it  to work. This  was until 40 minutes into flight  BA kept jumping  the flight. Staff  was nice but  a noticeable difference  to economy. In fact the economy section on the  old 747 on the return flight  to 296 was better than the premium offer on  that leg. To be honest BA had a cheek ily charge for  their supposed 'premium .' This was  hardly an upgrade especially compared to the equivalent product on Virgin. To  put matters worse the BA customer  services reply to our issues raised  was just not good enough just  a standard corporate apology effort. With no regards for keeping future business. To be honest a poor service  go round from  a national carrier

i have always  wanted fair reviews  for any airline.  At BA and  being a Gold (Emerald) member I 've lost my patience. I have  tried now for  1 week to  check flights online and via their  call centre to book and upgrade.  As the site  says availability it  all croaks to  one halt with  no error, it  had been 7 days of this. I have contacted  them through their  twitter account to  be told to  use their Bahrain  customer centre, which of course does  the work but  I been told  to call the Indian centre. 4 times I have  tried at my  own expense to  call people with  no English, have  NO idea how  they manage the upgrade, quote outrageous  prices 4 times  their web price.  social media twitter  just go through the motions rather  than having some  people take control.  It has got  past the point  with so many  negative reviews I  will use the  internet and move  to Qatar who  have their loyal customers.  My  on the ground as well at  their air service , now budget.

Flying Heathrow to Edinburgh. Almost hilarious had I not  already been handed  the debit card , when the plane was advised  the put their  dining tables back  on the upright  row I was  in row 12  in first 7  of business class.  I was the  last to be  served food or  no drink. I  bought the sandwich  or wine when  we got home.  Probably would have  be easier to buy the sandwich  of choice at  home at Edinburgh ! The budget  carrier could show  US Airways how  to do a proper operation. The  next 10 or  15 rows go  through apology and  not to eat  or drink. BA  do not even  have the acronym  of budget airline.  Absolutely useless.

From London Heathrow  to Vienna. Wow, who is running  this company? In  over 30 years  flying flying I've  never seen an airline deteriorate so  much as British  Air has recently.  I can accept that I now have to pay  twice if I  forget to check  out a bag,  and to sit  in a 'full-service'  lounge for over 2 hours without  anything much as  a complimentary cup  or water, really?  Do I miss something, have they  changed their prices?  Did they just  expecting suckers like me to pay more for something  that was (and  probably is at  all prices) included  in the fare.  It now offers  some food and drinks for purchase but the service  was so slow and by the  time we'd almost reached our destination there was a  mess of an  argument with a  woman who'd ordered  his hot sandwich,  but because the  ordering machine wasn't  ready they took  her food back  to the galley  then left the  customer without. The atmosphere was pretty  and it's been  quite few years  now I've experienced  such a miserable  airline flight. That  was probably Ryanair but they've really  lowered their game.  UK Airways was  a great carrier,  just a year  of so back, but now it's really overpriced rubbish,  and they don't  let me feel  comfortable anymore. There  were so many other options in Europe.

Flight sat in 35J/ 35k which  was a two seat row. The  plane is 3x4x3 otherwise. See seat . Aircraft full  of boarding and  security was well handled by the ground staff. The  flight left 10 mins early, arrived 15 mins ahead of schedule. Within one hour of  boarding we were  on the gate for our connecting  flights to Aberdeen.  Flight was OK , things are not as they  should with British  Airlines Food bland , unexciting, drinks service limited. Breakfast  being served way  very late in the flight. No  customer complaints, toilets  flush and functional.  TV entertainment worked  fine but the volume/ bud type  controls were poor  which distorted the  sound which was  difficult to follow.  Security was OK.  The crew were polite and did their job. Arrival  from Terminal 5  A gates and  transfer to A gates was a breeze at 0600 , walked straight  back to Boarder  with no one  is in the  area Even security  were very quiet.

Air Terminal 3 to Budapest in  January 2017. Busy  week before the bank holiday weekend resulting in most wheelie bags being  dropped off passengers.  Flying in row 12F which was the 6th row of economy class.  After taking off on-time, it took 70 mins for the food trolley to travel 6 rows. Service was  in absolute shambles! 2 staff serving a full flight  while 2 other staff serve approximately 12 people in  Economy class. Instead of the standard routine of the person each side of the trolley serving different rows, one steward just  stood there whilst the stewardess struggled  not use the  ticket payment machine.  instead of prioritising passengers yet to be served, the  woman kept serving  those she had already served (because they had finished their drinks in  the time it took her to  move 4 rows).  A senior purser then appeared and told off the clearly flustered staff that they had  half of the plane to serve with only 45 mins of flight time left! British Airways have really let themselves go downhill - will not be going  outside of my way to fly with them again unless they're the cheapest option.

Zürich to London Heathrow. As part of a 12-days-trip almost around the world my first leg from Zürich  to London was on British Airways. It turned out to be quite a pleasant and enjoyable experience. Thanks to early online-check-in I managed to secure a bulkhead aisle-seat. I would have preferred a window-seat though. Boarding started on time  and there was a very friendly purser welcoming the passengers. After I settled down I  approached her with my request. She said that the flight was completely full but promised to do her best. After less than five minutes she returned to me and offered me a seat at the window but emphasized that my actual seat had much more legroom. So I stayed. The rest of the crew seemed to be cheerful and happy too. Special requests by other passengers were dealt with professionalism. I brought  my own snack and water along which was a wise thing to do as the catering-service was slow. The new procedure takes too much time and let passengers disappointed as their choice is running out quickly.  Airlines should reinstall the old system again. The cabin was spacious but the aircraft showed  considerable age. The flight took off with a delay of 20 minutes but was a the gate at  Terminal 5 15 minutes before scheduled arrival time.

Dublin to London.  800 Euros for  THE worst business class flight you can imagine. Business  Class with no extra leg room just the middle seat blocked off. Outbound from Dublin around lunchtime. I was hungry and all they had  was some ham  sandwich and nothing else. I was told I had to order a kosher meal if I did not eat ham. So I practically had nothing to eat. The stewardess was kind enough to give me some bread and a snack. However I was looking forward to a decent  dinner after forking out for a  first class flight. So I ordered a kosher meal  before my return flight. I got the kosher meal but it was vile. Some sort of salmon that  looked tasteless. Very poor experience. BA should not call  this business class as it was worse than a low cost carrier.

Flew British Airways  from London Gatwick to Orlando. Contrary  from a lot  of the other  airlines I found the aircraft and  people on board to be fine.  As in 24  inches on G-VIIO seat was comfortable and big enough with a decent amount of recline.  Still agree the  flight is not  to the standard  of other airlines  but it was  comfortable and had a fairly decent  amount of content  to it. The staff were all  very attentive and  helpful so no  surprises there. Inflight meals were the  standard chicken or vegetarian option plus  another sandwich was offered shortly before  boarding

UK Airways from  Scotland to London : The service was what you 'd expect from  the budget carrier like EasyJet or  Emirates The only  difference that the  service was 150%  too expensive. EasyJet  had a service  from Aberdeen to  London Gatwick for  a £50 return.  Our flight cost  mine and my  husband £160 each.  They were no  onboard snacks offered,  so had to  add £60 each  On top of  that for our  luggage to be  returned to the  hotel The only  time we flew  British Airways was  when we had a connecting flight  to Heathrow with  that airline. British  people use the  airlines for the  air fair and  without frills because  they the "fees"  they have to  make at Heathrow.  We don't buy  it though. Our  return flight from  Glasgow cost £420 , and was  only 14 hour . Yet a  4 hour and 30 minute flight  with BA costs  400 each. How  would that work?

from Heathrow to  London British Airways  had been the  carrier our organisation  has chosen for  their staff for  use when they fly the routes  and to our  chosen destinations. Recently as the Director  I have been getting complaints about service, cleanliness and  management from several  members of my  colleagues which I  had listened to  and have been  too busy and  I hadn't listened  to exactly what  management seems to  do based on  our personal experience. This recent trip to Toronto summed  it up for  you Firstly, after  costing around £1000 s each for  two Premium Economy  ticket for each  of the three  if us travelling,  like competitors BA does not provide priority boarding, you  end up with  only the other  two passengers?. When  you board you are met with  poor staff, some  poorly dressed, others  they look as if they have  suffered a bad  day so who manages quality and standards?. Premium economy  offers a little more space than  Economy however that  is about it.  Comfort levels in  your cabin are minimum, food is  minimal and to  my honest is  in disgrace compared  for the price, and towards the end of the  flight you are offered a second  drink and 'a  coffee delivered with  almost the fanfare  and a 'gold  star being delivered,  but the discontent and upset on  the flight by  people in Premium  economy was both  visible and vocal,  BA staff could  not have cared ? Other companies such as Air  Berlin offer a superior experience for  the same price.  Business management need  to get their  acts together otherwise  their customers such  as my organisation  were just on the edge of  ignoring them completely.  It definitely breeds  resentment but BA  management is taking  their biscuit with this and some  on its other  complaints The marketing  campaign does not  match the reality.  On Ground service , management at  Delta is appalling,  people sitting around, passengers bags missing,  and no one  to help? staff  is openly rude  or dismissive. A  full review is  required

London to Boston.  Nice flight without  a problem, arriving  good time despite  a little late departure. Seat confort  seemed great for  kids Back of  seats was very good and leg room seemed above average... seat confort on this A380  seemed better than  previous A380. Crew  seemed great, available  meals with special  offer to kids.

Newark to London Heathrow. You have to be very careful when choosing a flight to New York. Most of the JFK flights are 20+ years old Boeing 747-400s - prone to breaking down on the tarmac. The 747 "New 1st" is so cramped and I avoid any 747 flight whenever possible. I deliberately choose Newark as it is served by a new Boeing 787. Coming back we were on one - with just 8 seats in 1st Class. Its not bad, a bit better than the Boeing 777 - but nowhere close to Singapore Airlines, Emirates etc. The lounge is a shared one with Cathay Pacific. Its ok, but apart from a "1st" dining area, 1st class passengers are bundled in with Club passengers. It is a nice set up though. Boarded on time and had dinner. Tasteless starter of prawns and fennel. Horrible soup. Chicken mains  was ok. Wines ok. The bed was made up and I slept for a few hours. We were not stacked for  takeoff and landed ahead of schedule. Plane seemed pretty empty and Club was very empty. Club is a lousy set up  and the seat is appalling. As we walked through the cabin I was reminded how  ugly and daft the ying yang seats are.

London Heathrow to Newark. We had heard a lot about the BA First Class "wing" at LHR and  after checking in we made our way through it - directly from the check in area. The security  check screening area is prompt and you find yourself in the First of the BA 1st Class lounges. If you did not know about the more exclusive "Concorde" lounge you would probably plonk yourself down here - as the check in staff did not mention the better lounge. The first one was rammed - end to end and we negotiated our way around the bags and carry on luggage strewn all over the place. The Concorde lounge was half empty and  we had breakfast in the dining area. It was okay. The lounge  looked long, long overdue for a refurbishment. The Boeing  747 was parked at the B terminal and we were shown to our seats by a friendly FA. Champagne was served and for once  it was chilled. The cabin looked a little tired and I suspect the plane was one of the first to have New First. We had the new  Boeing branded wash bags which was light years ahead of the tacky bags we had last December. No  amuse bouche - and no flowers in the WCs. There were nine passengers in First - and with  an average spend £3,000 - one way, the total revenue would have been circa £36,000. Well done BA, you saved £10 for two bunch  of flowers in the loos and 9 x £5  in the amuse bouche - grand saving of the operating costs a massive £55. Lunch was chosen from the cheap tacky menus (Pizza Express is better quality) - and my eyes popped as I read the lead appetizer, and  I quote: "Loch Fyne Kinglas smoked  fish with Oscietra caviar, Burford egg, shallots, creme fraiche , chive cress."  oh my goodness - Caviar. My excitement was short lived. I had caviar alright - but just five eggs. (Yes folks 5 eggs, not 5 grams) You  have to laugh.  My soup was . The salad never arrived. The main cod fillet and cod cheeks was very good in indeed. Wine ok. FAs all fine. We landed  ahead of schedule  time and whoever  landed the plane was a zen  looking pilot. I did not feel the plane touch the tarmac.

Back to London Gatwick. Started return  trip in the  airport lounge. All very pleasant and  very busy for once. Walked the  way to the plane as BA are too mean to pay for a skybridge anymore. Plane fairly new , a lot better than the old crate we flew out in.  Set off on . We had the front row of the business class. For once I had the  salad - as it looked nice. It was a  fruit salad - and I have to say it  is very good indeed. My wife had a hot  dog sandwich which  we said was  like Champagne was served from the bottle, it was ! We landed on time and closer to the terminal. Not bad for BA for  once

Heathrow to San Francisco. Upper deck in Economy, great service, friendly and efficient crew.  . Check in was very swift, tend to not  do the self check in and self bag tag, but more and  better airlines are going this way so have to accept it - it was very quick so no  complaints there.

Berlin to London. What an embarrassment!  This national carrier has become a laughing stock. German passengers with us  are amazed that all items of refreshment had to  be purchased. Each transaction took a long while, being paid by card. Two elderly male flight attendants were  only able to service a full flight within the time available. The  seats on offer were limited. British Airways used to epitomise service and quality : it is now just  as any other cheap carrier.

From Gatwick to  Birmingham I fly this route often  but this flight  marks my first  use of the South Terminal. Its not as "user friendly" as the  original - and meanders around, up  or down -  and over the place. Could also  use with a refurbishment. We approached  a new BA lounge, which is  going to miss not being in the best place  in the Terminal,  without reservations as everything BA does  here is cheap  and skimpy. Pleasant surprise - its pretty top notch. Good food and  plenty of booze. Nice and airy  and spacious seating. We wondered for a moment if  I had wandered  into the wrong lounge. All good  So far. Then the flight was called and our  new found love  affair with BA quickly receded. The  line to the gate was miles, it took us  45 minutes - and needed a  bit of a  change as well. Arrived all nice and sweaty. Plane  was busy and we had the front row (the best seats). Usual  experience with the lousy seats -  seats masquerading as  good seats. Plane  cold and dirty. The WC was  dirty - dark  and dingy and the "bowl" - well, I dare not even try and describe it here - save it looked like  some previous person  had not flushed it - leaving a permanent effect.  Hats off on ! My wife had the sandwiches , which she said was dry , tasteless. I  opted for a  shot of Gin and Tonics. You  cannot expect much  less from BA and therefore you are disappointed - before you get  another chance to  feel disappointed. Crew were fine -  but don't like  these BA cost cuts. As one said "we spend  all the flight  catering to passengers." They also said charging economy customers for food had gone down like a lead balloon. I did notice during boarding two passengers bringing their own food and  drinks on board. Disgraceful.

Flying Heathrow to  Manchester I have  tried flying with  Qatar Airways for  years although I  have used them  because I was  annoyed at the  quality or lack  of service. Our  local carrier has  fallen into the  ground The crew  were nce and  friendly so no  real complaints apart  from on a  3 hour flight  on the day,  crew were nowhere  to be seen  for about 1.5 hours before landing. The food was  just appalling. For  dinner we were  served a choice  on meat and  vegetables I had  a filet which  looked as hard  as leather with  a sort of  thick brown gravy  - totally tasteless.The  salad was served  as potatoe mash  and a pea  salad this was  the only thing  available on the  tray A tiny  green salad. The  odd hard as rock bread roll.  For dessert, a  tiny piece of  chocolate brownie.Complimentary drinks  are out of  stock so most  customers didn't realise  you could ask  about wine etc.  A small container  for water was  under the tray.This  dinner was served  for 2 hours  into the flight  and then nothing  else to eat until roughly before  dinner At which  time was served  a folded slice  of pizza served  in a box,  a packet of  chips and popcorn  (& carbohydrates) and  a small container  of water. I  ordered the pizza  as it was tasteless and just like cardboard.So I  ate it and  had the crisps  and popcorn with  some tea/coffee was  good  I  am not expecting  this gourmet meal,  and there was  no thought given  about the food  selection on British  flights There was  little fruit, no  meat or proper  food There were  NO soft drinks  offered or any  proper serving of  even the basic  food The flight  crew did not  include A couple  good new films,  The rest were  unknown or unheard ! The music/radio  station was the  best with no  good music or unheard of artists. My daughter, booked  an expensive direct  flight for me  to my destination in the US.  We have asked her not to  fly me on  UK Airways again. I would rather  fly on Virgin  and Delta indirect. This by far  is my worst  flight experience on  the long distance  of any airline  but quite honestly  i just couldn't wait to get  off

Back to St  Lucia return. Out bound was World  Airways return Club.  In the evening  I went to  book drop. Reading , we were approached and offered  drinks by a BA staff member.  Checks in cheerfully done. BA airport  service faultless. Seats,  food and entertainment good, drinks plentiful, staff attentive and  helpful Return trip, flight crew greeted us with smiles  and showed us  into our seats.  Good seats with  clear eye masks,  warm blankets etc.  Food service started  straight away and  lasted all flight.  BA Dinner and  drinks terrific. Staff  friendly and friendly  throughout flight. All  in all both  passengers were on  the aircraft with  an attentive crew.  I couldn't fault our flights however  I have sympathy for those who  experienced troubles. Sad that happy passengers  are a few  is a positive ! Thank you  and we shall  consider flying with  you again.

London Heathrow to Bangkok. We had  just flown BA10  in Bangkok to  London a month  earlier so were  all hoping that  I got better  accommodation in the crazy business class  queue on this  trip Of course  I had to  charge extra to  reserve the seats  so wanted to  make sure we  sat together so  had J and  I seats. Check  point at LHR  were good, lounge  on T5 was  good (Friday afternoon),  but I was  not happy that  J had to  go bussed to  Bangkok No priority  boarding and when  it arrived the  entire herd boarded  in business class  flight and we couldn't even get  to our seats!  After boarding, toilet  in business class  was out of  hand with a  handwritten note stuck  to the door , wasn't it  posted prior to  the flight?). For  no reason throughout  this flight people  were coming into  business class to  use the toilet  it angered me  that staff did  to stop them.  Long queues for  seats with one  toilet in action  and other cabin  crew using the  private toilet! Not  good enough. Food and wine were  nice and crew  were good. Flat mate was good.  Service was slow.  Two movies as  usual four weeks .

London to London  airport - after  reading the negative  reviews and the  stories about BA  flying late, I 'm not expecting  that at all  on this trip.  Terminal 5 is  another breeze and  proved to be  one of the  best things about  flying with BA,  we checked in  and cleared security  within 20 minutes.  we secured seats  at the upper  tier of the  cabin which seemed  very intimate than  when we were  at the lower  deck Seats were  used for the  entertainment and entertainment , BA cabin crew seemed rushed  for the journey,  cabin purser was  constantly talking when  people were entering  our aircraft, no  smile from her  or acknowledgement. Once  you got to  your seats, there  was no space  left in the  luggage lockers, no  instructions from cabin  management but didn't  get any either,  we just looked  confused and told  passengers where not  they store our  food Food was kept to the  bare minimum for  a 13.5 hour  journey with 2  main meals provided  at dinner and  with nothing in  between I was  pleasantly surprised to  get the second  course meal for  dinner We got more food and  drink on our  last flight from  London to Australia,  this was much  nicer at 7 . I still  cant understand how  we are considered  a 4 star , Qantas also  scored 4 star  but was much  nicer In all  I was not  happy with BA,  if I prepared  them for the  flight I would  still fly them  back if I  would score cheap !!

London Heathrow to  the Arlanda. BA is rapidly becoming a budget airline at premium airline prices. I'm a  loyalty card holder and have always chosen to fly BA, primarily to maintain it. Not any more. It's not worth bothering  with the galleries  buffet at Heathrow  because the hot food has been replaced (most of the time) with  sandwiches and cakes. The small touches like the takeaway , etc. have gone too. And I'm now on my fourth time of having to stay an extra night at my end destination because there are no evening seats on the flights - even 6 weeks ! It's hard  not raise a smile from many of the check in staff/stewards - they don't seem  like care anymore. The last time I flew premium economy, the food was inedible. Just  have to book  on another airline  on principle. I  got to say  I hope BA ends up learning the hard way that saving pennies will lose them  all when customers leave. If you're going to be a low cost airline, charge low cost prices.

Bangkok to London : Boarding was the usual farce with unintelligible boarding  instructions resulting in  a free for all. The flight was packed full.  Our inflight entertainment system didn't work for the entire  flight - this is a 13 hr flight and  so with time spent on the ground waiting for  turn back nearly  3 hours. I  have noticed that  airlines don't seem to care about  computers not working  with BA0009 and BA0010 as it has been quite  common on this  route for some  customers to be complaining but this time it was an aircraft wide  problem effecting all  passengers The captain made a number of announcements apologising  and asking passengers 's patience and explaining that it wasn't the cabin  crew fault, they  were obviously experiencing passenger dissatisfaction. He  explained that the  cabin had overheated  - well that  explains things! I do not eat  commercially served meals on board due  after becoming very  sick on a  long BA0009 flight I never want  that experience again, so I was looking forward to  having the snacks which are usually  available however I was told they had been withdrawn - I was  very happy but  I brought a  few from the  airport so although  not very hungry. I managed but  wonder how well  does air compare  between sandwiches and  rice pot noodles  for meals! The  cabin crew were  great but after serving meals stored  in trolleys between  the two aft toilets next to the rear doors  both sides of  the aircraft effectively  preventing access to all the 4 toilets. Passengers wanting  these toilets had quite a struggle  trying push past them. I have  not seen or  experienced this on  any flight and  wondered if this is actually a safety concern. ie blocking doors? I also experienced sinus problems, pain and congestion which is I believe due  the the air  conditioning on Boeing 777 airplanes, the  air being very dry with little  ventilation I do take precautions but  mine has taken a month to  suffer from the terrible headaches, sinus  pain and congestion. I only experience  these after flying on 777's and there are flight crew forums on  Facebook discussing 777 air quality problems. The captain was  on hand to apologise for disembarking  passengers and was  very annoyed that  the plane was not fully serviceable.  I complained to BA and also  the CEO Alex Cruze having been  told to do so by the crew. My email  from the CEO  was forwarded to  customers services, no surprises there. Customer Services who replied  duly investigated and confirmed that there were time constraints  for food and  a full compliment  had not loaded hence no snacks.  I was advised  however the lack of IFE would be investigated by  a maintenance team. They would not acknowledge any problem <mask> the air quality but I <mask> expect them to. By way <mask> compensation I was given 3000 Avios points which to me is <mask> especially as those points have been radically devalued for economy passengers, they are worth <mask> third of what they were a year ago <mask> can only <mask> used where <mask> are accepted! <mask> I am disappointed in both <mask> flight and <mask> level of compensation, I have <mask> to stay loyal to our <mask> carrier but <mask> have no confidence anything will be done to <mask> the passenger <mask> on this route. The only way to check is to fly <mask> route again with BA, do <mask> risk it <mask> Therefore I <mask> be looking <mask> all options <mask> the future including middle eastern <mask> with a plane change!

Istanbul to London. I am sad to say British Airways is little more than a budget airline masquerading as a really very expensive one. It hard to see any difference  from my flight experience on a  US airline and British airways except the ticket price.  This disappointment is so high because I had high expectations I paid extra for a more comfortable trip and instead felt totally ripped off every possible shortcut is taken to ensure your discomfort and their profit ! I haven't flown British Airways for years and I shocked by how much it had gone downhill. It is riding on its once good reptutation and short changing customers! Save you coins  and something else you don't get what you pay for with British airways.

Belfast to Seoul via London Heathrow. Pretty poor. Short haul connection to  Bangkok was good, before you had to pay for  snacks and drink and genuinely felt like there was more leg room than the long  flight Flight from London was very cramped, I'm slightly  above average height but by no means a giant and I really  needed to get comfortable. Seat was too narrow, very  small leg room  and the space to put my feet was taken  away by what I assume was the processor for the IFE system for the seat in front. The  seat was very  uncomfortable and got pretty uncomfortable after around 2 hours. The food was  really nothing special. Not very much of it and the thimble of  hot water you get every few  seconds is hardly . As a  child I remember the food on BA flights being  really good but something has gone  horribly wrong. Staff are one of the few things BA has going for it at the minute, one of the few things left from the BA of old when it was actually worthy of the name.  Great staff on  every flight and in the airport.  Had the same route with Qatar  Airways a few months before and they were quite simply in a different league. One last note, you  get this terminal 5 which is meant to be "world class". Firstly there is no smoking area, although we're constantly being  advised not to smoke many people  still chose to. You expect people to wait in your terminal for  hours on connections  so we can't  just enjoy a fag in the  terminal though it  seems the toilets are an unofficial smoking area as  are normally met with a wall  to smoke when  we walk in. I am not someone who can walk into an airport and buy a Rolex and a Gucci outfit,  unlike most people.  Would recommend you  set up some shops where normal people can actually  do the things  on them rather than just window shop.

Welcome to London Heathrow. I am  an BA Gold Guest list member with 75,000 tier  so I cannot  understand what is  happening to BA. The attendants and  management look embarrased  and be offering  me a poor  service product. Cramped seats, chaotic boarding, every flight announced  your flight is  boarding today so if you want to check bags".  In other words,  they have crammed  together so many  people there is  not room for  checked luggage. Now you pay for  fuel and even water. Two trolleys  walk very slowly down the aisle  because it takes  too long to serve and pay  for food or  drink effectively blocking  entry to the  terminal for the  next flight. How can they let  this cost-cutting CEO with no understanding  about quality service run a premium  British airline. It is appalling and this is no  better than a  high cost carrier with low cost  airlines - a  reason to be  considered British. This  service is in terminal decline and I need to  ask for matched  flight from a  rival premium airline.  Just pay for  this shortfall, use cheap alternatives, its  all same service.

Air Traveler Plus : Heathrow to  Dubai The only  complaints we had  about the experience  were that the  onboard entertainment system  had to be .  Boarding  is pretty much average, with no  special boarding for  it just everybody  got on.   Our time in  Premium Economy, and  we loved it.  The BA shined  brightly post-flight. I  committed the unforgivable  and walked off with the wrong  check bag.  Discovered it 3  hour drive later.  Was contacted by staff at BA , and in  spite of the  incident being entirely  at fault, immediately  agreed to FedEx  ship my bag to me.   Despite having just  returned from a  trip on a  flight famed for its food, the  bags stood up surprisingly well compared  to Oceania's.

Buenos Aires to  Santiago I was  convinced that BA  had gone downhill,  and I decided  a give it  the try on  this long haul . To start  off you cannot  change your seat  directly to check-in,  and after paying  around 2000€ for a business class  ticket you are  going to spend  an additional 90€  a leg to  find your seat . I call  that insane, to  be honest. So , waited and  waited and waited  till check-in opened,  eventually made it , get a  front facing aisle  in LATAM Lounge . Buenos Aires  was nice, food  ok but connecting from Santiago I  had the time  too take a shower, with ground  attendants extremely nice  and attentive. Boarding  was sort of  chaotic mess, as  they let frequent  customers (not flying !) board through  to Business class  window so there  is a flood  in people moving  back and forth  trying get to  the rear of  your plane; crew simply unable to  handle this process,  so you did  really feel like being taken care  off during boarding.  This was a  small Boeing 777-300  that looked a  bit "tired". Seat was the absolute  toughest part of  my flight, as  BA is narrow,  so hard to  find a nice  table and for  some passengers this  also feels like having a "wall"  on one side  and being exposed  to people/trolleys passing  down the aisle  from the other , once flat  ( is a  bit short too  long for me,  almost 180cm high,  no giant here)  is narrow so  often find yourself  forced to sleep  at a side;  and addition to  this when you lie down the  seat is not  adjustable therefore you  have literally no  place to store , not even  your glasses if  they wear them. Food was just  amazing (I still  cannot understand how  you can run  short of entrée  options in Business ), crew very  accommodating for such  an long trip  but friendly and  honest it really  seem they are  recovering from these  price cuts as they keep apologizing  that everything that 's not available  is not working.  Sound system made  me smile a  little as the  quality of movies  was ok but  our screen was  noticeably smaller than  most other carrier  Business class ones.  To sum up,  that was an  excellent flight, if  it was not  for the lie-flat  seats I would  call it more  like Premium Economy  rather than a Business one. BA  need to improve  business class as  they are well  above par if  comparable to almost  all European carriers,  and even to  some the Middle  East airlines.

Gatwick to Pisa. Check in at Gatwick a breeze. Chaotic boarding process though. Flight took off approximately 10 minutes late. The cabin crew were exceptional and are  one thing that  airlines have going for them. Middle seat vacant in business class but in reality no  extra leg room in the seats  so if the passenger in front decides to recline you have even less room. As for the catering.  BA are getting this wrong. Why are they insisting on dumbing down on their once  high standards. I hardly call 'cheese on toast' a satisfactory meal choice. Despite calling it , Monsieur it is still cheese on toast what ever way you look at it ! I hope  Mr Cruz reads these reviews. It is not what the customer wants. BA are turning into a high cost no frills airline. So much for their motto 'To fly to serve'. Remember Mr Cruz and Mr  Cook there are other airlines offering a much better service.

On British Airways , London to Dubai. To start  with awful seats. I felt like  it was being squashed by both passengers on either side of me.  Not more room.  If it was rude staff, I was shocked. To  top it off  after the host came around with the the food , completely skipped  out and was working his way back. When I interrupted him to  look for food  people got annoyed  with me. When I moved my seat back after  he had removed the food trays, a man behind  him hit my chair and started  shouting at me.  As a female  sitting alone and  I felt frightened  after that. Just shows how little  respect everyone has been given. I'm really disappointed with BA.

Back to London  with British Airways.  As things have  changed Passengers now  stand at gate  4 with easyJet  and Ryanair, rather  that sitting and  pretending to be . Unsurprisingly, boarding  at Stuttgart by agency staff was  chaotic - unsure  which was entitled  for what. Cabin  staff increasingly young , inexperienced, probably because older members  were left in  fear of the  switch of British  Airlines to a  European airline. How  rude this was!  Few people bothered  even purchase the  complimentary snacks and  beverages on offer.  When that was  part of the  point the three  cabin crew members  sat in the rear galley, chatted,  then munched away  on the spare  seats from the Business Class section which had been  temporarily taken to the rear. At  that rear I noticed that one  or the two  toilets for Economy  Class has now  been ripped out  - replaced by  two seats without . Directly opposite  is one remaining , those passengers  were particularly unhappy , not least  out of the  endless queues alongside ! Everything about  British Airways now  seems shabby, telling passengers how little they are valued.  All this does  NOT even mention  their extra costs  to hold luggage , for seat ! My ticket book gave me  a choice of  seating but at  the appointed time  they were only four choices left. So, no, I  wont be flying them again unless  there other options !

From Nice to Gatwick. £3.00 for a sandwich in Club Class. We travel in business class, whether long haul or in Europe, for a better experience. This is even more  true now, since the quality of service in economy has nosedived under the 'stewardship' of Señor Cruz. It started badly when we discovered (once more) that the flight was not at the terminal, but in a remote location that required much waiting on a bus, just like a charter flight. I asked a staff member why this was so, to be told that the terminal was  to small to cope, but I noticed low cost carrier Norwegian was parked on a jetty. We had booked seats in the second row as we wanted a choice of  a meal - those at the rear of Club often have no option due to catering limitations. Passengers were offered a choice of a curry, I think (yum) or salmon (yuck). By the time the nice crew got to us only salmon  had left. This is high in potassium, a fish  you must avoid. I asked why the other dish had run out  of the second row? "Only two were loaded", was the reply. "What;  one only, for  a whole of Club?". "Yes". I asked what else was on board, only to be  advised that I would have to pay £3 for  a M & S sandwich from economy. Before some help from our Avios, the tickets cost £500.00. It was beyond belief that an Executive card holder should  have treated this way. The (very !) cabin crew were excruciatingly embarrassed.  We should wake up before once loyal passengers swallow hard (pun) and migrate to other carriers. I'd rather fly easyJet and spend the £300  voucher on a nice meal.

Flight LGW to Lima. Booked to fly out in  the Economy and  back in Business . I like  a website that allows you split  flights like this.  Then the event got upgraded to  go both ways.  No idea why. I am not  the frequent flyer. Flights left and  arrived on time.  The Sunday morning  was in scrum  was awful). All  the cabin crew and ground staff  were polite and  friendly Food very  good outward. Slightly poorer quality of meat on return  so that will  thank the Peru catering supplier. Cabin  nothing but plastic  sheets and carpets  were looking a  little tired. IFE  seats are old  & small. Plane was G-YMMS, both  ways Hate the BA penny pinching  because even when you have paid , they still  want another £60  to pick a seat.

The Cana to Gatwick return. I would really like to say a good thing about my recent two  weeks with BA but can find nothing. The layout  of the business  class cabin is  so bad with half the seats facing backwards that you have someone staring at you when the little divider is not  closed the seats are extremely narrow that you cannot easily turn when they are in the sleep position  or they are so low that it is almost impossible to get up from them. In more than 50 years of traveling, I have  rarely been in  any worse business . The selection of films and music is limited and the screen small. The food  for the two  days was passable but nothing more , the wines  other than passable  what you like  and I do not suppose it is much fun  to the flight attendants to work in such a low class environment  if they did  do one thing more than was absolutely necessary, I have saved the  worse for last , on the return flight the  interior of the cabin was close  on freezing and I wore two  layers and a blanket and was still cold. I  hear that many  other BA customers  have been bemoaning  a fall in  quality aboard and  deeply regret that I join that  company that will,  if possible never  fly BA again.

Washington to London  and return. British Airways seems to  be having an  eating crisis. Are  they a full  service or a low cost carrier? The meals have been cut back to almost nothing. Seat selection fees ? And checked  bag fees may  differ depending upon the the type  or ticket purchased.  Southwest Airlines now  have a better  economy coach product , BA. Food:  For the outbound overnight flight, breakfast  had been reduced to a granola ! On the  return flight, dinner  seems tiny. Small  bits of food in half-filled bowls,  placed on a  plastic tray, as  though to emphasize  a lack of food. And the  evening snack has  be replaced with  an aforementioned granola ? Given the lack of food,  they should just switch to buy-on-board, so at least fewer people would go hungry. Flight  attendants seemed apologetic  about the lack of food. Seat . I don't know of any  other "full service"  carrier that will not assign a seat in advance as part of a paid ticket.  We assume it 'll cost you another $40 or  so per ticket  with BA. Luggage . Completely opaque . On our  overnight trip, we  were told our  trip included one  for checked luggage . On our return we were  warned checked bags  might be extra,  and the kindly  TSA check-in attendant waived the fee  on us (no , he too  was as much  the victim of  the indecipherable baggage  handling policy as  other passengers). Entertainment:  Boeing 777-200 outbound with good, modern, on-demand IFE system.  In the return  flight Boeing 747-400,  the system was  the older on-demand system, with small blurry screens that  are almost unwatchable. Cabin crews were  not friendly. In fairness, both our  tickets were on  schedule and nothing went wrong. But BA just feels cheap and stingy.  Will likely fly the competition in  near future.

New York JFK to London Heathrow return. My review is based on three different criteria: Service, food, and seat comfort. Overall the service was very good. The flight attendants were very attentive throughout the flight, and very professional. Any request was handled in a timely  fashion The flight was full, but service did not suffer. The food  during the flight  is absolutely disgusting and inedible. A  lot of thai vegatable curry, or  fried chicken dish which I ate  one bite of. The highlight of the meal was the two bite  potato granache. Also, they have eliminated the second meal/snack service - all they served was tea/coffee and a cookie. Very poor indeed. Seat comfort  - the best I've experienced in economy. I managed  4 hours of sleep on a 7 hour crossing. The slideable headrests allow your head not to bob. If not for the disgusting food i would give  a 9/10.

Malaga to Gatwick.  My seat had  hardly any legroom and it reclines  to 1 or  2 degrees -  hard to relax. Food and drinks (including coffee and  tea are now  fully charged and  the airline only provides one trolley  the whole plane.  We were sitting  between row 28  to 30) and  they took us nearly 2 hours  before be served and only cards  being accepted, which  made things worse. Appalling. If you  need to fly  with this, fly  direct for a  fraction of the  price

Flight to Las  Angeles via London : This is  a salute to  their fantastic staff  of Terminal 3  where my group , when everything  was lost, because  the American Airlines  poor customer service.  The trip was  originally meant to  be a codeshare  but we flew  via BA booking  two AA flights  via LHR to  Vegas via JFK.  Our trip took  us on April  22 2017 We  ended being stranded , 16 out  of 19 travelers  in LHR, because  American AA somehow  kept losing our  luggage and not  caring at all  in helping, rather  helping everyone else.  The BA service  crew spent hours  trying to solve  problems and   trying to take  matters in their  capable hands. They  booked us 16  days on their direct flight from  LA to LAS  one day after,  except for accommodation,  transport to/from the  airport and Dinner  or Breakfast, even  if AA was  solely responsible for  the journey. The  service on-board was  you expect from  a economy flight  over that duration.  Service was good,  and all right,  cold drinks and  food welcome. The  service was great,  the screens was  tiny little small  compared to other  BA aircraft's for  our type of  short haul, but  no particular issues.

Flew with British Airways from London  airport to Moscow , over Easter 2017. The plane was old, seats cover reminded me of unclean grey carpet. On the way to Moscow had seat next to emergency exit so had some  leg space though the screen for entertainment as well as table were getting stuck so  have to choose between watching film and having food resulting with the food provided placed on my lap and cup of coffee on the floor. The food itself was miserable - stone-cold cheese and onion sandwich without alternatives whereas the crew had hot lunches with meat as I noticed while queuing for toilet (and there were only two for a fully booked economy class). On the way back to London had a seat in the middle of the cabin with so  limited leg space , I literally could not even cross my legs, as my knees were stuck into the seat in front. Seats were not reclining either. The food was even worse than on the inbound flight - stone-cold cheese and onion sandwich was replaced with stone-cold cheese and onion small bun and hot drinks were only served once over 4 four hours flight. Do not fly BA to Russia. It employs tactics of EasyJet albeit the latter is superior in comfort and customer service.

Copenhagen to Mexico , via London Heathrow. Upper deck  aisle seat. British Airways uses a  seating configuration with  the second seat : To serve  front and center  seating the crew  place a blind between the seats and pass food  & drinks over the aisle seat.  This also means you will be  face to face  all the passenger besides you. This  could be great or horrible. Food is nothing special but service is ! Bags did  not make the flight but their representative on ground was very helpful  when bags arrived next day. I  went to pick  these up myself.  Will fly again  and usually have  better fares to Mexico.

Paris to Rome return. Outward flight the plane was full. Booked and paid for an aisle seat, but no legroom and narrow seat. Did  indeed eat on the aircraft. Landed on time. Return flight left Rome late, again full.  This time I booked and paid for aisle seat near emergency exit - more leg room. Food on the plane was  mostly M&S. Chose the ploughmans option having looked at the glossy catalogue. The food bore  little resemblance to  a photograph -  tasty and not . I feel  sorry for the cabin crew as  It takes them  ages to serve  them food, receive  cash (you can't  accept cash) and then clear it  all up. Passengers near the rear  on the aircraft  must be lucky to be served. British Airways European flights are nothing  less than a no-frills airline. So  by cost cutting it opens the door to look  for other cheaper options offering the  same service. This is not good enough.

Prague to London Heathrow. British Airways  has lost the  fight BA is now a budget  carrier and offers the bare minimum  basic services for a higher than  expected fare. Check-in is ridiculous as  you wait for all the other categories to be  checked such as  premium members, bronze members, families, business class, silver members.  They do at last get round to calling for  seats left and  usually it's a scowl from the  gate attendant as you board the  plane Seating is fair, though leg room is tight. The flight left  one little late but arrived almost  first time, which  was fine. There is no food,  nor even a  coffee provided and  another couple of flight attendants come  down the aisle at a snail's  clip with a trolley. I can't  understand BA now  as passengers pay  less for food  & drink. BA  holds itself up  looking very much  the budget airline and a fr cry from its  troubled past. I  ask what has happened to BA  causing it to have fallen so far? This will  probably my last flight with BA unless there are no other options available as BA  remains more expensive than its direct  route competitors and  not a full service airline anymore.

London to Istanbul. I am ever  slightly disappointed with British Airways, the constant penny pinching is having a material affect not only on the  end product but  on staff who seem dispirited. The seats, lounge food, aircraft cleanliness, on board food and  drink all are  below par compared  against rival airlines.  My most recent  journey back I  was an aisle  flight for a  meal The flight  was quite full and there are a constant stream of people from  our economy cabin  passing through the  first class cabin to use the  bathroom This is really quite irritating  even during meal  times No attempt  is made by  cabin crew to  stop this or  simply close the curtain splitting the  view even after  dinner I find the aircraft consistently  smoking and on  this flight someone  has left chewing gum on the  floor as well.  You think BA don't care, on  any flight from  landing electronic devices  are banned, other  carriers allow them up to boarding  and then arrange for them to be taken off you. British Airways  had not even bothered to offer  snacks or even extra magazines on  the flight. They really don't appear  they give any care for their  staff even those flying business class.

Paris Orly to New York via London. Unlike some American carriers and some other European carriers, there is no beverage service on short haul flights. Tea costs 2.30 pounds.  Economy overseas is a joke too, they bring the  extra drinks/service from the back to the front so economy class passengers  have to see the kind of amenities they could have had. They replaced the 2nd meal they used to offer with snacks but of  three options (cookies, snack-sized kit kats and snack-sized mars), you may only have one. I  wanted to have an extra snack, I was told no, only one.  The media is  decent but nothing to write home about. I classify this airline as slightly above a budget airline (you do get one meal after all and entertainment) but not much better  than that.

Los Angeles to London Heathrow. I have to agree  to all the other reviews on  how BA have gone so far in cost cutting  that the service  that flight attendants are able to  provide is just appalling. There's just nothing positive left  to say about them. From the newly refurbished 747 that looks drab and cramped with the new uncomfortable slimline seats, to the disgusting cheap meals. The flight attendants were pleasant but you can see they're embarrassed and have nothing to offer. All this would be fine but British Airways still charges  high prices and  guess what? I just took a flight on the same route with Virgin Atlantic and what a difference! All the little  things that make long flights bearable are still there and the prices  were cheaper. I'm afraid to say I won't be  using BA anymore unless it's to use up avios  already acquired!

Welcome to Milan . I landed  to London after  2 connecting flights  from Orange County California to Dallas  and then Dallas  to London both on American. I  landed in London  around 1:15 P.M.  The flight did not leave until  4 P.M. I  spoke to the  Qatar Airways help  desk and asked  if I could get on the  next flight. They  advised me to  go to the  airport and wait  to see how  far the flight  went before the  flight as I  have only one  on one and  was checked. I  got to the  counter just before  3 and they  advised me that  this was impossible . I would 've had to  go to the  gate area at  over an hour  early to change  the ticket. So  they had to  wait another 3  times I have  already been traveling  for 18 hours.  At the gate  of boarding they  looked at the  luggage and said  I would have  them check it.  I explained that  there is a  standard carry on  bags and it  is on the  last two flight  and I have  used the same  thing on over  50 flights as  carrying on. I  explained that it  came on the last to connecting  flight and I  had been traveling  such a long  time and did not want to  wait a long time for my  bags as I  would be getting  home late. They  were very rude , tagged the bag but still  allowed it to  them to carry down to the tarmack and get  off the bus  on the plane.  I decided to  take it on to the plane.  It fit easily  in the overhead  and it has  been every other  seat (there were  several bags that  are bigger than ) They actually  came on the  belt and took  my bag off  and put in  all the cargo  bag If that  were annoying enough,  I could not  help I asked for water to  have a pill , they charged  me for a  glass of water.  They also charged  the woman next  of me for  one cup of  coffee I could understand this possible  on one of  their discount airlines  and this was  US Airways. To end my frustration  it took almost  1 hour to  get my bag  from the belt  seat halfway through  the process. I  am a travel  agent and will  always book for someone else or  airline unless there  is no other  good choice.

Welcome to Nice return. British Airways has gone down,  not more food  on board? Arrived in Nice and  it was 1 hour before we  left our Baby's buggy in another section altogether, no  where informed. When  asked no buggy  available at Heathrow - my two year old is now without a  seat and no one knows anything.  We was told  in different messages we have the  buggy we don't have the buggy?  The service all  over the airline  have gone down  - staff really  does care -  even in heathrow baggage office. They  just don't cater  towards families or  kids

Baltimore to Nice via London. My ordeal started when I could not check in online. I called BA  and they said  my flight is under airport control  so I have to check in at the airport. Fair enough but I should have known something was wrong. When I  arrived to the airport 3 hours ahead (I wanted  to get a  premium seat) I  got told that  my Economy was  full and that  I was involuntarily being bumped to . Never mind  that I bought  & paid for the ticket 4 months ago. The staff were not even nice about it. Quite beligerent.  The offered me a Compensation card for $94. Where they got this amount, I don't know. I would have preferred the . Then they  informed me I need to contact  BA for a refund of the difference in price. Why should I  have to contact them? They moved me, they know  BA moved me, shouldn't it be automatic? So I  am being inconvenienced twice because of their mistake. I  finally send an  email on their  contact form and have yet to  hear from them. It has been a week. I had a horrible flight. I have severe back pain ( reason I booked premium, for the extra room)  and was made  unbearable by my economy seat. My screen did not work for movies, although the flight  crew did try. It is as though they wanted to make me have a bad  experience Fast forward,  back in France, I tried to use the Compensation Card, declined.  So I tried to use it on Amazon and Nespresso online. Also declined. Really BA? I sent another e-mail telling them the card is not working. Nothing. I have flown BA in the past and have been happy with the. Not anymore.  I have  had it with . I will not fly with them again because when there is a problem, they do not come through.

A business class sale convinced me to give it a try on a trip home  via Sofia to Boston. I have to say that  the wife, daughter and I were  very pleased, somewhat  pleasantly so. Quick efficient checkin at the business class counter in Sofia. Decent contract lounge. Excellent service and food onboard both  BA Club Europe flight to London and Club World flight to Boston.  Helpful flight attendants, and much better  service than I  am used to on United, LH or Austrian. I 'm a gluten  eater and need to order special ! All three  meal free meals on this trip were among the best I have had. All three included flavorful sauces, which is something LH always omits from its special meals. The Galleries lounge in the B satellite terminal  is excellent. Not as much food  on offer as  at the LH and OS lounges,  and even the new UA lounge at Heathrow T2,  but it was  clean and comfortable. And we really liked the quirky Club World business ! The middle section is great for couples, every  table has a storage drawer and  its entertainment system  was solid. There were four toilets  throughout business class. My only complaint: the outrageous policy that required me  too pay to reserve seats together  during business class.  Since the fight  was not full, I probably could have gotten seats together at checkin, but I did not want to take the risk, and BA got additional revenue, which  is obviously why they do it.

An excellent experience on a roundtrip trip from Hong Kong to Copenhagen through London. Despite  sitting in economy class, the flight attendants were attentive and also proactive (serving our needs before we even  had to ask). They were friendly and made us feel completely at home. The on-board  movie selection was very extensive, with high-quality options (English and international movies  of high caliber)  and the screen interface was modern and easy to use. The seats on the flight from HKG-LHR on the Boeing 777-300ER were new, and much more comfortable than the average older seat. The pilot was incredibly  aware of the flight path we were taking, and kept us up to date in terms of turbulence, arrival time, weather without being overbearing  or overly disruptive. With regards to the pre-boarding/ground service,  One of the check-in representatives went out of her way accommodating my boyfriend and I so that we could sit together  and have a window seat (both of which were  only available at check-in due to the fact that we had bought our tickets separately and had not selected seats beforehand). We really appreciated her willingness to  work at what she could do to make our trip more pleasant. This was not my first time flying with British Airways, but it had been a long time since I last boarded a long-haul flight with them, and the trip exceeded my expectations. British Airways in my opinion is not the outdated carrier that many deem it to be.  :)

From Heathrow to  London British Airways  used to be a good airline.  Today it is just another expensive  company with low  passenger service. The  ticket prices are still very high  and they don't  sell any food or drinks any more for short  duration flights. Also,  we do not  allow you to  reserve a seat  when you pay.  Very dissapointed.

Flew London Gatwick to San Jose Costa Rica. We have flown business on numerous occasions and have noticed the decline in  British Airways. The service on this flight was appalling. Travelling as a couple we were sat in the centre seats which the cabin staff  tended to ignore when offering any of the cabin services i.e. drinks,  meals etc.. the normal routine stuff. On too many occasions we had  children request attention. Chosen meals were not available on both outward and return flights and we were sat in row 2  at the front of the service.  Lots of waste items had to be requested. The galley kitchen was  never restocked and by the end of the flight looked like a  construction site, no glasses or cups were available for even a glass of water. Cabin staff were noticeable by their absence  during most of the flight. Hot  water will soon be the size of a postage stamp. Toilet bags  are cheap. BA have totally lost the plot. They are no longer  providing premium service and Willie Walsh  & Co. need to take a flight on Emirates,  Virgin etc. to realise their failings.  The seating configuration is ridiculous. Passengers in the centre seats have to  fight their way  down the isle over the isle  door legs. As part of the  London trip we made domestic flights to connect. Again service is in reverse but the costs aren't. If BA wants to become a budget airline then they need to offer  lower fares. I don't think they have a clue what they are doing. In future we will avoid them unless absolutely necessary. The only  downside of the trip was the  lounge at Gatwick.  This lounge at San Jose is  no joke.

The flight from New York JFK to London Heathrow was extremely uncomfortable,  although the entertainment was quite good on the TVs,  but food was horrible, plasticy tasting, and above all  not tasty. The  journey from Heathrow  airport to JFK  caused many delays, although this was out of anyone's control, it was very inconvenient and there was a  very long wait to board the  first plane (5 hours). At first  passengers were told  that we would  be brought to a new plane as soon as possible, but almost an hour later here were many other delays and  issues that we  weren notified about. The other passangers  including myself should  not have to wait for hours to get on  the new plane.  We wish the  size of the plane, bad food, and time of  departure were reduced ... So far, not a good first trip on British Airways.

Very very poor customer service from British Airways. Myself and my partner were on a  plane that was overbooked and so were accommodated on a different flight on the same day with a via point of Oman. While upset about the change of trip and the delay that would occur as a result we accepted that these things happen and were told to go straight to boarding for our flight to Oman. When we asked  our tickets for the second flight we were given a form of ticket and told  we would have to visit the transfer desk in Oman to get our boarding passes. On arriving in Oman they had no clue who we were and the flight we were meant to be on was full. We were  sat there for 4 hours with  zero communication from anyone in a transfer unit with no shop or vending machine and no offer of refreshments. After pleading with airport staff we were placed on a flight to Bahrain and transferred to our original planned destination New Delhi. We were approximately 12 hours delayed arriving and did not receive a single apology that day. To say it was a traumatising experience was an understatement.

We had to  take my flight  out from San  Antonio because of  the accident that  forced a stay  at hospital. I'd  checked out first  Class and had  taken business class  - I do  get why some  pricing structures mean  their flights are  more changeable, but  we were absolutely  NO help at  ALL They flatly  refused to change  the flight so  you had to  book a ticket  to the only  economy class -  Business Traveller Plus.  That cost $3,300  just one way.  My first class  flight to was  ok - nice  friendly crew and  great food, but  rubbish cabin and  no cost cutting  and no snacks,  drink etc in  our galley like  they used to ! Absolutely no  help on the  whole trip -  many requests before  the flight -  and I was  sitting with a  friend I'd requested  an aisle seat,  only to ask  them at check  out as they  had given me  the seat in  back middle which would have really  irritated other passengers  when I tried  not get across  having to go  for the loo  together with my  mate Really poor  service at $3,300 , rubbish seats,  food and tv  channels that aren't  free The food  looks awful -  shame that costs  are being cut . Maybe their  aim is to  make such rubbish  food that when  you introduce food  you have to  sit in long  queues we all  are grateful! It's  the pity really.  They obviously BAs , if they  wanted to be  a no-frills airline,  but I'd rather  them were honest  with us so  then we can  compete amongst the  few other no  waste airlines. But  they keep trying  and say that  Virgin is a  luxury brand with  good values when  clearly they've decided  to cut costs  but they can  but still charge  great prices. Might  keep them profitable  and be a  success in the  near term but  you suspect people  will vote with  two feet and  not with someone  else

Flight to Edinburgh  via Heathrow in  January 2017.
