I've  always enjoyed flying British Airways and  will make my yearly trips to  Edinburgh with them  easier than flying  direct to Newark  on United. The  short haul flight  was OK - food service was  a wee bit  slow but it  included the usual  chicken and rice  which was OK  for an economy  class flight. However,  it was a surprise to me  - they no  longer served breakfast  or even a  sandwich in the  cabin - so  the chicken was  my only food  I got on  the flight. I  was too fussed  at that, until  we got on  our connecting flight  to Edinburgh where  i found out  why they no  even served free . By this  time I was pretty hungry so  I caved in  an got ready  to pay for  my bacon roll,  but never happened  before the trolly  never reached me! To top it  off off, we  departed Heathrow late  because of a  computer problem, meaning  I missed my  first connection in  time - but  you understand that  such things happen  in times. However,  budget cuts to  services and the  continued densification of  the long and  short haul fleet  make BA a  bit less attractive.  Plus the headphone  jack on my  iPod was loose  and it was  quite difficult to  watch films during  this flight, which was disappointing. On  the up side,  BA staff both  behind the desk  AND during the  flight were great  and always. Considering  I got the  tickets for a  great price, it  seemed OK. Although  I will definitely  not be going out my way  and fly BA  but will just  look for the  cheaper or direct  flights in future.  Not indifferent in  not flying with  them - if  they suit you  best then go !. But don't go out your  nose to fly  BA - if  they are cheaper  than direct options,  then go for  it instead because  their isn't anything  really outstanding.

Well where do you start. This is a business  flight on a supposedly premium brand.  A ticket price  runs in excess  to £5000. The lounges at LHR  still need work. Yes British Airways  need investing but  long overdue. The small lounge for  departure gates needs  not be re-thought  to offer better food options. To the aircraft - its been refitted apparently, but should  have scrapped. The  engines remain tired.  The vanity screen  is not working . The entertainment  centre is past  their best, with smudges and scratches.  The carpets look like they need a very good  clean and are  old indeed. The toilets are 'old'.  However the aircraft is well past  and could be described as a premium. Regarding the  bathrooms - they  had been bashed  so are a  shadow of their  old selves. Sad  yet true. Too  no apologies for  the rubbish decisions  from management. On this trip the  catering kitchen was  not stocked and  many of the  essential items were missing e.g. Waitrose  sandwiches and yogurts. They have also stopped the ice-cream.  Food served was  not good -  saving grace was the meat platter,  because what could  they do to spoil sliced meats  and cheese. Blankets are faded and ragged. The toilet bags are a joke. Cheap and nasty. This route  is the jewel  on the airline  crown and one that has slide  on the priority ladder. BA need to invest in  their new fleet.  Improve the crew.  Upgrade the catering  staff get a  bit more choices.  Change the seating  - change seating configuration to avoid being an Olympic  pole vaulter.

London Heathrow to Singapore. Business class flight from Heathrow  - Singapore. Flight took off over 2 hours late with no real explanation why, and we were not  even informed. It  appears BA is these days later in taking off.  During the flight  it felt like many of the staff serving were not friendly as one would expect in any flight let alone in  first class, and my calls to  order additional water or other quite basic service elements  was not responded to with any friendliness or a service mindset. The  final meal we were served was absolutely awful. It was supposed to be an Asian meal of a curry with prawns, but was just  a gunge, and was not edible. I really don't  know how they could have deemed this meal acceptable. Also the breakfast was far too late and seemed to be a  mad rush to try and complete the service before the plane landed  - which seemed totally unnecessary. As  I was hungry between courses I went to the  kitchen to get snacks but the  quality was poor,  as the staff seemed to react badly to this for some reason.  I have noticed  the big difference  to the snacks on offer in the past few years. I have  remained a BA silver member for  many years but now see no reason to renew.  We always try and fly Qatar  whenever possible when going to Asia now, as the  quality is better and often the price too. There is nothing redeeming  about BA.

How was I  thinking flying this ?! For the  third time travelling this airline our  luggage has been  stuck Two years ago London to  Paris our bags  were lost for  3 days. So this flight our  bags are left in London again!  So I'm stuck  at Dubai in winter clothes, missing  the pools and  staying at our resort waiting for  my bags to  show up. It's only been 3  weeks now in  those same clothes. Upside - service  on board BA559  - excellent. However, business class on  the Europe flight  is no different to economy so don't pay for business if you think you are getting a comfy  ride

Just got off the flight from  Manchester to New  York and have to say it  is one of the worst long  distance economy class flights I have ever had to ! The legroom  is an absolute  disgrace for such a long flight  and first time I have ever been unable to  bring my laptop to work (I  cannot understand why they don't offer  laptops on board!).  My seats are minuscule and if  your are unfortunate to be sitting next to somebody  that is rather  big boned shall we say, then  it is a dreadful experience. In my section one of the toilets  was not working from the start of the flight , the other  toilets rapidly descended  in a disgrace  and no cleaning  done throughout the  journey I have travelled a lot  over the years, first, business and  family and had  the gold British  Airways card, but this was just  awful and I don't really know what BA hope  they achieve in  their long run - I can guarantee, I will  look other airlines  first before considering them again. Anybody contemplating going to New Orleans from  London - fly  to somebody else  and get an  air connection - you won't regret it. As for BA, they have about as much chance of me booking another flight  with them long term as Trump , of winning  that Nobel prize  at oratory, were  not to exist!

I flew on a reward flight from London Heathrow to Brussels for a weekend and decided to treat ourselves to a full service experience.  We were very well looked  over by superb  Flight attendants who  had a great sense of humour.  My lunch was chicken salad and a nice dessert. What we did notice is that the legroom was just the same as economy, and seemed rather worse  than usual. The  only perk we had was a blanked off seat in the middle,  which if you 're a bit chunky like me, it was quite difficult to manoeuvre.  That all tallies with what has been written in the newspapers, and  I like many other reviewers and  other loyal flyers  feel that BA is being turned into Vueling. If it weren't for  our excellent pilots and flight attendants  of BA who  make our journeys  both very comfortable  and safe, we would not travel  with BA. We  would try to find another full service airline, because we enjoy flying.

Our cabin crew, bar one lazy individual, were excellent. T5 feels like  a monopoly -  The Lounge food is simply appalling. Between breakfast and  dinner there is no hot food.  The hot food is removed at 9.30am sharp. Why  even leave it ??? So all you have is bread and stodgy  food The upstairs of the A380  was in need  of a serious  Master Cabin crew  – although you 'll sense lower  class BA flights  running often late now in my experience. The Club  Class A380 seats aren't comfortable. Despite  us knowing, crossing  over someone's legs  to get out is still a nuisance. There is  no scrum it down for last  set of toilets before landing -  we had one  man shout at  me when I'd  started waiting long before him and  I just turned up and tried  to arrogantly barge in.  Many  short term loyal passengers are starting  too feel disrespected  or undervalued, let down after years ' loyalty and  excessive spending. We're not getting what we're paying for, although charged. That's the sad bit.

I am just  sorry to have to write this review. I changed  from Lufthansa to  British Airways more  that 10 years  back because it beening a premium  airline that was  unique in any  case Mostly flying between Berlin, the US and in recent years very  to Cape Town.  They had more  comfortable planes, innovative  technology like a  luxurious (rather new)  Economy Class, lie-flat  seats in Business  and a new  fuel economy and  had very good  staff with good  comfort and legroom.  Going from Cape Town to Berlin  in January to  receive my Silver  Membership made me realise, that none  from my initial  motivation to choose BA still exists,  perhaps the exception  for the great  BA staff, that  i feel really  grateful for. The  airline hired Álex Cruz last year, a very experienced  Brazilian airline executive  - he is doing the best  we can: Turning BA into a  budget carrier. Unfortunately.  The result is  great pity. No more service on  short haul flights,  limited service, only paid snacks on  old worn 747's  from Cape Town  for the grimm ies to be traveling in cramped  old 777's with  the extra seat  built in from  next year onwards. British Airways as  the premium airline  has lost. Realistically for year to come. Even with  BA status renewed,  I don't think I will fly them again if  they don't have . Meanwhile I understand, that companies  cannot unterstand and  own their mistakes.  I do hope  airlines will do  that in the  very not to distant future -  and keep their  amazing staff on  staff and on board.

Oh no, no, British Airways. You've messed up. Someone  sitting in an office thought it would be a good idea to charge for food and drink on flights, just like many other airlines do, and they said "Let's provide food from M&S: that will make our offering classier than the rest."  The problem on  the 18:55 flight from Marrakech to London was that — it being dinner time — loads of passengers  demanded food and  drink so the  service was inevitably : A piece of friendly advice, BA, you need  only provide 4 cabin crew to handle economy on a dinnertime flight, or you merely  annoy your customers. Sitting near the  end of the  plane my wife  & I got served 2 hours into the 3.5 hr flight, by  this time our  legs were hanging ! But what's this? Only two sandwiches left, and  we bagged the last two packets  with crisps. You're  selling things you can't deliver, BA.  What is such as thing as  advertising standards, and your beautifully photographed food and drinks  display drives a coach and horses through the principles of advertising standards. The 2 cabin crew serving economy  went on with their service most impressively, even managing  to smile as  to the umpteenth time someone's payment  has failed to register on their  card (Hint for frequent flyers: if your card just doesn't work you  pay your food  and drink for .) Meanwhile, behind the service trolley, a phalanx of passengers with their legs tightly crossed  struggled to avoid exhorting the cabin crew to move  the trolley so they could access the toilets to  relieve themselves (a very appropriate expression in the circumstances). Other passengers simply  tried to relieve  them of the packaging of the food they bought hours earlier: several  amongst them eventually came down the  stairs waving their empty bottles and M&S extensive food packaging for the crew to remove from their sight.  Everyone at British Airways is employed to read reviews on this website, please take note and pass it  along to your  colleagues if you dare. The process I call 'Ryanisation' of British Airways  seems almost complete. You now charge  on checked baggage (yes, I know that's indirect, but  even idiots can't  get through the scam), you exert an extortionate price for those unfortunate enough to be tall, and who  need the legroom of emergency exit seats, and now you've devised a  new system of charged cabin service for food and drink on 'short -' (what even BA used to call 'medium haul') flights that annoys  less than half the customers on board the plane. Oh, and by the way: why don't the cabin <mask> deploy the <mask> overhead monitors that display the flight progress? Too costly, perhaps? I suggest that BA needs to return to the days of advertising when you had a wonderful slogan, but <mask> a minor revision: "British Airways, <mask> world's least favourite airline".

Having only flown  BA / Ryanair for all my  international journeys over the last 10  months or so,  it was pleased to see a  new low-cost BA flight for my round trip from London to Rome. In hindsight, I wish I'd booked a different airline and not booked  one based on  their legacy reputation. To say that this was a disappointing experience would be an understatement. I expected, at the very least, an equivalent service to that of other low-cost short-haul airlines, certainly not ! Narrow seats are to be expected but these seemed far more narrow than the  previous Regardless of , there is no excuse for a seat being so uncomfortable. Even on a 2.5hr trip this was almost unbearable coupled with the fact that, at a relatively small 5"8,  my knees were  facing the seat in front. Lucky  the seats had no recline feature  could make matters worse. I was also tantalised by the BA bragging of M&S supplied , I am more than happy  with pay for this on a short-haul flight and don't expect anything for free. It  certainly looked delicious  from the pictures and descriptions. Sadly, being sat in  row 22, this meant that after  the frustratingly slow pace of the cabin crew finally getting to me  is that they  had run out of pretty much  anything No sandwiches, no fruit salad,  or yoghurt. I asked what they did have. Their response 'Bottle of water or a Kit Kat'. After asking the cabin crew why there 's so little option their response was surprising to say the least. 'They never give us enough food. It's mad. They give us 6  meals for the whole flight'. Needless to say that  they can no  more live on their past reputation. They had an opportunity to position themselves as the best of the low-cost carriers. Sadly, they probably sit about 4th or  fifth down the list. I'd say I'd give their long-haul a chance but after this experience, I won't bother. What a shame.

My Heathrow to Munich return. It used to be  a enjoyable experience flying BA. Sadly  all the cutbacks  are kicking in , and travelling  now just feels  like a bit  more a chore. The loss of  the free bar/food service on European  flights is a real step down.  Much worse is  that cynical way  by which it happened: downgrading the  food offering so  drastically that it  feels like an  effort to offer  free M&S food  above board. Oh,  and how replacing  a free drink with the same  one only now  we have to  eat is an 'improvement' in service  remains beyond me. Not even a  free tea or  bottle of water? (I asked for  bottled water on  this flight earlier  last year to  save paying, only  then find it  smelled of chlorine  so wouldn't recommend you do the same). The 'card-only'  baggage system is  awful as well,  and takes forever  on the trolley  to get from  the end of  one plane to  each other. Next  down the list  are the outrageous prices that BA charge to select a seat in ! Not wishing  TO pay this,  by the time  you checked in  for this flight  ( maximum 24  hours in advance) there were only  4 or 6 seats on the  first plane I  could choose from. Add  into this the lack of choice  in their "menu".  there are only  another couple of sandwiches, and if  they don't like  bread or cheese,  eat out of  luck Well done , you've alienated  your customers and are hardly likely to attract new ones. The flight  from Heathrow to Belfast is my  main gripe. The flight was meant  for depart at 1645, but was delayed to 1720,  not a big deal right? Wrong! The gate only went up at 1650, this led me to a  queue which took  you to the aircraft. It was 1730 before everyone  else boarded, again, hardly a big  deal except that  we didn't take off until 1830,  this meant that my dogs had  a spend an extra night in  Belfast as I  came back too  early to pick them up. Something I struggled  not get my  mind around is  when paying for  economy class flights,  and then expect  people to pay  an additional £77  / person each  time to reserve  flights There were  12 of us  total so that  was in excess  the £600 to  our flight cost. Flew from Lisbon to London and return. I was scheduled to fly BA208 from Miami to  Frankfurt on January 18th. Boarding and departure went normal, but than, close  before take-off, the ordeal began. Captain  discovered a technical problem (at approx. 09:15 pm) and that's when the horror started. Overall, we ended up  staying in the plane until 01:00  hrs before we  are finally allowed to leave the plane (any attempts to fix the fault failed). We were given accomodation, but that was a 45 mins  flight from Miami Airport. Check-in took another 30 mins  leading to a long queue of  other passengers, and  this place was like a freezer. Was re-booked for a flight the next day, but downgraded from Premium Economy to Economy.  A tatty 747, very uncomfortable seat , entertainment screen was the size a mobile phone.  Best of all, the delay of one day has forced me to add another night  in London, and cancel my connection to Munich. Total  flight expenses, not counting the difference between Premium Economy (which I paid ), and Economy  is ~$500. Including the gap between Economy and Premium Economy probably ~$900.  Surely this is where a service oriented company would have an opportunity  for make a  difference Submitted my compensation claims incl. proof for the above expenses, as per protocol online - no confirmation.  Ended up with  the call (had to wait approx. 45 mins to talk to a human) and was  told that most  costs are not refundable but I would be compensated for the remaining. No further confirmation, email etc. Was  paid a mere $50 into my  refund with no  clue what this is supposed to be for (the expenses were $900).  Went to do  further research and it appears that under EU law,  airlines are required  not compensate for consequential damages if the delay if  greater than 3  hours (my delay was 21 hours).  Absolutely atrocious  Customer service, lousy ! How on earth BA deserves  5 stars in  paying me.

London Heathrow to  Las Angeles. Worst flight ever with  US Airways, you can see why they have fallen out of the top 10! Very lazy and oblivious staff members. While leaving the service light on for 15 minutes  waiting for some water, I went to the back of the plane to find 2 members of staff  reading the paper. Even after complaining  of customer service after the flight we weren't treated much better. If it wasn't because  the the avios program it was enough to put me off for a life time!

Unfortunately British Airways are fast becoming a  middle rate budget  airline in order  too appease it's  passengers

Heathrow Terminal 5 is a great  airport dedicated to  UK Airways, the  ground service was not as fast  like they say,  everything was normal. First  class IFE felt very old and  very clear at  being something you'd  expect on non-refurbished B777's. Choice of  music and TV  channels are pretty  limited so I  cant fault BA  on that. British Airways use a version of  a 747 with  the minimal number of economy seats  in this route from London Heathrow to Johannesburg. Every seat on both outward and return flights was occupied. They make a bigger profit by having more seats in business class etc and so squeeze the economy class people into a confined area. Seats are narrow,  and cushions are hard, and I  saw a "large" person next to me both trips. I paid for an aisle seat in each case but comfort is impossible. Food was passable and no more, but there were two meals on the long  haul Cabin crew were surprisingly young and seem to be in training ; polite and efficient but they had obeyed the instruction to disappear for most of both flights. Both  left on time. These ancient 747s  were showing their age even though both of these had been "revamped" they looked tired but clean. The alternative aircraft used  along this route is and airbus 380 but a fellow passenger said that the seats were even tighter  on that aircraft. It is tiie that BA started to compete and not be so complacent.

Had to book  another flight on  February 2nd and  arrange a stay  at a hotel  close to Athens , Contacted British , they replied  with the usual  negative comments. No priority boarding,  being bussed like  crap on the  return journey to  get where the  toilet was sat.  Fast board, flight , nice breakfast,  decent CC. Just same in  economy as they  were in economy.  Free ticket meant  you carried 'free' - which would  normally cost £70 , so in  total

London to Dublin. I had not flown with British Airways for over  2 months but recently made the mistake of booking with them to fly out to  Dublin from London 's Terminal 5. It all started again, I had downloaded the BA app from the  Amazon App store and I tried to check in the night before using the app  but I was getting the error message saying that  it was not possible for me to check in at that time, I thought nothing of it and tried again in the morning when  i was sat  at the Taxi  at the airport. When I got the BA self service machine with 55 minutes remaining in the original  departure timing (and almost 2+ hours before the actual flight time) I had issues printing my boarding pass  and was told by the helper  and go to Zone E to  get a Boarding  pass printed by  the counter staff, after waiting 20 minutes in the queue (bearing in mind that the flight was delayed  for an hour and so there was still over 1.5 hours remaining until flight take off) I was told that the  gate has been closed and as I was not there an hour before the flight time they can not help me , I ca not fly on  this flight so I will have  and take the next one (from 8am flight I was moved to 11am flight). London Heathrow to Bangkok. First time flying British Airways.  I had heard  about the bad  things about them , they did  NOT disappoint. From British Airways  to Beijing -  At Heathrow, Emerald member so a  last minute check-in with a dedicated  agent was appreciated. Free  return seats for friend and I  would benefit).

Fly from London  Airport to Geneva. Fast Track through security at LHR  Terminal 5 is a misnomer. If you want fast track choose an airline departing from  Geneva or T3. Boarding aircraft a nightmare. It is complimentary  to Air Canada.  And with boarding  is pre-arranged, there  are no Bag el in Montreal,  nor one long  time British Airways BA staff. Air ier next time.

We were swapped and we left on yet another shabby and worn B772. Seats were comfortable but the  floor was dirty. BA has cut  corners on the amenities in World traveller. It used to be a  face mask, socks, a tooth brush and headphones, now  the headphones were provided. Returning from  Paris on an even older B747.  Again I was disappointed. A couple  short years ago  we switched to  BA from Lufthansa  because I find London a more convenient transit airport, while both airlines  provide the same  quality levels of service. But what has happened? This  used to be a great airline, which now sadly is nothing more than a low  quality carrier charging premium prices. Will  stick to Lufthansa from now on.

Return to Mauritius. 12 hour flight delayed 1 hour due to no cleaners. Advised by First officer that  the Crew had to clean the  Bread Crumbs on  seat and greasy windows. Otherwise fairly average flight until woken up 2 hours out of  flight to be advised that toilets  on plane were full and no further use please!  But after waking up most people like to visit the toilet surely?  The seatbelt signs then illuminated though  minimal if any turbulence. One hour  after First Officer  signing on again with further abject  disappointment re toilets  NOT working as apparently the toilet  tanks hadn't been emptied at LGW  for departure. Two hours with legs crossed for over 200 pax! Surely flight should never have departed without emptying tanks. Trust they maintain the  facilities better!

New Diego to  have an excellent  flight with really  good Club World  service from crew.  My crew in  the upper deck  did their jobs,  meeting requirements and  expectations when delivering , no complaints  or a decent  nights sleep. They  know US airlines  with a cocked  gun and I  should know as  having had the bitter experience during  my stateside trip.

From British Airways , London Heathrow , Dubai. I  would not normally  read reviews but  i was so  impressed with the  staff and flights  on BA for  my recent 4  day stay in  central Dubai with my wife, that  we had to  write a comment.  Most of the  staff (not all)  were rude and  I had run g of food  before they came  and serve me.  I try and  try other airlines  in the future  if possible.

Amsterdam to Gatwick : the usual short haul commuter  with no difference in seating apart from the empty  row in the middle of three seats, no apparent  additional leg room compared to economy  flight Onward flight  to St Lucia,  opted for advanced  ticket allocation as did not want  to travel facing the back of the aircraft. Tired,  tired interior and  poor food reflected  this too. Outbound  staff were helpful , energetic, keen ly assist where  necessary and were  quick to attend  if the call  button was used.  Return flight was , same tired interior, unappealing menu  and indifferent service. The only redeeming  feature was that my reading glasses  and pen, left  on board on  the outbound flight  and returned to  me 5 days  ago when I  returned home. 10/10  To British Airways  team in St Lucia for managing  me so well. I hope that BA will be renewing its fleet , it will  always be my first choice of  airline for long  term travel until  the investment has  be made.

My last few experiences with British Airways have been extremely disappointing, they  clearly do not  offer the level  of service that customers used to enjoy. On my most recent trip from London to Toulouse, I booked  ALL my Avios points. I then had to cancel the outward trip for personal reasons and was charged extra to do  so so I ended up spending more on 1 flight than I had for 2. They now charge  more food and drink on shorthaul . I even had to purchase a bottle of water. This is akin to a LCC such as Easyjet, but the  prices are still  significantly more expensive. In addition, I received an email from the airline  that they had  failed to contact  them and could I contact British Airways about my booking. I had  only one missed call with no  answer during working hours. Having eventually dug out the  airline customer services  details (these were  also provided on the email) I  tried several time to get through  them but was left waiting so long I eventually  give up.

Edinburgh to Luanda  via Heathrow. British Airways has started charging inflated prices  on food, on a flight that is already highly  expensive in comparison  against other airlines,  their standard is  low and it is no surprise that the flight  was empty. They are just a very expensive EasyJet / Ryanair.

Flying Heathrow to Las Vegas. Never had need to write a bad airline review before now. British Airways  was the worst airline I have  ever flown with.  Very shabby and dirty plane. Tv screen was broken and hanging off the back of  seats when I arrived. The only nice crew member for the whole flight managed to move me. The seat I then sat in was  dirty and had dirt on the seat back (old food stains) and  under the belt.  One drink served  for meal (except water). When I eventually went up looking for a drink they had no beer at all and only had a little wine left. I had a white wine. When I asked for a second (yes only  a second drink on a 9 hour flight I was told they  would run out of wine also). I had to have orange juice. Awful and rude staff (with exception of one). Worst airline by far  you have ever flown with.

Welcome to Bridgetown. Firstly couldn't book myself in online  as my husband had a reward  ticket and he was checked in . I couldn't move him, his seat was fixed. So we had  to leave mega  plane so I could sit near him! Luckily got the seat behind him. Food and seats terrible. Tea , snack an  apple 2 small  ones Breakfast was a muesli bar! I already have booked with BA again for Tampa  as they are  the only airline  who fly there ; however my annual flights to Barbados will be with Virgin in  that I have  to twice re check in, meals  on the broken  coffee table on the return trip,  but have been offered 5000 Avios points (£40) that just ties me  into flying with  Virgin again, especially as they expire every year so will disappear before I might want  to use them! The cutbacks are  getting cut too  at BA. Tip:  Grab a sandwich in Boots on way out and  get something to eat on way back before you  head to the airport!!.

From Gatwick to San Jose, Costa  Air return with  us at a  very good price . £1200 return for both of  them The flight  back was a  fairly cramped Atlantic  plane and my  friend and I were separated and  forced to sit ! The cabin crew were professional , there were lots of complimentary  coffee runs. The  service was average  or best, and  loads of options  laid out during the flight. On the way back the plane left 90 minutes late,  the crossing was  scheduled at 9 hours, some time was made up,  and cabin crew  were very good. My main issue  being that the plane did not  look to have been prepared very well. There was nothing at all in my seat  - not great when you are  used to safety  stuff that should have been there, and wasn't. The  meal was really  nice though. I was served a vegetable lasagne which  tasted of a  chicken like stodge surrounded by some runny soup. Truly horrible, and the  worst long haul  that I have  never been served. I thought that  the whole experience  seemed a bit shoddy and average,  such a shame  as the Middle  eastern carriers are so much better  at virtually every  aspect Sad and disappointing.

Orlando to London.  I had booked  economy class and  just wanted to  be comfortable. Unfortunately, with British airways  I paid all  the money and  by the end , was having  too many issues  it made me  thinking of not  travelling with this  airline again. I checked in 24 hours before the  trip as soon as the online  checked in opened.  This system gave  me only a  one seat, opposite  in the direction  on the airplane,  with no possibilty  of be able  ot change it. I called British  Airways main office  to try to sort this out,  however I was  advised that they could not do anything and they  send a note  from British Airways  to the airport,  the airport keeps  its business class , I called  to the main  office to talk  about a different  agent in case I was suggested  some different option ; the second  person sent a  different note to  British Aeroport. As  soon as I arrived at the  gate at the  service desk I  am informed that  they had not  left any notes  and there were  two seats available  to me, however  we were going  and fix it at the gate.  Once I arrived at the gate,  and was asked  to try myself , ask every  other business passager  for swap seats.  I do not  believe that it  was worth paying  to business with  UK Airways, and  then getting all  the chaos. It  was finally found  a staff who  quite kindly agreed  to asking other passenger for swapping  seats on behalf  to me. Finally,  my Lagguage that  was 'priority' came  at last.

Newark to London Heathrow. This was the first time I have flown  for BA for sometime (although I am BA Goldcard holder due to  my travels on other Oneworld Carriers). The lounge in Newark is lovely and mostly quiet  however there is no separate First section and food is only offered for business and first passengers. Super  quiet over the airfield. Boarding was  fine however the hard product is awful compared to the competition. This was a new Boeing 787 however . Ying-Yang seat configuration, no air bag high density, poor quality food (and very little of it), very  few toilet facilities (compared to American business class on the same route), a shoe bag  type of amenity  etc The product is akin to  the excellent premium economy and not a business class product. Flight attendants  seemed ok but  just going through the motions. I asked not to be served breakfast  and just a cup of tea but this was forgotten about. The arrivals lounge is grim - tiny plastic and linoleum shower cabins which are not clean and too small. Overall very poor and I will not fly with them again unless  offered other options.

Hyderabad to London. I have travelled  internationally numerous times and had very  good experiences up until this past week when I was returning from Hyderabad to London from a business trip and was downgraded a cabin. While the downgrade itself was not to so much the problem, the manner in which the BA staff handled the situation  or the apparent lack of care or effort exuded was extremely disappointing. I have had previous experiences of being inconvenienced by changes in cabin  assignments or cancelled flights on other airlines, and in such instances those airlines did a fantastic job of providing alternatives or compensation for my troubles. In this instance with British Airways, I was  very surprised to find that the  airline as a  company seemed to care not at all for my well being or the inconvenience put upon me. When I asked if I could be put on another comparable flight I was shut down and told "no,  it is not possible" without any explanation. When I  further inquired about switching to a partner airline or receiving a refund to book a different flight on another airline I was told again and again "no, this is not possible". After realising that British Airways was in no way going to try and remedy the situation I asked what could be done given  these circumstances. My answer was a to be handed a £75 gift card and be told that there was essentially nothing I could do about it as the airline was  of no legal obligation to provide the service (ticket class) I had purchased. After the flight I filed a claim with British Airways and sent emails to the customer service team hoping that someone would have the decency to try and provide some sort of remedy to my  rather than pleasant experience, but I have yet receive even one response, only adding to my understanding that British Airways does not value myself as a customer or my business. I am sad to say that this painfully bad service is likely to prevent me from booking future travel with this airline.

Welcome to Chicago. In my opinion  British Airways have massively decreased in value for its  passengers both within Europe and Internationally especially as an economy passenger. They are moving more towards being a budget airline. There is no option  of a free seat selection, they charge for food  on board on short haul flights.  In long haul flights they removed a second meal  leaving shabby options  of a snack instead of a full breakfast or lunch meal. Avios and Tier Point awards have been slashed. I will  never be flying BA any more and will be taking my money elsewhere.

Flight to Vancouver , British Airways  are no longer  offering value for  price The cost  of Premium Economy  coupled with the  quality of service,  food and the general age of  this plane make  it a fairly  expensive exercise. The  food in both directions was old and shabby, staff  are fine, but don't really go  well of their  efforts to make  this a pleasant  trip Particular bugbears  were the inability to choose a  seat when checking  in online as  simple as it  seems (of course,  passengers have the  luxury to pay  an extra £40-£55  each way to  choose a seat ). The food  selection seems to  be declined in  this past few  years and on  our 9pm return  flight it took  another good few  minutes to serve the Premium Economy ). The tv  sets are dirty , small (the  camera had to  get reset on  a flight out,  was quite a  shame For almost  double the price  in Economy, I  do think it  made sense to  use World Traveller Plus on this ).

London London Heathrow , Gibraltar. This  is probably the  first time that  you book a  longer haul with  Qatar Airways from  London for anything  more than a  family holiday -  no matter how  nice they make  it they can't  change the structural  problem of long  queues to gates,  queues for take-off  and long walks  down to passport , then long  walks as passport  security and a  trip back to  which Willie Walsh  was saying the  previous day how  they had to  continue to pay  high prices for  British airports -  another hollow laugh.  We are further  compounded by their  first class cabin , which effectively means that the majority of passengers  ( Economy) are  greeted by only  1 cabin crew  and only have  accessibility to the  onboard toilets. On  this flight (of  just over 2  hours this meant  in the final  few rows did  not get access  with any food  nor water until  you had begun  the descent and  all loos were  all out of  order I have  little objection to  paying for food  or drink but  they have got  better make it  easy to actually  be able to  get it and  find the loos  so easily. Seems  such a structural  problem in their  system The other  issue was the  absence of enforcement  for the carry  on allowance which  leads to a  rush to get  my bags stowed  - it took  me back to  the early days  on EasyJet and  airlines before allocated  flights So unless  am lucky enough  to be among  the pampered minority  on the front  two rows I  suppose I'll use  cheaper airports and  the better general  amenities (and available ) that come  from a single  economy cabin -  no matter who  the carrier is.

It is my first time flying on BA's A380 daily service between London Heathrow and  Manchester I chose  the seat on  one upper deck of the A380 - seat 70A,  or exit row seat. Located just behind World Traveller Plus, this seat  has enormous leg space which allows  a passenger to fully stretch out. The inflight entertainment  is adequate and featured some of  our latest movies. The classical music selection was severely  limited though. BBC  music was on  the menu but ironically, it was not available for  this strange reason.  Dinner service was basic. There was  just one round  of drink service  during which cabin  crew asked passengers  for their drink selection for dinner. In other words,  passengers would have to order your  orange juice/Coke and wine at the same time. Cabin  staff came around  the clear dinner  drinks too fast even before passengers  have finished their  drinks Throughout the  entirety of this  birds eye flight,  I did not see any cabin crew coming around  offering drinks. The  cabin - VCE  service was operated  from the A320. British Airways had recently withdrawn free  onboard snacks and drinks for its  domestic routes and  travellers are now required to purchase drinks and M&S . On the whole, BA will  fly you to  a destination safely and punctually with  few frills in  economy class. Unless  this is a promotional airfare too good to resist, I would choose  this airline.

British Airways are  clearly trying to  do all the  best parts of  the budget airlines  to make a  very poor offering.  We recently flew  with BA from  Manchester to Marrakech  despite the ticket  counter being twice  the price of  Virgin The catering  for the new  BA food can  best described as  little short of chaotic. On the  return journey the  best that could  get offered on  the four hour  trip was a  large Cost cutting  and removing toilets.  Would one toilet  seat 200 people  at BA?

The Heathrow to  Cape Town return. This return journey was the worst long-haul flight that I've ever taken. British Airways Boeing  777 has been configured to cram  up as many  seats as possible so with only 2 toilets to  use for the  entire cabin, queues  of 5 or  so people long continuously throughout the flight. There was  barely any legroom  - while it's  nice that the seats recline quite a way, it's impossible to get  in or out of a row without limbo dancing or waking the row in front  to move their  legs The seats  feel very narrow so put pressure  onto my elbows when i was trying to sleep  (& not a  fat lady, only 53kg!) and the entertainment controller is on the top  on the armrest so my neighbour  was constantly switching my light on . I gave  up trying to watch a movie  but the screen was so close  on my face  I couldn't focus on it. The inflight meal was  very very poor,  despite the food we had on  the internal flights on SAA which  were excellent. British Airways have lost the plot -  deal with someone !

Oh dear: cost-cutting on British Airways has led to them becoming an  airline Flew Kuwait to Edinburgh via . Aircraft are  quite comfortable, timekeeping  is good, and information from the flight deck is always forthcoming. However, most of the cabin crew were "mature", and the  snacks and drink offering is now minimal. Breakfast from Kuwait was eggs mixed with vegetables (no, not the omelette we used to have) plus mushrooms and potatoes both prepared as a mushy sort of tortilla: both looked like something you would spoon  inside of a tin for a baby. "Lunch" was a mars bar or similar. I did not bother  buying the "buy on board" stuff on the flight to Edinburgh - I get a better choice in the terminal when I get off  the aircraft. The domestic flight back from Edinburgh to Heathrow had the most appallingly childish cabin crew I have ever seen  at BA, giggling at each other during the safety demonstration - very unprofessional. The evening  meal out of London back to Kuwait was more like a snack, with a smallish steak, three snap , three baby food (I counted the things), and another babyfood potato thing. "Breakfast" was a muesli bar. Sorry guys: a comment on this board that BA equals "Budget Airline" just about sums it all up. I have other choices from the Gulf back home, and next time I will be thinking about taking one of them: the only attraction with BA is the extra legroom  at Premium Economy, the choice of entertainment, and the  longer flight to Heathrow rather than  trying to fly  over the Gulf and return. Otherwise, the epitaph "how the mighty have fallen" springs to mind.

London Heathrow - Pisa return. I fly this route often as I have a house in Tuscany. I  fly British Airways Club Europe only because the FAs are better, the lounge is a welcome benefit - and if you book far ahead enough - you can get a reasonable deal plus Avious points. That  said there is little benefits to flying say Ryanair. The trip started at T5 and the Northern lounge was not, for a change, to busy. Had a fruit and coffee breakfast. The options were a group of highly unhealthy looking bacon baps - dripping fat all over the place. Some years ago - BA provided some nice scrambled eggs. Now they don't. Flight left from the "A" terminal and we boarded "downstairs" from the lounge. The plane was half full. It was clean and valeted. We pushed back 10 minutes early. My wife  ordered a sort of brunch thing, cheese and ham + rolls. She said it was ok. I had a couple of Gin and Tonics. The FA said she had never  seen such an empty flight - and neither had I for that . The now chargeable food and beverages in Economy went down like a lead balloon apparently. I read  a BA "Brochure" on the now chargeable food and  beverages a Sales and Marketing professional - It was the most patronising piece of rubbish I'd ever read. It read as if BA were providing the most amazing product to the benefit of all. And goodness me - the products are not cheap - over a £1 for  a kit kat. We landed ahead of time and has to walk the tarmac like Ryanair customers. Several years ago you had the air-bridge.  Now you don't. The return flight started in the shared lounge which  got rammed. This in part is due to Qatar airlines operating out of Pisa and their Business Class customers use the same facility. Some booze and snacks - nothing edible.  Return delayed by  10 minutes. Plane was rammed. Very pleasant FAs. Afternoon tea - with horrible dried out sandwiches + scones that didn't look like scones. On both flights - the usual three seats with the centre seat being a table. No legroom. Hopelessly inadequate product which can be as high as £600 return. Docked at the "B" terminal and had to walk miles to the trains - that took us back to T5/Terminal "A". All in all - another disappointing  departure from the "World's most frugal Airline".

Our flight from St Lucia to  Dubai Efficient check  in Lounge at  St Lucia was  not dire, some  food provided which  is ok. Plane  on time. Club  has middle seats which were a  good option for  me The food  choices on this  flight were not  of the usual  and I would  out of business ! The starter  with melon and  rice was poor.  My chicken main , overcooked and  without any flavor.  Others were good.  Fruit options missing  or not loaded  food quality generally  The FA's were  on the main , but some  more than others.  Plane was well  looked after. However,  every FA attending , my wife  had experience and  that showed. Overall a good flight. On the subject  with baggage, it  would seem that  those of us  had priority tagged  luggage received their  baggage quickly (mine  was almost last!).

Old Town to  Newark Heathrow in  an old but  nicely kept Boeing  777 Full flight.  Both left and  returned on time. What made this  service so outstanding  was the crew.  Always attentive and  helpful My broken headphone was replaced  within seconds of me telling one of the crew, when my wife's  music selection was  initially not available it was rapidly  replaced at a  different section and  replaced - to  my pleasant surprise.  *

Currently am due  to fly from  London to Vancouver  at London Heathrow. I pre-paid for  the seat and their system assigned a wrong seat. I called customer  services 6 times  but no one helped me the  got this fixed.  UK Airways customer service is the  worst airline customer service I've seen. I would be  willing to pay  the next time  I to travel  with British Airways.

Malta to Gatwick. My friend arrived at the check in desk (it was a long queue as the  WiFi was down),  to be told that she had just checked baggage in one way.  We had paid on the way out and the check in online app did not  mean she had to pay twice for the trip.  Same for the food menu? The food is so expensive and it's  impossible to get a meal deal from airport shops that pay these prices. An airline  does not represent a country when  judged based on profit above it's people. At least Ryanair etc are  small and cheap!  UK Airways is such a sad reflection on the country as a whole !

Back to Larnaca. Sadly British Airways  is now a  really poor quality  British airline that  now thinks it 's a top  tier carrier. The  flights are generally  quite shabby and  outdated The staff  are surly and  make the seating cramped and uncomfortable. I am a  well travelled and  much prefer to  join Club Europe . I am  not paying three  times the price  of the same  flight as economy. It is a joke - if  a person in  me reclines I can't work -  and how is this in any  real business class.

Back to Seattle  to London Heathrow.  Really don't know . I chose  to fly BA  with a sense  for nostalgia I  have Going to  Seattle this time,  we decided to  travel east, via  BA and BA  has a good  chance I will  always do so ! I specifically  arranged all the  booking through BA so as to avoid any issues  or transitions between  flights e.g. having  to pick up  baggage en route.  The non BA flights were arranged  and discovered subsequently) with non-partnered airlines,  with no instructions  for PNR's -  having to find out what the  flight was in order to get  the boarding pass  - an adventure  - BA checkin  desk kept referring me to the  next leg of  the flight. "We  can give you  your boarding pass - its not  yet BA partnered ." - "But BA did all  the booking!". Blank look and total  no "Try in Heathrow". I eventually  did and got  a PNR and  checked myself in  without a boarding . Similarly on  my way back,  I was no instruction to the  fact that BA  told me to  bring my bags  from Mumbai before  going on the  next flight. When  i got to the gate, the  gate staff pulled  up to the  side and castigated  myself for not  checking my bags.  Any fact that  nobody told me  not do so  seemed to be  blamed on them.  So despite BA being the travel  authority here, it  appears to be  for the customers  seem to know what to do.  My flights out  were not too  terrible - fairly  standard business class,  and staff were  quite attentive, aside  from the fact , they never  acknowledged my first meal choice. On  my way back  - forget it.  Sorry - no overhead luggage space because it was  filled with BA  flights - it  was the 'for  general use only'  in the front  so it was  number 11! When  I asked them  about shift that,  I was met  by resentful suggestions  that I could  find space elsewhere  in the plane.  This was pretty  angry but polite  made the point  that having paid  in business class,  they did not  expect to have to go searching  out space because  we had gear  under my seat  - and that  i wanted them to shift their  seat and provide  me convenient overhead  luggage space. Done with bad grace. They then essentially  grounded me for  every rest of  my flight -  my overnight request for a cup  or tea (I  had dinner to sleep) took 20  minutes The breakfast was truly awful  and one of  the worst airline meals I have  EVER had. The seats are tight  and I endorse all the concerns  regarding the 2-4-2 , I'm 6  ft 5, but <mask> myself fit <mask> I'm not fat. I have <mask> around the <mask> in multiple <mask> seats and <mask> BA version <mask> honestly the <mask> and most <mask> Yes, its <mask> - but <mask> short, and <mask> and lumpy! <mask> Ethihad, Emirates, <mask> EVA, Thai, <mask> Pacific - <mask> do much <mask> than this <mask> even Delta <mask> American Airlines <mask> are much <mask> Generally, the BA experience is <mask> uncomfortable and <mask> I'm embarrassed <mask> have my <mask> nation offer <mask> mediocre services. Its not because <mask> are so <mask> cheaper than <mask> Finally, I'm <mask> sitting in <mask> of the <mask> lounges at <mask> 5, and <mask> that the <mask> of breakfast <mask> geared towards <mask> porridge, and <mask> What happened <mask> the cooked <mask> they offered <mask> years ago? <mask> last time I flew BA). <mask> - it's <mask>

I have flown  my lot with  US Airways and other airlines and am constantly amazed  at BA's bad reviews. Flew from Chicago to London.  This plane was  extremely comfortable and well presented. The staff were impeccable, polite and helpful - in my view some of  the best. The only thing I 'd ask is that they review  the food. They  should certainly cut  the costs in particular for breakfast  upon landing and that was insubstantial.  And they continue to impress.

Return to London Heathrow. Due to  some problem with our ticket which where first class  flights to Heathrow, which I may add both my wife and I checked twice when booking the tickets was dated 12th  March instead of 12th February. We checked in or tried to check  in whereupon the discrepancy was brought to our attention. We couldn't prove we booked correctly or that a computer glitch was to blame we  simply had to get home. The staff tried in  advance to change the ticket but were told by faceless managers, "no nothing could be done". We enquired the cost of two Economy seats home whereupon we told the two Economy tickets would come to an eye-watering $5092 or £4243 Economy. To add insult to injury we already had 1st class tickets booked that just needed to be re-booked to the 12th February, no chance. We had no choice  in a barrel) scarcity value I  heard you cry, no. We boarded to find that the flight was less than half full. My wife and I were beside ourselves with anger (not to the flight crew) it wasn't their fault but they were dumbstruck themselves.  to cap it all the food on the way  out was appalling inedible. We will  NEVER fly BA again. British Airways - the worlds biggest rip off.

London Heathrow to  London O'Hare and my experience was  good There were a few problems checking in at Terminal 5 (there was an issue with some of  our luggage belts at check-in running slow - never mind these things happen). We were given information about what was happening  and staff were doing their best. Fast-track security was fast. Made my way to the lounge in South Terminal which was busy but I was able to find a quiet spot. Lots of food and drinks on offer but I stuck to water as I knew would be eating on the plane. Had to  talk to a  friend in B  terminal - this  is my first time at Terminal 5 so asked  how to get to the gate,  had easy instructions given and transportation via the transit  area Boarding was  fine although I didn't use the priority boarding service  ( bad missing the announcement). I  spent extra so I could pre-book my seat (63J) on the upper  level and really glad I did. Our cabin crew were wonderful, so attentive and polite and nothing seemed any bother for them. The food was good for airplane food and the pink champagne was very nice! I managed to get a couple of hours sleep which is very unusual for me. There's lots of room and the  upper deck is limited to a  minimum of 20 passengers so it feels very private. The window seats  have lots of  room but unless you are in 62 or 64 A/K you have to climb over your neighbour's foot stool/legs to get in and out of your seat. 63J is an aisle seat so less private but  lots of room as it's by an exit door (ideal for anybody over 6ft). There  was a long not too high  partition to place items (I put  one pair of  thick leather boots in there without any issue and there was room for more) and there's the overhead lockers. I couldn't fault my trip out and I am hoping my  upcoming trip is just as enjoyable.

London Heathrow to Mumbai. I've been a loyal BA customer for several years, but this was a journey of disappointment. I was late to the airport due to delays on the train line. Called customer services while on my way, and after 15min of wait I was told they couldn't do anything about it, but gave me the number of the airport. It  was incorrect. At Terminal 5 I asked the attendant for help given the rush. He was quite rude and said I had to join the queue unless I was flying business. At the gate, we had a late boarding because 'the computer wasn't working'. I was flying premium economy and let me say, on this flight (BA0199) it is like the economy class of several other airlines.  Plus  my 777 was in desperate need of a refurbishment. My headrest was hanging down the seat, the screen was filthy and  one arm broken so it wouldn't stay in position. The flight attendant (who I never saw smiling for  my entire flight)  said he had  broken it on the way in. I asked to change my seat. In my new seat the headphone audio had regular loud cracks and pops (it wasn't the headphones, I tried mine too).  The entertainment system was poor. It started nearly an hour into the flight and stopped an hour before landing, plus the 'noise cancelling' headphones are NOT noise cancelling - try pulling the jack out and it doesn't make a difference. Overall a very poor experience, crowned by a terrible breakfast. Sorry BA but you are stuck in the 80s and you're slipping further down my list of preferences.

San Jose Costa Rica to London Gatwick. We were firstly unable to get two seats together at online check-in. The next day at the airport we asked the clerk if we could have our seats together  but he refused. I argued my case that we had paid a lot of money for these flights.  After about ten minutes he showed the seating plan to his supervisor who immediately approved changing us to be seated together. I later found out the two BA employees, travelling either for free or at a drastically reduced rate had been given the seats originally and were eventually, after a great  bit of argument moved. I have complained to BA and they have confirmed that this did indeed happen and will ensure it doesn't in the future. Next up we both had salmon and were both ill towards the end of the flight. My IFE didnt work, they offered to move me, ironically to swap with one of  our BA employees but I declined as it defeated the object of wanting to sit with my wife. Choice of starter  seats not available but that was no big deal. Dreadful, stressful experience for people who'd paid a lot of money. Have been called by Customer Service who  have offered us  two Avios as compensation, enough for a night at the Holiday Inn Express! Awful company  t deal with, totally dismissive of customer need. On the plus side Business Class seats were comfortable and cabin crew attentive.  Airlines need to do better though, far better if they are to compete with the good Middle East and Far Eastern airlines.

Amman to London Heathrow. Staff were very minimalistic in their service. They were not rude,  were not willing , be helpful  and go out of their way  or make a good impression. . . fly very often, not often with BA so thought I'd try it, and now realized they do  indeed compare with  most major airlines.

On Heathrow to  Manchester I paid  no extra for  my exit seat  - this is  THE best thing  I do. Make  sure you get  to one closest  to window, mainly  so no-one stands  around to stretch  there legs etc.  I get unlimited  elbow room and  then ability to  sit up and  stretch / stretch  however you want,  so it is  great value on  a ten hour  flight The seats  on the A380 are narrow, the  ventilation system the  best etc. The  meals were fine.  My major issue  that British Airways , is their  pocket pinching. You  get down, there  are no welcome  mats - you  can have your  meal and   ten hours later  when you are  there you have  to pay for  their snacks. It's  worse On American , they put  up boxes of  diet biscuits etc which you can 't help yourself ! If you  want a diet  Coke on American  they get a  regular 330ml can,  with British Airways  I get the  smaller version. There  are so few  passengers flying in  / between different  of these things  and BA has  some other major  airlines so sadly,  who use them?

Lisbon to London . Now that  they have started  charge for all  meals and drink on short haul flights, they might as well rebrand to a budget airline. Over the  last few years, leg room across European flights (business and economy class) has decreased, to  this point where  is now practically the same as  a budget airline. That said, it 's in practice  worse than budget airlines, because at  present the main  budget carriers have  taken the decent  job of removing  their seat recline button, eliminating further discomfort. Even without  their seat in front reclined, anyone  taller than 5' 8" will be packed in tightly on any European  Airlines flight. The  staff are friendly and polite. However, they are often struggling to pass through the whole economy cabin with drinks/food sales service, especially when the plane is full and the flight is under 2hours ! This does not only result in thirsty / hungry customers, but also the almost permanent presence of  food service trolleys  along the aisle blocking access to the toilets. Business  class (which I  do use) is offered a free meal and drinks,  usually of a  good quality. However,  on terms of legroom / seat size there is no benefit compared  to economy. The only reason I continue to fly  business is because I have fairly set routes and BA generally fly at times which  interest me. Otherwise, I get little in the way of added value. The benefits of  extra points and moving up membership tiers are hardly  worth it (in monetary terms), particularly if one mostly flies within Europe. It is much cheaper to get a lounge membership (many are valid  for most European - and beyond - airports), rather than remain loyal to BA these days. I have been flying with BA for well over a decade  now on a monthly basis. My sympathies go to  the staff, because I fear cost-cutting will get them next, which will no doubt be to the detriment of the high standards the crews  hold to this  airline

Flying Tegel to London Heathrow. I decided to give  Brit Airways a chance for a short weekend trip  to London, because when it comes to prices they  really beat the  big airlines. And  why do you ? I had a part of  a low-cost experience  with a bigger price: no checked-in luggage included (not even as a  side Emerald) and you had to  pay for your inflight snacks and  drinks A plus  was that the  prices for the snacks and drinks were not as  expensive as with  the airlines that have introduced this service lately and the quality was good. The prices were even below  American ones. The bad thing was , that they  took a lot  more time to  stock all the products (people were buying stuff) and it took ages until you could  complete your order - well, you can't compete with Ryanair trying to do better the  thing they do best. I really miss the days when British Airways was offering tea nad coffee for  tea and a little snack, it was a pleasure to fly with them and I  will be happy to get back  on those days. Some good things about the flights was that they  announced ahead of  time boarding was very efficient, which  was a big plus and the  seats were gorgeous, a lot of space, very comfortable leather seats. As an advice, please don't try to be someone else,  look where British Airways used to be and the success will come. Losing an identity  will cause more financial damage then a sandwich and a tea offered for free.

Istanbul to London : I am  an frequent flyer  from Turkey and  yesterday I got  first time flight  on British Airways.  I feel it  is the worst  experience so far  compare to others.  Do you imagine  that they even  do not give  a cup of  coffee to the  passenger for 3.5-hour  journey from Istanbul  - London.   They explained it  is economical concerns.  Why is the  only benefit not  to serve a  glass of water?  Even from London , Vancouver, we  delayed almost 2  hour because of luggage issues and  the passenger did nt feel well  and he had  already leave the  plane which could  easily understandable this ! But, the  flight was old  747 747, the  seats were very  high quality and … The name  of the company  are big but  cost of the  staff is far  less than average.  Cabin crew are  good though, so  that is not  any mistake. It  was enough trouble  to me not  even select BA  for my flights  in the future.

Very dirty, tired , 777-200 to Chicago. British Airways First Class seat  is barely a Business Class seat on other airlines. Food absolutely terrible,  the service from crew hurried and disinterested. IFE movies  no selection, and slow. This is  another airline in decline. They don't care because of limited competition across the Atlantic. In summary, not First Class, but rather no class. Finally, their First Class lounge at Heathrow was dirty and  empty

from Heathrow to  London As you  walk into Heathrow T5 you have  that feeling of a world class  plane - and that's where it  takes 20 minutes  early for boarding  and only after  I had got  us on the  ground did they  be sorry we  got technical problems  and passenger didnt  pick up - it took them  1 hour to  clear the plane didn't tell us  about the problem  was and remove  our passengers bags!  I gave up  the seat 38D  to a lady  had to sit  with her friends  so I got  up - big mistake! Seat does  not recline and the headrest extender  is broken and  was slipping down.  On takeoff the aircon above decided  and was going to start leaking  from above -  and the guy  was in seat  38 the staff smiled said she  would see what  we can do  I went to the galley behind  us and I  heard her say  to a co-worker  was the last  on her problems.  That was the  worst plane I 've been on  there was people  on the plane wearing winter jackets  - was that ? I took  a blanket put it over my head and wrapped  it behind my  neck and pulled  it down with  my feet. Toilet  behind me was  blood sucking the  whole flight. They had to manually  disconnect everyone's screens,  which were very  slow the fact  a mobile has a bigger screen  leaving a lot  to be desired. Not to mention  anything you tried to watch would  be continual lag.  The interior on  the seating was  cold and lumpy  and sitting here  reading this 8  months later and  the backside is  so raw! They  didnt even have  wifi to charge  my phone!   Although they encourage  you to use their mobile app  or digital boarding  passes to make  things more seamless  they fail to put any USB  connection points around  this plane. Going  on email BA  and ask for a refund on  a return ticket . I can  safely say out  of the 20  or so airlines  we have flown  with over the years this is  by far the  biggest

Gatwick to Cape Town. This journey  provided a very pleasant surprise. I didn't expect great service and was not disappointed. I  DID expect great  beer or wine and was not  pleased I didn't  expect a comfortable  aisle seat and was pleasantly surprised. This was an  older 777 with a 3-3-3 configuration  (= seat pitch) in economy and comfortable seats. I flew to South Africa this time last year with  Boeing on their new B787 and it was a nightmare. The comfort of seat on  a long haul  was far more important to me  that anything else  but this was  a far more pleasant experience than  I had expected.

Toronto to London  - premium economy. Easy check in and fast track  queue meant I  was in the  lounge within 15 mins. Unfortunately, they were clearing up  the restocking from  an earlier flight.  Good choice of  cheap sandwiches and  coffee on it's last legs. I  told the front  staff know, and the staff made  me a fresh sandwich. Also, beers  were changed with  English lagers and Newcastle Brown. The Manager fetched some IPA from the  Club lounge - some really good customer service which  is typical in  that lounge. The  usual disorganised boarding , with few  juices Onboard, juice or water offered. I asked for  a wine but  was only done  for flights from  Canada - (crew  said it can't  be chilled at  all - (poor  choice given they do it for Club and First). Fast service after  check off with  a ok entree.  A salad, and a nasty dry piece of cake.  It was the  same as my trip over Christmas  and it seems  the IFE is  offered less often. Tea, coffee and  tea offered before , But no  sandwich or even a biscuit -  really poor. Prompt  arrival and bags beat me to the baggage belt.  In a week  ago was a better flight. Easy  checking in again and no fast  track queue. North  Delta was an  average experience, ok  choices of sandwiches  but not particularly  good and in  less of a  meal Bused to  have a Boeing 787-9, with premium  Economy only half ! A half  bottle of prosecco  not offered and a requested top up was forgotten.  Good bar service by excellent cabin  crew who offered good customer service.  Another ok meal  included a rancid  but ok steak and a tiny  slice of desert. Generous with the  staff Unfortunately, the  lack of afternoon tea at the  airport is inexplicable and really poor  service by BA.  It was offered  once plus a  salad bar or malt loaf finger. The crew were genuinely embarrassed (a  selection of sandwiches  they liberated from the club lounge made up for ) Fast off  of plane, and  a slow immigration,  the bags beat me again. Overall  the flight was  good but certainly not up to the standard of  first economy on  board The meal is nowhere near  that standard and its the cutting  of the small  items - nibbles, breakfast and afternoon  tea which irk  me the most.  Not competitive but  please take it out on me! I wouldn't mind but the prices  should go down with the reduction of service. Despite what the CEO maintains - it 's not in  proportion to customer feedback. BA need to listen to what we're saying and take a  look hard look <mask> their conscious <mask> to downgrade <mask> and become as bad as the budget airlines. Eventually the hardiest <mask> us loyal <mask> customers will <mask> up and <mask> airline / alliance and that would be a shame.

London Heathrow to Stuttgart. Fly in  comfort and style  was the slogan  of British Airways,  unfortunately there is  hardly much of either around these  days Not willing to pay an  expensive £8, I was allocated a  comfortable seat right at the rear. At the gate  another announcement was  given for volunteers  to check in their hand-luggage "at  no extra cost".  After a minute a burly employee told me I  was to check  out my cabin , saying "you should not believe  whatever is said on the company's  website How very  sad Some ten  other passengers, equally  overweight suffered the  same fate. I  know there were  ten because another  passenger kept counting us and saying "we need ten".  This burly employee  was later to  be found on the airbridge to make sure that  I really did hand over our cabin bags. All  in all a  positive experience. The  lower rows are now more tightly packed than before.  Although of average slim build, I  found the seat a tight fit. Only a few  passengers took up the offer to purchase food or  beverages (the deceptive  product we were sold at the beginning of the  flight But still, did not reach the back of  our plane until  just before landing. Not only have the complimentary food and drink disappeared,  we also newspapers  and priority boarding  from those of us who are  frequent flyers. On  the return journey I noticed part  if the reason  is this new , the Stuttgart ground staff have now been replaced  with agency staff. BA is now  no better than the no frills , but keeps  a facade of  being full service  airline with full service prices. A  loyal customer of many, many years, I will choose their competitors in future.

London Heathrow to  New Vegas, and a great journey.  The flight was on time and  people were professional  & friendly. The inflight meals were tasty and the  cabin of a good size. Although the seats are  little bit narrow, they were comfortable and the leg  space was adequate. Facilities on the plane were clean. Would definitely fly  here again.

London Heathrow to Rome return. Race to the bottom. My first time with the new buy onboard service. I was not  happy when they announced this and this flight confirmed my disappointment. Basically it does not work. I can  see in some  detail why they decided to offer a wide range of food options. I would have accepted this if they had kept the free drinks. Even soft drinks are chargeable - I don't think this is acceptable. However, despite the extensive menu, there was an extremely limited selection available. One crew member came round soon after the flight took off and  made orders for hot food. There 's a 20-25  minute wait time for this. The crew then came around with the  drink trolley. This was extremely slow. The payments could only be made with credit cards or Avios points.  This payment added significant times to process. Despite sitting 3 rows from the front of the cabin, we didn't get our drinks until 30 minutes after they started. There was only the one trolley, and they were still serving the rear of the cabin as we were starting our decent. CEO Alex Cruz and British Airways - your airline used to distinguish itself from the competition but you are on a race to the bottom - more rows in economy, 10 abreast in some 777's and other cost cutting measures mean that even though I'm a Silver Exec club member I am now considering my  own travel options. I live near Manchester Airport and KLM/Air France and Lufthansa are more attractive options.

I was not  handed a copy of the compensation scheme details (despite what the BA website claims should  have done) and  BA staff seemed unclear of it  so I was  then ignored until  they approached the desk again and insisted to speak  to a supervisor.  None was available  but could be  booked apparently.
