Some would <mask> this cheating. <mask> saving grace <mask> the experience was that the flight was punctual, and unlike mainline BA, this route is run by its subsidiary BA CityFlyer which still <mask> complimentary drinks and a snack <mask> which the <mask> crew service was efficient. I rate it 2 <mask> of 10 <mask> the stress <mask> in checking <mask>

London to London Heathrow on BA is a 6 hr 50 min overnight flight. Sleeping on overnight flights in economy class  is an ordeal in itself, bit I was highly disappointed that more than an hour before landing - we had just  entered French airspace - all cabin  meals were put on bright for the breakfast/snack service (following the dinner  before take-of in  all the more ) this service consisted of a cup of tea or coffee (or cold drink) only.  And even a  meal was offered.  I was shocked.

So a tale  of two airlines  and their individual  approach to Business  class passengers. We  are flying to Mauritius on holiday , I felt, given the flying , we should  prepare ourselves and  ourselves up-front with  having the 'comparative'  cost of Business Class. The British Airways flight itself was okay, the  staff friendly and  spacious cabin worked . However, I  was totally shocked  by the standards  and catering in the Gatwick Lounge  (* small issue for some perhaps,  not for me, it's all part  for the Business Class experience). To  make my point,  please attach a  picture of what  a policy of  putting shareholders first  really means for  your passengers. With  a very confusing layout that greets one in the  International Terminal now  ( BA have  come in, the  ' yourself' check-in  and even label your own bags!). I was pretty  shocked by the  point we actually  reached the 'Lounge'. But then to  being greeted with  that was totally  unacceptable So, Willie,  other than screwing  with costs for the benefit of your shareholders, this  sort of display  of overt cost-cutting  has now lost  you revenue for  your future. Short-sighted ness or what?  With a lesson from Emirates who  we decided to  go home with,  and disgusted was I over our  experience They put passengers first!

London Heathrow to  the return.Both flights  are punctual but sadly the 747-400 aircraft used are  really beginning to look their 20  plus years of age, especially compared  to the A380s  we have used on this route.  The cabin is looking rather tired  and worn and  my seats are  not comfortable enough for a 9 hour flight. I was very pleased  I have booked  an exit row  ticket for additional  seating The IFE system is also quite dated and  outdated compared to modern offerings. On  the plus side the cabin staff were friendly, helpful  and courteous and  that is somewhere  we seem to do well. Food  & drink were complimentary and of  good quality for economy class. Boarding at YVR was  very well organised, less so at the Heathrow end. It is also  the shame that  most flights depart from the cramped  Terminal 3 at Heathrow. Overall a reasonable experience, but  hope that they  could improve to excellent with a bit more polish.

Return trip from Washington Dulles to London Heathrow. Flight was barely a quarter full. Going to Washington flight was probably only about a third full. Attendants said  this was the quietest they had  ever seen. Given that I was  on an A380 it really did look empty. Food and service was good both ways and the aircraft was only a couple of years old. Plenty of  seating on the  main cabin and  some overhead lockers seemed larger than any other airliner  had flown on.  I was given an exit row seat which was very welcome. BA usually charge £58 for this seat. It meant about 5 foot of legroom and because  our next cabin in front was business class the toilets were curtained off for the  return flight meaning the area was very quiet. No real gripes although the "snack" served about an hour before landing has been downgraded from  a small meal to a tiny Twix chocolate and a cup of coffee. Flight cost £430 and using some airmiles I knocked this down to £330. Loads  more interactive channels to watch but films weren't the  priority but that's a personal thing.

Flying to London with British Airways.  Not a frequent  traveler For a change, we decided  and fly BA  from London from Thailand for our 12 hour journey.  When we were  boarding we realized  how the seat  noise was coming ! Underneath there  are lots of . We then  thought that we  cannot watch movies , due to  noise that there was no sound.  We informed the  BA crew and  they said that  we will report  to relevant people etc. Our other  issue was the  seat - it had no taste , and was  made with plastic , which broke few times. In  general I would not recommend flying  by BA.

London to Hong i with British Airways. The flight is good as I booked the  first business seat and it is  better if flying  in to get  your best seat 16K, other seats are below standard  in long haul business. Yet a similar seat on an A380 is better. Service is  excellent and food  is adequate. I  fly this route many times on  BA rather than . CX is better but BA  better priced, and that is, if you get the  cheapest seat. 7 points for B777 and 8 for A380.

Using British Airways from Paris to  London is less  complicated as they are the only major airline that has the check in counter located one floor down  the basement, but  note that on  this occasion the business class lounge is relocated to the Cathay Pacific  lounge as this  allows for long  haul passengers. Boarding  on time but  arrival in tarmac  takes half an  hours not BA's '. The pilot tried to make  up time but  has failed by a few minutes  to have lost  their allotted time, so the aircraft  landed a mile away with inconvenient  direct deplane and coach connection, but  not that business  passengers are taken  home first in  a separate car.  Every flight is  packed with snack  or drink.

Return to London Heathrow. Don't waste  your money buying BA seat assignments  into advance! I  experienced that a  month ago, at  the same time  that I made  a booking, and  opted for an aisle seat of  your choice. When I went back  a week before  my journey, my  preferred seat was  available and I was placed in  the undesirable middle seat. There was no remedy for  it Five calls  within three days . BA connected  up to people  around Delhi whose  English vocabulary was  very sorry, and  said no. I 've been deceived,  lied to, and  told off. I have flown British many times; this  was absolutely my last time. It  is acceptable to  make an error,  yet totally unacceptable  you callously make  an effort at  least to rectify  it Take my  choice choose another ! I am  an OneWorld emerald flyer on AA,  with 200k miles  per year, and  you can tell  that service from  a British Airways  has unfortunately declined .

The quality of British Airways has most certainly gone downhill. On short  journeys from London Heathrow to Rome it is nothing more than that  for easyjet. Online check in was quick and easy, and terminal 5 is a delight however online check in is only available 24 hours  after departure unlike  Emirates which allows for check in 30 days prior to departure. That was the only  pleasant part of our journey. We boarded a packed  BA 767 which was decaying with the middle seat  getting so narrow  is was impossible to get in  / out of  our seat in  between (We were in row 13). Without notice, we had to go  through de-icing which meant a 45min  difference to our service (we did however catch up 35mins). Our inbound  flight was on  the newer A319  and had better seats and a  longer Due to slot restrictions at Rome and London, this flight was  often delayed. During  both flights the new buy on board was poorly done, taking forever  including a limited range of overpriced products. I therefore  could only conclude that the airline , once one just 10 months ago offering meals  for short haul  trips as well  as always being  on time is now nothing more  than a low cost carrier with  cramped planes and a useless service.  Such a shame.

London Heathrow to Brussels. Living in  Brussels for 6  years I décided  I go back home for a week. I am terrifying about flying but choose to do it by plane anyway. I am happy to have chosen BA, in the airport, at the gate, in the plane, I felt safe and people listen to me. I had the chance the two times (going and back) to meet the captain in the cockpit to feel better. The crew was nice and friendly and thanks to them I had a comfortable flight and I 'm now ready to Take it again. The planes were clean and nice

My partner and I flew Dublin to Seattle via  London Heathrow with  Qatar Airways. Heathrow  in Seattle was  on a B777-200  that was slightly  overweight and seats  are rather cramped,  making it impossible  for sleep on  a 9-10hr flight.  Passenger check-in wasn't possible and we  only able to select our seats  on our booking  using an Iberia  Airways number even  though it was  rejected by BA.  Three lengthy phone calls and same response was given  - nothing could be done about it until the  end Arrived early at airport to  the plane was overbooked so my  friend and I  can get our seats together - ground staff could  say nothing about ! Luckily we were able to  swap with another passenger once on . Food was bland to say  the least -  possibly the worse  of any carrier  had ever flown ! However, service provided by cabin crew was excellent. Would only fly  there again for  lunch

This whole experience  felt poor flying from London Heathrow to Athens. Ancient aircraft (767), poor  onboard entertainment and the new food offering in which you purchase your food was very  basic and lacking some of the  already limited range of products. On short haul, and  BA at 4 pm is classified as this, BA  are now a low cost carrier without the efficiency  of the more established low cost carriers. The sole advantage is that they fly to/from  major airports. This  company is trading on past reputation and it can only be a matter of time  till a largely  loyal customer base  leaves them for alternative airlines.

Return to London : Having flown  from Doha with  British Airways, the  flight with British  Airlines was a  disappointment For a  flight the Club 's seats are  not comfortable. There 's hardly anywhere  you stow bits  or pieces. The  airline crew were : We departed  Qatar approximately 9am.  Shortly on reaching  cruising altitude, we  was informed that they were now  offering "lunch". At  breakfast We were  informed that we  would be given  sandwiches on descent,  this on a  5 hour flight.  Any cynical person  would think that  the crew wanted  the get meal  planning out of  their way early.  I don't know  which timezone "lunch"  was in, possibly  London but certainly  not Doha or  London time. After  three hours I  ring the bell.  One female cabin  staff person came and asked incredulously, did you ring  that bell"? Yes,  but the entire  time I asked  about the sandwich and she told  us that I  would have to  ask No, I  want it now.  After a five  dollar meal, a  sandwich Having just  flown on Qatar  Airlines where the  meal menu is  de la carte  and you can  buy anything at  meal time, apparently  this pre-prepared sandwich  made a big  hit In business , I was  also pointedly ignored  throughout the rest  of the flight. I did complain  once to BA , to their  credit I received  no response -  apparently they were  sorry I felt  the way. Never  again Pay a  penny for this  poor service.

Will never touch  British Airways again.  I flown BA on this route from Orlando to  Birmingham Heathrow for a long time  and services have seriosuly gone downhill.  As I went  to the back  on the plane to ask for  my snack I  got told I had to buy them. Having paid  over £1000 for my tickets I replied I'm not  satisfied that I've  got enough for  my flight already.  to which the  general manager replied 'well thats just  the way the  world is going, people want value  on money and  this is how  you get it,  all the airlines  is doing it,  unless you don't like it tough'. I have never  felt spoken to so rudely by  another member of staff in my life! As well  as this the  tickets were old  but the screens  didnt work. Other  airlines namely Air New Zealand, Singapore , even American,  in my opinion  all represent a lot better value  for money, you even still get  seats on long haul flights! (I  mean all the  others are doing  it right?).

* Bradford to Heathrow. Service is  comparable to Ryanair and EasyJet. I've  tried flying with  them regularly for  around 4 years  and I can't get my head  round what is  going on. Complimentary drinks replaced with  no Buy on Board menu and the flight is  SO short not  many passengers even get served now!  - Really just ! There is  great competition on  an LBA route,  but I certainly  will pay anything  less to travel with BA from now on if  they are alternatives available - Ryanair  service is at around a fifth  of the price usually!

London to Los  Angeles via London.  on 12/31/16 at  midnight the night  before my flight, I received an  email saying that  the first leg  in London had  been cancelled and  we needed to  try to reschedule.  On the phone,  BA rep told  me that he  had a flight  booked later in the day I  can take on  January 31st. I said great book . Flying Heathrow to Innsbruck. I have been a loyal customer of British Airways for 30 years. If ever I had a choice between them and another airline I chose British Airways, but no more. The new food and drink service is appalling. The crew on our flight never  make it to the last 8 or so rows, so my children (sat at the back) went thirsty. This was particularly poor as another child had wandered  towards the back of the plane and vomited copiously  afterwards - clearly  it is not BA's fault, but  certainly is their fault that I couldn't then get a drink for my children to take their minds off the stench of puke pervading our part of  a plane. Next time I will fly Ryanair. I doubt we'll notice any difference.

Los Angeles to London Heathrow. Starting with being charged $180 to check  and hold luggage,  everyone on the  other sectors being  charged to check  in hold luggage  absolutely free. The onboard service continues to decline for passengers in BA World Traveller - terrible food, minimal  service and raised eye brows if you ask for a second glass of wine. You get the feeling that if you so much as ask for anything other than the bare minimum you will be restrained and arrested on  landing at your  gate Seat was okay,  better  service than American Airlines I have  to say but the movie selection and TV selection was poor as usual with random selections of TV programmes which are interrupted continually by  flight announcements. The new BA CEO is doing a great job of turning a once great airline into  another low cost subsidiary Vueling.

Gatwick to Barcelona.  Flying with the new M&S on eworld service. Boarding  is badly organised  because the cabin , cabin bags  only a few)  sat in the  luggage compartment and  then took ages  for all the  passengers to place  their bags overhead.  Also had to  put my bag  from behind my . It's not  easy to fly  with them anymore  because their service , just like  other airlines, but  luckily I booked  the tickets before  their announcement of  flights onboard.

From Heathrow to Rio de Janeiro.  45 minute delay on the tarmac. Air conditioning wasn't  on during delay  - would only  start once engines were on. The cabin was therefore  incredibly hot. The foam in my  Boeing 30B had  deteriorated to the  extent I could  see the metal  plate underneath digging  into my tail . I informed  BA cabin staff  about this - but due to  the flight being overbooked, I couldn't  get moved and  instead I was given an extra  charge This is  a 12 hour  flight and I  dont think this  not acceptable. I was very uncomfortable during this flight.  In flight entertainment  is pausing and pixelating/blipping. In flight  charges now have to be paid . Considering the price of flights,  I think this  seems very poor.  UK Airways is  running a budget ! In fact airlines currently rated  lower than BA  and the Top 100 airlines (eg  Air Atlantic and Malaysian Airlines) still  provide complimentary on  board snacks. There  was two in flight meals on this flight -  On both occasions  I was not  given the meal  of my choice  as it had  run out. Once,  we could forgive - but twice? When I complained  of this to the flight staff  at the second  flight (keep in  mind this was  near the end  to the flight ). I had been sitting on an uncomfortable metal  seat for 10  hours - the  attendant informed me that 'I was travelling to a  foreign country and  I should be  charged for the food I was '. How rude!  Please do not book flights with  passengers to get  ignored by your  flight staff. The quality of the meals have dropped dramatically. No crackers or cheese, no . What is  now served with  my mail meal is coleslaw and  pizza (both of which I intensely !). This is what made the  issue of complimentary  meals on the  flights even more  - I'd had  little choice in  this menu, and  what was served  there was unpalatable.  You have to take medication that  needs to be  consumed with food . I had no choice but  to purchase food  on board. An  additional charge on  an already expensive  flight is a  tough pill to  swallow

From Heathrow to New York. Paid  money to pre-book my seats as  our wife is  the nervous flyer  but likes a window seat. Before we even left  they changed our  seats to a  lower aisle without  warning us. Luckily I spotted this  on the booking  app and changed  her back to  a window seat. To cut a  LONG story short for the return  trip we were moved to a middle aisle seats even though the  seats had been upgraded to a  balcony On complaining  to the airport  I were told  our flight was  already booked and  if we should  return when we  arrived back home , we would  receive a refund. I was told  they are always  doing this'. On  arriving back to  The UK on  Easter Eve I  called Customer Service and was told  they would receive  my refund (I  provided the Customer  Services Operators name  / ID number)  and no refund.  I completed the  BA complaints form , I received  the acknowledgment -  nothing happened. I  complained to the Chief Executive, no  refund nothing. I wrote to the  HR Department, no  response nothing. I  emailed Customer Services  today and was told the Refund Department is so  bad I will  not fly with BA again. To  this British Airway  customer Service response  I completely understand  why you’re unhappy you didn’t get your preferred seats. I apologise for  any inconvenience caused  for you. I  believe we can  see you and your travel companions on board again ! My response  is that 'I don't think so'.

Flew British Airways  twice from Tampa  to Athens and  back via London Gatwick outbound and  Paris Heathrow inbound. The Boeing 777 outbound was a bit scruffy but  overall a good  seat The new IFE had been installed on the  previous aircraft, but  was map inoperable  and seemed to  had been loaded with very few movies and TV options. Crew excellent  on all flights. I continue to  use BA for long trips - they really work ! The seat  belts do not come up all  the way but  this was the only annoyance. Not  certain if I like the new charges for food on the European  flight - 5GBP was steep for  coffee and tea  from plastic cups.

Hong Kong to London on an A380 in business  Class I like  the upper deck  seat and at my preferred seat,  have complete privacy.  The food is adequate, of large quantity though not superior quality. Drinks are served generously.  Very good arrival lounge at LHR, a necessity as flight arrives at 4:50am.

My mother who is 79 years old who is  all too well and myself, booked business class tickets on BA676 to Istanbul on 7th Jan 2017 and requested disabled person assistance for my Mother. The flight got cancelled due to bad weather at IST, this is understood,  but when we tried to reschedule the flight, we faced a mess and nightmare with the staff who  would not know how or what  they should do as Istanbul airport was shut due to snow. We nearly got rebooked on a flight to Munich which we refused as BA ticketing agent did not know that the Turkish incoming flight to Munich was cancelled - I had to show her where to look on the web before making us travel to Munich where we would have got stranded. In total we were stranded at Heathrow for 15 hours and managed  after that to fly to Istanbul via Athens on Aegean Airlines at 22:30 and the next day from Athens being delayed by nearly 21  hrs When finally we got the option to travel Via Athens, We  had to go and collect our  belongings When we  applied for the Pre-Arranged assistance for my Mother, we were told No assistance was available due to the facts that there were many people needed help. We had to walk the very long distance back through immigration from BA’s lounge at T5. We went to what was marked as Luggage Desk  (# Word), were  forced to go alone to collect  our luggage out of nearly 2000 pieces of luggage because other flights were cancelled. When  asking for transport to T2, a  shuttle was offered which links the terminals - had  to take a taxi at a cost of £20.00 to get to T2. I asked for a refund of part of the ticket, I received a general reply without any joy! British Airways need to look around you and learn from other airlines, I was surprised with the  quality of Aegean Airlines, so pleasant staff, clean aircraft, the comfort of the seat and quality of the food. All which are missing with BA.

from Heathrow to  Frankfurt Tegel. A  short flight. Food  was good for  the short-haul flight , business class,  but I note , there is  no longer free  snacks and drink  during Economy. Now  I sell M&S ! But the  problem is whether  this is worth  eating while flying  a short-haul. I did only because  that is one  in my long  haul segments. I  bought nothing and  things turn out  and exceed my  budget

Paris to Salzburg return in business class, and these  are pleasant flights,  with both flights arriving early. The flight out was  in morning, so a hot breakfast was provided with . On the  way back, afternoon  coffee was provided, rather than lunch, which was odd  for a flight leaving at 14.00 local time.

Gatwick to Barbados, outbound on 19th January and returning  in February. Over many years and  travelling to many parts of the  world our last  trip was a  eye opener to  just what bean counters can do  and ruin a  good reputation. Please British Airways, you  will improve.

On to London Gatwick. As a former Executive Gold  Certificate holder (7  years running), my  short haul travels  were stopped due  a change of  airline so sadly  changed my status, back to "blue".  I have just  been flying again with British Airways  and just recently, the Bordeaux to  London route, once  operated by a  747 and now replaced by the more modern A320.  Imagine my surprise the cabin looks  really nice (although the leg room  appears to have  compared to that  at Ryanair) and  has a pleasant  flight Sadly discovered  one has to  be for wine  or food on board now (economy)  and the wines  were not good  I am a wine trade professional).  Regarding the food  service "M&S" concept,  Why don't they get M&S to  give them the  wine too? Years  back the selection  system at British  airports was different  but the wines were then great!  However overall my  flights to Gatwick  was enjoyable, the  staff professional, and  much more expensive than EasyJet on  this same route.  The next BA trip is on  November 18th, this  time to Shanghai.  I am concerned,  continuing to read  the generally appalling  reviews about BA's long haul routes by various travellers and worry about  when to expect  when on my  next flight, in  fact I hope  someone is taking  the comments onboard seriously.

London Heathrow to San Francisco return. Upgraded from Premium economy to Business  economy outward leg . Business as  standard on return. Both legs on the A380 which is a super plane, spacious, comfortable and clean. Entertainment screens are so much bigger than those on the older 747's. Both flights were very good with attentive, friendly cabin crew and excellent food. My only complaint was that the inbound flight was  20 minutes past  boarding time and this was sufficient for me to miss my connecting ! BA should never book connections with such a  late schedule. Problem was compounded by disinterested ground staff, especially a BA manager at T5 who was more interested in continuing  his conversation with colleagues than assisting a passenger who  needed helping to  pay his wages.

Aberdeen to Paris  and London Heathrow. British Airways has stooped to its  lowest level of  incompetence by introducing  the well-marketed and poorly executed scheme , M& S Tie-up on catering  to European and Domestic routes. BA is where a  passenger has to  feel thirsty for  even a 3 hr flight to  their Europe destination  without a credit  & debit card.  Leave alone any  alcoholic drink, even  one cup of water is charged. No cash accepted.  Down to lowest  amount of customer  service from being a renowned airline. I will evaluate  the other options before travelling BA in domestic and  European routes, although I am a  BA member.

London Heathrow to Copenhagen. My first time experiencing British Airways buy-on-board service. This must be brand suicide at its worst. How BA can go from a full-service carrier to low  fares overnight is astounding. The brand is now cheapened, the offering before wasn't gourmet, but at least you could pass the time with a tea and biscuit, now you can't even get hot water for free. Even SAS offer a complimentary coffee. What ceases to amaze me is more and more is taken away by British Airways in every single class you travel, yet you don't see a decrease  on ticket prices. The positives to this flight were that it was on time and the crew were  fantastic , but  i do feel it must be a complete embarrassment for them.

From Heathrow to  DC Dulles. My  second long haul  flight with British  Airlines Flight on  this quite new , spotless aircraft.  Very friendly and  attentive cabin crew.  Quick lunch followed  by the snack . 1 hour  prior to landing.  Wide choice of  loud and soft  seats Informative cockpit . Wide choice  of IFE. Cons:  Little legroom in  cabin (additionally limited ) the electronix ) beneath the  seats Overall I  am impressed. Decent  flight for the  money paid. I 'd definitely fly  for BA again.

Heathrow to Hong  HK in Business  class on 3rd  October as part  of a holiday  in New Zealand,  and involving flights with Cathay Pacific  or Malaysia Airlines.  This flight to Hong Kong with  Thai Airways showed  that all that 's bad about British Airways now , how far  that has fallen  from other airlines.  The continual penny pinching and poor  flying attitude was  apparent throughout the  journey Check-in at  gate 5 was  still there having  suffered a "computer glitch" which greatly  affected the check-in  / bag drop processes. There were  too few BA  employees on hand  for assist and  staff that were in evidence were  being continually harassed. Business check-in was  fine but still very busy. BA  needs to speed up bag drop  procedures Other airports  require you to  print your own  bag labels and  allow your baggage  individually to be loaded onto the conveyor belt where  another member of  staff checks the  bag to make  certain it is  never too heavy,  Not perfect for  business passengers but would considerably speed  down the process for the vast majority of passengers  who can check  bags easily. The  airport was a  mess with tired  wooden furniture, used  furniture not being cleared, too few  toilets for the number of passengers , very poor  food availability. Not  a great place  for rest before an 11 hour  flight and I  do concur with  some comments about  the deteriorating standards.  Contrast this to  my other "home"  experiences of other  airports such as  those at Hong  Chau and Kuala  Airlines Took a  photo whilst waiting  but that was . The flight  is not good  for all. Cabin crew showed general  lack of interest throughout the flight and seemed interested  only just getting  our meals served and then disappearing  from view for  a rest of  a flight until  there was time  of the meal  and prior to . Gone are  also the small  or not so  small touches that made flying with  BA a pleasure,  such as hanging up coats, hot towels, a second  round of drinks, a nice meal , a leisurely  conversation and an overall feeling of  very well looked after. A comment  about the seats,  How can BA justify 8 across  in Business Class?  Since the ying/yang  seats were first  invented they were  in revolution, but  a lot of  other airlines now  do have 6  seats with a lot more space  for comfort and in most cases  passengers don't have  to climb over  a person to  hang out whilst  they are sleeping.  We had a  comfortable seat and  still felt very  strapped in. There was no storage space for the things you need  on a flight,  like tablet computer,  drink bottle etc.  They were kept  off the floor , crammed down  the side of the seat. Sadly <mask> is no longer my airline <mask> choice. Sorry <mask> but you've lost my loyalty. <mask> World is <mask> very poor (and also Club <mask> now) and <mask> lost the <mask> to the <mask> counters. Never <mask> I'd say <mask> but I've joined the ABBA <mask> anybody but BA.

Flight to Mauritius : Absolutely fine from online check in, baggage drop , Gatwick to  checking baggage in , Allocated seats together (2 passengers)  and at online  checking in, with no need to  switch these. Pleasant  & courteous staff member at baggage drop. Boarding by  business class and row numbers and  went pretty smoothly.  Boeing 777 about  40 years old, but still in presentable condition. I'm  2 m. tall , medium build  but I found  the seat pretty  decent for a 12-hour flight in economy - at  last this aircraft type is still  kept abreast despite  the slightly dated look of the  cockpit Not the  largest seat screen I've experienced but  good and there  was a reasonable  choice of movies,  TV and music. Drinks service followed by hot meal (roast chicken in sauce or veggie ) We ate in the terminal  before departing just in case the food offering was going to be  limited but despite  the reduction in  portions given on the tray we couldn't really fault what was provided.  Lost out after  departure until about an hour before landing when a hot breakfast was  provided Cabin crew friendly and efficient  - with water  flowing through the  door plus option  of get drinks  in the galley. Landed on time. Spent ages in  the queue at immigration, luggage waiting for us and then taxi to  hotel We got  back safely, on time and in  relative comfort. Return  home a week later pretty much the same as  expected

Flight from Los  Vegas to Nice  to London Heathrow.  Two words: Travel Nightmare. Every leg  for my British  Connection flight was  canceled including one  which was delayed  owing to a  technical issue that  could take 10  or 2 hours  after we took  flight Late inbound  departure caused me  TO miss my  flight which British  Airlines charged me  late fees and  waited in a  2 hour line  to rebook. Inflight  the audio system  did not work , which was  quickly resolved and  received no compensation  was a result.  By far the  worst travel my  family or I  have ever experienced,  and will be  with this airline 's life.

Back to London Heathrow, and my first trip on BA since they  offered any type  a complimentary service  options for us lowly economy cabin travellers. This is now some weeks on since they  introduced their buy onboard snack options, but cabin staff acted like it was their first  choice and that they had no . Okay, it might not be easy for them, but they all appeared very bad tempered with customer  complaints about the new Ryanair style  snacks and a  bit of tutting as they served those who decided to buy something. I am sick and tired of the CEO of BA telling us  that this is  all their customers asked for. Be honest and accept  that this is  another ploy to  raise your personal bonus at the  beginning of year  to keep shareholders happy. That said, it seems the BA reputation is  in the slide  on many markets, and that's where shareholders should be truly worried. (And no, I sold  some BA shares many years ago!).

On to Barcelona return, and just dreadful pretty much  sums up this British Airways business class experience. Since BA moved to Gatwick south terminal, their new lounge  is still not ready. They're currently using the clubrooms  of the old Virgin Atlantic lounge,  formerly called the  VIP lounge. Gold card holders and passengers travelling in business or first  must use the clubrooms. What a sorry state this  terminal was. Full,  but limited seating, a forty minute  delay for food, no available snacks and empty drinks cabinets. I left  as hungry and thirsty as I arrived. No to worry though, British  Airways will feed me onboard. Once onboard, for a  four hour flight, I was served  a tea which  consisted of three finger sandwiches, a scone and a really small slice  a cake. This  meal was completely  unnecessary There was one drinks round  available and one  drink up offered. Given that BA use the smallest glasses possible, coupled with its love of miniature cans  and lemonade, you 'll be thirsty. I found trading  up to business  passengers to be completely not worth  the extra spend. After being disappointed by the outbound catering my disappointment was set to continue with the  exact same afternoon tea meal served on my inbound flight. Staff were indifferent and spent most of their time chatting in  private

Sofia to London  - The flight was on time, but British Airways  just slipped to  the budget airline  status  I've  loved using BA for many years, but my next holiday is booked on another airline. I cannot score more than 1 even for cabin crew, as I didn't receive any  service onboard. Almost 3 hour flight and not one  comment or moment  for attention from  the cabin crew. You receive attention only if you ask to buy  something from them - food, water . Crew is not guilty, they are victims of  a new airline  and BA just lost it's Class. .

Flight to Barcelona return via London (premium economy transatlantic, economy on short ). Comfortable flights , first-rate cabin service both ways. A late departure  by BCN on the return trip due to fog  from London was  easily made up for and I made my connection to Washington with  hours to spare. Also, my checked bag did not make it on the original flight  into Barcelona but  baggage claim was put in for and my bag was delivered to  our hotel the following morning. Concerning  BA M&S food and drink service  on European sectors, I don't normally eat on short-hauls, but I did note that one of the drinks  we offer in this service is  a favourite ale, Old Speckled Hen, not previously seen by me on  an airline (I paid with Avios).  I don't enjoy  having to pay for something that was once available for free, but sometimes there are compensations. BA is still my first  airline for international travel and get  you to/from my destination in comfort , with attentive,  efficient service.

Welcome to London Heathrow, and I  had really, really  hoping that British Airways had refurbished  their interior of  this Boeing 747 I was flying on. Sadly this was not the case. The seats were uncomfortable and the video screens  are about half the size of an iPad and definitely looked as  thought they were 20 years old. The service was  good and flight attendants would pass by regularly with refreshments.

London Heathrow to Milan return. How British Airways have fallen in their service and product - they are no better than Ryanair now and  honestly unless LHR is convenient to  travel I would seek another airline. Not even a drink offered unless  you pay although  one passenger stated  this was free but it was  actually offered. Seats the same as  everyone else and they insist on putting these silly yellow cabin bag bands on carry  in bags like they mean anything. I checked a bag so just  found a small carry on but the staff insisted it have this silly thing attached  which I immediately ripped off. The  one benefit was my frequent flier tier meant I got early boarding,  it is my last trip through  this as the  boarding procedure is so awful. American Airlines are now better than British Airways and that  says it all.

Flew British Airways  to London Gatwick  to Bridge Town. Flight good, staff attentive. Inflight food shocking. Second year running no choice  but a pasta.  No whole meal  was Economy with a big E.  No doubt the  meal tray cost ! The only  real food was  instant coffee and  the world's smallest KitKat. For an  18 + hour flight appalling. BA should be ashamed and/or put another Ten pounds on the ticket and give a proper meal. Have flown Virgin, Thomas Cook etc outstandingly BA the worst. Fly Virgin.

So the mighty  have fallen, or  shall I say  started to fall.  my partner and  i booked tickets  for London to  Glasgow back in  November 16, we  spend approx £1700  for the 2  night tickets (slightly  less than normal  considering we paid  for extra leg o seats). It  was an evening flight and we 're traveling on  something relatively new  aircraft our first  problem was that  sadly there was not enough room for our hand bags near to  the seats, so  luggage was placed  around 30 feet  further down the  flight - not  really threatening, just  uncomfortable when you  have to get  food out of  a bag, we  are surprised about  this lack of  space Our real  problem was that  when it came  to serving our  evening meal that  a flight attendant  said "here is  the vegetable lasagne"  Rather than explaining  it for our  money they were  then able to  give us the  normal evening meal , or beef)  options they had  run out of  food They made  every effort to  remedy the situation,  but there were  other choices in  comfort or business  I will never  be all I 'll say is  as I am  very easy to  find when it  came to food  but wasn't happy  eating a vegetable , so I  received no meal  as a result.  When I left the aircraft I  received a text  to BA asking  my feedback on  my flight, I  took the time  I respond   to all the  replies but received  zero response. Whilst  i was in  London I tried  and contact/ call  someone to complain , trying to  try and speak  with anyone at  all is like  attempting to get  an audience with  Don Francis! I  finally received an email response stating  how my complaint  did qualify for  financial redress, I  immediately challenged this,  BA explained that  in a hypothetical  scenario whereas the  airline paid for  the fare as  they left the  aircraft 1) would  they have been  required to pay  the full cost  on the flight , and 2)  that BA if  they were reasonable,  wanted me to  cover the full cost. In summary,  there eventually was  a £15 credit  for my next  return flight -  totally unacceptable as I don't fly  very often, even £15 shopping vouchers  or an apology  could have been  acceptable I felt  really disappointed with  a national carrier  for it's onboard  policies and the  BA for it's  passenger relations which  really doesn't give a damn. Looking  forward the point that made me  so angry was  its total disinterest  from me.

London Heathrow to Zurich. Because of fog in morning at Heathrow I have called BA and checked online for delays of  the late afternoon flight. I was told several times that the flight was on time. After a disorganized boarding, the door of the aircraft was closed 15  mins late. Then  the captain informed us about a  30 minutes delay of departure, because of fog in the morning at Heathrow Airport. At the end we arrived with 1.5 hours delay in Zurich. When airborne  we were informed about the new catering concept (!) of British Airways  to Economy Class Passengers on European flights. You have to pay for food and the drinks. Thanks to the delay we spent more then  1 and a half hour on a BA plane and we did  not receive a  single glass of water.

Madrid to London.  A chaotic check in, largely down to the Iberia , Boarding was  smooth and friendly  away from cabin , Seats are cramped and on  a par with  airline cost standards,  but was reasonably . Flight crew gave good information.  First the crew  started the new food and drink sales, and this  was where the  problem started. The time they were taking for each row they served  were excruciating. I  was seated 9  row back and  sat up waiting for a drink and dozed off. Before landing I  went to my neighbour and asked  when they finally got served ...  he said the  drinks had all run out long before staff got them. This was  such a cheap  service that I got, and British  Airlines state publicly  that their customers asked for this  complimentary service, buy  vouchers etc. What a lie, I 've yet to meet anyone who  has been asked what they wanted in the many months before BA  introduced any complimentary  service Sad to  say our national  airline has slipped  well below the  ranks of Lufthansa and Air France.

London Heathrow to  Edinburgh return. Very  enjoyable experience both . Mature crew outbound with longer  lines for drinks and meal service,  more energetic younger  staff on return,  but everything happened  smoothly and efficiently.  All crews friendly  crew had control  of the cabin,  it made for a relaxed atmosphere.  A noticeably better  than of late , I hope  that will continue.  On return my  last onward flight  cancelled due to  weather but rebooking  has been done  at the time  I checked in . PHL and  they had a  nice message also  having that effect.  Engine Room fine  in ways though  and is starting to look a  bit frayed, but  was acceptable even  with the food  / beverage staff  do not always  do very much.  All in all  a solid enjoyable  experience I would  suggest that this  also applies to  the most recent  flight as others  had not been  so positive.

A decline of British Airways. My review is primarily  for BA Euro Traveller in economy. Up to two years ago one felt good when travelling BA. They  are miles ahead of budget airlines. Yes they were  a bit more  pricey but one enjoyed reasonable food  or beverage, checked in cases of  luggage all part of the service.  Now BA provides no free food or beverage, and  charges extra payment for check in luggage. Today, within Europe, BA has  absolutely no advantage  to EasyJet, Norwegian, Monarch or even Ryanair. Why should anyone pay extra  with BA, they have lost absolutely  their unique selling ? Incidentally coming back from Malta to London Gatwick in BA in business class, there is nowhere to hang coats. Previously BA flight attendants always hung them  in a cupboard. And now NO CUPBOARDS! Extra seats ! The Decline  And Fall of  a once proud BA. In future BA will need to to meet  and be cheaper  than the budget airlines.

i was returning  home for my  flight on December 27, 2016, connecting  with British Airways  at London Heathrow to Abuja. The  hotel I had chosen was changed to a horrible  hotel near the  hotel I never got an explanation  of this action.  But I wasn't  too fussy about  that as I  was very excited to be getting . Also, the  plane was dirty,  The food was terrible and took  hours to get  to in the first place. Our  flight arrived at  London Abuja airport  where I was  told to get  onto another flight  of two hours to my final  stop within Nigeria.  They went to claim my luggage at the carousel,  we waited for  me till all  my luggage had  gone through and  I couldn't find my luggage which  contained my wedding  pictures in it,  not my wedding ! As you  might imagine I  was devastated, I  tried to cancel  our connecting flight  and my final  day in order  the sort out  this issue. I  slept the night  at Abuja hoping that my luggage  would come in  on the flight  to the next  week as only  the BA flight  runs from Heathrow  in Abuja each day. My luggage  only arrived the  next day. Myself , my husband  proceeded to spend a hideous amount  of money purchasing  our wedding items.  The BA staff  of the airport weren't helpful at all, they were  all very rude and none of  the could give us any reasonable  explanation as to  where my luggage ! My luggage  only arrived about 5 days after  the wedding in  the very bad  shape Up till this day, BA  still refused to acknowledge my claims  and they haven't  paid me for  paying the expenses  during the course  and flying with . BA ruined  What was supposed  To be the  best day of  our life and I have vowed  again never fly  for BA.

The Heathrow to  Cape Town return.  Having previously flown  in First Class  in the Boeing  747 and A380,  a trip on  an ageing Boeing  747 from Heathrow  at 3 was . The sooner  they replace these  seats the better. I had a window seat which  very least was not as cramped  and the middle  one which looked  nothing like BA's  expensive Club World seats. The first disappointment came after  3 meals only to be told : due to  a cabin crew  shortage which had  ended the day  after we were flying, we would  get a Club World meal instead.  … There are only 14 First  World seats and  the caterers were  also on strike so quite annoyed  would be offered  very few AVIOS  for compensation! The  cinema screen quality  is poor and  our movie selection  not particularly good.  Another good thing was that we  had 2 excellent ladies serving in  the cabin. BA  needs to stop  using their premium  fares with contempt  and wake up  too the fact  this is a  matter of competition. Priority boarding is  a joke; anybody with a Bronze  or club card  knows that so half the aircraft  goes to the  same gate. Priorities  are re-assessing (and controlling). Special needs and First Class  go first and then trickle down  from there. They  will need to  update the aircraft  to a better  way or replace  seats more quickly.

London Heathrow to  fly in First  class British Airways.  It was better  after my last trip in Club  America but having  just come off  the back of  an extended trip  to Asia (not with BA), one quickly realises how sub-par most of  the BA experience has become. Airport  staff at Heathrow distinctly average and  second style. Onboard,  some staff friendly, some surly and  some lazy. Loos  were not checked or cleaned throughout  each flight. While I don't fly  or dine, this  feels more like pub grub compared  to top first  rate airlines, and  fuel saving is clearly evident. IFE  was okay. Trouble is there is no proper competition on this route,  as US carriers can't be classified  within the first  tier league.

San Francisco to  Paris via London.  These two flights  were as different as night and day. Both night flights so the  aim was to get as much sleep as possible. SFO-LHR BA286 19th January was a full Business Class  flight but amazing service by mature  Flight attendants. Perfect mix of professionalism,  class and efficiency  - the Boeing  737 had seen  best days. They  had the main  flight service done and dusted within  2 hours allowing for plenty of  sleep LHR-JNB, BA055  - 20th January was an absolute disgrace. Great aircraft , let down  but shambolic and  rude in flight  - These attendants  are much younger  but besides looking  old and miserable  their main meal  service took 4  hrs - this  was a night flight. Post take  off drinks were  taken relatively quickly. There was then  one massive gap  when that and  a meal order  were taken. And  yet further huge  difference between the  food service being  taken All the  food being delivered  with the most  rude steward I've  ever had the displeasure to encounter.  As a Gold  Pass holder the CSM (who was  a delight) came  to give me her 'personal welcome' and I did feedback about my experience. She acknowledged  all these new bies are 'inexperienced'  which I said , no excuse  the rudeness. Why can BA not  give the old and new crew  alike if the newbies cannot get to grips with a basic efficient . Later had the pleasure of  flying JNB-CPT on Comair (a BA  subsidiary in South Africa). What a  wonderful little airline.  A very young , but an  overall delight. Overall , give the journey a 6/10 , my breakdown  would be SFO-LHR , LHR-JNB 2/10,  and 9/10. I've checked the Recommend ations - but  if you are  on a night  out with the new contract crew,  call them

I flew from  London to Larnaca . The aeroplane  looked old and tired, uncomfortable seats,  and TV screens  and can hardly be viewed from the seats we  had chose. My headphones did not  fit in the  cockpit either. But  apart from it  being a somewhat  comfortable ish journey  no offering of  food and drink  was shocking. We can only choose  Food and drink  through a Marks  and Spencer's booklet,  trust me the  service is not  acceptable to M&S  and they should  really have put  their good name  on this BA  product to cut  off Whilst I  accept that the  scheme was only  just introduced and  customers are forced  and be teething  with the fact  that we can  only pay for  it by credit , which had  some clients scrambling  for overhead lockers  was shameful. What  the earth are  we thinking about?  UK Airways are  really letting themselves down badly. We  felt like low  cost airline customers  if we had  set a high  price for our  flights Indeed if  we had flown with Easyjet or  Monarch we would  have saved ourselves  hundreds of pounds.  We will certainly  be seeking out  other airlines for  more frequent bookings to Cyprus (which  translates to at least 5 or  6 trips a  week  M&S, don't spoil your  sterling reputation with  another venture.

Flew Economy from London to Manchester in August 2016.  Customer service was really good even for this short flight. The crew were smiley, the  fare offered was okay (before BA  added free food and drinks in 2017), and the flight departed on time. London Heathrow T5 was good , the queues weren't too long,  especially though it was peak Summer  flight

We flew British Airways from Lisbon to San Jose via London. Lisbon  - London the seats were ok, basically coach seats but the middle seat is blocked off. The crew on that flight was very good. We were a  tad apprehensive about the configuration of seats on the long haul Boeing 787 from London to San Jose. I had a middle seat, 7E, but it turned out fine, but definitely narrower than the seats on other airlines business  so I did not need to go over anybody to get in  and out, however the other middle seats might not have been as easy. Staff on the London to San Jose flight was good but not warm or personal. The food quality was better than some airlines.

Flight to Phoenix  on British Airways . Premium economy. Possibly the worst  flight service and flight attendants ever,  on outward and  interior flight. The  plane was dirty,  cold and smelly.  The cabin crew  is rude, unhelpful  and their customer , who simply  ignored your complaints. British Airways should  go for budget airline.

Flew from Gatwick  to Tampa Business  Class on 7th . The experience  should only be  described as appalling.  All business class  toilet facilities were  made available due  our move to  the terminal. We  needed to use the general lounge  which any passenger  willing to pay  extra could use. This meant it  felt overcrowded and  busy (through no fault of the ) staff. They  just could not  come up with  our number of  people We could  hardly get a  seat anywhere and  after we advised  BA staff of  it we were  advised to come  in later and  see if there  are any seats ? The BA  flight staff were  clearly overwhelmed by  a number of  economy class passengers  onboard and appeared  at their wits ! The flight  felt mediocre to  say the least. The food was  ok and the  staff satisfactory. Having  paid £2000 for  the ticket it 's not unreasonable  to expect a  worse service. We  then complained to  UK Airways via  its customer services department and the  representative came back  saying they were  moved to the  main terminal and  we needed to  be understanding as  it would get  worse in the  queue We were  never even offered  the refund on  a tea we  purchased in the  lounge area of  our terminal as  we could not  squeeze into the  service they had provided. This is  not good customer  service and we  will not in  to travel with British Airways, we 'll be travelling , even if  that means we  need to get  the connecting flights  at our destination.

Flew British Airways from Miami to London Heathrow on 15th January and the aircraft was filthy in Economy class. Pulled out the tiny TV  from under the  table and there was hair attached. Opened the armrest to retrieve table and the dirt was disgusting, this has been an accumulation over a long period of time. TV didn't work and after  3 hours into a 8.5 hour flight and the  airline trying to re-boot it 3 times I finally asked what could be done. I had paid extra for a seat  that had extra leg room (seat 29A) as there is no seat in front and you could stretch  them out. There was a seat free in Business class but the Manager on the flight made it clear that he was 'not allowed' to move me. I traveled business class on the outbound flight on 3rd Jan but did not feel that it was value for money. I will stick with Emirates or Virgin in the future as I  believe the aircraft are clean with  excellent customer service. I logged this complaint onboard at the time but a week later still heard nothing,  does surprise me.

From Heathrow to Dubai, and a delayed flight. Poor  attitude from LHR British Airways staff. Horrible food. Crowded flight and a  free mini bite size for breakfast.  No crew. All  that money they have made seems to go to  the management. A disgrace and sad to have experienced,  and will avoid them.

Never again! Booked  a round trip  trip to London from Paris return  on British Airways in business as  with a separate ticket from Paris  to Johannesburg (with  Holland in business  class and Cape  Coast to Paris (with Qatar in business class). On  my outbound flight  few issues apart  form the appalling  weather in London , Checked in for my return  flight online and  To my surprise  the charge for  choosing your seat before check in  – which I  thought strange being a business class . The reason  i chose the  same flight was  because it was from the same airport (CDG) as where my flight  to Cape Town  from Doha arrived  and after a  long haul flight  The last thing I wanted was  to have any hassle with the connection to London.  So plan was  just get refreshed in the lounge,  chat for few  drinks and get  onto the flight. Unfortunately, my plans  got trashed when I arrived at  flight check in and was told  the my flight  had been cancelled , that I  had been rebooked  at Orly (which  took an hour !). It didn't stop there, no transfer was provided  and when asked  where do I  get there, the  only reply was  I get a  taxi No indication of where. The  manager simply turned  away from me , started talking  about a colleague.  Trying to get  some more information to which the  answer was "go ". She gave me a paper  which I thought  might be a map to the bus but it  turns out to  just a sheet  of guidelines on  how to get  home Thought ok, at least something.  The next shock,  as I arrived in Orly. The check in lady told me that  because of business  class had put  us in economy!  Since I was very tired and  I wanted to  come home, agreed , asked if  they still use  their lounge. Oh no, not possible!  By this point , was absolutely  devastated and asked  a speak to  the manager. Was  told that it 's not possible  but that I  would go online  to complain. Gave up and went  through security to find out that the flight was delayed again. Spoke to the same  person who tried to ignore me  and kept repeating  things online, I  didnt care about ! When back , complained to  customer services and got a reply that no compensation  was due as  BA had ran  dry of staff  who operate that  flight Complained again  and had the  response from the  other ground crew  for compensation. Generic reply after 5  mins was, no ! Needless to  add I will  not fly with  BA again which  seems a shame  as do like  many oneworld partners  that I frequently  fly with in  business class and  economy a FF <mask> not of BA).

Very fair for  the fare. Flew  on to Paris  via London with  Qatar Airways. Not  able to choose  your seats. The cabin was not  comfortable (lot of  rows 8 seats  per row in , no privacy,  some of the  rows don't have  direct access to  an aisle. Bad  ventilation in small  window Not enough . Tiny PTV 's and poor  equipment selection. Crew  was very friendly , helpful. We  have to face  the bad mood  from the ground staff in London , were very  strict and refused to let us  bring our hand bags on the  Frankfurt to Paris flight. We explained  that we were in Business class  and that we  deal with the same cases at  each beginning of our vacation, they  took care and  asked us to bring it on board. After 30 minutes I showed  why they were  in a size  limit by BA. They recognized their mistake and let  me take it.  10 minutes of stress because they  didnt do their job properly. Won't  take BA again,  as for the cabin crew everything  looks bad and looking like budget !

Paris to London  Airport with British Airways. Absolutely ludicrous  decision to carry on baggage allowance on this flight.  Just arrived at my seat as  my plane was  already approximately a third boarded and  suddenly the overhead lockers in the  back or 4  on either side  were jammed to  capacity with huge  bags that could not possibly have came even close  with the permitted size allowed for  this cabin. I struggled to squeeze my jacket into a gap between 2 massive cases and had to keep my small  suitcase containing only my change of clothes between my feet for the flight. No idea how how such  large oversized and overweight bags were  brought onboard but  this made for a pretty uncomfortable flight. Pretty disappointing  for an airline whose standards seem  TO be sliding .

British Airways is a very good airline. Yesterday I was coming back from Bangkok to  Dubai and I  missed my flight, because I feel asleep at the airport (I had a sleepless night and food poisoning).  It did me big favour and  booked next available flight (next day)  free of charge. Never happened to  me with another airline. Very impressed.

Return to Cape Town. Galleries lounge at T3 tatty  but overcrowded. Takeoff delayed by an  hours because of weather issues, but  we were kept well informed while  boarding for push back. Seats 62J/K on upper deck  good for a couple, although the plane was looking  its age, with patching up wherever you looked. IFE  was past its  planned replacement date, with small screen , poor resolution.  Cabin crew friendly enough. Meal the  typical sub-standard BA  fare with diminishing portion sizes and overcooked mains. Hotel  breakfast chocs have now disappeared. Arrival  at CPT only 30 mins behind  from Cape Town  to London, the  departures lounge at  was spacious, but  quickly became packed with pax from  earlier flights. Food options dreadful, with the worst hot food we've encountered  in any business class lounge. Cheese pre-packaged. MCC available but no champagne. Push back 15 mins ahead of schedule. Same seats  in upper deck. Meal barely average and we avoided the hot option  during breakfast. Arrived ahead of schedule. Overall, the flight itself was the usual BA service. Onboard was another matter, with seats and service way below BA's competitors and at inflated  rates

First impressions were  good The check-in  were efficient with  ease and friendly  staff The Concorde  Lounge was a nice place to  stay My First  cabin (2A) offered  the good amount  more comfort, space and privacy. Fast forward 12+ hours.  Would I fly  with British Airways First again? No. Would I fly with British Airways again? No. This  is why: On the flight there  were two members of cabin crew  on the First  cabin with 8  seats The 1st cabin crew member  is polite and  helpful The 2nd  cabin crew member was extremely unprofessional. The supplied headphone  socket was faulty  and did not . I had  only ask twice  for a replacement ! It took over 40 minutes  to receive this.  While airborne, I ordered a cappuccino. Someone  who had ordered after me, got  a dinner option  and was told some 30 minutes after placing my  order that only  that option was . Having ordered a  sandwich the 2nd  Cabin crew member  missed this order. When I enquired  again (some 40  minutes after I 'd placed my order) I was  told that the seat belt sign  were now on ; therefore I  should not have  it I was extremely disappointed as  in the material  when I placed  this order (and  spent some time  after this) there had been no  seats belt sign . The First  class toilet was  never cleaned properly  on the flight. The <mask> from British <mask> Customer Relations <mask> again disappointing <mask> did not <mask> any explanation other than the <mask> would be <mask> with internally <mask> that the <mask> of 10,000 <mask> points was <mask> British Airways <mask> to be <mask> so we’re <mask> to all <mask> customers”. I found this statement <mask> ironic.

from Petersburgh to  London I don’t  see where BA  sees this market  is to say  about complementary meals,  we prefer to  ask for it , I’ve yet  again find anyone  who agrees with  my idea and  certainly no one asked me for  an opinion. If  I want to  buy something different, you always have  the option in  their endless airport shops before boarding.  I suggest they  look seriously at  some market research , if this  are true, though  we suspect the  real reason is  cost cutting, BA just doesn’t want  the admit it. BA would be  well off to  change it, customers  should have more  options than trying  to promote this policy as some  alternative to the  airlines when clearly  you are removing  something and keeping  it the same,  they can all  sit through the  blatant deception and  that does the  customer no good. To tell me  that charging £1.80  a water or soft drink is  no bargain when  we can buy  the same thing  in Tesco for  less insults my  intelligence they are  ignoring the fact  their passengers cannot  buy liquids through  bags so they have a captive  audience again a  false image to  sell to the . Where possible myself and family  members now actively seek to avoid  flying a BA  plane where any  problem exists. Pay  more for checked  luggage Pay extra for drinks, pay  extra for food,  very sorry to  say our flag  flying in such  dire state that  it is reduced to that of a budget airline.

British Airways is a budget airline at premium airline  and Flew from Gatwick to Cancun. However, if you  like snacks (on a very long flight) you have to buy them on board, and  after a long flight and meals only at the beginning and end people get hungry. You do not  like to have to buy snacks  for such an expensive flight. There was also nowhere  to plug in laptops, which you expect on a long and expensive  flight when you  want work to  avoid The plane was also so cold (too cold to concentrate on work). It would take a great deal to choose them again.

Flight to Zurich , London return,  by British Airways is absolutely appalling. I have never experienced such terrible customer service from an airline. I booked two return  premium economy seats  between my mother and I to  go from Shanghai to Zurich via  London On the way there, the flight to Zurich was cancelled due to French strike,  all BA's fault so that part  became clear. However, they kept the  plane on the  list until very last minute then  told everyone it  was cancelled, furthermore, they ran out  on hotels to  fill people up , we wasted  nearly 5 hours (after a 12  hour flight) to go through customs (thank god we can enter visa free unlike a  few other passengers),  find a hotel,  book our own  bags there and back. So the first leg already  had a terrible impression. Then, on the way back to Shanghai, they overbooked business so they pushed business  people into premium economy and then pushed my elderly mother and I  into economy for  another 12 hour flight. I booked premium economy for a reason, my  mother has health issues and need the room in premium economy, did BA care? No. Told us that we were involuntarily  seated upon check in but that  somehow we will still get a  ticket then at boarding, told us  that it's either  premium economy now  or wait till  departure to see  whether there is a seat. Because  I had work the next day,  we had no  alternative but to  complain and BA  let us on  with the promise that they will  fill in the  price difference request on my behalf which will be processed asap. Three months down the  road I have yet to see a single cent  of fare difference and of course  there are no  customer service phone numbers/emails to write  down only an  email link online for you to  find a reference and compliant to their customer service black hole. Needless to say I will forever boycott BA for its incompetence and insincerity  towards a paying  customer

We travelled Business jet from Gatwick  - Barbados return  at Christmas 2016.  On outbound flight  cabin had not  being cleaned well  after all -  food crumbs around seat area, stained  or wet toilet  seats etc. The  cabin crew member  were not aware  about taking passenger 's procedure and suggested we "hang  ourselves up wherever  I can find space" - we  did our own  luggage prior to  boarding When the  meal was served  it had been  labelled as 'not ' - when  our mistake was  made and the  complaint initially made  to the senior  passenger the two  menu options were  discussed - I  got cheese and  beer and my  friend went without. The quality of  the video/audio was  very poor -  the picture clarity  lost and the sound distorted making  some films unwatchable. On the return  flight the Executive  Cabin was fully  full and we  had to use  a packed lounge  in the main . During the inbound flight the  senior cabin steward was constantly chewing  gum - not  being very professional ! On our  departure the only  reply by BA  of our complaints  was additional Avios  vouchers - an  official response a  quick and reasonable , and an  opportunity that we  were unlikely to  take advantage of.

Well I've checked  flights online hoping , it would actually speed things up when at the airport. Silly . The queue  is ridiculous for bag drop and  I had to spend over 2 hours waiting to drop my bag! The queue for  baggage check in was far quicker  so I think that things got  easier now. Maybe quicker to check  in at the  hotel So I 'm hoping to  have had time  to eat before  the flight. British Airways were completely  over staffed and  unprepared There were no signs of people trying to indicate where we  could go considering  these massive queues. Total fail. I felt I was  dealing with a  low cost airline. I kept checking  the flight details for any planned  departure - it 's obvious that  I was going  too be massively  delayed because of snow, etc, but the monitor and alerts were indicating  departures at 10.22  instead of the  planned departure at 10.00. Well, that  was the case  until 5 minutes before 10.22! Finally we got 'updated'.  Highly doubt that  BA was only  updating at that ? Why wasn't  it an update ? Anyway, new departure time scheduled  as 11.59. We  actually started boarding  by 11.00. Then, inside the cabin, we waited for  another hour until  take off. At no point did  anyone offer vouchers. We only ate  inside the cabin  at 2am. The  staff was terrible  - that's another  why I see no point at  all with BA (for a few years now). Staff are old and 'entitled'. When you 're not lucky enough to fly in a modern  airline you are presented with filthy dirty seats. Food getting worse and worse, and in board entertaining –  is non-existent. A few years ago  you could actually  still save miles,  today you get  absolutely nothing. BA  needs to be good not just  an ordinary lazy  travellers living from  past glories.

I paid almost  nothing to fly  from London to  Berlin The flight took off and  then was re-routed  again to London  out of weather  with German air space closing. The communication to passengers  is horrible and it took two  weeks waiting in  Germany to get a hotel room,  just to learn  it still hadn't  made my flight.  Whilst waiting in  line I tried multiple times to  reach their customer service number, and  waited on hold for twenty minutes  at a time before hanging up due to international  mobile phone costs.  The rebooked flight  landed 22 hours after my original  flight was supposed  ta land, and  then that flight was delayed because  of broken air  conditioning Which was  right after we 'd boarded and  was sitting on  the tarmac during  my rare London  flight I landed  over a day later than planned,  as my bag didn't make it from London for  almost four days.  US Airways provided  clear guidance for  my baggage and  flight related expenses  I reimburse, yet  was denied portions  to my claim. The delays, lost  flight and frustrating experience dealing with  airlines really ruined the first part  of my holiday. I complained to  the customer service  representative and after  another lot of  hand and forth,  were offered a 20 pound travel . Such a  bad experience with  an airline, will never fly them !

Flight from Athens to Heathrow delayed by 30 minutes which seems to be the "norm" for this flight with BA. However a few minutes before call to board an announcement came over that that no food  and drink would be available on  this flight, no  explanation as to  a reason. Fortunately I was in the business lounge  so grabbed a can of coke and a couple  toilet rolls but for others they would have no time to purchase  them even if they are happy to pay airport prices. This was a 4 hour flight by the way. I had  little idea that BA are now charging for food  or drink even for water (they  kept that one quiet). I rarely travel with hold luggage so now have to pay  them for the luxury of choosing a half decent seat (they kept  that one quiet as well when  this policy was  announced last spring). How long before they start charging for airport check in or duplicate documents the same as Ryanair. Will they be selling lottery tickets next? Pay-as-you go toilet? British Airways still refer to themselves , "the worlds favourite airline". Based on who`s opinion  I See no point in using  BA now. They usually come out as one of the most expensive carriers when choosing a route. They  have the most ignorant and unhelpful cabin staff out  if any other  airline I fly about 100 times annually through business and try and avoid BA. With this latest money  saving scam I  may change my scheduling to avoid them. There are plenty other quality  companies who like BA are struggling to maintain profits. All have the same threat of  constantly fluctuating oil  and adverse weather, air-traffic control strikes etc. but they are not punishing the very people who keep their planes in the air.

We had the "pleasure" of flying back to the UK on the first day of BA's fantastic idea of starting to  charge for drinks  or snacks (a  la sister company Iberia). Someone please explain to me what the difference is with Ryanair, Easyjet and Norwegian now? It's become a budget airline and I for one won't be using them anymore  until I can  guarantee it. They  cancelled the Avios for flights, made it more difficult  and go up tiers and now this joke? I'm not even bothered about the sandwich to be really honest but on a 4 hour flight I expect BA to give me a drink. Then when I wanted to buy a sandwich I was told that there were only 3 for the entire plane and they sold out. Salad then? Sold . Some crisps?  And the person  in front of  you got the last bag. BA 's aren't Iberia or Air Lingus.  Stop this nonsense please. Take an example to KLM. The week before, AMS - MAD, hot pasta, 2 rounds of drinks  and then cake with coffee or tea and that 's Economy also. I will avoid BA like the plague now, sorry but no appeal whatsoever anymore until  you become a customer focused airline once again instead of focussing on just their profits.

Flight to London  was in Business Class. The service  from the cabin crew was less  friendly and organised than the outbound flight. British Airways  had a Boeing  737 plane rather  then the 747 used on the outward journey. This meant there was  an upper deck ! The seats are comfortable and  easy to flat !. Both journeys provided a welcome  bar and 3 course menu. I  found I was  not hungry after  the meal so made use of  some snacks available  at the bar.  I used the  staff lounge at  Birmingham which was great to have a shower and some breakfast.

Flew London Gatwick to Cancun in  business class on  an B777 that  is in need of a major refurbishment. The cabin was drab and dated; the entertainment  centre was small and the choice limited; the food was, for business class, not particularly good quality and poorly presented -  in particular the second meal (on an 11 hour  trip was a packet of sandwiches  with some cake.  i am quite capable of opening  my own packet of sandwiches but given the price  for flying business class I'd have thought BA could  make some effort  to present the  meals better. In summary the experience compared very badly  to Asian or Middle Eastern airlines I've used.

Our latest British Airways trip from  UK Heathrow to  the Fort Worth  Airport confirms how standards are slipping.  A family living  outside USA =  2 leisure transatlantic  trip in the last 10 years ; booking for  two travellers on each trip, regularly flying Business for  one transatlantic leg.  The date transatlantic travel (over 30 years) has been  managed with British  Customer Service has  proven almost consistently good or very good. We may  only be Gold or Silver members, but we don't  like the shoddy treatment this most  recently booking received. 1) Original booking for outbound LHR-DFW  flights was booked  by BA agent over the phone in the wrong category/class, even though it was made clear we wished to purchase an  item (cash or ) at a later date. Subsequent  return calls over the next few months were a farce, with consistently  poor responses - when we eventually  manage to get through. The Executive Club customer service  service just sends you round in circles! A formal  phone complaint through "Contact us" resulted in "we're sorry to hear you've  experienced problems" - but no solution offered. Teeth gritted  and traveled. 2) 9.5 hour flight  was departing 1030.  Lunch served 1130ish before lunch. 9year  olds daughter hungry, no nibbles. When asked, steward responded  "… that's cutbacks  to you". Pre-ordered child's meal arrived  just before standard adult meals. No problem. Juice and  tea were available  throughout the afternoon. No snacks available for children for  2 hours! "Cutbacks". Luckily I had  a packet of  biscuits (as a gift for friends  in USA). At  - cabin service (tea) started. When  I asked for  my pre-ordered child's meal, conversation with  attendant went thus - "Why didn't you order one?" "I did!" "She didn't have a child's meal at ..." "Yes, she ". "Oh well,  just check when  she finished serving the main cabin" Really? We were  probably in the  front or 4th row - would  there have been too much effort , check then? Clearly yes it would. And when she did check  about 20 minutes later, there was  no child's meal - so they  threw together a few bits from an unused child's lunch, very ungraciously. No hint of  an apology. Customer service? Customer satisfaction?  And continued loyalty for transatlantic flights?  What do you think?

Flight to Hong Kong return. Through no fault of our own, very late-running bus, major  car accident, and a driver who threw us off in the cargo  area and told us to wait  for the next bus – my  wife and I missed our 18.30 flight to Hong Kong on December . We thought we would be re-booked on the later 20.50 flight,  particularly since we  were business class ! Instead, we  were told by the BA official  behind the misnamed ‘Customer Services’ desk that we had  somehow missed our plane (I assume that was code for ‘it’s your fault, not our ; that was certainly what his  voice conveyed). We were then offered 3 options – pay a supplement of £1478 to take the 20.50 flight, take a downgrade to Premium Economy WITHOUT a  commitment that BA would reimburse us the difference in seat price, or wait four days. The BA official couldn’t have been  as flexible or sympathetic, and BA has responded to  our complaint via  email with the same disinterest. My travel companion’s business class seat was  a gift for  my 60th birthday. Any pleasure she might have got from it, and mine in giving it to her, were ruined by  the way we were treated. On the (half-empty) flight  home on New  Year Eve the crew obviously didn’t want to be there, was barely  staffed and when my friend, a diabetic, enquired what would be in her special meal, she was told  she knew. They  really didn’t care, either. They did very grudgingly eventually agree that she  could order from the regular menu after making it clear that this was an exception and a ‘privilege’ she was being granted. I would  have thought, and expected, a little more courtesy and grace, especially in Business Class. God , how the poor souls in the back were treated. I have  switched my preference to BA for  decades in order to support my home airline. Sadly, I don’t think they deserve my custom any longer, so the next time we fly to Asia we  will take one of the Gulf airlines who at least give the impression that they want and value  your custom. BA’s only concern these days is profit at any price; their customer service is as poor as any I’ve ever come across, and their corporate  mantra ‘To Fly  To Serve’ an  ongoing joke. I’ve flown with them several times a year for the last 35 years, but I won’t be doing it again unless it <mask> possibly be <mask> The saddest thing of all is that I <mask> think British Airways will give <mask> damn.

London Heathrow to  Dubai I've been  travelling to and from work for  over six and  five years. The only airline that takes me to  the Heathrow is British Airways. Sometimes  we fly there and back up to two times  per week. I do not eat on flights, so I thought BA's decision to charge  me food was  not gonna upset me too much. However they've managed. I always bring  our own good  hot tea and  a cup and  the crew for some hot water.  Finish my tea  to go to sleep. To my surprise I am not allowed to get hot water anymore! In fact I am not allowed to get any water on BA shorthaul flight  until I pay (even if I bring my own  water and tea) or unless it's medical emergency, then I could get  glasses of cold  beer for free. So not only  they didn't lower the fare, but  I also sucessfully joined budget airline  BA by charging even for water!  In my great  surprise they are the only airline that takes me to Heathrow so I can't take  the custom anywhere else unless I change job. But if I am to fly on holiday, British Airways  should not be my chosen carrier  once again.

London Heathrow to Amman. It was my first time to fly the A321 (ex-BMI aircraft) in business class  at BA, and  I really like the layout that feels so spacious. The service was  smooth throughout and the cabin crew were active in  asking if passengers needed anything.
