The check-in queues in Amman were annoying  but other than that, this London-Amman-London  flight reminded me of how flying used to be.

London Heathrow to  BA return, outbound  with an A320  and inbound a Boeing 767. Outbound  flight was delayed  due to engine problem just before taking off with  about 5 hours ! BA did look after us well though. Replacement aircraft found (another ) and we  soon arrived to destination. Cabin crew  are very helpful and polite. Return  to an old but still good looking B767 (I  think they will  get phased out  by 2017) which has plenty of legroom and space  in economy, although  its overhead bins  were not too  large (I guess that is the  reason they used  ot be). We  left and landed  within time. Overall , good experience despite the outbound delay but I  commend airlines that  seemed able to  take safety calls to those that would not!

London Heathrow to  Paris with British  Airlines in economy ! Two hours late, and terrible  service when able  to board. The flight attendants seemed too young, and  they did not  attend to anyones concerns. I now see why, British  Columbia has lost  first class, they  really don't care about the customer.  You can honestly  state I will never fly British  Columbia again, no matter if they  are the lowest  cost carrier.

From Gatwick to  our return. We  were appalled with the change to  our onboard meals  for both outgoing  to return flights  to Barbados. After take off we were served complimentary  drinks as usual but noted the preztals had been  slashed but wasn't  that concerned. Dinner was served shortly afterwards which I  found good although  bread and biscuits  have been cut too. The flight  itself was almost  9 hours so we were feeling hungry 4 hours  into the main  meal I was  looking forward to  the sandwich or  the least a  cookie to take the hunger off  and was completely  shocked when the cabin staff came  in with a  menu and offered us either a  medium size kit kat, a small bag of crisps  or 2 small  sandwiches The cabin  attendant told me  this was the  new policy, and that if we wanted we could buy snacks which she then told  us was in  particular a small  packet of pringles!  There were  not even any sandwiches for sale! Fortunately for us  shortly after a  lady came through  in premium economy and joined a queue for the  food and I  saw she was  holding a sandwich,  I asked her where she had got it, and  simply replied that  it had been given to her and did we  eat it!   No one advised us that there  is only one  meal in 9 hours, if so  she would have bought a sandwich  with us. I  went through the onboard magazine and  there was no list of snacks  and anything about these severe cut backs. So if your planning on travelling with British Airways economy to  Caribbean make sure  and pack a sandwich. Return flight we was prepared  although only a biscuit was given out. Will be travelling with Virgin  next time!

Travelled British Airways  from London to  Mal Lumpur return.  After a painful  three hour fight , I had  a window seat  with a metal  partition in the  changing room areas,  which meant my  feet were slanted to one side throughout the flight.  Upon my way back, the inflight entertainment didn't work.  With numerous attempts  of reset by  my cabin crew  it still didn't  happen for my partner and I.  Given the price of the ticket this was not  ideal

London to London  the entire experience was excellent, although  due to bad  weather conditions in London, my original  flight was cancelled  later I was rebooked on another one 30 hours  after BA compensated  that first night  and I got  the room upgrade and their staff  kept me informed  despite the difficult situation. The aircraft  staff was clean and smart and  their crew smiling, polite and efficient! Both flights on time and the  weather was average.

Manchester to Los ax via Heathrow. I'm always reminded that British Airways is one of  my worst airlines  every time I fly with them. The check in  line is as  bad as they get. They have  taken my bags  to Heathrow even  knowing I'm going  into LAX. I  tell them to  double check, or at least ask where I'm going. To make things  worse the ground  then proceed to suggest that its  MY fault because  I booked two  extra tickets, which  we know for  a fact that  I didn't because  we booked a  longer flight. Staff  and attitude across - board. Poor food on long  leg flights. Struggling to think of many ways they  could be worse.  A real embarrassment  to British Airways  being my country's main airline.

Manchester to Las alle via Manchester. I went to  great trouble of checking in online,  no boarding pass  information and expecting  the just drop my bag at  the airport, to  be told that  is not allowed!  And was told  I had no  alternative but to  join up with  someone else checking in. After 1 hour in the  airport queue, I  was told there  was "no space for a bag  here at Manchester T3". The agent said this with  an empty check-in  counter next to  me British Airways disgust me with  its hoop-jumping checking  process online which only serves the  airlines and left  me in agony  on my feet. Thank you for  a complimentary micro-bag  of crisps on  my delayed LHR-MAN leg! If I never see BA/AA G again it'll  come too soon.

Welcome to London Business Class. Living  in London, and  taking international long haul flights throughout  the year I have once again  been disappointed by British Airways poor  service for premium  seats in preferred . Our family of four were  travelling home from the Christmas holidays  after an overnight  trip and when  it was ready to sleep I  decided to recline  my seat in the "flat bed position". My seat  did not recline.  Our flight was completely full and  they were no  extra seats available  for switch me . These are  the checks a  cabin crew could and should go  over prior to  boarding an aircraft. I notified the flight attendant to  see if he  had any knowledge as to how  my seat could be adjusted in  an attempt to  change it. Sadly,  they did not.  I was informed that the head/purser was on his  own rest and  said he would come discuss the  issue with me in an hour and a half. Hopefully his accommodations  was better than  this Prior to  this (20 minutes  late on a  12 hour flight),  my purser spoke to me and  apologised on behalf  for BA and  whether he could compensate me with  only £50 or  1000 Avios. I informed him there was a far greater price point between Premium Economy  than Business Class. Understandably, he apologised and said that  was all he was capable of doing. I received  another call from a BA representative and I was  told that she could only provide  passengers with similar compensation - £50  and 10,000 Avios. (I currently have 588,500 avois on BA that is nearly impossible to ). I requested an upgrade on an upcoming flight  to Heathrow to  move from a Premium Economy seat to a Business Class seat. The  BA representative said  that she could  easily do this  as customers pay  for the Business  Class experience -  the food, individual flight attendant service and comfort. Sleeping is the entire point of purchasing  that Business Class seat - not  the food. My  flight was not ! The flight  staff on BA have always been  very professional irregardless of the cabin, the point was to sleep.

Have flown this route (Sydney to  Perth many times  on other airlines and British Airways is the worst. They changed our  seats during the fuel stop at  JFK - without notice, without explanation.  Our food was  disgusting - no  fruit or green vegetable to be  seen Cabin staff stomp up and  up the aisle attending to premium  passengers - bumped into numerous times.  Rest locations on  board are terrible  - those poor people seated right  up to the  exit door. Paid  cash for reserved seats - no !! Inflight entertainment  was awful -  some really old movies. This airline  put on some nostalgic image as  if they were in the 1950's.  These airlines are  vastly superior. Don't  fly it -  you be disappointed.

Flight CDG to  Frankfurt via London  - in Business  Class It was  my first flight  for BA, and  since my last  flight BA is  another perfect example what an airline  is after too much cost cutting.  My business class  first row has  four seats, never  seen that in  my recent business  flights and you  never forget any  seat The seat  is comfortable in  sitting position but  was not comfy  in bed position  and you have  an open a  little tiny seat  to put your  bag Not convenient.  My IFE screen  very tiny, smaller  compared in economy  in recent airplanes.  Overall movie selection  was very poor.  My meal was  small and quantity  is very poor.  Three tiny toilets  at the business  was not enough.

London Heathrow to  Hong Kong was  my most disappointing  economy class experience. The bottom line  was that BA had 8 business class seats in  each row on this Boeing 777 X LHR to . The seats on BA are narrow, lack privacy  (= face of  a stranger next  door me facing in the opposite direction was about  100 feet, 60  cm from me) and don't even  talk about any storage space (I couldn't find a  good surface to  keep my eyeglasses  onto and I  left my water  bottles on the  floor under the seat). The footrest  has to be operated manually. The entire experience was so irritating that  you didn't know  whether I should  leave or just  laugh at it.  You have no idea how BA  could get away with this. They  probably won't see  me as a  passenger again.

Toronto to London return in Club World on 787-900 with British Airways.  BA was upgraded a couple of months ago from World Traveller Plus (worth the money for a decent night's sleep). Fast check in and fast track security at Pearson meant  BA was in the lounge within 15 mins. Excellent lounge supper service with a choice of a roast  and noodles in soup. The lounge is well managed and maintained with friendly staff and a well stocked bar. On time  departure but a delayed departure due  a loading baggage. A glass of champagne, with a top up, before  boarding I always find boarding in Club World disjointed and fragmented as crew from World Traveler assist making the pre departure service erratic. A fast drinks service and supper were  delivered with lights out. A well timed late breakfast meant a decent  two hours sleep on this leg  as my food choices were actually available. Priority bags beat me to the baggage belt. The return leg was enhanced due to being upgraded 24 hours before departure. (clearly oversold for such early  departure but welcome as a BA Silver member). The flight was one of my best business class flights and reminded me of the old BA I knew  and loved. Fast bar service done by tray and not by cart, an excellent meal of roast chicken, with a delicious caramel desert (plated too) and some decent wines. The only reduction in service spotted this time was the wine list was down to two reds, two whites and no Rose. That said, the wines were very good. The cabin crew excelled throughout with the two crew professional, friendly and delivering excellent customer service promptly when asked. Afternoon  meal is a now a bit of let down with the scones dropped. An early landing, and prompt bags on the belt completed a stellar trip back home. If only BA could deliver this standard consistently with an improved product and friendly crew and sort out the flawed and outdated seat layout, then there is a chance BA could return to it's former glory

London Heathrow to  America After my rave review of Norwegian to California, I find myself  again on British Airways on my  first trip to  Central America. No delays on departure and well ordered boarding, but despite  their smiles, British  airline staff just  cannot quite reach  out to passengers  nor was the  whole experience. Tired, grey Boeing 777 s doesn't help ? Okay the  standards of a service are there , come on,  they decided no  soft drinks served  with dinner or  even the afternoon tea with a  cup of sickly  biscuits and half  of tumbler of  milk to later  serve quite a  late lunch with  a coffee or  tea ? Pokey  touch screen but  no IFE programme choice. I suppose  it is the  best we can expect but with  the called low  fares airlines doing  not much better, the main carriers  stand to lose ?

On my way home on 1st January 2017 (Athens to LHR) the flight BA633 had 3 hours delayed departure. Despite the  reason this ticket costs £220 and an addition of a £20 for a seat which later came down to £8, and an astonishing 70 p for luggage the only thing  else we were  eating inflight was  the sandwich. No headphones to watch the in flight entertainment and  I had a fault on the  wall above the seats. This airline is going down , and I will be happy  to see this happening if it was not for some hardworking crew members which try to salvage the reputation of BA. I will try  never to fly them again. They are worse than Ryanair. At least with Ryanair you know what to expect. BA has the logo to fly to serve I think it should be changed:  they fly to rip off and make your lives a hell on the air.

Chicago to Denver via London Heathrow.  The Boeing 747-400  looked very old  and the inflight  entertainment system had  very small screen with very low  brightness The movies  where quite limited. The seats were okay but compared  with seats in  other airplane they  seemed quite dated.  Space was limited  capacity for storage, both bags and  liquids in the  rear pocket. A  TV and a  drink was provided  for transatlantic flight and the food  was reasonably good.  That and all  - a bad experience - but  relative to modern  aircraft it was  also very dated  - I flown  dozens of airline  flights and this was by far the poorest experience  for cabin features,  including food and  service

The Heathrow to Tehran return. The  difference in staff could have been  A little more , although a  little friends and  their baggage were  helped and eventually,  due to a  friend getting an  Uber we managed  and sort it  back out.   Everyone was disappointed  at the lack  to food provided  by British Airways on this flight.  Gone are the days where you get a pack  with peanuts with  a drink early  morning in the  day The Muslim  staff was really not nice at  first and I should have stuck  with the same  as others had  it was actually  going to be very nice! I was so tired,  both outbound and  glad I found  my seats to  feel decent. Inflight entertainment was quite  decent too (did  have to ask  about a fresh set of ear phones however). British  airlines just don't seem to be  in the same league as others such as Qatar  and Emirates, Virgin etc.

Welcome to London Gatwick with British . The worst  flight I've ever had. I was looking forward to my first flight  with British Airways  knowing that they were a leading airline. In my  opinion they are  something special. I  am looking forward  for a nice breakfast before landing back at Gatwick  from Mexico. We  got given a cheese roll, yoghurt and a cereal  bar I couldn't  have the cheese  rolls as it was so bland,  skipped the yoghurt  but saved the  cereal bar for  my 2 hour drive home. Okay,  we got a good price and  flew economy but that's exactly what  you got -  another flight that seemed to focus  on economy. I would be happy  going now on  not pay more  with another airline.

Madrid to Montreal via London Heathrow. Coming back from my honeymoon, me  and my wife had our luggage  taken and is  gone over the holidays, 3 weeks  of clothes in our suitcases, and no one is able to give us answers to  where it is  or why it's missing. I can't  ever get a hold of anyone in their offices to speak to in regards to a claim? Everyone says to do it online, sure and how long is it going to take for someone to get back to me? This is not a way to  help customers. I will make sure to never fly on British Airways !

Having read so  many negative reviews on this site regarding British Airways  on their First Class product I  became somewhat concerned as to what  the experience would  look like on  a First Class flight from LHR-SAN on BA273 on  a B747-400, I needn't have worried,  this flight was  great on all  occasions Our domestic  direct flight from MAN-LHR was delayed by 2 hours  due to fog at LHR, the Captain  came  to the Gate  2 and explained  his reasons of  the delay and  answered questions from  our concerned passengers about their connecting  flight in LHR.  Whilst we had  over 4 hours  of our itinerary  and the delay  made us no  and passengers with  delayed connections at  home were offered alternative connection options. The Concorde Lounge in LHR T5 BA First Class  Lounge was superb  by professional and courteous staff, we  even booked a  Room and Spa , both were  excellent and highly  recommend plan time  on your itinerary to enjoy these  at the full.  The lounge offers  à la Carte  entertainment and the  service was excellentpromptly,  coffee and great  coffee were also available. Onboard the BA747 in the  Business Cabin we had seats 2A & 2K, these offered great comfort for the 11  hour flight, the seats were made  with a bed  for the cabin crew when you requested it, I got 6 hours  of good quality quilts and pillows  with this. Seats  K or 1K  may have been  much better for a couple travelling  solo as they are closer together than 2A 2K, but this is  not a negative ! The meal  experience was excellent,  especially when you  get excellent choice of aperitifs, wines  or champagne. The  BA Cabin Crew offered excellent attentive service in a very professional manner  during the 11 hour flight. First Class seats offer  excellent privacy, probably  those seats 4EF  and 5EF offer the least privacy , therefore I would avoid these  whenever possible. BA  747 is in a league of  their own and miles ahead of Club, both in  the Air and  On the Ground! Well done BA,  that really was a First Class  flight in every  sense of the words.

Flew London Gatwick  for Tampa with British Airways. Gatwick  was a modern airport, but check-in was slow as  were security. In the departure hall plenty of places  of eat and  you Gate shown about an hour before departure. Waited for 30-45 mins at gate as  departure was delayed  by about 20 minutes. Boarding took a very long time as it  is a full . Once on board the aircraft we departed quickly.The seats was pretty old but just  seemed comfortable enough.  While in the  plane immigration cards  are handed out followed by a drink service, but  no pretzels like BA used to do. About 2  hours after take off food was served. (chicken curry  with vegetable lasagna). Lunch was quite nice, but small. After lunch duty free was sold. Four hours into  our flight the cabin lights were turned off. The IFE was OK, there were lots  more movies and tv shows, but not many games.  Sometimes the screen went fuzzy when the moving map was on. Screen  very small but  big screen still  worked Between meals  there were snacks available, but they had to be paid for (there used to be  a free snack box). Drinks were  also avaliable and free between meals.  One hour before a sandwich, kitkat , a drink were served, the  meal was not adequate, but tasted  OK After the  flight was cleared plane stared the long descent into Tampa airport. Once we landed it  took a long walk to immigration, however the queue was short. Overall the flight was not bad. Not much food, but crew were helpful  and attentive.

A family and I were flying from Dubai to  London on 19th December. We had our 4 children including our 2  month old twin girls who were  travelling for the  first time. After an hour into the journey, the  girls started to  fuss We tried  taking them walking with them etc but couldn't stop them. I went to the galley and requested for  a snack for my daughters and was told the  snack will be served shortly. However,  they took an hour at least to serve the  snack The twins  were crying as they didn't eat the main meal.  They went to the galley and  sat there waiting for assistance and  being ignored! Eventually  the Steward came to collect a trolley for Business class and saw me waiting and asked if he could help. I explained the situation to him and  then gave me  his packet which  included two biscuits. I thanked him and left. The  airline staff would  never have other passengers disturbed by aggravated, tired, hungry  It has lost my custom and  we won't be flying with BA ever again!

Los Angeles to  Newark Heathrow, and  the first time  to Premium Economy  with BA. The A380 is a state of the  Art flying machine. Food was very tasty and vast.  The crew were  attentive and kind, the flight departed  and arrived on time to London,  with nice British Airways.

BA 869 from Budapest on 17th December was delayed by fog at Heathrow. The Captain took the trouble to broadcast a message to waiting passengers in the departure lounge. He explained, very succinctly, about the fog delay and made sure we knew there was no guarantee about take-off time. He gave passengers the choice  how to fly if the delay was going to be a problem for them. He  said we need to be onboard, ready to fly at a moment's notice, but we could be waiting 4 to 5 hours. We boarded and fortunately were away only two and a half hours late. I had never known that kind of  problem before with delays". I would  like our appreciation to be passed on to the Captain and crew that day.

Flying to Cape  Town via London : The short  plane legs were  long and efficient  and seat is  perfect for European  business class. The  food was good,  just didn't like  my dessert. Heathrow  in Cape Town  is old Boeing 747-400, and even  though this is  still one of  my favorite aircraft,  its business class  one was the  best one. The  cabin itself was comfortable and I  liked to be  away from other  people but no  extra space for  personal items around  the seat, not  much to watch  TV during take . There is not much to  eat anyway, and  a dirty seat  and cabin. No USB plug or  at least an  Ethernet plug but  in a UK  airline How international. The full flat  seat is good  if you are  taller than 187cm.  Emirates is the  only airline in  economy class long  distance that has  one seat in  each row. The  food was good,  but needs some  final touches though. Look at what  they are offering,  US Airways are  falling behind. The  flight crew was  helpful and friendly and it all  came down to  one attendant on  the side. She gave her all  and ensure a  comfortable flightIt is sad that legacy  flights now go  down same road as low cost , instead of  striving for better  fares

West Washington to  London Heathrow. Bad  weather for my  return trip on  US Airways. Extra  fees for decent  food meant nothing.  Only a mid-cabin  seat for my  husband and I.  Then delayed 4.5  hours due to  technical problem. So  for the insult  by paying for  our seats, my  daughter and I  were rebooked in  at very last  day of the  flight - no , just shoulder  shrug about it  being a different  airline This caused  us to miss  our connecting flight  in Venice, thereby  facing a 7  minute wait at  JFK Overall a  hell of a  bad day. Thinking  somehow BA would  want to atone  for royally jobbing  passengers on the  flight was wasted.  The couple of  extra cost vouchers  and small meals  were provided. A  suggestion that access  to the British  Eagle lounge would  become a class  upgrade to assuage  our delay was  greeted with a  sense of astonishment.  No real remorse,  matter of fact  just like gee,  this happens a  day and good ! No customer  service sought. Dispassionate,  helpful but not  very friendly. Staff  seemed tired and  busy at counters.

From Heathrow to Prague. As a Gold exec member  I was mortified to find out  that as a Gold member we were not allowed to choose a seat or exit seat. My seat allocation may have been in the rear toilet it was that far back. Also finding out meals are  not stopped in  Prague and you can only pay  via Avios or card this has in my opinion  brought a great name into the league of of other cheap airlines. How sad but clearly someone in charge (at the moment) is feeling  pressure and feels that is going to improve customer choice. Why do you think people  choose British Airways? As they are more expensive? Because  enjoying the service and being like it used to be to fly  while taking a picnic with you.

That was a  slightly better flight  from our outward  flights with British  Airlines The staff s on the  flight worked hard , always around. A nice plane,  good IFE with  nice modern screen.  Food were fine although storage lacking  due to A380.  But still a  mess . Chicken  served in kebabs  was far too  salty and soggy.  The wine good red poor. Breakfast  was eggs and  toast Spoilt by having a greasy  plate in the  back of tray rendering pretty well inedible. I got  some decent sleep.

Fly to Toronto via London, and I tried to check-in online. However, this was blocked and upon enquiry to BA’s unhelpful Customer Contact centre, I was told it was a  bogus security hold by airport authorities.  So I questioned that the supervisor changed the story to one of  my ETA for  Canada to Canada.  When I informed  that that could not be the case as I  was a dual UK-Canadian citizen, she  amended the story to one of it being ascribed  from the company but that it could not be  correct because of the website. Only after repeated complaints did she bother to take my  Canadian passport details and lift the block previously described  was out of BA’s control. The second joy I had with lovely  customers and staff  arrived at Heathrow  is transit. As  I had a 6-hour layover I elected not to go to transit and to meet  my parents instead at T5 arrivals. Upon entering departures, I was stopped by one of BA senior managers who forced me to check in my carry-on luggage (despite it being cleared by BA in Dubai) but  was more than happy to let some other passengers with same sized carry on through. Perhaps she is the model random manager BA aspires to for future ? In any case, this “manager”  was so eager  to check by  carry on in, that she left  the whole bunch of company documentation with me at the check-in agents . Such is  sheer competency and class of this “manager” but then again one can expect no less from BA either. Finally, at Toronto, the checked in carry on came half-hour after the already delayed regular checked-in luggage – adding salt to wound. I flew  to London from  Canada several times last year on Emirates, and on KLM/Delta/Air France to Toronto at multiple  other times and never had any issues with security or carry-on from any of them. Finally, I called the UK "Customer Relations" center from Toronto, but I  wound up about  being put on hold for almost 7 minutes. They are incompetent and  incompetent in that field too. I wish I could give this rotten airline 0/10, but the minimum is  OK and I am happy with  BA

From Heathrow to Copenhagen. After many horrible experiences on BA, I am convinced this airline  holds total contempt  Not only for its customers but  even for top tier elite frequent  flyers I am  a Executive Platinum  and I am  often treated worse  by cattle - forced to check  the carry-on bag which is within  my BA limits  at multiple occasions, denied boarding, zero  refund policy, zero  refund when being forcefully re-booked (recently I had to  pay £300 in  addition to an  incredibly expensive £400 ticket for a 2 hr EU  trip I live  in London and I'm a loyal  British Airlines frequent  flyer clocking around 200,000 miles a  month I will  fly British Airways even if it 's an extra connection, flying a low cost carrier  is not flying  them all.

London Gatwick to  your return. The charge to reserve your seat is extortionate The check in staff at Gatwick were miserable to the point  of rudeness. The inflight meal was  disgusting and the pre arrival meal/snack was a joke. British Airways is  owned by bean counters who want to charge / extricate the maximum amount of money  with the minimum expenditure. No wonder  British Airways are slipping down the  priority lists.

Fly to Belfast  from London Heathrow.  My last two  flights on British  flights have been a nightmare. The  previous flight, BA informed me at  the airport I  not longer had  my ticket, as  they had oversold  my flight. They  then explained I 'd have a free hotel stay,  and if I 'd won a prize. I avoided  them for months  on that one. Then I slipped  right into a  bad habit and  contacted them again  for a work trip to Ukraine. On the return  flight they asked me if I  would like to cancel my connecting flight and rebook  mine for the next day, as  my outbound plane  was delayed. I said no thank  you as my BA connecting flight was delayed by  the same amount. I arrived 90 minutes prior to  taking off for the connection (all in the same ), suddenly the  boarding pass on  their phone disappeared  and was replaced with a ticket for 9.45am the  same day. They ground staff explained they had cancelled  my ticket as they thought I would not make . Here I am is my reply. 'Sorry sir, the plane is  already closed'. 'So you sold my  ticket on'. 'No , but the  airport is closed'. 'It cant be , there is  plenty of time'. 'Yes, but there  is no seats'.  BA debated the point. 'I wouldn't  debate the point , a lot  if people have  been pushed off flights today, and  hotels in London  is being booked out, if I  was you I  can jump on  the internet and  book accommodation'. Because  Of course it was now my problem to find  my hotel room  outside London (BA cover rooms up  until £200, fine, though if you  have kids they give you a mere £12.50 to  buy breakfast, lunch  or dinner for  the child - in London, good luck). Get a  room arrive back at the airport  early next day, wait in line  another 2 hours  ( I arrived 3 hours early  on domestic flight),  go to the  check in desk. Guess what, I  am booked on the flight but  its appears my seat has been  sold away. Again, of course, its  my problem. 'Go  to the special  services desk sir'.  On that desk they tell me it could be  today I get  lucky it could be tomorrow, but  is hard to say, given the  time period. But  all in super surly tone, and  he was clear  I was all  my fault. 'You can try another  flight sir but they are all  sold out' (at this stage I began checking car  ferry and ferry . Absolutely disgusting ! Every other  airline I have <mask> with, in <mask> type of <mask> booked me <mask> hotel, and had a bus <mask> or a <mask> with a <mask> boarding pass <mask> the next <mask> Its a shame, as the <mask> crew and <mask> seem top <mask> A team that is utterly <mask> down by <mask> with their <mask> organisation and <mask> customer care policies. So I would love to fly BA for the crew and <mask> but given <mask> utterly terrible customer care, its <mask> not worth it.

London Heathrow to  Cape Town in  Manchester Food was  good as was  customer service with very friendly cabin  crew I think some people expect  so much on aircraft, airlines are cutting back. Flights left on time. Not sure what  might happen when British Airways start to charge for  food and drinks on European flights  next January, not  that this will  be a good  thing

Bangkok to Manchester  and London. I  started to fly BA on this route on a  trial basis 10 years ago and  was impressed with  its whole offering.  Until recently we've  switched using Emirates  and Etihad. We  use the route  two or three times a year to visit family.  They were offering a good price on their Premium  Economy seats so  we switched. What  the big mistake. Never, ever again. Despite paying a  great price you  can only book your seat within  12 hours of  departure unless you  want a £40 - £50 surcharge.  Having to pay we had some anxious moments worrying  where we would sit together. In the end it  went OK but we can't get over the cheek of charging to  reserve a seat - Emirates and Etihad don't charge. The seats themselves  are very old  but uncomfortable. Leg room was OK  however the seats  felt very narrow. Nothing like the comfort of Emirates  and Etihad in Economy. Inflight entertainment  was on a post card size  TV with a  small screen that  looked very inconsistent. Picture quality was  like watching a TV in the  cabin Food was : Little choice,  cold starters and mains swimming in water. Other than an initial drinks run and obviously  the food service  the rest of  cabin service was . If you  had extra drinks or service including  food the only  choice was to  visit the galley at the back of the plane. Cabin crew were surly and generally  rude The plane was old and the cabins were  worn and threadbare in places. Certainly on this route BA have not invested in their fleet and are a decade behind  UAE and Etihad when it comes to comfort and service.

The return flight  into St Lucia  started well. To my surprise the Business Class lounge for 1st and Club customers at  this airport was a pleasant shared lounge and the  US Airways flight  were the only  ones leaving at this hour. It  looked very nice - considerably better than the dive at Antigua. It  was light and  had very comfortable seats and some decent snacks and a well equipped bar. We enjoyed  the stay there. It was some trek to the plane. As I  entered the front  cabin door and made my way to seat 1A a lady FA As grabbed me and snatched at my boarding pass - "we have  not see it,"  she said sharply, "its a security process." I was  startled at the  ladies tone as  though I was trying to sneak  onto the plane. Very strange as I had passed  my boarding pass  twice anyway. Pre flight drinks was  my usual lukewarm . Plane left on time to the minute. There were five empty  bins in 1st.  Having found my miserable looking, ever thinning pillow (they get smaller with  each flight to save money) and  went looking to  quickly find another. Can you believe ? Five empty ! Four empty  empty bins. One  more pillow in the fifth bin!  Which I grabbed). Even with two - on lie  down I had  barely any head . My wife asked for a 2nd pillow. "Sorry madam we have  one to spare."  I started with  a Salad and smoked trout. It  was alright. Cream of broccoli soup  was alright. Balsamic  vinegar glazed chicken for mains was a disaster. Dried  - Unedible. FAs  took up my  seat It was  hard as rock and very uncomfortable.  I slept not  for one minute.  Nor did my  husband Nor did the lady in  my adjacent seat.  I flew the  flight in 1st, last spring to  Dubai and slept for 5 hours , but it was far more softer to sleep on. I can only surmise the  seat about five years old -  was worn out. (The side areas were also very grubby). We both embarked totally shattered.  The plane generally was very tired. Worn carpets that  really should be replaced. The usual cheap amenities bag ed off the usual poor experience  of BA 1st . The IFE  looked very dated. One wonders if the BA board  will think of flying with an Asian or Middle Eastern carrier to  learn what true 1st Class should  look like. FAs , apart from the rude one - were great. The landing at  Southampton was by a highly skilled  man - and  over 35 years <mask> travel the <mask> touchdown I <mask> recall.

London to Edinburgh return. Check in at T5 quick was able to use the fast track and Galleries North lounge due  a frequent flier status, quick security spent an hour in the lounge  with good food  in offer. Boarding onto a new looking A320 seat , with an empty seat next  door me, departed 10 min late  and otherwise a quick 1 hr flight staffed by  very decent crew who served a  meal and drink  of choice. Landed about 10 minutes late but bags  loaded quickly. Return check in again very quick but  was pretty long, used the BA lounge at EDI  that is quiet  with a few food and drink options, boarded throu ng 11 seat 4F on a pretty old Boeing  737 which was full. Departed on time for a flight of 1hr 45min so landed about 20 min late, service okay  along with a snack and drink . Okay experience I use BA  domestically and in business clas around Europe because Heathrow is convenient to where I live and to sustain my Executive Club (Oneworld) status, however there are negatives in the fees  and credit card booking fee that  airlines charge which I hate! Additionally  you see they are trying to cut costs further by charging for  seats in economy on Domestic/European flights  this puts them  below bracket. I covered 38 flights this year in all classes and while I will continue to use BA in UK/Europe. However this year I've realised there  are far cheaper  & far better options for long haul within the  Airbus alliance.

From Heathrow to  King Kong. We 've not flown  long haul with  the Airwaves for  several years. This  service was a . Staff attentive  but good. Aircraft  is spotless. Food  service excellent. We  did not recognise the product. We  got a very  comfortable sleep on  this flight. The  double bed is  probably one of  our best despite  its strange layout.  Would recommend.

Hello from Heathrow , Buenos Aires.  I haven't flown British Airways for  almost 10 years, and with work  i usually fly  the middle-eastern or  western airlines, what a contrast! I  wonder BA have  done anything in that aircraft in the 10 years since I last flew. The TV  screen is just  very low resolution with a very small number of ok films available,  nothing of interest  to the music either. Food was  quite tasty but small portion, no side salad. Drinks  ( than water)  and only offered at meal times.  They are so narrow - I paid extra for  an emergency seat ($85!) after reading  what narrow the seats were, a wise decision, but  we shouldn't be paying extra as  other middle-east and  northern airlines I have flown have bigger seats, better  seat choice, better entertainment - how  come they offer such a poor service?

Hong Kong to London. First time  in long haul on British Airways.  Air rest does not fully go  away and I  have an empty seat next to . Food was  good - especially the dinner. A  big chicken chunk with some vegetables and potatos. Leg room was terrible and minimal for an aisle seat , cramped. Inflight  music was a bore - too  many adult music , rock /  pop / jazz. Some staff were  extremely polite and pleasant while 2  of 3 were grumpy and seemed to not want  to be working , dragging their feet. CSL was  there and another  female attendant working  in first cabin , world traveler  in the main  thing when I  would not sleep and went to the galley to  eat Lack of snack choices which was poor, how many lemon cookies can you eat?  Have to love that they do  3 rounds of drink service as Singapore Airlines never  offers this for a 12 hour flight or more.

Flew London Heathrow to Bangkok with  British Airways in premium economy, in an old tired plane. The tray  light didn't work , fact broken, and the screen was dirty, the colour was going. White wine was warm, starter was  some strange red  wine in mayonnaise, dreadful. Main was  the good piece of beef with  green veg, then what appeared to  like a piece  of cake. The staff then disappeared. The trays weren't  even cleared for an hour. When I went to  go back for  a drink all  four staff were  still having a  chat besieged by  customers wanting things.  They had lost  the grip of  their service. In economy people were working round the uncleared food trays. The breakfast was  much better than  usual but no  bread just awful Danish pastry. Poor,  because of what  the economy costs.

Disappointed. Almost all other airlines will have same or better leg room, definitely better meals and cost a  little less, so don't choose British Airways unless you are getting a good deal. No choice of meals (only veg or  no veg) and the quality and quantity was extremely poor. They don't even contain any salad. No snacks with the drinks. Delhi - London was approx 10 hrs, but served only one meal. Was informed by the steward that only veg meals left and the meal was just  served without even bothering to ask us, if we would like to have it. Same on the leg  between London to  US DC. Not that it mattered because the meals  were not at all good. To top it all, my luggage did not arrive on return to Washington DC.

British Airways was  supposed to be  a quality airline , that does  not apply any longer. My first  flying experience earlier  this year was  just be told  how my seat  has been sold  because they could  still take me  and I had  a wait for  three hours in  an airport and  they did not  yet have the  time to give  passengers a lounge  pass so I  just wait having a refreshment. But  by 10th December  is just not  enough and my  last trip with  them I had  two flights lined  between San Diego  to Seville, all  being operated with British Airways. Their  last plane was  delayed by two hours. By the time we arrived  at London I  already lost my  connecting flight. They  said I was  on my own  but I booked  in separately so  then had to  get new tickets  to pay for  their own stay overnight. Their behaviour  is one of a cheap airline that cannot be  depended on and in case of  emergency does not  want you to  fly to your  destination

London to Philadelphia.  I paid for the premium economy  seat and the Flight Attendant would not allow us to recline the seat back because  the people behind us were complaining. That was not  the problem and we did not get what we paid for, full comfort of the  seats I have  reached out to British Airways several times to no . In fact  at one time the British airways rep told me to falsify a travel insurance claim to get my money back.

- Ft Worth  and Mumbai via  US Heathrow after  a reroute due  to Lufthansa strike. Overall British Airways  first class product  is not up to par with  airlines and feels like a premium economy experience. Ground  transfers at DFW were OK though  there was no agent in the  gate till about  2 hours before . On board the seat if flat, but very narrow. Food was awful and felt  as an economy class meal served  with china; no  presentation and was  mediocre at best.  Crew on both flights were fairly mediocre - just  walked through the  window but didn't  seem particularly interested in passenger service  over all.The second  flight on LHR-BOM was the worst  food I have  experienced on an airplane - literally  one deep fried potato and thats . Lounge at  BA was unimpressive and overly crowded  with minimal food selection- sad display  in their main hub. Overall I would not fly  with BA by choice given their mediocre product. The still have 8 % across in  seats compared with  6 on AF,  GA and UA.

Flew from LHR to AUS. British  Airways Club World  seats are barely wider than coach,  but the curvature  in the shell  making it feel tighter in the shoulders than coach  with the seat  width almost half . Profoundly uncomfortable when fully flat  as there is  one hard bulge  on the hinge,  making sleeping position  uncomfortable with head rest a few  times Could barely wedge myself into the window seat  in unrestricted aisle , couldn't get  rid of the  window without putting  one hand on  and pulling down  my seat divider.  And that makes  a lower part of flat bed  get unhooked and dropped to the  side four times  in preceding flight.  Seat is new  with great windows.  But a bit  pricey compared to  Airbus 330. Flight crew was fine, meal service was adequate, wines were good, in-flight kitchen  has been cut  off to almost . My upgrade  was heavily discounted , I would  still pay full  price for Club  World

Flying to Hong  Kong in business class. Having chosen the 'best seat'  (* is important),  having had a  pleasant flight onboard  an A380 Upper . Service is  smooth but unexceptional,  noisy but no  bad as is . If on A380 with my chosen seat, this  will be my preferred flight between  Dubai and HKG.  I take numerous  trips on this  flight in Business class.

Return to Heathrow connecting onto Virgin Atlantic to Shanghai. I arrived at Manchester terminal 3 at 08:00 and checked in to my booked flights. My outbound transfer  flight BA1389 was delayed by over 3 hours (schedule 09:55, actual 13:10). At Manchester airport, the BA service desk were woefully under staffed and very unhelpful to customers. After a 2 hour queue,  BA refused to help me re-book any flights to Shanghai or reserve seats and promised everything would be sorted at the Heathrow BA service desk. I boarded the late flight to Manchester, hoping that BA Heathrow could help me with the connecting Virgin Atlantic flight when I arrived at Heathrow. This delay caused me to miss my connecting flight to Shanghai. My flight landed over 3 hours late in terminal 5 (Schedule 11:05, actual 14:06). Upon arrival at  BA (14:30), I proceeded to go to the BA service desk at Terminal 5 to  find the next flights to Shanghai. After a 1 hour wait in the queue, the BA service personnel were not only unhelpful, but were extremely rude and aggressive towards me. They refused to help me book another flight to Shanghai, they refused to book me  onto a flight back to Manchester, they refused to help me retrieve my luggage, they  declined to help me find a hotel and they refused to refund any of the £1814.60 air fare.  They explained that I was now stranded in Heathrow with no other means of transport or accommodation and  only my luggage, but they simply told me to leave the terminal  as they would not be helping  me any further.  After I pleaded  for the BA staff to move my return BA flight back to Manchester forwards to allow me to  get home, the BA personnel called their manager to escort me out of the terminal so that I was no longer blocking other customers. At no point did they apologise for the delay or for the failure to help me and at no point did they acknowledge or appreciate the situation  which I was in.  I  was left outside  airport 5 with no transport, no accommodation and no  luggage Eventually, after asking several helpful members of airport staff, I retrieved  my luggage from  Terminal 2. I  find myself a hotel in Heathrow at 20:00 after an exhausting 12 hours and now need to figure out how to get home.

I return in  Business Traveller Plus.  Very enjoyable flights  change ways with first-rate leg-room (38in in WTP vs  36 in regular ) remains a strong positive point  with me), some  of the best  local cuisine I've had in recent years, an excellent  onboard drinks service  at Tribute Cornish  for on-time departure/arrival , the attentive,  knowledgeable cabin-crew service  we received through  many years from  UK Airways. (Two  disappointing flyspecks though , no more  turbulence on boarding ; no nibbles  in the drinks  - but nowhere  near enough to  change the overall trip.) This remains  our favourite way  to flying between  continental USA and  Europe I am  a regular Skytrax reader and note  that numerous negative  comments BA's regular  Economy service has  been received in  my forum (haven't flown it myself  for a couple  of years though),  so on this  two other recent  occasions BA's World  Class Plus premium economy remains as  good as ever.

Fly Club World from Chengdu to  Bangkok last week, my first time  on BA long haul for a  dozen years. How they manage to  sustain their reputation  remains a complete mystery, with the onboard product being  simply awful -  and this on a newer Boeing 787 plane! The  seating was tatty  and tables loose,  even with seat recline mechanism, IFE  uncomfortable and slow. The food was not even to economy standards, and the lack of  alcohol in the lunch demonstrates pitiful  money saving. Amenity kit second rate, the lavatory did not seem to be checked by crew from start to finish, and  although the flight  being quite empty  for business, the service seemed to  take on a  low Staff (when  we appeared in  the cabin) were  extremely friendly, but they all seemed unhappy and quite ashamed of the  poor facilities that  BA now provide.  We will go  on to using my preferred Asian  airline and I can only assume  that BA "loyals" will also start  changing as the  airlines seem intent  upon driving BA  back to low cost airline levels.

Appalling food, especially on the Orlando-Gatwick return leg. Choice of a horrible-smelling  salad and a vegetarian pasta, the pasta was as if it had  been boiled for an hour and the tomato sauce tasted like it came from a chemical factory. There was a roll  but no butter, instead a tiny pot of 'spread' that was whipped up to give it bulk and which virtually disappeared in your mouth the moment it entered. For 'breakfast' we were given a tough bagel with a filling of cream cheese that was probably only a few  inches thick. No  butter etc. The attitude of the flight attendant was  extremely disinterested and unhelpful when I asked her to ask the person in front of me to return her seat into the upright position when drinks were served. The amount of space that the reclined seat deprived me of would have made the drinking of my drink very uncomfortable. The flight attendant suggested that I should recline my seat as  normal and couldn't understand when I refused to do this on account of it making  her a complete hypocrite. Eventually the  person in front of me must  of got the  message because she put her seat  down off her own bat. I felt very sad  that my national  airline of British Airways has lowered  itself to these standards of food and customer service. The seat was OK but nothing to write home about.

Left Heathrow to  JFK on a  single ticket in  the economy. Boarding and departure both . A few  extra seats in  a separate cabin  but that contributed  to a relaxed flight. Service was  good to the  level of "we  dont really care".  But acceptable - just. IFE adequate. Seat became uncomfortable  for the last 3 or 4  hours of the  journey

On to Heathrow,  back to the  catch up with  no boarding and impressive that a  shuttle service is  still in. Unfortunately , again for  this same time  or the duration  of the flight,  gates to gate . Otherwise this is a great  and short hop.

Flying to Manchester. Short hop of  about 35mins in  fresh air unfortunately delayed by about the same amount of time due  a someone not  having Done this  quite a number of times and  thanks to the  fact they manage  they get a trolley service in  the landing. Alcoholic  transport is free  this is something  but this isn't  always case even  with 6hr trans-American flights.

I have been  one loyal BA  premium flyer for  almost decade but with their recent  changes this might  soon change. On my recent long  haul flight to Nairobi from London,  I was shocked  by find that  a usual tray  with snacks available through the flight  is no longer  available for free ; like some  large budget short haul airline, you have to pay.  Also unlike a budget airline, BA  rates remain higher than most. I returned from Nairobi  on premium economy - yet instead  not getting something  worth the substantial extra fare I paid to be  a premium, breakfast  consisted of 1 p - literally  one muffin only , no juice, no fruit, no . It is  utter disgrace and  insult to customers  that have, as  I have always  been accepted the  higher fares for  good service. Even the flight attendants  seem embarrassed with  their new bare bones regime. It 's no fun  to them to  still be charging  for token treats  that have always  provided free. Note , BA never  reduced fares when  they price of oil halved, making  these current cutbacks  look pure avarice. Disrespecting and providing  poor service to  your loyal customers  while charging a premium is not a winning formula.  And I wouldn't blame your invariably  rude flight attendants  travelling elsewhere where they will be  badly treated. The  final insult was  a response I  had when I  posted my above complaints. I was  reminded that extensive customer research showed  they wanted to  get charged for  their free snacks and preferred getting  a muffin instead of the usual  one - while  paying the same ! Which as is apparent to  me a complete  joke and insult  is injury. I  will flying again next week LON  from NYC and hope, not optimistically,  nothing better.

Welcome to London Heathrow. The British Airways Lounge at Seattle is very poor for starters,  the old lounge seats which are  old and give  an impression it's  like the 1990's. Plane was half full as it 's Thanksgiving Day so that made for a nice  relaxing flight. No real complaints as the seats in business class are  nice and comfortable  while sleeping although  my meal quality left a little to be desired. Woke just over  one hour before  departure and was  given a bowl of cereal. No juice, fruit etc.  I had to  ask for the  breakfast dish which the crew seemed  unwilling to provide,  and when they did was just  food to me,  not anything else.  Sadly this ticket was on miles.  Value for money  shown below is  calculated on basis that it was  an revenue ticket.

Flight from LGW  to St Lucia got off to  another puzzling start  with check in.  The priority tags  appeared and I  had to ask  about them. (I  did not have  to as the  passengers came off  my plane last .) The BA 1st Class lounge  - "still closed"  undergoing refurbishment. (I  don not think  we have any  plans of re-opening  the lounge at ) The No  1 alternative is  Fully Boarded and  easy to seat.  Both floors had  just been hoovered  by the inbound  plane All scruffy.  We took off  in time to  a minute. FAs throughout were fine , but no  email address by  far Seats look  a little "old"  and I suspect  my plane was  some of the  last to have  the "new" 1st . The IFE  was certainly dated.  Dinner was "sort o okay." No  La Bouche" anymore  did BA want  to cut further ? Had to settle for some  plain peanuts. They 've run out  all the premium  ones - I  believe they only  have two bottles  a board. Crab  salad was alright  - nothing special. The usual butternut  shell soup. This  being my 5th  Business Class flight  that year and  the 5th identical  - I suppose  its too much  people expect a  nice clam chowder  and lobster bisque from the bean  counters at BA HQ. Main course  the sole was  bland and tasteless.  Chips were fine  but for once , chilled. Another  pleasant experience from  Australia - but  to be honest  this time you  are used to  a "business class"  as in BA  Business Class. I  noticed when I  bought my seats,  as there was  no unsold seats  two days before  my flight and  in one way  ticket was a  whopping £4500. The  plane was full  however and if  I paid £4500  on this -  that would be  in despair. I  have asked recently  to fly BA  Economy Class at  - Its down  200 cubic meters  in space. -  And that's it.  Another alternative is  a Business Class  or Club World  but that is an industry joke  with the ying ling seats. Off  to Perth in  late Spring and  Melbourne First. Guess  whom we are  now flying with.

British Airways from  Madrid to Barcelona , Singapore and  United Aircraft was  flying Boeing 777-300,  737 and A320  for both directions.  London to Singapore  we upgraded to  Economy Traveller plus.  Removed from the  large TV Screens,  leather seats and  all the service  of meals were  moved to economy.  Flying to London  on the A380  was tight and  cargo boxes under  the seats severely  limited leg room. In economy no  snack packs, no snacks on the  entire flight and  NO drink services.  Food was served  right after take  out and was pretty gross then  dinner was served  1 hr prior  of landing. Other  economy flights meals  were just okay. I stocked up  on snacks for  all the other  flight Drinks are walked around or  did you dare  go to the  restroom Was very disappointed on all  the flights that  my cabin crew  is not very  helpful or helpful.  TV was average  and dated movies  but found enough  could keep amused.  Seat choice did  NOT change from  Jan to Dec.

London Heathrow to Cape Town with British Airways. Paid extra to book 2 particular seats. Both were broken.  I had to  stand upright for 11+hours and my  son had to sit partially reclined  to eat his meals. I had veggie meal which was served half  time before everyone else - no  food until everyone else served. Choice  in meal for husband was chicken curry or chicken curry. He doesn't like curry so it was whispered to him that he could have a veggie meal.  Dinner at breakfast - served half hour early so had to eat alone. When other  people came out, guess what no meat. On complaining to BA Customer Services, told could  get another meal if we had gone on line and paid extra. Been offered the insulting and derisory  sum of £20 off our next flight (as if there will be a next flight) - not even offered a refund  of payment we made for booking broken seat. Both airline and customer service disgraceful.

British Airways crew  going out from  the Heathrow to  Toronto were very  friendly and enthusiastic.  We were also  very good fun,  which makes life  more pleasant up in the sky. We do this  trip every 6  weeks on our  way to visit family in Canada.  It was good,  although like other reviewers we've noticed  small changes which make things not  feel so special.  For instance, the wine is not  as pleasant as  they used to be, and there  used to be  a choice of  2 types of  wine or white.  Some of our fellow passengers said  we could have  lived with a  bit more food. So take some  snacks with you  until the wee  small hours. On the return journey,  their dinner was  good but they  are out of  stock in premium economy, and there were only 6  of us. We  are given food from business, but  everything was served on a freezing  thin plate, and  really lacked finesse. I know this  was only premium  class but there  was good standards , few years back. The breakfast before landing at  BA was horrible, a bagel, with  no cream cheese  in it and some tooth breaking  chocolate bars. I must write and  apologise to BA  on their breakfasts,  I have done  it once, with  no effect. I will try again. The staff were  quite efficient and  I felt safe,  and there were  frequent drinks runs,  so like many  passengers who travel regularly with BA,  we were a  tad disappointed, and  wish that they 'd be kind  and to listen  from their loyal customers of many .

- There is  something good to  like about this  bus - People with 3 pieces  or hand luggage  are allowed to  fly Business Class  - pitch is : there is  not space to  board Catering at  about 15.30 hrs  there was a  table with 3  cheese sandwiches, that was it for  the 2 hour and 10 minute flight in Business  Class Moving map  did not work.  Bus parked far  back from the  plane amongst cargo  and bus only  stopped once all  passengers had disembarked.  Low priority Business  Class bus. Altogether  a terrible experience.  Going forward: TAP - you have  a business.

From Heathrow to Hong Kong with  British Airways on  an A380. I  actually had more  room / seatspace on a 2 hour holiday charter  plane to Spain.  I know why  I had to  take such a  cramped position for  3 hrs. Then  on top it all, i'm sorry sir we havent got any breakfast ! Not a  single chappie. Return  to same cramped  position For a  short haul flight  you would not  blame BA.

Private Airways from  London to Bangkok : If you are thinking about  taking British Airways  to Bangkok. Don't do it. Thai Airways or Eva  Airlines for the  same price offer a much better  deal (for direct flights). If you want the best go with Emirates , it's a  fly over flight.  We fly this  airline 20 times  every year. Here  are the key  reason why you  do not fly with British Airways.  On my experience I believe they  make flights so  they are always full which increases  the risk of  feeling uncomfortable and  uncomfortable flying. The aircraft are very  old If you ask for a  sandwich during the flight the staff love to tell you 'Can you wait? service is  in 20 mins' this has been tested a few times. They hate anyone who asks  for a snack because it starts  a chain reaction  with other customers.  Your next service  will be in 1 hour but  they will still tell you 20 mins. Entertainment is terrible and old and you will  also keep accidentally  hitting the service button and light with your arm.  NO phone charger , no USB . No Wifi. Seats are very old, very uncomfortable

Great service flying from London to  very attentive crew and acceptable breakfast on outbound leg and meal on return leg. Outbound  legs the crew  was pleasant and efficient. On the  returning leg the  passengers were one  if the most  friendly and approachable  i have met on a BA  flight in quite  some time. Food  at a shorthaul  restaurant was very good and drinks including champagne regularly , The only  complaint I have is that unless you are a  First World Emerald card holder you can't select your seat at the  point of booking unless you pay  the per person  per sector. I  believe it's a  US Airways thing.  In the LCCs  can you book your seat for  a reasonable cost.  On business class  flights I expect  I get seat  choice as a  result regardless of  class status. I  feel this policy  is misguided and  we will take  it into consideration in booking future  flights

Singapore to Sydney in business class.  Our price was lowish so we booked—never again. Seat comfort was almost non-existent with appalling . The in-flight service hit a  new low for  an absolutely shambolic, no team effort, aloof hostesses were  downright dismissive of passengers. Food and  drink were cut-price  and worsened by  bad wine and . No water offered and meal  was forgotten. Entertainment choices were sub-par. No noise-cancelling headphones. No cosmetics in  those dirty toilets.  One dollar-shop amenity bag. I have  experienced better economy  airlines than this sector. Shame on  you British Airways. </s>

Hong Kong to London, seats 22K and 22J. It  was one of the worst journeys we have ever had to entail. My other half who is 6'3" was locked into a paralysed position for 13 hours made worse when the passenger in front reclined their seat for 90%  on the flight. The small metal box in front of his seat also restricted his leg room and comfort. He couldn't even watch the  onboard entertainment as there was barely a gap between the screen and his face after the seat in front was reclined. As a shorter  Asian person at 5'4", I was also deeply uncomfortable through most of the flight. Placed in the middle, I barely had any where to put myself, seats  being so narrow and confined and the person sitting on the other side of me  is of slight build. My headphone socket was crackling , the film  I wanted to watch, Cleopatra, (with the desperate hope  of killing 4 hours of time) wasn't working, it was just a black screen with audio. After travelling long haul last  year to Tokyo with another European airline, I could clearly detect a  huge difference with the way economy  passengers are treated on BA. Within 10 minutes of takeoff the other airline cabin crew handed out bottles of water and  packets of pretzels to customers. On  others we had to wait at least 30 minutes before being offered  any drink. On this particular flight staff seemed unfriendly and unapproachable and there seemed to be a general contempt for economy travellers. Would much rather pay more and travel with another airline than  travel with BA long haul ever again.

A good flight  from Heathrow to Stockholm. Busy and  slow boarding as  people board by row number. Therefore  it took forever , with an  error of hand  and flight was  running late. On board meal now  a bag of  chips or biscuits but I know  even by January even that will have gone, thereby relegating BA to  a low cost airline. Not surprised  thank you, as they have to compete with the others, but BA  will need to keep their prices ! Female crew were as friendly  at ever. Males less so.

London Heathrow to Zurich return using their business class. Online check in and easy access through security at Heathrow. Lounge was overcrowded and not much better than using a coffee shop in the main terminal. Seats onboard A321 are a joke for  business class with very small legroom / seat pitch. Food also shows reals signs of cost reduction, and  it is very much closer to low-cost carriers than airlines like Lufthansa or Swiss. Staff service was best described as "perfunctory"  – they provide F&B and then rest of the flight in the galley chatting very loudly about their Christmas plans. Return flight no different, except that cabin staff did manage to say hello as we boarded flight. BA has become a very expensive and disappointing  airline to fly.

What a disappointing experience flying British Airways from London Gatwick to Mauritius. Flew club class and the service was merely adequate, they did what  they had to do and no more - at no point we were made to feel valued customers. A request for a cup of tea after dinner, resulted in no tea brought (it was allegedly given  with another passenger), when we had fruit as a dessert, it was given with no plate, bread at breakfast was also given without a plate - had to be put directly onto the tray. On the flight out the  following film releases  were in the onboard flight magazine,  were available to view. Given that we paid a  bit of money for these tickets, the service given was very poor  with the flight attendants not overly friendly. BA now seems to be a budget airline with regard to service and amenities but premium in price. Flew Emirates last year to Mauritius and there is no comparison. Emirates wins hands down. BA needs to get its act together as it will loose customers.

Double disgrace. They cancelled my flight  an hour and 45 minutes before the the flight  and put me on the next  flight with 3 hours 15 minutes . I do have VIP access to the lounges,  and non of  their lounges in  Britain accepts my  BA access card/company.  After I asked the BA staff and managers to  request access they  just gave me  this insulting £5  piece of voucher.  Surely they can do better than  that It probably  doesnt mean anything  to BA, but I am not  a happy customer.

Bassinets by British  airlines cater for newborn only. My 10 month old son could not fit in it. The only option was a child seat, however my son sleeps lying flat and will not stay sleeping in the child seat. The only option is to sleep on you. However the arm rests are fixed in and hard. Couple that with the need to breast feed your child, with his poor head and  neck crammed in between the seat, either his head would get banged on the armrest or he'd kick the armrest at the other end. It was not a pleasant flight for myself or the child flying from London to Hong Kong. Other airlines offer bassinets up to one , some even 2 years and  they have arm rests that see moveable so that your child is not so constrained in a tiny space for long hours. Imagine a 13 hour flight with your child sleeping on you diagonally length wise because he can't fit in the  chair And every so often you fear he'll fall off your lap. To travel like this for any one or child is ridiculous and British airways refuse to do anything about it.

Security at Singapore  Airlines is carried  on in a  private area away from the desks  so it was done quickly, efficiently  and enables you  easily bypass the  line to enter  a terminal. Boarding  became chaotic. After  greeting families with  both first and club passengers, and  boarding the staff simply let everybody head towards the entrance. As before, the cabin crew  was professional, helpful and enthusiastic. Dinner  was served quite soon after takeoff because it was a late evening . It seems  to shame that in its desire  to cut costs,  British Airways uses  forks and napkins  that seem a little too thin and the cutlery  is slightly too  small Nevertheless, the  dinner was tasty  and cooked properly , there was  also good selection of wine and  beer After a  round of glasses  of port they made my bed  which I slept  on for several  days The seat  was equipped with  four USB ports but these put  out such little  pressure by iPhone  taking a long  way to charge and they could  hardly handle an iPad. We landed at Heathrow on  schedule and reached  gate 5 within  a matter of  hours One of British Airways’ greatest  assets is its  ground crew who,  by my experience, are considerably better  then their rivals.  All the airline  needs to do  something to stop  trying to save money and start  providing its premium  class passengers those little extras that  we have become accustomed to on  other airlines. It  may have been  a one-off but  management also needs  to ensure that  everything is carried  about properly.

New York JFK to London. Pleasantly  glad to have  had a nice flight on BA.  While the aircraft  was relatively old, the seats were comfortable with a  decent seat width  / pitch. I  received a rude shock when I was told I  needed to be seated in the middle seat of the middle row but it turned  up alright. The  problem with BA  were that we  needed to purchase  the seat if  they wanted a  second seat. It  was their way  of ancillary income.  Their IFE can be improved as  BA have very  few offerings. Cabin  attendants were extremely friendly and attentive.  We were tested  as we had  an ill passenger  worth taxiing for ! They showed  up and were  helpful in their  new

London Heathrow to  Manchester City. A  very good flight,  started on time, crew smiled and  looked like they 're having fun.  Nice full cooked  continental breakfast which  were served with  amazing efficiency and  very hot. Interactions  among passengers positive.  arrived on time  but as had  the luggage we  were in the  last queue for  our car in  no time at  JFK Flight back , not as  quick as was  anticipated due to  delays earlier in  our day, check in was surly  and on board crew still fine.  On both flights  both crews paid  special attention to children and I  loved how they  put child lifejackets  into the bins above kids for  every child passenger.  Economy was cheap too, the only  problem being that  we don't have business class on  our flights so we couldn't treat  ourselves to a  day of luxury

London to Toronto : Business class  and First return. No complaints at . Both flights departed on time  but landed slightly  delayed Food actually  quite decent for  food and crew  – top of  its game both  flights Had the latest entertainment system  either ways. Clean est seats. Not  much else to  report – if only British Airways could get it  done right every  day

India to London  Airport with British  Virgin OK service  en flight, but  seeing through the  side windows was  an issue as  they are no  screens on the  flight I understand  that airlines are  busy coming up  new solutions but  this is a  big flaw on  a 787, on a long daytime  journey you can't  take out the  window just lower  your intensity. Seat  placement is poor  and almost all  flights you will  see either needing  to climb over someone or have  someone climbing over  you Not up to standard. The  accommodation in Chennai  were also poor.

Singapore to London.  Had not flown British Airways long haul for over  5 years I  were pleasantly surprised on my recent  flying trip to . The premium economy seats on the upper deck were clean and comfortable and the food served was  well above average. However, more important was the unobtrusive  atmosphere provided by the cabin staff whereby announcements are kept to a  distance and there is no constant  noise during the  flights Both flights left and arrived on time. Overall a very good experience.

Tel Aviv to Heathrow with British Airways. Another good flight. IFE much improved. Tasty food  served promptly with plenty of drinks. Seats not great as usual but  not so important  on a relatively short flight. Friendly and efficient cabin crew. Flight was 25 mins early at Heathrow, which is always a  plus Only downside was slow check in faff at Tel Aviv.

Return to London  As with British  Airlines I fly  back very frequently  and the service varies each time.  Our lounge at  Emirates is a  disappointment with only a few seats  and very limited  amount of drinks , 2 miniature bottles of wine between approx 20 . However the  flight itself was  packed with nice  sandwiches and champagne. The cabin service  too was great  all around offering  meals frequently for  the 3 hour flight this was . The flightdeck  keep us updated  throughout the flight.  The only other  issue would be  my baggage was marked with priority  and was one  of the last  people come off.

It was a  strange experience while  travelling back from  France to Singapore  by British Airways. Our baby stroller was marked for  the other airline  en route to France, so we  may have to wait long way  and it will  not come back  in Singapore.   We ordered special  vegetarian Meal. As  per their staff,  our meal is  not vegeterian. However  they were served rice and lamb.  Meaning that there  is no alternate  meal made. Even  a refreshment meal  is provided with the leftovers bread which was hard to eat. The cabin temperature was very low and  miserable during our 8 hrs journey.  We pledge not  to take British airways ever.

Amsterdam to London. As a member  in their Executive  Committee and someone who has flown with British Airways  three times this  decade I now  regard them as the airline of  no resort. The  attitude on BA  are beneath contempt.  They used to be the source  to most complaints  about flying, but  in my experience  their service and punctuality beats BA  in their reliance on a long  established reputation. Every  single flight I 've taken this year has been a source of  annoyance and disruption.  from disruption in the cabin the  like of which  I have never witnessed on any airline other than British Airways, to  delays on nearly  every BA flights I have taken  during 2016, rude,  demanding staff that  behave like BA  was still a  British state enterprise.  Yet when I search a flight  for BA appears  they shudder. It 's even worth  leaving the UK so you get  a different national . There were  always problems with the booking process. What makes matters  worse is that British Airways accept that they are  right when making a complaint but  did nothing to  make matters right.

London Heathrow to San Francisco with  British Airways. BA  where once a classy airline for  their first class service, amenities and food. But they have succumbed to  US economic pressures to the point their first class service is a lot less than it use to  and the price is still absurd even using points.  They even hijack you for an additional $1000. Or  should I like to say, you cough up 200K in points and the $1000 fee covers their real  fee for you to sit in first. They have jammed more seats in so the  planes have more customers. The seat in spite of its new design is tighter and  more comfortable for a 6'1", 240 person to do anything but sit up and watch a movie or hope they do not run out of the food selection on the  plane Second, the staff use to be the most experienced flight attendants but the last two times I flew BA in first I had young attendants who clearly were not use to serving FC customers. A request for say , additional pillow or second cup of coffee went  ignored more than once which is a sign of inexperience. The last  flight flying home in April I was handed a menu with a tasting menu or a traditional menu. First class was maybe 50% full. When it was my turn, I asked the flight attendant if I could select some of the tasting menu along with  some from the  standard menu - she said she would check and shortly returned to say they were out of the tasting menu items. Now please explain to me how  the international first class service could  go out of food 10 minutes after leaving the airport? Clearly if they do not have enough for mix or matching , this is a stingy sign of cutbacks on the lowest scale  - save a few pennies. At the average price  around $10,000 for a first class seat, BA should  make damn sure  second class has all the food you need. Their  website also talks about late night  snacks and on the last two BA first class flights to the US when I wanted to try these snacks they were gone as  most are shared  with business class. The food served is both uninspiring  and generally on the level of US airlines first  flight which is  grilled to death and reheated. Way  you go BA,  we have sunk  to the lowest common denominator. Third, when I arrive in SF and  the spite of my luggage having a priority tag, it never comes  in in the  same batch and often towards the end of the delivery so they have failed on even that count. Unlike the first class asian carriers like Singapore and Cathay where my FC luggage arrives <mask> BA is always hit and mostly miss. Finally, <mask> galls me is the worthless survey they ask <mask> to fill out describing my FC experience on <mask> I let them know everything I said in this review and the last question asked is "would you like us to call you <mask> this review <mask> experience"? Yes, <mask> say and not once has someone called. I am waiting for the day when BA announces "all passengers including first" should buy food before boarding and headsets are for <mask>

London Heathrow to  London with British Airways. After experiencing the modern T5, we boarded our flight on time and got sat down. We were in an older 777-200, so the seats weren't very  comfortable due to  extra material and the entertainment screen  is small. We departed late as they had to unload bags, they  even had to reset the entertainment . In the air we were offered beverages. Later  in the flight, the meal service. There was chicken curry (I had it - it was nice but the rice was a bit dry) and a pink-looking coleslaw as a side salad. The dessert was a butterscotch/chocolate mousse, which  looked good. The other alternative was a pasta. I watched some films - there was a good range - and I like how the BBC News is up to date so I could  stay up with the current affairs. The crew were  also overly friendly,  they kept servicing us with extra drinks. I had a nap, and then we were served a small  breakfast snack. The much rumoured Mars Bar is actually true, as well as some Belgian chocolate cookies and other small snacks. We landed on time, but had  to stay on the plane until the immigration hallway became a bit clearer.

Last leg DUS  to LHR was  over Europe. While  economy class has no different seating to economy this aircraft was really a joke. It  is completely outdated , worst of  which it seems  to be not  long before the  flight Crumbs on  each seat. Table was sticky. Asking  Crew members they  are and are  really friendly and  willing to help  on cleaning. Overall  atmosphere on this  plane was extremly  disappointing Next leg from LHR to  Europe very similar , Business class  and upgraded with  an outstanding new  equipment but seats  where still old. The housing of  the seat was  replaced with gaffa  taped next to  a footstool. Asking  management about that they told me  all the housing  broke off and  they was not  able to fix  it so they  put gaffa tape.  In general the  cabin looks quite  and bit dated , might need  a further upgrade  more than the IFE and some  minor details (e.g.  it should be  upgraded - extremely  wide and roved).  Cabin in LHR  was outdated. Boarding  at LHR was  very uncoordinated as  the lot of  passengers don't listen to the announcements  and try to  interrupt and impede  movement of other  passengers Crew on  flight once again  was friendly and  helpful Meal choice  is ok.
