The Kitchen ->  Long time an  interesting feature of  flight is a  joke nowadays. Selection  seemed to go  bad every time  we fly. Worst of all: One  of my bags  was not made  back to the  counter This itself  can happen and  is not a  concern at all  as the handling  on this was  a real joke.  On identifying that  my bag seems  ot be lost  I went to  baggage counter (even  after finding it  is not that  hard in Boston).  Just explained my  situation and the  lady looked in  her computer and  saw that I  did not checked  this bag ->  but I had  the tag that  he could show  for her. Getting to Singapore  was first class  and British Airways  at its best.  The Concorde Lounge  is well staffed , the food , wine was . I was  taken to the  First Class cabin  by an enthusiastic  flight crew. There  was a slight  pause on taking  pictures which was  much easier with  my second glass  or champagne. Throughout  my flight and  cabin crew achieved  that perfect balance  of being friendly,  attentive and interested  as well as  caring what I  wanted The food  is to a  fine standard and  each wine glass  was kept topped , After dinner,  a crew member  talking to me, a mirthful Frenchman,  to my bed . I had  two hours sleep  and wake up  for breakfast consisting  with fruit followed  and a full  coffee The aircraft  was on time  so we left  with a minimum  to fuss. The  cabin was clean,  my seats seemed  spacious and the  bathrooms although small,  was kept spotless.  You could not  remember anything before and during this .

From Heathrow to  India return. I  think Air India  as the worst until I traveled by British Airways  in Premium Economy.  Ticket Prices are  low at all  and thus I  feel they must  be charging more  for nicer services but not all.  British Airways staff  in Delhi Airport  was rude and  demanding I have  got plenty of  baggage limit left but even a  10 mm difference  in cabin baggage  which did not  help as it was little hard  I put in  a case because  no handle. Another  large camera pouch  should consider as a separate bag.  Also was forced  too give my  phone bag to my father in  law and left  in a normal  travel bag with all stuff in ! Coming to  Bangalore aircraft, food  service staff - equally poor. Food  was horrific, seats  had torn, headphone  cable not working,  drink tray was  torn (I was  told to keep  my tray on  my food tray  without support by thighs) , tv  screen was not  at all visible  result of too  much scratches. Staff  was not able  any help at all. Nightmare experience.

Marrakech to London Gatwick with British  Airlines Baggage allowance is a joke. Doesn't matter how  much it weighs , long as  items are of a certain size but even this is not enforced or monitored by  UK airport staff. Apparently you are entitled to have one case and one piece of hand luggage to carry onto the  plane However, on boarding the plane there were people that had 3, or even 4  pieces of luggage which were far larger than ours.  These items were crammed into the overhead compartments whilst other flyers had to remove their smaller bags and put them by their feet causing  us even more  very uncomfortable space  to travel in. Other flyers had  our duty free items smashed and  destroyed When we  spoke to the  ground crew they were in agreement and there was even a manager  on the flight who witnessed this and gave us his business card to use as  the reference when making our complaint  with customers services team as he  is also shocked by what was going on. When contacting customer services  staff were far  less helpful even given the fact  the there was an airports manager on the flight. Absolutely shocking behaviour from a so called reputable airline. We will certainly never be using BA again.

First economy from  to Heathrow to  the return. Check  in at T5  fast and easy  I was able  to use fast  boarding and the  nice Executive lounge  on my FF  after boarding through  to A7 onto  another clean looking  plane Departed on time crew provided  free snack and  drinks on the 1 hour flight. Return check in  very quick although  our security system at BHD is  also very slow.  Also the Executive  lounge which is  packed with a  variety of snacks  or drinks, it's  right adjacent to  a gate used  at BA is  really handy. Departed  in time, seat  taken on another  Airbus A320, crew  had a hot  breakfast on this  one which was pretty good for  a domestic flight.  Flight time on  time return a  slightly longer 1hr  45 min due  to congestion at  JFK Good service,  i guess the  return option not  recommended but would  try again even  had I had a choice.

From Heathrow to  Kiev with British  Airways Good flight,  was clean, seats  clean and uncomfortable , it was  cheaper so you  keep your money  and takes your  money Food was  good and was  good Staff were  friendly Captain informative  As a go  to event we  attended Separate lounge in Kiev airport.

A very comfortable  journey from London  via Las Vegas with British Airways. Good food and drink and the usual excellent service.  Unfortunately BA seem to have abandoned the practice of  serving afternoon tea at about midnight  UK time and now serve a much more appropriate light hot meal.  Flying back, the  food was surprisingly  comfortable However, on this older 747, the IFE was simply not up to it, with limited content other  than films.

I booked and  paid an online ticket for a multi destination 6  month trip that took me from  Bangkok to London,  from London, Nigeria,  Bangkok and back to Bangkok. Before  leaving I called the British Airways service number on  site and asked  how I needed to change rearrange dates with this ticket was that OK - was told 'yes but  only to pay  the £150 fee', and nothing else  - little steep  and OK. I further checked extra's would be against  the Visa card used to purchase  the ticket, 'of course' was the reply. BA make you pay to  reserve a specific seat now. The  trip started okay but the aircraft used on the  first flight very worn and old - anyway got through to 3rd  plane visiting Nigeria for 12 days business and looked like I could arrange to come home earlier - fired up the BA app on internet roaming service  to find its not possible to re-book on the APP as indicated  - not given any local number  I call -  trying out possible BA numbers - to find they  no longer have an office in  Nigeria and get onto what transpires to be their call centre in  Nigeria Operator checks there is space on an earlier flight but then announces he has  to check the  total cost to come up with  the extra of £1000+. I decline this option and explain the £150 as advised (actually  BA says change over is £0). Later BA call centre call back and say they can offer a  fixed cost - hustling for business like they are  dealing in an open market - however for this option it would  only be possible to take payment  using Visa. It had to be paid in cash to only a single bank branch  near Abuja (during bank open hours) - some 6 hours and 300Km's  - By now  BA had readjusted to fly on the original dates  angry with BA over the mis sold flight and  some impractical conditions they try and enforce. Taking this  up with BA  continues - takes 2 month to elicit a first  response - to  get dealt with on one sided . They do not take responsibility  over the advice given over the phone, will not  acknowledge any shortcomings  with their APP  unwillingness to discuss it and failure  to advise on  some very special conditions that apply to their Nigerian flights. My return  home to Bangkok  was a tired sunken seat with  many worn and  worn table closures and scratched video screen topped by the sight of BA cabin staff too short and rotund to be able to reach and close the  overhead lockers before  take off -  after persuading a  fellow passenger out his seat to  fix this for them that this  was not the former 'flag carrier' <mask> a worn out and low cost discount carrier. Never again.

Heathrow to Houston  on British Airways.  Best travel experience  on my life.  And the seats were so bad  and uncomfortable with  the cushioning -  we couldn't relax  to go to  rest for the  rest of the  trip The movies  were good but  how am I  allowed to watch  movies on a  device that's smaller  then my iPad.  The food was absolutely atrocious never  in my life  have I had  one bad plane  experience I wouldn't  wish for anyone  and be quite  honest

London Gatwick to Antigua. Having flown premium economy with  both airlines we  decided to upgrade our cabin for  a holiday in Antigua at a cost of £350 to British Airways World Traveller Plus, and we were told by the sales adviser that  passengers would receive a bigger seat , more personal service with dedicated staff for this cabin grade, better choice of meals and beverages. What we received was a polarisation of this - we had very poor  service and the only difference between  this and our cabin grade was a slightly bigger seat pitch. Having flown long haul  for BA on numerous occasions in  the past I am completely shocked at the service we received - it was more like a budget  airline - we received a half class of bubbly prior to take off, this was  quickly followed with a drink service (one drink per passenger), we then received our meal service. I asked for white wine which was warm  and chilled and there was no ice - about 50 minutes later they served lukewarm coffee. This is not the type of service I expect on any  holiday let alone  from the upgraded World Traveller Plus cabin. After several hours when no other drinks service  is offered I went to the galley to ask for a drink for myself and my fiancé, to be told there  was no drinks left apart from  champagne or red wine - which neither one of us drink. As  this flight wasn't full I cant  why there would  been a problem you just don't expect to hear this given the cost of the holiday and the upgrade that you have can only have 2 drinks on an 8 hour plus flight? 5 hours after the dinner service we were given a sandwich and that was the conclusion of the service aboard a flight of more  than eight hours - certainly not what I would expect from an  airlines such as BA. Our return flight was in economy and the only difference was a slightly smaller  seat pitch but as this flight  also wasn't full we ended up with 3 seats between 2 of us. The service was exactly the same as on the outboard flight ie. same poor standard and for the first time ever there was  a hot breakfast before landing we were served a brick hard croissant. I was looking to book a long haul holiday to the Maldives next year with BA but after this flight and the appalling customer service I received when I complained about the service on the flight when I was told that when you pay for an upgrade your paying for a  bigger TV screen , bigger seat - which I certainly don't think  really justifies £350 upgrade fee. If you are thinking <mask> upgrading I would think twice <mask> what you are paying for. BA have now lost my custom <mask> having spoken <mask> other people on holiday I <mask> not alone in making this decision and therefore <mask> have booked my holiday next year with Virgin <mask> BA can no longer rely on there previous <mask> name they <mask> cutting too many corners giving poor service and <mask> interested in listening to their customer they need to decide if they are going down the budget <mask> route. If that is the case, they need to drastically cut the prices or start to give a more professional service and raise the standards where customers feel they are getting a good service for the price they have paid.

From Heathrow to  London with British  Airways Good Terminal  to ground service.  My former bmi A321 with AVOD  - which was  good Seat comfort okay for 3-hours , would not have liked any . Staff service  really forgettable from the outset -  we really weren't  making the effort.  No communication and 2 rushed services  for the start  & end of  each flight. Food  is a joke  and a very small sandwich for  my 3-hour flight  - honestly can't  get any lower , can it?) Flight kept to schedule - ticket  was quite good , and my  flight is really  more on the  seat rather than  seats

London Gatwick to  travel with British Airways. BA now stands for Budget ! Having flown BA for many years in all classes from first  to economy, I could not believe how everything has declined so drastically. I was offered a drink, no  drinks were offered, as in the past. There was a choice of 2 meals, a pasta and sausages  or mash, by  this time it got to me there was only one meal on offer, I was refused a second bottle of wine with the meal. Before arrival in Barbados afternoon tea was a mini Twix bar, I took 2 and  was ordered to put one back. The earphones for the inflight entertainment were so uncomfortable and kept falling out of my ears. The return flight was no better with breakfast before arrival being just an inedible bun. Having recently flown on Oman Air, Virgin Atlantic  & Turkish Airlines where the food and drink on offer was fantastic.  Mr Cruz should realise that he is running a once proud national airline not Vueling, BA as our national airline is a total embarrassment.

Flew British Airways from Johannesburg to London Heathrow. Travelled several times in Business Class but booked First Class this time. Outgoing flight on 747 seats surprisingly cramped (centre seats), food not great and  entertainment options poor but great bed made up for this. Yesterday's flight on A380 also disappointing but seats much better (centre seats). Entertainment better. Food quality very poor. My starter of vegetable tart had uncooked pastry on the bottom. I returned my main course of fillet steak because it was vastly overcooked and the potato/cheese thing uncooked. The 'chef' told  that all meals arrived in packs and were just heated up. He could not alter the cooking time for the steak. I had a very ordinary salmon fillet instead. The sweet was just two slices of  chocolate cake with a spoon of jam and a spoon of something . The breakfast muesli was horrible and the French toast was inedible. The wine didn't  appear to be what was described and the orange juice seemed out of a carton. The First Class  dining experience was  a business class at the most. Will not travel BA first again. Felt very rushed in the morning  with staff desperate to serve breakfast not giving chance for people to wake up and get dressed.

Fly from Miami  to London. First  time on the  flight and was  very little surprised  how unremarkable the  flight was because  on board via  the jet ways  and boarding was  considerably longer than  the 747 or  737 The World  Class Plus area  was on the  top deck and  BA had divided  first class areas  to smaller spaces so losing the  view of the  plane The seat  felt comfortable and spacious even when  the seat in  back was fully  empty on the  first night flight  I still had  space and room.  The service was  as usual British  with the cabin crew being friendly  but interactive. Overall  very good quick flight and would  definitely recommend BA  I will stick  with the 787  if I really  enjoy

Flew British Airways  via London to Baltimore. Have read so much about this aircraft and  am looking forward to flying it. What a fantastic plane, the large windows and higher  cabin pressure made the plane feel  comfortable and light with no dry plane eyes after the flight. The  addition of traveller plus makes it  good value and the new seats  feel very comfortable.  The flight was smooth, quiet and had a very helpful and interactive crew.

Welcome to London , and the  service was on . However cabin  quality is awful,  planes are cramped  and uncomfortable. On board service quality  has declined on  all flights and this flight was  no exception. Offered  breakfast was only  a sandwich (compared  to hot meal !) - it's  no joke. Economy Class complimentary service  should end soon. Cabin crew was  also OK, but  only giving 2  stars because they  would be much greater than the  cost of services . Our luggage was delayed 45 mins at Heathrow  by 5. BA  was offering low-cost airline standard - the only difference  is price, it's more expensive which makes poor value  on money. I'm  still using BA  now and I  can see the  massive downgrade in  price during the last 2-3 years and even more  a decline in  quality Shame on British Airways for sliding down to so cheap and so poor image!

Montreal to London and return to Toronto. O/W leg  from Montreal was the most average  BA experience to  Date Poor third  party lounge with little food choice,  mediocre wines and  terrible ambience. Boeing 787-800 aircraft was substituted by Boeing 787-900 which was  okay on the face of it,  however the same  flight number moved  up from the  second row of  seats to the  row in front  of the toilets - annoying as gate staff unable to move me.  When the air field withdrawn, the  flight went tech less to a  mechanical issue. Two hours later after a total reboot  of the aircraft  and we took . Excellent updates  via captain. However,  the crew were  unhappy during the  change with Biz  staff including me having to ask  for a glass  more water. Bizarrely First was blocked off with lights off and vigorously  ringing with no  entrance to the  proper bathroom. Drinks and dinner served promptly. My choice  of fruit for  lunch had already run out. Only  4 loaded for the whole of  us with honey , yogurt offered  but turned out  too be a 99 cent pot plonked on a  tray No croissant  offered (left in  queue in error)  as the orange juice has been downgraded to UHT  version of a carton. On the  second leg from Heathrow T5, the  departure lounge was very disappointing. Shabby  / poor food  and drink service by the third  party provider, with  filthy / scruffy toilets which I  had to queue ! Worst lounge  service to date , cannot be  called first class  by any means.  After boarding on  a 777-200 with  no first entrance  switched off. The cabin manager was by herself and  suddenly we were  directed towards first  flight  Friendly  with prompt champagne and a prompt  drink service after  lift off. recovered  just a tad.  Menu had not  upgraded since my  flight in October  and was disappointing. The amenities bag  for first is now the old  third world offering.  The menu with  some usual suspects  - Beef, Chicken  & Cod but were cooked and  tasted really well.  My promised cheese  bar had already  run out -  Only 4 loaded. (seeing a theme here) and so  I was fetched  for club. Afternoon tea sandwiches were  cheap and bland.  On the race to the bottom, BA continue to  poor service -  particularly on the food front. I don't find it  uncommon in first  classes for something as simple as cheese to run  up with club  sandwich being substituted.  BA may save money (and wasted food) but the  staff whilst cheerfully making the best  from a bad  situation are not  being given the  choice or or <mask> to deliver <mask> class service. <mask> fact, the <mask> were the <mask> saving grace. <mask> don't seem <mask> get it. <mask> in premium <mask> they continue to downgrade service <mask> save money <mask> gain an <mask> worse reputation <mask> the UK's flag carrier. Biz and First Class <mask> are dropping <mask> an alarming <mask> Wake up <mask> and IAG <mask> before it's too late.

I booked flights with British Airways  for London-Kuala Lumpur-Bandar-Kuala Lumpur-London. These were all booked at the same time and they also  had the booking, therefore contract, with Royal Brunei Airlines (RBI) for the KL/Bandar/KL legs. For whatever reason RBI cancelled one of the flights, and it was only by accident that I found this out, by going on the BA website. I had to change a flight and waste  the day in Brunei. BA have refused all responsibility, even on the  pretext of communicating  the cancelled flight  to me. I find this deplorable , booking everything  with BA. I would certainly never book anything direct with BA again, as this lack of service by a major carrier to a customer is despicable.

The space provided for business class seats on this flight is just ludicrous. I have flown budget airlines that offer better leg room. This carrier is aware  why they have exclusivity on business  class on this route as there are no alternatives.  With the price paid for these  flights versus the  service received this is daylight robbery. Next time I need to travel to CT I will fly SAA  and JHB.

from Heathrow to  Allen Dulles with  British Airways. This  marked our return  home to the  airport as we  have flown over  to London on  the BA B747-400 . First from  London We were warmly greeted upon  boarding and escorted  to our seats.  Our A380 interior . First cabin  were immaculate with  much more personal space at our  feet when compared  to the 747.  Here again, the  On board service  is excellent as  were the food  & wine (although  once again the  food was a  little overcooked). I  really hope we 'll be able  to fly in  this again one  final day with  BA

Back to London.  Has anyone ever  be told to  carry marriage certificate  while traveling abroad  from Spain? According  to a British  passport gate agent  of Barcelona Airport,  was supposed to  take my marriage certificate with me  for order to  hop on the  flight and leave ! I drove  over the border  of the States , meet a  friend in Canada  then flew out  from Vancouver on  that same day  to London for  one week, and  flew from London  to Spain for  two weeks. All  along the way  through going through  all of Canada,  USA and Spain,  and was granted  visa without been  asked till the  final day of  this vacation when  she was leaving ! All of  a sudden, this  lady agent asked  my “where are  we going?   Where do you  mean  Are  you traveling alone?” I thought she  sounded rather friendly  until she pulled  her aside from  the gate and  said me “you  need to wait . I need  you talk to … There were  At least over  50 people behind  me waiting and  struggling to figure  out why I  cannot get on  an airplane.  I am a  legal resident of US; however, I  am a citizen  from the country  participating in Visa  Entry Program, which  means I don’t  require visa to  enter Spain and  especially not when  I leave. So,  whats wrong!? My  names on the  plane pass and  passports are matching  and the name  on my US  permanent Resident Card  did not match  with my passport.  Of course, I just got married  and that I  had different last  year from my  wife but even  so what kind  of right does  she have to  check me for my US Permanent  resident Card and  stop me at  the gate like ? So, when  someone asked me  if I have  enough documentation to  prove the mismatch  from my last  year I jokingly  asked “marriage certificate??”  Last thing I  realized was I  cannot get on  an airplane because  I didn’t have marriage certificate with , and what  was it even  matter was after  we spoke to  her she said  telling me "you  may go this  week but next  year you will  need to have  wedding certificate with " It was  just ridiculous!

Dallas/Fort Worth to London Heathrow. Excellent service overall in British Airways First. The first class  cabin interior was  an excellent condition  and the staff could not have been nicer. The  cabin featured the  all new First cabin and it was quite elegant. Food and wine great as well although the steak  was a bit overcooked. I hope  you fly with BA in First again.

Flew London Heathrow to Berlin Tegel with British Airways. No queues at terminal 5 at lunchtime - everything was very quick and efficient. Flight was punctual and well organised and service good with one exception. The flight info said there would be a “snack” but all we got  was a small bag of crisps. Although it was a near two-hour  wait over lunchtime,  There was no food offered nor could we purchase any. (No shortage  in drinks, including wine, though). You have been warned.

Flight to Lisbon  by British Airways.  A bad flight, when a person  did not want  the check in  luggage it is  best he packed  and not waste  money in the luggage pick up.  My luggage was taken during the  security procedure because  they said the  plane was full,  and it was  because there was enough space to all to have  the mini trolley . I had  on the plane,  some people that  you must say had bigger luggage then my own.  Back in the plane fast exit  from Heathrow and  carry on flight a bag of  nuts or peanuts,  nothing healthy. On  my arrival at  my plane parked near the Military Aerodrome on Portela ( Maduro), and 10 minutes bus ride to the  airport and more 10 minutes to  wait for luggage. Long time BA customer but do  not know if I will fly again.

I flew a  business trip with  BA to Miami onboard one of  their A380 aircraft,  wondering what has  lead to this ? Outbound flight  stopped 1 hour  later we had  to due to  the broken seatbelt  that should have  be spotted during  landing Having flown  the route several  times on the 747 we were  look forward to trying the A380.  we were seated  in row 31  that is the  first row in  our mid section just before the  large galley area. From the moment  I sat down  the was a  loud whine coming  from the wall  below us! Upon  questioning the crew if this would  stop they said  yes it was  from fridges in  the galley and  not the engines  so we wouldn't  hear it. This  carried on for  2 hours and  their crew issued  some ear plugs to wear and  said that the  sound was "normal" on all their  new aircraft. The  meal was horrid  and only a  flight of 2  and I chose a curry which  contained no flavour  it was incredibly  cold The return  flight was a different A380 which had the same awful noise but  it did stop  for 2 hours prior to arrival.  The food on  the return was  absolutely disgusting as  was the outbound  flight and as  usual the "breakfast"  only consisted of  one cold bagel  type thing with  the blob of  melted cheese in  it middle. The  temperatures have dropped  how far it is incredible. I'm  told if I  flew in row  2 on Emirates  or the like  I wouldn't be  covered with ear phones I'm booked to Miami once  more in early  January fortunately on  a quiet 747  and after that  I will no longer fly with .

Paris to London  with British Airways.  Cheap flight. Fast , full flight  that left Lisbon  on time and  got to London  and no delays.  Economy on flight  was nice for  so a cheap ! Not like  a return trip . British Airways  make us feel  good when the  trip is ok.

The flight started in the First Class Concorde lounge at T5. It is certainly showing signs of wear with tacky material hanging down around some of the seats. The seat cushions need refilling. The general ambiance is quite good. A refurbishment is long overdue. The food quality and choice is generally quite poor - although the Crab Tortellini was good. Nobody invited us  to choose from the menu or to offer drinks. I had to walk the floor and find someone. All sloppy. The menus also were worn and scruffy and someone, a  waiter I think, had scribbled on the inside, some funny cartoons. We boarded and the flight departed to the minute. All good. The Boeing 787 has a small 1st Class and I realized that the space also is smaller than the 777 option. The 747  option is a total disaster and I go to great lengths to avoiding flying their . Food was OK. Very little wow factor. The meze was fine. They ran out of Cod -  although at this  point I don't think we had hit the cruise. Seven from eight passenger - and only one Cod apparently. I had the lamb which was alright but  in short night flights I prefer not to have meat. My wife's allocated seat was - broken, hence the vacant seat on the flight. So she sat one side of  her plane and I sat the other. Brilliant. The plane was only six months old.  With the competition on this route you would think  BA would want to impress. Was it a coincidence I wonder that there was no Arabic or Asian passengers on the flight? With Emirates on this route - why would there be? We landed on time and then had  a walk miles. Another underwhelming experience with BA. I  wonder what those who spent £3,000.00 one way thought.

The flight started badly in the so called new Concorde lounge at Dubai. I have reviewed this in  my lounge section. The situation was worsened by a three hour delay to our departure. Apparently minimum rest period had been compromised. Not sure  that this was true but we ended up with a 787 crew not a 777 crew. On the 777 the First seating is double that of a 787 and result was we were served, the entire full cabin of 17 - by one FA. He did his best but must have walked about 10 miles in the flight trying to keep us happy. The Boeing 777 first seat is the largest of the three options (747/787/747). Mine was starting to show signs of wear. No amuse bouche. As announced last month BA have cut back this  - Wow, a £3 saving on a £3,00o one way ticket. Well done BA. Champagne was lukewarm, as  was often the case. Lamb and  tomato salad appetizer was ghastly. Horrible in fact. The soup was the usual Butternut squash soup (do they offer anything else or am I unlucky) and was lukewarm but okay. The apricot chicken was pleasant enough but I could not taste any apricot. A bistro product at best. Later in the flight I had afternoon tea - sandwiches. All dry and tasteless. Watched a movie on the inflight entertainment system and this  worked fine. Nodded off and had two hour nap which was nice.  All without being stacked for a  flight As one comes to expect with BA, underwhelming due to the bean counters at LHR cutting back  staff as well as increasing fares. I'd like to see the entire BA board removed and a new dynamic team of  man and women with vision and inspiration for our  new carrier.

Gatwick to Alicante. Crew friendly but a bit amateur , business class Club Europe cabin. Upon boarding I found my row of seats dirty  - lollipop stick,  empty hankie wrappers, newspaper and empty water bottle all strewn across seat.  I had sat  on gate for an hour since  arriving from Glasgow,  but isn't it  raining and why don't the crew  check the state of the business  class at the very least? Pilot  came on the tannoy and said because there were meals being served we had to wait for 6-7 more to be delivered. This delayed the departure by  30 minutes. More afternoon teas were carried on (and crockery). Cue lots of banging and clattering in the forward galley. Crew  member offered a  coffee once which I thought was  generous for a  European cabin. Not very proactive. Call  also went unanswered twice. I asked for a Baileys and ice to  top off the meal when I managed to catch the attention of  Pilot As duty free trolley rolled back I was  handed two bags of nuts instead  and another CC. Gave up at  some point.

Fly Heathrow to  be with British  Airlines and they  have some of  the oldest planes  flying this route , the screen  has only 6"  long square lines  on the screen. The food is very poor on  board compared to other airlines covering the same route,  only two offerings  of water on the outbound flight. Usually fly this  way in business  class and British  airlines offering is far inferior product  on this route ! Despite being Silver member will be voting with  our feet and  using other airlines  options available on all future travels.  There was one  long trip too  far with British  Airlines

London Gatwick to  our return. British Airways is a  bad airline and  you will never  fly it again. Paid extra for  premium economy and  paid £192 to  be sure we  would sit together,  something I have never had to do with airlines  for long haul.  we were told  this may be a small charge  when we booked  our holiday. The  lounge was very  noisy and dirty , floor was dirty, my tray  was covered in coffee stains. On  the outward flight, one footrest would not stay up,  going inward the  foot rest and leg support would  barely work. The crew gave us  the champagne welcome  but vanished until the food came,  even if you  would have liked  your drink. It  appeared the crew were very tired  and just fed up serving people, I suggest they  switch jobs.

This was my  second time to  fly into London  City Airport with  British Airways. I found the experience to be very  pleasant indeed. The  gate agent was  both friendly and  helpful and made  me very positive  first impression. The  ground staff were  helpful and polite , boarding was  quick and efficient. During this short  journey the captain  were informative and  the cabin crew  performed a sterling  service at serving  tea and snacks  during a relatively short flight. Disembarkation  seemed orderly and  each bag arrived  on good time . I am  still very happy  traveller and will  fly this route  later in the  UK

Had to fly out of Johannesburg  on BA on 27th October but  owing to aircraft  issues (A380?) managed to get onto another flight (Boeing  747 to ensure I caught my connection to Charlotte  via London. This particular Boeing 747 had clearly had its day, but  while infinitely better than my return flight on the  day I paid  an additional fee for my seat , irrespective, felt "packed in". The  problem was very  much slow service  by section cabin staff and   it my opinion  way too many  seats are accommodated  on this aircraft. Chaotic boarding did  however help matters.  Do in future use one of the US airlines for this route.

Welcome to Los Angeles. Initially late boarding as aircraft was late on  arrival so cleaning  had been better.  Get over and  everyone else was superb! The overall  atmosphere isn't flash but rather understated  sophistication which you have to be  Italian to fully understand I suppose.  Excellent champagne, fine  wines and cognac complimented the restaurant 's a la  cuisine meal and  the service was second to none  in our geordie . We loved  this fact that one of our  meals could be  used as a  table for 2.

London Gatwick to Mauritius return. Our outbound flight had certainly not been memorable, but new to British Airways we were prepared to wait and see. The inbound flight commented upon here was much worse, but with many facets of the earlier experience.  We paid two supplements for the flights. A substantial fee to upgrade from Economy , a very unpopular one to ensure as elderly clients - on overnight flights - we could sit together! The combined cost therefore was significant. The benefits were not. Firstly, upon being seated we were faced with a cabin crew apparently in a bad mood. A lady ahead of us had a headrest problem,  and was rudely dealt with and seemed intimidated.  Throughout the flight  and waking hours, passengers seemed to be a nuisance. Food - as we had flown this class on  all scheduled airlines, we were expecting a menu to select meals. How silly. Here the economy trolley brought appalling food with a twin choice - chicken or veg (a bright green Risotto). So, no Choice! No bread roll, no cheese and bikkies, a 'choice' of one red wine, and plastic cutlery. This was served after the attention in Economy, and may account for the absence of choice. Whatever, it  tasted awful. It was noticeable how many meals remained uneaten. What a waste of resources. Significantly better quality has been had on holiday airline journeys of shorter duration. The Premium Economy (WTPlus) cabin had no provision for toilets. It was necessary to go forward to Club, or back to Economy! It became clear early-on that going forward was not popular with those in that cabin, so back it was! During the night, with passenger debris in aisles, this was hazardous with  using plastic bags (from headphone containers) to slip on. Is nobody in British Airways capable of seeing the provision of a loo for 24 passengers is essential?  On arrival in UK we read that BA is to put even more seats in Economy class on this type of aircraft. Goodbye British Airways - not even nice to have used you.

Flying to London , in economy . The food  on a 4  hour flight is  like a sandwich  for lunch. 1  food service instead  of 2 in  good old days  so you better  get everything you  want for the  next flight. British  air service keeps  on getting worse  and worse. It's  another shame because  their crew are  just generally friendly  & nice people.  They will only  keep getting worse , worse if  fares are cheaper  than all the  flights which they  almost never are.

London Heathrow to  Mal Lumpur. Concorde  arrives at LHR , Check in easy at First Area. Was excited  to try the  new 787 and new first on  my special occasion trip. Cabin intimate with 8 semi  standard suites. Look  nice with nice finishing touches of  glass and chrome,  but seats quite narrow. Champagne before take off. Nice crew but slightly  overweight and not totally familiar with  cabin type. Main  menu was very  bad Scallops overcooked and main beef  is overcooked on  one side. Breakfast ok. Bed for  two comfortable but  quite narrow. Power outlets wouldn't work with my iPhone or iPad. Table  before dinner wouldn't  fit properly and  the light fell  out of its  place - on a new aircraft?  I had a  great flight all  round redeeming Avios  on occasion. The  newer first is an improvement but  they need to revaluate their offering against competion, likes  of Qatar Airways,  Air Singapore etc, because their products  or onboard service  lag behind.

Its a shame  of once upon a time being such a good  airline to now  get service at  such high price!  On such an old tatty plane each way, very uncomfortable. Entertainment was old and tired.  had to keep  stopping many times just to change the channel. Food was like mush on the way  home and on  the return they served me a  small meal as  was all they had left. The cabin crew service was very poor on the return . The crew looked miserable as  if they didn't enjoy their job. Asking for anything  seemed like a chore for them. One of the crew looked so  tired her hair was all over the place. I asked to buy  another bottle of  shampoo when they came round with  it duty free. The steward said he would come  back with it soon. I waited  & waited, then  asked him an hour before landing. He apologised and said he forgot,  so he will bring it down , Again I waited, and just  as we were  going to land  and asked again, he returned with a bashed in  bottle of perfume and said sorry but this is the last one. I couldn't except  it as it was very badly presented for a gift. After all  that if I knew it was the last one,  then I would have chose something else, but it was too late , we were  on Terrible 12  minute flight.

Get to London Heathrow, and wow, British Airways has gone downhill. Very  rude and abrupt staff and the  service if you can call it that, was a sandwich and a  cold coffee in a paper cup. This is on a five hour  flight British Airways needs to take  one look at the likes of Qatar Airways etc.

First time using  British Airways as always flown Virgin but routes from Orlando to Gatwick were full with Virgin. The flight  got cancelled with no reason for 24 hours. No  even a text message sent to my phone 4  minutes before departure  and no telephone or contact number. After an hour of ringing everybody  I could at BA I ended up being passed to an offshore call centre. If you deal with BA this will be where you call for everything - cut off three times and completely incoherent. I was traveling with  a wife and  8 year old daughter in "Club World" seating. The  aircraft was over 18 years old and whilst serviceable, it was in a dire state. My daughter commented "this is like a dustbin with wings daddy" when  we got into the cabin. On arrival to my "Club World" bed it had a  small piece of plastic that had fallen from somewhere.  They handed it to a stewardess who said "that bit isn't important" whilst looking down at me and taking it away.  The inflight system  is a joke, the resolution on the screen made  it almost impossible to see anything. All the pixels were broken. The charging for laptops etc was US only and the remote for the  navigation system didn't work. An announcement came on before we left "we have a passenger travelling with us  who has a serious nut allergy.  Please do not  carry any nuts at anytime". Once  we had taken off we were served warm wine with a large  glass of mixed nut! I am proud to be  Australian but I  feel incredibly embarrassed  of British Airways to represent my country in such a poor way. Fly with anybody other than BA. Trust me, they 're nothing short  of a joke. </s>

Flew London Heathrow  and Bangkok with British Airways. Cabin looked worn and dated. Cabin crew were friendly and attentive. Disappointed with lack of snack with bar service, in fact I previously flew in June and the airline always provided  the fully stocked 'help yourself' tuck box. Inflight meals a disappointment compared with other airlines. Inflight entertainment satisfactory.  I have had  similar inflight experiences  with other non direct airlines on this route.

Welcome to Geneva.  Im not sure  British Airways are  ready to short  change business anymore  and can see  BA going high  with economy seating  again as some others do. Business  the same as  as everyone now  talks about, but  the downgraded food , lunch consisted  was a small  salad with a  piece of ham,  side of Palma  Cheese and dollop y buffalo mozzarella  cheese and a  bread roll. And  that was that.  Not even butter  on the roll.  But the value  for food was  only GBP1. Crew  tried their best  on a poor  economy Flight on ! Not worth  a premium over  the ticket.

it does seem that many of  the negative reviews of British Airways  are from passengers  of First or Business class. My wife and I  travelled from Heathrow to Los Angeles , found the  overall experience extremely  satisfactory Boarding was efficient, the seats were comfortable and  the leg room  better than adequate. IFE was very good. The food was, well, it  is airline food , you cannot expect haute cuisine at 38,000 ft.  Breakfast was tasty , and there was some decent red wine. The cabin crew were  outstanding in every way, both friendly  but efficient. Would  anyone recommend BA to a friend?  Not without question.

We booked to fly Club World 4 months ago. Turned up at St Lucia to be told British  Air had overbooked  so we had  be downgraded : this is on  our £1700 ticket.  According to the duty manager, they  always oversell the  extra cabins and  staff are fed up with apologising  and angry passengers.  we were given  £ each travel  day as compensation, so it means  you have to  contact British Airways again. We ended up in World Traveller plus (premium ). Seats were  available but it's the standard Economy ! Breakfast was  a croissant which  has come out of a fridge,  it was disgusting.

My flight from  NYC to Boston  went okay. Disappointed  that only be  allowed to sit  at middle of  row of 10.  Sorry to have  them pay extra  to have a  better seat. Also  breakfast on board  was disappointing with  the one meal  with a biscuit . crew were  nice and helpful.  The return flight  is different. Staff  was particularly helpful.  Sat in front  of seat fully  but I wasn't  trying to fit  the tray in.  One member said  it was causing  problems for the  man in front  so I requested  to put his  tray up to . Also armrests  do not lift , leaving less  then 6 inches  of seat in  middle and armrest  so I was  essentially trapped in  my seat for  4 hours. Not  pleasant and unsafe  in an emergency.  Only had one  meal trolley followed  by a meal  for an hour ! Staff then  left and only  water or juice  available for rest  during flight. Will  now use BA . Delta and  Southwest flights offer  much better service.

London Gatwick to Valencia with British Airways. Boarding the flight at Gatwick was good, professional  & orderly. Ground staff at the airport were lovely and check in was efficent. Onboard we got out  at the gate and under way quickly. Seats were fine, plenty of leg room back in economy, although they seemed to be a little dirty when I sat down but I thought nothing more of it. During the flight , cabin crew were professional doing their duties. All friendly and welcoming. Food wise we only got complementary biscuits - a little bit of a let down - but on a short flight , this totally understandable. Drinks were fine, got the normal selection: Coke, coffee, juices etc. On the return  trip it was slightly different. They  seem to have  less in stock not only in the food department but also the inflight shop. Disappointed in this as what I wanted to buy wasnt avaliable.But on this return flight the  positive outweigh the negatives. Flight crew  was amazing. All kind and welcoming like the first flight. Overall the flights were nice. Well worth the money. Definitely would fly with them  again on short  leg flights through .

London to Seville via Madrid. If  you want budget airline service but  premium airline prices, look no further  at British Airways. I used to fly a lot with BA for both business and pleasure. But lately they really started dropping the ball. In 2016 I  have a streak  of 8 consecutive flights all delayed by 30 min to more than  4 hours. But  this is not  its worst. Recently I booked a flight to Seville  via London. After a few weeks  the flight got  cancelled It took  me 3 different  calls to find  another solution via  email on the  same day. ('No  I don't want  the fly the  same day!). But  Guess what, 1  day later my  trip to Madrid  got cancelled as well. Again it  take some time to find an alternative. Ultimately I  have to settle  for a 7 hour travel time  rather of 2.5 hours. Also I need to take extra holiday and  travel costs to  fly to my destination in Seville. After complaining to  them about this , I expected to get some  kind of compensation,  for all I'm an esteemed Silver  Member (their words).  Apparently none of that. A few  phone calls later I am stuck with an automated  BA service replying  telling me that  no compensation is possible. I didn't ask for any  compensation or anything.  All I asked  instead is to waive the re-booking fee if I ever have to  book a flight. This seemed only fair after BA cancels flights willy-nilly  but doesn't take  the customer into  account If this  is the service  acceptable to a Silver member, then I really don't want to know what they do to customers not  members of their  cheap flyer scheme.

US Airways state  seats you can  opt in for . When I  requested availability 24 hours prior to  the flight, there  are only three  tickets available for  the three of  these I also  wanted to have  the window seat , only available  seat were aisle  seat in C  to J. Due  to online check outs I had  only the option  or select an  extra seat. At  arrival at LHR  we spoke to  BA customer services  member advised that  depends on how  often you pay  for the seat,  not certain seats  may appear available , in short,  the less you  spend you get , the less  the seats with  seats not being  provided This is  now a new  rule and the  crew member said  that has led  in many complaints  with customers. The  aircraft was a  737 reg G-CIVV  bought in 1998.  The aircraft had  just renovated a  couple of years  ago and had new seats and  improved lighting. However  - aircraft tables  was not clean,  the room was  dirty and the  aircraft is "an ". These are  spoken words of  the cabin crew , not me.  Really - the  old is an  A when compared  with the new  aircraft Cabin crew  are very friendly  but were not  easily seen, only  at the start  on the flight.  Breakfast was ok  with veg lasagne  and a nice  cheese mousse. However  my one meal  ruined towards the  middle of the  flight by a  bite size chocolate  bar and undrinkable . BA wake up - look , see what  their competition is  doing aircraft wise  - sort out  this unfair check  in policy.

From Heathrow to  fly with British  experience To fly to disappoint. After  the arrival in Heathrow T5 the check-in area for  Air Europe was clearly marked and  marked for the  area of the check-in lounge and a host was  guiding you to  your check-in line.  While saying hello  to the host  on my way  to the check-in  lounge I was stop with an unpleasant “Excuse me,  it is business class”. Like a  naughty school boy I returned to the lady and show her my boarding pass which  enabled me to  join the “exclusive ". Check-in was  complete and I  arrived airside in  about 20 minutes.  In time for  some duty-free shopping  in an airport  well decorated for . Being a little bit hungry I was looking for the “light  meal or snacks " prepared for  me and “drink from our World  Class bar” as  is promised again  from their website.  My only   purchase made was  2 sad sandwiches  and after checking 4 empty bottles  for display I found some warm , white wine.  So I decided  the cut my  time spent in  their “comfortable private lounge” and treat myself with some Costa coffee and some nice tasty sushi in the  Lounge Waiting for  the promised menu which “features irresistible meal options crafted  that perfectly match  your time and duration of your flight”. Couple months  later a tasty  lunch with canapés  was offered to  you in Club Europe. In the  return flight I  was offered the  food option “beef or fish” with,  and a nice  big smile from  Captain Purser. The tray looked like  an Economy tray  from a Tarom or KLM flight  in Bucharest. No  longer an overlapping  main meal option of cheese and  a merengue and a fish which  is the blandest food I ever  tasted onboard. When  everyone was still  waiting for my  " British experience”  my tray was taken away. Coffee  and a second  set of drinks  being served shortly  as the main meal service was  and I couldn’t stop wondering where  my smooth, stylish service from my  last flight went.  Of course, the crew was polite  but nice as  much as they can, shaping their enthusiasm according the  food offered to  me And another  strange element: no  complimentary drink service;  I needed to ask for another drink as the  staff was busy  to stop the  club Europe toilet  on the front from leaking and flooding the entire  cabin galley.

I have traveled with British Airways many times in the past. It  was reliable and safe but the attitude of the  ground staff put me off. It therefore came as a pleasant surprise that this seems to have changed. The stewardesses were  very friendly and attentive. The aircraft was a Boeing 787 with a seat configuration of  110 which was good. In-flight entertainment was very good and it worked.  Service at Seoul Incheon airport was  very quick. We departed more or less on time , got to  Korea on time but had to do one circuit  because of traffic. All in all a very good experience.

Flew London Heathrow  to Cape Town  and Johannesburg. Effortless  packet drop and  return transit in  some very quiet , Silver card  flight so made my way to  London North. Plenty  good seating available , sadly I  arrived too early  for the dinner service so ploughed  my way through  my rather poor  " tea" sandwiches.  Lunch selections however  was tip top.  Landing at remote  airport quickly turned  in a scrum,  with passengers crowding  into the entry  doors preventing passengers  attempting to board  or doing so.  Large part to  blame for boarding  the A380 so  soon before the scheduled departure time.  On board flight  1 to JNB  proved up to  speed with a  nice young mixed-feet  passenger and good  fitness levels. The  economy on the  flight puts that  on its sister  BA fleet wide  commercial aircraft to shame. On time  arriving in JNB  was then onto  the morning BA  Express connection to  London Flying Comair  was like flying  high in the  morning with full  buffet service breakfast  and a bit  good old fashioned cabin service (endless  cups of tea!).  The arrival in  Amsterdam made for  great end to  the good journey.

I was very disappointed to find  that British Airways are now a very 'middle of the road' airline compared to a  year ago. Why? Firstly, compared to my only other  airline in an A380 (Qatar Airways) there are more  people crammed into the BA business. On the outbound  leg only 1 of the 2 upper deck toilets was working and  in the return  journey my in-flight entertainment screen was broken which meant , it was not visible and kept springing back to a near  horizontal position. The only possible solution  the steward could  find (as there  were a critical  piece missing) was  simply wedge it with a cork  which sounds very  reasonable for a 21st century airline  but whenever we hit slight turbulence  the cork kept  popping out and  knocking the screen  from view (very  handy when you are half way through a film). The flat bed side window cabin  food was good  and the beef that was my  second main course  tasted tough, tasteless and quite inedible. I gave up  about 10 minutes  just trying to  taste it and chew it. They did at least have a nice  strong red wine.  My staff did well enough. I  continue to fly  here a lot and am a Silver Card holder but it is no longer my airline of choice.

I hadn't flown British Airways in a while but I thought I'd  pay them a  go again. I  was in Club World, seat 64K upper deck from  London Heathrow to Chicago. Let me  start by saying that BA crews  are tremendous. They are friendly, approachable, professional, amiable and  knowledgeable The flight  crew did a great job in getting us there safely and they were informative without being over bearing with their announcements. The service on board was very good, the food was plentiful and quite tasty. The  flight entertainment was excellent. Loads of choices and great . All in all a great  experience Based on that, I will keep flying BA  for my transatlantic flights. Again, the crews are a  credit to BA,  who do a great a job.

Vancouver to London Heathrow. I was  booked on Air Canada but rebooked  on British Airways as I was unable to make the AC flight  when AC cancelled an earlier flight  - YYJ to YVR. Having flown British Airways in the past, I was looking forward to flying them again, but my trip was somewhat disappointing. Seat on the Boeing 747 not the most comfortable, but still a slightly bit  comfortable than on  Atlantic Canada's 10 across Boeing 777-300ER.  Dinner served after takeoff was chicken with rice - it was fairly tasteful. Cabin crew seemed approachable, but after the meal service, cabin crew disappeared and made very limited appearances during the 9.5 hr flight to London. I wanted a glass of water and had to push the call button - then waited over  20 minutes until  a cabin crew walked by. Before landing, breakfast was served - consisting of a tasteless pretzel bun and granola bar. It 's very evident that BA's service standard has slipped considerably since I last flew with them in 2013. How the mighty have fallen.

At Heathrow to  London with British Airways. Smart and clean A321. Young  flight crew dealt well with demanding  that drinks trolley  handed over and a child who  kept on standing up in his  seat for takeoff.  Only a bag of nuts for a near 3 hour flight but we all know this story. Yes, they are reducing the service but  their other forms , medium-long transport  (& ferries) includes  this in the  mix

We was pleasantly surprised by the  experience first time for premium economy  on this particular . The seat  is comfortable with  great legroom, the  food was excellent , airline food  from both ground  staff and flight  staff were friendly  but efficient. The flight was quiet and smooth, on time and made up time on  another flight. The only downside was  when the inflight entertainment stopped working after one hour, despite the crews  stating it could not be restored for the remainder  of the flight.  We did note one steward enter  a premium economy  flight with a  radio and upgraded about 15 people into business, the rest of us went without for  two hours. It worked fine on the return journey . I guess  is just one  of those things,  it annoyed me  that a certain  select few were upgraded and the rest ignored.

The flight Kuwait  to London was  on a refurbished  The flight was  good time, cabin  crew were hard-working,  service was a  little British, and  the in-flight entertainment  included AVOD, and with a wide  selection of movies  and a huge  amount of classical ). The flight  went smooth, and  the information from  our flight deck  brought us up  the date on  the progress of  the flight. The  cabin crew even  managed to find  one last miniature , single-malt scotch  for me (good  job guys). Transit  to Heathrow was  smooth and the  flight to Edinburgh  arrived on time,  on time on  an Airbus 319.  Both the service  arrived on time,  my cabin crew  kept the flight  well and the  plane came out at Edinburgh with  little hassle. The  return flight was  very good: prompt  arrival from Edinburgh,  smooth transfer at Heathrow, and on-time  return to Kuwait.  Good time, an  Boeing 747, with  the small seat-back , so I  could not bother  about the entertainment . The evening  meal was the  usual "chicken or " (come on,  when can't we  get a change) ", edible and  delicious and the  cabin crew were  pleasant and unobtrusive,  coming through the  cabin regularly with juice and water  for this overnight ! Overall, the  experience was up  against the usual  standards I expect  from BA: I  felt safe, comfortable,  properly fed and  rested and all  three journeys were  on time and hassle-free, with a  great set of  cabin crew and  the tidy and  efficient aircraft. Well  done BA.

British Airways was the cheapest airline  so I booked this flight from  Birmingham to Gatwick,  cheaper than Easyjet.  Great service, ok  local food. Professional  turn round. Captain spoke with me , Plane was on time and no issues. Best  possible flight from a great little airport.

silver card holder  - British Airways . PPS card  in Singapore -  London to London  flights - average  English when called  - service staff  with a bit  off an attitude  but it wasn't  my job so  they do BA  no favours. 1.5  minutes late and  you sent the  luggage to the  wrong part of the airport so  20 mins delay  to the baggage  and Barcelona flight . Worst bit  was BA codeshare.  If BA 2190  checks out it's  like BA have  not got their  acts together on  it at all- cost silver card holders booking BA  flight had zero  boarding rights -  had to charge  BA for second  flight - free for silver card  holder Get to  BA lounge BA  has explicitly asked  that Vueling codeshare  should be excluded  - no ability  ot use lounge.  Unable to pay  and select my  seat BA trying  to save money.  Unfortunately the Vueling  flight was third  - none of  my check in  flights to Singapore  was BA leg  - so I had to go  through the BA  lounge to get  scanned in before dropping my bags  back to BA  - I have close to a  billion miles on  me - I  booked BA for  the trip -  it could have  used SQ /Star  flight - your  last couple of  days focus on  passport control and  the cheap and  not sorting out  your codeshare process  to both standards  - your poor  service interaction that  they treat me  as a cardholder  that works just  like me in  your "will fly  the next time  you come to  this bracket. You  are cost cut  it out of  business

I am tall, 196cm to be exact. That's why on a recent flight from London to Brussels I couldn't face being crammed into a microscopic economy seat. Instead I decided to pay £385 to fly in British Airways "Business" class. What a mistake! On arrival to Heathrow's Terminal 5 I tried  the enter the queue at zone B as directed by one of the information signs. I was told that the staff had decided to close that so I had to go somewhere else. I joined the queue at "C" instead but was told when I  walked to the front that business class checked in at H. I made my way to British Airways business class lounge, which was crowded, dirty with wet smelly bathrooms that looked more like a run-down bus station than an airline's lounge. The place was wildly understaffed which meant that there were used plates, cutlery and half eaten food littering tables in the room. It was far less crowed in the rest of the terminal which is where I waited for my flight. The gate was announced and  I made my way to gate 10C where the  plane was being bussed. I was in seat 3D. It was not a business class seat at all but an economy seat with almost zero legroom. The  selling point of spending £385 was legroom and I didn't have any. I asked the flight attendant if anything could be done.  BA would not have been my choice anyway but I do understand that given tight schedules and limited choice sometime you are forced to fly with a particular company against your better judgment. In that case don't make the same mistake as me. British Airways.

Welcome to Heathrow.  I cannot believe  why British Airways  decided to embarrass  the staff so  much as they  try to cope  to all the  fuss regarding the  services served, which  we were never  informed about. We  spent over £700  on our flight, two of us.  That is so  hard for loyal ists if we  have to go  with Easyjet or  maybe we would,  but to receive  that same treatment  in a great  disappointment

A chaotic check  in at MLA, with no British  Airlines staff checking  passengers is queuing  up resulting in  a lane being  filled with non  business class /  family members. Security  staff more busy  than Ryanair and  BA passengers going through priority/ fast  food Flight ok , warm food  cooked in mushroom  soup or beef  or crushed potatoes  and also with  salad and enough  water to make  you feel sleepy.  Except that if you have a mushroom allergy beware as there is no option to  test your meal  directly or over  the phone for  that specific allergy - BA should do something about  it Annoying passengers as per usual  when using LGW , for me that's a holiday  experience with people  I don't fly  much yet they  seem to be  flying Alfa and  scared of flying  at the point  where we were  cut off by people behind us for reclining our  bags and I  said "obviously you  cannot fly much"  despite us being  blue with BA and gold with LH...). Landed ahead  of schedule but ended up waiting for bags until  they were offloaded  and having a  luggage tag on ... Excellent and friendly cabin crew.

Flew from Bangkok  into London Heathrow. Once again the 3 cabin B777. Crew were very friendly but not very attentive when it came to service so I never got a welcome drink. The seat was the standard Club World seat which is ok for lying down or sitting full up right,  the in between feel awkward. The food was bordering inedible with especially the steak cooked beyond all recognition.  As always BA's lack of dine on demand and  free snacks were showing (the Club kitchen is getting worse each flight it seems). However the meal service is reasonably quick at just over 2 hours from take off and a significant improvement on the outbound flight. The inflight entertainment selection is quite good but the screen are small and terrible and the cabin as a whole could benefit from  more total over hall. Pre-landing snacks were better than the main service but still not  much writing about. Crew were friendly through out the flight but again not very attentive by missing out on servings. If I had not managed to get the tickets at a heavily discounted  discount I would have felt cheated on both the hard and soft product provided. British  Airlines needs to step up their game to get my money again.

London Gatwick - Pisa Return. Another  less than satisfactory experience with British Airways. I fly this route often as I have a home in Tuscany. When I first flew this route (as opposed to Ryanair) on arrival you had an air bridge  that made it a more satisfactory experience. Now, as a cost cutting exercise - you don't. Which means if its raining you get wet. which we did. The BA LGW Club lounge is closed and we went to a temporary set up at the North terminal. It was fine. Very busy - but the light lunch was better than BA's own set up - the last  day we used it. Plane left 40 minutes late as we were stuck on the apron waiting for a slot. I  settled for a couple of G&Ts - and my wife had the afternoon tea which she said was fine. On the return the "Club Europe" lines at Pisa check in were used by just about anyone. It was a zoo. The BA airport crew didn't care and given the management at BA don't care about customer service and quality, why should they? Lunch was quite pleasant, some sort of Chicken dish. We got stacked for 15 minutes which is annoying. On both flights I got the front  seat which gave more legroom. The seats? Well the usual abysmal so called "Club Europe." A disaster and only worth the  trouble if you buy them in a sale. FAs in both directions were splendid. They get very embarrassed  about talking about BA cutbacks. Who wouldn't? Flying 1st class next week to the Middle East. Not holding my breath that it is going to be an eye popping experience.

We pre-booked seat  number and, on  my seat, noticed  papers piled at  end of seat,  broken plastic bottles  of paper etc.  in the cabin  were dated and  dirty Also the  home entertainment screen  would not work.  Upon arrival in  Bangkok complained to  British Airways but  had a somewhat  late reply apologising and received a  small £20 e-voucher  in compensation. When  arriving back to Thailand (Flight No . 27 Sep)  a check-in member  of staff advised he was unable  for print of  a pass for  the flight Bangkok  to Chiangmai but  told me this  seemed quite normal  it would cause no problems. With  flights booked through  my final destination I was advised  at Bangkok airport  that without the  necessary boarding pass,  we would have  to go landside  and check in  at Bangkok Airways  flight check-in. A  major fiasco ensued  showing the ineptitude  at British Airways  and BA motto  - fly to  Thailand - I  could not.

London Heathrow to  Las Vegas. Outbound great welcome and  excellent Homebound friends  had same great  welcome from female  passengers on their  end of cabin.  Unfortunately my wife  & I were  chasing after young male attendant whose  accent was rather  erratic and for  us everything seemed  ot be too  much trouble. Detracted  us somewhat from  our very enjoyable  fully booked Vegas  experience - think maybe the guy  is in the  next career. Boeing  - OK but  little bit tatty all round. I  think they're near  me

Tokyo Haneda to  London and British Airways is cost cutting all the time! I was  very disappointed with the onboard catering.  After a 12  hours flight there  are no mid flight snacks or food. The tuck box vanished from your offering. We  are served a small breakfast at  breakfast (9am Tokyo time) and nothing until 90 minutes before landing. Pretty much 10 hours with no food!  So not  just the food available seems to have been reduced  and it is  also very poorly timed.  It looks like despite BA's good profits, they are cost cutting to extreme . Perhaps the CEO could try out this sector in World Traveller or World Traveller Plus (rather the the First class he probably uses on a long  distance flight) and see how he  looks at the  start of it! Maybe he will turn a little skinnier! Certainly not  as enjoyable or  relaxing experience!

I had a  perfectly satisfactory flight with British Airways  to Boston and  Paris this month  ( 2016). I  slept most of  the way had  to nibble at the food the quality of which might be declining although at altitude  your taste buds are pathetic and had no alcohol. The only reason I fly first class is that the beds are  less comfortable than  second world and  I dislike the club seating arrangement.  Aside from breakfast scrambled eggs I hardly eat on  long haul. Generally speaking, the cabin crews are good and attentive and it's a bonus  if you get some ex Concorde crew. I never want to board  an aircraft early  because I know that I will not have trouble stowing my bags in first. A previous review complained that on the 787 there is only one toilet in first but  they are only 8 seats. All in all, I use BA because  unlike the UK I can get to any part of the world  quickly with few changes and in safety.

From Francisco to Manchester via Heathrow.  An improvement from the outbound leg  of this journey. A 2 year old A380, the  cabin were much nicer than the  previous outbound flight - seat 82a, I did like  my extra storage bin to the side of the  cabin by the  door which freed  me room on the floor (can't say if that's  the good thing  from BA or  bad on this aircraft though as it was my first A380 flight).  Take the positives out of the  gate No sense of organisation to  the boarding process . 400 folk  waiting by a gate. Cabin crew  were uninterested during boarding. 7pm departure so I was looking forward to  getting a meal  and getting to sleep early to  hopefully get back on uk time as best as I could. At  arrival meal arrived,  little choice offered and bits missing  were both mine and my partners , I got  a bread roll she didn't, she got a dessert  he didn't, neither of us got a drink and  my gosh it was a travesty  someone had the cheek to ask  a member of  my crew for  a Diet Coke! Woke for breakfast  after a few  days sleep and instantly regretted it. A folded omelette  and potato wedges  in a cherry  pie (breakfast of kings). The final couple of hours was spent watching  my interactive map to see how  much I had  been to suffer and listening to  the cabin crew in the back  talk about various things in their  daily lives. The  10 minute call  was from the  pilot and crew  had prepared the cabin for landing.  My quick connecting flight to Manchester was pretty much  that same too. If I could  count things as  5 stars I  would I'm ashamed British Airways is my national carrier.

Flying to San Francisco via Heathrow. First time flying  for British Airways and will most certainly be my  final 11 hour  journey from London  bound to San  Jose on a  very very tired looking Boeing 777-200  - not what I had expected.  The system was  poor in choice  of colour pixels on the screen. Couldn't sit with my partner as unlike most "leading " BA opt  into a system  with charging if you want to reserve a seat before check in opens? When check in did open  passengers were assigned seats miles apart and the plane  is fully booked - so 11 hours of no  seats IFE and the option to  return to my  partner involved a 5 minute walk  off the plane. We could have opted to go  on Virgin cheaper but decided it would be nice  to go with  Emirates Who as far as I can work out are on Ryanair's  list of additional . Never again British Airways, never !

After many years  of flying on  after being a  staff member for  my last 6  months I have  finally lost my  patience with BA.  ) There is no point BA even having a  passenger relations team  as it seems  the hands are  to firmly tied  and be able  and do anything  to a loyal  passenger when things  go wrong. I  once spent over  month on a  flight to Singapore,  both being First and inbound in  BA World. The  plane was a  relatively new A380  but on the  first journey, the  crew developed issues in the toilets  where the toilets  might not be  flush properly. The  crew on board did their best  but after things  but still wasn’t  the very pleasant  feeling from the  passengers (and the  airport might I  add  On  getting Inbound a  3 days later,  they were delayed  for 3 hours  bc of a  plumbing issue in  our toilets where  it was no  drinking water throughout  The entire plane  must have been  that same aircraft  as the outbound).  BA ground crew  dropped everything to  go and fix  this because they  did feel it  was fair departing  on a 13  hr voyage with  not running water  to the toilets.  This meant no  hot water to  clean the toilet  but the suction  machine still worked),  and not running  water to clean  toilets and of course no tea  / coffee facilities.  Several hours had  passed and the  crew decided to depart anyway, the  decision was to  land the plane  with loads of  hot water and  soap in the toilets but no  tea or coffees  for the whole  flight (they had  better get the plane to land  back at LHR ) before the  2 hour delay  and stop each  party claiming 300  Euro under the  airline compensation policy (the plane landed  safely to LHR  after 54 min ) To top  it off, after  getting back to LHR, the ground  team from BA  failed to tell  the airport ground  staff of a late gate change  that resulted in  the bags delivery  be delayed by a further 1hr  30 min. So  In summary, I get home 5  hrs later than  planned with toilet  problems on the  plane which created  a bit of  bad smell around the whole aircraft,  with toilet issues  on the way , delaying the  flight and making an uncomfortable journey  along the way , and seriously  delays my arrival back home with  some baggage issues  attached to it.  BA has the  potential to get  any decent amount of compensation in  that situation regardless  of the class  we are travelling  on - the  answer from BA  public relations was : Avios Points!  is 15,000 going  ot get me?  So I ask  I can do  that and the  nice lady on  her phone (who  then embarrassed herself  trying to tell  us couldn’t do <mask> as the <mask> decision is <mask> Can I speak to the <mask> I ask? <mask> am thinking <mask> a loyal member spending so <mask> on BA <mask> might have <mask> decency to <mask> to me), <mask> answer was <mask> they don’t <mask> to anyone. <mask>

Bari to Gatwick. Yet another abysmal  service from BA. No wonder the majority of passangers  on short haul these days are  booking package tours.  Those making individual  flights obviously travels with other more customer focused airlines. Check in at  JFK was resonable  and unlike on  any outward flight,  where the boarding process was the  usual expected chaos.  This decision to  use hand luggage  with tickets is  the poor one.  Like other airlines, no attempt appears to be made  and regulate the  size or weight  the bags carried  onto board. On this flight, I  had several arguments  about locker space.  The cabin crew  treated us with bored zombie like  English Meal service costed of a  single edible sandwich hastily delivered with no finesse. The  meal arrived a good half an  hour later than  our food! It  is the the  stated aim of BA cabin crew  management to provide  good service as fast as possible  and maximise the time available to  customers in the  lounge Do BA  passengers never sample  the economy short haul product?

From JNB to  Australia via LHR.  So disappointed and  expected so much more. After reading  your comments have  all agree that  Gulf Airways standards  had slipped dramatically.  I flown first  the same routing  a while back  its very evident  you see the  short cutting in  many aspects that  are definitely not  worth it to  offer that sort  of pricing. Food  was at all up to standard and can honestly  not have had  much better experience  being flown business  with Gulf and  other carriers. Its  another real shame , when you  talk to staff on board all agree and are  so embarrassed. On  the positive point,  crew on all  flights were really  friendly and helpful, just let down by a poor  system

Flying to London. First time flown with British Airways and the last.  Service was slow,  quality is poor to say the least compared to other airlines, and to be honest the last time will use them. Check in was fine as done most of it online myself, boarding ok. On value for money I  would recommend another carrier.

My wife and I have been  flying British Airways short haul in Club Europe for  three years and until recently have  done more than  satisfied with the  experience provided. Noticeably,  each year that  service has become  much more erratic culminating in an extremely poor performance and unpleasant experience  during this recent  journey to Malta ex Gatwick. Departure  TIME was 0750  but we arrived  to Premium Check-in at 0620 to find only one  person of staff  working the desks  between First and  then There were  a least 10  people waiting in  the queue, some of whom defected  to Economy desks  and were heavily  jammed with faster  incoming queues. Only after more than  10 minutes did extra staff arrive and when we  left the desk  the attitude of  a Check-in lady  leaves much to  become desired -  somewhat unsmiling and  indifferent is probably a kind description.  it would have been good to  had been informed that the No 1 Lounge was  available in the  back of the  lounge offering, but no mention of  the lounge was  mentioned at all.  The No 1  lounge struggles to cope with the additional passenger load, but that is another story. Boarding  went fine, but  our in-flight service  from a totally disinterested cabin crew  was perfunctory at  times The meal service was late and slow with no drinks of any sort offered  until after all  food had been dispensed. Clearing the  plane was even  worse The flight  was in final  descent to Luqa when, returning from  the toilet, I  found one of  my cabin crew sitting in the galley playing solitaire on her I-pad whilst bottles and  drinks remained at  bay which then had to be hurriedly removed as the Captain announced  for crew to  prepare for landing".  Should I have  paid for being  a mere passenger  during this lady's games session? Appalling - and such  stark contrast to several LHR-PRG early  morning flights over  the years when it has been a joy to  travel BA. This  may just have  been a bad flight, but I  doubt that this  marks the future for BA unless  something at the  company reads these reports and takes remedial action before it's good name  becomes lost forever.

Flew with British Airways for the first time from Sydney to London return. Very unsatisfactory compared to premium  flight experiences with other airlines. Had to pay to  reserve seats and  not only was  it no priority boarding, the World Traveller Plus customers  in fact were  very last to  arrive There were  about 6 rows  in premier economy,  but was told that the meal  line has ran . The meal  brought me back to air travel  of the 1970s. The starter consisted  of 6 tasteless pasta spiral and 1 cherry tomato.  The fish was  bland and tasteless and the rice  an unappetising grey . The dessert  is a square  and plain cheesecake.  All beverages at  table were served in thin paper ! There was no other service, no offer of water or snacks  with the meals. Toiletry consisted of  a wash and nothing else. The  seats were not cleaned and replenished during the stop overs in Singapore. The seat was comfortable enough but has only a foot rest rather than the leg  rests of other  flights BA World  Travel Plus is certainly not value  for money and I will not  stay with them .

New York JFK  and London Heathrow . British Airways.  Do bear in mind that this complaint concerns a business class ticket. Customer service is non existant. I  did not choose  seats on line.  Called for help and was told  that was not possible for them to do it  on the phone.  Should I use another browser. I  told a friend  who could try  with her pc and another browser.  Different story. Unable 't choose seat.  Call airline again  and was told  again it could  only be done  by airport staff. After pressing them for the number  and being assured  it was being  given the contact info for BA  for JFK, I called only to  find I had been given the  wrong phone number for JFK. Absurd.  We hadn't used  this airline in years and never  have again. It's a shame. They  ought to be such a class  company

We haven't flown British Airways for  such a while  but this journey to Nice drew home to me  that BA is  no longer the premier airline I  expected it to be.
