Trip was  of no major  problems but my  point being is  because it is  not different to  any of the  various other airlines I have flown  with as EasyJet,  Singapore Airlines, Flybe . Cabin interior  felt a bit tired, I asked  the air hostess for a Diet  Coke and didn't  find one. One toilet between 120  + people in  cabin isn't great  on a 1 hour 40 minute . Cluttered galley  with people waiting for the one toilet, congestion in the aisle blocking  out flight attendants  is not ideal.  Never get me  started the flight  BA airline was  cheaper but no different than the  others lower cost  but when comparing ticket prices BA  not longer has  an edge for me.

From Heathrow to  Malaysia Lumpur. Very  good service. This  being their much  cheaper Boeing 787 first class. Could nt book a  table in their  cabin despite trying  and book 3  months in advance. The cabana in  our lounge was  nice and had  one clear partition  for the toilet/ chair Nobody bothered  or check if  I needed anything.Priority  there was a . Outbound service  on board was  the Cabin crew  failed to anticipate  your needs. No . One toilet and the same size as in a low cost  flight Food OK  but not great.  On arrival I  questioned the chief  complaining about fast  track only to  be brushed off  with "we don't  do fast track ". Return flight  is equally poor.  After the bell  ringing no one  in Rang again  took an hour to order breakfast.  One came and  says "of course  when we start serving from the  buffet side". So  much for first  time dining on . The only great part of the trip was the first class  breakfast in Kuala , thanks to  Malaysia Airlines as  that is their lounge and NOT  Qatar Airways .  Malaysia lags behind  La France La Première as far as first class  dining is concerned.

Travel with British Airways is always a good experience, took a short  flight to Majorca out on 10/10 returning 14/10 from LHR T5. Flew out on G-EUYY A320 and back on G-EUXF A321 both excellent flights, the crew were very smart and welcoming and the aircraft clean and comfortable. Enjoyed the lunch and bar service going out and refreshments and  drink service on return. Noting other reviews its a  shame people board flights hungry as  their are many outlets at the airports prior to  leaving even major retailers do good "meal deals". The crew make the difference ensuring a safe comfortable flight.

Still cannot believe  that British Airways  had such a  narrow seat pitch  for such a  small aircraft. I  have been on  several short haul flights that would have been far  too comfortable let  along a 12 hour flight to  London I am  not overweight but  I am 6ft-2ins tall and when  the passenger in  front of me  took his seat  their was absolutely  no space remaining.  That total lack  in space ruined  my otherwise flawless  experience and would  certainly make me  consider alternative airlines for long haul comfort in future.

Seattle to Prague via London Heathrow  on British Airways. Check-in took about an hour (online checkin was not available). The catering onboard is the  best from all European legacy airlines. The breakfast on  a long haul flight was a bad joke (bread with cheese and a muesli bar).  On the 2 hour flight only  served chips or biscuits. I talked to the cabin crew on most of the 4 flights, they encouraged me to write reviews, because they do not agree with the company catering policy too. Also the performance of the crew is of a very low quality. The aircrafts were new, that is of course more important that food.

Welcome to Heathrow.  British Airways gave  us something I  wasn expecting - probably my worst  commercial flight experience . Clearly BA's  security measures have been primarily concerned  about turning economy  flight into the  ultimate 'cattle-class' experience. They really need  to up their game to compete  with Singapore Airlines , Emirates -  they deliver economy  style travel at  prices completely different  than BA - where do I start? Cramped seats  that even felt  too small to  my children (6 and 8) and little leg room.  It feels quite tortuous after 5 hours of travel, let alone 12. The food was laughable - yes,  BA says on  the marketing blurb  their are 12+  items to choose  from but it fails to mention that they are inedible. I thought  a children's meals of macaroni cheese  might be a  safer bet -  a grey gelatinous  bits that turned  brown made even  the cabin crew blush. The entertainment  provided just about  what the children  entertained - but  the high hopes  - kiddie rucksack,  free 'kids' treat  bags and a  welcoming welcome for the under 12s was completely lacking.If  you have a choice go with another airline. Go with Emirates.

London Heathrow to Budapest with British Airways. Yet another abysmal flight with : The majority  on passangers these days seem to be large tour . Perhaps that's why service standards  and comfort resemble a 1970s charter . The cheaper no checked baggage tickets, allowing a ridiculous 23kg of hand luggage, cause  delays on boarding,  as 2 or even 3 people  having to lift heavy luggage into the lockers. Consequently  toilets are blocked and while these  transfers take place. All semblance of  the boring has  been abandoned, there  was no welcome  upon board, only  loud shrieking from  flight attendants to  those seated quickly  enough to place  luggage small enough  on the seat in front to accommodate said oversized  heavy luggage. The  seats on my flight were hard and uncomfortable. Cabin so called service,  almost nonexistant. The packaged inedible offering  presented as breakfast  is thrust at  me with no finesse, and accompanied  by half a  hot cup of  stale stewed tea. The cabin staff  seemed hell bent , racing through  customer service to  make time available  to chat in  the galley. The  one redeeming feature was that the  flights left on time, and arrived 10 minutes early. I was only  taking the flight as part of a tour group.  Even independently, I  could have opted for a rival low cost carrier.

Washington Dulles to Nairobi via London. Was excited to fly First Class on BA from Dulles to Nairobi, since it's about 15 hours of flying time I decided to splurge on a 1st Class ticket. Things started off poorly at checkin when BA's computer system  went down  a seemingly constant problem ) . After 45 minutes of waiting, they  was finally able to get a back up system going and I was checked in and off to their Lounge. Great meal and service there. My flying companion didn't want to splurge on a 1st Class ticket so she was in Business Class. It wasn't long after we boarded that she came forward to report that their business class seating was the worst she's seen. BA has this squirrelly layout where passengers sit forwards and backwards on the flight, meaning that you lack privacy and someone may have to step over you when  your asleep. Well I sprung for an $850 upgrade  for her and all was well. Until the captain announced that there was an unmatched bag on board and it had to be removed before we could depart. Here's where BA's systems again breaks down and their computer isn't working to locate the bag in the hull. 3.5 hours later they locate the bag and we take off. We land 3 hours late at Heathrow and miss our connection to Nairobi! No one to assist you; head off to another terminal  for customer service, wait 30-40 minutes  on line to be told that they can put you on a Kenyan Air flight business class in 8 hours or you can wait  for the next  morning and fly out on BA. We chose Kenya Airways and arrived the next morning without one checked bag. On our return flight I had booked a  Business class ticket and asked if they would upgrade me since I couldn't use my 1st class ticket. No, can't do that and you'll have to apply for a refund. Meanwhile they upgraded a couple of passengers gratis! I  was told later that that is "promotional" and to hell with a paying passenger. The bottom line is, don't fly BA if you are going on to a distant location, they are unreliable , assistance is negligible. If you're just flying on to the Continent where there are multiple flights you  never make it.

Flew Malaga to Gatwick. Although a better flight than two weeks ago the 'service' of a small packet of crisps, peanuts  or biscuit is a disgrace. At least with other airlines you can purchase food. Passengers were hungry and  cabin staff were clearly embarrassed with the megre offering. For our national carrier to go to this low base and makes a mockery of 'To fly-to serve'. We will choose any other airline over British Airways in future - human cargo are clearly an inconvenience for the BA  crew (although the  cabin staff did their very best). No doubt BA management can't wait  and get their hands on more of our money when they start to supply food at a charge. Truly shocking values  clearly not customer focussed in any way whatsoever.

We were very excited about our  Air World journey to Mauritius and  very disappointed we were. The food  were great, the wines weren't either and the foot board of my " bed" kept on collapsing so  I hardly got any sleep. The cabin staff were  lovely and very  accommodating We have  a Virgin Upper  Suite and it  was much better as your bed  is made up with a duvet  and sheets. All we got on  British Airways was a sort of  very nasty blanket and no sleep suit either. Very  uncomfortable in all of it. Our  flight was terribly  late because the incoming flight to Gatwick was struck  with lightening which is not BA's  business I know . I would have thought they could provide another  flight to save  us to wait  as long as  they have done  with the past. Maybe they just  never have spare  seats any more long haul. We have travelled British Airways Europe several  time in the  last 3 years and think this  is wonderful but long haul just  did not do it for us , certainly we  know next time  I go long haul we won't have to travel British Airways unless  we pull up  my socks.

Return journey Gatwick  to Dubrovnik. Outward journey seating was basic but were at least served a basic cardboard tasting breakfast and one drink. Return journey departing at 12 noon only served either hot drink and 1  snack or cold drink and small of packet of  biscuits I think this is slowly acclimatising people to refreshments being withdrawn completely early next year on short haul flights. Staff were very friendly but they must be embarrassed by the lowering of standards on British  airlines

We recently flew British Airways business class from Calgary to Rome via London and returned  the same route. Like previous reviews we too will avoid British Airways  by all costs. Although the cabin service and staff  on all of our routes was exceptional the layout  of the international business class seating is brutal! Who designs seating where you have to either bother your fellow traveler to get out or  climb over their feet?  Even worse is what British Airways sells as business class within Europe. They  offer nothing more  like economy seats with the middle  section blocked off. My husband is 6'4" and I'm 5'10" and our knees were jammed up against the seat in front of us. Could you make your passengers feel anymore cramped?! My biggest complaint about British Airways is having  to pay to reserve my seats! They are the only international carrier that does this.  Especially in business class. When I  signed on 24  hrs in advance, there were no seats to choose from - and to my utter surprise my husband and I weren't even seated together. Shame on you British Airways for being so cheap! We are flying to Europe again shortly and will  definitely be looking  around On the plus side, food  & service on our flights was exceptional but your customer service leaves much to be  said

London Heathrow to  the return. Appalling : The booking  system is dreadful : they charge  if you want  to change seat  for economy, I  had been told  you will be  charges for food  and drink from January, and the  app very difficult  for use. Their  customer "service" via  phone or email  was abysmal (they  are extremely rude,  sometimes completely wrong , and I  had been cut , given wrong  tickets and put  in to loop ). Whilst some  on the cabin  staff are lovely,  they are extremely  rude This week a steward refused  and help me  place my cabin  seat in the  luggage locker (the  suitcase was not oversized, but I  had a bad  one at present,  and I asked  him very politely)  - yet he  never refused though  it helped other  passengers I flew  first class a  month ago and  my fold out  bin was filthy , even though  a steward saw  it he ignored  my wet coffee  table and salt  was everywhere and  I had to  repeatedly ask him  for clean it.  Which he did,  albeit with very  much grace. I  use British Airways  when I can,  because sometimes the  right routes and  times fit best  for my needs.  But every single  flight I do  fly with them,  and am reminded  why I dislike  them so much.

Mexico City to Malaga return. Things started badly when  the 2 year  old son was  late on a  missed booking reference. The call centre in India refused  my help fix  it saying I  could manage his  flight because it  is in my  name Then we  got a three  minute delay at  BA - something  to do with  BA miscalculating the  baggage allowance. During  that time BA didn't give us any food or  drinks and gave  you no updates  as to what  was happening. We  were just under  3 hours late,  but couldn't get  our Return journey at Malaga, another  two hour delay.  When we got  there tried to  check Avios points  exchange website, but  was getting 'system error'. Then tried  contacting BA customer  service and after  checking through the  BA system was  told that "due  to disruption your  flight cannot be  accessed  That's  my last time  you fly this  totally uncaring airline.  " The only  news is that  Mexico City is  one great airport  over a weekend!

Come on British Airways. Really. I have flown BA long haul on two journeys in the last four weeks. First from LIM-LHR and now LHR-DEN. I know  how BA has refurbished some of their B747-400 and B777 but the  aircraft are a disgrace. As a  British carrier, what message does this send to the rest of the world? On a  positive note, the  BA crew are  extremely polite (sometimes to the point  of being passive-aggressive),  but this is a humourless service. Even London Underground has moved from  their dated uniforms.  And in-flight catering is lack-lustre. I choose vegan because the standard meals  were truly awful.  You now even have to pay for the snacks  and meals (unlike  LAT or LATAM). I understand the economics are difficult,  given that some  companies subsidise flag ging but small and low-cost changes would make a major difference. Firstly,  beef up the staff (have you  noticed the LAN ?) On the last flight, one crew member hadn't shaved and it wasn't designer stubble.  Throw some humour training into the  crew and just  keep passengers flight comfortable. The IFS systems are so  old that they match the reruns of old BBC sitcoms/ soaps offered.  on a positive note: 1) I  believe BA is  the safe airline  with the crew professional. Big bonus  point for me. 2 When there is a problem, BA is efficient  in sorting it out. 3) Communication  within the cockpit is usually good.

Being a gold Exec Member and this was a redemption flight one should not really complain. But if I was paying 4000 UK for this I would be out raged. The Aircraft at B777-200 well past its sell by date. The Crew whilst personable and very pleasent look bored. The food is a disgrace, wines (white warm), reds (cold) so bad as when I asked for the Business class menu to compare it with First, was superior in every way. Example being First - Soup versus Business Crab Tian? The CSD just apologised and said I know its a  lie but we keep telling them. Aircraft was so  heavy the ceiling fell in with the celoptape loosing its grip and some foam plate  sticking out. It really is past a laugh asking people to pay their rates. Overall I find BA moving to a 3 star, its overall product is lazy, apathetic, inconsistent and tired. The crew are fantastic in the air as for the  Economy well its like a tube station or a civil servant job for life atitude. My advice stay well well away for premium prices,  the Euro Business is laughing stock.

I hadn't flown  with BA for  quite a number  of years, so  upon seeing their  current fleet, I  came expecting something . Instead, it  was like being in a time warp. The aircraft  has seen better days, in my opinion, and judging  from the IFE  markings and the  cabin design, damaged  seats and uncomfortable  seating it showed. Our nearest toilet  was out of action, not good.  My crew were  in the service  is okay, it 's just a convenient way of 'A to B'  In my opinion,  nothing else. Only  should this airline manage to update  all they offer,  improve (aircraft wise)  or provide as much emphasis on  those everyday economy folk as they do on their  frequent fliers, I  will consider them 's Value for  money is negligible,  and after using other, forward thinking  British airlines, the  service made the end of a  pleasant holiday feel somewhat sour.

Flew British Airways from Boston to London Heathrow. The plane was clearly dated - judging by the old IFE screens and even some rust  here and there , but the plane was clean, the crew were extremely nice and polite. The food was good, although I would say the light meal just before arrival could have been a bit more substantial. Overall, it was a nice flight. A note on the ground service: the way it is set  up - with  one line for bag drop among others and multiple counters that can call for this and that spread out - leads to some people not hearing being called. I could clearly hear the  counter annoyingly saying  you have called them and they  are not listening  so I am not doing it anymore". I really think it is not nice, given  some distance between  those counters and the lines and the natural noise on an airport terminal.

From London Heathrow  for Lisbon with  Portugal Airways. The plane was slightly  slow but the  pilot explained why  and we recovered  the delay on  the way. I  find communication to be important and  appreciated the gesture.  All crew were extremely nice and  every snack we were given was just fine for  only a short  delay I am  very sorry we had to take  the bus in  order to get to the terminal.

Toronto to Lisbon  stop in London (outward) and stopover in London (return) with British Airways. A mix of Premium Economy and  Super Easy check in at Toronto where the staff are great and the club lounge  like usual was clean, welcoming and well run. OK  snacks with juice and water offered on boarding. Bizarrely, no sparkling wine offered ("Sir - we only offer  sparkling wine on  return from London") No hot towel after take off but menu card offered. One round of drinks followed by dinner. Steak was overcooked, dry and with a  nasty gravy - the worst meal to date. The biggest insult was the breakfast which has been downgraded from the "muffin or nothing" to a basket of smaller muffins, chocolate and cereal bars plus tea / coffee and juice. Just when you thought BA couldn't stoop any lower,  they manage to find something else to nickel and dime. Good club lounge in T3  with decent showers.  The flight from London to Lisbon was one of the best short haul flights for  BA A younger mixed fleet crew , really friendly,  offering great service and a prompt drink and snack service - a tasty roll (2 bites) and a  drink (1 bite) with second drinks provided on request. Returning from Lisbon, a dreadful bus  ride to the aircraft, a more sullen and older crew with average service with the mini savory roll replaced by sweet or savory snacks (shameful that BA are increasing the sugar on offer across most flights with the current  obesity debate). The BA lounge on the B gates at T5 remains  my favourite lounge with plenty of  seating and some  comfort and quiet.  Also one of the old 747's with the old configuration with PE in front of biz class with juice, water or sparkling wine offered  on boarding. My IFE had frozen  as I sat  down and even  then reset had a mind of it's own. The  onboard video was abandoned soon after starting for a  quick demo as there were clearly IFE issues across this aging 747. I finally gave up watching TV as the channel kept changing. No hot towels again.  Next drinks round , on asking for the little bag of pretzels, I was told they had be cut by embarrassed  cutter (at around  20 a bag - really?) A vile coleslaw starter, a choice of steak or butter chicken curry which I had and  the small pot of chocolate pudding completed dinner. The chicken was tasty but not a business class entree (as claimed) by any stretch of the imagination. Tea and coffee but no after dinner drinks (had already been cut). The biggest insult in this continuing degradation of service is the scrapping of the second meal. The sandwich has gone with either <mask> cookie or single finger of chocolate with tea / coffee with <mask> embarrassed crew (again). This constant reduction in the PE product with the small stuff can't go much lower - there's <mask> the seats <mask> space left! Ironically, whilst in <mask> the announcement was made regarding short haul food and drink being charged for in economy. BA are being disingenuous to <mask> that people are asking for improved catering - yes, they're asking <mask> you've cut the service back so much in the first place. I'd pay for a decent M&S sandwich but I enjoy my free <mask> Charging for <mask> / coffee and juice - <mask> Air Canada haven't stooped that low. I really worry for BA's <mask> The drive to improve the <mask> line has gone too far. I don't see fares being reduced to reflect the reduced service. The board of BA / IAG group and their shareholders should be ashamed and embarrassed with <mask> as the demise of the UK's flag carrier continues.

Flew British Airways to/from Heathrow recently as first experience. Have read a number of previous reviews commenting about the indifferent attitudes  to cabin service. I absolutely agree,  but what a shame. But BA, if you actually read some of these reviews, you can actually retrain and improve our perceptions quickly. When boarding, rather than  simply pointing to which aisle to  avoid walking down, actually have your cabin staff positioned (even in economy!) to assist passengers struggling to load carry on baggage  and to get seated and out of the way of others. Many of us are unfamiliar with the somewhat different controls on the newer 777's. Perhaps a handout as we board or a  tour of cabin ? On long transatlantic flights, cabin  crew disappear for at least 4-5 hours mid flight. Perhaps an occasional trip down the cabin once every hour or two  to ask if customers need anything? (Or are they fearful of the extra work?).

I frequently use  US Airways morning  flights from Boston , London, and  back again, but  the reduction in  the quality of  food served in  flight is startling.  The English Breakfast  menu was a  complete surprise until  our last flight,  after which the  lack of portion  size and quality  became noticeable. The  standard landing snack  has always been  a decent chicken  egg sandwich, but  for this flight, it was a  disappointment - maybe  because I forget.  Our cabin crew  was efficient and  helpful and the  service was excellent,  vastly improved from  the older 747's,  as we have  experienced on the . Beware, however,  Long Track security  from Heathrow, which  even in the  past six months,  have been glacial,  but better than  the lines.

New York JFK to Düsseldorf via London Heathrow. The  plane check-in was  quick and easy. The choice of seats (free of charge) was very  easy even the plane was half-full. The check-in (baggage) organization in JFK was a mess. Long lines with no priority for  passengers You should arrive min 2hours before the boarding, otherwise you will  miss your flight.  The staff  in the plane more less accabtable.  When hand luggage got misplaced in the plane, I  heard somebody just remove it. I asked the staff,  well at least they found my hand luggage. Recommendation to BA, staff  is partly unacceptable. Beverages and seat comfort in total .

For simply next time we fly, and where possible, we shall use any other airline (with one exception being South African Airways) rather than British Airways. Flew from Johannesburg to London Heathrow. The seating in business  of the A380 is dire and the description given by another reviewer that it feels  almost if you are in a coffin is pretty accurate. The staff  are just about acceptable, but they  seem indifferent and just going through the motions of serving the food and beverages whilst trying not to look too bored whillst doing their job. Oh, and my TV packed up and froze, so I was unable to watch  or listen to any music for half of the journey. The Qantas business class seating is superb and just how all the other airlines should configure their seating on the  ground Shame they don't fly to South Africa, although, if they did,  its would be impossible to book a seat, as everyone would choose to fly with  them and not British Airways.

London Heathrow to  London Took off , landed on  the Sandwich on  this outbound flight  was good with  lots of drinks  in this short  trip Return flight  is offered again  with plenty of  drinks a full  meal Seats hard  and okay. Service  great on both  flights Tickets expensive ly for two  tickets got it  down to £150  on avios points.  I only booked  one week before  departure

Flying Gatwick to  Birmingham I never  in my life  took a flight  was bad as  THIS one. My husband and I were flying to  Manchester for our second anniversary from  London Airport. The  attendants were rude and inattentive. I  hit the flight  control button so  several times, and  while waiting 20 mins, they just  turned it off.  And that was  only the worst  about it -  the flight was  very cold. We asked if they could please turn  it up (they  didnt care), multiple passengers asked for  extra blankets (not that it would help). I was literally shaking the  first flight through, even though I had multiple layers  of clothes on.  I will never  go direct to  London with British Airways. I paid more for a direct ticket, than  a indirect flight,  but thanks BA  on letting me realise paying more  will equate to better service.

Paris to Bangkok via London. What a mistake to choose BA for this business class flight. The experience of the seats (with their weird coffin-like configuration, sliding screens, and people climbing over me almost continually) was enough to say "never again". The service was very patchy, with some  really long-faced and size-challenged cabin staff.  Very undrinkable, and forget having a  single Main course near to inedible,  although the portions were thankfully miniature. The wine selection was good, but my unsmiling stewardess told me there  were no Bordeaux "only merdock". (I should have explained  how Medoc is a Bordeaux region, but really). This  service comes nowhere close to Thai, Emirates or Cathay. Singapore Airlines is in a league way way ahead. I should add that the lounges in Paris and London were great. Paris was a share with Cathay, and London's Terminal 5 lounge was excellent. Shame about the flight and the quite hideous  cabin tight, face to face with a complete stranger, noisy and hard.

So dire. They  started installing a  special check in  process which failed.  Long queues at  check in and  you had to  wait to be  moved out of  the line or  it would have  lost our flight , arriving well  into advance. They  even lost our  luggage both mine  from my partners,  and they didn't  actually get it  at the Glasgow  airport The luggage  was 2 days  to arrive in  London that's 2  hours from a  5 day break  so we had  to stay in  hotels on luggage.  The online information  system didnt match , we were  told verbally on  the phone and  most people we  speak to were  very rude and unhelpful. We submitted  a formal complaint  through our return  on BA website.  It took them  over 3 weeks  in reply and  when they did  they accepted no  complaints and gave  us a list  more excuses about  how they had  this new check  out service that  were causing problems  from London. Totally  unacceptable to the  people in Glasgow.  Totally appalling company  - gone are  they days where  they had a  good reputation for  chasing after customers.  No we will  NEVER fly with  anyone again unless  it is absolutely  any other option.

Here I am again after my previous review 2  years ago of specifically the British Airways online check in system. I am currently in Cyprus on holiday and will be flying back to London this evening  to my elderly Mother. We sat next to each other last night at 1930 and  had our BA apps on our  smartphones at the  same time. My Mother had a choice of 12 seats (on a 300 seat Boeing 767), and I  got a choice  between just 4 seats. Again. So clear evidence of passenger inequality at BA, even though the passengers are  all in the same cabin class. This happened 2  weeks ago when  travelling from London Heathrow to Larnaca.  And why do I, who flies  4 times a year with BA, only get 4 (very poor location) seats to "choose" from, and another BA Economy passenger gets a choice of 12 seats  a choose from?  Also why do BA offer an  extra check in  system which is not fit for purpose? When I  flew with Aeroflot, you can choose your seat at the time you actually book your  seat As it should be with every airline. But  they appear to suffer from some  type of 'seat  sharing issue for some reason. I  guess they would rather people pay the £15 to choose a seat in advance on top of the  already high price of their tickets,  which I personally will never ever do.

Flying to London Heathrow with British  Airlines The was  a first experience  flying BA's A380  and it was very comfortable and relaxing. We usually fly Etihad from Australia to LHR but this time decided to try BA. The boarding at Singapore was  quite friendly and on time. As  the was a late evening flight (2320) we just  had to get  there and into bed as soon as possible. We  stressed this point to the crew and they were fantastic in making  that happen as  soon as they  felt permitted to set up the  cabin The config of First Class in BA is  4 with 2 aisles. This is  just as good as the Etihad First which has a central aisle with individual cabins  ( apartments) of  every aisle. Never the less the seats were fine  and flat bed ding if a  bit narrow. The  passengers were very  comfortable and did  NOT bother us until breakfast time.  Lunch was just ok with limited  space but this  was ok for us. The A380 is clearly the benchmark in long  distance First Class flight and on  this occasion BA  offered a high  class service.

From Jose (Costa  Rica to Gatwick  by British Airways.  I was very unhappy with this . The seats  are uncomfortable. The  carpet was old and the tv  screens were scratched  and appalling to  me There were  NO drinks services  this whole 10 hour flight, not  including the 2 meals which were  cheaper than usual.  You couldn't get  off and walk , as the  boarding sign was  up for extended  delays I didn't  realise there was  no turbulence, I've had worse. The  lights disappeared for  short periods of time. British Airways are obviously running  for the cheap whilst trading on  a previous good . This is  terrible Compared to  their Dreamliner which  also has games,  wireless charging ports,  unlimited films and  video on demand  - this is  vastly inferior and  i will never travel BA again.

Heathrow to Bangkok  with British Airways. Fast check-in by  BA staff at  the The Galleries  it was as  they were busy , seats were comfortable and the food ok. Boarding  started approx. 50  mins before departure  and boarding through ! Unlike most  on the Middle Eastern airlines we  are just pointed  at the general  direction of our  flight rather than  pointing to them.  This was an  empty 777-200 in  a 3 cabin  area and the  cabin was showing and while generally  good the trimming  is coming apart,  the IFE screens  looked small and  our seats felt  that bit cramped.  So much like  Virgin Atlantic's Upper  Class seat, these were great for  travelling normally or fully flat but  sitting in between was a struggle.  Overall the ying-yang  seat configuration is  uncomfortable to say  very least but  our centre seats  are great if  you travel as  a couple. Welcome  cards were eventually  made and we  took off only  slightly delayed. Dinner  started painfully slow  but it was  another good 3  hrs after take  off before dinner  had finished. Starter  & dessert were  good but the entree was far  to overcooked for  my taste. Also  there is no  dining on demand facility, you eat  when you are  ready when it  suits the crew. The crew were  attentive but painfully . It also  takes more than  an hour after  departure before the cabin lights were  properly dimmed. Breakfast  was served 2  hrs before landing  before the crew  was transformed. It  was a quick  but efficient service,  no shame it  take them 9  hours to get  at that point.  Breakfast was not  great but edible.  BA landed at  exactly on time  and no fast  pass cards for  boarding were given.  Food arrived on  our belt only  moments after we  had passed through , It is  clear that BA  have been cutting  back in their  crew cabin and  that shows in efficiency when compared  against the Middle  Eastern 3, the  European airlines and  even the US , They could  learn from cutting  the very generous  fuel allowance and use the money  spent on fuel on getting a  better hard product ( and cabins)  or improving their  hard product (food,  service etc), especially  for their current  pricing point. Based  on reviews here  BA had set  my expectations of  them low and  it was still  disappointing

I flew Melbourne to Singapore via Sydney on 1  July with British . Our preferred  flight is Etihad  and we decided  instead try BA  where we secured  a very competitive  economy fare. I  have never flown  here before but  had heard not  so good reports, so was a bit apprehensive. We were delighted with  excellent service from  British (BA flys  independently of SYD) in Melbourne in  getting our bags  over to Singapore.  Jet boarding in  Melbourne was very  easy and we  felt warmly welcomed  with the very professional cabin crew.  Our 777 First is a 1-2-1  cabin and we  loved the centre  lounge with the  pat down privacy ! Departure (1500)  was on time , the 9  am flight up  from Singapore was  extremely smooth. Cabin  crew were very  helpful and attentive. There was ample room to stretch , although we  could not makeup  a sleeping option , we were  allowed in Singapore  and go on  an LHR. The  service was lovely  and was the  selection of wine  and drinks. In  all we were delighted with the  accommodation and flight.

Early morning flight to Amsterdam from  Chicago A complicated schedule cause a  slight stir at  first but check-in were woderful this  year and did  well at most  minimal assist. Straight  off the plane which was an  old B-767 with  a 2-2-2 configuration  and business class. Crew professional and  the choice between  please meet or  learn english for  breakfast Full served , cabin cleared in the 50  minutes the flight lasted. Despite a delay out of  Chicago we were  back on time in Amsterdam. The  cabin was crying out for a  nap but otherwise a good flight.

San Jose - London Heathrow -  San Jose in September 2016 in Premium Economy. Was so excited when British Airways announced the new San Jose service earlier this year. Driving  from the 101 to SFO had become a tedious task with traffic getting more and more congested. So was relieved to  get out of SJC, a ten  minute drive from home. My only one gripe with BA is not being able to select a seat at time of booking without paying an additional fee which should not be necessary in  premium Economy. Night before travel, I was unable to select a seat during on-line check-in, so next day I proceeded to the airport only to be told  a seat was available due to over-booking. Was provided an $800 compensation credit card to  spend the following day which I gladly accepted. The  BA 787 is a beautiful quiet airplane and a  nice choice of aircraft for this route. Was given  champagne upon boarding and a hot towel. Only one drink service after take-off and only one shot of whiskey was provided. Dinner service included a choice from the Club World  cocktail menu. Full  course breakfast prior to landing. Return  was given glass of champagne upon boarding and hot towel. Lunch was a Filet of Beef. Mid-flight snack  bar was a let down and afternoon tea included a pizza. Cabin crew were OK and nothing exceptional on both sectors. Overall a good trip.

Flying to Porto , Barcelona to Gatwick a week  ago with British . Both flights  on time. While the seats are  above the cabin , and the  ground crew professional, the service has  actually been minimized.  Just one quick drink run (tiny serving) and a small snack (tiny bag of crisps or biscuits), nothing ! They even missed several rows when handing out the snacks and  we had to  return them. Crew spend most of the time arranging things in the  plane Maybe it's  time to start  preparing food for purchase?

Flight to Boston  and London. First  time flying BA , flying Qatar,  Bahrain and Oman , business class.  Checking in at  BA was quick  and efficient with  two seperate business  and first class  seat in area.  BA uses the  economy lounge, which  is basic but  comfortable The flight from BAH to  BA was on  Boeing 777. The  rows are in  a 2x4x2 configuration  which are very narrow (similar to  the economy seats,  but marginally larger  in the economy , though reasonably . When fully  occupied there is  too much room,  so people over  10 feet will  notice There was hardly any storage  space and the  LCD screen was  too small and  in poor quality.  The food was  only average (I  liked the carrot  / pumpkin soup).  the crew was  young and the  crew felt old  or tired. The  bar in Heathrow  was large, but  was too busy  to be able  too sit comfortably.  The bathrooms in  all the main BA lounges are  quite dated and  require a good  smell far more  comfortable then they . The quality  the food in  each lounge is  poor though the  wine and spirit  here is decent.  The flight from  Dubai to BOS  came on a  747 and this  was similar to  the 777 -  slow and tired  with cramped seating  in business class.  The crew were a bit better  in this leg,  but still disengaged. The food was  of average quality,  and the wine  selection while small,  was good. Overall,  BA has the  look of a  British carrier compared  against some of  our middle eastern counterparts. The lounge  was sub par,  especially when compared  against the Qatar  lounge in Doha,  not even the  One / One  class lounge in . The business  flight ticket was  very cheap, though  I can now  see why. Given  a choice I  will not fly  it again.

From Gatwick to  New York JFK  on British Airways. Check in at  gate is a complicated, slow process  but once through security things get better. I dislike  their business class  seating layout. Old  fashioned very worn out seats with little or no  cushion but the  amazing cabin crew  make up for all of this.  They were going out of their  ways to serve, to make sure every passenger was comfortable, well fed  with plenty of drinks. Food was  served Flight on time, but arrival at JFK is  one long immigration  process etc.

We flew from  Malta to Kos on Tuesday 13th  January departing at  midnight As the flying time was  between 3.5 and  2 hours long,  I had contemplated flying Club Europe  as with identical  seats to the economy seats, it  would seem worth  my money. We  flew in around  5 and having  just paid to  get our seats, everything went smoothly  as most of  Terminal 5 seemed  pretty quiet. I  had tried to  figure out in  detail what food  if any) might  been offered on the flight as  we would have  rather not eat  lunch at 06.00  at the terminal.  However despite knowing people that work  at British Airways,  this seemed quite  limited as the  web site is  very ambiguous. Having  explained that, I  should find out  if the food  menu depends on what band your  flight is classified  under but try as I may,  i couldn't find the LHR to  order on any  of the bands. In the end  we had tea  with toast at Gordon Ramsey's which  is expensive but  a lot quieter  that the other outlets serving breakfast. Boarding was on , although we  did have to  take a bus  from somewhere near  hour three which  arrived around 10 ! The plane  was little more  then half full which obviously speeded up boarding and  I left a  minute early. The  flight crew were  very friendly and  accommodating and we  got offered a  banana and a  coffee for breakfast,  it was fine. As we had a spare seat  on our row  for three, it effectively meant that  I had the  allocated space as Club, which made  our flight a  bit more comfortable.  Having arrived a  little early in  London after a  slightly bumpy landing  where we were  in customs and  received our bags  in half an hour. Overall a  good flight and  airlines must have  a tough job  filling their Club  style seats unless , course passengers  want to, pay  hundreds of pounds  and lounge access  or a hot  flight

Flew British Airways from London Heathrow to Johannesburg. We enjoyed the flight very much on the A380. We chose two seats together and it  was comfortable. The inflight entertainment was  great and had  a fair choice. The food was ok and there were plenty of drinks to go round. Staff were  friendly and helpful.

The husband and I flew from Atlanta to London , it was a nightmare experience. First the flight  got delayed of  2 hours and since we had to make a connection in London to go to Geneva, we only had 45 minutes do so and it was a nightmare. No one to helped us, we had to run like crazy in the airport. We had to pass security and immigration one more  and we finally  did it but  our were the very last ones to board the  flight to Geneva  as it was about to close is door. I was shocked that  UK Airways did not provide us with any assistance, obviously they do not care about their customers. On  our way back,  another flight from Geneva to London was late by more than 40  minutes and we had to run  again in order  to catch our flight to Atlanta. We flew in premium economy that does not even have its own bathroom, when you are in premium economy, there is only one bathroom for about 150 people and it is a shared  toilet with people in economy. The food is non existent, one ounce  potato salad and four once of  a "so-called" meal  plus dessert and  one coffee. You will be left  hungry so don't  gorge on their food because it is more than a huge disappointment. We paid $3800  in this trip and I regret choosing this airline. Premium economy is not worth the extra fee, you only get 7 inches more than in economy but  damn it. You will struggle to find a bathroom available and the food is exactly the same than  in economy. That's it.  I  will not fly with them again and for everyone who is interested  in make a flight connection in London Heathrow, please make other arrangements as it is a huge airport and British Airways flights are late. The only positive thing I must mention is that employees on the plane were very gentle, polite and  willing to talk  with but other than that, everything else with British Airways was off.  Neither worth the price nor the headache.

We flew from  Downtown Atlanta to  London Heathrow on  May 2nd, and  I have to  confess it was  the worst experience  I have had . When we  walked onto the  flight there was  NO room for  any of our  blankets at all , we had  only put it under our feet,  bearing in mind  that was a  6 hour flight.  as uncomfortable as  it was I  knew I would  actually get some sleep, when I opened the blanket  there were long  white hairs stuck  into it. The  covers were ripped ! When the  sun came out  I didn't get  a one, 2  hrs into the  plane I asked  a lady for a mineral. I 'm still waiting!

Gu Dhabi to London. British Airways is usually a very organised airline.  I do have  some stuffiness and it irritates that  you need to pay for selecting any seats, even  when we fly Business class. This is something that  BA and every  sane person, would consider as utter madness. I did  indeed pay a  fortune and managed to get an aisle seat for my AUH-LHR leg on my trip.  Everything was chaotic although this is  not to do with BA but  rather the airport , Staff were  friendly and efficient  when we landed ahead of time.  Upon departure we were given a  small snack and  on arrival a full English breakfast. Overall a comfortable flight.

From Heathrow to New York JFK.  The poor service  is beginning to . Cabin interior  is tired and  our media screen  was tiny. Food  seemed ok but  we had one  drink and were  later told there  is no beer left on the  plane Asked three  other attendants for  a drink later in the flight , only one  person bothered to  answer - and that was to  explain there were no drinks left.  Food on the return flight was  no better. I 'm planning a  first class trip  in Thailand in November and I  think the Emirates  ticket is £550.00 less than BA. The British Airways  flight is again a Boeing 777-200,  they are now  older and outdated , the Emirates  are all A380 or 777-300ER, less  than 5 years  ago with the  latest up to  date entertainment and  all in flight service. And they  offer a chauffeur  driven car to take you to  the airport! -  Why would anyone  use BA if they had a  car

Left Heathrow to  JFK return. Outward leg was full. Seat downstairs on  middle aisle. I am tall and  this is not  great leg room. Plane was clean  - crew efficient. Evening meal of  chicken and rice  seemed passable. Departed  and landed on  schedule - I was actually en route to Botswana  - time to connect with that flight. Return leg  was not full, seat upstairs and  it seemed quieter.  No passenger in  middle seat so  he had aisle  side window to  open but the arm rest between  our seats only  took up half  that - seems  a BA design  was and is . This crew seemed to be in a race  and complete the  food service - again chicken and  beef (5 days after outward trip) and not as  fully prepared. The  flight crew were  told to serve coffee in the  back of the  meal in order to disappear as  quickly as possible.  They reappeared at  dinner which was the BA version  - a "full " as it  was on the  outward trip -  bright yellow which  appeared to be  uncomfortable but the  food was OK.  Landing on time.  The crew seemed younger than usual , maybe they  need a senior  manager point out to them that  all the serving  and meals is  not obvious and  is what we  paid for.

Ab Dhabi to  Uni return. Probably  one of the  worst flight/travel experiences  myself and my family have had  too endure! From  What was supposed to be a  special occasion for  us as a  group taking our  kids to the  US to get  her into university , into an  airline that will make sure that  they never fly  UK Airways again.  Sadly when checking  in in Abu ja the flight  was cancelled due  some technical problems  with their new  Airbus 787. Of course flights get  delays and we  can understand but  I was rediculous  at the total  absence of communication. Passengers stood around  2 hours with  no one knowing  anything was going  and eventually a  check in clerk told the passengers  they come back  The next day  around 10 am  to check in. The actual flight  out was 14:00,  however the plane  was delayed yet again. British Airways staff were no where to be !! Eventually a  new British Airways  plane arrived. We then couldn't check  in because the  machine was broken,  After an hour  later decided to  finally check us  in and we  flew away to  see our daughter  off in Uni.!  Finally at Heathrow,  two hours to clear customs because they were short . Then on to collect bags , to find that my daughters  backpack for Uni  is missing, apparently  she made the  flight and no  one knows where  he is. Again  zero communication from British Airways despite  multiple calls to  them each day , the crazy thing is that  we have to  repeat the story  with every service  desk person that  answered the phone.  Crazy thing is  that in the  trip to Uni  we had packed  a few sentimental items into her  check in bag,  and we explained  this to the BA phone operator,  and was told that was probably not the wisest decision. Thank you  everyone for the great advice. Now , on the  train returning to  UK to Abu  Dhabi (same plane)  2 days later  when the plane  was delayed again  thanks to hydraulic  oil leaking from  an engine. Great  flight found the  plane But a  NEW plane all  new problems! Seriously  UK Airways, should  do not test  your new aircraft  when you haul  them around the world.

Gatwick to Malaga. Aircraft on remote stand at Gatwick North Terminal requiring a shuttle transfer and  boarding via steps without  windows - not bad this early  on as just overcast but dark and chilly waiting to board. Aircraft in poor state of preparation with stains on back  and seat leather and generally dirty. Pushback delayed due to late arrival of passengers who missed shuttle. 40 minute delay in departing due to aircraft movements volume that lead to two female passengers having argument that  lead to CSD  decision to return aircraft to stand with one passenger being moved. Well dealt with by  the staff. Very noisy group of  friends on golf holiday in seats  on rear of row 21 who  had alcohol the  entire journey becoming very loud using  vulgar language - spoken to by other passengers and  asked to desist. The food just gets worse each  time I fly with them - muesli high in  salt and cheese , tasting worse than cardboard - is this really  they best they can do? Finally to round off flight, a very hard landing to  finish one of the worst short haul flights I have ever taken  on BA . The staff great but product is  poor

When a flight  departing at 18:55 , advertised snack  consists of a  packet of crisps,  a two biscuit pack, or a  very small packet  containing nuts. These, and a drink  in a small  tea cup were  sold with no  indication possibly the  airline crew were  confused by the  lack of anything  more substantial. British  travellers need to  consider whether to  buy food offered  in short haul  aircraft or to  use reasonably priced  high quality snack , as do  at low cost .

This way, London  Airport to Amsterdam  on British Airways.  London itself was  Easy Food tasty  and staff friendly.  It is a  long flight and  our flight attendants  have a lot  of do in  such little amount  in time, so  I can be forgiven for being  somewhat hasty. The  only complaint is : incredibly crowded ! Lockers in the lounge would  be a great  addition especially for  business travelers.

Flew from London Heathrow to Seattle. Poor boarding procedure at T5 with the indicators suggesting  plane was not ready to board but on arriving at gate we walked straight on,  joining others who were waiting and seemingly not sure whether to board or not. Econ seemed about 75% full. Sat half  way down but  with no choice  save for main meal which was served after about  4 hours of  taking off. Cabin crew very apologetic  but blamed management for recent cost cutting measures, saying  it is happening a lot and  upsetting many passengers. Travelling with 3 children who didn't like the only  food offered, so much frustration with British Airways taking a budget airline  approach but charging all full service price. Complained to Customer Service after  arriving home and was told the  crew at LHR was to blame and they didn't  have to delay the flight waiting  out the extra meals. Seems a bit lame and complete contradiction to  anything the crew said. Crew made an extra effort to bring a few snacks from business to my  cabin which was highly appreciated. Hard to recommend BA but given the competition on this route, and the desire to stay with One World/BA FFP, it's a poor choice.

London Heathrow to  Manchester It seems  British Airways has lost so much of its traditional customer base that  is turning into a budget airline at scheduled prices. I only fly  for them now when tour operators give me no choice. Ground staff  are the now usual bunch of  well worths, refusing to change my  seats because "that's  all the computer has allocated". Boarding was the now expected shambles. The no checked baggage fare option results in so many  small bags being carried on board  that overhead space for small cases is at a  minimum On this flight several were removed from lockers, and the owners rudely told to put them under  their seat in front, thus severely  reducing leg room. Cabin staff were rude and uncaring. Again now the  worst for BA.  Only in flight snack was a soggy croissant and a small plastic  bag of tepid stewed tea. The seats are very narrow, allowing minimal room a no  communication between neighbouring passengers.

I am a  commercial traveller on  several airlines and  frequent One World  Airlines FF. British  Airlines flight BA632 from LHR to  London on 11th  May was by  me the worst  flight crew that  I have encountered  in 45 years of flying. The  crew had no  concern in the  number of passengers  from Business Class,  but were more interested in chatting with each other  in the galley ! After 1.5  hours in the  cockpit we were offered a drink,  a champagne was  served and the  crew gave me  some gin and tonic. After that  we did a meal service and served a fish  dish that had  been overheated and  so was inedible.  This was all the service we received on the whole flight of  4 hours. No  pick up of  passengers no offer  of water, and  in the cabin  they spent their  free time in  the galley eating  & talking. I  then went out  and asked them  were there any  service on this  plane and received  no reply

Gatwick to Bilbao. British Airways migrating to southern terminal and it causes a chaos. Everyone is used to flights being constantly  delayed in Gatwick, however with silver tier membership or flying business one expects to wait in a BA lounge. BA does not have a lounge now, instead they are using No 1 lounge subject to capacity. And when 5 flights are delayed,  their is no capacity even for business class passengers. Does BA ground staff care about it? The "computer  says no" attitude prevails together with the usual BA familiarity and "sorry" that means nothing. Try to be more professional and  show some respect. Now the customer  experience is non existent and no one cares about anything. If I want no frills , fly easyjet.

BA club Europe,  London Heathrow - Istanbul - London , over a  hour check in  was T5 quick as was priority , used the galleries South lounge  which while very  crowded was okay , a few  decent food options  available from the main terminal. Boarding  back on to a pretty old  aircraft however seat  very clean and  comfortable departed a  tad late but  made up the  experience with on  the arrival. Crew  were good, friendly , chatty, one  if BA's assets,  food served was  very nice lots of drink runs on the 3hr  delayed flight. Check in on the  flight again quick , was the  last security lane . Istanbul Ataturk airport is not  a favourite its crowded & dirty,  the lounge used  for BA is  some of the worst! Not worth  the trouble of finding. Boarding through  gate 209 organised seat 3A old  but clean and comfortable 767, departed  within 1 hour  very good food  & service from a nice crew,  good LHR on  arrival although the flight arrived on  to the furthest  away gate and  boarding (Not BA's !) took so , with huge  delays which meant  another 1 hour  waiting landside. Good  experience Will continue  on use British  Airways if the  timing is right.

Madrid to Perth via Singapore. So  frustrated with BA. Really useless airline.  Was delayed on  arrival to London 3 hours and no reason given. Missed connecting flight to Perth from  Singapore Was given  free lounge access , this was  better than nothing but I wonder why they couldn't 've just given me access to  their lounge. I decided to give  BA a chance  by avoiding BA/QF flying between Australia and Europe but I never will … Pay to  reserve seats? Pay  or request meal? I guess BA  was positioning itself as a budget airline, but its price doesn't reflect that yet. It's a shame as I enjoy the transit through Singapore rather than the gulf states. Meal service was alright, food good, and  bathroom service also okay but they  sat in the galley most of the flight and didn't serve drinks. They were quite  an cheerful bunch at least. Check in process was smooth all in !

Welcome to London  arriving with British  Airlines in First Class. The boarding process at Miami was chaotic with  a staff member inviting World Traveller Plus, Club World and First Class  members all join  the queue to board. Despite flying First Class it  was 15 minutes  to get to the front of the queue and a further 10  minutes on the jet bridge before getting onboard. The  staff were indifferent  as we were not escorted to our seats. The "hot" towel service before take off  was a cold  plastic towel which had not seen any hot water. The "hot" nuts were served 10  minutes after the drinks. The meal was dry and  of poor quality.  The cabin crew forgot my partners main course and put one in the oven 30 minutes after everyone else had eaten and when it was served, it  was cold and  wet When the  team member made  my bed up I was informed  we had "run out" of duvets  but the crew  only managed to  find one after  he complained about the poor experience to the CSM.  Overall on this  experience BA's penny pinching across all of the cabins  has lowered the  value of all of the product and it is  definitely worth paying  for First Class  and save yourself  some money because United Airlines Economy  Class is better than what I experienced on this .

We flew as  a group of  five from Heathrow  to Krakow in Club Europe. The aircraft was clean and newish so  were the new "economy" seats in  the Club section.  ( would like  too know who at British Airways sanctions the use  of these tiny seats in Club I know its nice to have the middle seat  - but I  would prefer a  regular seat to  sit in - maybe BA should have a look  at Turkish Airlines Biz cabin!) The service outbound was just adequate - one drinks round,  with a dinner  plate (BA872) which was edible but  dumping / dumping  a meal out  in a heated plastic container into a china dish in front of the passenger lacks some grace to say the least.  Are the crew trained to do  this or was it just bone idleness not to  put the meal in the galley  or serve to  another passenger? In all, the outbound  service was just about passable but not comfortable given the seating. Now for the return ... what a  nice Nn lounge at Krakow - that's right you  hang onto the end of that overcrowed bench by the gate and  get quiet! The flight was delayed  for nearly 3  hours so by the time boarding  came it was a scrum (priority boarding abandoned) to get through the  gate as most  people were so fed up. British Airways prefer not to pay for  wheelchair access to the plane so we were then  off to a nice ride in  that old banger bus crammed to the gills with sweaty fed up  passengers all trying to avoid other peoples armpits. Once  off the plane the same tiny seats, although we  were winners all round as we  went to bag  2 and 1C so at least we had some  breathing room. The meal service on  each leg really did make me . The steward offered a shriveled  potato salad (leg s skewers), or  like this, a boxed sandwich. I  just had to ask if that  was it? He replied "yes" to which I replied  "... who's eaten  half the food?" He laughed and actually said we 're lucky, and if I had any food with  us could he have some! And I'm not making this up. Once at LHR it  takes 1h for  the bags to turn up by which time the  bus service to the parking had stopped (and that  got into a  little drama but  i won't go there on this ) So -  what did we  get for our Club fare to Krakow? In my opinion very little,  although what we did get was : If anyone <mask> thinking of <mask> to Krakow <mask> BA my <mask> is save <mask> money and <mask> economy (with another airline), and spend the saving <mask> fun there. In fact choose another airline since <mask> on this route are just a joke. I <mask> been Club <mask> hundreds of <mask> over the <mask> 20 years and the gradual <mask> in the <mask> has now just about reached the point where <mask> I have used up my <mask> Avios it'll be Bye Bye BA for good. (I will only use Avios to get First long haul as that gets you the best return on them.

London to Denver. Seat space   poor (I'm 6ft 2" and really )  Film  quality poor, screen  time - poor temperature control, poor food.  Drinks  - Nothing in  relation to Emirates,  not Turkish etc . on par  as Ryanair at  least (Ryanair doesn't  have films but  drinks almost as  good but 8  minutes of this  long flight is  very painful). Better  go find another airline and route  if possible.

London Heathrow to Cape Town. Check in at Heathrow T3 very efficient.  Use my card to access the BA Lounge at T3 which is pretty average, although enjoyed a good  meal with very  nice claret so did not need  much eat on  board Boarding a  whale of a  row at remote  gate 35 where both the PA and aircon were not working, but nonetheless everyone seemed  to be seated  for the inevitable  last passenger/bag offload,  this caused a 30min push back , Service seemed  good on board  although I did  NOT eat dinner)  and we had  one friendly young  staff member on our aisle. Managed  a get some rest and with  some breakfast before landing at CPT,  45 mins late. All in all,  excellent value for  money The usual hopeless British Airways  logo which needs constant re-sets and is from the  back of the ark.

Flew London Heathrow  and Miami return with BA, then onto Bogota with  BA British Airways  had gone from being a very good airline to barely satisfactory. Not  once was the  flights delayed by  1 hour both ways, but due  to a baggage error they made  during the return  flight I only  just boarded the  plane on time.  In both flights  I ran out of one of  the food options, leaving only the  main dish. They  poor entertain system  of low quality , a small  menu with poor resolution. Seats were  worse uncomfortable than many other airlines  have flown in ! Their only saving grace is  a generous trolley bar allowance. I had connected from  BA to BOG with Avianca -  which are a much better airline. Seats were more  spacious and entertainment  systems of a  much higher quality,  although they had  been charging in economy. Shows how  much BA have  become when they're being outdone by the Colombian national  airlines If it  was for the better price, I 'd have preffered  the flights with  them

London to Johannesburg return. Still waiting for a reply,  after 6 attempts via email, post and phone to  get contact. On flight BA 0055 to Johannesburg the  customer service was  The worst we 've ever experienced.  We took off around 19h30, and were only offered a drink at . This was  my only drink  served that night. Dinner was served at 22h30, no drinks accompanied this. We were surprised to see we  was sitting in the back row of the plane, which was not what was shown  on the diagram when we booked and paid extra for selecting our  seats when we  made the booking. We did not have a choice of meals as they had run out, all we were offered was  this very poor excuse for a  pasta risotto, which was inedible. It  waited over an hour for the  tray to be cleared away. Breakfast was served to  our special diets around 04h30, waking the entire section where we were seated, then the  lights turned off  after another hour until we were  given an equally horrible breakfast. Coffee was not offered at all - the amount of  tea offered was below minimum requirements,  if we had  not taken our own water with , we would  not had a problem. When we  exited the plane it look like a rubbish tip, no waste had  being collected during  the flight, the  airline staff were surly and uninterested. Prior to this  incident we tried  and avoid the “back of plane” issues by paying an additional £56.00 for exit row . The payment was accepted and receipt issued via email. When we went to check  flights online our  reserved seats had been allocated again. When we arrived at Johannesburg airport we were told that the seats were no longer  available and had been allocated to other passengers. No  refund or explanation was given. Not  the way we  expected our holiday  to end. The service on this flight was as to be expected, regular drinks offered (water throughout the  flight the only negatives being no choice for dinner and a poor breakfast. Cabin staff were very good. We have not received a refund  on the £56.00 paid for the exit row seats,  so I await  an explanation as  regards why these seats were not allocated to us. Even though we were flying economy, we expect a  level of service and edible food. If the back rows are to receive less or no choice on food and drinks then they should be charged less.  That is unfair and bad business practice. Upon speaking to other people who have flown with BA, the general consensus seems to be that only first / business class passengers seem to be valued, and our experience confirms this. BA were not the cheapest flights by far, we <mask> to fly with them due <mask> reputation, which was sorely let down.

British Airways is  even worse. Online  ordering in, what's  the point if  I cannot choose !  No  hot food on  either of my  recent flights (except !) yet the  airline still don't  mention this. Moreover,  although I asked  both a warm  drink as well  and a can  of coke on  exiting the flight  it looked like  BA was doing me a favour  in giving 2  tickets as opposed  as just one! At least I didn't take the  one offered to  me Always late  for flying in  & out of , which might  be due to  changing airport.

Flying Heathrow to  Birmingham I went  through the British  Air app on  my phone 20  second after online check-in opened, and totally disappointed to  discover only 4  seats available to  choose from. This  is the second time this has  happened with British  Airlines in the  same few months,  They really should  only be offering  an online check-in service if you 're given a  second choice of  seats selection! I  emailed them to  explain why they  do this, to which the reply  is that most  seats are "restricted" on online check-in. They did sort  a seat I wanted however as  was flying with  my Mother who  knows I want  should be sat  next to. Yet when I looked  online at the  possibility of paying  more for a  seating reservation before online check-in opens,  it was a  single choice available. If British Airways  do want to  pay extra for choosing a seat, and make it  nearly impossible to  find a seat  reservation for those  not paying, then  they should abolish  this online check-in as it's clearly  already providing the  value it should do - Online  booking means being  free to choose  among several seats,  and being unacceptably limited to 4 seat choices only, just 20 seconds  when online check-in  had opened!

The online check in is available from Dubrovnik so everyone checks in at the airport.  Parking in Dubrovnik is OK but  pretty poor, but better than being  at the busy  international departures area.  Our in bound flight was late and we were therefore late departing.  Not priority boarding. Cabin again not very clean probably because they were trying to minimise the delay! No newspapers available, when there are only  two rows in business you would thing BA could provide them in  their premium cabin. So called 'Brunch' was served, which was a few  tasty looking pieces of ham and  potatoes with a tomato, lettuce leaf and cucumber. Very  disappointing for what is scheduled as just under a  2 hour flight.  Looks to me  as cost cutting  thus far and not sure how BA expect to hold onto premium passengers who are paying a lot of money for their tickets. Cabin crew did nothing to stop economy  customers coming through  or use the toilet in business,  leave it that ? Very poor  service and think we will look at alternatives next .

Book a domestic  reservation from Knoxville to Atlanta for onward British Airways flight to Heathrow. Went to BA  for check in  and to be  informed that they  may not have  a reservation so  we needed to  raise it with  a travel agent.  All in staff  was bothered and  kept on being  rude Finally resolved  that issue after  nearly an hour  with the assistance  of my agent.  Flight in Atlanta was mediocre at  all Flight itself  seemed fine and  cabin crew were  extremely attentive but  they weren't anything  that I'd say . First Class  is average at  times when compared  against Emirates or  American Airlines. My  plane didn't arrive  before Heathrow so  had to go  thru the rigmarole of raising a  reservation with BA  and baggage - it was finally  delivered almost a  week later. Overall,  exactly the kind  customer service that  I would expect  when flying First  Class Raised a  question and received  no response after nearly three weeks  ( four follow  through calls to  public relations), who said that since  the agent had  cancelled my Knoxville  reservation that was  scheduled to land  at Atlanta less than 3.5 hours  before the scheduled  time for the flight to Heathrow,  their system "automatically  canceled my booking ." - I  dont know whether  this is normal  but I've never  come across this  company before in  ALL my years  experience flying. Absolutely  no customer service.  Prices have declined steadily over the  years and its  current offering simply  seems good enough,  Not to mention  its attitude towards  people paying for  its premium cabins,  that is atrocious.  Safe to say,  wont be flying  for them again . I can  handle it.

London Heathrow to Dublin. On time  departures and on time arrival. Good  time and good . However, there are more cutbacks, no cooked breakfast on 06.45 departure, ham and cheese crosissant instead. The  two cups have . I managed to get another coffee from the Galley, and some biscuits. Still recommend  it

Last flight from  Moscow to Dubrovnik.  Check in reasonably  well although only  a desk at  first class check , New fast  and security was  the Number One  gate was busy  so we had  a reasonable choice  for seats, refreshments , On boarding , by the  back of the cabin, when lowering  the tray table  to the seat  down front on  board my seat , and my  Seat 4A, they were very dirty, nothing that could  probably be solved by a wet  cloth but not  clean enough. Hot  tub was OK.  Cabin crew were  really good. Flight  landed on time into Dubrovnik, but  our bags were  on the last  one so priority  boarding doesn't work.  A bit disappointing really.

From Heathrow to Hong Kong. Very  disappointed by the  booking agents or  who was making decisions about seat  selection for BA 's service to HKG on September 10th. I was  buying my ticket  in April, so early. As BA  Member Club Gold  Member I had  reserved already then  a favorite seat on this aircraft , 51D on  main deck at time of buying the ticket. In AMS, when checking  tickets for that flight, this seat  was still granted,  but hours later at gate I  got reallocated to 14G on main  deck First no  comment then that they "could make a family happy to sit together", but they could  never tell me  if this family was traveling with  BA or not.  The other seat  changes due to  another full flight. Just the cabin service director was  happy to get  for a change to 13B, a  bit a little further away from the restrooms. But still recurring disturbing odors and noisier flight on main deck. - I have gotten already 2620 EC tier  tickets this year and have little understanding for how  management treated me.  I am so  happy flying with  airlines they know my preferences: upper  right aisle seat and as much  center front as possible. I am  happy to give  up my seat  with families with infants or any  other person, but upon their reaction , guess this  was not the  case  Communication is marketing and  it was very  poorly done by  management this time!  But should I  be loyal to  this company which  is not respecting my loyalty benefits?  Especially concerning their  booking policy, that  passengers not paying  their reservation earlier on or booking late need to  make aware that they might not  get seated together!  This flight itself  was aside from odor and noise,  and the cabin  is very pleasant.

Amsterdam to Heathrow. Swift checkin, security and passport control. Lounge with a nice view, but  it might have a little larger  drink and food selection. Incoming plane  waits for about 30 minutes, boarding for 20 minutes but on time arrival. Boarding process a little chaotic. Was moved to 2C, because on  that seat was  a husband of  a handicapped woman.  Was served their afternoon tea with sandwich and scones which was delicious.  Pretty comfortable, pitch on the small , Business class  public transport to LHR terminal 5 main building.

London to London.  Great time flying on this route  for BA and always boarding with  a minimal delay of 1 hour.  No snacks on  plane despite comfortable  & pleasant flight.  I recently started this route some  years ago with low cost flights  but the service does not meet the standards that  could be expected for a company  of its dimensions.

Flight to London . The aircraft was fairly new (which made a  big change compared  with the many ancient long haul planes we've flown on with BA). We'll ignore all  possible reasons for the flight being  so delayed and  go straight to  our complaint: having left our hotel  quite early for breakfast we decided to wait for  the food usually  available on the plane. As we  never land until  noon we assumed  their would be some lunch offered. We were offered  no soft drink and the choice  between a bag  or crisps or  the bag of  sandwiches We complained  and were told  again this was  the policy on certain flights since  very beginning of  2014 What a  shame We regularly fly BA and  a silver card  flights however, we've decided to fly  our next two  short haul flights with Emirates. The  other planes we've flown on lately  are long haul flights have been dated and not very clean, and the standard of the food in business class has gradually declined in  popularity What other airline expects you  a climb over a strangers legs or to have  another stranger climb over your legs  to gain access to the aisle?  We can't keep  letting people up  you have no alternative but to  simply climb out!  the older I  am the harder this is becoming.

we flew from  London to Porto . The flights were on time, crew on board were polite and helpful, the captain kept us informed  on both the outward and return flights. The cabin and toilets were clean. Porto airport was well run and efficient, Gatwick  Airport had filthy toilets was not such a pleasant  change

The many problems  BA had with  my outbound flight paled in comparison to my return.  Upon arrival at T3 from another carrier I went to the BA baggage check in  but was told that unlike every  single major carrier  at a major  European airport anywhere  on the planet, BA cannot possibly  take bags to my departure terminal,  however The agent  makes it clear it could be done but that  we would get in trouble. Fast  Forward security was woefully slow and  confusing When I arrived at the gate boarding had  begun Though I had purchased a  seat upgrade to avoid some of the horrible service I had received  on my outbound flight and despite having only two carry on items ; despite management's  public statements in their replies to  the earlier complaints  that "Our hand  baggage allowance at  the bags with a 23kg limit  on the is also one of the most generous",  and the fact that the flight  were not full  and more than half of the bin space in business class was empty, I was forced to check  the bag carry-on compliant bag. The  gate attendants were  clearly shocked about this and later  apologise for the  baggage agent's unwarranted behavior. The flight  was okay with  these same uncomfortable coach seats in  economy class and  an inedible food offering. In all a waste of money for BA's  premium business class  airline The recent Economist article about  their race to  its bottom service tier and the reneged promises made along the way speaks volumes about management's hostility towards customers and especially BA and OW elites. The asterisk on the Oneworld  Facebook page singles  down BA as  The only carrier in the group who will not  let it's own  frequent fliers and  passengers on OW  and have a checked bag on  the lowest and only competitive fare  BA offers. As the Economist article  states loyalty is  relatively easy to  lose but extremely  expensive to re-attain.

Welcome to Moscow. I was supposed  to travel with  BA 233 today.  I had a  connecting flight coming  into Dallas which was a little  late As soon  when no one  met me at the arrival I  thought that I  was plenty of  room and did not rush to  my gate. When  I arrived to  the gate 5  minutes before closing  a lady said  the BA moved me to another flight because this  one was full  after my previous  was delayed. I  was really surprised  as there were  not lot of passengers still at  that gate and I was not  a last one.  She asked if  BA company will  reimburse me for  the cancellation because  we will miss another connecting flight  from Moscow. She said that the  airline will not  tell me anything  because it is not the company's  responsibility  After  that she said  if I am  still listening and  she will cancel  my next flight  the BA transferred  us to - BA 235. I  questioned why and  she said that  you should listen and then I'll . I listened , but could not understand few  questions still. Why  No one met me at the  gates if there  is a risk  for me being  cancelled Why she  explained that the  plane was full,  that my place  is given to  someone else without  telling me. Why  not least she  will say sorry  only once and  continued to insist  on her version  because it was  not fault of  my company. Is  that really something  which BA treats  as a normal ??

Return to Cape  Town via Heathrow. The aircraft was  very old with  no TV screens,  no seats and  the air conditioning  system which settles  air on air .  Food was ok, nothing  special but when  food was served  everything was started  way too late  so by the  time the food  got served, there  was no time  they serve any tea and coffee. .

Vienna - London  Heath - Porto in March 2016 in Economy, VIE-LGW 2o minutes early,  but almost on time after a 20 minutes departure delay. Web-check did not work. After having entered all  my required personal and passport details  online the system informed me that “no web-check-in is offered for this flight”. Quite irritating, as this information could have been easily shown at the start of  boarding procedure. Having Oneworld Sapphire status , used the  new premium check-in counter and was able to score an aisle/window seat.  It worked fine with no lines but required to be at the  airport earlier than intended, as BA charges extra for  certain seat selections (even for a middle seat at the back of the plane).
