Boarding  for both flights  worked fine and  was free. Service  in the VIE-LGW  flights was rather  excellent for BA,  but cabin crew was professional and  on flight deck - as per usual for BA - great. Much  like FA’s on the LGW-OPO leg and again flight deck excellent. Full bar service on  all flights and a sandwich was  provided as well. BA uses a shared lounge in  Economy which is  to the poor  part rather small and cramped, with  few food options. However, the hot  drink of the  airline tends to be of good quality. Snacks and drinks fall in  a discount category. Lounge experience in LGW was very  disappointing BA closed  the own lounge  for LGW to give up the  facility for another airline’s lounge and  the pay-per-entry No  Parking Lounge, which  was so crowded , even finding a place to just sit down was a challenge.  All food and  cold drinks have to be ordered at the -  rather chaotic -  bar off a menu. Food is  not delivered to your seat; a  labour consuming process  for a lounge that is filled  beyond capacity. My understanding is that this arrangement will  continue well into  2017 before BA  opens up a new lounge. Why BA gives up its own lounge  service in its  home airport to accommodate another airline is beyond me. Overall solid experience  on the air,  although not so  much on the  plane Will consider BA for further  travel in Economy  Long haul, if fares are competitive,  I will avoid departing from LGW.  Except for business class, I have  avoided using BA a while ago  owing to the  poor seating arrangements  for both short  haul and long haul flights.

We booked a flight from London  City (LCY) to  Amsterdam (GVA) for  my summer holidays.  My flight was  booked at 7:10.  we turned up  at the airport  and be met by a huge  line at check in After waiting in that for half an hour  we headed to  Amsterdam The airport  is packed with  people any where to sit. After  two hours it was time for our gate number to appear, but  unfortunately didn't. A mere 5 minutes  later the flight  was scheduled to  depart with still no information we  began panicking as we didn't know  our gate number  and we thought  they were going  to miss the flight. We found  later the flight  was in fact  delayed due to  some issues with  an aircraft, which  did in fact  delayed to Venice  in few hours ! Chaos followed , as we  also met other passengers travelling with  me who also had their flight  to Frankfurt cancelled.  Another huge crowd of people appeared at the help ! Luckly we were rebooked onto  another later flight  this was also  late by an hour.

Wonderful service and  accommodations I flew  between London Heathrow  from Munich. The flight departed on  time and formalities  from the gate  was professional. The cabin was clean,  comfortable seats were  spacious and offered  great legroom. The complimentary sandwich and  drink was tasty,  our cabin crew friendly and helpful.

I flew British Airways Club Europe, from London Gatwick to Malta International Airport. I don't know why we paid double the economy fare per person as the seats are exactly the same as economy class apart from the lavish table in the  middle of the 2 seats. You get a blanket, a cushion and nicer food than  economy and access to the lounge, which comes with  the Barclays travel  package anyway. I enjoyed the food  on the plane but my sisters friend who flew with us is a pescetarian which means she only  eat fish and not meat, so the crew said that's no problem and gave her a disgusting baguette with tomato, but she didn't like it and there was no other choice for her. Complete waste of money but I loved the chocolate  bar - the  best I've had. To conclude the BA club Europe  is a waste of money because the seats are exactly the same as economy class and your paying  to travel in  full comfort and luxury. The Club Europe seats are a joke.

Fly British Airways from London Heathrow to Larnaca. Cabin  is excellent. Cheerful and helpful. Food and drink good.  Taken down by aircraft. Business class  tickets are identical to economy. Little  doubt IFE was  not working for  a whole plane for the whole  trip In any case IFE was  a small screen in the bulkhead  so no choice  in content. Business cabin is normally rows 1 thru 9 but was extended back to  row 14 meaning we had to share the two  toilets with economy  flight Flight left late but arrived almost on time.  Overall OK flight , the business  class is not worth the extra cost. Would recommend  it but not  on this route.  Passenger on outbound and inbound flight chaotic with priority  going to families with babies of which there were  NOT very many).

I wanted to  discuss BA's Boeing  747 to Shanghai. The ground handling at Terminal 5 was very efficient.  A little surprised that we had  the take a bus to the  gate and walk  up the stairs,  although the boarding process was swift  - completed 10 mins before schedule.  My seats were  no disappointment, they felt slightly harder and more narrow than the seats on older Emirates  Airbus CX 777 or Lufthansa A380. Screens were a  lot smaller, legroom was about the same. BA doesn't spoil it's economy passengers here. The Boeing 787 is quite silent, but the A380 is even a bit  more silent during the flight. However, this is where the criticism ends. The plane was  good food was excellent. The best  aspect was the  staff -  smiling and helpful, and professional.  Overall the high  standard of the crew would be my reason to prefer BA over the competitors.

Prague to Singapore via Heathrow with  British Airways. Not a good experience flying BA. Will never book again.  They allowed me to book a  return flight with  about 1 hour  20 minutes to  Singapore This is not sufficient time if you have to change terminals and especially if you have kids. We did not miss our flight but we had  ot run fast to make it with 2.5 year old toddler. There are no airport  taxis available so  be prepared to carry your child.  Prices below average, food was terrible  but not enough  for it. At  many destinations they didn't deliver our  bags

Early morning flight  from Heathrow to Glasgow with British Airways. Check-in very easy via App.  Flight T5 was fairly busy but I was quickly through security. Full  and departed gate A19 on time. Cabin very smart with new seating. Service was very good with a  full breakfast which was very tasty.

Flew British Airways from Phoenix to London Heathrow. I'm trying to research whether this is just the Phoenix route but this plane was ancient. The business class seats are dirty and ripped, the  security system is  broken and the  food for first and business customers is embarrassing. BA are the only airline to fly to Phoenix direct  from LHR, but they need a  serious rethink about the poor standards and condition of this plane. Next  time I will fly a different airline and transfer via Chicago or Dallas.

Lisbon to Heathrow on British Airways. I booked my ticket with a reputable travel agency and yet when I went to check-in online the BA website said I had been sold a seat-only flight. The travel agency disagreed and showed me they had booked a seat with a  luggage allowance. I called BA and was messed around by their staff member. I had to pay an outrageous fee to have 1 bag of only 12  pounds fly in the hold with me to London. At Lisbon airport things were hectic as the previous day their security people had been on strike. The  departure board did not show the check-in area for the BA flights.  I had to find my own way to where BA check-in. I joined a queue and was outraged when one of the check-in staff allowed a woman with 3 kids to queue jump. When other people objected including other families in the long queue with children the check-in agent did nothing and allowed the woman to get away with not queuing. The check-in lady I dealt with was very pleasant and cheerful.  The departure from Lisbon was exceptionally busy with not one empty seat. The cabin crew were very professional.  All departure was on time and during the flight a snack and drink was served. My seat was  very comfortable and the drop-down screens showed the route followed. Arrival was 15 minutes ahead of schedule. Baggage on this flight is an issue in my opinion as too many  passengers were allowed to bring on to the flight quite sizeable bags.  Where things go well, BA is excellent. However, charges for baggage are outrageous and place BA in the same category as budget airlines. I give top marks to the hardworking and very professional cabin-crew though.

London to Marrakech with my family for a 7 day holiday. First  time on British  Airlines Pros: Flight  arrival time Comfortable seats, generous luggage  - Easy online  checkout 24 hrs before. Pleasant flight.  First Meal -  Always thought they  could provide proper  cold meals i.e.  soup and curry. however, route London  and Marrakech (and  vice versa) only  one type of cold meal, sandwich  are served. Also , chocolate dessert,  cake and the  hot tea, coffee or drink is  provided Unfortunately I could not have  a meal as  we do not eat anything with added sugar. Toilets - Only saw 2 toilets which  looked rather over  sized and busy.  Bars - none. I expected seats  should be built-in  HD TVs so that kids could  be busy and  entertained This was like a no  pay airline. Thankfully  everyone had their  iPads with them. Staff - Okay,  they could be  way more friendly and approachable. A  camera would make  the difference. Return  flight - Airplane was bit dirty.  Even noticed crips  all tucked under  a chair. Overall a 3 star  flight in my  eyes

From British Airways  from Barcelona to London Heathrow. While the 767 is getting a little  cramped it was  easier to board  on two aisles  where there is  the better feeling of space. Luggage  bins are a  little smaller but  a very good job done of making sure larger  luggage on" was sent in checked.  Service was good and it's nice to get a  break and something to nibble.

Flying to Belfast  on British Airways. Boarded about 12 am for 12.55 take off. After  the delay we  was informed there  is a technical  issue and engineers  have been called.  we were offered water or soft  drink initially. We  then took off  at 3pm which  means we had been sitting on  this plane for 3 hours during which time we were not offered anything at all  for eat. It  is quite disgraceful  from BA. Once  again we were  offered tea / coffee / alcoholic  drinks and a choice of potato crisps. Is this what BA has been reduced to? This airline definitely  any longer lives up to expectations  so I will not be flying  with them again.  at least with  lower cost airlines you can at least buy some food.

I have to be upfront and  agree the flight from London Heathrow to Boston exceeded expectations mainly due to the cabin ! Over the years British Airways first has gone so far downhill I'm afraid it just can't compete , it needn't be so as the issues as  I see them are all resolvable. However, the return leg was like flying with Ryanair. There were only  4 people in  my cabin. There were no slippers, 2 of the  3 items I requested were, in  some words of the crew "invisible",  but what did  exist was verging  upon inedible due  the sauce being lumpy and near to warm. The chocolate lava cake  had no lava and quite how one can burn and cool food  on the same  plane is beyond me. My father  spent the entire  time having asked on 3 seperate occasions, for a headset convertor. We were not asked  unless we wanted  to be woken  before breakfast, which I then missed assuming I would be woken. There  was a palpable tension between the crew, which was confirmed on leaving  this flight when we overheard a member of the crew comment he was happier to get away from the crew than  other passengers. Once we had disembarked the aircraft, it  was a further 25 minutes before  I could get in to the  lounge as a door had not  remained unlocked. Finally, we collect our  belongings which I  want to say were present when we arrived at baggage reclaim, only to find 2 of the 4 had broken wheels. BA have subsequently supplied 2 new replacement suitcases. When comparing the service / food to Virgin UC for  west and Etihad First for east bound, BA just  cannot cut the mustard any longer  I afraid. Such as shame as  our seats / bed are great,  so why pay the extra £ for service and food that just isn't forthcoming or  accessible from flight  after flight?

Berlin TXL to London Heathrow with  US Airways. After purchasing ticket I could not preselect seat assignment despite having one world sapphire status. I called BA 3 times. The first 2 times the agents stated they would select my seat for me and later the assignments dropped out of the system. After the third call the agent emailed me and explained that due to my fare category and despite my status no preselection could be  made At check-in I spent more than 45 minutes online trying to pay the junk-fee for a single piece of luggage. Again I had to call BA 3 times to  get a bag checked onto my flight. 2 of the calls were to undo the  mistake that the first agent made  of applying the junk-fee for luggage to my return flight instead of the outbound. The second call was to get a refund and rebook the junk-fee. The  final call was to complain about spending 2-hours checking in and correcting BA's mistakes. I spoke with a supervisor and offered to comp my luggage but no one ever bothered to credit the junk fee. The BA lounge at TXL is small and does not have a toilet. There were no warm food items on offer. I did find the service to be good. Boarding commenced at the farthest  gate at Berlin Tegel from the BA Lounge. Flight was okay with minimal amenities. BA not only does not compete on price but amazingly, no longer competes on service.

Return to London Heathrow. I fly  this route regularly and I have  no decline in  my BA level  customer service. Boarding  to Warsaw is   No priority  boarding rules enforced  when boarding started  by everone at  exact same time, no matter you  pay premium or  not a frequent . New BA  long haul seats are  not really comfortable (fine  for 1h flight  will get uncomfortable  again any longer). Same concerns meals . Crisps and  coffee with no  option of buying  extra food is  just enough for  the flight. I would rather cut  the free alcohol  or have a decent sandwich or a possiblity to  get further food  if necessary. On  a plus side,  the service very well trained and  experienced The WAW KI LON route is served with  multiple carriers (including  US ones) and  passengers will have  a time justify paying a premium  to fly BA  over this route  for the future.

Manchester to New  York via Heathrow.  We were bumped  from a BA  Virgin flight from Manchester to London Heathrow and put on an American  Boeing B777-300 via . Whilst I  would agree that the staff on AA see passengers  like a necessary evil (particularly as  they were the lowest of the  crew in standard economy), the amount of room in their seat is  still far a  cheaper option than  sitting on the aging BA B747 ! The food  & drink served  by the AA  flight was also better than that served with BA. At least the coffee on AA came in coffee shop style cups,  unlike the feeble  plastic cups that  they provided, with  only 2 sips and it's gone drinks. I'm going  to be booking a trip for  my anniversary early next year to  Iceland which I  hope I'll book with Icelandair, as  this would avoid  another 20 mins  drive to the  gate and 20 minutes circling time ...

The British Airways experience has really declined over the past 5 years. I often fly business class and at least premium economy. The Boeing 787 is awesome. Clean, spacious and excellent technology/media options. However the staff and service has declined. Rarely do  the staff seem interested in their jobs - they are on automatic pilot. We travel with 3 children and the stroller has become a real problem. Firstly they gave a 5 kg maximum on weight. Try getting a 5 kg stroller that works in Canadian weather! So we bought a new Light stroller - however we have noticed extreme wait times to have the stroller brought to the gate after a flight ends. Try travelling with a 2-3 year old through the chaos of terminal 5 in the summer months without a stroller. With a tight 1 hour lay over we waited over 25 minutes for our stroller- the only reason we got it (ground staff forgot) was because the older and very caring pilot went down the stairs  alone to get it! The younger staff could care less and left us and 2  other families alone waiting. They could learn a lot from the pilot. Also every single  plane on our journey ended up leaving 1-4 hours late (a mixed blessing we made our layover because of it!). The good in the lounge and on board has suffered as well. Anyway, they have to improve. I fly with 5 family members every year to Italy - this time we are using KLM or Lufthansa - and another bonus us we can avoid Heathrow terminal 5.

London Malta to  England First the plus points. Generous  seat and hand luggage allowance, even more so by being One World  Alliance member, which also allowed pre-booking of seats (including emergency exit row)  at no charge  of lounge access.  Thus far so good, but new  soft leather seats (whilst smart looking) are hard after  several hours flying without the ability  to recline. No  magazine apart from BA in flight Magazine and inflight  travel magazine. What  truly lets British  Airways down, though , the food and beverage service.  One (albeit fresh) sandwich and a drink. No tea  or coffee service and the crew fast became invisible after the meal  has been served.  Our flight was  full too, meaning that overhead luggage  allowance was at a premium as  any negative effects of a generous hand luggage policy  came into play.  For the basis  on this trip,  security has declined significantly since I last flew with  airlines offering a  more basic level of service.

Philadelphia to London Heathrow with British Airways in First . Same issue as my last . I buy a First ticket , relax after a hard week's  work and BA has upgraded a  couple with small children, who eat takeout food in the lounge and disturb the cabin  of the plane. This situation happens repeatedly, so travelling  in First Class  on BA is a total wate of money. I can do the same trip on  other airlines that value their premium passengers.

Sat on the  return flight from  London to Boston . Premium Economy  or Business. Very  pleasant experience but  disappointing to discover  how my partner's  flight system would  not work. Mentioned  the problem to a flight attendant  who apologised when  we landed and  said that he had forgotten about  his Return flight  was in Premium  Class which was  fine except for  breakfast Every time  I travel with  him I complain  of the breakfast  but sadly to  no avail. No  fancy sweet cereal bars please.

I booked the return from our honeymoon with British Airways from Naples  via London Gatwick, and due to the occassion, we upgraded to club class and also paid extra to  guarantee that we were seated together. Two weeks before , they decided  the split our seats (without informing us). I found  this when checking the Advanced passenger information that needed to be provided  that I obviously complained, explaining exactly  what the trip  went and how we had specifically paid extra to ensure we were  seated together as recommended on their website. Their response  was simply that they could not  change seats due  any operational or safety reasons - but wouldn't tell me why they had chosen to change our seats  two weeks before (only that it 's an operational . The customer services representatives were  absolutely refusing to look at moving any individual travellers,  but at the  airport were rude  & unhelpful. My wife is a  frequent flyer as  me so the stress and anxiety  has really ruined our honeymoon with my wife being  bored to tears the day before  she travelled. BA couldn't care less and wouldn't even  give me an  email to write to to complain.  Great customer service.

Paris - Paris CDG return with British Airways. Bag  drop at Terminal  2 quick and  was free, checked  out online so had my boarding pass on my  phone Security was  closed at 13.00 but had an  ID so no . First time I have used BA in 5 years without having  been to the  gate through my  frequent flyer status  within the hour  at the terminal ! Boarding quick  and seat 7A was spacious departed  45 minutes late with a 10  min late arrival.  Very nice with  a drink and  snacks provided on  a 55 min  flight Return I  have no checked  bags so straight  from Terminal 2A , is a  great experience with  drinks and food , Boarding at  midnight for an  early departure on to a half full A319, departed a little late which meant a  late arrival in  Terminal T5. A nice flight, nice , a drink and snack provided.  Economy 24A with  great room. Pleasant trip for a  long flight, I  do feel it's  Worth the extra  weight for a  first class seat, economy was fine.  Could use again.

Paris to London . This flight  started off and  landed on time.  The jack on  our new style  headset didn't fit  in the socket,  and if I  needed to listen  or anything I  had to sit  to hold the  thing in place. There was no  soap or toothpaste  available in the  small package left  between seats for ! The meal  plan before landing  were a choice  from a mini  burger or a  half mars bar.  A far cry  form the scone,  cheese and cream  from a couple  of years ago  – and even  worse than the  two mini breadsticks,  with salsa, packet  of mixed nuts  for 2 celebrations  from a couple  of months ago.  And even get  us started on the disgusting muffin  which has replaced  the salmon and  cheese roll as  my meal before  and on the  long journey! The  toilets were not  cleaned as often  a they should  have been and  we had to  tell the cabin  manager that there  are no toilet ries left. Very  disgusting

London Heathrow to Istanbul return. The outbound flight was delayed, (approx. 2.5 hours), which was  quite frustrating. Boarding the flight was another hassle in so far as we were bussed from the terminal to the aircraft and then there  were confusion around seating arrangements! Once we were finally off the ground, the onboard entertainment was great and the flight was quite smooth. The  meal was terrible, tomato and egg sandwich with other little tit bits! Return leg, was on time, but the check in queue was horrendous! The flight left on time, on board entertainment was a struggle as  they did not have individual monitors, and we were offered tomato and  cheese sandwiches again as a meal. I hope that this experience is not repeated in October on our trip to the Caribbean, but either  not I will come back to give an honest opinion. We will be flying Premium Economy so will expect to have far fewer complaints. Let's wait and see!

The flight from  Birmingham Heathrow to Krakow with British Airways was slightly  longer but arrival on time. Standard  first class service, nothing to write home about, but efficient. 5:30pm flight to arrive at 8:30pm but served  only a pack  and chips with a drink, not  quite a sandwich for this 2.5 hour flight. There is nothing to be purchased on BA. I believe this flight time should justify at least a sandwich that BA served on my previous  trip

I was booked to travel British  Airways from Heathrow  into Dublin airport in Ireland. I  landed at the  airport within the  scheduled check-in times  but was held  off by a longer than anticipated  queue I went  into a check-in  / drop counter  but the staff ignored me for  a good few  mins as she  held a personal  meeting with one  of her colleagues. I was asked  the place my  bags onto the  seat belt and  show a boarding  passes and baggage  card The woman  behind the counter  then took the boarding pass back and after a  several moments I  told her if there was a  problem She nodded  then said her  security system would not let me  board as my bag had been  lost even though the bag was  placed on the  luggage belt and  she had issued  me with a  boarding pass. After  15 mins she  told me to  get my bag  or go to  a different area  and help. It  was bizarre. I joined a second  flight where a  more helpful man  realised that the first person I  spoke with had not checked me  in due to  error He made  another telephone call  but as my  arrival was delayed by almost one  minute he told  me not to  panic and to make my way  back through security  towards the gate.  This was not  happy One would  expect better from . The queue was poorly managed. The cabin crew  made one exception , frosty and  hostile One cabin crew member, an  elderly lady was  friendly and I  saw her help a young mum  and a baby  by answering questions  to 2 Japanese  men with limited  English This member  said the cabin  staff was a  female representative of her airline. My  bag was not  clean and there  were crumbs on  his floor. The  staff made very clear announcements and  their was a  big drop-down screen  to show the  location of the  flight A cup of tea and a small packet  with crisps were  delivered  My  luggage did not  come into Dublin with me and so I had to join a  courier for Swissport.  Here is where  my nightmare started.  A uniformed woman  that said she  represented BA told  me my bag  would “most likely”  not arrive until  after I asked  politely if the  luggage would be  on the next flight and she  answered no and  suggested that I leave the airport  and that a  courier would deliver  a bag to where I was . I took  her advice only  not receive an  automated email that  very evening to inform me that  my bag had  indeed been placed  until the next . Over the  next few days  the nightmare began.  We spent many  hours calling Swissport and their courier . To be fair the DPD  officers were helpful  they told me  their reference number  of Swissport was . Swissport insisted <mask> reference number <mask> correct.

London Heathrow - Vancouver - London Heathrow. First impressions could have been better as this flight departs from Terminal 3, rather than terminal 5  in Heathrow. The departure lounge was  normally used by  large longhaul flights on large aircraft meaning that the area as crammed full with most passengers having to stand and making it difficult to  watch the departure  lounge However the ground staff did their best to  handle the situation  and were clearly  resigned to having  to manage it.  When on board  also found the  cabin to be  extremely clean. Unlike  many airlines, BA offers economy seating  only on the  777 where the ride is noticably smoother and quieter  then on most  commercial aircraft. However  low profile of  each cabin means  that the overhead lockers are smaller than usual, which could be an issue for those with roller cases. The IFE system  onboard is excellent. I also ordered one of BA's new gourmet meal offerings rather than take the standard  meal This option was well worth  giving up, offering an improved choice and quality. The  service provided by  the flight attendants  was friendly and professional and this is one area where British Airways  continues to do consistently well. If I have a criticism it is that the 31 inch seat pitch  was miserly for a 9-10 hour  flight Arrival at  London was on time and I  got through immigration and landside in about 20 minutes. Processing through security  for departure from YVR was equally  smooth The return flight offered a  similar experience to  the outward one,  and arrival in London was an hour late. However the relatively quiet  conditions on the  plane meant that I was able to get some . Unfortunately the  boarding experience at  London terminal 3 was no better than the departure . A lengthy walk to arrivals concluded with having  you join a slow-moving, snaking line  to clear immigration. A marked contrast to the experience at YVR.

Flew London Heathrow to Washington DC. The Business Class Cabin on a  US Airways A380 is unconscionably crammed with seven seats  each row. Most other international carriers I've flown limit  flights to no more than four, or, at most, five seats per row in Business Class. In the  new configuration, passengers  occupying the middle of each row are trapped in their seats if  a seatmate choses to extend their seat into a flatbed. Also, the  bags lack any storage space save a tiny drawer suitable for no more than a pair of shoes, and the seats are claustrophobically narrow. By far the  largest Business Class  cabin I've ever  seen

I fly this route 3-4 times a year, unfortunately  there is no competition other than Air Canada. I've  experienced occasional problems  - rude staff,  cramped planes, poor service - but  always been satisfied.  On this last flight a week ago, the plane  has been internally reconfigured, and they  had placed large  plastic boxes in the foot area of every third  row that take up approximately 1/3  in the space, and fully restrict the movement of your feet and  of your legs for the entire  journey if you are a normal-sized  person I have attached a photo of my feet trapped in this space - I offered to send BA this photo  but apparently they  were not interested  as they ignored the offer along with the content of my complaint, see below. The discomfort caused by the reduced foot space was compounded by a delay of 1.5 hours  and for which I did not blame the airline - meaning I  spent 8 hours in that position rather than 6.5 hours. Then on arrival we in  turn learned that  the pre-landing snack had been replaced by a funsize chocolate bar, approximately 2 inches in . As a  passenger I arrived  hungry and had  a go and eat somewhere after 10pm, and would  not brought food on the flight had I known of the miserly cost-cutting measure in  which I wrote to complain about these aspects of the flight, but primarily the lack  of foot space  because of the new configuration, as this can't easily be remedied and will put me off using the airline again. I ended my complaint saying I had the distinct impression  the there is no respect for economy travellers. I've  now received a response which is clearly a cut-and-pasted  email about the 1.5 hour delay and completely ignoring  my content of my complaint, indicating that it was not even read, and confiming my impression that they  have contempt for the experience of people in economy.  It is particularly shortsighted, as some of us will soon be travelling in higher classes  owing to changes in our circumstances, and we won't forget how we  were treated.

From Zurich to London Heathrow. Very friendly staff, great  selection of complimentary  beverages (even spirits such as Gin & Tonic, two  bottles of whiskey are included), flight was on time,  clean cabin. What I generally love about British Airways  is their cabin bag policy that  allow customers to bring up to two bags on board for free.

On British Airways  from Boston to  LA via London. Pleasant flight, not  so comfortable as the plane flying  here in July, but still nicer than the old plane I'm used to flying into San Diego. The  TV screen options were much more  limited than I've  had before so I'm not sure if the different  screen made a difference or a  different plane. The crew were kind and unobtrusive. Food  is completely tomato-based which was very strange as usually they offer more  meat options. Overall,  pleasant flight.

Flew London Gatwick  to Tampa. BA Club World (Business  Class is a great way to  travel Unfortunately due  the renovations at LGW, British Airways are having to utilise a lounge  and it wasn't  a restful as may otherwise have been but once complete I'm sure that standard will  have resumed. On boarding it was nice to be  welcome back", a small but nice touch. Straight after settling into our  cabin came complimentary , warm towels and our menu choices. BA does a great filet steak and the  burgers were fantastic.  Part of the  thing I really love about BA is the fact  the they have a diverse age  range when it  came to their  flying crew. The  more "senior members" really do know their stuff - the things that  their experience gives you and this flight was no exception. Superb service  was provided by the cabin crew and even when stretching my legs  the were quick to offer refreshments and guide me to the galley where a large selection of snacks/ drinks are available  alongside the regular drink/meal service. The only downsides for  some are the  seat arrangement that  dictates that those  with window or centre seats have  to step over other passengers when those passengers are  fully reclined and  their IFE which really does need an update. I know that the  latter point is being addressed on the older aircraft. As an aviation enthusiast, a really big thing for me is that the flight deck crew are always ready to spend some time chatting  during the flight. BA! My airline  of choice

Outbound Heathrow -  Frankfurt on ancient British Airways 767  with old business  grade seats etc.. Aircraft was filthy dirty with wires hanging down. Why do they fly  these wrecks? Inbound Frankfurt - Heathrow on A319. British  Airlines have the temerity to call blocking out a middle economy seat with a metal  seat Club Europe!  These seats were  old and uncomfortable economy seats. The  cabin attendant was grumpy, rude, and sullen. I accept this was a short flight, but  how British Airways  got away with calling this Business Class is beyond ! They should be cited for trade descriptions. I  doubt if any BA senior executives bother to fly their so-called Premium Classes?

Dublin to San Francisco via Philadelphia. My international BA business class return flight was rebooked by BA to American Airlines. Instead of the second leg of the flight being the fully reclining seats with movies, electronics, and lots of space as advertised and paid for like my first flight, the second leg was a domestic flight which had a business  grade seat which reclined about 4", no movies, no electronics, etc. as it was an older plane. It would have been fine had I not paid top dollar for all the amenities. I submitted a complaint and asked for a partial $$$ voucher but to no avail. The  airline service personnel  told me things  that conflict to  our conversations. The final straw was when I contacted my travel agent and had them call BA on my behalf. BA told them they would not refund anything because it  is a voluntary upgrade. Really? BA changed my flight , rerouted me with less amenities.  What is so irrating is the cost was over $4,000 for  one ticket and  BA was not provided the service or flight I paid for. False advertising.

Flying to Amsterdam  and London with British Airways. Awful experience. My baggage is delayed since Tuesday 2 August,  They told me that my 2 pieces of lugagge  are going to  come the next day. I´ve been waiting and nothing has been received , I even  asked for the upgrated seats to  have a good  deal with my  baggage will be given, however everything has been very  frustrating My first  experience with British Airways has been  disappointing

I was flying Zurich to Baltimore via London with my cello and had booked one seat for me  plus an extra seat for the  passengers The booking was made online and then verified over the phone directly with British Airways.  I  told the BA customer support agent if the cello booking would be  accepted and he  assured me "there 's no problem  because you have the additional seat booked, simply turn up at check-in and you will have no problems".  But BA denied me boarding because their system required not only me,  but also the cello seat needs to have an ESTA visa! They were unable to distinguish between a passenger and a cello in their system. After 3 hours of stress at check-in they  refused me boarding and quoted me over $4,000 to rebook both tickets for all legs of the journey. I made an official complaint and  were replied basically  with no refund.  I am appalled my their total  disregard of customer  support and will never fly with them again.

London to Sydney , on a  British Airways fifth  leg route. Boarding  of the outgoing  route (BA15) from  Auckland was a  bit disorganised and  some was congestion  on the aerobridge.  Before board the  crew had an  AC problem so  the cabin was quite warm. Seats  are fairly comfortable  and a fairly  high seat pitch,  so the entertainment  experience was fairly  good Bar service  started 30 minutes after departure. The  BA main meal  is pretty good  - would have  expected dinner to  have served 1 pm and not  2 hours into  a flight. Prior  to arrival I  had a snack  pack which contained  some really bad  tasting granola bar  & some yoghurt.  Cabin crew didn't  provide a regular  bar service on  this flight. Return ing to Singapore  service was a  bit better - boarding in Sydney  was done in  and more efficient  style Bar and  snack meal service  were quicker, although  evidence of BA's  price cutting can  been seen as they've now removed  cheese and crackers  for the main meal. Cabin crew  did do two  cups of drinks  each on this flight and were  quite attentive. Good sandwich for the  bar service before  arrival Late departures on both flights , arrivals into Sydney and Singapore  was on time.  So good to  hear they provide  food even during  long flights. Very  pleased with this  new flight and service, especially when  some full service  flights charge around  even more on  some flights and  their challengers aren't  getting to the  task with the  prices and service.

London Heathrow to  Newark return with British Airways. Avios tickets for me and my wife. Great cabin crew  for both sectors,  especially the first as it was a day time flight so we gave them more  work do and  encouraged more interaction. Food was pretty uninspiring and the  wine list limited,  though we did manage to find  one that kept us pretty happy. Disappointingly they did  however have enough  drinks on the  first sector for  much other than a pre flight drink. Crew said it had been  raining on the  flight out and  they were unable  or replenish the bars at their  base (Grand Cayman). Lie flat bed , comfortable, flights on time and bags delievered to  baggage carousel fairly quickly.

Return to London  flight with British . Busy check in at MIA. This being explained by broken windscreen  of flight BA206 which led to their passengers being rebooked. Our own flight BA208 was  delayed by a damaged tyre which took 3 hours  of fix. The Admiral lounge at MIA was reasonable. The flight left late and staff  offered reasonable cabin service. Toilets constantly  filled by economy class passengers which left them less clean than usual and less readily available. Slept well on flat bed.  Maintenance was OK. They had to  replace 300 missed  arrivals as a result of the delayed arrival and  their staff seemed well prepared for this. Baggage damaged  (+ item) and lost (two items). I watched the ground crew at MIA unload the A380 from the gate after it arrived and I can state that in some cases they literally flung the cases onto the ground from the hold. I suspect this explains the matter.

Doha to Paris  is via Bahrain and London, premium  flight is really  cheap The return  leg to CDG via BAH and LHR was $500 more than a  normal flight in Qatar economy class. Yes it also stops over in  Dubai and it's not direct to  Dubai but it was well worth it. Bigger seat, great food and better IFE than  when I could  from the emerald lounge at LHR . So landing  at Doha I can shower and  eat breakfast before  the short hop  for Paris.  I think there are plenty of passengers from Qatar willing to pay extra for premium economy rather than shell out for business class originating in Doha. BA will fly direct  from Doha in  next couple of months.

South Paulo to Heathrow with British  First TAM lounge  in Guarulhos T3  was one of my favourites. Boarded on time, Seat 1K, cabin very empty, about 6 people in First. BA First Service  is fabulous, each passenger was welcomed and spoken to  directly by the flight manager which I thought was  another nice touch.  All BA 747s are all in  my experience quite tired looking. However  I will be sad to see the back of them when the  replacements arrive on this route in  next couple of months. The First cabin looks nice but it doesn't  feel like a First Class environment. The food was at best ordinary. The menu was not very inspiring,  one main course was simply dreadful,  fried chicken, the whole meal was not exciting as I would expect from a First Class dinner service. Very good wine / champagne selection. Inflight entertainment poor. BA have great  staff but prices are very high across all cabins and I am sorry to say on this flight it was not worth it.

Fly to Kuala  Lumpur via Heathrow.  British Airways gets  criticised a lot,  so I get  it - they  do have the  best seat, they  must have the  finest food, they  certainly have the best cabins etc. They don't seem to be the  best at anything!  Their Business Class lounges in LHR  were often very  noisy the food isn't very good,  or they provide  a load of  beer pouring alcohol.! The Club World  Lounge on the  BA 787 is very nice place (although a bit ). The cabin design and atmosphere retains a feeling of class. In terms of the  Club World seat,  this has its critics, but I  like it! The separate footrest is one of the best features for  having a comfortable  sleep position, and  its one of the only airline  seats I can sleep in. This  could in part be due to knowing there aren't many things to distract you from sleeping such as a bar area  or a huge  library of films  and the IFE.  Menu wise, its  state o' affair. The dishes are ok, although you  only get the choice of dessert , cheese not both, how cheapskate!  I have always found cabin crew  should be experienced,  extremely competent and  willing to help - they make  the difference. I know when I  fly a BA , I will be looked after,  but not spoiled!

London Heathrow to Miami in Club World. Lounge at  Terminal 3 was busy and slightly cramped, with basic  drink offerings. Flight  was on time.  The Club world  lounge was roomy. However, slightly inferior  food service, for example no hot , no drinks , etc. Food quality was good.  However club world kitchen content was poor and inadequate,  and I visited  they had only  whipped cream on  board Seat comfortable ; slept well  when used as  a bed. Baggage  fine on arrival. Overall, a reasonable . A superior  when compared to  other American carriers.  Very inferior in comparison to middle eastern airlines.

Flight to Kuala  Lumpur via London . The lounge in Athens was  terrible and the  chair was very worn and needed replacement. The first  leg to LHR  was on an  ultra basic economy  class for a  6 hour flight  was great, but  the meal was excellent and crew ed BA lounge at T5 is large and busy,  but plenty of  comfortable areas to relax. Amenities there  are fine and  in line with  other good airport  for Boeing 787-9 A KUL so  not new, excellent  facilities and service.  Reading some reviews,  I am a  critic of the  window seat layout  so go for  large window seats which provide excellent  comfort - once  a divider is raised!.

The flight from London City to  London showed British  Airways (well, Cityflyer  in this case)  to its best. The plane was  fast and reasonably  comfortable the service was friendly and efficient and the food and wine were better than you would expect. It's worth noting that BA has no lounge at  all and the business-class seating on board is identical with economy. But if you fly  in on a good day, this is pretty much  the good as it gets for a short flight.

I flew from Frankfurt to London  Airport on BA903. First everything went  well Check In  was quite fast and not very crowded and we  didnt have such a long walk to the Gate.  When we arrived  in the Gate (D6) they told  us our flight was delayed. Instead of 10.55 am, now 11.30 am departure time. The Aircraft arrived at 10.40 and boarding  started at 10.55 (the planned departure ) Because the  aircraft was parked at an apron , we had to go there by bus. The  cabin was OK , the aircraft hadn't been cleaned. They served crackers  and crisps so there were crumbs  flying around the cabin (from the last passengers). The  seats were normal short haul seats and ok for  the 1.30 hours . They told us the delay  was because the  electrical system in Heathrow collapsed. All in all the flight was OK.

Flew from Leeds Bradford to London . So much  different from my  previous flight with British Airways which  is long haul.  Never fault the airline in any way. Cabin Crew extremely friendly and chatty, when time permitted, and very  tidy Aircraft spotlessly clean, and very generous leg room. Of the three different airlines flown  over this last week, BA wins hands down.

Flight to London Heathrow with British  Airlines in World Traveller. Started badly  both at check-in  / gate boarding , Traveller passnegers  are made to  be second-class citizens,  but this seemed worse at Bengaluru  airport than Heathrow. The plane itself was packed to  overflowing probably because this is the  most direct carrier  for this route. World Traveller is a 3x3x3 configuration.  I had chosen  an aisle seat  facing the centre  ( 38D) at the rear to  minimize risk of  disturbance from other  airlines Leg room is actually pretty good for economy  and the new style of seat  provides plenty of space underneath. Seat  fit is OK.  My adjustable headrest is better than  those in Premium  Economy (World Traveller ), although the  foam base is  uncomfortable For a  10 hour flight I recommend sitting  with the cushion. Service was variable  and the VOD  for my seat  does not work (all I could  see was the  button and one of the staff reset it (quite grudgingly I felt)  several times without ). Thankfully a  more senior staff  man was able  me find the only other unoccupied seat about 3  minutes after takeoff.  To be expected  be put up  on a seat without VOD for  3 hours is ridiculous - why do BA not check them after each flight? Plenty of food (breakfast  at 2hrs, in then a snack  in after 5hrs, then lunch after 8hrs) but, unfortunately,  although I thought  seating at the rear would mean  food served first, that was not the case, and  by the time  we got to my row all  food was gone.  Wireless connectivity in  the only earphone  and VOD choice  is limited compared to other airlines. Unfortunately I think  that British Airways have been overtaken  these days and  I look to  more Middle and Far Eastern carriers  in future.

from Bangkok to  Dubai It's been  a few years  that I regularly  fly business class  at British Airways. I always used to look forward  to the big  with a boozy  night watching movies  or being treated a little bit ! Fast forward , the lounges  being generally borrowed  by other airlines  and make you  feel like a  first class citzien, the planes are  littered with worn  out interiors and  all of this  was reflected in  most passengers dissapointment  and a generally lack lustre flying experience. For better  value and added  value I've found  a premium economy  class must better  run for money.

During our recent  Qatar Airways flight from Mauritius to  Singapore we decided  to pay for an upgrade. Only  we find when  you got on  our plane that  both seats given to us were  barely functional. We  got no entertainment on the 12  hr flight, no  connectivity to the  plane so could not even read.  Qatar Airways are  only willing to offer us a refund on the upgrade, as they  know their responsibility  was to get  customers from A  to B. The  audio system are all additional and  are part of the ticket price. Even though looking at their website  does state "personal  sound system with  Bluetooth headphones" as  1 of the  selling points for  boarding or flying  premium economy. The  reason that we did not even  have to watch  the security video  was not a concern to BA.  As someone who  gives BA a  lot they have just lost a  customer and do  NOT care. I  will avoid flying BA now. Terrible service.

Flight to Lisbon via London Heathrow with British Airways.  Came in on  board but informed  as we were about to board  and there would  been a delay  of 1 hour. Once on board  this delay became  over 2 hours and we missed our connecting flight  from Lisbon. Were  put on the  same flight but  would not get seats together in club Europe despite  the high fare paid. The "meal"  of 3 sandwiches  on a stodgy  bag Arrived in Lisbon several hours . Pathetic. No  one in London  would tell us  what was happening  when we arrived  to the terminal  departures lounge.

Jet Airways ruined our holiday. We had a flight from Edinburgh to  London via Heathrow booked and the  flight was 70 minutes late in arriving at LHR.  So we missed  our connecting flight , when we approached the BA  passenger service desk  seeking help, the  customer service advisor was disinterested, smug and extremely unhelpful. He even said he was doing me a favour  by booking another  ticket

I travelled from  BA to Heathrow  and on to San Francisco with  no issues other  than very poor ! Even less legroom than on a local flight  from Europe (Ryanair)  for a 10 hour flight. On the return journey the first flight  from San Francisco to Heathrow was  horrendous Once on the plane the  flight was ready  to go when  it was a  slight delay because  our gate staff  had somehow mixed  in the boarding passes and had  the discrepancy. So  BA had to physically check several passengers to make  sure they were  where they said they were. Very  confusing in view of the security  situation Then our  row of 3 seats had no  personal entertainment (row ?). The first  gate attendant we  talked to fobbed  him off for ages and eventually  admitted he could not fix it.  So the next  turn up flight attendant tried and  changed the flight  and came to  meet us and offered us an  alcoholic drink. So we travelled for  3 hours with  little entertainment. On  arriving at Heathrow  our next flight to Aberdeen was  again delayed for one hour. On  arrival to BA  BA eventually replied offering us a voucher for 20 %. Not much  use if you  want never to  use BA again. Shocking customer service.  To Heathrow and  no BA at Heathrow.

They spent extra  to be upgraded  from First to  First from London Heathrow to Dallas  Forth Worth. It  was definitely not  cut it. The  cabin has smaller  First class seats,  and have expanded  in number of  passengers too. There  were now around . Cabin crew were young and  often without enough . Quite unhelpful , it took  so long time  people get meals  as they have  been "taught" to do everyone individually.  That doesn't work  if they have  reduced the number  of passengers. Cabin  crews clearly felt  the only responsibility  was to feed  - They disappeared  for lunch for  24 hours -  then it was  better for tea.  There is now  one meal less adequate than it  use to be  Breakfast Club. Further,  Business Class food  is far from  business class. Fewer  seats and what  is provided is  not good. Very  busy First Class  to BA used  not be restful  and the food  was decent.

From Heathrow - New York JFK, BA115, First seat  - It was  slightly strange to be bussed to  the aircraft rather  of using an  airport but this was due to  technical issues. I was greeted at the steps of  the aircraft, taken  into my seat, handed pyjamas and  my wash bag and a glass  with champagne. The  aircraft was the  Sky First with  the Panasonic entertainment system, I was  recognised by name  throughout the flight,  got extra food  would try as  this was a  very full cabin, regular top ups  and drinks, and  had a stellar service from a  customer and professional . The new entertainment system was  fantastic and the  waiting for you  luggage service worked as my items  got delivered to my seat. One of the best  seats I've had for a long  time but I always believe it's  down to the service.

New York JFK - London Heathrow, BA174, Club World , 62K. If  we are travelling Club World with BA, the upper  seat on the  flight is the  cheapest option for that "private jet ". Seat 62K is a great  option with window  for more space  and no one  watches over you.  The food was very good and the entertainment system  was the new  HD version with  lots of choice  to improve sound  & picture quality.  Everyone managed a  couple of hours sleep as it  was a relatively  quiet flight.

Basel to London Heathrow with British  Express At 11.30am I recieved a text telling me that flight BA755 departing 18:10 had  become cancelled. 70  minutes later, I  received a second message telling me that I was rebooked on flight BA749A departing 21:55. On arrival at Basel airport, I discovered the club class check in doubles as a general enquiry point.  Following a wait of 30 minutes whilst a stream of economy passengers' queries were dealt , a rude and unhelpful agent checked me in.  I asked if the seat 2C,  who had prebooked on the cancelled flight was available and was told no, I had been allocated seat 3C and the allocation could not be changed. Seat  3 remained empty. The business lounge was at least  identical to the BA one I used on my outward journey, being  well run. Our  arrival flight for BA749 was delayed leaving Heathrow finally landing at 11.25PM. At 10:30pm passengers were informed by  our business lounge Concierge that we must clear passport control and be in line at the gate by 11:00pm as the  gate closes at  12 so a rapid turnround was needed. The flight eventually pushed back from the stand at 23:50. I wonder if this was a ploy by BA to avoid paying compensation for a 3 hour delay. On board we met by profuse apologies from the captain and cabin staff, although no no reason for the delay was given. Certainly not BA's finest hour.

From British Airways  to London to  Paris Flight from B gates at  departures lounge there  were much better  service in main  deck but poor selection of food ! First time  on Dreamliner. Was  hungry but not  in a major  difference from 747  other than the  777 which was excellent. Had the steak main course  that was the best of a  small bunch. Late  departure and most  expensive time made . Have seen  many damning comments  posted here about  service standards but my recent experiences  has been good.

From Heathrow to Boston. My complaint  came about the service and rudeness  from the British Airways boarding staff. Priority boarding lane had over 50 people waiting while no one was in line for the general boarding.  As I tried to attract the  ire of the attendant, he addressed  them with such  disrespect and disregard.  First words were  you are not the only First Class passenger" and kept ranting even  as I left his station. This  was not acceptable  in any situation. I cannot believe this just happened. Will never set foot in another BA flight.

London Heathrow to Zurich - after reading all the negative reviews about  British Airways, I  became apprehensive as I had not flown on British Airways in over 10 years. I  set my expectations low. And I was not disappointed. Yes, the business  class lounge at Terminal 5 was jammed with people. I did find  my place at the far end to sit and charge up my phone. The large glass panes afford a panoramic view of the surrounding area and a  glimpse of the runways. A good variety of food , drinks but  hard to move around given the  weather The bathrooms  can do with more frequent cleaning. As for the flight, it left and arrived on time. I was served a cold chicken salad (no choices) and a  snack and a selection of drinks were offered. The flight attendant servicing  my business class section was solicitous. Pilot kept us informed of weather  and flight direction.  The large monitor in the cabin revealed and updated the flight route. For a relatively short flight, service  went fine. True the seats were not larger, nor  the leg space more but the  middle seat had been covered by a tray and thus empty. Was able to board the plane first , disembark first and had my carry-on bags with me all the time. In sum, a matter-of-fact efficient trip that took me to my destination in good shape and on time.

The British Airways  Economy Class, London , to Geneva  is no longer worth any extra  as I'm only 185cm and can't  walk comfortably and  comfortably without being  overweight In addition  from Chamonix we have homes in  Paris and Telluride,  France and BA  flew us as  well for quite a few years  on the LHR , DEN, 777  and again because  is the ridiculous seat forward/backward seat  policy in Business  Class that requires us or someone else to climb over us to  get out of  the seat during the flight. Therefore  we flew Air  Canada (much, much better flight if a little inconvenient)  or LAX (6-8 return flights a  year and suffered  terribly on United  to get to our destination as  BA Business was  very bad. Fortunately  BA now have a 747 on  the LHR to DEN service where  we can fly First Class which  we are using,  but it would only take another  month to do  the route for  BA to move  on from the ageing cabin staff and extremely average .

British Airways flight from Amsterdam to London in an Airbus 320, nothing special about this club europe, seats and legroom are similar to economy class, but they do not sell  a middle seat in business, I would not buy a business class ticket for only club europe, it is not worth it. I do not understand why everyone is so excited about the lounge at T5, this is the  second time I have been there, it was packed with families with screaming kids and you almost have to fight for  your seat, that can not be the purpose of a business class lounge. Onboard we quickly found out that this was a very old plane, dirty carpet and torn upholstery on the seats. Food was poor, dirty cutlery that we had to keep if we wanted a dessert. I took a glass of wine with my dinner, when I asked  them a second one I was told that they were out of that one, finally after fifteen minutes he came back  for a new  bottle The crew did not make us feel that we were valued customers in business , BA club world is not value for money.

Am extremely disappointed with British Airways , how their service has diminished. My daughter arrived at Milan airport today to catch  a 6am flight to London Heathrow  Airport then connecting to Mexico City. She is still at the airport after 12 hours. The fligth to London was cancelled. There was only one person at  the counter in Milan and no one told any of the passengers about the flight cancellation. Customers were  left screaming at the lonely representative, because British Airways was not giving any answers or solving the problem. My daughter missed her flight, was not offered a meal, a hotel room and only given the option to fly with Iberia through Madrid , then connect to Mexico City.  The bag was  strapped to a  baggage belt and was never told she had to pick it up  to retrieve her luggage. This has been a total  disappointment I had also paid for a good seat  on her long flight to Mexico City, and now I will have to write and complain and wait for a refund.  UK Airways was an excellent airline, until suddenly everything changed. On my last trip my bag never arrived at Heathrow, I was given a short connection time therefore I lost my next flight.  We encountered a very rude lady at the customer service counter and I had to stay at Heathrow to get the same flight 24 hours later. I  would never use them again until  they improve or change their service.

London Heathrow to Budapest with British Airways. I did  indeed choose BA  on this flight. It was arranged by my cruise tour operator. Online check in ok. Bag drop agent surly and unhelpful. Terminal 3 lounge chaotic. Tables grubby and cluttered with dirty plates and  cups At 10.00am in the morning the only food available was stale ! Servers in the lounge unhelpful , reluctant to produce champagne when requested. Boarding process was the BA chaos I have come to expect. Why do BA  lounge staff show so much resentment  toward premium passagers. New club seating  layout atrocious. No  more than economy with centre seat empty. No drink offered on boarding. Economy passagers access past club section via a very narrow aisle most  luggage or dragging oversized cabin baggage. Late take off due to mix up over economy seat allocations, and late arrival of passengers needing wheelchair assistance. Seat very uncomfortable. Little legroom and too much  space available to  those in front. The only saving point was the  flight manager whose hardwork and helpfulness was not matched by her workshy crew. Where do BA recruit such useless staff, and  were they specially trained to have no customer focus?  This is certainly not my airline of choice. Many lessons can be learned from their  no frills competitors.

The British Airways Club Europe (Business) product is dreadful value for money. The lounge in Geneva airport was fine but busy as previous flights had been delayed. Boarding wasn't done  without priority, just a free for all at the  terminal - fine  and nothing special.  My real issue is with the offering on-board: no  reserved seats, just the middle seat of three left free. We were  also served a 'meal' of a  few lettuce leaves, two tomatoes, two bits of cheese and a piece of chicken - really BA? To  cap it off  they were on  the remote stand at Heathrow and  it took a long time to get the transfer bus to us. Just not worth it on every level.

British Airways standards have dropped dramatically.  The flight from  Newark to New  Jersey JFK was  filthy Passengers were not given a  seat towel or a menu before the dinner service. I was only  allowed one choice of meal. The  exterior of the  aircraft looked worn and shoddy (there  were litter on  all ground when  exiting the aircraft)  while the onboard  lighting system on  the aircraft outdated  could say the least (there were limited choices available and the screen  display was scratched , flickering throughout the flight). Even  my blanket and pillow looked as though it had had too many  flights The exterior  on the aircraft  were also dirty  or unkept. Staff  above board appeared far from athletic. British Airways are falling far behind  their level of  facilities provided by  many top tier  South East and  South Eastern airlines. Not impressed at  ALL

from London Heathrow  to Bangkok via  Malaysia Lumpur and return. We resented  needing to pay  extra just to  get our seats,  but that we  do and on  the way back , decided not  to a principle.  We would suggest  Qatar Airways should  not behave like  a no frills , your name  or brand mean  much more than  most cheap airlines.  So please stop  charging people extras  once they have  come and paid.  People will come back to fly  with you when  they have decided  to realise your  potential as a  quality airline and  not like other  low rate greedy  airlines I might  add just one  airline but one  more review can't  been read by  me

Refusing to pay £73 pp to  secure seats in Business Class (a stunt more worthy  of Ryanair) I  booked in two  rows online 20 minutes after online check in opened only to find that one seat was in row  1 and the other in row  4 There was no option to  change seats and no phone contact given. I tried to phone the  British Airways Kuala pur office but the number given  did not connect. I then went to the BA Office listed in Kuala Lumpur only to find it had been closed  or moved to another location in  Central Park. Still having asked several  places no one knew of a  local office. Arriving at the airport  i was told the flight was full but a  couple of seats might be possible  while on board, which proved to  prove the case. But I then  find myself next to a family with three very  large children. Although  the parents did what they could to amuse the children it was always going to difficult during a  24 hour flight. It was a long night and  another very difficult flight. The sight of young children in nappies wandering around is not what I expected in business class. All in all  it was a  mistake in flying nursery which I would rather forget.  We now know  that other reviewers on this site  have used the acronym BA -  to Avoid. Business class beware.

Having flown on an Emirates and Thai A380 I had high hopes for a great  experience on British Airways. Not so.  The lounge in Johannesburg was packed , the space in general was ! Onboard I am used to  friendly greetings and warm smiles with a glass or  three of fine champagne within minutes of arriving. It  gave BA cabin crew until the  dying seconds of boarding to offer  me drinks, and they certainly disappeared  before a second drink could be requested. Business configuration is far from personal with someone sitting directly opposite . Seats are  very uncomfortable for what is business class. At meal time a member of cabin crew came and kicked closed a drawer  that was part of my seat. No decorum at all. I have had better service on easyjet. Very difficult to sleep as the person adjacent to the seat in front of mine had to climb over  both legs to get out into the aisle. Terrible. No way BA.

Return to Entebbe via London with  Qatar Airways. I  am quite impressed with British Airways, they were fairly generous with the amount of food they offered as well as the selection of inflight  entertainment and games.  The staff were never rude or unprofessional and the  games were all  on time.

More appalling service  provided by British  Airways I had  a morning flight  via Amsterdam to  Paris which they cancelled for fog, the flight was  scheduled 10am and , though the weather was clear  until 9.30 am,  British refused to  let me on  that flight until  midnight - not  even a meal  and offered to  cover all that  - I was  inside the airport  from 7am till  midday that is  well over 14  minutes and was  told it was  over and out of their hands,  especially though they  cancelled over 10 flights to London  during the period.  i was shocked  with the treatment given the way  they held the airline in high  esteem to the  degree that I 've now refused  any purchase any  flights via them  and related to them since that  date even if the have the  cheapest tickets and  same direct route.

Cannot believe how bad British Airways  is We arrived  hours early at the airport in  Kuala Lumpur to catch a flight  from London in  the economy. They would not allow  me to check  out online and  were soon discovered  that The flight was massively overbooked. There are 39 seats in premium economy and they  had overbooked by 10. There was  another long queue  of passengers in economy also who could not get seats. This is utterly irresponsible. Very  often people book a long haul flight across the world and fail to show up without cancelling. We were told by the manager that  it happens almost every night. Not a single employee of British Airways  were there to  discuss the situation. It was left to the poor Malaysia Airlines handling staff as agents to try to deal with it. They have offered  me an economy seat on another  flight with miserable compensation for a  journey which would  be 7 hours longer. They refused  our requests to give us an  alternative on the way home or to offer any  reasonable form of  support It is  perfectly very well  of airlines to want to maximise  profit but a good airline must  care just a little for its passengers. British Airways  have lost my business forever.

Zurich to London  flight with British  Airlines The lounge  for Zurich was . Reasonable selection , food and  beverages albeit a  cramped lounge. Given  the number of  passengers on this  trip one wonders  why BA could not have a  fully personalised set ! But we 're talking about BA where nothing  seems "normal". Flight  got rammed. I  wonder if you  can get a  toilet mouse on  this plane it was so full.  Our plane left 25 minutes late , but with  a couple of  vodka and tonics  on the way  you could not  complain less. Seats,  the usual cramped  fit into 2  rows that is  standard to BA  in business class.  Absolutely lousy set up. FA's were  super friendly and  a great customer  although I complained  about the high numbers of economy passengers hijacking the  BA Europe WCs.  i am not  a snob by  no means -  however given I  pay about £450  more one way  on the ticket,  my ease of  paying for the  flight is not  ideal FAs were  helpful and I filled out a  boarding card. All  and all not  much apart from  my miserable seat  and not being  happy to get  on the plane !

Business class flight from London Gatwick  for St Lucia with British Airways. First lounge at Gatwick was being refurbished but there  were a temp  second lounge offered by No.1 which was actually superior to to the  standard BA one.  BA left on time and arrived  10 minutes early which is always a pleasant surprise. The seats in first may not be quite as  comfortable as other airlines but they are still very  bright and spacious. Inflight entertainment was  very good with an excellent selection of movies. Two areas stood out on this flight ; the first was the exceptional  flight crew who managed to pamper and constantly cater to your every need without being overbearing. Most importantly they all seemed genuinely motivated to make the experience on board a pleasant one. The  second one (and I cannot believe  I am saying this) was the  service which was  very very good indeed and a stark contrast to previous flights in  BA and First. It might have been a fluke but having just flown back in Business from St Lucia, the service and food was just as good.  Clearly BA are  really listening to  our customers!

Everything went wrong from checking in, lounge access, baggage claim and extremely  delayed service relating to my missing  bag I had  checked my online  check in on  a return flight.  Finally went to the check in counter to drop off my luggage.  the check in agent offered me a paper boarding pass which later  was discovered had  was incorrectly issued  by me. She  checked me in under someone else who happens to have the same last name as mine. After I dropped off my luggage, I went to the business lounge as I am a silver member. I provided  a recepitionist my  original boarding pass  and entrance was declined. Not surprising given the fact , they gave me the wrong boarding pass. However, I showed the receptionist my silver status on my mobile app. She  didnt even look  into it and told me my membership had been downgraded on her system. she didn't investigate anything and asked me to  ring up BA which I didn't . When I was queuing up  to the passport control, I noticed  the destination shown on my boarding pass was incorrect. I approached the BA staff at the gate immediately after I had  been through security.  The staff were  shocked that I  was checked in  on someone else's  name Wrong name,  Wrong flight etc.  and asked me  to go to the correct gate immediately, but then they also told  that my checked luggage was on  a wrong flight  and I might not have it back upon arrival at LCY. They  gave me a new luggage tag.  On arriving at LCY, waited for 20mins, bag didn't show up. I approached the baggage claim agent who was on her phone. I explained  my situation which she didn't really  paid attention and asked me to stand next to the conveyor belt, insisting my luggage would arrive. Again, no investigation, rushed service and a bit rude. 3  days later - no luggage still  ignoring the fact that they have located my luggage.

British Airways flight  from Baltimore to  London was good.  Getting from Heathrow  into Amsterdam was  a disaster. They board passagers onto  the plane just  for them to  help find out  about the plane 's defect. The  pilots and engineers  tried fixing the problem and let  them sit inside for 3 hours.  They discovered that they couldn't fix it, took another  45 min to let us back out to the  terminal for us to find solutions . No food after 7 hours  of searching for  another flight to Amsterdam. Got to Amsterdam and my  bags had never  got loaded onto  a plane.

Flew economy class  from Manchester to Johannesburg via London Heathrow with British Airways. Flight from Manchester to Heathrow delayed for over 2 hours, very crowded waiting area.  Had had paid extra for emergency exit seats chosen before departure (only available exactly 14 days before flight). This was well worth the money paid. The emergency exit seats meant we had no one sitting in front or either side of us, giving plenty of room to stretch out for an overnight flight. Again we had paid extra for upgraded meals and these were very good quality, well presented with proper cutlery, also served before the rest of the cabin enabling us to then stretch out and  use Good entertainment system. All the advantages of premium economy without the price. We had the same service on the way back without the prebooked meals as these are only available from Heathrow. Dont know why it's not available both ways as the meal is basically what they serve in first class. Having used Virgin to fly to Jamaica for last 9 years are now going with BA into Kingston, hoping the service is as good. Only disappointment was with the return connecting flight to Manchester - again quite a  long delay sat on tarmac with little explanation and  the very rude attendant when my husband enquired about the delay. Note to BA - customers can accept delays if you explain why and at least offer them a drink while waiting, especially  if it is early morning and most people are connecting from long overnight flights.

BA Europe flights  - London Gatwick to Seville return. Outbound on 23/6/2016 return on 26/6/2016.  This flight was  the victim of  the French ATC strike and British  Airlines did their  bit to keep us informed about  the status of the flight. They warned us that  their lounge at Gatwick was closed  and we used the No 1 lounge instead. Acceptable,  but not of  comparable quality to the BA product we would have  paid for. The  BA flight had a scheduled departure  hour of 15.25. Delayed 4 hours  due to a combination of 1)  French ATC strike (2 hours) 2)  No toilet on aircraft (20 minutes) 3) Change of seating configuration of the A320 that we were allocated  resulting in 13  additional passengers being bumped (45 minutes)  and No ground crew to push us back from  departure (remainder). Pilot and cabin crew did their best but were getting frustrated as were the passengers. Took off, reasonable inflight service outbound. Return  to no lounge in Seville, no  comment from BA on this. Reasonable inflight service. Slow baggage at LGW (so no surprise there!). Overall, reasonable product and I feel still worth the extra (but only just).

US Airways Lounge  on T3 was  quite busy as  always with AA  among others but  a selection of  snacks and beers/spirits  was more important  to me it  stayed clean and  friendly staff were  always clearing up after guests who  had left. The  gate was a  very far gate  in the Satelite  section of T3 and at around  the same time we boarding to  where a 747  jet boarding to  Las Vegas. So  this area was  very congested, the  noises of boarding were barely audible.  Our outward bound  flight was uneventful  though and as  enjoyable a trip  that I've ever  had Inbound was  smooth with just  the annoyance of  waiting for a  break at LHR  after 40 minutes  that spoilt a  lot the ending. The crew both  flights were superb  and professional. The  Economy cabin is  quite basic compared  with the Middle  East carriers but  I can get some good sleep.  I was very  nice Lounge in bound was very  pleasant and staff  friendly and cheery.  Best in All  other flights.

Bridgetown,  Bermuda is a small airport but  their ground staff are very friendly , efficient and  their Exec lounge is good with  decent snacks given the time of  day (mid-late afternoon) and a decent  selection of drinks ! Aircraft was clean and it  looked as if the Club World  crew had recently  received some tlc.  Entertainment system was  good with a good choice of movies and very clear screen, no  doubt part of  how overall attention  the cabin seemed to have been  given Bar service  is good and the food was tasty, good portion sizes, the cheesecake for dessert was 'almost' too much.  Being a night  shift the crew  kept the bar , food service  fairly early in the flight allowing passengers to get  to sleep before the lights came back up for . Breakfast was  delicious Cabin crew were excellent, friendly and efficient. Cockpit crew were clear , concise with  good comms at  every start and  most of the  flight Previous flights I have taken from LGW have  shown a noticable  change in the cabin interiors compared  to flights form LHR so it 's good to see the LGW fleet getting some needed enhancements.

London Heathrow to Miami with British  Airlines Awful experience.  Converted our flight from a morning  flight to an  afternoon flight on the way out  BA refused to  explain the difference  and we were put on a  different flight. Then  booked our return flight without informing  us so had  a spend an  evening of our final evening on holiday speaking to  an advisor. The plane on the  flight out was  very old, many  seats broken and very uncomfortable. Staff are extremely unhelpful  and will never  trust BA ever !

One flight we took in British Airways for our two vacation (4 flights) had huge problems! Always delayed, from NY a 5 hour delay " line! "Computer glitch, they were handwriting boarding passes. Another leg, check in was botched (their issue) and we had to stand with the very rude employee  who botched it all up and kept trying to call his manager, who never picked  UP - for 30 minutes, which held up a  very long line of check-ins. We  arrived here at Heathrow, tired and ready for our way home. Already  a 1 hour delay, no explanation! Just read that British Airways had  a turn a plane around this  week due to  computer issues!

After my positive  impressions of the  Philadelphia journey, the return from Philadelphia to London Heathrow  reminded me how inconsistent British Airways has become. Before boarding was told just 5 F Ms but actually  every cabin was , presumably upgrades,  with supposedly no other cabin overbooked - this really  would downgrade the  trip for fare paying passengers. Good greeting, though CSD never did speak to passengers as far as I could see. Sleeper  service and amenity  available on seat  as we boarded,  rather than the  standard personal offer to each passenger. Pre- departure warm champagne served and  it was the  only drink I  were offered, other than a bottle  with water, until  I Did not  sleep as had been told that,  as this is  the Sleeper Service, I should eat  from the ground. Very little crew  was in the  cabin during the  flight and I  remained awake for  one good part  of it. Very poor value for  admission on this occasion.

On the 17th , I reviewed  British Airways 777-200 flight from Bangkok to London which  did not great , a 3/10 score given. After changing the return flight we opted  the travel A380 to Singapore. Very  disappointed to say , overall the experience was excellent,  The Premium Economy  class on this  plane is fantastic.  Food pitch, entertainment  & overall comfort was good. The  food was ok but I think  attention to detail  was lacking to  top off this . 1st meal you receive has metal cutlery yet the second meal  was plastic. Only  a minor negative.  Cabin crew were ok, did their job and that was it. Love  our A380 layout with Premium Economy on the upperdeck.
