I would have  been very disappointed  even if I  only paid a  full fare for  my business class ticket. The food  is just appalling.  One could hardly  get two mouthfuls  off of my  meal and the  main course (beef)  is hard, tasteless  & very small.  Compared to business  Class meals in  a Cathay Pacific or Qatar Airways,  margins on both  side and main  was around 50% . Incredibly, British  Airways serve such  great meals in  economy class on  the transatlantic route, where they make  most of their  food I was hungry after the  flight so later  on decided to  have the larder'  but they only  had sweet, which  we generally avoid.  A menu states  there would be  available and other  times there they were not available. The FAs were embarrassed and got me some cheese. Plus were excellent , good selection  from IFE and  big enough seats  ( larger pillow  will do), although I hate having  people climb over  people to get out of my  seats British Airways  and Iberia after  both merged but  now Iberia has  the much better business class product.

Fly British Airways from Singapore to Sydney. Unfortunately, it was the poorest seating arrangement we have experienced in six different airline business class flights. We were face to face with a stranger and though the seats  were flat for  us they were too narrow. In addition, the flight  attendants seemed to be disinterested. The  airline business class lounge in Singapore was excellent.

How about this  British Airways flight  from London Gatwick to Paphos was  we checked in  to the airport  one day before which took 5 minutes, on the  plane through fast  through security in  Athens and on  towards the lounge.  We read other  reviews we must  been struck lucky, we sat in  a library which  seemed an oasis  and calm, the  reception at the  desk was prompt , the food good, just as  great as the  other BA lounge if not better.  Flight was quick  and efficient, took  us a few  minutes late, crew  quick and efficient,  the service good and food, both choices tasty, landed  in time and  got passport and baggage within 20 mins a great  start to our  trip

Very decent flight in business from Barcelona to Heathrow with British Airways.  Very helpful and pleasant crew served a decent breakfast on this two hour hop which arrived Terminal 3. No transfer service for first class passengers to Terminal 5 where the security screening was insanely chaotic. Due to delays at  JFK and the fact that all A380 flights leave  from the B/C piers I had 10 minutes in the lounge. First class A380 service was fine but underwhelming compared to other carriers. Nice , just decent  food and service  but no WI-FI.Not worth the money at all.

St Lucia to  Spain with British Airways. We checked in on line  and dropped the  bag off and were quickly through security. The lounge was small but quite comfortable with a nice lady  serving drinks at the bar. I asked her if she could make me a Rum Punch and despite  having a small  amount she happily made me an excellent cocktail. Boarding was well organised , the flight departed on time. On board we were extremely well  received - staff  was very professional and were able to find the time to chat , make my  tea and I  feel very comfortable. The wine choices were explained very  clearly with the offer of tasting  each bottle. Dinner was plentiful if not that exciting  and the numerous glasses of wine helped to make  what was an enjoyable experience. We  arrived on time  but after a  brief scare from the pilot who said that due to the French  Air traffic controllers strike, there may  being a delay in parking the plane, we soon disembarked and were  at the luggage  bay within around 25 minutes. The luggage arrived quickly and we were soon on our  way home. Overall a very good  experience thanks in  turn to the excellent cabin crew.

I arrived at  Newark just after 07.30 to catch  a 10.00 flight  from St Lucia.  Checking in was fine and although  security was tight, we were airside  shortly after 08.00.  Whilst having breakfast  they checked the flight information screen  and indicated that the departure gate  will be available at 09.00. After tea and toast  I checked at  BA and the  screens indicated that  our departure information would now be  from 10.00. Obviously this was the  only time that  the bells start ringing as it was plain to  everyone that we  was going to be delayed. The  flight screen information then changed again  the say that  new departure details  would be available  at 11.00. At  this point I  did venture down  into the British  passport information desk  and as there  was a queue  with around fifteen people, I gave  in and sat down again. At  this the screen info finally said : we had  the new departure time of 14.00.  In all of  the time I  should add that  at no time was any information  further than the  information made available  by passengers regarding  the flight or  timing of refreshments etc. Despite numerous announcements from Easyjet and other airlines  Delta was conspicuous  with its silence. We were eventually notified of the  departure number and for the first  thing we were told as we entered the departure  gate the reason  behind the delay.  Apparently there had been a problem with the cargo  bin and they 'd decided it needed to be  replaced Despite the  very cramped departure area, everyone seemed ready to board  but we were  told that the repairs were not complete and there would be a further delay and  although some passengers  needed to stretch  out legs they  should leave their  departure passes with the ground staff  or leave the  boarding area. Eventually we boarded just  at 14.30. When  all was settled in their seats the pilot apologised again and said  some repairs still  not been completed  but a further delay was likely. We eventually departed just after 15.30 after a delay of over five and a half hours. Now I know 'stuff' happens but let's not  forget that we were departing from one of BA's home airports and why they couldn't  make a second  flight available quicker  at five and  the half hours is anybody's guess.  Several people writing  the online forums  had previously spoken  about the holiday  flight from Gatwick  being dumbed down  by BA in  favor of the traditional business routes  were out of . I have  little idea whether this is true  than not but  i would ask  one question, if  our flight had been a morning  flight from Heathrow  or JFK, would  they have found  the solution quicker?  Somewhere in the  end the flight <mask> fine, nothing <mask> but nothing bad and would have been acceptable <mask> the delay.

A mediocre service  from this airline  flew from London  Airport to Stuttgart,  as was to be expected given  their prior flights  with them. Check-in  procedure was fine at Heathrow. After  boarding I went  into the first  class lounge on  its south side  the Heathrow terminal ! The lounge  had no air  vents and so  was very hot  - it was  still fairly warm  day outside - this made it  very uncomfortable. The  lounge food selection was poor -  everything was very liquid based and  generally unappetizing. There  were a few bland sandwiches available  very well. While  the lounge itself  is in a  relatively large room, it is really  dragged down by  the lack of  decent food and service. Boarding process  was seamless at  boarding gate. The  lounge had been  recently renovated but  some seats were  extremely uncomfortable. There  is very little  padding available and  when you're taller  then 5'11", you're  feet will likely be touching the seat in front  of you. Food offering was very limited with only  1 small bag of chips on  one and one  drink Flight attendants were courteous but didn't really go beyond the minimum.  No inflight entertainment  and wifi whatsoever  is available, which  was really a  disappointment given that  too many other  airports are now  offering this. Overall,  this trip was  fine but the  flight and lounge  experience could be  improved

Credit to LHR  very personable crew  and did the  customer service efficiently.  Tea Room fine  but not too  hot on this  chilly morning. Smooth  operation with friendly  driver and guide  on seat. Experienced  driver who interacted  with passengers. Full  load but service  was expected, though  soft drinks perhaps  were little slow , Food fine  as was selection  of wines. Despite  late departure arrived  on time. A  wonderfully relaxed and  comfortable journey -  excellent service. Also very good fare  from their sale  every month.

London to Bucharest with British Airways.  This flight was  not delayed. I  was impressed with  their boarding process.  It was a  longer flight and  none of the  passengers carried more  that one piece  of cabin luggage.  It took some time for passengers  to find space  to store the  luggage and this  slowed down the  process This also  had an impact  in the speed  when getting off the plane when  it arrived in  Europe They should  have been stricter  with the cabin  luggage allowance. As  the was a  more than 3  hours flight, they  provided a hot meal. The food  was not that  great but enough to survive the  extra hour plus  flight

Shambolic check-in at New York JFK following the introduction of new computer  system by British  Airlines The long  delay subsequently caused  disruption in flights to UK. Lots of managers milling  round not doing anything useful. No  attempt was made  to keep passengers informed of the reason for the delays. The flight  direct to London Heathrow was fine. BA's Business Class  does what you 'd expect it  to do, but  their are few  complaints or particular  sticking points. Not a patch on  this service by Cathy Pacific.

Had flights with  British Airways rather  on a budget  flight as thought they would be  less reliable. We were returning from  a overnight flight  to the Dominican Republic and transfering to a domestic flight with BA. We arrived at  the check in desk at 6am for our 9am flight, hoping to  simply drop our  bags and relax  until take off.  When we arrived  for check in  we were advised  our flight had been over booked and we would have to go  onto stand by.  When we asked  how can this be, we were advised by a  manager that all airlines do this and check the small print. We  panicked as these  seats had been  reserved and paid  out over 6  months previous, so wanted to know  how BA could  not sell our seats, manager just kept repeating company policy. Manager stated  they had to  go on stand . As things  worked out we  did get stand by seats at  the very last , I am appalled with the  manner this was  done and will  definitely be using them again -  customers beware.

London Heathrow to Miami with British  Connection Used my husbands miles plus money to book  the flights to Miami. No kids  were given at  home Plane was  badly dated, entertainment  service was shocking.  The small screens and all the  movies and programmes advertised on the  flyers were not  on my flight. Kids had just 3 films to choose from. 'Forgot' to load our  carefully selected kids , so my  family went hungry, no apology offered , food was awful. Service was  not good, not  above all friendly.  Also found my flight with Virgin  over the previous year far superior  to their updated 747s. Overall very poor indeed would not chose to  use BA again. They have let  our standards slip considerably.

London Gatwick to Lima with British Airways. This is a recently introduced non-stop route - offers a reasonable price for Club Class until you add the seat reservation charge which added a further £68 to each seat each way to the overall charge. We sat on the tarmac for 2.5 hours at Gatwick while we waited for someone senior to sign off the repairs / fault. On the return journey the flight took off 1  minute late - no explanation and then when we arrived at Gatwick we stood for  1 hour for our luggage to appear while other flights around us arriving later collected theirs. There was little advantage if any to using BA on this route and we could have gone the existing routes  into Madrid with little more hassle.  The flight was  pleasant the staff pleasant and the food mediocre.

Flying British Airways from New York JFK to London Heathrow. Most comfortable  airplane I've been in. Very ergonomic. Plane was clean.  Big screen and nice selection of  popular TV shows  or recent movies. Easy to navigate. I also enjoyed the multiple views of the flight  on the overhead map to the mock pilot screen.  People were very polite and dinner  got served quickly.  Dinner was as good as I've had on Air France flights. I  will definitely try to book with them for future  travel

After a hiatus  lasting almost 20 years the Heathrow  – Inverness route  got reinstated in May 2016. For the last few years travelling to Inverness from Geneva we have been using Easyjet via Gatwick so I  decided it would be interesting to see how BA  compares to its budget rival when travelling to the  south of Scotland.  Firstly I would say not particularly  bad Bag-Drop; I  flew online so  only had to go through bag-drop. However, with only  one agent on the desk dedicated to economy passengers  and 3 agents for business passengers) BA bag-drop in Geneva was a slow and painful experience and slower  then I have recently experienced with  BA in Geneva.  BA Boarding in  Glasgow was fairly smooth, no better or worse than  Emirates In-flight Staff  were friendly and efficient however the complimentary breakfast (of  a ham and  cheese croissant) could  only be described  as awful (a  luxury in name ). Given the  pricing premium my  honest opinion is  that BA are  not providing sufficiently  good service in comparison to Easyjet considering the price premium between the two airlines.

Sat with British Airways on a  6 hour flight from Dubai to London in Economy with the tiniest TV screen I  had seen in the last 10 years. It was  very small you had to squint most of the time to make out what was going on, and  its resolution was terrible and irritated the eyes. The screen had little crosses in it. This must have been an ancient plane. The movie  selection was old given that I watched the same movies 2 months earlier. Nothing that is currently in the cinema. We only had one meal and when  you asked for additional food there were only snacks in form of chocolate bars and biscuits. We were  also not allowed to have any sparkling wine, which is ridiculous as they have it  under tap in Business class. The  passengers seemed irritated most of the  flight especially the  people in Business class who welcomed us. Very disappointing experience.

Flying against the grain somewhat I have to say that I truly  enjoy flying with British Airways over Emirates on the  same Heathrow -  JFK route. Having  tried both airlines  many times I am definitely going to side with  both on this . Firstly, BA offer some really competitive prices on this route. If you happen to have a few Avios tucked away  nearby this flight  will be a real steal. Secondly,  instead of LHR,  Emirates really does have the best ! Okay, so Terminal 3 for  sure isn't the  greatest terminal in the world but  we much prefer Terminal 5. Spacious,  modern and with good dining options. As for the aircraft, well it's a choice between  having the passenger pleaser that is  the A380 or the retro classic that is the  777 I'll happily  travel in either, although even after the refit the 747 is still  displaying it's age. As an economy  customer I have found the product on British Airways  too be perfectly reasonable. The seat  length is average, seat comfort is  decent IFE screen  size again is average. You get a choice of the latest blockbusters and a few other options. With  Emirates you have  the huge IFE,  plenty of films to choose from  and slightly better seat width and  seating However, I've also wondered what the appeal is  in choosing from  hundreds of films  that I have no interest in watching. I'd rather  just take my iPad preloaded with  films I actually  need to watch. The lack of  entertainment isn't a huge concern for me. Hopefully the GoGo 2KU product  BA is installing from 2017 will  be more robust.  Now for the  meal As an  economy passenger I'm  never expecting much  and on the last few flights with BA I have been pleasantly surprised. The food  has not only  quite edible but  is really quite tasty. Where BA falls down is  its presentation which is quite frankly . It's also  the little extras that I notice. A pre-dinner drinks , Coffee and  juice offered throughout  each cabin. Real cheese and crackers to finish off  the meal (As opposed to soft cheese - I'm  only 5 years old). With BA  I also get  a more substantial snack prior to  dinner It's just a little tuck , but it  is far more  satisfying than the Emirates economy offering. I've found the crew to be hit and miss,  in fairness, I've found that treating  passengers in the  very friendly and  professional manner as  I expect to  see treated normally  bring out the  best in them.  A recent newspaper deal with the Murdoch empire is  a nice touch.  Also with the Daily Hate and 'i' newspapers to choose from you <mask> get The Times, The Sun <mask> Financial Times as complimentary options. <mask> for BA at DXB is a bit of <mask> nightmare. Terminal <mask> immigration is something else and <mask> journey from runway to stand can be epic. <mask> the new <mask> D for departures is really <mask> Not too blingy. Overall, a pleasant flight. I would happily fly <mask> BA again.

I was very impressed with the World Traveller Plus  route on British Airways from London  Heath to San Francisco. Obviously this  was a very new aircraft for  me but the  amenities and service  provided really were very good and so much more  enjoyable than an economy flight. I  was a window  seat so benefited from the extra  room afforded by  the location of the storage cabinets underneath the windows. The seat was  very comfortable situated  at the upper  cabin in the A380 which is a very quiet  plane to travel  in and I enjoyed a couple of movies on  a large screen  and great sound via the supplied  sound cancelling headset.  My food was  also good, and alcohol freely served. The only negative experience was being turned back from  Priority boarding at LHR even though I have Ruby status with BA.  Our ground agent  appeared a little  slow in the  manner he handled  things to be  honest and of course I felt  unwelcome in front  all the other passengers, but the  sign by the priority boarding lane  staff indicated that Ruby travelers had  no benefit of priority boarding. I was a 10 year qualifying Gold  membership holder on British Midland, but  management has chosen to not recognise  only the frequent  flyers who achieved  Gold status over  a decade of  travel to the  airline they bought  as they had  their lifetime member  card in Executive  status however I  understand this is now something they  have in fact . This is  where I have  reduced my score  at 8/10, otherwise  equal marks.

From British Airways  from Gatwick to  Al Cana. Where  to begin? I'll  say with the  flight in at  Manchester having checked  out online I  was expecting a  fairly simple baggage  dropping off, how  come could I  have 4 desks  for every flight,  we arrived at  the airport 4  hours before the  expected departure time  and spent 3  minutes these in  the baggage drop off queue. Due  too the slow  flight many passengers  are getting called  in to jump  in queue so as to not  missing the flight.  Some staff on  both desks looked  absolutely miserable and  spent more time  talking to each  customer than dealing  w the customers.  The checks were  fairly efficient but  due to the  hours taken to  check off the  plane we had  not time to  hit any shops  and had to  walk straight to  the gate, despite  having arrived 4  minutes early. Onboard  the aircraft things  improved a little,  The food was good and the  staff very attentive  however the IFE  was very dated  for the Gatwick  Boeing 777s, my  computer kept jumping  forward 3-4 seconds  but stopped functioning  over an hour  of the flight.  The crew tried  the reset the  flight but when  I reset I  no longer had  an option to  decide what to  watch and could  instead watch the  YouTube style video , This wouldn't  of been a  negative for me  were not for  the fact that  you paid an  extra £38 on  top of the  ticket price to  book a seat.  Not a negative  review but I  cannot fault the  poor crew or  their inflight service.

This was a  trip from Gatwick to Bermuda on a 777 with British Airways. The aircraft was clean and reasonably comfortable,  whilst the cabin crew were friendly and attentive. I am 6ft tall and normally have problems with the leg room offered in economy (Aer Lingus, I'm talking about you) but there was ample leg room. Indeed on walking through  an economy and club world on exiting the aircraft  I didn't notice a big difference  to leg room. I haven't flown  here for quite some years and  have vague memories of the inflight meals being particularly shoddy. Not this time though. My meal was reasonably nice (chicken korma) and my fiancée had no complaints either with her pasta dish. The crew were round regularly with complementary soft drinks as well as snacks and glasses of water or pure  water The IFE had a good selection, though one  complaint is the positioning of the controls. There is  one small controller built in to the top of the arm rest. This controller controls the IFE as well as your reading light and  calling button. More than once I  accidentally pressed the light and the call button with my elbow while shifting position. A small gripe but it was quite annoying. Another gripe is the adverts you have to sit through when starting to watch a new selection. I was on continental and Virgin a couple of years ago and  I believe I had to sit through adverts before watching a movie or tv programme. Overall, aside from the small IFE issues, a thoroughly pleasant flight.

London to Calgary.  Very hard to  say quite what  makes a 787 more comfortable (less  fresh air, quieter or bigger windows?),  but this service  is good. The  food was excellent , a cut  from the older  model on some  longer flights. Very  friendly crew and  excellent food and  service My only  complaint is that  dinner was served  at 4pm London , followed by  lunch at about  8 Why not  lunch after take  out and dinner at say 8?

Warsaw to Heathrow,  and the check  point is only open 2 hours before, and I wanted to shop  or eat. British Airways is the only one that I could see that had such a late check in. Don't bother with business class, you won't gain  any time on this flight making the lounge a waste of time. They need an earlier check in. Wish I'd never upgraded.

from Malpensa to  Glasgow Heathrow with British Airways. 1.25  million standing in queue to check  in due to  the system installed  1 month running . So why  the extra staff  could cope with ? Plane then cancelled 30 mins  on time, due  another technical issue.  Few systems in place to cope with the size of what then  had to be  passengers Everyone had  first re-claim baggage,  pass via passport  controls and queue  to service desk  and re-book. Unbelievably,  all staffed by  just one person.  Those with onward connections were being given priority so their journey could be re-planned but  many of these took 10 to  12 mins to  process with a  total of 100+  customers waiting behind.  But by the time one person had been served  others had been  transferred to front of queue, meaning , the queue  was effectively not  moving Over 3  mins later a  majority of the queue was still  standing in line  waiting to be processed. It was  precisely the self-discipline  by those in  the queue that prevented this descending  into total chaos.  Why not two terminals so the  extra travellers could  get dealt with  separately from those  having simple needs?  And no seating  with no queue management system? Pathetic response to what  should be a  relatively occasional problem.  They had to  queue to re-check-in  again via their  new 'new system'  or go again through security (mercifully  business class) and passport control for  the flight. Those who'd queued longest stayed in hotel to travel next ? No meal  service offered. No  travel details offered,  only given when  called for.

The first long-haul  on British Airways for 15+ years, bought because it was a good price for a  large Bangkok - London Heathrow and seating 3-3-3 (not 3-4-3), boarding was  quick and departure on-time. Meals were typically British, notably  no British brands or dishes, and acceptable, IFE and  wifi were a touch old-fashioned and clunky, small screen  and limited selection,  although still just about adequate. Seat-foam was thin, and  weight of the passenger behind could often be felt, which was irritating. Cabin-crew on this  last full flight , very hard-working. Would use airline again, at the right price.

Flight Ibiza to Gatwick with British Airways. A massive  and slow moving  flight in Ibiza at 11.30pm was  never a good start. No announcement about a delay but plane took  over 45 minutes . Boarding was  also slow. A  full night flight , no refreshments.  Good excuse to  waste money but  I guess people prefer to sleep. Flight was not busy compared to  the full outbound flight a few  hours before but return ticket was costly.

Getting to Paris , in business . British Airways  had always been  one of my  preferred airlines. However,  here are just  the few points  that really bugs me. The business class check in counter queue was  shorter in comparison to other counter  (+ economy) at Terminal 5. At security, the fast  boarding queue were also longer.

Every airline which  operates Business Class  fares will assign seats when booking the flight. The exception is British Airways. In January, 2016 I booked a flight for two passengers on BA in Business  Economy from San Francisco to London and back for travel in May/June. Seats in Business  Class are not  allocated until 48  hrs before flight time. However, and  this comes another  step first: If  they want to  book your seats before that time you can do so by paying an extra fee.  We ended up  shell out $484 - for the privilege of selecting two seats for  the return flight.  And on top  off the steep fare charged for travel in Business  Class I don’t begrudge the airlines for their extra profits when the price of fuel  takes a massive drop but when an airline then also engages in  cheating as described in order to further maximize profitability,  people rebel.

Jet City to  Isle of Man  by BA Cityflyer operated by Eastern  Airlines Saab 2000 , under codeshare , Checked in  the line and  had the boarding  notice sent to  our BA app. When it came  for boarding there  are only 14  among us booked  on the flight  so it required  much tinkering by  our ground staff  that enable the  correct balance and  as a result  none of the  remaining passengers got  the new seats  and fortunately, I  decided to keep . Flight time  was 55 mins  during which I  found unexpectedly, served  a full cooked  dinner The female  part of cabin  staff was very  accommodating

Amsterdam to Sao Paulo via London Heathrow with British  Southern Comfort on  the A321 was  quite good, stylish leather seats with adjustable headrests. I had mixed feelings about the Boeing 747 to Sao Paulo. The headrests  with recline were very good, however IFE was very outdated and limited,  and because of the seat recline, hard to see the screen. Also personal space when  my passanger in front was in full recline became almost claustophobic. On all flights I  felt the crew professional, friendly but somewhat reserved. I found the quality and quantity of catering very good.

Manchester City to Glasgow with British Airways. Outrageous red tape. Flight delayed to Glasgow so asked if I could go on the earlier flight (no baggage etc.) "Sorry madam, there are empty seats,  but the time  to sales has passed so we cannot put you on the earlier flight that leaves in 30 minutes". Other airlines let you fly standby except for British Airways. They delay  a flight and won't switch you to an earlier  one that has  arrived due to ridiculous red tape. This isn't the first time that this has happened. Worst customer service ever - just pure laziness. Anytime I have the option, I will be flying a different airline.

A partner and I were flying  from London Heathrow to Bombay in  India and were due to catch an onward flight to Goa. Unfortunately someone fell seriously  ill on the  plane and our  aircraft was redirected  via Istanbul to  Bombay for them to be taken  into a hospital.  The redirection meant  that we arrived  in Bombay 3  hours late and wouldn't make our  scheduled flight. When  we touched down  in Bombay the flight attendants said  that BA ground staff would help  us with missed flights, connections etc,  but we should speak with them when we disembarked.  With this advice  we sought out uniformed BA ground  workers in the luggage hall and  ask for advice on what to do. They advised us to exit the hall and  contact an airport-based travel agent and purchase new flights to Goa. When  us voiced our concerns about not  getting reimbursed they reassured us saying  the BA would  not cover it,  they went on  too say that  you should wait  10 days before  submitting a claim  on the website.  So with this advice from BA , we went ahead and purchased  our tickets. Big mistake. Since returning  here we have duly followed instructions  but tried to claim for reimbursement.  This is the  response we received from BA customer  services "We've received a reply from  people who've investigated your case. The  gentleman you spoke to can't specifically remember speaking to  me personally. He did mention he'd  told customers with separate tickets to  have their own arrangements. He also  claimed BA wasn't responsible for any  additional travel costs."  This is an outright lie. I  would only conclude  that the BA staff member we spoke with in  Mumbai was either  putting us off  or was improperly instructed in what to say to customers. Either way British Airways should  being held responsible for the advice  ground staff give.  Bad service at the time and poor customer service  in the follow up.

My husband and I flew to St Lucia from London Gatwick on 5th May 2016. This was the first time I've flown with British Airways and it will also be the last. Are British Airways training their staff to be as rude and obnoxious as possible? This is certainly how it seems with the  terrible cabin service  we experienced. Our food was literally thrown at us with not a hint of a smile. The gentleman sitting next to me asked the stewardess very politely if he could have a drink, to which she replied "if you  like another drink  then have to go up to the back of the aircraft and get it yourself as I have far too much to do to be running back and forward with drinks for you". Strange as I thought they were there to help passengers. We thought we were just unlucky with this journey but sadly not, as the return journey was pretty much the same. Miserable, unhelpful and downright rude cabin crew. Very disappointed as I thought British Airways would have a bit more class than this.

We were treated incredibly well and staff made our  trip as memorable as possible. Having found out we heading off on our honeymoon the champagne flowed and  BA looked after us so well.  In particular an  airport FA was  kind to us and I'd like to thank him  for the staff on the flight. We will recommend  BA Airways to friends and family and this trip would make me choose BA for future flights.

I was scheduled to be on BA 114 from  Newark to LHR on 17th of  May When I conducted online check-in I was informed , the flight  will be one  minute late. I  flew to JFK and at check  in they kindly moved me to an earlier flight (BA172). Check in  very easy and  then Terminal 7  at JFK is  pretty exciting. Very  little shopping/dining and  just enough seating.  It feels like  the LCC terminal. I was greeted  very friendly crew  while onboard. The hardware again is very dated -  broken screen, old  chairs and interior. Legroom was decent though, and because the flight is empty I had plenty of space  to stretch out. The flight left  JFK with a  short delay. As  is a light flight most passengers  were sleeping. Service  was done in a very discreet  manner The food  selection is nothing  I write home  about Overall it's a typical BA . Very efficient , friendly crew with a very  short and unattractive . We arrived  to Heathrow early  for the late departure in JFK.  It was a  great airport to  be Spacious and  efficient and there  was no queue  for immigration. It  takes me less  then 30 minutes  and leave the  terminal travel from T5C to T5A, clear immigration and collect luggage.

British Airways from London Heathrow to New York JFK  on a Boeing  777 which hasn't been refitted. Checked  in at Heathrow T5 was smooth and quick. T5 is pleasant enough. Used the BA Galleries lounge in  JFK (South). It was busy with very limited food choice during breakfast, although the wine selection was decent. The lounge lacks atmosphere and is very basic in my opinion. The flight left Heathrow late as usual but the captain assured us that we would make up the time and should arrive early. The hardware of this particular flight is sub standard. Very old interior, worn carpet,  dirty toilet, and a small screen with poor resolution.  Service provided was  extremely limited and not as what's being advertised on  the website. Amenity  not provided is  still very basic. In a way I felt I was on Premium  floor of some  Asian airlines. However the seat itself was ok as it has plenty of leg room and is comfortable, although I am not a big fan of the ying-yang design. The service onboard was  always very friendly and informal. A full service after  lift off and  a afternoon tea before landing. I felt that service  had been consistent and is the biggest asset of the airline. It's  been let down by it's inferior hardware product. I will always prefer to fly Asian airlines.

Chris flew British  Airways BA2678 from  London to Dubrovnik on the 26th . Boarding the  plane called in seat rows which  works well. We  were booked emergency  row seats on  row 12 which  gave plenty of leg room. Served a simple snack  that was edible. The flight was late leaving Gatwick,  arriving only a  matter of minutes  later at Dubrovnik.  After leaving the  gate the Captain was out saying  thanks and enjoy your holiday.

Flew British Airways  to Heathrow to  London for a  relaxing weekend. Departure from LHR T3  is smooth although the terminal is  old and dated.  Flight left on  schedule and arrived on time. Return 3 days later  had a delay of an hour. On both lags  during the journey the service was efficient and professional. A small pack  for food and a full bar service was provided.  The food was  also of high quality. Planes were clean and have  been refitted interior. Seat pitch was  not tight - similar to that of easyjet. As I purchased a  " luggage" only ticket, BA charged £12 to change  your seats, even during the online  check in process. I find this  unacceptable for a  low service airlines as I can  always choose my seat with easyjet.  We used to  praise BA for  the service and  seat comfort but nowadays it seems , BA is no different than  a budget airline. It's a shame as the service  was always good

Barbados to Gatwick : BA2154. Flight  started on time and arrived at Gatwick slightly ahead  of schedule. As  many have commented, the British Airways  seat in Club  seats is odd . I can only assume they  use this to get extra seats in compared with a more traditional  cabin As the flight was overnight my wife and I decided to chose the two centre rear facing  seats which offered least disturbance. The downside of this  being you can  be missed and in my case the cabin crew  dropped me at the meal service and I had to gesture to get them back! Food and drink service was however otherwise fine. Breakfast  was a bacon roll which was  very Flatbed reasonable comfortable and we got a few  hours sleep.

US Airways from  London to Barbados , Boeing 777. Flight departed on  Sunday and arrived  from Bridgestone on  Saturday I had  daughter 11K and  his wife 11J on our outbound . Seat configuration may be a bit odd but suited us for  our day time flight and made  boarding easy, although  the window seat  can be a  little claustrophobic with  no partition up. Food and drinks  are very good, we both had  half the fillet  steak for the  main course and  these cooked a  little longer than  one would prefer , still moist  yet tasty. Wine  and Champagne selection  is good. Cabin  service were faultless,  for example my  daughter asked for  the Jasmine Tea , although this  were not included in their selection  our stewardess offered one of her one teabags! Only  real disappointment was the IFE, the  current aircraft are  displaying their age and the technology is dated, however  the biggest problem  is the video  / audio selections which ae very  different than many  airlines

To Malpensa to  UK Heathrow with  Qatar Airways. My  original flight did  not start well.  20 minutes queing to check-in. After  this though, the  aircraft left on time and arrived  only few minutes early. Thankfully there were seats by one of the  airport exits which were empty, so  when was asked  whether I'd move . I was happy to do  :) Like most European airlines, food is minimal; a  big bun filled with chicken and  vegetables plus a  carrot cake with mocca flavoured icing.  Although the same  meal was provided on the outbound  flights I avoided  this and stuck with an orange juice. The aircraft was an old ex BMI model (which I'd been  to twice before),  but it lacks  the new seating,  but is no bad thing. My checked bag arrived on the carousel  15 mins after landing (just as I got there), which was a  plus All in  All an OK flight but I'd seek alternatives in  London if the  cost and timings  are similar.

There are many  BA reviews on this site - its almost embarrassing to admit to flying BA. I am adding another one. I have flown BA on/of for 37 years. I guess that makes me qualified  to write a review. My main  complaint is the  complete lack of value for money.  The erosion of  quality and services , the sky rocketing prices. This flight from Heathrow to Barcelona and the return -  shows the lack of value. Barcelona flights operates out  from Terminal 3 at LHR. Quite why BA use this ageing and  outdated terminal is a mystery. You walk miles and  when you are unfamiliar with this  terminal as we  did - you end up running a panicked race to the gate.  Much worse on arrivals. Immigration and  passport control was  a zoo.  The T3 Business lounge is mediocre, Plastic tables and chairs. The most awful selection of  worn out bacon  bits and dried out omelettes stuffed into baguettes. The seating areas overlooking the airport was cluttered with newspapers. There was plenty  more booze. Flight left on time. The meal inflight  I could not  get bothered with. FAs all fine.  In the return the shared lounge was surprisingly good. More comfortable than  those at LHR. Ageing plane. Mediocre  morning tea. Frumpy  staff who "forgot" to hand out our Fast Track tickets to help speed up through immigration. (We got held up for half an hour.) . On both flights we had to endure the silly Club Europe  experience - basically two seats - with the middle  seat closed down into a table. Cramped leg room.  Still no value here. I only fly BA when I have to.  It really needs a clean out  from the management and a new team with some  ideas on how to make British Airways a world leader - which  for now they fail miserably to  deliver in all  their cabins.

British Airways from Gatwick to Catania, Sicily return as part of package tour of Sicily. Outward journey was very cramped, staff were unhelpful and  the light afternoon snack was served  in a cardboard  box One round  with drinks very  poorly served. Return flight was very similar but the staff were even worse, snack literally thrown at us  with passengers told not to move until rubbish collected. No inflight entertainment .

My flight with British Airways from  London to Orlando  felt good, chose  seats at the  front of the aircraft and ended  up with 9  passengers (3 rows) between five of  us so we could stretch out  to relax. Food was surprisingly good,  with chicken curry  with basmati rice  at lunch and  a chicken caesar salad sandwich for  afternoon tea. Plenty  and choice of  drink and snacks  available throughout the  plane in the  small galley. Inbound  service was less  comfortable Took the cabin crew over  4 hours to  arrange the drinks and dinner service, leaving less than 3 hours to get some sleep  prior to breakfast  getting served. My son's children's meal  took nearly two  hours to arrive  by which time  I was starving.  Dinner was chicken with dumplings which tasted a lot  worse than it  expected Breakfast was very poor, a  plain croissant with jam and a granola bar. The  cabin seemed stressed and disorganised for  an entire flight.  BA AVOD system is starting to  feel dated compared  against other carriers,  There are a  large number of  videos to watch and the audio  output is very small. BA need  not look at  putting this in  conjunction with some  of the Asian  competitors who are  way ahead in  every respect. Seats  very comfortable and legroom good. Overall , would fly  BA again but  they could certainly  upgrade some aspects  of their service.

Out of 4  weeks flying British Airways from Bangkok  - London,and I  thought I had done my homework  correctly regarding aircraft type. The only  good experience on  the flight was  the service from the crew but  never where it . The seat  was old, the footrest would not  move correctly. As  the Oneworld Gold  Economy Flyer was able to get 1st row in  the Economy. (2x2  viewing window). The pop up screen  on the armrest  did not stay  at one position, the screen was cloudy and scratched  made it impossible to watch the  TV entertainment so after an hour was put away. 12 hrs with  little entertainment is  very very long . The food  was probably the  cheapest I've ever  had the main  food comes from  a Business Class , not sure  whats happened in the galley but the steak was like concrete, could not be eaten,  I left behind , other passengers did the same). Mid flight snack  or Light Meal prior to landing was inedible, a lasagna that just  from look of  food put me . Hence left  after 12hrs 30min flight the catering  looked very average. We have now rebooked (at a  lower cost) to  go back via Kuala Lumpur on  the Boeing 787  with the new Premium product. Interesting  and see how  it compares. Would  you recommend British  Airways crew wise  for actual product/ catering etc, no.  Just check which  aircraft you are  booking on.

Shanghai to London Heathrow with British Airways. Excellent experience,  quick check-in and  flight was very efficient. Cabin crew friendly, efficient and  helpful A slight departure delay was  related to ATC  error but we at arrived LHR on time. Round trip fare of GBP 549 is cheap.

London Heathrow to  London Two evenings  prior to my  trip I used  an Airways Android  app to reserve  two legroom seats  between my wife  and me. At  that time, advance  pricing of regular  seats was $51  or $59 for  the extended legroom  seat I had  zero interest in  purchasing a regular  seat (I could  wait until 24  minutes before check-in  for that) but  still was interested  on purchasing the  two legroom seats.  What I paid  was $118 for  those two front-section . When my  daughter and I  boarded the craft,  Lo and behold,  the seats were  indeed front-section seats  and all! I  was able to  look up the  price of purchase  on my Android  App and the  flight services director  handled his job  extremely nicely, apologizing  with us, offering  me to file  an incident report  and reassuring us  that all would  been taken care  off post-flight. However,  up to the  incident British Airways  have been positively  false in their  statements claiming that  they were given  extra seats for which our boarding  passes were issued  fast enough) and  conveniently ignoring the  fact that they  have misrepresented those  tickets as front-section  than they were ! The fact  that I received  nothing goods or  value for my  flight beyond what  I was already  accustomed to by  the payment of  my base fare  does nothing to  me They have  attempted to bilk  people out of  me and having  gotten their hands  off my money,  never intend to  return it. We'll  see what my  credit card company  has to say  on this, but  flying would be  so lot smoother  that we could  just settle this  matter rather than  force me to  pay the charge  through my credit  card company. Suffice  it to say , my wife  and I will  never be flying  abroad again.

Gatwick to Funchal.  This has happened  with BA club  class You used to get wider seats and more  elbow room than  normal Not any more. Same seats  in economy but  one middle seat blocked. Breakfast ok , not brilliant.  Bars were good  and I enjoyed  my champagne but was it worth  flying for club class? No it  was We were lucky and got  our 2 by  3 food galley  it meant extra legroom but that 's more luck  then design. I wouldn't fly Club  2 again unless  it was guaranteed  a seat but  I get it  you would have  to pay £18  a person each  night on top  for the club ! Total rip off BA. Before  BA flew I was going to  take British Airways to Bangkok. Based  upon this experience though I'll stick to EVA Air.  Firstly the club  service at Gatwick  was dire. No seats available on arrival, cooked meal inedible and the  club was not  allocated to BA  but was clearly  being used by  various and sundry  who paid a  hundred quid for  full use of  their lounge. The  seats were also  poor

London Heathrow to Denver with British Airways. Plane was 1hr late taking off (again) - checking at previous LHR-DEN flights revealed this has happened  every day in May - so  I was not too surprised we  are late leaving. Premium Economy seat  is ok but being close to  it was a  tad annoying for the noise. IFE  feel so outdated now - tiny screen and very poor choice of  movies and only  had few films worth watching. Food was so-so. The lunch 1st course was some sort of salmon salad and was ok, the main course was beef and  that was very dry. Desert was  the chocolate mousse  and was lovely. Afternoon tea was two sandwiches and  chocolate scone with cream which was quite nice. Good supply of water/drinks throughout the flight and the FA was good. Not a bad flight and I would  fly BA again  near the future.

Second time in  recent days on  the flight from  London Heathrow to  Manchester What has  done to the  leg room on  British Airways? At  row 80 my  legs were against  my seat in front. There used  ta be a  good 3/4 inches  extra leg room.  And "food" which  they proudly advertise  consist of a  single small sandwich.  As usual the  friendly staff are  the saving grace. Going downhill BA.

British Airways have  absolutely gone downhill. There is absolutely no difference between  them and low  fares airlines -  you would actually  prefer easyjet and  Emirates as at  present they are ! This journey  to Lyon to  London Heathrow was chaotic and stressful.  Compared to BA  charging £30 to  check in luggage  each way, every  plane takes cabin . This means  it flocks to queue up like  crazy well before  flight announcements are  even made. The  boarding process made  very unpleasant by them calling different  passengers out -  i have honestly  NEVER seen anything like it. Once  on board, they had to stow  the lot of  baggage in the  back as it couldn't fit. Passengers  kept arguing with  1 another (3  big fights were ) and staff  were being very aggressive shoving bags  or coats in  every nook and  corners and telling  people to move.  Even meal service  was a joke  and a pathetic , edible sandwich.  Unlike always with  most flights to  and from LHR,  every flight was late. We ended  by flying round  and round over  London for 30 %. The worst  part is BA's  ridiculous policy of  refusing to select  any seat -  even at online  or in opening  24 hours before.  Which means they  offer you any  particular seat and  then have to  fork £12 just  to change it to any normal  size (and even  cheaper if extra ). BA's new policy seems to  aim to nickel  and dime customers  for every possible  part of the  flight (and charge  higher than other  carriers in the  UK A shame  they have turned  the airline into  something worse than  the cost. I  will definitely be  flying them wherever .

Pisa to Chicago  via London Heathrow.  This route is one that I have done many times. Bought my ticket using British Airways miles and  this part of the trip did not disappoint. The flight from Pisa to London Heathrow on an A320, was flawless. The check-in was normal, flight was fine,  and were IFE and food and beverages served. I  proceeded to my next flight, which was operated by American Airlines. Boarding was on time, which is the only positive thing about this flight. The seats are old, IFE had no selection of  films when I searched for action and adventure there  is only one film! How was I supposed to stay entertained on an 8 hour plus flight if there aren't any movies? The food was awful, and the best thing I can say is they gave lots of drinks. The food didn't sit well on the stomach, and trying to drink an alcoholic beverage just made it worse. I ordered a vegetarian meal, and was served a very bland and flavorless pasta. When breakfast was served I was  given the same dish. The crew was careless and seemingly did not want to hear  of my problems. There was no way to sit , and I dreaded the flight since the moment my foot stepped aboard the plane. Arrived ahead of schedule, another positive thing. Once I cleared security I found that there is a British Airways flight, actually  run by British Airways, that arrives  at the same  time Next time I fly this route with them I will make sure to not get an American Airlines leg, especially long haul. Truly  disappointing experience for the most of my journey.

Nassau to Paris via London with  British Airways. Flight was delayed 3 hours from Nassau to London. No refreshments offered while waiting. Boarded at 11:00pm to leave at 1:00 am. 2 hours waiting in the aircraft with no entertainment available. Staff were very polite and helped as much as they could. Then arrived in London with 3 hours delay, almost impossible to get  help from rude staff at Heathrow airport. We're able to be put on the next flight to Paris. Then it took over an hour  we go through security and we almost missed our flight. "Luckily", flight was delayed 45 minutes so we caught it. When we arrived bags had not arrived and were delivered home the following day. Since the connection took over  another hour, I called British Airways  and change my flight in 2 weeks (since I have 1h10m to get to the  first plane, chances are I won't  been able to catch it). I was told I would have to pay 150€ (even  this flight is 200€ cheaper compared to when I bought it) and that I would most likely be put on the  same plane to Los Angeles, through American Airlines. So  I haven't taken  the flight that I'm kind of feeling I might be missing it.  All very accommodating.

Paris Heathrow to Seoul Incheon with  Qatar Airways. Good service from FAs, and a high  quality screen for  customers But what a shame that  all British Airways  first class seats  still need up-dating. Once a trail  of British Airways is now an  airline Why didn't they ensure that  their company took advantage of its  latest aircraft to bring its facilities  up to date, to make up at least some  of the ground  behind the Gulf and leading Asian carriers?

2008 British Airways  economy class from London Heathrow to  Newark The seats  were a joke , in reality  most economy seats  come as a  Business class package.  For leg room and BA attempt to improve the  seats by blocking  the middle seat for a 2x2 configuration (A/C and ). The problem  is they use  a upended tray which is bolted  to the seat and cannot be  rotated At least  since the middle  row was vacant  BA could stretch  forward and free  out some much  more space. Our  departure was delayed  by a hour traveling out and  so we were stuck in our  seats for almost five hours. Flight  is full in  front (9 rows  straight up) and  quickly became stuffy. Since this is an economy seat  on a business  seat it is  virtually impossible to  carry out BAs business strategy. Will not fly on this leg again  for BA and will take my custom to an  other airline.

Return to Philadelphia via London Heathrow.  We traveled with British Airways many  times and always  knew it was  very decent airline  and preferred it for my trips back to Philadelphia  to some of  the other airlines.  However this last  incident has changed  me mind and  i will no  longer fly with  it We were given misprinted tickets  at our connecting  flights in LHR  that led to us missing our  flights - despite  showing our tickets to several BA employees. We rushed  towards the gate  office on our  way where the woman at the  desk informed us our flight was departing from A10 the terminal where  I had just  come from. We  decided to run  off all our  checked luggage and winter clothing the  direction the train  actually takes you!  After reaching A10,  you saw it's  gates sub-divided in sections: A10 a,  flight c, etc.  It caused even more confusion - at first it  showed us the  other way. Of course when we finally found the correct gate the  flight was already gone. The BA  man at the  counter apologized and told us to  expect to be  patient because "the problem was the fault of his colleague". At the customer service counter,  I also admitted the mistake, and  pointed it out to a colleague  and also agreed  she had never  experienced this kind  o error before.  A woman in line behind us,  had the same  error and missed  the same flight  for the same reason. The customer  service woman did  their best for us and gave us new tickets , for a  possible later flight, and advised us  thank you in  advance to "follow  that up". When  we did try to "follow it up" I was  given a response  which was clearly cut and pasted with errors and  confusion and did  not address the  issue of my  ticket I tried  phone call a  few times to  get to an agent in person,  I ended up  waiting for close to an hour , having to  refund several euros. The service was terrible and I  cannot imagine how  things would have been if there was a more  pressing issue. Aside  of this, the flights were cramped  and the entertainment system was outdated - small screen  with a poor  quality and you  have to hit your finger hard  on the screen  just get it to work. Not  the mention, the  morning of our flight (way back)  right after the  food was served  the system was out-of-order. The last  part is about  British airline food.  For a vegetarian, normally I like  the food but this time it  became a joke.  The "special" meal consisted of considerably  different food than  her boyfriend who had the regular meal. The pasta  was one of the worst I've had on flight, <mask> when breakfast <mask> around, I got a recycled fruit cup from <mask> dinner, while <mask> else received <mask> full box of food! It was so bad <mask> was comical.

Completely unimpressed with British Airways. They lost my luggage on a  flight from Dublin to London. When I informed them, they did not apologise but assured me I would have my bag by that afternoon. I was lucky  the air BnB provided me with a towel and toiletries. I had not heard from them by 6pm and was told to wait until  they contacted me. I then got a message at 8pm at night to say they had found my bag and the courier was picking it up at 10pm and then it would be delivered. So I specifically stayed home that night And finally decided at midnight they were not going to  get it so went to sleep.  I woke up and called British Airways at 9am to ask when it was going to arrive and where was it as I got a message saying it was being picked up at 10pm the night before so had stayed home. They said to call the courier company. I then called the courier company and they said that it was a mistake and they would never deliver a bag that Late at night. They then said the driver had a late night so wouldn't arrive until lunch time that day. so I went out for the morning and returned to my apartment at lunch. I  again received a message at lunch time that said they would actually not arrive until sometime between 3 and 5pm that afternoon. I called  and see if I could get a more specific time or they could tell me when they were on the way. They said no, and that I would have to wait at my apartment for two hours and to call at 6pm if my bag had not arrived. This was ridiculous. I am so lucky my air BnB hosts supplied me with towels and a toothbrush and that I had money to go out and buy clothes for the day. So unimpressed with British Airways and their disorganisation with my bag.  I understand bags are lost but to be told that it was coming at three different times and also the fact that British Airways decided  they had nothing to do with them anymore and to contact the courier company was a joke. They were the ones  who lost the bag in the first place on a 50 minute flight with no transfers.

He flew to  Paris T5 on  Qatar Airways with a connecting flight  on Avianca to Bogota from Terminal 2. The staff at Paris airport  wanted to check-in my piece of luggage on the  first Avianca flight  as I had not booked that ticket with BA.  I had bought  3 separate tickets. I realized that  it would result in having to  change my luggage at T5, go through Passport control  then go to  terminal 2 by  train as there was a problem with Heathrow Express. When I pointed  this to the BA staff the  problem this would have they said it was my fault for booking 2 separate tickets,  since Avianca are not part of  Delta like BA, but in Star .

I was looking  forward to trying the new 787  with British Airways flying from Kuala us to London. The economy seat  is a bit tight and the main niggle was  my entertainment box  at the base of the seat  which hampered me from fully extended my legs. As a result, I had a swollen  knee as a  symptom of the awkward position after  my long flight.  Cabin crew service  is lacklustre and when I asked a passing crew to fill my  water bottle, her reply was "I am busy right now" without offering  any followup. Food  seemed unappetising and presentation was awful. There was no  choice of drinks offered during the  entire flight other  than the 2  espresso services. Entertainment  service was adequate but selection cant match what is offered by other competitors.

These days I  am flying British , either long  haul or short  flights This flight , business class  from London Heathrow  from Nice was  another pleasant surprise,  The galleries lounge  at T5 is  very rammed and  noisy but as  this flight was  8 am it  not too bad  as as usual  their food offerings  are poor compared  the other airlines.  Quite a mess,  and if you 've paid to  board business class  you should be  free to board  a gold, silver  etc who then  go down to  the Great FAs,  either hot or  no breakfast choice  and 2 drinks , on the  flight 30 min  before luggage off . Return again  bags stacked over  seats for 15  minutes luggage took  10 minutes to  load to belt,  heavy bags all  around the place.  Could use again  after a short hop but try  to avoid business  short haul.

London Gatwick to Amsterdam. I was  taken off this British Airways flight as a result of a change of plane, to  another A319 I gather. The process was not well handled, and it appeared that some staff and/or standby passengers were given priority, although others also missed out I understand. The  major issues were lack of clarity at the airport as to what  the issue was, last-minute confirmation of offloading (which left  us short of time to take another flight), a poor process for transferring airports (I had to bus from Gatwick to  Amsterdam and poor follow-up when I queried matters afterwards.  They refused to state whether staff or standby passengers had been prioritised, repeatedly citing privacy. I checked with a friend who's a UK privacy legal specialist, and this applies to individuals but not to categories such as staff or standby, so it appears to be  another refusal by  them to respond. I also raised the transfer with BA, as this involved further queueing to turn a voucher into a ticket, which meant I missed a transfer bus. Better to issue a ticket, or a voucher that can be used on  the service that day, with BA to arrange it so with the bus company. On the positive side, I was compensated per the rules, and did make a BA flight later that day, which was OK. Nonetheless, this could have been handled much more smoothly, and I'm afraid British Airways customer service on the ground and in follow-up let them down.

Flew Toronto to London in British  style club world  with avios and  travel voucher. Prompt check in at  gate with friendly . The club lounge is well  organised with dinner  available as this is a sleeper . A good choice of food  even though the  waiting list remains unimaginative. The lounge  remains too small  and busy. Additional  drinks are needed  and too few  longer queues before  the flight was  cancelled Friendly staff  for the flight with lights out after takeoff and a tray service . The dessert , cheese and  fruit was perfect  - an ok . The flight is too short  with a decent  meal and the  clubs world layout  seems now dated  - in a  serious need of  a re-think. Once  on edge, it's  no fun being  run over by a stranger and  this is a  general lack of . Breakfast was  good with the  English muffin being  very confused offereing. Returning from Heathrow  2 days later  - with a  painfully slow check  out process -  apologies for T5  travel agents blaming  tea from the  prior day spilling . Went straight  into the club  bar on the  main gates which is a hidden  gem - quiet,  nicely stocked, few  lines and in  excellent condition. Pleasantly surprised to be  first to first  on arrival in  Club lounge .  Overall superb flight with BA first  to it's best. Decent vintage champagne  on take off,  very engaging and  helpful crew made the experience really  first class -  especially given the  flight was full.  Black Rose Champagne,  some excellent wine  selections - especially  good reds, and well cooked food. A movie, afternoon  coffee and we 're head of  town into Toronto.  My bags almost  dropped us off.  BA can be  lacking in service - especially in  club World and  some of the  lowest cutting in  20 years -  and these return  flights reminded me of the old  service and how  fast it can  work at its  peak

Off to London Heathrow. Sadly British Airways has gone downhill. To start,  my plane was  on excessive hand  luggage allowances meant  prior to boarding, the food was , leg room  was non existent , only 5'6),  freezing temperatures during  the flight and an inadequate ratio of toilets to passengers left me very uncomfortable. The positives were that staff were friendly , courteous under  all circumstances and they didn't bother  with us to  put the safety  checklist through. For  my 6 hour direct flight at just over £500  it was the  least I could  afford Provided you  arrive before you  can restrict your water intake, wrap up very warm and take your  own tablet/ereader then  it will be  fine But it's more a no  fuss airline/service and I'd rather fly with easyjet any  airline

Miami Heathrow to  JFK return with  US Airways. Delay  there and back  with poor communication  with both. Told  about a delay  time was extended  until we reached  the gate and on the return  leg and then  again once on  a plane. Service  in the return  flight seemed like  they were "going  through the motions"  less than worried  by the level  of service. I  would seem that  while British Airways  flight to Miami  and back to  Newark Heathrow have  extremely poor punctuality  whereas alternative airlines  may have the  exact issue. Inflight  services on inbound  flight not fully  restored after a  while which was  extended because some  flights had no  connection for the  first hour.

Oslo to London Heathrow. Check in was chaotic, and ground staff had no idea about check in, no information about lounge  and transfer etc.  An emerald frequent  flyer with British Airways. Seat is  an economy seat, it's a joke they sell this product as business class. No entertainment and a disgraceful  emphasis on business  class Service was very fast. Overall  service in this  service was no  doubt better than economy class - it's a complete joke they call  the product "business class" - you just waste your money.

Gatwick to Ibiza return. booked pretty  early and just a one night  return trip. Checked in on line and used bag  control at LGW North Terminal which was quick, as  is the fast track security. Not  a normal user of Gatwick, using LHR every month , found LGW had improved a lot since my  previous visit 5 years ago. The  terminal used by BA is the  new Travellers lounge which was ok  although pretty full and service a little slow. Boarding onto an ex BMI A319 via a bus but pretty well organised, seat 3F the old Club Europe layout. Food and crew okay on this 2hr 35min flight arrived just about on time. Return no online check in available so checked in at the airport by a rude  ticket agent, no lounge either at Ibiza but not  much problem. Late departure of around 1 hr boarded  a bus onto A320 with new seat layout, seat 1A which was nice. Crew friendly, service and food on this flight were better than  we had on BA for a  month - arrived about 30 min  late on to a bridge, bags off very quick so no complaints.  Absolutely would use  BA again, BA I use most  often

One big improvement  from the same leg 15 months  before British Airways . Economy from  JFK to Miami outbound, business class  London to Heathrow inbound. Lounge service  from Chicago excellent for me (Mum) and acceptable for my daughter - this time there was at least some simple-ish food which was child-friendly. Staff were friendly to the children on both legs,  taking time to fill out her  flight logbook.

British Airways generally does a good job in economy,  with reasonably friendly and efficient service.  However onboard food  or drinks are  pale shadow of  what they used  to be but  prices in real  terms are much lower these days and this is  an acceptable trade-off.  My particular flight  to Dubai to  Singapore was packed  and I certainly  felt comfortable sitting next to a large guy, squished  on one side  by my seat. But the cabin crew were fine  and one attendant was charming. It's  difficult when I  try to fly , or first  time I get . I'd put  Qatar Airways ahead  than many rivals in economy and behind in premium  economy where the food is particularly  good

from Heathrow to  Sao Francisco. I've  used British Airways  before in the  UK but was  very pleasantly surprised with this flight.  I have only  one Even with  this full plane, check in was fine and well organised boarding, plus  the flight was  good time. The food was very  good (really!), except  for tateless cardboard  pizza just before landing, and there  were multiple drinks runs thoughout the  plane An adequate  but small movie  watching service with  friendly smile. Best  first class flight  we had for  me It's great  to see that BA can still  run it very well and provide  great an experience.  And even looking forward now to  my return flight  as I've not been able to  enjoy that for a long time).

Chicago to Amsterdam via London Club  Amsterdam / Club  Amsterdam After a very nice first flight from Tampa to Chicago with my wife and  a 15 months old baby, transit  to Chicago was  relatively smooth. Our stroller was delivered at the gate and with a stroller there was  a special bus  that transfer us  to the other terminal. We did  however have to  clear security a  second time, so we arrived very soon in a crowded business lounge. As a gold  star I checked  the First lounge, but ground staff  did not welcome  there because it was crowded too. We found a  quiet "dinner part"  in the business lounge, were seated  under a very  nice ground staff who offered me  a glass of champagne to relax. Food was decent. Boarding the upper deck of this Boeing 747-400 was  another pleasure with a CSD welcoming us by name. Flight was excellent: food amazing, enough , drinks were  served cabin crew  look after us and our baby. Our baby was  laughing all the time, singing and talking his own ! After this  long flight, transit  to LHR terminal  was again relaxing.  Staff was again waiting for us at the gate, very nice. After security we went to the first  floor which was  again was crowded, but we found  another quiet place  to sit. Time for a shower,  snack and relax.  Last flight to  Chicago was in  a full cabin,  friendly and frriendly cabin crew. The only small remark we can find, is that this  last flight there  is no stroller  ready for us, but it arrived with our luggage.

Rome to London Heathrow with British Airways, and the flight itself was efficient and on-time. Comfortable seat, nice entertainment. But the ground service was terrible - we were the first flight of the day and the  men at the counter arrived to find 20-30 of us standing in queue. They got their stuff ready to work, sat  down their chairs, then just sat  around and ignored us for 15 minutes or so. The cabin crew didn't win any awards for friendliness either - they  done their job but I won't say much more. The food served was adequate at best. This was my second time flying British Airways, and I have not been impressed either time. There  were better choices.

You usually do  never have a  complaint with British  Airways but my flight from London  Airport to Toronto on 23rd April  was the worst  one I have  sat on. They  booked a 10  hour delay, which  worked out to  being a 6  minute delay, and  were also kept  to the gate . They only  offered us a  ticket which you  have to spend  for the same  time And on top of this  our bags were  lost along with  one of the planes. This was  really inconvenient as  I have no  baggage and arrived  about 4:00am.

On British Airways from Manchester to Dubai return via Heathrow with family.  My outbound flight was a night service and dinner was served at 1am. The children didn’t eat as they were fast asleep but the food was nothing special – supermarket ready meal standard. Leg room was horrific and it  really felt like cattle class. On  my return flight the seats were worn and old, screens were old and scratched the  children weren’t given their choice of  food as they  had run out, my three year old was given snack a box  of nuts my husband sitting next to her was asleep I was  in the row behind and quickly took it away  as she’s allergic. I could go on but you get the picture. The man sat next to me didn’t get any food on a 7hr plus flight  because he was  sick and they  have run out  the pasta. From my experience I won’t fly or recommend British airways anymore. The days of glory are long gone.

London to Philadelphia. Having booked business class and paid the non refundable  fare British Airways would not let me check in on line. When I reached Terminal 5 they bumped me due to . They offered me a downgrade that I could  only accept for  security reasons. If  someone had told me they were  busy when I  tried to check in online, I could have rerouted via New York and still arrived  within time for an important meeting. As it was, I arrived 7 hours late and missed my meeting. British Airways only cares about maximising its profits. It cares nothing for its passengers. I have been a loyal customer of BA for over 50 years. For many years I was a gold  card holder and this is how  airlines treat me. They sold me a product and then sold the same product to someone else after  he had paid the full and non refundable fare.  They used to  be good. their  title "The World's Favourite Airline" was not far from the truth. No longer! They are rapidly becoming the world's least favourite  airlines

London to Calgary  is with British  Airways and we  take this route about twice a  month and in  the past have  sat in the  aircraft which were rather aged but homely! This time, we had the experience of the new Boeing 787  which was very nice and new, and we found the seats just  so comfortable, particularily  for Premium Economy.  What we did not enjoy was  a change in  attitude from the staff, they seemed so different to  other crews we  had looking after  back on the  long runs. The  emphasis was on getting things served as fast as they can, and  I betide you if you want extra milk for  your cup of coffee! The food was good, and  we felt safe and efficiently cared for, but there was not the  rushing around that we used to  feel when wandering around in the  early hours of the flight, when you could go to the galley and get a coffee or a snack. After all this is a long haul flight, and I can well understand the rush on a short haul flight. The person behind us was air  tired which was not their fault, and the cabin  crew dealt with this well. Our return flight was  nice and we  got the glass  water fizzy prior to take off, which is a nice touch, and  is something that other airlines do in Premium Economy. I think that  airline managers should travel with other airlines to review its premium economy brand. Finally, I think the breakfast is not very  good and could  have improved upon. Like another passenger, we went and had something after  and those breakfast  items are horrible!

Using an Avios redemption ticket we  set out to  London in First Class with British Airways and the experience was superb. We checked in in London and  a lady that  welcomed us in  was warm and  friendly The Concorde  Lounge was good , we had a tasty table service breakfast before retiring to the  waiting area to . The lounge  was very comfortable  & relaxing. Boarding  was on time  so we were  met at the door and escorted  towards our seat. Immediately offered a glass of champagne  by the service  staff until landing. Lunch was very  nice and served  with style and attention to detail. The two cabin  crew that took  photos of us were superb and  a perfect combination of professional and  casual Afternoon tea  was perfect for  our length and time of flight and we disembarked  only find our  bags first off  a carousel in  London All in , a great flight. The return  lounge was in Club World on  the Upper deck  with an ageing  and lovable and  much cared for  staff and was almost as good.  Our lounge in  Manchester was small  yet comfortable and we dined before  each flight where  another good buffet was served with to order Pad Thai available. Upon  landing we were  greeted by the  very delightful crew , who personally  introduced themselves and  very clearly loved what they were . Individual and  personal service was  THE order of  each day and even though I  did not eat,  and was asked  several times if  I needed anything  and felt very  thankful for. I often complain about BA baggage delivery  but our bags  were again first  on the carousel and we were  in the tube  within 20 minutes  after landing, and this even though  BA was busy.  Could not fault this trip.

Flying to Hong i via London  on British Airways turned out to  become one of the most exhausting trips I have . I had high expectations of  an A380 flight  and new aircraft.  the opposite was true. Seats were very uncomfortable, service was very poor,  everything rushed and  service was horrible. Leg space was poor. It was the last time for me to  travel with BA.

From London Heathrow to Hong Kong. The British Airways First Class experience was fantastic. The cabin crew could nt do enough  and make my  experience one I  did not forget.  My BA experience started at check in and continued right until the  minute I stepped off the plane  in Hong Kong. The staff all  clearly demonstrated their  devotion to the BA slogan "To  Serve to Serve".  I chose the first course tasting  menu (exclusive to  Airbus A380). Each course came with a paired wine.  Every course was tasty and well presented. The crew took the time to describe each course as it  was being served and continually topped up the wine.  Both food and  wine served were of a very  good standard and quality. The seat  was roomy and  extremely comfortable. The fully flat bed was comfortable, mattress topper, cotton sheets, duvet and pillows.  I am over  5 feet tall  and had lots  enough space in  my suite for sleeping. I slept  well over 6  weeks and woke up refreshed.

Flying British Airways  to London Heathrow  to Sao Paulo-Guarulhos  on the 14/04 on the upper  tier and it  was probably my  favourite flight. The FAs were brilliant  for the service ! The plane  started showing it's sign of age  but it was  going ok. The flight departed a little bit late as one passenger decided not to  board

London Heathrow - Nairobi Kenya. Boeing 777 not new  and clean. Departed on time. Food was very average and was served at 11.30 am  for a "lunch" - bland and uninteresting. Cabin crew very quick and  friendly but then ran away for  most of the flight so that they could get the service over as quickly as possible. An hour before landing they reappeared again with  two boxes with a chicken sandwich,  soft drink and that was it. You sometimes wonder  whether British Airways check the quality of the offers made by other airlines or whether it is just customer loyalty that keeps them flying. Nairobi arrival was a nightmare as my electronic visa had a page not dowloaded and this resulted in an extra hour and a half  in immigration before it was sorted out.

From Nairobi more or less on time-had to wait for a thunderstorm to pass before take off. Premium  economy seat is  worse than Economy in that there is more leg room Flight was packed and the 777 was subdivided  into First, Club,  Super Premium Economy and Economy - not sure whether  of these subdivisions are really necessary - it would have been better to provide customers with a more modern/newer aircraft instead of an older 777 with all these seating alternatives that look rather dated. Food was average, choice between "grilled steak" and chicken and a vegetable salad starter and dried out  cake as a dessert. Cabin crew  pleasant but hardly any warmer than the food, they  appeared to want  to get the  storm out of the way as quickly as possible. It was a  busy flight and they disappeared until 1 hour before landing when the  big cardboard box  arrived pretending to be breakfast - a pot of yoghurt and a dreadful, dry cereal bar. Arrived on time and immediately  asked for a coffee and a snack at the  bar of course should have been served as a breakfast on the flight. British Airways  forgot to wake up and check what other airlines  served on the same flight.

Doha to London  and Bahrain with  Gulf Airways, and  also very poor lounge in Doha. Even flying First Class on BA there is no reciprocal arrangement to access the excellent Qatar Airways Lounge. Instead there is  one lounge for all other airlines. On boarding my wife and I were ushered to our seats.
