And to our amazement our individual lockers were opened by  2 flight attendants who promptly disappeared without making an offer to hang our coats or jackets, as is standard practice on even business class. No hot towels  at take off or landing, very average menu, and as we slept through dinner were keen on breakfast. Told that due to possible turbulence coffee could not  been prepared, both our cutlery earlier wrapped by the  captain were delivered without spoons to eat the very  good muesli. Orange juice tropics a quality. We had  to ask for marmalade with our toast. All the crew displayed little perception of customer needs, made the more marked by Qatar Airways Business class crew who  were absolutely excellent on the earlier Sydney to Doha Flight. Poor food, very poor crew  communication or attention to detail, who seemed to be going through the motions. Slightly aloof.  Far below the 3 Gulf majors in flight attention.  Our bed was very good, as you would expect.  Economy kit below the Qatar Airways Business class kit,  is a joke in comparison to Qatars First class kit. Very agreeable cabin and seats, but crew performance at economy class performance. Would avoid again.

London to Johannesburg, and I decided this time to fly with British Airways given they fly there with the A380. I was quite looking forward to the experience of flying Business Class on  the upper deck of the A380. I needn't have bothered. Following an uneventful few hours  at the Galleries Lounge it was time to board, straight onto the upper-deck. My business colleagues before me  walked through the gate without problem, however I was told to wait a moment as there was an issue with my boarding card - wait a moment sir, oh it looks like you've been approved for an upgrade to First which is on the lower  floor - no, sorry, my mistake  - you're still  in Business upstairs but I'm afraid we've had to move you from your selected seat" (the one I'd  pay the not inconsiderable sum of £80 to reserve in advance by the way) -  and not to worry, it's still a window seat". Except it wasn't - it was seat 50A, a windowless seat next to the toilets. The journey itself was uneventful. The food a bit of a disappointment without any flavour, my beef main was dry and rather tasteless. The wine was very good. Entertainment system 't bad, though not a patch on the likes of Emirates. The staff friendly and  pleasant enough and  even managed to  stay a few hours. I wrote to BA to  complain about my change of seat and the unprofessionalism of telling someone they had an upgrade when they  know I had to chase up twice for a  refund The one I eventually got was pitiful and as impersonal as could be with a stock answer about the need for them to  constantly change people’s seats for operational needs The biggest issue for me with BA’s Club World however is its ridiculous layout whereby people have  to step over each other’s legs - I don’t know of any other business class product which has this and it leaves BA well behind the competition.  While not my favourite airline, BA  could do worse  and take a note of their partners Iberia which has a staggered layout but offers direct aisle access to all. The situation whereby you find yourself starring at strangers until one of you decides to raise the privacy screen is also far from ideal and surely not safe as the cabin crew have to constantly lower it to pass hot food and drinks over your neighbour. Can’t help but think that BA have missed a real opportunity to shake things up  in their new fleet of A380s. Whilst some airlines have been creative and had on-board bars, lounges and showers, BA has just packed in as many seats as possible – <mask> are 7 <mask> in Club World upstairs and 8 Downstairs which is staggering and an insult when paying premium prices. <mask> should have known better having flown on one of BA’s other new additions to <mask> fleet last <mask> a Boeing 787 to Toronto, which also was <mask> claustrophobic. I returned home from South Africa upstairs on a Boeing 747 from Cape Town to London. The plane might have been older <mask> the experience altogether more pleasant. This journey ironically took me up to Silver Membership, I won't be choosing to fly long-haul with BA again however, unless I have to. There are far <mask> alternatives out there.

I am writing to complain about my deeply distressing British Airways flight from London Heathrow  into Cape town with a change at Johannesburg. The flight was badly managed throughout. when I arrived at Heathrow, I was told by a member of staff , my name was not on the system. She  then found it, She then said 'oh Im sorry to tell you that there are no more seats on the flight.' I was obviously distressed by this as imagined I would have to return back to Dorset? However, after much insisting she  she eventually found my seat. I arrived at the gate in good time for my  flight to Johannesburg. However we were all waiting for about a further half an hour  from the time we were meant to have departed the airport. In this time, there were no explanations  as to why we were so late boarding the plane. Once on the plane, again we waited and waited and waited - and eventually we were told that 'Sorry for the inconvenience, but BA did not  have enough time to the the engineering works, or refuel or do the mandatory paper work for this plane during the day.' So we were extremely late in setting off from Heathrow. I think this is a poor excuse  for not departing at the correct time and we were not given enough notifications throughout the lengthy wait. I was concerned about catching my next flight from Johannesburg to Cape Town. The flight attendant told me  NOT to worry and there will be lots of  extra ground staff  that help us all when we arrive at Johannesburg. However, this could not have been further from the truth. Once landed there were no British Airways staff present - except for one lady in a High Vis jacket who explained to people that needed to get the connecting flight to Johannesburg to leave their luggage as it would be put on the plane and to Run to the next gate for the flight. She then pointed at a  guy (he was  with no uniform) saying he will take me and another passenger to gate. We literally  ran through the airport and then the man asked for a tip? I gave him £5 but was extremely suprised that I would have to 'tip' someone who supposedly BA  told me to go withOnce getting to the gate and (just in time) the lady at Comair said radioed through and told us they had already sold our tickets, and rudely shouted at me as to 'Why? did you leave your luggage' By this point  she had tears falling and was feeling extremely overwhelmed. She then told us to 'just go back' with no further help. Luckily another passenger was with me and was kind enough to show me the BA check in desk to ask for new tickets to Cape Town. Once at the BA <mask> were not helpful in the slightest. They simply <mask> me to go and get my luggage from a 'Menzies' which was the other side of the airport and see if it was there. I ran too and fro the Menzies (lost luggage) to the Comair and BA office - back and forth for around 2 hours. No staff were helpful even though I was crying and feeling completely bewildered.

London to Los  America via Heathrow with British Airways.  We paid for emergency exit seats  on our flight  which was allocated  and at check  in 45 minutes later when trying  the board flight, we were stopped  then told we  were now at the back of  a plane with our tickets given  from BA staff,  who were sitting ! It transpires we have to  fight BA ourselves  to get our  money back after  waiting in a  queue This sums up British Airways now, as an  airline where customers  were effectively charged  with something they  were provided with  but then BA  takes it so  bad that they hope they get  to keep the  same customer service  almost non existent.  Worse than this,  the 4 flights  we took were  cancelled our son was given child  care we hadn't  given the choice  of meals was  out of only two options both  were disgusting, one  is the seats  actually broke on  the new A380  as the seats were incredibly uncomfortable  in that you  can feel the metal frame as there is no  padding in the  seats An internal  South America flight  I took had  less space and  more comfortable seating  on BA's A380.  I cannot find  anything positive to  write about them.

Got a British  Airways flight to  arrive within cooling  time period, they  claim refund takes  72 hrs. Many  days later still  not refund. Promised  date 11 April  would get refund  after 72 hours.  Payment of 15  March BA can’t  say when will  get refunded. Payment  on 17 April  cancelled for replacement  on flight booked  on first flight  being cancelled and  want refund to  the balance. BA  no care, holding  claim and won’t  explain when it  would be refunded.  Loyal customer for  2 years. Appalling  BA service and  BA say if  payment due on  18 April not  made for replacement  then it will  get cancelled and  you will lose  your deposit despite  this fact they  are keeping £353  of my money  but have lied  to as to  WHEN it will  get refunded. BA  planes are now  absolute nightmare, last  few flights travelled  to were delayed  due to hand baggage only passengers  stood up and  down the aisle  trying to stuff  the hand luggage  and overhead lockers  and no care  nor consideration for  the passengers possessions.  We had to  stop unless people  sit down and  allowed hand baggage  to be placed  on hold, plane  will be further  damaged British Airways  trying to decide  if it wants  to be a  non frills airline  Or not, it 's now worse  then Ryanair or  Virgin Not a  great experience to  fly BA anymore.  Despite having problems  of one type  and another on  almost every booking  flight with BA  in the last  3 years, continued  too be loyal  towards them but  now do not  understand customer loyalty , their recorded  Customer services message  that they want  and maintain high  standards after travel , wish to  have a passenger  relationship with BA  and they fail  on all counts.

From Heathrow to New York JFK . This was  The first time  since a while  where I have been on a  flight Even although  I was old  and was in  good condition and . Both flights  left on time  and no problems . . The  seats were okay  and the food  was very good  and economy. The  flight attendants were  kind and helpful.  We were very pleased with the  experience

London London Heathrow , Houston IAH. Avios ticket, and British Airways gold card holder. Having taken my food  order before others  on the outbound  flights I was  little bit surprised to find they  have given "my" risotto to another passenger. They were very apologetic however and allowed me  the choose something  from the First menu. Aside from  food the journeys  are uneventful, and the quality of  food was better  than the last  two times. Overall I'm quite happy  about this latest  booking experience.

Flew London to Beijing with British  Airways The flight leaves from Heathrow  at 5, normally Beijing flight leaves from B Gates, so I made myself comfortable at the B Gate lounge which is 100 times better than the two A Gate congested lounges before the flight. It was a good flight and day flights are more comfortable, though quite full. The BA Club seats are configured  wider across and  my seat is not as wide as competitor's, but just enough. CX may have better seat but BA sometime offers good value. The service is good. It has a Chinese crew and unlike with Cathay, the crew are always the same on this route (because they are based  outside China specifically for the London route), so a frequent flyer may  be recognized and get treated better. It was an on time flight.

It was my  third time flying  for British Airways  on this particular  aircraft from Vancouver  to Paris CDG  via London Heathrow.  Each trip was  completed on time  without delay. Online  sign in was  free and got  to pick out  which seats I  wanted Picked up  my boarding passes  at the airport  before any problems.  The food was  about average and  all cabin crew  were courteous and professional. Drinks were  well served or  could be picked  up from the  bar independently. Washrooms  kept clean. Overall  a satisfactory experience.  However one thing  which all travellers  on the YVR-LHR  series will notice : the age  in this aircraft.  I think it  should be replaced , since this  is a very  long route. I flew in late March and return  end of April,  in low season  so the cabin was still full.  We think this  airline deserves a  bigger aircraft like  Airbus A380. Particularly,  both back of  its seats are  very thin and  I can feel  the scratching movement  as the person  who tries to retrieve items from the front pocket.  the in-flight entertainment system is also  rather out dated,  graphics were not  good and colours  are rather misleading.

London Heathrow to  London CDG with  British Airways. Nothing special for a short flight but was happy that  I was on ! It is  typical that for short haul flight BA uses seating that the business  seat are the same as Economy  so that the  economy seat is  not empty. And on this flight  this was not  available so I  had similar space  to my next  was unoccupied. Snack  was offered free, though not hot,  along with a drink.

I Kong to  fly with British Airways. I normally prefer aisle seats  on long haul  but this flight I chose a  premium seat, because  this was an  economy flight on the upper deck.  This upper deck situation means that I can take  use of a  special side drawer where apart from easy storage I  may also put  stuff on top.  My Premium Economy  is just enough  storage to move  around if needed. BA's Premium Economy service is good,  its food is  about the same for economy as  is the case  on some airlines, and the seat  feels comfortable. BA is generous on alcoholic drinks though  I do not take advantage of it. But the  service is not  very good. All  in all the  service was satisfactory.

Imagine our amazement,  we went to  check our flight  tickets to London  after our holiday  to the West  End of the  UK and found  they were upgraded from Economy to  First World. It  was especially nice  to my fiancée who has only flown economy previously.  Customer service and  staff were very  good and the  comfortable seat made  her flight much  very pleasant. The  747 is a  great aircraft because  is is so quiet and looks  very smart inside.

I decided to  treat myself to  British Airways premium  service from Beijing to London, which  were not much  too expensive than . I had  my bulkhead seat which meant I had plenty of legroom and could  stretch out on  my flight. The cabin looked a bit tired but  the staff were  polite and professional  and I was comfortable. The food  looked quite good but a glass  more champagne when we boarded would 've been nice.  My IFE was  fine but the screen was small  as it malfunctioned during part of  the flight.

After our recent holiday to the USA, I was  so excited to  be flying on  a new A380  at the first time. After some  hours in the  Airbus Terminal 5  we went to board and found  seats were upgraded  from Premium Economy.  Our aircraft was smart and fresh  looking and we  were welcomed with  enthusiasm The A380 is by far the quietest aircraft  I have ever flown and the IFE was good with lots of  space The food was decent and  I had friendly , professional service on the plane and at Heathrow.

From Heathrow to Athens on BA642 (2/4/16) and returned on BA643 (9/4/16). We decided to  make a break from the low  budget airlines and fly British Airways to Athens as we had found  relatively cheap flights  ($ per person per way) and  fast flying times.  As someone travelling with us is  flying blind we could reserve seats before others on  our flights with  a priority boarding  being given as  possible Online check in was smooth  and boarding passes  to the outbound were printed off. On our flight out to Athens  passengers were given  a choice of a hot or  hot meal. As I had something to eat before; I passed, but  it was great given that some  passengers would have been transiting quickly  and wouldn't have time to eat  before the terminal.  The night flight  on the way  home was also  great as meals (one hot option only) were offered with free drinks and pillows were  available Flight attendants were professional on  the flights. Both flights landed early  (+ 35mins early!). If there is  much I could ask BA to  improve on is  have one desk open at Athens  with all flights  for the day  or anyone that  lands early and just wants to  print off boarding  pass or offer  self service kiosks  in other airports outside of London.  In conclusion British  airlines are better  then easyjet or  Emirates and if there is only a little price , I would recommend travelling with .

Riyadh to Dusseldorf via Heathrow with British Airways. Check in at Riyadh was terrible, broken baggage belts and staff explaining to passangers that there is an issue  incapable of fixing it. Flight to LHR was smooth and with good  security LHR however was a disaster.  Border Security took forever and the gate agent was even worse. I have a trolley and handluggage as specified. First she started complaining about the trolley - surprise it was within size - then she looked  at my laptop  case which was 1 cm too large and made  her check in  the trolley -  most of all  was her attitude in this. I feel that her  product bashing behavior definitely did not comply with the BA image and expectations from businesses  or passengers.  I will search  my options before choosing BA again.

Jet Airways used  too be better  at this. I  stayed all afternoon  in the Business lounge, waiting for  a Gatwick flight  around 7pm. My  seat card said  my gate closed  around 1840, and  as I hadn't  heard any announcement  before 1830 I  asked the BA man at reception  if there was a delay. I  felt very dismayed  when he casually  replied "yes, about  an hour 30 ." I was  so unhappy they  had not told  passengers earlier, or  ask if we  had help getting  on in a  very timely manner.  This was a  point when BA  would have tried  and reroute its  delayed passengers, but this man told  that his duty  officer had specifically  asked him not  not do this.  BA told me  even if I  wanted to switch  from an earlier  flight or LCY  then I would  want to go  to landside and  buy a ticket  to those flights.  There I had my first experience  of BA's new  Continental Europe, wherein  the middle seat  was covered by  a tray, to  give the perception  of more space,  but actually giving  passengers a wider  seat or more ! From my experiences of BA  Business class in  both long and  long haul, over  this past year,  this is very  plain to see  why BA is  intent on making  adjustments which make  them more money,  rather than changes  which benefit the  passengers experience. My meal was plonked  up in front  to me without  informing me what  food was, and  that wasn't at  all tasty. But a stewardess gave  a great customer  courtesy by giving  me a plastic  bag to decant  the bloody mary  in so that  I could hold  it to it  on approach to . That was  another very nice  service I hadn't  heard offered before  from any airline  I flown with.

it is very  odd that British wings pre-allocated me  to middle seat, which I was  never allowed to  do when checking  out online unless  you paid 9 pounds. At the  gate self service  checked in would  never let me change seat either,  and I had  go find a  full service desk to get my  own window seat,  a waste of my time and  money The short flight from London  Airport to Amsterdam was ok, flight crew spoke to the cabin a  couple times, which I appreciate. But cabin crew clearly  thought they were  somewhere else. My  meal choice was water and crisps, hardly "full service" but at least  it was free.

Welcome to Montreal  and London. What  we got from  Canadian Airways so far? 3 flights, 3 delays, for  total cumulated time  of 5 hour  and 15 minutes.  Out of a  4 hours and 35 minutes delay  from Montreal, they  let me miss  my connection in London. They booked me on another flight which made me wait a  full 4 hours  for London instead  of 2 hours.  Coming back to  Montreal from Marseille,  this flight is  just one more  and I am  now what you  might call a  happy customer.

London to Larnaca. I find travelling with British Airways  very hit and miss at times. Having flown extensively  in the past few years in  both club and economy with them it seems a gamble on how the flight attendants moods are. On our flight to Larnaca the FA's had a terrific attitude , were courteous and the cabin service director was professional and polite. The older type seating is far more comfortable than the new slimline seating adopted  although still only just bearable after nearly 5 hrs of sitting. The 767,s still have an air of spaciousness compared to the A320 that  is used on this route. All in all a good flight but compared to some airlines that offer a lie flat  cabin with personal entertainment systems on medium haul routes BA is falling behind.

From City to  Isles of Man  with British Airways.  Despite a not  surprising cancellation of our flight from Gatwick with Easyjet  ( seem to  be become more  or more unreliable),  we purchased tickets  on BA from London City. Despite  the weather problems  and with storm  clouds approaching, they  undertook the effort  and operate a  plane back to  The Isle of Man and got  you all home.  well done BA!

This flight from Copenhagen to London , was British Airways, but operated by Jet Time, who are operating some BA services on the LHR-CPH  routes this summer. The aircraft was definitely not up to BA standards - old, very  cold inside. Cabin service I cannot comment on as  honestly I had 3 seats together  but slept most of the flight. I really hope this is a temporary move on BA's part as this really is not the standard  passengers have come  to expect from them on this  flight

On to Rotterdam,  from Amsterdam to London. City Airport is undergoing renovation work, which gives the pier to the gates the feel of an abandoned warehouse. The  departure lounge is  now little more than a Portakabin. This trip felt a bit like catching a bus,  but is fine for business travel I guess. Onboard the outbound flight was less than  half full. BA's Embraer fleet are pretty new and clean. The E-170  is a fun little plane to travel in, with steep ascents out  at LCY and some tight turns.  Cabin crew excellent and a small snack (shortbread, popcorn or crisps) and drink were served on this 40-minute flight. Immigration and baggage reclaim at RTM is a breeze. On the return leg, onboard service was excellent.  Since it was  the evening flight the free bar service was much  better Arrivals at  London was a shambles, the flooded  toilets being particularly unpleasant. Shame they don't fly to Rotterdam from Heathrow though - T5 is far more pleasant than LCY.

Paris to London  flight service means  you can have a buffet dinner  on the lounge rather than onboard  your plane to maximise rest time. Excellent flight, LHR  flight track system  allows for speedy  loading onto my flight to Berlin.  Edinburgh to Berlin a pleasant flight , excellent service.  One negative issue  being that British  and business class  ticket selection costs extra if done  in advance.

Tel Aviv to  Liverpool Heathrow with British Airways. Fast , efficient check  in Plane left on time and  it was very nice and did  NOT give the impression of being rushed. Seat comfort  is Club World , which is  a nice surprise. Food selection and  service top notch. Absolutely no complaints.

London Gatwick to  Rome Fiumicino. If  anyone has flown  from Airways Club  then you'll realise  in the same  thing as their economy class EuroTraveller  has a seat  folded into a  row in the middle. As I  recall flying from Gatwick, the BA  flight was under  way and was directed into No 1. lounge which was quite packed already. When I  returned to Rome,  the baggage was  full To make matters worse, the counter for lost baggage which operates  on behalf of  British Airways was very poorly marked.  There was no  name or logo of British Airways. It was manned  a two person  that hadn't had  a clue what  is going on and would only  assist in filling up the forms. To make matters worse, they were  speaking to each  person leaving my  luggage and I  sat awkwardly staring  for them to complete their conversation.  Bottom line is, whatever carries the  UK Airway brand name is good.  Any 3rd party organisation which BA  uses are questionable.

Welcome to Dubai  and via Heathrow,  by British Airways.  One Outbound segment  includes an A380 , three others  a refurbished B747-400 s  As  the regular 20-year  customer and a  high level Executive  Club member, one  expects to expect  considerable variation in  what BA onboard . Staff are  not polite and  unfortunately some are , very well trained, so seem  they lack the  same attention to  service that should  come with Club +. The fish  on course served  at IAD and  BA was unbelievably bad, but other  options were fairly  good High Tea  and scones, clotted  wine and strawberry  jelly is an  excellent cost-cutting measure  from a British  Airways as I  focus on the  private sector. It 's sad to  think this airline  now working harder  a response to the competition.

Miami to Manchester via London Heathrow with British Airways. The aircraft was very old and dated, and too hot with no  ventilation above the seat. Food was disgusting - some  kind of chicken mashed up with potato and peas. These 747 aircraft need to be updated or retired as they are now showing their  HD Tv screens  are so small and have no USB or power .. Outbound flight was with American Airlines that was so much better. New aircraft, good entertainment and food with was good. Now that you  need to change terminals at LHR when connecting from Miami, there is  no advange of flying BA. So if you can choose a different airline or if you have to fly BA, avoid  the 747. The A320 on the domestic flight to Manchester was very comfy and looked so much better.

British Airways in my mind is fast approaching a national tragedy. As one who has flown them on/off for 35 years  I suggest I am qualified to have a view  down having travelled in all cabins including Concorde. We  fly Club Europe  at London Heathrow to Pisa and  did this last  year over the Easter break. We  had a home in Italy and fly the route often. Flight out started in the North Executive lounge  of LHR. It was not busy and was OK.  No choice of unhealthy bacon baps  or similar rolls stuffed with whatever. I had some fruit - tinned fruit. Plane was  the newish plane and the so called "new" Club . Three seats - with the  third one as a "table". Tables are usually in front of one - not to the side. Zero legroom unless you are in row "1". Last month I flew the regional Business Class  with Singapore Airlines, Malaysian Airlines and Vietnam Airlines. Needless to say - British Airways does  not come close when it comes  with seat comfort. Disgraceful. Food okay on both flights. FAs on both flights were also fine. The curtain  separating the Club cabin from Economy was broken, hence  we had queues  from the WC stretching into the Club cabin.Its long overdue - but BA need some serious management changes to build value into their key  routes

St Lucia to  Birmingham Gatwick in Premium Economy on  22 March, and I had the worst flight I have had for  a time on  Qatar Airways. No newspaper, inedible curry  and no wine,  not coffee. Breakfast  food was inedible and no coffee.  TV entertainment awful , old films , very small . Oxygen levels  very low with many passengers complaining  bout headaches etc.  Was not interested  as as usual , Airways employees  came into business  class and seemed to get a  great service! As  usual you say  will use them again on this  trip but very little choice as only competition is  flying and they  are not that good either. Compared  the airlines like  Air Qantas, Air  South Zealand etc,  they have much  more learn. Have used Thomsons to Barbados and Mauritius  in Premium Club section on the  new 787 and  this was a fantastic experience. Great  room service comfy seats and super in flight entertainment.

Flight from Seville to Gatwick on British Airways A320  Business Economy. Flight  started a few minutes ahead of  schedule and landed early as well. Seating was face-lifted economy class, and  i think less comfortable than the older style we flew out on in an A319.  Water and a drink okay. I do think British Airways could come  through with a 2nd drink or water service on a 2.5 hour flight. Overall okay.

Flew British Airways  to Oslo to  Newark Heathrow on  15 March.   People were happy and helpful, cabin  cleaned and looked . It wasn't a new plane but the seats were new. Served a turkey and cheese croissant. Will fly again with  them Was on time and landed early

Flying to Seville with British Airways. Flight was delayed  due to French air traffic controllers being on strike. BA did their  part to help,  all boarded on time and were ready to leave if a slot became available, however we still got away nearly 2.5 hours late. They served drinks and  even invited passengers  can view the flightdeck during the  flight Once we took off flight was okay, typical service with sandwich and drink. Wine was passable. Better than most shorthaul economy service, seat was comfortable given the limited legroom.

Flight to Seoul Incheon via London Heathrow, and overall , was very  pleased with my two flights on  board I'd checked  flights online and  the Drop at  JFK took less  than one minute.  A small snack was served, on  each flight to London, which was uneventful. The flight  from London to  Seoul was on  a new 787  and was almost  flawless A very friendly, professional crew,  which was of  a very high  standard and amazing sound. I was  surprised by the  length of both  meals (lunch and  then breakfast). The  first real let  up was the  plane It was  cramped (so narrow)  so I felt  very squashed in  by it. This  left the flight  slow and difficult  for sleep. This  little let down  but was a very good flight.

London to London , with British Airways. The main  reason I pay  when travel Business  way is to get extra leg room. BA's Club Europe now gives  you exactly the same leg room as in Economy, which may be  fine for a quick hop to Paris, but is definitely unsatisfactory on  the near four  hour flight. It  is particularly annoying to see children sitting in row 1 - the  one row with reasonable leg room.  Service was fine  - the food  was good, but no entertainment at . From now , I'll book Economy and pay  in exit seats - it's a . Either that or fly Turkish  with an airline which is going from strength to strength.

At Heathrow to  London on British  Airways and very friendly and efficient . We chose Asian Vegetarian as  usual which turned  out to be . Hadn't flown  there long-haul for  almost 10 years and improvement was noticeable. Free beverages  were offered and there was a  food choice too.  Bag allowance was  very adequate. The  service at Terminal  1 at LHR  was very well.

We have flown with British Airways over 100 times, usually in business class. On our current ski trip we paid a substantial premium to fly one way in First and home from London  to Denver in Business class. Yesterday our flight was cancelled due to snow. This of course is not  their fault. After  waiting nearly an  hours on hold  in their “Gold Card” premium service line we were  informed that all  their flights are  booked so they cannot help. We are “not authorised to help with this on the  basis you have  a drive to the airport and ask (“beg”) the airport staff to consider using a different carrier to help get you home” - for a long planned family Easter holiday. The true test of a company is not when things are going  wrong it is what they do when there is  the problem. BA.com  had been truly  negligent The email cancelling our flight did not even  include a phone number to call for rebooking.

British Airways from  Dubai to Johannesburg  to London Heathrow.  This leg SEA  and LHR was  in a 747.  That plane was  nice to me. I don't understand  any comments from  people who think  a 747 is tired or worn . Not a bad ride in  particular when the  passenger in front  behind you doesn't recline their seat.  We sat in  front of the  seats (seat 52A)  of the tail.  the food on this leg was bland, the continental  air was a  disappointment I would  take seat 52A  again if I  was traveling on  a British Airways  plane but be  warned there is  no wall next to 52A that you can lean  on to sleep.  This leg was  aboard an A380.  I sat in the tail of the upper deck  of seat 82A.  Every time, the  poor woman in  back of me  went to the  left as soon  when she could  but kept her  head that way  an entire 11+ hours of the  trip The A380  was a very  small plane and  my overall experience  is pleasant despite  the turbulence the  rest of the  trip The upper  cabin on an  aircraft is amazingly quiet. The food  on this leg was far better  than an English  meal served prior  to landing in  Amsterdam I would  never play for  Seat 82A again , there are  cardboard boxes under  a seat in  back of 82A  which limit foot  travel but I  would play for seat 82B, which  has an aisle . IFE on  these legs was  really sad but I'm not one  of popular culture. Cabin attendants on  these legs were polite and did a very nice  check BA ground  crew at Heathrow  was very nice and helpful. I've  traveled between South  Africa and North  Africa about a  thousand times over  this past two years. Flights that  take you to  connect planes in  the Middle east  and Europe fly  through Africa and  they tend to be very bumpy  even at night when most convective  turbulence dies down.  The flights that  are routed over the Atlantic Ocean  tend to be  slightly smoother.

Gu Dhabi to  Singapore Seating narrow , uncomfortable but seems to be  our norm with  new aircraft with  other airlines. Cabin  is excellent, but  when they move  passengers or British  Airlines employees from  Economy to Premium  Class or Business Class after boarding  is complete they  will do so  again without fare  and passengers noticing.  Fast food served  have declined in quality and quantity.  Original English breakfast  was to be one of the  worst meals in  service on BA. Now there is  not bacon in  the but rubbery  bread and the  boiled egg equally ! Truly awful meal. Flight on  time and entertainment system getting better.  at least the  seats on this  new aircraft are  nicer than those  on the ancient  ones still operated  by British Airways.

Gatwick to Amsterdam in Business class  is truly the most uncomfortable flight of my life. I thought that with British Airways  you might expect something a little better - what a stupid mistake. The Business class  tickets are standard  business class, with  one seat empty.  Food for breakfast was okay although  good enough if you were hungry.  And luckily they provide champagne during the flight.

Chicago to London  Excellent and terrific  customer service and  food The updated  home entertainment service is great with a very large selection of films  and TV shows. The menu was not extensive, but  was nicely presented.  All staff both  in the lounge  AND onboard the flight were great.  My transfer from T3 to T5  had a great  experience

Transfer and return  in an A320 in British Airways  Continental Europe. I would recommended to have any seat in row 1 as this has  been most pitch of Club Europe ! Two short  flights of just over 45 minutes to a full  hour a drinks and meal service was provided with  professionalism. Efficient  landing and disembarkation with luggage first off the belt at both airports.

PHL to LHR and return, both  in new cabin. British Airways has degraded its economy  experience to the  extent where US  airline companies may actually offer a better service. On the 777, BA  has removed the  restrooms in the  cabin to cram in more seats,  causing long queues  for the remaining restrooms. The new economy seating feels  extremely cramped, the  service on offer is of poor  quality and of  small portions, and avios accruals have been significantly reduced for low-cost fares - I just don't see any reason to continue to fly this airline. I find  absolutely ridiculous that  it charges insanely high prices to reserve seats in advance, making me have to stress out about checking  flights on time  or on vacation  and ensure that  we can snap up whatever good  deal is left by that time. My next trip to Europe has been booked with  BA - I  am able to choose a regular  airline for free at the time of booking, and  it will accrue the full amount  in miles that  it am actually . Although BA staff were courteous  and competent on this trip, that  does not make up for the current sad state  of the economy :

Domestic British Airways , Heathrow to Edinburgh return this  being my 2nd  trip on this  service over the  next 4 weeks.  Takes a little  slower if booked  at short notice  this is a  good service. Check  in bag drop  and fast track  to T5 very quick. I used the Galleries South  Terminal Boarding via gate 23, the flight departed around  15 minutes late  but arrived around  10 minutes late which was fine.  Lunch and coffee  served during the  entire 10 min flight. Return check  is a bit  late but once  checking in used  the galleries lounge for a quick coffee. Boarding at  terminal 5 on  nearly a full  service with business  priority which was  quickly departed on time for a  journey of just  under an hour,  bag tagged priority  took off quick.  Very much prefer  Boeing 767 on this route as  alternative to the  777

Philadelphia to London Heathrow and return, both in new cabin. British Airways  has degraded its economy product to  this point where US airline companies  might actually offer a better service. On the 777, BA has removed  two toilets in the rear to  bring in more  passengers causing long queues for the remaining restrooms. The new economy seating feels incredibly camped, the food on  offer is of  poor quality and of increasingly smaller portions, and avios accruals have been significantly reduced for low-cost fares - I just don't  see any reason to continue to fly this airline. I also find it ridiculous that BA charges insanely high prices to reserve seats in advance, making me have to stress out about checking in on time  and on vacation  and ensure that  we can snap up whatever good seat is left  by that time. My next trip to Europe has  now booked with American, and I 'm already seeing  the difference -  BA was able to choose a regular seat for  me at the time of booking, and I will  fly the full  number of miles that I am  actually flying. Although all BA staff were incredibly courteous and competent on this trip, that does not make up for the  current sad state  in the economy ! Bye bye BA.

Flying to London Heathrow with British Airways in Premium  class and abysmal  early boarding. No  quick take off . Ran out of wine bottle , and also ran out of  drink choices. Seat  was truly dreadful. I had to climb over the armrest to get . The person  watching played games , stabbing at  my screen for  2 hours. Complaints  they don't care and I am  still waiting for my miles to  become credited.

Travelled British Airways from London to Nairobi return and excellent flight both ways - outbound crew were not  quite as good as the inbound crew but I wouldn't complain about. I think the Premium economy seats were a new  design or at  best the covering,  and find it 's more comfortable , the leather  was almost up  with the comfort  in Virgin's A340 seats when they used to go to Nairobi. Had one problem with entertainment equipment on the return flight, it was locked  on on the announcement screen, despite no announcements being made, but there  are empty seats we could have  had Is premium economy worth the money, in my case I say yes, 22 stone, on a 6ft 2in, 73 year old frame does not like journeys much over 3 hours in standard economy. Check in  is ends good - as is  common at Nairobi , multiple security  checkpoints but its a known fact that different people notice different things,  so I see  that checks are a good thing.

British Airways, Athens - London Heathrow  to Los Angeles and return. Shorthaul : it seems the drink service  happens less often  than usual compared  with previous BA flights. The new  economy seats feel more spacious, but in my opinion it has less  comfort compared to  my old ones. Food quite good, pilots great as always. Longhaul - Upperdeck A380. Food  in courses quite decent but the snacks inbetween and  on the galley absolutely terrible. Seats feel very cramped on the A380 in economy class. Also unacceptable to charge so much to choose seats.  BA always seems  they have a delayed departure (plane  too big for  its own good?) Entertainment fairly good.  Will be interesting , compare with the competition, as plan on trying another airline next .

At British Airways Club Europe from  London Heathrow to Prague, as always, the staff are  extremely professional. You can see that  they enjoy what they do. The flight was fast and easy, no . The crew made sure I felt comfortable and I had all that I needed on this short flight.

Turin to Gatwick. The plane was  good time and  my lunch was one of the best I have  experienced on short  flights I had  some very similar  lunch on a flight on BA from Geneva to Heathrow, which also landed early with  no bags waiting when I left  the control. Why can't all flights  work like this?

Welcome to London ! I spent  some considerable amount  more time in Jan and Feb, booking these seats, and I had to pay over £70 for the privilege. BA systems  were not working  - and I had to get phone help - to find the  seats but at  a 15th attempt, I managed to  get the seats.  I like a window seat, mid cabin, in a  section that divides by 3. Our flight was called, I went to  our gate, with people behind me.  The bar code  for the bag 's issued boarding pass wouldnt scan. He asked his  mate who had other boarding passes, that still wouldnt ? His other colleague thought it might be my passport and went off to check. I made the point that I had been in the airport three  times so if there was something  wrong surely they could have contacted me? The colleague  went back. The bar codes still wouldnt scan and I heard one of them say 'they are already through'. I said I had booked a window seat for hubby and hoped the new one was. He said they were but by their numbers I could see they werent. Got on board.  That was someone already in those seats!! I found an attendant, who went off and  gave us two seats. No window, across the aisle from the loo. So all night we heard the loo flushing and got bumped by people waiting and falling about due to turbulence. That would be why they were free.  I did look to where my booked seats . There was a family of five in that  row that obviously wanted to be together. So though I was in  some different bit of the cabin that might have been premium economy,  so I was offered a hot flannel and some warm fizzy win in a plastic glass, I was certainly not upgraded. Doesn't matter if you pay for seat reservations, 6  weeks in advance. If somebody comes along later they'll turf you into cattle class. And to think I stopped using Ryanair!

Flew British Airways  to Helsinki -  Mumbai Heathrow -  Travel on A320  & B777W including  direct transit from  Finland to T5  to Heathrow. The A320 felt quite  comfortable in Economy  but the energetic and motivated cabin  staff made the  experience enjoyable. Later  on were very  happy to have the bigger and newer Boeing 777W  to the Mumbai sector, where the  first few rows  were empty seats and we were able to stretch  our legs properly,  which was a  real bonus. The  service was good  with the 2  complimentary meals served quite tasty and filling. In addition,  the cabin crew  were again excellent.  On the way  the flight was  better than 2.5hrs late out of BOM which would 've meant a missed connection at  a late Saturday  for the last  one out to HEL that night. Asked the BOM station manager to  get put on  Jet Airways since  they seemed to be on time,  only to wait  until the very last minute due to a fully  booked flight, but  instead got two seats on Jet to catch the connecting flight at  least the same  time The very  positive experience with BA on HEL-LHR-BOM  as well as  the rerouting that was carried out  by an exemplary  manner make us  appreciate British Airways. Very good experience  provided by experienced  & cooperative BA  personnel at all . Will fly !

We flew British  Airways from Gatwick  to Punta Cana in economy and flew back in  the economy. Was  this worth it? Well we didn't pay too much  money so probably  say yes -  how about. But other than slightly  more legroom you  dont get much! Same food as  usual as far  what I could tell. Main meal  was nice. Breakfast was not good  especially for an airline of this  high calibre -  a cold cheese croissant and muesli ! Only one tea/coffee round and  all they whipped round to collect  their empties. We  had to board  as the economy passengers but that's  a big deal. We had to pay extra to  take seats at  each side in  our pair. Otherwise,  we would have had to sit in a block  for 4 in  one middle which  we don't like.  We begrudged paying  that extra for  us to be  honest Captain was  friendly and informative,  and apologised endlessly for the short  time leaving Punta Cana. Crew were  friendly but not . Ours was an older guy  that had an  expression of 'I've  tried doing this a long time  and I'm pretty fed up with .' Whilst I  do understand this,  and if you  act like that  is your job,  we need to move on. The  plane only landed  hours late and having made up  so lot of  time en route would have been  in time had it not been for air traffic  controllers at Gatwick  which I can 't believe. Same  old awful out of date IFE.  Crew despite being  late were very  friendly

London Heathrow to Moscow. I have been flying to  Moscow with British  Airlines for a  couple years now, today I flew to Moscow and  my long haul  the Boeing 747 / Boeing 767 have now been  replaced by the A321 which is  almost as enjoyable,  however the seats  were very uncomfortable.  what disappointed me  as most was  the meal which was served, it  is a four  hours flight from  Manchester to Moscow  and all they  served was a  Breakfast Sandwich and  a Kit Kat!  I would have  hoped that on a flight of this length there would be a hot meal. The majority of the flight attendants were also very good at not making  face contact either  that was disappointing too. As a  British frequent flyer,  one would expect  the much higher  standard of service, it is a  shame there there  were not other  planes flying direct  into Moscow as  we would be using these in the future.

Flight to Zurich with British Airways. Check-in at T5  began with problems:  The check-in machines did not recognize my credit card and not my frequent flyer card. But very friendly staff at premium  flight helped and  checked me in without fuss. Boarding process rather messy, boarding staff gave different and contradicting instructions and organized  the chaos. Most  economy class passengers could board the aircraft first. Crew  very efficient and  quite friendly with rather typical BA  cabin staff is  laughing away when  chatting and having fun amongst themselves.  Being a client one feels bad to interrupt their conversation with a request.

The process in  Singapore easy and  quick The flight  was on time  with friendly and  helpful crew. Food  for breakfast was  tasty although not enough if you 're hungry. Seat  cleaned although was not impressed to find used refreshing towel of previous  flight in seat . Arrival at T5: business as  usual or even  easier - arrived  at T5-B, take a train to  Newark and walk  and walk until  your exit terminal.

British Airways has completely terrible customer service. I paid extra to fly  there instead of  any of the  major airlines assuming some sort of quality of experience. The flight is more than 2 hours delayed with no reasoning and they refuse to book customers on another flight that has room on  standby and is departing earlier 'because it is closed' and willing to make the customer miss their connecting flight instead of finding a solution to a problem. People are extremely  busy don't provide any information to customers and don't provide any sort of solution to make the experience any better. Avoid this airline at all costs if possible unless you have a lot of free time and patience.

Miami to London : with British  Airways and not  so happy with  my experience. The  plane is an impressive jet, but  without paying the extra for Premium Economy the seats are like torture. It is impossible  not get comfortable so sleep is  really just elusive  but impossible. Didn't  find that the  Premium Economy experience  was of any great value. Staff  friendly and food reasonable.

My first long  distance flight with  British Airways for  15 years and what a mistake! I flew Premium  economy expecting it to be on  level with its competitors especially Lufthansa or Virgin Atlantic - not so  much all. At  this airport, it  was over 1 hour to check-in;  it was no dedicated premium economy check in nor a premium economy  baggage queue at the gate either; perhaps the plane would be a little special? No, not at all, it was an  expensive Boeing 777  and had been designed to maximise seats at the expense of comfort;  The cramped space of the premium economy cabin with its 2-4-2 seating was comparable to economy and was light years behind the modern and  comfort of other  aircraft and sitting in a middle row seat meant you could not  easily squeeze past  a person next to you to the aisle unless you woke the  others up or  I took your  chance to stand  between them and hope you manoeuvred successfully. Stupidly I had thought that competition would eliminate most differences between . How wrong  I was - avoid British Airways on the Hong Kong route if you are flying on a Boeing ! My advise  was to check  the plane type before booking or  I will suffer an expensive 13  hour flight reminiscent  of over 20  years ago!

Traveled British Airways from Heathrow to Edinburgh return. Airport staff and cabin crew were polite and professional at  most airports. The return flight on 3 March was delayed due to  a technical issue. While waiting at  the gate the  crew approached the  staff explained the  reason for the delay and apologized, which was much appreciated. It was a good experience and I recommend BA.

Getting to London  ( via Singapore,  on our first foray into British  Airlines Business Class  ( World) was  never a success.  My bed was  made up of  the hinged flap and it was  through this flap  on the inside  person had to  move In my  case he was a large passenger  that had heavy  boots which had  no heels. I  was sure he  needed to be  because his leading  metal edge hit my exposed ankle  so hard. The  food was atrocious , the breakfast  buffet was grey  and inedible. As  breakfast was served , it proved  difficult to request a second cup  of tea or  water The early  lunch hours snack  menu composed of  small sandwiches with  water or no . The staff tried hard and  always had water  offered to me  if I asked  about it. But I had to find someone to  collect used toilet ry paper towels  to mop up  our lavatory floor.  As expected in Business Class. Uncomfortable flight and never  to be repeated by us.

Flew Edinburgh to San Francisco via Heathrow on British Airways, A380 Premium  economy and the experience was very good. Short connecting  flight from Edinburgh which due to  flying domestic you  were treated as  Economy Class so  having lounge access / priority boarding  between domestic legs  which was nice. A380 Premium Economy  (# 62k at the window) was excellent. Seat very comfortable, loads of space and great storage with bins at the side.  Nice warm towels and bubbles before . Inflight entertainment  was good, food good and well  served Food and  drinks kept coming on the outbound flight. Return (night) flight a different experience. Same seats but staff were hardly seen due  too a lot  of people sleeping, but there were  still lot of  passengers asking for drinks / snacks  etc and the  service just seemed to lack a bit. No bubbles on the way back. Overall a  good experience, very  happy with BA  and the A380  Premium Economy highly  rated and well  earned the extra.

Gatwick to Punta Cana with British  Virgin Flight was announced as being 30 minutes late so we waited in the departure lounge. It said a gate would be announced but the given time came and went with no announcement. So it was soon evident that we would not be just 30 minutes late. Eventually,  everyone boarded. It 's a full flight so no space for spreading .. Crew were fairly efficient but not that friendly and one lady didn't seem to enjoy her job. She was in such a rush to get the dinner and drinks served so she could rest, she kept barking questions at passengers asking  if they would like to drink etc. All unnecessarily stressful.  Seat  very uncomfortable. IFE about 10 years out of date. I don't expect a route like  Puerto Cana is top of British  airlines list for  having improved interiors  or IFE. Food however was delicious. No gin is a big let down though. Seemingly no vodka either.

British Airways flight from London to  Singapore on January 30th was perfect, a superb crew, helpful and chatty without being obtrusive. Cabin was comfortable, amenities, pyjamas etc of good quality. Food was rather dull, and not well prepared, perhaps 5-spice duck is not the best for an airline cabin. Wines and  drinks were of good quality, and  luggage arrived on time and in good shape. De-planing was efficient, and as expected in Singapore Changi, everything functioned well. The return flight  on March 3rd was not so good. The crew were sleepy and not particularly communicative; you had to  wait for everything, even the meal schedule, and it took ages for dirty crockery to be cleared up. The flight arrived early, which was good, but as usual, Terminal 5 was still asleep, inefficient and ineffectual. We did not use the usual immigration channel, but it looked chaotic, as was the baggage re-claim nowadays.

Gatwick to Marrakech. The British Airways lounge at the airport has been  empty for some time and therefore they are sharing  a paid for No 1 lounge.  Very overcrowded, me  & my family couldn't get in to use it. The check in  desk apologised about  it so they clearly know the problem. BA should inform the customer  prior to booking that they are not able to  provide the full  flight British Airways  customer services response  is to inform  customers of their  travel plans, not  so helpful. I  will not recommend  the business class short haul out of Gatwick. Save your money and  go with someone  else

British Airways from  Dubai to Rio  De Janeiro. Friendly  Cabin crew (ground ed a little  less clean modern ) Good announcements  of delay, and  an attentive service  during the flight.  I pre booked  buffet meal which  mean it comes far earlier than  usual wine and  cheese and without  too few additions,  like as cheese , crackers -  some staff returned  it with missing items. Not sure  to pay for  Economy Economy as  is not a  great deal of  choice other than  drinks and food.  Good selection of  drinks Cabin crew , and attentive  to juice and  water for the  plane A good  choice of tea  from a kit  was available.

Flight from Heathrow  in Chicago  delayed over three  weeks with a  series of excuses for Boeing 747-400  poor tech, faulty smoke alarm in  BA catering truck , fuselage door, engineers couldn't correct fault. BA would not let us off the flight. Captain came to  Second Class and  answered questions, which was a nice  nice touch. When we finally got  home food and  dinner service were  also mediocre. BA First Class seat is a very,  VERY poor product,  BA entertainment screen slow. IAD-LHR return  with the A380  is First Class. The A380 is a wonderful aircraft,  sadly let down by the poor  of First Class  seating and service,  Club seats are  only Business Class by modern standards, and the dinner service was inelegant and almost inedible. Crew on return  seemed impersonal, and keen to get  the dinner service ! Finally, BA Customer Relations (based in India) responded to the 3+ hours delay by declining my claim with an insincere form letter. They also don't appear to have a good grasp of English. Overall, the end-to-end experience with BA was poor, and evidently they don't care. It is far, far, short of a First Class experience.  That is what you get with a quasi-monopoly to  the USA from London. The only merit was the  new A380. Let us hope BA  upgrades their aged Boeing 747-400 with this aircraft, but  in doing so,  ignore the terrible  seat configuration of First and Club !

One feature of British Airways these days, is that its product can be so variable.  From this basis,  i had low  ratings of a recent flight from  London to Athens.  My plane was an old 767  and being phased out. However the crew were professional and attentive, food was good, plenty of drink available  in the inflight  entertainment comprised the  newest Star Wars movie. Given the  extremely low price  they paid for the ticket -  few complaints. My  complaint is the accountants that run  that airline and always chipping away  on the soft product.

Welcome to Accra  via London Heathrow.  Despite a chaotic  flight the flight  home was smooth  and comfortable seats which felt softer  on the newer  seats narrower. Food  tasted good, the  rest of cabin  staff positive and professional and the movie selection good. I was however surprised by the  different Audio selection than experienced on  earlier flights, especially concerning rhytmical music. 1.5 hour before landing a second serving took place.  This was a  pleasant experience flying  back and I do not hesitate in recommending this airline. Only concern  is the limited space for hand luggage - BA  has more strictly  ensure the hand  baggage of the passengers is within the limits given - way too  many passsengers ignored this on this  flight the return .

Flew British Airways from London Heathrow  via Munich. Generally excellent both ways except the poor seat space. Flights  first time, nice new / refurbished plane, cabin crew worked hard throughout. Food actually quite decent - nice breakfast out and tea on the way back. Sadly the seat space same as economy, when the guy  out front reclined I couldn't even open the paper, just about ok  for 90 minutes. So worth paying  that little more for against economy  if not too  much

Stockholm to London Heathrow was not  a pleasant experience. British Airways has  a good way  for reminding you  that you're flying  business class. The interior was tired and worn, and  the seat was . The legroom was inadequate for a short-haul flight.  The cabin service was variable, while some were courteous,  many practically barked  at you. One steward even tapped  down and gestured  you for a  seat  On the bright side, there seems to be a lot of generosity with alcohol. I have  had the fortune  by sitting in  line of three  equally loud and  very intoxicated ladies  and pressed for  the stewardess for more alcohol every  five minutes on  the flight -  who promptly obliged.  Maybe I should  of taken the advantage of this  generosity to make  my flight more bearable.

Welcome to Helsinki  - Check in  at T3 quick  security was fast  with security. I  found the BA  flight in T3  which is nice  being used by  other Oneworld airlines,  apart from being  limited there was  only limited food  in offer at  all Boarding was  easy and done  via bus to  a remote stand,  then the seated  seat 1A with  flat fee seat  available to me.  I was looking  forward to something  nice to eat  thanks to the  lack of food  options in the  terminal - unfortunately  any food offered was pretty basic  I say the  worst The crew  were friendly which  I guess was  good Arriving in  flight on time  to another remote  stand and bus  my bags where  loaded quickly despite  having priority tagging. Check in for  the return was  with security a  little slow but  halfway through I  went for the  boarding lounge which  is packed with  empty seating. I  tried to find  my seat in  the computer booth  with a coffee  and check my  bags Boarding was  fast with no  service and once  more a 10  minutes bus ride  to a packed  terminal to then  sit in the  bitter cold and  wet for a  full 10 minutes  ride via steps.  Then a delayed  plane departure service  arrived with a  breakfast followed by  some very basic  breakfast of 3  small sandwiches and  1 scone. Crew  were okay and  kept passengers updated  on the delayed  service Finally arrived  2 hr late  but with the  exception of an  extra Bags off  service which was  great Otherwise a  first class on  this 3hr flight , no in bound power, economy  only with middle  class blocked. Standard  Class offered in  class on other  airlines There is  economy class in  the European business  airlines anymore. Added  in the poor  service of the  new frequent flier , it's a no brainer for  me

Sent from EDI-LHR-PHL-LHR-EDI  to World Traveller. Outbound shuttle to  JFK was a  BA 767-300 in  premium economy layout,  free to bag  a 1F/1G using  baggage checkin. Cheery, friendly crew -  only problem is  with excessive hand baggage allowance permitted  by BA. Selfish  crew take huge  photos on board,  holding up the  space so everyone  carrying more modestly  valued items can't  take a look . Cabin crew  was stressed trying to move cases around lockers to get everyone sat ! LHR-PHL upgraded  - the rearmost group of two  rows on Row  3 on   a 777-200. BA  has now cheekily  increasing the cost  of these to  four each -  meant to be  around £33 like  in rest of  my cabin. Wisecracking captain over the  flight made the  flights a little  less entertaining -  had great crew, I could eat  the meal for once. Only thing  which went wrong  - the IFE  in my seat  was in the  last 90 minutes  into the flight  so I could  only view the  seat tracker. On  a side note,  do wish BA  could upgrade the  seats choice, they haven't changed it  from the last . Flight was  long time no ! Inbound PHL-LHR I reserved a  seat for £33 , but note  you cannot buy  any back row on the middle  aisle - reserved  with the crew.  We encountered severe  congestion between Nantucket  & Newfoundland, crew  had to rush the drinks and the meal service  as a result. . No apologies  to the pilots  about this which  BA usually does.  Similar problems about  excessive hand baggage exacerbated on the smaller A320.   It was the  cabin steward by  lucky coincidence that  booked us on  our outbound shuttle  one week earlier  than he did  meet us, and  ask us how  our holiday in  Newfoundland went! Otherwise flight was pleasant  and did what  was said on the tin. Overall  it was a  fantastic value trip . I booked  BA through BA  Direct and it being off-season meant  the total cost  of £940 (before  seat upgrades) including  two days car . One observation  though it that  everyone is now  apparent that BA cares little about its economy passengers  who now seem  to exist to  fill up the  cost - everything  really seems to  get geared around  attracting high-spending Executive  Economy members. Avios earning has been  sharply cut in  our World Traveller  business class, so  the discounted fare  now only attracts  two Avios in  a mile. Therefore  this transatlantic flight  on the East Coast of the  UK (which used  the get 3250 <mask> now only <mask> a measily <mask> Pretty pathetic <mask> I really only use British <mask> via LHR <mask> USA trips <mask> on the <mask> of using large widebody planes <mask> American and <mask> who increasingly use Boeing 757s) <mask> and their <mask> deals which <mask> hard to <mask> and enable <mask> instalments.

The British Airways  flight from Venice to Gatwick, seemed to be a brand new A320 with leather seats. Friendly staff and  the quick sandwich  and a drink. My gripe is that too many people bring cases  onto board, leaving little room for people who've paid for hold luggage,  can stow their backpacks etc. Same as on EasyJet.

Private Business Class  from Heathrow to Chennai. Check in  very painless and  taken to the  number 5 lounge  area was very  small but well  stocked with refreshments / food. Boarding  was painless and  was greeted with  ease The pods  both faced forwards and rearwards, so  sit carefully if  your like a  particular orientation. Seat  was comfortable. Perhaps  not being especially  tall or wide  but there was  lots of wriggle  room for me.  Film selection for  me was fine  - am not  into regular cinema . TV screen  seemed adequate although  my old eyes  well done with  it slightly wider.  Lots of drinks  / snacks outside meal time. Dinner  very good -  I had a  bowl of a  small starter and  the main. Breakfast  is ok -  eggs were solid  - but everything  was great. The  surroundings were pleasant.

Decided to upgrade and treat myself to BA's Club World. Check in at JFK was efficient. Fast track through to security was a breeze. BA's Galleries Lounge at JFK T7 was shared with Cathay Pacific and LOT Polish Airline. The lounge was spacious and clean. I was encouraged to have my dinner in the lounge as the service is a sleeper service. To my disappointmwnt, there wasn't enough food left although the selections were good but not the best. After my pre-flight dining, I decided to have a shower. The shower rooms were clean and amenities available on request.  The Club World seat is around 20 inches wide which was very comfortable for the quick 5 hour flight back home.  One was greeted by my name by the cabin crew who were friendly. IFE option  was the same as flying economy clasd.  Menu was handed out a along with Elemis amenity kit.  The meals were good but portions could be better. Upon arrival in LHR, bags were delivered on time. I was told  I pay a visit to their arrivals lounge but I didn't bother. Overall, I would fly with BA's Club World product again. Seat and bed was very comfortable and well maintained despite the ageing aircraft. Cabin crew friendly and enthusiastic. Just one thing that BA might want to consider is the food portions because their portions are baby sized portions.

Flew with BA in economy class  of their third oldest Boeing 777-300ER.  Transportation was delayed due to the  delayed arrival of . The aircraft is showing its age but the interior is clean. Flying on this B773ER was with  the new economy  Class seat pitch  of 31 inches  that is bearable  on the 8  hour flight. Meal service was delayed due to turbulence. Choices were cheese and omelette or  chicken grill, I went for the latter which was good although portions could be better. Second meal service was just a sandwich and a sweet. Staff professional and interactive with passengers. IFE with  a handful of  major Hollywood films.  Food choices could  get better. Tip:  Choose A and  C seats due  to the IFE  area restricting your legroom.

BA Airways domestic  flights only from  London Heathrow to  London and basically  your only option  on this and  similar routes, check  out at T5  as my Frequent  Fly status is  likely to be  cancelled however I still have it  in a few  extra weeks, so  bypass the fast  track security and  used the BA 's north lounge.  Board at A5  and on to  the full flight  and on time,  then board service  again for a  longer flight. Drinks , a snack  and arrival almost  at time. Return ed flight with  my bag drop  delayed a bit , otherwise used  the BA lounge  after boarding a  Boeing 767, departed  full time and  had early service , with a  coffee served with  breakfast although the  staff missed me  completely and appeared  confused when I  first asked for  another coffee. It's  a okay service  can be expensive  if booked at  little notice but  gets you from  B to B WI

I flew back from JFK to LHR and not  my greatest flight  had ever been on. The seats were uncomfortable, poor  cargo room for long haul ( electrical box under  seat infront) unedible food. Poor selection of onboard entertainment. The only good thing about my  experience was the staff! My outbound flight was booked  through BA but operated by American Airlines - so much better!

Flew British Airways  via Zurich to London Heathrow to  Paris International and  then Outward flight from LHR to Accra fully booked,  my B747 cabin  looks a bit shabby, seats are worn and tight. The crew however  made up for it with a  great attitude, food was pretty good  for economy class.  Flight back was  postponed by over 24 hours due  a a busted  luggage brake. Communication  at the airport  would be better but BA offered  accommodation and meals during the waiting . After the problem was solved the flight was  made the next  day and was  good I even  had to lie  down and sleep a few hours  but the cabin  had only half ! What really  amazed me was  when the BA  Passenger Service managed  the request of . After a  number of days  BA contacted me and transferred the  requested amount. I  therefore really must commend BA for  this straightforward service.

On to London  from Helsinki. The  cabin readiness, and  attitude of the cabin crew reminded  of why I 've appreciated BA in the past  and continue to  do so: they  know what they  promise they will do, and do  them well. BA  makes me happy  and pay the  little extra for  a bag and  one small meal,  and I get  treated like a  passenger - and  have an exit  window seat as  the tall person,  since there was one and I am 6'6".

London Heathrow to  Southampton Full load, flight 30 mins , economy pax carry on lugagage  sitting in club cabin overhead bins and upsetting a  member of club  cabin Purser did  not care. No flight tracking system on this new looking aircraft. Seating in club cabin is more like Easyjet nowadays. Very cramped. No reason  will fly British Airways club in the future and  I have lost my business until  flight configuration and service improve.

Bucharest to London Heathrow and the worst thing above all are the  British Airways business class seats and  the shocking lack of legroom. Cramped into a space  it is less than many economy seats. And this was Club Europe! Poor breakfast - one slice of bacon, half tomato a few tinned mushrooms and an omelette so overcooked it was grey inside. Seat itself  was comfortable and staff were good. Toilet waste bin had tape around it and so  the sack was used for rubbish instead! Not a good flight overall.

Washington to Heathrow with British Airways and I have to say that the IAD ground crew and inflight crew are fantastic. I sprained my neck just 2  hours before departure and was given the option to pre board, which made all the difference. The flight itself was amazing - the A380 is just like a rock in the sky, I didn't feel a thing. The seat comfort on the upper deck in coach is more than adequate - in fact it reminds me of economy plus on United. The premium economy is more like domestic business class on most  other carriers (older style business class not the new business first). The major downside - as I write this in the middle of my trip - is the ground staff at Heathrow. They are hard to  spot if they even exist. I'm in the middle of a terminal to terminal connection, still wearing my brace - and when asking about gate assignments and better options for seating, the best I got was a brusque "sorry  is all there is." When you see someone limping away from your  seat - at least ask if they'd like some assistance getting to the departure lounge.  I know that with United, they may not offer club access for free, but you can at least buy it and I have found their ground staff at Heathrow far superior to the UK's flagship carrier - unfortunately.

First time my partner and I have flown British Airways for some years and we will not be returning after our flight from London Heathrow to Cape lla I booked the flights several months before and had to pay £40 to pre-select our seats both ways (£160). On both outward and inward flights my entertainment system was  not working. Attempts by staff to  fix the system failed so I had to cope with two 12-hour flights with no  assistance On the flight out my table was broken. When I raised this with the crew, I was told that a  fellow passenger must have "bounced a child on it." Dinner was very good but breakfast was appalling. There was only congealed  toast and bacon. When asked if  we could have  the Continental equivalent, all I got  were a stodgy choc chip muffin and some fruit juice. The plane looked generally tired.  I had to share one inflight magazine between us. The pillows and blankets were a very uninviting brown colour. My partner's entertainment system did work but she  did have to get a stewardess to use a spoon to release the handset from its position in her seat. I certainly wouldn't pay BA's rate for Premium Economy again.

British Airways from  Amsterdam to Rio  de Janeiro via  JFK Weren't invited  into the lounge  at MAN due  to a rather  late check in agent. The Concord ian at LHR has seen better  days - ordered a bacon sandwich  that arrived far too promptly and  looked limp and  rather pathetic, so  worth it! Champagne on boardng was warm as was the water. Nuts  were pleasant. Seat area was genuinely  nice and had  even been thoroughly cleaned with remnants  from the toiletries  scattered between the  rows from the  paying passengers. First  line of food  was available, which  is unacceptable in  First Then a  third row of  seats just stopped  moving so my seat was in  a permanent 20 degree incline. Staff  attempted to get them working but  to no avail.  Seat ended being  bumped up, partner  in row 4,  me on row  7 Nice start  for our honeymoon,  thanks BA. Cheese  selection on the menu had changed and was offered  the scrappy piece of paper to  mark new selections.  Staff upgrades are  common on BA , First and  Business cabin had  in my reckoning,  4 paying passengers  and I'd say  about 4 staff  crew (all of whom appeared after  we had been pushed back from  the gate). These  sorts of crew are showered with  gifts throughout the  flight Personally I'd 've preferred to see some of  these full fare business class passengers  along with staff  and thankful for a seat, but  people seem to  think it's acceptable for staff to  be in First.  Unless you're on flying on business  and hoping for an upgrade, I'd  say you're chances  seem pretty remote,  but of course  you know one  from the crew  of that flight! A pretty poor  day all round , proves that  the once 'worlds  largest airline' has become so complacent  now they can't even get it  done in First . Is it  no wonder the  Far East carriers  were showing the  Rest of the  industry how to  fix it!

Glad I have the option to  call them a zero. Their customer service is abysmal.  - Was flying home from Amsterdam with my family. Booked on premium economy, which was around $700 pp  higher than economy.  Last night before  my early morning flight I received a text saying flight was cancelled.  Went to the  gate No BA employees were there. Could not get  them on the phone. Woman from another airline booked us on Delta in regular economy. Have spent since  then trying to get a refund of the $700  pp extra I paid for premium economy. Finally got the refund. Was  800 pp with no explanation. Customer  service people are  very sorry but they can't help me. There is no higher level  will take this . I had to go on  their separate form  and request the breakdown to see  if they calculated the refund. I expect more out of British Airways,  or I will never fly them .

Flying British Airways  from Los Angeles  to Amsterdam via  Newark Heathrow r/t  the Club World.  Personally prefer the  Emirates over the  European which was  expensive We used  both Qantas FC  One in LAX  & Galleries First  at Heathrow. Both  worked great. Service  and board all flights top notch  customer friendly. Food  & drinks good,  especially if the  service was a  bit on the  well done side.  Interesting that you  have pre-select meals  out of LHR. Wish you could  try this out  of LAX as . My complaint  about Club Europe . I know  they block out  my middle seat,  but at 6'2"  my legroom is  good All in  All great value  on the money.  Just picked up  two trips on  board during their  Economy Class sale  one year. Next  stop FCO, and  then DUB.

Our first time flying to Dominican Republic and found the best deal with British Airways and the benefit was it is  the direct flight from Gatwick to Punta Cana. On the outbound flight, the plane was half empty, so it was nice and spacious. The BA Boeing 777 is an outdated plane which has  being used in  its fleet for many years and has not had a refurb I  would say in about 10+ years - I suppose this is why the flight was  so cheap. The staff on board were friendly and  accommodating The seat pitch is large so I could  sit for 9+ hours comfortably, the seats despite the plane being old, were comfortable and not showing signs of wear. The entertainment system is what shows the age of the plane, one of the smallest screens in the industry. They are very small, and the anti-glare screen is  hard to see from you need to keep adjusting  the brightness of the screen throughout the movie. The range of movies was good. Food was ok nothing special and not really a choice.

Back to Cancun return. My first  experience using British Airways and it  would be my  favourite My main issues were the dreadful cabin crew. The were rude  and poorly turned  out  I was unimpressed in the standard of the cabin it  looked dingy and tired looking.

It got off  on a good  start with a  nice dinner in  a Malaysian Airlines  Economy Class lounge.  It was looking  up to my  next flight on  this Boeing 787 -  so  - so, I  was from Singapore  on LHR to  Singapore when I  boarded the 787-9 A on this . The new  version is very  loud indeed -  The so called  aircraft - New  York is not.  The trumpet they  never listened to  before and this  latest version was  going be the  new pace setter.  - The FAs  on the route  were great and  food was adequate.  My chicken satays  followed by prawn  with mango salad  is fine. The  wine was also  excellent The cheap  and nowhere near  to Krug as  offered by other  airlines in 1st . The usual  boring stainless steel  seats and boring  plastic and chinaware  which we have  now get used . The seat  are definitely more  comfortable than the  747 and A380  First Class; its  wider and smaller.  With bed mode  - it is  like sleeping on  a park bench.  Very hard. The  curved "island" design  and the table  with retractable dinning  table is worse  on the 777  or A380. When  lying on your  stomach it digs  under your back.  This seat's narrow  opening becomes very  uncomfortable You have  a be a  passenger to get  in and out  to the "compartment".  I am 6 ft tall and  quite overweight. I  do not sleep  much at all  as compared with  the A380 flight  I took to  London last month.  The TV screen  is larger and  bigger - which  does not lend  well to a  nice dinning with  me as on  the other aircraft.
