Not on a  slight angle as  if slightly facing  away from the  cabin The AV  camera is small  but overly complicated.  This is no  window There is  more window blinds  like on the  other aircraft. The  window can be  set to "black"  or so you  get two black  faces staring at  you through the  windows BA seem  disappointed when it  gets to a  low end 1st . I will  miss this plane  the future. A  penny dropping disappointment.

My wife and  I flew British Airways London Heathrow to Athens in  our Boing 767.  This flight was  about half full. We had paid extra for exit row seats, which  is ideal. There are no seat back screens and the ones on the cabin roof  refuse to work, this was not  the problem, not a great lover of overhead screens showing stuff you  normally would not  watch if given the choice. Left and arrived on  time

From Heathrow to  Manchester with British  Airways Outbound flight  was delayed by  two hours. Email was received on the day of travel. It did take 2 calls  to the airline  and establish if one could arrive . On the first call, there  was such a  poor understanding of  my question that  the operator thought  they wanted to  cancel flights. Fortunately  we were cut , as I think the call might have continued  through the rest  to the day.  Second call was  more successful and  the direct answer  was given, no  mater how unwelcome.  Printing your own  bag labels was  a new experience  for LHR (I 'm not a frequent air traveller).  A sign of the times perhaps , I did  get the impression  of going through  a self checkout  of a supermarket. Not much to say about bag  check off. It  is neither efficient  and inefficient, just  another linear series  with a few  tasks performed by  people doing their  jobs The young  lady at drop  in said that  their delay started as 10 minutes  at the beginning  of the week which had turned  into two hours  on Friday. At  departure gate, I did wonder why those with priority  seats moved to  a different seating  rows - all  within 3 metres . I suspect  I need to be seen receiving value for higher  ticket prices, because  others will of  never get there ! The flight was just about . My video  recorder did not work and despite requests to 2  ground crew this was not rectified  - well I  just ignored. Fortunate, as the film  or TV choice  is poor.   We do not  eat airline food that much. There  are plenty of food outlets past security to get something decent to eat. Never really  tried the wine. Beer and spirits  easier to get  on Return flight  was only made  easier by the  noise stream reducing  the flight time by an hour.  So the flight was just about  - Did not  enjoy the food  but I had  ordered salad from  the outlet at  gate - good ! Flight attendant  thought it looked  nicer than what  we were serving.  The seat in  front of me  is broken so it reclined further  then it should. The only solution  suggested by another  attendant was to  straight up walk  forward a bit,  to stand at  my back. Whilst the broken seat was not the  fault of the  woman in front, she did not want to be . The attendant  stood there waiting  for me to derive a solution. </s>

Seattle to Tel Aviv via London  with British Airways. The food was  about average and the cabin staff service was average.  Our seats are  clean and are OK as long as you do  not have a  situation where someone  has to step  behind you or you have to  stand over someone else. The inflight  audio system uses  the dual prong  built in for  the inflight entertainment , so I  needed to use  Bluetooth headphones which  are not comfortable  for long periods  over time. After  waiting outside of airport security for  a long layover at LHR and coming back through the security process,  we tried to  put my wife  bag in her  laptop bag which  we has used  during our travels  with many airlines  around the world  no question -  but was already  full on our first leg from Seattle. Her bag fit in BA's  standard gage frame,  and the BA desk agent did  nothing like how I put it in. Apparently it  appeared to not  quite fit, but it can only be placed in  its gage with  the straight up  / down motion ! After complaining  that her requirement  is unnecessary, the  ticket agent relented in a huff. BA also required  to I pay  to chose my  flight after buying  my 7000 USD  first class ticket. I am a  Delta MVP Gold  Member so I  could fly BA  on a partner  airline and get  a credit, but I cannot book  it without paying.  Having to pay , my seat , and the  poor luggage screening in LHR makes  it unlikely that  she will fly BA again.

Gatwick is not  our first choice but for Naples with British Airways it is the only choice so we reluctantly booked a return Club  Europa ticket for a treat. Check  in fast and friendly, and fast track was amazing, we were the only people using it. The BA lounges at Gatwick have been closed  so we were sent to the No 1 lounge which BA is  using instead. To say it is less good is an understatement. £8 for a glass of champagne (whereas free in the old BA lounge) is just ridiculous. The atmosphere is more Weatherspoons than Fortnum and Mason and the crowd  are noisy and chaotic. If what we were told  were true (the  lounge will be  open until next ), we will be avoiding it  next time and  only avoiding BA  for that case. Food was small portions and service bordering on rude from the barman who explained very impolitely that they do not serve diet drinks. Once on board the crew were welcoming and friendly and  their afternoon tea adequate but not exactly filling (disappointing after the rubbish  that were served in the lounge).  Our flight from Naples began with another abysmal lounge experience. Windowless, crowded and with very limited food and drink, again not worth the bother. Crew again were wonderful and very chatty and friendly. New layout A320 and we had booked 1 A and C. Totally unacceptable seats. No  seats so right up by the main boarding door.  No carpet, just a rubber floor and during boarding I was constantly bashed by peoples bags and during the flight my feet were trodden on by people  heading for the toilet. Nowhere to stow my single bag because everyone else had two  bags more and had used all the space, had to stow mine  2 rows behind delaying my disembarkation. Dinner was nice. Baggage last off  my belt despite being priority tagged.  If it not been for the crew on both flights I would have thought the  money was wasted  on Club Europe. Lounges rubbish, possibly  The worst two lounges I have been in Catering on board -  not bad and  treated nicely Crew - The only reason I would  recommend these two flights Baggage service - Disappointing. Seats-  Yes Like the empty middle seat but front row was awful.

An enjoyable short flight with British Airways from Heathrow to Dublin, the  flight was initially  extended by an hour due to a baggage error, however this did not affect me nor the quality  of the flight, the cabin was  very nice, seats  were nice with good leg room. Service from crew was satisfactory but could have been better, they could  of smiled a  bit more and gave a friendlier  greeting like other  airlines such as easyJet. The food was basic for a short 45  minute flight, wasn't  really anything exciting . I had a packet of  wheat salt crisps which were nice and some orange juice. The staff  seemed happy to  serve me. Overall , enjoyed the flight and will  try flying with British Airways again soon

Heathrow to Toronto with British Airways. Fast check-in and security. Galleries Lounge very crowded, poor  food offering and the furniture and toilets were not very clean. Boarding started on time for a 1705 departure but was suddenly stopped when it was announced that there was a technical problem and a new departure time of  1800 was given. This was later amended to 2100 and later to 1500 the next day : no details of the technical problem were provided. It is extraordinary that BA do not have  any better resilience plan for these incidents when they  are at their home base -  and a lengthy delay is unacceptable. Hotels/meals etc were organised fairly efficiently but not once was any offer made to re-accommodate on other flights until I made  the fuss (due to commitments the next day) and was reluctantly booked on Air Canada  by 0900 the next morning ;  they had empty seats in both J and Y . Several e-mails to BA Customer Service about this have yielded the usual stereotypical and  negative responses - they have ensured  us I will never travel with BA again, we do have a choice.

Toronto to Heathrow,  our last flight  for British Airways.  Immigration and security  check and quick  service lounge was  great and the  food provided for  my dinner was tasty and perfectly adequate. Departure about  20 minutes late  but this time  it made up  for a 5hr  45 min trip.  Overall comfort and  convenience pretty much  the norm for British Airways Business  flights : no  seating around the  cabin and the  LCD screen did  NOT work as  expected Breakfast has  improved slightly ;  the fruit was  crisp and edible,  eggs warm but  a bacon and  cheese muffin was  quite cold. Arrival  was fine.

British Airways outbound flight from London  DC to Marrakech  was comfortable. Being  the Silver member  I was able to choose the  seat in advance  (+ overwing) which  provides adequate leg  time for this short flight (3.5 %). Meals are  usually just confined  to sandwiches, all , plus tea  and coffee, plus one other drink  or snacks. There was plenty of room for luggage  inside the overhead . Return flight  was a bit  crowded on boarding,  and our priority tagged luggage did  NOT receive priority !

We travelled from  Amsterdam to Lisbon with a connection  to London on  May 9th 2016. Our flight was  cancelled - which does happen - however we had a to run  & catch our  next flight resulting in our luggage  still following us - upon arrival  at Lisbon no luggage. We were  given our luggage  by the local  baggage handlers who contacted British Airways  and be on  the next flight  3 hours later , we were given the option of waiting or  having it delivered to our place  o residence. We had no option  but wait since  my keys to  the residence were  inside the luggage.  After hours we came to claim  my luggage and  unfortunately 2 pieces out of 3 showed up. Again  passing through the  local baggage handlers  have now informed  me that our remaining luggage would  only be shipped  till next morning,  4 hours later , again they  gave us the  options of delivering  the luggage unfortunately our keys were . We had no choice but stay in a  flat in Lisbon  to wait. I was disappointed but  unfortunately things don't go as planned ? We contacted  UK Airways upon  our return to  advise them of the experience. The response was less than friendly this is why my review. They replied saying they are  solely responsible for  the luggage. Really? When I purchase my tickets I got an email  saying make sure that luggage specification  matches luggage allowed by the airline  in question. My understanding with our ticket purchase in  regards of luggage  is more than  10 Kgs per  flight and 1 Carry on. Where did I go wrong.

Welcome to Geneva.  An efficient check in, the plane was a newish, clean and comfortable  flight (better than BA's old 737s), pleasant crew, OK food for the time of day, good value and it arrived on time. The odd  problem is that BA does not currently have its own lounges at Gatwick but uses third party lounges which are not as good. This is dependent on BA switching terminals but nobody had a timescale for  this This needs sorting out!

Great first time  flying First class  with any airline. Joined the flight  without a connection  and didn't do  the check in , boarded without  reservation Met at  my door by  cabin purser, greeted  by name and  shown to my seat. Masses of space, very comfortable  yet private, given  it is semi-open. Not a huge amount of storage  on the seat  - my case  goes into my  small locker at the front of  the seat. My  partner and I  sat in 4E/4F  at the back  half the cabin,  front of the  flight deck). No  help from the  cabin Choose a  different seat if  travelling alone. Being  another day flight,  I didn't have  seats made up.  The cabin is  comfortable yet contemporary , elegant. Pre-departure  menu included Grand  Cru Champagne. We  then chose the  dinner menu option.  Chef didn't like  my lobster starter  but staff substituted  the course from  the a la  cart menu. Food  tasted outstanding and  every pairing worked . To be  that bit fussy, the steak was  good to the  extent of being  the IFE was  good although no  TV to watch . The screen  is attached to  one side of  the seat and  needs to be  adjusted for take off and landing  when in Club  America which is very irritating. First  on the plane,  although that doesn't  matter much as  landing at MIA  is always a  mistake I've flown  with for many  years in other cabins and cost  difference is evident , Their Club  Class is a joke compared to  their long haul competitor but First  is still a  class leader. I  was very pleased  to fly BA  and relieved that  they still have it when it comes to cosseting in first class.  We paid for  this flight as part of a  long itinerary but took the train  to London to  Frankfurt to start  the Club Europe  flight there to  Amsterdam and then  business class back  from Paris on  United Airlines. This  is significantly cheaper  then flying directly  from Heathrow. Still not cheap but  totally worth it , looking forward  to the next . My recommendation  remains for First  Class - the  BA cabins are average at best,  but I will  not be flying  it regularly.

British Airways business  flights from Edinburgh  - Las Vegas return via Heathrow.  All crew on  all flights were very helpful and  attentive Part of  the business class cabin on the  plane is located  in the upper cabin with 20 seats and two  cabin crew. The  cabin configuration however is just odd. The window seat  facing backwards and  the street faces forwards. There is  one privacy screen, but if you are not travelling  with a friend  and family member you'll be looking  for a complete  privacy for the duration of your  journey The cabin crew have to stretch over the person in the aisle seat to  order drinks and meals. If you have a window  seat you have  little option either but to climb over the person in the row behind you if they have their seat in flatbed  seat On arrival  in Las Vegas after an hour  of so wait at the carousel with at least a hundred people including myself didn't get their luggage.  Instead we all  continued to wait  on line whilst  friendly British Airways staff dealt with  a very tired and annoyed group of people. A $200 gesture was  offered but this didn't really compensate for the inconvenience. Return flight with  free check in and great service .

From Heathrow to  Manchester and I  am sorry for  Qatar Airways. I 've just flown  2 of my  worst ever flights with them as  they have fallen  into the depths  into being second  class against far  better competition. The  meals at T5  airport should be  fine but we arrived last night at 6pm to  get almost all  the food offer  gone so it's  that or a  hot potato and  chips then! So  far nicer to  save £20 and  buy a decent meal from one  if the many  stalls in T5 ? Then onto  a plane which  got tired. As  if bits of  seats 4 of  our seats were . My wife's ! My sound  system worked in  my left ear.  And really dirty  seats (and no  smell at all).  And late food ... But to  being fair, and  as a change,  my stewardesses weren't their usual BA  rude style but  were good and  very polite. But this is business  travel and it  certainly doesnt feel  of it any  more I try  to support British  Airlines but Emirates  is cheaper and  better

Milan Linate to  London Heathrow on  Monday the 6th.  I arrived at  terminal 5 20  minutes early. Polite  and smiling cabin ! As meal  time being late  and we received  a sandwich and  white bread with  salad with complimentary  water The aircraft  was in very good condition with  a new leather  interior and the  interior lighting that  was left on  is blue light ; same for  all washrooms with  the nice touch given to floor  by a parquet.  Our experience with  a ground staff  on Linate, left  nothing to be  desired as the  team members seemed  very annoyed with  the job and  were so helpful;  when we checked  the bags, they  could give us  a further information about where are  at the security  checks nor about  which gate to  go  T5 , very friendly  & helpful. T5  was very clean but a bit  too crowded. Fast  and efficient baggage  transfer

My British Airways  flew from Barcelona  at Heathrow on  22 January, seated  in 28F right  near the back.  Everyone was chockers.  I were delayed  taking off by  one hour due  of problems with  the Air Traffic  Controller testing a  different computer system.  BA had onward  service to Hong  Kong which was  pretty tight, told  the crew, they  boarded promptly, and  I was met  outside Heathrow with  this luminescent envelope  that gave me  entry through security , just made  the connection). Onboard  BA crew were  friendly and attentive,  my snack was  probably some sort  a chicken roll  and a very  light coffee and  fruit cake. I  think it was  the last flight  for the day,  but it had that lovely end of term feel  to it, everyone  was relaxed despite  the delay. I  know people are  little bit hard  at BA, they're  no flash but  with short hops  and they get  the job done.

Really good service  on a packed  Qatar Airways flight  from London to  Manchester Crew were  good Food a  beverage were well matched. The business class seat is  bigger now, but  you still find  it very comfortable.  Film selection was  another treat with  the good number  of independent movies.  will definitely fly  here again.

An excellent flight from Atlanta to London, with good food and drink,  tons of space  from a helpful cabin crew. Plane was delayed by bad weather in London but the  crew tried to  change things around. The IFE system was one of  the Airways newer versions which was very good, and it's a shame it is not available across the British Airways fleet.

Doha to London Heathrow via Bahrain. As a loyal British Airways customer for 20 years, I have noticed  many variations in the type of flight attendant service and meal/beverage service provided on longhaul . BA's longhaul Club World   class is showing its age compared to the competition, but I like the seat cushion. Having to jump  over someone's feet  to access a window seat is not ideal. AVOD quality varies depending  upon the type and age of the aircraft, and storage space for  food items also varies. Service onboard  looked good from BAH to LHR,  but meal service was good, despite cost-cutting at BA being evident in  previous years. The washrooms were reasonable, but not up to the standard of competitors. The flight was on time, and my bags transferred at  last to my next flight to  Dubai USA.

I received a  text at 3am  that inform me  of my British  Airways flight from  London to LCY  will be delayed  for 1 hour.  Married with a 5yr old, and  still staying at the Zurich Airport . I decided  the arrive at  BA check in  2 hrs before  the new departure !! Unfortunately, the  BA staff at  my check in , informed me  that the flight  Was Closed and  needed more check . I knew  it was incorrect, and asked for  Flight Supervisor, who  said that the flight, being at  a 1 hour late departure (2.5hrs ), it turned ), is not closed! We were  checked in of  a BA -  please train your check in staff  or fire the  incompetent ones. Luckily,  being a very  experienced flyer, I  am not going  to accept the  advice of the  BA check in  that suggested we  could fly in the evening?

London to São Paulo Guarulhos. British Airways Boeing 747's looks very old,  outdated and in need of an  urgent update. I heve flown 8  times in the past 2 month , in their Boeing 747s and all of them  are in the same condition. I  sincerely hope that the maintenance in  the vital systems are better than inside the aircraft,  which one can see in the  above pictures taken from my seat in the upper deck in my last flight. Also the entertainment system  is very limited.

Following several bad  encounters with British  airlines over the  previous year I  took them for  a short hop  from Ukraine to  the UK. On  arriving at KBP  i wasn't offered  priority access (Silver  & FF). I  was a good  checked baggage only  check  The  crew onboard was  slow but friendly.  My meal was  available on this  flight which was  from Kiev, tasty  and the price  well paid. Arrived  at LHR early  so we arrived  at a terminal  early and weren't  taken to the  airport as is  normally the case.

Welcome to Heathrow,  for the first  and last time I will fly  with British Airways.  Their aircraft from  a stand looks  new but soon  before we boarded you could tell  immediately the aircraft was at least 30 years old  and it was  very dated on  the inside. My  trip home was  horrendous - yes  this does happen to every airline, but they allowed  me to board  a plane and there was an  apparent fault, the professionalism of BA  staff was appalling.  ®

UK Airways flight  from Glasgow to  Birmingham Heathrow under  route code IB7519.  Handling was prompt and a very  enthusiastic welcome from  our crew. The  plane left on  schedule and arrived  safely at T5.  Every seat was  full and the  breakfast served was breakfast which was  quite good. Several  courses of coffee  & tea served.  Another good flight.

We took four  flights with British  Columbia last month - Johannesburg via  London Heathrow to  New York JFK  and return. On  arrival the service  seemed excellent. At  these three airports  it all went ! With BA the unknown is  the age of  the plane that  you get. The  cabin was excellent,  very clean and  comfortable space - I was on the upper deck;  a B777 also good with reasonable  seats and good , the B747  - so -  I had been  good and the  plane - the final leg -  Newark to JFK  looked old -  still reasonably comfortable  and the entertainment  very aged -  almost the size  of a large  postage stamp -  a poor picture. Really does depend how much the  flight means to you I guess.  I also tried the special menus  of LHR - business quality food  for which you  paid a small premium. Well presented,  delicious and a  nice treat.

Thanks to a  flight change from  0000 to 00.05,  this brought forward  the departure by  almost 24 hours,  which very nearly  missed our flight  schedule from Rio , Janeiro to London. The check-in  counters were crowded  out by Team  Emirates athletes returning  home from a  swimming session and  so were relieved  we get the  full track treatment.  Our first/business lounge  in GIG is  typical of the  worst we've been . Our seats  in 1E/F and  only marginally better  that the first  floor seats on  any 747, although  still far off  the standard of  Qatar Airways competitors.  We also suffer  from being near  the galley and  there was one  team member who  spend much of  her night talking  away to her . 1A and  it seemed to  being occupied by  airline employees and  there was far  too much schmoozing  going on. Service  for the whole  is reasonably good, although none of  our food on  our menu was  actually available. This  happened rather feebly  evident on the  journey from one  lounge to the  next The IFE  operated reliably and  our large screen  has a much  better resolution than  the 747s. Overnight  the temperature in  the cabin was  far too high,  which resulted in  very uncomfortable sleep  under the duvet  that the pyjamas provided. The toilets  in the 777  are ridiculously small  but weren't well  stocked during the  flight Breakfast was  a usual affair,  including an atrociously  bland omelette. Overall,  the flight was  good but not  really first class !

Welcome to Calgary  by British Airways.  Do not let  us use avios a to upgrade  even though I  did plenty. They only allocate 10%  to cabin occupancy  for this - shockingly poor. You don't expect your national airline to scupper your honeymoon ? Although there was plenty of  frustration in the  cabin the fact that only 10%  were allocated (and  some seats can  get empty) they  should let you ! We paid  the tickets regardless in the cabin below, but still  not allowed to  ( I would have used another  ticket if I  booked in advance  and will do  the future).

London to Singapore  by British Airways, and the plane  arrived 90 minutes late due to technical fault with one of their aging 747-400 that found itself minus two wheels stuck  on the runway.  Economy class was full. One would think BA would put themselves out on this route given the competition from Singapore Airlines. Wrong - the champagne was lukewarm  ( is often the case). The amuse bouche taster was ghastly. Some sort of couscous and tasteless. Appetiser of sushi style salmon was very nice. Soup nice but lukewarm. Salad was forgotten by the miserable female FA. Mains of sea bass was very good. My wife had the same - but the beef main. She was very complimentary of the meal. White wine was luke warm. Solution - the miserable FA came back with a paper cup of ice cubes and dumped the lot in my glass. Brilliant. Wash bag of freebies was cheap and tacky. The seat - well I am very critical of this design. So much space is wasted with the "island" console in the middle. The designer of this seat should find another career. Seats already starting to show wear and tear. Why British Airways opted for a canvas material rather than leather is a mystery. In summary, the A380 is fabulous. Slept for about 5 hours. Great flight. FAs mostly  were fine. Terrific landing by a very skilled pilot. All in all ; it was okay - but not overwhelming as First Class should be.

The British Airways outbound flight from  London to Hong Kong was on a 3 year old A380. We sat near the back on the upper deck and  were very pleased with how comfortable and smooth it was. On the upper deck there is a cupboard by the window seat which gives more space to put your coats and also doubles up as a shelf to put your drinks. The 5 year old  Boeing 777 on  its return leg was far more cramped. Also the video screen was faulty and it was difficult to  concentrate on the screen. The crew on all flights  were fine but nothing special. Just performed their job but never really seemed to go out of their way.

A slightly stressed  our flight from Oslo delayed nearly  2 hours due  an engine problem. Crew were caring and assured us that bags were  above board. Food  arrived and wine . CSD informed  passengers that a  snow storm was on the way  that we might  become stuck in  Oslo as their flight the next night had already  be cancelled. Newark was deserted and  we were there in 5 minutes. Overall superb flight with British Airways  connecting London to  Newark

Mexico City to New York JFK : This is a totally different . There is no conventional lounge,  rather there is  no 'pop up'  with copious champagne  but little food.  Take and take off lasts all  about 10 minutes so no time for more champagne.  A crew then  play around with  you before the  next stop in . In the  evening you clear  the customs here,  in the evening it is just a bore. The  seats are wide  and fully flat  so very little  difference between each  of a pair.  Service is on  seats which are  that bit limited in choice and  so no moving  seats The food was not even  half BA standard  which was lukewarm.  For 3 crew  and only 38  and service was  excellent All in  All difficult to  get over standard  BA service unless  there is a  very good price , getting to  the City is .

I was originally booked on a United Airlines flight from London to Boston, connecting through Washington Dulles, but this was cancelled because of the snow in DC. United rebooked me onto British Airways to complete the  trip to Boston. Without a doubt, BA is one  if the worst airlines I have flown on. Upon arriving at check in, I was told that I could only check in one bag, despite being allowed to take two bags on United. United said that I would be able to travel on an equivalent service with BA. The check in supervisor at Heathrow informed me that I would have to pay £65 to bring the bag. When I complained said "it's not my problem". I asked if they could call United to clarify  my bag issue, but they refused, saying "we don't  really talk to United" - in the end I didn't pay and will get it sent at a later date. The onboard service was very disappointing. The  food was barely . The staff were loud and abrupt, providing the bare minimum service  whilst yelling across  every cabin at each other making the whole journey even more unpleasant. The inflight entertainment failed multiple times, and passengers started to be reseated because of the problem. The maximum volume was also too low so it was difficult to hear the movies over the cabin noise, and  I am not hard of hearing. It was disappointing that there was no onboard WiFi or personal device entertainment. British Airways seriously threw away an opportunity to convince me to fly with them in the future.

London to Dar-es-salaam  from London /  London Yet another dreadful experience with  British Airways! Why do I travel with them? This  morning BA advised me that my  original itinerary was  changed because of a cancellation by  their codeshare partner Qatar Airways to  the Dar-es-Salaam leg of the journey, which would give  me a 24 hour layover in  Cairo before connecting  me to London. In itself, that  is not an issue, but BA  tried everything possible to wash their  feet of any responsibilities for their obligations under EC Regulation No 261/2004  - required by  Regulation 14.2 -  something they even post on their  Website It took  another day of calls by my  booking agent, and  many hours of  discussion with an  airline his supervisor, and the office  in Manchester before  I agreed that it was their  problem Their solution : a rerouting  for my journey  to Nairobi with  the extra flight by a non-code hare partner that cost them more  than the cost  of overnight hotel  at Doha - something they refused to consider. Go figure! Never again with British Airways.

Although been impressed with British Airways in the past, today we had a very different experience on our  flight from Edinburgh  to London Gatwick. We checked in online and arrived to drop off our bags 45  minute before the  scheduled time and  where met by an extremely moody  checking in lady. She radioed another member of staff  to ask if we were to be allowed to come on the flight in an extremely moody manner,  only to have us not admitted (even though 45 minutes is the amount of time to arrive before from their website).  Luckily we were  admitted and with  the last scowl from the staff left the desk. We got through security rushing as we thought we must be really  late only to  find the plane  stop for an  eternity

Outbound British Airways  service from London  to Rio de Janeiro demonstrated the difference a decent  hotel can make to a flight.  All staff in Club World were  all male and  white and delivered  generally excellent service.  British Airways seating  capacity in Club World is looking increasingly outdated, but a less than half full cabin meant that one  felt less bothered  about one's neighbours.  Pricing was reasonable,  although it was surprising how quickly  our options ran out. IFE had  another good selection  of films, but  the resolution of the screens is poor. No queues  in border control and priority baggage handling meant that we were in our taxi within  15 minutes of leaving the plane.

Gatwick to Male, and just when we thought the British Airways business class offer could get no worse, we checked in to find that  all BA lounge was shut and  our alternative was the number 1 Traveller lounge where for both first and business class,  tickets has to be purchased. Needless to say, no advance notice of this was give,n and by the admission of their own staff  British Airways management just don't care what impact this will have on  customers who have paid a great deal of money  to fly premium class. Based on our recent flights with BA where we have witnessed penny pinching devaluation of the business  class experience, to the extent that there is now no comparison with other similarly priced airlines. Their cavalier approach to customer care may result  with others like us saying last time with BA ever!

My son and I flew British  Columbia from Glasgow to Paris on  Sunday 7th January and returned on the 11th. On out outward journey, the London flight was cancelled, so there was a  delay on with our Paris flight. We did get  to London, the staff were great at helping us transfer to the 5B terminal to get the flight to Paris. But I noticed that by the time we would get to Paris, we would have missed the last shuttle bus to Disney. I mentioned this to the crew, who were very good at helping, realising that I was travelling with a young adult with learning disabilities. During the flight, one member of crew kept me updated. THere were some BA managers onboard as passengers.  Once we landed, he came back and told me that one of the managers would get us through to the taxis and explain to the driver where we were going and ask for a receipt. (My  memory is minimal, so I'd have been lost) The manager told me to keep our  bus passes and receipt amd claim  them for the taxi. My son and i had a great weekend, got home and a couple of days later, I claimed for a refund. Alas, the computer said a big fat no. It was just bad luck that we'd had to  switch flights I  know that it was a BA manager who told me to claim and it wouldn't take much to  just find out who flew on the flight. But still, no. Our  airline won't pay  back because we didn't have a long enough delay!  So legally, BA may be in the right, but morally, well. Even the insurance company thought there should be a bit of leeway. After all we were delayed due to a cancelled flight - their fault. Usually BA are brilliant when we fly with them and I cannot fault any of the frontline staff. Just that blooming computer. So I am 80 euros down on the  refund and 32 euros for a transfer I couldn't use.

From Heathrow to Cape Town and the British Airways bag drop and  boarding staff service was great. Onboard,  an evening meal was fine, but  the inflight entertainment choices are very poor. Films, TV  and music choices are limited. Cabin crew were courteous , served one drink and then  some - but no more service after that. Overnight no water was offered, we had to keep getting  up to go and ask, and  we only got  cups measures not bottles. Breakfast choice was fair but the food was awful! Luke warm gunge, cheap cereal, tepid tea - truly not worth bothering with. I believe this is usual as my brother had similar experience a month ago flying business class from Mexico. I will think twice about booking British Airways again . I have  less choice.

I was the  first leg of  the British Airways  journey on BA056  in Johannesburg to  Newark Heathrow on  27 January. While  the majority of  crew onboard where  helpful and friendly,  this was the  behavior of one  individual within the crew who was serving my husband  that left us both feeling extremely incensed that we  had paid a  lot of money to basically be  served by a  completely petulant crew member. She is  obviously in the wrong job because  she had zero  personal service skills and treated us  like if we  are a major  annoyance to her. British Airways may have some great crew who go  outside of their  way to make your flight a  very enjoyable experience,  however if you  were unfortunate enough  to experience the  following negative behaviour, this makes you anti booking future  business with this company. Is this really the way  it wants its customers to feel? Being a member of cabin crew  takes a range  different skills -  if you present  yourself as a  truly amiable part  if the team  giving your passengers a great flight , you can  walk away knowing  you have fulfilled  your part, instead of putting so  many energy into  doing so little.  After all, isn't  it us, the  people who choose to fly with  you and support you as an airline. Check in crew at Johannesburg could also do with training on  professionalism and smiling  - instead of  the greeting, no  thank you's" and blank faces.

British Airways return from Glasgow to  NEW York via  London on A321  to Boeing 747-400.  The domestic flights are nice enough,  good legroom and  comfortable seat, drink and packet of  biscuits or biscuit . LHR to  go both ways  in the 747-400, the crew friendly,  all the seats  very comfy for  the 7 hour  trip - they maybe difficult on  a longer flight but for this . In flight  it is very  pleasant Very pleasant flights and would  recommend

Flew British Airways from Kuwait to  Dubai via London Heathrow return, out  28 December, and back on 10 January. Although the  aircraft were full,  all cabin crew  was efficient, friendly and professional. I  had World Traveller Plus on the  return legs, and was more than happy with the  good choice of in-flight entertainment and the food. When I headed out to the galley to grab a single-malt scotch mid-way  on the flight to UK, no  problem at all.  On the return flight, I had the best fillet of beef I have ever been  fed in an  airplane and the red wine served  alongside it complemented  everything nicely. All aircraft were in  excellent shape: the announcements from the flight deck kept us informed, and  both flights and landings were smooth.  My transit through Heathrow Terminal 5 was hassle-free (although I did deliberately choose to fly  to Sunday both ways), and my  husband made it  home with me : the connecting  journey on the return flight was  shortened to just over an hour because of the late arrival of the domestic flight).  One of the best sets of flights I have ever experienced: in  fact I have written to BA , thank all  their crews involved.

Vancouver to London with British Airways,  Premium economy seat 12A. In flight  heating was inoperative and the food  tasted awful. On the way out from London the food was very good - why  such bad from Vancouver? On the way out thre were trim bits loose inside the cabin giving the impression of bad care. I don't  think the extra fare for premium economy is justified unless reasonable food is provided in both directions. Flights were on schedule, but on arrival we had to wait at London T3 for more than 20 minutes for a gate.

Edinburgh to San Francisco via London Heathrow. Flight was great until I found out my  bags hadn't made  their 1 hour connection. Was promised  by customer services  and before that  the 1 hour  flight was fine  and all flights were via Heathrow T5, this was a lie. EDI to LHR sector  was delayed slightly,  bags made the flight but the bags didn't. I was promised by ground staff the  plane would be quicker to the  plane than I , again this was a lie. 24 hours later  those bags haven't  come and are  still in some office somewhere in  san Francisco. Other than that I have no idea where they are.  British Airways  Customer service line is next to  useless with employees that do not  understand English and read from a  script

Frankfurt to London : Efficient and  quick check in, security queues were too long at  London Bus transfer  station terminal to  try to board  the small plane.  Was significantly delayed  getting to air  cargo control, and  so passengers had to wait inside the small Embraer , which wasn't  very pleasant. Seats are a bit  bigger than other  light aircraft. Snack  and a variety  of drinks were  provided by nice  cabin attendants. Very  long walk from  gate to UK  immigration control, greeted  two long queues at immigration counters  and 1 desk  open for non-EU . Inefficient baggage reclaim given I still had to  pay for my luggage after the  long immigration queue.

An early morning British Airways flight from Gatwick to Salzburg, at 06:45. Train connections from  Queen Victoria are infrequent at this time. Train station is in South Terminal while British  Rail check in counters at North  Terminal Very crowded shuttle transfer for  passengers but check in was efficient.  A crowded terminal ! Flight delayed  owing to fog  but arrived on  arrival at Salzburg.  Cabin interior was old but clean. Breakfast box was disappointing as the sandwich looked like it had disintegrated,  no good service from cabin attendants. No jet bridges at Salzburg and bus transfers from  terminal to terminal building. Very efficient border control and baggage reclaim.

Miami to Manchester via London Heathrow, and from the first flight on 28th December until our return from  Manchester on 12th January, our flights and issues with British Airways were dreadful. Zero customer service, change of planes, awful food, rude Staff, and lost luggage - British Airways made a lasting impression on our Xmas holiday. My family and I have been fortunate to  travel with other major airlines and never experienced anything like this. We spent extra money on upgrading our seats to Premium Economy and the service was appalling.  we would not recommend BA to  others and felt so strongly about the lack of  experience we felt compelled to write this blog.

Bangkok to London Heathrow on British Airways. I have lived in Thailand  for 4 years now and try  and go back to the UK  At least once  a year to visit family and . Normally, I  fly either Emirates  with Manchester or  at Heathrow with  Thai Air. This time around, BA came up with a fairly competitive price. The aircraft wasn't in particularly impressive shape and  their entertainment unit  looked quite outdated  so didn't work  within the first 2 hours of  my flight. Once it did work,  its screen was awful and very  slow I can't fathom why BA are using outdated  entertainment systems when rivals such as  the Emirates and even Thai Airways  have much more .. Inflight service was okay for the most part. Regular trips by the staff for  help in the  initial few hours,  but this certainly  slowed down afterwards. After using the call system to get the attention  of a staff member, I was  politely asked to  switch it off and asked if I had a problem. No problem,  just would like a drink please.  The alcohol (apart from wine) had  ran out. I'm  never a massive  Brit but do  like a couple of whiskey and cokes on a flight. Also, there was no Wi-Fi,  no charge points  on mobile devices.  That is again  in contrast with Emirates, Thai Airways and EVA. All in all,  I have to  agree it was  another disappointing experience. I won't be using BA again  on my next  trip to the UK.

Hong Kong to  UK Heathrow with British Airways. Efficient check in at the Airport Express in-town check In (train service from town to airport). Flight delayed but smooth boarding. Clean cabin, cabin attendants were very helpful and willing to serve. Dinner was  OK with a good cup of English tea afterwards. Cabin was quiet for a good  while Entertainment system was OK, choices of films (mainly non-English ones) can be expanded. Cup cakes was offered as mid-flight snack. Breakfast was horrendous. As always very long immigration queues at Heathrow, especially when the flight  is delayed with many other long haul flights landing  before my flight.  But good value for money.

I booked an extra legroom seat , payment was  made and the  booking confirmed. When  i checked in someone was allocated  seats and in  the seat I  had paid for.  I was given  one without extra  thigh room. I  am advised to  complain to Customer  Care which is not easy via  email or online.  I filled in  the form on  request to get  the £10 back  and I will  receive a response  reply in 28  days As you might have guessed  its is not  my £10, its  rather the fact  that I had  spent the time  and ensure my  booking was as  comfortable as possible  despite the "I  will give a  shit attitude of  the Airways once  a mistake was  made  British  Airlines needs to  raise its game.

Flight to London  again on January 4th and a good experience. Full flight on old but comfortable Boeing  737 Efficient service  and cabin crew. Snacks (shortbread, popcorn or crisps offered with coffee, tea and water. Landed on time despite  slight delay at AMS due to  lack  captain  kept passengers up to date. All  In all a very good experience.

On evening departure  of BA28 from  Hang Kong to Heathrow, plane fully  booked (pre-Christmas season)  and all classes.  First seat was 2K, the senior male purser presented himself and addressed  everyone with my Christian name -  I did not  really had the  impression that this  is part of  the nice intimate  atmosphere During the  flight I found  later that the  members of the  female pax in  first class preferred  a more formal  introduction and were  introduced with their  religious names. The  man offered the  usual welcome drink  - I gladly  took and soon  my face turned pale : the champagne was almost  as warm as  my cup of  coffee His apology  was prompt, but  very late. They simply had no  other drinks on  offer and needed  over an hour - or 30  minutes after takeoff - to have  the respective drinks  on the right  taste level. British  Airlines did not  do this service  up properly. Maybe  it was in , maybe it  was simply forgotten.  The plane had  landed in Hong  Chau about 5  hrs earlier, so  there was enough time to take  stock of the  shortage of beverages. The remaining flight  went ok -  good hosts in  a predominantly male  management team, food  is sensational, but  that was after  takeoff so no complaints in this respect. Seat was  and had a  decent sleep during  the 12.5 hour  without breakfast options  on arrival ahead  of schedule. So  was there a  right to complain  and to give  BA low marks?  Here we are  here about first  flight in a  leading European airline. The product has  to be perfect,  all part of  the game in . Serious irregularities  resulting in harsh ness of the  airline For me  it means that  that was most probably my last  longest distance flight  with BA. No marks on inflight entertainment because I  needed the sleep !

Club class on British Airways between Cape Town and London. Boeing 747-400 has the flat bed and while  overall quality of the cabin was inferior to the A380 between London and Johannesburg, it remains one of the better business  class product. Check  out at the BA counters in Cape Town would have been a breeze, was it  but for the unexpected six hour delay in the departure of the flight. The upgrade from Premium to Club class made this inconvenience almost bearable. However,  Cape Town airport becomes like a ghost town when all flights but  one have departed. BA's Executive lounge in Cape Town is spacious and  serves good food and Cape wines. There are free internet and computers and a friendly service, even at midnight. While comfortable, BA's Club seats on the 747 can do with an upgrade. They are configured in a 2-4-2 layout, with one passenger facing forward and the one adjacent facing backward, at the side row - the middle row has two forward and two backward facing. This is something I never understood -  two facing backward because it just makes no sense. The seats are separated by a hard plastic cseparator that moves up and down with the push of a button. Theoretically, the air hostess should walk behind the front-facing seat to serve the backward-facing passenger at the window - however, on my flight the air hostess insisted on leaning over me, pushing the button  that lower the separator and serving the accross my seat - after about three times this really got annoying. The problem is that if  we don't raise the separator, you and your fellow passengers stare straight at each other from a distance of less than one meter. Food was satisfactory, rather than outstanding. . The starter choices were poached Norwegian Salmon with marinated prawns or an oyster mushroom salad. Main courses included  choices of chicken with Port, Drakensberg trout, pasta or a cold main course salad of za'atar beef medallion. I chose the chicken and it  was OK, but inferior to my mother's Sunday roast chicken. There was a selection of South African Chardonnay,  Mont Blanc and some good reds. Breakfast was a choice of a cheese omelette, continental or a traditional English breakfast with bacon, sausages, mushrooms and potatoes. Arriving in London, I took the supposedly fast track option - a big mistake. In theory this is supposed to expedite your progress through customs as a Club passenger, but in practice it was a disaster -  you were only two or three border agents present <mask> any time and it took 45 to 60 minutes to get through the fast track immigration - I could see group after group of fellow BA passengers clearing the slow lane long before I took the next few steps forward. BA arrivals lounge was <mask> welcome relief from the hustle and bustle of Heathrow Terminal 5. All in all, not a bad experience, but having <mask> on these seats quite a <mask> times over the past 15 or more years, I really think <mask> is time to either upgrade the Club cabin on the 747's.

Just returned from  Orlando to London  and Miami, that we booked direct with British Airways.  Our outgoing flight  is really good.  Then a totally  similar story on  the return flight. We were redirected to check in  with American Airlines  but we had  no internal connecting . Although we  checked in shortly  when the check in opened, the  airline seating was  available meaning we had to pay  extra for flights we believed we 'd paid in full. Additionally my  ticket was split ! The AA check in would not allow us to check into the long haul  flights from Miami to London. After  this we discovered we had been checked in but not allowed to  swap seats. I've  spent a week  seeking an apology  to BA customer  relations and I've had several stock responses and been  met with the feeling that they  just do not  think about their customers. From their response it is  quite clear they  may not see AA as part of the same group "one world alliance" I used  too be of  a view that  I didn't mind  spending a bit more for BA  as their service  was really good,  and unfortunately they now seem to  offer a budget  friendly service. I  write this purely to warn other families to be aware of the danger of booking with British Airways but having a  return flight with  AA part of the "one world ".

London to San  Diego with British Airways was a pleasant experience. We left with a  brief delay due  of the traffic  at Heathrow (although boarded on time) but landed almost on time. We  flew an A380  and my seat was somewhere in the back on the upper deck. Enough legroom, entertainment  was personalized and very easy to use. Although it  is a day-flight we got additional to the usual blanket and pillow,  and small toothbrush  to paste. The  tea was good (served 2 times plus snack) and  so was the  red wine they  served us. I  love the complementary drinks, alcoholic or  not The crew were nice and  professional and careful  with our needs.  Many of them  are even wearing Santa Claus hats making Christmas feel like home. I  would fly them again, not only for the tea  I serve.

Copenhagen to London : a very full plane, with British Airways staff not limiting cabin baggage. Some people  travelling with 4 bags + overcoats led to overloaded bins. Crew frantically trying to move bags to any  small space in and around seats. My nicely pressed suit jacket rammed into a gap by a staff member ended up like a J-cloth. People using their  hands throughout take off and landing despite announcements to the contrary. Ran out of drinks and ice, so no drink on a 2 hour . Where have the standards gone?  Have raised this with British Airways but no satisfactory response after 4 weeks.

British Airways flight  to London to  Los Vegas reasonable with just enough  noise from the  flight crew to satisfy. Upgraded on  later flights to  First Economy. Awful  flight with crew  who spent their  days in a  corner discussing their  good times in  the Vegas. Dreadful  of broken seat  while the entertainment  center froze. Not  sure I'd ever fly British Airways  unless there was no choice!

British Airways from Bangkok to London Heathrow, and BA is really slipping down the quality %. With these  very old Boeing 777's, business class  looks pretty poor. No usb sockets,  poor IFE screens and power sockets  which cannot be used with British . Thin contents for the amenity bag and tired seating really shows up against the competition.

British Airways from  Birmingham Heathrow to  Cairo took off over one hour  early due to an unspecified technical  issue Economy section full. Seats generally  around 7 inch  which provides a  wide selection of  entertainment and music on demand. Food was some kind of chicken curry , a salted chocolate caramel mousse plus a roll and cheese. Close  on arrival they  offered a cheese croissant plus additional  cheese Alcohol available  for free until around Egypt. One serious cleaning issue  was seat 34c where the side  to the computer  screen looked like it had never  been cleaned hence  the detritus had built up. Pleasant crew, just one extended message which  mentioned non safety  related which could 've been omitted.

Welcome to Business Class on our British Airways flight  via Madeira to London on December 28th, paying a  total of E105 per person. Disappointed  by our reaction. Our seats were  a comfortable business class as I  described but exactly  exact same as  the uncomfortable economy  flight seats behind us, distinguished only by a curtain defining where economy  flight finished and business started! British  airline standards are  low

London to New York JFK with British Airways, and abyssal customer service. Onboard the flight  should be great, and it's the website and shoddy call centre staff who let them down. However, this time the onboard  food was as bad as the ground service. Food was poor. I was in the upper deck with only 5 other business class passengers, and yet my  seating choice was gone. The TV's didn't work in 2 seats -  I couldn't be  persuaded to try a third and  opted to just get some sleep. The staff insisted on forming a cliquish huddle and were speaking so loudly I couldn't  just sleep with ear plugs in.

British Airways from Houston from London  arrived in premium economy. The seats could recline a lot and were quite large. However the TV screens  are beyond small. It looked like ones from 2002 were better. There was virtually no difference in food to economy (except you had more than two choices), and champagne was served before and after takeoff in glasses. But after 10 hours the  seat becomes very uncomfortable as you cannot lift the armrests away, because the tray table and remote are stationed in there.  This made sleeping hard. Don't fly premium economy British Airways, it's disappointing.

I flew British Airways from Bucharest  and London Heathrow return, with A320 , A321 on ! The service  very good, meals okay, good staff.  Our return flight was 100% full  and we were forced to check  in hand luggage,  this was rather  annoying The flight  to London Heathrow , not on time. It had a 30 minutes . Overall, the  best experience for  an amount of money required on  this route.

Avios points flight to London from  Toronto for Christmas in Business class. Slow queue for check in though  - flying just Christmas there were a lot of  passengers and luggage to be fair.  Our BA club  cabin at Pearson remains well run and clean. Too few toilets and a really unimaginative wine selection being the only issues.  Just the usual slow service taking coats (I had to ask), papers, drink, menu amenity  etc - very random and fragmented delivery by an assortment of crew. The meal service was fast with  coffee served first.  An evening meal  was average at best and overcooked,  half the tray  arrived with the starter and dessert  served on it with the hot entrée dumped on the tray and that was it. Had to ask for cheese and a second coffee. Across the piece,  I can see the cuts and  cost saving British Airways are making to business class. Even now -  my two posh chocolates have been replaced by a unwrapped chocolate finger,  one flower in  all toilets, no drinks offered after dinner. The list goes on! Breakfast  is nothing special with an egg  with bacon muffin which is at  best edible (unlike the previous bacon baguette.) Reasonable entertainment . Crew were the usual indifferent long haul "I'm here as a favour to you ", with little rapport or effort  at delivering a  world class service! I think the main problem British Airways have is  a dated cabin ! The ying yang seating in it's day was innovative and one of the first  had flat beds.  Now crawling over a stranger to  reach the isle, being bumped by people and carts if you're on the aisle, and a lack of  aisle space mean  that the BA  cabin is way  superior to Air Canada and a  few of the middle eastern carriers.  Passenger loyalty is  constantly being tested and with the constant devaluing of the Executive Club benefits including mileage  for availability and cost I am now questioning my loyalty to British Airways.

London to Mexico City return flights on British Airways  for me and my partner using Avios and an Amex companion voucher. The flights were on time, seat very comfortable, entertainment decent, and the food and drink  were of significantly  better quality than its Club World equivalent. Cabin crew on both flights  were excellent.

Las Vegas to  Vegas with British  Airways was awful.  We were in  business class, travelling  to 2 young children and wanted  not put them  to bed on  the long flight,  so we had  booked a row  for 4 seats  so we could  fit one child  each adult. We  check in at  economy class which  is delayed, as  we are busy  they have moved  2 economy passengers  from the first  class line to  pick up things.  When we are  back one of  my seats has been moved, the  staff are unsure  due to why  but will rectify  this immediately and bring my boarding  passes to the  gate An hour  later I go  through the check  in desk as  none from BA  have been bothered  will come -  i am then  told actually your  computer is broken  and we can  help and its  not my problem.  The seat is  near the middle,  so it means  having one child  alone on the  side of the  cabin or the  2 children together  leaving me and  her husband alone  at other side  in the cabin.  Any other options  but British Airways  is not prepared to ask anyone  about swap seats  as we can  put 2 together  at different rows.  They kept the children together behind  us obviously meaning  we could not  see the whole  flight and my  husband was alone.  Then the lamp  above my childs  seats malfunctioned and  went on full  tilt the whole  whole flight keeping  one of them  isolated - the  children were unable  too override the  problem - seriously.  BA did offer  to seat my  children at the  rear of the cabin in a  different seat, alone surrounded by strangers  unable to move  her to the  middle which would have left my  children completely alone.  Checking out outward  flights from London  to Vegas one  on our seats  had malfunctioned and  my tv etc  shut down for the entire journey , nothing the  airline staff could  fix then either.  And they are  on planes! We  are still waiting  on a response  form British Airways.

Munich to New York JFK via London in Club  Class and Premium Economy. After flying  up front on long haul trips for the last 15 years I  picked up the  courage to give  Qatar Airways World Traveller Plus a try. First Galleries lounge at LHR was good and had my fill from the very  best food and drinks. Upon boarding I was disappointed to find that the cabin was yet to be retrofitted with the new (allegedly) much  older product. Despite its age the seat was comfortable but the only good feature is  its foot rest which is quite  helpful and helps  when trying to  get some sleep. IFE has improved in the last 12 months with about 10 current films, although the screen is dated both in respect of size and resolution. As a Gold Card holder I expected a bit more personalized service, there was no recognition of  Gold status at  all Crew were experienced and delivered a good service despite a full cabin. Food (Tandoori Chicken or Beef Cheeks) was excellent and virtually a Club World meal - in fact it was better than previous Club World meals I've  enjoyed on recent trips. All in , good value  on money when not paying full  price and given that Club World is so mediocre, Premium Economy is adequate for flights 7 hours or under.

watch out for  possible diversions at  night We arrived  to Pisa on  time circled for  20 minutes and  were diverted to . This was  because of fog  in Pisa and the fact that  there was no  emergency landing system.  I subsequently found  the the ILS  have not been  working for some  days and will  not be working  in a good  condition yet. Fog  very common at Pisa in the  winter We could  be a last  ditch diversion because  of unexpected factors.  Although there have been frequent diversions . British Airways  gave no advance  warnings that there  might be trouble. We had a  long wait at  a deserted Genoa  airport and no  British Airways or  British staff were  on hand to  greet or offer drink or food.  Finally one lady  came to show  us to a bus which took  me on a  12 hour journey  towards Pisa. We  had a 12  hours day with  little to eat  or drink. Our  only complaint is  that with advance  warnings from BA we would have  provided water and  food if we  had known what  would happen. In  that event, BA  could have done  better to provide  us refreshments.

British Airways flight from London Heathrow to Glasgow. Shabby cabin, lacklustre cabin , flight deck crew whose announcements were mainly less than informative. A crew which appeared to be going through the motions with little enthusiasm , as little engagement with passengers as possible. Some time after the cabin crew had closed all of them, the overhead locker above my seat fell open  BEFORE the plane even moved off stand at LHR.  On descent into GLA it opened again and hung  there for several minutes and I  felt tempted to  go and close  until I made  the passenger across  the aisle aware in case the bags fell out on top of him. Eventually, the  flight crew member whose jump seat faced up that aisle got up and closed it. We should have been sitting upfront given our ticket class (part of a longer trip), but, after service issues with BA and a long journey prior to  this flight, we couldn't be bothered pointing that out. Just another shabby experience to add to the other disappointments with regard  regards service and lounge provided by BA on a long return trip involving two other airlines, who were streets ahead in all ways.

Malta to Gatwick.  I have gripes  over British Airways pre-flight charges (I had to pay £30 for checked baggage and £21 to change seats), but in my case the total  value of the flight was only  marginally higher than  my equivalent Ryanair flight, and the  increase in comfort  and service is  worth the extra  Premium Cabin was  nice and the new slimline seats were quite comfortable.  Everyone was upbeat and polite, and  had a snack  in a well-packed lunchbox. I wish  BA would offer inflight wifi and  power outlets, but  as all BA  planes are this  nice and only a bit more expensive than Ryanair/easyjet  I will fly  on them more often.

Flying to Dublin via London after  breakfast Was excited as on British Airways A380. What  an disappointing flight. The service was terrible, very young and inexperienced cabin crew. Had to wait ages for them to answer  a bell when I rang it.  Food was awful,  our partner didn't  have a bread roll or milk with dinner. Seats  got bigger in this plane but  very uncomfortable. The worst of all  was the luggage , 23kg! Other airlines allow 30kg in Economy. What  poor performance from  the airline when we were 3kg ! Also having  to pay for seats if you want to book them is disgusting.  We will never  take British Airways again.

That was my  second time on  UK Airways flying from Tel Aviv to Philadelphia via . The seats were as comfortable as economy class can be expected  should be, though  i would've liked  my headphone jack to be on  the front of the armrest rather  than on the  back (which led  into the jack on my headphones  getting bent and  broken Food was  pretty good. The  best part of  the British Airways  experience was the AVOD system. Flights were on time except for the expected delays at  JFK My only  real complaint is  about taxes and fees that British Airways charges even with award tickets ; it almost  eliminates the benefit  in using an  award ticket. All  around British Airways  is better than  other airlines, but not at the  expense of Iberia  which I flew  all my way  from Tel Aviv)  but probably well below Emirates, Singapore and the world's  biggest airlines.

My family and I had a very good experience  traveling from Nice to Montreal via London Heathrow. Both  airlines landed before  ours and staff was very helpful in both flights. Meal quality was  better than expected and we were given seats with enough leg room, which appreciated because we were travelling  without an infant too young for  our seat.

Bangkok to London  by British Airways on 3rd January. This was most probably the worst  experience I've had in 15 years.  Flight crew were very poor, only seeing them when serving meals. No one came round  for drinks or snacks during a 13 hour flight, if you wanted anything you had to go to the galley - and then they were unhelpful, I was only offered a bag of crisp! The seat was very narrow and the remote  to the entertainment was on top of the armrest. Food was below the the standard I would expect from a national airline, small portions. Main meal and a pice of cake. No offer for a second cup of coffee. Overall a most unpleasant experience, I would not recommend British Airways to anyone.

My partner and  I traveled British Airways from Gatwick to Punta Cana  Friday 29th December.  Despite checking in , and paying an extra £45 each way per  person to reserve seats after already paying over £4000  towards our flights (wasn't a major  problem and was expected), we discovered that selecting our  own seats was fine, but our return seats had only 2 seats left both on opposite sides of the cabin. Being  the nervous flyer I was not up for sitting  on myself for nearly 9 hours  and we decided to try to discuss the issue at our baggage  dropped off point,  a gentleman working behind the drop off was as  friendly as he  can be, but  also said that we would have to raise the issue when we left Punta Cana,  and that it  was likely for us to be  able to do anything because remaining  seats would be  used for business  and first class ! Getting onto the plane we were the first  people to be  picked up to board before economy which was good , getting onto the aircraft we  found an extremely dated plane, with  display screens the  sizes of my iPhone and worn tatty seats with not as much leg room as other airlines we have flown premium economy. After take  off we were given a meal , the only  meat being chicken or beef which was okay, flight  staff then offered  free drinks -  after we had  no drinks gave us at the  appointed time two  glasses of sparkling wine which we hadn't asked for , we were  happy with, and thought that perhaps the service would make up for  our dated flight.  Until then 5 hours into the flight we had  seen absolutely no staff whatsoever and  we soon discovered from overheard conversations that a lot  from the onboard staff's family were on board and  they were all  staying in Punta Cana for 5  days before flying home. One member  on staff appeared around 6 hours into the flight , gave their  parents and friends  champagne from first class - and  waved past everybody . My partner  immediately asked a staff member for 2 glasses of water and we were told we  will have to walk to the back of the  economy cabin to  fetch them. When  we arrived at the back of the crowded economy cabin we discovered  the staff fast asleep and had  to wake somebody  for water. 1 hour before descending  passengers were given tea and coffee and sandwiches which were fine. All  passengers in our  seats looked half asleep, with hair all over the place. Considering this  is a 2pm  flight you'd have  thought it was  another evening flight.  I arrived in Punta Cana at 7pm extremely disapointed  at the poor  food and the dated plane we <mask> endured for almost 9 hours.

Back to Johannesburg , with British  Airlines This was  the first ever long haul flight  I see my  sister get married  in Zimbabwe. I  went in for  a big shock , not a  bad one. The  seats and room  was not really  that different to  low cost airlines  and this was  another 11 hour  journey - jammed  in like sardines  you got no  food Freezing cold  feet all the  flight back from  London and again  so cramped that  if the person  in front of  you puts the  food back, you  can eat your  dinner I used  another connecting flight  from Bulawayo which  flew with South  Africa Airlink and  even though it  was only a  4 hour flight,  the food was  much better and  the plane far  too comfortable. A  really poor experience  with British Airways  spent GBP 4000  extra for the  four of us  just get there  to back. I 'll never be disapointed with Ryanair  or easyjet again. British Airways   are trading on  a name only.

I usually fly  with Asian airlines , EVA, Korean,  Chinese and accustomed  of their very  nice service and . This was  my first flight  on British Airways  to Vancouver to  Dubai via London.  We selected it  irrespective of price.  My experience was  excellent Plane was  the older B747 , interior showed  its age. IFE  was outdated. Seat  quality was fine.  Flight crew not  complaining between meals.  Airport food offerings  are ok. Had  2 hours layover  from Heathrow. British  and ground staff  efficient and pleasant.  I might fly  British Airways again  as equipment is  comparable to A380  and Boeing 787 , price is  comparable to Europe.

Had to fly British Airways London to Delhi, due  for a rebooking . I had missed my connection from Frankfurt due to delays by United inbound from Houston. Ground staff most helpful, lounge impressive. Cabin crew  nice and attentive, food was good, unfortunately, the seats were a bit outdated for 2015 and desperately need to be upgraded.  Flight was delayed by a bug in the entertainment system, which was fixed promptly and the Captain made up for lost time. All in all, it was a good flight.

Paris to Los  LA via London ! Smooth departure at MAD and  Paris and transfer at Heathrow. Lounges at Madrid Barajas T4 and Heathrow T5 excellent, but  crowded and a  little frayed at the edges at  Los Angeles. No  problem with baggage or delays. The Boeing 767s used  for London and  Paris are so old they're almost  black with LED  LCD TVs and  brown leather seats, but comfortable, spacious  and clean. The A380s seemed almost  like the seats are a little  narrow but comfortable,  while the inflight entertainment is excellent.  Good amenity kit and simple but  excellent quality food.  Quite nice that they serve traditional  British things like brunch and afternoon  coffee and they offer excellent wines  and drinks. Nice  overall mix of  very professional and attentive cabin crew on all flights.

Copenhagen to Chicago  from London Heathrow.  British Airways club world is the  only business class  plane I've flown.  Rooms are tiny and the picture  taken is awful - thankfully I had my laptop with me, as the TV was . The tables  sit at an angle, so expect your food and  drink to slide  out (although the  toilet is probably  their best place for their food).  They would advise you to eat at the airport  - not rely  around the inflight slop.  You'll  risk someone climbing over you (or you'll have to  crawl over other people) to get  into the toilet  this is business class!).  And then they'll lose  your bag, tell  that it's going  t take 4-5  days to get  it to you  but provide no  information about what to do in  that meantime. If  I try and  try to get answers, leave at  least 45 minutes  early to sit in a queue (and then expect  you be put  next to the  right person, despite selecting the correct option in the  exit menu!). Avoid British Airways wherever  I can!

British Airways from  Manchester to Newcastle via Heathrow return,  always on-time. Economy on an A320.  Was much better  on domestic legs,  and both times on VIE legs . FA’s were  good but nothing  more and not  any more than  absolutely required. Information from the flight  attendant was friendly  and excellent. A snack and drinks  are served -  including a highly  expensive sandwich (barely  served on the  Domestic flights and  two on the  international flights. Additional  beverages on request.  We featured the  new slim seats . I miss  those older more  spacious BA seats with better leg room. BA has  recently changed the  policies and travelling  around with hand  luggage now also means that one  was no longer allowed to pick  the seat during  flight but a  passenger is randomly  selected Selecting any  row (even a  single seat in  a back of  plane now costs  around 18). If  one later decides to check a  piece of luggage  then costs are  another whopping EUR  100 at the  airport or EUR  500 online. Being  from Sapphire does  NOT help either.  No privileges here;  just the same  prices for seat  selection and checked luggage. So, BA  had a low  priced model, except for drinks service.  Unfortunately the prices  may not reflect  a change in  cost On the  return leg LHR-VIE carry-on luggage was  not policed. Although  the carry-on luggage  is the weight  limits and fits  in the overhead  bins and has  been without any problems on the  first three legs  of twenty previous  BA flights, I  am required to  check it in.  It was also  always a question  of occupied space,  and it happened in the priority ! Hopefully just  the power trip  to the gate ? However, here  was the main  point of BA,  which was a carry-on policy that enabled passengers to  comfortably travel without  any hassle of  carrying bags. Boarding  at the same  thing was again ! Instead of  one boarding, there  was now four  separate types of  automatic boarding, and  the procedure left everybody confused and everybody just stood  around blocking the  entrance to the  gate so that  eventually it became a cattle call  for everyone boarding  at the same ! Another thing  was that recent  changes in BA’s  frequent flyer program  made it impossible  for reach a  club status even  as regular flyer  when you regularly  use Club on long distance routes.  Perhaps BA is trying very hard  and annoy its  frequent travelers. While  we stopped flying  Club with BA  about a year  back after they downgraded their Club  Economy cabin and  I was avoiding  their long distance  flights for a long time due  of their terrible  boarding arrangement, I  felt BA’s European  service was a  better product and <mask> was using <mask> regularly for <mask> flights. However, after all these recent changes, I will only book <mask> if they <mask> the lowest or close to <mask> lowest fare. <mask> flights to <mask> UK, KLM <mask> to look <mask> good again. <mask>

London Heathrow to Barcelona, and for some reason British Airways continue to run this Barcelona service from the  old Terminal 3 at Heathrow, rather than new T5. That apart, this  service was fine. Boarding was quick and efficient. Seats in Economy are now pretty similar to those on low cost airlines. But this handluggage  return ticket cost  no more than one with Ryanair from Stansted would have. Food and drink was the now standard minimalist option on most European flights these . Just one question - why,  given this is the British national flag-carrier, does the  beer trolley not  have some British beer, rather than identikit continental fizzy lagers? Departure and  boarding in BCN was on schedule, and exiting the  airport a breeze.

London to Newcastle. Been a while  since I last  flew British Airways,  disappointed to see the same old planes in use  but now very much looking their age for domestic use. Technical issues  on departure, normal  procedure but the noise the plane made on taxi  lasted far too long and was slightly alarming and not the norm.  This pitch belongs on a dodgy charter not the national carrier surely? Last time flown I got a nice sandwich and drink, this time  the small bag of crisps and  coffee It's time  they stopped taking it's domestic (no competition routes) for  business and upgrade the fleet on short trips, the numbers onboard justify a better level  of service considering  these extra fees now attached for checked in luggage  and just carry on, puts me off using their long haul option with ever increasing fees whilst oil prices have been rock bottom for  too long now?  Bravo to the pilot for landing  - Monsoon like conditions with very  limited visibility - if only the aircraft quality matched their pilots!

Jeddah to London  flight with British Airways. Punctual, clean and efficient. Good quality food and multiple drinks served  with red and white wine plus  our excellent British  Airways Film selection , with the  usual on demand 6 inch seatback screen; slight delay  with screen registering  excessive finger pressure and 3 minutes of advertisements prior to each film.  First class cabin  is half empty  while the front  of the plane was virtually empty,  allowing plenty of space to stretch.

London Heathrow to Lisbon return with British Airways. Decent  service but the  crew onboard was  terrible Pilot and first officer sounded  calm and professional , kept us up to date with flight details etc but cabin  crew were cold and had a  general "couldn't care less" attitude. Why  take this job if you seem  to hate it?  Poor service when I flew London Heathrow - Lisbon.  Really a shame, especially as when you are really scared of flying  we could do with a crew with a different  attitude to passenger service.

We booked a  long round trip  from New York ; London; Paris  and New York.  I showed up  at JFK 2  days before my  departure and was  advised that my  flight had been  canceled which meant  they had no  tickets When I  went to British  Airways customer service, they said they  could investigate how  that happened, which  could take 24-48 hours but that  meant I had  my ticket. They  would not rebook  the ticket. They were entirely unsympathetic,  as though they  had made a  big error cancelling  my ticket. I  am forced to  purchase an expensive ($1300), last minute  change for which  I have still  not been reimbursed,  and though, finally,  London Airways acknowledged  that they had  committed a big  mistake I can  justify making an  error I cannot  forgive their unwillingness to help me,  because they put  myself in such  badly compromised position.  Back to the  airport on first , British Airways  Consumer Service assured  us that my  original ticket was not affected, and  had even sent  back an E-Ticket  version of my . But, again,  on morning of  a return flight,  it told me  they had no  replacement ticket. Only  later did a  representative finally admit  to an error had been made,  so he rebooked  the return, at  great cost.
