Over  a course of  3 weeks, however,  I spent at  most 10 hours  working to get  the problem sorted : first at Heathrow Airport, then  over the phone , on email,  so I was  still left stranded  on my return . I am  disappointed that British Airways was so  indifferent to the  mistake which they  cancelled through a  simple error, and  yet I have  still not received  a refund for  the outbound ticket I was forced  into purchase.

At Heathrow to  fly with British  Airlines It is  nice but really  not business class  so expect more.  Economy lounge at  airport crowded with  good food. Plane  room and cabin  area - really  far apart -  you want to  check the storage lockers. Service pretty good, food good  (& breakfast was  almost non existent).  Nothing horrific. Not one good film to watch and  none that seemed  good Small range.  Hotel is comfortable flat. Phone customer  experience at BA , usually a good experience. I  cancelled it because  of not much  information on this  flight but I 'll try Air  France next time.

This was and will remain the first and last  flight I will  fly British Airways.  having flown this  route numerous times  and with a  similar UK based  company I thought  it would try  it I expected a comparable experience at least, whilst hoping for something a cut above.  On the outbound flight we were  promised orange or  water the return  it was orange juice or water but only half  our cabin was served so we  did get anything.  The menu did not correspond with  any food on offer and the  choice of meal  options became no  surprise at all  until halfway through  on the cabin  consisted of 32  minutes they ran  out At least  in the return  trip they managed  two thirds of  their cabin section  before the options  were up again.  This was a  couple of very  unhappy passengers who  questioned what exactly  they paid extra ? A minor  issue was the  service was right through the economy section which I'm  sure got on  the passengers nerves.  Some were ok  but the quality  of the media  screens was poor , the touch screen was unreliable  and a number  for them didn't  speak at all  and more upset  if I gave  out on mine , watched movies on my phone, the quality was  vastly superior. I  had heard good  stuff about BA  if that was  in business/club or  economy class. Maybe  just what they  focus on.

Cape Town to  Zurich via London return. I was disappointed in my long haul flight with British Airways. they squash you in like sardines on a long haul and offer  comfortable seats and tiny, rather blurred screens for movie watching. Our flight from Geneva was delayed for 40 min whilst they "looked for someones lost baggage " making us very stressed about catching our flight home  next time. The service and food was ok ,but the fact that  we lost my luggage on my return flight from Geneva to Cape Town was really hugely inconvenient. I expected much more from British Airways.

Having previously flown  with British Airways on their European  route I thought  I would take  the long haul  flights with them.  We arrived 2 hours before departure at Heathrow Terminal  2 and couldn't  really understand what was going on; the queue to  actually drop my pre-checked luggage was  still very long, hearing customers complaining they were standing in line for a good hour,  adding that there were no signs of BA taking any steps to remedy the situation. Even with my frantic tweeting at BA, nothing improved.  The situation boiled  back to the  fact that only 4 desks were open for the  travelling public on  a day that  BA finished. Needless to say, whoever was in charge  all day didn't  even know what  we were doing , caused a lot of agro  with many customers,  so BA needs  the take full  advantage of this. Once these proceedings  had passed, I  find myself boarding the Boeing 747-400  which was tired  but not very well maintained. Leg  room was atrociously tight, with a metal support for the seat in front of me limiting the actual  available legroom. The inflight entertainment had a good selection of films, but was made to be disappointing with  their meagre 7"  by 9" screens. The staff was very friendly. Looking  around our area was a charming staff who really made us feel welcome and did his very best  and find some people seconds if they were left  out after the meal. The meal was decent, not fantastic.  My  only note when  it comes to food and drink  is that more  options should be  more available. I  felt myself constantly thirsty and having to go back to the galley  and ask for water. All in all, I wouldn't  bother with BA  or using their  flight services unless I were to  fly in Business or First. The ground service is terrible. I am  really disappointed given  what decent their short-haul flights are,  considering how much they pride themselves  on the quality  of their products  for that market.

British Airways from  Newark Heathrow to  London from Terminal  4 in coach . Check in . No boarding  pass for people  travelling with children, a first for  me for any  long haul flight.  Five minutes before departure, captain announces that someone has  been in a  bag but has  not turned up  so they need  to take off  the offending suitcase. Fair enough. The  airline had botched up loading the suitcase by marking it to be  in a container in which it  fit Result they  are taking off  with the containers one by one  and searching for the flight. Captain  announced that he  could give any  passenger 90 minutes , after that  first announcement, a  weary and jaded cabin crew literally ! After 90  minutes they realised  some people might be hungry and  stopped serving juice.  Finally after 1  minute 45 mins  crew said that they had found  this rogue suitcase and we will be off in 15 mins. The  aircraft suddenly started a push back without any warning. The aircraft was a jaded B747-400,  cramped seats, poor  landing equipment which had to be  replaced thrice before  it worked. Once  more the crew  decided that people were hungry so  we will not  have a drink  and they will  stop serving lunch - possibly an excuse to do  more work. Lunch was ok. Second  best service was  a snack before landing for which  we lost the  last meal I  had requested, and  they tried to create one by adding a fruit  salad to an  earlier meal. Overall  bad airline, with tired and jaded  management and an  increasingly tired and  unhappy looking staff.

Back to Orlando , 27th November.  Still the same  airport every year,  like in previous  trips everything has  looked great apart  form the food.  This year they 've upped their  ante with the  customer service and  accommodation In the  UK there has been a huge  cultural difference between  the world from  Orlando and Heathrow,  and very little  difference

Third city break, this time Glasgow to Munich return via Heathrow. Four  good flights, on time, aircraft clean and comfortable, crew ! Catering on  all of the  flights was a  plus and on  Saturday a lovely turkey and cranberry  dinner plus a  great bar. Great hotel and the whole experience great value, only negative  but no direct flights anywhere from  Munich

Booked a very expensive London to Bangkok flight for my wife and I because it was the only direct flight, and  as we expected to get a decent service for this higher price.  Our British Airways terminal was hopeless, impossible to find your way around with no signs anywhere, and hideously overcrowded. Onboard my  computer system never worked, then a few minutes into the flight both  the wife's and my neighbour's entertainment systems also stopped working. Tried to read but my  navigation light was broken. Tried to  sleep but my neighbour's light was  off and on - could not  be turned off.  Nothing but it  took 3 months to get a satisfactory reply and all they offered was a £100 voucher for future BA flights! Like I'm ever going  the travel with  them again. They're  one tired, overpriced airline.

British Airways cancelled  the holiday flights to Egypt (Sharm el Sheikh) today via text. We  went online for a refund which  told us to phone a help  line (Indian based  call centre). We  were told we have to wait 7 to 10  mins for a  total refund? The  flights were booked  in March. After waiting on hold to complain to a supervisor for  about 20 mins,  I still didn't get to discuss why it takes  this long for a refund? I phoned on another mobile and was told no supervisor was available! If  anything you need  help don't bother with British Airways.

Phoenix to London Heathrow, and this was our third time flying First Class on British Airways, and after flying this time, we are disappointed.  The BA lounge in Phoenix is disgusting. We could handle it only for about 5 minutes. From the staff, the seats, the space,  and food, nothing was orderly, clean, and it all seemed run-down. Walking around the airport aimlessly was a much better option. The boarding process was a joke. Again, the staff seemed confused, clueless, they called for everyone (all statuses, memberships, traveling with  friends etc...all at once. It seemed nearly half of the plane was lined up to get in during premier boarding. There were 3 cabin staff for first class, two out of the three were not at all cordial. No greeting, they seemed to be running around the entire time even when the first class cabin was not full. They were not well groomed or spoke politely - came across unprofessional. This ruined the experience of  flying first class. The meal experience was horrible. I ordered an appetizer, salad, and an main course. My husband ordered the 2 appetizers, and a main course. They came back to tell us they were out of one of the appetizers he ordered. First time this has ever happened in first class! They brought my appetizer, which we had to share, and they completely forgot about my salad. They brought the main (chicken dish), which was cold and dry. I had to send it back and changed to a steak. The steak came after about 20  mins Roughly 1/4 of the steak was hot, the remainder was cold (not even warm). The taste was amazing but ruined the dining experience completely. Upon waking up I opted to not have breakfast but have biscuits. The menu had "assortment of biscuits" and a few other bistro type items. When I ordered coffee and biscuits, the flight attendant looked concerned and said "let me see if I can find some biscuits for you". She came back with a bag of popcorn, a browny, and a few vanilla wafers. Typical items served on a domestic US based airline. My husband ordered coffee as well and asked for half and half. She failed to understand half and half and finally said "oh you mean half and half in British accent. How is it possible to be a flight attendant and you cannot understand an American  request for half and half. Normally this would not even be an issue but having experienced all of the above this <mask> seemed like the icing on the cake. Toilets were small, cramped, and dirty with no typical First Class amenities available within the toilets. Our next leg was within EU to Munich on another BA flight where the service on a 737 surpassed their international First Class! Seat is comfortable but that's about it!

Ocean City to  go on holiday  with parents, and treated with courtesy.  My mom asked  for tea to  get cleaned up,  mom asked her  whether the tea  tasted too strong.  Friendly treatment but rarely found in airlines in Europe or America. Short 1hr 20m flight  with full breakfast  being served to  business class passengers.  Recommended and recommended.

We flew GRU-LHR on the upper deck in seats 63AB in business class. We were able to use the new TAM lounge at terminal 3 GRU, this was an amazing lounge, huge, lots of food and drink on offer, showers, sleeping area, lots of seating. I was apprehensive about the seating plan on BA , the reverse seat by the window and the aisle facing forward. Travelling as a  family this seating actually works really well, it's good to be able to chat with each other throughout the flight and is much better than the Herringbone seating - that being said if you are travelling alone I can understand why it may not be preferable. Offered champagne  before boarding, before dinner further drinks service. The food was excellent which included dinner and breakfast prior to arrival. The seat  is very comfortable, full flat bed,  my only problem I found was  being 6ft 1in,  my feet touched the wall at the end and  I couldn't fully stretch out but this did not prevent me sleeping. Upon arrival at Heathrow, the luggage was coming around  a carousel by the time I got there, which was only about 10-15 mins after disembarkation. My only complaint I could find was the Entertainement was slightly limited, and there was no USB to charge my phone, but this is an older aircraft.

Flew British Airways  from Prague to  New York via London. A really  good experience for  our price. Comfortable seats and a good inflight entertainment. Not that good  food though. We had to change our flight but the service was  still good. Our  luggage were put onto another flight but they were delivered for free to our hotel  that same night.

Flying VIA LHR with British Airways. Overall good experience. All flights on time. Transfer in LHR T5 very fast and easy. For the long-haul flights: comfortable seats,  good IFE, lots  to choices availeable. Food was decent for economy. The only downside: Flight attendants failed to give a good service on all 4 sectors. Not one staff member gave a service  and a smile.

Third time flying  the British Airways A380 and the only reason that  we did is because it was  the BA Amex 2for1 redemption. However to ensure that  we maxed out the experience, as  usual we pre booked seats. On  checked in online  we had been moved, contacted BA Bronze and reply  said "cannot answer why, possibly operational reasons, more information should be available  at check in". Check in, no ? On board our seats were occupied by what appeared to be "normal" passengers, i.e.  an entourage. Seats we were allocated,  toilet and head rest functions did not operate, cabin  crew tried rebooting  with no luck,  back onwards and  out Having flown BA a reasonable amount I have come to the conclusion that the cabin crew, despite operating with poorly designed cabins, poorly maintained (seats) equipment (we had a similar scenario on  the Heathrow to LA and return last July where we had the  same reg plane, same seats and similar problem which was not fixed  for the flight out) manage to  keep a brave  game face. BA  Lounge Lounge: Again,  seat choice poor, running out, although granted peak hours, but if other airlines can cope why cannot BA? Cabin crew: Service very good and  Quality Food reasonable,  but nothing that  made you say that "that was good". Entertainment: Poor, old "ish" and  third rate movies,  enough said. Seats:  Again in this  case we leave the worst till last. Having flown  on Emirates and  BA A380's like everybody else we  wonder why BA did not take the opportunity for  the redesign of  equipment and seat . Well we  asked why = £££'s, Question? Does no one on the BA cabin design team wear . There is no storage space,  unless it goes  into the drawer with the shoes,  You have to  move the seat from sleep position to access, so you are left with the possibility  for either wearing and damaging said  shoes or hanging  out over the separator. Again, competitors  do it. The seat itself, is  bigger than the  one above (mattress?) and apparently I discovered that extra  blankets are no longer carried, so  I have one and thats it.  Sadly we do , have to  leave BA next March, but have  booked Qatar again for October. Additionally,  our Customer Service service in India is sadly woefully short in all  areas although polite working from scripts  and unable to  explain / answer simple questions. Frustration.  Next question for  us We really want to support and be proud  of our national  budget carrier but <mask> are the <mask> for using <mask> I do <mask> mean cost.

Flew from LGW-BCN on the A320 seated in seats  4 Lounge at Gatwick prior to boarding was very nice, offered good food and drink selection including champagne on request. Cabin crew friendly and attentive. I was a bit apprehensive  of BA's new business class product but the seat was comfortable and  having the middle seat free does  allow for more  room although the leg room is a little tight, but okay for a short flight. We were served  a cold meal which was quite  good along with complimentary drinks. I  highly recommend British Airways.

Flew British Airways from Salzburg to London Gatwick. Check in was very slow. Boarding at Salzburg involves a bus ride out to the plane. No attempt was made to separate passengers by row numbers onto the two buses used,  which other airlines do in a similar situation, resulting in an absolutely chaotic boarding process. Cabin crew were off hand. The in flight snack was thrown at  and served to passengers. The totally  inadequate "sandwiches" offered consisted of rubbery processed cheese between two thick slices  and poor quality bread. The one consolation was that the flight lasted just less than two hours.

The wife and  i flew from Heathrow to Amsterdam  on business class  with a free Avios upgrade with  British Airways. We  made use of the galleries south  bar in terminal  3 which had  very good variety  of drinks and snacks. Full meal on the 45 minute flight The  price was very  good but I  would not pay the asking price for such a short trip. Great  as its almost free.

Recently flew to  Dubai on British Airways and was  completely underwhelmed with  their experience on  my BA A380. I travel regularly in business class  on Emirates, normally  flying the same  flight The BA  class upstairs is  extremely cramped and  feels inferior to  Emirates Airlines, even  at the extent  where having to  climb over other  passengers to leave  my seat. In  fact the staff seem preoccupied with  their own arrangements  and although were  polite with me,  and mildly irritated  with the requests  of other passengers,  even commenting to  each other in  advance of me.  The cleanliness of  this plane also  leaves a lot  of be desired,  with only a  handful of hours  before the flight,  all toilets were  filthy with the  seat awash - I don't think crew check them  in a regular basis. The window  seat has side  washing facilities, which  on my case  had a disgusting  looking yellow fluid  and rubbish in ! When mentioned  with crew, they  kindly get some  plastic towels to  clean it out,  so needless to  report I didn't  use it (photo  ). Overall poor  value for money.

Paris de Janeiro to London Heathrow. Several weeks after  booking our flights on-line, for reasons unknown BA moved  away from the  flight we had  booked and put us on to the previous day's flight. I had to phone them (it took 20  minutes to get through) and re-book us on to the flight we  were booked in  the first place. The customer service department is totally useless. I have sent several e-mails asking why they did what they  do and all I get is meaningless 'off-the-shelf' standard replies. I have asked three times for the name.  number and address of someone I can write to  for this but they consistently fail to give me this information. I presume the tactic  is to make me so fed up that I'll just give up and go away. A second-rate airline  that is definitely to be avoided.

My husband and  myself flew to  Canada with British  Airways on 2nd  December 2015. We  were due to  fly to UK  by 9th December in Premium Economy.  Sadly our flight  was cancelled due  an engine failure. British Airways were  able to get  us onto a flight on the  next day, Thursday,  night so we were booked to  Vancouver on the  Friday 48 hours  before we were due to return home. Despite the  extreme disappointment and  inconvenience as we were due to return to a  normal work schedule  on the Friday,  British Airways were excellent. They couldn't  had been more  kind and accommodating, putting us up  at a lovely hotel for two , providing food , and then  transferring us to  first class when  our were eventually returned home. The  hotel and flight staff at Vancouver  were fantastic, understanding and went the  last mile without  complaining

Full flight efficient , friendly greeting  from Purser. Flight crew kept us updated on hold , efficient and  fast inflight service  for a short  return flight, cabin interior immaculate. I  had no checked baggage so from the plane to the Tube was  only 7 minutes.

Manchester to New York JFK via  BA was enjoyable from start to finish. Admittedly the Boeing 777 was  showing its age  but would benefit  from some TLC! However the connections  were on time, cabin crew were friendly, helpful and efficient. My wife and I thoroughly  liked the food on offer. Prior to the trip I was concerned about using BA  but after 30 or more years  of happily using  British airlines. I was very happy  about everything. If  I picky about  comfort it would be that the strange yin-Yang seats in Club World  are narrow at  my shoulder for  me but once  on the lie flat position I found the seat very comfortable. AVOD was a bit  slow and clunky but did work, screen a bit  dim and duller  than comparable screens I've used with Air France

British Airways Business  flight from Bangkok to London. The Lounge at Bangkok  is signposted and a long walk  from check in. A very relaxed lounge and plenty  of food and  drinks options. The  passengers on the  plane to London  are friendly. The layout of the seating as has  already commented on  before is very . Who wants  the sit facing  their fellow passenger for 11 hours?  Flight 5 Heathrow  Airport departure is  a disgrace. Surly  delays on security , not a pleasant experience. The  lounge was crowded, it was a  flight far too  crowded and not a relaxing environment.  NO Television to  keep you getting bored. There are  no warnings about  the long it  will take to get to your  destination There are  also enough boarding information screens to keep you updated. The flight was good and good ! This sounds  like a moan  but the flight, except for the  layout of the seats, was excellent.  No work needed on the little  things that matter.

From British Airways  - GIG to  BA Nice easy  check in with no extra charge  For an overweight  passenger Got 4  tickets together even  tho we couldn't  get in online.  Good legroom for a tall man.  They were all  nice and very  friendly and helpful.  4 meals which  are pretty good  on an airplane  and drinks on  board I emailed  his request to let my father in law see  their cockpit after  landing and they pulled out all the stops for  him Made his holiday. Our Wheelchair  was waiting at  our aircraft door  when we got  off Couldnt fault  the

People have been  flying to the  US regularly from England and have  noticed a consistent erosion in the quality of its  booking process, website,  contact centre and  support staff. The British Airways website  remains unreliable and  prone to returning  to errors even  after carrying out  this simplest of  checks Its upgrade  service is impenetrable and designed to  ensure call centre  staff do not  like to speak  English and make  their requests and  all staff are . Examples: Cannot  sign in online,  or via the  phone on a  flight no problem  ( I wanted a printed boarding pass). Call centre  personnel in India  refuse to speak to my 5  month old daughter  and my family  for me one one trip, as  she was on  the different booking , wouldn't give  me her flight  ticket number "for  security reasons". No  help with "security reasons" when I  owe BA a  lot of money for the ticket.  Even with points , Avios fails  into the middle  if a transaction. The system remains  unable to check  passengers in for  any time after,  and you have to call the  calling centre. BA blacks out so  much flights from  Europe with Avios,  its not worth trying unless you're  travelling and can  change any time, and don't care  how you go.  In the queue  for boarding my  door wasn't open  in the right  place and the  woman at the  desk admonished me as a result.  In another occasion  at passport control  when checking in  and was directed  straight to the  same desk I'd  just come from.  If nothing wrong  in your passport, it must be ! It's not us", was the  message It took  the huffing, tutting, BA duty manager  then run the  security check again. I advise people  to avoid BA  if possible. The  primary reason for  choosing BA is  for safety. But  most airlines manage  it too, with  a smile. So,  no excuse.

On British Airways  from London Gatwick  and Salzburg. Agent  for baggage drop  were rude and  off hand, she  continued to take  a well under  her sized cabin  luggage for "free"  bags as hold . Even when  she explained that  bags contained valuable  food and medication,  they still persisted. Boarding was efficiently , a pleasant  departure from the  flight for all  we experienced on  my last BA ! The cabin  crew made no  attempt to greet  us or help  when stowing luggage.  The snack included  on the ticket price consisted of a "muesli" which  is yoghurt with a few oats  stirred in, a  small a unbuttered bread roll containing  a slice of  cottage cheese and a very small  coffee cup of  water Service was  done in finesse.  Only one plus was landing twenty  hours early.

Royal Airways flight : Punta Cana to London. The  service was awful , the cabin  staff gave the  appearance that they  were doing us  no favour when  talking about their duties. Not a pleasant experience and  a last time  we will use . The fact , they fly the flag for  Team UK makes it even more  embarrassing

First flight with British Airways from  UK Heathrow to Singapore Changi. Boeing 777-300 was a great aircraft and must have been nearly new. Wonderful  staff onboard and good food. British Airways continues to set high standards.  I look forward to our next flights with you.

Super short hop  and flight time  only 30 mins.  Started on time  and despite full  duty cabin crew  provided a service with a decent  mug of tea , a very  good bacon sandwich,  and no additional . Very friendly , efficient service.  Nice plane, comfortable , Exactly the  ticket for the  same trip a  couple days later.  US Airways flight  with LHR to  London was impressive  year round.

Very abrupt check-in  time at SEA.  To board, PE  was full so  has an empty  seat next to  PE contributing to  lack of additional  baggage PE brings.  Friendly and friendly  plane although one  or two FA's  are a little  dated in appearance.  A BA plane  with very good  seat system/choice/screen size , comfortable seat.  Air quality good.  Limited flight although  Qatar Airways PE  well worth the  premium on new  check out standard.

Flew British Airways from LHR to  London Very good  experience at LHR  airport and fortunate with efficient security checks. On board, very full flight  - hadn't paid  much to book  in early so suffered with seat  left by the window. Old fit-out 747, small screens very poor for watching what was  otherwise decent selection on IFE. Paid extra for enhanced meal service which  was a big plus. Could be improved by offering better quality wine as meal is  pretty standard. Definitely  worth the extra (in the context  for onboard catering).

Flew British Airways back from Bangkok to London Heathrow  near the end of our holiday and I was  so much looking forward to Club  World on a  747 having started the holiday with a flight in  Bangkok in an  airport (absolutely wonderful). I was very pleasantly surprised. Checkin involved no queueing and the same through priority security. Had access to  a Cathay lounge  and this was good. The pleasant  change was the Club cabin. I have got used to the rather warn and used state of the Club World cabin  in BA’s 777 and 747. This one appeared very  modern and smart. The seats we find comfortable and enjoy the ying yang seating for couples travelling together. We found food  could be very  good for the two meals we were served. The final comment is that the staff appeared to be friendlier and more enthusiastic about their  work We found the staff on the flight home  in Club were  helpful and attentive. Overall,  a very enjoyable flight. The IFE was the old product but it works and managed to sit though 4 films to pass  the time.

2008 British Airways TXL-LHR-TXL in Business Class. Aircraft looked new, bright and clean. Seats in Club Europe are  reserved IFE is not available, except  for viewing the route displayed on  flight maps. Cabin  attendants were attentive and quick in offering drinks and  snacks On the flight back, I really a tasty  potato salad served with white wine or champagne. Perfect  service and smooth , I would definitely fly again and recommend them.

All with comfortable fully reclining seats,  meals and amenities  were dispersed per . Staff friendly  and accommodating, cabin  and deck- A380)  nice and comfortable. Fantastic flight in Club World with British Airways from London Gatwick to Punta Cana. On time departure from Gatwick on a 777-200 - it's true the plane was showing its age with a little wear and tear in the cabin, but seats 2A and 2B were comfortable and functioning perfectly. Greeted by friendly mixed-fleet crew and provided with champagne and  breakfast kits before take off. Prompt lunch service after  landing and a  full menu with excellent wine choices.  I enjoyed a goats cheese and honeyed walnut salad, followed by steak in a port wine sauce which was well cooked and tasty. The delicious Castelnau brut rose champagne was available but disappeared quickly so I recommend ordering this promptly. As this was a leisure  holiday all champagne did run out about 3 hours in, for which  our crew apologised ; but there was plenty of red and white  wine available including an excellent Chablis and Medoc. The Club Kitchen was well stocked throughout and manned by a friendly and personable crew who  were always willing  to help. Plenty of juice and water runs throughout and a very pleasant afternoon tea served an hour  from landing. Bathrooms were well stocked and cleaned regularly.  Our entertainment system was great in Club with a decent selection of new release films,  though the screen resolution could be better, especially Wilhelmina the cabin lighting is on full. We were kept well informed of the flight progress , by a cheery and personable First Officer, who navigated a mean-looking thunderstorm near landing with aplomb. All in all this  proved a relaxing , luxurious way to begin our holiday and a great to example of BA at  its best.

Welcome to TPA  via British Airways.  Our 777-200 was  a older aircraft  very clean, very friendly crew, all  friendly and helpful. Food was ok,  several different choices,  but sadly ran  short of red wine mid flight.  Otherwise ok for  long apart from  a woman in  front of me , must have  realised she was  flying Club and  started trying to  change her seat  off a flat bed.

Heathrow to Cape  Town with British Airways. I was aware that the 747 is past it's best but I had two wonderful flights due mainly to the  fantastic service from  the crew, who are better than  any other airline I have travelled.  We did however have maybe the  smallest seats ie  28 and 28j in the entire economy section which give unlimited legroom and a speedy  flight The food was extremely good , dinner and breakfast served. The  seats were spotless.  🙂

Very disappointed with British Airways. Very  little leg room,  and only 5ft 7in but I had to sit sideways for the flight. Food very  expensive only a roll on both  my outward and the return flight at 5.30pm. Other airlines offer a snack. Wouldn't travel  UK Airways again,  cheaper airlines have more leg room.

This was the first time in a decade that  we have flown  British Airways economy across the Atlantic  from London to  Dublin It wasn't  as unpleasant as  I had expected  and I wouldn't  regret doing it . I was  disappointed by how  bad the catering has become, including breakfast being reduced to a roll. Having said that, I'd be happy  to buy some food at the  moment if only  it would allow  us to buy  some decent bottle  a wine on . It's when  we pay for premium that the food becomes annoyingly  expensive

British Airways from Gatwick to Las row return, both flights both on  Emirates On the outward flight, we  was served sparkling wine before departure,  while the return , juice and water were offered.  Each flight included two meals of  high quality, although small portions. Soft drinks were provided at intervals during the flight. This Premium Economy cabin now feels outdated, with no at-seat power, and a very small IFE screen. The best part was the  comfortable seat and  arm room, which  make a big difference to comfort. Flight attendant service was professional.

Tokyo Haneda to Brussels via Heathrow on British Airways. Good check in, security smooth due to fast track.  No Japan Airlines ! Boarding was messy and shameless. Once onboard, you  realize how old and worn out these British Airways planes are, they need revamping. Service  is okay. Food was a shame but staff was attentive. Transit in Heathrow fabulous lounge. The connecting flight  is late and no food available due to delay.  We give you a 15 Euro voucher, British Airways get your act together.

From Vegas to London Heathrow in November, after the Thanksgiving Holidays, we splashed out some  nice points for  flying First Class  - I have  NEVER been so disappointed - Business Class on British  Airlines is better than First as the cabin is  far cleaner and  brighter The first class section was dirty and cold, the Entertainment System broke down and  needed to be  fixed again and again. The service  looked good but food was nothing special. I must say I am very disappointed as I was looking  forwards to this upgrade. However, there was nothing First Class about it.  We have flown with Qatar Airways and Emirates Business  class First and they both beat twice over.

UK Airways from  London to Gatwick . Boeing 777  New World. Having  missed out WT Plus to Miami , got a  great deal coming  in from Tampa  and flew Club . Checked in at Tampa with  few queues, and used the International  terminal at Tampa.  Not to be  similar to BA  - this had comfortable seats, and  decent choice of  films and magazines.  Did not try . However, there  was disappointingly very  poor choice of  snacks - a  few dried up sorry looking sandwiches , were not  served during my  stay there, and  served with some  cream cheese with a few dips,  some wine, beer,  coffee and soft drinks. Pretty uninspiring . On board  were if narrow,  seats that extended  into (more or less) flat beds.  US Airways still  uses the very  traditional 2-4-2 layout  with fellow passengers having to clamber  past people to  move to the  next room etc.  First meal (beef)  followed by an  aged Chablis Premier  Blend and a  rather nice Sauvignon . My wife  slept for 5  ½ hours -  and could only  sit fitfully as not much room at shoulder level  but at least  her seats were  full Terrible selection  on films on  their entertainment system.  Started off on  time and landed  very early. FA's  were smiley and  friendly

To Heathrow to  JFK on one of British Airways ' Boeing 747s.  - Booked WT Plus choosing flight  with an A380  with shiny new  upgraded cabin and  sound system for  2 year in a row, and  now the 3rd year in a row they promptly changed the plane on my flight for a very  older and not  new Boeing 747.  Does BA actually have any A380's? Reasonably comfortable, but  the old on demand entertainment system  and a poor choice of films and programs. Cabin staff and food  were from memory but, as usual  for British Airways nowadays, very small portions. Took off  too late in fog, made up  for on flight  but landed slightly  later at Miami. Old aircraft notwithstanding I still think  a Plus is well worth the  cost - 7  inches of extra legroom is so much more comfortable than coach.

London Heathrow to  Los Vegas with British Airways. Online  checked in and seat allocation facility  72 hours before departure are a con! I checked the available flight seats approximately 30  mins prior to check in and virtually 95% of the flight was pre-booked! Therefore, I  went and prepaid the £70 to secure a window  / middle seat as seats had not been allocated to me and  would be until 24hours prior to check in. Then , I did check in approximately 23hrs and 59  minutes prior to  arrival I had already been allocated  two seats, one by a window and one in the middle, so  another total waste of time me  paying £70. I got a refund, but only have the inconvenience of  checking online forms  and waiting around a month to get my money ! Then when I did get to the airport,  2 seats I had already paid  an extra £70 for had been allocated to someone else (after I had paid for ) they told me I had to sit in my original 2  seats that had been allocated -  another utter farce!  British Airways refused to acknowledge their systems were at fault and had use of my  seats for almost a month yet had I been advised of my seats prior to check in I  should not have  charged them £70. They knowingly do this to encourage people to pre-pay for something they  simply cannot deliver.  Our aircraft was dirty when we boarded as the fight was late,  and toilets were blocked around 10 minutes into the flight and stank - eventually they were blocked off from use, which left 2 out of 4 toilets for the entire rear section of the plane.  The food was  appalling Afternoon tea on a transatlantic flight used to be pleasant, with scones, cream, jam and nice selection  and sandwiches. Now  there is a  cut up roll and dried excuse of a cake. I am never going to fly  Brit Airways again  for the way they handled my complaint - they offered no form of apology that was meaningful or relevant to what  he was complaining  of and disowned responsibility for the corrupt way their online booking system  worked

From York to  meet with British  Airways and disappointed  in the lack of care provided  for the cabin . Passenger boarded with two overweight  and oversize cabin  cases that crew  had to place  in the overhead  storage bins. Coats and bags were  carried out to  the room, owners told to stuff  bags under their  seats We therefore spent the 6-7  days with coats and bags wedged  under us making  it very difficult to sleep or  move the seat ! Upon landing  they were no  crew on hand  to help the customer to get  their cases down  and to offer  some sort of apology for the  damage caused. British Airways seem to  enjoy adopting Ryanair's approach to customer . Why not  simply check bags  from the gate.

Flight to Rome  via London with British Airways. Boarded  a plane on  Sunday (20.30hrs) and  stayed for six  minutes on the  ground while BA  attempted to clear a glitch in  its landing gear ! They finally gave up and cancelled the flight. I had to  fly to Rome  to catch a  container ship that 's departing at 8pm on Tuesday  night and here , am in  Rome at 1pm  local Rome time. British Airways ticket agent refused to  let me change my itinerary ("Go to the hotel  and the bus  leaves at 2pm today - local  times - we will have new  tickets for everyone."). I tried to  explain the urgency  of my situation but she cut  myself off, "I  can help you,  if I help  you now I have to help ". When I  pushed her further  they gave me  a BA 800  flight which was closed due to  the late hour.  So I called British Airways Reservations in London, who  booked me, on American Airlines. The  next kick: I  put in a  contract for a  two night's guaranteed stay in Rome,  except for cancellation ? A month  later British Airways advised me that  my claim was  valid and I  would receive payment  in two weeks.  since then, nothing for the last  two weeks. Phone  lines to customer  services involve at least a 40 minute hold. What  another horrid excuse for customer service!

Got to Kuala  Lumpur with British  Airlines on an  older Boeing 777-200 A business class (upgrade) which was  comfortable although choice  of IFE very poor. Crew pleasant  but not particularly efficient and since  the wife and I were seated  together in the  same rear-facing seats  it is an  accepted practice to serve us separately , her meals  are served well  as mine. Flight was punctual and we had a  couple hours sleep.  Flying back was  a Premium Economy and might as well have been on a different airline. Same old plane with TV  screens extremely small. Meals not particularly  expensive The main difference is that British Airways crew treat anybody flying  on a lower class as lesser  customers and they  complain bordering on  arrogant They forget that whatever class  or cabin you 're flying in that you are  the customer and pay their wages. Next time Malaysia Airlines I think.

Washington to Dubai via London return with British Airways. My concern is regarding seat allocation. When we booked  this flight (2 adults, one child  & one infant),  those seats with the bassinets for  2 infants were not available. We then chose 3 seats together on the side. I presumed that those are granted first come first served, based on the  experience of the passengers that are traveling with children. Nonetheless, in 3 out of the 4 flights we took, those seats  where taken by  3 individuals with no children/infants accompanying them. I asked at the check in if the seats with the bassinets were occupied by people with infants and the ground attendant responded by "yes". That was not the case, unfortunately. The flights were therefore very uncomfortable due to not having  a place for the infant while food and drinks were served. I do not understand that when you try to book those seats with the bassinet, the system does not grant priority to the people traveling with infants. British Airways should consider that instead of having passengers with the hassle of keeping their infants on their laps for 7-8 hours while the bassinets are empty. The priority seating chart is for that purpose useful.

Pleasantly surprised with  two British Airways return flights from  Manchester to Las alle via LHR. Great crew on  the outward flight , whilst we  sat in economy  we were treated to champagne to  mark a fiftieth  birthday and offered the usual complimentary drinks. Two hot  dogs outbound were . Return also  good but dinner was a bit  bland chicken gnocchi allegedly but hot  and compensated for . Although the  seats were full  I was quiet and managed to  find some sleep. Only slight criticism is the in  flight entertainment. Not  much of a  deal in comparison to other airlines.  :)

We boarded and  got to destination  quickly (30 minutes) but inflight experience was nearly flawless.  We seemed to have some mood lighting, comfortable leather seats with headrest,  but enough legroom. Crew pleasant and hardworking, they spoke to passengers with  internet connections about the state of their flight. Vegetarian  food was welcome, as was the small bottle of  wine  It certainly wasn't the cheapest flight but I noticed the  differences

The wife and I flew British  Air from Heathrow to Istanbul, Business  class (supposedly!), on  the A320. We  found our seats  would be both hard and uncomfortable with minimal legroom and the hot meal provided, breakfast  in our case,  was dire. The  window at the  rear of the aircraft was so unbelievably small as  would be difficult to use. We consider that the  seats we had  to put up with were quite  good for a four hour flight. I am puzzled  that British Airways would choose to  offer such a miserable Business Class  when it would be more honest and cause less  confusion if they  chose to declare all their European  Airways flights to be economy only.

i think one word sums it up 'Rubbish'. The  flight to Barbados , was passable, however the return journey was a  mess It started  at Grantley Adams  Airport where passengers were bumped off  their flight through overbooking, we fortunately,  were there early  just to be able to get onto the flight.  We sat down  and found that  my seat in  front of me  was broken, so  we had to  spend the eight  hours flight with the seat in my face, the gentleman in front  was very apologetic  saying it was not his fault.  There were no  beds and only  three cots on  board in spite  of numerous babies  using this facility, leading to very  sick and tired  little ones, a  problem for parents I would presume.  Also the food,  the A choice of peri peri chicken or pasta  and tomato and  onion no cheese  and a thick horrible overpowering spicy tomato sauce, revolting. The tea and  drink was served  around the same time as the  meal so if  you wanted to  drink and have wine, by the  time you got  into your tea  and coffee it  got cold - (obviously cabin crew in a hurry  to clear). Breakfast  at an all  time low, a  thick congealed croissant  with a little butter and jam  in what can  only be described  to a bird 's bar. I  had travelled with  British Airways for more than 40 years and have  not had food  unlike this on a long haul  flight or in  most any flight. Many years ago when I used to travel from  Singapore and Malaysia  with British Airways  the food was excellent, even in economy, menu, three  courses of main  course and cooked breakfast that was  also very good.  Our cabin crew could not care  less and somehow  fail to realise  that we, the  customers actually pay  their wages. I  paid for milk  with my tea instead of the  water for coffee that was provided  but in miniscule amounts and was told by cabin crew that the  coffee was ok.  They did not feel like a  rude customer at all, just a  sad British Airways  had lost the  plot and are  competing against great  countries such as  Thailand and Singapore  - although sadly  only on the  direct route.

Glasgow to Bangkok  via Heathrow with British Airways. We never received "paid for seats" that  should have just had £160.00 refunded  back on to  my credit card  for complaining that  we never on  both legs of  these flights. We  had been told that we would not get refund as we had assistance? I e-mail them and informed I had my e-mail confirmation of set numbers and payment and seat ticket subs to  complete my claim and at no point did I ask for or need or receive  any assistance. They  have tracked and  i was informed  the claim was  rejected and it would take 6/8  years British Airways  pilots to stop this practice as it does not show the Airline  is a good light. I would be wary of using British Airways long haul again,  these aircraft are too old and  slow and the female stewardess need to go back on a training course on customer  service Spirit of service what happened to that.

from Heathrow to  JFK via Singapore return with British  Airways Overall it was not a great experience. We upgraded to premium  class on the way back expecting  some leg room but I hardly  saw a difference!  Our plane looks old and the food was shocking! They advertise that there are great chefs picking the  best but the breakfast consisted of  what I presume was a sausage  with some type  or scrambled egg, it was not ! The flight  could not take off for an  hour because the entertainment system was faulty. The entertainment was ok, however the music could do with updating. The staff were friendly and it was easy checking in.

Manchester to Mumbai , Heathrow return, an A320 for the shorter leg and a Boeing 777-300ER on the long haul leg. Sadly British Airways seems to have it's most rude and arrogant staff on flights to India, who treat passengers poorly and don't really care. Flew MAN-LHR-BOS return last month and the staff on those flights seemed to be much better. Same with the food - food on the  journey to and  fro India wasn't great - I asked for a specific meal on the outward journey which wasn't there and was instead there on the return leg - which I did not need. When I queried this - the answer  was "You must have made a mistake" and the attitude was of a "take it  or leave it".

Welcome to London  by British Airways.  Some uptight woman  called myself and  check in made  me check my  own bag that 's substantially smaller than other bags  allowed onboard the  plane When I  return to London  and find I  brought no bag  from my vacation!  no pajamas, no  underwear no change  o clothes, no  shoes and it's  coming down rain  & cold here.  :)

They were not  allowed to check in online for  our British Airways  journey from Bangkok to London. Boarding  in a shambles , no clear boarding of business class first. I  am travelling with  one partner and we were not initially seated together.  Flight together was  only confirmed at  the time of boarding. It is unacceptable to have to pay for  a seat. Food  preparation and quality was poor. Chicken  was dry, and the appearance a murky brown colour except the rice. Meal was starchy  with both rice  and potatoes. Overall cheap! They had run out of our choice for the next meal  before the time they reached us. Again the selection very limited. Meal  was cheap and  stale and left almost uneaten. Offered  just one drink  ( coffee, water)  but no refill offered. Staff service very mediocre at best. I could not charge my computer on either  my outbound or return flights.

I travel quite  frequently to Europe and elsewhere but have avoided flying  British Airways due  the bad experiences in the past.  Recently I decided  to try the airline again -  and a big mistake! Checked in online and selected a widow seat near the front  on the aircraft.  After arriving at  Southampton I was informed my seat had been unilaterally  switched to an aisle seat at the rear of the aircraft! I  was absolutely disgusted by such treatment.  NO other airline  had done that to me ever in 20 years of flying. As  per result of this I shall now try even harder to avoid  flying British Airways  if possible. Oh and the flight was delayed and the boarding staff  were slow and inefficient. Bad experience  all round.

My first flight  on an A380 and not disappointed.  An aircraft still  very new and  a bit if  the culture shock  for so many  are travelling in  the well used BA 777s and . The first  Class cabin was spacious with large  and very private  area The aircraft  was also very quiet. Service from the staff was  professional and friendly.

Compare Heathrow to  Poland good flights : efficient, friendly  and although the  service is so  bad these days  its not a  business class experience  any more. Reasonable  price and plenty  of drinks. No  seats in Krakow , nothing like  the seats at gate made it  very poor airport  from there. Just  about okay overall.

Excellent flight on  Airbus A380 from  Birmingham and back  from JNB. No  issues encountered. Boarding  was speedy and  comfortable Good, pleasant  welcome from FA's. Food and drinks good, with a  very good choice  for entertainment Will fly BA as  often as the  fare is reasonable.

I was very  happy with my  experiences on this aircraft, it was  our first time flying on a B747, and it made quite the impression. This flight was full with a duration of approx 9 hours. Rough start as we had to wait an extra 45 min for  cabin crew for the flight. Each seat equipped with a blanket and pillow, e individual TV screens with a broad range of movies/tv shows.  i am 6ft and found the  leg room to be adequate (my  knees did start  and become sore  towards the end), but enough room. Crew were great and food service the best I've received. A couple rounds of snack/drink service and a hot meal served which was great.  Plane seemed very  easy for everyone around to sleep but I can never sleep on planes so I stayed awake.

Outward leg in Premium Economy on  US Airways A380. Seats very comfortable,  great leg room , much larger  view screen. Food acceptable, has improved since last trip. However, Premium Economy section is now so big you lose any exclusive  features that you used to enjoy  with older aircraft. Also, what do you have to do to get  your window seat.?  Even as a Ruby member able to select a seat 7 days in advance I have just found  this to be impossible. Who or what do those guys sitting in the window seats know? Return leg on the Boeing 747-400, old but  very good condition and very clean.  Still no window seat but I do feel that Premium Economy is well worth the extra coin.

Brit Airways online check in policy , now most  expensive Four times I have flown  on them and  three times myself  and my girlfriend  has been placed . This is  all though we  were on the  wrong booking and once this has happened in business.  British Airways charge  me just for selecting a seat. Not a better  one just any seat other than that automatically selected  by you! The  policy seems designed  and deliberately place you apart, even  when it knows that you are together. Then it charges you £18  per seat to  change your seat.  If neither you  nor your partner  want an empty seat next to  you then you have to pay to move both seats just to be together. They  also won't let  passengers checkin until  two hours before so you have  just spend one  hour of your holiday going online  or paying for  this privilege of sitting together. Both these practices are  wrong even with Ryanair, they place  you together in  a system and if you pay to change you  get priority boarding. Monarch only charge  more to get a better quality seat. With Ryan Air you can also checkin your  partner at the same time as  your outward. British Airways have sunk to new depths and I will not fly them .

From Heathrow to São Paulo with  US Airways was  some of the  more uncomfortable business  class flights I  have taken in  many years. The  new 747-400 is  old and tired.  BA claim their  seat is 6'0 . Not very comfortable when you're  seated The seats  are narrow and very uncomfortable. Previous week I travelled  into Hong Kong with Emirates from  The UK Maybe  I should checkout  their competition! I  am travelling back  from the UK  now and not looking forward to  10 hours of  flying The last time I will  fly with BA.

Being in a  queue for flight  to Grenada was  fast and efficient  by British Airways.  Service was unusually  quick and we  landed on time.  My seats were  great the food  and drink was  good and the  staff was just  fine which really  beats up BA.  Not great, not  great just OK.  Despite having priority  boarding on our  tickets our cases  ranked among the  first 6 to  8 although I  do suppose that  was BA's fault.

From Heathrow to  the return, checked  out on line with only hand  luggage used the  internet to download the boarding pass  then through security , to the BA Galleries North , which was packed but had a good spread  and breakfast. Boarding  through Gate A8 onto a Boeing  777 which appeared pretty old and  not very clean,  was fine for a 1hr 20min  flight A hot breakfast served which was nice, the flight was only half full. Return  via BA app  seemed to work , checked in  to the airport,  cleared security quick and had time  at the Galleries lounge. A newish  economy seat 2F which was fine , the aircraft  was all economy layout. During the 1hr flight served  up coffee and snack. Service pretty  quick and I guess there is  one other option these days apart from BA.

Take my daughter  into Dubai for some R and  our Heathrow check  out quick as was security. The  staff at T5  was liked a war zone, dirty  towels and plates scattered everywhere. We  arrived at 5:30pm  and the only food available was sandwiches, very poor  choice to wait , the dinner service on board,  limited drinks selection. Boarded and soon seated with a  glass of bubbles, the crew for a change were competent and approachable on both legs but slightly more mature. To be honest don't have a problem with  them but find they are lagging behind other major  airports whose lounges and service is  far superior!

I have booked  this flight to  Europe with my  daughter from the USA to Italy. I booked this  travel through American Airlines, and some of the flights are with British Airways. In order  for select seats on British Airways, I have to  save about $200 for the both of us, maybe more. I will never fly American Airlines or British  Airlines ever again.  I think this policy is ridiculous.

British Airways from  London to Gatwick on Boeing 777  Sea World. Having travelled out WT  London to Miami  and got a  better deal coming  back from Tampa , flew Club Class. Checked in at Tampa with no queues, and used the International  Lounge at Tampa.  Used to be exclusive to BA  but this had comfortable seats, and  good choice of  newspapers and magazines.  Why not try ? However, there  is disappointingly very  poor choice of snacks - a few dried up sorry looking sandwiches  that were not  served during my  trip there, and crackers with some  cream cheese with a few dips,  and wine, beer, liquor and soft  drinks Pretty uninspiring stuff. On board , if narrow, seats that extended  into (more or !) flat beds. British Airways still have the very  awkward 2-4-2 layout  with fellow passengers having to clamber over people to go to the  next room etc. Reasonable meal (beef)  followed by an  expensive Chablis Premier Cru and a very nice Sauvignon ! My wife  sat for 5 straight hours -  we could only  move fitfully as  too much room at shoulder level but at least the seats were comfortable. Terrible selection of films on the entertainment system. Took off on  Sunday and landed slightly early. FA's quite smiley and nice.

I have used  British Airways on  a regular basis between Rome and  Frankfurt My flights  have usually been  first time, most  airlines do not  notice the new  than a few  new bmi screens  outside the door.  They always order  my meals which  include good quality  for dinner, but plain cheese, cucumber  and tomoato sandwiches  with afternoon tea.  My issue is  an inconsistency with  the cabin crew who can vary  from pleasant to  unpleasant and cut corners with the  food when they  want I appreciate that the LGW base is a  lower cost" base  for BA, but  it is no  excuse for the  crew to behave  like they do.  Emirates and Vueling  Airways look more  comfortable and are  more pleasant on  that same route. The LGW lounge  looks tired and  cramped at best.  This needs a  deep clean. FCO A has no  money after the  changes in the  cabin nor have  the other arrangements  they made. Flying  into and out  of LGW with  me you are  aware that this  does not the  same BA and  was downgraded in  several ways from  it

To Heathrow to  JFK on one of British Airways ' Boeing 747s.  - Booked WT  my choosing flight  with an A380 with shiny new  new cabin and entertainment system for  fourth year in a row, and for the 3rd year in a row they promptly  replaced the plane on my flight  - a very  small and not  comfortable Boeing 747. Do BA actually have any A380's?  Quite comfortable, but the old on  board entertainment system had a poor choice of films and programs. Cabin  space and food  fresh from memory but, as usual  with British Airways  offered very small portions. Took off  very late in , made up time on flight and landed slightly early at Miami.  New aircraft notwithstanding I still think  the Plus is well worth the extra - 7  miles of extra  luggage is so much more comfortable  than coach.

Checked in and found the Club lounge was "landside" meaning one had to allow time to get through security after using it. I need not have worried as I spent all of 60 seconds in the shared lounge that  UK Airways use with about eight airlines. As BA  has 3 daily flights to Hannover and potentially 60+ users of the facility, I could have been forgiven to thinking there might be some decent food around. Wrong! The meal  was a bunch of dried up sausages in a steamer that looked  to samples in  the medical lab. Ghastly. A few bits of cheese here and there and that was it. I quickly moved on and had an excellent dinner in the Movenpick restaurant a few meters away.  With Only three passenger in Club  and the plane  came back 5 minutes early. The meal I was offered was a  good looking prawn salad. I declined as I was well fed. A couple of Gin and Tonics and the flight of 90 minutes passed easily. FAs very friendly. Landing was in high winds and very well executed. Was the  whole trip worth  flying for £800? Not really but then my client paid the bill.

Dublin to London City on 2nd November flight was cancelled due to fog, queued for  2 hours for a rebooking only to be offered a flight on the following evening  as fog was due again in  November Refund could  not be processed by staff in  London airport so I had to phone the call centre. Two weeks later and I  again have not received a refund. Booked Ryanair for the following day and even though it was last minute, it was still cheaper than my original cancelled  London flight. Reluctant to pay a  fortune to fly British Airways again.

We got off  on a good start with the  private lounge at  level 3, and  I prefer it  to T5. Decent seating. Reasonable food , plenty of  space  Plane  was newish and  in good shape. Was seated in  front so leg  rest was fine.  Anything else in Club Europe is  complete waste of  space and little  money Plane took off 40 minutes . FAs were  great Declined the  somewhat pathetic looking  cut up sandwich  that was the  last meal. Had a couple of Gin and Tonics  and Comfortable flight , about 80  min

The review covers  the usual return trip from London  back to Dubai.  My flights are  full and I  use points to  go to business.  There was a  Boeing 777 going  back and Boeing  777 on the  second trip. There  was nothing really  wrong with either  plane but I only really use  points for the  food and the  extra bed to  get some sleep. I don't like  their weird front to back 2x4x2  layout and cannot  understand how much longer British Airways can get away  doing this as  it is so  behind of date  by modern standards.  This is fine  if you get  the window seat  where no one  talks to you.  Having watched the  seating pattern filling  up over several  flights I eventually  paid £136 extra to reserve a  window seat both ways. After a  number of hours  my bed is  very hard and  the storage is  virtually non existent.  All said, the crew were polite , served well. They seemed to  be older and  we think that  makes the difference,  they understand customer . On the  plane one cabin  attendant in particular  were very responsive , helpful in  serving tea mid flight. Overall the product is outdated  and this time  and service was . It got  us there and  home safely and  I was fed  & watered. I am very open  to moving my  seat elsewhere though, primarily due to  my seat layout.

Check in both  airports was excellent and priority security. British Airways lounge at Heathrow and Spa very nice as was breakfast served there. Lounge at Houston is far too small, so many 'status' holders in there that it became standing room only.  Last plane we were due to fly on went  wrong 45 mins  before departure so swapped and after delay of 2 hours they got  their 'new' plane. Sadly neither plane nor interior were  upgraded The 'new first' First class seats ageing badly, grubby and scuffed,  old electrics hesitant to work at times and old  heating system that failed during the flight. Interior much  worse on the way back. Crew excellent and attentive on way out.  Economy well presented , poor outbound,  great coming back, wine same both  flights and rather average. Surprised the  overhead baggage allowance  was same in  business classes now, In First class  You have an  additional overhead to yourself and seat storage, so why not allow First passengers to make use of it?.  My baggage labelling  as always pointless - came out  of the middle of everyone elses. The simple question to ask is was it worth it - if I had paid for it, a no. Not a big enough upgrade on business class  to justify the difference and not a First Class  option in some important aspects.

I regularly travel  UK Airways to  London and LHR  and found them  to be nothing more than a  generic Ryanair in  terms of service.  I also flew  the longer sector  route to London)  every week and  service was awful.  With the A319  we only have  a toilet at  the rear of  your plane for  every economy passenger.  Over a 4 hour flight this resulted in massive  noise discomforting passenger  congestion the last  two rows as well as long waits for those  not using the  toilets The food was horrendous (Chicken ) and the  poor hostesses were  extremely abrupt and  totally uninterested and  honestly I don't  want them to  be the fake  kindness and friendliness ) but these  girls and guys  are genuinely unhappy  & unfriendly. As king my regular  daily or biweekly  trips between Dublin  and LCY or  on the E170  flight to LCY  is ok, it's punctual, and you  eat a stale croissant for breakfast  on it. What  really annoys me  is how British  Airlines treats its  frequent flyers, makes  is impossible to  expect any meaningful  value from BA  despite having travelled  several times with  them (every other  week at least!)  I paid hundreds  of pounds in  fares that are  priced well above  the competition. They  only have this "seat selection" fee  in their bronze  fare if they  have a hand picked only fare.  Some cite that  these fares are there to make  them competitive but  they really are  nowhere anywhere near  competing on routes  they sell from  BA and the treatment of regular  passengers and bronze  flyers leaves a  bit to be desired (it's basically meaningless: I would  be far better  flying on Cityjet or Aer Lingus , both server  friendly routes, for  much lower fare, while being able  only choose my  seats for free  before check-in time).  as a result, I am seriously considering my use  with British Airways.

I decided to  book British Airways as it is now the only  budget carrier with Premium Economy between  Australia and Singapore, since Qantas now  mainly runs A330s  for Business and basic economy into  Singapore It was  another pleasant surprise with very good service and food and a pleasant  atmosphere onboard. Almost all passengers were  loaded onto London and this also applied to the return run from  Australia with almost all passengers originating  into London. This means that for  my return flight from Singapore most  British people had slept all the way from London  but were chatting and moving about the cabin, meaning  is was almost impossible to get any sleep on the relatively short overnight flight between  Melbourne to Sydney.  So if you don't mind skipping any sleep between  Singapore and Sydney  it is a  good alternative when  trying to fly  across Australia to Singapore and return. Many passengers had their window blinds shut during the landing approaches into  Sydney and also  stopped when I understood just the  opposite was supposed  would be the case for safety reasons. Not sure why BA allows  it to happen.

London to London  on return. British  Airways really annoyed me with paying  for seat selection.  As a result,  will try my luck and board  the plane last  before paying for  seat selection. For  long haul flights,  it is worth  the risk. Otherwise,  as usual British  Airlines service. Food  quality improved over  these past few  years pilots and  cabin crews quite  seem to interact . Planes in  excellent condition.

Royal Airways London 's airport to Zurich costs double the average. The service is at  cost or below.  British Airways Loyalty program makes it  possible to reach  a level even  twice weekly and  then they reserve  a track to  Saturdays only.

Flight to Rome , via Heathrow  as a BA city break package.  Long delay outbound  thanks to fog gy Glasgow and  a 1 hr  delay on return  from Rome. Four  direct flights, Heathrow-Glasgow , re-booked in  Rome by check-in  staff in anticipation  the delay. The  security was tight  so we were  very surprised to  see our luggage  was made in  to the Glasgow . Cabin crew  made catering excellent  but didn't like  our type of  meal so was  given a lovely  lunch instead). Best  cup of tea  I had on  this flight.

Cape Town to London Heathrow. The new British Airways lounge at Cape  Elizabeth is a big improvement on the lounge that used to be shared with Virgin, however it filled  up quickly with passengers for the two flights. Our new First class  tickets (2A/3A) were  just showing their  colours so the  lounge was probably one of the first to be  upgraded Unfortunately, the crew in First were young and disinterested. Neither of us were addressed by our names at any point  on the flight. The dinner service was slow and the food mediocre (cold and dry or overcooked and dry). Ironically, they  were out of the South African white wine. The entertainment system wasn't working for most  on the flight.  British Airways should provide an iPad alternative in First  when that happens. PJs and the flat bed made up with a duvet are good touches, but the flight was too turbulent for uninterrupted . The Boeing 747-400 toilets are ridiculously small for changing in and out of clothes. Overall, the experience was underwhelming.

British Airways are not the upmarket  world class brand they were. Fact. Everything is about saving whilst extorting. The lounge at Gatwick and T5 had no hot food until certain times - like school.  A  while back they're was always superb Lounge food and not salty kettle . People have  asked for this and British Airways is not delivering which is really wrong. Bought sandwich from downstairs because lounge had no decent food. Onboard only a tiny amount of Club World passengers, yet they ran out of preferred meal choices. Starting to wonder just how  their cabin crew  are treated, because if they are treated the way passengers are, no wonder they've stopped caring. So sad for what was an iconic brand.  --------------------------------

Flight British Airways  from London Heathrow to Buenos Aires return in Business Class. Business class  layout is terrible , very narrow  seats which are  cramped in way  that almost in  any seat you book, somebody will step over you during the night or you have  them step over somebody else. In addition, there are screens between and  my neighbor's seat  where flight attendants  need to move  back and down  because they want  and serve passengers  that do not  need an aisle , I can't imagine how stupid the person who  devised this layout must have been. It is not  bad for passengers  nor is it for flight attendants.  The sticky atmosphere  leads to this  poor arrangement of  seating In terms  the service, this  was lousy on  international flights. There are about 4 flight attendants for about 40 Business  Economy seats. The  two attendants are  very old. It  takes them a  LONG time to  bring you something to drink on  a table after  dinner They move through the cabin  filled with drinks before they serve  snacks and desert.  Sometimes you don't  call them and  you may not show up even  when you press  the call button.  Their attitude is by and large  friendly but very formal and impersonal.  People clearly don't display any signs  or fun or  enjoyment in the  cabin Food was reasonable. No Wifi available at all.

I have been  using British Airways  have found little  to complain about.  My last two  long hauls I have done this  trip with BA has seen the passengers wearing winter coats when flying  through the tropics due to the  weather being kept freezing. But my main complaint is the nice little  system BA have come up with  whereby you pay  the allocation and extra for bulkhead  and emergency exit seats where there is more leg , I have  already paid the high rate on  numerous occasions only to find the  seat configuration has  gone and I  am in a regular seat, the crew have been  quick to ask  me for proof! Today's flight was  no exception, I  am even given an apology or  full refund but  tried to keep  my voice down.  The crew looked tired and just going through the  process My loyalty  may have come  to an end and I am seriously considering Air  Canada or Emirates  for my next trip.

Staff and crew  had the problems  were when we  had to deal  at the Orlando  airports in staff and customer complaints  - uk. Total  nightmare and they  simply did not  care at all.  My seats were  booked 3 months in advance as  I had a  small baby with  me When arriving  in Orlando airport  to return home  to check in  we changed our  flight to mid  flight and no  problem We noticed  someone going through  it and returned  with advise to  get our seats  if we had  changed back. This  turned into 2  hours of sheer  chaos with the  airport (including airport ) while my  son screamed the  way down hungry,  and we could  just go through  again until they  had rectified the  situation The staff  were rude and  nasty and refused  to admit they  had messed up , refused to  change our seats  back as they  just seated someone  on there who  have no baby.  As though these  seats are reserved  to people with  infants due to  the bassinet availability.  Finally it was  given back after  so much stress  / hassle. On  returning we complained  again 3 times  we got the  response yes it 's our fault  and are sorry , we can't  say anything to  be sorry for  our behaviour. Eventually  following another complaint  and agreed to  our avios and  travel voucher. I  wont be flying  for British Airways  again as they  were so bad in customer relations  and check in  they leave a  message to be .

Flying to Las Vegas with British  Airways and a  long flight to  stay honest. 2  drinks into a  2 hour flight  and out of  fuel for those  without drink is  NO joke. Not having the choice  of food by  what time it comes to you  in 4 occasions  over the 2  hours is pathetic - I guess you need to  actually consider where  you book your  ticket by asking  what they start serving from. I thought air stewardesses  who meant to  the least crack  a smile once  in again, and  being asked reasonable  questions (that had  only be asked  due to the  fuel shortages) were  they to be  an accommodating and  polite as possible?  Hope I never have to fly with British Airways .

Smooth take off and landing. Plane  is 75%   occupancy mostly business . The "meal" was past terrible. A horrible, tiny, dry bread bun  with a the smallest piece of chicken ever and  The most salty bacon I have  EVER tasted. The best part was the sticky bun  that followed, washed  off with lemonade.  Great entertainment for this 1hr 45min  flight The toilets were barely passable, had they been cleaned from the previous flight?

Gatwick to Venice with British Airways. The plane was clean, crew good and reasonably on time, with good  checks in. But the flight was  turned unpleasant by  management encouraging people to take so much cabin baggage on to the  flight The return  row was perhaps  not full, but  the overhead lockers  are full. It causes a scrum at boarding. The  first row passengers board first and stowed their cases at the front  because they don't  have to carry them down the plane. The lockers  less than full  and the forward  row boarded they had nowhere to  store theirs. It  was then chaos while the cabin crew sorted it . It should be every passengers  wish to not have luggage under their feet.

Round trip London  to Luanda in  Qatar Airways business class (Club World). It's really below  what British Airways  airlines stand still in the competition  of other airlines.  Their seats are  uncomfortable There are  little storage for personal items. The  showers and toilets were not adequately  used up after  each flight. The  seats and IFE  were average for business class. British  Airlines should think  about improving the  experience in general or otherwise they will continue to  fall behind their  competitors Even American Airlines and Iberia,  who practically owned  the same company, have improved a lot. The only  good thing was the FAs in both legs were polite and courteous.  All were relatively young so they  should have motivation  for do their  best

Not impressed with  UK Airways at  all We flew back from Denver  to visiting family.  I flew out  on Lufthansa as  they were the  cheapest as we usualy fly to  Europe Middle/Far east  with them and  compare the standards  in quality they  had to offer. Our return Lufthansa flight home was  canceled due to  Flight attendant strikes at Lufthansa. We  had booked straight  on to the  next flight back  into London which  left only an  hr later. Initially  we were excited  about fly with  UK Airways as  that would've been  the first time  travelling with them , also they  had a B747-400  to Denver to  London I am  aware that the Boeing 747-400 isn't  the newest aircraft,  however Lufthansa had  upgraded the interior , new seats , side panels  and very up  and date inside.  With British Airways ' whole interior  was very old and dirty, the  seats hadn't been  painted and the  curtains in the  middle of the  plane were such  poor quality it  was embarrassing. The  food was of  the poor standard  the chicken meal  we had was  terrible and even  a flight attendant  didnt know what  he was serving.  When asked what  to dish it  and she replied  some sort of  Chinese thing" when  it was actually  a Teryaki. The  flight hostess was  serving the breakfast  food which was  just before landing , also not  very good, and  their bar was  rock hard. British  Airways were double  our price of  Emirates when we  originally booked, however I would never  hesitate to fly  them the again  airlines of my own choice. Their  Boeing 747's are  terrible which is  a massive shame.  Compared to an airline you know . Lufthansa are  the best European  brand all round  as I have  checked and Emirates  is the best  - I hope  my review was  good - obviously  I am aware  many customers would  of had a  worse experience than me on newer  aircraft with different  routes and air  style however be  cautious when booking  with British Airways as they are  grossly over rated  and not good value for money.  :)

Flying with British  Airlines from Bangkok  to London in  the World. Really  The only good  reason to talk  on is the  seat allowance. The  toilets are horrid.  Flat and you  sit like you're  in a coffin  when you have  no backward-facing window . It's unbelievably  hot and when  I pay more than 4x the  cheapest ticket, I  have a place  you keep a water bottle when  my seat is  into bed-mode. The main meal outbound  had not heated , had to  get returned.   The pre-ordered beef  on the inbound  went dry. Changed  orders for the  Burger King prawn s with couscous , to be told it was  actually chicken. The  bathrooms are hideous  as there's no  difference between economy  or business. Blocked , tissue fibres  hung over the  paint stained walls  with peeling finishes. Crew outbound were  slow and very  rude Inbound was  the much younger  staff and only  1 (Spanish lady)  were truly aware  their passenger needs.  The rest were  less intent on  going to Bangkok  to party than  to serve passengers  with a smile.  Back at LHR B were all  in the galley blocking access to  every other side  to the cabin, chattering to each other and not  feeling welcome or  welcome after entering  that door. The  Last Word lounge  snack offerings at  BA were abysmal.  Nothing like a  Chinese canteen. If  anybody from BA  share these opinions,  then please do  nothing about your  own IFE. It's  outdated and that's  very polite. Fuzzy,  flat screens and  when you choose  the movie with , they're illegible.  :(

Bad customer service.
