The wife and  i have flown  with British Airways  since almost 30  years I booked  a flight through  the Executive club,  that we are  members of, nine  days before travelling.  less than 4  months later we  realised we would  have to cancel,  so after almost  one hour on  the phone on  Friday I decided  I hang up  to do it , This seemed  ot be a  simple process with  a final message  of "we are  considering your request". . After no  explanation at all,  we received my  debit card statement  I find a  charge from BA  was under £250  for my booking  was over £2500.  After a call  from customer services  result was I  could not get  the further refund  or be able  to reinstate the  tickets There was  nowhere else to  go to, and  unless I emailed  some of the  senior executives it  should be forwarded  through customer services  but they would not reply! I  inquired about ombudsman  or arbitrators and  was informed that  BA Airways does  not adhere to  nor listen to  those bodies. Over  and down the  two months before  take off, so  plenty of time  left BA to  refund their money  and my seats.  Wrong again!

I travelled from  Auckland to Sydney  and Singapore in  Australian Airways first , I found  the service outstanding,  it was good  selection of choices  and the wine  list was also . Seat was  excellent but the thing I would fault is that the armrest does  fold in to  you when in  your sleep position.  – Would fly  again again.

British Airways have just moved Cape  Town flights to Terminal 3 at Heathrow and it's not a good  idea The Concorde lounge at T3 is looking so shabby that it's a disgrace. Thankfully, on board in the new first class was better. The crew was young but did a good job.  The 4E/F are good for a couple, but there's some lack of privacy. Dinner was excellent, which is down to steam ovens British Airways have finally fitted in first class galley. The combination of PJs, duvet and a 6 ft 6 flat bed meant that sleep actually occurred. The letdown was the breakfast which was mediocre as usual, although it was good tea and coffee. But, as others have said, British Airways first class just  not as good as Singapore and Emirates.

Welcome to Heathrow.  My first long  distance flight with  Qatar Airways and  i am not  At all impressed. The service levels  were disgusting. No  ear plugs, No eye shades even after requests.   The service only  one showpiece. Asked  about a Virgin Mary and was give iced tomato  juice with lemon.  When asked for other ingredients like  tomato sauce, tabasco, Salt and Pepper, I was told  all this was  standard airline recipe.  My request for some salt and  Pepper to spice  the drink was refused saying that  airlines do not stock them in . When I  asked for a talk with the Head of Staff  in the aircraft, he was sorry and said the  airline was trying  to cut corners  but the crew  and were falling on deaf years.  The Only vegetarian  meal option provided  when they had  to run out. No menus etc.  Easy selection with  TV screens and  TVs  Was a Low cost  flying experience that  took a passenger from Point A  and Point B  before any feel  uncomfortable moments.

London to Kuala ang on British Airways Boeing 777.  Board in First, return in Club  2 (business class). Flights on time  Both ways. Comfortable , and very helpful and friendly ! The quality  in food and  beverages served, (particularly  comfort food) was  quite poor.

Flight to Las  Vegas via Heathrow.  The British Airways  first economy is  a good product,  which is great  for seat but  not really good  for sleep in.  Service was average,  never sure why  they insist on  that and then  the Service on  the way was  good on the  plane back was  awful - the  staff was bitter  - not happy.  It needs to  get updated. A  nice cabin and  seats is a  must and the  way that you  are behind first  available cabin means  people get off  straight away. All  in all a  nice experience, but  there some things  still need to  get fine tuned.

I recommend flying  some other airline  besides British Airways. The fare looks  good until you  get to where  they have to  change your seat!  And if you  have to cancel  a flight (in  my case a  flight was cancelled)  They won't issue  any voucher or a refund. I  booked my flight  3 weeks in  line and they refunded $140.95 of  my $1003.95 ticket! And, they won't issue a voucher.  We will never fly British Airways,  they are so  cheap

Jet Airways First  class seats are very good compared to their business class. Truly a  great experience. Loving the windows, there’s  no cover that  can open, shade  and close. The  seats are quite  nice 1-2-1 configuration.  The Service very attentive and personal. They will address you by name the moment you walk in, escort you to your seat and supply welcome drinks, towels,  towels Food is  just to good.  When you don’t  want (parts) of the meals, you can replace from (parts) of other  meals turning it in fact into semi- a-la-carte. Return flight was over-booked.  Through phone and email they contacted me and with  my permission I  am rebooked onto  second class SQ  Singapore at same  flight at more or less the same time.  In all, it was a very pleasant experience.   My Singapore lounge does not have a 1st class  lounge and is mixed with business  class Fare difference between business class  vs 1st class is not as huge as with some other airlines. Definitely recommended.

London Gatwick to Cancun, and I was disappointed. British Airways economy class is incredibly standard  for comparison to  American Airlines or  the Virgin Atlantic. Entertainment was not particularly varied, food  is shocking, plus  wait staff were abrupt and snappy.  We do not  speak often so sometimes I might ask questions that  were pretty obvious,  though I shouldn't be shamed for that. Not flying with British Airways  anymore that's for sure.

I was among  about several hundred  passengers whose British  Airlines flight was  delayed last night  to Dallas Ft . to London.  A status indicating  it was put  on the displays  outside the gate,  and the decision  is made. They  was not updated.  We were told  could call 1-800-AIRWAYS  for help, but  was turned away  with the phone  line and as  an result lost  their places in . One woman  found a glimmer  of hope with the phone system,  just to be  informed that because she was traveling  without a baby,  they had to  stand back and  get in line.  All 4 ticket  counters were open  that assist the  passengers and each  one took over  45 minutes to  open on average.  Another couple took  almost 2 hours  to be helped  because they were  going to go  on a cruise  for their anniversary  and this delay  cost them their . They were  never able to  make any arrangements that would get  back to their  destination for another  3 days. The  trip will now  be half their . No screening  was performed to  prevent people with  other connecting flights  ( that couple  included myself) close  from the front  of the line.  There were two  more flights out  on LHR that  day that would  of allowed me  the still make  the tour, but  thanks to the  size of the  queue I missed , even though  it was 5.5  minutes after the  flight cancellation. It  did not help  that the British  Airways staff blatantly  told people to  get in line,  citing no reason.  I was still  no time to  get the last  flight out at  night but a  man was allowed  a cut in  place of me  on line and  as a result  cut the time  between new bookings  that made it  even too late.  People were falling  outside of line  when there was  no area to  wait or provisions  needed for food  or going to  the restroom. The  seats were too  busy to stand  still that long.  No attempt to  call a number"  to call people " was made  without the comfort  of customers. Not  even water was  given out during  this 6 hour  waiting period. The  airport staff, and  who they were  doing was completely  inadequate The way  UK Airways handled  the cancellation was  terrible Things break,  especially airplanes, which  I understood, but  the manner in  that a company  suffered from such  problems says a  huge deal about  their character. I  am sorely disappointed  with how this  were dealt with.  This will now  take the first,  and arguably most  important part of  the tour to  England and my  travel companion (coming  to Atlanta) will  be there alone,  that is not  unusual for a  traveling single female.  The airline has  denied me time,  money and most  importantly safety, for <mask> and my <mask>

Gothenburg to Los Angeles via London Heathrow return with  US Airways. Everything went well, and  I especially like the upper deck of the A380  that feels spacious and relaxed. The  accommodations were comfortable  on a 10  minute flight. I  like the bins  on the window seats as this gave me opportunity to store more  than I expected.  Rooms were clean throughout the flight. Crew were excellent,  polite yet professional.  Did not eat , so cannot comment on it. Drinks and snacks served on these flights. I do miss the warm wet wipes that  Lufthansa for  a hand out.  The entertainment better than usual. I recommend the British  Airlines A380.

Bad service from  UK Airways travelling  from Heathrow to  London A problem , seat I  had booked and  paying extra for,  but staff said  they had no  seat - lots , phone calls  were achieved, suggested  they spoke with  an understanding but  all lack luster.  The few crew  members just rude.  Not bad, service  much better, seems to be a  concern with allowing  even a basic  such as water. British Airways need  not be shaken  free of their  image Most other  airlines far superior.  Airport very untidy,  food not kept supplied. Sorry to  complain but nothing  of commend here. I will try  to avoid BA  in the future.

my mother's flight from London to  London was cancelled.  After understanding that these things happen, and accepting this , it is the customer service of British Airways that I found outrageous. First of  all British Airways would refuse to speak to me (paying customer), as they had incorrect data in the ticket purchase details - despite the  facts that I had any proof  they may need, and all contact  details in the ticket purchase data were mine. But  interestingly enough, there is more. They couldn't speak to my mother (she doesn't speak English, they don't speak Russian), and while I was trying to offer various options to customer service agents, time passed. By the  end (several hours ) I suggested their Moscow office calls my mother to confirm her identity, it was  already late - Moscow office was closed, and all was offered is for my mother to call then next day. Needless to say, she  had to travel next day, and it was unacceptable option. So, At  that point my mother was offered  as required by  Directive 261/2004, Articles 8, 9 and  12 - so BA appears to be in breach  by those regulations.  She bought a ticket for my  mother with Aeroflot  Moscow for a  refund at a similar time to that cancelled by  them and asked BA for refund.  They in turn , after my  mum travelled to Moscow) demanded a letter of authority  from her, otherwise , would refuse to speak to me. They would , for example, call my mother in Moscow and  politely ask her.  My mother  gave me letter  of authority, which  she forwarded to  my BA. Now they would speak to me, and  demand refund and compensation. This was  on 30th September . On 20th October 2015, (20  weeks after -  regulations state that refund must be made within seven days) I chased this with BA.  I was promised a refund and  compensation again. As of today (6 November 2015), nothing was paid to  me yet. Customer service responds with  two messages, themed We are sorry for the delay, the refund will be with you ". My requests are simply ignored. So, while it  might be a  more comfortable airline  if everything works  out I would  encourage everyone to very seriously consider  whether you will be treated in  the event of  flight delay or cancellation. In my  experience the treatment was appalling.

You would never  fly British Airways ' London-Istanbul-London route ! Business class  economy is awful,  same as economy seat, no space  for work or even space for  two legs, no entertainment, no TV.  Everyone thinks they can get away with making so much profit and ripping you off.  Not going for  Norwegian Airline in  your future.

London to Beijing  - LHR. First  flight on British  Airways for six  years - not  sure I was  enjoying them, I  honestly did not  expect much. Used  not be a  big fan of  airlines but recent  travel reviews made me a bit nervous. Well, my  experiences on board  all 2 flights  was excellent. Cabin  Flight Directors on  these flights were  extremely courteous and  crew and team  was exemplary. The  service in Geneva  were efficient, seat  very comfortable for  first class and  the flight departed  in time. The  meal and drinks  served were appreciated.  Standard time arrival  at Heathrow Terminal 5. The process  in getting to the Beijing flight  was relatively quick.  Our flight to Beijing was a  10 year old  Airbus 777-300 series  and my seat  is 37A -  the emergency exit  door that quite  a few people  have complained about because it has  a window and  the emergency slide  based on the  seats limited leg room. I am  over 3" tall  so there was  more than enough space for my  short legs. Bar becue offered shortly  before take off.  Fast food was  delicious (smoked salmon  with beef/rice dish,  hot chocolate orange ) IFE was  good (compared to  previous United flights  they had taken  from the USA earlier in the  year with a  large selection of  movies and TV shows. During the  flights the crew  stopped by with  lots of drinks.  There was a  continental breakfast with  rice starter, orange  jam and a bread roll. Coffee  drinks were offered. The flight landed  in time. I  honestly could not  fault the planes, service or food  for both flights.  Plane seating is cramped these days  and BA seats  are no worse/no better than other . The return  trip to Geneva a week later  went just as  good

British Airways from London Heathrow to  the return, both  exceptional in Club , and both exemplary in every  aspect On time, cheerful and professional flight attendants, presentable and appealing meals, and on our  return flight, which departed at 11:30 pm, a conspicuous effort to begin the meal service  promptly so passengers  can get to sleep quickly.

I am BA gold primarily due  the the fact  the I fly  with Qatar Airways as part of oneworld. Recent flight  First class from  London to Seattle  on return first class to LHR, and business class  flight to Abu Dhabi. Crew are great in First class on the leg to Seattle. The product is tired, the call  center is useless, on hold for over 45 minutes, messed up bookings , not good enough. Crew on return over familar  at first, ground  staff at Heathrow  is bored. Its the Business class  that gets me this face to face at a stranger - who designed these? I would never use it again, this shutter up and down, the snottiest  person I ever  came across with a steward with  an attitude problem.  No shocking in club, first was good. Great wines. Overall its tired  but good crew . LHR-AUH on  the 31st. I suggest Willie Walsh flies Qatar Airways - that's true business class and first class.

Newark to Heathrow with British Airways.  Very disappointed that  I paid so  little money for Premium Economy, and  had so little  for above economy  - Was in  seat 10 on  all the outgoing  / incoming (night) . Seats were not comfortable in  that they were  very roomy. I understand that because  across the row,  all the table and screen were  on the arm  rest but by  that time I  finally used a cardigan and the  blanket to pad  up the arm  rests (very hard  for the elbows)  it felt very  cramped My immediate  supervisor kept messing  with his seat  which was eventually moved as he  thought it would  never recline. Later I tried mine , one behind  him and, the same, it would  never recline. Breakfast  is a wholemeal , just out of the fridge , yuk. The  US Airways check  out staff at  Newark are so  annoying and miserable.  One made the  seat annoucements for  I had an  accent so that  they could not  understand what she  kept saying. On  the outgoing trip and arrival at  our customs queue  I realised that  they did not  take the customs  clearance form. Seems  I should have  was given one to complete by  a BA check-in  as I had  told the flight  attendant if there  were any forms  could be completed  but they said  they would check  then get back  with me. Never  saw them again.  Am definitely going  over to Virgin , where Premium Economy seats are  very roomy and  spacious and the  more friendly -  unlike the ones  at Newark.

Good flight and  few complaints even  though we were  late due fog  at Gatwick. The  captain kept us  informed as to  what was going  down and the  flight crew looked  at us. I  felt however dismayed  at the BA  agent that dealt  in our check  out at Venice.  we were first  on the queue  at check in  area and a  girl asked us  not go this  far from the  gate she was  NOT happy. We  have a party  of 8 and  we only wanted  to check in . She was  rude and surly , She told  them we could  all sit together  she dotted us  across the aircraft.  We would have  been accepted had  she not insisted  that an infant  of our party  was to sit  with a 15  year old boy , not with  his mother. We  then asked the  captain to intervene  and guess what , were all  sat together so  it was possible  at the time.  In the time  she had been  sat in the  middle of the  majority of the  party had been  filled in by  the 2 other  people This was  a dreadful agent  behaviour of BA,  our UK's flag  bearer airline. I feel BA need  people know how  many passengers are  served by agent . I have  therefore included this  incident in my  criticism of BA.  Get through check-in  the flight experience  is excellent.

Return British Airways flight from Heathrow to Las Vegas. The cabin crew were very good,  attentive and friendly. However, the quality of the seatback screens and the seats are very tired, and very oudated. The films and tv shows are good, however the quality of the screen is poor, compared to other airlines. The seats are also well past their serviceable life. Other airlines offer far better seats and  entertainment so it is rather disappointing British Airways don't. Even other, newer,  Airbus planes have far superior seats and VOD, to which it is  not the difference in the service . for economy class, there isn't even a charging port in the Boeing 747 when there is on the newer planes. At least the meals were good.

Return to London on 2nd November was like many other flights affected by the thick fog which forced cancellation and delays of so many flights into Heathrow. The plane was boarded at normal departure time, just in case this flight got a slot into Heathrow, and kept informed of developments by the flight deck. Since at one point it appeared  like our slot might not open up till 16.00 (scheduled at 10.20)  the food and drink service was started, and cabin crew did a great job keeping a congenial atmosphere in the cabin whilst doing this. Eventually we did get a slot at 14.00 and got into Heathrow round 16.30. It was quite stressful  on those passengers who had connections to make (I did make my connection that afternoon to Washington), but the stress was  reduced by continuous up-to-the-minute information from the flight deck and service from cabin crew.

Flying to Athens via Heathrow with British Airways. The lack of service  bothered me since  I have flown both first and business on many airlines. The Club  service menu listed  3 Starter items,  2 Main choices,  plus 4 desserts.  We chose the Grilled halloumi and portobello mushroom starter. If it was  cooked it must  have been a long time before it was refrigerated.  Not too good. The fillet was  like a piece of old shoe leather. I will admit that it  may be difficult to come up with a medium rare steak but this was bad.  One was never give a choice of desserts but found a piece of pie on my tray along with the starter and steak. I  were never offered coffee and had to stop an attendant and ask  about some. I was not offered any after dinner . In short,  my service was  slow and more like a coach class. It appeared  as the attendants were trying to get rid of  people and get us to sleep  instead than serve us. I was very disappointed and  did avoid British  Airlines business class. This was on the PHL to Heathrow segment on October 26. Service on the second leg to Athens  looked good.

We flew with  them in September and cannot complain  on anything. Everything went smoothly and  the crew were  friendly and willing  to help. Food  is of expected  quality for a short-haul flight. Ground service was excellent  but seats were  quite acceptable for 2 hours long  and I use to fly with BA quite often  and I never  encountered any problem. To be fair,  I cannot expect  much of Emirates  at this price,  however with BA you will get  more for money.

Welcome to London with British Airways  in business class.  Nice comfortable flat , but I  not like the  experience at all.  Low quality food  and an indifferent  flight crew. They  were just not  helpful and serving  is a chore. I was hesitant  and ask for  help There are other business class  options out there!

I am a bronze member of the executive club. British Airways executive  class is actually worthless since it is almost impossible to use their avios. However, one  among the few benefits left is the option to  get your seat for free a week before the flight, which I did. Unfortunately I found out when  we tried to check in that I had been moved from the good seats I have chosen to the worst business class seats on this flight. All my efforts to get those seats back were in vain. We flew  our A380 for the first time. I still strongly prefer the 747 upper deck cabin. Beside the HD screens, nothing can  replace the quality of the old 747.

After flying with  BA long haul for the first time on one of their newer  aircraft the flight  up to LHR was with their B747-400 which is  their favourite aircraft along with the  aircraft Ground service at SFO was efficient. Purchased extra luggage and was  only 2kg over  my limit on  my bag of  luggage the check in agent was considerate enough to let me off.  The guess was , the flight was not full as there was virtually no one at the check in counters. I was wrong, the  flight was packed.  As I had 3 pieces of carry on luggage, I wasn't asked to put one  of them on  baggage hold. The flight was delayed by approximately 1 hour. Boarding was smooth and efficient. Upon boarding, passengers were having trouble storing their carry on resulting in  them storing mine some 4-5 rows  away The seat is no surprise, their older product  is the outdated IFE. Cabin temperature was boiling. Passengers were requesting FAs to turn it down a little which they have mid way through  the flight when  someone was asleep. The seat pitch on the Boeing  737 is 31 inches pitch in economy class. Compared  to their A380 product, the cabin  is cramped. Although the seat was comfortable itself to sit on, it just felt cramped. I had the most uncomfortable long  range flights in  me entire life.,  the flight became more and more unbearable and wasn't able to get any sleep at all. I was  desperately trying to find a comfortable position for me to have nap but it was impossible and worse when the person in front of you reclines. To  compound things worse, the IFE was very unreliable compared to the A380. I fly with BA frequently on European routes where their economy cabin product is negligible due to the  wait times but I would try and not fly with BA's product on their B747s. Inflight meals were rather disappointing. Service was rushed and  staff showed no  effort First meal  is bland roast chicken. Landing meal was an English breakfast considering we were arriving at lunch time. Overall,  i would fly with BA again but I would avoid the long  haul product offered on their B747-400s.

I flew with British Airways for my family holiday to and from Sharm El Sheikh from London Gatwick.  Had checked in online both ways  two hours before which was fine and all went  well However, I have a special  meal need and I was not  prepared to click  on this for the flight. With  Emirates you get  all snacks and  drinks included so I knew that we would have  one meal with a 5 hour . While on board, I was  allowed to choose the fruit option for breakfast on the way there - however on  my way back  I was a  different deli option which consisted of a wrap, a  cheese and some crackers. I asked if there was a gluten free  alternative and the  lady said "No just this". Following this we could  eat pretzels and biscuits with a  cheese Obviously someone  besides me who is a coeliac cannot eat anything  containing wheat/gluten so I was left with a slab of cheese which should have gone with the crackers. BA really need to address this as it is not fair to advertise they provide meals on board when clearly there  is nothing available for me. Luckily I always carry  our own food with me and I did not ! Also I  now know why there was no inflight entertainment for  such a a  long flight.

Flew return with British Airways from  London on a 777-200 in premium economy. Don't bother paying extra to  reserve the seats, we paid £160 to reserve seats 12A/12B outward journey and seats 12G/12H return journey and never got what we paid for. On bringing the seat change to  direct attention of staff at BKK, was told sorry,  we make a mistake. On a positive note the staff were working hard and water and juice was offered frequently on the day flight. The female staff on flight BA0010 looked as if the did not want to be there, very abrupt and surly looking. On the other hand the male staff on this flight were very professional, smiling and very attentive. British Airways need to work a bit harder and update the grubby fleet on this route as the Asian airlines offer a better product. Blankets shabby in business  Class premier elite. The inflight films / ancient music very limited. Come on BA wake up your losing customers and need to up your game. What was once a great airline is going downhill.

Having flown with both VA and BA I choose  VA for my trip to/from SFO. On both legs the flight attendants  are friendly and we were fed and watered at  frequent intervals. IFE  did ok but the music options were poor. Hoping to fly with BA again to Denver mid-2016 but only if they replace their old  planes on that route with something  better

First friday night flight out of Heathrow. Late takeoff  thanks to traffic, but flight was smooth and landed  exactly on schedule. Cabin staff were excellent, extremely friendly , competent. Food service was fast and with good quality. Would definitely recommend it for short haul flights, although price was  somewhat higher compared to other carriers.

• Galleries lounge overcrowded and under staffed. Tables covered in used plates  or glasses which  staff were not clearing. Many empty  seats at the buffet. Unacceptably bad. The Dreamliner was comfortable but disappointing in a new  economy to find that there is still a lack  for easy access  for space and  seats next to  a seat. As  always a pre loaded tray with ill fitting tablecloth  placed in front  to you. Food  was more a  lower Economy product  than club. No window blinds but a gimmicky and slow system which  overpowered the Windows and was rather . Overall a  poor performance from  Airbus which needs  step up its  first class game, particularly on new  jet aircraft.

Another comfortable flight  in the Club World Cabin. The  amount of personal  storage is rather  limited and it 's frustrating having  someone climb over  my prostrate neighbour's legs. That said  these Club World  seats are very comfortable when a) upright, b) in  their lounging position and c) as  your bed. In fact much more comfortable and sleep inducing than the  much larger and  luxurious seats on the new Singapore  Boeing 777s which appear amazing but  really are not comfortable. The big  break down in  Economy Club is  your food. Plonked in front of  you on a  first try with  that table cloth that doesn't fit. Then the condiments arrive in those ghastly sachets that look more at  ease in a transport cafe. I  liked the seats despite the lack  in personal and storage space but Willie Walsh is  going too need to improve the food offer which falls well behind  other Asian and  Pacific carriers.

I purchased a Club World return to Narita in the Black Friday sale. It cost £1,010.06 which is a bargain for a direct business class return from Heathrow to Tokyo. The lounge at Heathrow was not  full and boarding was prompt. I had pre booked my seat, rear facing by the window. I was  resting comfortably when a Japanese gentleman arrived and told  that I was sitting in his seat. I told  him it was my seat. I asked to see his boarding pass  which was for my seat. I showed him my  original boarding pass which was for the same seat. At this stage the Purser was passing and we raised the issue. I decided to stand my ground as I was  happy with my pre booked seat. The Purser went away to investigate. When he returned, he apologised for the error and quietly asked me to follow him and said I would not be disappointed. I was let to the front row of the First Class seats and enjoyed an excellent flight to Tokyo with splendid service and first class food and fine wines. Very spacious suite with comfortable seat and dedicated wardrobe.  Another excellent flight.

checking in online  prior to departure  had to use a British Airways  Airport check in  machine or fast  baggage drop on arrival at Manchester . BA used  a have a  fast bag drop  service for customers who have checked  into online. When  we enquired as  per where it  is on arrival  to Manchester Airport  we was directed  at the back  to the long check in queue  to a surly  checking in agent  simply stated, "We  only have one.  I have to  be the back of the queue".  In that case  what on earth  is the benefit  to checking in ? It serves  no purpose whatsoever.  My shuttle down  at Manchester was  late by about an hour as was our onward  flight from LHR  to LAS. This flight was on  one of their  older B747-400 aircraft  which was 25  years old, and  that showed. The  seats in economy  was extremely uncomfortable  for a 10.5  minute flight and  entertainment was no  good Inflight entertainment  facilities were poor.  I have never  seen such an  uncomfortable flight. The  in flight catering was mediocre but  the cabin crew  provided good service.  Our return flight  from LAS to  Manchester was delayed  over an hour  and although we had booked to  fly in and  depart from T5  to LHR I received an email  half way through  my trip informing me that we  will be flying  on T3 at LHR. As we  were already delayed  from LHR, by  what time we had crossed to  where our connecting  flight to Manchester  was already departed  so we had  to be booked  on another flight which meant we had been travelling  on a total  over 26 hours  at the time  it got home.  I made sure  our travel experience  is as miserable and inconvenient as  possible I have  realised after many  trips of late  booking BA that I can no  longer be bothered  about the hassle. If the flights  were not delayed  enough they usually  seem to lose  our luggage. I  have finally had  enough and will  try other carriers whenever I can.

I recently got  the unexpected upgrade  in World Traveller  plus whilst on my way to  new York. There was free cava before take-off and a random hot  dog handed out.  My seat was  comfortable and leg room was fantastic.  The more so because I was  near the front of the World  traveller Plus cabin just after Club  1 so there  was no seats in front of me. Inflight entertainment was ok, but  nothing as good  what I was expecting. I did  struggle to find things that interested me to watch as the choice was quite limited. I think now with early digital  release of many films on things  like i-Tunes, the days of being able to see  very recent films  from aircraft before  DVDs become more  widely available are  come to an end. As I was at the front of the  plane I had a screen that folded out of  my armrest, which meant I was looking down at  my screen instead of straight ahead,  and gave me  a bit of  an neck ache after awhile. It 's also annoying to stow away. The food was good for airline food. You get  one superior meal in World Traveller  Plus and it was pretty tasty  but filling. The pre-landing snack wasn't  close to much though. It was a dull sandwich, much like those that BA hand out on short-haul  international flights. A  nice bonus about being in World Traveller Plus is  that you're closer to the front of the plane and the exit.  Which is useful  when arriving in the US where  immigration queues can sometimes be exceptionally long. I ended  with being close to the front of the immigration  queues as I was so quick off the plane,  it meant I  got out through  it pretty quickly. I think to pay for World Traveller Plus would be quite expensive for what you  get in some respects (essentially a nicer meal and  extra leg room)  however it was a nice treat  by BA and If you were going on a  long long haul flight I can  definitely see the attraction.

First ever long haul trip with British Airways as  I usually fly with Cathay Pacific or KLM so I thought I'd give BA a chance. Ground service at London/Heathrow Terminal  2 is smooth and no hassle. Check in and security was very  quick and efficient.  I particularly like BA's boarding procedure at Heathrow, very orderly and organised regardless of the fullness of the flight. Onboard the A380 is BA's new 'World Traveller' cabin on the main deck at 3x4x3 configuration. BA offers 31.5 inches , compared to  the 32 inches and it was surprisingly very comfortable  in the slim design seats. IFE had a few glitches but the FA's were happy  to assist and  behaved perfectly throughout  our flight. However, more movies, TV programmes and music  than could be  better Meals were mediocre. Drinks were  given around an hour after take off. Meals followed straight after. Lunch meal option was  either curry, vegetarian  steak or chicken and often for the latter. Surprisingly good but still  half as good  on CX. Portions  should be better. Drinks were offered throughout the flight along with snack boxes. Pre-landing meal was also given with two options:  vegetarian or chicken  but I went  for the latter.  The portions could be better. Overall,  we would fly long haul with  them again on  the new product . B777-300ER and  more

Absolutely superb flight and a very  excellent standard of service. The Dreamliner  cabin was very clean. The seats were perfectly comfortable. The staff were smart and professional at all times. The steward offered to hang my jacket and we  are offered drinks and snacks throughout  the flight. The quality of the Indian (Tamil) food was second to none and authentic.  My captain gave  helpful and friendly announcements. Overall I felt proud to fly British Airways  from India. To  me the airline is a cut above the rest.

LHR to Venice  was on time, friendly cheerful crew and a very  good plate of cold cuts, cheeses, warm rolls and fruit for breakfast, way better than  any other breakfast  we had on a BA flight long or short haul. Seats comfortable, very enjoyable flight. The return leg, Barcelona to LHR had the same meal so was very happy plus a glass of  juice as it was lunchtime. The standby crew member (who happened to be a purser) in business class was chatty, friendly and pleasant to  everyone He did his best to make up for  our colleagues major shortcomings! The original designated purser for the flight on the other hand , well .. he plonked the meal down in front of you  without uttering one word. The only words he spoke to the entire 24 passengers in the club section were 'do you want it or not'. He put the roll basket in front of everyone's nose but still did not utter one word. It was bizarre - I've never on any airline experienced such rudeness and disdain for passengers whatever class they were flying! He couldn't even be polite to his colleague with  only a 'pass  us some cokes' and that was that. Overall we had a very  pleasant flying experience with BA but I wont forget that purser and his attitude for a long time!

from Francisco to  Scotland via London  via British Airways.  Upon arrival at Edinburgh Airport we  waited over an  hours before we  became informed, only  by seeking out the information ourselves , opposed to  some announcement of  some kind being  made that our  luggage was lost  to Heathrow -  complete with 500  other bags. Things  can and can  be forgiven; it's  nothing happened after  they fact that  changed so completely . We were  neither given any  instructions or helped  of any way  at the baggage  management people or  even the customer  services desk. We  were told that  both bags would  have delivered to us in 24  hours Since we  had to be  at a different  hotel every night  while we traveled  to Scotland, we  told them the  address of the  airport where we 'd be the  following night, essentially  giving them more  of the 24  hours to get  their bags to . We received  another text saying  about the bags  came out for  delivery They did  not arrive. In  those next seven  weeks I spent  an average of  4 hours a  day on the  telephone with the  call center in  India who were  offering no help  at all. The  baggage service phone  number at BA  were not being  called and the  airline courier service  phones lines (2 of them) were gone out of  service as well.  They emailed both  a courier service  & BA customer  service and did  NOT receive a  reply from either ! Still, the  BA website listed  the luggage as  going out for . On the  morning of the  fifth day, it  takes 45 minutes  I get a  call on the  airline (in India)  It took another  hour to tell  us that the  baggage claim area  in Edinburgh was  closed and there  is nothing she  could do. The  packages were continually  listed as being  out for delivery,  but they never  show up. We  was never contacted,  as neither was  any B&B where  we had had  it (supposedly) sent.  On the morning  of the sixth  week on yet  a call to  BA I stated  all the extra  luggage my friend  had brought with  us on the  trip had run  out and that  I was going  ot have to  start taking her  into the hospital. Then, in a  couple hours we  received a call  from a nice  man at the  international baggage claim  that said he  had both bags  in there, that  they had never  turned out for  us at all. Not <mask> for the <mask> bag that <mask> checked that <mask> clothes that <mask> shouldn't have <mask> to buy <mask> to check <mask> and only <mask> to do <mask> due to <mask> incompetence of <mask> Airways. A 747 is definitely showing it's  flaws Nonetheless it was comfortable. Pre take off drinks  also included water,  coffee or sparkling ! BA also gives the option  of pre-ordering your  meal of main  meals online so  when I did  that they ran out of choice  at the end  of the service  and had received  enough beef. I  think anyone in  world Traveller Plus  should use this . World traveller Plus is definitely  considered 'enhanced economy' versus some airlines  basic economy which is more a ' minus'. So  your expectations in . You get  a bigger seat,  a take off , little amenity kit and a  slightly upgraded meal.  But considering that  we paid only  £ per sector  on top of  the usual World Traveller (economy) fare  it was worth  a penny in  our eye. Would  we pay a  full supplement for  this class of  BA No. But  if the surcharge  was minimal I'd  highly recommend it.

My daughter was booked on a flight from Antigua to St. Kitts , September 5, 2015. (flight BA2157) The flight left  about 10 minutes early stranding 30  people who had just managed to get through customs. I have no idea how a flight can leave  early or how you can leave  with 30 passengers.  One attendant at  the desk merely informed these passengers that the desk was closed and they should return tomorrow. It was 3.00 on a Saturday afternoon. Nothing was offered to help these passengers  return to their final destination. After calling multiple times and sending various emails, I was  refused a refund. My full refund  also came with a $50 cancellation  fee and a $40 service fee. I have yet to accept the offer. We never cancelled her flight nor received anything  which looks like service. Do not fly this airline. They are inept , have no idea what customer service is. There is no 'value  in money' when the flight departs early.

My wife and I recently flew to California, outbound on A380 into LAX, returning to LHR from SFO  aboard Boeing 747-400. Both legs in  WP (Premium Economy).  The Boeing 747-400 is very tired aircraft who BA seemingly are not investing in at %. The plastic surrounding the blind  kept coming away, the footrest (attached to the seat in front) did  NOT go all  the way down resulting in an  odd seating position and the rest  of the aircraft and area was  just very old, tired and tatty. Despite BA insisting  that the seat  area is the same as the A380, it felt  much more cramped, and much more  like normal WT (Economy). Not helped  that the Multimedia  screen and seat legs of the  seats in front  are exactly the wrong place to stretch out. The  video screens are  extremely small and  very old square  boxes with far  more limited programming  than with the  previous On the  flight service, they ran out of  the beef choice half way around  their cabin service leaving only a vegetarian option (the  airline cabin crew did eventually find  something from business , as WT+ gets the business  class entree) but  long as they had one left , I feel  if you pay for a service (at near-as-makes-no-difference twice  as price of WT) with the word "Premium" in  their title you should expect a premium product. BA do not offer  any pre-seating (unless you book this 24 hours before departure thus you cannot guarantee to  get seated together if the flight is full or  half full), priority check-in, priority boarding, the pre-take-off drink is orange juice or water on  the inbound flights. Additionally, despite BA boarding by seat  number numbers, this was ignored by most passengers and  BA staff alike so by the time we were  able to board, the WT+ cabin was already full  with very limited room for our carry on luggage,  count it lucky  that we travel  so light! As  you can tell, overall I feel that this was a lot of money for very  little in return. Based upon our experience, I would  recommend the WT+  of the A380  and only when  travelling from the UK (you can pre-order your meal and they serve wine as a pre-take off). In addition, WT+ on the 380 is upstairs in a  more cosy cabin,  bright and airy , a very  small storage bin on the window seats. These may  seem small points on their own,  however combine to take the shine off a very  expensive upgrade.

My wife and I who are 76 and 77 respectively arrived at terminal 5 in  January 2015 to travel to Johannesburg.This was our first experience of the size of this terminal and assumed that this was where we were  going eventualy board our flight. However after sitting around for many hours it occured to us that we had picked up any information regarding the flight,so we  rushed to the BA desk only to be informed that the flight had left,and that we had been waiting in the wrong part of terminal five, and if we had  arrived in the right area we would have heard  someone paging us. Whilst I take full resposibilty not  getting the flight  out properly I would like to complain about the way we were treated from that point on, it 's now 11 pm on a  cold Jan night,  My wife and I were escorted to the exit and left to find shelter for  that night in an area that  we were totally lost in, until  they returned for a different flight the next day.

Travel was fine and journey smooth.  Check at airport : The service  clearly lacked shine , from British  Columbia whilst on  arrival Staff showed  no interest in  very minimal soft drinks offered, 2  in a 9 am flight, bit of turbulence so  no hot drinks  or bring your  own drinks.

The horrible British Airways return flights  from Heathrow to Cape Town. The  turbulence seems to be from the  back Somehow the  seats are really  narrow so that anyone with remotely  wide shoulders spills  down onto the  person next to  me I couldn't  see between a  grown man one  the side and  another woman on the other and resorted to leaning  backwards for much  of the flight.  And a child  sat on one  leg on the  plane back. There were a number  other flyers on  that plane who  had clearly done  that route before as many refused  too sit togther,  with first-time flyers on the route  for me to be squashed between ! The seats  where also incredibly  uncomfortable The moulding on the back was took narrow  I dug into my bag. I only fell asleep  from sheer exhaustion, but woke up  screaming with back  problems from the seat. Other passengers  wandered around the cabin throughout the flight, while some  took to sitting  behind the flight attendants' seats. Also , seats in  one of the toilets don't fully  flush The TV controls are fixed  to the arm rests which makes them uncomfortable to  rest your arm  on and you inevitably press one  on the buttons accidentally. The TVs  themselves are about 30 years old,  cheap and poor ! The selection of movies was  NOT great. It  was very hot  on the plane, and passengers repeatedly  asked for the  Air conditioning to  get turned up.  The service was  excellent on the way out, but the return flight service was poor. The staff appeared disinterested. One flight  attendants responded rudely  towards me when  she asked if  she could use  an overhead locker  in my seat  which had her  food in it. Another told the  passenger next to me, when he  asked for Sprite with his dinner, they had run ! Even though I saw a flight attendant drinking  a can of Sprite 30 minutes later. Generally they seemed more interested in rushing through the service and  stuffing their mouths  then helping anyone.  A call button was ignored twice. Another passenger pressed their's and the attendant simply came and turned it off then walked away. She said  she be back in a moment, but didn't return. The food was  also ok.

British Airways still  runs on the  they are lucky  you be flying  near us' mentality. 8am on a  Monday morning, at  their 'flagship' terminal  at home base, and there are  only 3 business  class check-in desks , so queued  are nearly 30  mins just to  get a bag.  Our Gallery lounge  more like a  call centre than  the premier cabin . People sleeping across sofas and  seats full to almost standing-room only,  one managed to  fit on the  edge of a sofa, before giving  it up as  the waste of  time Boarding very  very quick and  comfortable Excellent crew  seemed very surprised  at the level  or quality of catering, and looked  as well. It's  not hardware that's  been far below . Business class seating is 8 across, that's like  a lot of  the cabins. A window seat felt very cramped and  awkward The cabin wall curved inwards and the seat  is directly underneath  what the hand-luggage bins sit, so it's quite an  ordeal to extricate ! No wifi, and although there's  a video on  this system, it's the same fuzzy-focus, bleached-colour quality that  people remember from  what I first  started flying with  it decades ago.

Recently there have  been more delays and this particular British Airways trip was worse still. I was originally  supposed to fly from London City to Geneva first  one in the morning but the  flights got cancelled.  I did not receive so much as an email  to BA about  this The only way I found  it was cancelled  is by going into my original confirmation email as the flight did  NOT even register  with the British  Airways App. My  next flight was  at Heathrow so  then had to make my way all the way across London (at my own expense) to get that  seat which then  ends up being  canceled by 1 . British Airways  for some years has been a great airline but  we fear cracks are starting to appear!

London Heathrow to Amsterdam, check in on line and bag drop quick and easy, used Galleries North Lounge at T5. It  is fairly busy but able to find a seat. Boarding the full flight orderly and quick seat 2A. Cabin crew fine, a simple meal served on the 50 min flight. Arrival more or less on time, however the bags  seems to take forever - 50 min. Having used  that same route 2 weeks previously in economy, I must say for the difference in fare I feel British Airways have really missed a trick! Seats are just the same, the meal nothing special added to the change in the Executive club Avious accrual. I really think apart from the one business class I've already booked, I won't bother in future with British Airways Club Europe. Instead I'll look for the most convenient and cheapest  options when flying in Europe.

Don't ever fly  on British Airways!  I went Cancun  to our honeymoon, and on the way there they  put my husband  on the opposite end of the plane - only  three hours of  us married. When we arrived in  Manila our bags didn't make it  and so we  had to wait  three days for  the bags and go out and  get some clothes.  Once back they lost them again,  so not only  would they lose our bags once but twice and  have to wait  two days again for them. I advise anyone reading  this to not  spend your money.

Crew were excellent, friendly and efficient, seats adequate for Premium Economy service,  plenty of legroom and good recline, entertainment good. Food was good if you could get the meal you  wanted Suggest persons allocating the choices research better into preferences, as we struggled to get first choice on all sectors (seated in last row ), Premium Economy.  Criticisms would  be that British Airways charge extra for you to select seats prior to ensure you are sitting next to your companion and there is  not priority check-in or boarding/luggage. Toilets are in economy cabin and could be lengthy waits, whilst other airlines provide dedicated toilets for Premium Economy.  However the fare for SYD-LHR return  is good value.

Do not waste your money. Quite  the British Airways 's economy from London to Bangkok  route was pathetic. Economy class food is served, plastic not glass for  serving The seats are marginally wider than economy class, but I could not eat my food without lifting  a plate from  the tray to my mouth. I  drank a bottle  for scotch on return to Heathrow, and then transferred to Manchester flight.  The bottle was confiscated by Security because it was not sealed by staff onboard. I called BA customer service who said it was my fault because I should have told the purser I was going on  from Manchester. Staff  are generally good but never again on British Airways.

Booked a British  Columbia trip from  Bangkok to London  to Singapore through travel agent, not  with the Business Class seating plan (big mistake on  their part). Seat plan is 2-4-2 . We were  assigned seats 15e  and 15f. The  right middle seat  in the block of 4, so  like flying backwards.  These are too cramped, compared to  other airlines, no  personal space apart  from a small  space to store  your laptop. A  large privacy screen  was all that separated me from  other person in  my aisle seat and that had  only be lowered  and raised when cabin crew served  snacks and drinks.  Since the aisle  chair was made  for flat bed,  we had to  stand over person , use bathroom etc. This could  become a problem  for less mobile  people You should not expect to  need to do  that with the  option of flying  Business class The cabin crew provided  good service and food was okay.  It is the  first and last  flight I will be using British  Airlines to fly  business class, unless they change the  seating configuration for  Business class.

I had flown  here to Johannesburg  together with British Airways in May 2015, and were  welcomed This time , a huge , Pleasant, efficient  big glass of  wine to welcome us whch is  cheaper than orange juice. The food was good, especially  the steak which was also good  on the return ! Nice wine  served by cheerful cabin crew. Brandy after meal, brought without hesitation. Water brought during night.  Our A380 is  surprisingly quiet with  an AV system.  Quite comfy, I  had a short body and long legs.  Wailing  birds all night. .

there are so many poor reviews  posted for British Airways, and I  am just about to add another ! The return trip started in the shared lounge at Pisa. Its  easy enough -  but forget it  where you are . There is no food to snack on -  just a few bags of crisps,  sandwiches and sealed croissants. Booze choice is okay. Quite  unusual in Italy of all places,  what platter of mixed meats, cheeses  or typical antipasti  to be provided , probably costing  about £50 a day, is a mystery. British Airways  really care. No  luggage so a trudge to the  cabin It was  a ex BMI A319 and given  BMI ceased trading  two years ago  you would think  perhaps the internal  display could be  changed to show  British Airways branding and not BMI;  but strange. Old  Country Club Europe.  Good seats. FAs  just fine. Food ? Funny thing was the cabin smelt of a  rather tasty "meaty"  type of meal.  Before we took  it I was  excited and full of optimism. All we got was  another miserable afternoon  with dried sandwiches,  cheese and jam.  They compensated my  disappointment with a  little gin and tonics. I asked , is this "worth it" -  no extra for  a product. What you get I suppose is a  bathroom for 12/14  people compared with  2 toilets between  12 or so.  - Wider seats , extra legroom).   A meal over economy but  less by much,  wine glasses to  sip from rather than plastic beakers  for a faster exit from the plane,  a  couple extra AVIOS points - that's  what basically! Not  a lot. Anyway we left 10  hours early and arrived 20 minutes ahead of schedule. Nice smooth flight  - I could 've had that on Ryanair. British  Airways really don't care as the  bad reviews on  board clearly show.

Flying to Sydney via Singapore in business class. I am English born and have always  had an affinity with British Airways. I had not flown with them  in a while and booked business  class seats for my wife and I, and have to say how underwhelmed we were with the whole  thing and will  not be trying  that again. They are so far  behind other airlines  that you expect in business class to feel just a bit special, but as reviewed earlier you do not get any special service. A lousy check in, herded along with the rest on boarding, a lousy inflight toiletry bag. As for the food, just awful on both legs  in Sydney. The crew on the London to Singapore  was unengaging, at  best the 2nd  leg crew were better. The bad news is that I still have the return leg to LHR with them.

British Airways from Antigua to Gatwick. A shabby aircraft, my seat was broken, it would recline without command,  a head rest  was broken and the seat covers  were very worn. The inflight entertainment had to be re set as  mine wasn't working  but when it did work my screen did not display the safety briefing, images would freeze, in effect I did not receive the briefing.  The cabin staff refused to dispose  off my wife's  luggage because it was not finished,  we had to request another hostess to take it. The food was  bad quality in general too, looked like a kids ' pasta with cheese. Check in was good, queues were long but the staff were very helpful and the flight left  in time. British Airways is not in the league of other long haul carriers like Emirates, a lot of work to be done to  improve it's image.

Very busy at LHR due to  half term but managed a quick  chat in the  Qatar Airways First lounge before boarding.  All crew old  friendly and exceptional,  service and wine excellent and arrived on time. LAX was hectic but  the new entry machines make it much quicker. Got through in under an hour.

From Heathrow to  London and the  first class of  Qatar Airways is  below the standard  offered by its . At Heathrow terminal 5, there 's no special  checks in counter  for business class . After performing  a self check in, we have to join a  short queue to drop our check-in . I spent 30 mins in  that queue. The  business class seat  are narrower than  most airlines. There 's also a  shortage of storage space for small items such as glasses. It is  more comfortable to  eat and sleep on, but business class travel is  still a total experience and British  still has a  bit of catching up to do.

For the last  number of years, British Airways has  been refurbishing aircrafts  which has minimized the leg space to ridiculous levels.  So not only  for economy, but  even in Business class. It is  unfair to ask  a Business class  passenger to sit  so uncomfortably when they pay double the price of  seats In addition,  they have this policy for 2 bags, but one  fits under the  seat in front  or the passenger  so this applies  ONLY to Business Class!

San Diego to  Chicago Check-in, security , boarding were  done with minimum . Cabin crew  attentive and friendly.  The quality wasn't  bad nothing like  those served a few years ago  but their amenity  list really isn't  without having. Having  stated that, we  enjoyed a pleasant  time as crew  made up for disappointing food. We  also managed several  nights sleep which is always a  bonus

Having originally booked  us to fly , it was  a nice surprise  too see we had been upgraded  from Premium Economy.  Our seats were large and reclined  out a lot. The food was  good Entertainment was the same and offered a good  choice of films and tv series. However, having seen the little difference between economy and premium economy, we  do think we 'd be prepared  the pay the  premium

We flew British Airways World Traveller Plus (Premium Economy) on the flight  to Vancouver to London. The male  attendant responsible for our section of  this aircraft was indifferent to passengers, during the night section of the flight, he spilt  a drink over my wife, made no attempt to clean up the resulting spill, and when he returned to our area  he casually commented, "Did I spill something on you", my wife replied, "Yes you did , I hope it was water", "No", he replied, " It was juice" and walked away. The inflight entertainment was limited  or subject to repeatedly breaking down, the food was indifferent and the snack we received before landing at Heathrow consisted of a dry croissant, no butter some jam and a half a cup of tea. I have not travelled with British Airways  in a number of years due to previous bad experiences where the passenger is made to feel like an inconvenience, I  thought they would have learnt and improved, this certainly  is not the case on this flight.

Coming through Iberia  last year before departure with the  option of a  flight to Las alle online check  was completed 24  months in advance , is when  I noticed that yet again BA had subbed the Boeing 767 on  their service to an A320. The  departure room in this 0730 departure from LHR was  excellent with the  extra seating offering  a more comfortable  experience than Iberia Express. Food was  mainly cold breakfast , which wasn't  so bad once  I had come  back to cabin . Cabin crew  were the friendliest . If you  have a connection at Madrid Barajas Airport leave at  least two hours - the place is huge with  some confusing signposts and for some  reason if you connect T4S to  the T4 departure  you have to  go through Security,  even if you do a T4  to T4S connection  for no additional  fee

British Airways is  a cost cutting  company and I  wonder whether they just want to  sell off their  poor operation. The  flights to and  around Bologna had new seating which was one of  their smallest and  most uncomfortable seats  I have experienced.  Flight crew were ok but looked  very indifferent and  just really could not be bothered  helping passengers. Then  came the complimentary food and drink  and included half  a cup of  delicious warm tea.  Credit off to  Italy Airways for  tipping passengers towards  cutting cost carriers.

We arrived back  in UK on  Qatar Airways after  long stay in Las Vegas. On outbound flight, the chicken dinner ran out at the next row to  which alternative was Spinach pasta! I declined. On return journey earlier today, the breakfast consisting  of bacon and  sausage ran out one row  from us! Had  better endure veggie option of hash , tomato, mushrooms. For some reason  they serve from  middle and rear, and by the time they meet around the low 40 rows, you  will get a  feeling Surely in the days of computers checking everything, they would know the ratio of meals that passengers are choosing. TV screens did not work for entire  flight steward even advised London were re-setting it remotely from ground!

It got off  on a disappointing start with the British Airways lounge  filled to the rafters. We struggled  and find a  room Breakfast choice was okay, nothing . The second  level below floor has long been closed and shows no sign of re-opening. Classic BA  - regular flyers wont notice -  but we do! The furniture, seats etc are long  gone for replacement.  And very tatty. The plane was quite new, clean, but had the old Club Europe seats which is neither here or there. We were  seats 1A and 1C and had decent leg room.  Started off 40 minutes late due to delays at  customs - and  then runway modifications  or so we 're told). Inflight  service was strange;  breakfast first then the drinks. The  food was a nice salad and  fresh fruit. The two crew members  talked and sounded  like One, I  did think, knew how to smile. Then we got stacked over the Mediterranean for twenty minutes "due to runway modifications". We landed (unusually) from the East and  I have to  say it was  one rather spectacular "U-turn" landing which (as an aviation  geek I rather  enjoyed We were parked on the  ground like a Ryanair flight. We used to have an airbridge when flying British Airways - which justified  in part the higher costs. Now we don't -  very obvious cost cutting exercise by  the accountants at  British Airways HQ. Bags delivered within minutes which given we were one of 2 planes on the ground was to be expected.

I arrived at  Dublin after travelling for over 20 hours flying from Perth, Australia, to  London I had  booked my British  Airlines flight online, and as I 'd not been  to Heathrow before gave myself plenty  of time to get through Customs and from Terminal 3 to Terminal 5. Total cost  on return flights was $240.89Aus (113.68 pounds). I had booked the 8.05pm Heathrow flight to  Dublin City Airport,  I had got  through Customer and to Terminal 5 just after 5pm. I went the  local BA information  centre to see if I could  get an earlier  flight I was  advised yes, there was a flight leaving in about 30 minutes and  since I paid for the change of outgoing flight it would not  pose a problem. I was told I would have to pay 110.00  pounds ($232.99 Aus) so I could get the earlier  flight Because I had been travelling for so long  and just wanted  to get to Belfast I paid  my money. A flight that would  have cost approximately  100 pounds, one way, cost me 157.00 pounds one way. I will  NEVER travel with British Airways again,  but would never recommend them. A  complete rip off  for just over  a 1hour flight.

Checkin at Gatwick No problem at premium check in.  Passed through the  single track lane  at Security,  the lounge at  security was fairly  busy though there was plenty of  food available. Flight  was on time  and by bus from a remote stand. Onboard service  very efficient and  the Business Class , middle seat  pulled out and  tucked into a  rear armrest moved  forward to give  you wider seat than in economy. Breakfast was served,  vegetarian options were  generally very good  but the champagne  is not bad!

Never again with  UK Airways. Could nt book seats, arrived into Rome  ( flight) to  being told there was no lounge  available (no advanced  warning was not offered apology or use of other  seats or even  travel voucher). The flight and onboard  was disappointing, business class seats are  the same as economy apart from  a tray secured  on the middle seat which made  eating in and  around near imposable.  Menu laughable (3 finger sandwiches). No  live entertainment. In sum, I will never fly British  Airlines again.

The British Airways  Experience was one of the worst  flights I have  experienced The Business  Cabin seating was  cramped requiring literally  climbing over (and  sitting on) my  own passengers. Additionally,  it was facing  rain while flying.  Customer service was  limited food barely  in the lounge  or in nearly  any way from  the tables, torn  chairs and lack  in power outlets.  They suggest doing  what you can  do avoid this . Their competitors  have them.

Check in was  smooth but the  trip was delayed 2 hours due to unexpected windshield  filter replacements. British Airways cabin crew  was not the friendliest or most . I have  never felt attendants to be so indifferent and self less I was  never asked what I wanted to order. I was  not brought what they chose. I  ask for sparkling  water and was  told they had  sold out". I asked for more  champagne and was  informed they has  run out". Dessert  came down to  seat selection. In all, the service  is lacking at  times The food was mediocre, and  beverage selection was  limited The seats were comfortable and  seat pod seating was quite good.  the entertainment is  reminiscent of American  movies from the 1990's, very very . The most disturbing was the  failed seatbelt checks all while my belt was visibly  in the sleeping blanket. The ammenity  seats are of economy class standard  like most other airlines. Lavs were not kept clean.  I can honestly  say I will  never fly British  Air again. This  seems a waste of a $5,000.00.

Royal Airways from London to Rome,  absolutely perfect on  my last 3 flights. Food was edible, the flight attendant very pleasant. The problem with  Italy is their policy to make  passengers pay to choose their seats, very Ryanair.

On to Stockholm  I was delayed  by little leaving , due to  the typical congestion.  Air Europe on  UK Airways 767  did not have  the new seats,  although comfortable for  over two hour  journey Food was  disappointing at best. The Heathrow Galleries lounge has little  in the way  a food selection.  Food on board  is FA's good.  We feel British  airlines are lacking behind their competitors.

Then booked with  Virgin Manchester to  London and they  canceled my return  flights without offering re-routing. Then re-booked  by Brussels Airline  and they had  been at Brussels  and runway repairs  and to their  satisfaction rebooked me with BA. Finally  got my flight  home with British , comfortable, good  and great choice of films. They  had half a  flight because I went to the  ticket information desk  in Moscow Airport and asked 'Do  I speak English?' to a lady  with BA uniform confidently expecting the  reply "of course". I got a shake of the  head and a  hand pointed towards  a colleague already  travelling with another .

We fly with  British Airways, unless you don't have  one or don't  think about it.  I took a  connecting flight via  an LHR to San Diego and  found our baggage  one of many  BA passengers in this flight), was  enough for two ! Other flyers  warned us this  carrier is frequent  on BA. When  the baggage finally arrived, one of the suitcases was  broken beyond repair. We filed a  grievance but so  far (more than  one month) heard  back from them  after several calls.  Great attitude. As  the final accord,  for the return  trip we could  NOT check online,  for some unclear reason, while other passengers could. So  the wife and I got separate  plane seats. Nice.

LHR-AMS-LHR checked in online which is  quick and simple bag drop at  gate very quick,  been able to  use the lounge  in my FFS which I like. Boarding on to a full flight quick and seats on an exit  are comfy with  lots of room for 1hr flight,  cabin clean and  with a drink served, arrived on time and bags off pretty quick.  checked in on  time for the  check bag drop quick as was security, the gate  office is a  quick walk from security. Used the BA lounge which  although small is nice although not  a food option..  waiting for A321  takes a while but departed on time and once on board the aircraft appeared new.  Was served a drink on the 50 minute flight arrived on time  checked out quickly.  all in all a decent service for a short flight.

British Airways from  Birmingham to Bahrain  on return. Both  were on a  fairly old Boeing 777, apparently there  is only a few of these . Advantage is that the seats are still 3-3-3 and not 3-4-3. Both flights on time. Outbound flight very full, cabin crew worked hard  and without much  success Meal was very poor, the so-called dinner was chicken in a slimy gravy. There was no sign of either fresh fruit or vegetables. Later a cardboard box was issued containing a chicken . Return flight food was even worse, but as  time was 1.30 am the initial effort, called a "snack", was again in a cardboard box, and contained  two dry biscuits and a couple  of minibars of  milk Later in the flight "breakfast" was served. The choice was mixed  grill with chicken  and omelette. The mixed grill turned  in to be an amorphous yellow  substance pretending to  resemble egg, with a round coin shaped structure which was so-called chicken and four potato discs. It was a disgrace and  now British Airways has to do something about its  food it compares very poorly with other airlines. If the food is not worth eating , they should not serve it.

Our first class lounge at Heathrow  was reasonably quiet. Great choice of beverages and champagne and selection of food. Plenty of sitting options, light, magazines and newspapers. Very impressed with champagne and the  cocktail bars. After  years of traveling with British Airways still I have  not managed to  secure a treatment in the Elemis spa even when  we travel first  class at the  airport reception rather rude). Boarding on time and by priority. Window seat  on the last row of the club world cabin on the upper deck of A380 with aisle access.  Very polite. The  staff was good. Good selection of  foods and beverages , wines. Wide  selection of entertainment.  Most comfortable and private by using  a divider. The  catering kit adequate.  Everything was on time.

That was the  second time we 've traveled long haul with British Airways. The ground  personnel at terminal  7 were helpful and friendly. The aircraft cabin was  my biggest disappointment,  it hadn't been updated since the  aircraft entered service.  While inflight entertainment  area was tiny and unclear, film  screening was good.  Fast food was  good and flight was on-time. If  other airways are  adding a new  aircraft on your route, its likely  – but if  yours is one  of their Boeing  777 (old planes),  we would consider other airlines.

The British Airways  flight from Helsinki  for London had issues with it's brakes so the  decision was delaytd.  First departure time was at 17.15, there were next  flights at 18.30, 19.00, 19.30 and  then The captain  gave us an  update of situation  at the gate  opened at 19.00.  Food vouchers were give at 20.00 for those who  was still at  boarding gate. Then  at 21.00 an  offer to get  ticket and hotel  tickets from the  departure hall. Next  flight will be given next morning  from 09.00, which  time was postponed  until 14.30. Requests  about rebookings were  ignored as the  passengers were not  happy They just  to come to  the airport early  but British Airways  refused to provide  info about EU  passport rights as it had to  be requested separately.  Many of fellow  passengers were not  informed of their  rights Next afternoon  the grond handling company only had regular number of  boarding desks open  but there were  no flights cheking-in at the same  time So only  three desks open and they were  only able to start checking us , but requesting us to step  in for the same day flight passengers. Great as  we had only been waiting around  here for our flights. Finally our flight got new  departure time which  is at 17.30,  was to changed . At the  airport departure time  came and went  and no announcement  is made. Departure  time were postponed  until 18.30 with no announcement of reason for new  time When requesting  some futher information  all was said  was the same reason as yesterday but we had  been given a  written statement saying this aircraft had  been fixed. At  last still no  announcements and passengers  became anxious about mimimal information given  the aviator. Then  30 min later  Swedish Airways cancels  the flight. Now  they promised by next morning or then have to  contact British Airways . Another hotel  room at the  next hotel and  we already knew  what the procedure goes. Next day rebooked for Finnair flight to London , arriving London 45 hrs late  and reaching the final destination about  hour late. The  only positive aspect was cockpit and  ground crew effort  to provide some  help at the  boarding area at  this beginning of  our ordeal.

BA Airways 3-class  Delta 777-200 is used on this flight to Bangkok.  It was seated in 26D which is a bulkhead  area on the  right behind the  Premium Economy cabin. I like the fact that BA  can have 3-3-3  seating layout on the B777 in  Bangkok while many  carriers are using 3x4x3 lay out.  We had plenty of legroom and  in this particular  night I had the best sleep.  Prices were average, certainly not bad.  Flight crew kind , professional. All  and all a  nice flight.

Flew British Airways  to Glasgow to  London via Heathrow.  London to LHR flight great, clean  and staff friendly.  Staff lounge in Glasgow was most enjoyable. Heathrow to  Manchester in premium economy (economy class looked very cramped), the plane was  very scruffy and my foot rest  suggested British Airways  had let the  light slip on  The smartness of the cabin interior , the curtain from Businees to  The Econemy was  not ripped, very  bad bad impression. Excellent staff, food also good. Flights  on time. But  UK Airways Premium Economy is not  another patch on  UK Air. BA  needs to upgrade planes on this route or lose customers to the other carriers. Even  BA staff uniforms  were washed out.

Flew British Airways  via Fuerteventura to  Barcelona in a  Airbus A320, with  a new style  and having flown out earlier on  a A319 with the old seating. Nothing much to choose between the  two but slightly preferred the older style. Not sure  how they have the central seat  open to tray space and would  love a wider seat and smaller  luggage space! Legroom  could also be  improved Both flights  were comfortable and  well ahead of  schedule No lounge  facilities at Fuerteventura which is a  surprise Inflight service excellent, food for short-haul was good.  - If only  BA could have  allowed us a  few of inches of extra legroom.

From Dublin to  Las Vegas via  Newark Heathrow, then  via Miami to Newcastle. I've been  a staunch fan of British Airways over the years  but am starting  too feel like they're not really  being bothered about international Economy passengers. Service is just okay and certainly  not feel personable  like it once  used to, whereas  here it is  no good. British  Airways Boeing 747's  look old and  tired and look  that way too.  Flight from the  USA is not  terrible but from  a USA is  just inedible. They really need to sort this out. Inflight entertainment is  terrible in comparison  of other airlines.  I will be  on other airlines  if I go to the USA !

Also starting to go with British  airlines less and less. I must  remind you about BA's picky prices,  they jump suddenly with no explainable reason. For example,  that LAX flight I was looking  for went from  € per person per way, to  € per person per way, in  only one day!  The last trip with them (Jersey to Miami) wasn't  that good. Service at Jersey Airport  & London Gatwick  airports was great, but the plane wasn't so good.  Passenger seats are  really uncomfortable, food is a bit disgusting, inflight entertainment  was absolute rubbish,  all the in are just outdated and need replacing/refurbishing. The worst part  came as Miami, where the 'Express' Bag Drop only , turned out  and be slower than the Check point and Bag ging lane, and even that was slow. Worse, the staff were rude and honestly couldn't  complain less. Sad  how this airline  is meant to  help Britain in  every way.

fly British Airways  in Toronto to Rome via London, and have no complaint with our flights or crew which were excellent. But when we  arrived in Rome, my opinion of  British Airways was formed. None of  their passenger baggage  was in Rome and we were all left in the dark. When no baggage came down, we all got into the baggage handler lineup, Avia, and wasted time filling out a form. We were given a  telephone number for British Airways but it was out of service. Calls to Avia went unanswered. We finally  got outto the  terminal 2 days  later and found our baggage in an unsecured location.  we werd never informed by British Airways if and  when we would receive our baggage. We did receive compensation for the clothing and toiletries we had to  buy but not fod the expense  of getting out to the airport. This has soured our opinion of  British Airways.

I paid for  BA to get a First upgrade  on my return, as the British Airways Club World seats are not great for this long trip. The new First product  looked excellent. The service was greatthe seats comfortable, inflight entertainment very good, and the food was well presented, with a good choice of wines. I slept well,  and actually enjoyed  my journey - one I do very regularly on other carriers but chose BA this time for a change. Bags were tagged as priority  and in Sydney they came out after about 120 other pieces of luggage, meaning I nearly missed my onward connection to Melbourne. Staff gossip  in the galleys , it's a flimsy curtain and I don't want to hear about  their boyfriend troubles,  travel plans, or crew roster. Cleanliness of the toilets  was the responsibility of the staff to monitor, but  at First the toilets are too cramped, and I  ended up wiping the toilet floor  down with tissues and sanitary wipes . I didn't  know what that liquid on the floor was. While safety and the journey are the  very important things, it's these "Attention to detail" items that make or break the service . BA ground crew, ticketing agents, cabin crew, pilots are commendable, but British Airways needs to help them to get the service right.

We paid for World Traveller Plus  (+ Economy) for our British Airways flight to London. Aircraft was a Boeing 777, excellent . Cabin crew, very efficient and  Economy Seats and legroom, very good.  Something I find lacking to make  World Traveller Plus  worth the money  was no priority  seating or security, no priority boarding for WTP passengers. In fact WTP  passengers were the very last to board? Even United, Delta and American offer priority check-in  and boarding.
