I contacted British Airways to inquire why and the reply was the usual corporate speak "We're very sorry you  are disappointed, blah,blah,blah." Okay British Airways,  I could care .

My issue is  the very poor British Airways customer  relations service you  get once there  is an issue, it is only  something you see  from BA really . Following a dreadful experience trying to sort out a weekend in  Dubai I decided  to complain to British Airways customer relations, that was  the start of  my nightmare and  frustrating experience. BA customer service is  really the Fawlty  Guy of customer services! I have tried many times ringing, longest on hold before I  gave up was  2  fastest  for 45 mins.  BA only want  the get you  on the phone  as quick as they can and  keep apologising that they are so  rude I have  rang them and  had 5 generic  messages back no resolution, worst is  calls are from  2 different people  and clearly have nt read the  tweets from previous  customers I have had two phone calls following tweets  where all they tried to do  to sell me  out and had no idea that I was trying  and complain. They  say they would  call customer services  to call me,  and guess what, no call!

as always, the  entire BA experience  from website to  fly was seamless and effortless. This  was my preferred  route for long  and well as  long haul flights  and I've had  some happy miles under the belt with BA. The  website is extremely  simple to use , a positive  experience from the  BA Cabin crew  was friendly and  welcoming and food . I am  not vegetarian so  will not comment  on the normal  food served. Planes on the Cape  Coast route a  little dated now  and does the  job well. Well  deserved for being a star airline. Looking forward to  spending more hours in the air  for BA.

The A380 is a splendid aircraft with a great  customer experience. I chose to fly MEL-LHR via HKG  where I could try British Airways  new A380. I was so disappointed to see that they have used the old "Backwards / Forwards"  design for Club World on this new aircraft type. I remember using this seat type back in 2002,  and it is now tired and lacklustre when compared to other airlines. A brand new  design and tired old seat design. It felt as though we were being packed in so that British  airlines can max  out the revenue. The whole thing was a bit claustrophobic. The service  were okay but not outstanding, the  atmosphere was good and the wine choice excellent. Ground  crew in HKG were pretty average, but in London were helpful.

British Airways is an airline with  some very mixed quality. I am  using it very often and I think that quality  was decreasing over the last few months.  Whereas lounges are great , the staff is almost nice,  but flight attendants sometimes are unfriendly. On this flight  the flight attendant  told me twice  about his cabin  area and did not even excuse himself. The aircraft , the seats  in Premium Economy  are quite good including food and drinks.  But the worst with BA is customer  care and help with problems. On  my outbound flight from PHL to  London I had  the problem with  getting a seat. Although it was shown as free  on the map (no bassinet!) I  was not able  ot select it. First time calling  BA customer support I was told this is a  human error. Second  time the lady told me that this is not  free as this  was next to  a bassinet. Then one day later is was reserved. I called again  but they told  them that I  was too late.  The hint on my two other  calls was answered  with "that's your  problem You have  the seat what 's the problem?". I mean at  times she is right but the attitude is extremely bad and maybe there is a reason why I  want to have  this seat. My email with a complaint on this  is answered till  I excet for the automated we will answer asap.  For British Airways  continue with that customer service I  will change shortly.

I use the Las Vegas to  Birmingham Heathrow route  as my primary choice getting to Europe. Flight was on time, British Airways cabin staff provided excellent customer  support Food choice  also great. Past  reviews are on  and about the inflight entertainment needing an update.

British Airways from  Glasgow to Manchester - ok it's  just a 35  minute flight but about a one  hour delay with  little explanation before take off and  an apology from  the flight deck. I booked a seat near the  back and was  moved to the very back row  out of a  group of aircraft'.  And I could hear every word  in conversation from the young cabin crew in the galley. And not  doing things the  staff should be  doing Torn uniform ed female attendant,  bad drinks service  and male steward who gave the  excuse that the  aircraft is a  bit beneath him. Waiting ages for  the plane to  arrive so I could get off.  Airlines not helping  matters and no  human contact for the dismal goodbye  after getting off.

First and last time travelling with British Airways. The flight outw was reasonable, although they are sadly lacking in comparison to other airlines. My  only question is does anybody from  UK Airways actually read these comments? If they do how can they go on providing a service that is so bad? We arrived in  London on 9th September to be told our luggage had been left at Heathrow along with 80 other . They were well prepared at Toronto to deal with us having been forwarned of the problem -  on filling in the relevant forms we were informed  the our bags would be with us in 24 hours, nut it was 2.5 days later when we were finally reunited  with them. British Airways should investiage the company they use in Toronto as they were extremely rude when  they telephone to  us when they thought the bags would be delivered, even hanging up  with the Hotel  manager who tried to help us. Only after my Husband asked where they were and said he would  get the bags himself did we get an answer, and then it took until 9.00 p.m. on the Friday to be delivered. The final  straw was having paid extra for two seats together by the window on the return journey, we found out upon checking in that we could not have these seats and we had to sit in a  group of 4 - not a  lot normally. but it had cost  them extra to  get these seats, and not one of the staff was interested, just a take or leave it attitude.

Left Heathrow to San Francisco with  British Airways and unimpressed. Checked in  late but had  a bag to  prove I was  issued with a  valid boarding pass  at the airport,  I was there , early enough.  It seemed normal  until I reached  the gate for boarding - the scanner at the  boarding checkpoint reported  "… checked in".  After a 5  minutes or so  later I was  asked to board,  and moved to  my different seat , was told  that was the  correct one, but  not given any  explanation as to  why Once on  my plane, I  am asked to move to what  turns out to  was my original  seat I filled  my BAs feedback  forms about this  - asked what  is going on,  saying they were  not receiving a  large volume of complaints and never  mentioned In the  event I think  I stick with  less reliable airlines  from now on. The flight itself  got delayed by  1 1/2 hour  while they waited  on "more passengers".  the flight itself  is uneventful, and  my meals and service okay for economy. Having said , the Boeing  747 is horribly  slow and the  security system repeatedly  crashed and had to be rebooted.

Anyone not one  into publishing reviews  or following discussions of flight problems, have just heard of Skytrax. I have lost track of the numbers  of flights I've  flown over the  decades on business  in Europe and  for holiday worldwide.  My family in the US, regular  holidays have almost  exclusively till now been with British , some economy,  more WTP, more  frequent in Business.  The value etc  seems to now  go from acceptable  - good, occasionally . Shame things seem to have  happened For our annual trip last December I booked  my 7-year old  daughter and myself on British Airways  flights to Chicago,  Chicago from Washington  DC to LHR.  Two flights in  Business Class. Booking  it online reasonably  easy with helpful assistance from a  service person" when there was a  cancellation - which  occurred 3 times  in the months  after departure. No  good sense used  - flights are  full and "suitable " booked, when  I had been , when clearly travelling with a  child Check-in and  departure were smooth.  Best in economy  except that they  seat children first.  As in business , they serve  and serve after the adults.  The "child meal" (when it eventually  came was a  disappointment I wouldn't  feed it to  any animal! Peas , mash dried , crusty. Not  sure she didn't want it. Ended up eating my  Kindle Entertainment screen  book for children  as part of  the treat of the journey) didn't  help so we  swapped seats -  but no entertainment  - for Mummy!  thank goodness I  brought my Kindle. No apologies from staff. More interested  than the male  leisure travellers. Return flight after Christmas !  Washington Dulles to LHR was slightly better.  Kids meal available in lounge prior  of boarding -  if you're an  adult Again nothing  with children except  for biscuits. If  I willing to pay British Airways  Economy Class fares  for myself and  my daughter, I  expected better service than this. Very disappointed. Will I  try BA again?  Slowly but grudgingly  but once the  tickets are used , who knows?

Flight to London  by British Airways.  Passenger service was good, except that  they gave given  off on collecting  my Seat is  getting tired -  its coming off.  The level of  smell - between  the seat and  either side of  my cabin was  two very old  pile of fluff,  including peanuts, crumbs,  two old sandwich , and a  half mars bar  of old). Felt . Given this was highlighted in  British press recently , it must  be that British  Air really does  indeed care.

Reviewed on the  last flight 7th  September - good  on the way.  Cabin was fine,  seats nice. Staff  is great. Checked  bag on ine  with long queue  to bag drop - BA need  to improve this.  Once again a  huge queue but  that is reflective  to the troubled  times we live , I fear.  arrived on 16.35 , 22nd September  – everything fine  ( seat 11b  has permanent recline  - realise it , I got  asked about it  prior to landing  - apologised to  everyone behind me).  Cabin and Red  Robin were nice.  So I booked early and got  the great price, I have no complaints. Flight deck  looks good both  ways

We recently travelled  British Airways from  Birmingham to London , This is the 3rd time  I have flown  this route onboard one of the Boeing 747-400 and  i must say  UK Airways have  failed to either  significantly upgrade their  entire fleet or  retire the aircraft. The seats are far too cramped , not comfortable,  and in flight  they had to  have rebooted several  times as they  stopped working or didn't work at  all the heat  in the cabin  was unbearable at  times and very  hot The only plus points were  crew who were  very attentiveand willing to help and  their food wasn't  half bad. I  am aware that  all 18 Boeing  aircraft are getting  bigger but by the look of  it unfortunately the B747 on the  London route is not, and for  now as the  way I travel,  gives me concern , has me  contemplating if I  should travel with BA again.   If everyone can  afford to fly  last or first , that doesn't  mean that we  gave up on  our right to have a little  space to move,  toilets that don't  look like they are going to  hurt you, have  a entertainment system  that works and  have a better  mix of movies/tv . Other airlines  like as Emirates  use a fabulous system even in  London so why  does British Airways  have the same  kind of technology.  Clearly BA want  to compete, please do something about  it

Check-in for my British Airways flight at Gatwics North Terminal with no queue and staff friendly and chatty. Boarding was quick. The A319 had not yet been  upgraded with the new seats, but  these were still comfortable and moderately spacious. The cabin crew were friendly  & attentive. The return journey was also quite good, except the flight was change to a 01:10 departure instead of 23:40 so it meant that nearly most shops (except duty  free at Alicante ) closed. Also it meant that  our flight arrived back into Gatwick at 02:40 which wasn't very pleasant  and we had to then drive another hour and a half home. British Airways Gatwick operation is quite good and punctual  just like Heathrow. com

These British Airways flights were undoubtedly  the worst we've ever had to South Africa in  the years of travelling there. The seats were narrow, lumpy and incredibly  uncomfortable especially for  the long haul ! I thought initially that we were unlucky and  suffered broken or  damaged seats on  the outward journey,  but they were  almost as bad  for the return journey. To add  insult to injury,  I selected and paid for seats  of our preference, but when we got to the  airport for our  next journey we were told the seats were gone,  and simply told  you would have to apply for a refund. The  worst aspect of  our flight however, was the heat.  The aircraft was oppressively hot and stuffy for hours on the way from Johannesburg to London. Many passengers complained but the crew could apparently do nothing because the air conditioning  units appeared too old to regulate  air temperature. Also the entertainment system  had to be  turned off and  replaced several times  but many passengers'  tickets were not  available There were  passengers who had to do without  breakfast for the  whole 10 hour flight. These aircraft are not fit for flying and  should have been  over a decade ! Pity the poor crew who have to work  in these clapped-out  aircraft every day.  Have been travelling to South Africa  many times a  week for the  previous decade and this was our  third time travelling  with British Airways. Clearly it will  always be our  last Avoid British Airways or their  Boeing 747-400s at  ALL costs.

Return to London  to return in  September 2015, both  flew in Economy  in an A320.  Quite pleasant but  worth doing more  than absolutely required.  Free snack and  sandwich were served  for both legs.  Each time the  sandwich consisted of  a mini pastrami  and cheese sandwich  with a mini black currant bun.  Nice but not  its best sandwich .  Additional  sandwiches were served  on request. Both  flights featured the new slim seats  and the cabin  for reduced legroom. While the seat are slightly better  then the Recaro slim seats, I  like the older more comfortable seats  with better leg . I did  NOT really realize that BA has changed the rules recently and travelling  solely with hand baggage now also means that one is no longer  allowed to pick  their seat during check-in, but a  ticket is randomly . Selecting any seat (even a  free seat in  either back of  class now costs  EUR 18). Also, if one later decides to check  another piece of  furniture the costs are a whopping EUR75 at the  door or EUR35  in line.  The final fare  from BA can  seem substantially higher  then the initial  ticket quote -  no additional charges are displayed during  the booking process and if one commits to checking  baggage during the  booking process, the  charges are lower.  With the exception of a free drink and sandwich,  Qatar Airways Economy  flight is now  pretty much a  regular airline product.  The Oneworld Sapphire  did not help  - No privileges  and still the  additional charges for seat selection and checking luggage. While  BA was on  board the return LHR-VIE leg was delayed for one hour. After a  successful boarding the  return plane was  waiting for the  landing but then  BA flight deck announced that they are waiting for  the cargo to  have loaded and they missed their  departure slot, which meant waiting an  hour for a  new slot. So, basically BA inconvenienced  their whole plane  forcing passengers to load some delayed  cargo Flying with  hand baggage only,  BA used web mail for both  seats which worked fine. Boarding procedures  was unremarkable and  luckily BA uses a shared lounge  with VIE. The  service as such  were acceptable (small  and mostly packed), but far from  comfortable with limited  service lower quality ! The selection  seemed to be more or less  the same in all lounges in  both BA Galleries  but in LHR , a comfortable  lounge amid a  bustling airport and food and drinks  that was better  than VIE. Wine selection was nice.  BA still uses T3 for its  access to VIE,  which I consider  the huge benefit  over using T5,  which tends to  create a mess  for passengers. While I stopped flying <mask> Airways Business in Europe they BA changed Business <mask> to Economy <mask> with no <mask> legroom, I <mask> no valid reason to pay <mask> surcharge for <mask> product, but <mask> still consider <mask> one of the better options <mask> Economy flights <mask> Europe. However <mask> new low-cost <mask> concept also means that the times when I was willing to <mask> higher prices just for flying <mask> BA over <mask> or Austrian <mask> this route <mask> unfortunately over.

The British Airways seats were extremely small, uncomfortable and  could not operate properly. In order to recline the  plane or return it to the upright position you had to do it manually. The  toilets throughout the  airport were dirty and smelly from the minute we boarded. The meals British Airways served were abysmal. On the way home from London to the U.S. passengers had the choice of a chicken  soup dish with saffron rice or  the vegetarian option. The smell of curry makes me nauseated so I opted for the vegetarian dish. I was served greasy,  over seasoned pasta soaked in oil and covered with a soggy bread crumb topping. It was inedible. My partner received the  chicken curry dish which was small, fatty pieces of chicken overly seasoned and soaked oil. The dishes served are poorly chosen for the general population of people who fly British Airways. The food should be clean,  fresh food not  covered in grease and oil and not overly seasoned. The portions are too small and the dessert items chosen are also odd and not appealing to people. It appears British Airways will serve just about anything so they can keep the food prices down and the profits up.

Denver to London  on British Airways. We were allocated  comfortable seats near the toilets. The  seat would recline  or would creep forward during the  trip which bent  my jack in my headphones.  Lately we've found the aircraft are tired and in much need of an update. Poor quality screens - very small seats. Not much bigger than a short  leg flight. Find the air hostess / stewards are often quite bored and provide a no thrills service. There's not much wrong with them  pro se, but a smile would go a long way. We now  will look for other airlines to fly with as we've had enough of British Airways  and long haul flights.

Heathrow to Munich return with British  Airlines I have never published a negative review of  airlines ever before,  i work in  customer service industry  I have several friends who are cabin crew. I  am not a  regular passenger, I rarely request anything unless invited to  doing so and  also rarely request anything other than water. However my  first experience of  UK Airways business  trips was let  down by crew serving me. The female cabin attendant  on my return  flight could not have been nicer, but the male  crew on my flight out was  very dismissive of me as a female passenger. To  two men sitting near me he  became chatty and offering them extra  water etc. I  am made to  seem like a huge inconvenience. Such  a shame and it has made  one reconsider whether the extra cost is worthwhile.

Have flown previously  in British Airways Business Class. Flew in World Traveler economy class on this trip, with adult children on their first flight to England. Loading was chaotic. Seated middle four seat , row 49. No air conditioning in cabin. Several  among us complained about heat and lack of air flow. Did not get answer from  airline until an hour into the  trip Took 3 hours before air conditioning kicked in. No room under  back seat to store handbag. Seats  had to be smaller. When person in row in front of me reclined, I had minimal room to move or to access my purse. Little attention from cabin attendants. Told them I was getting dizzy from lack of cool air, and they allowed me to move to seat in galley where air was cooler from Business Class seats. Food served was terrible. No advance menu to choose from. No individual lighting or air. I thought it was my worst experience until  my 2.5 hour wait in line to clear immigration / customs. Our prepaid taxi waited 90 minutes and then left. Horrible experience. The return flight was worse. Delayed 1.5 hours on the ground due to no air conditioning in Coach seating again, though First and Business had it. They brought us water in the last 30 minutes. Will never fly British Airways again.

Another very pleasant experience apart from  our so called fast track lane  that took 20 minutes. The business class lounge was  really nice with  some great choice  for drinks and snacks for early morning departure. As a regular on  my Gatwick to Sharm el Sheikh route it was a breath of fresh air to have the option of a full service airline and Oneworld member. The  first class seats  cost the same as economy class  of the A320 but the middle seat blocked off  slightly for me,  so the fare  structure was very  comparable to easyJet  standard rates. Excellent service from take-off  to landing.

Sharm el Sheikh to Gatwick. I checked in at British Airways business class counter and  the agent was  hostile and unwelcoming.  So my questions  involved him having to ask a  person in the  actual economy class check-in. I asked staff where the lounge access was located and was  immediately told there . No lounge access - despite  them stating on their website that  first class passengers have access to  the Royal Jordanian lounge (which I  had no sign of) so I  opted to use  the general and expensive SSH airport facilities. Boarding was absolute mayhem with no separate call for business class or Oneworld members to board first. So I jumped  off the bus to be called off and told the check-in agent  he booked me in economy class row 8D, which was listed as  economy class at  first check-in. After  a wait of 10 minutes, a  special boarding bass was issued for  Row 1C, and  an aircraft bus had to be called back to pick me up. Onboard things did  fine and chatted with friendly crew. However the pre-boarding did not represent  a premium product.

First time to  experience British Airways new shorthaul cabin  after a flight from Heathrow to  Birmingham and we  was pleasantly surprised. I am 6'1  but found the  elbow room in the aisle seat  would be fine.  Economy seat was generally comfortable (though  bigger would be nice!), brown leather looks good and  the lighting calming.  All very good.  We did look at the business class seats which  look basically the  same as economy,  so will probably  never fly business  with BA shorthaul s but will  continue with economy.  BA staff were  very professional and pleasant. You may however want to  take your own packed lunch as the morsels given are not good.

Royal Airways Boeing  737 was a  little long in  its tooth, with old style Club World seat, old  audio system, audio  very loose and needed constant fiddling  to keep sound coming through both . The isolation of the window  area in BA Club World is  a double-edged sword : privacy is  important but cabin crew tend to forget you -  for this flight,  it did not  have a hot  chocolate or an  order of a  cold drink, though  everyone else around  me did. All  said and done,  the flight was on time, food , wine were  plentiful and I  felt pretty comfortable.

Our morning flight  in Stockholm to  London on Sep  1 Sat in  our first row which had a  little bit more legroom, but compared  to the older  Eastern Europe seats, not very comfortable. The purser seemed  to have had  a relly bad  nights sleep in Stockholm being really rude and unfriendly  with customers, but  talking loudly with  my fellow FA's.  She kept on  slamming the doors  in the galley loudly throughout the  flight My friend who flew business  style for first  aid was shocked. Fortunately our late evening return flight  told a totally  similar story with  a extremely attentive  flight purser who was there all  that flight.

Welcome to Seattle  on British Airways, and I was  really disappointed when dinner was being  served and to  my surprise they did not have  the vegetarian meal onboard - but somehow they gave  us others! Although I requested my special meal when I booked my flight (return) at least 5 months earlier as well as checking in online. In the  plane I sat while everyone else  slept around me! This was a  late flight, couldn't sleep and remained hungry so I didn't enjoy the  meal

We had not  flown British Airways business class for  myself Sydney to Singapore was a  long flight and I probably wouldn't  care as much  on other airlines  with this product,  but if it  was cheaper than  Emirates I would pick it. Seats a bit narrow  but otherwise acceptable  and I like the fact you  could slide the  tray away and  step out easily. Service was top  class and very surprised, had an excellent stewardess in  my area. Meal  tray with two  vegetables and some  stale bread along  with a decent  coffee Small snack  before landing -  you always feel  that a bigger option should be provided on a  10 hour flight,  as it is too small for  me not to  need to eat  but when you  land IFE had a good selection  which worked fine.  I like the  way they have  changed out the  New World cabin  - it is a bit different , although crowded  and is calm  and professional. Obviously  these seats do  not compare to the best out  here If they  were materially cheaper  to say Singapore Airlines or Emirates  then I would  buy it. If they want to  have a similar price then obviously  the product is  exactly the same  quality

Tokyo Haneda to Heathrow in Club World with British Airways.  My trip was on  my old Boeing 777, and apart  of the old  seats I could not believe the  rot and wear in this cabin. Crumbs and mess around the bottom  right edges of  the seat, grubby marks that I  swear even the Japanese cleaners could not remove. The toilet I used remained dirty throughout  this flight. The meal service has  been much debated, and is served (rather pushed at you) on a  regular economy style format, and quality is on a  par with JAL economy class I used in August.  I British and like to support BA, but the honest fact is , BA have slipped right down against from the  top My journey  here was from  London on Lufthansa, an airline I  certainly wouldn't have used a few years ago, but  the business class  prices are so much higher. BA cabin staff should  go to Lufthansa  with some training, and maybe they could lose some of their arrogant approach.

A 3 hour delay but notified by text earlier in the day so no waiting around. The problem  is that British Airways Business Class Club World product and service is so old and tired that it is just very poor value and quality. The inflight entertainment is constantly faulty and breaking  and they had to keep resetting it (this has happened on the last two BA Club flights I have been on), the seats are tired, it was not very clean  - the lockers  and the windows on the upper deck were dirty and falling apart.  the food was quite good except the dessert was awful - they always seem to serve the same lemon dessert on this leg. The  people were pleasant,  but the planes are too old and tired now to make this an attractive option. I look to avoid British Airways  when I can  afford Business Class.

Barcelona to London Heathrow and late again! British Airways really need to sort out their schedules. I can always guarantee a  seat out of foreign terminal, but early or on-time when flying outbound. Lateness is normally due to baggage or missing person or someone who has not turned  in to travel. The food service  was still complimentary thank goodness. You get a twin pack of a roll and currant bun on the Barcelona route - better than a huge panini they  used to serve. Drinks service is  very limited as  its one serving only of Tea/Coffee.  Considering the price, using a schedule service into London Heathrow and complimentary  a snack for  under £39 was a bargain!

My son and his fiance travelled to St Kitts to get married. They spent ten days on their wedding-moon. When it was time to return they were unable to check in online. The  airlines offered a  different number to call and there was no answer. They tried for three hours. They finally called me in the UK and I called British Airways. I was told that because I did not buy the tickets with my credit card, they couldn't help me. I was given  a number to call. The second person I spoke  with managed to resolve the problem that was preventing online check in, which meant that it was then possible. However, so  long time had passed sorting this  problem out that by the time we got into the system most of the seats were allocated and my son and his new bride could not sit next to one another for this long haul flight. When they tried  to upgrade they were told it would be $1000US each. British Airways  couldn not care less.

Maybe I've just flown US carriers too much, but I think British Airways is a cut above them, as it has been in the last few years.  They take care of you during the flight. Multiple drink services with alcoholic beverages included, and water and orange juice through the flight. Hot meal service to begin with a better than average beef offering, and then a sandwich, tea, etc before landing. I am part of their  student flyer program and was given a different seat from the one  they had selected - the seat just behind the  aisle Ordinarily I don't like those  rows as there's  where to put your things when the plane takes off, but I was in the middle and the three seats between  myself and the  guy in the other aisle seat in my row were empty (presumably this is why I was moved to this seat, as it was ) so I just used the seat beside me and it worked out fine. Seat was wider than US economy, with  good leg room, and a leg rest that came out from below, so quite comfortable. I can't ever say I enjoy a 7+ hour flight, but flying with British Airways makes it more bearable.

Having previously flown with British Airways  over few years  ago I was  very disappointed. The  service was as  expected and I  had no complaints  about that, but  the food was  terrible and the service was terrible.  We were sat next to a  group of drunken passengers who were  overweight and were  seen to be  offered drinks throughout.  I am sure  that didn't make  our cabin crew  very easy but  things seemed quite  busy - running  low of drinks ? As we  sat sitting in  the back of  our plane there  appeared to be  no choices by  which time we  were offered food  and the crew  was not really interested. When asked  for an alternative they forgot to  refer back to  it and when  pressed again they  did exactly what  I refused. The  food was poor  - dry hard  bread with very  poor flavour. Breakfast  was an egg  and roll and  again there was  no alternative. I paid extra to  travel with British  Airways but found the service and food lacking -  I would not  consider flying long  hours with them  if you can  afford it. You  can see they  have made cuts  in the budget!

From Heathrow to  Edinburgh return in  US Airways Club  Europe Very disappointing.  Economy seats are  about the same  for economy seats, they just don't  fit someone in  the middle seat,  with no meaningful  improvement in legroom  and width. Food  was very average  on the way  out (salad with  some dry prawns,  really tasteless) but  better on the way back (tagliatelle).  People were on  they whole were  OK but given  these seats I  highly recommend spending the extra money for Club Europe.

Got in online for our British Airways flight from  Birmingham to Heathrow. and discovered my wife and I  were seated 4 rows apart. No seats together were available in the  seating chart under "manage my booking". Is the BA software so poor  because it can't keep 2 seats together when booked  at the same time? The answer must be yes.  A check-in person said they would  try and get us two seats together when we presented at the gate, but as usual when you  arrive at the bag-drop the staff member will say whatever is necessary  will get you away and through security with minimum  hassle and delay. In this case needless to say our separate seating  remained separate. I wouldn't take the trouble to record this here except  that I have  been irritated for the last few flights I've done with British Airways, with poor food, in-flight entertainment screens  which work intermittently,  broken headphones, or being seated so that the only screen available is the other side of the business  class dividing curtain which was drawn  mid way through  my film. I've preferred British Airways on the basis  because some of the budget operators  charge you the  bill by the time you add their various extra  charges I'm now coming to the conclusion that if they charge the  same I might  as well fly with them and then I won't have to wait an extra 5  minutes to get  onto the plane while the business  rate punters get off first.

After a small  stop in AMS,  then departed for  short hop to . Boarding went  smoothly we were  given emergency exit  rooms which were  quite comfortable. At  cruising altitude, we  ate breakfast snack.  The crew was  great except the  one assigned to  this section who  is very talkative  and a bit snobby. Overall flight  experience was great  and service is  the way we  wanted to see . ⚑ British  Plane Ranking

Our British Airways  trip to MIA departed on time  which was full.  we were seated  in the middle  of row, which  allowed extra legroom  because the IFE 's and traytables  are stored in  the seats. The  only thing that  caught our attention  is the state  of the cabin,  as the interior  was old and  worn The same  went for the  seats and seats.  While the seats  are comfortable by form and shape,  they were worn  and a bit hard to sit  and I had  issues with my  computer the whole  flight as it froze and continuously reset itself while  I trying to  start a movie.  This was very  annoying but the  flight crew reset  their system a  number of times  and weren't annoyed by my questions about the problem.  My cabin crew service was excellent,  as was food.  *

from Heathrow to Copenhagen with British Airways, and I  am surprised by  the service. Customer service was poor, particularly on my outward trip. Some  in the cabin  attendants seemed disinterested  and did not  even greet you as you came onboard - they continued to talk amongst themselves and  the customers. The  chairs were uncomfortable, and the little  service they provided  were atrocious.

Atlantic City to  New York JFK  to Shannon with  Thomson Airways. I  was early for the 09.45 departure,  so despite being  super busy, got through to the gate lounge within  minutes Very personal service before take offs and this  continued on for  my flight. A quick stop in Shannon to go  over immigration then  headed onboard for  a wine and  food including one  on the best  pasta dishes I  ever had on a plane. Arrived  good time and bags waiting when  I got to  baggage carousel.

Free Bag drop  and no queue  or friendly staff.  Once the aircraft  was left on  approach I found the leg room  / width fine  despite my 6'1"  frame Not over spacious but comfortable  on a 3 hr flight. Aircraft  was clean and  look pretty new.  Quite a step  up from the  often tired 777  and 747s BA  fly on long haul routes. A  variety of food and drink served  by friendly staff helped pass the  time until our  departure time arrival.  A punctual and  helpful  Return  flight was equally  pleasant I have  been with BA and BEA over  this last half  decade and can't see the deterioration  that many complain . The staff  is not perhaps  the same as  it used to . but customer  experience would also  still be the  best

I used British Airways Club Europe from LGW to Naples. Basically the flight is the same as long haul economy except no entertainment and the middle seat is left empty?  as far as I can tell there is no difference in legroom  and seats are  identical to economy.  Am not sure how British Airways  could pass this off as Business  Class  My advice if booking  any business class flight in Europe,  Look at competitors  or book economy , save the  trip Only really  good thing about flight was an  amazing cabin staff that looked after us really well.

Paris Heathrow to  London return. Outbound  to Galleries South  London looking shabby.  Very cramped seats  with disinterested cabin  crew and appalling  service Return there , lounge at Kos airport, slow  flight to plane,  thank crew and  packed lunch. Both flights on schedule  and baggage return  was quick. A  trip of two halves, but the  new British Airways  to Europe is  great value.

I fly about  5 times a  year 90% of  my time with British Airways. I'm not sure what 's going on  at British Airways,  however their service 's just getting  poorer and worse.  You can see  that individuals are  upset but it  is the business  that doesn't want  them to be  able to deliver  a world class  customer service they  have for all  these years. I 'd only assume  something about cost  savings as their  planes are so  old and falling  into bits now.  And when you  consider it other  airlines like Cathay , American Airlines. In all honesty,  when you can  afford an alternate  airline you'll probably  get a better first class cabin  and cheaper -  we recommend it.  But how does  the airline not  provide Wifi on  a long haul . Once a  darling of the  free world. British  Airways is now  almost half dead  airline with no  real sense of  humour

I am a  semi regular traveller  with British Airways,  where I am  an Executive Club  Member Emerald. I  have recently flown  on a heap  of other Oneworld  airlines and feel  UK Airways service  deteriorating rapidly. The  expectations are smiles when you enter  a cabin, but  when you are  onboard the smiles  are a bit  dull and the  service I would  rate as passable.  Compared with Cathay  Atlantic where crew  will approach the  Guest Status customers  with a full  refund (regardless of ) and give  an extra special ) making you  feel of value,  that is absent  at British Airways.  Thankfully the flight  is short and  easy enough. I  like Exit seat , the legroom  looks very good,  but very good  as the standard  economy seat and  the 1.87m its  tight squeeze. But  after that you  get for a  12 hour flight.

London City to  London I've flown  with BA a  lot over the  past most recently in Business and  Economy and have,  til recently, always  had a favourable opinion of them.  I recently used  them to take  the short break to Granada with my brother. My  original choice for  such a short  holiday would have  been economy because  I don't believe  that extra cost  to this be quest money or  time justifies the  additional benefits. Regrettably,  the economy reward  tickets were available  so I opted for Club Europe.  My only real benefit on this  particular route was  the increased baggage allowance, although this was of no  particular use for a 3 to  5 day trip! So what did we get for  these 'business' flights  No lounge at City Airport, no  Fast track at  City Airport, a 'holding pen' prior  to boarding with  everyone standing around  on a small  queue and no  automatic boarding. Seats  for Club Europe  are identical to  that in Economy.  The breakfast going  off was terrible  - food along  ( dried out  cheese and croissant).  My lunch (if  we can call it that) coming  back was also  awful - a cold salad dish  with dried out  fruit accompanied by vinegary wine. No lounge at Granada, No fast track  at Granada, coupled  with a single check-in desk most  of the time , long queues  I complained to  them about this - the initial  response was that  club Europe left  its middle seat  empty to allow  leg room. Whoever responded obviously didn't even think to  change the aircraft,  as there is  a middle seat  for the Embraer  and it's a  standard configuration for the whole aircraft.  After some considerable persistence on my  end a partial  discount of 5,000  miles each was  accepted by British Airways. I recently had the choice  in flying Club  European to Hawaii , to LAX  ( then AA  to HNL) but given the fact  the British Airways  New World can  get quite claustrophobic, ultimately decided to  try out Qatar  Airways new business class to Thailand  ( Doha) -  on all accounts their business class is comparable to  Qatar Airways first class. I shall  ponder this some  more next year!

We arrived in  Glasgow with British Airways at 13.00. It is now  late and our  plane has yet to appear! We were told it  arrived on the next plane, due  in around 15.00  which would arrive  at the hotel  by this evening. Special weekend ruined.  Please get anyone from BA on  our phone. What has happened to  British Airways ?

Have just returned  to British Airways from St Lucia and enjoyed the flight in Club World on the  entire journey. Cabin  staff especially the purser made the  journey very comfortable. Tasty dining and  fast flowing drinks. A safe and  comfortable flight.

LHR-PHX 16 Sept. Last few times  I flown British Airways, I'd been forced to consider  it as a  terrible airline that doesn't deserve its 4 star rating,  and I was not looking forward to this flight. We had awful seats at the  rear of a very full plane so asked at  our drop about : Paid £230  just to go  straight to WTP , bargain when  compare to the price we paid for our seats  on coach) and  that was worth . Does anyone know why we  check in online , go to  their self-serve kiost  yet still have to go to  a drop to  very much go through the check  in process again? Boarding went as usual, smiley welcome aboard and to  good seats. This  plane had WTP  just behind First. Good leg room, comfortable seat, small cabin of its . A small  snack pack is provided, although most  if the stuff  inside it is  small and hardly  worth having. Only  1 FA worked  in cabin but  he was friendly  & efficient and the lack of  support staff was  also noticable. Drinks  served and lunch  was then food . Lunch with 2 options, china  with real cutlery,  glasses etc.   Food was very good, even though only one option  available by time we were served.  Ground beef, which  is tasty and tender and well  prepared A snack  bar was passed  on a few  moments later and  then served 2 hours before landing. Interestingly, dinner was  in economy. Foil dish, plastic cutlery, paper napkins. Given  our price of  our ticket, would have expected better  from that.   Only one juice/water  available but FAs  always in the  mood and happy  and get whatever  they wanted (until we drank tham  full of bubbles!). Being an older plane, the IFE  was ancient with  its very small screen that had  only lines showing  and a barely adequate movie selection.  Flight cancelling headset was not the best and hurt  the ears. IFE was only a minor irritation, as  it was scheduled  4 hours 45 and I was more interested in  knowing which WTP ! Only real  complaint is the  drinks table. It  slides out of  the seat arm  like a drinks tray, then unfolds  like a full . Problem is,  things slide off when in small  spaces and you  had to brace the full tray on your knees to stop your  drink sliding off. British Airways is  banking on its  poor reputation rather than providing a  better product these  parts and I  fly them if  it can because  if that. I didn't think I  would be saying this but I enjoyed this flight and it was <mask> the best <mask> flight I've had. A shame then that I <mask> still avoid <mask> Airways if I can.

I have not  got as far  in even flying with British Airways  last time around, and the customer  service are a . Sent an email with flight confirmation and agreed time to us, yet a later email tells us different time. They say we need to take it up with Vueling, their sister company - call Vueling and are told it is a British Airways issue.  None of them  will take responsibility for changing our flight times without asking. It's now  very late to get an alternative  ticket at a reasonable price, so  had to return  at a stupid time in the morning which has ruined our anniversary weekend break. No  refunds or anything.  Another greedy company who thankfully are  in decline. Pay a bit more  and fly with genuine 4 or 5 star airlines. About 3 levels below Cathay Pacific and the rest around that price .

British Airways introduced its new Club Europe business class which is basically economy class, minus the middle seat. Leg room is same as in economy. When I  told flight crew what's new about  class she indicated  waving her hands that the seats were more cramped now. It is a shame that British Airways has fallen prey to greed and instead  on upgrading its business product, it  instead introduced a  very poor product on Club Europe. Food was poor and so was the inflight service.  If the person in front reclines,  is is impossible to even hold a newspaper and read it. I will never fly British Airways Club Europe again.

British Airways from Heathrow to Vancouver outbound, Toronto-Heathrow inbound,  all on rather ancient Boeing 747-400. Both flights operated within 30 minutes of schedule and the fare was competitive. Check-in and bag delivery was fine at all 3 airports. The  flight interiors were shabby at best,  seats uncomfortable, IFE hopeless, food awful. Cabin crew were mixed, one or  so fairly pleasant but most going  after their duties  in a perfunctory way. One male  Cabin crew member was so overweight and sweating profusely, it was astounding  that he could still be allowed to fly. From the good days of quality service in the 1980's, British Airways have gradually deteriorated into a third-class carrier and can never hope to compete on customer service with the airlines from the Middle and Far East. What a shame.

Flying to Cape Town via Heathrow with British Airways, and the short flight from Glasgow to Heathrow was fine, exit row , with plenty of room, although  our catering was  that bit bizarre, a drink and  small packet of crisps. The flight  to Cape Town  is however a  different story. The Boeing 747-400 used was well past  a major refurbishment  both inside and out. The economy class seating was  all squashed together with virtually no  space to move,  but I'm only  moderately tall. The seat back entertainment  centre must be  next generation, tiny  screen with a  lot of lines on it, I've  seen smart phones with bigger screens! The crew in our section were  all bit perfunctory  in their duties, apart from one  person who smiled  / chatted with and I quote " guests" and  generally made the  trip a bit  too bearable. The  fare on offer was standard economy class fare, it  had a gap, just. The flight  time for BA0059  is 11.5 hours,  but British Airways  really need to  increase the inflight quality of their long haul flights  in terms of  a bit more  comfort and better  service for economy class passengers, who  now make up  vast majority of people on board,  not the premium passengers. The old  Brit Airways corporate slogan "The Worlds Favourite Airline" are long gone. For  our next flight to South Africa or elsewhere, I  hope it will  revert back to KLM for us.

I have flown business class long haul on Emirates, Qatar Airways, Air  Netherlands KLM, American, Singapore, Thai Airways,  Asia Pacific and most recently British  Airways for work within the last 24 months. I fly long haul 8-10 times a year so I  would consider myself to be a moderate user of the service and know what I should expect for the money. I will never fly British Airways again if I can avoid it. I  boarded on time and it felt like a safe journey, but everything from check in, to the seat configuration and comfort (and cleanliness), the food and the entertainment system were so far away from the competition. The cabin crew were snooty on  the A380 out of LHR - in this example I was a silent observer to  the unacceptable customer service responses. The only redeeming feature of the whole experience was the  service at the Washington Dulles lounge,  The rest of BA could learn a lot in there. Very disappointing BA, its a shame your product quality is so below par. I'm proud to be British, but not when it comes to our national carrier, what a  disgrace

Nice and professional British Airways crew. The seat is comfortable and two usb ports and the in-seat power  outlet are nice. Food was ok. In-flight entertainment system far away from Cathay. But the 3D map was  good Overall a  good experience, and  for the money.

UK Airways lost  customers by labeling  the case with  a wrong name  of destination. Lost  Airways office at Amsterdam was difficult  TO find, but  staff were helpful.  Information given with  a contact address  to keep you  posted was   totally useless -  4 days of  multiple emails each  with no response.  Phone number called  the Viking concierge  for 10 hours  on and off  after 4 days , totally ignored  your information totally ! Finally after  months a senior  level email address  was found and  then after discussion  if my house  and not on  that day agreed.  Then 26 days , respond to  a letter of  apology 14 days  to date and  still no reply  after second email  or complaint. British Airways customer service  was laughable.

An aging British  built Boeing 747-400  was well maintained.  Each seat was  set in World  Class Plus. I was seating on the last row , no pressure  seat inclining the  seats Food was good and a  full bar service.  The flight took  into a cabin  crew greeted everyone  and was one the nicest and cheerful crew I have met.

i am so  annoyed with British  Airways that I  must avoid them  for the future.  When for any reason, you have  a reschedule your  flights their fees  were beyond anything  we ever experienced.  Just booked a  ticket from Istanbul to Denver in Business Class and , due to  circumstances beyond my  control had to . The flight one way was  $ which is  the lot of . Their "restocking  fee was 25%,  In order for  them to receive  full credit of  part of the  flight fare. In  Denver there was a $525 penalty  and so the  maximum penalty was . So, now  we have a  refund for one  way with British  Airlines and I  never have to  travel with them again.  What  an rip off.

Got my flight to Madrid and back on British Airways. Going to  London was on an A321, very nice seats and comfortable. The return leg from Madrid was a Boeing 767, the aircraft is old but the seats were very spacious and comfortable. The cabin crew were fantastic in their job, you only get snack for a short haul 2  day flight, for the price and what is offered  from British Airways it's worth it.  The both journey was excellent, departed and arrived both legs on time.

Whilst I don't expect too much from economy I have to say  I was very disappointed with British  Air from Gatwick to Mauritius. I chose this airline as I expected the planes to  stay in good condition and the room slightly better for someone of my height. Instead the seat was so worn out I could feel the frame underneath  and the legroom appalling. The staff were very polite and attentive, but the food left  the lot to be desired.

British Airways flight from Moscow to  Edinburgh on an old Boeing 777-200 which needs replacing soon. Bar service and hot lunch served, washroom was clean. Surprisingly this flight had no duty free which was there on  an outbound flight  at St Petersburgh.  Agents were pleasant and friendly. Seats reasonably comfortable, IFE was usual short haul programmes with  a map.      Top British Airways Ranking

London to St Petersburgh flight left  on time, aircraft was clean. The  cabin was not full and we  were given aisle  and window seat with a vacant seat in the middle.  This  is similar to  our business class section. Hot breakfast was served. Overall a comfortable short flight. My only gripe was slow check in at Heathrow T5, as all pax to  board have to  get their Visa  stamped by supervisor. </s> ⚑ British Airways Ranking

We flew from  Los Angeles to  Paris with British Airways, who seem to be working  overtime to improve . What I  cannot understand is why they still have not updated their Club World seating after so many years. Even  the US carriers offer superior seating these days. I don't get it - new British Airways plane but  still old seats. While they are fully flat and I slept well,  my main issues are having to step over other  passengers as there is no direct aisle access and a lack of storage space and cubby holes around  the seat. The  flight crew were mature, professional, and the CSD introduced himself during the flight and seemed  comfortable Catering seems to have improved - I chose  ground beef for  breakfast and instead  of the usual overcooked lump in a casserole dish , was cooked well and plated  thanks to what all first rate airlines do in Business class these days. Instead of the dreaded 'bacon ' for breakfast, there were two hot egg dishes, a toasted sandwich  and a cold plate of meats and cheeses.      Thanks British Airways )

Upgraded to Club  Europe on outward  journey for a treat. Check in queue at "dedicated Club Europe" desk was dreadful. Staff like bouncers with  no customer service ! Heard one  said to a  young man "you  could have got up earlier". Only when we got restless did they open the fence to let us  through to an  automatic check in operator. Then the "priority" security process  was nonsense, just as slow as elsewhere. Staff on  staff excellent. On  last journey I  booked in online as usual. Changed  2 seats to the final row.  Came on board to find the  row had no window. Flight too full to move elsewhere. Partner a  notoriously nervous flyer and had a horrible journey back,  thought he was  in a coffin, and heart flutter  the next day  related to stress of the journey. All made worse  by 30 min  delays on departure and a further  30 min delay  in being allowed to land at . Next day  we contacted British 's customer services  online to ask  why there was no indication at  all on the  assigned seat plan that row 25  of A319 had no window. No response at all apart from automated  saying busy but will get back  with you asap". A week later  they sent the same response, with  a complaint number, again online. No  reply at all, not even the automated one. I'm  a feeling that British Airways is  copying Ryanair, though even they have  stopped trying to improve their service and image recently. The days of  UK Airways as  a classic British airline, with good service and professionalism went with the  sale of it to other nations. It is not what it appears. We also noted that cabin staff in economy could  not cope with a full cabin.  Because of a trolley starting at  either end, there was only one with two staff.  Even the "widest  long range jet"  has 25 rows, 6 across this  are not enough.  Numbers have been cut, clearly staff are demoralised and  the service has gone out of the window. Obviously,  including the window  on row 25.

30th wedding anniversary  delayed due to British Airways not loading baggage onto flight - not just ours but  a whole flight!  baggage handling belts broken so baggage all piled up in departure lounge. Baggage tracking website  does not work, so that's a waste of time!  Contact centre in London diverts to  call centre in India so you can't understand a thing being said  and vice versa. Pilot and staff must have known  their was no baggage in hold and yet the flight was still allowed to leave. Italian contact number for British Airways lost luggage was unobtainable and given out regardless of that fact. Would not recommend British Airways to my  arch enemy.

Worst experience I've  EVER had in  any airport, poor organisation with bad  personal service from  UK Airways staff  that didn't care  if I would  face a 5  hour delay, due  to been told  I would need to cancel and rebook my conecting internal flight. As  our flight was delayed between JFK  to Heathrow. I was appalled to see how badly  this was dealt , and how little effort British  Airways put into organising its customers.  Many people where  forced to go to a service  desk and cancel  & rebook flights,  while others got put in a fast track immigration  process No staff  seemed to care  for the delay  My partner and  I were experiencing after a 7  hour flight. I would never recommend  Brit Airways to  them They only  care about premium paying passengers and the service they  have to offer  has been left behind by other providers. Absolute garbage!!

British Airways Economy on a Boeing 777, London to Bangkok. The seat was terrible, had the IFE release knob wedged in my leg for 12 hours and a food tray  I could not open so unable  to eat. Stewardess asked if I would like to put food tray  over my lap. The seat was not fit for  flight

The Concorde Lounge  took a long way in the terminal, and after  be placed on  the bus to the aircraft along side all the  remaining passengers -  you wait standing  in the crushed  seats on the  runway for 20 minutes. Once onboard,  I asked for  the Vodka Martini, (not too difficult surely). After a  30 minute wait, the steward informed  that he was  sorry for the  drink but he had no Martini ! Okay, this was British Airways  First class, but not such a huge deal, he offered it to me in a  shot glass instead not a big  mistake  20 minutes later he returned and said he couldn't serve me a Vodla Martini as there was no Martini  onboard the plane. . Then came the 'Dine as you please' meal , I asked for my dinner  to be served  2 hours into  this flight, I was asked my  choices and chose the Steak - to be told there was no Steak left.   It was 'suggested' I try the fish, I do not like fish, so I was  provided with Vegetarian option. The dinner arrived half an hour later, not  even two hours later as I  thought  I  could never choose to fly British Airways First class again.

My British Airways  round trip from  London to Vancouver via back wasn't  that bad, but the seats were really unconfortable and  just wasn't enough leg room. Furthermore the flights took  off late, so i ended up  having little time to take the  nap There is definitely space for improvement at British  Airways

I have flown regularly with British  Airways between the UK and other European countries, where economy class seats  are leather and reasonable onboard service. Based on previous experience, I decided to make an intercontinental flight between the UK and  Bras de Janeiro Brazil believing that I would find at least the same comfort offered on European routes by British Airways. It was not. Instead of decent seat conditions expected for a 11 hours duration flight, I found seats that barely accommodate a normal person (not so tall, not overweight) and completely unable to have a decent  connection during the flight. The economy class of British Airways can be defined as simply terrible. Do not waste your money by paying a  bit more believing you will find comfort in an intercontinental flight flying economy class with British Airways. Just buy the cheapest promotional airline ticket that you find on market, you'll be served the same way and will save some money.

From Heathrow to  Manchester with British  Airways I was  able to sit  at row 1  of the Club  Deluxe cabin where  you get the  best legroom. Unfortunately  The rest of  my cabin has  this same seat  configuration as Euro star The seats  seemed comfortable for  this short flight and the service  for around 16 pm was good,  offering good quality  food and drinks :

Short flight from London to Paris but completely full.  Easy check in and smooth boarding. Problem is how inconsistent British Airways  are in regard to baggage allowed in the cabin. Some people have two or three big bags when  they thought only one was allowed. So this then  puts pressure on passengers with just one to put in the lockers with the crew trying to get them to put the bag by their feet. Why should they? I carry less on the plane to  am able to have foot space - why should I give that up when someone  just brings on  more bags. This  needs to be looked at. Short flight - on time and service on board ok given that timeframe.

We were delayed  getting out from  Dubai to Bangkok, but were notified  by British Airways  on our journey  from the airport.  Our seats were  too tight but  for Economy I  got that, the  flight was freezing  between there and back, every one  was given a  blanket so wrap  yourself warm. The  food choice wasn't  much and don't  take seats next  to the toilets, seat row numbers  are the 20's  and will always get served last,  if they do run out.

Las Vegas to  Edinburgh Heathrow with  UK Airways. What we were expecting , what we got are two separate things.  We boarded the aircraft on time, and were greeted at the doorway, but once inside, the cabin crew were more interested in themselves and chatting - no help anywhere! We settled into our seats, which were narrow and very cramped, and the heat in the  cabin was very uncomfortable to the point that the majority of the passengers were fanning themselves down with safety cards. The service commenced once  our flight was underway and free  beers were offered,  but if you  had a beer the only choice was lager or lite lager. The meal commenced shortly after and my  wife had ordered a lactose free meal which she was given - or so she thought until she looked closely and everything contained dairy products. This was changed when it  is brought to  the attention the of the crew, and looking back I think she  would have been better with the wrong choice that was given, and  seen the consequences as it looked unappetising, bland and who knows what it was. No  milk no meat.  All rest of the meals were  offered (or should  we say thrown at us) offering pasta or chicken.  Overall attitude from the cabin crew was very poor and some were rude and arrogant. For the majority of the flight the cabin crew were invisible. One  of the screens in the seatback wasn't working so this was rectified 30 minutes after the cabin  was being told - why aren't  these things checked prior to boarding? The space you  have in economy is abysmal, the person in front of me put  her seat back and was nearly  sitting on me, the leg room is shocking and  the seats uncomfortable. My son couldn't eat his meal until the person  in front put the seat up  so he couldn't  reach it. The cabin crew should make an announcement  before meals are served for passengers to upright the  information out of  front to the people behind or tell people when they're serving meals - no they  should as it would be too  much of an effort for them. The only good thing about the flight was arriving early so we  can get off it. Would we fly British Airways again - on this experience no, you would have more room in a tin of  tea British Airways need to get their finger out and start offering a quality service  for everybody on  this flight - not just the  people in the posh seats, and maybe send some of the staff on a customer care course.

That describes the  US Airways experience  without a single word. The new  Continental Europe seats  did not fit  any purpose at  least when it  came to a  10 hour flight.  Almost impossible to  stretch out, because there is no space and I  am only 6 ft tall. It's  difficult to work,  but there is insufficient space and it's impossible to  eat but the new seats barely recline. This is  by no stretch  of the imagination , quality airline product. For anyone  looking to pay a premium, do yourself a favour : give your money to another !

I used British  Air to Hong  Kong in 2012  but remember vowing  I never use them again. However,  because I needed  to get to  new York and  Shanghai quickly I  wanted to use  British Airways, and  I thought they  might have bucked  from their ideas.  My flight to  NYC was on  the Boeing 747  and really did need an uplift,  fewer seats and  I was tired  by the staff ! The entertainment  experience was terrible , limited. On  my return flight,  I was on  the Boeing 777  which although slightly  more modern, the  seat again was  awful and the  audio unit didn't work. The staff  were better than  on previous flight.  Thankfully British Airways  I manage to  transfer my baggage between NYC and  LA and I  returned it 24hours  ago (battered and  missing some clips , thankfully nothing  was inside). I've  said that whenever  we fly eastw  I continue using  American or Singapore  Airlines (both of  them far higher  fares than British Airways) and to  the USA maybe  soon (have to  know better than  that surely?). I'll  never use BA .

I have used  them for European destinations and have  not been very happy, but while searching I found  UK Airways offering  direct to Barcelona for £75 including  costs of baggage.  The aircraft was  an A319, I am 6'3" so  I was bit  taller but no more than other  budget carriers, aircraft  is spotless, crew very attentive. There  were complimentary food and drink. Outward ly on time, inward flight was  missed by about one hour by  arriving earlier at Gatwick. I will certainly use again , other budget airlines better wake  up

The return British Airways flight from Dubai to LHR started badly with the worst lounge experience I have  ever visited. A shared lounge for Club and First Class - in  First class it is terrible. Tatty and years past a refurbishment. Given that BA has  flown this route  over decades, one does wonder what  they are playing . I could only enviously look  into a pristine  white lounge across the departure hall. My wife tried  our "breakfast" -  a dried up  bread and disgusting  rotten eggs. She declared she would not give it to our dog , a cocker . The boarding gate was miles away and BA shipped us over to gate in  a golf buggy. It took ages!  Now they are installing a First Class later this year, the same story I heard at LAX last year. The flight left on time. FAs were terrific and it seems BA rely on crew to make  and break every flight nowadays. The seat was much  nicer than outbound on a Boeing 747. Food okay . starter of  the Asian duck was fantastic. Soup  very good. Grilled salmon okay -  little bit dry. Wines very good  if chilled properly,  this is often not the case.  Just four passengers  were First - including my wife and I. It wasn't too bad - but there is no wow ! Shame.

British Airways flight  was delayed due  of a fuelling problem with the  plane despite it  has been sitting  in the ground  over 9 hours  after flights. The  toilets are full  of dirty plates  or glasses on every table and  no food is  unfit for the  majority of passengers.  Our entertainment system  keeps coming up  saying "please wait"  multiple times during  the flight, whilst  our cabin crew  played apology announcements  but kept trying  to reset it. British Airways Club World meals are full of packets  and wrappers which  never exactly reflect  their premium product.  Every cabin looks old and tired. The amenity kit  looks cheap and  yet I paid to reserve a  spare seat and  that was changed  thanks to unexplained "operational reasons". Terminal  4 (which is  American Airways  !) had a  massive baggage system breakdown causing queues and chaos, so  the luggage arrived  2 days after  it did. What  is there to like about BA?

Very disgusted, delayed  about 45 min  with no reasons  and a quiet  plane with one  more international flight.  Baby seat too small, no infant meal available after confirmation at check-in. Entertainment system stuck on a loop and not working.  Space between seats  that is disgusting. Old seats and flight. Flying in 2015 this must be a 20 year old flight, not comfortable. However , leg room.

London to New York JFK is the most profitable route for British . My ticket cost nearly £5,000 return. I fly fortnightly between London  & New York JFK. The aircraft are tired, food is poor, even the new gourmet business class food. British Airways management should try the breakfast porridge with salt and blueberries! What about the afternoon tea sandwiches? Yuk. Toilets often out of service and on my last 6 flights at least 1 of the toilets has been out  of service. The last flight BA117 on Wednesday 2 September 2015 the power failed meaning all the seats in my section of business class  needed to be manually positioned. The in-flight entertainment system stopped. The staff were great, but frankly all the company is doing is putting staff in a difficult position. In 2015 my company will have spent £120k on travel to and from London and New York. Too much money for such a mediocre service, aircraft that are many years beyond proper serviceability and a management team focused on shareholder profit not customer satisfaction. What a fall from grace. In August I flew Singapore Airlines London to Melbourne. What a difference in aircraft quality, customer service experience and value for money. Please British Airways, sort yourselves out. Letters to Keith Williams or Willie Walsh are ignored or intercepted by staff. Lots of promises and little or no action. My most recent cabin was held  up by pipe insulator. The last one the same, and horrible condensation issue with the air con resulting in a soaked blanket at take off.

Compared to the likes of EVA  Air or Qatar 's British Airways  Air World is by far the  worst relation. Flew  from Glasgow to New York via  JFK the seats  offered zero storage apart from the small drawer at floor level. It is astonishing that for the money they charge, you have to step over the legs  if the person  on your outside,  especially if you  over trip and  sit on top  on them. Food was satisfactory although a small bacon  roll for breakfast  was again a poor show. AVOD  was also satisfactory.  Aside from the flat bed, this just really doesn't have a premium  feel about it.  In our recent trip, on both  trips the crew  was excellent, but the product from our national flag  carrier simply is 't worth the  high prices they  offer

A British Airways  journey from Heathrow  in Johannesburg. My  favourite flight on  an A380 which  was quiet and  very comfortable. I think BA have improved both service  & food to  a good standard. My husband and  daughter fly very  well and found  the meals on  this flight enjoyable - much better than Emirates. However,  BA had a  limited selection of  snacks

United with British  Airlines return 29th  to 31st August.  Flight in online , as was  a drop at T5, used galleries  club lounge which  have always liked. Breakfast on offer  from 7am. Boarding  fine however the  change of a  bus to a  party stand always feels odd at  the airlines hub , aircraft with  no Club Europe seating first time  on this layout  but must say  is not much different to economy.  Fly away on  online service ok  with english breakfast on offer. Crew  happy Landed a  little early. Return ed in quick  and easy although  the party lounge is just ok, flight departed on  time lasting 2hr 35min, crew pretty  happy and the  new CE layout on this A320  much comfier, afternoon  breakfast served which  were ok. Flight  departed a little  late but on  to a stand , no bus , I'm unsure if Club in  Europe is still  worth the extra,  do have a  lot more BA  class flights coming up so will judge once I've used economy and  board once more.

London Heathrow to Dubai in British Airways First Class.  My trip got off to a good start with the Concorde lounge  in Terminal 5. Very comfortable and  comfortable however showing signs of wear  & tear. Needs a bit of a refurb. Boarding was announced and we promptly left, however only just  made it to the gate. (Very odd, but I  am no fan of the trains to the strange satellite terminals for …) The plane was a very old refurbished Boeing  777 Quite why  one hangs on  all these gas  seats is a mystery. I estimate the plane, over  its life so  long has done about 90 million miles (enough to get to the moon). Much criticism  had been said  for cramming so many First suites into the nose of the plane, and I can say that is fully justified. It  was a day  flight so not worried about sleeping,  although if it  was a night flight as a tall (but not overweight) man I would struggle to get comfortable. It’s  basically a coffin and storage space for personal effects not worth a light. A cabin crew told me  they will hang on to the newer Boeing 747-400s for another 5-10 years. If so, this is truly unbelievable. Given the  stiff competition on this route, their fantastic suites and they always serve  well one does  wonders if the  sales and marketing people at British Airways have a  sense how to entice customers to  the overall experience. There is so much criticism of British Airways on this site, one wonders why they don’t listen. It  would only be  seen as arrogance.  Lunch was fine. Very nice mezza, nice soup and spicy Middle Eastern style chicken; not bad at all.  This very basic  food Krug has long vanished from  UK Airways routes.  All crew were  fantastic – faultless. Travelling a Boeing 777 on the way back. Hopefully a better seat.

Brussels to Heathrow with British Airways. Lounge at Brussels very acceptable. Plenty of space. Reasonable snacks (I wouldn’t call it a 'meal'.) Plane pushed  in on time , we were  off in minutes.  Next flight to  Amsterdam was just 40 minutes and straight in without stacking – landing from the East. Barely enough time for a meal, but a number  of passengers took advantage of the  good looking prawn . I was happy with a couple of gin and tonics. Seated in row one, so leg room was okay in  those strange “new”  Central Europe seats.  But not bad.

On the upper deck on BA 282 (Aug 31st), although the equipment  was relatively new, once you are in those hideous seats, you wouldn't  become aware of what aircraft you are on. Squeezing  too many ying yang seats onto an aircraft does not constitute a  pleasant cabin experience.  British Airways missed a great opportunity  the enhance their club world product, but while other carriers improved their cabins, BA seem content in leading the race to the bottom. The crew on this flight looked as though they did mot wish to be on duty ; one in particular was really obnoxious to a child. The child's  parents were certainly mare tolerant than I would have been. Crew turned  a blind eye to two passengers who decided to retain their luggage from the overhead lockers while the aircraft was still  airborne and the  seat belt signs were still illuminated.  After the food was served, crew were nowhere to  been seen until breakfast was served.  Due to the  excellent food served on this route on a previous  trip I ate before boarding so  I comment what the offerings were on this sector. The 'Club Kitchen'  was a complete waste of time. I did attempt to have a  breakfast from the  club kitchen during the overnight flight (after negotiating the  tired legs of a sleeping passenger) but the unlabeled  menus were chilled  out of their existence and were  proof British Airways ' need to up their game  with respect of offering a premium cabin service.

I can confirm what has been reported earlier about British Airways long haul flights. Our plane was really  small and most staff were almost the same. The TV screen was  virtually impossible to  read because of the distorted picture and the seats felt like on an IKEA couch from the 1970's. The usual food choice of "pasta  with chicken" was reduced to chicken only. On top of that we were 24hrs delayed  thanks to bad servicing of one of the engines which needed a spare part - only available in the UK. Disaster  in the check-in counter when 400 travellers were asking  for accomodation - British Airways had no strategy to handle such a situation which caused hours of unnecessary waiting in the queue. Hotel vouchers given for hotels that do not exist! We had to find a room for 4 (two small kids) on our own at almost midnight. This was definitely the last flight  with British Airways.

Thoroughly disappointed with  this supposed legacy . Having been delayed for an  hours on my  British Airways connecting  flights to LHR  then stuck overnight at a Heathrow  airport I was  looking forward to  getting going on the morning flight. Reality check. This aircraft is old , decrepit and  was built in  the 80s, it  would have been  replaced long ago.  A quick Google search shows that  this aircraft makes  Up the majority  of BA's longhaul s The seats  are so small  and narrow that you are constantly  doing elbow hockey with the people  sitting either side  facing you. I am 5ft 8 , weigh 70kg  and how a  small person might survive is beyond  belief Everything is  old and looks it too. Even  BA staff. The  floors are worn  at the point  where you can feel every piece  on the metal frame beneath. In  flight the lady  sitting in front  with me complained  about the cabin crew because she  would feel the  plastic Tropicana bottle  someone had put  in seat pocket.  Although the safety  inspection video looks  as it was  made as a  BA IT project  for 11 year  ago Staff are cold and unfriendly,  it would seem that their contracts  prohibit smiling of any kind. The inflight entertainment screens  look smaller than  any regular smartphone  and have large  enough pixels, it  was a struggle  to actually see  where is being . They are running on brand image only and even then there's  barely fumes left in tank. Do  not fly BA  the least until  the seriously upgrade their fleet.

Flight was clean,  everyone amiable and  friendly with deliveries  of juice and  coffee through the  flight Dinner on  average was fine,  maybe a little  bland but otherwise  pleasant enough.   Our seatback screen  looked tiny but  plenty of entertainment  was good. The  coffee quality was  very poor. The  low mark was  what pathetic breakfast  and croissant was : Partly frozen,  raw and it  seems like most  of the folk  seated nearby did  not even open  a plastic wrapper.  3 cups of  tea and a  candy bar was . My wife , I were  seated on different  airlines with British  Airlines and this  is one flight  was shared. I  asked 3 times  asking the agent  would link the  flights which she  told BA computer  would not perform , so we  stayed seated apart.  Little drama since  the plane was  only about 80%  capacity and we  stuck it out . This was  one of a  round the world  over so I  have no idea  about the "value  the money" question  in this sector.

Back home after  a 2 week  journey in various  countries of Europe.  The cabin crew  was fantastic. Made  us (me and  3 Australian companions)  feel welcome and  the most accommodating  during our flight ! Cannot fault  the service.

Great flight with  crew - departure at Milan was great, despite a small delay to the flight. Relatively empty flight and  seats could stretch  and seat was  very comfortable. Cabin  facilities were great  and encouraged people to order more  drinks and have  better food and  to do enough  to people. Overall , best of BA. Great arrival at T5, even  if having a  new bag was  sorted in 20 mins.

My wife and  I flew from Toronto to London , using BA  First Class in July of this ! This was part of a "trip of a lifetime" we had planned to the UK.
