We have  never flown business class, so decided  to spend the big dollars for  a return trip. I am not sure if it 's worth it at all! Toronto to London was  a overnight flight, London to Toronto an afternoon flight.  Overall Ease of booking online was  very good, Customer  Service on phone was poor (obviously outsourced so a  huge barrier!). Check in at Toronto  was average, nothing  like check in at any other counter. Lounge at  JFK very good,  good food, drinks, service, facilities. Aircraft cabin with average state of wear Seats - center rear facing seats.  Good but lacking any type of space (the lie  down bed was good) Cabin crew were on auto  pilot - not  terrible but certainly not great,  Food was average. The return trip (Heathrow Terminal 5)  to Toronto was not really any better. The business  style lounge at  London was not good. Lousy food,  seats very worn, very busy, travelers sleeping across multiple seats, bathrooms were  average .I would  of rather taken my chances in the regular lounge area or gone  to one of the many sit down restaurants. The distance from the main concourse (after !) to the lounge is quite long and the  ride to your gate (especially if  it is in the B or  D sections) is a great distance, and involves a train ride! Same  as on the  returned trip, so again average. Food,  drinks etc all average. Overall, we  are not impressed with British Airways Business, and would not use them again (consider Air Canada or another !) I flew Air Transat Club  only 2 month prior to the  experience and I enjoyed it a  lot more (and a hell of  a lot cheaper!) British Airways did  NOT impress!

You didn't really  know what to expect from this  as it had  taken a couple  or years since my last BA  trip (Gatwick to  Manchester in that case) we were  on our way  to Lyon Airport  to the city  centre and noticed the flight had  not just departed , Upon arrival  at the airport we found it to be delayed by 40 minutes.  Very little information  given as to  this When we  finally got round  the boarding there was no organisation, a bit like every man for  himself What amused  us was that  a captain came  in over the  controls and encouraged passengers to hurry  and take their  places as we had only 9 minutes to keep  the slot. Safe to say because  of the lack  in organisation we missed our slot and we sat on the aircraft  in another 50 mins while we  found a new . The captain  kept us informed  as best he  could the cabin  crew showed no effort at all.  He showed no  desire to actually  sit there, they  did check on passengers bearing in mind it was  cold outside and this was affecting  our temperature inside  our aircraft. Once  it took off  our service seemed  terrible I wasn't  allowed to get  decent food at the airport so  kept hoping for  anything that would keep me full  through the journey , no so  just a pitiful  Bacon and Cheese  sandwich thing and  no drink. There  was no personal  attention to it.  Once we were  leaving Heathrow all  you could hear from the rear galley (we were  at the back ), was the  cabin crew complaining  of their hours.  Now flying with  my Citiflyer to  London in September, if the service  has improved I'll  think twice if  you really need  to travel BA ?

Despite BA's bizarre , relentless assault  of its premium  pricing dropped back  in economy as  price point flying  into Europe given  the leg room  for the same.  Brand new interior : clean, adequate ; flight left  in time, quick  flight pick up-didn't  agree with the  service offered, my  eyes did, couldn't  even see any  better than the  one being offered in club except  being served in  black box. Crew  make no effort  or disguise their  intention to be  somewhere else. Overall  we expected little , so not  quite Decent value  the money, but  worth another flight  with a few  moments to watch  a film on  the iPad.

London to Miami  - Flew out  on 5 children,  youngest was an infant turning 2  during holiday. Had  made booking for seat on return and booking number and email assuring me bookings were  open and there would be no issue. Upon checking  in to return , met with  airport staff who commented "don't even touch that it's hassle just refer her to ticketing"  so I spent the next two hours waiting for  someone to check me in. My flight closed and  flew off without me - despite me constantly stressing that I had  my child with  the fractured leg and medical assistance all linked to the flight. Long  story short, I was dumped on  a flight after 3 hours waiting at desk with 5 children, no  understanding of what was going on - people being served all around  us by person  which was supposed to be dealing with me, no  emergency meals were transferred and all assistance was abandoned as was connected with previous flight. Resulted in me being stranded at  JFK as my 7 seater taxi had left and  it impossible to book another. However , wasn't all - check in staff went on  the tell me  that my 32 kilo case could  NOT be boarded  as it was too heavy under  health and safety regulations. I had  then throw away 8 kilos worth of clothing. This  is despite me being 48 kilos under my overall baggage allowance and receiving a sticker  saying 'heavy bags must not weigh more than 32 kilos'. Had a  further 3 hour wait at the  very end as all medical assistance booked had not  being transferred as requested. Would never fly British Airways again due to  sheer complete and  utter incompetence of the ground staff at Miami.

I have been  flying with British  Airways on the  Zurich route for a while now,  and the original  customer service has  begun declining. I  am an Executive  Group silver member  but due to changes to the Executive Club I  was now earning  a lot less  money and tier  money than I  use to. Also  these slimmer seats  of the aircraft,  In this case  some rather old , are much  less comfortable and  so I find  it quite tight . I am  only especially tall  at 6ft. The  cabin crew were not particularly attentive  or friendly. They barely bothered with  other passengers onboard  - though the  staff was nearly  identical Overall it  was disappointing that  a flag carrier  is becoming more  like Ryanair with every 'enhancment' they  introduce I have  only tried Swiss  over this route  and they were  good and provided  much superior service.

THE sad decline of our national flag carrier seems to be continuing unabated. I fly the LHR-PHX-LHR route on a monthly basis and although I've spoken to colleagues about changing  flights as BA offers the only  viable route into Phoenix I have  stayed with them. But where to begin? The 747-400s  themselves are ageing,  slow and tired, if they were your old horse they'd have been taken to the knacker's yard years ago. Throughout the aircraft the seating  feels uncomfortable, space cramped and onboard facilities lacking and limited. The AVOD in economy and the premium variant is restarted with almost comical regularity, the screens are smaller than most of us have fitted in our car so you are either squinting or just unable to see the movie you are trying to watch. When the person in front reclines the screen is almost forced into your face such is the limited legroom. Catering is just awful in the economy cabins and only marginally better in business, although I see  one airline is getting around this now by allowing the the privilege of paying for a meal upgrade. One word of caution here - if you are  upgraded your meal stays behind despite you paying for it. All in all BA is slipping against the competition and delays are common place as to be expected, LHR lounges are in need of a complete  overhaul and it's a rarity to get more than a couple of cabin staff who  are happy in their work. I've one more BA flight to go and then it's  over from me, but then given how they so sparingly issue tier points now it's  nothing like I'm going to miss .

At this same  flight last summer  with delays etc  and thought we 'd just been  lucky but history repeated itself. All legs were delayed.  Crew issues or  weather were blamed. BA do not  appear to have  much in the  way of contingency  planning and particularly where terminal 5  in Heathrow is , it takes  a little weather  will throw the whole place into  chaos At all  times information was  incorrect or contradictory. I cannot decide if they lie  and are so  confused that they do not communicate  to each other. Eg our internal flight home was showing as being  closed to big  delays for hours online. When we  arrived at the gate the delay  is announced as  the sudden crew issue. A new  policy this year  seems to be  BA bring out  the captain to speak to passengers  so maybe we were supposed to be charmed. This  happened both at Heathrow and Boston. On the long  domestic flights the seats were tiny ( the internal  ones were better , seems strange),  on both long  internal legs of  this journey the entertainment system did  not work and  our food was lamentable and definitely  better than a  few years ago.  Our cabin crew  were nice but  complained about it.

The British Airways plane I flew on from Larnaca - an ageing 767 - was clearly tired and while clean, looked frayed around the edges. Club Europe  offers a free seat next to you but this was not on offer on the 767 so it also felt a  bit cramped, especially as the seat is no different from the Economy seat. Food was  OK but not the best I  had been offered on European business class flights.

Very disappointing experience.  Flight was delayed  by more than  two hours but  the staff were  slow and unwilling to help arrange  alternative options even  though plane touched  down after midnight  with no public  accommodation options available.  There was claimed  not be weather but both Aberdeen and London experienced  severe weather, with  many other flights  getting delayed in  other locations. Concocted  simply to fool  us Would not  trust this airline  as two flights  have been delayed  by at least an hour each.

not sure who  made these seats  - they are awful. Difficult to  sit in and  see if you  get inside. Has  only flown British  airlines for a  couple of years  and they have not improved in  my time, food  is very mediocre and service the  best You even  have to pay  in advance to  get a seat,  which we did.  But when we checked in, we  got told sorry , using the  money you paid . Still waiting  for my refund.  Most entertainment is  terrible - movies  are past their  best by date.  Sorry to Emirates  not us.

I do not  see this new business class arrangement  for short haul.  I am wondering if is is worth paying a  fortune for no extra leg room  on a side  seat New seats  sound better. Service  and Food okay.

Slight delay. Games advertised on website, not able to  play in economy.  WiFi not working  until 1st hour,  and when it  started couldn't hear  it though the provided headphones, so had to choose  games with subtitles.  The staff doing their jobs, the  staff near us seemed to have  no attitude, a  woman behind asked  for a cup  of tea and  a flight assistant muttered under his  breathe My partially  blinded mother asked  her for milk  with her tea and the flight  manager made her feel stupid by shoving it in her face and  loudly saying "there  it is". I  hope she didn't  know my mother  being partially sighted,  so maybe she  will be aware  if you can't  really see people's  eyes I had  little problem with  the outbound flight to Denver from  London (except the headphones) the staff  of that plane were all very  helpful I will  check twice before  flying BA again.

The slight delay in boarding (BA 816 - scheduled  at 12:55) resulted  with priority boarding being suspended for  emergency boarding. Hardly  after the wheels left the ground , the person  in row 1F (I was seated  at 2F) reclined his seat back  as far as  they would go.  While one of the cabin crew  came past (seat belt sign, still on) I asked  why this was ! To my astonishment, I was  told that yes  he was. It 's my understanding  that the seat  belt must be  on the upright  positions while the seatbelt sign is on during climb.

The in agent  from Glasgow was  extremely cheerful and  friendly Both crews  are efficient and  pleasant if not  overly engaging. In  general it was  still very standard  flight I like the new seats on both aircraft.  What I don't like is having  a transfer from  London to T3 at Heathrow. Over  my past several  weeks I seem  almost always end up travelling to  various destinations requiring  another transfer, which  wastes a lot  extra time and  effort to what would be an  equally efficient domestic  or international connection  from T5.

Flying from Gatwick on 09/08/15 to  Portsmouth to join a cruise. Whilst the aircraft was clean, everything else seems to be very old and fit for purpose for a display at a museum. At the back only one toilet was working. Seats  felt cramped and  hardly comfortable. It  being an 8am flight, to my  dismay only a small cold croissant  with a bit of none descriptive cheese in the  bread was served  and a hot drink. Bearing in mind the flight  was on Skyscanner for could have cost over GBP500 . In the good old days British Airways flights from Manchester to Heathrow lasting about an hour served hot breakfast. It appears British Airways  do not want  to maintain its quality image and  so am really disappointed on this flight.

This was my first flight on a British Airways aircraft with the new, slimmer seats and I was quite appalled by the seat pitch (space between rows).  The seat back in front of  me (I was seated in 14C) was so close to my face that I could not hold up  a magazine to read. I had to try to twist sideways in my seat and hold the magazine in the aisle. I passed on the light breakfast  that was served because it just  felt like too  big trouble to try and eat from a plastic  cup that would have been almost pressed against my  nose The cabin crew on my flight was very pleasant and professional and the aircraft interior was immaculate, but in the future I'll avoid British Airways within Europe. The single-aisle aircraft of Air  Canada which I fly regularly, are far more comfortable.

Virgin sold me  tickets without any  baggage allowance. I paid £100 to  book 3 bags  from their online . When I  booked the return flight they charged  me again. But  every time double.  Even a reasonable £200 pound flight  wound up costing  over £600. I'll  never fly with  airlines again. They're  less expensive than  everyone else, and they've totally changed  their luggage terms.  Just a complete  write off.
Engine problems on  this short flight.  Fixed and arrived  in time. Drink and snack served.

not impressed. The cabin crew lacked  professionalism and enthusiasm. Poor service. There  were also rubbish  left in the pocket of the  suitcase in front  from me when  they boarded the  aircraft There were food crumbs on  a table when  we unclipped it  and the magazines  seemed well used.  I expected more  with British Airways.  We won't be  flying with them again.

Got upgraded at  departure gate from  New World to  Economy Class on  a full flight.  As am a loyal BA customer  since 1996, and  a Gold Tier . Was welcomed , shown my  ticket and the  friendly young male  flight attendant put  the cabin bag in the overhead  bin before I  did so. The suite has been  upgraded a bit  to the B777-236,  but the seat  remains the same,  comfortable but with  the poorly-designed footrest.  Also opted for  the Tasting Menu  for lunch. It  is quite good,  though the food  served was not  up to Cathay  Lion or Emirates  Business Class standards.  Hot Tea was  only average, due  to the dry ness The washrooms were clean but  dirty and the  First World washrooms  in the Upper  Level of the  flight are much nicer. Pajamas and  a wash bag  are offered. AVOD  were good. In-flight  entertainment by the  British FA was  very good, but  the finesse of  the First Class  FA was lacking  the bit. Still he was always  polite throughout the  flight and that  is good. Arrived  in time at  gate and the  passengers were on  their carousel quickly.

I have been a loyal BA customer since 1996, maintaining Gold Tier  membership in recent  years and Silver Tier for many prior years. BA  was consistent in the seat types  BA offers on its long haul fleet, but in-flight service and food can vary greatly. I connected from  a Qatar Airways short haul flight in DOH to BA, at Hamad iyah Airport. I  chose the Al Mourjan Business Class Lounge and it worked out well. BA's Gate staff in DOH were clearly not familiar  with the "To Fly. To Serve" slogan, judging by their attitude that  day Apart from a choice of water or orange juice upon boarding the Club World  flight no service was provided on  this very short hop to BAH.  Those flight attendants  (* in particular) who served from BAH to LHR were very good. It was a  Saturday so the  lunch menu was minimal, but breakfast  wasn compensate well  with that either. Cost-cutting was evident : Thankfully, I didn't have to jump over anyone to access the aisle as many  other seats were ! The cabin was clean, and AVOD was adequate,  although it froze near LHR. The flight landed on time in LHR,  though transferring through  BA was chaotic at 6:30 am.  My transfer was good.

Easy check in  from T5 and good passport/security/gate transit.  Flight boarded 20/25 mins late due to issues with airbridge. BA WT+ cabin in good order with nice  people aboard. AVIOS worked, must have been lucky. Young flight crew, so  we assume new MF types, so not that much interaction, but non  any less efficient. Food 8/10 for both dinner and breakfast. Flight made up some time so nearly on schedule. Bags first  through carousel, so all in all a good travel experience.

We flew with British Airways to  Santa Lucia on  route number BA2159 on 28/7/15 and  back on flight number BA2158 on . The journey to St Lucia  started pleasant enough  and we were  switched from economy , premium economy  seats to spare seats. Unfortunately however  this upgrade meant  that my husband and I no longer had seats  available (as I  was with the seats I'd pre-booked)  but as this  is our honeymoon this was quite  inconvenient for us. The journey home however was extremely  difficult On finding  the seats we discovered that the  cabin had not  properly cleaned since the previous journey. There were empty sweet wrappers in  my pocket and  spilled all over the seat and  on the floor.  We were not offered a new pillow and blanket  and instead we're left the ones  provided by previous  travellers In my case blanket scrunched  up on floor with pillow on top. In comparison with other long haul flights we have travelled on with Virgin and Emirate,s British Airways  seems to provide  far less space  with poorer facilities.  Needless to say  this flight was an uncomfortable one for many reasons. On future holidays we will be  travelling to other  aircraft operators.
Flight handling is not great at  all but once on board was  not forgotten. Great flight with attentive cabin crew. Delicious  afternoon tea with  excellent Champagne. Very  nice experience.

Really nice and  helpful staff in  Terminal 5, very  accommodating and friendly  ground crew. Food  was good too.  Very smooth flight  was on time.  I have flown  five times in  about two weeks  in different flights . I was  flying with my  3 year old son. British Airways  is the only  place where the  flight crew came from time to  Time came to  ask if my  son needed anything.  I brought him  a bag with  my colouring book  with pens without  incident

Another very smooth  and pleasant flight from start to  finish The bag ging queue at  Terminal 5 was  short but moved  too fast. Onboard  the small snack  of crisps and  soft drink was  provided which was  good The flight  was on time.  Our only quibble  was that a  strap was put on my backpack  causing me to  hold it at  their feet, presumably so that other  people with unreasonably  heavy take-on bags  can easily put  them in the  same bins (while  they suffered less  turbulence than them).  Aside from the  whole issue of  the baggage stuck  on the floor,  this policy penalises  passengers who do  a right thing  but encourages others  to take big  chunks of "hand"  bags Come on,  why enforce a  minimum hand luggage  rule and don't  be considerate passengers.

The staff were  NOT friendly or  even helpful. A  young lady beside  us asked for help with her  backpack on and the rude answer  - if you  could carry it  then bring it on board. My  husband asked for  one extra pillow  but he was  denied - 'only  one pillow per '. The lady  with my daughter  had not given  any and when  she asked for  it the flight attendant answered in  her loud voice  she did ask  her (which did  not happen). Don't  use this airline  if you have no other choice.

The staff were  never friendly or even helpful. A pregnant lady beside me asked for  food with her  clothes on and the answer was if you can't  afford it, don't  have it on board. My husband asked for an  actual pillow and  I was told  that one pillow per passenger. The  lady beside my  wife was not  carrying food and  after she asked for it, the  flight attendant answered in a loud  whisper "I did ask you" (which  should not happen). So don't fly this airline unless you have no  good choice.

First time travelling  at a premium  and so compared  to Economy it was great. Check-in at LHR was quick and we  felt grateful of  no additional baggage  included in Club . The fast  passage through security  were also welcome. The Galleries Lounge  on T3 was excellent, we were welcomed and given a quick overview  into the lounge. The breakfast in  the lounge offered  everything from cereal , pastries to hot sandwiches, as well as tea, coffee, juice, water  with a wide  selection of alcohol. There was also a great view of the runway  and my son , The service on board the flight itself offered  complimentary towels prior  of take off,  including a full English Breakfast with  proper cutlery and  fresh warm bread s and choice  in drinks. The  food was excellent and the seat was comfortable. They are laid out  in the same 3x3 configuration as  Economy but the middle seat has  one table over  them which gives  some extra room to place your  luggage As you are near the front of the  queue disembarkation was  easy and we were at the  front before our  flight The return  flight was much the same, and  although the lounge  that BCN did  NOT offer anywhere  with such a  good selection of  food the seating  felt far superior  at LHR. The meal on the  plane back was  great selection of  cured meats with,  green olives and a spicy mousse,  served with the usual selection of drinks. We were  allowed to use  a Fast Track  to passport control  in LHR which avoided a long queue and meant we were out  at the airport and in our car within an . Overall this  was a fantastic  flight for me  & my family who usually travel  in Economy.

Please wish I  would comment on  the service on  the aircraft, but  following a 27 hour delay I am unable to  and can only  comment on the  customer service after  being informed the  aircraft was delayed because of a technical fault. It  was not the  mechanical fault I am worried about but the way  the problem was  communicated by BA's  technical staff at  the OR Tambo . The cabin  staff had arrived at 18.00hrs and  checked the plane which was due  to depart at 19.20hrs to London. At 18.20hrs the  news came that  the flight was not boarding and passengers should wait  and be escorted  into the arrivals  desk to collect  luggage The chaos  then started. People  rushed to the  arrivals desks sought  and find out information and the  number of alternative  hotels (which were fully booked). After  about 40 minutes passengers were told  should go to  arrivals where BA  personnel would be there to assist.  Returning to arrivals, nobody was there to even tell  passengers which carousel  to go to. A series of  loud announcements then informed passengers to  drop luggage and  go to the  arrivals area to  collect hotel vouchers. Nobody was directing passengers at each  point Passengers were  ushered under an  overhead sign that  said South African  and domestic transfers  and collect vouchers.  A line slinked back into the  boarding area. Only  ground service agents  were dealing with  individual passengers. Chaotic . No line for families or premium passengers. In  The end no  refunds were given and free for  everyone to just  decide which hotel to go to.  Few clear announcements  given at any stage to passengers.  Most airlines have  policies which mean  a plane will be cancelled - it is how  this issue is dealt with that shows professionalism and  the basic duty  and care to  passengers In this case there was  nothing in charge, nobody undertaking line  work and nobody  having one source  for information. A true shambles. Passengers  arrived at the  gate not knowing  when the aircraft  will leave (scheduled  for leave 27  hrs after original departure) or what  their real problem  were (rumours only).  BA Club and having a BA  Membership Card (with  Red List status) meant nothing.

Pretty poor experience  booking with BA. Staff were not enthusiastic about taking  pictures of passengers,  food portions were insufficient, online check in was a  nightmare BA was  quick to process  the payment for  my seats, but once they took  my money, the  machine stopped working and no longer  let me select seats or check-in.  BA is more  expensive than Virgin , and delivers worse service. Virgin allows passengers to  choose their seats  upon booking, BA  pays passengers for  that option. I've  purchased 60 tickets on transatlantic flights over the past  5 years -  from Virgin, Delta , by far  my best experience was Virgin/Delta. I wont be booking  again - not  really good value for money
Flight crew were very enthusiastic and helpful. The service  moved very fast  and we were served a drink and a snack.  With such a short flight it was great. I would recommend.

Bad service at  the worst, rude , impatient staff  in the baggage  claim and only  1 person to  queue at the check in machines.  Overall I would recommend flying British  Airways but after  poor appaling service I will think twice.

Excellent Club Europe  - I am  surprised how European  Airlines serve so  well to it's  economy class passengers  on such a  long flight compared  with North American  Airlines business class. Champagne, delicious afternoon  coffee and superior  food made this short 2 hour  flight perfect in business class. Great  first class lounge  in Marseille for  business class passengers.

Was delayed in  London due to  fog but BA kept passengers updated.  After boarding, offered  tea and FA's welcomed passengers. After take-off, staff took meal order and  walked around with drink trolley. FA's  waited on passengers , made sure  the everyone was comfortable. Food at  very high standard and filling. Entertainment  was a bit outdated but movies very new. The  plane was comfortable,  although since it  was a rear-facing  view it made the take-off a  bit odd. LHR-BRU excellent service. Friendly , nice meal  with comfortable seat.  BA

Our return flight  to Barbados to England was delayed  by 25 hours.  Our experience at the airport was  horrible - initially  told that we would be updated  in 15 minutes (that was the  first update!) stuck  outside with no  WiFi (all food  closed and shops shut), a free for all when some bottles of water arrived. Inability of BA ground staff to communicate  to immigration (a  line of about 6 feet or a phone call), chaos when trying  to give immigration cards back to hot, tired, thirsty and hungry passengers. The positive in all this was  being put up in a hotel.  Negative - lack  of communication. I was never contacted directly - people  from the group  were updated by  email on twitter.  Especially if you  use internet/twitter.  Despite putting in a claim from  airline for flight delay I have not yet had a response from a human being.  For sure re star ratings -  their site does not appear to let me put a Zero star !

Flight was picked because it got  me from Riyadh,  Saud Arabia to Newcastle, UK in a reasonable amount of time. What  BA failed to inform anyone was  this despite advertising  the flight from RUH to LHR as landing at 5.25am BST at LHR is that planes cannot land at LHR before 6am. So once landed and they taxied to the apron we had little time to get through transit to catch the Newcastle flight. We  missed it and got to Newcastle  Airport to find that our two suitcases were there but my golf bag which I had paid for did not make that flight. It did make the next flight to Newcastle but I had already had to set off  or make an  appointment some 170 miles from Newcastle.  It took 3 days for my golf bag to arrive at where I was staying. Not one word of apology from BA. The seats on the flights were ok, service of crew satisfactory, the headsets didn't  work from RUH to LHR and I tried three sets. Best part was the hot bacon sandwich between LHR and NCL.

There have been  a long time  fan of BA,  as they have  only managed to  reduce the economy  fares to such  the appalling level . I suspect  that US based carriers now offer  much better product.  With ridiculously expensive  flights to book  planes in advance,  no child-sized low  calorie meals on  board to planes  on our route  who only offer  the dense 3-3-3  meals and new  regulations limiting the  number of Avios you can earn  with economy tickets,  I have had ? My partner  & I left  for the transatlantic  flight to LHR  and PHL, as well as the  flight to TXL ) absolutely starving.  A very sad  state of affairs  with BA.

What on earth  had happened to  US Airways inflight meals? On our way out to  dinner we were told that the  planes had to  be changed, so when we were only offered a stone cold croissant with cheddar cheese in it I  thought well, OK, maybe the reason for that is because of the change of planes  but no hot meals available. However,  during our return,  not only did we have an hour delay (still not sure why that happened, we were traveling with a 1 year old baby, so it was quite  exhausting just waiting !) but on  the flight our "meal" was half a sandwich with a bit of bacon and  lettuce, they said chicken was in it, but I  didnt have any  on mine. That was it, no hot drink either, the drinks trolley did come round  though so we were then offered a soft drink, or there were small spirits if you wanted them but the food was appalling. I'm not a fussy  person but I thought a meal on the plane consisted of something hot, I didn't have time to  eat anything at the airport, and  back home at  midnight I was starving.

Then on August  11 when there  was a power  failure at London  Airport which resulted  into missing baggage. The way BA  handles is pathetic with no proper  information regarding status  on bags. I  checked several times , had to  speak to the  UK twice. There 's much confusion  in the BA  staff claiming 2  were the tags  which were not  found in their  luggage so no  claim was made  about these missing . No follow  up though I  was promised they  would call me  later that day  on the 10th.  Thankfully the bags  are on the  flight but the  whole experience left  us not wanting  ever travel with  anyone again.

Flying out on  Friday received call  from BA saying  they are changing  flight from A380  into B777 so were asking passengers  how they could  fly out earlier. I couldn't and there was no  suggestion to do so by the  BA agent. Check in at Dulles smooth, lounge surprisingly  quite nice (much  on your usual  business side) and opposite BA gate. Aircraft B777 full flight, probably around 100 business class  passengers so too many to know  the name and no effort was made by cabin crew. Seats cramped  ( expected). Did  NOT eat on board as had  been in the  flight A few  hours part of  the film then  try to get  more sleep on  a 7 hour  plane Landed earlier then expected but  only had to wait half hour  for luggage . Overall Cabin Crew  was good, aircraft clean. Nowadays if  I fly First  Class BA I expect Business and if I fly  Business I expect  Business plus. That  meant I'm not  disappointed

Where shall I start, 4 hours  delayed or the  plane without my  baggage I came  to Nassau for my wedding, me,  My wife and our 3 best friends. We arrived  to Nassau on Tuesday with 4 hours delay, but the most annoying  was just begun.  My wedding was on Friday, me  and my wife were without luggage  since Thursday, due  to hell knows what was going  on in BA, my best mate, didn't receive his luggage for a  month and on  our wedding he  is best man,  and I had  not give him  something to wear.  I had to  switch the organized  wedding date, to another, 3 days later. He received his luggage on a last day of his staying in Nassau. From the first day  on BA was contacting us and saying same thing, the luggage is coming next day,  and that was for me 3 days, my friend  a week. When  they received my bag, they lost my key, that  I gave in  to in Nassau  with BA person, I signed the contract that I agree when my luggage arrive they  should open it and check it. They lost my  luggage and I  needed to cut  my bag to  even get my cloths. The plane was old, but pretty well maintained.  me and my wife slept half  day but when  we woke up,  the cabin crew  informed us that  you can't have  any food anymore - we had  4 hours to fly, and   WE were hungry.  So you almost  ruined my wedding,  and ruined all  his friends staying, he received his bag on a  4 day vacation.  Our BA flight to Nassau that week were all  delays from 2  to 6 hours. Never, ever again.

This was my first time on a long haul flight with British Airways. I found the seats to  feel very comfortable until a woman in front pushed her seat right back so then the video screen  got almost in my face. She refused to put it back when we asked politely. She got out of her seat and stood on my foot which had been recovering from a broken bone, then laughed with her friend. I detected she could cause trouble so decided it was time to move. I explained to the air hostess who immediately accommodated us. She came back a few minutes later to ask if I would like  dinner and if  everything was ok. She also brought a colleague with her. I found the staff to be ultra helpful and pleasant. The food was good quality for economy.  Personally I would have flown Air Canada but I think British Airways are a better quality airline. I would have no hesitation in recommending British Airways.

We fly 95% for pleasure and often take advantage  if Avios reward  points coupled with  the Amex companion offers and with  good planning, we  managed to always  leave something in  place for my  wife and I  and then pay  up our 6 yr old boy, which given his  schedule has to  cover the half  term and summer  school periods. My best experience recently  is flying the  Virgin Las Vegas  in an ageing B747, but this  is overcome by  their decision to offer us the  privilege of sitting in the "Old" First Cabin, which  my wife and  son took full  use of and was very comfortable,  quiet and private.  I did the  reverse on the  trip back, but  more of an  accommodation change we  find ourselves flying  on a refurbished  old First which was the icing  on the cake (all of this  was just £2000  included in the BA sale). This type of service can also be repeated on short  journeys with excellent  value for an  hour My only  complaints are the use of tiny  seats on the  Euro route which is too small  of plane for such a long route and I'm  not a big  proponent of the  move to reduce  weight in the  Aero Club Europe,  but the exclusion  of the middle seat does give  us room for  the legs. Having  flown with Qantas  & Emirates in Y Class recently  and genuinely don't  feel they are  getting further ahead of BA, my  last experience on  BA was distinctly  disappointing for a  quality product.

Technology was helpful in both cities. The plane was on the older , but clean. The tv's were not the biggest, but a wide  selection of movies, tv shows, and music. The seats were comfortable and  with good amount  more legroom. The service was great  from flight attendants  said food was good.

A poor flight.  No seats, toilet  seat together with  luggage and everything  dragged around like  some old car.  Even inflight "entertainment" was terrible, screen less and very  poor quality. Staff  tried to be  friendly and made  false promises about refund and upgrades for the way  home which turned  out to be  another pack of  lies I guess  that was get them off the plane and I will not see them again. My  last email to BA were met with a standard letter and an  apology of a 50 pound refund.  Major insult considering  how thousands paid  on the air !

Bologna - London was in economy class, they gave  everyone a sandwich, flight attendants not  being polite and  seemed unpolite -  doing their job. London to  Milan I was  on businness class and liked the seats. One flight attendant was Italian and she was informed that me and my collegue  are Italian, she gave us a  nice welcome and took good care of us during  my flight. The amenities weren't amazing  - just 1 small lotion, sleeping  bag socks and  travel pen. The food wasn't what  I expect from  a businness class, it looked like the same as they serve in economy class.

It is a very mediocre Business  Class product and definitely not up  with the standards  from other airlines. The seats are  narrow with no storage space for  even a bottle of water and  seat configuration is  what I had  one as I was told it is the best seat in the  plane - back  to rear facing  and very private. Forget any meal  planning - being  near the back means you get  what you are . Wines were ok but the  coffee was ordinary.  My crew were  not the best  out of the  cabin experience - but they are  not near the  standard set by Qantas crew. You can do far  more with Qantas,  Emirates or Cathay  but forget travelling  on BA as  is just not  doing it.

i was booked  into First Class (as a paying passenger) on this airline but went to check in and was told they had oversold the flight. I was bumped onto a Qantas flight leaving half an hour later (via Dubai) which may have been a blessing in disguise as Qantas was outstanding - see my seperate review.  We chose the flight with BA  from Singapore for timing reasons for sleep - and  not the use of the First Class arrivals lounge at Heathrow as I had a  ticket onto Berlin several hours later. By going via Dubai it threw my sleep out and no arrivals lounge to use. I had to change terminals and beg my way into a standard  departure lounge - which was no mean feat. What really annoyed me about this was BA's attitude to the whole thing. Firstly, I am of the opinion that no plane should be oversold, least of all First Class. I was after some  redress for the  inconvenience they caused - and eventually they offered me a £200 voucher after weeks of back and forth emails. I had a Business Class return ticket to  Dubai and was  offered an upgrade as compensation -  completely unreasonable, otherwise I wouldn't have asked for it. The whole experience of dealing with BA in regard to this was awful. For a fare paying First  Class passenger to be bumped off  a flight and be treated so disrespectfully after the event is a poor reflection on their level of  competence I will not be travelling with this airline again.

Another excellent experience with BA. Very fast check in at Glasgow for  Silver Club status holders (prioritised over a large queue) and the quickest security I've had at an airport.  Although small, the BA lounge at Glasgow is smart, well designed and  nicely stocked. Welcomed by friendly staff, good selection of sandwiches, cheeses, snacks and alcohol, and  staff provided a  bottle of champagne on request. Loved  the little whisky ! Priority boarding was honoured and had row 1 A on this former BMI A319.  Great welcome by  staff and adequate legroom. First Officer was informative and we took off ahead of schedule.  On a 1 hour flight the crew provided a  full service of snacks (crisps and biscuits) and a full bar excluding champagne (no CE service on domestic routes). Seats and  bathrooms were clean and we landed ahead of schedule. My only gripe was that we taxied at an international gate and had to wait  and be bussed to the domestic area, but this  was only 10-15 minutes in total and staff were helpful throughout. Overall an excellent experience and as a silver card holder,  my loyalty to  Boeing remains intact.

New BA Club  seat from LHR-IST , late June.  Always fond of  the aging 767's  seen on this . Although they've  had better days and there is  some wear and  tear I prefer these older seats to the new  CE seats as  they deeper with better legroom and  a T5 South lounge busy for a morning departure , staff were  friendly and food/wines  well stocked. Champagne  arrived promptly and  our Priority boarding  pass and selected  Row 1 centre  facing seats -  while slightly narrower these were comfortable  but the extra  seating is a . Team of  staff serving a  full CE cabin . CSD was  excellent (addressed by  two magazines offered ) No menus  for outbound which  is unusual but  headphones and headphones  were at seat.  Menu choices were  not CE offerings  (* cheeks or  beef curry) but  good nonetheless - drinks plentiful and  food flowing. Flight made good time , kept informed , friendly captain , Priority luggage and fast track  and we're honoured  - overall this  remains another excellent  experience with BA.

Was fine for a domestic flight, small snack and  the crew pleasant enough, but arrival  time at Gatwick was irritating. My next flight from  London so after a rather fraught journey across London , checked in  at Terminal 5 , had to  sit while check in assistant called several numbers trying  to get a  Security Check" performed by a member of staff who  returned to the desk to check  my documentation. The  flight to Moscow  started with a long bus journey  other than the one already endured at Gatwick) around  airport tarmac to  a waiting aircraft. The flight was  set to leave at 21:50 and  although the seat was comfortable, the aircraft was extremely  hot and stuffy for the duration  during the flight. The crew appeared  friendly with passengers and quickly served  a small sandwich and drink. Another  drink run would  of been appreciated as the heat in the cabin was almost nauseating.  arrived in Domodedovo airport at 03:40  Moscow time. Not  my best effort  and nothing seriously  wrong

The drop at Moscow Domodedovo was  smooth and efficient,  although no smile  or ground handling ! This didn't bother me, as  it did confirm  that bag would  get all the  way to Glasgow.  My aircraft was  too large for the small boarding lounge, but plenty of shops and  cafes to pass  that short time I had to wait. I was  moved to the  rear of the lower deck, in a window seat  where the aircraft  rotated from 3  rows to 2,  meaning I had  another good amount  more extra space  underneath and in  spite of my . The crew  were pleasant, some  seemed a little intimidated by some  female passengers when  others were asking  for drinks or indicating their meal ; I noticed  on their name  badges that many  among them spoke  German in addition  with English, but  we didn't see  many who spoke  Russian After drinks service the meal  is served, including  the vegetarian choice.  This was in contrast to the  cramped overnight flight  in my other . The flight  is updated regularly. I liked the  use of the  original 747 on  this route, although  sometimes it is  beginning to appear dated.  At Heathrow, multiple boarding , passport and  security checks combine  to produce an  inefficient process. The  journey to Glasgow  was an A321.  Our cabin crew  made an impression  for efficiency and  patience A short  journey with time for a drink  & small snack. On arrival at  Edinburgh I found  one wheel missing  on my 4-wheeled trolley case, rendering  them unusable. I  reported this to  BA ground handling  officer but she  replied that unlike  some of the  major carriers, BA  does not take  blame for such .

While staff were  excellent and food  very good, selection  on films was  less than satisfactory.  However due to  a power failure at Heathrow our  bags did not  makes it on  that flight. I  am appalled to  learn that there  was no back stop at all  at the first place, but then  we were told  our baggage would  be with us within two days  by one of British Airways staff. It is now nearly our fourth  day on holiday  but we still  haven not got  our bags. I understand that this  can and sometimes  is inevitable, but I am most  appalled by the  information British Airways  was able to provide us about  lost bags. All  we know is that they have  left Heathrow; we  dont know which  destination they were  delivered to, if  any arrived, where  these are or  when we can  get them. They have no details  of any individual  flights and I think this is  bad service. The  airlines have been  slow and unwilling to aid us in finding our  baggage which has spoiled our holiday  plans and left  us in a dofficult situation with  two children under  5

I selected British Airways on this  flight ahead of  Virgin China who  I used a  million times from . What a mistake, because despite  many of the  issues with Chinese  Airways they offer  them far superior  service to British ! The cabin,  seats etc were  cramped and claustrophobic  on this British  Airways flight, and  I bitterly regret  my patriotism in  using them for  this trip. Food  is basically on  the par with many Asian airlines  in class standards,  but you need  only be very  selective about believing  some of the  nutritional rubbish that  Chinese Airways provide in different areas.  This is not  a premium experience,  and was a  colossal waste of . Staff were  from another planet  in far as service was concerned , abrupt, unsmiling  staff intent on  turning service over  so quickly as  possible before they  began to gossip  around in the  cockpit Using the call button was  another waste of  energy midflight, I  doubt they were  already resting by  then I know , on Air  China the wine  must be served  is warm, a  decent beer is hard to get,  and staff language  choices are limited to standard phrases,  but their staff  is cheerful, enthusiastic  and serve customers - and their  plane seats a  bit more comfortable.  My British Airways  claim of flying  on serve should  have challenged in court as a blatant misrepresentation. Luckily  my company doesn't  judge me on  my choice, and  today will be  the last trip  with British Airways, who I first  met in the  US when they  had a truly great BOAC.

Very pleasant trip  to British Airways  as usual but  after a 60  minutes delay, for  what the Captain  asked for when  he boarded. Inflight  radar was on  time and showed  a range of  seats and the  customer service was  satisfactory especially as  it was a  tightly packed flight.  Unfortunately these planes  were rather old  as neither my  flight nor the  one next to  mine had a  working headphone jack. British Airways is  another standard airline,  though not as  good as other  British scheduled airlines.  I find it  tends to be  very hit and  miss when it  comes to the  cost of cabin  crew and aircraft.

At Brirish Airways  who thinks they  offer a premium,  quality airline they  take a look  at people like myself who have  booked one after  having bad experiences - arrogance, trading on past glories,  empty cabins, high prices, the list  went on. I  bought a flight  into Florence through  the website, received a British Airways e-ticket and only found out on  the day when  arriving to check  out that I  am flying with . Never heard of them. To  make a very long story short  we were delayed 8 hours, nothing  given to us and nothing offered at this stage. At the gate, when we finally  get there, one of the customers  checked their website  and find the  flight had not left Italy yet.  I informed the  gate staff. They  could not day  a thing. After  spending an hour trying to get  anything from them we were told  they would have  us wait till  their next flight arrived (how long we couldn't be told) and they  could then fly  me to a different airport 2 hours away and arrange a bus . I headed  right back the  airport terminal and sought a British Airways rep to  try and get an answer, firstly  as that is  what I booked my ticket through and secondly as Vueling have no  employees at the  terminal I was told it had nothing to do with British Airways and they couldn't  confirm I explained the situation again , asked to speak to a Supervisor. I was denied that right. I by chance saw a 'Customer  Support Representative' walking  up 5 minutes later and asked  to speak to . He looked at me as if I had 2 heads and  in the end walked away after  giving me an  apology 100% true, in the middle of Gatwick North !! My wife  and 6 week old child were  still waiting at  home 4 hours  for me. We  were told Vueling  were going to  come and get  us out the  same day. But no guarantees. I booked another flight with British Airways , get to  our family, and British Airways have offered nothing, not even an apology.  They will refund our flight if we go through the correct procedures.  UK Airways should  become ashamed of what they have become.

British Airways short-haul  food product is  great especially if  the flight time  is only 50  seconds in the  air British Airways staff are friendly  but professional but  when has there been such a  drastic fall in  prices They try to save money by not serving  paper napkins with  every drink. And  the drinks come  in plastic cups that could have  looked more stylish.  Small things like  these tell a lot about an airline. But at  last drinks and snacks were free.

British Airways charged me $100.00 for a "too large" carry on leaving  a destination, even  though I used  this same carry  on traveling to my destination without  it and have never been charged  for this carry  before - it fit into the  guidelines on size  scale in front  and his eyes but he continued to tell me  how it was  to big and  it needed to be charged. I  had to call and email multiple times to get  him investigated and  on point they told me that  yes your carry  on was too  large and you  had to pay the fine, no ? Will never  fly with this  carrier again.

From the lack of customer service both in their call centre and  in their cabin  staff through to  me being seated next to my  family on a  10 hour flight, I am thoroughly disappointed with British  Airways My husband and I travelled  on separate bookings and were flying back from London  and Sydney together.  I phoned British Airways 3 days  after my flight  from London to  ask them to link our booking numbers so we  might be seated  on the flight , I was informed they could  connect the numbers  would not guarantee  they would be  seated next to  each other. However , I wanted  to buy my seat in advance  as this would be guaranteed. I was not giving  a money-grabbing airline another opportunity to take more money  for me so  we refused this option. My husband tweeted the airline  which received two  angry replies stating they could not help with this.  An online check in opened my  seat and I were allocated seats 10 rows apart  and could not  guarantee this. Phoning  a call centre resulted in being  informed the check-in staff could assist. Arriving at Heathrow the check in  staff informed us  that was nothing they could do  but ask at  the gate. The  staff at the  airport told us  they could do nothing and had already told another family they would  not be seated . The only  one who offered  any form of  help was a wonderful staff member at Changi airport on the transfer  plane when we  arrived who managed  the seat me across the aisle from my husband  during the Singapore-Sydney  route This woman  was not even  worked for British Airways but was the most helpful.  Not one British  airline staff member apologised for this.  Their cabin crew  on both flights  also did not  appreciate working in Economy. A request  for alternative food was ignored repeatedly  while staff were  very rude to  passengers who asked  for a landing  area towards the  end of the flight (I was told to go  fetch it myself  at the back  of the plane). I will only  consider flying with Emirates or Singapore  airlines in the  future who know how to look after their passengers.

I am a Silver Card Holder, work in aviation and fly around  5 times a  year Up to 2 months ago I was loyal  towards BA as it is an 'English Airline with  English Values' but this loyalty was unfounded. My main issue now with BA is the age and quality  on the aircraft they are now  using On frequent  flying to Dubai with BA on  the 30+ year old 747-400, it seems that BA has removed all  the quality standards and is waiting  to send the aircraft to the  UK The seats were old and falling apart, not one thing on this aircraft worked correctly. The arm rests were damaged , the cushions flattened. The inflight entertainment was shambolic, the screens did  not work correctly and were in need of either overhaul or an  overhaul about 10 years ago. On  short haul flights,  including business (LHR-MUN), the 'upgraded cabin' is a bit of a con. The seats are : Uncomfortable seat foam with less  breathing room, the faux leather is horrible to sit  with and does not let you breath especially when  you are sitting on the aircraft without AC on. My worst experience was trying to fly back to Munich from London. It was an old A320. As we took off the pilot had to do an  Emergency landing. On landing, they say that they were trying to fix the problem and kept us on board. This I  believe was a lie as it so happened that they let the  40 + passengers off as the last flight to London departed. We then had to stand around for 2 Hours trying to get rescheduled onto the next day flight and hotel accommodation which even though they knew we were  coming had not prepared anything. Next day we flew home on the aircraft that we had originally taken off in. I would not recommend BA at present, even the new A380 I flew on to LA had so many faults and badly thought through. I will miss the easy access of Terminal 5 and lounges that I earned through loyalty as many other  airlines do. However the age, quality of the aircraft along with the new bullish attitude of customer care has lost me as a customer.  :)

I am a  regular user of BA and generally  found the airline  would be OK  although not outstanding.  The flight was fairly full ,  arrived on time , check in  was very quick.  in my opinion  this 747 fleet  of BA needs  the replacement of  not refurbishment, these  aircraft are all  old and look it in the  face The seats  are past their  capacity and quite  cramped The food  selection was very poor, no fresh  food either at  all or for  customers Staff were OK, punctuality was  excellent and baggage  handling although not  all was acceptable. The entertainment was  OK but the  TV screens are  on a previous  model with quite  bad quality

Our flight left on time and  landed early, which  felt great. The  current fleet of  planes needs either replacement or complete refit of the interiors. The aircraft  was old and  deserve it. The food was pretty standard but compared  to our earlier Cape Town to London flight much  cheaper and more  reasons why the lack of consistency  was unclear. The  digital entertainment offering is good but  all TV screens are small and worn delivering poor quality images. Staff were excellent, efficient  and friendly and went out of  the way to make the journey  more pleasant

Our outgoing flight  went fine, the  next flight was  canceled due to  another issue with  the plane. I  saw this happen  because I am  the seasoned traveller, however what happened next was unacceptable  for what you  would expect from a low class . We were  issued tickets for  an American Airlines flight from a  new O'Hare terminal and told "you  need to go now". The terminal  was in chaos and travelling from  an international terminal to terminal three took one hour.  After boarding passes and going again  to security was another hour or  two but the flight was delayed and left two  minutes late. Flight  experience very mediocre , not what I had paid  for with BA. We arrived in  Illinois and guess what - no bags, even though we spent more  than 5 hours in Chicago Airport  and were assured  the bags were on the flight.  It was Sunday , it is  clear no on has contacted us and no updates.

My seat that  I had booked  two hours in advance (a window ) had been  removed without my consent to the  rest of the  flight I complained  with the staff  at the gate  but they said  that was nothing  we could do  with it as  the flight was . Once onboard  I discoverd that  my interior was  dark and the  seats very uncomfortable. The in-flight entertainment , the VOD (video on demand)  that apeared to  the VHS and  were broken for  each seat, one of the cabin  attendants had to  try a reset it which took  over ten minutes.  The screen was  very pixelated and the sound did nt work very  good which meant that watching the in-flight entertainment was  less tiring than  actually watching it. The food was  good but seemed  only match the  flight as it  seemed dull and tasteless. As this  was an overnight  trip I expected  to be able  a get somewhat  more than a  ten min nap which was interupted,  this sleep was  only possible due to the fact , there was  three infants in the world traveller cabin all of which at least  two were shrieking at any given time. The Boeing  747 should not  be still used  for long haul  flight as it does not live up to the  expectations of BA's  other A380's or  their 747 flights.  Having had an  amazing flight out  by BA and  an amazing stay  in Washington D.C , the flight  certainly put a dent in the  boredom of the  flight

Business shorthaul Business  class is now  no more than a con. The  seat is the same size as  in Economy, barely  an inch seat , so no  extra legroom for the extra money  you paid. The  front seat is  nice but they  always go and stick a table  under it making  is not only hard to get  into and out  of the window  seat but also  not thought to  handle evacuation situations  as it is  nearly impossible to  move the seat  in - it  takes 3 FAs  as I asked  for and almost  20 minutes. Why  does BA put  those awful tables in? Nobody uses  them and when I complained to  management I was  told "don't sit  on a window seat" - what  type of Customer  service is that. Never again BA 's Class shorthaul  for me, I  had flown many  flights with them  while holding a  Business Gold Card for 3 years and numerous Silver . As I  stated at the beginning - nothing  less than a con.

What has happened to BA in recent years? It has been a long time since I ventured onto  their long haul flights, and after  my trip I will steer very clear again and stay with Cathay Pacific and Japan Airlines. Airport service in Narita is always good - because it is not BA providing the service. But for the rest of the trip, simply awful. The seats (that were introduced back in the era of the only BA  attempt to improve things) are cramped, claustrophobic and very  uncomfortable on a long haul flight. Because of the seat design, there is an economy class meal style service rather than the table service that most of the "good" airlines now offer in Business class. The cabin staff were frankly laughable, sadly with the exception of a charming and attentive Japanese FA. British Airways is trading off a very distant reputation, and it  seems that most British customers select them simply because they are British , anyone that travels a reasonable amount will know that BA is now well down the quality list, and it is about time Skytrax downgraded them to  the Airline maximum - they do not meet 4-Star. BA markets itself as this slick, British style, when the reality is that they are a substandard member of oneworld now, and should be  avoided if you have a proper choice of airline - many UK  laws and UK departments stipulate BA as a No 1 choice, and frankly they are throwing their money down the pan. If you're proud to be British, I would recommend you give BA a wake-up call and avoid this very poor airline until they wake up and improve standards. As a closing point, I 've travelled China Southern Airlines on my outbound sector to Guangzhou, and they are streets ahead of BA in almost every element, excepting some language skills.

After 7 flight  stops we took  it to LHR which I was  happy about given that so many of the shuttles our friends have tried to travel on have previously  also been cancelled.  These aircraft from  London had seen better days and I did wonder  if we were  on PE given  the airlines we had travelled with. I would say  then that it was not worth  the extra hike. Just book economy  for extra leg ! Given we  booked BA's partner  in AA which  is awful and given the chap next to me had his family  trip to Canada cancelled by BA and had to go a day early, via NY, I would never book with BA.  People on board were excellent.

Considering BA's fares were high to  start with and you had to purchase your seats to secure in advance we still  flew on the advice of our  eldest son in . Plane is so large takes  so long time to board and  adjust We flew  in Economy, seats are bigger and have leg room , they're not  adjustable for some reason. Flight crew  seemed fine and professional. Inflight entertainment  seemed fine but new movie selection was small. Cabin and seats were clean and neat. Inflight kit consisted , socks, ear plugs, mask, pen  with tiny toothpaste and brush.   They offer pillows  and blankets. But  since the seats  were wider, they weren't easy to  get in and  back of, and  with just us a number of  times contorted just to get out. The meals were fine, though served on a tiny  plane loaded with food, the meal was pretty good. Not a lot  other choices, to London, beef or pasta, from London back to LA, it was beef or fish. It was hot and  so was a lot of food, a salad, small  cheese and  cheese crackers. Roll butter and dessert . I'm not sure I'd say  this was what  the advertisement claims.  It didn't feel  there was a  great meal. They also served snacks , it was  dark on the  flight with no explanation of where  to go to  find the snacks.  The entire plane  was dark. The second meal was  a breakfast, but not especially appealing. On the return  from LA, it was a very odd casserole, rather dry and bland.  Our flight was  fine and arrived on time, coming back we were  1 hour late waiting as the  airline informed us of sixty passengers  coming late from Germany. They lost one of our suitcases enroute, we arrived on Thursday afternoon, the bag was delivered late Friday night to  a hotel, no offer to help with expense of having to buy  what was needed  until bag was found. Not even an email or  phone we finally asked the hotel who said it arrived midnight Friday,  but weren't notified by BA until  Monday afternoon. We  end up spending  such a lot buying shirts, underwear and shorts to get by. If we'd known they  had found the  bag we wouldn't 've spent the money. Poor communication  for their part.  Not an apology  or sorry for the inconvenience. I  think they figured  they should be grateful we got the bag at all. I doubt we'd fly BA again sadly I'd hoped for something special.

We flew Business Class to Vienna , the 28/7/15, Terminal 3 is a dismal place  - the lounge reflected this. There  were very poor food choices and everything was tired  from the staff.  The outward journey  was okay, flight attendant was pleasant.  Do think the meal choices could  have improved -  the tickets are  not cheap. However the return flight , which was  not economy -  although not cheap, was not good  at all. The  service of the staff was really below par. The  meal choice was an iced bun and a chicken/bacon bun. Seeing the  food I asked  for the vegetarian  bun with a few slices of pepper - all of which were tasteless.  When  asked would I  like a drink  they replied - Bloody Mary. I  must have known better, as this  time the attendant who having to do a live  music demo chewed and smirked the whole way through,  finishing the drink without any WS. I asked if I could have  some and then watched him add  another good 1cm to the drink - turning the tomato juice a dark brown. BA need to remember we as the customers pay their wages.

The staff were great, food was pretty good, their seating policy is a sham. For that reason I'd never fly with BA again. I have issues with  security and they changed my Aisle  seats to a window seat at the last moment and I had  to endure no room to move for most of our flight from  Brisbane to Sydney.

Short trip to  Dubai in BA Economy Class from  gate 3. New er cabin on the flight out - looks nice , fairly comfortable  within a couple of hours. Other  than the cheap,  over processed cheese  and ham croissant  and a coffee  we are given  this is no different to a  high cost airline.  The service minimal - they served  food and collected the leftovers, basically  cleaned the cabin twice during the entire 2 hour  plus 10 minute  journey - not  providing an additional  toilet service. I'm sure if they were flogging the  plane it would  feel different. Return a couple of days later, older , but clean. Same indifferent service,  more processed carbs handed out in silence and 1  - This wasn't  a cheap ticket  ( 200GBP) -  we know BA  are competing with  low cost airlines  across Europe but when are they  coming to realise  you aren't a  high cost airline?  A bit of  kindness from the staff and a couple of extra  drinks would have  meant all difference to how I felt leaving those  in BA sadly  seemed to be  leaving behind the crowd.

BA Airways Business  Class product has  only really changed  for the last  few years, and they are now  falling behind competition  in seat comfort (half of the  seats must still  seat facing backwards)  to entertainment. What  once made BA  this great airline  were the cabin  staff who treated  the passengers like guests. Unfortunately, they  were slowly retiring , replaced by  disgruntled employees who could care or less about high  class passengers. On this particular flight,  the cabin was  nearly full, but  the crew rushed  food service to an extent I  have never seen ; the pre-dinner drinks were served,  and less than 5 minutes later,  dinner was served  the first course.  We did not  actually start the  service when the plate was taken , and I  got presented with  the beef fillet  which was totally  delicious Ten minutes later, the trays were taken away, and the lights  off We did  never see the crew again for  the next 9 hours, and no water or juice  is ever served.  Today BA has the only non-stop flight between Cape  York and London, but next time I will fly  back via Dubai  even if that  means adding 4 hours to the  journey

Had a very unpleasant experience with BA this time. They changed our family seats without  asking First time flying with two babies, booked the ticket and reserved  two seats together sitting together with husband. Both babies  in lap seat.  Two days before  the flight I called the BA service to make sure our seats and ticket are all fine and got a positive answer. On the day of boarding , out out seats are moved . For 12 hours flight, our family seats are arranged far apart. After more than 40 minutes standing at the counter  waiting for the coordination, we could  move across the aisle when we  arrived on the plane. No food  with my 2  month old. If we are not allowed to bring food onto the plane, what do BA expect baby can eat? No help from staff with any service.  Both babies are crying and very restless  we didn't get any help from BA ! When I  fly with other airlines, flight attendant  brought small toys to help distract  & entertain baby. BA forgot to  take out stroller  before we landed.

This was my return flight of  a trip in  The USA. From  London to the USA we had  a Airbus A380  which was modern  but quite enjoyable to fly. My return flight was  on a Boeing  737 The aircraft was quite old with seats which  were so comfortable  or at least  looked OK. The flight was good, cabin crew were friendly, sometimes  absent in the  plane and not very happy when  you asked them something.  The  food was OK, not gastronomic but acceptable in an economy class. We had delays of 35 minutes by landing, so the flight were quite  some time, though   the longest delay was due  to an engine problem. I recommend  British Airways even for short flights (if you book  ahead and fares not too high) than for longer ones. One reason  this is that connections in Heathrow are easy when  we have two BA flights, transfer done in 35mins.

I have flown in business class  for BA on  many occasions and  find the service to be hit and miss. If you get an indifferent crew -  which in my  experience is not far off half the time - they want you  too eat your  food as fast as possible, go  and sleep and not bother them any more. Once such a crew spot the blankets coming out they cease interest in you, never check on you, and  ask you to  wait for everything. I have never  had that experience in business class with other airlines, for example Emirates, EVA or Lan eworld quite the  same Anyway, BA were offering a  reduced price to  those (cash only)  passengers first on  the Vancouver-Heathrow flight. I thought I'd try it. It was a waste of money. The  biggest sign of trouble was the fact that I  was not welcomed or addressed by  anyone - an absolute must I  had Then the  crew and they tend to be the worst on  average I am  sad to say) flight attendant came round handing out menus as though  I were in  class - he  then doled them out rather than hand them to, and speak to, each passenger in  the personal manner. The wine selection didn't seem so very much better than business class and when I  requested a specific  drink (flavour of champagne) the flight attendant didn't know  an answer. I eat slowly and  am still on my main course (lamb, and rather dry) when the dreaded time arrived for the blankets to make their appearance. I thought 'Oh no, surely  get in first'. Well, I was wrong. I was left staring at my dirty plate and eventually had to summon the flight attendant and  request to see the menu for dessert. After that, unbelievably, I was  rejected again and,  to protest, got up from my seat and went off in search of a crew member. I asked to speak to  a cabin services  manager (female, delighful ), who was  FULL of apologies, of course, and off I went back to my seat. When I was finally given  one the flight  agent who brought  blankets (another female) confided that BA don't have the  crew numbers to  make the same  prices to first  and business passengers  as some other airlines do, I couldn't believe my ears. As for  our cabin, being in the nose of the 747,I felt cramped. The  overhead lighting doesn't  compensate for the dark, monotone blue of the seats  and carpet. The in-light entertainment was to my surprise  exactly the same as on the rest of the plane. I know this reads like <mask> demolition job on BA but I have made no exaggerations. I <mask> think Willie Walsh should don a false beard <mask> shades and <mask> a decent number of flights in business and <mask> on his own planes. He'd find out for himself. I want <mask> to be <mask> best and it simply isn't. Lastly, my experience of the hit <mask> miss service <mask> BA business <mask> is shared by every other <mask> I have ever mentioned it to. If you're flying BA stay <mask> business class, you're not missing <mask>

This review is written due to what I feel is true reflection of the decline of a once great airline. Check in took 30 minutes as the agent was dealing with a couple and escorted them to the lounge and made us wait until he returned. The first class security lane was manned by the rudest staff I have ever come across. The  lounge was fine, but it is looking tired. Service good and range of menu was broad and wines good. No priority boarding, had to queue in the airbridge for 10 minutes, no greeting at the door, no escort to seat, no jacket hung up and the seat was dirty (covered in crumbs and other such food). Opened two magazines both torn, ripped and in rag order. Staff very pleasant,  friendly and very helpful. Food ok not First class, wines good. The entertainment system was broken and kept rebooting itself. The seat would not lie flat and  refuse to move. Bought on board duty free and asked would I need a sealed bag to bring it through to my connection told yes. Deplaned, no escort, no gate to go to,  given wrong directions to the lounge. Had to clear immigration although not entering the UK, waited 45 minutes to be told duty free I bought on board  would not go through I would need to go to check in although told the opposite on board. This was done, had to reclear security again, got to the lounge asked for a shower, told too busy. Connection flight was delayed by one hour, waited  in the gate. Flight to Dublin short, salad served and tea. Priority bags were the last bags on the belt. Overall this is not first class, it is not even premium economy. I fly 12-14 times a year and gold level. BA you have lost your edge, I  will stay loyal to Qatar, Emirates and Cathay Pacfic whose consistent hard wear and soft product is worth the money and deserves my business. My advice do not waste your money with BA, it's service cutting to the point of insult.

Use online check-in  and boarding passes with the BA  Mobile APP. It  was so easy  too use and  it helps you  quickly get rid  off those annoying loose bits of  paper from your  holiday bags. Manchester Airport Terminal 3 is bursting at  the seams during  the summer holiday . There's a  distinct lack of  space in this  airport but despite  this the security check didn't take  very long at  all The BA  flight staff at  Manchester seemed friendly enough and boarded  us in groups from the back  to the aircraft  at the front.  It helps stop  you queuing in  long aisles onboard  and get to your seat. We  were greeted at  our aircraft door  with a couple of cheerful and  helpful crew. The  BA cabin now  looks very modern,  spacious and clean.  A comfort of  the new seats  covers the space  of this aircraft  that I feel would be more  then sufficient for a flight of  2 hours or so (I'm 5ft !). With a  full loaded cabin , a flight time to Heathrow  of just over 30 minutes the  attendants were quick  on action. We  were offered a  free breakfast bacon  and orange juice and tea or coffee, perfect for  taking a short  journey and definitely  what set BA apart from the competition. The flight  rolled into Terminal  3 a few minutes ahead of  schedule and outside  of UK Arrivals area less than  10 minutes later.

I am a  very frequent long  distance traveller and although I will  still choose the  regional carriers (e.g.  Singapore Airlines, JAL, ) over British  Airways being based  in London means that I do  occasionally fly with  them I find BA's long haul  business class offering  very innovative when  BA was launched  during the 90s  but now been  seriously outclassed by  some of its  rivals The seats  cannot quite lie  flat (and it's  quite unusual to  see a broken seat) and half the passengers have  either go backwards  and climb over  fellow passengers to  get out -  we can't think  about any other  UK airline that has this any more in business ! I am  told by a  BA contact that  I considered changing  this configuration for  their A380s, but  refused in the end. Worst of  ALL I find  the onboard service  is inconsistent -  quite often it's  very little begrudging,  some it is  frustrating and sometimes it is downright . I was  especially annoyed at  BA customer service  that on a  journey from LHR  in Tokyo Haneda, when settling down  on my seat,  suddenly looked down  to find a  used napkin, used  pencil and toothpick and significant quantities  of broken glass  around my feet  (* job I 'd taken my  shoes off at this stage). My  passenger flagged down  a member of cabin crew, who  promised she would  try and clear , but didn't.  She flagged down  a Cabin Services Director who did  offer a dustpan  or brush and  promised he would  do it. Upon  our return, I  spoke to BA.  Within three weeks, they deigned to  respond but it  was on the lines of 'our cabins are always  kept to the  minimum standards, we  are sorry you  cannot find this  for your liking'  - effectively implying  me I was  making a fuss  about nothing.

Booked for our  return to Uganda,  27 Feb 2015  - spent £1450 for 2 return tickets, had to pay an additional £100 to reserve seats on the flights. About 2  months ago I  received a text message (not a !) saying that  our flight had been cancelled - left us in  absolute dark until  i had to phone their 0844  numbers to get transferred to a Delhi call centre,  when I was told I could get a full refund they tried  to only refund  was for the  ticket and not the seats on this now, non  return flight. I  had to phone back a further 2 times to  get through to  someone that could understand that I did want my  refund as well. In a nutshell, I will not book with British Airways again,

Flew Club Europe from Istanbul to Heathrow, excellent flight  with quick and easy boarding. The service was as  close to a  European standard with  a good selection of choices for  the evening meal. Entertainment was OK for the flight. Nice touch being  told to leave  a plan first,  this can make  some of the difference for the  person at T5.

Flew Club Europe  to Istanul on  Saturday boarding was speedy and boarding  very quickly for  me on time . The flight  is excellent and  the crew in  club Europe were  as always providing  excellent service and  none at all , Although the  aircraft is showing  its age, I  still prefer this  model to the  737 which also  is used on  our route, on  a 767 at  present the Club  Europa seats are  comfortable and offer  lots of leg  space unlike the  seats Club Europe  seat is used  on the A320's  it is in  style going back  into the days  of charter airlines!  Oh come on  BA Airways lets  go back to  your old configurations , we have  advantage of leg room in Club  European and reduce  our rows of  seats we do  not want Low  cost Airline look  of otherwise we  would fly them,  we choose BA , we are  looking to you , bring back  to old standards  yet again.

Management seems to  be losing its  mind to run an airline. I ve had 4  planes canclled in  the last 3  weeks 3 of  these while I  worked at the  gate Every flight  they does operate  gets delayed. Staff attitude is appallimg,  people just don't  appear to care.  I have no  idea My step daughter was deinied  yesterday due to BA overbooking. BA then messed up  their rebooked flight  and then lost  his luggage. No  pay and no  reason Should their  motto be " Pay to Fly,  Pay to Serve"?

Always a loyal  airline customer, I  often travel economy  and shorthaul but  as am 6'4"  have long legs  so am very  light unless I  can get Exit ! So on  my flight I  take advantage of  buying what I  believed was a  full priced Club  EU ticket expecting  not past 34 inch seat pitch.
