However to find  upon boarding that  airlines have reduced  the seat pitch  from 30 inch , exactly the  same as in : The presence  was an empty  window seat and  very little table  on your tablet  there is no  joke Fortunately this  was a short flight but even  then I was extremely uncomfortable. Cabin  crew and other  passengers said there  had been loads  more complaints but  thankfully BA don't  fly I sometimes  travel to Cyprus  but the thought  about a 4  hours flight in  these cramped seats  pissed me off ! The meal was passable but  because the flight  got off a  couple of minutes  before midday it  got classed as  " breakfast" and  red wine was served. It is clear that BA are putting profit  before customer service  but I am  surprised that anyone  wants Club Europe.  Later in the year I was  planning to travel  across South America  via Madrid in  First Class but  am now cancelled  or switched to another airline. In  2019 I will  travel BA shorthaul  if possible.

Got a hand book only fare at short notice so it was pricey. Allocated a decent seat but amazed at charge of €26 to change it so didn't bother. Flight seemed to be full of families split up probably for the same  reason A ripoff.  Flight was late, usual excuse of late arrival from  the previous flight. Flight deck crew affable. Food and drink good and free, a bonus. Cabin attendants, an older purser up  quite a bit , The two in economy were really going through the motions, no eye contact and  bad service. 1 drink served in a 2.5 hour  flight For the  last hour the two at the back were eating Club Europe meals which I saw them bring from the front. This was BA2591 on 22 July. Not great.

Flying to London  Airport in Business Class, seats were  extremely comfortable. Reminded  me of sleeping in berth on  arrival Food was good and the  staff were very nice and attentive.  We had a  brief layover at Gatwick before flying  on to Inverness. Couldn't use the BA lounge after  that flight, but  usually that is  not the case  in Heathrow. Don't  see why. We  took rewards to  Sky Club World , enjoyed it.  I have flown  the long haul  three times and  we have earned  the return business.

I had the misfortune to travel up to Newcastle on a hand-baggage only fare which, for some reason, doesn't entitle you to choose a  class I was allocated seat 11A  which had the tightest leg-room I have experienced, luckily it was only a short 50 min flight. These fares aren't cheap and BA seem to be focussing  more on extracting  so much money  is possible rather than providing a good service which  has a real  premium

Day trip to Vienna, used BA Economy as their  Business Class fares are a complete rip off on BA these days. Heathrow T3 departure experience is quite shoddy compared to T2 or main BA flights out of T5. Service onboard the flight  was perfunctory at best, and staff  appear to perform to a script  which in some  cases portray the feeling that because they wear a BA uniform they think they are so excellent -  The sad fact is their standards are below several major European airlines.  Chris Purser, CSD  (- whichever grand title they give to cabin staff) on outbound flight spent a lot of time giggling  in the galley like a 6 year old child, and then proceeded to make the  necessary announcements in the campest and  most disrespectful tone of voice - again, this seemed  to be done  for the amusement of his fellow t-d's. As a oneworld Emerald (not with BA!), I stick with oneworld members, but Austrian  offers a much better service and quality standard than BA.

let me just  starting off by  saying that I'm  a educator, and I have the  temperament of a saint. This being , after my first flight with  BA when my  parents stayed in  India and didn't  made it to  The UK until four days after  she arrived, I 'm fairly calm.  Plans are made.  My flight had  been canceled (which  seems like commonplace at BA), and  I re-booked after  about three hours on the phone.  As I ventured  out take my  flight home, I  am notified via text message that  my flight had  been canceled yet ! After speaking  to a calm man about my horrible experience thus  far he informed  me of a  customer care number  so I could  reach and complain  about my flight.  Now remember I'm  your teacher, and I also payed  BA for this ! That's an  8 months pay  period so we  all know. I'm  preparing to leave  London and still  has not received  anything via email.  Also cannot reach  me via telephone.  Has not been  provided proper accommodations  that resolve my dissatisfaction with BA.  Safe to say I will never  use BA again.

My baggage check in took forever,  I was 45-50min  just standing in the queue. The  baggage looked good  & well maintained , Inflight entertainment  was good and  listening to latest  TV documentaries, talk  of 5* for  me The seating  area was just about good enough.  be careful of the head set  you can get  on the way  and snap. The air conditioner was  not up to the mark so  air was warm in the cabin.  My inflight food  got extremely hot,  in short it  got burnt. The  excuse from the flight crew when  I asked for  my second helping of 150ml coke  tea is that  we needed to  keep stock for the return flight.  This was the  first time in  years of international travel of hearing this excuse.

Flight was decent.  Safe to say the seat was rather cramp. I'm  5 or 5 foot 9, sat  at seat 32F. Inflight entertainment was alright, but do take note to  never unplug the  headphones whenever you  come out of  your seat. It damages easily if  one gets caught  in something. I had to change  the headsets because  of that, because  being in a aisle seat, you have to get off when someone  wants to use  a lavatory, thus remember to unplug it if you intend to get  up from your seat. Service was  good I requested for eye shades, and it came  about 1hr later, crew must have forgotten about my request. I didn't pursue it as I thought I  could just head to the back galley and request for them after my movie. In  terms of food, it was appalling  and greasy. Overall, I will not say never again, but given a choice, I'd look  again for Singapore Air first, then  the big 3 Gulf carriers. For  the right price I'd do BA again, otherwise, there are better ways to suffer than that cramped seat

LHR to KUL. Bag drop off took much longer  that expected especially as we had  not checked and printed our boarding . Full plane  departure about 45 mins late. Food and drink better than expected, as was cabin crew  service and seat ! Friendly and efficient service. I suspect the plane might have seen better days given  as the entertainment system was ancient - no games, small screen compared  to the likes of Singapore Airlines, Emirates etc. Some cost cutting evident : no menus, hot towels, metal  chairs - which is fine by  them  Would be happy to  travel with them again.

Both flights on time, aircraft appeared to be well maintained. BA should  feel commended for  having 9-abreat seating in the 777, legroom is adequate and adjustable headrest  is a nice touch. AVOD was decent, with clear  audio though movie  screening was not extensive. Catering was  poor on the outbound flight from Atlanta, with breakfast  nearly being inedible,  though much better on the inbound flight from London. Cabin crew were  attentive but utterly aloof, interacting with the passengers without the slightest hint of warmth. Not allowing seat selection until 24 hours prior to the flight (without paying ), is a  crime in my  opinion

Outbound flight to  Amsterdam was on time, but return flight delayed by  over 2 hours. Due to an equipment change the  flight was on a B767, and I was seated in the premium economy cabin, which was definitely more comfortable, and had the added benefit of AVOD, which is unavailable in  the usual A320. I was pleasantly surprised to be served a warm meal on both  flights which is more than I was expecting on an intra-European flight.  Agents were professional, but not particularly helpful or engaging.

Return to London Gatwick in Business  and seats were quite comfortable. Reminded me of sleeping  a berth on . Food was very good and the service staff  were all very nice and attentive.  Also had a  long layover at Gatwick before flying  on to Inverness.  We use the  departures lounge after  a flight, but  find that is  only the case  from Heathrow. Don't  know why. We used rewards to  fly Club World  and really enjoyed.  They have flown  the long haul  numerous times and they have earned our return business.

I might have been in economy for service, food and seating, 8 abreast. No room to move. If you are over 80kg or 6',  be squashed completely. WC clean with paper towels. Adequate IFE. The difference between older crew on prior sectors and young cabin crew on this flight was stark. They were polite and totally wooden. On past sectors the older crew took the time to know you and, as a frequent flyer, even say thanks for  flying BA. Hung  I returned crushed. The dinner was the same as Jet Airways domestic , Breakfast at 03.30 a bit of fruit, tepid  breakfast pastry and egg roll served out of alfoil. Club World is like a stretched Economy with a Business Class fare.

The lounge was more business class then first. Boarding smooth, aircraft clean. Didn't like the seat much, B777 the seat is closer to the windows then the A800 which is  far preferable for me. Crew professional, no WIFI, just repeat that no WIFI, food selection limited as they had a 'catering issue'. If I booked and paid for First Class  you shouldn't have to hear they had a catering issue. I had  my sampler selection  from the wine coupling. The portion were small so had to ask for more food from a la carte, overall the food was not fantastic. Saving grace has to be BA cabin crew very polite and  professional

After read many reviews on here I was somewhat  skeptical about flying Club World with BA, however, I  were pleasantly surprised by the comfort, service and overall experience that we enjoyed on this 13 hour flight to Kuala Lumpur. We had front row seats 10A and 10B, 10A window seat is  forward facing and 10B is an aisle forward facing seat, the seats  are very comfortable  so we got a solid 8  hrs sleep. We were concerned that seat 10B would get disturbance from the galley and washroom which were in front of it, however, this was not the  case and would recommend this seat,  which also has no one stepping over you to get out of  a seat, seat  11 gives good privacy if needed by raising the divider, but you do have to step over the legs of the person in seat 11B to get out, not a huge problem but sometimes difficult when dark. Very attentive and cheery cabin , they maintained this good level of service for the full 13hour flight. The food was just about acceptable, champagne was offered pre take  off and during flight, wine selections ok. I would  be happy to travel BA Club World again on this 777-200 aircraft  in seats 10AB or 10JK, but I do prefer the Upper Deck on the 747, sad will be  a day they retire the good old Jumbo, I'm not a lover  with the new A380.

LHR-BKK-LHR. Started badly with all the  unnecessary baggage warnings at Terminal 5. BA's low 23kg baggage allowance had me nervy. Seating  with less legroom than competitors and seat not very comfy. Outward food  the best economy meal I've had in a long time. Return trip horrible. At check-in I was under 30kg but over the 23kg derisory BA limit. Was asked for £65 more but declined. When I quoted Thai Airways 30kg limit I was invited to buy a ticket with them. So I had to put on loads of clothes and dump a few cheap  bags to get my boarding pass. On the plane  I had to sit next to a very fat man (not BAs fault) and the food was disgusting. Some rubber chicken with four strips  and gravy-sodden potato wedges. No vegetables. Second meal only  served by tasteless  piece of sponge. No salad, yoghurt or other goodies. Between the 2 meals a goody box was given out with an oat bar and a few other bits which was nice. IFE had  the smallest screen I have ever  used and a  limited choice of films. Return flight journey progress constantly broke down. Generally, a poor experience considering BA's prices. Will not be using BA again.

Business economy on newly refitted Airbus . The seats  offer so little legroom, it has the feeling of a budget airline  different from budget  - but OK for a short  trip The problem is this seat configuration is used  in Europe and it's possible to  stay in such  poor conditions for  a longer flight. Upgrading to business  is a solution  - there's no extra legroom on these planes. Have  used both Swiss and Norwegian in the past few  years as well.  Norwegian had more legroom. Would recommend Norwegian (great airline - cheap, comfy, free wifi) but  avoid Swiss (dreadful customer service). BA cabin staff continue  to be very mixed : some  very polite and helpful. Others are  sometimes rude (as  I was on this flight) Overall,  service can be great, but sometimes  just so much.

I flew BA 's LHR to  Room 64A, Upper  Lounge in Club , Excellent experience , great service , a good  movie selection too.  BA crew were  polite and very attentive but the  lack of crew  on passengers hels as there are  just 20 seats  in the upper  decks with two  cabin crew. The  cabin was comfortable  with plenty of  seating and storage under the windows was a great  feature too. The  onboard entertainment was  great but the  service was very  small compared to  how it used  once be, BA  could do more  to add a  bit wider variety to its film selection, otherwise a  fantastic flight.

Excellent First Class  flights from Chicago  to London, easy  access and excellent  facilities provided at all times by  our cabin crew  in First Class. The food was  good and a  large selection available . Breakfast was  provided with a  large selection with  choice of organge a and tea  which came in  a pot which  had a lovely . If you are flying British Airways and connecting  to an American  Express domestic flight  take note that  passengers can now  travel from T3  to T5 at  the airside by shuttle bus which  leaves every 30 mins thus avoiding  the security lines in T5, this  is only to  American Passengers tranferring from an American  domestic or American  domestic flight to  a British Airways .

I was amazed that this airline charges extra to  get a seat in advance. I have never seen that on any  other the non-discount carriers, especially in business class. When I pay for  my business seat I expect that  a section will be free and  there won't be  paying for another ! The b-class , not uncomfortable,  just configured weirdly,  very little storage space near the  aisle The FAs  have to constantly lean over the person in the aisle to get to the person at the window,  which is annoying  but probably makes extra work for . The food  is flat out  and looked like  standard microwave fare.  Food service was OK, nothing special.  While I wasn't going to watch any in-flight entertainment,  we did check  this out. Pretty meager selection. If given a choice, I don't think  I will fly  anymore after this  flight is over.

One leg CAI-LHR  arrived on time,  the crew was  great but the  plane was very cramped and legroom  is non-existent. The second leg LHR-JFK  is much different : helpful crew  and horrible seating space. My knees  felt pressed against  my seat in front of me constantly and had to relieve them  two at a  stretch It used  once be a  budget carrier but  today it's not  even better than  the budget airline.  I do my  utmost to avoid.

Travelled in party of four with prebooked seating 4 abreast outbound, 2 abreast inbound. Cabin clean, well presented and tidy with good welcome. Not a full flight but approx 80% loading. The level of service from cabin staff was excellent. Service got  better quickly with full choice of menu and drinks available. Good, clear  and short information from flight deck. Toilets were clean and tidy throughout flight. Lights dimmed  two and a half hours into flight to allow rest with water rounds taking place by cabin crew. Good English breakfast served 1.5 hours out of JNB. Return flight good with attentive cabin staff and quiet cabin enabling some sleep. Food did not seem to be of such  as good standard  for this leg. BA on these flights provided excellent service and we were impressed. TV screens a little too small.

It is getting more like a budget airline every time I fly.  I now have  to pay £15 to choose a seat when I  fly in and then wait an  additional time to board. Fast track  was called forward  boarding and about  20 of the passengers went that way. When I  first got to the front I  ask if all  on fast track were fast track  and was told "no but we  are not allowed to make them go to the general boarding queue"  so what is the point. Easyjet  and Norwegian are  far better than BA for short haul and any Middle East airline for long haul. Try harder BA please!

Service on time, nice crew on  my plane, very comfortable seat and great food. Snacks  and beverages served during my 6 hour flight. The  projection system screen  is big, but with not a lot of TV shows and movies. Everything was perfect, even the arrival was great.

The booking of our flights was straightforward. However, when we have paid to sit next to each other,  and paid for  this opportunity to  book seats in advance, you would expect the seating plan for the aircraft to clearly show where all the toilets and galleys are so  we as the paying customer we  would have a  choice as to whether to is near them particularly on a long haul flight, on  this occasion British Airways failed miserably. The plane was new and the  beds were comfortable and spacious enough, not the upper  deck in ecconomy.  Sadly being seated next to the toilets was not the best location, particularly as we had pre booked the seats online. The service was  excellent and the staff helpful and happy to be there. The gluten free meals that we ordered were provided although the  cost could have been more substantial especially after an 11 hour flight. All in all a stress free journey which was comfortable.

Check in at First counter by  a scruffy guy  who wouldn't check my bag through on a connection.  Excellent ground crew  - ordinary on First check in  ( special) and in the lounge.  Asked to answer  why there was an arrivals lounge at Changi and  clearly not interested  with passengers (sorry ) compared with  some Qantas products. Managed to get upstairs at the  final minute on  First (10/7). Excellent  ground crew. Couldn't  be been more  accommodating than on  every other sector  of this trip.  Friendly and interested. They couldn't understand  the lack of  my bag at Singapore. Good food,  nice cabin, uncomfortable  & dated seat  and didn't sleep ! This cabin  I probably don't  pass on to  another Shame because they were excellent.

We encouraged passengers  to check-in online  to save it  both time and money, what does  this do? It  makes the number of staff for  airlines drop to  the barest minimum.  Economy class bag  checks at 08:30 at Heathrow had  three empty desks  in a queue  resulting in a  totally unacceptable wait of more than 15 minutes. Then having raced through  security there was the almost inevitable flight delay, only  this time the  added delay to  an incoming aircraft  was a result,  passengers were told,  from someone forgetting  the tow the  bags on to  a stand from another part of  Manchester airport! With  planes taking off to the west, there was yet  again 20 minutes  wait during taxiing. Only crisps or  a couple of  breakfast biscuits were  carried along with . Sadly the  gulf between the national airline and  the carriers just gets closer all the time.

BA2678, LGW-DBV, 16/06/15,  and BA2679, DBV-LGW,  London Baggage drop  was fast at the BA check  in Then had to wait 10 minutes for the the express sercurity  to open didnt  boarding at 5.30  pm as stated. The lounge at  home excellent, good selection of food  and drinks. Priority boarding very good. The flight out  looked good, nothing was too much  work for the cabin crew. On the return again fast check in, then queued for 20 minutes to  go through customs (no fast check in) once through  and to the lounge - ok but not as good as Gatwick. Priority boarding poor  in Dubrovnik, all put on a bus to be taken to the  airport Cabin crew not as freindly  as the return  flight Both flights about on time. The only complaint is the club europe seating, you pay a lot  less for theese , but the  seat is the same as economy leg room. Come on BA put it back to 34 inches as you are just giving more buisness to Easyjet and Ryanair.

Overall the journey  went good. The  flight was okay,  snacks were served  snacks which weren't  very appetizing. The cabin had recently been refurbished, it was very clean  and new with mood lighting. Screens coming down from the ceiling provided  us with a moving map. Overall  very good flight.

If I could give it a  go I would. From the moment we checked flight departure time and were incorrectly informed resulting in waiting to board for over 3 hours, to the incorrect arrival time as  shown on the  big screen. A  4 hour flight with only 1 main meal plus a snack served - without any drinks. Their idea  of an Asian vegetarian meal is grilled vegetables and  alcoholic drinks only served when the  customers were either not sleeping or chatting away. Very uncomfortable hard seat, aisles so small that most passengers  had their legs  stretched out in  those aisles and  finally finishing with nearly an hour  wait thru customs  & then having to wait 20 minutes for my luggage. Can you please get off your backsides BA,  please fly economy with Singapore Airlines as they still realize it's human beings they are transporting.

The staff were excellent from the  beginning to the finish. Service onboard  were friendly, professional,  extremely helpful. My wife left her handbag on board the plane when  she arrived at Heathrow, and the BA flight attendant  actually travelled from Terminal 3 to  Terminal 5 to  help deliver it back to her.  if you know  this huge distance between terminal 3  and 5 at Heathrow, you'll know just how much effort the flight attendant put in to returning the handbag. That exceptional level of customer service is almost unheard of these  times so BA  earned a 100% customer care rating from my wife and I. Snacks were good given it was only a bit over 3 hours flying time. Aircraft was  fine however the only negative was  the Business Class seats, in fact the tiny cramped seats was the  one thing that BA should really  improve as it sort of killed  something otherwise perfect  seat They were standard Economy Class  seats cramped in tight so your  feet were pressing into the seat in front. To convert these to Business Class seats all they did was put a fancy clip-in style armrest to make  the row configuration 2 seats instead of 3.

And it was ! The flight  attendants were friendly  and helpful. The  seats were fairly  small with plenty  for storage space  on the sides.  The food and entertainment were fine.  Our husband's screen  did not work at first, but  a flight attendant  replaced it in  a few minutes.  Our cabin was . One of  our seats did  contain a broken  chunk of plastic  like the cup holder was. It  may have pinched  / cut someone.  We were happy with the flights.

Same tired plane  ride to London.  Pilot and cabin staff were friendly, pleasant and helpful. A first on this series of flights. Flew on the same plane on the way from LHR to  London (see other recent reviews). Moved to row 1 , more space. Still sub-standard and why, why put economy seats in business class? Lounge was crammed and noisy pre-flight. I  joined Star Alliance as a Gold Member so at least got to see the Miles and Smiles lounge. BA, look around  or rest on  your century's efforts. I've flown BA First but just  not any more. Responding to Skytrax  concerns may just help increase profits. I must say,  apart from the  rude crew on  BA 677, the polite but totally disinterested service (when it exists) and  the cramped cabins will be my memory of this business trip.

All I can say is mediocre.  I flown this  plane with other  companies in business , I believe  I have been  disappointed The British  Airways product is  mediocre and just  like TV screen , and poor , food okay  and nothing more,  just poor. The  main highlight was  quality of service  by the crew.  We had nothing  too actually complain about, but nothing  would make me  want to use  this product again.

I have been flying between Dublin  to London once every 2 weeks on average since the beginning of the year, and I have regularly used British Airways  in the beginning. However, I have found their new policy of asking  around £15 for seat selection (even at check-in) really annoying, unnecessary and  insulting to loyal customers. Fair enough if they want to charge for pre-booking of seats, but at least they should allow  this at check-in time in line with their direct competitors on the same route (Aer Lingus). I have also found the service (food, drinks ), extremely poor for the fare charged, even for the short sector. If they continue their money-grabbing policy  they will definitely and happily give more of my business to Aer Lingus and Cityjet which operate the same route and seem to not treat their customers as infinite cash cows.

B serviceless, low class. I had low expectations and they weren't met. Club World has  moved from leading  to lagging. Cramped  seats (8 seats  max when others have 6), and a tired old plane. I usually fly in an  aisle seat but know better on  flights so was in a window seat. The passenger next to me  got repeatedly woken  as food was handed over or  dropped on him. After the service the polite cabin crew disappeared. Only  one bottle of water all flight.  My food was tasteless, overcooked and the presentation with  the food condiments reminded me of  fast food chain. At the price this is the worst product in the skies. Seat was broken and IFE clunky. Being  compared to CX, QF, SIA, Finnair,  Air Tahiti Nui, AA, Lan Chile  many more, I hesitate to call it business class  as it isn't.

From Club world , Club Europe  is the same , Economy on  a decent airline. Food was okay,  served with alcohol  if you wanted . Must be  our oldest aircraft  in the fleet.  Only IFE other  then a 24"  bag for the  cabin Was told  from the ground  floor that my  checked international cabin bag needed to  have checked in, not happy. It's  normal on international and domestic roll ers other than  being a turboprop. My colleague had  the same. Officious , uncalled for.  All the same  two bags were  brought aboard 4 days later on  a return flight.  All were economy  only and cramped  with little recline , less pitch than economy on  most airlines. Why  go for Club  and business class  when you don't get it?

I managed to switch to upstairs on the 744,  quite happy as  this is a quiet space. Seat 64A footstool was  full so the  floor was uncomfortable. We left Singapore  around midnight and got into LHR  at 0441hrs, so sleep was intermittent as I tried to adjust the  position to compensate.  Life out of  Singapore was okay but still lacking. One pleasant attendant, one grumpy. No  Fast Track on landing because we got in early,  no queue with coach tours. I'm  staying on British Airways this trip  and won't be booking by choice again.

All meals ran out, just sausage and potato left,  NO children's meals available! Return flight delayed by 7 hours as plane was not in a safe condition. Scheduled flight at 8pm departed at 3.30am! They had to fly one in to Orlando all the way from Cardiff -  very bad joke. No children's meals  available

Overall good all  first class flight, only issue experienced  being the slow  food delivery upon  arrival in JFK.  Service exceptional and  entertainment provided was good. The seats  fitted full flat.  Space provided for  good entertainment, with  various films, tv , etc. A  comfortable flight albeit  a little expensive.

If British Airways review their seating  options I will  use the airline again. The seats are so cramped and when the passenger in front decided to recline his seat that was it, no matter how much I asked him to recline back, he would not do it. Only when the food  came did he  leave his seat  again and to  add insult to  injury the food tasted vile, and  ending up eating  the bread roll ! I will use BA now as a last option.

Flew back 30  minute LGW-MCO flight delayed at Gatwick for 8 hours. Got told at 13.55 when flight was supposed to leave that there was a technical fault and they  were bringing in a new aircraft  from Cardiff, told  to report back  around 15.15 to be told that still not here  and to report back later and given £10 voucher. Told we would take off at 17.15 Come 17.15 got told they needed to try and get a crew. Did not depart until after . It was our tenth wedding anniversary not one member of staff said anything (I spoke with back  home office the day before and  got told they  would arrange a glass of champagne ). Boarded aircraft  it was a very old 777, no champagne, no duty free and no kids packs. My IFE had to be rebooted.

I was pleased  I see that  Qatar Airways now  have 'proper' gates  at Terminal 3 , compared to  the previous bus  stop scrum. The  service was organised,  flight crew friendly  and the onboard  food good. We  were served a tasty ham and  cheese croissant with  before the flight departed and arrived  before time and  it arrived quickly. The seat wasn't  very comfortable but  All in all,  was good!

This was my first time with British Airways. I was disappointed in the amount of seat/leg room compared to some other airlines I've traveled with. I was also surprised that on longer European  flights London to Istanbul for example which I traveled) there was no TV when the flight is as long or longer than flights in Asia from country-to-country  which have TV/entertainment system. The universal  audio system was broken too and  its sound wasn't working. The service button to call an attendant was broken too. A stewardess on this particular flight from JFK to LHR (BA1511 on June 19, 2015) was  really rude to my daughter. My daughter is unable to eat dairy and both food options on the plane included dairy. My daughter asked  her if there was any non-dairy options and the stewardess, takes the food from my daughter’s tray and says “I guess you’re just going to have to eat that salad.” It wasn’t what  she said that bothered me, it was the way she said it.  We didn’t offer pretzels or non-dairy snacks or anything. This was my  first experience with British Airways, and I was disappointed. It wasn’t until my flight back home that I felt a bit  relieved On my  flights back with British Airways, not this flight in specific (from LHR to LAS), I encountered a steward  that was very pleasant, polite and very professional.

As a frequent  flyer on various airlines, British Airways  was by far  the worst I 've experienced. Substandard  customer service even before the flight. My original plan  is to fly from Toronto to Rome via London  on July 2nd.  My tickets were  purchased and confirmed in March. Two weeks before departure,  no email was  emailed to me  regarding my flight  connecting London to Rome. I called  and waited on the service hotline  until I was able to get  in on one  flight and my parents on another. The rep refused  even try to put me together with my parents.  Less than 48  hours before departure  a rescheduled flight was rerouted to  London The agent  informed me all  my travel expenses would be my . On the  morning of departure I got my flight from Gatwick to Rome after  flying from Heathrow.  It was told  later the flight  had rerouted to  Toronto and just before departure this  switched back to a direct flight to Rome - very confusing communication.  I arrived in Rome to discover my parents flight  was delayed for  2 hours. With more BA flights  flying into the  city the service  center was closed  and my flight  had arrived. There  was no BA  representatives anywhere to  provide assistance.

A family and I flew from Rotterdam to London  on 26th of  June and it's our first time traveling with BA.  We chose it  since we thought this airlines would  be better than  the airlines with  no delays. We  proved very wrong. We arrived at  London airport on  Tuesday and sat down to wait.  Airlines announced flight delays due to "technical" error for 1.5 hours before  then announcing that the flight was  cancelled We were  given no explanation  but for one phrase "technical fault". We were then  quickly sent back  into queue in line to be rescheduled. We waited  for 45 mins  which was then  transferred to a  different flight (original  time 1.05pm). We  are denied all chances to board an earlier one  for 4pm. We  could not complain  we gave BA  more trouble. We  violated procedures and  demanded for compensation . Their reply  is simply a  shrug and they  assume all responsibilities.

Returning from Chicago to Berlin, the overall flight experience was no better than the outward sectors a week earlier. I opted to skip dinner and instead have breakfast since the flight landed around  noon Breakfast was a hard slab of cake with one drink - a total disgrace! Once again the cabin was too  cold and I saw no passengers using their blankets. The Berlin flight  also was delayed, initially due to  the usual "late incoming aircraft" excuse, and then to a broken APU.  Apparently no air was being pumped in to the cabin and the engines could not be started! For some reason it then took half an hour to locate one that did actually work. Meanwhile on one of the hottest days of the year we waited on board in  almost sauna-like conditions.  The captain kept us informed and then made up a bit if time, although we still landed 35 minutes late.

My experience chimes  up the general  opinion on the  Disney World service : Cabin, seats and fittings are  past their age , look rather  dated by this point. Not too  much red wine  was on my  arm rest when  first boarded. Tiny  cabin and IFE  were dated, not  much entertainment selection.  Overall food quality  was good but service from cabin  staff was rather  slow with little  details to make  for a special  guest experience. Nuts  and chocolates served in packets, not  packed Not attentive  to providing drinks  - or water.  I wasnt offered all of the  food listed on  a menu -  Where did my  mac and cheese  sandwich go? Had  them ask for  my refills after  the meal. Brewed coffee only -  not fresh lattes/cappuccinos. Was not offered disgestifs after the meal. Cabin crew disappeared after the  meal Self service  items in the galley were economy  only (apart from some nice rose !) Just not a luxury or experience! Felt like I was in economy but with more space and  privacy

On this occasion  my partner and I experienced a 3.5 hour delay with BA. There was no communication  from the airport, nothing until we  stepped onto the  flight where the  crew told us  they were due  for a bag that had not been checked in  time at Heathrow.  Because of the  time when the  luggage finally arrived it had no  fuel on board and was not permitted to fill  up at our  gate This meant  no toilets because  had no flush , no warm drinks on board.  we were sat  at the runway  half an hour because the engines would not start. We had no aircon for 40 mins. When we  finally got back to Heathrow the captain told us that he was  sorry for the  plane

Boarding well organised and efficient. Seated  as World Traveller on the upper deck. 2x4x2 on this deck is preferable to the 3x4x3 on the lower deck. Flight attendants welcome customers on board and  staff was friendly  & professional. Seat  is comfortable. Legroom  adequate for economy. IFE excellent; a huge range of  meal options. The  worst was lunch. The chicken casserole was basically a  few pieces of chicken swimming in oil with a few vegetables. Very  good Afternoon tea,  on the other hand, was nice. .

According to FCO , BCN to  put PTV on  alert for e long haul planes,  I did the  same and it  automatically activated when  they boarded the  flight The food was ok except  during the return flight from London  to Montreal where  no chicken was  cooked No flight  delays on outbound journey but 3 hour delay on  the return flight  when the aircraft  had to be  grounded due to  some mechanical problem. ​

The night flight was delayed by  almost an hour;  not the fault  to the airline , a contributory factor to our disappointment with BA  on this flight , June 2015).  I paid extra  on our Premium Economy tickets, then  once again to reserve seats, and past experience with  them and with equivalent seats/service on Virgin Atlantic had led us to  expect value for  cash and some small rewards for the extra costs.  In this flight,  though where the  most real benefit  proved to be a small amount of extra legroom.  we were last  off board after First, Business and  Economy Where customers  in Premium Economy used to be  presented with the  option of a  bottle of fizz ed orange juice,  whatever it is  water or juice. Once we had  set off, drinks  are served; fine, but when the  waiter came to collect the empty glass/bottle, he knocked  his glass onto the floor, where  it broke - the staff were  very rushed and  made to be  working on numbers  that I was made to feel that the breakage  were my fault!  Dinner did not arrive until after  dark by which  point I had rather lost interest, as had my  passengers So far,  our extra costs  have bought us extra leg room  for one glass  or wine (I  had not offered a second, possibly  because of my  fear of causing  a steward to  drink a glass).  Quite by contrast  that other night , the lights were never fully  illuminated there were  no offers of water/orange juice to  avoid dehydration. The promised (on the  business card) morning  ' snack' and  orange juice was  the hastily delivered piece of dried-up  fruit and a  morning coffee - no mention of  orange juice. I  could really see what my extra  tickets were getting  us that those  on Economy had for less - the extra leg room was rather negated by the passenger in front's  less reclined seat. I will not,  not at all , be travelling with BA again.  It left a  rather sour taste  at the end of our holiday.

Check in at  Emirates was a disaster and ludicrously (for it has a lot of BA flights) I was told there are no BA staff at that  desk to sort  the problems. 100 minutes prior to departure, 2 check in desks were open - 1  business 1 economy. As a BA  credit card holder,  I joined the business queue. First  one lady had considerably too much baggage. The arguments went on for more than 10 minutes before she  paid the extra fees. Then the technical crew for a pop event the previous day had to be checked in. Not only were some of their 20 or so items very overweight, others were way too large. After 20 more minutes I asked a young lady why the other business passengers could not be processed at the economy desk. This was not possible, I was told. Eventually another economy desk opened; yet our queue remained immobile for a  further 15 minutes. Finally after more than 40 minutes, someone decided we  should be processed at an economy  counter after all! Looking forward to a drink in the lounge, I then discover there is no lounge airside. As for the LHR-ORD flight, I have been spoiled with business class intercontinental travel since business class was introduced. To board an international carrier and discover a seat pitch  is just 31" was a major shock. This is like travelling long haul on a budget carrier only at considerably greater cost. The worst part was the cabin was kept at an extremely warm temperature throughout despite requests for the captain to reduce it to a more reasonable level. The meal was OK and the IFE had a decent selection of movies. But overall, the flight was hugely uncomfortable. With some other carriers still offering  a seat pitch greater than 31", BA has lost my future business.

After my flight  from Vienna with  BA I was  looking for a slight improvement on  our way back ; however the  service was very . Drink service  seemed rushed with  a stewardess pouring  her entire miniature  Tomato vodka into  my drink before  pouring a drop of Tomato juice in when I  reached for a Tomato and Vodka  tasted unpalatable. Was glad to be off the plane  In all fairness.  But that one  more BA will wow me.

Slightly disappointing flight  on an aircraft  that was showing  some age. It  has very little  thought is put  in cabin decor  so it looks quite tawdry in  all fairness. Food  tasted okay -  wine and cheese  included - but  nothing to write home about. Seats weren't great for  half my height  so all in  all I was  left feeling underwhelmed - budget level  but at a  decent price

Return and return , A321 new  for Europe seating,  the Boeing 767.  Had not flown  to Europe for  several years and wasn't looking forward  for the flight  due to the  new seat pitch  that is the  equivalent as economy.  I was fortunate  on both journeys  to secure a  spot in row  2 where you  always have extra . The only  economy seat with  extra leg room  is the emergency  room row. The  meal and drink  service was good , the service  of the crew was excellent on  this return leg.

It appears BA  chose to adopt a “do as little as possible”  on this route,  probably due to their monopoly. The aircraft and cabin  were looking tired/old, and decidedly mediocre  compared to recent business class flights  with Emirates, Etihad  and Qatar Airways.  Not excellent service  from cabin and  on deck crew.  Front seat (2K) was shockingly filthy.  Floor had been cleared since the last passenger, but I noticed much  less filth e.g.  water /drink splatters on the cabin wall, crumbs in  fabric folds/gaps and stained cover, all sorts of debris on floor in gaps/cracks, and remarkably  filthy carpet. Cabin  attendant offered me  some of the  available seats, but on inspection these were in a similarly grim state. Seat was OK for comfort, but  an IFE choice with very poor quality screen. Meal  service was good for food and  drink although dirty environment was off-putting.  The Veg’ meal  service improved since  I tried. Pantry service is underwhelming in places e.g. Mars Bars and KitKats are tragically promoted as retro,  with some nice ice cream. Return  seat 1K, and  excellent service from  cabin and flight deck crew. I'm  just grateful that this cabin is  not Tired, so  no dinner. Decided  and watch a short TV programme , found much  better picture quality on screen compared to outward, although  much less programme choice. I found  sleep comfort mediocre  with bed mode,  and got five hours of sleep.  New cabin layout  was clearly designed to maximise passenger numbers without much thought for their comfort. Awake for  lunch so when  we were offering  breakfast rolls I asked for my wife and my  beloved Lacto Veg ! Staff returned ashen faced, and  clearly apologising, with two neatly wrapped  individually labelled plain white bread rolls. Such bad service,  and a lack of joined-up thinking!  Just couldn’t make  that up. Post-flight  review found the BA customer complaints  section to be dreadful, and left  home far more disappointed with the service than at  any end of my flights.

Flying home was  as good as the flight out. Had long delay  before depart, in part from a  sick passenger who checked in, then disappeared - one  if those mysteries about airline travel that happens from time to time.  Meanwhile a  third plane of passengers were delayed , total by  45 mins. A320  was newly refurbished and clean. So called "new" Club Europe seats were installed, and as  I was in  Terminal 1 it  went okay. The menu was identical to the outbound  but the beef main course was was terrific. It was the sort of meal that I would have happily paid £20 for in a quality bistro. FAs  are great. The  first FA was the sort that understand customer service. Her colleague was  close to retirement and seemed to  live on another planet most of the time. At  about half way  stage I wanted another gin and  water but they 'd run out  of both ice and proper "glasses". On arrival to LHR we were parked miles away from the Terminal.  The reasons was given. All in , a very  pleasant experience.

Having boarded there was a technical  problem with air  conditioning and the  line got very  hot The cabin  attendants did offer  bottled water to  help all passengers , and delay  was only around 20 minutes. Once  aboard drinks and  snacks were served.  Everything on A319 was comfortable for  a short flight.  The GLA Airport  has parking stands  they are so  long away from  the main terminal  for pick up  flights and changes to the airport  over the past  handful of years  have increased the  parking distance. This is annoying if  they only have  small luggage and  need a quick  departure especially on  this late night  when One sees  Emirates and Ryanair passengers passing through  their arrivals process  far quicker.

- The food  was poor, my wife's steak could have been anything, my curry had a tiny piece of chicken. The  cabin was less  then half full , cabin crew hadn't time to bring a glass of wine. After the meal, staff disappeared. No after dinner drink offered, no refreshments during the night. For  this price this could have been a lot better.  Food on old  days was better.

This is my 3rd flight with  them in 8  months and  the worst yet. The customer service and communication is appalling. Originally my return flight was from Rome to London Gatwick but my flight was  delayed due to issues at Rome . But instead of BA getting  to contact with  us in regards to this, the third party company I booked the  ticket with had to. When Checking  arrived they tried  to charge me for baggage again although already paid ! When I  spoke to them on the phone, they just tried to fob  it off to  their numbers even  when I called the Customer Service number. This is  another shame because  at once the  original flight and flight service was good which is surprising. But as  per result of  their rudeness, lack of communication and appalling customer service  im very unlikely to ever use  it again.

Jet Airways never fails to surprise.  We find the  customer lounge in  BA quite reasonable and on this last occasion was impressed with the manner in which the Lounge Manager handled a cranky passenger who was accusing him of destroying her favourite newspapers. Then, once  again I discovered that Business Class  and some of BA's European routes have a seat-pitch that almost prevents gaining entry to the window seats! For those used to flying Qantas  in economy in , think of  one forward seat in economy with the middle seat kept empty: and that's it! On  any other hand, service and food was excellent and  their flight crew commentary was superb. BA have an excellent in-flight magazine.

I was delayed  3 hours -  and was given  no notice, but  I had to  miss my connecting  plane and ended  out with a  bit more time  to Heathrow than  normally would have  had Check-in was  good and cabin  crew attentive, food  good - but  BA do have  a issue with  BA The 747  seat tapers at  your back -  so not enough room for 3-4-3  - and rows  farther on have  this configuration. Rows  4 don't have  enough room for  additional seating either,  but BA do  it anyway by  deliberately making the  front seats narrower  then the rest.  having endured a  12 hour night  sleep in one  or these horrible  chairs my back  got twisted and  cramped for weeks  - This is  just not acceptable  for a long-haul  aircraft especially at  JFK - BA  charged extra for  seating identified as  needing more room,  for the same  way these seats  could be advertised  for having less  space and cash-back  available for anyone  wanting to accept  it (small children,  or

Short hop from  an empty terminal 1 at LHR  at LUX. Nice  to be able  and use the  facilities in LHR,  after an aggravating  delay at security despite virtually no line. Excellent service on board, off , plane at LUX, through passport control and in the car in  just 10 minutes. I was impressed  at the cheerful  attitude of cabin staff.

So I was rather disappointed to  discover that my early morning Sunday flight was cancelled  no any reason  on the afternoon before the morning I was to  depart - the whole point of  this trip was so I could  actually go back  or return the same day to attend my sisters  wedding saving time and also money  thanks to the trains being so  delayed I managed to rearrange my  accommodation for the  first night and while annoyed I had to now  change last minute accommodation, I thought  this would be  ok and as  easy as re-booking  this was via  my BA app.  Where it didn't  help me was  that the flight  was re-arranged to fly out with  was severely delayed and my heart  sunk as I  received a a text/app notification telling  me so - I think this was very sneaky  enough to mention before re-booking and  I spent a  lot of hours getting to know Terminal 5. The  usual feedback from here and from  passengers is flights on this particular domestic route are often subject to delays and cancellation, and for a  premium service airline  this is simply unacceptable - more  than anything when everything else is cutback, reliability becomes  important The plane itself was immaculately  dressed and clean and I liked the simple but  spacious cabin. BA staff also do  tone things down a bit, often quite brusque and unfriendly, and the desk staff do come across rather  harsh when there are issues as there was here.  The Crew were  great but lack warmth of some  American Airlines. Sadly  they aren't any  other options on this route, so  will probably be switching back to rail, despite sometimes competitive fares.

On to Santorini.  Plane was busy , but then  flying often is.  We left about  10 minutes late  ( this was  based on congestion.  I guess we  were stuck with  this excuse for  these next 10  years until they build a 3rd runway). Plane was  pretty clean. We  landed in Club  Economy (new seat  was in row ). I am  sure we were  in rows 2,3  which looked very  good The only  difference with economy  is the table  - in the  back - instead  of a seat.  This was very  nice indeed. I  tried the Thai  buffet - my  friend had the  side of beef  which she said  tasted excellent. FAs  are very friendly.  Beautiful flight all  this way. Its  sort of worth  my extra money  we guess -  extra privacy and  just one WC  on the front end of the plane. It could  just be so much better, with  better seats and  doing away with  this silly central "table".

Fantastic from the word go. Check  in was great,  VIP lounge great  even with the  full elemis treatment which was lovely.  Great service and  eye to detail.  People onboard delightful.  Everyone was nice , was a  great pleasure.

After flying many,  several times, I  could honestly say  BA was the  best plane I  had ever flown . The aircraft  is old and  falling apart. During the flight the  lid of the toilet flew off,  half of the  overhead bins was  smashed and the  frame holding the  bins was broken.  The carpet was  ripped and the equipment was being  held together with . They did  NOT have enough  oxygen and nothing available for me  I have a  peanut allergy), the  equipment that was  used was not  fit for human consumption. The toilets  was not cleaned  throughout the whole  journey (13 hours),  so as a  bonus the smell  out there was ! The rubbish  bin was overflowing  from waste, which  was soiled nappies. The only time  I saw the cabin crew was  when they were serving food. They looked very scruffy, not what you would expect of  the BA cabin ! All in all a very  disappointing flight. I  return to Asia  every year and  would ensure I  will fly BA  on this route  again

Very good flight in Club World from start to finish. OK, so the plane may be rather old,  yet it was in immaculate condition and the cabin crew (older, mostly British) delivered efficient  work and friendly service. The lie flat bed (I took a rear facing window seat) is excellent for  privacy and gives great privacy. The food offering was not amazing (some cost cutting here) and I was surprised to see nuts served in bags not on dishes. There was however a good selection of drinks and glasses were topped up as required. Inflight entertainment was excellent, with a great range of both movies and TV shows. I fly often with the middle eastern carriers who offer newer planes and a more  modern feel, however BA scored highly on crew, seat comfort and ease of sleeping. I also visited the  beautiful T3 arrivals lounge which is first class. I will definitely fly BA club world again if the price is competitive.

A good experience.  Italy owns Vueling/Iberian  who booked me  in to Rome.  When they try to book you  onto this airline  but no. No  spare room, no  and never again.  After two weeks  in Europe I  was really looking  forward to going home to my  parents When I  eventually got to  my BA counter in the Rome airport, I was  told my flight  from London was  cancelled I would  never be able  to make my  dinner in London and I would  have to spend the night and fly out in  early morning. At  a BA desk  i was told they had a  room for me  in walking distance.  Since I'm 70 , I would  walk more like,  walking distance if  not a camel.  The room and  meal were fine,but when I went  in the restaurant  where my meal  arrived I was given a menu with three items on it, told  you could have  two for free but be charged  like any other  meal I had  saved extra to  clear my aisle  after months in  Italy but now  we had to  book again (BA  would have done  that one day  in advance of  my flight, middle  price for my 12 hours of  travel home to  London

Welcome to BKK June 13th 2015  BA World (Business). While the aircraft  is starting to  look its age, seats were reasonably  comfortable - as  far as you don't mind the  unusual seating configuration where some passengers  are facing backwards.  Customer service and  breakfast quality were  outstanding - with  two of the  best breakfasts we have had in  commercial air - a delicious fruit  sandwich followed by a 'full english' which was hot  and tasty. On this overnight flight, sleep was difficult  - due to  the narrowness of the seats. BA  cannot provide a  seat 'topper' as  many other airlines offer to enhance sleep comfort. Fair  values for money proposition.

UPDATE 15/6/15. There was a delay,  that I understand and accept.   The crew were  incredibly helpful and went out of  there way for me and my travelling companion as we were due to make a  rather tight connection to travel home by other means. It was unfortunate that my travelling companion's bag didn't make it on  her outward journey, particularly as our break was only  two days long and we had  made travelling plans for the day after arrival.

Just flew from  Amsterdam to London,  economy class and  was surprised how  far better the  plane was than  my first. It 's interesting and  comfortable and attractively . If only  they would abandon  the bizarre seat configuration in business, it would be  really good. The  service was OK,  albeit a bit  cramped but it is embarrassing to  see the attendants  scrolling down the screen every time you need anything.  Or find your  face inches away  and that of  some stranger. Fortunately,  we now know  which seats to  take to avoid  bending over my  seat to reach  my aisle.

Just flew out  on the 8th June 2015 and  everything I can  report is that  their staff, flight  and service was  great We had  a little issue with the flights  as the people  that booked it  and made an  offer on our  flight but BA  sorted this out  with no time.  You will definitely  be flying out with them again . I will recommend them. Service  of the plane  were excellent.

I fly with this airline almost every other weekend from Abu Dhabi to Muscat. Throughout (I think so  with 7 trips  with them), they have never had any delays with me, and even  if there has been, it would  be a maximum 30 minutes (and still be able to arrive in  Dubai on time). Staff are professional, yet friendly enough to chat to. It would be  great if there  was a flight from Muscat to  Ab Dhabi at an earlier time  the only ones  for now is one that arrives at midnight). The only downside to  the airline is  all the Highlife shopping is not available for that Abu Dhabi - Muscat due to the short duration, even if you  ordered and paid  all the items  purchased and were  hoping for an onboard delivery.

Ended up on  this 25-year-old 747,  and second-oldest in BA's fleet, and boy did it show. The cabin was seriously dated and in need of a good renovation, but I guess this aircraft will be retiring  one day soon. The outbound flight was on a nicely retrofitted 777 : comfortable spacious chairs and excellent, clear and larger IFE screen. The screens on this 747 were tiny and and very  low resolution by comparison. Nevertheless, the service was usual good BA standard: courteous and efficient, with decent enough food (better than  some past years, when revolting soggy  meals seemed to  be the norm).  Despite the ancient , not-up-to-standard aircraft, the flight was pleasant enough.

Flight were boarded , but suffered  a weather delay  of over an  hours because of  severe thunderstorms. Throughout this time, the  flight crew kept  everyone updated and  after about 30 ml water/juice were  provided before being  informed that we 'd soon be  ready to depart.  Our cabin was clean and the  staff friendly and polite with apologies  about the delay. Breakfast snack just ok but only  for short flight.  So my view  is in general  good short haul , but really  need to improve  on long haul .

Terrible. Flight time  is well over  2 hours. Seating is like Ryanair,  but we are  in BA Club Europe. Which genius decided that 30  minutes is sufficient for premium passengers?  no idea what  I do with  the legs. It's  difficult to use my laptop. This  was not business ! Very uncomfortable , especially for the money I  spent BA -  Chris

28th May 2015,  flight B747, Seat 29A.  Paid  no extra for Legroom seat which  looks good though the width is  quite narrow.   Passenger in seat next to me kept fidgeting And her arm kept twitching into mine the whole flight which was annoying.  Flight was on time and cabin crew were all very friendly.  The Food also  looked pretty good for economy.  747 is really showing her age now, though the cabin was clean, tidy and in good condition, it was old in  appearance and very noisy.  The entertainment system is also quite long in the tooth with a small, blurry, screen.  Pretty good flight though.

9/6/15, ORD-LHR, 777-300, Club World, Seat 13b.  Had  flown as World Traveler Plus but was upgraded pretty  close to departure. This meant I did not have  enough time to  get a meal before hand and the meal on  arrival was both small and not very good.  Would have been better with the economy mean I think. Breakfast was pretty poor as  usual with
several items not given out. Other than that the crew were excellent and very attentive.  The seat was full lie flat though pretty narrow I  guess compared to other carriers Business  The Entertainment system was also very  nice and up to date.

10/6/15, LHR-GLA, A321, Seat 9A.   Was able to  select this seat  from advance which  gave plenty of legroom as no seat in front. Â Flight was pretty full.  Cabin crew were  both extremely friendly and helpful welcoming every passenger individually.  Flight was delayed by difficulty in storing the silly amount of  carry on baggage people brought on board.  Some stuff was obviously way bigger than the allowed size. .. It took ages to get it all sorted  and was ridiculous, however the crew  kept smiling though  and all.   Had new configuration seating which I  find pretty comfortable.  Drink and snack was served as usual.  Landed nearly 30 mins late to  find my baggage had not made it from GRR  and was quite  disappointing  Overall good flight though.

In May 2015,  an A321 (new ), Seat 4A.  Flight was on time and  about half full.  I've read complaints about the  aisle seating however found it to  remain comfortable and  available  Drink and snack service  is fine and  the cabin crew  was all very friendly.

Once on A319,  We sat on  a plane at  departure gate for  almost 40 minutes due to one  door closed, no drinks offered. No  evening meal for my wife, Empty  seat under the  front seat tray. Landed allegedly almost  record time due to the excessive  delays scheduled for  that leg.

Flew Club World  From Gatwick to  Southampton in April to connect with a cruise back to Europe. Arrived on a Norwegian flight from Stockholm at Gatwick the day before and were able to check in luggage the evening before the flight to avoid any delays, next day very quiet, efficient check-in in economy section. Missed Club World check-in. Next day very efficient priority security straight to lounge. Very crowded but found seats eventually. Ordered champagne delivered promptly but it was difficult  to get a refill as staff a bit overwhelmed so fixed own G&t. Boarding on B777 efficient and shown to 2 back facing seats, basically a double bed. Glass of champagne provided as we settled in. Take off a little strange as traveling backwards but when in cruise no problem at all. Several drinks services before and during meal service. Very relaxed and very professional crew. Food mackerel pate and steak quite good but not business class in its heyday which  I was privileged to enjoy. The seat was strange. Very narrow and a lot of the time you are looking into a strangers face. BA has 8 across seating, more than any other business class operating the B777 in the World. Entertainment ok. Reasonable screen but hardly World Class. Things going fine until, 3 hours from touchdown they said that champagne was finished as they had to save enough for returning passengers. What about we passengers who had paid a lot of their own money to fly Club as a special treat. We persuaded a very nice first Class CA to raid first Class to provide a glass  of champagne. After that we were on our own with the Club ! What a joke. Packets of crisps and a choice of red or white.  Very poor indeed for business Class. All in all an ok flight with a very good crew but signs of penny pinching throughout. Oh dear BA, how you have deteriorated.

Flight from Kiev  via London on  a Airbus 319 in Business Class.  Standing room was not so good but otherwise seats ! Food served was good. We departed on time  but arrived 10  mins early. Immigration queue in Terminal 5 was very long and slow and my bag was waiting for me once I got through. A nice flight.

This is more of a general  observation having travelled almost exclusively with BA longhaul as a family for the past 3-4 years. I highly  commend BA for  everything On our travels I have found the BA staff inflight: 1)  to be sympathetic towards my wife and I with having infants. They have offered quiet areas during service (on the A380) to help settle our baby. Left us to last for dinner service if we were in the middle of settling the kids (nothing worse that being made  to take a tray of food when all you want is your kids to sleep). 2) Friendly and attentive, but maintaining professionalism. Crew are not servants to passengers. They have a fairly strict roster of duties to attend to but I find that they are more than happy  for help at the less peak  time They are less inclined when they have 300 people to feed. It figures. I  am fortunate to regularly travel longhaul  on business and so reach Silver tier on an annual basis. Having BC check-in is a great bonus for checking in a family - shorter queue etc. The greatest perk  is that as Silver I get  two bags at 32kg each. Not only that but when I travel with my family, my wife and eldest child get the same allowance as I do and our infant gets 23kg bag. Plus car seats , pram free. That is a huge allowance and makes packing less  stressful BA are a professional outfit and get you where you are going, I have no issues with them and find them value for  investment I could  not care less  how the food is like. I fly to be on time and  have good connections.  The T5 is  excellent

LHR to YVR return. Hard earned Avios points trip. Had been 3  years since I 'd travelled Club World and not  a changed. The  airport at Heathrow  is very crowded.  At Tea time  with just sandwiches,  tea and soup . Sandwiches were  delicious and very  comfortable Plane as a 747 that  had seen better . The seat  was clean but tired looking. The biggest let down , the screen  which was blurry  and comparison to  my Bling Airways  seats I had  on economy. The  breakfast meal was really nice. Beef  Stew that was  fresh and cooked.  Chicken Salad full of flavour and  vegetable starter that  we wanted more of. The 2nd  dinner was "afternoon " of 3  small sandwiches and  1 piece of  the rocky road.  A real cream  cheese would have  worked better! Seat  is upright and  great sleeping position. Got plenty of rest and sleep both ways. Coming  into the lounge , Vancouver is above the gate.  Not enough seats.  Good snacks. Another nice meal on board, spoilt by a dry bread roll. Breakfast was  another big disappointment. Expecting a cooked  hot breakfast we  ate fruit in  a plastic box followed by an  orange and bacon , I took  one bight of  the muffin and it mad me  not to gag. Good crews on  all legs. Bags  and out priority , big plus to BA. As a free plus  flight and surcharges , it was  great but BA need to improve if they want to lead the  market instead of being just average.  🙂

The World from  Home Busy flight  in the ageing  Rear Seats comfortable  as always and  a calm cabin  on the Upper . Only fault  with the crew.  Some seemed just  out of training school. Although very  helpful and friendly,  you two made  quite a few mistakes with orders  for drinks and  got nervous. Flight  off and landed . An all  too good experience.

My review refers  from a return  journey from India  flying in Premium ! The seating  looks fine in this class and  was definitely worth  paying extra from standard economy in  terms of the  extra room. However ... where it  ends The service  comparison with Business  class I travelled out in, is  appalling The BA  cabin staff seem  and treat anybody  either flying in  First or First  or second-class citizens  who barely do  their job. That 's the awful  thing - the  experience I've had  on a long haul flight has  had me seriously  considering my choice  in carrier next time I fly  en route.

This review concerns  BA in Business  class I'm not a fan of the BA business class seating. It's very awkward to access the aisle from a window , and also the practice of having your meals passed over a  small divider is  annoying for both the customer and the flight attendant.  That said all , the service on board was great, the stewardess looking after my  section of the cabin was chatty, friendly and couldn't do enough to help. The seat itself is OK,  nothing overly comfortable but I did manage a few  nights sleep. Food  is not great on BA though.  :)

3 of 3 - 747 out upper deck) 777 back. Fortunate to be a silver  customer so get to allocate seats when booking. Flights  2 out, 1  minute delay on return, reason late  landing aircraft (really  no excuse). On departure no knowledge of which gates  will be used for this and many other flights  with both main lounges by security in T5 hellishly overcrowded. Assume the remote lounges would have been empty.  737 tired with ancient entertainment system but quiet upper deck, 777 the  best except crowded and busy on  upper only deck - although both  planes have new  first class so  any upgrading had  been just not  part of it.  Service however excellent throughout in both directions so well done, particularly return  leg which had  huge number of  school children making  for demanding work. Food both directions actually quite decent, continual drinks service for first half  the flight e/w then help yourself in galley. Good  booking as we gained big discounts  by booking a  full package. Had I paid full fare would have  felt very disappointed  - doesn't near  live up to the main opposition  these days - too many seats  in an inconvenient layout. I do  wonder if BA have given up going for the  family traveller in  economy classes on some long haul  flights now (as they have for short haul club)  they now see  only higher spending families as their revenue source - maybe that's why we got the antiques to fly in.

Travelled from Venice to Gatwick on  8 May check in staff rude , unhelpful plane seats and food trays dirty and seats very worn and uncomfortable. Lady  next to me had her arm rest fall off during the flight. Food for my daughter inedible. Attendants very lacklustre. Nappy changing table fell on my mum  while on the toilet attendant suggested we sue BA! Wrote to BA  to complain got fobbing off email  to return. Won't be wasting my money on business class again. Shocking service and standards from start to  finish

Bad customer experience on BA flight. I have a  confirmed flights for British Airways from Singapore to Sydney for tomorrow. When  I tried to check online the system did not allow me to  check online check-in. I called the BA contact center in the UK and was shocked with the response received. The person told me that there is a difference between confirmed  tickets and confirmed seating. Essentially BA  tries to sell their seats at a premium. They arm twist the passengers and make lame excuses that although you have confirmed flight bookings it doesn't mean you can fly unless you get the seats allocation. We are travelling as a family but got scattered seats. Very embittered with the overall experience. Will never fly again with British Airways.

I had this  horrible experience of  flying British Airways  from Heathrow to  JFK The plane  was parked in  the no-mans area  before we were bussed to the  gate To my  horror I had  the climb through the stairs with  no carry on . The width of the seat  in the leg rest is the smallest I saw  throughout my 40  years of travel ! It's a  wonder that that  an airline is  using this kind  of carrier for  a Transatlantic flight. The quality of  meat is one  if the worst  we have ever seen. I picked  a non-veg chicken  because the taste and content was  horrendous The container  is marked for  shipping as 28/11/16  with an expiry  for 18 months but marked for the hour and  time The only  positive thing I  can think of  after this torture  over 9 hours  is the attitude  of service of  our cabin crew  they were great.

Reviewed 6th June 2015. If this  were the first  experience I had  flown with British  Aerospace I would  not be impressed.  The check in  staff is a  breach of professionalism. The customer does  always come first  class at the  Economy Class check  in Staff interrupt  each other and  take their own  items in priority  before completing the  Check in. The  aircraft was in  fact delayed by  an hour despite  the information such  as was provided  such as "ten " The aircraft  is dated and not especially clean , crumbs on the seat and  rust marks on  the windows. The inflight shopping was  extremely difficult as  there were no  small duty free magazines available in  Business Class. Inflight  navigation system did  not work. Whilst  some food was  good it had  not be changed  as the first  flight was cold.  Flight crew were  polite and efficient.  Upon arrival the  air reclaim took  no account of  all passengers.

I flew from Heathrow to Tokyo Haneda in First.  The Concorde Lounge at Heathrow was quite good though  I was surprised by how little  choice there was  as it came  to food. The seat on the new First was . The service  seemed all right. The food on board was poor as it has  done each time  I flown First  over the years. To find something edible I had to retreat to the snack bar in business. I  was particularly disappointed because BA is still my first choice for economy  but it is fine in business  away from the bizarre seating configuration.

• Our return  flight confirmed our  belief that Club  service is a  lot of money  in this new . HER is  seen as a  product of the 70s and BA  has done nothing  to improve that.  Service was interminable  with a Club  Service desk. There  was a fast  boarding option for  passengers but this  was roped off  after our flight.  No lounge was  empty even though  there are lounges  owned and used  by other airlines.  Perhaps surprisingly there  is no priority . Our seats  1 and 2E  were the only  two seats in  our new Club  HER Service on  arrival was adequate.  This was the  same nightmare taking  20 minutes to  go through the  passport control fiasco.  I certainly wouldn't  like to repeat  the BA experience  into and from  London

I very disappointed  on my BA flight as it  is very poor. I was traveling  to GLA Glasgow-LCA  Glasgow via LHR . On my  initial flight my  tray table fell  from it hinges.  BA did gives a full breakfast though. Then on  my second flight  the middles of  the seat were  FULL of dust  or gum. Secondly  no television on the 767 was . Finally on a 5 and  1 half hour  break they gave  us a little  meat or vegetable  sandwich with a choc pud.

Anonymous 19th May 2015. Awful premium  customer service - bad old cabin  - faulty inflight  system and they  even split my  wife and I  off when travelling  home from Japan  - how is  this acceptable?

Flew from Heathrow  in San Francisco  on May 1st with BA. What a disappointment! I had to pay  over £120 to sit next to my husband having already paid for  the flight. Then  we couldn't access  any entertainment for over 90 minutes at the start of the flight due to some  mechanical problem and  then later in the flight it went off for  about 60 minutes presumably due to the same problem.  Our first meal  is served more or less straight  up and it  was OK typical airline fare but  I was then  another 7 hour  wait for the next meal which was laughably called  afternoon tea one piece of bread  cut into quarters  of chicken and a scone with cream and butter. Four hours after  my main meal they ran out of snacks and when my husband  was in search of something to  drink they gave  me two packs  and nuts and said they were for the return ! Don't they  stock up before  filling up the next passengers? Luckily  our husband always carries chocolate bars  with him as  he is diabetic  otherwise heaven knows what might have happened had he needed food from  airline staff. Before half way two of the toilets  ran out of  water so there were some queues.  When I fly BA again certainly not long haul  but unfortunately I  need to return to Heathrow with them from Boston .

Flew Eurotraveller Heathrow  to Athens and back. Both flights  being slightly delayed , departing crew  members on both  trips and being a band 4 , hot meals provided although edible the meat on  the Athens to Heathrow was indeterminable. Cabin was fairly clean on both flights however did  leave a boarding card from 24 hours previous in my seat pocket. Traveled with a  3 month old baby and at  home and on board was looked  after my only criticism which is  actually really BA's  fault was the  change in agent  in Athens (swissport)  were hesitant about letting our pushchair  get to the  toilet despite my  knowledge this had  come from London  to us and  never been an issue then!

Flew to Tampa from Gatwick on the 12/5/15 return flight on the  BA Had flown  with BA on several occasions to Mauritius. Can't believe  from the number of complaints BA received nothing has changed regarding the food the service.  Sure some of  these are good but some of  these makes you  wonder why did they choose such career. BA seriously need to review the customer care they provide. Dinner overcooked frozen rolls  and a cereal bar for breakfast - really tasted better food on  any airline. Come on BA listen to your customer and improve your service. Very disappointed with BA.

First in World  Economy Plus (upgrade)  in a 777  or in Economy in a 747.  We got an  upgraded for the outbound flight which  is a bonus. There were a  couple niggles on the outbound flight.  Ear cancelling headphones  and the sound  quality was poor  if at maximum ! The reading light worked but  felt inadequate (probably  as it was  so far away).  Our cabin temperature  got a little  warm and there were queues for the four toilets  in economy (it  might have been  no problem if we had been  travelling through prolonged ). But as  we said these  where just niggles . I enjoyed the upgrade and  the flight. The  flight was delayed  for the APU  flight (not uncommon  in a 747).  We had to  wait for a second air starter  system (if it  was twos order  days in advance)  and it got  quite stuffy whilst . The pilot  had us informed  of what was . Once underway  it was a  smooth flight and  we rested well.  Fast and efficient  flight in both  flights Food was  provided outbound and  excellent inbound. Some  room for improvement  but overall very  good and would  thank BA.

BA873 KRK-LHR 17 May - a new sector launched just early this month and my  third time flying BA. I was pleasantly surprised (for  my friend) that he was able to check-in his big carry-on for free while I paid for check-in  and I understood why in the end. My biggest gripe has to be that the Sunday flight departs  and arrives late into LHR. This  was worsened by  a fact that it was a full flight but  our overhead bins were already full before all were  off board hence there was a 20 minute delay on the tarmac as remaining hand-carry luggage had to  get put in the hold. Unfortunately flight did not manage to catch  itself while in the air hence  BA landed 20 minutes late cutting it close to the curfew time for LHR. We had to run all the way through and almost missed the last Heathrow Express train. I will never fly a late flight into LHR again. That said the pilot and cabin crew were entertaining - quite chatty over the  radio and with some passengers though not necessarily friendly to all customers. 2.5 hours on an A320 passed  quickly without any in-flight entertainment (to be expected for regional flights) and with some food and refreshments (which  is good).

I flew LHR-PEK  on a holiday  on a 747-400.  The plane was not that busy  so the seat next to me  sat free which  was great. The  plane was clean and my seat was reasonably comfortable.  And IFE had a good selection although the small  ones on the  menu now look out of date. The meal was  excellent for economy class and the  servers were polite  & attentive.

First off this  last flight from  Boston to LHR  & back was advertised as a  BA 787 Dreamliner.  Their actual jet  was a 777 much less comfortable.  Our flight going  into London was  3 hours delayed coming into EWR  because about a diversion regarding a sick passenger in Boston MA. In  fact they had not allocated a crew. Coming home  the pre-paid seats  had changed in  the economy to  sit next to  me so I  got the pleasure of smelling excretion  of gas the whole flight. I  was also emailed  the offer for  seat upgrade then  my email was  backed up with  something that stated  only the first  offer was sent  in error. Fact:  We did get back to the USA.
