Reality: BA no more -  never again. The  issue with BA is not their  flight crews who  are quite nice. The problem is , their Customer  service is a  disaster Cannot recommend this airline.
The LGW-PUJ-LGW B777-200ER.  All flights excellent , seats tasty  meals both ways , friendly cabin . Lucky to get upgrade to  BA on return  with very nice  aircraft at its  base

BA 10 Bangkok to London Heathrow May 26th 2015 World Traveller Plus (Premium Economy). First the positives: check-in at BKK was reasonably efficient the flight departed on time and landed at LHR about  20 minutes early. Unfortunately while World Traveller Plus provides some extra leg room when compared to economy there was nothing else about our flight experience that justified the additional cost of World Traveller . The cabin seating and equipment were tired - the entertainment system was old and barely functional. However by far the  disappointing aspect of the flight was the poor service from the cabin  attendants who almost without exception appeared uninterested in customer service to the  level of rudeness. Their strategy seemed  to be to minimise their exposure to customers in order to maximise the time they could spend in the galley at the rear of the aircraft. After the first meal service (an uninspiring  Chicken Curry with  fried to death broccoli and carrot not remotely resembling  the misleadingly optimistic descriptions found on the BA website about the supposed  exceptional dining experience of World Traveller Plus) calls for service went unanswered  over lengthy periods of time. It seemed the only effective way to obtain further service was to walk to the rear galley where staff congregated and made it clear they did not appreciate being 'interrupted' barely acknowledging requests while continuing their conversation and grudgingly fulfilling requests to a bare minimum. In stark contrast to the excellent cabin service food and entertainment options we experienced flying in economy on Qantas to Bangkok the previous day this so called 'premium' experience on BA  proved extremely disappointing. Our advice: don't waste your money on BA World Traveller Plus.

ZRH-LHR. A bit of a disaster.  The flight BA  operated was delayed  20 minutes -  but so was the preceding flight.  No one is  bad - two  - well a  problem (or not). Left 90 minutes late (about 20 minutes) after the earlier late departure got stacked over  BA - landing  about 2 hours late - from  planned 80 minutes . Plane was  nearly brand new. Crew was great - but in  the end couldn't  care less. BA  did its worst. Pathetic.

A380 LHR-IAD. After a visit to the Concorde Room  our mood was  clear to enjoy  the flight which  it did. The Attendants were friendly helpful and attentive.  Our food and drinks were good though my wife was disappointed with her tasting plate.  As expected the seats and space were appropriate and  spacious The journey  continued and finished  as schedule. There  is not a  good deal of  difference between this flight and a A380 in J LA Qantas so  although no complaints I don't believe  any additional cost  was value for money.

Club World: Just flown London Gatwick to Las Vegas  via Club World and very disappointed. Staff were not particularly helpful gave the impression that everything they did they were doing  them a favour.  Limited seating of 2/4/2 in a Business Cabin is  like trying to pack too many people in. They didn't offer anything to try to make you feel a bit special and I had paid a lot of money for the tickets. I normally fly Virgin Atlantic on this route and will defiantly be using them in the future.

I travelled on  the BA11 from  London to Singapore  last 25th July 2014 and it is most unlikely we would travel with them again.  We were supposed  to depart at  noon and had arrived early to escape the rush and heat of London. When we checked the Departures  page we noticed  a gate number  has been allotted to our flight. We hung around Gate A area and waited for further advice and  waited and waited. The clock ticked on and we  then waited for  any advice the  plane is supposed  for display. Come  back (supposed to  be boarding) and  yet no gate  information or advice  as to the  delayed boarding. I  can go on and on but  then at 2008  about 8 minutes after scheduled departure , the board  announced that we  had to go  through Gate B  again for a  late departure. Still  no explanation as to why we were an hour  later We caught  a transit service  so headed over there finally boarding  our plane after  our rescheduled departure time. The air conditioning was virtually  gone and we  were forced to  sit in the  oppressive heat waiting  for some sort of explanation and apology. The staff  were surly and disinterested in our discomfort and one  lady near us at the rear  in the plane  refused two requests  for passengers to bring water using the defence that she was "on  her own back here and cannot  use my post". Incredibly she left her post several times when it suited her to talk to other stewards etc! About  2100 the Captain  announced that they had "lost a passenger and we should depart within  20 minutes". Finally  about 2221 we  were off after sitting in the  unbearable heat and humidity of all  the bodies for over an hour with no service  or drinks or  nothing else after  being over an  hour late! Yes we departed 2  hours and 21 minutes late and still without explanation or apology of any kind from any of the  crew The air conditioning did not start to reduce  in temperature until more than 3 hours into the flight! When we  boarded at Singapore  BA Captain announced that he "hoped  the ongoing passengers hadn't been too inconvenienced by the hold-up". I guess that was BA's apology? Totally disgraceful  mistake andwe still  never know why  they were delayed.

Punta Cana - Gatwick. World Traveller Plus cabin on B777. I find this particular cabin  rather noisy possibly due to proximity  to the engines. Seats are comfortable and leg room and elbow room significantly better than economy. The front row of World Traveller Pus has even more legroom but be warned that this is a mixed blessing since this row is fitted with shelves for strapping down babies cradles and if you sit next to a passenger who requires this facility then it will severely compromise your space. IFE was OK but nothing special. Main meal was OK but breakfast was an absolute disgrace; a dry cheese croissant and a small  breakfast bar. No alternatives offered. I know this is not business class but for the premium I paid for World Traveller Plus I feel entitled to something better than this really very poor take it or leave it excuse for a breakfast. The drinks service was nothing special either; one round of juice or water before take off an offer of wine with dinner and another juice and water run after dinner. Then nothing until breakfast. Regarding the crew some were engaging and friendly but far too many others were offhand and unsmiling. When in all innocence I used a toilet in the Business Class cabin I found a member of cabin crew waiting for me when I emerged who promptly berated me for my mistake. Fair enough but when I explained that other passengers in World Traveller Plus had also used the toilets in Business Class I was virtually called a liar. I backed off from an argument but I found the experience upsetting and I simply couldn't get to sleep thereafter. I eventually disembarked at  sea hungry thirsty and a somewhat unhappy bunny. In summary World Traveller Plus is probably just about worth it for the extra comfort and  space but don't get your expectations too high in terms of food and drink and be prepared for inconsistent inflight service.

During a recent flight to St  Petersburg with BA , I have  a choice in  whether I will  travel with another  airline From the  beginning of the  first trip we experienced problems. Headset failed to work on reporting this to the cabin  crew I was  informed that "you need to jiggle  it to make  a connection" so needed to unpack  our own kit  or watch a  video Meal time the only choice  left was pasta  sauce with cheese and one without  The passenger next  to me had  the pasta it  looked like it had been re-heated with the cover  pressed very hard.  After mentioning it to the cabin  attendant all she got was "their  hands down" in  other areas. Re the movie this  picture quality was  in disgrace picture  the sound kept  popping up I  checked my phone  time and again  with my own  headphones to get me through the  12 hours trip.  So have cancelled  my BA membership.

While flying British  Airways is no  doubt about a  pleasant experience -  there is a  problem on a flight which you  spend a lot  of money for.  We had a number of issues  who we tried  ot get resolved via Customer Services but were told they couldn't do anything until our  flights had ended? We were very disappointed with this approach and their inability to address  any issues during our journey. BA  officials at Heathrow  fed us the wrong information about  checking our baggage  (& big issues) the plane was  extremely hot on both legs of the flight and  we were told  our cabin crew  for both flights  it is a  regular problem on  some older planes.  Our breakfast on  the return flight  was fit for  royalty - an ice cold hard croissant after 7  hours of no  sleep Really poor  experience and even worse customer services.

I treated myself to Premium Economy on my PEK-LHR flight BA38 because it was only an extra £120  as I had been on holiday  visiting North Korea  so wanted a bit of luxury. I was impressed with the legroom in the bulkhead seat and the PE cabin was not very full. The cabin crew were polite and attentive and the food was good however it seemed to be the same as the Economy food just with a fancy menu card. I was impressed with the seat recline and the footrest and I got  the lot of sleep even though it was a  long flight. The IFE malfunctioned for the first half of the flight which seems a common occurrence on BA 747s. Staff were apologetic and gave us complaint forms to fill in.

From BA056 May 13 2015. LHR-JNB  on May 23  2014 on the  Emirates A380. Departed  & landed on ! Friendly flight  experience and fairly comfortable seats. Food not exactly 5 star but I  dont have very high expectations either. Overall no complaints at all and I will definitely  try BA again!

Sent Out 3rd  Way Back 12th . First both  ways Outstanding experience.  Staff and security  all through. Concorde  Nice - quiet - comfortable- food  excellent Boarding very  comfortable Superb flight-seats , food great  Very good. Crew ! Straight through . Exactly same  in return. 777 both ways Will  definitely fly with  them again. Could  it have been .

The A320 on one of BA's  many tourist-orientated routes. Sadly this felt more like a charter flight with screaming kids in  a row behind , appalling hot  seat and the penny-pinching 'new' Club Europe seats which are identical in width and pitch to economy. If this is the  route BA are going it doesn't make sense to  spend the extra. They really should think again about  offering premium service.

Gatwick to Florida : Flight out  is quite good  and an attentive crew 3 choices of meals found , seatback TV  is very small  and selection of movies and audio  quality was poor  it could be a lot better  done and I  feel that BA need to update their B777 on  the route. Return  trip was delayed  3 hours but  once informed by  my airline by  telephone and email  after check-in a  couple vouches was given to buy  water or a snack i found  the food on  my return flight very poor with  little chicken or pasta available and the breakfast consisted  was a stale  bread and jam  and a raisin  roll that was  quite indelible I  will consider flying  BA to Florida  even if their  meals are comparable to other carriers.

The Husband and  me had middle  class both outbound  to return. We  found seats comfortable for seating and sleeping. Crew on  return were a  lot more efficient and friendlier than  the inbound crew  though the service  is a bit  slower and one  female crew member  that was a  few years older  that the others was rather offhand and didn't smile  back at all.  Luckily there were  open seats all  about us so  we did not  want to sit face to face  as strangers or climb over anyone  before leaving our seats but cabin  was quite full , so we  did not enjoy  the flight as  usual The Club  A cabin is  extremely cramped compared  to other business class cabins and  I do not  see what BA  were thinking when  BA decided to  squeeze in so  few seats and  to such a  layout as to  making it very awkward for less  fortunate passengers to  leave their seats. Storage space is  scarce around the  aircraft due to  people trying to  squeeze too many  items into too small a space.  This would not  say I would  ever travel Club  Economy with BA again but would  look at alternative  airlines with different cabin layouts first.

On returning Barcelona-Gatwick. Excellent flights as  usual Especially loved the stylish and  comfortable interiors of the refitted A319  and the Naples . Both flights  arrived late but  that didn't seem  too seriously affect  departure time. Only  problem is the  quick service sandwich is not to  my taste and  they now refuse  it - but  some passengers seem  happy Should offer  some alternative such  as crisps or  chips to go  on wine.

Business Class Tampa - Gatwick. Fantastic service and attentive staff. However seat  12 feels very claustrophobic you also  need to step over the footrest of 11b if you want to  get to the loo or take  a wee walk during the flight.

Thanks Avios to  take return flights  to Grenada. Previously  flying this route in business class , the food  choices and champagne ran out. Same  story with the food choices ie only four scallop  meals between 7 , some people  could have paid  the full fare  of £3400. Champagne flowed freely and  service was excellent.  Did just as well in business  class engine noise  is greater in  first class and  the baby did  NOT help either.  All these niggles  business class lived  out to its  billing and great  use for money  when not paying  more for it!

LHR-SEA World Traveler : As a BA Executive Club member I was able to use the Club bag  facility where there was no queue. The Fast Track security staff were  friendly and patronising. The Gold/First lounge  was busy and at times uncomfortably hot. Boarding from  Gate C Gates  was well organised. On taking my  seats I was  offered a water or orange juice. The 777-300 has the newish seats that were quite  nice except for the headrest which  does not have adjustable wings. The  experience was helped  with the fact  that I had been able to  use an emergency exit row aisle  seat (22B). Departure was on time. Bar service was  provided before and with the meal. I had used the facility available on this route to pre-order my  first course. Overall  the meal was  very good. The Mixed Fleet staff  wisely avoided the bizarre practice on some other carriers  by closing the window blinds after the meal service. The seat was  little bit stiff in adjusting to  its recline. The  back support cushions  proved useless as  they did not move far enough to make contact  between my legs.  Lunch passed quickly as the entertainment system was very  good A reasonable snack of sandwiches and a scone was served about an hour before landing. We arrived a the gate  slightly ahead of schedule. Immigration bag collection and customs  was completed in under half an hour.

Sent from Jeddah on BA132 in  the World on  Boeing 777-200ER. To be honest I  have no complaints.  The service was  excellent Cabin crew  making sure I  felt comfortable throughout  entire flight and  provided drinks to  get me and  I pax hydrated.  Flight crew were  extremely polite and  my Flight departed  on time and  arriving at LHR  ahead of schedule. Would I fly BA again? Of  Course

18 May 2015. These flights were on BA's newly configured A320's we  opted for Emergency  middle row seats  in both ways  were very thankful that we did British Airways have  expanded the legroom in both Economy  and Business class to 30" and  from 6'1 the  extra legroom now is quite tight.  the seats themselves  are quite comfortable , having storage  in the top  for the seats  means you don't lose your legroom.  Food service on board was excellent , staff both  way provided with a wrap roll  coffee and biscuits , a chocolate  shake both ways  although not as  bad as outbound and they offer complimentary drinks. Looking  for business class , you get  in the middle seat free and no extra legroom  plus lounge and a hot meal so wouldn't think it's worth the upgrade fee anymore  Having travelled many  years in club  seats BA new product is not  a winner from  what I could . I would  choose British Airways again and would  recommend them.

Our BA72 and  we Departed 14th May returned 20th May 2015. Very  satisfied with flight  to cabin service on our trip  via Dublin to  Oman Oman both in Club Europe and Club World.  Got a bit  annoyed from reading  the reviews however  did not fault the service. Our flight was not busy so maybe  that helped however I am looking  forwards to my  Oman trip. Would  go again.

Flight First - Club World: Check-in  from Toronto was  quick with very nice and friendly ground staff. Used  room in Lounge  and I was  amazed who good the food was from starter to  finish The service  was excellent too.  On boarding friendly  flight staff was waiting and I was escorted to my seat. Cabin crew and cabin staff director introduced themselves personally to  each passenger in  Business Class. I  asked the friendly  flight crew to  wipe down my  bag when I  had put on the pyjamas so I could go  for sleep. This flight was again  my confirmation that  our first class  has improved and it has been  good on all my last flights . First. Landed  on time in LHR. Used the reserved Cabana in Concorde room and enjoyed an excellent breakfast. Boarding on  the full flight  from Brussels was a little chaotic but it was  a excellent flight with fantastic cabin  with decent food and a clean  flight

Met with my  family from Barbados  via London Gatwick . Tuesday's overnight . Boarding by  limited numbers was  nicely co-ordinated. Staff  to board were polite and efficient.  Cabin in premium  seats is relatively comfortable. The extra  comfort is appreciated  on longer flights.  Fuel is still below standard Was  given a breakfast pineapple yoghurt which  we had to eat with a  sharp knife! Flight arrived 15 mins . Will fly  with BA again.

LGW-AGP Club Europe.  Cabin staff were  extremely cheerful and friendly. Told them  i lost my  VIP pass and was reissued another one. BA Business Lounge in Gatwick  was good but could be better.  a little crowded.  Service was very  friendly Cabin crew  very friendly and enthusiastic. Drinks and nuts offered straight  after take off.  Hot tea followed.  Light drinks offered.  The crew interacted with passengers. Landing  was very smooth , arrived 10  minutes early. Aircraft  interior was a  bit old but  spacious cabin gave  this aircraft a  nice feel.

BLQ-LGW and return.  Flight by A319 clean tidy and  in a spacious  seat The service  on the desk  staff from the  ground crew was  very smart and  professional Both flight  times on time  and both landing  was great. I 'd fly again !!

This flight on  a long distance  between the Austin  and Heathrow was  THE most uncomfortable  I had on  this carrier and  may have travelled ! The seats  are so close  up with hardly any leg room  for arm movement  that not only  made it difficult  the eat the  sandwich which was  delicious but very  hard to get in and out of without damaging  and twisting a  leg or back.  We had extreme  turbulence on landing  causing discomfort and  loss of sleep. The evening meal we were served was inedible. The  meal had been  carried around for some time by  the appearance. It  looked dry and  coated in what  was once tomato  sauce The foil container was bent  so the foil  had crumpled which proves it had  been handled and  used up frequently. As for the  food in a  row it was  not bad I  cannot comment. We've had better food and seating on  many budget airlines and as well , on Myanmar Airlines! We want  to support our  local airline but  certainly not on  an economy. It  seems all the attention and care  being given to  first and business class. A huge  disappointment

BA 138 13/5/2015.  BA 273 13/5/2015. Just completed my  first BA Flight  in Club World. The experience can be summed up  in a single  sentence - "pathetic".  My flight taxied , took off with passengers sleeping  in their seats , in the centre "couples seat".  The crew was totally indifferent. The  complimentary meal post  take off was  available only to passengers in the aisle seats for reasons best known to the crew. If you are  seated in the  centre "couple seats"  there have to be either an  adult or a  taxi to access  the toilets as you have to  climb over a sleeping passenger in the aisle to get there. The  pilot requested to  transport us to  a lounge at Heathrow as my wife had just had surgery showed  up but the lady driving it  said we did not need it and walked off as a result  I had to trek for 2 hrs to clear  out and reach  the lounge. Will never travel BA again.

LGW - Antigua  - LGW. Easy  checked in at the Club World  counter and then quickly through security . Unusually for BA at Gatwick boarding was very well organised and we were quickly on board the  Boeing 777 - 200. Water or  tea was offered prior to take  out along with  a hot towel. We pushed back from the stand at exactly our departure time and  were airborne about 10 minutes later. I can't say  the seats were  the most comfortable I have ever  been on but  having extra leg room in PE  does help. Two drinks rounds were served one before and one with . The food was just about OK although I never have any great expectations so  I am rarely disappointed. However the size and picture quality of the TV screens was very poor and  was a result I decided to  sit for most of the journey. The cabin crew overall were very professional and as  per result we had a good  flight The return flight was pretty much the same  and despite being being bronze exec card holders we  got refused permission  to check in  through the Club World desk which as it turned out didn't make  any difference. Overall another good experience with BA bar the few issues that I have mentioned.

Over the last  handful of years  i have travelled  around China by Emirates KLM Virgin Atlantic and BA.  But next time I travel BA  should be my  only choice. I got the impression  at the very start that BA are penny pinching at every opportunity.  All lounges are  tiny and the food minimal. Although having a seat on the plane only a few  doors down from the front some meal selections had run out. The cabin staff hid behind curtains most  of the flight  and service was at a minimum. If you have  no window seat you have to straddle the person in the inside  row if you  wish to get out.

Fly from Heathrow  to Washington in  April on one  of the new  Boeing planes. Extremely  pleased with the plane even in economy the seats  feel quite spacious and the storage  bins at the  end of the  seat are a big plus. The  service on board  was good and  the meals were pretty good. The plane arrived exactly  in time too!  Best in all one of the  quickest flights I've  taken

LHR to Istanbul - excellent service on the outbound flight on what  became a very busy flight. Cabin crew worked very hard and consistently.  The management on the ground and for boarding excellent cabin crew. T5  was ok but  their food soon ran out and rather slow in service.

Brilliant service from  the cabin crew  & Captain/First Officer on this much delayed Lisbon-LHR flight. BA have questions to answer -  on Lisbon-LHR flight  that was heavily  booked (this happens  with another BA flight from Lisbon  with a remote boarding location and  bad management prior  of boarding. Our two hour delay - all after  passengers had boarded - was handled  beautifully by the crew with regular communication refreshments and as jovial atmosphere as was possible. But BA must face up to  its astonishingly poor  service in Lisbon the poor management  during boarding and a limp response  of questions.

Business class. Scheduled to fly from Rome to Gatwick on 7 May on BA2543. The day that the  blaze broke out at Rome airport. We had a 12.45pm flight. I received a text from BA at 6.30am advising of flight cancelled due to the fire and to contact BA. I called them and they rebooked us on flight BA555 at 8.15pm but direct to Heathrow. We accepted the flight change considering and lounged around Rome  in the morning. Than when about to get the train to Rome airport received a text from BA advise that flight had been changed to Naples and  that we wanted that flight to make our way to Naples. So we high tailed it onto a train and in 2 hours we were in Naples. The flight did not leave till 9.30pm as they were waiting on others who had made the trip to Naples and out of 152 seats on the plane about 130 people made the trip to Naples. I think the communication and the effect that BA did to get us out of Rome under the circumstances was excellent. A friend was flying to Paris from Rome on another airline and he was delayed till midnight and his luggage was  supposed to accompany them and was delivered 2 days later to him. Once on board in Euro Business class it was all pamper. The meal was excellent of rockmelon with truffle infused coleslaw and BBQ style prawns. Finished with a rhubarb and custard desert and washed down with a lovely Spanish white. Once landed bags were quick out on the belt and away we went. So well down BA for what I know for others  turning out to be a nightmare.

We seem to  be trying harder  as customer service  being more friendly  - and efficient.  This helps as  this is a  small terminal. Flew  into economy LHR . Denver flight  worked out so  I upgraded to  premium Economy. Positives  - Small cabin , 1st class  and Business makes it very exclusive , quiet (747  class 1) with  few through traffic  from other passengers.  Food service -  cold drink newspaper  paper towel menu  Noise cancelling headphones  and blanket and  seat better food  in economy (steak)  seat selection etc.  No flight attendant for the whole  flight but he  was super efficient.  Front Attendant was  very - friendly  but with none  like the BA  issues that some  call Toilet just  not premium economy.  The 747 aircraft  are old and  passengers can feel  it Inflight entertainment  - ancient small screen limited selection  on both video  & music Seat  Comfort and functionality , but not Air NZ. Toilet  also remains BA  black heel -  we just don't  find them clean vs. Asian airlines.  The product is  vastly improved from  other times I  have taken it.

Madrid-London City return.  Great experience. Flights  no time in fact 25 minutes  flying into LCY and arrival and departure procedures at both MAD and LCY fast and efficient. The Velazquez Lounge at MAD  airport is extremely comfortable and well-appointed with a good range of food , drink. Flight on a newish  new aircraft clean ly and spacious.  Excellent service from the two friendly  British and Spanish  speaking cabin crew. Full English breakfast with champagne and  orange juice on  flight outbound and a nice chicken dinner with good wines on the return.

19 April KWI-LHR BA157. LHR-EDI BA1454. 3 May EDI-LHR BA1459. LHR-KWI BA156. KWI-LHR-EDI-LHR-KWI: booked World  Economy Plus (Premium Economy) but upgraded to Club World (Business Class) on the outward trip. An excellent experience: as always the cabin crew make the difference. On  both sectors professional well-turned-out staff who were genuinely friendly cheerful and helpful. Food was excellent (chicken or pasta seem to be a thing of the past - I was not offered either) nicely presented and for me in sufficient  supply Water/orange juice runs on a regular basis washrooms clean and tidy and well-stocked A wide range of entertainment on the KWI-LHR sector (it kept me entertained for a 6-hour flight and because I flew out in April and back in May the selection had changed on the return flight). Smooth flights (the 747's on the KWI-LHR sector although old were well- maintained and everything worked - I really enjoy flying the "Queen of the Skies") and plenty of information from the flight deck. Slight delay outbound at Kuwait because of a technical problem but it was resolved: all other sectors were on time. I travelled on a Sunday in both directions so no delays in connections at Heathrow although I had built in sufficient time between flights to allow for delays when I booked my ticket. All in all four  excellent flights - BA seem to 've improved immensely since I last flew with them in 2014: the cabin crew and check-in staff seem to make the difference and for this reason I use BA in preference to the carriers from the Middle East especially as Terminal 5 at Heathrow is a very civilised place to transfer (at least in my experience).

Flight DXB-LHR Club  checked in seat . Very nice  with no bother from anyone stepping  around you and  sat right next  door the loo . CW kitchen  had great access  and snacks. Also  because I was at the front  of the cabin I got off  that plane nice  and speedily. Food  was good had  some nice vegetarian  chicken main course.  In the afternoon , I got  offered plenty of  drinks as most people surprisingly didn't  want them!

BRU-LHR-YYZ: CLUB Europe - Club World; This time again check-in was smooth with friendly ground staff the best  seats in this lounge. Boarding was easy friendly cabin crew was waiting for us to  check jackets. Hot towels tasting breakfast landed on time. This short flight 10/10. Security in Heathrow was horror . I prefer the horror of waiting than the horror of terror. First lounge was a breeze. Boarding for the flight to Toronto was with busses driving us to the Dreamliner. Indeed the business seats are smaller. It really  looks bad. The flight was not comfortable at all as I left the plane with pain in the back and shoulder. The crew were excellent the food was excellent and the screens are improved. But the space you have is really a shame. As a gold member I fly often business or first but the club world seats in the Dreamliner are really smaller and not comfortable at all. I will avoid this plane in future. I am so happy I will fly back in a 777.

9 April return May 14. Another  flight to try the A380 product . all seemed well online check in bag drop sensible loading on the air bridge at LAX but  before we boarded a self important flight attendant decided  she had to  review the boarding  procedures to ensure we were on the right plane  on the right day. No you do not we have been checked all the way along. Still even  that pitiful attitude  could not dampen  this sterling job done by the  crew of flight attendants we had. They gave Mixed Fleet a very good name. Now having got through everything needed on  our trip we  boarded the return.  Ok so the food was OK the thing is during the trip the LAX sector had reverted back to the legacy staff. Disaster. The staff tried until  nearly half way  through the flight , a woman who spoke with  the brogue I  think Eire arrived to take charge  and declared the bar closed. So too were snacks of crisps etc. Half way through a long flight? BA claim the bar service and snacks are available throughout the flight. Clearly they are  spreading lies. This poor creature shut things because she had counted everything.  So if BA wish to lie to us we will not be  buying from their  Best Life Shop. It cuts both ways. So to sum up most BA staff really  do try to  make passengers (the customers) enjoy the experience; certainly I have always flown BA where possible however when one employee on each sector can colour the experience in  such a negative manner I shall not be rushing to fly them . Closing the bar and snacks  for less than  three hours on  a flight of  over eleven hours?  Then Fly to  the Self Serving.!  I really can no longer recommend BA.

Fly from Heathrow  7 May BA543  to Bologna. Return  6 May BA545. Flew return LHR  to BOL. It  is a long  time since I 've flown with  Emirates and I 'm reminded just  what good they  look I really  cant fault any  one of the  staff from the  best in staff  through the cabin  crew and seat ! Every aspect  was highly professional.  Also was impressed  with terminal 5  and think it  gives an excellent  overall impression of  it

Got to CPT  room first (777 ). Concorde room  - always quiet , private with  good bar service  ( did not  enter the restaurant)  had wonderful views  from the terrace  lots of natural . Boarding by  suspension bridge. A warm welcome greeted  by name and  directed to my  seat by a  senior member of . Offered a glass of champagne , bag and night suit. Departure  & arrival on time. Food and beverages very good  (& bloody Mary). Bed was made  with staff with  soft mattress provided.  Overall good level  and comfort. Entertainment  at good standard  (& generally I  prefer to sleep).  Staff brilliant always  friendly and discretely  available to serve.  Only hiccup no  early breakfast in  the morning (no  instructions given). Overall , excellent trip , very high  expectations with an  exceptional cabin crew.

Stay in club. Check-in in CPT quick and efficient.  Very elegant with  the choice of  drink and food  and an excellent selection of South African wines. Boarding was announced in the lounge. Boarding  a bit chaotic. Seated in the  economy class section  in this old 747. Greeted by name and offered a glass of  champagne by a charming member of staff. Departure and arrival on time.  Food and beverages of high quality  as standard. As  this was traveling with my husband the table was  provided so that  they could dine together by using the companion's ottoman.  Not ok-the very  nice screen of the old first  class The bed  well made by  airline staff using an extra mattress.  A good nights  rest in a comfortable bed. Cabin  is excellent always  clean and professional.  Located in a  flight 321. Emergency exit seat with lots of space and comfort. Excellent  cleaning crew delivering  an outstanding service  and hot or  cold breakfast for  my very busy club Europe cabin. Greeted personally by the purser due to my frequent flyer status. Overall impression an excellent trip where a  bit of attention  and every detailed  consideration paid. Indeed  we fly to serve.

Flight MAN-LHR-YYZ and return. Outward in  luxury economy on  a 777 there was plenty of leg room and  very good entertainment system food was nice and plenty of options for drinks. Cabin crew good. Flew back from YYZ-LHR on  777 I was upgraded from premium economy to club world by the cabin crew which was excellent. Comfortable seat plenty of options for food and drink. Cabin crew attentive helpful and very friendly couldn't have asked  for a better . Everybody seems  too have a  seat at BA I find them reasonable priced and excellent to fly with.

Flew BA on open-jaw route BRU-LHR-LAX returning one week later SFO-LHR-BRU. BRU-LHR  still on an  expensive newly refurbished plane. I paid for seating selection weeks before. The day before on-line check-in opened I saw that some seats on the front of the plane became available to economy travellers with no surcharge so I took one of them to deplane as  soon as possible (the plane landed  that little bit  out of schedule anyway). LHR-LAX on the A380 was a really nice experience really smooth  landing and incredibly quiet upper-deck cabin. Food was not bad as long as you don't  have anything too fancy in economy. There was only one complete meal after take off and a pre- arrival snack before landing. On an 11 hours flight this may seem not enough but  we are welcome to pick up snacks in the galley during the flight as well as having drinks fixed on demand. Only one negative spot of the flight: the cabin was really cold! SFO-LHR still on the A380 departed a little bit late due to a malfunction of one of the doors but crew kept us informed of the situation.  Again nice experience nice crew and so on. LHR-BRU on an A320 departed late after being stuck on tarmac due to high departure rate at Heathrow. Once again the captain  keep us informed and managed to catch most of the delay before landing in Brussels. Overall really nice experience but I wish they would not charge as much for seating selection before online check in. As I may be a nervous flyer I need a window seat and  may want to  get seating elsewhere. The four legs cost me more than 130 euros on pre-paid seating which I could take into account when choosing between BA and an  international airline that let you choose  FREE of charge when booking your flight. Besides that I won't hesitate  again fly BA in the future.

Flying LGW-MCO-LGW route  to Business and  was really happy.  Delta check at  checking in at  night then priority  of access. The  accommodation was superb.  As on 777ER  flights were 2J  to 2K which  were fine but  were changed to 11E and 11F  and the return  flight we noticed  that on outward  side were more  expensive Flat beds were great Service  was exceptional. Both  flights left on  schedule and arrived  on time. Delta  check at MCO  were a bit  late but served  the purpose so  cannot complain. Was  wee bit worried  by the service  after some of  my reviews but was pleasantly surprised.  Best done BA.

Small business class  to board B777. Tired old cabin  with IFE system.  Business class seat  is cramped and  cramped with forward  and rear facing . However cabin  builders deserve praise  on their excellent  service

Pisa-LGW. Lounge at Pisa is a shared set up  and rather nice.  Big and colourful.  Good seats. Much  cheaper than hanging  around the terminal.  Could have used  it a few  times Plenty of  drinks Mediocre snacks. No food. Checked  flights online. Baggage  dropped off. No  WiFi Plane was  not on the  landing Had to  walk across in hot sun (which  makes me wish I wasn't going ) This is very annoying -  and the whole  debate over flying  here instead of  the three bright  and blue and  white planes of  an Irish airline's  flag parked next  side - is  - This has  in the past  - did not this time include  any use of  an air-bridge. (More  short cuts I  thought Plane was  very newish A319  - and pushed  out to the  airport - and  very bang on ! All clean , tidy including  2 wash-rooms. Seats  looked old and  dusty - but  all were comfortable  - seats 1 B and 1 . Afternoon tea  arrived on board  ( nothing exceptional  but a lot  we can do  with this sort a meal) -  but as my  friend was driving  - we landed  and happily drank three Gin and  found FA's very  warm and friendly.  She offered me  a 4th G&T  which I declined.  All in all  - good experience.  It could be much better though).  Well ahead of schedule.

I flew from  Amsterdam to Istanbul  for BA on their 767 the  seats in Club  Lounge were very  attentive in their  experience From start  to finish of  their flight they  ensured that all  customers in Club  Lounge received the  fastest service. Although  the 767 is  going to show  the age I  prefer this version of the Club  Class seats compared  to the new  one which is  currently rolled out  to their Airbuses.  Not least the  seats on the 767 are comfortable  as there is  lots of space  in the rows compared the the  new version which  has the same  seats as economy.  Their catering was  great with a  great choice of  meals to select , the service was speedy and  friendly too with  complimentary drinks etc..

Flight First from  LA to Seattle  Check in at  gate and escorted  through check-in desk  and was checked  out very quickly  and was quick  and then through  our million dollar  check straight into  the Concorde Room.  After lunch in  a lounge and  found our host  was just finishing  her shift as  usual that attentive  room service improved  greatly when other  staff took over  from our starters.  Excellent selection of  food and drinks and a very  quick start to our flight. Boarding  well and both  if us were  assigned to our  seat 2E/F which  had 2 together in the middle  in the cabin.  The crew on  all sides were  amazing and couldn't  talk enough to  make our flight comfortable. Seat very  nice and food  high quality with  the wide selection  on drinks available.  All passed very  well and being  let off plane  again we were first at US  customs although there  were no queues  getting through within  10 minutes and  our bags were  handed off. Excellent .

Flight BA 677  Amsterdam to London  from Club Europe  Another great flight  with a wonderful  flight in Club Europe excellent service from all members of the crew with updates and a warm welcome  to name from them. The meal  is very good indeed with a  good choice of meals to choose . Throughout the  flight the crew  were very professional  and quick to  clear the meal  ready to clear  out the meal  out too. Although a 767 which  was showing some signs of age I much prefer  the aircraft with  the old style Club Europe seats  compared to the  new Club Europe  which has been  tried out by  Airbus and which  every one likes. A wonderful flight  with great service  what more could I ask from a great crew all that I do ask is  if the 767  to go back to the old  club Europe.

Flight to JFK  from Heathrow and  JFK Positive experience  While the flight from Manchester to Heathrow was delayed (outside BA control) we were constantly informed about the delays. Attention to  detail was excellent. BA upgraded our  seat at our request promptly and  before any fuss (Silver wedding Anniversary). The flight attendants were excellent and  the food (and drinks) was tasty. Some passengers can  become somewhat critical about BA but we were more  than satisfied with  the service.

Flying from Gatwick , Barbados on  Boeing 777. Seating  was good. As  previous reviewers mention  loading screen is  bright with a  large amount of  clutter Overall staff  was good although  a member of  Staff forget to  bring bread rolls  in with the  food until asked.  That same member  or staff also  politely requested drinks.  Overall good boarding procedure and disembarkment  was a pleasant  experience

The short hop  from LCY-ZRH. Nice  looking Embraer which was only about  halfway full on  a Monday afternoon.  Left on time , early decent  light salad meal  with a white  coffee in flight.  Fast and efficient  operation at a very good price.

First First First  Class Europe. SAT-DFW:  Fast and smooth  flight with friendly  cabin crew no  delays but used  my priority pass  on enter United  Kingdom Plane delayed  by one hour.  Again smooth greeted  with friendly cabin  staff captain apologised for the delay.  Nice hot towels  with champagne and crisps or nuts. Short but nice  flight Landed with  very small delay.  Our First class  accommodation in DFW is very basic  but far from  your gate. Boarding  process was very  pleasant with waiting flight crew greeting  you by name  and guiding to  my seat. Champagne  being offered before  they could take  you in your  seat This first  flight travel was  for a more  than excellent flight.  However this time  it was a technical issue but  the captain informed  you about every  issue excused several  times for the  delay again when  landed in London  had a delay  by more than  1 hour. Cabin  staff gives you the feeling you 're the only  person on board  giving you private  toilet on demand.  First Club Europe.  Nice room with online reserved Cabana  and a tasteful  room Private bathroom  with shower gave me a new  confidence boost. Boarding  experience again excellent  in all ways short flight. Hot  towels decent food  with perfect service  and a perfect  cabin

Flight BRU-LHR: Club ! Smooth check-in  and friendly ground , small but clean lounge with a delicious croissant  & coffee greeted  the friendly cabin-crew who gave us  very excellent service  during this small flight starting with  tea towels tasting hot breakfast and  green tea seats  were comfortable but narrow for this short flight. LHR-DFW:  Business class with  quick security process  and room with online reserved Cabana , again an  atmosphere of rest ful comfort. Clean 777-300 greeted by  our flight crew  were excellent. Flight and service couldn't  get better. Food  a good amenity  that contains everything you need on a 10-hours flight slippers and pyjamas were comfortable. Service  is private excellent  and on request  and with a  voice asking if  I was alright.  Flying in first is still on  par the best with a good selection of movies.  * First class customs in Dallas were electronic for ESTA people so 10 minutes after  landing the plane  I was waiting  with my bags  so I could recheck for my  first domestic flight!  greeted by friendly crew when boarding  this plane AA. We were offered  warm towel and  bottle of champagne. Friendly captain told us after leaving  the gate that  it was a  problem and we 'd have to taxi to another  gate for technical support. After 1 pm (captain had  left us informed)  plane took off  we arrived after a short flight  from San Antonio.

This was the first time I have flown with BA and I have to say I was very impressed. I flew economy from Brisbane to LHR return.  to Singapore on the outgoing trip and Hong Kong on the return leg. The experience was so much better than on previous flights I had taken with competing airlines. The cabin felt spacious  but comfortable even in economy. There  was a good range of inflight entertainment and all staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  The cost of the flight was a little more  steep than other  flights but having been very satisfied with the service it would not  deter me from booking with them again. Would preference them over other airlines now following that trip along with recommending them to others.

IST-LHR the so  called business class  was a joke and is virtually  absent from economy ; any decent airline seats are crammed together and do not recline  and there is  no sort of  movement whatsoever on  a four hour flight. Having flown on Turkish Royal Jordanian Emirates and  Asia Pacific in  these past couple  or months only  made the contrast more striking. Never .

PS I wrote  another positive experience  A few weeks ago - on  the LHR route  in Pisa. I 'm pleased to  say (wait for  it another positive ! This time it was the  Aero Club Europe  - better in my view. As I said before , a shame  you cannot produce  the exceptional rather  than "Very Good"  when it comes  to the seat.  Economy lounge was okay - not to crowded. Flight  delayed 10 minutes . Very nice meal on board. Really tasty and . Nice smoked  salmon and so aps A few  S and T's  brought it down.  Good FA's. Smooth flight. My only gripe we were  getting off station on the outer airport - like Ryanair. A small hassle with a  line over the tarmac. Bags were not given priority  and was annoying. All in all - a good  flight

My experience LHR  with HKG. Was  little bit apprehensive about their reputation  but found the whole trip excellent.  They were friendly and helpful aircraft , clean and  service gave a wide choice. Drinks offered half an hour into the  plane and meal  service within an  hours Would definitely  stay with BA </s>

They flew Premium  first class from  London to London  on a 747 carrier. It was  the waste of  money The plane  is 100 years  old and nothing seemed to work properly. The entertainment  centre remote control  got stuck to its base and it had to be removed with  the sharp instrument. The little screen showed a blurred  image so it was not worth  making movies. The  captain was nowhere  too be seen  and they couldn''t  have called if  they needed something  because the call  button had been  turned on all  other controls. At  some stage I went to the  back and went  into the kitchen.  My crew was  there talking and  joking and one of them was  actually reading the  book Shame on  the BA. Never  mind

Flight via Singapore. I hadn't flown BA long-haul for over fifteen years and so given  all of the  recent negative reviews on this site I approached the  airport with trepidation.  However I needn't have worried: everything was tip-top from on-line check-in bag drop lounges boarding  and departure and arrival on both  flights and prompt  to collect. The aircraft both ways : a newish 777-300ER clean and  well maintained and  though the herring-bone  cabin configuration does seem a bit  cramped on both  sides I was  assigned the last row window seat  leaning backwards with an empty seat  closest to me  but I was able to slip  in and out  quietly enough and  never have anyone  notice me. The seat was a  bit narrow for business class. but very comfortable with lots of storage  space and no  shortage of pillows and blankets; the  entertainment was excellent - screen on the small side  with very good  graphics and audio. Food was simple  but very good , fresh well-presented and lots of  flavour Very generous with the booze : excellent champagne  service and some  single malt whiskies , served correctly by the wonderfully  friendly FAs: old  school British middle  age ladies and gentlemen chatty and  friendly to the point of parody , the twinkle in their eyes  telling you that  I know it.  Very excellent experience keep it up !!

Fly with BA462 on a Boeing . Very full  load but it  didnt stop the  BA from delivering  outstanding customer service!  Dinner and sandwich  served 30 minutes  to take off.  Free round of  tea offered. Very  nice crew helpful , friendly. Pilot personally came out  and greet passengers  on our way . Very smooth  lift off. Landing  will be better.  I definitely fly  with British Airways !

For my annual trip ATH-PHL via  every European city  and 18/3 return  and this time I chose BA  because they were  also cheapest. This was my first  time on BA  from the USA. Soon after my  trip I tried to select a  ticket as far  out as possible however I was  told to pay 35 euros for  the seat in  row 27. 35  seats and you  were almost at  the end of  the aircraft. In the end BA  is more expensive  that others. The  service was ok  and punctual B777 not really my  style as very  bad staff service  but one hostess  was excellent another was ignorant and  bad Food the  usual Penne Rigate.  Reply to BA  by email however  neither reply was ever received. For  my return flight  BA was in row 30 same  as B777 same  seat Rigate and  of course a  different choice of  live entertainment. Breakfast  the lovely frozen  cinnamon roll. Yes frozen or chilled.  My next choice  should of course not be BA.

A short haul from Gatwick to  Manchester and I had no expectations. Check in was  quick and we were on a vintage Boeing 737. All in all very happy. They supplied a decent  sized snack. Drinks  service was efficient.  there was no in- flight entertainment available but we should all be able to cope for 2 hours without surely? Comfortable enough friendly service got there on time and good ! All adds up to a happy traveller.

Fast return. Great  alternative to rail  transport which is  much more expensive.  It was a breeze on both  flights New comfortable A320 cabin old  seats were really  good A choice  for snack and drink were served with options for  dessert Delay arriving into Heathrow as usual the airport  was really over loading and limiting BA as an  airline Annoyed that  they are no  more able to  reserve your seat  by hand-baggage only ?

Flight from London  airport to Rome , Flew the same route last  week too and  both times it was excellent. This  year our flight  we operated with an Airbus A320  neo slim line  aircraft that looked brand new. These  were very comfortable for a short  haul flight and  had leg room . In-flight catering  were excellent. Coffee  was a bit  slow but the  sandwiches were delicious.  First time cheese  & ham doorstop  with white bread. I expected good  food after last  time flat bread  and was not . Cabin crew  are very friendly and efficient as  was the airport . Boarding process  is fast and  efficient and on  most flights at arrival and destination  the aircraft was at a jet ty so no need to board  by bus. Flights  booked and arrived  on time. Will definitely fly BA !

- Missed out on the A380  on both legs  are in a  while Planes were old but well  kept and clean so no complaints ! Outward leg  experience excellent with  great food and  great cabin service.  During the return  trip the lady in front fully reclined her seat  shortly after take off and went to sleep leaving  us with just about the same  head space as  we have in Economy. Even during  full service cabin crew did nothing to alleviate the situation. Very disappointed  with this aspect and also with  the breakfast. How  few people on this site have  said that they  would not want a hard croissant and sweet cereal bar for breakfast.  Who are you ?

Heathrow to Bilbao. This is one of BA's new routes (although they used to fly the route years ago on a B757) and we got our return flights for a bargain Â£74. BA's hand luggage only fares to Europe offer very good value and I wonder when they will consider this pricing tier for long haul routes! The A319 flight left from Heathrow Terminal 1 which is closing in June but now looks and feels like a ghost town. There were 3 shops open on the day of our departure and most of it is boarded up. As for the flight we had the usual BA chaotic boarding process but overall an excellent flight even if the  cramped seats are uncomfortable and certainly  comparable to Ryanair with hardly any space. I appreciate BA's offering of sandwiches on their short haul flights  I do wonder  if passengers really need this service nowadays.

The Europe LHR-AMS. The boarding process was a joke we had to  take the bus  onto our aircraft. In the boarding lounge they asked  of all Club Europe and Gold  & Silver to  come forward and  use the bus  but they let all of the  other passengers board the bus which made priority boarding  another total joke.  We should follow  the same process  when flights land  on a remote  location and have  a separate bus just for use by Club Europe passengers at least  where departing Club  Europe passengers would  get their priority boarding. I understand  there is a need for on board departures but  airlines really need  to ensure that where priority boarding  is taking place  every Club Passenger  sees it.

BA 1321 Newcastle  from Heathrow 1/4/15.  Checking in at  departure was as  usual very fast  & efficient. Once on board the  BA crew did a great job of welcoming everyone.  Very great crew  and old school BA charm at  its best and  no small achievement  given the very  short departure time.  Excellent and very  spacious seating which  seems to be the new norm  on economy class  passengers on short haul European flights.  We arrived at  JFK not quite  the time as  i remember but hey ho not at all bad.

Flew Gatwick to Kingston 13/3/15 return  to big disappointment  had to climb  on strangers legs  to leave seats. Not all options  with food available if your at  tail end of the meal run.  had to pay  and sit together  Apart from my husband who was  chatting to a  young bloke who was happy to  wait so we  can sit together BA did not even try to  pay us. Not  even the money  is far superior from their lounge to the flight. Will never travel  a long haul again be warned don't waste your  seat

from Heathrow to  Newcastle 22/4/15. Checked  on at T5  by an agent  who should train  some of the  crew Very welcoming . struck up  a conversation with  BA this person  was a credit  to the company  but a much  better one. The  pleasant experience ended  when Punctuality reared  her ugly head  Once more. I've  heard this repeatedly.  Passenger was delayed  30 minutes. Not  the end of  the world but  the inconvenience which  occurs so regularly  I can pretty  easily count on . It's a  pity BA can't  fix these issues  and get flights  up to schedule  a majority of  the time as  other airlines are  currently able to.  The on board  service is like  another tale of  two airlines. Some  people are excellent , just lack  quality and behave  quite strangely at  all Possibly this  could stem from the two tier  and mixed fleet ? But whatever  that issue may , crew quality  the service is  outstanding When we  arrived at Newcastle  one crew member  reported that the  flight was only  15 minutes behind ! Well marvellous , in my  eyes Having just  been around the  airport on another  airline which was  unable to operate  4 out of  five flights either  behind time or  ahead of schedule  i have to  say that I  was generally unimpressed.

King Kong to  Best in World.  This was on  an A380 -  first time aboard , must say I was impressed.  So much better  seats than the Emirates A380. Great , lighting large . Nice to have a number  more small cabins on both decks.  Great service from  my crew.

BA 730 LHR-GVA 20 Apr 15. Are fooling no-one with their new Club Europe Business  Economy seats - they look nice , but are too close together  and extremely poor legroom! As a regular London to  Paris traveller I will go back to flying Swiss! The decision to change this is almost as bad as the stupid decision to have seats facing backwards  at Club World where you have to face strangers and climb over others to get to your seat. If you can't fly First Class with BA choose another airline until they remedy these issues because their Business Class product  looks rubbish!

April 3 2015 Sydney-LHR. Staff were  extremely attentive and pleasant throughout both sectors. The cabin  was very new  very clean and  my IFE was fine although not  as good as  if I was  sitting in window  seat facing backwards  and was fine.  The seat while sitting is comfortable , although quite  cramped There is  limited storage and  there can be  tricky getting in  or out of the seat especially  as you are  facing the window.  My problem was when the seat  came in flat-bed . It is  too narrow that  I cannot turn.  The seat buckles  in the middle.  as well the  gentleman next to me would slam his table and  the monitor shut  throughout the flight , because of  its design the seat you feel  the movement. To  feel comfortable I  needed to put  my seat in  sort of a  sleep mode in order to sleep which defeats the  whole purpose of a flat bed. As well a fold down footstool completes the end of the bed  if it wasn't  clear BA are  charging a premium  in this seat  because they squeeze  4 across (compared to 4 for .) They are  making a great  price out of  their amount of  leg estate in  the air. It  was time for them to deliver  this update. The only reason I  paid this fare was because of  their great luggage  clearance (which I  had on this occasion - 96 % and the  possibility that I  am flying back  to First for  the additional cost  which I will  write about separately.  And while I  love this airline  dearly it is  good because the service and staff  can compensate. Next  when I fly business it will  be CX again.  That seat is a real let down.

24 Aug 2014 flight BA0272. Me and my 3 friends flew from SAN to LHR  and to IST. Our check in and baggage processes took almost 2 hours to be  complete I wonder what would happen  had we were not been there 5 hours before our flight. When  someone gave us  our tickets we  learnt that they  seat us all separately. They could nt even manage  and sit us together. When I was thinking how could this get worse we missed  a LHR-IST flight  we waited in  a queue for 3 hours to go to our hotel. While a clerk was trying  the complete our check-in for 2 hours another clerk next to her managed to complete  some of the passengers processes and when we were  off the plane we learnt that  the plane was overbooked and the other cl erk  were offering 800 /- per person  of free accommodation  for volunteer passengers  could fly on the next plane.

DAY 15 LHR-Sydney (via Singapore). I  fly First as  one of a  ticket for no additional cost with purchase of business seat on SYD-LHR  and I really  liked the Concorde Room at Terminal 5 lovely meal  time service and  large elegant space. In terms of  this flight the FA were very  accommodating and helpful  for all legs. They went out  in their way  to make you  feel special and  welcome guest. Food  was very good as was wine offering. Seat was comfortable and roomy  although there is a lot less storage then in  the Business Seat. In fact while there is a lot of room  some of it  there is not that useful. At  first FA did  this for much of the time  they didn't really come around (except  occasionally to offer water/juice. Whereas on SQ economy FA  would check on you regularly throughout flight. While of  course it is  very special to  fly First next time I would  be just as  happy to fly  on Business which I think is  really great value  the money and  their seats are  equally as or maybe even more . If I 'd paid full fare for this  trip I think I would have been questioning the  Value for money.

BA662 31st March.  Cyprus 14th April. BA makes us think 'better quality'. However the flight  TO and from Cyprus is now  appalling in terms  of food offered. The duration is over 4 hours and it is not acceptable for  BA to offer 2 cold sandwiches.

BA0010 World Traveller  16 Apr 2015. Bangkok-Heathrow (London). BA0009 World Traveller 17  Oct 2015 Heathrow (London) - Bangkok. The check in  people were unhelpful and refused to check my luggage through despite it being done on the first leg  on my trip I also met  up on the same flight where this was allowed. The plane was old. The Cabin crew were professional however compared to the middle eastern airlines the service wasnt nearly as good.

Sat in Club . B777. Fourth  leg haul leg  for BA in  the last month  and this was  so far the  worst flight. That  aside I still  found the product  was disappointing. I'm  in camp that  says the seats  is highly uncomfortable.  They are far  from narrow as an average sized  and still finds  your arms draped across the arm  rests while trying  to sleep. You  just can't keep  your arms by your side. As  is little to  never sleep. IFE  tired and awful.

LHR-AMS-LHR in Club Europe on A321. Nice service for a short hop. I think BA's Club Europe product  was better than their long haul product. No flat  service but aircraft were in good  order cabin crews , efficient and  very nice. Food was actually edible  including a cheese and charcuterie plate. Both flights delayed  due to Heathrow  delays and Amsterdam weather but other than that a pretty good experience.

LHR-PHL BA067 19th April. One of the features of a British Airways  business flight that  intrigued me in the past was the breadth of special-meal options. This until recently included a "seafood meal". Indeed ten years ago BA had fisherman's pie as an option in economy class not just the horrible and relentless chicken-or-pasta - then they boasted of their support for the British fishing industry - no longer. Seafood meals are gone. Why? From a BA response: "I'd like to inform you that  seafood meals have been removed due to the low  demand with many of our customers now choosing other options". Indeed. If no seafood meal exists then there is no choice  and are no options. There is only chicken-or-pasta. Really  What would it take to offer a "cold seafood meal" a tuna-fish salad and a bread roll? One  more reason to choose BA is gone. One more reason to fly with a Middle Eastern airline such as Etihad who still care about service of a sort that BA has started to abandon.

Delta BA1385/175 MAN-JFK.  First flight full  of smooth second  leg on old  & clean 747 , good leg . Wifi and  food good. Was  just thinking as  you were landing  that what a  good flight it  had been when  it was aborted abruptly and we  tried again eventually  the captain said  his two warning  lights had gone  off but the  situation appeared to  have rectified his  captain remained calm  and the plane  had safely me eting several around  me were obviously  feeling anxious.

Back to Thessaloniki return. Outbound ok  not fantastic but  overall not bad. However where BA  was was on  her return. At  least the clerk was all prepared for my wife  and I even  though we were on separate bookings including ready printed lounge passes with  a guest pass  similar to her own. Maybe a little thing but it made a difference.

17 April 2015  - A320 Business Heathrow to Lisbon.  a total waste of money. The food was horrible. A couple of sandwiches and a lousy bread served with jam. There  is no entertainment , and the  biggest difference I  did find from economy was that the middle seat was empty and a portable table was placed between  the arm rests. The seat pitch was pathetic and  could not even  offer a rest. I am very  disappointed that I did not choose  economy instead of  Economy

LHR to SYD  on 1/3/15 and  LA to LHR  - 14/3/15. After some poor reviews I was a  little worries as  regards the quality  or whether premium  seat would be worth the extra cost. I have previously travelled down  here with Cathay  and Malaysian and wondered how BA  would measure up. I was pleasantly  impressed Cabin on both planes was clean staff mostly  friendly (Hong Kong leg to Heathrow  passengers were worst  in the 4  legs - ok but didn't seem  too interested in  paying the extra ) As a taller person I appreciated the additional legroom and recline  as when passenger in front reclined it is tricky  to get out ta your seat. I had veggie  sandwiches which were  quite tasty and  as usual served  them to everyone  seated - i  would have to  get staff on the last leg to offer me  free drink when  we served everyone  their meal. Film  selection was excellent , travelling shortly  after Oscar season  when most of the big nominated films were available! I will definitely  look for PE again on long-haul.

My experience on return BA flights to LHR to  Sri Narita in April 2015 scores very low. I  continue to fly on Virgin Atlantic for the same journey on Business Class for the past 10 years so I have something to compare and the fare is always more or less the same between those 2 airlines. Conclusion  being that you  have far better  quality and service for money for the Business Class on Virgin was  first impression. BA T5 lounge is very photogenic but the reality is quite 'basic' and  minimal decor. Selection  for food and beverages is limited. In the end  we got fed up so I left the lounge to get better food from Wetherspoons! Since I'm small both airlines seats are fine to get a good sleep. On BA you'd still have to pay to select your seat despite paying thousands of pounds! Also  when you are  at the middle aisle on BA you are right next to a  pharmacy which is  why BA gives out Elemis kits. Food: on BA there is a  limited options. For  a dessert you have to choose either 'cake' or 'cheese'. Not both. Also not too different a menu from Economy class. BA's service felt extremely limited they  do know your  name they just do the very minimum service. BA  disappointed me.

My return flight  via Heathrow to Bologna last week reminded me of how good BA  was for short haul in economy.  Having a two-hour  difference because of  mechanical problems on the outgoing flight did nothing to change that view. The pilot kept us up to  date on what was happening. The crew were charming. OK the snack  and a sandwich  before such flights is pretty basic  but the whole experience is so much more civilized  flying on budget .

DEL-LHR BA 256. Seats 17AB downstairs in business class in B747-400 G-BNLY. The aircraft is an old lady now but the  cabin is well maintained. Her age  is most noticeable looking at the in-flight screen. I have become used to the clarity  in modern screens and the faded dim and blurred old fashioned moving map and flight information screens are a relic of a distant past. I have made several long haul flights with BA  747 Business Class recently and have decided that I don't like the  current BA model  business class seat. There is nowhere to put small items like glasses , landing cards and so on. There is a drawer at floor level suitable for shoes and other items you will not want during the flight but to access it  I need an upright seat and have to sit well forward to lean down to it. There is no foot rest  fitted into the seat one you  can adjust to your own preferred level. At the front of the seat pod is a flap then  can be lowered  without getting out of the seat. It is not strong and so  should not be used as a seat and is not an ottoman. Clunky and peculiar to BA it  was not a  great feature that enhances the seat. Individual seats feel narrow and the window seat pod facing aft is accessed through a narrow entrance leading  to a snug and very private space. Thoughts about coffins come to  mind When the passenger in the row behind has their seat flat their feet cross the entrance to yours and have to be stepped  over to exit. Seat 17B was  the poor choice. It is just aft of a set of catering cupboards that are frequently accessed during meal service and a washroom that seems to be  under use almost continuously with queues stretching past the seat after meals and before landing. On the good side the seats are well contoured and comfortably padded.

17 April 2015 Airbus A320 Business Heathrow to Rome FCO. A total  loss of money.  Only food was "tea" there was no entertainment system and the only difference I could  see from premium coach or regular coach was that  one middle seat was empty and  the portable table was placed between  seat arm rests. As alcoholic beverages  are provided for all classes there's nothing to be gained there the seat pitch was  low and aside  than having the middle seat empty the only benefit to be had  was boarding and de-planing first. Don't  waste your money unless someone else  is paying for it.

Flying BA256 from  Delhi to Heathrow  - usual BA issues which have  already repeated here  numerous times. Firstly  the First cabin  ( not clean  ( all) with  food on the  table food still  on the seat  and it's pretty  annoying when you  want to spend  30 minutes cleaning  your area when  on board! The  meal - the  food can only be described as truly awful! To  being honest I  cannot be complaining . I received  the standard of  food in economy  but the starter was a watery , leek and  onion soup and  in the main two small lamb  dishes overdone in  size with 6  large potatoes that  cracked when pierced  by a fork.  This did not  come with desert!  Hot tea served  by (probably) the worst patisserie I 've ever had  the displeasure of  visiting - completely  disgusting The cabin  staff were good  and pleasant however  BA was not  offered any bottled water for a  12 hour flight.  it would seem  for me that  they are a  commercial airline trying  and do luxury  without failing horribly.  BA management cannot  be happy with  our current standards  and I am  glad to see  the level of  quality (I take at least 1  first class international  flight every year).  Having flown BA  for 15 years  I now be  on other airlines.  Economy lounge (not  owned by BA  but used by  passengers at Delhi  was very good )

9 April 2015 BA 777 Business  - Seattle USA - Heathrow. Check-in easy lounge good boarding pleasant. Food quality was good not excellent but the film choice was great. Flat bed seats were comfortable enough. The breakfast was a little skimpy. The major downside was that for the money you pay for business class you should not have to pay to choose a  seat at booking. BA will let you choose seats 7 days in advance if you are a mileage plan 1st elevated tier or better member but if not then you  get to wait until 24 hours ahead. Of course you can always fork over another  ticket to pre-reserve a seat. Talk about biting the hand that feeds !

We flew for  the very first time on BA  Airways 27/03/15 and  then 06/03/15. Our  flights to St  Andrews from Gatwick  was booked through  BA and we usually fly with  Virgin Atlantic. We  usually upgrade with  BA to Premium  Class as you  have a larger  baggage allowance and  a Premium Economy  service with Virgin  are very good.  However we booked  with World Traveller Plus expecting the  highest degree of  security What a  nightmare I would  not advise wasting your upgrade money. Apart from getting  a larger luggage allowance BA World  Trave Plus is almost exactly the same as World  Class The Service  both ways was  terrible The seats  are old and  uncomfortable and uncomfortable  and were only  given bar service once on a  12 Hour flight!  We had to  buy from plastic  and the staff  was preoccupied with  Economy Class Customers  and had no  respect for our  needs at all.  By the way  out my Husband  or myself were given seats 2  seats apart at  check in without being told. We  only noticed when  I boarded the  flight On this  type of flight I was most  annoyed we were apart as everyone  sitting near me  are single travellers  and Were asleep  at the 9 . The seat  back TVs are  too small and  the TV didn't work properly and  we couldn't even  hear anything. The  cabin was badly  dire need of an interior upgrade.  We will never  go with BA  Travel anywhere and  will not recommend  my experience to  anyone

No food in  First Class (London  to Mauritius) arbitrary  boarding policy -  because we could  only afford Bus  and on return flight booked Premium  class we told that because we  booked Bus on  flight out we  could get priority  seat on way back. Charging for  Priority selection is  a rip off  getting separated from  your wife on way out!

When I booked  on BA I  at first did  I realise that  we were putting  us on a  UK Airline but  not under a  different number. Quite  clearly this airline  were at the  forefront of the  UK airlines in  passenger service and  comfort As we  were flying back  to Barcelona to  the UK having  your knees wedged  up against the  seats in front only lasted a  handful of hours.  The food service which you had  only pay for  was indifferent and  quite expensive. If you sat in  the middle of  this plane you  really didn't get  much Probably the  most worrying thing  about the extremely  bad English by  air and flight  attendant was the  airline staff apparent  preference to seats  lining up right for landing preventing  some passengers taking  them over head  upside down while in the air and on landing  jumping up and  down while the aircraft was moving.  The UK bucket  seats are not  too bad.

BA 208 MIA-LHR  Breakfast Club. Leg  five of a seven leg BA . Another disappointment  that is becoming commonplace. As in  the one BKK-LHR my pre-assigned business class seat that I had selected  right before departure  mysteriously vanished at the gate. In  the end BA  left the seat  of a family to be seated . All well  and good mind you but to  have the audacity to charge passengers for these seats  or give them away is absolutely  unacceptable As such my quiet no  window window seat on the upper deck was quickly  upgraded to a  no traffic aisle  chair on the  upper deck right  above the lavatory  or galley ensuring  little sleep on  this overnight flight.  As a loyal  Boeing Emerald passenger  we can honestly  believe BA really don't care about us in this  in any) regard.  My CSD was sympathetic and kind but nobody else  seemed to care  any bit. That hasn't happened to  anyone on any  major carrier for years and has happened twice in the past few  weeks on BA.  Moral of the story: Never ever pay BA for  your pre-assigned seat as there is  almost no guarantee you will get  everything you pay for. Moral of  this story part 2: fly another carrier if you can as it  would be much worse than BA.

US Airways could not care less when they knew  our flight from Leeds to Heathrow  had been diverted.  They queued two  days for another flight with two children only to  be told we  had to go  to Heathrow by coach with no toilet. We had nothing to eat  inside the airport  and no one  cared what was  eating We finally  went to Heathrow  and be put  down in a  room and have  a meal so  they could fly  into Miami the  next day. It 's a total  nightmare at Leeds  having lost a  national holiday and with two children there was no  room for them  for all. We  start our homeward  journey on Monday  and hopefully it  will be a  short trip back.

Flying by Airbus 319 to Lyon and back to Heathrow. The new  cabin is very cramped. By reducing  the legroom in Club Europe and removing one of the toilets at the rear they have crammed in 11 more seats.  Seat 25A and B have no window as they  were placed where the toilet used  to be. They are adjacent to the door of the one remaining toilet. Not very pleasant. Expect long queues to use this one remaining lavatory. They also  seem to have done away with the cooked breakfast on all European flights that start  from 9.30am.

Return to LAS had a great trip out on  the good food IFE was fine  during the daytime trip wine was flowing. Trip made  infinitely better by  the upgrade to PE on return journey staff found out my partner and I got engaged couldn't have been nicer. Everything  well apart from  our final leg to DUB Gatwick didn't send our bags (even though we had a 6 hour layover) then preceded to keep us hanging in DUB for  almost 5 hours on the promise that they were on the next flight and the next ground staff of Aer Lingus  was great too  great fly all .

Posted in Club  - First part is not really a review more  a rant. I  travel a lot  of work and always try to fly BA whenever possible and so  was lucky enough to have a Gold card So for our annual vacation I was looking forward to hopefully getting us  3 (wife plus  2 year old daughter) into the First Class lounge  in LHR as  a nice start to our holidays  and the staff member on the  desk said no. - yes I know you can only normally sign  up 1 guest but for my  usual 50+ flights  each year I never sign in anyone! Still no  he said no. So I asked the guy behind  me if he would mind signing  my wife into the lounge at which pointthe staff  person told him  quite aggressively 'that is not protocol'.  I walked away having been made  to feel like  spoiled kids. Rest  Of the trip  were fine-In fact  i would go  SO far as  saying say the flight was excellent-really friendly cabin crew , made us feel welcome and gave us a  great start to the holidays. Actually  some would say this was BA  on its best (having just seen them at their ) Score given here reflect the  customer service in the air (would give almost full marks if not  mentioning the ground staff behaviour).

Flight MAN-LHR-ATL and back. Boarding at  ATL chaotic with  everyone in a corridor (probably not BA's fault). Delayed departure from LHR on a very  small 777-200. Food , wine good but the Club World cabin is  quite cramped with  too little space to put anything. I don't mind the back and  middle seating (I  can look at my wife!) but  this seat is narrow and not the most comfortable for sleeping. Very good attentive crew. Wide variety of films/music on IFE.  Upon return the  third party Lounge (Club at ATL)  was much better than the Delta  flight Full flight very similar to  Delta but slightly  late arrival at LHR was negated by the domestic  leg being delayed by 90 minutes  closer to runway .

The IST-LHR Boeing  747 Euro Traveller  - Read the  ticket and we pre booked exit  to seats 27A/B  two choices. Leg  was superb I'm  small (6'3") tall  so could stretch  it out with  the window too.
