Was an old  cabin though with  great personal entertainment  and power. Appeared  we have the  best seats which were OK surprisingly  the four hour  flight passed quite quickly. Food was  actually very good  for the crew . Disappointing choice  in alcohol though no JD or Rum. Departed IST about twenty minutes  early but were  only ten minutes  late into LHR.  Better done BA  better than the  flight experience reviewed !

LGW-SZG in business  class Not sure  what the point is with the  slightly reduced legroom Club Europe seats.  Had breakfast but  was able to get breakfast in the lounge beforehand ? Only reason for going CE was because only  one more than flexible economy ticket. If there was a big difference  you wouldn't bother. Flight was on .

Flying to Bangkok  from London Heathrow  - 13th March.  First time I 've ever flown  to BA normally fly long haul  or Virgin but they don't fly to Bangkok. We were offered upgrades in the last  2 days for  big discount but  cancelled on the  flight out. World traveller plus was very good with  more leg room , comfy seats.  Great food too.  got to sleep 5 hours in quiet cabin. But  if I had paid normal price then it was not worth the extra money as  i found economy  cabin on the flight home were  not comfy and  good leg room. The plane was older 777 but not problem. very  quiet and the  staff were attentive.  One was nervous because of previous  flight but no  time to be as we had a very enjoyable flight.

LHR-JFK/IAD-LHR. Superb round  trip (for a very fair price) in economy with BA. Flight out  of an hour  or so late  taking off because  off the weather  but was excellent  as we got  on Fairly creaky , but the IFE was fine  with film selection)  and the free  entertainment flowed throughout.  Great curry on the food front. Return was the real highlight on  a new A380 that had joined  my fleet four  years ago. Large  but even bigger  choice of films/TV , and the  really good free food (shepherd's pie)  and drink (red  wine and beer). Comfy seats with  lots of leg  space (and I'm  over six foot). Service on both flights exemplary and  you have to  admit that I  believe BA have become a really  neat act.

On 30th March  - LHR-YVR return  for my school  was a rugby  match (27 people). Seats were reasonably  decent and they  replied to my  repeated requests of  BBQ pork well.  Love it. But  our IFE was  simply horrendous and  could not meet  my expectations of  Qatar Airways- outdated  and with TV 's from 3  years before. Since we were flying  on a Boeing  777 there were  2 seats per  row but this  time the cabin  was quite cramped.  My recommendation for  return - put  two seats per  person Even though  they were negatives  from outbound I  want to say the return was  better I had  two seats with  the boy who  had to sit next to someone  so I sat  on the extra  2 seats. IFE  is far better  but due to  opening the window  so I was able to sleep  until around 6  am when I  only awoke by  a breakfast/snack which  was decent. Food  was no flavour  which was quite  dry (Lentil masala)  and still edible.  While my experience  with BA84 was  not enjoyable I  think many of  my companions had to move seats because of the  poor working IFE. One of my coaches had ordered  orange juice so  his cabin crew  brought it to  me as they were serving but  then the other  coaches would take  it away for  whatever reason and  at the end  all said they  were none left.  We had flown  to Cathay Pacific  from Manila the  previous week and  had said that  they had enjoyed  that thoroughly. One  was his worst experiences of air  transport especially due  to him being  overweight and rather  uncomfortable Overall a decent experience but  not met my  expectations To improve  British Airways need  to start to  be able to compete with other  airlines like Singapore 's Etihad Cathay  Pacific and Qantas  but there service and level of comfort has definitely  crossed over from BA.

Welcome to Istanbul  flight BA0676 in  business class. I should have guessed what I was going to get when I saw  how service is  provided on a Boeing 767. Business or club class  at a total  waste of money same seat as  premium economy. No  real leg room or width no  great inflight entertainment  and no seat power it's horrendous  you may just as well book euro traveller. Both  planes had seen better days the covers of which were in places falling apart. Food was only average too in my  case On the plus side of things the plane was for its age (it was the oldest 767  Emirates has got)  in surprisingly good order and the staff were friendly , and the  aircraft arrived only ten minutes late  this is a  plus
Welcome to Philadelphia  to return from  a Booked Club World and upgraded  Rooms First with Avios. Great service  as always in  abundance and the  hotel room continues  to excel.

Air Shanghai to London on 17 Mar. The whole  journey was very good. The check in procedure was  really quick. Boarding  was finished very  well The cabin  crew were helpful and friendly. The  flight was very  pleasant The temperature was very appropriate.  I did enjoy  this flight. Meal  and tasty drinks  were quite good  Quality was not lost. I really  did not expect  it

London Warsaw to  London Reasonable all round. Fairly nice sandwich and drinks.  Staff were patient  with some passengers  who thought they were in an all inclusive hotel. Very busy flight. New seats are extremely cramped. Feels  every bit Ryanair. Boarding a bit chaotic as didn't  move by seat row. Baggage started coming off one carousel at Heathrow only to inexplicably move to a  new one without  explanation or announcement.

I travelled from London to Jo'burg and back on  an Airbus 380 and had mixed experiences. On the  way out I was in Premium Economy and was pleasantly surprised by the spacious seat and window locker and slept well. The return in Business was a different matter. I was truly shocked by how many seats had been crammed in the  extremely narrow seat , lack of  ventilation and having to climb over  my feet to vacate my seat. All this at a premium price.  🙂 The cabin crew were faultless and were only too aware of  their views on the cabin! Never again.

Return LHR-YVR Boeing 747-400. I had been advised to fly BA but unfortunately I ended up very disappointed with the return leg. My seat was double booked so they eventually got me one  but the entertainment system was not working! When I asked about it she said it had not been  fixed yesterday either. No other vacant seats in economy  and there were  2 in business class but would not upgrade me. 10hr flight with  them Definitely would not fly with them again.

I usually have  only positive experiences  while flying BA.  Last time travelling  with 30/03/15 LCA-LGW the staff could not have been any less interested in the comfort of the passengers. It was a  4 hour flight  passengers were served the meal within the first 20minutes with nothing to  eat for the  next 4 hours. There was no inflight entertainment. The staff did not  serve any hot drinks and when I walked all the way to  the end of the aircraft to ask about a hot drink was told no one was going round offering tea but if I wanted one I could  ask and get  one from service . The staff  should have looked  no more disinterested  than their passengers!

A day trip , March 25  two flights in  a morning flight  in Airbus 319  evening flight back  on a 737-400 J featuring the  most comfortable old . Both flights  later or early.  Nice service for  this short domestic . A breakfast  sandwich and drinks  was served in the morning while  sandwiches or biscuits  or full bar  service were offered  for the evening  flights back. FAs were excellent on  two legs providing  generally good efficient , friendly service on these short flights. Flying with hand baggage only  I used web pages for both  trips which worked . Boarding procedures  were unremarkable which  was good. BAs  Cabin Lounge in  Economy is fairly comfortable and spacious , although very  limited in the  cabin Acceptable cold  beverage choices and  served as the  only hot alternative.  Food choices were  good and of  decent quality. BAs  Cabin Lounge in  Paris was more  crowded but again . Again various  good quality drink  options but just  very limited food  options (basic snacks  like as crisps , hot soup).  Again an excellent  short flight experience . Economy. Would  be more than  willing to do  so again. (Oneworld .)

After a trip  with American Airlines  and my flight from London to  Dallas was on !! What a  relief I wish  ALL my AA trips were done  by BA. Great  extra leg space  between gates airplanes.  My 8.5 hr  flight went by . TV in  the seat with plenty of great . Food was good and flight  attendants were helpful  but patient.

from Heathrow to  my return. This  were a fairly  straightforward trip for  planning purposes. Bought  the PE ticket  but used Avios  to upgrade as  per my usual  I Prefer overnight  stays but these  particular ones were  not To be  frank I only  ever choose Biz  as the space  was flatbed. I do always find  the food to  be good though.  There was a  737 going and  the 777 coming . I find  my BA service  can only be  good and functional.  I was 'missed'  by several things  and gave up  going to find  somewhere for a  pot of tea.  Other airlines give  much better service and provide a  better product but  so long as  I upgrade with  it and I  can get a  decent seat I  will stick with .

VIE-LHR on March 24 and return LHR-VIE on March 30 both straight forward point to point midday flights both flights in Economy on an Airbus A320 with a mixed fleet crew both legs on-time or early.– An edible sandwich and drinks (full bar) were served on both legs. On the flight to London FAs were not unpleasant but not overly active except for the required meal service and duty free sales. However additional drinks were handed out in the galley if requested. On the flight back a rather young crew was trying harder but was - quite untypically for BA - rather robotic in their actions and announcements. Again additional drinks were served if requested. Both legs featured the new slim seats in the cabin with reduced legroom. I  was really missing the older more comfortable BA seats.  Armed with hand baggage only we used web check-in for the first flight and the check in kiosk for the flight back. Both worked efficiently. Boarding procedures were unremarkable and pleasant. BA uses a shared lounge in VIE which again was quite busy but not  terrible The Lounge as such is acceptable but far from great with limited and lower quality offerings. Food  & drink seem  too be more or less the same in all lounges in VIE including OS flagship lounge. BA’s Galleries  Lounge in LHR  is again a comfortable oasis of rest amid a busy airport. However this time (breakfast time) the food offerings were quite basic and drink wise even basics  such as orange juice or tomato juice were not available. Hopefully just an off day. BA still uses T3 for its flights to VIE which I consider a huge benefit over using T5 which looks nice but tends to be a mess for passengers. Overall a good flight experience although I have had much better crews on BA before. Still consider BA as one of the best options for Economy flights in Europe. (Oneworld Sapphire).

Very disappointing experience. Arrived at airport  for a flight to Nice and learnt it was 1.5 hours late - with arriving aircraft nowhere in sight. Prior flight was boarding (also delayed) Having no  bags checked and seats available I thought I might get to Nice  at all in time. No such luck. Whilst the flight continued to  run for another  20 minutes I spent arguing with  airline staff to even check whether they could get me on the flight. First class  flight staff refused to call the gate. All with "flight is finalized".  Despite similar situations with other airlines (most notably Lufthansa) they always re-opened the flight and got me on.  My only excuse was "it's the  holidays (obviously BA).  Staff in addition took calls whilst handling my - urgent - request further delaying the  flight If I have a choice I will definitely  try other airlines. In addition they have changed the seating in Europe to come more in line with Easyjet and Ryanair. At 6"4 very uncomfortable. Doesn't help to upgrade to Business: SAME seat. So you end up paying 300 pounds for a very predictable and unexciting food.

Flew LHR-IAD-LHR on new A380's in new World Traveller Plus. Overall great service and experience  from hard working  and friendly crews both ways. New  cabin product is great. Seats are  the huge improvement although 6 hours really is the limit on the overnight leg coming  up for comfort. Food was good  including my partners Vegan meal. New IFE excellent and  really like the upgraded noise cancelling . Only 'extra'  I would have liked would have  had the option  for a sparkling  water or even  one as a  daily take off drink. Have had the best and worst of BA  over the years  and this was  definitely BA as it should be.

LHR-DEL rtn. B747  both ways and  was showing their age. Crew were  used both ways. People may not  appreciate the yin/yang  seating arrangement but  this doesn't bother . The screen  pops up after  departure and you 're in your  personal space. Seat  is still very . Wine list  is good and  even the Rose  is alongside the  Red

BRU-EWR via LHR  and JFK-BRU via LHR on the  BA All flights more or less on schedule. Terminal 5 in LHR is nice with a lot of sunlight making it very bright and  comfortable looking. Cabin crew on all flights in general professional and giving  really good service. Food and drinks ok. The seats  here however very small and BA really needs to update their seating as soon as possible. The first flight from Brussels to London Heathrow had their updated European cabin which offers better seats but a bit less legroom. Seating on the B747 is very old but still a bit more comfortable then the new B787 Dreamliner where the seats in  Europe are really too small and legroom just ok.

23/3/2015 LHR-SIN BA011 First. Awful from booking to completion of the flight. As a BA. eworld executive member at time of  purchase some 11  months ago booked this flight on the new A380  Only to be told by BA in May 2014  our equipment had  be changed to  their extremely old 744 due to  mechanical issues. Sold feeling a little let down secured  rows 1a and 2a on the  flights these are  a best of  no bad bunch  and to I wonder why BA  crammed 14 seats into such a  small area where other airlines only fit 8 seats into the front  row of 744s'. At the beginning of March I  posted the booking online only to find that we  have been moved  to row 5 in the middle this was not  right I called  up BA gold line to object only to be  offered numerous contradicting excuses non of  which were valid  once on the flight I found out that the passenger in 1a  were a lifetime gold member so. I can only assume that rank has its privileges. Now onto the  flight arrogant staff with one exception really poor food served at different times as we were in the middle which meant we had different staff attending to us. Plane interior shabby not surprised for a 20 plus year old  passenger along with  the PA being  rude I felt this to be a safety issue and when mentioned  I was ignored. I booked this flight for us a part of  a special Far East holiday I had high expectations  for BA First which have not been met in anyway what a total waste of money. Will now try to avoid  flying BA in  one of there classes once I  successfully redeemed my  BA balance.

LHR-PHL return. First  day half full  on both legs  of Club not oversold. Very much better service than when full as crew have time to interact. BA BA should consider cutting back the  amount of seats  to sell a  very premium product like so many others have now chosen to do. Food disappointing as usual - much room for improvement . Decent wines but whites/champagne always  bad on the return as kept unchilled during the turnaround. T5 experience fine both ways  but mid-week and  end of year  being so busy. Lounges good and  most staff friendly both LHR and PHL.

Today was the  longest flight in . One World  on the world ticket. Buenos Aries . LHR a 13 hour flight.  We really didn't  get any complaints  on this flight or BA but  with the other  3 airlines in  the months it was pretty average.  No FA's were  good the food  was OK the only really bad  part was the  music Half a dozen new releases  and a dozen  and so older ! Likewise the  aircraft selection- pretty  good The 777  is around 6  months old so  it was due  with an upgrade.  Can be fare  wise comparing BA  vs Emirates so  fair contest really!

Between Gatwick (LGW)  and Lanzarote (ACE). We haven't flown  together for sometime  and to be  frank we have  no desire to fly with BA  Airways anytime soon. The plane was  a Airbus 320  and was just  not a bus.  Really hard very  uncomfortable seats not even sure you  could recline them. We sat in  Row 11 and  on both outward  / inbound flights  our cabin temperature  got far to  hot and stuffy  as it seemed  to be an issue in just  two rows as  in front and  centre of the  plane was much . We both  came off the return flight with bad headaches. The  flight was simply  awful thank goodness  we ate a  small breakfast before  hand as the minuscule roll and  there was hardly  anything to feed  my child and  whatever that topic  the food was  hardly suitable for  a young toddler and there was  a child option.  Passenger service was ok nothing to  worry about very matter of fact , despite the  rude comments the plane was clean etc. We flew the same route  from October last  time with a  different holiday airline  but that was  all round far  far superior.

DEL-LHR-HAM in Business.  This club world  airline feels really old now. The seats are narrow and not up to the standards  of a world class airline. It was innovative when it came out  but now feels narrow dated and not a match even to Air India which has  very flat seats on the Dreamliner. The food was OK but nothing special. The service was also ok but lacked touches like smiles hot towels. Amenity kits very cheap. The young Indian crew members on the Delhi route noticeably better than the older London based British crew. The plane was an old and slightly grubby 747. Basically everything was mediocre if adequate. The overall impression was a product past it's prime from  early 1990s. Old  planes old crew old seats old IFE BA are losing ground not just to Emirates but also other European carriers like LH or AF. It feels like the 1970s and 1980s before BA transformed itself.

Day to trip : Hamburg booked  the day before . Great value  the money. Outbound flight was on  an A320. Great  comfortable cabin comfortable seats - with enough legroom and  all new lighting. On return was  on A320 class  - not refurbished.  Prices will be  available once all  seats refitted.

I flew today from San Francisco to Heathrow Business Class and as always it's a delight flying with BA. Staff were helpful and polite - in fact they couldn't do  more for me. Seats were comfortable. Entertainment was OK and food was . My only criticism is that on the outbound  leg we were  served lunch immediately on taking off but then had to wait neatly  2 hours for a light snack before landing. As I did not want to 'raid  the larder' and eat fattening foods I was left starving! I still  feel the overall experience with BA  was far superior to any other airline.

We flew from LHR to Brussels and back on  our reward flight which was very pleasant even though it was a quick hop across the channel! Just about had time  for enjoy the cream tea on the outbound flight. Quality of the tea drink was the best I've tasted in the sky. The champagne  tasted very nice too. Business lounge  at Brussels was very pleasant and is to be recommended.

GRU-LHR 15 March 2015. Returned to  BA this last 3 flights solely due to Avios  and coupon but  not this tkt. Bossy cabin crew  of the like  from BA as we remember its glory days. G&T always welcome but skimpy and only one and no nibbles! Wine was good this flight. South America routes still dogged with ageing 747 as  compared to Lufthansa's modern or upgraded fleet. Outbound from  Amsterdam my TV didn't work but they did credit  for 3000 avios. Food okay but  fuel for such a long flight poor. KLM and AF do it .

Flight A319 out  and A320 in.  Quality time in both directions staff  were professional and polite. Sandwich out , a choice  between snacks (crisps biscuits or chocolate raisins) in as  well as complementary  beverages including alcohol. Smooth through Geneva airport in and  get stuck in  another 40-minute passport  queues at LGW on the way in (not BA's  fault of course)  accompanied by a long walk around  after work for  our airport shuttle to the train station. This was a rare occasion  where BA was cheaper than all  the the competition on the route.  For balance I  still don't think  a BA experience is much better  with the low-cost  alternatives unless you fly to Heathrow . Terminal 5  - much nicer  than Gatwick. Although  most food and drink is free the choice is  quite limited (e.g. no British beer  or option to  grab something substantial  if you're hungry  or the snack  was a bit stingy on the way back). I  expected we might get newspapers but we didn't. On  average it was perfectly fine but I wouldn't pay  anything extra for  it - I'd  much rather have the choice friendliness  or flexibility you get with easyJet.

We have been a longstanding BA gold card holder  on frequent business . BA has now replaced all business class seats on short haul flights with seats so cramped that  being 6'4" I  do not sit  without great discomfort. This shows complete contempt for BA's customers. I first encountered this on a round trip  through Brussels. It will be Eurostar for me in  my future and Air France for  when I also  carry a gold card on other  BA hauls. Is  airline management so confident of its customer base that  it can give  them less space  that Easyjet offers?

Summary - A380 was excellent a  blast of fresh air in comparison  ot the typical  commercial planes of  our Mixed fleet  and very friendly , enthusiastic. Food  quality was excellent  for my first  taste and the  onboard kitchen was  filled with a  range of delicious sweet and savoury  food The upper  cabin was excellent  as it was  relatively quiet and  comfortable with approx  20 seats in  a forward section.  Cabin very good  for a larger  cabin than found on 747/777. Cabin very clean and  in general felt  quite fresh and  spacious The only  problem is still  having to climb  with the passenger seated in the  middle with the  x yang layout.

Having heard so many negative reviews of BA I still mustered the courage to book  a trip to Chicago and SFO. To begin with  when I reached Mumbai airport with  our online check  baggage printouts 4 hours before scheduled departure I was pleasantly surprised to see the BA staff ready to check in the baggage. We were  finally checked in  flight to Chicago with a 5 hour halt at LHR. London Heathrow Terminal 5 is chaotic to say  very least the security taking forever  ( our case 45 min) to clear the hand  baggage gave us some 3 hours before we boarded  our Chicago flight which was comfortable. Our next connection  from Chicago to SFO on AA was a bit messy as the  luggage space was full and last minute check-in of hand baggage was  difficult Then for  a SFO-LHR-DEL flight the SFO-LHR got delayed but again check-in was pleasant and though the connection time between two flights was 80 minutes because  of the delay we had a margin of only 35 minutes. When we requested the  baggage purser to let us disembark  like anyone else he said "why did you take this connection even  if you make it somehow your baggage wont" - so much for assistance! Even after  the last of all we were  greeted by the  security representative at the gate who took us thru the fast track channel and we made it to  that flight in a record 20 minutes. All went  well except for one tiny hitch one piece of  luggage never made  It to our  connecting flight.

Comfortable seats and  lack of space , the food  were poor and  my in-flight entertainment  service was rubbish. The screens were  tiny and the  audio quality terrible.  Nobody liked that  fact that the  BA crew were  all mature people  but the service  is far from  perfect This is  my first time I have flown  on BA for  nearly 15 years . I will  review and avoid  BA in future.  We have had  far better flights  on other airlines.

Jet to and from Punta Cana from Gatwick. Two  different flights. Orderly , Great crew. Food mostly quite good although if a salad is going to comprise  very few lettuce  slices and a chopped up tomato  then don't bother.  Staff pretty much  any time. Both  flights busy. Breakfast on arrival in  LA was poor too. IFE is horrendously behind competitors. Really dire. Ran  clear of options after about half an hour. Some  airports offer thousands of films and programmes. The crew are the best part of BA  but the seats  the catering are  right up to ! Check in  was excellent at  the ends. There was a minor  computer glitch at Punta Cana which  caused a short  time but a member off staff came through the queue to keep us all informed. Top notch.

We travelled CUN-LGW 11 March and it's the last time we will ever travel Business  way with BA.  Limited lounge facilities at Cancun only a voucher offered  towards use in departure area food  service On board usual gymnastics to get in and  Out of seats  and out of  seat choices for  the limited choice  for breakfast tea  available in a  cup without saucer.  BA staff excessively noisy in galley throughout flight. Better  food in cattle !

due to a  visa issue I  had to fly  first class from  Bangkok to Singapore Singapore to Heathrow Heathrow to Mykonos  Airport then returned  on 6th October.  This was seated in the same  class 16k both  times My main  complaint was that  by the time  people got to me for each  boarding time whatever  we had chosen  off the menu  we had run  short of or  there had been  a mistake and  we didn't have  the meals that were on the  tray Often I  would have to  go out to  someone for a  seat as they  seemed to forget  that there was  a seat. In  late morning because I am diabetic  you had to  speak to the  kitchen and ask  about something to  drink which was  hard as most  passengers where sleeping . I didn't  have to disturb anyone.

Sent via LHR. Outbound flight YYZ-LHR was delayed by  one hour. Good thing they sent a text message well ahead of time. Boarding was quick and efficient  in flight entertainment (IFE) was superb with plenty of very good choices latest releases. Probably the best I've seen in Economy class. Service was ok normal. B777  was great - I'm 6ft 4in  and I asked  for bulkhead seats. I ordered a special meal and it was ready for all four sections of my journey. LHR-DXB portion all good (B747). On the way back DXB-LHR was great (B777) - I took the 3.20pm outbound flight right after my business was completed (as opposed to taking those 1-2am flights that are offered by other  major carriers). LHR-YYZ flew on the new Dreamliner 787. I was not too impressed with  the seat configuration and space. To me the 777 was more comfortable.  All in all I was pleased  at BA's service and comfort.

Club Europe from LHR to Frankfurt . Outbound flight was great A320 's new seats  and are very comfortable great food and a good service. Aircraft on the return leg was a very old A319 rather dirty and quite shabby looking inside however purser working Club Europe was  great

Travelled back from Cape Town on 28th February 2015.  Check seats beforehand  to make sure , we had  front row seats  only to get  onto the plane  we discover contrary to what the webview had displayed  there were bang s in the middle of a row of seat!  Went to BA and told that the maps you  will see on ba.com are representative of the seats  on board flights and that they cannot guarantee your  flight will be exactly as shown on our website  as the configuration can vary depending  on the aircraft you're travelling on.  Absolutely a total  turn off! The  staff were extremely  noisy our inflight entertainment system keep  working Once the food had been  cleared out and  thrown away the flight attended disappeared completely and absolutely no water or  food were offered  - we were about two hours from landing! BA need to get  its act together and invest in  their aircraft's. Clapped out 747s - even first class looked shoddy!

British Airways business  Class is outclassed  our rivals. The  movement out of  my seats needs  attention - I  would not expect  someone to step  over me when I have my seat extended in  order to get  rid of their  own area. The  airline food was  good Drinks were  available occasionally -  several times on a ten hour  journey - slightly  stale coffee -  served out of ice. The idea  is you have  the selection of food to choose  with in the business class galley  seems a joke.  The business class  passenger used business  flight toilet and then helped themselves to the food.  The entertainment very  poor The terrace  food at Gatwick  was outdated -  the hot food  ranging from porridge  I checked in  before 9.00am) a  couple pieces of  french toast plus  your usual cold meats and cheese.  A business class  at British Airways is definitely not  for the money.

I have to admit to not being a fan of the BA  First World (Business Class) configuration but this is what our travel agent came up with for our direct flight. Seating you head to toe allows them to get in 8 seats across compared to their competitors normal 7. On my flight 11 rows this gave them 11 extra seats good for  the bean counters but can cause problems for the passengers. On my flight from MLE  TO LGW 10 hrs 35 minutes I was in 11B facing forward and in the bed position my feet were on a drop down stool fixed to the back of 10B. The passenger in 10A facing back had to step over my legs to exit their seat and kicked me a number of times  and they did this during the long flight. It is illegal to drink alcohol in the airport in Male and so after take off I was looking forward to a cold lager. The drinks trolley came but all the beer including the lager was warm. The FA said that they had no means of cooling the lager on board. I cannot drink warm  water and I am not a spirit drinker and so went without. I settled down to watch a film but my entertainment system would work for about 15 minutes and then shut itself down. No entertainment system and I then found that  all of the adjustment buttons on the seat did not appear to be working so it was either sitting up or lying down and risk being kicked. There were 2 meal services on the flight. The  original one was OK but when it came to the second one when they got  into me last row in the cabin they had run out of food and all they could offer  me was a salad. Not the best flight in the world and when we arrived at LGW all the economy bags came off first and the Club bags with "priority" tags attached came off last. I have been in  communication with BA and Customer Relations has stated "You traveled in the cabin you originally booked. However the meals we serve and our in-flight  entertainment system is complimentary and not included in our fare. The BA  website has a description of this service which includes: 1) Extensive Flight Entertainment System. 2) Seat Converts to 4 key positions. 3) Choice of light meal or four course dining. BA claimed to be "The Worlds Favorite Airline". They are not mine. They also clam "To Fly To Serve". Well as  to say they did fly me from MLE to LGW bt I am not quite sure where the service came in.

Flight to Budapest  then back in  business class. First  class not too bad apart from  the narrow seat  it is exactly the same as  first seat but  the spare one  in between. Usually  they are moved  such that they  are wider with  another narrow seat  down the middle. The return was  disappointing BA do  not pay for . Europe travellers  must use Fast Pass at security  was disgraceful especially  when it is  so slow and  noisy The lounge  was mediocre at  all Absolutely not  Worth paying for  it BA need to get a grip on their  poor standards and increased prices.

Hi I have a house in  London so fly there often. I used to fly  on certain yellow/blue/white  BA carrier from  Manchester but got fed up at being treated like an inconvenience and  that the FA's  and spoke poor ! As a  BA card holder my wife and  i enjoyed a  nice breakfast in  the lounge. It 's not busy.  They were seated in the exit  area which I  checked before we  arrived It was  nicer than the  Air Europe space  they had last  time - which is why I  chose economy as  well to Club  as I feel  still very poor ! The plane  is a nice  new A320 with the new seats.  It was spotless.  I had a  light snack on  the flights +  A few Gin  and Tonics for  dinner ! (the wife was driving  on arrival) The  crew were great.  Helpful and treated  me like customers  and not like  customers Funnily enough both flights pushed  out early and  landed early. Flight  4 was a bit rough due  some high winds  in Pisa -  having a re-assuring  message over the  warning system was a thoughtful touch  for nervous flyers  - my wife included. All in  All BA at  its best. They  keep getting it  well or spectacularly ! There never  seemed to be  anyone in the  I Am flying  in with them ! 4 weeks  flying and look  forward to it.

Welcome to Bangkok  by Thai Airways  they were lovely to fly with  good choice of  airlines and good  leg room. We  are expecting at  least the same  level of comfort  in service with . The leg rest is terrible  and only an hour after take off the lady in front put  my chair in  to recline and  left the space  on front of me so claustrophobic  I couldn't see  the TV screen  and it was  too close to  my face as  well as having  me sit at an awkward position as I have  short legs and  she put them out in front  of me. So  sad The food  is dire with  only pasta or  grilled fish with  fried rice After a fortnight of  fried rice it  must have been nice to have  something different. Does  anybody actually read  or take notice  about these negative  things are we  wasting our time?

My partner and I booked a  lovely weekend break  with BA in NYC including flights from Manchester and accommodation - we deliberately selected the  cheapest flight option  for the round trip to save having to change terminals at London Heathrow. When I  signed us in online 24 hours before travel we discovered that our  long haul flights had been changed  with American Airlines (5th to 9th )! This meant we had to change terminals T5 to T3 with very little time following our flight  into Manchester - even with the  BA transfer notes  it was a very close call  - very stressful  and not helped  from the fact that we got held up trying  and leave T5 due to a  broken door! The flight with AA was OK but the food on both the outward  & return legs  was disgusting and  nothing at all  like we expected.  Our BA web  store allowed me to book the  forward transfer but refused to allow me to book the return so I had to  manage that myself! I have rated  our travel experience  at 7 &  10 based on  my American Airlines  connections to and from NYC. The BA flights from  London to Heathrow  were great. We also struggled with  their AA website when trying to check in for  our return flights.

LGW-TFS-LGW seat pitch  / comfort were good. The snack was perfectly adequate but the bar service was diabolical. My husband asked  after a beer which was bordering on warm. I asked for a  soda and diet coke was advised had run out  on Bacardi (bearing in mind we were one of  the first to be served). I settled for a white wine which was tepid had  to add ice to it. Further into the flight my husband asked  after a second  and he was told that they had to save the beers for the return flight. Our crew were  both slightly older they were obviously  more experienced to the point of doing everything automatically but not actually listening to the  passengers On our return flight we received almost the same service only  missing one can of beer and no Bacardi. Very disappointing we wanted  just relax and  toast our anniversary with an inflight drink. The return crew were slightly more attentive but  some good old  school customer service was missing.

Long time in  the leg room  of Europe. Don't  feel no different  than economy both  husband and I  travel with legs  still jammed into seat in front. Save your money  up in the back and spend  the savings on  the better hotel , holiday or  a Good crew  & food though.

LHR-SOF-LHR seat 1A on an upgraded A320 in both directions check in  to T5 quick and the galleries  experience was fine as always. Departed  good time a breakfast served by a pretty nice crew not that  any room really  and business class appears to be getting less. Return  checked in quick  and security at Sofia very slow , the lounge is not worth using!! flight delayed around an hour due to weather but once away a decent meal  cooked by yet another nice crew landed around 30 min late on a remote stand but bags on the belt by the time I reached it.

This is not  true of BA in general only this particular flight.  We flew LHR-ABV on Saturday 7th . This was the Friday 6th  leg that had to be rescheduled due to technical issues. Now if anyone is familiar  on this route  you will know  the service onboard  is sometimes not  as consistent as say the transatlantic routes. Considering that the flight had been delayed 23 hours one would have though that  the crew would have been more  professional This is not to say  crew were in any way unprofessional they were just  such a hurry  they give you a drink and your meal. There after you barely saw them! Duty Free sped through the cabin faster than Usian Bolt  upon landing and immigration cards were handed out just  before landing. I was part way through completing mine  and I heard the "Cabin Crew 10 minutes to landing" announcement! The  row I was sat in had a broken IFE  door hinge and would swing back to the closed position. Fortunately the  seat was not full which is  a first for this route! Sadly  the seat I then chose also had an IFE A too - a minor one but annoying nonetheless.  Fourth time lucky and hussar! I  must add that  our choice of  meals were rather  disappointing too. The food would have been good save  it was on  the main menu.  There was a choice of Chickpea  and Chicken and African Stew. Which  part of Africa  does that stew pertain to be  in lord knows.  But I opted for the chicken. I must say I was supremely  bored It was  just short of a "school dinner": flavourless and unappetising.

London to Budapest  and back in Club class. First  class not too  bad apart from  one narrow seat  which is exactly  a same as  the seat but  they spare one  inch between. Usually  seats are moved  in that they are wider with  another narrow seat in the middle. The return was  that BA do  NOT pay for Cub Europe travellers  can use Fast Pass at security  very disgraceful especially  when it is  really slow and  noisy The lounge  is mediocre at  all Absolutely not  worthwhile paying for  this BA need  really get a  grip on their  own standards and  low prices.

We flew from  LA to SIN;  The aircraft was a Boeing 747-400  which was tired  & old. The IFE had to be re-booted and  the system was  nothing yet up  the date like  every other BA  aircraft The seating  mats on my  New World seat kept coming off  The aircraft seemed very tired. The  flight again was  on a good  place and the  attendants were helpful.  We always fly  there and I  loved the Boeing  747 but unfortunately  my 747 have to go at some point.

LHR-SOF-LHR 27th Feb/2nd Mar Seat A1 on an A320  flying both directions  came in at  the quick used  to BA Galleries  customer lounge which  looked good as ever. Boarding on time as was departure and arrival new business seats  for both aircraft  and were comfortable ; Food (Breakfast) and crew on outbound very good  while waiting once  for immigration in Sofia. Return check  was quick although  baggage check was  very slow the  airport in Sofia is dreadfully dull with no facilities , or drinks  you would be  thinking of using  in general airport . Departure was  about an hour  early as was  normal due to weather at Heathrow;  the crew were  happy as was the lunch served.

I took a flight from Gatwick to Barcelona. Although it had a BA flight number it was operated by Vueling and that meant I couldn't use the BA lounge despite my silver Executive Club membership. I  had choose Vueling I was under the impression I had chosen BA  I would get the BA perks  all the same. There was no in flight entertainment  (< 1/5 - it should be 0 of course).

I travel world-wide , on business  travel in Business  class I don't  think I have  EVER had a  trip with BA  it wasn't without  an issue. Recently  and not for  the first time  I checked in  and find that  Business Class had been over sold.  So lets call  greed what it  is Greed it's  just disgusting practice.  The planes are  so dirty and  when you get  right down to  eat the food  tastes awful while  The Cabin crew  was mostly helpful  & friendly you  can see them  disappear from meal time even when  you use the  order button where  can they go , what and  who are they  doing

European Airways general  aviation services in  First are generally  excellent However the  company refuses to acknowledge that premium ground services should  get added for  flying First class . Ground services  - as special  fees for transfers , are so  often available on  all carriers for  the First class  and are sorely  missed at BA , Lufthansa First  Class terminal and  also at FRA  amongst others). Even  to a Gold  Star Club top  tier member there 's nothing available  – even when  you call and  get assistance on long-haul First flights (ex. LHR to  flights that involve  sleeping in planes  called T3 and  boarding at LHR.  Airlines needs to  step up and  enhance the overall  first product. The  upgrades to the  First cabin are  very marginal. Packing  only narrow (even  for new A380s)  seats in First  cabin the airline  is a huge  advantage to other  budget carriers who  provide a true  first product (ex.  Delta has 8  extra suites in . Wake up  passengers - your  regular fare paying customers are irate  at this lack  in First product  - including full  service support (especially  on special request)  when paying First ).
Paris - Mexico  - Cancun - Gatwick in economy.  Really fine food ok spacious seats  with crew and  comfortable landing. I  would fly again with BA.

Just flew with  BA on 6th  October to Goa  and had three flights in all starting at Manchester. On our outbound  flights we were  upgraded to Premium  Economy which was  a Very comfortable  but was much  appreciated On our  journey back we were in economy.  For a family  with 4 we were split only  by an aisle  so it is much nicer to  all sit together.  Our youngest was  really sick I  believe as a result of turbulence as well as  sensory deprivation. Bless  that steward who cleaned it up. However we were  there for 10  minutes with the  same effects! Nothing anyone could have  done however. Staff  are very friendly  and nothing seems  will be any trouble. Would certainly  book again with  them but this  this time the prices have rocketed.  Not as much room in the  seats and when seats are reclined there's little room.  One passenger in  me kept putting  their hands over the back of  my head rest , then covered  the TV screen - I had  them keep moving  it off. Just one bit of  tip for the stewards - make  note during meal  times you are vigilant in ensuring  the passengers put  the seats up!

Flew LHR-JFK-LHR in  London and enjoyed  excellent service on  both sectors. I  have AVIOS points for these flights and had booked in World Traveller *. From the moment I boarded  the LHR terminal , I was  called by name throughout the flight. (I have a BA Executive Club  Member Card.) The  BA crew couldn't  of been more  friendly yet discreet. Offered a glass  of champagne extra wine and post  flight drinks. I  were given a very warm welcome.  For the return  from JFK I was surprised and  pleased to have  been given an upgrade to Club World in spite of travelling on  my Reward Flight. This meant I was able to  enjoy the pre-flight supper in the JFK lounge which is so much  easier than eating during the flight so I was  able to maximise  this I couldn't  of been more pleased with the  hospitality I received  across both legs. When BA gets it right it is in a class of its  own friendly personal yet very unobtrusive service.

Recently flew to EZE and back from LHR. Longest  flight on the BA network. In  every direction the  flights were brilliant and nothing was too much trouble. IFE rather dated and choices were only average. Food was ok better  that last year on this route. Actually had a very tasty steak  courtesy of EZE  it was pink great! But full English breakfast is best avoided the continental choice was excellent. On schedule  each ways and landed 30 minutes early both ways. Baggage arrived very  fast For once there were no long queues at  BA (Buenos Aires). I fly this route perhaps twice a year 3 years ago it 's all pretty diabolical but despite cutbacks crew all seem much more friendly and the food is slowly improving. No other  direct flights from LHR.

Not in Club World. My disappointment  lies with BA on the A380  Clubs World seat.  Its theory being the flagship plane  - it should have the flagship Business class seat. As a regular  customer with BA I know the  BA product well  and this seat is a lot more cramped than  their older 777 product. What BA  do when they downsize a product is insulting the regular traveller whom  they notice and take offence and  share with someone else. Its a bit like the BA First product this used to have caviar on  the JFK route  and silver plated cutlery and Krug champagne. Now they don't. I notice  - I used to experience it.  The prices have  shot up - and quality has  slid downwards. Very disappointing.

Flight was cancelled with no explanation. No offer of help whilst having to stay the 2 extra days in Thailand. My flight from Bangkok to Heathrow was horrendous. Travelled World Traveller plus which is a total waste of money. We were served a meal within  those first couple of hours of the 12 hour 35 minute flight. I was offered beef or Fish.  Fish was actually  vegetarian Apart from  the tub of Ice Cream the next meal was not for another 8/9 hours. When the meal did arrive it was Pasta or Chicken. I asked for chicken. It was . It was also vile. Sent it back. Judging back the food going up and down the aisle  as did several others. I went to the back of the cabin for a cup if tea. I was advised if  they wanted more tea could I retain the paper cup as they  are running out!!!  it was like being on some 3rd World airline. This is BA. Supposedly the flagship airline of our country. It's an absolute disgrace. I have flown for over 40 years and never again  fly BA.

Flew from SFO  into Milan via  London on 2/14  and 2/21. Outbound  was rescheduled due  some changes requested  for my company's business partner in  Italy This was  the third reschedule and BA charged  us 533.90 and  more successively on  the basic $1822.00  per flight. No  European airline does  so in my experience. Incredibly my travel agency could not reserve me  the window seat  because of time  out unless I  requested an extra  seat for each  leg I did so but was  assigned an aisle  chair on the  first flight anyway. Both overseas legs were on 747s that were extremely cramped for someone over 6 ft. tall. On the  plane out my antiquated in-flight display  did not work.  On the way  home my headphone jack was broken.  I left Heathrow  30 minutes late  due to a  computer glitch but for the next  four hours the BA website indicated  on time arrival  and my wife waited two hours extra at SFO. Overall a very  unpleasant experience. I will avoid BA  if possible.

The return flight from Cape Town  to Heathrow BA0042 , was a  terrible experience. My entertainment system was not available for three hours despite being told that it could easily  have re-set. (No  one was available to do it).  Once it did become available it was lights-out time and my seat  would not recline.  It was not  possible to focus  at the screen with the reclined seat in front at such close . Two stewardesses  explained the seat  belt was preventing  a seat from reclining but when  that was not the reason no  anyone else came to investigate. No one seemed to  care that I needed to stand for long periods  or relieve my  stress Being polite  and patient did me no good. I have several questions. How often are the seats  replaced Why is  the entertainment system  being unreliable? How  regularly are the  lap belts checked because mine kept slipping? Customer Services want me to chose BA in  near future but as they ignored addressing these issues when I wrote  about them I  have too many doubts.

Flying BA2043 Gatwick to Male in World Traveller Plus. Plane a Boeing 777 which was very old and thus the entertainment screen was small. The main dissatisfaction  was the food - going out  it was the  cheapest that we had ever had in long haul and coming back it was not much better. The choices ran out when the cabin crew got to me (comment someone has to be last and unfortunately it is you sir). I finally got my choice  and the Captain gave up his first choice! Other airlines particularly middle east and far east based do a much better job.

Flying from St Vincent late on LIAT Airways we landed in Barbados  about 1750 for  the 1755 flight  from Gatwick. The  Delta and Virgin  flights to Gatwick  was still on  BA Tarmac. All  the passengers were  immediately met by  a representative and  passed through to  our flight. BA  staff had to  pay for themselves , therefore missed  the flight. That  means pleading for a seat on  at 21.10 hrs ! Not good  passenger relations. I  would add the  reception at check in was brilliant though.

LGW-AMS on Friday 13th. Flight delayed  at almost an hour despite being informed in the lounge that everything was on time  as provided by Captain was late inbound aircraft. (this  is my third  long running BA flight in as many weeks). No  response other than the rather matter of fact explanation from the flight  attendants surly cabin crew who clearly wanted to be somewhere else other  then looking after  my guests on . I have  four more flights  over the coming month with BA  and regretting having  continued with this  until now.

Beyond Appalling. Flight delayed by ten minutes departing Rome to LHR. As  the result one  man decided he was going to miss his connection  from LHR. He  not allowed disembark ation leading to a delay in  arrival from Rome of over 1 hour 30 minutes. Consequent late arrival to LHR. Missed connecting flight. Abandoned in Heathrow at 10.30 on a Sunday night had  to book new flights miss a  train work find  another hotel for the night. Ground staff of no use whatsoever. Staff totally unhelpful. Taking things to a  ridiculous conclusion what  happened to stop more passengers disembarking before departure thus  delaying the flight ad infinitum. Correspondence/ contact with BA  has been a joke since.

I have always  liked BA and  have recently been upgraded to bronze . I would 've thought had  a few perks? Wrong! My 15 year old son and I travelled  from LHR-NYC on  Sunday but it  is a code-share  from American Airlines.  We couldn't check  in online so  just stood in  a long queue  I couldn't book an aisle seat either. BA at  JFK airport apparently  could help because  I was a  mistake even though I had bought  a BA! The  aircraft was on  board and seats a reasonable size.  Flying back we  flew from Washington 's airport -  There was a snow storm and  it was freezing. The plane which  had an Airbus  321 was supposed to leave at 6.35pm and showing  an "on time"  was until 6.15 am on the 21st Feb. Then BA Announced a  45 min delay which sounded reasonable  until the weather  conditions and all  their other planes were delayed or  delayed We were  just boarded on the plane when  BA announced the  plane was too  heavy to be  taken out and  it was too much snow behind  the plane so  he called the  snow ploughs! We sat on the  airplane for 6  mins with no  snacks or refreshments  or water! There was nowhere for  a go apparently  so we couldn't  get off the  plane It doesn't  take a rocket scientist to work out that with  half the snow and a huge  wind that there  will be large  delays The final  decision was after  3 hrs and  the third attempt to move the  planes was that  it had to sit for another  20 mins defrosting  its wings! British  Airways were not prepared to cancel  or reschedule the  plane but instead  made us sit  as cattle on  an airplane. It's  a disgrace and we they will  just put it  up to bad weather and not  just bad planning  and bad management  at their part!  Need to look  at a new  company to fly with.

I fly BA business regularly between Delhi and London.  I was surprised  by how dirty the plane was , on 2 of my last three flights my  seat was sticky and the area  underneath me stained. The food quality is generally pretty poor - especially  on the Delhi  - London leg. Also why not get some decent  magazines - Country , Decanter the Economist rather than  some dull inflight magazine and a grubby copy of  Economist I residually like BA but they have to up their game.

LHR-JFK. End of a One-World RTW trip. What a disappointment. After a mind-numbing trip through Flight Connections (BA to BA) and a 15 minute walk to the last gate on  our B concourse only to get on a 12-15 minute bus ride i was escorted  into the F/C cabin which reminded  of more of a rabbit warren than an airplane. The aisle was so narrow that it was impossible to put my  sleeping bag in the overhead over  my seat. Very claustrophobic. Seat was strange. Very narrow and difficult to sleep in - at least 6-7" narrower than the seats on CX or AA. Strange recline mechanism - normally you can adjust the recline and the foot rest separately but not in here.  This seat reclines  on one motion so you can't  ' tune" it like with other  seats Menu looked fantastic - apps were good salad was nothing special and the main course (Indian style Lamb) was virtually inedible. Cheeses were good desserts and  salad OK. EVOD was not to the standards of  my competition. Fewer  music and TV selections than either AA or CX. Crew was fine. Stick with AA/CX from now on.

My wife and  me travelled with our daughter and  their 20 month old baby to  Australia We travelled in First Class.  I did the  round trip last  year but without  our daughter and  infant son. Naturally  we were a  wee bit nervous about travelling with  a baby but  our staff were  extremely accommodating helpful  & friendly that we had nothing to worry about.  The staff on both legs were superb in every respect. The food  was excellent and  both First class  seat pods were excellent in every  respect Comfortable clean  seats well appointed.  we will travel  again British Airways  every time we  are not fault ed in any  respect Just one minor thing that is no fault  of British Airways.  As they call  the flight there 's a dedicated  departure row for  Economy Class passengers  and it seemed that everyone was able to use  this lane which  meant that we  had to join  that queue rather  than just walk  straight through. I  realise that this  was rather pathetic but surely if  someone is prepared  the pay the  entire fare one should be entitled  of some form  special privileges. We 've travelled with British Airways on many occasions and  every time we  have had the  same wonderful experiences.

In F class  of the A380 . IAD lounge  was charming great  staff nice Concorde  Room room with  excellent service nice food and on  my visit an  amazing soup. Greeting  was very nice  friendly bartenders that  knows how to  handle their job.  Only the slightest downfall was in  a Club Class  part of the lounge the finger  sandwiches were dry  as sand and  never as flavorful.  Cabin Manager Captain and Inflight Crew were was kind  and generous with  their time. Food  is decent Champagne  and great! IFS  was strange and  was easy to  navigate but got  help from FA's  on both flights.  Experience at T5 was shocking. Like  ever heard of  a bovine charging  for the exits.  People like sardines  or small trains  with nothing to  hold onto everyone  had to tumble.  Getting through fast  security however was  no breeze. Return. F check in  counter at the  far end of  a terminal agent  behind the counter  with the personality of wall paper . Concorde Room  service were delightful breakfast was nice  but was ok.  Return to gate  is nearly the  time it was on arrival. Boarding  the First was  another snap FA's  high notch food  flight Arrival into  gate was as  smooth as surgery  and long walks  with machines little help. Overall after  reading so much  negativity about BA I was at  least made to  be special at  the stop except  check in at  JFK

After a recent  flight from Johannesburg  to London I was shocked to  discover such cramped seating conditions in the World Traveller economy class section.  Had not been able to secure  my aisle seat (which would have  made minimal difference ) I was  only a middle  class of 3. Like many other  people (and some women) I am  only 6 ft.  have long legs  and the acute  pain I experienced  would manifest from  my start of  my flight to  an end about  2 hours. It  became difficult to  stretch my legs , at times I had to stand in my  seats to alleviate leg cramp. It  had caused me considerable back pain.  They did offer  to swap seats  with a lady  occupying the adjacent  economy seat but  she was unwilling  to do so that was her ! So it became necessary to disturb her on  several number of  occasions to take  the walk along  the aisles in  attempt to alleviate  my cramps. The  flight staff were  gracious in allowing  me to use  all of their  toilets in order  to stretch my legs but had  to return to  them during a  bout of turbulence.  Being very similar  circumstances it does  makes me wonder  why British Airways  should bother take  a notice or  attempt to treat  their passengers (customers)  in this appalling . About 10 yrs ago I experienced an appalling  journey from Buenos Aires to London . British Airways  apologised for different  reasons and swore  we would never  see them again.  However I felt  I would give  them one more chance. What a  joke The world's  worst airline -  please make me  sick

Got to Boston  to what was  often called queen  in the sky  or grandmother of the sky. Went  out on ancient  plane with tiny  computer with badly  lit screen and  lousy selection of  films and music.  Did just OK  with crew very  bad Not worth  the money better  than in economy.

Our flight was  in Dubai we travelled on the  first outgoing and  one incoming to . We travelled  on economy the  seats were cramped and hard. It  got freezing cold  and cold in  Dubai passengers wore  shorts with a  scarf on them  very well. The  food was awful  without choice whatsoever.  I asked for  a coffee because I was so  thirsty but had to wait an  eternity and then  forgot to ask  more before I received it. The  Flight attendants on both flights did  not look smart appeared to want  them perform there  job as quickly  and possible without  a care for  the passengers wishes  such that they  can stand and chat at back  the flight and catch up with each other. We  had had better flights on easyjet.

Heathrow to Washington , upper deck club world return. Crew fantastic aircraft  spacious seats comfy food excellent both ways. Cannot pick  sides with anything  apart from they  advertise 50K as being a window seat when in fact you actually cannot see out  of a window from this seat. I think it's time BA invested  some money on  the Gatwick club world cabins. The Heathrow product is  ten times better but the price difference does not reflect the difference  in standard of  living and product ..

In return. The  first flight was . Nothing special  like always. The  seats are the  best fitted seats  for European flight.  The meal was  ok compared to  the The return  staff was really  bad One of  the FA was rude. He looked  old and tired  as it was  the last flight  for the day.  Also showed no  remorse in collecting  their used cups.  We know it 's a short  time but it  is just unacceptable.  It just a  shame to see  that a great airline is declining  like that.

Recently travelled to  London return in  London from LGW  with flights on time and very  comfortably on board the B737-436 (G-DOCW/G-DOCX).  We provide a nice complimentary breakfast  onboard BA2736 and  tea and snack on the return  so no hesitation  to recommend.

Flight 0058 Cape  Coast to London Heathrow Seats 03A  to 04A. Check  in - Directed  to Club World check in. One of our bags  is labelled with First Priority label.  A little annoying  - on the way out all  the luggage was  placed very last  through the carousel.  Next was via  gate 2 and then through World 's Plus section.  Less annoying as  it happened with boarding and disembarking  on the way . Electrical problems  with entertainment and lighting - resolved after two hours.  Only First amenity  item on board.  The sleep suit  available as not  on board either.  Cards for buddy dining kept collapsing.  Apparently it was  a 1st of the month new  drink list available.  With one glass  at Mersault there was no more  on board. Offered  glass of last  resort whites as  the alternative. Butter at breakfast was  free Needn't have  worried about the  bag without the  priority label. It came of before  any other bags!  Our First luggage  went through long after most of the other classes  on travel had  received the baggage  - We did  go through door  3 however. Crew  friendly and apologetic.  Why do we pay the extra? It's back to  Club World for us. Time to  consider trying other  options as well.

Flew from LAX-LHR on BA's new  777 The crew  was rightfully proud of their new aircraft and could not stop telling the passengers about its status. My seat was picked as 53K Upper Deck. I couldn't believe how cramped it was for this long journey. The divider partition was covered in red wine stains from a previous trip and staff seemed nonchalant about cleanliness. The available width of BA's offering is a big disappointment. Whilst those socially awkward individuals might enjoy the clandestine surroundings I for one  do not favour the casket-feel of Club World. The A380 and 787 were a chance to hone the business class offering after much criticism. Execution of the flight was prompt and we pushed back on schedule. I fly a lot for work and am privileged to enjoy the premium cabins but  the attention to detail and very slow service don't inspire a return to a specific carrier. One alcoholic drink was offered just after take off and then the all too familiar menu was wheeled out. BA's menu for this flight was identical to a return LHR-MIA-LHR leg I took back in early December. Lacklustre  drinks and the infamous warm chicken  and salad. Maybe I was tired  or didn't endear myself but it needs to be better. I recently flew the A380  in AF to LAX in Business  class that was a role reversal! No limp and greasy bacon sandwich on AF either. LAX Teminal B a massive improvement over the years. From fast immigration to pleasant design , the leader in aspiring all US airports to improve their standards and get rid of carpet underfoot! Although and in summary is this solely enough in a demanding arena where those availing themselves of premium cabin experiences have quite the opposite.

I have been a loyal customer for the last 10 years and have progressively seen the service cleanliness and interest in client satisfaction decline. I just came back from a  round trip and will not fly BA again. Several reasons: my seat  for Business Class was noticeably filthy - crumbs on the seat and hair on my pillow. When I told the attendant she just fluffed the pillow and  walked away. I was hounded for  not filling out the breakfast form in 5 minutes  before plane had  not even taken off) and told that "I would not get breakfast". I was served raw chicken and when I expressed interest in another dish was told that all the other passengers had eaten and that there were no more dishes on the plane? The dish was taken away but no follow up or apologies - not even an extra bag of nuts to ensure that I was not hungry for the 7.5 hr flight.  But the most disturbing part of traveling with BA is that the staff are unapologetically arrogant disinterested and unapproachable and any response is as if they are  doing you a favor. As a customer paying nearly 10000 USD for a round trip ticket I shouldn't be afraid to speak to staff and highlight a dirty seat or food that is not cooked. The  seats on two of the legs were broken and my screen did not work on three of the legs. There are plenty of other first class carriers out there that  I will now  become a customer of.

Flew AMS-LHR-JFK return  28 Dec - 31st Dec. AMS-LHR-AMS on A321 the first thing you notice is the cabin interior. Although clearly an older bird the new interior has a very comfortable and warm feel to it - yet also modern. Nice and comfy leather seats leg room just sufficient for flight under say  2 hours. Service is as expected a quick drink and some nuts (though a sandwich  might be nice  after a mid-morning flight). They are clearly matching their product with the competition on this route as free newspapers where available upon boarding contrary to the intercontinental stretch. LHR-JFK-LHR on B744 totally different experience. Transferring through T5 at LHR easy enough although  we got the feeling they like  to control the  traffic flow to the max - but hey this is the UK after all. Also BA advertise T5 as like it's one building - not the case. All this was acceptable until we found out we  were being directed to a bus gate. They actually board a fully booked B744 through busses with one stairway and door available for the entire plane. Given  as the 788's completely cold and dark occupying the airbridges I felt  this was totally unnecessary. Turned out to be a very dated 744 with mostly Club World and First  class as the economy plus and  that consisted of only 2 cabin  with together rest of the plane premium product. How  they lose your premium clientele at warp speed. Prime example! Service on board was nice enough food pretty ok and plenty of drinks to  choose from. Seats dated and sometimes broken - my adjustable headrest would adjust only to slide back down slowly same problem on both sectors. IFE well just bring your own . So dated it's just not worth switching on. The cabin crew made the difference though on all sectors they were  super friendly yet professional and very helpful. Arriving early morning from JFK of course we parked at a hard stand. Waited our turn for 20+ minutes in a non ventilated cabin to get in the bus  - only one exit in use. BA this is not acceptable. Disembarking  on commuter plane up to 100 pax with buses well ok. But a fully loaded 744? Come on.

Out from LHR  for JNB on  28 Jan flight  and check in  but as we  had e-tickets had nothing but passports  to destination never  been a problem before but was  more like a quiz at a  school Also advised  that we would  need to pick  off our luggage at JNB and  checked in again  to JNB for  departure so we  spend time looking for luggage which  was being transferred.  I have never liked the premium  economy seats on  Emirates but connections  at JNB made  them necessary to  use BA. Seats  with plenty of  leg room and general space is  great but are  trying to hard after a couple  more hours my backside begins to  hurt Crew were . As far  the airline food , it was . Return on  arrival on 29th , same problems  in seats also  seat nearest to our seats was  out of order  and without treading on people you  had to walk  towards the end  to the aircraft  as an alternative  is when sitting  for premium economy  there is not  possible to see  the lights as  we are behind  you When possible will always try  or use Virgin  Atlantic

Service from LHR  - CAI new  7 day business  trip - was  absolutely superb. Cabin  attendants were attentive  very helpful flight  attendant on time , spotless food  & seats comfortable. My return flight  was again good  cabin attendants food  and fine seats  comfortable and clean.  even though the  landing was at  a time very  strong winds were  strong in UK the landing was  beautifully executed and  for me as  one nervous flyer really I could not have asked  or two better  tickets I obtained  at excellent prices  on both flight  times relatively last  minute too! No  point in flying  anywhere at anytime.

Best Economy. Both  meals on lower deck of the A380 professional yet  excellent service plenty  and drink runs between meal services.  Passenger comfort superior  over LH and AF380s. Travelled with an elderly passenger attentive gate staff allowed us to pre-board on both flights. Both flights arrived ahead of schedule. So far best transatlantic experience on an A380.

Flying to Singapore  in late Jan/early  February 2015. The economy seats were relatively comfortable but  could be a bit softer. The  second leg (BA16)  was quite good except for the meal which was barely edible. The  plane back had a much improved meal but the  PA system had  several issues and  had to be  on about 4  hours Another problem with the return  flight (BA15) is that if you get on the  plane in Singapore and not in  London by the time online check-in  doors open for  passengers there are  almost no seats  too choose from.  They wanted a window seat and  was not a  seat window to  choose from at  the moment the  internet check-in opened  for me. Service  of both flights  was good. I  started feeling a  bit dehydrated and  stopped for plenty  to water on  our return flight  and had no problems at all.  All the staff  were nice and  helpful

- The trip got off to a good start as the North  Shore was not to busy and  it made the whole experience relaxing  more than an  endurance test -  but it is  when it is busy. Had a nice early light  dinner The aircraft was a new A321. I like this plane. It  is rammed end  on end. The plane had the new Club Europe  logo and it  struck me how  stupid BA seem  to be in missing the opportunity to develop a  plane that could be really high in quality - but isn't. Unless you are seated in row "1"  then the leg  space is appalling and the same as economy. As  for the old  wide seat - the centre seat between 3 seats  - is a . Quite why this is logical  escapes me - because it seems  would imply that  because it suits  you they will  in a whim seat three passengers  and not two. This was a  perfect opportunity to stand out from  some competition and  also establish a  non - wide C.E. seat. At  they same time justify the higher pricing. Its no  surprise BA have very few - if any -  European Industry awards  to the services they provide. So  - I had  my light lunch and a couple  a Gin and Tonics which was  good The FAs were great. Flight  started a few  mins late but  still whizzed over to Zurich in  20 minutes which was great. The  worlds favourite airline? Try "The Worlds most frustrating airline!"

I flew club world from JHB  to LHR on 21/01 on the  747 The flight  in overall was a good one. Sitting on the  top deck of 747 is definitely a must as  is a fair bit quieter than the main deck. The check in was a breeze  as the staff  on the desk  are very friendly especially considering I was travelling with  loads of luggage bicycle etc. I didn't use the  bathroom as I know the one in JNB is  not very good. The boarding took  right on time and we were  given pre takeoff drinks soon after seating. Take off  went a bit  slow but smooth non the less. The food leaves  A lot to be desired on BA I had  only Salmon main course which was very bland. The up side the  food was perfectly chilled and the  salad was yummy. The seat configuration is not the best as you are facing your neighbour. The seat  in the lounging position is very  nice but is a bit narrow for sleeping it's also a bit short for taller individuals such as  me Arrival at T5 was very smooth as I  think the fast track lane from landing to climbing in the taxi was less than 30 min. I would definitely fly  them again but they do need to look into the quality of  food and the seat configurations for future upgrades.

My wife and I flew business class LHR-HKG 23/1/15 on a 777-200 seats 11 E&F. Check-in was ok once it got started this took several minutes as the woman at the counter was  busy with 2 friends. The lounge was good overall if a bit crowded and over heated. There was  food type offerings  until 6.30pm when hot food was  offered This was  all well cooked and presented the Thai green curry  was excellent so compliments to the chef. Boarding was on time and efficient unlike our previous BA experience at HKG. We found the middle seats on this plane a bit cramped but comfortable for sleeping. The inflight food was very good I had a chicken and rice dish my wife had braised beef which she says was excellent I do think dessert and  drink should be offered. Unlike our last BA flight 5 weeks ago the crew on this flight were excellent friendly and attentive. The IFE  seat is fair but the screen  was square and is small compared to that on  the A380 (and very small compared to CX). Thanks to the FA's we had a very enjoyable trip. We would fly BA again but only if the  airline was very competitive the staffing inconsistencies worry me some what this is really a management issue and should be addressed if it were the BA brand would be more competitive.

Flew back from Milan LIN on Jan 4th. Because of "mist" (the pilot's actual characterization) most flights that morning had been delayed/canceled in/out of LHR. No delay info given at check-in nor at gate. Upon boarding the captain informed us that because of "mist" we were being held on the ground for 2 hours. My connecting flight  for SFO was 2.5 hrs after landing in LHR. Flight attendant assured me most flights  were being delayed therefore mine to SFO most likely too. Upon landing  into LHR a sea of canceled/delayed lost souls. I was immediately told I was forced to miss my connection because my flight to SFO was on time.  We was forced to join the longest line I've ever seen for rebooking. It never moved. We were told another set of rebooking desks were available upstairs  " faster". Crossing the border control took just as long. Upstairs it took me 5 hours just to get closer to the desks but still at least a couple hours away. I finally managed to join the free wifi and call BA's office to get rebooked online. I was rebooked on a flight from SFO to LHR. The wrong way around. When I pointed out the obvious the agent told me there was a "computer glitch" and promised to call me back. She finally called me back and got rebooked on AA flights to JFK and to SFO from there. The next morning at the AA check in they could not check me in on the JFK-SFO because of "issues with the BA ticket". It took 90 minutes and multiple interactions with 3 different desks  not get it solved. I nearly missed the flight to JFK too. My suitcase was never loaded on that flight and I didn't get it at JFK. It took me 5 days to get my suitcase back. I will never fly British Airways again.

Flight LHR-MIA in  Frankfurt Seats 13E and 13F on . It was very comfortable for a day flight and after a light meal I managed to get  about 5 hours of sleep. Recline is good and leg room ok for a person of my height 5ft 10in. Food  tasted ok and would have liked to eat my partners sticky toffee pudding because mine went down too well! We were off the plane first at MIA before First and club which was rather nifty. Good experience.

First flight from  flight T5 to  International Dulles (IAD)  with Club World. Check in was  easy even if  the layout of  the T5 check-in  desk isn't the most intuitive. Security  was efficient. However the BA lounge  felt overcrowded and  packed with minimal  amenities and only  home comforts. Outbound  service on the  BA Boarding was  slightly chaotic due  to the gate  gate being too  small for such a large passenger  load but the  crew did push  through on-time. The  club World cabin  and the upper  cabin could best  of described as  clean and functional.  It was reasonably  comfortable if not  comfortable but despite  being a relatively  small aircraft it  could feel slightly  uncomfortable already. The  club World seat  placement was forward  looking and on  an aisle was  comfortable enough. The  touch screen was rather small and  our choice of  headphones wasn't terribly  attractive but everything  else from the  tiny USB power  cable was working.  In general layout  in the cabin  is terrible. Not  only do window less and middle  row passengers have  a step over  the legs of  front seat passengers  to get to  and from their  feet but when  no privacy screen  on seats is  missing for take-off , and during  boarding services you  catch yourself staring  a disconcertingly close  window into your  own face. It  makes everything feel  awkward and cheap.  Operations were fine and the crew  was polite and  friendly Overall I'd  rate the outbound  flight as 'Okay'  as a business  class flight. Return  home experience was  far from okay.  My flight departing  DC at 10.20 am was cancelled  two hours prior  to departure due  some mechanical issues.  Note that there  was no Club  World seats on  the earlier flight  north of IAD  at night which  they could just  easily make at  the push and  then would have to fly back  into Economy. When  they asked about  my BA flight  from Baltimore (BWI)  an hour later  and was told , yes there  were Club World  seats available that  night so I  had to be  bumped onto that  flight instead. Arriving  to BWI check-in , was informed  but unfortunately there  still weren't any  club World seats  available and I  will have to  fly back in  World Traveller Plus.  My flight from BWI to LHR I was on  was rather old  flight The cabin  layout was dated  looking and cramped  with minimal overhead  luggage storage. World  traveler Plus seats  were cramped and  cramped with tiny  flat screens. In-flight  service was bland.  Cabin crew were  helpful but not  particularly friendly. Flight  arrived and arrived  on time. As  a UK passport  holder Immigration at  customs was quick.  Bag reclaim took  time but bags  landed within five  minutes of reaching <mask> baggage hall.

Hi club world : The overall product still good  but need some  advice on aircraft and seat desing.  Sometimes the window  it can fell  little bit narrow  but no extra  seat for your  seat On the  one hand good  and fast connection . LHR great  and FA nice  & attentive. IFE  great choice of  a nice food  also great). Will  try them again.

Flew SYD-SIN-SYD and  all in all can't complain. Service was excellent food excellent large wine choice. Seats weren't  that different to other Business class seats we have experienced although I would suggest that couples don't choose window seats as they need to actually stand up  or walk around to speak to  the partner.
