Seats in centre are adjoining with a sliding screen between. Qantas first class lounge in Sydney was fantastic with full restaurant service. Singapore lounge very comfortable with plenty of seats. Would definitely fly BA again.

The MIA-LHR in First. Seats 5a and 5k. This was my first time in BA first and I was really impressed. From the moment  the boyfriend and I walked up to check in to the moment  he left the plane we were very well looked  after The food was nice and particularly enjoyed the "buddy dining". My gooseberry crumble went down well. I  needed around 2 hours sleep as the jet stream and storm that  is hitting the  middle Eastern U.S made our flight very bumpy but  not super fast.  Total time being little over 7 hours 20 mins.  We must mention the cabin crew  members were very helpful and professional. We bought the seats in the  middle and it  paid money well .

LGW-ACF-LGW (Club Europe) On both flights  they had very good cabin staff , the purser was the same on both flights and he was  very efficient and very friendly as were both stewardesses. The food was very good too lovely and hot large portions of chicken/beef tasty liked the choices given so we were  both happy. The new seat configuration  of the Airbus we did not  use we were in row 8 then 6 and they were fine but I'd not  like to be in the first row right by the door and noticeably colder (stood  up by the row queuing for the loo) and there is no bulkhead any more  so it's a very small open space between the  first row of seats the loo and the galley! I'm only 5 ft 2 tall and very slim build and I found the loo  because looking around I couldn't see how 1/3 of the passengers would fit in it and I don't  think they were all way overweight it is very small and slanting roof. A tall and big built person would not be happy! I gave inflight entertainment 1 as obviously they don't exist on short haul . The seats were far too upright and therefore uncomfortable you could only recline them a bit or otherwise the poor  people behind you wouldn't have had any space and I kept sliding forward on mine. The leg rest has gone too so I had nothing to stop  my moving forward and the space  between rows felt  awful lot reduced.

Welcome to Heathrow , 23rd January  2018 Very old  aircraft with old style interior in  BA A real  disappointment after a  couple of long  haul flights in  the new cabin.  It really needs  improvement Anyone who has not flown  for BA before  can leave with  a terrible impression.  New worn cramped  with many falling  apart with outdated  seats Food and  drinks service usual  and standard though. Please BA get  rid of this  old interior once  and for all. It really lets  the airline down  & does nothing  about the passenger ..

I travelled BA  with Business class  flight to Vegas  before Xmas and  then to LHR  to San Diego  last January. Business class travel is a rare treat  to us and I can't understand  that BA persevere  without this unique  outward facing seating  design To sit  for 11 hours  faced to face with a stranger  sounds awful as is the lack of space created by the curved  seating between the  seat The cabin  conditions were great  but was below  par and the  overhead entertainment system  is poor choice  for terrible picture quality. Outbound we  were upstairs on a 747 there  was two attendants assisting only 16  seats and they  were a good  job and kept  the two toilets . Given these  conditions this flight  really should have  looked fantastic. However  given the negatives  described above I  would classify it  as just about  terrible We returned  in a 777 and my negative  experiences are sadly  these same other  passengers we were  stuck on the  747 for 40  minutes on landing  on buses to  JFK

Flew Business Class  - Flight crew excellent as always.  Service was pretty decent for airplane  Class Seat was  spacious and certainly  easier than sitting in the back of the plane. However we think this configuration is  a failed experiment by BA. Eight seats across is too many for  Economy Class. The  rows were too  small The backward  facing seats are disconcerting for two reasons: If you  are traveling with a spouse or  children and neither  want to face  you you can't  be together. Secondly  if the divider is down you  are at a  full 15 inches ! Hope BA reverts to the  old style one !

Los Angeles (LAX) to London (LHR) in Club World. January 2015. Have not flown out of the Tom Bradley International Terminal  at LAX for years but it's now much improved.  Came in and  easily drop a  package as was security and in the oneworld lounge  within minutes. Good choice of food and drinks and  plenty of space. Short-ish walk to the gate good welcome on board and drinks served quickly. Couldn't fault any aspect of the experience and  just took off and landed on  Sunday and managed a good five hours sleep out of the ten hours duration. Love the Arrivals Lounge  at LHR. A  quick shower and 2nd breakfast sets you up for the day.

Had a return  journey to Dublin  after Christmas and  finding BA to  prove extremely disappointing. My principal complaint  was the dirt  in the seats ' floor area  looked as if  they had not  properly cleaned for  previous flights. Also  at 5'8" I 'm not that  tall but still found the seats  uncomfortable and uncomfortable.

Sent Business A380  flight and returned on 777 BKK-LHR. Found T5 lounge great as usual  people were fine  and ok in  the cabin. Food  served was tasty  & cabin crew professional but friendly. Wash bag was  fine for Business , hey it's not a deal braker. IFE was ok touchscreen on both flights.

The First flight to LHR was  excellent with an  excellent Captain and  extremely efficient staff  and a refurbished  Crew Cabin is  also smart. Arrived  at LHR early  which is a  nice change despite  the enforced 'stacking'  it happens to  facilitate landing at . Return flight was great too  Thanks to the  passengers and crew 's service on  a full flight  of the A319  that was the old type and  that did it ! Overall a  positive experience with  the

My wife and  I flew to  London late November  and had pre booked seats online  ta and fro but on both  occasions the seats  had already occupied  when we boarded  The flight attendants  attitudes towards this  point on the  whole journey was  its best rude unhelpful and indifferent. Asking for a  refund was a  constant siege after  3 hours into  a flight they claim that they  have run out  of galley drink ! On our return trying to  secure a refund  on the pre  booking seats proved  that Overall B.A.  A got to rank as one  if the worst  airlines to travel with staff with generally poor and  mean attitudes penny pinching which is  based on mean and poor legroom.  Hate to say this B.A but  this and other  passengers put our  favourite airline to absolute shame.

Flew BKK-LHR was fearing the worst  and read the reviews on here  of the aisle  seats where people have to step  over you to get out. Relieved to say this  never cause me any problems and  it wasn't disturbed. Found the seat  would be comfortable in both the  aisle and flat bed positions. Service  in the cabin  itself was adequately good. Food average.  Audio system average.

Reviewed on A380.  Business Class Seat . Crew unprofessional  most of the  flight forgot seat  number existed with  no welcome drink  every 15 mins  ( passed no  drink top up until I asked  3 times) forgot wine match with  each course and  then handed out  a "ok?" as  no comment. New tasting menu was  not good. Had a flight in  London with CX  a few days later and the  same quality crew , overall service was another league  that far outshone BA. The BA  seat product is  a waste of money and crew  need a re-train.

London Gatwick to  Southampton 27th December return 7th January. 777 Aircraft economy  Class I never travel economy class so it was  a bit of  an eye opener particularly on a 12 hour flight. The seats are  much too close  up and quite  uncomfortable In the  middle seat the  pull down tray was broken. When  another passenger in front put his seat back I  did use the  toilet and when  I asked the  lady to ask him to put  it forward a bit she just shrugged and said nothing. Poor unfriendly  passengers and absolute  bad food. BA are miles behind the Far and Middle East airlines  and still charging . I have no idea why  I use them.

Bangkok to London Heathrow. 8 Sep 2014. On this flight British Airways stinted on everything. I don't mind a frugal airline  in long as the fare is cheap. British Airways is not cheap. As soon as we were in the air the  prices plummeted. Everyone had their airline blankets over them.  There were not enough stewards/stewardesses. Forty  seconds before the  flight on board drink - and no small snack not even a small packet of  chips Seatback TV did not work in the section I was on and the man next to me had to move  onto another seat.  All seatbacks should be checked before the flight. However  thankfully they did work. A small number of films TV shows I have never heard of and no games option. First meal very frugal  second meal no salad and no bread roll. And creamers! Even for tea! Whatever the quality of the meal serving creamers  cancelled out any  semblance of quality. Snacks we had  to wait and when they were available there was a limited amount.  Thai Airways even ran out of  peanuts BA hasa  habit of paying to book a certain seat they  always miss a trick! I resent having to pay to book a  specific seat. The  flight was expensive but it had  one good time slot and no  problem Never again.

Thursday 19th Jan  2017 Heathrow to  Southampton Legroom in  Manchester is too  big I'm 6'2"  you just don't  fit On a long haul flight  recently I sat  with my knees  staring out into  my aisle and  my seat space  for 10 hours.

Just returned from JFK last Friday  a reasonable flight  was delayed for an hour and  one half. Main  course was okay  and the breakfast  was appalling a stale croissant with some jam. I  made good money  in this flight.  It disappointed quality  is slipping away.

Chris (BA 4467) got the flight  off sale for a pretty good  deal Great legroom  on the E190  and comfortable seats quick and hassle free boarding. Service  is a bit slow but included a drink and a snack (enough for such a short flight of  an hour) with  the option for  dinner if so desired. Would recommend. LCY is going to be my airport of choice when going to  work in future was sitting on the DLR 15 mins after landing  back at my hotel 40 mins after disembarking and the trip on  public transport was  just £4.80 rather  then excessive cost/time  from other airports in the area.

• Excellent SLOW  Lounge at CPT with outstanding food  including 'loos with  great view'. Reasonable  price to JNB although 737 pretty  good BA Galleries lounge at JNB  but a patch on SLOW lounge.  Lounge layout on  the upper deck  is superior to  that on A380 , flight particularly  with less than  halfway full. FAs  staff and food  were managed well. Food better than  BA IFE not as good as  seats and screen  comparable to Club  Lounge on A380. Flat- bed seats  good although narrow  so hard.

Flying to London  Economy seat 2A  on aircraft. Very  small difference between  economy and Business  in comfort terms  and the food  is disgusting. Poor  choice of entertainment.  One good thing  i can remember  was a nice  old Burgundy but  it was probably  better in economy ! Will stick  to business class  in future for  the airport fast  lanes and lounges.

Flight from LGW  to MCO on  Flight 772. Compared  with last year , cabin was  good Wide variety  of food and  seat Quality was  good BA is  still behind a  lot of airlines  on business class.  Every seat is  comfortable if you 're over 6 feet tall. Staff . They don't  get out of  their way. It 's that they  are just doing their job. You don't see them between meals. They  have to step  up their game.  I don't think  it is a  5 star airline.  I would only  fly because of  their flight.

Recently completed a round-trip LGW-Barcelona. Flying out I was in economy a bit tight but  everyone was very friendly. Only complaint would be that drinks took a long time to  be served in , by the time they reached the back it was well past an hour into  our flight and long after the sandwiches had been  taken out. A second drinks or coffee/tea service would have been appreciated. Flew Club Europe on inbound (Jan 7 13.40 flight) and although I'm  more a seasoned business-class traveller I thought it was  good for the  additional premium paid.  It had the  same layout so  few complaints about seat comfort not sure if I'd  feel the same  in the newer  seating arrangement from what I've read  around this forum. Crew member serving  in club cabin  Could not have been better - everything was served with the most gracious of smiles  and the mood in the cabin was relaxed but convivial. Food and  service very good  - appropriate for  time of day and length of  stay Miro Lounge , Barcelona top-notch. Will definitely try to book Club  in the future.

First in First.  Our brief trip  to celebrate New  Years in Honkers.  A First class  seats in average . Track and  then welcome in  our Concorde Room.  Back to a  restaurant for 3.  Excellent meal and  drink My salmon  curry was nice , and the  steak was very  tasty rounded off  by a sticky  apple and date  sauce which was  good but next  to more clotted  wine please. I  have a couple  more glasses of  wine and a  small pinot noir.  Finally at C64  back to my  friends after a  few warm personal ised Champagne slippers  arrived and an  extra kit proffered.  Both seem excellent. They will also  take us home  for New Year's . After take  on drinks (bloody  hot for me)  have an amuse-bouche.  My friends indulged  on a full  meal but I  also had the  Chicken Soup which  is very tasty.  My friend's Profiteroles  was yummy. The  rest were very  kind to us . After being  put on a  cruise of the  cabin by Kim  I slept for  two hours or  so before indulging  on a full  meal Got changed  on landing. An  excellent flight with  an excellent crew.  Welcome home. After  another pleasant supper  at the Qantas  restaurant we were  escorted to the  rear of the  aircraft and welcomed  to board by  the now familiar  staff Champagne settled  us down and after take off  the dinner was  served with an  array of beef  and prawn and  wild salmon with  lemon oil caviar  accompanied by lamb washed down with  two rather nice  dessert with a  small plate conclusion.  After a good  night sleep I  took to a  cup of English  sweet tea and  fruit juice whilst  our friends had  their full works.  On disembarkation. BA  does its best.

Reviewed Jan 6 . LHR-JFK. First.  It is great  having the first class experience with  checks in security  and straight into  your Concorde room.  The lounge and  toilet facilities are  a great refuge while flying especially the dining room.  A 777 has  more room in the cabin than  the 747 flight  into London which  I appreciated especially when it came to my bed.  The 2A is  nice and roomy. It was a  short flight so service was efficient and friendly if not a little . Overall the service was at  a great BA . What was  disappointing was the  cabin was lacking  with freshness and  comfort which was  disappointing There was  a (1hr) delay  when planing at  takeoff which was not BA's fault  it really made  the flight much  longer than it  otherwise had been.  We would fly  again First again  praising the service stylish cabin and  overall comfort.

London-Gatwick to Venice  on 30 December  - everything went  well at check , no problems flight arrived safely. Info given during flight. No gluten  free option given  as snack during flight but got  drink option. Opted for a drink  my own snack which I always  do as stand by. Cabin crew  very rushed but polite.

We flew from Gatwick to Jamaica in November. Check  out was easy , very quick and we were  immediately in the lounge. The lounge as usual was comfortable but with a very poor selection of food. As we were there around 09.15  I had hoped to have a hot breakfast but in the end the only hot dish available was porridge which I  didnt fancy so we settled for  sandwiches and cakes. The departure gate was not the biggest and as  the result it all got a bit messy with  some staff trying coral the CW  get in to a separate area  to board first. On board most  passengers were OK and the staff are very efficient and helped to make the experience  another good one.  Our return from  Kingston was pretty much the same although the check in was slower. However this was compensated by an  additional lounge (Club Kingston) that served nice hot and  cold snacks and then escorted you  to the departure  gate As usual the crew turned the lights down as soon as dinner was cleared away but I did manage to  relax for a while and then sleep for 3  or 4 hours. Overall quite good , based on this experience I would recommend this  flight

Welcome to Newark  from 787 aircraft.  Airport clean and tidy excellent in flight entertainment good food and drink  served by friendly  people Overall excellent  Value for money. The Galleries Lounge at terminal 5B  is an excellent  spot quiet for  this time of day with plentiful  food and drink.

Now back from a fantastic 2.5 week trip to Thailand flying to  London from Bangkok  on BA on  Emirates aircraft. I definitely would choose  this airline next !! We flew out on 31st December 2014 and  the crew were  hostile and inattentive. Asking for a  drink seemed as if it was  like putting them out. One of  the crew swore  off communicating with  his colleague during  the drinks service  within ear shot of us. Outbound  had run out  of the the  vegetarian choice for  our very small  flight by the  time they reached  us so we  opted to had  the veggie option. For most of  the flight the  passengers were camped  in the galley at the back  room having a  conversation with colleagues  whether working or not so you  know it was a imposition to ask for water  and snacks. My  personal entertainment system  had streaks all across which couldn't  get rubbed off  so the movies  were hard to  watch Return flight  crew on 16th  February were much  more surly but  still conspicuous by  their absence meaning  you had to try and wade  through the party  at the back  and try and  grab water or  snacks during the  meal Two passengers were flicking raisins  in the cabin  at other passengers which might have  bee spotted had the cabin crew  had more of a presence. The inflight entertainment system  has major issues  that meant it  only work on demand making it  difficult to plan  hours of movies.  Had 2 very  large meals at the either end  of a 13  minute flight with  extremely limited options  with snacks in  fact One staff member said they  had very little  food then allowed a passenger to  buy about 5 packets for herself. Tray table was  used in seat  8 also. The  staff said as  that was an  early flight they  suggested we all  get to sleep  but the flight left just before  sunset so not  that I call  it night flight. I used to  love flying BA  so have always  felt impressed with their service in the past but now the planes and the crew  seem tired and I am sorry  to say neither  my partner or  myself enjoyed the experience. Will look  into EVA Thai  and one of  the Middle Eastern  flights next time.

San Diego-LHR-MAN. On 6th January we flew from San  Francisco to Manchester  arriving via Heathrow.  Originally flying out  last Christmas Day via LAX on the A380 this  flight was a  fantastic return to form for BA's  Club World offering.  Our San Diego  Aero Club lounge  are currently undergoing  renovations but is still a nice  touch and unlike the UK lounges  before arrival we 're offered a  meal not just  to 'self serve'  lounge When it came time to  disembark this was a much smoother experience than our  outward flight on the A380 the  lounge at San Diego had the  dining area well organised and once club passengers were  seated we were  on the aircraft  plenty of bubbly in hand in  hand The cabin crew were much  better and professional  then those on the outward flight  in this is smaller cabin with  more passengers you  almost felt that  you were the  only customer your  ticket price would  be and nothing was too much . Drinks were  well topped up food was excellent and the cabin crew were chatty and friendly. The  entertainment system might not have been  quite as impressive as on the A380 but considering  everyone slept for a large portion of this 10  hour flight that was unimportant. After a very average  outward flight on  the A380 into  London this superb  flight home on  this smaller aircraft restored my faith  in BA's club  service and means  hopefully for future trips to the  East Coast we will be flying direct into San Diego rather than .

London 870 22nd  June 2014. Flew  from London to  Manchester Very satisfied  customer service staff friendly and professional.  Even though this  was a fairly short trip food  and beverages were very satisfactory. Will  definitely recommend this  trip

LHR - Helsinki in Business Class. I happened to  get on this flight as I booked a flight to Shanghai with Finnair in business and BA are a Oneworld partner. Although the cabin crew were very attentive I feel that Club Europe is not worth  the extra money considering the length of flight and extra services provided. The aircraft was a brand new A320 with leather seats but there  is no extra legroom in the Club Europe section. The seats were the same as in the economy section the only difference being that the middle seat is not in use. There is a movable partition separating the two cabins presumably to offer maximum flexibility for the airline. Hot towels were provided before takeoff but no welcome drinks. The generous  buffet service started shortly after take off followed by a rather disappointing meal. Considering that it was a 2.5h lunchtime flight all that was on offer was a cold meat platter with a salad and a bread roll. I have had better service in Economy on BA short hall flights in the late 90s. Furthermore I recently flew on a China Eastern Airlines domestic flight of similar length on business class on a new A320  and the seats were in a 4-abreast configuration with much more legroom and I was served with a hot meal! There was no personal entertainment - the overhead screens showed the moving map for the duration of the flight. I do like BA but if you are flying short hall and are considering Club Europe I suggest saving your money and flying in the economy cabin. These low ratings reflect my expectations of business class and not the airline overall.

My wife and I travelled from Manchester to Las  Vegas via Heathrow. The flight from Manchester was delayed and then on arrival at LHR the boarding passes which were fine at MAN were no good at LHR. We had  to queue for over 2 hours to get more  passes Others with the same problem missed their main flights! The staff  on LHR are rude jobsworth who take great pleasure in causing the maximum discomfort. The 747 seats on the LHR to LV flights were terrible like small deck chairs. Any leg/knee movement from the person behind was felt even with the pillow between me and  my seat back. Compared with US Air the seats are much smaller and far more basic. Seating totally unsuitable for long  distance flights. The entire cabin is extremely cramped the aisles are so narrow that anyone who is not slim tends to bang into your  seat every time they pass. BA brought a whole new meaning to "cattle class" The cabin staff were efficient and professional the food was fine. I am  not a large person certainly not overweight but I was badly cramped. I would never choose BA for  a long haul  flight again. We travel from Manchester to Las Vegas 2 or 3 times a year. BA is by far the worst carrier we have flown with especially when you add in the extra costs for seat  upgrades etc. Very Poor!

Regularly travel from BCN to LHR. In addition to  getting us out of T5 making international connection more  comfortable it is now using the  new refurb'd A320s on this route.  New ones where BA sneaks another row of seats in between 1  & 10. Already faced with overpriced  seats its now insisting on make journeys less comfortable. Less costs more.

I have not travelled with BA  in almost 7  months as a result of moving  to Asia and using carriers like  AF I flew  back from LHR to MIA on a 747 and horrified to see that the Premium  service has not changed in the last 10 years.  They have quite  the ageing fleet now when compared to most European  or Asian carriers and it really shows. The entertainment screen was absolutely tiny and the  weak point is  with that ridiculous adapter for which you have to  spend an arm  or a leg so pleased I found mine from  some years back!  You must go  and have a  look at the AF premium product  and a wake up call. The food was okay nothing to rave about and perfectly satisfactory service onboard seems friendly and  attentive however the state of the uniforms of some of the staff was shocking not sure if its a case of  poor quality material or lack of attention to appearances.  We do remember the strap line "BA the worlds favourite airline" but  clearly they have slipped quite a  bit way back.

Flying Miami to  Boston it was  another nightmare the  man watched me  struggle with 2  small cabin cases  but did not  want to help  and another passenger  tried to put  things in the  seat for me  whilst the attendant  sat there and  waited It was very clear that  he could not  have bothered. When  my meals were  not served he  whispered to myself and my husband  did you want  this as if  someone was doing  us a favour)  He asked for  food the whole  of the trip.  When arriving in  London yet again  BA stood and  watched me struggling to get the  seat down as  our husband only  had one arm  and could not  help me. I  have travelled many  trips with BA  I always found  the staff very  friendly but sadly not on this  trip

Off to HKG  Country Club -  Southampton Lovely newish  design and very  nice staff with smiles. Seat was rear facing and  works fine as a bed but seems to have got a little  cramped Window seat , and was expecting some sort of decent storage space but only  the tiny little  storage drawer meaning  I had to put everything above in the locker and bother the  attendant in 13B. Food and drink  was very good as was inflight entertainment. Decent sleep in a comfortable  room - only  big niggle was  the 8 abreast cabin which seems inferior to Cathay 's Virgin "herringbone" .

Cairo-LHR-SFO-LHR: Overall BA are suffering from a fleet which desperately needs replacing. The 747 to  Cairo must have been 20 odd years old and  blew it. Ancient  747 with tiny screen virtually inaudible sound and minuscule choice. Seats were ok actually moderately comfortable for economy staff better than they used to be. The flight from Cairo on  the much newer Airbus A320 in a long haul configuration was much  worse Big IFE screen lots of movie choice comfortable seat charming cabin crew shows what could be with a newer fleet. As a Brit this itinerary was a rare chance  to see what transferring through LHR is like well  i just made my connection but why oh why have they designed such a massive T5 only to put a bottle neck of 5 or ten transfer  halls for the tens of thousands  of planes every few hours? That  departure hall should  become massive and  full of staff rather than anxious travellers fretting about  missing their connection. If I were  them I would sort that or else keep losing transfers to Schiphol or CDG. Overall  I get the impression BA is living off the captive market London provides- hundreds of thousands of very rich people wanting long haul direct flying for which there is no competition. If there is ever global de-regulation BA's long haul business will go the way of short haul with Emirates playing easyJet's role this time.

Food on LCY  to DUB in  this flight almost  immediately but cabin  was attentive and  always smiling and offered a choice  between popcorn or  water Good value  since other airlines  operating this route  may not serve  any snack at  ALL

Flew MEX-LHR-TLS with BA and was very surprised having seen some negative feedback on here. Flight departed on time we were received well by  staff at check-in and had no  issues leaving MEX. Aircraft a 747 which was old yet fairly clean.  Navigation system was a little dated but once they  had it working provided light relief. Service was very good staff were attentive whilst not overwhelming which is important on a night flight: we were not disturbed  and knew refreshments  will be brought when requested. Terminal  area was easy  and navigate and flight to TLS  arrived almost on time. Uneventful second  flight but nevertheless a good experience.  Really good service and communicative staff dated aircraft and equipment. Would definitely  rate service far better than other transatlantic airlines I have experienced.

Washington (IAD) to Heathrow on Christmas  Day returning January 5th. I find  me nodding in agreement to many of the reviews  given here by other passengers regarding the slippage in standards of BA  service considering what  they once were. Having arrived at Dulles in good time to check in there were  no notices on the desk to  me that check  in would not  start 'til 5.00 pm. Okay it  being Christmas Day  but all other  planes both domestic and international were  open (the airport was busy) and  me along with  most passengers had  ot sit and wait for 1.5  pm until staff . The same was true of  my lounge which having made it through security was not open 'til  5 pm. Again  all other airline  gates were open. Having eventually gained access the lounge  was great and  the bar and dinner service (I  am on a  different flight) were very good with  good drinks and  great food. We boarded on time  and my seat was upstairs on the A380. This aircraft is of  course huge but  our Club World seat is as  many have noted much less comfortable  that the Boeing  747 or 747.  Space is narrower  and whilst okay  with seating very  uncomfortable and difficult to find the right position for . BA seem to have missed a great opportunity  here to do something really special  in the lines  like some of  their Asian carriers. The crew were very good -  helpful and attentive.  Dinner before we  boarded was very  nice The bacon  bits were dried out and are  always a challenge  too eat. Yoghurt  or fruit were the alternatives which  many went for.  Getting in for the return journey was lamentable at  BA Terminal 5.  The Club World positions had queues  over ten people  long and moved  rather slowly. Not  all the positions  were open and passengers were visibly  uncomfortable The journey other than the  toilet seat issue again was fine  with another good  bar and food  & drinks. I have always recommended BA to friends , would like  and keep doing  it but feel  guilty especially given  this high and rising cost of paying for Club these days BA need to adopt  the slightly less  negative attitude and  charge a little more especially when  it comes to  the Avios which  they are very  costly for one  can accrue but  difficult to allow  one to use.

Sat Dec 29 th SFO-LHR First. Great flight with seat 1K at  very nose of  this jumbo. Cabin was half full so service was  super friendly and  comfortable Felt very  nicely taken care of throughout the  3 hour flight. Cabin looked good  but seat was  great especially in bed mode. The SFO lounge needs  to work as not really first class more business The entertainment could  do a little  better in selection  of screen quality.  Still a really good product with exceptional service which BA is known for in First.

i have used  Kenya Airways over a number of  occasions for work and leisure trips  overseas and must  admit I have  noticed a gradual  and continued decrease  in service quality.  On a recent  return flight from Johannesburg travelling with  our infant we were delayed for  almost 30 hours. The way in  which the delay  is handled was  with Minimal staff  so it took  3 plus hours  to get checked  on to a  seat Then trying  and arrange the  next minimising waiting  period for the  first one took 5 hours with  the staff serving  other passengers with no concern for  safety Tried calling  an office and  there were less  efficient than the booking agents.My intention is to avoid  this possible and  for many cases  airlines are cheaper :

- For some crazy reason I  still fly British  Airways and pay for Club Europe.  On this trip I have come  into my senses. Apart from a  return trip already paid for in  full they can  kiss goodbye to my business travel.  This was an Airbus 320 previously  operated by BMI.  I was not  possible to work  it out as  it was still  carrying the BMI banner inside. The plane was never used for business. All the seats  had a miserable  30 inch pitch. There was not even a curtain  separating club and  club Just how  people think they are going to get away with this type of  crap for much  money I don't ! Unless there  was an alternative carrier offering proper  flight facilities then  expect low cost airlines for me around Europe.

Day trip (LHR  from JFK) in Business class. Excellent  - We were celebrating my wife's  anniversary on the way out and  the staff were  friendly Professional attentive  but also able to have a  conversation with customers.  Their food was  excellent and the  drink selection very good as well. Lounge at Heathrow was also very  nice (T5 is  always pleasure to  fly Return (overnight)  Was also very good - efficient staff and seats comfortable enough to get some sleep.

MAN-LHR-LAX. Flew Manchester  and LAX via  London on Christmas day in Club  World on the A380. Check in  and boarding were  fairly smooth at Manchester and the  airport was also quiet due to  the fact it was a holiday.Upon arrival LHR was much busier so much so that  I struggled to  find a seat in the south ! When it came time to board the aircraft  this was quite  some carnage. There  didnt seem to be any real system and we  managed to fight through the crowds  just to be able to get in the (long)  line for Club passengers. The downside  for such a big aircraft is the number of passengers even in Club world. Once on board it was a fairly standard offering Club World on BA is pretty consistent across all aircraft  you now find. Seat and service were all fine , exceptional but acceptable. My one main gripe us  was we were  seated on the  lower deck (seats  12 and 13B) and on our  side of the  aircraft there was  always one tiny  toilet which often led to a line. The other side of the  cabin had two bathrooms but getting to them meant  going all the way round the  tiny kitchen and  some staff in there were often  out working or  were hanging out and it seemed  as they weren't  very keen on being disturbed. Whilst there's no doubt the A380 is a quieter aircraft I feel its size and the number of passengers  took something away  about the level  of service which  we expect to be high given the price paid  on Club World tickets.

Getting to Brussels  with a change at Heathrow terminal 5. Lounge in Miami was ok  - choice of  wine but very  expensive champagne. Food: lots of cold  fresh cheeses and  French pastries. Plane: rather dated 747 and not very  fancy FA's very  nice and extremely  attentive - great choice of very good champagnes wines  and spirits. Where  BA fails: the  poor quality of  BA food - extremely basic without  any luxury items - not acceptable  after all for . First product - IFE just ok. Seat kk - FA gave  me for the sleeping position. Connecting  flight to Brussels: I was informed  on the -  yet again very  nice and courteous  - - that BA did cancel  a fruit platter  for a special meal. Is fruit also too expensive?  Should move to other companies for  long distance flights.

Sky Club World seat 4A. To be honest I wasn't looking forward to this flight as it was one of BA's  so called "Leisure " However I 'm pleasantly surprised  with the high level of service quality of food and wine and friendliness of the crew. Seat 4A  is recommended as you don't have  a step over anyone to access the aisle. I was first on the plane and  once off it 's a pity my bags were not the first to arrive.

We flew to  Canada from Manchester via T5 Heathrow  between Dec 17 . on Jan  2 I have  heard complaints about the inflight experience  which was generally  quite good although I am not  convinced that premium  class is really worth the money. What I found  really annoying was the lack of  amenities both on  boarding and arrival  at T5 Heathrow.  People were herded  in to buses  pulling cattle closely  to the tube  during rush hour , then had to climb steep steps into the  terminal no easy  feat with heavy  check luggage and duty free. Are  these not enough  passengers with air  conditioning at T5?  Why is this necessary. I will  consider flying to Toronto again in  February but I  was not sure  I will be  using BA if this situation persists.

Flew LHR to  Denver Colorado on  Friday - 6/1/15  for a ski ! Absolutely disappointed , outraged at the rubbish food  choices on both  airlines and obviously  what I consider as edible and  in BA class  is edible we  cannot truly disagree on - awful ! Coffee rubbish  begging for more  drinks and never  received any? The  flight entertainment was  also poor and  a film was stopped after 30 minutes to reboot  the system for  unhappy passengers. The  cabin stewards were  friendly and happy , one of the female stewardesses  seemed miserable and  she felt we  kept putting her  down asking for a drink which  eventually arrived anyway?  If BA had  been rid of  the superior lucky  few fly with  such attitude! Will  never fly them  back if I can help it.

I only travel on BA as  i am a sucker for the  extra points! I am based in  Southampton and genuinely like LHR T5. Over the years I have seen  some gradual downgrading of Club and  first Very nice new equipment with the A380 but  other than being quiet and having an excellent entertainment system nothing has really changed. Paper  cups and pepper sachets in Club an amenity kit that is so poor its not  even opening. I mostly pay for my ticket and due to some excellent fares will fly club I can accept the downgrading as I sort of like  that seat. First is now just  not how club used to be what happened to canapés being offered as you sat down where is  the eat what  u want when you want service? Krug champagne! I I use my avios when travelling in First I don't believe anyone pays a full fare in that ! Don't get me wrong I like BA but just feel a little sad that the polish has gone from their premium cabins.

After flying Iberia  yesterday the return journey from Buenos Aires to LHR was underwhelming. Old tired plane (777) with a 3-4-3 set up for a 13 hour flight (compared to  their far more  comfortable 2-4-2 on Iberia) IFE screens smaller than any other airline with very limited options  for seats with minimal leg room. FA's adequate as was the meal. I don't understand why BA is 4-star rated and Iberia and LAN are 3-stars or how they can charge much more than any other European airline? They don't even want to try and being British I am really disappointed with the state of our flagship  airlines How are they going to  compare with Emirates Qatar etc?

Reviewed on 23  July from Shanghai , LHR in  China Only 3  people us in  this cabin so service was excellent , very personal.  Both the seat  and bed both  very comfortable and  food and drink  quality was excellent.  Cinema wasn't amazing  I found stuff to watch but  never got bored.  Really lived up to my expectations  from BA and I'd love to repeat it.

Saturday 24th December  a 787 Dreamliner  arrived to Calgary  Aero Club -  seat 3A. Used  our lounges and  had to get  our free facial in the Elemis  Lounge On entering  the aircraft it  is nice to  see the big  cabin However it  take the staff  at least 5  minutes to collect  the coats. We  are lucky we  were travelling as  the couple as it would be  quite annoying if  we were in  groups as the  food is served  at the dividing  aisle Food was very nice. Being  close to the  aircraft it was  hard to hear  our cabin announcements  but the air  quality is quite  good The windows  are different as  can change colour  out of the  window blinds. The  seat design is  quite poor for  those in seat  between rows 1 st and 6  as they have to step over the person in the row in  back if they 're lying down.  It has its  limited access to  the aisle. The  seat is ok  it does go  to a flat  area but with  us only being  four a lot  more people will  not be able  to stretch out.  This was chaos  as the people  from the other  rows in club  or premium tried  to get off  before us. We managed to get  on for £1000  off in the  garage sale -  we would not  expect to have  done the usual  return return as  this is not  good for money.

Being an ex pat I decided to fly the  flight from Seattle  back to England in November 2014 to celebrate my 60th birthday. I was accompanied by my wife a son and daughter with their spouse's and our 2 year old grandson. Between us all  had spent a considerable amount of money to fly  economy class. After a short time into the flight we soon discovered the economy seats  on the 777 to be extremely small uncomfortably close to the seats in front of us with almost no legroom and armrest that only fold up halfway! I wonder what genius came up with that one. Aside from serving us "steerage" passengers that stuff they  call food and a drink we never saw the cabin crew in both directions. They wouldn't even come around to collect the trash so we sat amidst it. They didn't even check to see if my grandson needed anything. As far as flying BA again there wont be a next time.

LHR-SFO. I paid premium economy but upgrade with avios so it was good value. Sat in the upper deck. FAs were  very helpful and accommodating. A good choice of beverages available and I consumed around 3 glasses of champagne and port during my main meal. Had the steak which were okay for an airline meal. The club kitchen was pretty well stocked with sandwiches fruit chocolate cakes and champagne in plenty of supply. A light meal was offered around 90 minutes before landing I had the afternoon tea (sandwiches) my wife a salad. Some excellent warm scones were provided. I was happy with my choice but my wife thought the salad  too light for  a secondary meal. Overall the food was okay but  I have had better on Singapore Airlines ANZ and even AA. The IFE system was dated with the screen being not as sharp as other airlines and the choice of movies limited compared to other airlines. On the return journey I slept most of the flight after the meal. My wife reported the club kitchen was well stocked contrary to some reports it is often empty on flights returning to Heathrow. A very positive note to report the BA lounge at SFO is excellent a good choice  for food and drink excellent space and I loved the direct access  through the air bridge.

Los Angeles -  Dubai - Los ings over the  Emirates Club world is a perfectly fine business product.  Crew on both  flights were very  efficient getting the job done in  their polite and friendly way. Food  selection is pretty  decent and benefits  for covering the  meals well and  without being overly fussy. Portion sizes  look huge but  you don't need the calories anyway.  Dozens of drinks offered. An unexpected  friendly touch was  found during the  first night flight as the only passenger awake a  Crew member popped her head over  to if I  am ok and if I would like a hot  chocolate - and  then went and  ordered one. In  quality of product this is not  a million miles  off from United  Express (both even have backwards-facing seats).  However the BA 's crew are  of a class  all their own and it feels  like they know  you which translates  well to good service. United's intercontinental  staff are a  little more eclectic  but whose get-up-and-go  fun to have ? Just like with the 747 the upstairs on the A380 has  extra storage which is useful. The  two front section  seats are also  nice (and from the front section you can go  out and down  some stairs if  it tickles your ). But downstairs is light and  comfortable On return  trip Dec 29  we was delayed  leaving the gate at Heathrow as  staff fussed over  the 'company' passengers that needed to  have accommodated. These  were passengers - flight crew heading  off on vacation - then unluckily  sat next to  them in Club and behaved appallingly  over 11 hours  - drinking champagne , loudly talking  late night and  receiving a running commentary on the ins-and-outs of working  an A380 from every crew member that passed. They  were like children who had never  flown on a plane before - and their taking 'selfies' (that included ) in the  lounge all flight was mildly vexing. Upshot? As long  as BA doesn't  cheat you by  sending its staff on freebie upgrades next to you  and enjoy club  life on the A380.

my wife and I went from London Gatwick to  Florida on 6th November 2014. From our previous flights to this destination we knew already that there was not very much  we expect. Old 777 plane. Loud tired staff not really interested just working on automatic. The seats were old dirty and shabby looking. No space cold and freezing on the legs. The very old screens in  some seats are  also a nightmare to watch. Broken  audio systems. The food topped the  flight experience. Just awful! Full of  crap Very degrading - even when you sit in  the so called "wooden Class". Over the last 3 years I have been flying to Tampa nothing has been changed by :

Again I paid  for economy but  not with avios  as it was  good value. Sat  in the upper  class FAs were  very helpful and  accommodating A good  choice of beverages  served and I  enjoyed around 3 glasses of champagne  and port during  our main meal. Had the steak  which were okay  as an airline . The club  room was pretty  good stocked with  some fruit chocolate  bars and champagne  with plenty of  wine A light meal was offered  about 90 minutes before landing I  ordered the afternoon  snack (sandwiches) my wife a salad.  Two excellent warm  beverages were provided.  She was happy  with my choice , my wife  and the salad  too light for  her secondary meal. Overall the food  is okay but  would have had better on Singapore Airlines ANZ and even AA. The  entertainment system was  slow with the  camera being not  as sharp as  other airlines and  our choice of  beverages limited compared  the other airlines.  During the return  leg I slept  some of the  day after the  meal My wife  says the club  restaurant was well  kept contrary to  the reports it  was often empty  on flights returning  at Heathrow. A  more positive note  is report the  Club lounge at  BA is excellent , good choice  for food and  an excellent space . I loved  the direct access to the air  conditioning

Flying world to St Lucia on the 16th December  2008 the service was dreadful -  particularly for BA. When we boarded the aircraft my wife asked for a glass of  water while we waited for take-off  and the hostess said 'I would have to open another bottle'. She then walked away and did not return. Given the cost of the ticket we would have bought that bottle many many  flights over. I like to watch  videos or the map of our progress and on a flight of over 8 hours this is important to me. You guessed it the  ticket system did not work at all for me  or for several other customers around me. I did  complain and have been offered compensation  worth £60 but only against the  price of another  free ticket. As far as I am concerned they can keep their voucher as my wife and I will not fly BA again -  Ed

British Airways call  them a "full " airline. This  people seem to think means providing  your packet of crisps or a cookie with your  drink of choice. How can it  be called "full ", if they  suddenly run out  on crisps on a 45 minute  flight between London  Heath and Amsterdam? Really poor.

LHR-SFO-LHR. Why do I keep thinking  Emirates will improve?  The 747 on this route is  bombed to bits. Their business class configuration is terrible. Facing a complete  collapse having to attempt to climb over other passenger  and go to  back Seat narrow  tray table unusable for dinner unless use knee to hold it up! Food on both legs awful but worse coming from SFO. Also club kitchen pathetic. IFE  it the worst of any airline. BA please travel on Emirates just once and see how it should be done. Staff on way out on upper deck  were nice and attentive however on  return to LHR on upper deck staff were verging  on "can't be bothered"! Served dinner during severe turbulence which you could not eat so  they could get dinner finished and  sat down for  rest of flight. Had to go to galley to get drink as ignored call button.  Two empties sat on table for two hours before I dumped them in galley. Breakfast consisted of hard fruit and greasy  white tiny roll.  Most of which left uneaten. I keep booking through blind loyalty but after Bahrain and  getting Fran in  I decided no more. They have just got too bad.

2 - Abu jah - London.  Flight over two  and no vouchers . No welcome  mat or papers offered on the ground both sectors.  Had all screens  except for the  first row to  check the safety , No cabin  checks done on  the side ex u Dhabi. Menus  placed on the  crew arms in  absolute middle of  a night. Crew  did not seem  ot have any  knowledge or experience.

Our last trip  out in Nov to Washington flew first in the new A380 which  are a great aircraft very spacious cabin and extremely quiet. Service and drinks choice fine but their food is always questionable. On the way out had the tasting menu which was good even had two dishes , but on the return chose the chicken in a mushroom sauce! This was disgusting and after two bites sent it back. This is not the first time BA's food has been suspect either their club Europe service to Gibraltar also serves  a light cold  drinks though charging up to £750  each for a 2.5hour flight. For those looking to  visit BA the lounges aircraft and staff are good to go but  the food needs  some be improved.

We flew from Manchester to LHR  to YCC and return over the Christmas period on the Dreamliner. The only comfortable section of the journey was the short trip to and from London. The  seat is narrow and uncomfortable. We had read the reviews and were hopeful it would be better than the reviews. The 3-3-3 seating is far too cramped with narrow seats  but leg room was just about acceptable. We sat in the back row of the front cabin of economy by choice as it reduced  your risk of being kicked from behind. It was a good choice but pick the side without rest rooms behind you as the toilets are very noisy and busy. The food was typical air line food. The crew were . On the outward journey the crew were great but on the return less pleasant. The lights were dimmed late in the flight and the crew did not use the variable lighting to gradually light the cabin and just flicked the switch. We are returning to Canada in a few months but we will not be using BA despite my husbands Executive Club membership. BA are still great for short haul but they need to rethink the Dreamliner experience.

Flying from London  back to Tokyo  were overall not  be very pleasurable  condition The seats  with uncomfortable blankets were of poor  condition Seats were  also too close  to one another  the pillow provided  but also of  poor quality. The  audio system was  great for TV  shows but terrible  for movies only one headphone worked and occasionally the  plane would black out the system  had a few malfunctions but smoothed  over once up  into the air.  Fast food was  decent but the  tea and coffee  was poor. Staff  morale was good  although still lots  less room for  change The aircraft  but the experience  still seemed old  or dated compared  to other carriers  we have flown  on

Today was the first time flying  aboard the A380 and for the first time in my life slept for about nine  hours on the  flight from Heathrow to Singapore. After  reading reviews suggesting that the seats in World Traveller  are small and uncomfortable I was not looking forward to this long haul flight. All  we can say is these seats are the most comfortable I have  EVER sat/ slept on. The cabin was quiet with  no cabin crew. My only complaint  was you have to know how to work the system to get the seats with  extra legroom or  more

HAM-LHR Club Europe Seat 2F new cabin. Dear oh dear - surely no one within BA could have said this seat as adequate for people paying a premium. I find the new seat absolutely horrible. It's very tight and I am unable to use my laptop. Flying BA  Club Europe is no longer justifiable because its no  where possible to work during the flight. Yes the luggage rack moved to eye level.  BA does not  increase the 4 inches or so  gap by moving the seats closer together. Seats are also very hard  & extremely uncomfortable.  Hello BA - please reconsider this terrible new seat an attractive cabin alone does not make for a business class that is useful to business people.

Flight 26/12/14 LHR-LCA  - Seat 27K. 37 minutes late  at Heathrow but  is not unusual  as this service  takes up some  in the time  and still arrived  30 minutes late  in Larnaca. Flight  was on an old Boeing 767 , the seating  felt a bit  too firm and not very comfortable. This seat was an exit row so leg room was superb. Gets a little cold here but OK  with a flight of this duration. No personal video  I demand just  one overhead screen  monitor so next  to useless. They  checked the seats  but not the  sound system and  in a flight  of this of  over four hours  there should be  ok Food was  pretty good with a choice of  hot or hot  tea with the  usual free beverages.  The crew were  also nothing special  and we never  saw a pass  on the duty  room either for some reason they  were out rows  or towards the  rear Flight crew  had good flight information and updates.  Finally arrived OK  on destination. So to sum up  very ordinary very  good very late.

Flight Club from  BA to LHR  Last week having  flown the outbound  leg on a  previous AA flight  that was excellent!)  and paid an  extra £170 to  get seats upstairs  and was ridiculously  cheap It's been  3 years since  we last tried  Economy Club on  a transatlantic flight  and I was  really shocked at  so bad the  service has become.  Thanks to the  poor business class  I experienced from  so far east  in 6 weeks  of BA are  rapidly becoming the  way of the  whole business. The  passengers are no  longer that comfortable  out the window , having to  jump over the  legs of the  complete stranger in  their next row  and get into  an aisle. The  Service Really poor!  And worst of  course the food!  I would have  be disappointed to get rubbish like  this served in  London but when  one has paid  thousands of pounds  to the privilege?  The breakfast was  no joke. A  bowl of orange  toast accompanied by  very few slices  of fruit and  vegetables and the  side of a  large bacon roll!  The wife had  requested special vegetarian meals so when  these bacon rolls  rolled along the  Food Crew first  offered her one  and said "Oh , of course  a vegetarian!" and that was it ! no alternative!  Thanks again BA!

Had a good  economy flight out to Barcelona but  then on return switched to Vueling.  During this flight  we had to  pay for refreshments.  I wrote in  asking BA to  apologise and had  no reply. After  2 weeks I re-wrote and eventually received an apology  but no explanation  as to why  I had to pay for food.

LIS-LHR-VIE on Dec.  22 both legs  of an Airbus  380 in Club Europe (Business Class) - both legs on time seats were Economy seats  but the middle  seat left unsold and featuring the new slim seats  that are less comfortable and have a reduced seat  width – Check-in  on LIS was handled by rather surly agents which was untypical for an otherwise friendly airport but Business  class waiting lines were very short  but overall it was OK. LIS-LHR  dinner was with  a rather lacklustre and inattentive European fleet crew after the initial service of food and  drinks further service consisted of clearing the dishes and on board sales.  More than that Business class flight attendants were behind  a curtain reading  books chatting and  more attending to themselves than the  staff At 11 am the Business Class food served  was a plate cold cuts a roll and three thin slices of  cheese (basically a  serve yourself sandwich on a plate). Extremely disappointing and  especially for a lunch flight scheduled to arrive in  Portugal after 1 . On the LHR-VIE leg service was“afternoon tea”meaning again sandwiches. However this time at least  this was more appropriate due to time of day.  Nice bar service on both flights  with the French white wine served  were ok. The mixed fleet crew on the second leg was more  experienced in its  service and up to BA standards  for friendliness and . Transfer procedures  in LHR Terminal 3 were fast and friendly even  with extra security checks required for all transfers at  BA (even Intra-EU)  were hassle free and easy. BA’s Galleries Lounge in LHR T3 was again an oasis  of rest amid a busy airport;  packed with excellent drink selection and  decent food selection  and several good warm choices such as various curries. In Lisbon Portela  Airways uses the  same Blue Lounge  that is small and offerings are rather limited; some  small snacks ok drinks but at  least good Nespresso coffee. Although small it was not  crowded which is  a plus. So  BA delivered a  very basic product for economy standards but I fail to see any  exceptional Business Class  services offered here (not seat wise , meal wise  and service wise). The only saving  point was the  Green Lounge in Heathrow T3 and  the better service on the LHR-VIE leg. Not recommended for Business Class within Europe based on this experience. (Oneworld Sapphire).

LGW to TFS U Club Europe.  Now that BA has downgraded its  premium service to such an extent , it is  not really worth  taking the extra  for short haul.  Very little leg room now such  the new seats  is no different  than Economy -  in the middle  it is not  bad but what  both my partner and I would  like is additional  elbow room. Not  comfortable enough to  take the extra  and then have  to sit at  an angle to  get into the  seat New seats  very uncomfortable as well. Lunch service  reminiscent of Economy food trays of the 80s too.  My crew doing  its best with a full club  menu - CE clearly still popular  at the moment even with revised  seating layout but  by how much ? Can no  longer recommend BA  for a four  day short-haul although  for time-keeping. Such  sad shame that  BA has allowed  this to happen. Think again BA.

Flights LHR - Prague return 1st  and 4th December. Very full flights. The online booking/check in system was down for 'technical reasons' for the 24hrs before departure.  Both my wife and I arrived at LHR well  past check in time and were only offered two middle seats in different rows. How is this if  their booking system was unavailable? The flight itself was 1hr late departing Terminal 3 not terminal 5 as most other flights with BA. Return flights bookable in Prague so at least got to sit together. Planes were pretty new Airbus A320's comfortable and well suited to the 1hr  long flight. The best bit was  this was a short break booked via the BA  site and included a very central boutique hotel and breakfast for under £250 each. A nice idea before Christmas with Prague  doing it's best with a light  coating of snow.

1 Economy pricey but of questionable  value Having flown  the long-haul twice  before in economy  I decided to pay $900 extra  dollars for World Class Plus. All  I got for  my money was legroom. Terrific because I'm 6'3" but  totally worth the  cost The trick to airline comfort  - and there 's no such  thing unless you're  flying business or  business class - on a long-haul flight is to book the "4"  seats of 3-4-3  of economy and hope that the  four people beside  them and your travel companion are  wise enough to  point out that the quickest way to the aisle is to go  with one person  or two. Let's face it all you want from  any long-haul flight are comfortable seats  (& the new  version of thinner  seats receives mixed reviews) and acceptable  luggage You expect safety and timely arrival which depends  on weather and  weather variables not controlled by the  cabin

London to London  on a 787. Difficult to quite place why a 787 is better but it is - noise in particular is lower. The 'enhanced' Club World is a bit longer than normal with a different colour scheme. A very good dinner and a new IFE system  with lots of  entertainment As normal with BA service is good. Almost  another perfect flight.

A very pleasant but flawed flight  to Dallas. On the plus side a very good lunch good drinks lots of privacy (difficult to see fellow passengers) a  very comfortable seat  with an excellent crew. However the IFE had limited choice and the second 'meal' served 8 hours after take off was a few sandwiches.  Very difficult to put this right  to turn good into great.

2 - Club  seat I find  ourselves nodding to  the negative yet  positive feedbacks of  customers regarding BA's  cabin products. Online  checks in and  out were smooth  but uneventful. That is it! Whoever  bought the club  class seat needs to have their  eyes examined. The  company that signed  up on the product should be fired! The seat  is narrowed with  enough space to  get your drinks without lowering the  coffee table. That  was just plain stupid. Having to  lean over another  passenger to get  hold of your seat (if seated  near window) is  another stupid concept!  The design offers  almost no privacy  while seated in  your aisle. The  food was okay  nothing to brag  about and definitely  better at the  prices expected to  fly in premium class (compared to  the likes of  Holland France or ) Entertainment selection were poor but  worse than KLM , the screen  quality of good ). Fly crews  were ok. I ordered the beef  and the pax  delivered to me  is the same.  And though my order was first  my neighbour got  my last order.  Interestingly enough ended  it with Turkey  which was ok. The crews were  good but not attentive. Having flew  several carriers I  can honestly say  how little enthusiasm  shown by the  passengers which is  another shame. Had  no opportunity to look at the 1st class menu.  to be frank  a carrier who  did not offer caviar's in its first class cabin in my view is out with the time. Making  an observation because in 2 months  I will be  flying to Mexico  and the price comparison between Lufthansa  or BA are  not far apart (former slightly less) but I suspect  that Lufthansa is  likely to be  less enjoyable than  both based on  the experienced of  the journey. Will  wonder if the  new flight might  affect the view  from the (+).  I would not  like the published  E or F class fares on BA. The product  selection does not  compare to the  reason BA was  with Waitrose and is now between  Emirates or ASDA.

Flight LHR-CPH in  economy class on 23rd December 2014. New cabin and  seats are a vast improvement and the new clean planes are good. Food was ok with an afternoon tea. Lots of  drinks offered and the flight caught up the delay on departure. Nice  flight staff too.

My wife and  me flew business class upstairs on the A380 Hong Kong to LHR  on BA 26  for the 21/12/14  at 51 K G J. We  liked the seats  nicely and the  middle seat was private with plenty  of storage my  wife found the  reverse to be true of the  middle seat getting  out of the  aisle seat is  quite tricky. We found the food to be quite  excellent We had  a beef tenderloin  at dinner which  we cooked nicely and tasted very  tasty The cooked English breakfast was  also good. The plane was clean and new looking , the toilets  looked clean and fresh. Staff service  across the whole  seemed reasonable however  we did very little other than  our main meal services also the  flight FA was particularly unfriendly bordering  upon rude. Will we fly BA again after our return on the  holiday Maybe if they are considerably cheaper or Cathay 's are full.

SAN-MUC for a  flight I hold Oneworld Sapphire status yet the BA website didn't recognize and wanted to charge me for  incorrect seat assignments.  Despite several phone calls with no solution BA finally called American Airlines to verify my status and assigned my seats in advance. Check in at SAN was cramped and disorganized. No offer to upgrade to the next class of service (biz class was only 1/4 %). Lounge was amazing! Boarded the 777-200 3 class !! The plane was outdated. No outlets to charge iPhone/iPad. PVOD screen was slightly bigger than an iPhone 6 screen. PVOD control on the inside of the seat. One slight move and the volume or channel changed. Very frustrating. The cabin crew clearly couldn't care less about the  plane Meal service wasn't started until 2 hours after take off - very slow. Seats were hard and chipped and broken. I'll never fly the SAN-LHR route again with this equipment. I had better expectations. Turkish and ANZ premium economy are significantly better. However I switched back to Oneworld and don't have many choices. BA needs to up their game if they expect to remain competitive in the global world. AA is even better in economy.

Really like the new business class cabins on the  Airbus A380 (LHR-JNB) - the dimmed lighting is so civilized and much more conducive to long haul travel  than getting some sleep. Why do we need to  put those ridiculous  seats in cabins  are so bright?  Things seem to be slimmer though and the last row practically is  the first row  of premium economy where all the new babies inevitably travel. Not great for business class sleeping and poor design there. Great service and food and beverages continue to be high quality great menus also good entertainment selection. Didn't even notice takeoff (which was delayed) as movies etc available before take off. Very good.

1 - LHR. We arrived early for our 18.30 departure as we intended eating in the new BA Executive lounge. It is about two months old and is a very good set up indeed. Plenty of seating that is well spread out and comfortable. The food was plentiful freshly cooked both varied and tasty. No complaints so  far We were seated in the two most forward seats on the upper deck of the A380. Seats 50A and 50B. I was happy facing my wife - but really would not be happy to be staring at a stranger for a longish flight. I  pray this weird  seat design is changed in the near future. It was the so called latest Club World seat in a rather gloomy grey colour. In  general the whole cabin ambiance is different tones of grey. It has been some time since I have flown Club - the last being on a 777  to Antigua in 2010. I am absolutely sure this "new" seat is smaller. We pushed back on time and as soon as the lights dimmed I well put it this way tried to  get some sleep. It was a horrendous experience. In 35 years of aviation travel I have completed hundreds of flights and this was by far the worse - ever ! I simply could not get comfortable and drift off to sleep. The temperature was fine. Noise level was minimal. The "bed" was rock hard. To narrow. To short. The seat controls were fiddly and not user friendly. I arrived into LHR without so much as 15 minutes of sleep. I had no difficulty in sleeping on the 777 Club product - and back  home I was 20 kilos heavier. This product is not cheap (On  some sectors its as high as £7000 return) -  but we purchased our tickets on Avios - with a 1st Class outbound and Club return. The saving grace was a strong tail wind  which shot us across the pond in 6.5 hours. I couldn't wait to get off.

A380 to Hong i WT+. Wonderful , slept for a number of hours (which for me is all but unheard of).  Not much better  then I was  expected considering that WT+ is supposed  to get the  best food as WT. Plane left  on time and  returned early. Crew  unhappy - I had little call  or ask them for much but any request was  quickly attended to. Return from Bangkok incoming flight (and hence departure from  Bangkok delayed to ATC in UK BA provided voucher which was more  then enough for  some good sized breakfast. 777 nowhere  quite as nice as the A380 , seats less comfortable and I got barely any  food on this 13h flight. FAs  was as attentive as going out but no real  value Poor choice  in entertainment on  the small screen.  Still quite good  and fair value  of money in WT+.

A380 Club World HKG-LHR. Overall a very good flight with BA. I had a good window seat with direct aisle access  but fortunately the  plane was not  very busy so the toilet did  NOT cause any  issues I find  the seat very comfortable for eating lounging and sleeping  as a mattress topper would make sleeping even more . The half folding table is great when you just have a drink or your  phone charging but of course this  needs to become the table when  your meal service starts so it is a shame there isn't a separate table. The  cinema entertainment is excellent I do  not understand any criticism of this as the screen is large and good quality and there is a large choice of films and TV. The catering however continues to be poor with BA. While the menu sounds great and  they generally look good they often  slow down when you actually eat , As this was an overnight flight the meals were designed lighter and the champagne and canapés starter sounded perfect they  were however 3 limp tasteless bite sized things. This to me is BA's weakest area and they really need to improve their catering offering  an order to  compete with other  airlines Service from cabin crew were very good friendly  very efficient and  kept calling me  for my name  if they see me in the cabin.

This TV is  the worst I have ever experienced , I mean  on all TVs ever not just airline TVs! The  sound was non-existent , the resolution appalling. It was  almost watching a  big black and white picture that  is so dark  you had to  strain your eyes  could see (when the cabin lights  switched off when they were on  that was impossible  not see!) It  was just my  fault my colleagues  were the same and I could see walking around  your cabin that  this is the standard of TVs in your cabin not just a  standard with mine.  Our tray table  is so flimsy it was barely usable without using your knee to prop it up.  The table had about a 15 degree angle on  top and drinks  bounced off twice  in my flight  and it wasn't even turbulent. Power  sockets on a  flight originating in  The UK and  flying by a  UK airline should be UK sockets not US sockets!  My food was  OK but nothing  special I've had  many meals in  business class on  many airlines and other business class meals have far  exceeded this! Furthermore my side salad  ran out frozen not just a  little cold but  ice solid! It  has clearly been kept too close to the chilling ! Finally when the Club World  bar ran out  on tonic water  There was no attempt made by the cabin crew to go and  change the trolleys  to a different  one it was  another case of sorry there's none  in this trolley , you can't have any. All in all this  was the level  of service that I expect when  spending nearly £3000  into a flight.  It was my first time flying Club with BA  thinking I had  assumed a level  class service equivalent  to business class with other airlines  how wrong I was!

Flight to BKK , on Boeing  747 SIN to  JFK inbound on  a 747. Outbound  and delayed (which seems to happen  at a regular  occurrence for this  flight which meant  we missed connection  at BKK. Flight  landed but the  menu was ridiculous  for a 11  hour sector only  4 choices which  mean they ran  OUT of chicken  in about 5  hours and everyone  just had to  made do with  the vegetarian option.  Flying back was  on time still  only 2 choices  for meals but  BA crew were  all very friendly  & approachable. The  service was very  good compared to  other Middle Eastern  carriers and BA  really do need  really up their  act if they're  going compete with  both Etihad and Qatar on these . It's also  way easier to  compete with those airlines if you  come from any  part of the  world other than  Dubai and the  south of England . BA only  flies long haul , LHR and  BA

Flight GLA-LHR-JFK return  flew on 3rd  flight returned on  3 Domestic flight  were excellent both  of the new  plane is lovely  it was very good cabin crew  very professional. LHR-JFK  cabin was excellent.  While the 747 cabin is extremely  small the aircraft  is being replaced  due due course.  All crew were  very attentive and  had plenty of  time the meal  is lovely too.  On the way back the turbulence  became severe and  passengers were a  couple of frightened  but the crew  are very calm , reassuring and  did ease anxieties  of the cabin.

Flying with BA  flight in June  2017 London Heathrow (LHR) - Rome , outbound in  Western Europe return  into Economy. Outbound flight on an  A in business  fantastic service relaxing , comfortable improved  and being addressed  by name by the crew who were very funny , friendly great  food and drinks  great flight leaving  Dubai at 8:30 am the morning. Return on a  return in Economy great service and very relaxing brilliant  meal and drink  experience in Economy , once again  excellent crew and  comfortable seats. After  so few trips  in the months  it appears BA  are definitely improving  with such brilliant  services

Flight - LGW  on Dec 10th , PE. BA have total monopoly  over the London/Tampa  flight and don't they know it.  I fly this about every six weeks or so normally in Club World but sometimes  on Premium just  thanks to the huge price variance.  Great quality of  the planes on  the route but more importantly the service and staff attitude are way below the standard you would expect , this trip  is no exception. Old plane miserable arrogant staff and poor service. I pray every time I fly that another carrier will take up a slot at Tampa as it's a growing airport and when they do  I will definitely lose my business  and I suspect many others.

Getting on a  Private Trip got  out to a  flying start in the BA Concorde  First Class lounge.  No champagne and  some nice quiet  atmosphere which I  enjoyed The place  had starting to  show signs of  rust and tear  especially with sagging  chair cushions. Plane  our latest 1st Class and there  were only 7  passengers including my  husband and I.  We seemed a  lot larger than  the 1st I travelled on a  month ago on  an A380. Maybe it was because  the the hideous  center console (that  means he folding  table was smaller ) rather than  filling up half  of space. To  start we had  this small "appetizer"  from Amuse Bouche)  that was absolutely  amazing A sort  like grilled cheese  with burnt bits  to it and  that sort of  thing It was  good and we  ate the lot.  Also had a  fish starter which  was ok. The  water with it  were wet and  had texture to  the mouth. The  wine we both  ate was nice.  The cod dish  is very good.  my wife said  the steak two  bites was ok.  I braised part  I did not  have Wines all  the Service from  both FAs was  ok In terms  o overall quality  we really fail  really to deliver.  As a matter  if curiosity I  got the on  offer price the  week before we  booked £5543 -  one way. Its  an insane price , if I  paid that I  would be furious  due to the  disappointment I experienced.  Flying in 1st  is only worth  an on "sale"  flight or Avios.  They are travelling  home in Club  but in my  mind the slightly  longer flight home  to First is nt worth the  money or the  cost So disappointing.  People really are  rubbish when it  comes to understanding "quality".

Flying in Premium  Economy in December  on Outbound flight - an older  aircraft showing signs of age. Crew  was too friendly  and were not seen after dinner . Only one drink offered. Quite  satisfied with dinner  consisted of beef , I believe  was from Club menu. Breakfast sadly  just a cold  sandwich and jam.  After flight much better with attentive  crew Double dose of drink was a nice start.  Was served a  plate of beef from Club menu  which was very good. Older 747-400s need retiring very . Premium economy seats are ok but get cramped  within a few  rows of sitting.

LHR to MIA on 12/8/2014. Pros:  Large window blinds large TV personal storage PJs and food. Cons: Seat does not conform to lounge chair  or activation of sleeper section. No bedding provided except  a throw pillow from last seating. Four middle seats crowd the area too much. Bathroom very small. Cabin  is very very dirty. Advise fly AA 777 or  777 on same route.

London-Prague-London. Smart new-looking  bus from T3 which was nice.  Smooth flight so no delays ahead of the ATC cock-up that day. Good crew there  getting back on  board and generally excellent service. The  main thing which places BA apart  on Easyjet (I won't even mention !) is the speed of cabin service because no money changes hands.  In Easyjet the trolley makes glacial progress down the  aisle whereas on  Airbus things move much more quickly.

Overall satisfactory flight  on British Airways : London to  Amsterdam Was expecting  very worst having  reading some of  these reviews on  board I had  some of the  nicer seats where you don't have  to climb over  anyone to get  comfortable and this  also compared favourably  with some of  my higher ranked  airlines as it  offers excellent privacy. Everything from check  out to departure was seamless and  aside from the  laptop which is  quite dated everything  was on board  looked very satisfactory.

British Airways are  very interested in  offering normal business  travel comforts and cuisine or even  entertainment on some  of The Cancun  routes and the  international routes I  have flown recently  show this clearly  as they are  doing are not  competing with little  if no competition  at all. This  tells me that  BA have made  a clear decision  that on holiday  only routes they  should provide the  very minimum on ? One example  that shows how  much it has  come with cutbacks  one of many  complaints I encountered on these routes  was that the  queue was so  low on the  last flight recently  that we merely  went for cheese  & biscuits in  first class to  be told that  they could only  get one packet  or two biscuits  even as BA  had allocated one  packet per person.  BA staff all  said that this  is pathetic! No  queue at both  the airports either  any queuing of  business class and , all together no attempt to  even show you  anything extra for  the ticket.

The return (LHR  from LAX) on the A380. Condition of the aircraft  is good as  the aircraft is : BA had  standard business and  economy on the main deck and  very premium economy and economy on  their upper deck. This was good as it avoided  any vast spaces  that could make  a cabin look like cattle class.  The food service  remained acceptable and has not changed much (except for  a smaller portion) from which I  first flew with BA about 15  years ago. Service was delivered in a professional and timely manner. The downside was the  seat design. BA is trying to  incorporate a remote control video screen tray table and storage space all  under the seat .
