This makes  each tray table  with video screen  much too small  due to sizes  that I experienced back in the  past This made  the travel experience  feel like cattle class as the  second dimension is typical economy seat size. All other airlines have improved the travel experience by improving the  cabin seat design.  The worst experience was on the return leg when  the passenger absolutely  forgot to put his seat upright during the dinner  service and this  occurred after I  pushed him repeatedly. This resulted in my tray sloping  over and the dinner tray and  tray table hitting  the stomach. The cabin crew just  brushed me off  after I asked  them to ask  my "gentleman" to put up his  seat for just 10 minutes. Come  aboard there is a big difference between good service (not upsetting customers) and just avoiding difficult situations.

JFK-LHR B747. Brilliant flight - namely because of the flight attendants. They were really friendly - not hurried in what they were doing and seemed genuine. The product on this older 747 wasn't great. It was nice having the extra room and smaller cabin in Premium Economy -  however the TV screen was tiny and you could tell it was  definitely an out of date aircraft and needed updating!  Food was absolutely excellent - beautiful lamb cutlet and beef cheek - best food I've  eaten on an aircraft. Quick flight - reasonably comfortable and would definitely fly again!

i cannot believe that BA calls  this plane from  Houston to London  a "Dreamliner". I'm  living in their so called "club world" which is the equivalent to Americans business class , this plane is awful! There  was no room  for put anything at all. Everything  and I mean everything goes in storage. You are literally looking straight  through the person  next to you. Attendants are rude. Don't waste your  seat While its  great to go non-stop between Austin and London this will be the  first time I  will take this  flight

Delta and CPT-LHR-AMS in club. 767  from Amsterdam and  this is just  great Love the  plush cabin. A380 . JNB. This  being a late  night I could  see - from the lounge - the A380 arrive at the stand  up 30 minutes prior to boarding  after arriving late  at another destination , even though it doesn't require  any lot of inside-knowledge to see  how such a  flight can not  get 'turned around'  after 60 minutes. However BA did  however feel there would be a delay until it  removed all it's  300 passengers from  the lounge and had them lined  up in 4  small lanes in  one of the  runway then announcing a delay of 15 then 30  or 45 minutes: How to get your most appreciated  crew furious never  heard so many complaints on an airline even before  a flight started:  Poor ground management:  What a good  seat Upperdeck club  lounge is absolutely  fantastic and this plane is so quiet that you can hear everything. Never realized how much snoring is  carried on at  the first time  you had to  buy earplugs. Food was just terrible and how BA gets away with  packing pepper and salt in the  middle of the  coffee sachets just baffles me. The flight to Jo'burg  is obviously done  for the more  senior crew who  has incredible charm ability and the  most entertaining sense of humor. That  goes to the  cabin crew' on  our way back  into Cape Town.  A 747 with spacious seating all  night Crew stressed running all the time no manners  or sense of class and definitely  a sense of  humour Food was slightly better on  this long flight  but way below any other European carrier I flew. It was my first time in  Africa on BA  but love the  seat very comfortable for sleeping. There is a lack of space to put your stuff , other than  having a really  great product. BA lounges definitely stand  out in the  absence of catering (food). Transfer at  terminal T 5  is quick and easy but terminal  3 is a tacky shopping mall  seeing how -  so soon after  being delivered as  luggage - half of it was  demolished for remodelling.  The return to Amsterdam on a  Boeing A319 was  excellent Good breakfast  and seating is  spacious

From JFK - LHR late November.  AA Concorde Room: very nice indeed food not that good for once. Seat 1K: fine comfortable enough but  no space at all for small things - even  a wardrobe had no storage space. Just room for  my coat and  bag below. This compares with American  Eagle Business Class which had essentially the same seat loads of storage space and good  service AA Business  Class is equivalent to BA First Class. The service  is fantastic as  always with BA.  Choice of tea  nice and breakfast good. Toiletries bag  was fine with  all the items needed. Toilet a bit naff for First Class. Value  on money simply  means the deal  I got was really good - BA always do deals late November. Otherwise it would have been poor  - However AA  was preferred - BA do not  offer WiFi.

I flew "Business/1st  class from London  and Dublin and  via Berlin to London recently on an Airbus A-130  ( a 737). Three seats on  each side. The  main thing different  this coach was  we put a  coffee table over  a center seat. The seats were as cramped as  some airlines. The  food was excellent  but the seats  make it a  good deal.

Back in November : Flight left Gatwick at about 0900hrs to arrive  London at 1340  hrs We were served a croissant  with cereal bar  and coffee and a yoghurt at  around 1000hrs. No further trolley service at all during  this four and a half hour flight. On the  return leg leaving Tenerife at 1415hrs we were served a wrap and a cheese roll with either drink  from the bar  or hot drink. The drinks were  delivered after the  break No further trolley service. The seating configuration was tight to say the least and I am 5'8. This felt like  some budget airline ! The Captain asked us to enjoy British Airways hospitality!

VIE-LHR on Nov 29 on an Airbus 320 in Economy - straightforward evening point to point flight with a mixed fleet crew. Flight departed  in time and  landed ahead of time in Heathrow  as is a rare thing these days. No luggage to check and  luggage check-in was working fine. Plane featured the new slim seats which are a step back in both comfort and legroom. Mixed fleet FA's were pleasant however the service was not particularly well organized. It took them quite some  while for the service to start and it took  less than 30  minutes to get a drink after the sandwich has been served. On the other hand  the bacon sandwich was actually good  and full bar service was offered. Other than the  normal service” of sandwich drink and duty free the crew was pretty much in hiding mode. Service not quite up to usual BA standards. BA uses a shared lounge in  Lounge which this time was quite busy but not  great Lounge as such is acceptable but far from great. Still believe , BA offers one of the best economy products  on the European market and flying them is in general a pleasant experience. (Oneworld Sapphire).

MAN-LHR-ZRH and return.  Very smooth online  ordering and seat selection. Lightly loaded flights so I  ended up with an empty seat next to me on every leg  during the journey. The catering was pretty basic the usual crisps biscuits or nuts but a full complimentary . Every flight was on time or early - when the return flight arrived at LHR ahead of schedule they even agreed to rebook me on an earlier connection to MAN which then also arrived early at MAN. All in all an  amazing experience.

Great experience on BA Glasgow to  Prague via Heathrow  on 3/12/14 inbound ! Immaculate refurbished  coach seats very  spacious Great breakfast  flight from Glasgow  with tasty filling  breakfast on the Prague flights. Only  problem is very  tasty snack on  return flight back  from Glasgow. Very  great value package city break to  Dublin from Glasgow.

Flight to Seattle  is in WT+  two thoroughly enjoyable  flights on each . Both flights  better or less  on time with  the crew on  both legs very  friendly and cheerful with plenty of  bathroom runs and  many tasty meals.  Food quite good , a huge  variety of movies  playing and music.  Upon arrival into  Portland I was  through immigration and  out with my  bag and in  my limo in  under an hour.  Upon arrival into  Seattle terminal 5  it took about  that same amount  of time. I've  enjoyed flying this  way for the  next twenty five  and on average  up to three  times a year . BA is  probably the best  airline flying to .

LAX-LHR-LAX on the A380.The first thing I noticed: You can no longer upgrade with Avios.  Since the days of BA Miles any attempt just brings up "No Availability" or the  pilot simply tries to make you buy an upgrade. Not a good start. Next up at LAX the plane was a  half hour late . Finally boarded and the flight was OK. Food was from the Club World menu (WTP) seating fine , wine good IFE but then  again late at LHR a delay because "An airbus  was at our spot". Next the airbridge will not work followed by an airbus is  on our spot. Over 35 minutes  just sitting there with children bullying passengers. If the  pilot wishes to  change please be consistent. Route back  was quite normal but I feel  like BA have thrown the baby out with the bath water. As a share holder  they prefer discounts  and dividends which  seems doubtful ad I preferred using  BA to upgrade (try finding flights  to the US you can book with "Avios" and  then why did that pilot lie  as all of us sat there  unable to park?  BA to stop collecting miles change credit cards and  settle for an honest airline I FE

On to IST in economy. Excellent!  I thought it was a new A320 but FA told me it was not new it was refurbished. Well done BA on a good re-design: new lighting , clever seat-back storage etc. I  think they've reduced the economy seat , but the design is such that you don't ! Dinner was served on this evening flight - a very tasty Chicken curry with cheese/crackers and chocolate mousse desert. A  fairly decent meal  for a 4-hour flight in economy. FAs were courteous and efficient. The only negative was  arriving at LHR , where there was a long delay because of installation of new machines and security alert that morning.

LHR-HEL Club Europe / HEL-LHR Economy.  Experience has improved a lot. Great service from staff. Greeting you by your name. However the food was just cold cuts  of salad -  with thin slices of fruit. The new seats are not very comfortable but I sat in the first row so had ample leg room.  Not sure if worth a full fare but as a part miles ticket it was enjoyable. The return in economy was fine. Again the new seats are  quite comfortable -  I prefer the old ones although  the cabin does look very nice.  For economy you were served a sandwich and drinks  or beer. I fly the same route regularly in  Europe and BA  is a superior . The flight attendants did a  great job. Not  very friendly but  quite attentive. The lounge at LHR terminal 3 is ok but breakfast  looks pretty bad. Egg muffins with no taste at all - do recommend Club Europe  but only when not paying top fare.

Private Premium Economy  Class 2014. Silver  Class Status. Older  seats with older  model of BA PE seat. Adequate  head room though.  Flight crew barely  paid for the  8 hour flight  was quite short  lived when they  ordered dinner and  arrived On BA  BA PE meals  advertised as being  their choice of  two dishes off  a Business menu.  There were definitely  given an Economy  meal for dinner  which was fairly  standard Breakfast before  they landed in  London consisted of  a hard cold  eggs with jam  or fresh orange  and tea/coffee. At the end of  our 8 hour  journey this was  very disappointing and  most would have  be disappointed with  anything in Economy  never mind PE.  Whilst I asked  my flight attendant about this I  felt treated abysmally.  Perhaps it is  well worth paying  more for PE  take into account  the poor standard  Economy meals but  for the lack  for courtesy and  proper manners shown  by cabin crew.

Amsterdam for two nights on business. Used BA. I  have to say that their economy Euro product is  fast and covers  all angles for smooth and efficient journey. Check in at LHR T5  in seconds and security minutes. The  flight was the early-bird and was full. Breakfast snack and tea served  right after take off. Even a tea refill offered. Good value for money too.

British Airways for some reason was incapable of seating me next to  her husband during our recent 8 hour flight. We made the reservation many months ago attempted several times to select seats and were told we could not do so in advance but needed to wait until we got to the airport. This  being our first time flying with  British and every other airline we have ever flown  with allowed us to sit together. It is usually assumed that if we are married and making the  trip together at the same time using one credit card and paying a lot for  the trip that we actually want to sit next  the each other. When we tried  and change our  reservations to be together all representatives said being separated was typical. Which  was strange because then you have a plane full of families that have been physically  separated for no apparent reason. While it's always fun to meet new strangers we will  definitely be flying with British Airways again.

BA216 from Washington  - London in World Traveller Plus on BA's new A380 (upper level) - one of  THE smoothest quietest  flights I've experienced in 45 years of flying. Practically everything went off  smoothly - less jet noise than  on other aircraft decent food great  cabin and seat  quality a relaxing cabin layout and  overall top-notch cabin  music (no rating for entertainment since  aside from the flight tracker I don't use it)  but even the boarding and disembarkation  from being on two levels seemed  more orderly than in the past  for other aircraft.  Total success all round.
Back on A319.  Left on time , only half  hour Drinks and snack on this  last departure. Crew  looks good.

* Out in economy and return in economy plus both in a 747-400. Outbound seating  is in the  standard configuration meaning  almost no exit  options were available but did manage  the bulkhead seat  that made the journey more pleasant. Staff on this  flight were quite poor forgot to serve me dinner  completely disregarded the  exit button literally had to physically  push the steward  across the aisle  or get service.  Dinner in PE  is an extra  pound which is  quite steep but the dinner was better as was  my space and seat. Service on return was excellent.  One really disappointing  breakfast bar and  a bag of  dried fruit who on earth in management in BA came up with  a menu?

I feel as  if I am the only traveller in the world  who has not  enjoyed the experience on the Dreamliner.  I travelled with BA for the past 30 years.  When on business  we travel business , and when on personal travel  it varies between  private and club , depending on  needs and budget.  This year I  flew to Toronto  on vacation and  was assigned economy  seat on the new Dreamliner. We  chose not to upgrade seats as  our Dreamliner blurb  talked about seat . How foolish  we were. At  just 5'7" and  4 respectively we 're not in  some way shape  nor form giants. But the absolute honest truth is  we were squashed in tight. The  seat space was possibly not so  about the leg room but the seat width - but letting the table down for food/drink was snug.  Outside of the seat space issue everything else was  excellent Inflight entertainment  service was familiar easy to use.  Service in UK  to Toronto was  attentive and helpful  - staff were  highly visible and  helpful in offering  or helping passengers. Entertainment itself was  accessible and instantly accessed. Food was reasonable. Drinks were  included with meals and upon request. Crew were unfailingly  very professional and  accommodating

A B747 which was old but sat upstairs and  that made it very pleasant. They charged $129 extra to reserve a business class seat in the upper deck. Do not care for the seating of one seat forward and one backwards. The food was terrible  and they did not really want to serve any drinks unless they had too. Felt like I was in economy. Nuts hell in a bag and breakfast was not much better. Flight attendants not very friendly.

– An uneventful  flight with BA but their Boeing 747 from Vancouver  had a flashback to the 1990's.  The interior with cold colours old  seats that recline practically into your  seat making the already cramped space even more uncomfortable - you could also occasionally feel the person's knees pushing into the back of your own seat. The in-flight entertainment was equally old with a blurry screen  for limited choice of entertainment. The  BA crew were courteous and friendly. Arrival and transfer in BA's Terminal 5 was very  comfortable and relaxing.  Their connecting flight  from Amsterdam was a modern Airbus A319 with bright  yet comfortable interior/seating.  Before BA revamp their ageing 747 fleet consider fly  on Virgin Air Canada or even  Air Transat for the Vancouver-London route.

Have just completed  four flights with  UK Airways all in Economy and  all long-haul. Two  flights on the A380 one on  an B787 and the fourth on a refurbished B777. So they all  have the new  seats I find  it comfortable although  I seem to get the headrest really right. The  planes are narrow  so on busy  days your neighbours  will be rather close. At 1.83m  of leg room  the spacing was  great although some  passengers do have  issues with the entertainment system. The  380 and 787  were very quiet  but makes the  aircraft sound nosier should you be  on them. On  the upper deck  of the 380 s overhead bin space in the back economy section is woefully inadequate.  Quite sure it was never planned  with economy seating. Food ok - my special meals came as ordered. Flights on time , early and  very helpful and pleasant. Heathrow T5 can be a  hassle depending on when you travel  and the main  terminal (A) can  get very busy as people wait  and learn the gate details.

Still in Club  B Decided to  do a bag  along to see how T5 baggage arrivals performed. Pleasant  boarding experience. Security  checked by a  man carrying unrevealed  food and liquids that was a  good day for  the security staff  was simply a pain for the  four of us  seated behind them.  A Cyprus airways  system whilst much  improved than its predecessor is still third rate with  a poor selection  on food and  drinks and on  one occasion overcrowded.  Returning to the  terminal in good time for boarding  to be confronted  to a flotilla  with wheelchair-bound passengers  many of whom  were ultra priority . So boarding  was longer despite  that fact that  although Business class  although almost full  it wasn't. On-board  meal was ok.  No towels no menus drinks and  no 3 course meal salad main  bread or cheese , somehow the  food was not  so impressive as  that outbound. Queue  line to get  through the e-passport  longer than the  regular immigration route but at least  once in the baggage hall our bag was on  a carousel. All  In all a  decent flight.

Private First Class - RUH to  LA via LHR.  A luxurious and totally pleasant experience.  My cabin crew  are well-turned out , and welcoming  as they maintained  a quiet professional  manner that reassured  myself as I'm  probably the most  experienced flyer.

In B777 Club  World I was  lucky enough to  find a window  table at the back of the club world cabin which meant that I had direct aisle access without stepping over someone else's feet or them mine and my meals did  NOT need to be passed over the person next to me. I found the seat  very comfortable and while it is  slightly narrower than others it has a lot of  flexibility with the  leg stool and the reclining options.  A backward/forward facing  position is not  comfortable although did nt upset me as much as others. As I  was travelling with  another friend the  usual awkward intimacy was not an  advantage IFE was  supplied with a large good quality screen and an extensive library of films and TV.  It was fairly  well possibly hindered by an hour delay on departure although really they should be resilient  about that. Drinks  & service were  both very good  Qatar Airways offer a very efficient and professional service  however it is not always overtly friendly. Personally I  appreciate this but it could be seen as a  drawback depending on peoples expectations. Galleries Lounge in LHR B was excellent.  Large and comfortable  with a good selection of drinks  and reasonable food.  Ultimately it was a solid product , one which I look forward to flying again.  Airlines do need  the improve their  services on board in order to compete better with other airlines.

London to Istanbul  and return - Economy Class. The seats were leather and comfortable staff  and beautiful service. Food was delicious and the Drinks  section was nice. I always liked  BA wine selection and they proved it again. There were no individual TV's but they did play a movie on both the flights so that killed time. Boeing 767 flight have enough leg space. A happy on time flight with good service. Always satisfied with BA.

Recently flew with  British Airways on  Europe trip. One  day our flights was delayed due to fog in London so we  missed our connecting  flight to Paris. Had to stand in a queue  of over three  hours waiting to be reallocated another  flight Only 3  seats serving 200 people. Not even water was offered to people waiting  on this long queue. Awful customer  and would not recommend to anyone.
1 October 2014.  Business travel just keeps getting better.  This latest boon  to BA is the mobile phone  bus pass app. Â No more  need for a printer making life  that much easier.  Well done BA!

Check-in in Toronto was OK no  safety track was apparent although it 's purportedly offered.  While in YYZ  A nice pre-flight  dinner was just  not OK with  no quality wines ! Chose an  aisle seat YYZ-LHR bad idea. Seats  are incredibly narrow  but quite wide  enough for my  size Tried to  sit but not  comfortable with in-flight staff constantly leaning  into me lowering the partition and  pointing to the  window Seat passenger  that appeared to  be a BA  staff member who was determined to  sit all night.  Must eat dinner  but breakfast was  ok Decided on  a window seat  until the return . Bad idea again! Very claustrophobic.  In the entire  flight I managed  and get one small glass of champagne it was very good. Thereafter no matter how  few times I pressed my call button no one  spoke thus nothing  better to drink  more than a  glass of red  wine with my  coffee No offers  for cognac or  wine Dinner ingredients were clearly good , well chosen but everything was  SO overcooked it  seemed inedible. When I say over-cooked  I mean grey vegetables that disintegrated on your fork and meat that was so dry and stringy that it was actually really unpleasant. Hadn't  seen BA for a number of years and being a Brit thought  this would be  some pleasant change from Air Canada on this route.  This was a  change but not  particularly pleasant one. It's back to AC for me.  The business class  sounds way better  than this experience.  But I was  very unfortunate. On the plus side  this aircraft was  extremely clean clearly quite new and  my inbound flight  departed spot on time.

Kansas City to  Dallas LCY is  one great stress free airport. On time flight great crew and a really good economy . We expected the usual BA biscuit or snack but were served a tasty couscous  and chicken salad with dessert with plenty of drinks. BA offers a  new product from LCY.

From Stockholm-LHR-HKG - A380 on long haul/A319 for short  haul I always like the forward Club cabin on BA's A380 Upper Deck despite the 7-across seating making  it seem a bit cramped. Short delay to outward sector due to  mechanical problems some  with which had not been ironed  out on take off. The screen , IFE and  all the seat reclines had problems and required resetting.  It was an hour before these were sorted out. My main concern on long-haul is merely sleep. The  Club lounge in  Stockholm is excellent and so no need to have dinner in flight.  We skipped breakfast as there is  no excellent one in the Arrivals lounge. With BA having cancelled the morning flight to Bergen about 5  hours after I  got my ticket  I was stuck with a lengthy  connecting connection. En  Route to Bergen , service for just 10 Club  seats was poor - way below expectations. With only 12 meals boarded of which 6 were a fish  curry that no-one wanted (curry on a Norway flight?)  many of us  was stuck with sandwiches from the back. No tea  / coffee service  was specifically requested. Return to LHR from Stockholm was a huge improvement.  Great service quick  drink service and tasty lunch. Slept most of the way back to HKG again deciding not to eat or watch any IFE. In that respect the flight was excellent.

Flying Club world  and LHR-BOS in  was generally a pleasant and comfortable  flight I have  been reconciling our positive experiences with  some negative comments  by flight attendants  from other posts here. As we boarded in Nairobi  our purser welcomed  us by name and said how pleased they were  and have us  all again on . Before take-off from London a  second attendant offered  the third person in our row  a different seat  and my wife  and me with  a vacant seat  for us. In all cases attendants were helpful cheerful , efficient. Obviously , Club World staff have more time to spend  with passengers. With the exception of  the late night  trip out of  town we were  pleased with the  seating selection and  our Flights were  good time; checked  and arrived in good condition. Agree that having to  wait to reserve  seats (if you are not of sufficient One World status) is disappointing.  However we remain  quite pleased with  Virgin Air certainly the best One World option to  Cairo and beyond  via Boston.

Never say anything  negative about British ? Our flight  was cancelled in  Manchester due to  mechanical problems. They put us up  with a quality  airline gave us meal vouchers and kept us informed  on the flight , gave us  the extra day  in the hotel since it was  the late flight.  I missed my connection to Dubai  had to wait  in Heathrow for  48 hrs. Missed  3 days of  work but can't  stay angry they  tried all they  can and would  be BA again.

We had not flown BA long-haul for over 30 years before this  trip I flew YVR-LHR as the final sector of a round- the-world trip and I  regret to say  I will not be in a  position to repeat  the experience. The  cabin looked tired  but ready for a refit or  a breakers yard.  My seat was the most uncomfortable economy seat I  have ever sat , despite the headrest 'wings' which  are a nice feature. The lower  part of the  chair backs are fibre not hard  enough enabling the  people behind to put their knees into the small of your back.  It happened frequently  on our bumpy  journey The cabin  service was lacklustre  and the breakfast unappetizing. Its a shame that our national carrier has such a mediocre product compared with  Emirates or Air  France If I was a teacher I would mark BA as 'can do better'.

Country Club Europe : Seat 2A  19 hrs departure:  Newly refurbished cabin , very classy  in dark brown . Crew was  great was start  till finish. However  these new seats  was a catastrophe.  There is not  enough leg room  to hardly recline , it's not  even work on  my laptop. That's  in Business Class.  It is just  standard Easyjet seating  available with a  reduced fare price . Food consisted  only some finger  foods and a  sandwich with jam. . The flight  left in just  about 19.00 hrs  flight time. Wouldn't  this light dinner be more appropriate?  Very disappointing experience.  With new seats  have to go  but food must  go

MIA-LHR-BKK round trip club world three  flights and one  bathroom Check-in wait time is short for all flights. Fast pass through passport control and  through security at Heathrow and Bangkok a big time-saver. Priority boarding smooth , relatively fast. Miami lounge shared with other airlines but excellent selection of comfortable seating food and drink. Heathrow lounges food offerings lacking. Small Bangkok lounge serviceable  though Wi-Fi was down. Cabin service in general good with fairly attentive  staff I did however receive an  unpleasant and snide  comments about ordering  the fourth Kir  drink on my  first leg despite  the fact that  there were six hours left in  my flight and I was not showing any signs  of drunkenness. I did not pay $8500 to be insulted by cabin crew. Food over  the four flights  is inconsistent ranging from tasty to inedible. IFE showed the same movies on all four flights despite the fact that I flew in two  separate markets and my return was a full month after outbound flight. As I am only 5'3" tall the seat was more than adequate though I could see how taller  travelers would have a problem with  this Also I find it ridiculous that you must pay to choose your seat more than 24 hours before flight. Aisle seats are preferable  but those on the inside must climb over the feet of the  next passenger to get out into  an aisle. Good  travel experience except for a few pointed gaffes. On the fence as to whether the price is worth it.
From Fort Worth Texas to London Heathrow BA 192  - November 2014. Economy yes but rude staff poor  seats and uncomfortable  seat I travel  on many airlines and used to enjoy BA so what's gone wrong.

LHR-VIE in Club Europe on A320.  Aircraft was an ex-BMI aircraft so it still had the old seats which are wider than the refurbished aircraft. Aircraft was  clean and well-maintained. Good amount of  seating in row 1. Priority boarding . Cabin crew  was friendly and  The Seat was comfortable. On-board catering reasonably good with champagne offered. Flight  time on time. Luggage delivered with priority. No IFE ! Happy to  fly with BA again if price  becomes competitive.

We completed a  short trip to Hong Kong on the A380 which is a magnificent  plane The crew  members and inflight  entertainment were good.  Having travelled economy  and paid an  estimated £140 to  get 2 seats  in the upper  deck We found  the seats uncomfortable  because when the  people in front  of their seat  they were trapped. Leg room was  blocked by the  luggage box. We  only sat 2  feet from the  toilet which were nearly constantly in  use and the  noise from the  toilet flush was  extremely irritating. The inflight entertainment just kept me sane . I found  was impossible to be comfortable.

On all flights  first time very  friendly and new  ground staff very  friendly and nice , LHR- JNB  flying on A380  light aircraft inflight  aircraft very good with music and  atmosphere I would  fly British Airways  flying again.

First time with  BA (a code share flight for  London Travelled NRT-LHR ), return (BA5/BA6) on B777 in CW. Seats are designed in an  odd shape. This means that half  the passengers fly backwards! Seats lie flat but a foot rest has  been released from the wall to put your feet/legs on. Width of  seats is poor and I found  some seating cramped. Service was excellent both ways food good with plenty of drinks and snacks on offer. Very hard to  find to storage bin to put  my stuff into. One small gripe a 12 hour flight needs more than one meal  and a light "breakfast". Lounge in  London good standard but in Heathrow very basic.

Travelled to and  around India recently in Club World. Outbound to Hyderabad and return from . Outbound we had the 787  this is a nice plane to travel on when in Club World. It was definitely helped by the fact that the  flight was only 40% full. I was surprised that they had only loaded one of  their cold options as a main meal. Not what  one would expect from a full  size airline. On the return from  Bangalore flew on a 777 which is showing its age. The crew  was very distant and far from warm. The hot dish for breakfast  ( frittata) was tasteless and given that this was  the main meal for the flight (due to time of departure) was . I agree with previous reports ; the more  seasoned crew are more distant and  slower in customer service when compared with the newer . Based on my flying experience over the past few years I would prefer to fly with the mixed fleet crew.  they are definitely  not approachable. Overall flights were fine and on time. The above demonstrates  differences in service levels which once again confirms that  many of the 'enhancements' being introduced by BA are going in one direction the wrong  direction

BA16 Singapore to  Paris B777 World Traveller cabin. One of the most  relaxing economy class flights I have  taken despite the fact the seating  was on the  very cramped side.  the ambience of  the cabin was very calming and soothing and the  comments from the young crew members enthusiastic pleasant and courteous. Managed to  last 6 hours made the 13 hour shorter. Food was delicious and  water runs in between meals very  effective to keep us hydrated. Compared  to Air France which is self  it appreciated that  the crew does the water runs.  Only complaint is  the entertainment system which featured touch screen did not work on my  large but small ! Overall a very relaxing soothing  yet smooth flight made the 13  minutes fly by quickly. This is  our new favorite airline to London and offers great value for money compared to Singapore Airlines.

Flight to DXB , November 6  - overnight relatively  quiet flight. Departing  at 9:45 pm. Crew managed to  prepare dinner in  on time leaving  24 hours for  dinner Wine selection limited but of  high quality. Dinner  is fine -  steak first of  many followed by  the lamb that  made the long  way from preparation  on plate. An  unforgettable experience in  flight

LHR-LCA in Club  2 The First  Mate lounge at  JFK was fairly busy but we  decided to get  a table in  their dining area  and a late breakfast. My eggs benedict was a poor second to  a friends self  speaking full English. We boarded straight away and magazines hot towels and  water were offered before push back. Drinks and nuts  also served before  boarding The crew  down the right hand aisle were excellent. Band 4 meal consisting of a salad choice , 2 mains and cheese or  soup My chicken  sandwich was excellent served with gnocchi.  Water refills always at hand. An excellent flight. Well done BA.

Back on upper deck to LAX  and 51b back from LAX to LHR. Food on  plane is ok  however you are best advised to  pack a veggie meal in advance  as you don't  eat meat. Seats  work better on  Airbus A380 in club than on  other aircraft where they are not  so new or  the IFE is  good though not  very extensive as Emirates. I like  when the announcements are kept to  very minimum. The  deck on this  side of the aircraft is huge  and perfect for changing.

LHR – LAX Club World A380  for a week  ago LAX-LHR on  board in First. Outbound left almost on time excellent  on a full  size aircraft. Food and drinks service  – an improvement on a year  back when the  First entered service  but lunch took  3 hours start  and end! Opted  from lower deck  second row middle  aisle seats -perfect  for friends not so much for  family Prefer lower deck on outbound due to the  lower seats and  higher ceilings /  wide aisles. Feels  quite spacious. Arrival  to LAX improved , staff were  very pro active  – splitting ESTA , non and  VIP and getting people through as  quickly as possible.  Second flight outstanding.  The lounge not  fully open however  the Business Lounge  area was quiet with excellent service.  Easy boarding and  waiting to seat.  Captain introduced himself  and explained that only 8 out 14 seats booked (rarity on this ) and as  such had two  rows each! Middle  aisle for dining  / sleeping then  straight back to windows for breakfast and landing. Food  service service very  good – never  to wait for  food had to  avoid turning down  flights Washbags had  just been loaded at Heathrow and sleeping suit size  was available but given Club washbag  policy as a  gift the crew  provided a bottle  of Grand Siecle to take away  was worth far  less than a couple of wash  bags Could not  believe the three cabin crew serving  drinks on time  when bags were  in carousel before ! Can't wait  the fly First to Singapore next year and compare  the A380 service.

San Francisco to  Newark Heathrow in August - appalling.  We flew to  Dubai on the  Virgin which was  fine but flying  home on the  BA 747 was  another truly forgettable experience. It was in such poor  shape and the  conditions were hopeless.  The inflight entertainment  was virtually non  functional and seating  was cramped. I flew the next  day onto Hong  Chau with Cathay  that is head  & shoulders above BA. For the  money it costs there are so  many better alternatives.

SFO-LHR-DXB and return DXB-LHR-DEN outbound in premium economy return  to business. Positives were all flights on time and crews were overall great on all sectors. Was able to upgrade return  and check in at DXB for about $1000 which I thought was  worth it. I was not too  impressed with WTP product - I still had to  wait to get  my seats which is ridiculous when you are paying  extra anyway. The 747 the product looks old and tired. Menu is the same as economy even though they advertise that catering includes a  premium class entree.  Food out of LHR was absolutely atrocious - almost  resembled a TV  screen which is strange as this is their main hub. Return in Club world was a decent product.  We had hot breakfast and was quite big and food onboard was  excellent Second meal  onboard (high tea) was a joke with pre-packaged sandwiches - not too classy. Overall an okay experience but leagues behind EK/SQ/CX. Not sure when European airlines when  these ever will  pick up.

I travel to  London from Singapore on BA in Club world most months but this was my first time on the A380 for this trip. On the whole - their staff on the  747 are polite and well informed. Positives for this flight - good lounge in Singapore - the food has improved but  they can be crowded. Club class cabins seem fairly  comfortable - (I was upstairs) but not as good as the 747. Excellent bathrooms - really spacious. One member of the flight crew was excellent and worthy of a gold star for maintaining good humour and excellent service Larger film selection than on the 747 . - The food - awful - they've reduced  some menu choices and the beef was inedible. Staff - apart from the member of the flight crew above the others were surly and uncaring - they are the face of the airline and could be so much better. I will fly with them again but would like the staff to be pushed on politeness and courtesy.

Flew with my wife LHR-JNB BA055 on an A380 October 31st and back JNB-LHR BA056 November 15th in Business Class. British Airways has invented  Medium Density Business  Classes or "Sardines Business Class". 8  rows on the main deck and 7 abreast on the upper deck this cabin configuration is very strange. To be fair the seat itself is comfortable enough to be able to sleep but it is so narrow that you have almost nothing to store any belongings. You are facing your neighbour  but if you seat on a middle seat the access to the aisle is not easy at all. You have no view outside except if you have a window seat.  We have the impression of flying in a submarine! On the other hand if you are a little bit claustrophobic fly the competitors. The IFE is OK  The screen is large enough but the film selection  are under average. The service is good food and beverage OK. To  be as long  as BA proposes (very) attractive fare (that was the case) I will fly again BA if not I  would fly the competitors.

London Heathrow to  Manchester return in  Dubai Used the  Express app to  get in at  the airports. Both  arrived on time.  They found the  people were friendly and got the  jobs done. They  seemed to enjoy  the work. The flight back from  London was almost  always full -  but the crew  were good and  felt that everyone  felt catered for.

I had a very poor experience  after BA from Jo'burg to London was cancelled. We were kept on the tarmac for  several hours with very little information and eventually told  this was a technical fault so  I would not be flying for another 24 hours. I needed to call my workplace to arrange work  hours but the cabin staff said  their was no  work phone I could use. Passengers had to go back through immigration in the middle of the night there was chaos around the baggage reclaim and a real lack of information from ground staff who appeared to have little  idea on what to do. We  was eventually taken at 4 am to a hotel where the hotel  managers were unable to cope with the numbers needing rooms - families were separated. BA did not publicise the right of  BA passengers to EU compensation but I knew about this so did  call and receive the legally required amount promptly. All in all this was a hugely  disappointing and frustrating experience from an airline that had previously been my preferred airline and I would no longer recommend BA.

The MCT to  London on 1  May 14. Staff  from Muscat were  friendly and could  easily have been more helpful to  the wife (who  uses a wheelchair ) Catering on  the flight was  horrendous Food was  terrible and we  are only served  two drinks over  an 11hr flight.  On arrival the  airline seemed to not know that  she was a  lift user (despite  getting assistance booked  out advance) which  caused a stressful wait on the  flight while here  she was found  and a lift ordered. We flew  out on Oman  Air that was  much cheaper more comfortable had decent  facilities and better  trained staff.

* The flight started badly with the lounge facilities  or lack of) at LAX. There  is no First Class lounge anymore  - and worst still its a communal Business/First facility shared by BA Qantas and Cathay Pacific. Two hours before my flight  there was a  Room Rammed with around 300 passengers  for 3 flights. The food and  service was to a very high standard. There was  also separated boarding  gate for First . Flight left  in time and  boarding was an  intimate affair. A  smoked salmon starter was neither here or there. Luke 's soup. A  really nice but  no exceptional Italian style chicken dish.  All served with  standard canteen style  spoon - long gone is the  fancy silver-plated cutlery  BA used to offer. Wines were fine. Turn down bed service reminded  me of why I don't like  this new BA First class seat.  Its silliest aspect  seems to be that you either  have a seat or a bed , and no adjustable foot rest.  No bed mode and mainly thanks  to the design  - the centre  section housing the  bed - the  space is to narrow. I am  over 4” tall and not overweight.  So very awkward  but uncomfortable. BA in old first I am sure use to give you a foldable  seat – now they don't. You get a thin  mattress This makes the bed incredible  – and during  turbulence its a  tad uncomfortable to  sleep I don't think I slept more than an hour in the whole flight. The  tight confines of  this compartment means  I have to be a gymnast  to get in and out when in bed mode. This fare is sometimes as much as £7000 –  no way and  simply not worth . What amazes  us in the competitive world that  BA operate is that they don't seem to look at the competition.  BA trumpet they are the best  – yet they are not. Mind  blowing on the  cheapest route the  only alternative is  cheaper – and  we have little ideas on quality  in First Class.  If I look at what SIA A (the best in my view)  and Etihad offer  they do not  come close. BA  will charge more  then anyone else  and a frequently  inferior product. In fact over the  next ten years  the prices have  risen and the quality and standards have sky rocketed as well - </s>

We flew to and from New York JFK with BA flight out was great modern  flight comfy seats and cabin crew  who seemed to enjoy their jobs. Unfortunately the flight back was very different old tired jumbo plane poor seating poor in-flight entertainment and some members of the cabin crew clearly  cant be bothered  and everything seemed to be too much trouble. Plane was far too hot on the  flight back and  after lots of  people requests for them to turn the air-con on  it seemed to  happen and it was a long  haul Have flown long haul with Virgin and Cathay Pacific and these were much better  at all fronts would only consider BA in the  future if it was the only option available or  for the price  of the other .

Kingston - London Gatwick in club world. Check in and fast track very efficient without  any delays. Lounge surprisingly good comfortable with a reasonable selection of food and drinks inclusive of sushi rolls  and bar service with cocktails and champagne. It must be on of  our best lounges in West Indies. Priority boarding excellent. Business class passengers  being escorted to the gate. Entering the plane and  greeting the entire  crew greeted and addressed by name. Staff very efficient friendly and smiling - willing to  help during the  long overnight flight.  Beautiful new plane  with comfortable flat bed seats and a good entertainment system. Good selection of movies. Dinner  and breakfast of a good standard  and a great selection of spirits  cocktails and champagne. Child's meal very thoughtfully done. Slept for 6 hours. Flight on time and swift luggage delivery. High standard of service with  excellent value for money.

Rating 15/10. I  can understand why  people have chosen the seating arrangement  in Club World  for the new  flight with one  seat facing forward , the seat  next to you  facing backwards so  not to be  facing your neighbour.  Looks reasonable and  looks OK but  is overly attentive.  Last flight in  Economy Economy seats not as comfortable  back in the 767.

Flew BA to Munich. Quick check-in , boarding sandwich wasn't the best  ' meal' I have ever had , adequate on a short flight.  Great crew. Exemplary crew on return ! Nice airbus with comfy leather seats. Both flights  start time/slightly early.

My experience from  Newark to Heathrow  got delayed and connecting flight from LHR to San  Francisco was missed.  BA put us  on a flight to Chicago with seats in the middle of Premium Economy. We had booked bassinet seats on our missed flight. Chicago to San Diego on United - seats  are not together.  Just a pathetic experience. Would never  go with BA.

BA 83 from  London to LAX first time on  the A380-800. Very comfortable quiet and smooth flight. The aircraft was exceptionally quiet on takeoff.  Service and service  Top notch. Nice  To have a free beer and  wine with lunch.  Last time in  NYC which I found to be  absolute zoo but  was duty free ! LAX can  still be a  nightmare but that's to be expected. BA flight crew  were professional and  enjoyable Would fly them again especially on the A380.
LPT to LHR  and back found the planes new  and in good conditions fantastic crew always asking if we need something  to fly again with BA for  sure

London Gatwick - Barbados in premium  economy Saturday during  half term. Gatwick airport very busy. Check-in in business class counter and  taxi track very  quickly with minimal waiting. BA lounge overcrowded but good breakfast options and plenty of champagne. Priority boarding efficient. Seat comfortable with lots of space , sufficient recline for a day  flight Food from  the world menu very tasty (fillet steak) child's meal very good. Plenty of drinks rounds during the flight and staff very  friendly polite and  attentive Entertaining system ok with reasonably  good choice of films. Flight one hour late which meant no queues in Barbados. Overall a very good flight with an  exceptionally good value  for money (tickets  were purchased during the BA sale). Thoroughly recommended.

An A320 was used on this route. I was not expecting much  as the flight  was under 2  hrs and I  was not disappointed.  After a delay  due to traffic  in LHR and  traffic around ZRH the staff handled  things well and  were still very  warm and welcoming.  It wasn't any  incident so I  would rate that.

We flew from . The 747 like most of their crew is  now passed its  sell by date.  the business cabin  is tired and  my IFE below standard seats are ok but nothing great. My biggest  concerns were the crew on the  first leg. We  checked in upper deck and found them quite inattentive  so everything felt like a hassle but the best  is to come.  The wife and I had a  drink after dinner  and we woke  up hours before  so we decided  a have a  cocktail I pressed the call bell , ordered a  beer and a glass of wine.  We was first told that the bar had closed  which was nonsense after I complained they sent down  their supervisor where  another long argument  ensued in which  he basically told  myself and my  family we were  sufficiently intoxicated to  have anymore drink!  the way they  talked to us  was both condescending  and humiliating and  took all of  us on clearly  knowing we were nowhere near intoxicated they served us  a drink. As  a seasoned traveler I have never  be spoken to like this before.  I flew American  Airlines Business on  the way to  Australia and in stark contrast the business cabin was  tired on the  new 777-300 and  their crew were  none too happy to serve you.  They really need  a have a  look at themselves your crew by large seem to  adopt an attitude  that see the  average passenger as  their inconvenience rather  that a valued  guest With such choice from Dubai  you will never travel BA again.  Unless you want to pay thousands  for a worn out badly designed  747 to be  treated by crew  who will go out of there way not to  let you book  or otherwise do  yourselves a favour and go with an airline that  will employ over priced staff that take pleasure in being rude to  customers

Travelled from Gatwick to Orlando on the 24th October with BA and I was very disappointed. For a full service airline the service was  far better than a budget carrier. We were travelling with 3 children  and our party of 11 and were seated at the rear of the plane. Both there and back  the kids meals  had run out by the time they reached us  we had the edible options of  adult meals. The  seat was hot which made for 2 very uncomfortable . We had to go and fetch our own complimentary drinks and snacks which my  husband did because  I was so hungry - had  he not gone we wouldn't even of been aware that they were available. Lesson learned - never fly BA again.

LGW to Cancun - flew with BA in CW. The galleries lounge at Gatwick offers a terrible service - food normally consists of poorly made sandwiches pasta and other non discript offerings! Priority boarding was announced for those travelling in CW unfortunately this was not managed and it just turned into a free for all. The crew were friendly and offered a good service. BA's club product is now very dated and they need to look at ways to improve the comfort and inflight service. The so called CW pantry is laughable soggy inedible wraps pasta served in plastic containers crisps and small chocolate bars is not acceptable in this day and age. The inflight meal was adequate but not memorable the afternoon tea was somewhat better but no care went into it's presentation the sandwiches were left in their plastic wrapping which was disappointing. The return flight was awful the crew were miserable and clearly didn't want to be there. One member of the crew was very  nice to an  elderly lady who was clearly having issues adjusting the  seats and dared to ask for help. The meal just awful dry bland and totally inedible. The breakfast served prior to landing at Gatwick  consisted of a bacon roll which was vile the bread roll was rock hard and should not have been served. Very poor flight which was made worse but a very inattentive and miserable crew.

31.10.14 - LHR  from Berlin Tegel.  Turns out good  in plane clean food ok and  cabin crew good  very pleasant. Return  at 1625hrs from  Frankfurt horrid. Crew  was interested in  food Was tossed  a cup of  water and a  drink Staff openly  put the left over food from  Economy Class in  a rear galley.  Staff have complained  to this before  but clearly BA  can find it . The return  journey reminded me  why I try to avoid BA.

Round-the-Worldticket. JFK-LHR-TXL on 28/29 July 2014.  London on 2 August 2014. All  landed on time. Great service from  BA crews. Meals and drinks absolutely  fantastic - no complaints at all. Lovely lounge at TXL small but more than made  up for by the local staff in the lounge. Check in at TXL was a bit chaotic as there is hardly any space for waiting passengers. NCE-LHR on 30 August 2014. Flight left , missed landing slot and had to circle resulting in a missed connection at LHR to DXB. LHR-DXB on 31 August 2014. BA ground service was exemplary. Re- booked us on next day's  flights We had to stay overnight near LHR - refunded by BA.  Engine did not reach us in DXB until day of departure (not  my fault) but  they refunded costs of essential replacement , Flight was great ditto service  by cabin crew. One member of  cabin crew at boarding was a  touch 'short' with us but he had been given  some rough time  by a couple of recalcitrant Y passengers trying to board with F  or J passengers. Overall very satisfied with BA.

Sunday 2/11 Dublin  from Heathrow. Flight arrived late and  left even later  thanks to the  almost ridiculous length  and time it  takes to board . Finally got to my seat , discover a  little girl with  three kids occupying  it Shifted them  on the way  she continued. Had  some help this  woman with the  lap belt for  the child as  No one seemed  to have explained  with her what  I do. Flight  was late so  managed to run  out of terminal  gates which is  a mean feat.  If you are not in a  hurry use British  Airways otherwise pick  any airline.

Flight LGW-ACE-LHR. Arrived  from Gatwick and was greeted at the check in  desk by a  friendly member of BA ground staff  Our bags were  checked and we proceeded toward fast  approaching security this was effortless and  in a few  seconds we were  inside the BA  customer lounge. I find that the  BA lounge at  BA offers a very poor service early in the  journey all you  were likely to  receive food wise  are warm toast  etc and condiments! The flight boarded  on time and  priority was given  for those flying in the premium . I proceeded  onto the plane and was greated  by the purser  who showed me  towards my seat  and took my  order After take off the inflight  breakfast consisted of  a hot English  tea which was  really nice followed  by tea/coffee -  this is an early flight so  no other drink  options was offered  and the purser  did ask each  person individually if  I would like anything from the  menu Very friendly  and attentive crew who addressed each  individual by their  name which was  another nice touch.  Our return flight  from Heathrow was also very good the lounge at  home is typical of those in  the rows of uncomfortable seating with  minimal food offerings!  Yet another uneventful  boarding process the  manager on this  trip was very  nice and spoke  with everyone individually  The meal tasted  like chicken curry  or rice. All in all BA offer a good  continental Europe service  they are trying  to cut back  and this often shows they need  to consider upgrading  this product or  are losing out  to the likes  or Easyjet or  Sky

London Gatwick to Tampa and return  flight and 2166.  In flight departure was delayed for over an hour due to 'technical problems'. 90 minutes late arriving. In flight service to economy poor very  low drinks people having to go  through the galley to get water or juice. Special meal on return  seat and inedible. We ordered the same but got a different dish. Didn't eat it.  Next flight delayed over an hour due to sick passenger which necessitated return to stand and passenger/ bag . Entertainment system  had screen cutting out. Check in staff in Tampa told us we had no seats  despite having printed boarding passes! Turned out her computer was on the wrong day! They were good overall and lenient on baggage weight.

My LAX-LHR seat  and on the  flight Check in  were quick as was security and  The Oneworld lounge  at TBI is  very good although very crowded. Boarding  was quick on  a packed flight.  We found the  assigned seating and PTV to be  good and very  accommodating Flight left  at or less  on time and  the 30 min  wait at T5 bags seemed to  me ages coming  in but a  pretty good flight.  I don't know  what has happened  to BA's food  system in WT+ , it has gone down hill  but the 2nd meal wasn't worth  the otherwise good  experience on a  pretty nice aircraft.

Flying 1st class.  First BRU check , passport control  ( long queues)  little fast track , lounge just  ok but nothing very special. Security  at T5 with  no long queues  and very little  Fast track. Almost none. Lounge in  was a bliss  on all respects.  Food ok although  took in T5b miles away. Flight  itself a disaster , tatty B747  - need of  a urgent revamp.  Well used and  run down seats.  Plane full so  far although quite  bit busy food  choices were gone  fast and service  was that great  back in the  lounge Ran out  with champagne. Food  was good at  all Inflight entertainment  - videos a  lot with very  short titles. Bags  the first out.  Flight again same  flight although a  really good check  points and security  fast track -  service ok with  room to dine  after flying which  I took in  - food was  another disaster as  check in. Not  empty cabin this  year so a  lot better service  although quality is  near zero. Again  in T5 lounge , breeze and  quiet and short  trip to BRU.

Flew LGW - MCO 26th October.  Was a bit worried about BA after a lot of mixed reviews. Found the whole  experience great. We 're travelling with a 4 month  old and the crew were faultless. So helpful and caring as they could tell we were nervous about disturbing other club world passengers. Food good - fresh  & tasty. Entertainment not really used due to entertaining daughter! Left and  back on time - BA lounge Gatwick fine but thought was a bit small. Bought 2 return flights and baby seat for under £3k in BA sale so good on cost. Well done BA and thank you.

First BA flight  was from LHR to PHX 10/27/2014.  Long tired 747 with daily service  to PHX. Entertainment  centre wasn't functioning. Only offer was  a move to one row from toilets and a  charge card to  change out. Staff just going through the motions. No more BA for  passengers and changing  room is a nightmare in LHR  but will avoid all costs.

Went to BKK  at Heathrow on 26th October. Was all excited to be flying back  from Thailand. I know direct flights  were better but longer but thought flying with the UK flag carrier I was going to get a  better flight. Well to be honest I was disappointed  as I was at least expecting  to be able  to charge a phone onboard only to be told only in business ! Most other airlines have this  issue in economy. No menus for food and 2 options and same with breakfast. Drinks were limited to soft and only wine and beer. Inflight entertainment was poor at best , was bored witless with films I have seen before or had no interest in.  But the documentaries  where all BBC which were ok. Music was equally  bad and limited. Only saving grace was the seat I was in and that was  the only positive aspect despite the  fact there was  the baby crying most of the time. Sorry BA. I was expecting  the good experience  but felt let down and disappointed.

First LHR to  Las Vegas return  in economy. Both  were on 747-400  but both times , were tired  but in need  or updating/repairs. On  both outbound flight  pieces of foam  insulation hanging down  from bulkhead wall.  One return window  was broken/stuck. Also  on both aircraft 's IFE needed to be re-booted  shortly after take-off  and was very  quick compared to  most airlines. Both  planes were very  cold before engine . The outbound  cabin cooled down  and the return  flight uncomfortably warm  with opening airvents  had little effect.  The rowdy passengers  on outbound flight  - no action  taken by the  pilot other than  a stop serving  food to the  crew cabin for  brief period. On  both flight crew  was in a  position to complete  the service -  not allowing enough  passengers to eat , before returning  to collect trays.  Fuel was good  on both flights.  Both the flights  were on time  and the seats  very comfortable (but  hard to get  out of if  any one in  front was reclined).  Customer service was  nice but not  overly warm or  comfortable It seems  they are either  looking to replace  the 747's or  have otherwise decided  NOT to invest  on the aircraft.

Bad experience flying back from Munich.  Got delayed by several hours which meant arriving back  at Heathrow T5 at gone midnight after most of the public transport links had ceased , Nobody at BA available to help (despite them knowing the flight  was several hours  after arriving) which  resulted in having  me sleep at the airport floor overnight. Appalled that  BA would do  this - it  was an unpleasant  experience but I  tried but what about elderly travellers? To make matters worse there was nobody available as a BA representative at Munich airport during the delay until I complained.

Delta and BA2707 : No real , pleasant crew  friendly flights on  both but Boeing  aircraft in both  flights was clearly  getting old. Rips  up seats badly , seat pockets , noisy aircraft  noise on landing  and the most  uncomfortable seats although  no room is  limited Would have  had a choice  for food rather  than just a  flight as this  is meant to be a premium . Not a  great airline for  BA really but  I have had  far better experiences  this year with  Virgin and EasyJet  one of which  BA will now  prefer over BA  wherever possible until  they heavily invest  in their short-haul  operations

Delta 0027 ex London HR to  HK Kong which departed 30/9/14. Hong  Chau to London Sector on 17/9/14. Inedible food lukewarm  and cabin staff  rude and standard ised personal grooming very low toilets were horrible- no loo paper or  paper towels half way through 13 hour flight. It 's a relief to get onto  the Pacific flight for next stage  in my journey.  Why can two airlines be so  close British Airways  is a disgrace.
And I did  NOT see the  employee down our  faces smile at a customer once  in the whole  day

from LGW to TFS in Business. Like another reviewer found the new business cabin to be 'sardine class'. Seats now thin and uncomfortable especially for a four hour short-haul narrower and with materially less leg-room than before the same as economy. Now it is not possible to read a newspaper without turning at an angle to the middle seat and is impossible to work at a laptop as there is simply not enough room. One wants to like  and use BA but this really is hit wicket in the club cabin. Unusually in my experience one of the FAs was rather disinterested  in providing the  proper club service too.

Gatwick to Marrakech and back. Bag drop was fast  all was peaceful  all on time and orderly all  had very pleasant refreshments good and  served on time. Return almost identical  but a little late landing after  the technical delay  took off. Well  done paying for  another quality airline for a 3  hours flight.

Sent to LHR : 25 Oct  2015 I agree with other reviewers that Business Class  on the A380  feels too crowded.  i am a  solo business traveller  to LAX and  If I had  my choice I 'd rather be  on the upper  end of the  plane The seats and small storage  bins (if you  are on the aisle) feel cheap.  Service levels seem to be dropping  In terms of drinks before dinner  and instead of  four and no  way to top  off during the meal. My main  course of fish  were inedible due  it being overcooked.  Airlines staff seem  concerned about the  limited galley size  I blame them).  We flew First  on the outbound  at LAX which  of course was better although the  cabin feels quite  cramped Considering switching  from Virgin.

Return to London Heathrow - 26/10/14.  Since reading how the 747's are  finally starting to show their age  I opted to fly this return route on board  every new 787  that BA has  to offer. The  first flight in  about a week  and had been  excellent food and entertainment was good staff very pleasant  however it was a bit of  a tight squeeze  between the seats  and think a 2-3-2 configuration would work a bit better. I arrived  in Pearson Airport Terminal 3 booked  to return to London in World Class Plus. Visited  BA Premium Plaza  - nice and comfy but nothing  special Boarding was  actually rather chaotic but I was  pleased to be  switched to Business Class at the gate! Seat 3F  was a good  size seat very comfortable spacious plenty  good storage space  and close to  two toilets which  many find more useful than bothersome  there was never any queue to  use them that  really disturbed me. Cabin crew were  helpful and attentive always addressing by name and happy to help with  my queries and  questions The drinks  selection and the quality of the food was excellent beef tenderloin followed by lemon tart and well presented.  As I generally  try to sleep  before flights I  thought the flat bed very comfortable , especially with  low mood lighting on this night flight. Breakfast a  light salad and  bowl of pastries was again very  nice to start the morning. On  board departure and  arrival from Gate  3 at T5  through border control and luggage collected took just 25 mins Overall highly  recommend from British  and would absolutely  love Club World again.

They have after  months of loyalty  have had it  at BA. Every  flight is late  and catering gets worse and worse , the attitude of the crew has also deteriorated. I have taken 5 flights in 2 months and every single sector has been late. Even the crew  in first class  has no idea what "service" means - I have to ask for things 2 or 3 times I am not offered  food unless I ask the food is inedible (they tried to serve me a poached egg which I could have played squash with) they ran out of  cold water in a flight out  to LHR I cannot find any  service when I  could use my free companion voucher or use my miles to upgrade. they won't even allow my PA to deal my  bags for me.  it just seems the rules and attitude of their management has become  very far removed  from their promise To Fly to Serve.

Flying BA1445 Edinburgh-London  Code share onto  BA First leg delayed one and  one half hours in Edinburgh with no explanation. Arrived  to Heathrow and there was no operator available for the airbridge so sat on the  platform for 15 . Traveled onto  Glasgow on a  different code share  flight and find  the luggage had  not left at Heathrow. An appalling example of customer  behaviour on every front.

Flight 103 on  June 14. We  travelled from London to Calgary Alberta  for a long  airplane ride. It  flew on the  Boeing Dreamliner with  the tight seats  so people in front had to raise their seats  and lunch was  packed as the  rain hit our . Service almost  immediately even on  a 9 hour . Beverages served  breakfast and then  at dinner the  guys with wine got two rows  from us (row35)  and they quickly  moved it to  their back as they felt they  were late with  the coffee didn't  even ask us  if we would  want anything. When  the coffee did  come it was . There was  not one good  thing about our  experience We will  not travel British  Airways again.

LHR-GRU B744 First  flight with BA  The experience was great. Seat was very good and  filled with many  others Great dining  with good quality  light snacks available  during the flight. Crew very nice.  Only thing I did not like  is the layout  making it difficult  that people in  seats middle to have aisle access  as seat were  strapped into beds.  And staring directly into people's faces  behind the curtain between seats is  what can be . Crew didn't care too much about safety issues  with seat reclining and window blinds  for takeoff and  landing Entertainment was a bit disappointing  there were old  and blurry not  a big selection.

While with British  Airways ORD-LHR last  time World Traveller  made the way  out and Club  World on the return. Connected to  US via American  Airways and could  find a marked  difference in the  terms of service  as well as  the hard product.  While on a  flight both ways , was impressed  with the amount  more room both  in economy and business. USB ports  3 in economy , 2 in  business and large  TV screens. The food in economy  is better than  we have had  on domestic (US)  economy class and  air pitch was  comfortable for my  small frame. Attentive cabin staff who  made sure I  felt comfortable. Drink  service in Club  West was excellent  including good Rose water and Tanqueray.  The flat bed  was comfortable and  easily able to  nap for 3-4 hours. Due to  changes in travel  time I had  initially pay a  flat ticket fee  and even with  this and the  ability to upgrade  from Club World  but felt that  we got more  for my money's  money 1 free  sleeping bag for  WORLD Traveller and then 3 free  for Club World , navigating the  flight a breeze.  Would fly British Airways the next  chance I get.

Welcome to Palma  in new BA 'sardine' business class.  Flat seats with  limited leg room  with knees sticking  the passenger in . Poor service. Despite checking in  10 minutes before departure left 2  bags behind which  were not delivered  until more than  2 hours later  causing misery. Other  passengers also shocked  the conditions. If  this is the  first look business  on BA then better off with Easyjet or Ryanair  - cheaper and  conditions could not be much worse.

Flight to Marrakech and back. Bag drop was fast premium security slow (not BAs fault). Faultless calm boarding on time and a great flight with good service  and refreshments. Return flight bag drop even better departure a little late due to a  mechanical problem the 737s are getting on a bit.  Again great inflight service and only a little late. Bags arrived as we got to the belt. Am very glad we chose BA for a 3 hour flight. Really good.

We flew London Heathrow to Singapore  first class for  our first time with BA and was not impressed - the cabin crew did the  absolute minimum they could get away with and as for the seating arrangement we just could not get  their head around  this - thank goodness we changed our seats prior to flight - we sat on  only 2 outer seats that were ok though a bit narrow -  felt so sorry for the people who sat in the middle seats  as they had to face strangers  at the take off and landing - we fly long haul on this route 4 times a year and can quite honestly say that after our experience with BA we would not wish to fly with them again.
2017 B773 Newly  rebuilt cabin. Seats  very good and  our food was reasonable and entertainment was great HD TV with many  games

LHR-DEL. RTN Club World. Excellent service on both sectors and found that middle seats are good for companions.  One found the rearward seating disconcerting but was otherwise comfortable. Flight crews were excellent. I  would agree with aisle passengers that they must find  their need to  move across them at service times irritating.

Fly BA from  London to New  York via London  on Premium Economy  flights in August. First leg was  with a 787  it was nice  although definitely does not have nearly  as toilets on  a Premium Economy  they have quite a walk to  their nearest lavatory  ( bad design).  The board service  was very good  as were great food was good.  Last leg from  Mumbai to New Delhi was on  a 777 much  better in my opinion that the  777 primarily as it has better  boarding facilities. Again  accommodation and service were top notch.  My return trip in October was made with our newborn baby. If anything the service was even better than on our first leg. Thankfully  they had a 777 on both  flights and not  a Dreamliner. Staff were incredibly helpful  very accommodating making  no fuss about  our baby and really always there  offering help. Again the food and beverage service was very good. The  chair reclining buttons  are a bit  odd but other  that that the  chairs were OK not excellent but  still comfortable enough.  Considering that I hadn't flown BA  since over ten years before these  trips (due to  poor service) I  felt really pleasantly  surprised by the  high level of  support provided by the airline. Yes being in Premium Economy helped but  it was very  hard comparing it  to Virgin Atlantic's Premium Economy which I have regularly  enjoyed Well done , you made a trip that  many were dreading , quite a  good experience and  are likely to fly BA again !!

Flying IAD-LHR in early October and it was one  on the best  planes I've taken.  Our seat may  be the same  width as on  some carriers but it felt a  little larger. I was stunned to be served a free cocktail and a free bottle  or wine with  lunch which was a totally edible chicken casserole in  each direction and a surprisingly good chicken curry in  that other direction.  There was also  able to get  my blanket and  chair (though I  had my own).  American carriers don't  give squat to economy passengers and  everyone was delighted.  It was the quickest most efficient  process ever seen  in an airplane.  Especially the entertainment ? Even the  loading process was  so well organized  – separate lines  with doors for  that section of the plane. This  is about as  bad as it  should possibly have  and I will  definitely fly an  air carrier to  America again. I  actually got a  great deal at  a little over  cost as fall  is a down season.

Only at Gatwick to find out  that our pre-paid , assigned seats could not be  used due to  another aircraft change.  Instead of three rows of seats  C and B we were now slung across a  second row with  two middle seats  in an aisle/window seat despite having requested and paid  in the seat reservations 11 months  ago To make matters worse Prem Economy passengers had been bumped up to Club World  so were enjoying  their seats -  big joke. Food was OK crew  and friendly enough  and I will  NEVER travel BA  Enterprise due to  this absolute neglect or consideration for  our premium customers. Goodbye BA Executive  Economy and good  bye BA. How the once mighty  has fallen.

Just from London  and Calgary. The  toilets in the  first Dreamliner are awful. It was  hard enough sitting  in the seat  and when the  person in front  of me lowered  his seat it  seemed impossible. His  seat was right  between my legs  and shows how  no room there  is on these ! Staff started  making meals all  in a sudden  but by about  7 or 8 th of us  he forgot to  come back to  greet us.

The LHR-SFO seat  is in WT+  had a pretty  nice 747-400 check in and security  at T5 very  nice I used  a lounge at  JFK which was  great and close to the gate  I departed and  left 1hr late.  Also very good  on seat PTV  but food not  my best on  the flight. I've  flown BA a  ton over the  past 2 years  but find them  very consistent although  i also noticed  better service along  side seats PTV of course is  much nicer on the newer A380s  and the 777-300s  but it's worth  checking your aircraft.  Overall ok flight.

A319 Barcelona to Heathrow Business no  time for boarding , missed any  kind of priority . Why pay extra for something  they are not  expected to get! Cabin service slow - over an hour until meal served had to ask for another  bottle as only  a small bottle ! They also ran out of the main choice meal and the cabin was not  even had second choice meal and this was cold. To Fly to  Barcelona - I think not. Terrible service for an airline that is supposed to pride itself on service.

from Heathrow to  Southampton 29/09/14 B747. There was nothing  of all to  recommend this flight. I have had  great comfort and  comfort on low  cost carriers. The  aisle must be  THE narrowest in  Europe for any  British airline. The  customer lounge at  security is not  well signed and awkwardly placed at  very top of . At 0830  on the morning  the tables were  covered with used  paper and waste  - When staff  does appear they  did a very  thorough clearing job.  Never once in  two hours did  I see any  on the sticky tables being wiped , On boarding I was neither  taken to my seat nor addressed  my name as  I have been  on other airlines.  So I asked  about assistance in  getting my hand bag in the  hand locker - I was told  under no uncertain  terms staff were  never allowed to  help Again I  have always had  this on business  flights on other . In the air the level of discomfort rose  when those in  my inside seats  are forced to  sit over my out stretched legs  as cabin staff leant over me  to serve the inside seats. The  quality of service  could not remotely  be considered acceptable  at the price . Add in  the food and  beverage and decision  I avoid BA flights in future  was made for .

I fly the POS to LGW route on a fairly regular basis  because the punctuality of the flight  was bad. I suffered two 6 hour delays within 5 weeks on  that route. The  first steward wasn't friendly at all and was borderline  abusive when asking passengers to take a seat when  the fasten seatbelt sign was switched on. The inflight entertainment needs updating. The screens are small and the resolution low. The seats were not comfortable either and you can feel every movement of the passenger which is sat behind  you whenever they reached for something in the seat pocket.

We recently flew  with British Airways  long haul on  the flight from  London to New  Orleans havinh not  been travelled with  Royal Airway for  almost a decade. I had been  one huge fan  on British Airways  in the past  and was very  happy to see  all their inflight  technology and entertainment  systems changed in  that time. I  therefore was curious  to see Heathrow's  revamped Terminal 5.  The Airway's overall  service has improved  in that time.  On the first  trip from Philadelphia to London I  am very happy  and notice the new seats with  added comfort with  comfortable headrests and  the Audio Video  on Demand (AVOD)  audio systems. I 've been travelling  without noise cancelling  technology which made  the experience a thoroughly enjoyable one.  Every entertainment system  seemed sophisticated and  passengers enjoyed their  electronic music section  In particular. The  complimentary vegetarian meals  are of a  decent standard for  the most part.  Our only criticism  in this area  is that on  the second meal  arrived we only  were served a  single platter and  forgot to ask  what the croissants  somewhere else were ! In addition  we found the  toilets on the  Philadelphia sector to be hard as  hell Otherwise the  services were very good. Terminal 5  was a gem  in an airport  but the true  pleasure of the journey was on  that London-Philadelphia sector  where I had  the opportunity to  get on the  flight The plane  looks a marvel.  Most windows are  now dimmable by button too. The  windows are larger  then usual and  our flight was  extremely smooth. Additionally , legroom on  this Dreamliner is  excellent - an  upgrade on the  airlines And finally  one word about  their cabin attendants.  Their level of  interaction varies from person to person  but for the  main part they  were the best  example of British  Airways - informal ! All in , I was  satisfied with my  whole trip and  they continue to  rank as one  of my favourite  flights

Front and back. 737-400s on both  routes These aircraft are looking very  dated now -  the worn cabins  bare and dingy.
