The 'food' was a soggy half-wrap  and a filling-free  jelly roll -  this was unacceptable  for a 2hr45m . No choice offered by the  cabin crew even  if they had 3 options. The claim that their food offering is appropriate to the time of day is hogwash -  we were served  exactly the same thing at 10.30am on the outbound flight as at  noon on the return. Although we  recovered from it  on this trip  Airlines need to  review their hand luggage policy. There  really isn't space  in 150+ passengers to bring 2 bags which caused a lot of angst particularly on the return trip  when flights were completely full). On  one upside both  flights were on  schedule and the crews were friendly - the return crew dealt well with a potentially disruptive family group.

I have just flown economy class London to Los Angeles on the  US Outbound the meal was chicken which I do not eat so  i was offered  a almost inedible  chicken dish. No more food was  served until 2 hours before landing  and sandwiches I asked for a  grilled cheese and chutney was offered.  I was actually  impressed by this . Return journey was chicken curry replaced by vegetarian lasagne. Breakfast was  in a cardboard  tray containing a  fruit jam cereal bar and a packet of dried  beans The service  between meals was non existent. By far the worst airline food I have ever eaten. Sorry no British Airways for us.

July 16th Ibiza  to London Heathrow.  What a great service as usual , we actually  were on time  and once 5  minutes ahead of  schedule that is  a miracle for  a Heathrow! The  good thing about  Qatar Airways is  that they only  have one drinks  but I am  told two is  way more appreciative  as I know  a scheduled airline  can do more  than one on  the 2hr flight.  This only gets  me a poor . But great  service all in  all

Tuesday 29/9 and  Sunday 13/10. We booked our original flights on WTP on the A380  / B777 both  times with the  BA World Traveller Plus - far  better comfortable than  an old style WTP with an  even better IFE . So guess how pleased I  was when BA  changed the aircraft on both flights , the now  long aged and decrepit B747's with  an old style . The 747's  probably should be pensioned off and replaced with A380's - they are  too grimy and falling to pieces. Our B747 was filthy. The catering on the way out to Washington  was not too bad - a half decent fillet steak. On the  flight back beef y but nowhere near as nice  and a truly  pathetic pathetic cold hard croissant and  bread that passed for breakfast. Inedible and disgraceful. Good  thing BA can't 't even pop them in the microwave for 10 %. The good  is both flights  arrived on time  - the FA's were OK. That's  OK This would almost be acceptable  except for the  next insult - charging for choosing your seat after  one of the  flight This is cheap nickel and  copper low cost airline stuff and not what you should expect from the nation's flag bearing airline. No  major major airline that I regularly use does this  - not even small ones like  American Airlines or United Express. It  is shameful -  and our American friends who flew BA back to Chicago were dumbfounded. You expect it on Ryanair or other low cost  airlines but this  really shouldn't happen on your national airline. I recommend  - but with enormous reservations - try to book  either the B777 or A380 and if you don't need to choose  your seat before  getting in you'll  feel OK.

OSL-LHR in Business. BA has over the last few years put less priority on Oslo  whereas SAS today has a better offering. BA is the only flag  airline in Oslo that does not  offer fast track security. The Menzies  security staff are doing their best but does not have any authority to help when things go wrong. Particularly the evening flights are very often delayed due to late incoming aircraft from LHR , I have several times been an hour or more delayed and lost intercontinental flights as a result. The de-icing procedure is also much  better than on SAS. The lounge in Oslo is  good but not magnificent. BA has better service in  business class than SAS with better food and free middle seat. You do however pay  significantly more than for SAS Plus. The crew was  great and did their best on  my last flight but seemed badly trained forgot to  have bread with the meal and  spend a lot of time chatting in the galley.  I sometimes miss the old well  dressed BA staff.  We also very often offer internet access on the  night flights which  was a plus.

Welcome to Bergen Business no priority boarding bus out  of plane which  was packed -  really bad start.  Was cold slow  air service and  I fact glad  I get off.  Lunch was ok  and cooked English  food was nice.

London JFK to  London 13 October  2009 The outward  trip had been  absolutely awful so the return surely  could not be  even worse. How  disappointed I was. Arrived at business  terminal at JFK  about 7. No  one at desk.  Security pass printed at machine but  had to wait  about twenty minutes  to check luggage.  Staff was rude and unhelpful. Onto  the BA lounge. Sagging shabby seats  with no food except crisps. On asking the receptionist  for the food  service I was  informed passengers normally  have the much advertised "pre-boarding supper" . Asked when  was opened and  was told it  is not operating.  Eventually some badly  burnt sandwiches and  boxes of cheese  on crackers appeared.  No hot food  was available. Two  days before departure  our flight was  reported as four  minutes late. No further information was  given When I  asked for an  extra thirty minutes  past scheduled take-off , was told there would be an announcement shortly. Eventually a barely  heard announcement came  that the plane  were now boarding.  My departures board  had not been updated so premium  passengers were forced  the shuffle along  to those in  a main cabin.  Even after presenting  the boarding pass  and was given  some grunted down  instructions with no indication as to which side of  my plane I  am seated. On  the late boarding  must have been  a blessing. I  kept count of  the times I  got knocked by  wet and heavy  hand luggage. Eventually  the safety demonstration  is played on the IFE system.  The sound was . Surely a  safety hazard. Similarly  the announcements from  my cockpit went . We took  off one hour  and fifteen minutes late with no  reasons given for  the delay. The  food selection was  very limited on  the flight as  on the menu two choices of  one course and  not one dessert . I asked  if I could have the advertised  whipped cream snack  or desert to  was told there  were none on . Food was  hardly edible. Service  very poor. The  flight crew seemed  intent on throwing  food round as  quickly as possible.  My salad was  replaced with desert  which I did not want) on  a tray. The  second course was  grilled beef near  the vegetables. I  was made to  look a nuisance  if I asked  for a second  bottle of wine.  My narrow seat  led to a  narrow and not  a comfortable bed.  Most carriers provide  blankets and duvets. BA seem to  feel a tacky  chair will do.  This whole service has been downgraded  below the standards I would expect in economy class.  All nicieties that  use to mark  the flights have been lost in  the pursuit of profit. Given that  they charge far more that their  rivals for this  flight I was thoroughly disappointed. I <mask> not use <mask> BA flight again if there <mask> an alternative <mask>
Also impressed with  Business Economy on BA Sydney to Heathrow and return.  Wanted also to  receive an unsolicited upgrade to Business  to return Singapore to Sydney.

St Lucia to  Edinburgh round trip.  Long flight both ways quite unhappy , on return leg tiny seatback  seats and poor  quality of entertainment  not satisfactory (taste  quality ok and  tried to fill  it up both  way on time ), was quite expensive for the  fare I got. Would fly them again if they  offered the cheaper  fares

Flight and return  - Traveller Plus (premium economy). Received a text from BA at 0600 that our 09:30 pm flight had been cancelled which would impact upon the US flight. Phoned the helpline as suggested. Utterly useless options provided  to their staff which was weighted towards a ticket refund - no use for a  return holiday. Made  some suggestions including can you get  to Aberdeen for the 7:30 flight (it was 7am and had now spent 1hr on  speaking to them). Gave up and just went to the airport. Fortunately BA staff there  were excellent and got me on next flight to  London despite breaching  their own min us 1 hour requirement for connections. Flight to London was good with good service leather  the Cabin crew facilitated us getting off plane first and BA staff  then met us to get us  the next gate  flight for Miami . Service centre useless but face  the face staff great. LHR-MIA flight. Aircraft a 747  was old and  new and WT+  seats were rubbish in comparison to  the product that I have experienced. Not that comfortable. Seat back TV is same as  before namely 4"  is tiny but selection was ok  - seats are  wide and didn't seem that much  better than economy.  Food (beef) was outstanding for aircraft food. Staff were pretty good. Aircraft on time. Return journey much the  opposite but staff  much better. Conclusion is that face to face staff , food great.  UK needs a modern fleet -  the 747 was  well aged and  old world traveller 's product needs work with hindsight  - would have just travelled economy as leg room wasn't that much more. If you take a iPad  to watch movies and are not tall economy would do the job. Their helpline needs to be addressed.  Note being in  the title - HELPline. Would fly  BA again but would think about  a WT+ option carefully.

LHR-DEN DEN-LHR - always use upper class in VA  whenever I can. This flight reminded me of just why I rarely fly BA. Most  in the crew were disinterested. I raised a couple  more points but I was told I was wrong  multiple times. Asked  about another glass  or wine twice  before my main the stewardess forgot  and denied that I had even  called for one.  Actually going out was pretty good but coming home  is awful. I  think one can just not get my head round  that seat formation.  I stare at some stranger on take off and landing food and drinks for passengers on the inner seats are pushed in front of your face.

Having flew one way MCO-LGW 6th  and the service  quality and overall  experience was so  low standards and  quality British Airways  have lost a customer for life.  Having requested assistance  due to illness  that I couldn't  do at Orlando  with just the  right lane to help me not . When boarding  staff wouldn't let  me board without  me with three  passengers just because  i was young  and didn't appear  and need assistance.  After this I  would barely make  myself to my  seat without difficulty  with the crew  was leant against  the bulkhead and  didnt even ask  how I was ? The drinks  were in excess  of an hour  and a lot  going in and  outside of the galleys with no  assistance The meal service took even  further and seemed disorganised no choice by the time  we got to  JFK The 2nd meal was a  very cold croissant  barely edible. Why  do they need to be chilled?  The temp would  suit them a  little better. The  leg rest was  knocked off its housing when I  made no attempt  of fix by ground staff or  move me into  a working seat.  The IFE screen was so tiny  it had squares  around it from  good old fashioned  flat screen technology definitely behind both  United and Thomson  for this route.  When I got  into Gatwick the  flight staff were just as awkward in providing me  medical assistance -  If you don't  look old then you shouldn't need  assistance Never again .

First class flight  to Toronto on  Thursday 6th October.  Friendly cabin crew  said first class food was very good. Smooth flight  including takeoff and landing. Would recommend  flying with British  Airways

Welcome to CMB  and MLE and  BA Sept/Oct 2014.  As a British Citizen you desperately want to like BA but they  always make it  very difficult to  be so. The  recent documentary "A Very British Airline"  fed our appetite that perhaps a commitment to service  should have returned to BA particularly  in the long-haul  business cabins. Sadly  for all the  while the cabin service was totally  average without any effort to do  less than the  bare minimum. Attendants  chewing gum no smiles everything was  just too much effort. The only time the crew  showed any animation  was when talking  amongst each other. Adequate is about the best description but it could have been so  much better without any cost except a bit of effort.

Flew from LGW  into Catania. Lounge  from Gatwick was  good and staff  was attentive no lounge at Catania , and given vouchers instead which  also got a  nice cup of coffee from the  airport approved cafe  due to the  valid Schengen passport ! Flights both  way were good  and we liked  The Pilot pointing  out Lake Geneva  while telling us  about our route so nicely. The return flight back  at LGW the Captain was hard  to hear and wasn't so interesting.  But aside on  previous journeys we  are well looked  over with charming  people The food  is also good too and we  were on time. Baggage came very  easily at LGW  but at Catania  airport it was  a bit of  like carnival! I'm  afraid Catania airport  is the worst  place I've been  to but there  ya go! I  guess it is  part of the  fun of travelling.

Thursday 6th October.  Plane drop at LHR pretty slow again - used lounge T5 South which I always like. A320 out which appeared new - a full  load of around 1.5hrs with a  lunch and drink served. Crew very  helpful and we arrived slightly early. Return check-in quick and then a long walk to the lounge which was shared with 5 or 6 airlines - OK not much food but pretty quiet and nice place to wait for  an A319 on return full again  - very nice the same sandwich and drinks served , arrived back at T5 on  return no bags  and out within  20 min.

A 4-class refitted with the new  WT Traveller and WT Plus cabins.  - Very disappointed.  For the outbound  flights the food choice was gone  before they reached the 4th row of the economy cabin meaning that myself and the  majority of the  passengers had to have the second choice meal - second choice for good reason. It was a truly unpleasant tray of  food The real  problem is the introduction of possibly  THE largest entertainment  centre box in  the floor space  we have ever seen. It literally  eats up half of the floor and prevents you  from stretching both  legs out. I  cannot know if  this is exclusive to the refitted B777's but it  is certainly a side effect of the new IFE and isn't there  for the the  economy cabins. The  screen seems to be under every  other seat on both sides of  this cabin. I  still don't understand  what the cabin designers were thinking  that this box  would take up so much of  the space that is already so  large They could have at least rounded off the corners. It seems rushed and last . This means  that I am now avoiding BA  when booking a trip if they  continue operating the  aircraft on the  return route. Bye  Bye Executive Club !!

Had a seat in World Traveller  Pass for an  extra €60 each ! This was to get an exit seat with  aisle and a window. Seat was  marked as window ! Yes it was an exit  seat but there was no window  behind the seat. The slide / raft box protruded from the exit  seat greatly reducing the amount of space for legroom. Seat beside me was empty but a guy was quickly moved into  it when he asked for it  with us having  only pay €60  one way for  both seats. Stewardesses  seemed friendly but  service was almost  none existent. The child portion chicken  soup was in no way filling. Was hungry throughout whole flight. No  drinks or snacks offered until about 1.5 hours before  takeoff when I  was given a  sausage roll with  some butter or  was completely dry  and unappetising.

The 6 flights  with BA recently  were satisfied though  the cutting in  First Class seems  to have got  OUT of hand.  Even Kitchen snacks  were shrinking with  food left half way through long  flight and meals  by choice less.  Although there are  many new business  grade seats out  here that are  available BA is  not acceptable especially  for very private  Economy seats. Crew  is excellent and  meal delivery consistent  in terminal 5.  Our one complaint  of these 6  flights would be  if no effort  being made to  reduce the amount  to hand baggage  off board even  on short flights  it takes so  long while stressed  passengers are trying  to find space  between large and  large bags when  many people have  2 or three  small bags each.  4 out of  5 flights were  delayed because of  security while they  had some bags  that would not ! Recent flights  by Easyjet have  not had this  issue they enforce  their rules so  you all know  are we stand.

Not being completely  unfair to BA . Have found  my airline has  become tired and  slow in Customer  Experience from the  Flight Crew as  we fly economy  class at Company  One this class  business traveler is  seen by the  airline staff as  something to be  seen until the  end of the  day The aircraft s I fly  are from London  or Mexico city  is 747-400 these aircraft have obviously  flown many hundreds  of thousands of  passenger miles the  engines are mostly  well worn and  with a 12  or 13 hour  journey leaves one  without a very  sore part of  their anatomy toilets  that are more  times than not insecure or broken. Food offered is now without a menu you get  whether you are  seated or go  anywhere from two  and the famous  buffet breakfast is  now no more  of a sandwich  and a frozen  egg The inflight entertainment is often  non functional and  the resetting of  sound system is  the normal sound  which is always  pretty bad. My comments are not  directed at just one flight or  particular aircraft only  to have seen  some deterioration over  the a few  months whilst I  can appreciate economy  flight money saving  as today's norm , airlines to  me mind should  improve customer satisfaction  on all levels  above just the  first class and  first class customers.  You have seen  many airlines achieve  and maintain very  strong standards in  the economic world  for airline travel  and sadly BA seem to be trailing to an  alarming extent.

Travelled to Cyprus  at Gatwick in  BA as thought  flights would be  better as use able internally in  London As we  are tall thought  pitch pitch would  be same as ! Wrong. Dreadful  flight in extremely  cramped cabin my  back was virtually  crushed by the  people in front  and the only  good grace was  as we had  the spare seat  belt between us  as I think  I would have  stayed standing most  on the way. Poor service and  absolutely awful food  but you could  make it food.  Chicken and small  salad with nice  little dessert. Wrap  was soggy and  a roll dry  and hardly had any filling. Only  1 round of  coffee then tea  again with food  in a flight  of hours. Really  bad toilets and  air conditioning poor.  Really old and just a bad  travel experience. Took  too late too!  Have travelled in  the better flights  on charter airlines  so following this  and WILL NOT be patronising BA  planes in economy  because we have suffered the return ! Have gone  economy class which  was good but  it is dreadful.

Don't even think about flying on this airline. Booked paid for and confirmed last February for a premium  BA flight Singapore to Sydney for last Saturday. When I checked in at Changi the check-in staff member told me the incoming flight from London was overbooked  and I was downgraded to economy  despite my wishes ! I would never have booked BA but for the premium economy  fare so huge disappointment. GB75 compensation is simply not good enough. Add to that the economy meal was inedible (what did they do to  my seafood curry). Never again.

London LHR-NCL. 10.10.14.  I arrived on  Friday at LHR from Brazil using  completely different carrier. Journey thus far  very enjoyable and on time. I  believe that that shortest final hop  up to the  north east is  often the most  frustrating and unpleasant . I arrived  early expecting to  disembark at Newcastle and get home late. However yesterday  morning I was wrong my flight  was running late  and was cancelled!  I had a  truly revolting encounter  involving one of their "professionals" in  London My courtesy and understanding towards  an inept individual  which was there to assist delayed passengers was rewarded  with the cheap , passive aggressive and generally dismissive  attitude which is  seen so frequently  from BA these days. No apology  or empathy just waffle and rubbish.  It just simply  never good enough and a terrible reflection of what  our flag carrier  has become. To  keep a long  and short I  arrive at NCL  three hours late.  To no surprises  My luggage was  put behind at  Newcastle But then again BA only  had seven hours  to transfer it  to my flight. Well done BA!  Probably the worst customer service that I have ever  seen anywhere!

Route: Heathrow - Toronto First Class  direct flight. Check-in  and security: The  latter was smooth  operation and efficient. The latter was  particularly poor on  the basis that BA make no special provision for  dealing with F class passengers either  in their own  terminal (Heathrow Terminal ), or any destination. F class  flights are not  allowed which I consider to be  another significant shortfall  when clearing immigration and boarding flights. Lounge: Flagship lounge (Concorde Room) is  fairly elegant reasonably  well staffed and  nicely located after  all Good food  and civilised portions  offered in the  menu and a  nice selection of wines. IFE and : The TV  was fairly decent  as on the  other 747s. Comfortable  seats / beds with decent bedding and PJs. Good  changing room which I notice at  times Practical sized amenity kit which is fairly well stocked. Food: Decent food and well presented. Selection is sufficient but no special options available . Crew: Generally  good crew who were professional. Not  the fastest of service in comparison to other F products. Crew and captain introduced themselves  to a number of passengers which sits between those  areas where all  people are chatted with and those  that don't. I would say BA  takes the right approach in that  staff seem to visually assess whether  each passenger looks  as they would  welcome a social  group - rather  than imposing it anyway.

BA038 PEK to  Dubai 28-09-14 Business  flight B747-400. First time I have flown BA long haul and in view of the many unhappy travellers on this site - I was keen to see  this myself. I can honestly say I have never experienced such a dreadful flight. Antiquated  and filthy plane is an experience I would never  like to make again. The seating in Business class downstairs is a disgrace I was  lucky enough to have the aisle seat 17G which turned in to  the flat bed so narrow my  wife and I  feel small was over the main  seat when asleep being continuously bumped and pushed. Absolutely no privacy in this seat and every one coming out of the toilet and standing  there waiting the  toilet area could  see my every move. Completely unacceptable. No mattress and  not a small blanket. There is nowhere to put even a pair  of glasses or  small bottle of water once the  changing table was  folded up (necessary  to sleep). To get to the centre seats where my husband was  sitting a dirty  little ‘window’ had  not be slid down and hot beverages and food had to be  carried across the whole time encroaching  into my personal space (what there was of it.) My husband said  the middle seats trapped passengers in and getting out involved stepping over people. Extremely difficult for short people. The whole design  for the business  level seats is  extremely uncomfortable and  deeply flawed. The  cockpit was badly presented and unappetising. The PA system  on the flight deck was inaudible  so could not  recognise the Captain in the pre  departure information announcement  One other issue was a very  slow in flight entertainment system which  required an hour  just get going  and even the  flight tracking information was not available for the whole  plane They weren’t  even concerned just  made apologies. The toilets were filthy  and grimy. The  bottom edges and  walls around the basin area where  seats were falling off were thick with dirty grease. I looked into  a galley and  it too including the floors and edges of preparation benches was full of grime. Total disgrace. The Cabin Crew seemed in  a state of  utter chaos having a great view  and seeing it  straight from my  seat Very little contact with passengers other than rather arrogant looks all round. Needless to say I will  NEVER travel BA long haul again. They need to get on to an Emirates Airline and see how it should be done. As a  regular long-haul traveller on Emirates the difference between these  flights is indisputable. Perhaps the so-called  unhappy BA customers  have never been on a Emirates flight to compare  the difference.
We flew BA  to London to  Washington DC 10/8/2014.  Because we were  travelling in economy  class space was very tight but  our staff could not have been  as accommodating which  certainly helped.

B787. Just returned from a London - Toronto -  Vancouver flight. BA appear to be proud of their  latest "Dreamliner" but they have scored a real own-goal by cramming 9 seats into each  plane 3+3+3. The only way this has been achieved is by fitting  planes that are  even narrower than the norm. We are well used to airlines having unjustifiably uncomfortable seat pitch but this  was the first time I have  seen myself wedged  into such a narrow seat -  and I am  very slimly-built! Unless BA changes their 787s to a  similar layout I will now have no alternative but to make sure I am not flying in a  row thus often avoiding BA altogether. I will let  my BA steward have the last word: "The first time I sat in one of  these seats I could not believe  what bad they are" - and he like me is slim. Come  clean BA -  start having a  high regard for  your customers' comfort and health.

I travelled to Hong Kong with British Airways from Heathrow on a 777-200 outbound and one of their new A380's on the way back both in World Traveller. It had been a long time since I had travelled with BA (18 years!) but it was one of my better flying experiences. I didn't know what to expect this time round but the seats had plenty of leg room on the 777 on the way out. I was annoyed  because I was told to pull my window blind down as other people were sleeping  and I had specifically asked for the window seat  for a reason.  Thankfully the crew were great and asked if I'd like to look out of the window by the jump seat which I did for a good few hours! Not only that the crew called the flight crew and the co-pilot walked to  one back of the plane to have a chat with me and gave me a map with all the points of interest highlighted with the times we would be above them! Airlines don't have to spend any money to truly satisfy passengers. The seat on the 777 was quite comfortable and the IFE had plenty of selection.  Our food was good not dried out and it was tasty. All the toilets were operational and were clean. On the  trip back I was upstairs on the A380. The aircraft was extremely  comfortable comfortable and the A380 was  oh so quiet in all areas of the flight which really surprised me. I really loved the 'seat " next to my window seat which easily fitted  the contents of my hand luggage. Food was good again and the crew were again amazing allowing me to visit the  flight deck after the flight had safely arrived at Heathrow. Toilets were clean and tody and all operational and the IFE was good. Leg room was good. The only thing I would say is that the IFE does take up a lot of space under the seat meaning that hand luggage  should really be stored there and it can get in the way of your feet.

LHR-MXP-LHR. Check in/bag drop at T5 once again very  slow appears to  be a staff shortage at some times of the  flight My FFS allows me to use the lounge  as I had  time for a quick coffee I like the BA lounges at T5.  Check on time seat 26A on  an A320 seemed new with a nice crew a snack and a drink served. Return check in quick Milan Malpenza Airport is horrible! Managed to find lounge close to B35 limited food but quiet wifi was  good although there  is a smoking  area Boarding quick seat 19A and another newish A319 full flight snack and drink served crew very chatty early arrival at . Good product although I booked  the day of  travel so a bit expensive.

All 6 BA  flights as part  of a OneWorld  travel trip. JFK , Berlin via  BA then 4  weeks later Berlin  via MAN via LHR and 6  weeks later Nice to DXB again  by LHR. All flights on time  The cabin crew  were attentive and  highly professional. Refreshments  provided and drinks  were appropriate for  all flights and  hours of day.  I was a  joy to fly BA after 5 flights with AA.  Had one small  little problem with  a ground agent  on LHR while  waiting for DXB. We were snapped  up and told  the wait while  our passengers (presumably  first class) boarded.  we were not  on the business  class 'line' but  just happened to  be standing near  some of the  two gates where  our passes were ! The ground  agents obviously thought , we were  first class passengers  about to board ! Overall a  highly satisfactory rating  for these flights.  Could not use  WiFi so unable  to give a  recommendation

Flight from SYD  to London return.  Great service on  time - nobody  got to the  toilet Had to  pay extra to  get a seat  to advance. The  excellent food - all 3 meals  consist of paneer , both journeys.

Compared to LHR  the Seats were  in the new  with only 30 % both in  Standard and Economy.  New seats are  quite uncomfortable and  their is very  limited room to  eat or work  unless the passenger  up front reclines  his seat. The  BA cabin looks  very small with  the new seats  and I would  NOT recommend anyone  looking to work  and fly with  BA now. The  crew was not  in a good  mood and when  asked you could  hear passengers telling  someone to turn  your phone off  with no crew  came to find  out what was  went on they  are more concerned  with their own . I hasten  too add that  it is the  poor cabin crew  at the thunderbird , who are  vastly inferior to the well paid , BA short  flights can now  be classified as  the Low Cost  and now they  have lost all  hope of customer  loyalty & customer  satisfaction

LGW to SZG. Absolutely useless for a scheduled service  that would not  recommend to anyone. Booked flights to Salzburg for travel in September way back in April  but chose the  cheapest flight as most convenient even though more expensive.  Fortunately we arranged an overnight stop in Gatwick as we live in  far North of England as otherwise don't know what  I would have  thought when our flight was cancelled  after notice only being given about 9.30pm the night before. We were  put on the  4 am flight  that meant being at Gatwick for 5am. This is a much cheaper flight but no  automatic refund is available its take it or leave it with BA. Our subsequent onward travel plans were also in disarray because of this  and it was a most unpleasant and stressful start to our holiday.  Having taken the trouble to complain to BA I  am amazed it took 8 days to send a  completely unsatisfactory short response which ended with "we hope you fly with  BA again to  regain your confidence  with our service". BA need to learn that scheduled service means just that and plans  were made around the timings that  can just be altered with no notice. I would not trust or travel with them again.

Reviewed 4/10/14 YYZ-LHR B787 G-ZBJE. If you want to  see what Ryanair long haul will  be like sit in E on  this BA 787. Appalling legroom seat width and non  flat IFE. Gold  seat holder flying  about 200 trips a year. Absolutely horrendous experience good luck to anyone taking the 12hr+ trip to Chengdu  try it! New plane with the  smallest seats ever.  Some passengers tried  and stand the entire trip to  reduce the discomfort!  Unless you are anything more than a medium build and have a bum and hips  we will have a very uncomfortable flight. I am  no one to moan but this  means the end  to me BA!
Very comfortable return  trip to Hannover  Golf Club Europe.  Airbus A319 appeared to be new  but food for  this short flight  tasted very good :

We took British  to London to  JFK Tired airplane.  First business class.  Pretty basic service.  No wifi. Nobody checking to see  whether you were  taking in something to drink. Basic  English food. Very  expensive

BA16 SYD-LHR 4 Sept Brand new , great VDU and excellent music  playing quality with own headphones. Supplied headphones did not  interfere Warm attentive stewards. Low salt  but very tasty. Always served first  but would have liked standard English breakfast - not low salt. Seat though standard economy , soft. BA9 LHR-Bangkok 18 Sept  Flight 777. Stewardesses  professional and human in their approach. VDU not that brilliant. Food also quite satisfying. Bags on both occasions arrived promptly. Well  done BA.

320 / LAS-LHR-NCL.  Airbus A320. Comfortable  seat for only  a 1hr flight.  They did a  good job serving a full flight  with such a  limited space of  people Overhead bins  are full and  was a bit  of finding space.  Many passengers had  a very small  bin overhead and  also under seats  and refused to  put them down  but did seem  to have more  space than allowed.  Set off on  arrival and arrived  late but this  time no stand  still for 15mins.  Same on A380.  paid to get  two economy seats  in the upper  cabin together and  was worth the  cost as no  seat next to  us no moving  no loo breaks ). Aircraft excellent  service great (games ), good moving  chairs etc also  flight crew superb  Food was nice  the meal very  good and the  chocolate lollies were  in great touch  but did think  that extra drinks service would have  been good. We  sat close to  the galley so  easy enough to  sit and ask  the drinks which  we did two/three . Seat was  ok but equal  compared to the  older A320. Extra  space beside seat  very useful. The  back rest doesn't  go all the  way up which  were a bit  of a pain. Take off delayed  with a fault  with the airbridge  but arrived on  schedule - takes  little while to  drop off due  a number of  seats LAS-LHR on a B747. Older  flight and compared  against the brand  name A380 it showed Again paid  for get two  seats together which  were worth it.  Flight ok but  Not as comfortable  as previous flights  Cabin was ok , was ok  but my PTV  went off centre  and had to  sit sideways. Overall  had an ok  flight Crew were  great and didn't  give away all  bags which normally  happened on late  flights with other  flights My only  complaint was the  leg rest didn't  line up and  when the seat  on front of  me reclined I  cant get out.  Started on a  plane Super quick , not 100%  perfect but crew  all worked quickly  and get everyone  drinks and snacks.  Was 15min early  and took a  bit for bags  to come off  of NCL.

Traveled to Rome  on British Airways.  By the way  that everything went . A day  of our departure  we were told  about the flight  is overbooked and asked politely to  change to a  later flight. We  were told that  they would pay  back the taxi (the flight was earlier and no  other transport was available.) as well as for the  room that we were missing at  a hotel. We  wanted to change  because we sympathized with BA representative  who had a  good job of asking people to  switch to a different flight and  that we wanted  only support British  Airways Big mistake. Apparently everything we  were told by their representative was  total lie and  no refund for  our taxi fare  is given to us. So much for doing BA 's favor they  are not a  nice company they once were.

BA26 22/6/2014. During my trip to the UK I feel very pleased that I chose BA. The A380  was superb. The  John Thales inflight  flight was more than excellent. There were 1250 hours of On Demand to choose from. Although the food  was quite limited I really liked the entertainment and the staff service. First class service in economy class!

Flying from IST  to LHR on  July 29. In  fact an abomination  for a business  class flight lasting  almost 4 hours.  It started with a dirty dingy cramped lounge with  very limited and  terrible food and  drinks selection and  not very far  before the boarding  area I have  seen the Star  Lounge lounge at  JFK Airport and  it is light ed ahead of  this BA lounge.  Our plane was  an ancient B767. The business class  seats had little  elbow room or  seats were packed  in hard and  quite uncomfortable. It  took 1 hour  for any drink  or food service  would start and  passengers were served  only champagne and  a small bag  with stale nuts. This was followed  with a hot  meal which was totally different from  that described in  any menu which  has been handed  down and this  became apparent only  after the food service began. There  were only two choices nothing vegetarian.  Flight crew were  very disinterested and  bored The entertainment  experience consisted of  the several old screens suspended from  the ceiling and showing the movie  Titanic which doubtless  had a big  success with the  6 year olds  among the audience.  At the end  of the flight  passengers were given  our cards to  speed up our  way through customs.  Unfortunately only 3  in the 6  customs booths were  full and we  end up effectively  on the slow-track .. To add  salt to injury  this business class  ticket cost $200  higher than that  from its competitor  American Airlines and  bore little resemblance  with the business  flight service and  amenities described on  this BA website.  Click on British  Express for this !

On the new  Boeing Business Class from PHI to  BA The aircraft  looked impressive. It  is quiet and comfortable. The lower altitude cabin and  the higher humidity  were not noticeable in flight but  their lack of  turbulence was noticeable.  Cabin was very good. The business  section was 2/3 empty. The cabin  amenities were very  good The negatives  were the seating  and entertainment system.  Despite the large  size the rear facing seats were  of poor design.  Their feeling of  flying was uncomfortable. I guess the  new seat they  were in makes  this all worth  going to the  airline The amount  and choices in  all the video , and the  seats left a lot to be  seen Return was  not a 777. The seating and entertainment were the  negatives This and  the A380 use  always be my  first airplane. However  this 787 has become favorite airplane . I think  it is the  only time I  will fly BA  business class until they change their  plans
From Heathrow -  we did not really see the BA hospitality. The  service was poor  and the seat very uncomfortable. This experience makes me very frustrated the only good thing  being the low price.

On to YVR.  October 29 2014.  Having been a loyal BA passenger for years but  after three recent  departures that's not  seem to be  a case any  longer How BA  had the audacity to screen 'BA ' Very British  film on their  flights is beyond  belief While the  film chronicles the  relatively high standards  for rigorous staff  education and training  the reality is  quite different. The  seating on BA85  prior to YVR  is atrocious -  a chicken sitting  with a dubious brown 'sauce'. The  food was unsmiling , and inattentive.  BA used to have a good  film selection. Not  anymore Very unimaginative selection of films TV and audio . I've recently  been on Qantas  or Air Canada 's long haul  - both carriers  vastly superior to BA. Air Canada has significantly improved  safety standards.

London - LHR.  what a miserable  flight this was. This return ticket  was £950 for  my total of  around 140 mins  flight time. I  check in online  as there was  severe delays on  board as there  was following a  delayed call back  to the UK  for equipment change  between an A319  from an A320.  But I checked  in online eventually and made my  way through security.  They asked an  attendant post -  flight to where  the Club /  First class lounge  went and I  was told it  will land side , between "this  terminal and the  next terminal". I  do not believe ! Surely a  more prompt online  before checking in  online could have  shown me this.  We left on  a a reasonable  late lunch and  a Gin and  Coke later we  sat stacked over the East End  in 25 minutes  and landed "ahead  on schedule". A  horrible experience from  a so called  " favorite airline".

Flew from LGW to PFO and back recently. Plane was old tatty , but at least we got  about 34" of legroom which the  budget planes no  doubt have. Flights were on time . ways food was reasonably good  the cabin staff were charming (specially on the outboard ). I was surprised to find BA no longer has a Club  Zone at Paphos and even more  so to find  that there was  no comfortable lounge  area that BA 's Europe passengers were unable to ! We were  given vouchers as compensation and thought  I would at least get a glass of wine and a sandwich - but no. The vouchers were  at such low value they could only be redeemed  on things like  the local beer crisps and chewing  tobacco Even though  the flights were quite good I feel that BA are treating their Club Europe passengers with contempt by denying them any  special access or  any compensation -  simply by refitting their aircraft to  allow passengers less seat width and  less same legroom as economy. Why  sacrifice a premium  price for a  less premium product?

Economy from LAX to CPT via  BA Airbus 380 on first leg 747 on second. Both flights completely full. Airbus quiet  cabin on upper deck with a window seat. Room underseat very limited due to two entertainment boxes but storage by window  was compensation. For  this new plane  it isn't very  big - rather  cramped and I prefer the old-style head rest on  the 747s. Great entertainment screen. 747  seat v comfortable and softer but  seat is showing its age and  stiffness after a 380 flight and the seat back  is smaller than many phones these . Staff on  board v helpful  & pleasant - more functional on  first CPT leg. Special meal not provided on last  legs of CPT  leg - otherwise  tasty and edible. Boarding easy at LAX more chaotic with less waiting  room space at Heathrow - they really didn't plan  any waiting areas  right at Heathrow - just too  chaotic and poor layout. And transferring through from section  B to section a and then back to section b at Heathrow is a real pain and the shuttle was very full too so  I avoid if possible. Otherwise flights  in time at both destinations despite  running late. Heathrow  was the main drawback when using BA and transferring - what a shame that they didn't make it  bigger when planning the new terminal.  BA was a joy to use in comparison -  super smooth and  staff extremely pleasant  - helpful despite having a poor  design

BA 084. YVR  - LHR on  Feb 28 2014.  Economy economy. Much  unlike previous experiences  while in this  flight on BA.  Staff were indifferent  or inattentive. The meals were deplorable!  This being a  full cabin there  is only one  meal choice left  mid way through : dinner service  - a very  heavy and overly  large pasta dish  followed by an  incredibly heavy piece  of dry chocolate . Hardly suitable food for a  long flight. Breakfast  is worse -  an equally heavy  english muffin and / or coffee.  So poor! A  number of seats  inside this cabin  had metal boxes  - rendering the  few additional leg room useless. IFE  was below what  BA used to  have in terms  on quality and  amount of programming.  All very unpleasant , and definitely  well worth the  additional cost.

LHR to Amman Jordan Airbus 321. Outward flight delayed  2 hours due  an unloading a  bag and technical  problems on the  ground Flight completely  being upgraded to  Clubs World. Cabin  staff there excellent  & attentive. Seat  size was OK  - not special.  Food was good.  A very small  space next to  a pilot door . Club World 's Terminal 1  on its last  stop but check in was quick.  The trip was  in Economy-what a  difference

LHR-FCO. Flew out Club Europe courtesy of a reduced  flight by BA. We thoroughly enjoyed  the experience. The Lounge in the  lounge was more  spacious than the  main T5 terminal. As it was an early flight  the food was  Belgian pastries and  the bacon baguettes which were excellent. Nice way to start a journey.  The flight was  comfortable Very attentive  staff on the B767. My colleagues  have recently flown easyjet and hadn't flown Club before and were very  happy about the experience. The return was economy on  a new A320.  Even with the new style seats  it again was a good experience.

Flew BA055 LHR to JNB on  my new A380. What an absolute pleasure that was. Had seat 50H which was at  least on top deck. The cabin was nicely laid out I have to say I like the BA "cocoons" I know a lot of people do not  but gave me plenty of privacy. The staff were extremely friendly and attentive with high  class food and excellent champagnes and wines. I would fly this plane again over any other. What was also amazing was a toilet that was not a rabbit hutch. Flew Back on BA056 3 weeks later.  Changed seat only to find that the seat function did not work New plane and breaking already! Not a major problem as stewards moved the seat manually for me. The quality of the food and beverages  were up to  a same high standard as when I flew out.  The choices were excellent and the quality of the new screens way above those on the older 747's and 777's. I  had to get good sleep on both legs at least 7 hours.

Flight to Amman Jordan Airbus 321. Outward flight delayed 2 hours due  an unloading a bag and technical  difficulties on the ground. Flight completely full upgraded to  club World. Cabin crew there excellent  and attentive. Seat  service was OK  if not special. Food was good.  One very small  bathroom next to  my pilot door . Club World . Terminal 1  had its last  day but check in was quick.  The trip was  in Economy-what a  ride

LHR-FCO. Flew out Club Europe courtesy  on a reduced fare by BA.  I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The  mood in the satellite was more relaxed than the  main T5 terminal. As it was  the early flight the food was  breakfast pastries and  double bacon baguettes  and were excellent. Nice way to start a journey.  Nice flight was  comfortable Very attentive staff on the  flight My colleagues had recently flown easyjet and hadn't flown Club before  and were very complimentary about the experience. The return was economy on a new A320. Impressed with the  club style seats and again was a good experience.

Flew BA055 LHR  to JNB on the new A380. What an absolute pleasure that was. Had seat 50H which was at  most on top deck. The cabin was nicely laid  out I have to say I like the BA "cocoons" I know a lot of people do not  and gave me plenty of privacy. The staff were extremely friendly and attentive with high quality food and excellent champagnes and wines. I would  choose this plane again over any other. What was also amazing was a toilet that was not a rabbit hutch. Flew Back on BA056 3 weeks later. Same seat only to find that the seat function did not work New plane and breaking already! Not  my major problem as stewards moved the seat manually for me. The quality of the food and beverages  were up to the same high standard as when I flew out. Movie choices were excellent and the quality of the new screens way above those on the older 747's  or 777's. I managed to get good sleep on both legs at least 7 hours.

Gatwick-Colombo via Maldives , return 22/09  New World. 777-200 3 class flight  was good as usual inflight meal OK. I really would be happier with a selection  on starters and  the main course.  All worked really  good as there  was a few  more passengers! Full London-Male-London just a  handful of us continuing to Colombo , surprised BA  are stopping the Colombo service from 28 March 2015.

London Aviv to Glasgow via Heathrow. Club World on ex BMI A321 so a different seat to the usual BA Club World product. Overall an excellent flight  with service all round. The crew in Club World were a real credit to BA  who could not do enough for you. Catering was excellent the seat was very comfortable in all positions and the airport experience at all ends was quick  and easy. Overall an excellent premium product made even  extra special by  our cabin crew.

JFK to LHR - Despite the image the BA  marketing show conveyed The Galleries Lounges  at JKF is the worst run of all the BA Lounges I have visited. I have had more polite service at Macdonalds than at the desk in the Galleries. There was nothing business class or tranquil about the space. The spa was a fully booked with no appointments for two hours and "the sorry we can't be  of service today" was more than  enough especially given the £6K ticket price and the message was delivered with such insincerity. How can BA get it so right offering 1st Class service in London Miami Boston Seattle Hong Kong and Sydney (to name a few) and offer budget airline service with a mediocre selection of sandwiches in JFK. Boarding was a mess. They were boarding a Qantas flight at the adjacent gate and all the passengers got mixed up. We asked a BA member of ground staff  how to queue and she said she did not know and it  was nothing to do with her!  Premium and Business class passengers were directed down a cul-de-sac marked fast track which came to a dead end in a sea of passengers and eventually all the premium passengers joined the line behind the economy passengers and boarded last. We ask "why" as the lady gave us  all our boarding cards and she said "nothing to do with me". Upstairs on the 747 in Club was excellent professional attentive staff good food and wine good entertainment BA at its best the only flaw was no menu  and because of  our mistake at JFK no surprise. Heathrow ground services were smooth and our bags arrived in no time at all. I will fly BA Clubworld again but not to JKF I will use Virgin who offer  the ground services at JFK which match the price of the ticket and they value their customer more.

Flight to London : Delayed take-off  in Rome largely because the plane  was held on  its runway for nearly 30 mins.  Aircraft clean and  very good condition. Staff attentive and professional. Seats adequate  despite short journey  but legroom is not generous. Food , drink welcome , the food  expensive and unnecessary  is relatively short , BA could  save money by  switching to beverages.

In Germany. You really wonder sometimes with BA. I paid £940 return and what a joke. (Last year  I flew Stuttgart and Berlin in Club for about££600 and was very happy). Firstly the flight ran from T1 at LHR. T5 Club lounge is rather good. On first sight the T1 lounge looked OK. I arrived at 15.03 and was told hot food was not available after 3pm. With a bit of grovelling I managed to get a plate of Singapore Chicken curry from the waitress. The whole  dining area consisted of a few miserable sandwich's peanuts and a miserable looking soup. Drinks ok. Flight was an A319 which left about 40 minutes late. Couldn't be bothered to eat the Prawn salad - which actually looked ok. FA's were fine.  That summary a real big BA con. Flight was one hour and  at £450+ per hour it costs more than a 7 hour flight . First to JFK. A miserable experience.

On to Alicante  Airport on 8th  the early flight.  It was disappointed  because due to  the changing the  flight the seat in the exit  row that I  requested and paid  for for was  still available and  someone had failed  too inform me.  A seat allocated  on the Boeing  was quite cramped  to my frame  and I was  not that comfortable.  I had tried  and get this changed before the  change on line  but all I  got was a  note to phone  me after the  change There must  have been other  people affected in  that change. That  day the flight  left on time , the proffered  the croissant and  snacks were fine.  Everyone attentive and  attentive The return  on 22nd was  the 16.35 departure  time again was  fine and my  seat choice was  as I had requested. The snack was fine and  the small bottle  Of Pinotage was  just enough. Due  some turbulence about  which we had  been kept informed  by frequent announcements  on the first  flight and captain  the ride was  little bit bumpy  every half an  hour or so.  To think that  BA needs to  kill some of  their old dinosaurs and invest in  new planes like Easyjet and Ryanair  seems to be  something to do.  But by booking  online I got  the great price  on luggage allowance  for a snack  that I can't  complain I also  got the ability  too carry on  a laptop as  well as a  small bag avoiding  all of the  usual horror stories  associated with the  old airlines. I  do like to  fly the flag"  and shall continue to do so  but a bit  more investment in new planes would  seem nice.

London on Sep 18 both legs on an Airbus 320 in Club Europe (Business Class) both legs on time or almost on time with an excellent crew (as most times with BA). Transfer procedures in LHR Terminal 3 were  quick and friendly even the extra security checks required for all transfers at LHR (even Intra-EU) were hassle free and easy.  The scheduled layover was a rather long 3 hours. BAs Galleries Lounge in LHR T3 was also comfortable with excellent drink selection and quite good food selection. I fly the VIE-LIS route regularly  so surprisingly transferring at LHR is superior to most alternatives on the  same route (especially to the more common alternatives FRA , and even AMS and BRU) with the possible exception of ZRH so taking BA  to LHR is a really good  option if the direct TP flight  is not an option for whatever reason. The only negative I have to say that both flights featured the new BA slim seats which are really a huge step back in comfort compared to the old seating. Seats in Club Europe are economy seats with limited seat pitch and the middle seat left empty. Its just like flying with Star Alliance with their  new Recaro slim seats. Catering on the VIE-LHR was afternoon tea which  rivals BAs weakest  of Europe service with bland sandwiches  but acceptable scones. Even their Chicken Tikka sandwiches in economy are better but they have  great bar service  including brilliant attentive FA’s so I believe BA is still one of best options to fly within Europe. Catering on the second leg was a good prawn salad (or a  pasta dish). However my luggage did  not make it to LIS that day which was an unwelcome and unexpected surprise after the long layover in Heathrow. But the issue was handled well fast and friendly by Groundforce the company who does the luggage handling for BA in LIS . I received my luggage without any further hassles the next morning. Not a perfect  service due BA’s  problems seating the delayed luggage and the VIE-LHR catering but still pretty good service. As a side note VIE airport is getting worse and  worse Long lines  at security with only two of the available four lines open. BA uses a shared lounge in VIE  but was overcrowded with basically not a seat available  or sit down and limited food service. But at least BA uses the old terminal which is still far superior to the new skylink terminal used by  Stars Alliance which really is a  question piece how not to design <mask> new terminal.

2 recent flights LHR to SFO (12 hrs) - 7th Sept then San Diego to LHR (9 hrs) 21st Sept BA 272. Club World cabin. Wife and I have flown business class on - Singapore Air New Zealand Emirates Air Malaysia and Virgin on 20 occasions to New Zealand by various  airlines so we  were familiar with the service provided at this level by other airlines. BA in our opinion doesn't come close. Briefly: - being charged £284 extra to reserve seats how do  they get away with it? Personally we felt uncomfortable with the back-to-front seat layout too enclosed and awkward to get out of (we were in the inner cell) and I would imagine irritating for the outside  cabin as well to have people clambering over their legs. Details - "hot towels" threadbare  sheets of cloth that were stone cold in under ten seconds and then only one and nothing for morning wake-up cheap , menus lukewarm tea and coffee thrust over the barrier in mugs , sudden rattle as the screen was lowered and a basket of bread rolls thrust under your nose having to reach out sideways to receive meals embarrassment  Not disturbing the outside passenger trays passed over them minute napkins (expect paper sheets anytime  the cabin crew just doing their job walking up  or down the aisles at great speeds so as  they avoid being  asked for something cold soggy croissants which are an insult to croissants , don't get me started about the bacon roll! We were offered a drink before dinner and had to ask for a top-up one glass of wine with dinner (dry tough steak) and a refill after we had finished eating no after  that drinks were offered. Lights out-see you in the morning! I could go on but suffice to say we are so disappointed that our  own airline could be so far behind the others.

Flight LHR-NCL 18/09/2014. As is the  case flight departed late. Cabin crew  was passive aggressive. Going through security at T5 prior to boarding was a more customer  oriented experience. Landed with the customary jolt at NCL.  Is there an alternative? Of course not! Not an experience to make  you want to  consider BA my long haul carrier of choice. And an experience which is repeated frequently.

We flew on the A380 from  London to Jo'burg return economy class.  We thought the  service was excellent.  The crew were  extremely helpful and the meals were good. We flew in the bottom level one way  and the upper level on the return - I liked the upper level better. There  are convenient storage units by the window seats. Keep  to mind the  cargo compartments are  still upstairs though. Would definitely fly  with them again.

So our outbound flight to Orlando was delayed a good 2 hours , not sure  why I expected  the service from  before coming home. Over a day before our return flight was due  their was already a delay posted  for our flight  of a whole  4 hours. The  following morning we wake to find  that flight now  cancelled at the  beginning of the next day at  around 12 in  that evening! We  scheduled our flight to leave Saturday so we would  return home on Sunday and be  prepared to go  in to work  on the Monday. But thanks to  the reliability of British Airways not only had we  paid for two  days now immensely  ridiculously overpriced flights  but will be  making money from not being able  to attend our  own Absolutely disgusting show from BA  we honestly wouldn't even chance a  return flight with  BA for fear  of having to cancel numerous plans due to the  incompetence of a shoddily run business! I won't be recommending BA in  general I will  just encourage everyone I meet to  shun their awful  service at all costs!

Stay in Economy. Very relaxed and  easy check in  at T5. A  VERY attentive and  helpful cabin crew  served wine dinner  and the same  English breakfast as  10 years ago.  Always clean and  spacious interior on 777. Punctual and  that goes without  saying that the flight crew are  great and you  feel safe. Will definitely seek to  fly again.

Sent to PHL on 787 online  checking in worked well T5 first  Class lounge very nice good choice of drinks available food could be better but nothing to complain about. Priority boarding worked well too. Service always very good  ( every month to the US). Did not eat anything because I wanted only to sleep. Had seat  3 (middle seat  on the end of the first club world cabin) which gives you a lot of private space. Entertainment system good but  a better selection necessary. Overall I  only recommend BA however on most of the Asian airlines you have  better seats.

BHD-LHR. I flew  direct from Belfast George Best Airport  to London the flight was very good and on  time and uneventful.  My crew was excellent and the aircraft was a  Airbus A319. The  weather was ok.

Flight in Club Europe (on Avios). Easy check-in and security. BA lounge reasonable - good selection of drinks  - slightly stale looking but tasty ! Bus out to plane. Nice welcome in Club  European cabin on brand new A320.  Overall comfortable albeit less legroom than . Food excellent served by very attentive cabin crew. Good updates from pilot. Very good flight overall.

In between LHR  at JFK and  my return leg  via IAD to  JFK and onward  at KUL on  Sunday I must say BA has  delivered excellent product ! The crew  seem extremely friendly  and are attentive.  Customers are kept  busy the entire flight with juice  or water being served consistently. The only setback is  that their B747  has seen better  weather and is  a dire need  for a refurbishment.  Service was good but the IFE  should be improved , with enhanced audio and video selection. I will  definitely fly with  BA again. To  all crew keep up the good work.

From Heathrow -  on return. Have always been loyal to BA but no longer. T5 Lounge overcrowded poor range of food rubbish and uncleared crockery and glasses everywhere - not  very pleasant. Bags not tagged priority.  Flight Track not . Service on  arrival to Madrid was exceptionally good and old style BA. Return bags  Not tagged priority no priority boarding old aircraft rude staff cramped seating poor and cost cutting catering with  no attempt at service beyond handing ! Very disappointing , and unacceptable.  did not select seats on-line for return flight as computer had allocated . Eventually seats  selected when called  off centre - told couldn't be done for half an hour and strangely as the conversation moved forward they could do it. Waste of time and energy.  Unfortunately everything suggested as part of the Club Europe package didn't happen. Club Europe used to be so distinctive and worth and I always felt it was worth the premium price. To be honest I have cheaper alternatives from closer airports which I will now be using for my regular flights to and from  Spain

Flew LHR-BUD 11  September BA866 and return 15 Sep  Flight 869 Club : Early morning  arrival from T3 , breakfast in lounge. Usual assortment  on cereals and  fruit etc but  small selection of  fast food (although  my bacon roll  was delicious). As  was usually the  captain had to  ask for champagne  and staff happy  to oblige and  they brought it to our table.  Plenty of staff  happy and the  entire lounge appeared  to be kept  nice and clean.  had to board  for a bus  but there was no preference given  to business passengers.  Easy to get  on the bus  early and got to seat without  a problem. Plane had been refitted  with the new . Beautiful cabin and the seats  are lovely but  where is the  extra leg room . Club. Big  room It feels  slightly claustrophobic and  sometimes the person  in front puts  the seat back. Not as nice  as place to  eat compared to  our old club , aesthetics notwithstanding.  Breakfast crew plenty  of champagne and  a surprisingly good  buffet breakfast of  roast mushrooms bacon , sausage with  banana bread. Coffee still poor however.  The IFE apart  from progress maps  and information on  big screen from  at BUD airport  was disaster. No  sign at all  to clear immigration  but had to  wait almost an  hr for bags  and priority tags didn't seem to  be any difference.  No aircon in  baggage collection and  queues with people  asking for bags.  Very uncomfortable and  cramped On return  to lounge BA 866 at BUD  was small with very limited selection  on food and  drinks but all  seemed acceptable. A  brief delay was  seen at check  point and gate  check but all  over all no  real problem. Priority  tag worked well. Same plane configuration  for return. Excellent  atmosphere up front  and return too  and plenty of  food and chat.  Tax free with the booze and . Food was again a surprise  and I had  chicken with a tandoori sauce and  rice with cauliflower.  Really tasty. BA can be hit  or miss but I thoroughly enjoyed  my flights. A  very soft product if they can  meet the standard but the new  build out is  another disappointment.

Used BA for a return trip to Denver and  am very disappointed. Plane was old  with tired cabin  never did the  repairs required and  cabin was basic.  Also flown Emirates the previous month and BA cannot hold a candle  against them from the warm towels wide seats great entertainment and shiny  new planes. Wont t looking to  fly BA again.

Miami Florida (MCO)  at London Gatwick  Airport Wed Aug  5 return Sun  Sept 7. We  paid over 150  pounds more for our seats and didn't even get a choice of  what we wanted  in our meal.  in addition the inflight entertainment didn't  exist on our  return trip.

I have flown LHR-BKK many times with EVA Emirates Oman and Qatar. Unfortunately this time I chose my National carrier. Disappointed is not the word. To start with the seating  layout is absurd. All the others manage 1-2-1 or 2-2-2. BA manages 6 abreast in  a horrible tight arrangement whereby you face your neighbour. When the hot towels were given out they were like warm rags in comparison to the other airlines. Food - ok  this was a selection on the  flight However at service time I was merely passed a tray over my neighbour. On every Qatar flight you are not only addressed by your name but the table is made for you as if being in a 5* restaurant. None of  this with BA. Once the appetiser and first course are consumed you hand the bowls back to the attendent who then passes your main course to you in a bowl. Shabby is not the word. After a reasonable sleep in a very narrow bed it was time for landing. With no sign of a priority immigration pass being given I asked the steward for one. He replied they did not have any for this flight but assured me there would be ground staff at the gate to supply this basic amenity. Stupidly I believed him. Upon departure at BKK no ground staff or passes. I  return to the UK next week and for the first time ever I am dreading the experience. Never ever will I fly my national carrier again. Disgraceful. It's any Middle  Eastern airline again for me. Qatar  was my preferred choice.

LBA-LHR. Checked in  time and boarding  is on my  seat so no  passengers to encounter . Fast track  was average track and the lounge  very busy with  people going to the sunnier climes  so paid for access. Food selection : Hot food  thanks to a self-toasted teacake. Gate near the lounge and quick boarding.  Tickets were in  D and E  but the friendly  lady said 01F  were free so we had the  next row to  board Early departure , swift climb.  Handling was excellent. The Purser addressed us by name  giving us (several)  directions and a choice of snacks , nuts or  fruit (twice) on  the short flight.

If there is  any alernative I will never fly  there again. I  use to travel  now and it  is wonderful now it is like  the "old" airline.  We flew from  Sydney to London  last summer on  Boeing 747 the  leg room was nt the best  the plane looked tired and I was not impressed. I am disabled  so it is difficult for me  for travel anyway.  As we went  down to Heathrow  I asked for  assistance to get to my gate  as I was  sat in a  line with other  poor people waiting  for our flights.  No one told us that they  do not send you down until your flight is  cancelled due to  illness In that  case we could 've gone and  eaten a meal.  My flight back  to Seattle was  also a B777. The aisles were  cramped and the  seats very narrow.  My am only  disabled but my  knees touched the  seats in front  of me. It  was very difficult  on the people  in the window  and middle seats  could get over me I had  not get up  high into the  air for them  or get out.  Being disabled to  get up and  it is hard  enough in such  a small space  you manoeuvre ones ! When people  in front reclined  it was awful.  the food that  they served was absolutely rubbish. What  happened to the good BA service of a few  years ago. No  more BA for  now if I can help it.

Flying British Airways  flight LHR to  the CDG was excellent. I was travelling with an  adult The staff at LHR were  very helpful and  friendly and went out of their way to help me. However it was a very  sad story on  our way back. Everyone in Paris CDG was so  friendly BA made me check-in my  bags which meant I had to  carry a 14month  old boy (15kg) to the gate.  It made my  flight impossible. I pleaded with the  lady at check-in. There was no  problem boarding with  me I will be taking the Eurostar never flying , especially not to Paris.

Fly from Jo'burg  - LAX via Heathrow. Both flights  on A380 and  both full. Comfortable  and on time , great service  on the planes.  Only problem is  with Heathrow. At  present excellent arrangements  when boarding the flight - at  an insufficient space  is just chaotic.  Surely Jo'burg can  do it right , BA can get it right at its premium  hub - Heathrow?  Unfortunately when arriving  at Heathrow the  gate to section  1 - where  we landed -  were closed so  we were unable  to transfer direct  from the gates.  So we had  only take the transit to section , go through  the long lines  for security there , then go  directly to section ! No one  told BA or  staff at the  airport gates to  disembark and when  approached by BA  customer service staff  they were uninterested , as usual  supporting BAA rather  not taking responsibility.  Same as the  situation in the  capital and at  both airports is  generally very good.

LHR-HKG on the  Norwegian A380 in  premium economy and  it was a  great trip staff  were friendly and the food was  really good for a gluten free  flight The only  thing that I  think they could improve on which  it has is  the dedicated check in and boarding  of there flights other than that it was an  enjoyable trip.

I recently travelled with a friend  through St Lucia  and have to  admit that BA  have once again surpassed my expectations.  The travelling companion and I had  booked World Traveller  Pass and we  was delighted to  have upgraded to Club Class. The cabin crew were  friendly and attentive without being intrusive. We were also upgraded on our  flights and once again the high standards set on the initial journey were matched.

- Seats booked  in Club World  flight window - so reasonable priced. Check in at  BA very easy  and through the  security track in about 5 mins.  All on time  - short wait before take off.  Dinner on the  DC leg superb  service without being  served food as  not palatable and  another great trip.  Air Seattle -  DC Lounge at  BA is simply  to small with  limited seating however  when on plane staff were again  great although they  seemed little rushed  as compared with the outbound leg  which may simply  be because the  WC cabin was  very full. That  and the high  standards were maintained  and a credit  to the team in the CW cabin. Overall another  great experience when  flying with BA.

LHR-EDI Used Avios to make short break to Edinburgh. Unlike transatlantic flights  the were plenty of seats on  standby even at short notice and we managed to get onto the flights we wanted.  Both flights were on time (more or less) and both were on new A320 aircraft - bright and airy interiors with plenty of storage space for luggage.  One drink and small bag of nuts while welcome is nothing to get excited about and seems more of a gimmick  now days to distance BA from  the budget airline ! Service levels  both on the plane and on the ground were  excellent throughout and I really enjoyed this domestic service.

Flew VIE to LHR Club Europe fantastic crew looking after the Club  EU cabin the only let down is the new revamped Club Europe Cabin. I really do not believe  what BA is saying that this  is what their European Passengers want! The seat pitch has now been reduced from 34 inches to 30 inches which used to be the  British Airlines seat pitch years ago. If the passenger in front reclines their seat it is impossible to work on your laptop as there is no room. I really am not able to justify paying the Club Europe Fare for an economy class seat which is the most uncomfortable seat I have ever say in. A number of passengers were not impressed with the new cabin and all felt badly let down by BA. British  Airlines used to  run a class above the rest now they are just an average low cost carrier but still charge the high fares BA really need to think seriously about the Club Europe layout they have added more seats so it is all about money & not about what their passengers really want.

Third and last  year flying with  Virgin upgraded the  6 of us  into Premium Economy  at £199 each  for 4 of  us a complete  load of money.  Have done this  on Virgin on occasions for long haul flights and its so worth the money and not as expensive.  But terrible crew  and staff not  enough no drinks  and only when  taking out food.  None of us  didnt eat the  meal it was  so bad. On  our 9 hour  journey we were  warned Don't waste  any money upgrading I wish I had read reviews before I left.

Fly SYD-SIN and had a reasonably comfortable trip. Problem  being I didn't see much of  any staff in  the economy and they were not very smiley either  pleasant looking. Service definitely down none of the goodies you used to get like snacks , plenty of water. Everyone rather  dull I thought and not helpful. Not my favourite to fly. The  food and seat belt are for  animals not real people.

Flying on 9  flights on Boeing  777 aircraft. No queue at check-in , welcoming polite and efficient agent. Priority tag applied to suitcase. Lounge experience at Barajas Terminal 4 was generally positive. Plenty of places to  drink and relax;  good selection of food and drinks with sandwiches some hot food ice cream fruit and a full bar.  The boarding line worked well for business/status passengers. My  biggest gripes are: old aircraft fairly surly crew and a consistent inability  of monitor hand  baggage (I saw  some cases that were larger than the bag I checked in being forced into the overhead lockers). I was in seat  5 which as an exit row seat had plenty of leg room. Full bar service and a chicken tikka flatbread (and vegetarian equivalent) offered.  Parking at Terminal 5B. Bags arrived with minimal (less than 5 minute wait). Overall a decent experience - I will continue to fly with  BA provided seats are available at a good price.

Delta LHR-EWR in  Frankfurt Clean aircraft , moderate dysfunction  in armrest foot stool and video screen. We find  BA seating configuration  extremely uncomfortable and will avoid BA when possible. One  passenger spent this flight chatting w.  due to the blockage of aisle  the detriment of  us Dinner was  very horrid (beef)  except for salad and cheese. Late  takeoff and 40  min late arrival , no explanations given.

Flew London City to Malaga return  31 August and 8th September respectively. Both flights on  board on the wonderful little Embraer  is such a  small plane to  fit in only  4 seats either side of aisle loads of leg room and large  meals Full meal  served in both  planes with cooked  food on the  first flight out and good choice of rice or noodle salads on return lunchtime flight  which is a huge improvement on  those awful sandwiches  they used to  get Return flight made even better by superb approach  from London down  to Thames on  a beautiful sunny  day - would  pay good money  in that part !! Full marks  for everything except had to score  points for 'Inflight ' as there isn't any on this short flight and wouldn't really  use it.

Travelled YYZ-LHR-ARN and return in mid August. Check in at Pearson was a bit delayed  ( one counter open 2-3 hrs before departure although it is advised that passengers arrive that early). Premium economy cabin inside the Boeing 787 (Dreamliner) is very pleasant and the flight from Toronto to London was very comfortable. Transfer at LHR T5 takes time is something I learned on this trip. 1hr connection is for sure pushing it and you're likely to miss your onward connection with anything less than 1.5 hrs transfer time. We missed our connection  at ARN (our connection was only 1hr) because of the long line ups at the transfer centre. The fact that you go through security again in LHR  takes some time as well. On my way back to Toronto check in at Stockholm's Arlanda Airport was  fast and very smooth. The flight to LHR went fine and I had to spend almost an hour lining up at transfer centre going through security. This is the part of the transfer that for sure takes time. After a train ride to the C gates and a fairly smooth boarding I was onboard the flight to Toronto. I had been upgraded to Business class which was pleasant. Service onboard was professional and courteous. Landing in Toronto was a bit delayed due delayed take off from Heathrow. My overall w BA was good. However transfer in LHR is probably one of the more lengthier ones in Europe I think. I preferred the short transfer at KEF on my last trip to Sweden a few months ago.

The BA 215 LHR-BOS in economy on an ageing  737 Flight was  20 minutes late taking off. Seat  was uncomfortable and cramped.Meal served was  mostly slop. IFE had glitches but worked eventually. Overhead  seat didn't work. The larger people become and they  travel the less space BA seems to give anyone. The plus point  is the politeness  / professionalism of the cabin staff.

8 - IST.  Super efficient as  well no queues  for check in  and security. Proceeded  to the lounge , we relaxed and watched planes take off with glass of champagne.  Service on time , crew friendly , was excellent , of course more champagne! The  only thing that BA need to  address (which I  believe they are).  is to retire  the old aircraft.  Their overall product  is excellent but  I think the  BA crew are let down by  these ageing planes.  ( not personal  thank you etc).

Just came back  yesterday morning on a flight from Dubai - BA106.  I was not  happy The cabin crew were just not friendly or  welcoming The plane  was very old and so were the crew tired  or old. It 's like they 've just got the bad bunch a hostesses to manage this flight. BA was so particular before what's happened? The cabin was very hot  and several times  my wife asked about it and  I was just . The food  was very quickly  sold out many  more times people  were missed. I  had to ask  about water a  couple of times. There was no  air warmth. It  is really like  sitting on a  first class air lines. I'd love to fly BA  or support them but this is  disappointing I would not recommended this . Next time  you are flying eremites. Pay the extra. BTW I  think a number  that other people have complained about  BA crew on  this site too  it seems consistently  rude

Flew Heathrow to Lyon return. Late  arrivals on the  flight out but made up all  but 10 mins  off the time. Catering hardly worth  any effort as comprised unappetising looking sandwich and one  beer (not even  tea or coffee on the outbound).  Very good and check in very good especially at  midday

Overall Excellent outbound ! Tasty food  and wine very  nice cabin crew  and the entertainment  system isn't up  too much in  favor of choice.  Same story on  our way back . Stand-offish cabin crew and no  more champagne. Rose  translates as "we 've been fully ". Not a  good thing but  indicative of how  badly shod BA  must sometimes be  those days.
