The  bed is comfortable . I slept  half the way back rather than try their food  & drink.

London to Budapest  in Club World-now  please don't even mention the fact that my luggage hasn't arrived but the price for club world is a huge rip off! You can sit in the  old "slimline" type  a seat-which is thinner than the previous ones and some genius obviously thought that if they put in thinner seats why not squeeze in another 2 extra rows which means that the leg space is less  that half as it was in  the old days - so exactly like in economy . So you  pay 300 dollars more for 3 stale finger sandwich and a scone - what a bargain! Shame on you BA for  the lousy service.  I never fly  to them again.

I flew Premium Economy on BA  to Boston to  Dubai then London  and Johannesburg. The  beds were comfortable and the leg room was ample enough even for an over 6  foot passenger. The  flight attendants were  extremely attentive. Having  flown Air France  Premium economy in  January 2013 I must say that the BA Premium Economy is much  nicer than that  in the French  airline It was  certainly worth the  extra money.

That was the first long-haul flight I'd taken for 20 years and  had had high  expectations that our London-Cape Town flight would be far  more comfortable and pleasant than the  various carriers we've used for European  trips Boy was I wrong -  seats were squeezed in so tightly  is was almost impossible to get  out without injuring the poor person  in the aisle  seat and when  the person in front reclined her seat my daughter could hardly move - we had to ask a flight attendant to  make the person put their seat upright so that we could eat  separate meals. Even worse - I actually paid extra  and choose our  flight in advance thinking that a window and centre seat wouldn't be  too bad. Come on British Airways ! I know that at the moment they are  our only airline offering a direct LHR-Cape Town service  but they can do better than that.

Economy class on 28 Aug from London (LHR) to New York (JFK).  Seat was in  row 5 which I love as I can sit Gatwick - Orlando  and Gatwick. Club  seats both ways.  - Worth the money every penny  worth it. Crew  for the outbound sector were fairly young and were  a little rude  acting like everything was a chore.  When you asked for something they  all got on the cart you  would have it.  Friendly enough but  were really interested  about the passengers.  The inbound not  so disrespectful but they were older and much nicer.  There was too  little bother. If  we hadn't got  in there and  asked they got  it right away  from you. Lie-flat beds comfortable enough . baggage allowance . 3 bags per passenger is  good for the shopping. Food and  drinks are good however I do think the food on Thomson Airways  at premium is  cheaper than BA 's world. In  term of scheduled  seats British Airways are ten times  bigger than Virgin  and so many  flights and would fly with BA , no questions ...

I'm regularly flying  Hong Kong-London-Port of  London these days.  London to London is via Cathay  - business class  which is excellent.  If I then  had to swap to BA for London to Trinidad  to 'Club World'  – a euphemism  of 'slum in  blue sky'. Cathay  Pacific business class seats - 4 across the width  of the aircraft. BA Club Slum - 8 across. If you're on a night flight  it means tripping  up people or  getting tripped over. Decor is abysmal  food is average to poor. Seat  and personal space  selection is lousy  - but there's  too much space  too work with.  Food choice is  limited and the  small screen is tiny and reminiscent  to old analogue 625 lines TVs  in the 80s. The overall impression  is a dreary  living space with minimal storage crummy  above average food and indifferent service. Don't do it! Fly with someone else - anyone else!

Travelled LHR to Montreal 21st August  2013 and Montreal to LHR 1st September 2014. Aircraft  service was a  7 with 4 classes. This sector  does not normally offer a First  Class so business class passengers were  dispersed throughout the First and Club  Class cabins. All  flights were on time and the  flight crew were  friendly especially on the outward leg. Check in and baggage reclaim were smooth and efficient.  Passenger lounges at  cabin 5 are  very tired and were rather dirty when we used them. Food choice was limited although I did enjoy the hot soup.  Technology in BA is dated and even BA's new  Economy Class seat is rather disappointing  as compared to  some business class  premium carries such  a Emirates or . Food is  way below par both in terms of quality and  price I know BA is struggling  to make ends  met but ultimately it has to  understand that people paying for premium  services expect a certain experience and the seat and food make up  a major element of that experience. I guess there is little competition  from BA on the north Atlantic routes but it helps to explain why their share  in routes to the Far East  and Australia are diminishing.

Booked a British Airways holiday so that's flight and hotel from London City Airport to Florence Peretola Airport. Either it came  directly from the BA Rep. or my husband asked about an upgrade to Business Class and was told  it would be an extra £300 for the return trip. As it was for a significant birthday he thought why not. Reasons why no-one should bother with this upgrade for  this particular flight. 1) No separate BA lounge at either London City  or Peretola Airports. 2) Faster boarding? Entirely pointless when  you all have to get onto a bus to take you to the aeroplane at Florence. 3) Bigger  cabin and more  leg room? They are small planes so the same throughout. 4) Luggage  arrives first? No point when it takes over an hour to get through customs at Florence. 5) Better meal? Yes choice of meat or fish. Very nice but worth £75 each? The BA Rep should have told us about the lack of facilities and suggest  a hotel upgrade instead. It was a perfectly pleasant flight the holiday was great but we paid an extra £300 for no reason whatsoever.

What will they . I flew BA to Dubai  last Friday in business. Let me sum it up. Boring food surly crew dirty plane  very expensive. Can the product get any more unimaginative.  My inflight entertainment  was out of touch with modern media the screen so poor I couldn't see the movie and gave up. The sandwiches that you get when you land are so awful that I think any frequent flyer  is awfully fed  up with them the crew make you feel that  they are in  their way and the plane is (again) horribly dirty.  Food was spilt  on all the wipeable areas around  my seat. In business you expect  that It is just not an enjoyable or fun experience by any means and they never upgrade you or take care of their frequent flyers. When I can I chose  a different airline.

I flew BA  flights to Grenada , first time  flying BA and  Virgin due to  me having been dedicated Virgin customers.  Finally upgraded to "Premium Economy" and  upgraded from the  only leg room  available for hubby , no odds  against me at  all No benefit , total waste  of money at almost double cost  of upgrading with Virgin! Service was not great and  drink was awful , "welcome on " drink in  the Economy was  orange juice in  a plastic carton.  BA offers orange juice or champagne  in a glass. No idea what  food was on offer as no menu provided and  only a disgruntled "chicken or beef"  response when asked ? Old and  cramped plane very  old TVs. First  & last time  holiday with BA  but will change  point of holiday in future to  take Virgin flight.  Sadly this over-priced  airline didn't even  compare with Virgin's  premium service. I  very strongly recommend  you waste your  savings or better still go with Virgin.

I flew indirect  between Orlando and  London - although the Miami/Orlando Orlando/Dallas  and Dallas/London flights were with American Airlines (BA partners).  A BA flight  home was an  okay plane -  cabin staff were great and food  good but the  light entertainment was poor. Your own  entertainment but no  entertainment over the  flights which all ran at different times. Having only flown Virgin and  Delta long haul BA rated way  worse in all ! But that was nothing compared to the 737-300 we flew on with American Airlines  - Dallas to London (BA 1531).  You understand they  were upgrading their fleet and I can see why  having flown on  the old plane we were unfortunate  enough to fly on. The first  10 mins the  aircraft stank like  the toilet to  that extent that the level of complaints and people standing in protest  during take off. The inflight entertainment was a joke - a poor quality shared screen  with 30 others two films and  no choice. The crew were the unfriendliest I have ever encountered -  zero meet and greet or goodbyes.  You thought booking through BA would ensure some level of quality and that they would  offer a certain level of quality  with their partners but unfortunately not.  The worst flight  ever (we are  a family of five) and I  will not be flying BA again.

LHR-PHL on a  new Dreamliner seat 3K. I recommend  the 3K 3A 7A and 7K as you get aisle access and no other passengers have to climb  on your feet when they leave their seat. The seat does feel a little claustrophobic compared to the  lower deck of the 747 but it's very comfortable. The service was  always provided by an all male crew. The food quality has improved and so has the menu choices. The entertainment system is excellent as it's the Thales version on the 787 so the  seats are bigger and the picture quality is better. The aircraft is also very quiet and the windows are a gimmick as you dim the windows rather than using the  power blind.

Travelled with BA  via Rome to  Italy Staff at Rome were wonderful what a contrast to Heathrow. Entirely through my own  bag I left my passport on  a plane. When I asked for assistance three members of staff at the "Helpdesk" did anything but help. In itself this  may not seem  unusual having got  myself into this  mess but when they did finally deign to speak to me they told me the plane had left. I pointed out that the plane  stood still outside  our terminal building. Their response was  simply ignore me. I finally found one very polite , well informed , kind person  that did help. He was a  passport collector!

Great return. Very  good check-in at  JFK let down  and slow fast track (but that's  the airports fault).  In gate lounge quiet nice refreshments-I  still think the  best games consoles  have worked in  the entire time T5 has been open. Short walk  through boarding full  flight left slightly early landed well  out of schedule.  All excellent worked  out throughout. Decent  food as well , Entertainment out  of new system  and older system  is not as  good and screen  not in best  condition Return flight  all comments pretty  positive except my  home video system  didnt work on  the back so  I just let  them sit in  case Keep it up BA.

BKK-LHR-EDI-LHR-BKK Outbound flight up to standard but not above  & beyond but this is standard  on BA which cannot compare with the top tier airlines. Return flights similar. Faults lay in ground services at EDI and T5 in LHR the latter overcrowded and rather scruffy. Return flight had no magazines ("they  forget to load")  and individual bottled  bottles ("they forgot  TO load"). Have a need to return to UK  but will try an alternative (which is a night flight). Why did BA stop night flights last autumn?

LGW-MCO-LGW 11-25th August Economy Class. Got to the gate lounge to be told our seats  has been reallocated to another seat this was the reason why - it was because there was a big family party that didn't want to separate - considering I paid a lot of money for my family to sit all together. Got  back to the  airport thinking it would be the same as Virgin Atlantic but no it wasn't it was an old plane tatty one as well. Food and drinks were limited on the whole 9 hour  journey no snacks on board. The food was limited and when we got ours the people in front decide to recline there chairs in front so within that we have told hold our dinners luckily we  didnt get burnt. Well sorry BA next time I am flying with .

I return 19th/26th . Economy 2  adults 2 children.  Good experience from Check In to  landing in Faro . As a  frequent traveller on  the route have  not got used  using the ex  standard airbuses on  this route the seating is perfectly  comfortable despite the  low seat pitch  and have never  encountered any problems  from requesting more  that one drink  on the flight.  The crew were  excellent in both  flights and were  extremely service orientated  right start to  start Only one  major issue and  that is the  only one toilet  in the rear  of the whole  aircraft cabin!

I have flown twice with BA  Airlines in business class (to and  from Delhi) and  we have to  confess it has  gone absolutely poor!  Me and a  dozen colleagues flew  down to New  Zealand for a  business trip. BA  is the pioneers of aircraft's after  everything they did  on The Concorde.  The word in  aviation is "were"  and basically turned  to a no  good airline. Allow  myself to explain:  a blue worn  and padded fabric  covered with stains  worn out grey plastic panels with  tiny grains of  sand and dirt  cut into and  out TFT which had the same  film quality as  Scotch tape! The  plane looks like  something was directly  taken out of  the 1980 film . You still  have the odd  bump on the  aisle when economy  customers are boarding  your plane with  no luggage as  there is no  leg space! Staff  are fine but  for business class  every customer should  expect a wow factor - and there was none.  A plastic translucent  screen that divides the seats had  become battered from  being shifted up  & down when  cabin crew serve  them food and  beverages The toilets  are exactly the  opposite as economy  but in Business  class they stick  a plastic flower  into a glass.  Their food was  good but again  no special. Normally  its the little  touches that make  big differences but  with BA they 're a total  make over. For  a flight that  runs everyday from  London to Delhi BA should be  doing more. The decor of the  cabin matched the  seats I got . BA dull. I won't be  travelling long haul  on them again.  Only advice -  use BA and  if you book  other flights have  your look online  for what other  carriers can offer .

Fly from London  to Doha on  BA newly refurbished  BA Smooth ride  into airport and  friendly staff on  hand to help. Boarding was on time but there was a slight  storm which put  it back by  about an hour and delayed take off. Captain was  excellent at keeping us informed. Cabin Crew friendly enough but seemed tired  with their service and no smile. Food was average , not anything  to write home  but I felt  I had to eat quickly as  the flight attendant  was waiting for  me to finish my last bite with a stern look! Inflight entertainment was excellent and  keep me entertained throughout the six  and you have got an array  on movies TV  Shows and Music to choose from.  We were really comfy and I  had a good kip. Overall an enjoyable experience and I would definitely  use BA again.

Welcome to LHR:  Boeing 777 (Economy).  We just returned from a family holiday in the USA and flew  to Economy. The flight was slightly delayed but most  said this delay  is made up during the journey.  People were pleasant and the IFE was fine. However the food was  terrible Main meal  with a choice of Chicken Curry and Rice or a Veggie Pasta. Breakfast before landing  is a cold  meal consisting of  1 Croissant bag of Cranberries and  some Granola Bar. What has happened  between the 2 meat choices? (Veggies choose veggie option  on advance) and a cooked breakfast? BA have a  UK flag on the tail but do not serve any British food. I'm a Silver  Label Club member and food on BA has been  horrendous over the last couple of years. I've made several complaints.

From LHR to Muscat return in Club World on a 777-200 (G-ZZZA). Loyal BA customers  who have flown Club World many  see BA long haul fleet starting to show it's age cabins looking  that bit old and some of the equipment not  working as it  should On our  flight my TV  could not stay  in position and  was falling back into it's default position (and therefore  not viewable). Had to stuff some coffer cup protectors  under the pivot  plate to keep it in place. This is not the type of quality you expect when you are paying several thousand for your flights.  Maintenance and service  are good as  well BA need to make sure , they inspect and make sure that everything works in the Clud cabin every trip!  When you paying  the sort of money a club  world first ticket costs you expect  everything to be perfect. Agee with  some comments about  the World layout it is starting  to annoy me  bending over someone's legs to get out to use  their toilet! Generally  I think BA is a good  looking product but haven't tried Emirates Qatar etc. yet!

Economy class on 28 Aug from London (LHR) to New York (JFK). Boarding was in Terminal 5 which I love as I can sit for some time in Caffe Nero  for a coffee and watch airplanes  take off or land. I choose BA just because  of their Terminal . Boarding went quite smoothly and the flight was full. It took about 40 minutes till we actually took off after  whatever time we were supposed to. The seat I had wasn't comfortable the cushion was moving and the seat wasn't firm. The inflight entertainment  had a limited choices of movies which was disappointing and the screens  seemed small and sometimes were not working. Flight attendants were all women who were polite and smiling they  did their best to make it a pleasurable flight. Toilets were clean. The headphones were broken and I had to ask for new ones. We landed on time. It took 15 minutes till the plane could park and then another 30 minutes to get off because as the captain informed us there was a long line at immigration and we  will have to wait for them to give us the go ahead. Inside Terminal 7 there was a  long line it  takes 2.5 hours to finally reach  immigration officer. This was by far the most annoying  and tiring experience I have had. To land at 10.45pm and get out at 2am is just too much. I will now choose an airline that lands in a terminal which can handle large numbers of passengers more effectively.

BA15 LHR to SIN B777-300ER First Class: nice a (four months old) but a few signs of wear already. The seat (2K) was reasonably private and reasonably quiet. Useful wardrobe with enough space  to put various items and shoes but the seat has almost no other storage space. Things have to be left loose in the foot-well area. Footrest doubles as a buddy seat although his would be rather cramped I'd imagine. Seat itself fine and comfortable. Good enough to get reasonable sleep on a 12hr journey.  The lighting and temperature perfect. View of outside restricted by the angle of the seat - just when it is interesting (t/off and landing) you are strapped in and cannot see all the fun outside - the child in me I guess! Food and service excellent. The toilets , wow - a flimsy concertina door poor water supply into small bowl so not really good for brushing teeth. Middle-eastern airlines are so much better - BA really has to re-think. Overall BA First Class is equivalent to  Boeing Business class. Cabin crew very attentive - if only they had a better product to work with.

Travelled as a family of four to the Maldives. Despite numerous requests  from weeks in advance we didn't get seats together on the outbound journey. The plane was old and the entertainment system antiquated. This seems to be an issue on BA routes with little competition it was  very similar story when we flew  business to Mauritius. On that trip the entertainment system failed all together. On the return journey from Male I watched what I thought to be a three part crime drama called "the tunnel". Only after watching the third part did I discover that there was a fourth or more! Why? Why would you not have all the story? This experience  showed many airlines have better entertainment systems in economy than the BA service in business on this route. When you are  paid this kind of money to take two children business class you want good entertainment  that keep them occupied. They don't  have the space! Would also have been nice to sit together! Food was grim my ten year old  son who normally  ate everything ate nothing on both legs of the trip. A ten hour flight with travel at either end is a long time without food. There seemed  to be a  system to serve the food throw a bottle of water at you and then shut  down service until an hour before arrival. On the outbound journey I pressed the service button after 15 minutes it self cancelled. Pressed again 15 minutes later it self cancelled. I returned my glass to the galley myself the staff were so  busy chatting amongst themselves they didn't notice me. Presumably this is why they didn't see the service request either. On the return trip service  went a little  worse and well below standards you should expect. Food was equivalently poor. This is the second BA business class trip I've taken to the Maldives and each time I have been disappointed given the cost. I've also travelled economy on Emirates to Male which was actually better and business on Emirates which was fantastic. I know BA have monopoly on the direct route from Gatwick to Male but I will be going  into Dubai on Emirates in future.

380 and ORD-LHR.  The crew on  the flights. The new aircraft are  excellent although I  prefer the 777-300ER  to the A380 as the journey  is more comfortable  having more legroom at the back  than the 777.  I really have upped their game and would happily  work with them again in the future.

I flew from Singapore to Heathrow on a B747 which is certainly an ageing aircraft that showed its age. I think this is one  the BA's main let-downs. The inflight  cinema was slightly  disappointing There wasn't a single movie that I fancied but then I  think everyone has  their tastes. I did listen to some music though. The service on board was generally  excellent at least on the side  on the aircraft I was on.  A stewardess who served was very  nice and attentive.  My food was good although I got a sense that something was missing from the meal overall. It wasn't highly appealing. I also find  these seats comfortable they are softer  than those on Singapore Airlines. I slept very well and I'm not usually one to sleep particularly well on flights. BA can certainly improve  on some aspects but overall I have found them a pleasure to  fly with.

Fri 20 Aug  2018 TO BRI.  I checked in  early so only  needed to drop  bag and clear security. Wrong what  an chaotic system  they were running.  Those who checked  in online had  to wait in a very long  line to simply  have their bags  scanned and sent  in their way  via a member of BA staff. If this is  the case then  just get all  these counters working and clear the  queues quickly. Pity  those poor people who squeezed their  tickets to the  security check in  and bag tagged  checked bags only  to be told  to join the  security line. I can not understand  if the system  are supposed to  be more efficient.  We then had  the situation of  the staff dragging  people out of  their line as  some were going  to miss their  bags Even the  very nice BA  crew member who did our bag tags could not  explain what went  on Flight was  late on boarding  as to flight  coming in late.  Any issue with  staff or the  people on board all very helpful.  We have a  bag and wrap  which was very  glad Captain kept  us informed of  the delay and  plane landed 30  minutes late and he did apologise  again for late  flight Please Gatwick  can sort out check in.

Flight Checked in  about 10.00am for  a 13.10 departure.  check in was  good Then proceeded  into Fast Track which was not ! The lounge  was quite busy  and the staff  were very helpful.  No on time  meals before take off were offered ! We were  at the new  terminal so the  bathroom was nice  but clean. I  stayed in 1F.  I converted into  the flat bed  that was good. About 20 mins  into the flight  our drinks run  me through. When  seated we asked  us what we  are having for  lunch I choose  The Salmon for  breakfast which was  good For mains  I choose the chicken option which  tasted good but  my veg was  very hard. Finally  we choose the ice cream for  lunch Landed on  time and got  the bags quickly.

I flew from London to Sydney Club World /  Business Class. Having done similar OZ flights recently with Qatar Airlines the experience was like  visiting the Premium  or Third Division  flight clubs. Everything  with BA was  very shabby and second rate -  so sad. Numerous  perks from the Business Lounge the  check out of the cabin the comfort of the seats privacy food  service - all  first rate. And for about £2  each extra flight . Why? I  will seriously consider flying to Sydney  from Perth next time - longer  term an experience where you arrive feeling caressed not bundled along. Really  bothers me to say this - a very poor way to present  your country's airline.

Friday 15th August  2017 In my mind that when  we bought the  cheapest tickets it  will be a  better flight experience  based on their  credentials as a  4 star airline.  That turned out  it be totally  opposite I used  to travel with  many airlines it  appears that my flight experience with  them from Changi  airport to Heathrow was the worst  of so many . Not worth  money spent at . Firstly the seat space was really small (I  cannot imagine those  that are bigger  than I am  but I am  of medium size ). Secondly the  amount of food  service was not  great in comparison  to other airlines.  We only served  food twice for  my 12 hour  short haul journey.  While the service  I considered moderate  and it seemed  to no one  complained about the  food in economy  class (no one  wanted to top  off the toilet .) Lastly the  home entertainment was  really back dated.  My movies selection  may have been  30 years old.  Micro earphones and  LCD screens. All  In all an  average customer.

Back to Gatwick. This flight seems to be late on a regular basis. Three times  one hour late , once two hours late this summer of the  four times I was involved. Seems the summer schedule is very optimistic Check-in at Bari 's hopeless always  late and 'bag drop' seems to be used by travellers with ticketing problems. Boarding is poor regularly left  you wait in  the hot air bridge between the gate and the plane. None of this done by BA staff but they are doing BA's reputation no good seemingly using the level of service expected with the low cost carriers that also go to London. Onboard though is always good despite the age of the planes. Fair choice of drinks and a good sandwich nice crew. My flight ended with a 50 minute wait for luggage. A lot for BA to address here.

Off to Cancun  to club world  championship in July.  A plane which  we think BA  ran out of ? Food -  I can't understand how they can  make it so ? We flew  an upperclass to  Barcelona but had  better use BA this year due  to date's will  not use BA 's Cabin crew  - too bad  it could be  worse Save your  money or go  to Virgin.

Flight BA458/463 out  of A319 G-EUOE and return on B763 G-BZHB excellent flights both ways. The cabin service was very good , I got the seating as requested nice refurbished  cabin on the  return journey. Definitely  good choice of  seats

Delta B777-200ER BA0108  - 18 First  Class Transferred from  the Emirates flight  at DXB. BA  Premium Galleries Lounge  and staff member . Boarding reasonable  with an on-time departure. Cabin crew  friendly and definitely  living up to  their "To Fly.  To Serve" BA . Food tasty  but well presented  although not quite  First Class and  this was evident.  BA New First  Class is comfortable though the footrest  was poorly designed  as a storage  area for small ish items is . IFE monitor controls and selection  are good but  this screen could  have more adjustable  to reach. Lovely  interior ambience including  soft textures mood  curtains and window blinds. Toilets cramped  and stocked with  their cheapest liquid  soap and toilet paper. Overall an  excellent flight but as a longstanding  but very loyal BA customer (Gold ), I ask  if they seriously  consider improving their  experience in an  extremely competitive market.  Had a little  help at LHR , remote stand disembarking and bus  transfer to T5.

We flew from Gatwick to Rome  and back on holiday and was  pleasantly surprised by  their standard of  hospitality and service.  The salad on  my outward flight  was exceptional and  a steward on  the return leg  (= a near-full cabin) was anticipating  other passengers might  order BA food  like me. I've flown First a few times in the past few  weeks and the  service was so  bad I thought  we should pay compensation as well as refunding the  original ticket. In  Rome it is usually OK. The  only letdown this  year was the  security at Gatwick.  It was like  a Ryanair holding pen.

Friday 28th July flew from Edinburgh  for Gatwick. Flight  was delayed 3  times as it  has been hit  in lightening on  this flight this  I accepted but what happened afterwards means I will never use them  again 1) Information or details of  anything was happening had to bedraggled out of them. 2) At no  stage was any  help offered. 3)  This flight was  also delayed to  encourage people to  go back onto this flight when they choose to be transferred to a later flight  rather than wait  to see what  is happening this lead to a further delay of 1 hour. 4) No breakfast or snack was served for health and safety reasons. 5)  As they stated  we would be well hydrated during the flight only one drink service  were provided this  consisted of 4 fluid oz cup  cold water between  1 and 2.30pm. 6 They then  offered to leave our luggage at  customs while we travelled to Gatwick.  6 After giving  them the run around for an  hour and a  bit they then  tried to tell  passengers they could not track our  luggage 8) It then took them  2 days to  collect them and send them from  London to Gatwick. Would I use again or recommend  again never in  the month of  September

We flew from Munich to Boston  via Heathrow T5  in August 2014):  Munich to Heathrow , flight out of Munich at  midnight The flight  looked good leaving on time but  due to flight  crew arriving from  London the night , so we  could not get breakfast served on  economy class. From  the T5 to Boston as the  food was nice , the business seat was OK  and special in  compared to other  flights like Iberia , which is much nicer. The cabin crew was nice and friendly  which was nice as I have  had to have  a salad instead  of hot meal.  We managed to  have a good  conversation all the  way to Boston after the meal.

Flight Club World.  Had 400 GBP  flights from Prem  in a day . T5 lounge  very positive -  good selection of  food which was  properly labelled. Had a treatment -  facial massage and  cabin staff were  very attentive. Dreamliner  is a great way to fly - although delayed half an hour  way ahead of time. Felt relaxed  being addressed by name throughout and  cabin crew was  friendly and yes . Two hot  food services and  a multi course  lunch was served  without fuss. Not  worried about the  checked bag- although it is more  comfortable to carry . Entertainment options are excellent. Baggage  sorted for me  on carousel. Good flight for BA.

Day 56 JNB-LHR , August 2014 Business class A380  upper deck. The flight did not  live up to  expectations Too many seats makes business  level cabin look  too narrow seats  on each row  and in opposite  direction no problem  about this but this impedes free  access for some of the seats specially the ones  at the middle  and window side also not much  room for storage  of personal items like specs etc.  The window blinds  for this section  or upper deck were kept lowered  for the entire  2 hr flight  with no cue  of any outside  light whatsoever until we landed at  Newark and parked  on the stand , like sitting  on a light proof box with artificial illumination. I  suppose you need  not keep the  curtains open for  approach and take off? The 747 business class is  less comfortable than A380.

We paid £2500  to upgrade to world traveller plus  after we got  a departure lounge , were upgraded  to business class  BA was brilliant , air hostess  was a point  in letting us  know plus other  things that we had a free  seat On the  whole journey in  world traveller plus  a happy table broken and air  stewards very sarcastic  or very bad  air stewards seemed  unsure if they were doing you  no favour. Paid  a lot of  cash to fly  in Maldives have no choice to  ask BA to go direct stewards , or female  and to remember  that we are  just paying a lot of money  on a service.

I flew London  and Beijing in  the World on  BA on Aug . The cabin  is a disgrace. I sat in  a upper deck  in 62A and  what worried me  was the filthy , the metallic looking tape on  the emergency exit  doors and the foam strip that was hanging down. In addition the  toilets and lockers  were filthy inside.  Prices and service  were excellent but  I will vote  for my wallet and boycott BA  From now on  when possible.

Flight Club Europe. Travelled with hand baggage only given the well publicised  issue with Swissport  the handling at  JFK Outbound flight  this was BA  at its best.  On time departure (a rarity it seems at LGW for BA) A320  in fair condition , additional leg room in Club  Europe and two  extra flight attendants.  Flight return (22/7/2014)  had a different . Probably my  favourite BA flight !! Delayed departure  at TFS though  only about 10 minutes late in arrival at LGW.  Two additional leg room on this  trip in Club  Europe Lazy cabin crew who did the bare minimum with limited grace. And screaming infants  out of control toddlers and ignorant  teenagers in the  Club Europe cabin  is not the airline's fault but  it could have  and should have  been more to  handle the situation. One example -  two teenagers in  seat 1 immediately  pushed their seats into the faces  of the couple  in front of  them after take . The cabin crew didn't even  let the teenagers  to their seats  for the meal ! All credit  goes the couple  on front of us though. They had the manners  NOT to recline  the seats into  the faces. The  extra premium to  fly Club Europe  was just not  cutting it when  these people's children  are not controlled and the promised  passengers 'personal space'  was not provided.  Below are an average of both flights: outbound top  five across the board (bar entertainment  that was none)  - I would have preferred to  see zero.

18 August 2014  London to Orlando flight details and departure went well. However when the  food was served on the flight  it was limited  either chicken or  pork which was  fine until they ran out and then could only offer the veggie option which was  vegetarian which my Father in Law doesn't eat so he ended up with 2 bread s as his . This was served within the  second hour of our over 8 hour flight and  about 7 hours later we were served a snack  but only had one option coronation chicken (chicken again!) which only 2 in our party of 6 liked. Again my Father in Law had nothing as he was 1 of the 4. Pretty  amazing show British Airways as we travelled with Virgin to Mexico in  July this year  first class and they offered a menu with three  options for lunch/dinner  and enough for everyone! Again when the snack was served option were given and enough  for all. Virgin also provided a very good entertainment system with up to date films TV and games which was something  we need on a long journey again BA was  not able to provide. BA your  products are definitely  giving more value  than our money! I wouldn't not  use BA again as I don't like to limit  our choices however  i would definitely  continue to fly Virgin in future. In my opinion all flights should have enough food  for all of their passengers and look at what  you are offering as coronation chicken didn't go down well with a large number of passengers what's happened  too good old ham or cheese?

We flew the  airplane from LAX-LHR-JNB-LHR-LAX in August 2014 in business class. This plane was  made by someone who never flew it. The seats are so close together with no room on the window side to get out when  the seats are flat. A person has to put up the foot rest for a  seat to stand and then step over the person next to them to get out into the aisle. In addition the person on the window seat gets  only the food handed to them in front of the face of the person on the aisle. They have put so many people in  each row that the seats are very narrow. There is virtually no place ( a small drawer at the seat) for personal items to be used during  a flight without getting out of the seat to get something from the overhead.

My journey was  between BOM to  Dubai (I had  another connecting flight  from LHR to MIA surprisingly enough the transit at  all wasn't all  to bad). Aircraft : Got a  big upgrade from World Traveler to  International Traveler Plus.  Every seat was  spacious and spacious service was professional  and the food  very nice especially the English breakfast that was served  prior to landing.  Only only drawback  were the absence of overhead air  conditioning which at times made it  seem little stuffy and the in-flight  menu which lacked the variety of Emirates for example.  Was a pleasant  flight Wouldn't mind  going with BA  flights at all.

Sad to say BA missed a big opportunity when  the new 787 and A380 entered ! Same old sub standard business class seating as on the retired 747s. Compared to  other airlines the BA premium service is poor and I don't know how they keep a 4 star ! The cabin crew were excellent though I will concede. Food was very poor with my steak ruined because it was  coated in grease (laughingly referred to as jus) which mixed with the hollandaise sauce to  create a disgusting . The 787 was good and BA have improved their IFE system  the screens are small and have to be stowed for take off and landing unlike  those in economy and premium. Pay more get less.

We flew from LHR to Luxembourg  in an afternoon flight we enjoyed  very delicious afternoon tea and champagne because it was my husbands birthday. Flight attendants very  friendly and jolly  and felt very much as if we were having a really nice  little celebration up  in the sky!  Tickets received very quickly on both flights. We travelled  back in economy , it was really good with  drinks and a  salad or crisps. Only problem was that there was no place for  the aircraft to  load up when  it got in  due to bad weather. We were off as quickly as they could so it wasn't  so bad!

I was on BA 835 from Dublin to LHR  on 25th July 2014 which left Dublin at 13.05 and my travel  arrangements were such that I had sufficient time to connect with my  passengers from LHR to Hong Kong.  Upon leaving Dublin the pilot opined that it was  another good day  for fly! On reaching LHR we were informed that due to thunderstorms we were to  have diverted to Gatwick and were running out of fuel. In summary we sat on the tarmac at  BA for over two hours with only scant updates as to when we would be taking off for LHR and the temperature inside the cabin became oppressive which added to the misery. On reaching LHR BA staff were in my opinion ineffectual with a 'sorry and shrug of the shoulders' and with no real  consideration for those passengers on connecting flights. I was lucky as I managed to get on my flight to Hong Kong with Cathay Pacific but with only  minutes to spare after a dash to terminal 3. Whilst I understand the volatility of the weather the real point of my review is  how BA appears  too have abandoned the basics of customer service and this is clearly reflected in BA's absence in the top 10 airline ratings. Could do a lot better!

Flight BA 937 Dusseldorf to London  on 13th March . BA 932  Berlin to Dusseldorf  on 15th March.  All flights served  on Airbus A319.  Plane was in  very good shape  the pitch 34 inch and the  tail 17 inch.  Service in DUS I owned Lounge) is quite nice but nothing special  outside of BA  747 LHR T5  looked very good  and a lot of space even it was very  full at this time but anyway  we know it  from other times when it was  not empty. No check-in because of  the luggage only.  flight 937 was delayed for about  an hour due  of foggy weather  over London so the very nice  staff start to  offer Drinks to  reduce the waiting  while on ground.  Food served after  breakfast a choice  between a cold  salad with assorted  vegetables and meat  on bread/rolls or  the warm cheese  with ham croissant  and salad. Drinks  including Champagne were  served twice. More  drinks for that  relatively short flight.  Wait for BA  flights (bought liquids)  and T5 was  really quick also friendly staff. BA  Lounge as I wrote was busy but worth it to reduce waiting  time Very nice  flight attendants drinks  ordered 3 times  and Dinner with mixed salad. No  TV Inflight Entertainment  as on most  BA Flights) small  screens with flight information.

Heathrow to Newark  on 787. Flight  very pleasant and  efficient Left Heathrow 1 hour late  but arrived on  time Seat was  great and food  were ok. Service was excellent but had to walk  back in the  rain to catch a bus to  get us to  the plane. Would recommend BA due  to service and Heathrow T5.

Sunday Aug 8th LHR-HKK. Club World. Upper deck. Overall  very good flight. The service was a bit robotic. Pre- departure drinks offered. Main and breakfast served. For the main course I opted for the healthy /  light meal which was tasty and just what I  needed as I was trying to avoid a heavy  meal before bed. I was surprised  at the limited wine selection: Two whites and two reds. I had a NZ Sauv Blanc which was tasty but 'connoisseurs' may have felt restricted by choice. The staff were overall very pleasant and happy to help when asked but just weren't pro-active. Passengers (myself included) were having to ask for things that should have been attended to without request. They seemed 5  minutes too slow for drink rounds meal service etc. This is a small complaint however as I managed a solid 7  nights of sleep and the overall  sleep was good. The entertainment system on the A380 is much improved and is as good as any I have flown VSSG etc. The window seat is certainly more private and feels much more spacious with the storage compartments under the windows and I would recommend these - especially over middle ! All in all a solid  first class but still lagging behind the likes of CX or SG primarily because of  weight and seat layout. There is a 'Britishness' to the product which still makes me smile.

June 25th 2014. My wife and daughter boarded in Boston. The door  was closed and we were ready to depart for  home Then a  water cart hit the airplane. We deplaned and that  is understandable. After an hour we  got told the plane would not depart and there was no room on any other planes for days.  Contact your friends - make your own arrangements!" was the only customer relations help offered by British Airways. The BA help on the ground said there were no hotels on vouchers. I really  really really thought British Airways was the standard of air travel. If you have any alternative do not book British Airways.  Sounds great as  long as everything 's going as planned. If anything goes wrong they  are a confused people who have no idea how to help you.
Flew Sydney - Singapore - London return. Thoroughly enjoyed both flights good  & good service. Would definitely use  January 2015 for  the flight to Oslo. Thank you  British Airways.

Boston - Houston - LHR. Two of us travelled using Avios and Amex companion voucher. Excellent cabin crew on both sectors  with good selection of wine and  food pretty decent particularly outbound. The staff in Houston even found and  repaired my iPod which I had  put on the aircraft on the outbound sector.

Flight LHR-YYZ BA97 on 9 July returning BA96 28July. Check-in at LHR an absolute breeze including security which took only 5 minutes. Galleries Lounge at the south end of T5 awful with poor food dirty furniture and smelly toilets. Outbound aircraft was G-BNLG surely one of the most ancient 747s in existence judging by the state of the interior at least in the main cabin. On boarding all the window shades were down (10.20 departure) and stayed down for the entire flight including take-off  or landing most peculiar. The head cabin service person said it was  because keep the  light out - I have questioned if this is a new BA policy for daytime flights. Departed and arrived a few minute late no issue. Food and  service very average as usual nowhere near the standards of international Business Class elsewhere. Immigration and baggage delivery in YYZ very swift. For the return again the  visa formalities were quick and painless ; the lounge  at Pearson is ok but nothing special. Aircraft this time was G-BGYC the upper deck was in reasonable condition although as always with BA's Club World seating  their is little stowage space and the whole backwards/forwards concept is something I personally dislike. Food almost non-existent on this 2310 departure and most people slept: this would be understandable if a proper  meal was on offer. Unfortunately it was no better than going to McDonalds with some unripe fruit and a sort of egg and bacon muffin - just awful. Also the person in the window seat did have something to eat and drink and every time the crew member came with his orders he would lower the partition to pass them through with all the disturbance that creates. Is this service policy poor seat design or  bad crew? Flight  and time arrival processes ok but baggage delivery slow. All in all the experience was what I expect from BA these days average at best.

Flight from Heathrow to Newark. The new Dreamliner was fantastic. Very comfortable quiet and clean. The cabin crew were superb very  friendly with customer service being their priority. I appreciate  that flying on a new aircraft makes a difference to the flight however if BA continue to invest in their fleet and maintain and excellent level of customer service I  really see no other reason to fly with another carrier especially when considering BA's avios points usage which allows all of your points to be spent on flights. Virgin however dictate how many points you can spend on each  flight I've flown with BA and Virgin many times it was a nice attempt by Virgin advertising themselves in terminal 5 however when you're sat in terminal 5 after experiencing a quick and easy run through the terminal about to board a  beautiful new aircraft it's hard to see the advertisements working.

Great service from LCY-Angers in western France on Embraer . London City Airport is so very convenient for  London dwellers and  all flights were  extremely comfortable. Saturday 's outbound was totally full but on time attentive cabin crew very comfortable and not even the breakfast of a disappointingly  large croissant with ham and cheese could spoil the  overall impression. Coming  in on the  Sunday was less than half-full so double drinks and snacks all round! Tickets were £120  apiece which seems very reasonable considering  the alternative for  the region is Ryanair to Tours from Stansted for  about as much and once you factor in the  added price of  drinks and snacks  beating them BA , hands down.

Wednesday service from LCY-Angers in western  England on Embraer 175. London City  Airport is so very convenient for  urban dwellers and the flights were very comfortable. Saturday  night outbound was totally full but on time attentive cabin crew very comfortable and not  even the breakfast of a disappointingly hard croissant with ham and cheese could spoil the positive impression. Coming back on the Wednesday was less than half-full so double drinks and snacks all round! Tickets were £120 return which seems  very reasonable considering the alternative for  our region is Ryanair to Tours from Stansted for almost as much and once you factor in the  extra price of luggage and snacks  between them BA wins hands down.

Flying on 30  in J class  on an Airbus  320 I was  hoping more however I was disappointed.  Service was OK  and not particularly  good food just  something with a  choice of a  salad or meat platter either very poor. Cabin crew in an automatic  mode no smiling , more interested  and chatting in  middle of the cabin and complaining about not sure  what No inflight  music altogether not  including a shared movie. However we  were on time  we arrived 15  minutes before schedule and the price  was the cheapest  available for a  C Class seat.  They fly BA  Express but I am more keen  on Intercontinental flights  because the quality  seems superior than European routes.

Upgraded from Premium Economy to Business from YVR (Vancouver) to LHR (London).  Our Club World cabin was full and a couple of the passengers had been upgraded to First. Despite this the staff  was friendly and helpful although the food wasn't that great (the chocolate desert was delicious though). Seat is  long and wide but if you're facing rearwards on the 747 you  could be sitting right next to  somebody you don't know. The IFE had a lot of choice and  too many new movies to chose from. Altogether a  good flight.

Upgraded to business  class on return  journey from Verona. Absolute disgrace. Flight  left around 11.30pm  with lounge closed  by 9.20pm. Lounge  looked awful dirty , very little  by the way of business class facilities. Flight was cattle class and I have seen  this organisation and  professionalism on an easyjet flight. Boarding  felt like a  rugby scrum with  no priority boarding  but then spent  30 minutes on  to a bus with no air  bags crammed packed  into hot conditions.  They had run out of food.  First flight in  minutes and absolute  no customer service.  The joke and how they have  this audacity to claim it was  business class they  should be accountable  to the trade  unions act.

Standard economy. Embraer aircraft only half-full at most and on time. For such a short  trip a high  standard of cabin service with wine and a small  breakfast offered. An excellent flight in all respects.
Excellent economy. Pushed back late but arrived on time.  Boat was full  of good cabin  fare with sandwiches  & drinks. A very good standard !

London LHR-LAX. A380.  Everything was clean.  People were comfortable  but the leg  room was restricted  by the IFE-  system which has  sensors installed underneath  the seat in  an Amenity kit  included a cushion  and headphones and  microphone There were  not eye shades  and ear plugs.  On both ways  was same selection:  either Masala or  mac and cheese  with average quality  replaced by a  chocolate ice cream  or a sandwich  or breakfast croissant.  They lacked courteousness  attitude and motivation.  Customer was on  the flights repeatedly  and reaction to  my call button  and they were  waiting hours not  available in the  flight IFE-system is  provided with a  large selection of  TV documentaries etc.  Up to a  complaint the system had to be  changed which erased  the preferences. This  experience with British wings is not  common to other flag carriers due  both the lack  in service and  also restricted seating.

Sunday 26 July : Upgraded from  Lounge to Club , before I  even had the  courage to ask.  Looking for money  and a '5'  which I didn't  pay for the . Flight went  well and I  only managed some  rest on the  small flat bed.  The crew were  friendly and helpful  One of the  passengers retrieved his  spare USB adapter  into his luggage so that I  could charge my  laptop (I was  also little surprised  that there wasn't  a USB port  under my seat  on upstairs 747).  That same attendant  was in the  baggage control hall , called out  - without success , - looking  at a passenger  I had left  my glasses behind.  I was absolutely  lovely and the  coffee a little  too drinkable. This  was probably up  graded as one  if the better  seats I've taken  - most are  done under sufferance  and this one  is pretty good ...

26th July LGW to Orlando. Drinks  served from the  lounge was good. Champagne upon boarding and a top  ups without requesting.  This was greatly appreciated! Food was not outstanding but pleasant enough. Overall the cabin service  is good. Several services of drinks and top ups when requested. What let this flight  sink was the number of unruly  children on this flight. I was in an outside seat on the port side and an 8 or 9 year old child in front got out of her seat every five minutes or so continually throughout  this flight and her younger sibling was also jointing her when she did manage to stay put. I attempted to avail myself of the flat bed but three times these children stood on my legs as they clambered over  to their seat. The parents of these children never once intervened to check their children's behaviour although they were well aware of how they were behaving. My wife did not  get much luck either. The couple to her rear were sat throughout the flight crossed  over in the isle playing with their children and their toys and my wife had to struggle passed them every time she wished to use the toilet.  What a tripping  parent There were many other children on the flight who were well behaved so it can be done if parents set  expectations for their  children Whilst BA cannot be held responsible for children's behaviour I feel that as we were in the Club World cabin some sort of  statement should be made by BA requesting passengers with children respect the comfort of fellow passengers. P.S. The Club Lounge at  Orlando was like a kindergarten but that is another story!

* Outbound A320  flight 26/7 return  flight on 27/7  with Euro Traveller.  Both flights boarded efficiently departed and arrived on time.  Customers were a  tad tired but  well enough for  a 60 minute flight. Exit row  2 on A319  are worth taking  if available as  it provides extra  service Refreshments only  if the flight  is too short  for anything else.

Toronto to London in WTP on  the 787 and  Manchester to Toronto in club world on 747. There were elements of  both flights where BA seemed to  revert back to  its old self. The Dreamliner in  Toronto was on  point with some of the best cabin service I've  had from a male attendant who smiled couldn't do enough and was just professional. BA  seemed to have dropped some of  the nice touches  too so no hot towel soft eners before take off or menu cards - looks  at WTP seems  to have been demoted (again). Fast  drink service and  an entree before the WTP service  went into WT for breakfast which has reverted to  "... or nuffin"  - Ts and Cs and juice from paper cups.  This really is an insult after an overnight flight  and is ill thought out and penny pinching. Landing  back at Heathrow , fast bags  and a good  long flight. The return flight in club was one of my best ever. The lounge had a better  selection of hot and cold food  with most of the furniture still  needs replacing. On  arrival two male  passengers upstairs on  the jumbo were  just Friendly helpful  and starting off well with a 2nd champagne before  take off due to delays in boarding. Fast bar service and an  excellent lunch with  the sea bass being exceptional. A calm oasis on the upper deck  got some sleep  until the now  popular afternoon tea  being served. Real personalised service with  genuine smile reminded  us of old times of BA  trying it's best.  All on time  boarding and fast bags off finished  an excellent flight. Why can't they  offer this more often? (Answer - variable cabin crew).

Delta BA274 LAS-LHR  flight 8/6/2014 onboard G-CIVB (B747). Flight  was on time and smooth. Catering  is very average  with small portions.  Alcohol was much less then BA standard. Crew was  great but we didn't see them  stay a very long time during  our flight. Only 2 drink rounds were made during this 9.5 hour flight everyone knows that is not  normal Seats were good with just enough legroom.

Edited on 17th Feb 2014. I was in 4A from Jamaica to London Gatwick and no need to climb over anyone’s  leg and you're close to the toilet and the galley were your  can help yourself.  It is very  friendly and good , Great meal  I had the  Coconut Curry very  good and a nice bottle of  gin to help it down. The  crew were very helpful. Going to  London soon and  hear they have  wifi on the flight so going to try that.

Flight July 23 , World seat . It was  not a novelty  seat on a  large aircraft for  a flight just  over three hours  and I sat on the upper  row which was  comfortable but this  did not detract  to the excellent  entertainment provided by  its two dedicated crew. I chose  the seat as  only one has  me step over  six feet when  I exit and  it is also  only fraction longer than the other  seat with three  pockets and four compartments beneath the window to store  luggage I did not use the  sofa as a bed but used  a Z position which is very good for relaxing.  My food and  beverage choices were  also good and the Club Kitchen  is well stocked  in the main  area for treats  after dinner.

Now on 19 th seat 1A  in World. I  flew on one  on the converted  military jets that  we used to  fly and was  very impressed with  this seat. The  cabin is 1  to 2 seats  and if you're  traveling alone the  aisle seat is  great to have. There is lots  more space to  carry items and  every seat has  different positions from  the chair to  the flat bed.  My seat also  features a built  on massage function.  A TV screen  is 15 inches  standard size and  comes from a  shelf in the  cabin The service  seemed excellent from  the male crew  member and the  beer and wine  selection was of  very high standard.

BA206 from Miami to LHR on  West deck dinner took over 3 hours to complete. 2 staff obviously not sufficient. Very  little 747 TV  watching going from colour to B&W , as had more than enough  room to watch a couple of movies while dinner was not served.

I have used BA over the past 20 years as I chose to move my airmiles to their  having regretted it ever since and will use them up as soon  if possible. Even  while flying on  their paid flight I find the staff snooty they have a bad customer attitude. At  that moment I am trying to  get in on a flight only  booked because it  was the best option for my multiple stops and the on line  checked in does not work. Told by staff member never mind just do it at the airport not  any point in reporting it because they won't do  anything for 24 hours. That is  not customer service  and you can only check in  12 hours before hand. I have had lost luggage  twice on the same trip had  my seat changed for no reason (someone else was  trying to use my original choice , not a  real problem) flights  twice but was able to change them back to the original booking.  We have travelled economy and premium economy and flown  24 hours with no inflight entertainment.

A BA935 DUS-LHR , 31/5/2014 onboard G-EUPU (A319). Flight  arrived on time  & smooth. A  coffee was served together with a small sandwich. Crew  seemed good and the seats were also fine for  a short flight.

Flight BA283 LHR-LAX  - 31/5/2014 onboard  flight (A380). Flight was punctual and very smooth. A nice breakfast and dinner was served  during this flight.  I also received  an ice cream which was very  tasty Crew was  warm and friendly. Only drawback are  a very few drink rounds that were made during this 11 hour  journey We were  sitting on the upper deck on  row 74. A  other big advantage  are that the  flight is in  the 2-4-2 configuration  so the window seats have a  very nice 'bin'  where you can put all your  luggage

Round-trip with family from JFK to  Dallas via LHR.  Return flight was delayed at JFK  about 2 hrs.  Was stressful with  9 month old  AND a 4  yr old. Inflight  service was good. Transit at LHR  was a nightmare! Mile long walk  from alighting to central point in Terminal 5. No gate information anywhere. Had to check-in  as they had to scan each  and every food item for the baby! Though departing flight was from same Terminal 5  had to now walk 30-40 yards go down a  little walk again to train get  a second stop go up escalator again and walk  back 50 yards  towards last gate - C63. Now here the gate agent wouldn't let our carry on . Said it  was too big.  I had to remove all baby food and items  of the kids and carry them in our hands inside the plane and check the carry-on. Return flight again was delayed.  We checked in at 3.30am for  first flight but flight took off at 9.15am. Transit at LHR was thankfully better this time. But the  gate to JFK  was an old 747 - falling . No bulkhead this time as original flight was late and they had to accommodate  everyone on another full flight. Old seats kept reclining on its own. A/C was blowing  loud and cold until takeoff. Had asked staff to  give meals first to the 4 yr old - no luck. Never going to fly  JFK again or  again through LHR !!

Friday 22nd/23rd July  2017 and BA755 A319 each way  and drop at T5 seemed to take ages. Once  again used the  arrivals lounge which was pretty full  for this time  of the day.  We delayed a  bit and arrived  only 15min late  so on this  last 20min flight  was fine for  economy class a  sandwich and drink  and return bag  Once in Basel  we used the  VIP Lounge which  looked very nice.  Last flight quick , very full , sandwich and  drinks served and  drink service good  on a short  flight arrived T5  mins late but  soon recovered and  arrived in 30 min

We flew to Rome from Newcastle via Heathrow the  airport staff service was excellent at  Rome as we needed disability assistance the day before we were due to fly home I received a text at 17.30 to say our flight had been cancelled but could not contact customer services for over 14 hours we were told we had been booked on an earlier flight which meant taking a taxi  to the airport losing the money we had already paid for our previous transfer and the disability assistance service we receive in Heathrow was awful. We were  delayed for 1 hour for someone  to take us  to the plane and then at the next station there was no one to take  me to our flight connection so I had to push wheelchair myself.

Flew on a 777-200 from London Heathrow to San  Antonio worst flight  i have taken on British Airways. Being a rather tall person 6'7"  tall travelling in  aisle the person in front of me could not recline his seat due to my legs blocking his recline he complained to the cabin personnel that he could not recline and I was asked to remove my knees so  I could recline  explaining to cabin crew that I  could not have a comfortable journey  but did not seem to care. When the food  is served I  did not even  get my tray  facing down so the cabin crew would not serve me a meal stating that the tray must be in the down position to eat a meal. So  to tell you the truth I spent the best part of 7 hours of a 11 hour flight  on the toilet At least in there I could  spit out my  toilet Wrote a letter to British Airways to inform them of my flight haven't heard anything back from them. Just shows  that they really care about their  customers

Flight Edinburgh-Gatwick. Late  about 40 mins  and that's not unusual. Flight itself  was clean quiet made up some  noise Crew smart  and friendly. Only down side was  getting off a  plane to a  different gate to  avoid being herded  through a packed . Bags came fairly quickly sometimes . LGW it  could be a  hassle

Two A319's each way check/bag drop atT5 took ages around 40 min. Once checked in lounge and boarding good seat 15c enough time for a coffee and sandwich arrived a  tad late due to weather. Return similar flight experience same food very full flight bag  dropped at BSL very quick and very nice lounge.  Left a little late and arrived 20 min late otherwise good experience nice crew in  opposite directions.

First B747-400. Used  this to sample  a 'new' First. The check-in area  at DME was very congested but  you did not have to queue.  Club lounge had  issues of not  very comfortable seats , limited food  & beverages. The  lounge area was  treated like a  drawing pen and  is much too  small for a 747 load. First  & Club ended up boarding through  another different gate ! Once on  board I was  taken to my  cabin and given an explanation about  various seat functions.  Feedback from the  Cabin crew was  excellent (there were only one other passenger in First). The food was OK but not  very exciting. The  biggest disappointment was  my seat and  loss of personal  belongings with only  small room for shoes and a  jacket in the  back Everything else  had to go in the overhead locker. There seemed  ot be too many seats crammed  in the cabin.  We moved from  First to 3K  and this had a bit more  space and privacy than the others.  In my experience BA First should  be called Club  1 Plus.

Just had a  flight from ZRH  to SFO via LHR. The leg  from ZRH to  Seattle on a  Piper A320 nothing  good The leg  of LHR to  SF was on a 747-400 (G-CIVY)  was very good.  Hotel was clean  but in a  great condition. Entertainment  - not perfect  not sufficient. Food  and service very good - Beef  is delicious. Staff  very very friendly , helpful with  the Kids. Flight  time was very  much perfect flight  for all of us.

We had a  leg from LAX to ZHR via LHR. The leg from LAX to LHR was on a A380-800 (G-XLEA) was very good.  Cabin was clean  and in perfect  seats We had bulkhead seats for  the family - perfect (be Aware: Bulkhead seats were  very cold because of A/C). Flight  is full and leaving on time , boarding was  slightly less. Entertainment  system very good - Touchscreen is a little bit slow but selection  is huge. Food and service very good - Beef  absolutely delicious. Staff  were friendly and helpful with our  reservations The leg from LHR to ZRH was on  the regular A320  - special.

14/7/14 Trinidad-St Lucia-LGW Club. On the way down from  Saint Lucia BA  did an inexplicable outdated crew change. They are the  passengers from the  previous days flight having a two  night holiday in  ST Lucia. Check  out at POS is usually unprofessional trini-style. BA shares  another lounge which has a colonial style dress code so I had  a nip to the loo to  transition from my shorts to trousers  and on time for the 45min  flight to St  Vincent where the  group of holidaymakers  flew back to  Trinidad I was  shocked as I  saw the new POS-St Lucia cabin mates ask each other if they  wanted a beer!  They then landed  to St Lucia and were busy saying goodbye to  each other and  their incoming new crew but not saying goodbye to  the departing POS-St Lucia passengers! St Lucia-LGW with new  crew Girl came  down with newspapers and I said 'FT' please which she had in  one hand but she had no clue what the FT was! Did  I dare ask for top up to the one glass of bubbly as it is  said as soon  as the various jobs are done by various designated crew that's it. New male wash bag is a  mess so I  asked for the female wash bag  which actually is slightly better. Flight got very cold  and I asked  about an extra blanket. Told politely but firmly 'sorry'  but there were loads in overhead  compartment which I  checked later. The  trick about most BA flights these days is to  expect nothing and  once u get  the odd staff member who actually does that extra  duty consider it  as a bonus.
Welcome to LCY Business. Great lounge  on Madrid flight  was very good  no awful service , arrival at  Madrid good however baggage awful all  flights through but  first priority last .

Flew LCY to  London in Business only 3 people  in a cabin  only 12 no  breakfast no pre  take off drinks very poor service awful food warm  air turbulence as  we got in  the air dealt  in very well.  Very very poor .

Got a wonderful  BA fare from  Birmingham City to Florence £56 each  to London City  A delight to  fly through except  that your flight  is badly delayed , sadly ours  was No announcements  made to tell anyone what was happening 2 hour  delays shown on  our departure board  set up at  the time. Actually  being BA fan , this was  handled very badly.  No information or  explanation Then when  I boarded we  are delayed by another hour thankfully  once on board  both cabin crew  and pilots were  good at communicating , almost made  up for the  poor handling by  ground staff. Great  English breakfast and  tea served on  hold on the  journey out. The  return flight was  in time and  had a lovely  meal and a  very acceptable snack  / drink service.  Good value compared  against the "low  flyer carriers no  additional charges for  meals etc allowed  and free drinks  if you wanted them. Apart from  the delay outbound , wonderful trip.  Could have been  a 10/10 had  we left on  time

DOH-BAH-LHR-LAX flight started from Doha with  the short hop to Bahrain to  load up more  luggage Check in  time ok but  left over baggage  fees by 1 kilo so made  to pay. Flight  landed on time  in an older 777 with broken  engines so everyone was roasting inside the plane not good in a  blazing hot middle eastern summer told it would be  fine once airborne  and had to endure twice due  the stop over in Bahrain. Crew were fantastic though very welcoming the moment I stepped onboard compensated the lack of AC.  Lunch was served and it was good nothing to write home about  as was breakfast.  Very old with no AVOD capabilities  so movies are  in the loop  and few channels with old movies. Arrived at LHR  around 3 -  still very quite  and early in the morning so few people and  nothing around. Flight to LAX again  with an older  plane but new IFE with AVOD  this time crew mixed bag male crew a bit  disappointed Food -  breakfast was ok  minus the dessert but small portions bring lots of food and 2 hours before arrival  was sad sandwich and yoghurt was serve other carriers serve full meal as second meal or snack and  about that time  they crashed on  landing the plane nothing to do  with it good thing it was  at arrival time  very boring flight and full as well arrived on time and bags were out in 10 minutes that is if you  can come out of immigration faster.  It was an ok long flight very disappointing but it did get me where I wanted to be.

26 July BA117 LHR-JFK. Well I 've not flown with BA for a number of years as they are not my  preferred airline from past experience. We were travelling with hand luggage so should be easy. Decided to not  just purchase seats but go for  a check in and seat selection. All very easy , got good seats on 777-300 should have been 747 but obviously had an aircraft change. So we arrive at airport and go to security and scan our boarding cards , rejected you need to get  a passport and visa validated from the BA desk  before you can  check Would be  interested if this  was shown on boarding pass. Boarding  experience good onto a new plane good seats good  friendly staff seemed interested and engaging. All the crew seemed very good. I walked off  BA aircraft with my view of BA restored would  happily fly again with them yes.

From GOT-LHR-LAX and back on the new A380. Flight  from GOT-LHR was  excellent even though the flatbread they served was inedible.  Getting through T5  quick and easy. Must say that Heathrow gets better  & better for  each time you  go The long haul flight on  an A380 was  fantastic I was  sat on the upper deck which  was a huge privilege since the  planes are 2-4-2 . I was  seated in a  private seat which  makes it all  the better since  we installed lockers  close to the seats where you  could put your  luggage The staff  is excellent (and  not very good !) and the  service was better  than I could've  asked for an  easier route. The  overall experience was overall better than  i thought for a 500$ ticket , so far  the best I've gone with when it comes to flights over the  UK

The Club World R/T. Old careworn  The Airplane was  never clean both  flights Food outbound from Gatwick was almost inedible and  then they also  got out of . Inbound airplane toilets reeked. At least food on  takeoff was slightly  healthier Cabin Crew  across sectors were simply going through  the motions and  being rushed /  rushed The Club World seats are  cramped and uncomfortable. The inflight entertainment system was a bad joke. Screens  small and tiny  previews of movies. BA's so called Business Class experience  is woefully outdated  and an extremely  poor product when  compared to other  budget carriers. I  was amazed that  Qatar Airways standards  remain so low  and they get  away with it. This is mere  B to B transport. What is  missing from their Business Class is ...

Flew LHR to  Mumbai return with  the husband - very disappointing. The Galleries lounge at  gate 5 was overcrowded noisy and  gave the feel  like a cafeteria not the tranquil haven suggested by BA. The food  seemed below average.  Had to avail ourselves of the  catering facilities as they were fully booked. Not enough  room for the number of people in the lounge and my husband  having to queue! We had to pay extra to guarantee 2 seats  - to the tune of £240. When we boarded the aircraft (Boeing ), the cabin crew appeared rushed and flustered they were not forthcoming  in drinks or refreshments or particularly welcoming. The 'yin and yang' seat configuration didn't work out well for us as we  often had to lean forward to talk to each  others The seat  aisle was okay  though quite narrow.  The IFE did not work on the return flight. The in-flight food  was above average  but not outstanding. Check-in at Mumbai  for the return  flight was very  slow We were kept waiting for at least 40  minutes with no  explanation for the  luggage The business class lounge at Mumbai is appalling cannot be described as business class at all. No  surprise the food very poor both in quality and selection and had clearly been hanging around for some time. The whole  package of BA's  Air World was seriously underwhelming and we will not fly with them  again

LHR-CPH-LHR. Business class on the way out and economy  for the return trip. Flight on time on both trips staff as  usual excellent both  in the airport  AND on the planes. No inflight  issues at all both operated by  staff whose seats  were looking just  that little tired.  The biggest gripe  I have is  with food on the business flight  which had some  sandwiches which were  intent on being  cooked and on the return trip was a cold  plastic wrap which  is very short  on imagination. Quite  unfortunate that the  business appears to  has gone downhill badly since our last flights. Come on BA these  are the sorts  little things which  get you a clear lead over  all of your  rivals

LHR-FRA-LHR in spotlessly clean airbuses both looked brand new  but they weren't). Crews were immensely friendly and helpful with a smile for everybody. Slight  confusion on the return leg but kept well informed. Only minus point is the remote  gate at FRA that slow boarding  & disembarkation to a snails pace.

The JNB-LHR return.  Having considered BA  - they fly  an A380 on the route which  was undoubtedly the  best aircraft to  be on. Only hit minor turbulence  in both directions  and one can  finally get some rest. BA have  really upped their game in premium economy - the  Norwegian equivalent was  always the worst  from the sky. The A380 is  another considerable improvement.  My gripe is  that on premium economy you get  no special boarding  ticket so by  the time I  arrived on the  flight the cabin was already full - can only  assume the others all had the  special frequent flyer privilege. Anyway the  cabin was superb with proper crockery  & cutlery attentive  staff and superb  food But I 'd only recommend flying the A380  as you are  going to find yourself on the  Boeing 744's expect  complete opposite -  a cramped cabin with mediocre seats and regular economy  class service.

Not disappointed with  our flight back  from Munich although  for only 2  flights all that  were offered was  one small basket  full of a  mixture of nuts  and shortbread. The  journey over to  London was considerably  better being offered  the curry wrap . We were  warned when booking  our return in  London that there 's only one  flight left however  later in the  flight there were still seats left  with one next to me! However , really the snack offered that's  my main "bone of contention" as we chose British Airway in preference  over the cheap budget airlines but  can now find  very little difference  in the on flight catering.

Just taken a BA flight LHR-JFK  with Outstanding service  that went above  and beyond to  keep us comfortable.  The cabin director  pointed out it  was my Dad's 60th birthday and gave him a bottle of champagne to take away. Very friendly and  never too much ! We flew on older 747  & newer 777 with latest interior  in both very  spacious plenty of leg room and entertainment great. Screen  of older aircraft  is little small but much better on newer. Food  was the best  we had on  this airline. Restaurant quality without a  problem

1 - London  to Nassau. All  flights on time.  Flight from Paris  for London on  Saturday was a  nice trip and  was The 2nd  leg from London to Nassau on  an old 767.  Breakfast was good  & tasty with  loads of drinks  on offer. Flight  was not too  long so plenty  of room for  people to spread  around the cabin.  Only issue with  my flight was  my AVOD which  is very old  so picture was  taken so clear  and sound terrible. Other than that  a good experience.

London Gatwick to  Southampton Bag drop very slow and  poor print luggage  in Plane an  older 737 but very well preserved  interior and very  friendly Cabin crew  was nice. As  if the pilot , the real  fault for the  2 hour delay. Why do ground crew always say  yes to late  boarding of incoming ? Sandwich lunch  and nice and  good drink selection.  Once onboard a  very good experience.

Flight from Sydney , Singapore to  Bangkok to Lisbon  was long flight , 27 hours including 2 hours each at Sing la London. Have flown with the  other carriers that  were very good but flew BA  last time as best value for  me I was not expecting great  experience but was pleasantly surprised the planes were good  and good entertainment and food was good. The staff  were also pleasant  and professional. Only  complaint was on  2 legs including  where they did  NOT ask people in front to  move seats when they served meals I asked in 2 cases and they asked person  in front to  lift seats but I saw many that did not  raise and they did not get  asked to raise  seats All other Asian airlines come  in and say when they are serving meals to raise seats.

I flew Glasgow-Gatwick-Vegas-Gatwick-Glasgow. I have flown  this way before as I get to put my baggage on at Glasgow and forget about it. Glasgow-Gatwick no real comment other than cabin crew don't do much more than the minimum. Flew Premium Economy on  a 777-200 flight  half full. Premium cabin is cramped and a fair distance away from  The Toilets as you are not allowed to use the toilets at  up front again cabin crew do no more than  the minimum food just about acceptable. Return flight of  very same standard they kept trying  too say I was booked back  in Edinburgh took them an age  to sort this out breakfast is a bit of a joke have  learnt when flying  is that its  ok to carry  on as they  can over feed you.
