Of course  once I got  over to Gatwick I ran into the French ATC control strike no  apologies made. After having to hang around Gatwick all  morning I finally got a flight to Glasgow at 8pm at least my luggage arrived well done to BA there. When I made a  request to BA customer service I  was told by them that my flight(s) had been cancelled due to Aircraft unserviceability when I queried this the respondent confirmed that aircraft u/s  can offer no  explanation as to why I was told different. I 'd like to  say BA but Virgin totally beat them hands down.

Welcome to London Gatwick on Avios companion ticket. Fantastic cabin crew -  relaxed yet professional - good and tasty choice of food and very nice selection of  beverages After a few less than satisfactory BA experiences of late this one proved that  BA can deliver a top quality product.

LHR-YVR-LHR. Flew in  from First on  the shabby 744  which was nothing like First was displayed on the  recent documentary about . Squeezing so  few passengers into the nose of  a 744 is a joke. The  crew both ways  is excellent and  tended to the  many empty cabins with great attention  in detail. OB  used the old  BA crew and  it was a  nice mixed fleet crew not normal on this route.  Flying from LHR  seemed palatable and  even YVR was  great On the  return leg the  engine was faulty.  The fast track OB was a free for all  so we were  being fed to  the aircraft on  exactly how it  would be. I  think the BBC  really hurt BA  or First passengers  with their expectations  compared to abnormal  service only to  be let down by an average product on very tired equipment not  being shown on . We were generally happy due  to the fact , I used  BA and an  airline voucher for  the flight if  we would have paid for the flights then it would have been  cheaper and would  have chosen Air Canada. BA really  did need to  roll out their  old equipment sooner  rather than later  and more premium  travellers opt for  budget carriers especially  for the middle  east and far  eastern routes. We  would continue to use BA due  of the Avios rewards which demands  money for financial  reasons I could not recommend for  anyone having to  opt for either CW or First.

BA026 7th July  2014 66B. Arrived  late off a  direct CX flight  and able to  use the QF lounge close to  departure gate at HKIA boarding very  well and was upgraded to WT+ at the gate  this was welcome  after travelling from London to Malaysia  & back over  4 days. I  liked the A380  with quiet seats  and very comfortable  on WT+ this being my 5th  time on BA's  I departed on  the IFE was  ok however crew  provided food not  the best on  a flight I  had TG between  the BKK and  Singapore 2 days earlier in economy and the food  and crew were  happy will continue  using BA for  comfort but tempted  may use the Star Alliance again  in future.

Flying from Aberdeen to Toronto via LHR. On board  our new 787s on this route  one can really notice the difference  which they make  over the 777. No drying of the eyes or popping of the  tongue thanks to the good air . Although a  bit cramped in economy on the outbound journey I was able to secure a bulkhead  berth on the  way back. I would definitely recommend  economy as value for money over  economy Just buy the economy ticket and pay to have a front row seat (there is more leg room and the same service from  one I saw). The small commuter plane from ABZ to LHR and  Toronto was starting to feel pretty old and tired by comparison to  a 787 however  the cabin crew  do a great  work shoehorning in  a full meal  plan in less  then an hour.

Great return. Out on B737 back on A319 both flights almost full.80 minute delay leaving Gatwick due to French ATC strike not airlines fault. Going out no problems hand baggage only checked in online. Return a different matter unable to check in  again and no  room service machines at Jersey Flybe have at least  1 Check in opened over half an hour after  boarding time when  a sullen agent appeared eating an apple and carrying a newspaper. She then managed to seat by wife and I in middle seats in  middle rows. Customer service at Jersey shows B.A. in  very bad light. The flights were fine beer and snack both ways on a 30 minute leg.

Flew BA 025 B to Hong Kong in First  class seated in 1A July 2nd 2014. Great flight great service and cabin crew were excellent. I have flown this sector many times and  it is one  of best flights that I have  done on BA.

Live from OZ  to watch start  of TDF in  London BA cancelled  BA flight 1340 X the day before due to staff issues and  switched me to a 13.50 flight , then expected me to get  onto the 15.30 same day return  in London. Very poor and lame . To make  it worse will  not refund return  ticket of same day as on separate booking. Amazed  such a big  airline can't manage something as simple  as staff rosters  to ensure customers could get to Leeds to see  a start of  their 2014 TDF.  Truly a disaster.

Off with my  host sister and  sister inlaw to  London via Heathrow.  Really long flight  and everyone kept  thanking me when  i told them  where we were  flying Decided to upgrade to Premium  Economy and thanks  to our travel  agent got a  great deal. Several  weeks ago I  had put off  by flying British  Airways so thought  I give them another go. Wasn't  expecting all flights  were good considering  I flew straight  up to Rome  but felt pretty  good at the  time of 30 hours in the  airport The Premium  Class seats had  loads of leg  space on all  but 2 bags per person even  the flight from  Manchester to Gatwick  which we were  really grateful for.  Must say the  meal was anything  to rave about.  If the food  you are eating  had been on  the plane as long as you  have it really  must be good.  Overall the flights  had really good  every time easy  transfer of bags , the only  problem is having  them pay for the allocation of  extra seats. Apparently  it is now  in practice. Just  be upfront about  things that's all.  Ill defiantly investigate  it again though.

Flying YYZ to  LA on 1st  flight Booked WT+ but was upgraded  from Club World  and the gate  and went some  further to compensate  with the awful  return flight (see  previous review). Fabulous  crew very attentive  and attendants decent  service (although the  toilet was a  little dry) excellent . Only slight  downside was that  Boeing 777 is  a noisy aircraft  especially sitting near  the front. Overall  it was BA  doing its best.

From BA 293 B772ER Club World.  Sold fairly quickly  from the T5  Business Class counter due to Gold Tier status. Security  was average despite  fast Track. First  class Lounge food good and the  media centre worked well. Boarding efficient  and Fast Track.  Got the C 1 gate on  time Staff reasonably  accommodating and friendly throughout the flight.  The latest Elemis  laptop bag is  a bad joke!  The food is  actually quite disappointing  and inconsistent with  my pasta meal  being quite dry.  Drink and beverage choice good. The  very old CW seat is in  serious need of a competitive replacement.  Six across in  length is pathetic.  The seamless seat  by itself is  very comfortable though the foot rest  will not work  correctly when combining  these two to  form a bed.  If reduced to  two across in  length there will  have more room  in the storage of small items  especially during the  day and much  better shoulder elbow  or hip room. Thankfully I did not have to  trip over anyone's  shoulder from my  window seat as  my aisle seat was unoccupied. Baggage  is awaiting my  return after clearing  it at IAD.  Was a reasonably pleasant flight but it is sad  too see how  the BA CW  seating has declined so much over  this past 15 . I am  a very loyal  CW customer and  intend to remain  patient for now.

Having paid top  price for Club Europe and upon leaving the UK we thought it  as well worth  paying as great  easy check in fast track immigration and lovely lounge. Once on plane saw a number of economy passengers  putting their hand luggage up in  the open lockers above the Club Europe passengers which we feel should be policed as the late arrivals of the Club Europe passengers had no room to put their hand . Service and  service were average  and really not worth the extra money especially once we got to Rome when all the Club Europe Passengers luggage was last off we  lost close to 30 minutes. Hopefully  Italian Airways will sort out the Rome baggage handlers. Flying them again next week we hope for a better experience.

London - LHR. I love BA but sometimes they have an off-day and this was one of them. Crew not ready  for passengers boarding  and some still  without their crew ! Pre-flight everything seemed rushed with no newspapers or  toilet kits offered.  Cabin itself was fine and food  looked good. Landing  at LHR we were parked remotely. My husband had  requested assistance and we were told  to wait until all the other  people had disembarked  which took 20 minutes) only to  return to join a bus with  no help at  hand Needless to say no one 's hand inside  it and only by flagging down  one passing buggy  do we manage  and get to Border Control. Just not great.

Flew from LHR to YYZ on 23 June on new 787. Not impressed. Very bumpy taxiing. Smooth inflight but I couldn't really notice the  low cabin pressure or humidity that is supposed to  be so wonderful. I was seated in a window seat. Flight completely spoilt by massive 130 kg passenger seated in middle seat - he could not fit between the armrests and needed help from both myself and passenger in aisle seat to even fasten his seatbelt. This is unacceptable especially since  he paid £30 extra to choose my seat! Cabin crew friendly and  helpful though why  I didn't notice the situation with my huge fellow passenger and do something about it I don't know - safety issue  if nothing else. Otherwise flight OK.

Just flew AMS-LGW-MCO and JFK-LHR-AMS this month. Overall is was an acceptable  flight Food and  did the normal airline stuff. Staff were good and  greeted us often. I only found the seats very unpleasant.

World Traveller Plus from Beijing to London LHR. Old  & tired 747-400 B planes really should be pensioned off now. The cabin was freezing with everyone wrapped  with blankets for the whole flight. Complaints to the  ground crew just  received a "sorry  I have no control over the  ambient temperature" response.  Every meal ordered was given to  somebody else by mistake so I had to have  it Video screen is tiny on these planes - not that it  helped as the system wasn't working properly so I  cannot watch any films. Pretty poor  for a 9.5  hr flight. Sound system for communicating with passengers was  badly distorted so it was impossible  to understand any announcements from flight- deck or cabin crew apart from a little bit of extra leg  so I've no  clue what extra money for World  Trave Plus is  supposed to be for.

Wednesday 26th June.  BA Europe. BA  profits are slipping.  Paris Galleries Lounges  seem a shadow  to their former selves. In the  latest round of  cuts a famous  British broadsheet newspaper  has been axed , food offerings  disappointing and sub-standard  and a lack of attention to  service tables. However , on-board service  seems to be  at a high  standard and the  A 321 clean and tidy with  a helpful cabin . Flight was  hampered by a lack of bags  found on the  aircraft due to an IT breakdown  in T5 which  caused a long  look at CPH  baggage dept. for  the missing bags.

Flight LHR to  HK Kong on  22 May. Was really looking forward  on flying in  a new A380  and for some  reason the plane  got swapped on  that day for  an B777. Flight  left about 25 minutes late but arrived 20 minutes  later into HK.  On boarding I  had to swap  places with a  passenger who had  been seated separately  to her husband.  We ordered a  nice meal I  let one of the cabin crew  mates that I'd  changed seats. When  my meal was  finished I got  warned off very  quickly by one  of the cabin  crew for moving  me without telling  them - even  when I had.  After I could explain my meal  were dumped in  my lap and  I flounced off.  It was ok. Cabin crew smiles  seemed forced. Serve  you meal turn out the lights , disappear for 9 hours seemed to be the  talk of the  trip No way  this World Traveller  was worth the  wasted money.

Flew LHR to  Paris and return 22nd April and 29th April in Club Europe. I had high hopes for Business class albeit shortish haul but was somewhat  disappointed Legroom not  exactly what I  want from Business . 34 inches is hardly room  to stretch out. The service was  decent but the choice of food was limited and  certainly not what I expect from  a business class experience. As for inflight entertainment? Oh dear. On a  24 hour flight I expect so  many better old  with one film  option only. If you didn't like the film tough. All in all I will not rush to pay the extra.

Flying in "first"  mode The experience  was really a step back in  time Having arrived  in London on JAL after an  amazing experience in  a 777 first  class I had  high expectations of  a premiere flight in BA first.  Needless to say  that won't be ! Whose idea  is it to jam 14 seats  onto a space that quality airlines  fill with 6  to 8 seats?  This crowded ugly  and lacks privacy.  This whole cabin - and this  particular 'new' first  you might add  - feels pretty  empty and is  definitely showing signs  of wear and  wear The seat itself is narrow , displeasing. Crew were cheerful and  polite but the  experience would be  in business class  seats on world  Class airlines. That  summed it up really - BA  has simply not  producing a world-class  airline I can't  understand why anyone  should put down  the money they charge for first  class unless there 's no high-profile  African or Middle  East alternative available , even then  I probably go  outside of my  pocket to avoid  it I suggest that BA product  representatives might want  a go on  their world tour  to Abu Dhabi  and Hong Kong  or Singapore and try out the  service because it's plainly evident that they either have no ideas or  simply don't care. There is apparently a "new new" first class planned  in the 787-9 when it enters  negotiations with BA  and I sincerely hope that both  BA hard and soft products will  be worthy of  being branded "first ."

I had flight from Vancouver to  Toronto and back , aisle seat  was prepaid for  was changed to  another aisle seat  that put me  right near the  back where I  really didn't want to be. What's the point of  picking a seat  anyway and prepaying for it and  still they change  it with no . Entertainment system  - ok but  airline food (if  one can call  them that) was  terrible - chicken  wings or pasta  - just curry  - they ran out of pasta  which left people  have no choice.  We had better  experience on charter airlines - never again.

London Gatwick to  London on Avios ' ticket. Flight  booked and arrived on time. Surprisingly  limited choice and  variety of food  or wine. Entertainment  was somewhat limited in choice. Cabin  lines were pretty . Generally slow  response in responding to the call </s>

LHR-PEK-LHR. We travel  the club world often and my  initial impression is  pretty good. Yes , the attitude  of the staff  can be not up to expectations  or the food  is comparable with some of the  budget airlines but  The price you pay for a business class seat with BA is  reasonable And for me a flat bed on an overnight flight is  not matters the  least Contrary to general recommendations when I travel with a companion I  like the middle seats on the main deck and not the upper deck because by  avoiding the screen  I can have  my own little  private cabin. And if the flight is not full is so much better than the  cramped upper deck. Strongly recommended for  a discounted ticket.

London - BKK Premium economy 19/6/14. I always travel  in Air business but this time I had to  book into BKK early having been told by many that BA Business  is at best rubbish I decided to save some cash and go P/Economy seat no: 14A remarks on flight seating at  BA ok service seemed tired but the real downer was the food the plane was  nowhere near full but by the time they got to me most of the food  were gone and I was left with some sort  of pasta dish - totally inedible. I must admit  we didn't put anything near my  face just pressed one of the pasta flutes - cold dry and  so I was given a pat ty butter type stuff alas nothing to spread it on bread wise , it was put there to  grease the runners on the seat.  Both G&T were served once choice  of coffee or tea with second course at least I did get  my pick had tea a very hard type of  tea thing egg sausage mushroom was the so called dish - again poor. The only redeeming factors were I didn't go business class as the seats dated back to the eighties in a 2/4/2 configuration unlike  our 1/2/1 lie flat and we  were 20 minutes early.

Having taken several  BA flights to  London Heathrow and  then to Newcastle  I can understand  how BA have  now announced extra  passengers on this . All flights  cancelled yet all  due to cabin crews who managed  and supply a full trolley service.  BA and cabin crews all to a high standard  and service with  lots of meaningful  service Can't praise  that

We flown with  us several times over past few years mostly economy  or on holiday through travel agents. Aircraft's vary from a bit shabby with little space to sometimes a  bit bigger and newer with a  lot more space.  Not always efficient and polite. The  only main flaw is the snack  food offering -  these awful wraps  they are like  stone cold cardboard. We don't need a 3 course  full meal but eg a granary bread sandwich [with  some veggie filling  for us] would  be preferable to  these dreaded wraps  which we do not eat which  have such a  mess

Letter to VIE : 704 23  July 2014. The  cabin service in  The Traveller is  poor as are  all customer service  standards of the  new Mixed Fleet , The food  choice was inedible  the choice of  Chicken Bread with  Chicken Tikka or  Caesar Salad. Do British Airways not  understand that not  all likes Curry  with spicy food. At least do  the offering of  Chips or Cheese  Salad to make the selection a  little better in  view of the  prices passengers have paid. As for  the cabin crew  the new Mixed Fleet with their  white Hats are  far inferior compared  with the cabin  staff on the  BA contracts. At  best experienced cabin  crews would sort something out in  their galley to  at least compensate  for the lack  or food choice  even if it  was cheese and  bread This crew  would not offer  drinks and were  said to be  served once they  ate their meal , I would  of expected for a two hour  meal they would  very least walk  around the cabin  a few times  for more drinks  but the only  reason they came  back was to  put away the  food which many  others around me  have left and  never touched and  then do the  Duty Free. I  visited British Airways  every week and  it is the  worst crew I  have known. I think the Mixed  Boat Crew are  lacking in their customer service standards  they can certainly learn a lot  of their more  experienced colleagues who  were on the  previous contracts so  now on BA  trying to bring  up the high  expectations again the  current Mixed Fleet  crew are letting  us down very badly.

Flight from LHR to Hong Kong  Feb 13th 2014 BA 25 and  30 flight took  around 1 hour ! Therefore as  we had an  onward connection to Jakarta with limited  time to get  that connection I asked on board  some help with  issuing my onwards boarding card to  Jakarta as BA  to Belfast refused to issue me  onward boarding card.  The CSD was  never seen nor did he even  try to speak  to me even though I am GGL member. The  only help I  got was from  another of the Hong Kong based air stewardesses who  went out of  London to help ! Without her  help I would  have missed my  flight to Jakarta.  Overall not impressed by the service.  I made a  call up compliant  and never received  another response.

I flew from  Vegas to Heathrow and then on to JFK and returned from Las  Vegas The flights in the UK were fine but the flight to  LA and from Vegas to Heathrow  was terrible the seats were narrow and the food  looked disgusting both .

The BA 202  flight to Heathrow.  The B747 version  - We were  seated in PE.  My cabin was  quiet and not  cramped so we  have plenty of  space The cabin  staff were very  helpful and spoke  of all the  people in our  room Service after  taking off was very quick and  friendly the food  is very good  but not hurried  allowing us 3.5  hrs to sleep.  My seats were  very comfortable and  our extra space  is appreciated. My  only complaint is  my TV monitor  is faulty and  was a black  streak down the  screen It was  never an issue  as I was planning to sleep  more than watch  another movie. The  flight was quieter  for economy as  it was at  the front of  a plane and  we had a good 3 hours ! The Flight  attendants were offering  wifi throughout the  flight which was  great The breakfast  was a croissant  in a box  that I found  was bit of  a disappointment. Overall , would fly  in Premium Economy !

Just travelled Cancun  with LGW in  business class. To  that point I  dont think the  cabin was as  nice as Virgin  Air Emirates who  we normally use.  Cabin staff were  friendly although I  am surprised there  were no lounge  staff at all  when we got  charged USD 22 k for the  night in the . Cabin crew  were not particularly  helpful or helpful.  Dinner and wine/drinks  were nice although  our crew had  often be prompted  to serve drinks  right after dinner.  Weight and space  was ok although  seating on seat  is as good  at Emirates or . My friend  had no direct  connection to aisle  and had to  stand over another  4 legs. Breakfast : sub standard.

I was excited to fly on the new A380 with the new  seat We sat  at 14j and 14k. When we  got seated we were offered champagne and we organized our belongings quickly. I sat down got out my magazine and asked the flight attendant  how to operate the light and  then apologized that  our seats had  low power and they have been working on it.  Finally after about ten minutes the door closed and the plane pushed off and I  apologized again about the issue and she said the  crew was working on it. The  power never came on during the  four hour flight.  I had no lights no entertainment no seat adjustments. I not given  the opportunity to deboard when they knew of this problem or to  take another flight. This is not how you treat  any business club  member or any  customer I was told I would be contacted by  their representative but that did not .

Club World–LGW to  a week later  back to LHR.  After check in  fast and easy  crew member came  out and pointed  you through Fast Track and gave lounge instructions. Lounge  was offering very  little compared to  BA made do . Marmite on  toast and lots of Champagne! In celebratory mood as  expected for a 30th cabin crew  was fantastic the  champagne kept flowing , never a rolled eye or  a surly attitude  to the crew. Managed 4/5 hours ' nap. Upgraded  from home bound to CW through  customs 24hrs before  bags even bagged  off deck. An  all night flight  back on time.  I always found  my crew fantastic  in pre departure  drinks and mixed fleet seemed genuinely flying to serve. Only downside was  a terrible dinner - starter and  a dreadful steak  was not much better. Requested tray  and taken away  so skip dessert.  Sat and slept  well and got  back 6 hours  later for a  cinnamon roll. Landed  in LHR on  Sunday through security four bags collected  one out of  20 in 25  minutes Club World and Heathrow fantastic when it goes well. Apart from  snacks and beverage  was a definite 10/10. Will be  one very sad day when the  airlines retire UD  the A380 far  to cramped.

Best EDI lounge  - Flight to  airport on time food decent attentive crew. North lounge at T5 much  nicer than chaotic South lounge. Flight to FCO by  air cabin 767  and upgraded using avios - fully flat beds great  service superb food  plus wine. Lounge  from FCO okay  but not great.  Was delayed at  night due to  rain at LHR so ample time to use the  flat beds watch a film and  eat FA excellent  food very good ! Overall the  staff and service  is superb.

From Heathrow to Singapore. Brand New  Hotel very comfortable very clean. Entertainment  very good and food tasty but  in small portions. Staff functional but  very friendly only one water run  for 13 hours.  Starts early so  cant complain. Better  on Qantas flight  direct to Brisbane.

Flew LHR-CPT-LHR as British Airways is only carrier flying direct London to Cape Town. Outward flight due to leave 21.30 delayed by nearly 3  minutes and the communication at the  departures lounge was  having lots of  frustrated passengers at the lack of information being given ! Fell asleep  but finally got on board only to be woken  1 hour later to be given my "special meal" which I hadn't requested. Told stewardess it was not for me and she rather huffily took it away.  When the trolley  going round with  their regular meals i was not offered one - this suited me as I don't  mind eating at 1 o'clock in the morning but thought it rather  odd of them  to ignore me. Return flight was on time but had passenger from hell next to me who was too large for the very narrow economy seats so I spent the night sitting at an angle as it was impossible to sit straight with Mrs Large spilling over onto my seat. Well done to the stewardess who put up with her obnoxious behaviour with a long suffering smile.

London Gatwick to  Florida No surprises  to guess that  as our original  ticket to Tampa  is cancelled this is not a  full review. Due  of a technical problem with our plane our flight  is cancelled. After  found out from  fellow passengers in  our terminal that  the flight was  canceled we were marched back through  an airport to  queue for our  flight to queue  and go back  through immigration to queue for our  luggage to be  released onto the  automated system for  no unexplained reason.  What an insult  you have to  sit in line  3 times for  over 3 hours.  No extra staff  no positive explanations  no apologies no  good service only  the lie of a promise of  a special flight  to following day to our original  departure (which did not happen) and  very inadequate vouchers  of food and drinks. After accepting  why our flight  is cancelled and  then accepting the fact we would  be travelling the  same day BA then just drop  this email to all passengers to  inform them what  arrangements had really  had made. Our first arrangement was  a flight 24 hours after our  scheduled departure time  from Heathrow to  London to Tampa.  I did not book our direct flight by accident  Why on earth  how would we  take a flight with a stop over. I declined this arrangement for  our flight instead  from Orlando. A  bigger busier flight  and bigger busier  and time consuming  and a 3 hour drive from  our holiday destination.  Orlando arrived 32  minutes later than our original arrival  time and therefore  lost a day  and a half  into our holiday.  to add further  insult on our return flight the extra leg room  that we paid  extra for not  coming to us!  The claustrophobic seating cheap microwave style , cheap wine , and a  lack of money.

BA Europe -  very premium -  had the misfortune  of seat 1f  is normally a  good seat in  Eastern Europe -  only for a 4 hour flight ) to ACE - cramped (not  quite as bad as the rest  of CE with  BA - not advertised - 30  inch rather than  24 inch seat  height - no  padding just a wall. Add to  it limited luggage  and think its  better with middle  seats free for £600 more. Is  that worth it ? no thinking avoid BA CE  altogether - shame  only a few  people to suffer yet. Purser -  this is it now - get  used to it"  poor service downhill ."

We travelled to  London from Europe  flying business class  on a two week Mediterranean cruise.  We upgraded to  economy for the  extra benefit of sleep. My first impression is that  this fleet is  expensive and not very well kept. The seats were uncomfortable the cabin was dirty and  people were surly.  Our food as  expected on any  airline was adequate though nothing to  rave about (take advantage of the scones and clotted  cream - their  one saving grace). Upon our return  I awaited in London Heathrow Terminal 5 for them  finally put the  date on our flight. It finally  arrived 20 minutes before the flight  but it showed we were in satellite C - it took us over 15 minutes  to get there  and have the  flight agent tell us we should have been there earlier. She did  let us so we thought at least that was  the perk. Well I am here  to tell all  you don't pay  your money. There 's little to  NO difference in first class. The seats are just as uncomfortable the food was the same and I  always felt like  flying second class  - This time I think it  was because were  the upgrade so  they were always  at last and  had little selection/choice. To tell you the truth if  you had paid  for this upgrade  I would have  gotten upset as I don't believe this is up  to par. We also did a  connecting flight from  Malta to London  on the Saturday. The airport was a disaster (3 cruise ships all flying out the same time) no  response from the  airlines and very little help. When we got on the other side of the check in the multi-million  euro duty free area was amazing but really they should have taken  advantage of the  staff to deal with the check in area. Upon moving through security we were kept in the dungeon  section of the airport to wait with tepid air  quality while our  plane was delayed with no explanation.  Once we were  finally boarded we  were told by the captain that  the delay was due to thunderstorms and we were  just going to  continue to wait. The last part is not fully BA's fault (they don't design the airports or determine  their closure) however their agents did  attempt to make it better either  through having people out to direct  us or give  them updates). All  and all I don't believe I 'll ever fly  BA again -  it is unfortunate  as they used  and set the  toilets - now  they are barely  cleaning up the floor (wish they  could - at least it may have been cleaner).

Paphos - LGW  in June. We had monitored the  return flight on the internet so  I knew it was about an  hours late although  I did not receive a text from BA to  confirm this. We  arrive at Paphos  Airport to a  very chaotic scene , the queue for security was snaking back around  the complete length  around the check  in area and ultimately merging with the passengers looking  up and waiting to check in with a number of different airlines.  BA had 3  checking in counters open one of  which was for Club Europe with  around eight couples queuing for each one. We had  signed in online  but still had to drop the  luggage off and receive our boarding passes and this took approx 20  minutes I then asked where the fast track through security was what  an stupid question that was as  apparently there wasn't one. After 45  minutes in the  airport we finally  found it to  a shared lounge and settled down  to a glass of wine or  two The food  choices were OK but again not  the great choice  of veggies. The flight home left  only 45 minutes late and was  fairly uneventful with  very relaxed cabin crew. We were  off the plane quickly but then had to wait for around 45  seconds for the  luggage to arrive  from the carousel although fortunately ours soon came through. Overall just an OK flight but BA's premier European product is somewhat  lacking

Off to LHR  and club world  from seat 3E and 3F on  the 12th. We  give BA a  LOT and the  flights can be a bit hit and miss but  every flight has  had our best  one ever with BA great food  and plenty of it nice choice  in wine well  equipped club kitchen  and snacks but it was the crew that made  this flight outstanding , from the  crew a real  testament to BA.

Just travelled LHR  via San Francisco and returned via  a Vegas flight . Some years  ago doing long  trips and forget  how tiring it  would be. Flight  there was 'ok' but return not  so Outbound spoilt  after an hour  or so delay  once boarded as  someone decided to  use one of  his wheels glad  they did though.  Travel yesterday not  as good as  flight again delayed  at about one  an a half  hrs but no real explanation. I realise people want  more sleep but  people can be so inconsiderate at . No sooner  had their seats  not fully reclined. Meal was just  plain curried chicken  and breakfast of a very hard  cookie with jam , nutty bar  and dried cranberries . coffee was  not what I 'd wanted after  my delayed 9 pm flight. Entertainment  made good choices , sound quality  very poor. Boarding  experience in Las as was rather shambolic. Will still  go and 'fly  the flag' again.

LHR-Belfast-LHR over a  mile Ground staff , flight attendants  very professional and  informative Excellent announcements  to the cockpit  relating to weather related delay outbound.  Cabin on board A319 very comfortable.  Can save a  bundle by eliminating  travel with beverages?  Quite cheap indeed.  Our 55 minute  trip both ways  passed quickly. Generous  cold drinks and  light snacks were  provided (try the  lower cost competitors).  It is ideal  for short haul  flights within the  Caribbean and to/from  continental Europe.

I flew LHR-YVR outwards 20th May 2014 on 747. The cabin newly fitted and no problems on return  on 10th June 2014 we were greeted with old style fittings. The  new cabin was  very shabby and the seats were damaged and the  seating set was  missing as the picture was so  bad Even the staff apologised for  the state of  the cabin and  cabin so if it is so bad why do  they sell these seats. I would be unlikely to  travel 1st class again with BA unless they would  guarantee that the  aircraft would have the updated seats and cabin.

LGW - Paphos 4th June. Check  out and fast track security was very easy and we were airside within 5 minutes. As we were flying at 2.45 we decided to have some lunch in the lounge. The lounge was busy but there  is still plenty  more space to relax. The food options were poor to say the least with soup sandwiches or ham salad being the only items on offer. My wife who is a vegetarian was not impressed as she had to make do with an egg mayonnaise sandwich. Having been told when we checked in that the flight was 'bang on time' the screen informed us at 2.05 that we should proceed to gate 101.  With a 10 minute stroll we arrived at the gate to be told there was a delay to the flight. Why on earth this information could not  have been passed through to the lounge is a mystery. No pre flight drinks were offered and we eventually took off about an hour late. Pre lunch drinks were served  for 40 minutes and then lunch about 30 minutes  following that. The  staff were very nice but rather  stressed and mentioned that the plane (737-400) should not  had been used on this route. My wife had pre ordered a veggie meal that was not loaded on the plane but the very  friendly but stressed  lady said she could have hers. It was a nice gesture but my wife felt slightly guilty about  ordering it although she did and enjoyed her meal. I was told that there was only one option left for me and I could have Kedgeree or Kedgeree so that's what I had. It was OK but not particularly  good Arrived at Paphos about 45 mins late with our priority luggage being in the last 6 cases to arrive on the carousel. Overall the flight was just OK although if it had not been for  the excellent cabin crew it would  have been disappointing. My wife did receive an email from BA within 2 days of our arrival saying they had let her down with the non arrival of her pre ordered food on this flight and apologised which is  good enough.

Business class from Shanghai to London. It was the worst business class. Staff give the impression that they are above service and I did not feel that  people were courteous or polite. On one occasion I  went for a  bottle of champagne and never got one on another occasion when I dropped my fork for the meal  he buzzed for another one no  one came when I tried to grab the attention of the staff  by walking past he said sorry sir I'll be right with you  he never came. Eventually I just  went to the back and grabbed  it I would never fly BA again for the money you pay you can get  much better business class and value from other airlines.

LHR-EWR rtn econ/premium.  A good experience  as usual with BA. Having gone through the highly  upgraded T5 it was all aboard  a 2 week old Dreamliner for the 7 hour  domestic flight. Seats pretty comfortable for  me and new  sound system very good indeed. Return in premium economy wasn't bad at  all comfortable enough  for sleep the  remainder of the  first flight. Cabin crew professional and attentive in both ! Will be  reviewing the service again next month.

BA11 LHR-SIN 11 June. This flight  and the reciprocal one from Singapore to London in  over a month  we have restored  your faith in  BA The aircraft  was clean and  in good condition; seats were comfortable staff were unfailingly attentive friendly polite , efficient. Meals  was of a good standard toilets  were clean and properly maintained throughout the flight. Boarding and disembarking were seamless from BA's side. One of  the best flights  we have had for years on many different carriers.

Welcome to DXB , Jun 14 Club World Upper  Deck 64A -  Great flight slight delay of ten  mins but excellent  service on the  flight deck. Food choice is excellent , service as  well of a  pretty high standard.  Nothing too sure  about the new  hand bags large  black string bag  has minimal contents , wash bags  get bigger but  some contents get  smaller Nothing really  new in the  washing bag not  the eye masks  and ear plugs.  My contents would  include mouth wash  face wipes etc . is about  all BA looked  at returning to  the Brown which  is a lot  higher than the  new range. Otherwise  another great flight  aided by special  staff on arrival  by DXB who  put me through  Immigration and Customs  in 20 mins  after landing which  exceeded all expectations.

Flew from Edinburgh to New York via LHR on 5th and 10 June. All flights  where very full but the service from check in  back on board were very good. My only complaint  was the breakfast  on the return flight a croissant , and tea  or coffee which was very disappointing.

Fly BA 175 12/5/14. Return BA  170 1/6/14. Recently  left economy on long haul to  Boston and returned  in San Francisco having previously done  short haul with . BA knocks  it into a cocked hat. Love BA. Keep flying  the flag!

OSL-LHR June 8th.  4 days after arriving I departed still less my check-in bag from June 6th. Flight delayed this is more often than  expected on most  international flights I ve been on.  Lunch offered in economy same Chicken Tikka sandwich or bean salad as  offered on last 3 flights in a week on  both routes. I  much rather have the option to  bring something I might want to eat. Cabin crew Brilliant nearly always are but its not just about  the crew service but it's the only reason they  have any customers.

Jet 213 LHR , Boston. T5  and very busy but check in was fast and efficient. The flight was on a  Saturday the aircraft was clean but looking dated. We were seated to  one rear of  our aircraft. The food choice was  small but both  meals had curried  rice fine if  they like curry  and limiting if you don't. Lucky  to us there was still a choice. My TV was broken so  I had a  good 6.5 hours. The flight crew were very helpful and happy.

Glasgow to LHR on a completely  normal flight. The  passengers were amazing despite being provoked  from an extremely  rude lady who  were sitting at  an emergency exit seat they remained calm and professional despite her rude and obnoxious comments. Departed on time and landed early  which is always  appreciated

On both A320s.  Other than bussed to stand on  an outward all was very good. The bus is  located at a  different terminal but  a warmth of the welcome from  my crew cheered you up a . Simple and  light flatbread and  sandwiches ideal for  the 1.45 journey. The return was  a tad delayed due local ATC  and even though only 10 mins , so the flight deck kept us very well  supplied and the crew came round  for juice or  tea Delay was made up enroute  the bag appeared  when I reached  baggage carousel. Advance  booking and using  the few points (some I earned ) on this  journey made the  journey cheaper than  low cost carriers.  After BA renewing  the fleet the  journey seemed almost  perfect and all very enjoyable.
The Fiumicino - LHR Jun 1st  - Airbus 321. Great staff food  was poor I  would have been  willing to pay  more a better option.

Reviewed June 8th.  Four days after  arriving I departed  much less my check-in bag from  June 6th. Flight  selection this is  more often than  not on most BA flights I ve been on.  Nothing offered in economy same Chicken  Salad sandwich or  Caesar salad as  offered on last  two flights in a week on  all routes. I 'd rather have the option to buy something I  really want to  eat Cabin crew Brilliant nearly always are but its not just about  cabin crew service ; it's the  only reason they have any customers.

My outward trip  between - Heathrow  - Milan was  smooth with even a guide to  direct us to  a connection at LHR Terminal 5. The return trip  from - Heathrow  - Manchester was  not so good.  the system would  only let me  go online and  even being the first in the queue at airport check-in we had  already been allocated  seats right at the back (we discovered on boarding  but no plan  or explanation given  during check-in) with  the recline. Both  trips were late  arriving at Heathrow especially the communication  was poor: at  one point the  pilot said 'Please wait' then there was a 'last ', even though  the gate had  never yet opened;  security staff seemed  confused at the  airport no explanation or apology were  provided unless they were in the  flight announcement but  I doubt it  as it was  very short. Having  landed at Munich  airport check in  was 1.30pm we  only got to  Munich at 9pm , too late  so the pilot  picked up some  of the lost  luggage (all excellent pilots by the ). But during  this time the  main refreshments were  one small packet  of crisps and  a drink twice. Not impressive although  most staff on  board were friendly  and polite.

Welcome to DXB : Outbound flight  was 2 hours  early as well  and it took over an hour to clear security.  Economy lounge quiet  good food and  beverage Jumbo on  way out new interior new and  improved good entertainment  and attentive crew food as usual  - - (recommend  to always eat  in the airport which given cost  per flight one really shouldn't have .) Inbound flight  is a 777.  As on way  out as on  way in except  arriving on time  I must commend  our crew members for their endless  service with one  heck of a  777

We just flew round trip on the new A380 from LAX to LHR (and then  on to Rome).  Their A380 business class area was nice and the food was decent. However the layout of the seats  was great (you have to jump  on the person  next to you when they have  a seat in a flat position). Also avoid the aisle seats as  you feel like  sitting out in  the open and  they are constantly  walking by. As  well the seats  in the aisle have zero storage space so you are constantly getting up to get things out of the storage bin above you or losing them under  your seat. The BA lounge in LAX was ok  to great (although the food was decent) and their  VIP Lounge in  the Terminal 5 was just ok - very busy and crammed with people. Nowhere to  relax and enjoy  the downtime. The  service was the  best we've ever  experienced in a lounge (only things  really were horrible  - sandwiches a  couple cookies and  chips Since LHR is the hub  for BA we expected way more.  But our biggest issue was with the staff on  ALL the flights. They were highly  lacking in quality. Some were very  nice and helpful  but were beyond rude. I had read that British  Airlines now has a new system  and the same staff does not do the same  job on a  consistent basis. There  is apparently a lot of "floaters" who come and  sit and work different flights by ). To me this seems like a big mistake , most likely  explains the huge discrepancy in service.  My flight home was an hour late (BA seems  to be late  A lot based on the many reviews). They also  managed to lose  all of our  business We travel  very lot and will no longer  fly British Airways as it's too much of a "Russian Roulette" as  on whether your  flight will be  delayed or not.

We travelled Club Europe from Gatwick to Paphos as we were going out to get  married The extra  space was handy  thanks to the  flights and all the extras that we needed to  pack but we  should have paid  for the extra space at much less a cost.  Because it was our wedding we decided to treat ourselves and go  out full hog so spent nearly £1000 extra on  club Europe seats  just to get a really good experience. Check in  went quick and  simple but there  were no queue  at the normal check in either  but we didn't really benefit from that. The lounge was nothing particularly  bad although we didn't get there with much time to spare so that was more our fault. We  was let on  to plane first through the front  door the plane the problem was that the rest of the passengers also came through  the same door  going through the  Clubs Europe section  and to be able to put  our bags up into the compartment I had to  stand by my  side until the  first plane had boarded. The seating then was just a row of 3 seats with the middle seat blocked off so although there was "extra room" it wasn't what I'd have expected. Our bags were marked as priority with  numbered tags but came out with  every rest of the luggage. I don't know if  anyone went in expecting more than  we should have but for the extra money we  spent I think we were entitled to have higher expectations. Not an  easy way to start our wedding !! We'd never  do Club Europe again it was  the complete waste of money so hopefully others will read this and save the money to spend on  they rest of the holiday!

LHR-ATH-LHR outbound 6th June. Check in and lounge good as normal at T5' boarding done by bus which I always find odd at the  time hub seat  but on an A320 I like BA's club Europe and this flight was no different.  Very happy crew and the food English breakfast was pretty good flight arrived on time  and off quickly. Return 9th June  checked in at ATH airport quick and polite used  the lounge which is ok but pretty full with 2 flights leaving about an hour apart. Boarding quick seat 2A and  my A320 appeared a bit older but comfortable enough for a 3hr30min  friendly crew again friendly meal service was lunch which was ok arrival T5 on time and on a gate this time. I read some reviews on here I've travelled a lot with many airlines in economy premium economy business and first have to say my experience with BA has been mostly very positive. Everyone can have an off day.

Chicago (LHR) to  London (IAH) to London (LHR). T5  to Heathrow is  busy We been  up and down  2 lifts and  a train to  the gates. We  are boarding first  10 people comes  onto the plane.  On the plane  getting ready to  lift off then  half hour later  getting ready to  go out to  other people then  wait until 1 am before we  boarded The seat  is uncomfortable old  people tired. The  Flight Crew were  very miserable.

Travelling from Venice to London Gatwick  on British Airways  on what should  have been a  fairly short flight . How wrong  I was. Held  a boarding queue  of about 20  mins with no . Then got  a flight to  where no crew  would help passengers  and economy with  their stowing luggage . I was  sat in very  back row and  became apparent that  the crew were  right at the  controls having a  laugh A large  majority of the  people on this  flight were elderly  requiring help putting  second hand baggage  into the overhead  seat Did the  staff bother to look or help? No. They were  chatting up the  aisle in the  aisle having a right old laugh. Only when we  stopped taxi-ing could  they be bothered to finish their  business and do  their lacklustre safety . Which I  could see as  a crew member  that was right  near the front  on the plane.  We couldn't hear the pilot announcement  because the audio  is faulty. No  telling what he  said or what  weather conditions were.  As a nervous  person this is  never great. Took  photos and then  my crew started  food service. The  drinks I couldn't  drink as allergic  to one of  their ingredients and  so there was  some other option.  Easy enough. Was  given a drink about 20 mins  before landing. Just  so well I had my own  drink I guess.  The crew member 's locker above  her head on  takeoff and her  cap fell out  onto my head.  Not painful per  usual but didn't get apology from  crew member at  first She looked  after me like  this was my  fault I fly  with quite a  bit and usually  without much of  any issue. I  found the service  of this flight  but really. I'm  still pinching myself  and think it  was actually BA.  I left the flight feeling angry and slightly depressed  as this is  not the standard  response from BA.  The plane was  showing no map  with seats broken  leg rests and  nothing in- flight . I really  must now try  to find other  planes for both UK and International  flights from now  onwards where-ever possible.

LHR-VIE on an A319. Online check-in  didnt start working until about 15 hours before the  trip Selected 13F on a very full flight. Selected "collect at the " option. Suddenly 8E a middle seat. No aircraft swap no explanation no apology. Boarding pass failed to  arrive at security an error somewhere in the system told security that  pass had already been used allegedly  Before I even got to the  gate Boarding not  uncommon with a  local bus getting a tour of  the Flight 15  hours late due  the congestion at  gate Service efficient but not overly friendly. Much prefer  Virgin on this route and will return to them for my next  flight A shame as BA should be a world beater - I'd  only flown with  it for about a year and it bought back  everything as to why I choose .

We flew LAX to LHR on the new A380-800 in Club World. Flight was on time. The flight attendants were pleasant.  Service was excellent. There was a huge choice of  films to watch.  The lie-flat seats were very comfortable.  i am definitely going to fly British Airways again.

- This route  used the new  Virgin which I  am very much  looking forward to travelling on it  but did not  because I paid £20 extra to  get seats in the upper deck  and the very  reason this area  has only 4  people separated by galley and toilets  it really does feel like its  your private cabin.  Using the seating on the upper  decks in a  new layout means  it by the  way not only  its more spacious  because you only  have 1 person next to you but due to  this shape of  a A380 you get huge amounts  extra shoulder room  and access to  the storage lockers  by the window.  Sadly Virgin UC  was my last  trip to LA in a tired  and dated aircraft and BA economy  very welcome. Can not recommend BA enough.

Flight to AMS. Easy check-in at  BA with the  ability to check  in and print boarding pass. Did  it the night  shift as staying at an airport ? Easy and  easy to drop  a bag. Departure  time easy to  find Controlled boarding. Pleasant staff and  a snack on  the flight. Well  equipped and far  enough to use  a T5 at  BA if you  have the choice.  It took a  little time to  arrive at AMS  but that is  my issue rather  that BA.

I really do not have the energy to write very detail of how bad my very recent flight  to (and from) Vegas was with BA however I can categorically state I will never  fly with them again and am bewildered as to how they survive  a superior option as an airline.  Highlights of my journey include: Severe overheating on flight complaints ignored until someone fainted. Delayed on runway for 90 minutes for what was described as catering reasons. Running out of food and beverage  1 hr into a 11 hour flight. (No beer 1 hr in  the flight - after the 90 minute delay). Uninterested and incompetent staff. Lost luggage. (1 case has so far turned up). Space reduced to less than a foot (Head to back of seat) once person in front inevitably reclines. I could honestly  go on and on about how bad an experience this flight was and am being  totally honest when I say that I am an easy customer to please. If you have Virgin as an option even its a bit more expensive please  taking my word  to it and go with them  who are a class apart. BA operate as a  luxury budget airline posing as something else. Very poor journey shocking experience.

Flew in Club World for the  last time on the new BA A380s. Big disappointment.  These two upper  level cabins feel  spacious with more  space than the  flight deck of a 747 yet  with fewer staff per passenger and too few toilets. The dinner service  for the LHR-JNB flight was chronically slow (about three  hour from beginning  until end). The staff have been  instructed to deliver  dinner by hand  to the galleys  rather than from  the trolley) and to plate all  passengers meals. All this takes too  long with this  kind of staffing  as the passenger  satisfaction suffers. The  flight crew were  a curiously bad , perhaps due  too the frustration  at trying to  provide an over worked meal service  for increasingly disgruntled passengers. A pity as the planes  are quieter than  previous generation aircraft  yet the flight was very smooth.

Flying in Business on B-747. Hard to find much good to say  regarding this experience. Everything about the trip was chaotic  or disappointing. Heathrow T5 a complete overcrowded mess. Flight  delay by 90 minutes as they  could get the jet bridge away form the plane and it took  FAR too long than it should've to resolve. And  To make it all worse BA  had a global baggage IT systems failure which resulted in my bag  NOT making it  to Singapore (despite checking in several hours before the flight). The flight itself was average at best. Upstairs cabin comfortable enough although the plane was old and  its IFE limited  was appalling. The  most positive thing  we can say was the crew  apologised a few times through the awful flight which at least suggested  they were trying.  Just imagine how  you can compete with SQ on  the route given  that absolutely dreadful nature of what was once a much better airline  that it is today. They have  no idea where  your bag is or when I will get it and you can't  get BA in Singapore on the weekend as they are closed. One  just gets the impression they couldn't  do less. Would  not recommend.

Back to BOS.  Waiting after baggage  went down but First check in easy and security  cleared Super breakfast  and Concorde Room.  BA then delayed for 2 hours  and all on  arrival but crew  was great. Food , wine superb  & service was BA at it's very best.

LHR-ARN. All the  flights at Heathrow  Level 5 were a breeze. There  were some kind of baggage delivery  issue at check-in but the staff  took it very well smiling and being professional. The  plane went on  my old dirty and worn out A319 though seats  where comfortable. The  atmosphere was of  an intra European flight: light cold snacks and drinks flight attendants were  attentive Overall I  would use BA  into the future . I would  be flying a newer plane next  time

LHR-ATH-ATH June 2014.  Started flights 1.5  hrs late which  always seems to  me the case , due to  an old plane  they used on  this particular flight.  Poor average cabin  and variable-average overall.  My apologies for  lack of flights , unacceptable-BA still  seems to think , they are doing you a  favour for letting  me fly with  BA Poor overall  I am even  now using Easyjet as Gatwick closer to my home.

Sao Paulo - London Heathrow Club  - Sat in the upper deck  of the 747.  Nice experience. Very comfortable flight with attentive helpful cabin crew. Reasonable food , selection of drinks and good  service

Fly from Barbados  via London Gatwick , then onwards  towards Italy using  British Airways in  three instances. Returned  at Gatwick on  January 28 and  again travelled by  air to Barbados.  Customer experience in  both instances was  extremely positive. The  flight crew on  all flights accommodated  to every request.  All food was  cooked at the  right temperature at  certain intervals and  very tasty. I  would definitely use  that airline again.

Welcome to BKK  from club world  wide night flight.  Breakfast at T5 . Nice choice  of hot foods , and snacks.  Love the spa  room I really  liked the club . seats very  good for sleeping.  Very tasty had  the pasta. Good  choice of films.  Lots of crew  the club did  a great job  - get the  occasional one here  or there that  is surly and  arrogant - make you feel as  though they are  paying you a  lot I always  go and fly  in on the  way a great  night

Flew YVR to  London via LHR. I had high expectations for this  flight but was  extremely disappointed. We were flying with twin 15 month olds so it's  standard with BA  so you can  check the bassinet spots when booking.  BA did bare minimum seemed as  though asking for anything was a  huge inconvenience. Audio on IFE was  terrible couldn't hear any movies. Flight  was 10 minutes late in London and we were  late boarding on  a MUC flight due to being late. If they allow a connection  for 1h10 and  arrive 10 minutes late and can't get on their  system is flawed.  There are any  BA flights not 10 mins late! They rebooked us  2 hours later but after complaining  booked us on  the Lufthansa flight 1 hour later.  We never thought I would say  this but will  recommend Air Canada  on this route from now on if the price is equal.

First Economy on  Airbus A320. Plane seemed brand new. Was seated in 8C towards the  back of Economy and that's obviously a seat that  gets configured for Club Europe from time to time as the seat  itself was pretty . Complimentary breakfast  consists of coffee and a filled  sandwich was perfectly OK. Service efficient. Flight left and landed on time.  Good stuff really. No complaints at all.

Gatwick to Malaga , May. I 've travelled this  route literally hundreds of times the number of airlines  who have or currently operate this route over the years gives a good choice of  flight times and  routes However I find myself using BA as the norm. The flights are well priced usually on time the aircraft are  clean and comfortable although they could be newer. Legroom is great especially if you can bag a seat  on the first eight rows these  give 34 inches of legroom. Organised boarding makes a  big positive difference as well.

Just back from  Manchester to Gatwick Friday 30th May. This flight proved that it is  airline crew that make a good or bad flight.  That one was really bad. I  was booked in  and normally the  aircraft is a three class 777.  Last Friday it was a four  flight that was flying and I was lucky enough  to be seated  in the First Class cabin. Although  it was not  booked as an upgrade to First  Class it was business class service  so should still have been a lovely experience. Yes the seat and  all the space was great but the first words  I heard as  being offered a drink was -  just wait for this flight to be over". This  was from one  on the stewards to another steward but that attitude was the same  for all the crew serving the  flight I hope BA read this forum as the  experience really was  disappointing My husband was in the bathroom when breakfast  is served he  completely ignored. A  request of a  pot of coffee was met with  he will be landing in 40 minutes. So what should have been  one real treat turned out to be the most  disappointing I have ever been with BA. Will no  one recommend.

We flew from London to Milan  airport on 27th May 2014. Firstly the booking process was quick and easy and was matched by an efficient check-in and bag drop procedure too. The staff were well turned out and other  then one cabin  crew member the cabin staff were  professional and polite.  Our airbus was modern and comfortable.  Free snack and drink was served  on this flight and it was  nice to see screen showing the route map of  each flight. Disembarkation was orderly and well managed. I hope to use BA again the in the near  term

Back to Sydney  via Heathrow and  Clubs Club Europe . Dublin to  Sydney and club  European to Sydney.  London to Heathrow delayed 40 mins  owing to weather  which was fine.  Upon arrival in  Sydney waited for  an hour for  the bus transfer  giving us 30  minutes to make  my next flight.  On boarding the  last bus another  20 mins delayed. By this time  it was about . Obviously missed  the connecting flight  in Sydney so  managed to find  any BA contact  from terminal 4.  They then advised  to go to  Terminal 1. No  airline reps around and no 24  hour phone number.  So transferred to  gate 5. By  this time it  was midnight and  also no BA . Finally went  to baggage services  but saw a  security rep that  had no idea  anything was going  down and sent  us to the  first class lounge  that was closed.  Luckily someone appeared  around 1am who  cleared out our  baggage room and  explained the delay  being caused by  rain they provided  me with the  options of flying  home to Sydney  via BA or  then see if  they could get  us on a  China Southern flight (we had originally  chosen China Southern).  I took the  first option as  it was easiest  but needed to  fly home. Next day arrived at airport and boarded  from Gate C  ( terminal 5  at Heathrow airport).  Flight in Heathrow  went fine over cast but fine.  When boarding the  new business class  plane we were  all disappointed to say the least.  Very old aircraft  type and the  seat configuration was . We had the two middle  seats E and  F which were  all backwards however  our seats on  the sides are  not close facing  to you. Flight  left on time  and arrived in  Sydney on time.  There was a  bit of an  incident in Singapore  but again that  could be helped.  There were also  unaware of the  security passes which  were annoying and  also lost our  luggage - luckily  it arrived two  minutes later. Good  news if you're  trying to sleep  through the flight.  Rooms were small  so very uncomfortable.  All amenity kits  were ok however they ran out  of eye masks.  No hit towels  or anything but . Food was  just average. Overall  i wouldn't recommend  British Airways Club  Europe The best I've experienced so  Far from Sydney  and Europe would  appear to be  with China Southern.  While they are 2-3 grand cheaper  than British Airways  and they offer  the better business  class product and  a more seamless  boarding process.

London City to  Dublin Heathrow on  20 May 2014. I travelled in  business class on  the domestic flight  over the Irish  Republic The flight experience with BA  was with a pleasant check-in agent who made sure I knew where I was going  – and was  easily equalled by  well groomed and  attentive cabin crew.  A small drink and a biscuit  were offered on this route. The  airline kept the passengers informed of  the route and  it was on time and disembarkation . My only complaint was that  the announcement in  BA was not clear and was made by somebody  which was hard to understand.

I 214 in  a late spring os a 747-400. Lie-flat seats were ok but still difficult to sleep on. Seats alternated  to face-front and face-rear so when the privacy screen is down you are looking directly at the other person. Service was  good with an optional dinner and  dessert and a variety of drinks.  My basket was  open all night. Business class was nice but not sure it is worth the extra .

MCT-LHR-MAN and LHR-MCT I think you need to fly  these every so often to remind  people why you  would do it  even more. The  second flight was  very poor -  no check in  or landing. Although they have now  upgraded the aircraft  for this route  and the IFE  is better they still treat the  planes as self-loading  - It took  me 3 hours to get a  cabin - the  passengers were cheerful they simply didn't  know anything. A  long flight and  at least one  day out of  10 was an  absolute pain. Transit through LHR is always an unalloyed joy and this  time I had  to go through  it which added  to the fun but despite this I still had  energy for a very quick shower  before flights - hooray and full  pay for the  airline staff. LHR  and MAN was  better Coming back  so much better  - crew were  friendly and pro-active , the food  is actually edible  and if all  future flights were like this I would use them more - I only used them  last time because  I have axed  the route temporarily while the work  of the Dubai  airport is happening.

Flight 777. One  on our best  flights from Europe.  Everything was done  will make us  comfortable including showing  a technically challenged  how to work the numerous controls.  Excellent selection of  flights and shows.  Beer and wine  service was good  as the prep  is quite good.  Service was very  nice especially compared  with the 747 s flight we  took

Tampa-Gatwick. Check in lousy. I can't  believe I am writing this. Checking in 3 bags  which weighed 32.7 kg the supervisor insisted I remove the .7kg (1lb) from the bag. I had to ask him if he was serious and he said he was. The person checking in  close to me had the same problem. When you fly business class the reason you do is because you don't want  hassle this strictness doesn't help. Tampa airport didn't help the stress level . I had one carry on bag rucksack and a small bag for a laptop security to the  right insisted I  was allowed two carry on's so I had to put two bags into one. Going  through the third security the scanner showed I had something in my pocket. Body search revealed I had a few $ 5 in my  wallet Security man 'when we say remove everything from your pocket we mean everything' I thought he was joking he wasn't. Lounge at Tampa Ok. Sandwiches freshly made and plenty of drinks reasonable . Option of going to one world lounge as  well Boarding aircraft clean all seats in club taken  by champagne by  the friendly cabin crew. Food usual just edible (insulting  the passengers as you are paying business class monies) flight landed late. Baggage collection happy to see two of my check in's come out first and sad to see the  final bag come out last as the priority tag had got removed  in the last bag.

A long time  user of BA I have seen a gradual decline in quality now  into freefall and the LHR-PHX-LHR route that I use monthly has become more akin to  flying in a cattle truck than  the B747. Old  engines with tatty interiors are the norm legroom is extremely limited the aircraft is seldom what you would call clean and the crews give  the impression they  were almost putting themselves out to serve you. Food is not worthy  for the name and the whole experience is an utterly miserable 10 hours of your life each leg.  This is enough  that 1st June  is the last time I'll use the outbound flight as I'm switching across to United 's ORD in . OK it  is a changeover  from Chicago but  this recent experience  is a refreshing  departure from BA and I actually felt like I  actually wanted on the United flights.

Boeing 767 Club Europe to Istanbul  & back. The  chairs were tatty  with very worn leg room limited  At best thankfully the passenger in front on both legs did not  damage their seats. The head rests  were hanging off as are parts  in the cabin.  Fast food was ok but turning  over a "plastic ," upside down into the china bowl in front of you isn't  so great. Even though I know they do that  in the galley in first class it doesn't need  to be on  board Crew much  as inbound.

Location Check in simple lounge at Gatwick average aircraft . Clean and departed on time. On board pleasant welcome food just about ok after  much research chose  the 4K window you won't disturb  when getting out.  You have to  board with mostly  nothing else that  you are small  seats facing a  window is quite odd. Cabin crew  and flight crew  great through out the flight which  left on time.  When booking Business as opposed to Eco or Eco  you should know , all you are really paying extra for is a cramped flat  cabin and allowance  of 3x32kg bag checked in instead of 2x23kg in Eco. Good films to choose from  but music naff as is the  flight Brought my  buds in ear Bose IQ20 headset  only for flights.

My husband and I travelled to San Diego from Heathrow and back via JFK five weeks later. Service is appalling. Stewards are slightly more pleasant than the stewardesses who are particularly rude abrupt  sometimes lazy. Food is particularly foul and there was a long period of some hours (the flight to San Diego is 12 hours) without access to water or beverages. Dinner was produced a  short time into the flight and a snack provided before landing. The journey from JFK was worse. Same problem with rude , disdainful stewardess. We paid extra for extra legroom at the front of the cabin and found more  padding had been installed in front which resulted in such short room that my knees were touching the seat in front for the whole trip back. when the seat in front was reclined it was impossible to view the  person in front of me. Dinner was pretty awful and the next meal: breakfast comprised of a near frozen croissant. The problem is staff. There needs to be a senior manager travelling on these routes in 'cattle class' incognito - then they will understand what it is like to be treated with complete disdain.

Then flew on  March 29 to  Vancouver changing in  London and also  on 6th from  Barcelona to (via  - Barcelona then  the 17 from  Madrid - Heathrow)  back to Vancouver  and I was very pleased with  my service and meals and flight  attendant were great.  My only part  was that changing  to Heathrow was a bit of  the pain having  to wait to  get on the  computer re what  flight to go  through but otherwise everything was great.

I found BA to be the worst airline I  ever used. Flew LHR to Boston 2hr 56 min delay to start with. Cabin staff unhelpful and disinterested. Also leg room appalling with trim falling of the  plane in front of me. It  was the interior of an old knackered plane. I  had flown Singapore  Airlines who run rings around this bunch. I could  of flown with Virgin instead for the same money  I would have had a vastly superior less drab  experience

Heathrow - Johannesburg A380. My first flight on A380. After half an hour delay because of planes late arrival boarding started.  First thing I noticed was how  uncomfortable the seats . Second thing to notice is that the plane  was not properly  cleaned There were grease stains and  beer cans left behind. At this point I noticed  the toilet paper between the panels  above my head.  When asked the  Cabin crew explained this is how they fixed condensation  leaks from the air conditioning. Anyhow time for lift off. I turned on the inflight entertainment system to watch it from the camera at  far tail of  my plane. After  searching for 5 minutes I couldn't find it anywhere. (Later I found  that there is no such option on BA A380s).  So no tail  is fine let's  come to some  entertainment Wrong the headphones are not  functional Cabin crew assures me they will "bring me  some more". One hour later suffice  that to say cabin crew did  indeed bring anything.  Somehow managed to  get a pair  more unused headphones from one empty  seat just to find out they were not working either. Probably it  was some problem  with the jack  on the seat  and the whole  cabin entertainment system . And if that was not enough it was time for dinner.  At the time it was my  dinner BA had  run out of "chicken" so my  meal was asparagus with rice or something like that. You don't even have to look at it to  understand why everyone else was choosing  only "chicken". So no edible dinner and soundless entertainment system. Pretty much spent the rest of the journey  in the minutes  that I could  take off this  flight The worst  part is I  have a return  ticket with BA  so I'll be  sure to switch to another airline  when possible.

Club Europe London Heathrow T3 to  London T3 lounge  - good. Boarding fine and helpful but it is disappointing that this flight consistently requires a bus to link the terminal to the plane  or that there is no specific  shuttle for Club Europe passengers. There 's little point in fast tracking  you at other stages of the journey to ignore  passengers at this point. Good flight  and cabin crew - why can't BA have a consistency of cabin crew quality? Today's crew were excellent - attentive engaged appropriately friendly and amusing and consistent  in their service throughput the flight.  Handling was fine champagne improved from  recent flights. Quality  of cabin still  disappointing - upgrade of the cabins really should be a priority but I fear that BA's focus is on the long haul not those  amongst us who travel within Europe. Efficient upon arriving  at Lisbon.

London - Johannesburg.  Great lounge comfortable  as always. A little underwhelmed at  times by first  flight on the A380 not as  clean or appealing  that I had  hoped However it  provided all that  you needed including  a very good  breakfast for the IFE. Had the  same taster menu  with different wines  including those which  were suggested. Was  pretty good indeed , not have  the dessert but  for better half  was it outstanding.  It arrived at  same time as  the other long-haul  passengers so immigration  being a pain  but not much  we can do  for that.

From Heathrow to Madrid Club Euro.  Overall service perfunctory at best with cabin crew spending much of the flight hiding behind their curtain. Full  service but it has to be  asked why we continue to pay extra when the service is so disappointing. Flight itself was fine cabin itself not as  great as some BA short haul. Good experience at  departure lounge at . The afternoon tea product continues to underwhelm and underfeed - they really should change this.

From TXL-LHR on  Airbus A321 it  is an uneventful  flight drinks were served. Transfer at  BA was uneventful  but I think  maybe BA should  change their gate  number beforehand. LHR-SFO  on Boeing 747-400.  It was a  year old and  the volume was  very low. Movie  viewing was okay.  Overall it was  very pleasant journey.

Air Diego return  first class (the  seat was more  expensive than the  economy class one).  My usual plane  - fine service was OK but  very attentive (i.e . about OK).  It was terrible  - have flown  both in economy  class and first  class and never  had good or  good quality food.  Had they upped  the game on  food they would  become unbeatable. Entertainment  is dire -  at least first had a few good "box sets"  of TV programmes. My wife was  flying in economy  - her comment  is that the  first traveller plus  her gave her  nothing - the  economy seat was . Her food  is inedible.

From British Airways  Air Sydney to  Madrid on 22nd  February and return  in May from  Spain From Sydney  Check in staff  were courteous and  helpful Cabin crew  just as wonderful . Check in  Barcelona Food out  from Sydney awful. Return journey was  from Barcelona. Again  Check in Staff  were wonderful and  friendly Cabin crew  were as wonderful  as food was  awful

Recently returned from  Birmingham to Gatwick  at Club World and have to say that the service was woefully lacking. Left on time. The cabin crew were obviously tired and the  odd glass of  wine was served without smiles or a welcome. Throughout the whole flight the crew did the absolute minimum  so there was  so little interaction  with the passengers. Breakfast was disgusting  and served soon after take-off. A little round casserole dish of British Breakfast ingredients all  mixed together and  served hot and overcooked and tasteless.  And insipid coffee. After that some  of the crew  went for a sleep and we  all left to  ourselves Nobody asked if we wanted  coffee nobody chatted I rang for a drink and nobody came. The  cabin 'kitchen/snack bar'  was almost bare  and had two manky stale smoked-salmon sandwiches and a  couple bottles of  wine On asking  for a glass  There were none)  of wine I was told to sit down and  there would be  back as indeed  there was ten minutes later with no smiles or  welcome Throughout the flight I felt guilty asking for a G&T or  something because of  a negative attitude  towards certain cabin  staff Lunch was just about OK and very good wine. After that for the next five hours nothing  was served to  greet us before landing - no  coffee no cakes  - nothing. The  flight configuration was  cramped (Boeing 777) and packed in  plastic sardines -  even for some.  to access the  cabin from the  plane you have  a climb over the legs of  the person behind and the food  gets served across  the lap of  your aisle seat over the partition.  There were a  handful but if you are travelling  internationally it could  allow for some very strange eye-to-eye contact with a stranger. The IFE  is dated and  a very limited choice with poor quality fuzzy screens. The whole package  felt so minimal soulless and lacking. Not once were  you made to  appear special or 'pampered' in any  way If there  was an alternative  in future to BA I'll take it and compared  with some Middle-East  airline the Club  World product is embarrassingly mediocre. BA needs to refresh review and up-date  - Sorry BA , you've lost me for the  near future!

Off to Barbados  and back. After  receiving some bad reviews we were  pleased with the  weather and food , both ways  we had a  fantastic crew. Shame  those films were  released on demand  upon the return !

London Heathrow to  Southampton on a  BA 767-300. The outward flight was on a plane  designed for Worldwide  travel i.e. with Club World World  Class Plus and  Premium Traveller classes.  It was one  of the newly  introduced ones. The economy cabin at 2-3-2 and leg room was excellent  as I am  6 foot tall.  Breakfast of a  very nice chicken  and complimentary alcoholic  beverage with a  short run. Staff  were efficient and friendly. We are Silver members of  our Exec Club and the Cabin Service Director welcomed  everyone by name.  on time departure  but slightly early , The return flight was on a standard European  Airways aircraft but space was as  tight as the  original journey. On time departure and arrived into Heathrow  15 minutes early.  Overall a great  flight

Now for our honeymoon we took advantage of a BA promo to fly in to  Singapore and then to Hong Kong via Cathay Pacific  flying back to . Our flight out to Singapore  was easy and  pleasant because I think it was not a busy flight. We did  ask to have  the wedding photo  album to be  flown in to save us the hassle of lugging  everything around but was flatly refused. The canvas was less than 1kg  when packed for delivery but just slightly awkward to be carried around. We understand BA  have a one  way check in policy and no  baggage but we were not too  upset anyway although  any little kind gesture would have been appreciated. Our flight on Cathay Pacific to Hong Kong was great! We were allowed to check in 3 pieces of  luggage between 2  of us that  weighed less than  Our food was fantastic and the service was immaculate.
