For our way  up to London  we were excited as we knew we were flying the A380. SQ and Emirates have A380 we have . This turned out to be a mistake from  we start. When we were checking in we were  not allowed to  carry in extra hand luggage despite the combined weight  being less than 40kg for all 3 items. When  I got on the plane we  was shocked to see how tiny the seats on  our BA A380 were in comparison to SQ or even Emirates. Next we struggled to find an overhead  luggage compartment for  extra hand luggage.  A staff instead  started helping us find a space  for the bag  sat on her spot pointing at cabins that looked  empty but were  literally over rows away from our seats. The ultimate bad experience came when breakfast was served. By the time the trolley  got to us  our were no  available options for our breakfast and  the food was  just plonked on our trays. No  interaction no explanations as to what was under the foil no smiles!  This was quite  late by now  as I had  to ask the  staff what was being served. I have never felt more humiliated. With  staff it was  just silence. Miserable  and lifeless crews  at work who can't seem to  be less with their customers. No smiles no interactions no explanations no communication. Needless to say the highly  recommended dim sum with noodles for breakfast was left untouched! Our overall flying experience with BA has been anything but pleasant friendly generous comfortable , delicious meals.  I had just  acted as a reminder why I  had not chosen BA the last 10 years and perhaps the next  few to come.

Gatwick-Venice return. Two contrasting experiences. Trip out pretty good A320 so much better than the old 737's used at Gatwick. Staff friendly and a good snack and beverage included. Good updates from cabin and we left and arrived on time. Trip back felt like it had been crewed by brand new staff in the  cabin Food handed out 20 mins after take-off but drinks took another 30 mins to be offered around cabin. Half the cabin crew seemed  quite pre-occupied with passengers not sitting in correct seat even though flight not full. Think a smile and re-assurance to move back after take-off would have sorted the issue however one female crew member in particular had forgotten to bring her 'happy face' to work that day! Flight OK but not up to standard you expect. I fly BA quite regularly and choose over EasyJet as fares and flight times often similar but service superior. I hope the Gatwick service levels can reflect the BA brand otherwise  they have an  obvious competitor in EJ at this airport.

1st Class LHR-PHX.  Great seamless flight. Great driver collection  and concierge service  if it was extra). Concorde room was lovely great  service and nice breakfast. First class  & onboard staff were very good. Producing a very  nice custom meal  with my wife.

When we booked  our holiday to  India I was  quite pleased to see we were  going with British  Airways as they  offered a good  deal Sadly our  experience put a  stop to this. As part of the service they offer BA allow  YOU to either pay an expensive  amount to choose your seats in  London or you  could log onto  the website for free 24 hours ' advance. I  had to do this several times  without success and finally rang the  first number suggested.  During a 14 minute call at premium rate the  flight operator (whose grasp of English  was great) was unable to advise about the problem nor manually book  any seats and  did offer nothing more constructive than  " trying”. I rang the complaints line (still premium rate) and other  having a better  grasp of English  were still unable  too assist in any way. Both  agents assured me  they they would  fix it all  in the Airport.  Keeping in view  all this we  failed to arrive  at the airport . We entered  seat details online to find that even though there  are only 2 of us we weren't sat together or even on  that same row.  By now my wife – who is a nervous flyer – was in tears! We  both sought assistance  and had to  wait but eventually  were allocated 2  seats together. As  they were free  we don't know why these weren't given originally – however given our further experiences – maybe they don't like using them? I have flown  longer haul before and found that you always get  a more generous  use of space particularly shoulder and  thigh Sadly British  airlines don't appear  too follow this doctrine. The legroom was adequate however as soon as the woman in front reclined her seat I had about 4 inches between the front of my nose  to the back of her seat.  Since my TV  remote is in  one back of  my seat it made trying to watch the screen  extremely difficult. I  attempted to watch  the film however this brought on a headache so  I was forced  into stop. I  will love to see what regulations  we have to  enforce regarding VDU  seating however in  my work environment this would be banned without question. The final disappointment came when the  meal was distributed. I had the  Fried Chicken which  was over-cooked so that the rice  got cremated to  the top and  back of the  chicken whilst my  daughter had the cottage pie which tasted of plastic. She didn't eat hers. I ate mine but had  a stomach upset for the following 48 hours. All in all this  was an experience  i do not  wish to repeat and I shall certainly not fly British Airways by choice in the  UK We didn't  have these problems  in Sri Lanka <mask>

Australia on 29  February and Antigua-LGW on 13 May Boeing 777. It  started off badly . I went  the pay the final payment on  arrival on evening  on 16 February.  The system rejected  both my credit and debit cards.  On checking the  details of my  account with BA . I found that the final  amount had been  sent to my  card and I  was owed the  last deposit. I  wrote an email  asking get it  resolved only to receive a reply  stating it could  only be sorted out by a  conference call. First  line was useless  to a person  and had poor  grasp of English.  Next call to  the premium number  meant a 20 minute wait to get someone to  sort out the  details having been  called round twice. I was told  everything had been sorted out and received E ticket  along with my  details of account  that I owed ! Two weeks  on I received  an E ticket  The only difference  there was that it showed the  last four digits  for my credit card. Next credit card statement did  NOT show money  taken out. Not unusual for some companies but made me nervous that  it was not well. Two weeks  before flight I  receive a phone  call from BA  stating that there  had been a  computer glitch and  that they have  lost credit card details. I then  got an email  reply and confirmation  it had been . About 22  hours before flight  we went online  at check in and changed my  ticket and entered  travel details etc  on printed boarding  pass Arrived at LGW to just  change baggage labels and drop off baggage. Met by  man at terminal who tore up  the boarding pass , printed off a new one  using ‘bring back  the old system.  I then had to queue to drop off baggage.  More than choosing  airlines it was  the complete waste  on time to  get in online.  I left and  returned on time.  On the inflight  breakfast meal was  the worst I have ever experienced  on an aircraft.  It was no  bread and the red wine was  bad The inflight food on my  next flight a  smooth trooping flight to Singapore in  May was better.  For return flight you could only  check in online and alter seat  position Check in  to Antigua was  one of the  worse check ins  i have ever  experienced Left Antigua  on time and  reached LGW on  time Food was worse than going . No choice. Starter was small  rolled up lettuce  salad with small  lemon wedge with  the rotten end to it. Main  course very dry  salad with a tomato sauce on  top White wine was just about . Coffee served as we started  the course. Asked  how we could  drink it later  were told no  because turbulence was expected. No turbulence <mask> cabin crew <mask> to clear up and disappear <mask> a bit of shut eye <mask> minimum staff <mask> duty. At <mask> with Ryanair <mask> know what <mask> get for your money.

LHR-JTR-LHR. A tale  if opposites for BA's new route  into Santorini. Outward it couldn't have been better with  a FAs decent  takeoff and arrival that was ahead of schedule. The return started off poorly with substandard facilities at Santorini airport including no online check-in no business class lounge , no priority boarding. An air  traffic controller issue kept the plane grounded for 30 minutes. On board they'd forgotten the menus for the dinner service and the starter and cheese course had been left behind.  BA Club Europe toilet then ran out of water.  Overall overall okay but the return  was disappointing.

Flying as a  group of 4 (2 adults and  two young children)  in London to  America I hoped  it wouldn't be  a problem sitting  down in the 4 middle seats.  I had not  tried to reserve  a seat as  we had never  bothered to pay  this before while  traveling with Emirates  airline or Cathay . The seats  reserved at check  out were 3 on the left  so My wife  stayed with the  kids while I  chose to sit  in the row behind. The seats  could not be  changed at check  out or on  another plane. It  seemed ridiculous that  seats were not  on the logical  place for a  group of 4  at the middle of the plane  as though my  ticket had been  prepared 5 months  in advance. I  asked the stewardess  as the situation  would be difficult  on my family , the staff  or the passengers  alike as this  happened when my  4 year old  complained as he  refused to sit  closer to me.  He had to  change seats with  the wife a couple of times  during the flight  that was a  longer flight. On the return flight  I reluctantly paid  extra (£23 x .) to make  sure we got the 4 middle  seat The journey  was less stressful  when my wife had her own  seats as she  did recline as  a passenger behind  is too tall  and refused to  stretch his legs  he should have  room and extra  room and reserved  the seat with  more leg room). My wife complained  and the steward ess the passenger  refused to let  my wife recline  she was made  the move to  another different seat.  In conclusion I  thought staff were generally friendly but  they exert themselves on service the  flight was okay  although the entertainment system was dated  it didn't have  many games and  no screen kept . It seems  that flight services  in USA are  not up to  a same standard  as flying to  The Middle East  and the Far  East as British  airlines had failed  the comparison at  many levels when  flying with the  other airlines mentioned  previously - my  first experience to the USA was  for American Airlines  - that was  worse than BA.  My main disappointing  thing with BA  was definitely having  to pay extra for choosing your  seats If you are travelling with a family of  four and you want to guarantee  everyone sit together  they have to  pay an extra  fee on top  off the original  price of the  airline ticket this  seems more like  2 additional charges  from Ryanair!

London BA001 and  onwards Quick check  out and fast  through security although I had to show my boarding pass to get  to Gate 24 lounge with a view of our  flight and a  bottle of champagne. Quick boarding nice  welcome by a familiar face. Cabin has stood up  nicely and is  not fresh as it was on  arrival Starter choice  in Shannon now  supplemented by a selection of canapes served on a  large USA immigration  line forward and  not back on the aircraft but the airport is  full Once in  mid air salad drinks and a choice of mains. I had the curry which was excellent followed by chocolate fondant smothered  by chocloate sauce - bliss. Later  on the Friday 001 flight which departs at 1245 as opposed to 0945 they serve  dinner rather than afternoon tea. This was a plate of cold cuts and samosas.Tasty.Quick disembarkation lovely crew. Return  on 004 Sunday evening supper in the busy Galleries dining room. then quick boarding on  a full 31/32 . Supper served  for those who wanted it and  also a full hot English breakfast  bag or a bag to go. Bussed to the arrivals hall and  checked and then  off in 15 minutes. Excellent crew  and flight.

Flying in World  Class on a 747-400. After having  done 3 consecutive  years on AA  ( having been  so surprised) I wasn't sure how an old BA 747 would measure up but aircraft  were spotless and in full working . Crew were  friendly and helpful. The food was  also good and  generally IFE far better than AA.

Got to Vegas , 8th May  2016 dismayed at the standard. Filthy  waiter back in  Front of me  sat with a  sandwich by a  woman Only choice  for meal was  some lemon pasta , some food  served up in  it was brought  home 3 chicken  wings to share . 6 of  our Sandwiches crisps  and nuts etc  were refused when  suggested as an alternative; we were  warned by the  manager not to  go in the  area we did  ( row 31)  get it normally . The worst  thing though was  the staff who  did come over  extremely rude.

On a recent  trip from Sacramento to Paris some friends and I had a terrible experience with another  flight and had some trepidation about  a return flight  to Paris to Sacramento. We did however choose British Airways for the  Return flight and  neither of us had flown with  them before. I  am happy to report that the experience was totally different. Our flight was delayed by an hour which  would effect our layover and did  take us to our next flight but we had  the cushion of  3 hours layover  but we were ok. On the flight the seats  are more comfortable more leg room , noisy better entertainment due to  the on seats in front of you and the access to the  internet was much easier to navigate.  It also had  WiFi relatively together which the other airline refused to  offer us even  if we had  booked the reservation months in advance.  One screen was  too far ahead I couldn't see it and it  showed only one  screen The staff  seemed very kind to hydrate us frequently and gave us plenty to eat and it was all very palatable. I will  definitely recommend British Airways for International flights to my  family

I should be in a nice  place in Romania ! 9 hours after I arrived  to Heathrow courtesy  Of British Airways I am still  at Heathrow heading  home to Glasgow! The 7am flight  started well 10/10  mins getting me  from Glasgow to  Romania The connecting flight to Bucharest  was delayed by more than an  hr which meant  they wouldn't get  my connecting flight to Timisoara. I  finally went to  emergency services (waited  30 mins) who  said to get  out to Timisoara tomorrow about 3pm as the last  plane on 9/5/14  had fully booked. They offered to put me up  at a hotel in Bucharest but  were not able  too book one.  So waited 50 mins at a  reception desk where  although there was  anything they could  do to check availability of a hotel in Bucharest I was not filled with confidence.  As I was  booked out for only 48 hours and would miss  a large part of my meeting I decided to go back to Glasgow. I was  put on the  plane to Glasgow and given a  sheet of paper with all the details and told to go to  their gate when it was called  where they would  check all about  flight booking as  I was on the computer. Told my boarding pass  was sorted. They  duly sorted it and I got a lecture about  what I needed to do in future. There was  NO way I  am getting on the flight told  them I should be grateful as  they were doing  me a favour putting me on  their 6.50pm flight. Told to go back to the  ticket desk and  wait in the queue again!
Score : 10/10  Fast Flown Economy  Value for Money , Comfort Staff  & Catering Entertainment Recommended

08/5/2014 JFK-LHR-BRU. After the perfect outbound flight we thought that the inbound flight could not be the same.  Our lounge is JFK was very crowded and not really relaxed. Boarding  is again relaxed  with a perfect  seat on the Upper deck friendly  but relaxed. Slept nearly the all flight in perfect conditions. The flight  however was delayed  by more than 40 minutes but the captain excused humbly for the delay and gave us plenty of  space business cabin  is full but the service on  this short flight  is more than  perfect

On return. Very  pleased with the  accommodation and crew  performance on the  return sections as the Belfast ones are only domestic , still excellent. I was impressed with the food  there was a  roast chicken dinner going out and  afternoon tea on  my return leg.  All crew were  absolutely exceptional and make this airline  special the seat pitch in Club  Lounge is poor.  The Galleries lounge  at T5 is just OK being  a bit of  the cattle market compared to the  airport longge in  London which was  excellent

Flight BRU-LHR-JFK. Short flight in business  form Brussels to  NYC was how  the short business  plane has to  be excellent crew  and food flight  landing on time. Flight from LHR  to JFK started  in perfect conditions:  nice lounge in  seat 5 (as  a gold member)  had excellent champagne  with food and  beverage Boarding was  nice with helpful  people a nice  staff to welcome  you on board , to relax  in a nice  dinner In one  case the start  to a perfect  day in a  private cabin landing  on time in  New York. This  was how it  really should be.

Many different people have different experiences  but wanted to share that I  had mixed reviews  that are great  and one can be used as  motivation while the  second for pat  on BA's backs! I was traveling BLR-LHR-SFO route on  8 of May 2014. The first flight from BLR-LHR  is chaotic and as mentioned by others on this site most food options were exhausted  at the end  of the flight. I don't complain  as I got my food choice. The flight staff  was some really courteous people while  passengers were pretty . The second  plane is really  not worth mentioning - it was  my most cheerful  plane I have  flown on! The  cabin attendants were  right the pains  and being on  this second leg  on a 24 hr journey was  well felt. BA 287 flying on 9th May 2014 - fantastic flight. Food was okay  - I loved  my Lily O ats chocolate mousse!  Also - its  probably time BA upgrades its entertainment systems. The audio was lousy and  it was clear  but audible even  in the highest  settings against the  loud sounds.

Yet again a good flight from  London to Warsaw  with an A320. Cabin crew were  very efficient and  friendly on both outbound and inbound ! I was  tempted to upgrade  for £72 when I booked the flights but decided not to due  with the good catering service on  the flight and the shortish journey.  My wraps have been replaced by a flat bread sandwich which is much better! Looking forward to my next flight!

Only in business.  The flight good  and attentive staff  The flight staff  would seem to  have less had  they ask for  food even water  and coffee after ! Not what  we expect in  a World from a 4 star .

20 May 2014. LHR-FRA on a  BA row 18.  Available via the  airline app no  cost to drop  for a day trip. BA Galleries  Lounge for a quick spot of  photography Boarding started 20 minutes before departure. Not a  busy flight. Left slightly late due  to cargo being  unloaded but arrived on time. Standard  fuel and food . BA short haul European flight.  Airbus FRA-LCY on  a E70 Row  17 Use of the JAL lounge  in FRA opposite  the gate area.  Close to the  gate and an  early departure. Full  load and not  much room up above for carry  over items on  an aircraft on  the full flight.  Parking quite tight in row 15.  Good standard food and drink for a BA short haul service.

Caught a connection from Gatwick to Jersey and it  went fine. A very short flight with very efficient and effective staff.  Not much more I can say because we were up and out so quickly. I was travelling business and it is  high time a little more space was made in the cabins. If  people cannot cross  your legs then why are you paying for business  level seats?

I have just  started reviewing all  my reviews on this website and  its seems every  day to me  that if you  were booked in  first class you  pay more than  ever have a  cheap flight economy  flight premium is  good and go!  Unless you want  not take the  trip I travel BA to Tampa premium economy three  days a year  The food is disgusting and I  cant sit in  aisle 14 now  if anyone has  had there seat  down this aisle  and warned they  run out of  seats on the  plane when they  come to you , they offer  you an economy  ticket and quite  frankly they do  NOT care if  they complain well  I complained! Myself  and the man  sat next to  me kept up  their complaining and  5 mins later  the steward comes  in with two  empty dishes. The  waiter had kept  their meals for  him So be  warned that if  you are seated  along aisle 14  take your own  risk because you  did not get  a decent meal.

Getting from San  Diego to Heathrow . Flight was  about 3.5 hours  The food particularly  for breakfast was  the worst I've  eaten on an  aircraft The sets  felt very uncomfortable. I feel BA  have a long  time to catch up to the quality to other airlines such as  Emirates and Qatar.

I flew Singapore to Sydney with them recently and  it was the most horrible flying experience. At the  boarding gate the staff were just  too disorganised in getting the passengers on board that we had to wait for almost an hour before we got on. The plane was  an old and  overweight 747-400 which had the dirtiest cabin I have seen. There was  a stale smell  everywhere in the premium economy cabin. The seats were old worn out and lumpy despite being in premium ! The inflight entertainment was a joke. The video quality was mediocre and the noise cancelling headphones were  only working for  much of the flight. The food was some strange fried rice which  tasted bland. The crew were unfriendly they didn't serve drinks once throughout the flight. The worst part were the toilets smelly with a toilet bowl and sink  overflowing with toilet paper. Overall I will never fly British Airways again unless I don't have any choice.

Being in business  and looking forward  for a B787  but this flight  is a B777.  In the rear facing seat- comfortable  enough but it  is always awkward  having to clamber  over the passenger  side diagonally opposite.  Enjoy the plentiful  glass of pink champagne. Lunch was  plentiful as was  the afternoon tea.  Large screen on  a small side but managed one ! Crew were  very friendly and efficient.

Flight to Gatwick on 13th April.  Handling itself was okay but on arrival we were "parked" a long way from the baggage reclaim area  for which the Captain apologised). After  the 30 minute  departure from the  terminal our problems  escalated as we then waited another  less than 2 hours for our  baggage to arrive. Many flights that  arrive a long time after us  with our bags  and set off  arrived far more promptly. BA have acknowledged they are responsible for the  delay from "start to finish" but  have gone on  further advise that  all parts of the operation are sub contracted including this part. Can't recommend BA because of this experience  or because of  they way our subsequent complaint has been handled. Not  likely to use  BA again because of this.

LGW-VRN-LGW both in Club Europe. Was offered an upgrade on the way out for £85.  Nice check-in as  airport was quiet  until 6.30am. Used the Galleries lounge-reasonable cold food selection but the only  other option was  cold Nice atmosphere though and good  view of the  flights Left slightly late due to congestion. Nice breakfast with individual bottles  and Heidseck Monopole champagne. No aerobridges at Verona so had to walk to a bus in the rain.  Breakfast delivered quickly. Return flight was delayed by an hour as the incoming flight was late. BA use the Catullo lounge  which is very poor with an abysmal selection of  drinks hot not even a sandwich just biscuits and pastries at 9pm! The lounge is before the security check so not  easy to relax altogether. Crew very  upset about delay  of drinks and  room service-the chicken curry was passable.

15 May 2014:  Las Vegas to Gatwick. Boeing 777.  Only on BA , thanks to Avios Companion coupon.  Cabin crew are  much more present  on the journey  has not experienced  many of them  traveling too far  to please a  waiter it seems  almost okay if  we run out  for a meal  first or if  your not seated ! Certainly yesterday  morning the wc was not on  their duty list.  Having flown AF , SWISS KLM  short haul in  the past year , by far  their catering in  London is the  least in content.  My offering for  food was almost  like insult.

Welcome to LHR.  Easy check in and priority security . New food selection in First  floor lounge but  not the decent  service in the  dining room. Boarding easy and upper  deck crew excellent  – lights not  come on until  shortly before descent  and arrival on . Bus to  London but bags  arrive when we  get there.

Im not normally  one to whine but here goes.  arrived at 0725 am a Tuesday morning via the  exit gate A10.  Full of "Fast ", signage and  the fast trackers  are herded through  a checkpoint onto  a bus where  I waited until  they were joined  by all the  other passengers! Outstanding!  I OK (fairly  old ex BD ) but the  thought of a  super fast Fast  Track amused me  no end.

Chicago O'Hare to London Heathrow on  20 May. check  was very fast  & efficient. New 777 plane. Take off and landing about 30 minutes . Friendly flight  with Efficient service. Good vegetarian meal. Very pleasant flight.

Travelled to HKG on board the  Emirates A380. Boarding was efficient with a dedicated air  lift for First passengers. Welcomed on board offered champagne  with pyjamas and wash bag and settled into my suite. The space  was more noticeable  than a 747 or 777 equivalent with a wardrobe that can fit carry on baggage , jacket and shoes plus a side bin that accommodates other items. The food was excellent with the choice of a  four course taster  tray with accompanying wines or a  La carte. There are also treats available in the first galley. Breakfast  was also very  tasty I managed  a get plenty of sleep as  the aircraft is very quiet and walked around the  entire plane to get a sense of scale. The crew were excellent  to me by  keeping engaged in conversation whilst delivering an unobtrusive service. The entertainment system was the Thales product. Plenty of  bright interactive screens and no rebooting  which is the case on other  short haul aircraft. I couldn't fault this flight just a pity I  would spend longer on it. Looking  forward to the  return journey.

Flight 059 London  / Cape Town April 29 2014 economy. It's been a while since I flew BA world traveller and it will be even longer until I use them . Clapped out  - terrible uncomfortable , awful back of seat video  chat - my partners failed. The  crew seemed totally disinterested and disengaged and far more  concerned in getting the "service" note the quotes over with ASAP. all they wanted to do was to retreat behind the curtain and gossip.  The drinks service . when asking for a whisky  and soda I  am offered whisky and tonic. Paper cups for coffee at breakfast. Meals are better at a Little Chef. The amenity kit was an ancient set of headphones and a toothbrush.  Thanks again. Wake up BA there are major competitors out there and  this time it Emirates via Dubai.

Las Vegas-LGW 777  business class. Business. The unique forward  facing facing seat configuration fits in more seats than other leading airlines.  Try to get a window/aisle seat  if you are  seated as a  priority but you will be lucky  provided you are prepared to pay  extra to choose your seat. Otherwise  you will be allocated a seat 24 hours before the flight and there are limited  chances to change  your seat allocation  during a busy flight. In the middle 4 seats you will be either facing someone during service take  off and landing  or sat next  ot someone with a small partition between you. In  other seats the foot rest is part of the  partition and blocks access so you will either have to step over  to be stepped over to leave your seat. The  passengers were comfortable  at all positions. Dinner was average but less elegant than meals on other leading airlines. Breakfast was a disaster; hardly any of the choices  on the menu were available but  little explanation or  directions were offered which was typical of the functional unsmiling flight attendants.  You got a good price in a BA sale but the overall experience was disappointing.

Another interesting contrast  is recent Gatwick , Turin and  Barcelona flights. Going  in it was  the (new?) A320  that was bright  green and spacious.  All the way  back it was  the B737 which  looked clean but  looked bit tatty  and felt cramped.  The food and  service on both  flights was commendable.  I believe that  all of BA's  may retire by  either end of  this year which  has come too soon.

To Marrakech. Had  originally travelled on  a British Midland  Route with mixed  results Things seem  ot have improved  after the take-over  made integration of  the Staff more  efficiently both on  both ground and  in Meals seem to have improved . There has  been a real  loss of choice  along this route  as is) but  now the improvement  can be consistent.

LHR-HKG on Boeing 747 - 23/08/12.  Lots has been written about the  poor old 747 fleet so I won't go in to that. What was annoying was that I was 4 rows from the front of the World Traveller cabin and by  that time the crew had got to my row to serve lunch  one of the  pasta choices had already run out! That in itself  should have been ok - it was perfectly acceptable pasta but the starter was a pasta salad. Not very sensible offering  2 dishes almost  the same. The crew did what  is required of  them - serve drinks and food  - then we didn't see them  again for 9  hrs until breakfast  got served. I flew home in  a Club World (see separate review) and my advice would be to  fly in the  cheapest cabin you  can afford. On a 12 hour flight it really is worthwhile.

Just got back from Bridgetown Barbados flying with British Airways and frankly  could wait to  take off. I was so disappointed. I have travelled  twice with BA but the flights  taking over and coming back left a lot to  be desired. The plane was in  need of repair.  It had water  pouring from the  seat where I was sitting and  when I told the stewardess was told that was  just due to  weather and proceeded to stuff a tissue to stop the dripping. The  walls were so  damaged that bits of the cladding were coming away. The food was  stale and inedible. The staff were unapproachable and looked fed up. BA get your act  right or you'll be losing flyers by the hundreds.

Flight Check in  did ok apart from being snapped  off for being too early to  get in come  out in 5 minutes. Got through security quickly. Terminal  2 has very  basic facilities. We  exited the aircraft  then sat in our seats realising we had a  medium haul flight in short haul seat pitch with a very small  leg width designed  towards a below averaged size person.  This wasn't at  ALL helped by the passenger in front reclining their seat immediately after  our seatbelt sign went off. Food  A basic small meal return flight included a breakfast consisting of a small bread roll with a bitesize cereal bar. Both legs went at least 4hrs without any food/drink service.  This was quite  frustrating have to  endure 5 minutes of adverts before  a programme starts.  Sitting near us  with a child with no working IFE for return flight. What annoyed  BA most was on the return leg we were  asked by the  gate attendant "Do you mind moving forward so the couple behind you can eat?". We did presuming it 's policy whilst finding it strange  that never happened  for the outbound flight. No one else was asked  to move the seat forward so we felt angered that we were the only ones . It is 100% not surprising BA has fallen  below other airlines  during recent years  and middle eastern airlines such as Qatar provide a  much better service  and a similar  fare

HKG-LHR in New Club World on Boeing 777-300 - 26/08/12. Bought ticket  at WT+ and managed to get a last minute upgrade using Avios to Club. First time in a premium cabin. The  seats are comfortable  and a little narrow but they  eventually move to  my lie flat position meaning I was able to  enjoy 6 hours sleep. Plenty of  good quality champagne and wines offered before and during dinner. 3 course  meal sounded a  lot better than it actually tasted.  You should think  twice about ease of food preparation on board rather than trying to do lavish dishes that don't quite come off. Breakfast was better than expected - plenty  more choice and a good selection of fresh rolls  & croissants. AVOD worked well. My only complaint was  how the cabin  staff found it very difficult to be friendly. Every  item appeared to be an inconvenience to them - little things like  salt and sugar  for my coffee. Generally though I 'd have to give Club World the thumbs up if only because a lie flat  seat is infinitely  more appealing than cramped Economy on  the 12 hour flight. As I was in Club through an Avios upgrade I cannot  disagree on the value for money.  As I paid  premium fare I might have expected more.

Return to LHR : July 2012 , I flew  here in premium  class on a 767. I chose this flight because on the 767 the layout is 2-2-2. I chose an aisle seat in the middle  aisle so I could go to the washroom etc  while disturbing y  I ate and vice versa. The seats are comparable  with North American business class except with narrower arm  rests (better than  BA but still  not meant for sharing). The entree food was the same as business class and I wasn't really impressed.  It wasn't bad but wasn't good either. I would  definitely fly BA on this route again mostly because  of the layout and the option to fly premium economy.

My return in CW from LHR  and BKK in  July 2012. The positives of both  journeys were: they  were on time , were comfortable and lounges were  spacious The negatives were: very poor  food selections on board (over cooked  food uninspiring) very  poor crews -  depending on what  section of the  flight you sat you got a  slightly different in-flight  service - some of the cabin  staff should get new jobs as passengers are a severe inconvenience to them and the IFE was unreliable  but on both flights the IFE  needed to be re-set at least . Overall the  seats were fine  and I will  use BA again  as the price is right.

Flew LHR - VIE return operated by bmi but 319 aircraft. A319 aircraft was clearly new and very clean. The crew were smiling friendly and helpful. No in-flight entertainment but not a problem on this short-haul flight. Delicious lunch was served -  steak and mustard sub roll and  cold drinks available. Have flown British Airways on this  route many times  now and they have never had a flaw in  their service and staff whether on the ground or in the skies.

Flying from Heathrow to Toronto. Booked  my exit seat for night flight  - Cost £55  but worth it.  Service was ok  both ways except  one awful breakfast prior to landing  at Heathrow. A  English muffin in a piece of  bread and a polystyrene cup of coffee. Not a  great flight -  better value with  a Transat club which costs about  as same and  is better in  a way.

The LHR to BKK. 747-400. First try back with BA in about  10 years during  which I have  tried many other  carriers and been  disappointed with most. The only things that impress me with BA are the staff and  its ability to pretend this is a quality airline and the fact that people pay  me so much money to be  fed like cattle. The Food is  no doubt some of the worst I have had in Business anywhere poorly presented badly  cooked and barely edible. The AVOD looks like it was installed 10  months ago and then wasn't the  middle of the range screen size is terrible viewing  angles and resolution poor. The seats  fit well as a lie flat configuration. That's the highlight. I cant help feel that if BA senior managers occasionally used  my own money to fly with  us then we  could see real change from our national flag carrier. Regretting my already  boring return flight  and my 550000  total air miles.

It was a  British Regional operated flight on a  flight from Manchester to Heathrow -  not with a  valid flight number so I have  a report it  in here. On  arrival the cabin crew member didn't  come up to  read our boarding  address or welcome  - No check on seatbelts etc.  prior to takeoff.  Shuttle service started  shortly after takeoff  so this was  not very short  - this consisted  only a trolley with drinks and  snacks - as  is usual on  all Domestic services.  There were 5  men in front  of me returning  after a weekend  away who were  drinking 2 gin and tonics each  - the cabin  attendant was very  friendly with them.
